original: all the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead, and all of Bashan as far as the cities of Salecah and Edrei in the kingdom of Og.
translation: Olgeta taun long hap graun, olgeta Gilead, na olgeta Bashan inap long ol taun Salecah na Edrei long kingdom bilong Og.

original: (For only Og king of Bashan had remained of the remnant of the Rephaim. His bed of iron, nine cubits long and four cubits wide, is still in Rabbah of the Ammonites.)
translation: Og king bilong Bashan i stap yet long ol lain bilong Rephaim. Bet bilong aian, em namel long nain kubiti na wide em four kubiti, i stap yet long Rabbah bilong Ammonites.

original: So at that time we took possession of this land. To the Reubenites and Gadites I gave the land beyond Aroer along the Arnon Valley, and half the hill country of Gilead, along with its cities.
translation: Long taim dispela mipela kisim dispela graun. Mi givim graun long Ol Reubenites na Ol Gadites, ol i go long sait bilong Aroer, stat long Arnon Valley, na hap graun bilong maunten Gilead, wantaim towns bilong en.

original: To the half-tribe of Manasseh I gave the rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og. (The entire region of Argob, the whole territory of Bashan, used to be called the land of the Rephaim.)
translation: Long hap-tribe bilong Manase, mi givim rest bilong Gilead na olgeta Bashan, kingdom bilong Og. (Olgeta ples bilong Argob, olgeta graun bilong Bashan, bifoa em i kolim olsem graun bilong Rephaim.)

original: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took the whole region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites. He renamed Bashan after himself, Havvoth-jair, by which it is called to this day.
translation: Jair, wanpela desenden bilong Manase, em i tekim hap bilong kantri Argob olgeta, inap long boundary bilong Geshurait na Maakati. Em i kisim nem Bashan, na em i givim nem Havvoth-jair, na dispela nem i stap yet, inap long tude.

original: To Machir I gave Gilead,
translation: Long Machir mi givim Gileadi.

original: and to the Reubenites and Gadites I gave the territory from Gilead to the Arnon Valley (the middle of the valley was the border) and up to the Jabbok River, the border of the Ammonites.
translation: Na mi givim eria long ol Reubenites na Gadites, stat long Gilead, go daun long Arnon Valley, em i borda long middle bilong valley, na go ap long Jabbok River, em i boda bilong Ammonites.

original: The Jordan River in the Arabah bordered it from Chinnereth to the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea) with the slopes of Pisgah to the east.
translation: Wara Jordan long Arabah i kamapim border bilong en, stat long Chinnereth, go long Solwara bilong Arabah (Solwara Solt), wantaim slops bilong Pisgah long sais bilong east.

original: At that time I commanded you: “The LORD your God has given you this land to possess. All your men of valor are to cross over, armed for battle, ahead of your brothers, the Israelites.
translation: Long taim ya, mi bin givim yu olsem: Bikpela LORD God bilong yu, em i givim yu dispela graun long bai yumupela i kam na takedaonim. Ol man bilong yu ol i strong, yupela mas go bek long en, ol i kam long ol gun bilong war, long hap bilong brata bilong yu, ol Israel pipol.

original: But your wives, your children, and your livestock—I know that you have much livestock—may remain in the cities I have given you,
translation: Meri bilong yu, pikinini bilong yu, na animals bilong yu - Mi save olsem yu gat planti animals, inap i stap insait long towns we mi givim i go long yu.

original: until the LORD gives rest to your brothers as He has to you, and they too have taken possession of the land that the LORD your God is giving them across the Jordan. Then each of you may return to the possession I have given you.”
translation: Na LORD Bikpela i givim ripos long brata bilong yu ol, olsem nem i givim long yu, na ol i kamap narapela bosboi bilong kantri long sait bilong Jordan. Na bihain yu yet ken go bak long ples bilong yu.

original: And at that time I commanded Joshua: “Your own eyes have seen all that the LORD your God has done to these two kings. The LORD will do the same to all the kingdoms you are about to enter.
translation: Na long taim i go, mi bin givim Joshua tok: "Ai bilong yu yet na yu lukim olsem LORD God bilong yu bin mekim long dispela tupela kip i go king. LORD bai mekim olsem long olgeta kip i go king yu nau yu go long en.

original: Do not be afraid of them, for the LORD your God Himself will fight for you.”
translation: No ken sku bilong yu, wantaim LORD God bilong yu Em Yet Iet Bai fait long yu.

original: At that time I also pleaded with the LORD:
translation: Long taim ya, mi go bekim bikim askim long LORD tu.

original: “O Lord GOD, You have begun to show Your greatness and power to Your servant. For what god in heaven or on earth can perform such works and mighty acts as Yours?
translation: Papa God, Yu bin statim showim bikpela namel bilong yu na powa long wokman bilong yu. Husat spirits long heven o long graun inap warkim wok bung na strongpela akt bilong yu olsem?

original: Please let me cross over and see the good land beyond the Jordan—that pleasant hill country as well as Lebanon!”
translation: Mi go akros, mi lukim gudepela graun i stap bifor wanpela sait bilong Jordan, na kantri bilong maunten ia, olsem Lebanon!

original: But the LORD was angry with me on account of you, and He would not listen to me. “That is enough,” the LORD said to me. “Do not speak to Me again about this matter.
translation: Bikpela i kros long me bikos bilong yu, na em i no lissen long tok bilong me. Em i tokim mi: "Em i nau, enuf. Yu no ken tokim mi gen long dispela matar.

original: Go to the top of Pisgah and look to the west and north and south and east. See the land with your own eyes, for you will not cross this Jordan.
translation: Go long top bilong Pisga na kisim i luk long wes, na not, na saut, na is. Lukim kantri wantaim ai bilong yu, bikos yu no inap pasim Jodan.

original: But commission Joshua, encourage him, and strengthen him, for he will cross over ahead of the people and enable them to inherit the land that you will see.”
translation: Bikim Joshua i gat wok bilong en, givim gutpela hap long em, strongim em, bikos em bai go befoa ol pipol, ikam in go long nupela hap, na ol bai ken kisim kantri we yu laikim.

original: So we stayed in the valley opposite Beth-peor.
translation: Mipela i stap long bosel namel long sait bilong Beth-peor.

original: Hear now, O Israel, the statutes and ordinances I am teaching you to follow, so that you may live and may enter and take possession of the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
translation: Harim nau, O Isrel, lo bilong ples na lo olsem mi laik tim yu long bihain, na yu ken i stap, na yu ken go insait na taker ovatim graun we LORD, Bikpela God bilong tumbuna bilong yu, i givim yu.

original: You must not add to or subtract from what I command you, so that you may keep the commandments of the LORD your God that I am giving you.
translation: Yu no ken kisim i go long na kirapim, nau yu yet mas holim ol tok save bilong Bikpela LORD God bilong yu.

original: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did at Baal-peor, for the LORD your God destroyed from among you all who followed Baal of Peor.
translation: Ai bilong yu pilim wusai LORD mekim long Baal-peor, na LORD God bilong yu bin bagarapim ol man i go bek gen Baal bilong Peor long mitupela.

original: But you who held fast to the LORD your God are alive to this day, every one of you.
translation: Bikos yu ol i stap strong long LORD God bilong yu, olgeta blo yu i stap alive yet long dispela de.

original: See, I have taught you statutes and ordinances just as the LORD my God has commanded me, so that you may follow them in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
translation: Mi bin tisim yu lo bilong ol wok na ol ka bilong ples olsem Jehovah God bilong mi yet em i givim mi tok, bilong yu inap bihainim ol long graun yu nau yumi go long en i kamdaun na yumi ken tekem i go.

original: Observe them carefully, for this will show your wisdom and understanding in the sight of the peoples, who will hear of all these statutes and say, “Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.”
translation: Karamim ol long ken, nau bai yu showim save na undastandin bilong yu long ai bilong ol piple, husat bai harim tok bilong ol loa oli, na ol bai tok, "Nesen bikpela i go, dispela bikpela nesen em i nesen we i gat save na undastandin."

original: For what nation is great enough to have a god as near to them as the LORD our God is to us whenever we call on Him?
translation: Hamas long nason wei bikpela i kamap long ol, i gat god belisim ol olsem Jehovah God bilong yumi, wenever yumi kolim em?

original: And what nation is great enough to have righteous statutes and ordinances like this entire law I set before you today?
translation: Nasyon wanpela i gat bikpela stapla, olsem nau ol i gat jus lo bilong ples na ol lo bilong tisa olsem loa bilong yumi yet?

original: Only be on your guard and diligently watch yourselves, so that you do not forget the things your eyes have seen, and so that they do not slip from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and grandchildren.
translation: Kam bek long yuself, wachim yuself longlong, no ken lusim ol samting we i kam bek long ai bilong yu, na no go daun long het bilong yu, tasol i stap long laip bilong yu. Pasim stori na toksave long pikinini bilong yu na grandpikinini bilong yu.

original: The day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, the LORD said to me, “Gather the people before Me to hear My words, so that they may learn to fear Me all the days they live on the earth, and that they may teach them to their children.”
translation: Dei yu stap bifor Bikpela God bilong yu long Maunten Horeb, Bikpela i tokim mi, “Kisim ol pipol i kam bung long mi, harim tok bilong mi, na ol i lem i fearem mi oltaim ol i stap long graun, na ol i tisaim dispela stori long pikinini bilong ol.”

original: You came near and stood at the base of the mountain, a mountain blazing with fire to the heavens, with black clouds and deep darkness.
translation: Yu kam klostu na yu stap klostu long bun bilong maunten, maunten em i bakarap olsem ai kot mama long heven, wantaim klaut blak na dikpela dokis.

original: And the LORD spoke to you out of the fire. You heard the sound of the words, but saw no form; there was only a voice.
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim yu long narapela sais bilong faia. Yu harim saun bilong ol tok, tasol yu no lukim bek na figure; i gat tasol voys.

original: He declared to you His covenant, which He commanded you to follow—the Ten Commandments that He wrote on two tablets of stone.
translation: Em i tokim olgeta long covenant bilong em, em i givim yu komando olsem yu mas bihainim - Ten Komando ol, em i raitim long tupela ston bilong raitim.

original: At that time the LORD commanded me to teach you the statutes and ordinances you are to follow in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
translation: Long hap tumas Bikpela i givim mi tok olsem na yu mas skulim ol lo bilong Pikinini, yu mas bihainim long graun yu go karim graun we i stap long hap Jordan.

original: So since you saw no form of any kind on the day the LORD spoke to you out of the fire at Horeb, be careful
translation: Sapos yu no lukim nenpela fom long dei em LORD i tokim yu long narapela sait bilong Horeb, kalabai i kamap, yu mas stap i go long wari.

original: that you do not act corruptly and make an idol for yourselves of any form or shape, whether in the likeness of a male or female,
translation: Inap long yumi no ken wokim olgeta samting i bagarap, na yumus ol i go wokim idola bilong yumi long faom o pekala, man o meri, long olgeta samting i no stret.

original: of any beast that is on the earth or bird that flies in the air,
translation: Olgeta bis o pisin long graun o olgeta samting i flai long skai,

original: or of any creature that crawls on the ground or fish that is in the waters below.
translation: O bilong eni kain krecha i go long graun o fish i stap long wara i go daun.

original: When you look to the heavens and see the sun and moon and stars—all the host of heaven—do not be enticed to bow down and worship what the LORD your God has apportioned to all the nations under heaven.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kisim luk long heven na yu si san, mun, sta - ol spirut bilong heven - no ken entisim yumi katim hed na worship ol samting we LORD God bilong yu givim long ol narapela ples long anidas long heven.

original: Yet the LORD has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be the people of His inheritance, as you are today.
translation: Na LORD i kisim yu, na i kam bekim yu long nambis ferren, long kantri Ipig, olsem ol pipel bilong inheritance bilong em, olsem yumi stap tude.

original: The LORD, however, was angry with me on account of you, and He swore that I would not cross the Jordan to enter the good land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
translation: LORD i kros long me bilong yu, na Em i tok olsem na mi no inap go kas long Jodan bai mi go insait long kantri i gat guinea gutpela we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu long wei bilong inharent.

original: For I will not be crossing the Jordan, because I must die in this land. But you shall cross over and take possession of that good land.
translation: Mi no go krosim Jordan, bikos mi mas dai long dispela lan, tasol yu bai go pas, na yu bai kisim i tanim gutpela lan.

original: Be careful that you do not forget the covenant of the LORD your God that He made with you; do not make an idol for yourselves in the form of anything He has forbidden you.
translation: Kamdai bai yu no ken lusim kuvuk bilong Bikpela i go long yu, we Bilipela wokim wantaim yu; yu no ken wokim hevi long eni samting we Bilipela i hangre long yu.

original: For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
translation: Long ol bikpela, Bikpela i God bilong yu, em i ai i kaikai olgeta samting, na em i God i gat jelos.

original: After you have children and grandchildren and you have been in the land a long time, if you then act corruptly and make an idol of any form—doing evil in the sight of the LORD your God and provoking Him to anger—
translation: Bihaen yu kam na havim pikinini na grandpikinini, na yu stap long kantri long taim olredy, tasol bihaen bai yu wok abusim na mekim idol - ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu, na bai yu mekim em i cross long ai.

original: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you this day that you will quickly perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess. You will not live long upon it, but will be utterly destroyed.
translation: Mi singautim heven na graun bilong yumi olsem witnes long dispela de, yupela bai i go daun kik na kat long lad bilong yupela i wokabaut i go long Jordan, ilya bai i pisin stori long en. Yupela no bai i stap long taim, bai i go daun kik, olgeta bai i bagarap strong, nogat ken.

original: Then the LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and only a few of you will survive among the nations to which the LORD will drive you.
translation: Na Papa God bai sindaunim yupela long ol pisinini, na nambis pepeza blo yupela yet bai stap long ol kantri ol i go daun olsem punishment.

original: And there you will serve man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see or hear or eat or smell.
translation: Na yu stap servim god bilong ol man i makim long diwai na stoan, ol geta no inap luk, no inap harim, no inap kaikai, no inap smel.

original: But if from there you will seek the LORD your God, you will find Him if you seek Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
translation: Bai yumu go bek gen, na sukim Lord God bilong yu, yumu kisim Hem, long tingting yumu sakim Hem wantaim het bilong yu na spirit bilong yu.

original: When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in later days you will return to the LORD your God and listen to His voice.
translation: Wanpela taim yu stap insait trabel, na ol samting i kamap long yu, bai yumi go bek long taim i kam, na yumi kam bek long LORD God bilong yu, na yumi harim tok bilong Em.

original: For the LORD your God is a merciful God; He will not abandon you or destroy you or forget the covenant with your fathers, which He swore to them by oath.
translation: Bikos LORD God bilong yu em i God bilong amamas; em i no go lusim yu, o no go bagarapim yu, o no go lusim kovenan long ol tumbuna bilong yu, dispela we em i promis long ol long ot.

original: Indeed, ask now from one end of the heavens to the other about the days that long preceded you, from the day that God created man on earth: Has anything as great as this ever happened or been reported?
translation: No askim nau from wan end bilong heven na go long narakai long ol taim bifo i kam, from de bikpela de God i mekim man long graun: I gat sampela samting olsem nau i kamap o i harim?

original: Has a people ever heard the voice of God speaking out of the fire, as you have, and lived?
translation: Ol pipol i ever harim vois bilong God i tok nau long paia, olsem yu, na ol i stap?

original: Or has any god tried to take as his own a nation out of another nation—by trials, signs, wonders, and war, by a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and by great terrors—as the LORD your God did for you in Egypt, before your eyes?
translation: Oli bin givim kanaka long narapela kantry, olsem bamakim olsem kanaka bilong en i stap long wanpela kantry long triwal, sahn, wondar, na war, long han strong na arm stretchim olos, na long bikpela bagarap, olsem Bikpela LORD God bilong yu mekim long yu long Egip, bifor ai bilong yu?

original: You were shown these things so that you would know that the LORD is God; there is no other besides Him.
translation: Yupela bin lukim ol dispela samting, bilong yupela i save olsem, Bikpela em i God; i no gat narapela god bai sindaun aside long Em.

original: He let you hear His voice from heaven to discipline you, and on earth He showed you His great fire, and you heard His words out of the fire.
translation: Em i givim yu harim voys bilong Em long heven, olsem bikos blong dishiplinim yu, na long graun Em i sho yu fir bilong Em, i bikpela tru, na yu harim tok bilong Em, em tok igo longpela fir.

original: Because He loved your fathers, He chose their descendants after them and brought you out of Egypt by His presence and great power,
translation: Bikos em i lakim papa bilong yu, em i chuisim pikinini bilong ol, na em i kam bekim yupela long Egip long presens bilong en na strongpela powa bilong en.

original: to drive out before you nations greater and mightier than you, and to bring you into their land and give it to you for your inheritance, as it is this day.
translation: Na God i mekim strongpela wok long drivim ol i go bifo yu, na kam bringim yu i go long kantri bilong ol narapela ples, na givim i long yu olsem inheritance bilong yu, olsem stap today.

original: Know therefore this day and take to heart that the LORD is God in heaven above and on the earth below; there is no other.
translation: Siosi long dispela de, yu mas save, na yu mas putim i go insait long het bilong yu, LORD em i God bilong heven na graun, antap na doun; i no gat narapela.

original: Keep His statutes and commandments, which I am giving you today, so that you and your children after you may prosper, and that you may live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you for all time.
translation: Iu holim statut na kaunsol bilong em, olsem we mi givim yu tude, sapos yu na pikinini bilong yu bihain i kam ap moa strong, bai yu i stap planti taim long graun we LORD God bilong yu, Bikpela, i givim yu olsem oltaim.

original: Then Moses set aside three cities across the Jordan to the east
translation: Na Moses i makim tripela taun long hap side bilong Jordan long eastern sait.

original: to which a manslayer could flee after killing his neighbor unintentionally without prior malice. To save one’s own life, he could flee to one of these cities:
translation: Siti bilong refuj i stap, ol man i kilim man inap ronawe nau bikos nogat tingting, em i kilim nek bilong en without laikim long taim bipo. Long save laif bilong em yet, em inap ron na go long wanpela bilong siti hait:

original: Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau belonging to the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead belonging to the Gadites, or Golan in Bashan belonging to the Manassites.
translation: Bezer long bus em i go long hap graun bilong ol Reubenites, Ramoth long Gilead bilong ol Gadites, o Golan long Bashan bilong ol Manassites.

original: This is the law that Moses set before the Israelites.
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong Moses i givim long Israel.

original: These are the testimonies, statutes, and ordinances that Moses proclaimed to them after they had come out of Egypt,
translation: Dispela ol testimonial bilong God, ol laen bilong God, na ol kaanu bilong God, Mosis i tokim ol long dispela, bihaenim ol kamap nau long Ples bilong slavery bilong Israel, Ijip.

original: while they were in the valley across the Jordan facing Beth-peor in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon and was defeated by Moses and the Israelites after they had come out of Egypt.
translation: Wail em stap long valei kros long Jordan, we i kam fas long Beth-peor, long lan bilong Sihon king bilong Amorites, husat i stap long Heshbon, na Moses na Israelites i winim em bihaen ol i kam aut long Egip.

original: They took possession of the land belonging to Sihon and to Og king of Bashan—the two Amorite kings across the Jordan to the east—
translation: Ol i bikim bos long graun we bilong Sihon na Og king bilong Bashan, kiwan kings bilong Amorait i stap klostu long sait bilong Jordan i go long east.

original: extending from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley as far as Mount Siyon (that is, Hermon),
translation: Ol i go longwe na kamap long Aroer lonk sait bilong valley Arnon, inap longwel Maunt Sion, em i bikpela maunt, o Hermon.

original: including all the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan and as far as the Sea of the Arabah, below the slopes of Pisgah.
translation: Olgeta Arabah long sait bilong solwara Jordan, na i kamap long Solwara Arabah aninit long sok bilong Pisgah.

original: Then Moses summoned all Israel and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the statutes and ordinances that I declare in your hearing this day. Learn them and observe them carefully.
translation: Moses i kolim olgeta Israel i kam nau na tokim ol: Harim, o Israel, lo bilong papa na lo bilong mama olsem mi tok klia long han bilong yu tude. Lernim ol na halivim gut.

original: The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
translation: God bikpela, em i mekim nupela ka long mipela long Horeb.

original: He did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with all of us who are alive here today.
translation: Em i no mekim dispela kovenan wantaim tumbuna bilong yumi, bastala em i mekim dispela wantaim yumi olgeta i stap alive hari long tede.

original: The LORD spoke with you face to face out of the fire on the mountain.
translation: GOD bilong mipela i tokim long yu bipoa long bipoa, kam bek long paia long maunten.

original: At that time I was standing between the LORD and you to declare to you the word of the LORD, because you were afraid of the fire and would not go up the mountain. And He said:
translation: Long taem, mi stap namel long bikimain bilong tokim yu tok bilong Bikpela, bikos yu bin pikinaba long faia na yu no go ap long maunten. Na em i tok olsem:

original: “I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Mi bilong yu, mipela God, nau mi bringim yu nau long kam aus bilong kantri Ipigipia, aus bilong haus bilong bubu.

original: You shall have no other gods before Me.
translation: Yu mas havim i no gat biceman bilong spirit naring bifor ai, yu mas tok bilong wan god tasol.

original: You shall not make for yourself an idol in the form of anything in the heavens above, on the earth below, or in the waters beneath.
translation: Yu no ken mekim bagi long yu yet long stil bilong eni samting long heven ibaksait, long graun ibilo, o long solwara ibenith.

original: You shall not bow down to them or worship them; for I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on their children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
translation: Yu no ken go daun long ol, o i kam worshipim ol; bikos Mi, LORD God bilong yu, em i God i gat jelos, mi kam bekim bikhet long pikinini bilong papa ol, genarason third na fourth, long ol pipol i hate M.

original: but showing loving devotion to a thousand generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
translation: Bai yumi mekim lav wantaim gutpela pasin long tausend generesion blong ol i lakim Mipela na ol i holim komando bilong Mipela.

original: You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not leave anyone unpunished who takes His name in vain.
translation: Yu no ken usim nem bilong LORD God yu long nogat samting, bikos LORD bai no lusim pipel i go fri long penalti hu igrisim nem bilong em long nogat samting.

original: Observe the Sabbath day by keeping it holy, as the LORD your God has commanded you.
translation: Kisim dai bilong Sabat i go long kepm hap bilong em, olsem Jehovah God bilong yu tokim yu.

original: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
translation: Sikis de pe yu mas wokim olgeta wok bilong yu,

original: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God, on which you must not do any work—neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your manservant or maidservant, nor your ox or donkey or any of your livestock, nor the foreigner within your gates, so that your manservant and maidservant may rest as you do.
translation: Bai seit de namba seven em i de - Sabat long LORD God bilong yu, na yu no ken mekim wok igo – nek yu, nek pikinini bilong yu, man bilong wok, meri bilong wok, animal bilong bus, o donki, nek animal nating bilong yu, nek man i kam long ples bilong yu we i stap long gate bilong yu, olsem na man bilong wok na meri bilong wok bilong yu bai ol i givim ples long saris na meri bilong yu ol i mas rep long ol sem moning.

original: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and that the LORD your God brought you out of there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. That is why the LORD your God has commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
translation: Yumi remember olsem yumi bin slave long kantri bilong Ijip, na Bikpela God yumi, em i kam bekim yumi wantaim han bilong pawa na arm stret long wel. Bikpela God yumi, em i tokim yumi long kaip de, olsem yumi mas keepim de kaip.

original: Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, so that your days may be long and that it may go well with you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Sambai i respektem papa na mama bilong yu, olsem Jehovah God bilong yu i tokim yu, na bai yia bilong yu i stap longpela, na olgeta samting bai kamap strong long yu long graun bilong yu we Jehovah God bilong yu i givim yu.

original: You shall not murder.
translation: Yu no ken kilim man.

original: You shall not commit adultery.
translation: Yu no ken wokim bubu.

original: You shall not steal.
translation: Yu no ken stilim samting bilong arapela man.

original: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
translation: Yu no ken kisim tok bilong bagarap na toktok olsem long hap bilong brata bilong yu.

original: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. You shall not covet your neighbor’s house or field, or his manservant or maidservant, or his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
translation: Yu no ken bilivim meri bilong nekbia yufela. Yu no ken bilivim haus bilong nekbia yufela o graun bilong en, o man servit o woman servit bilong en, o bulmakau o donki, o ol samting bilong nekbia yufela.

original: The LORD spoke these commandments in a loud voice to your whole assembly out of the fire, the cloud, and the deep darkness on the mountain; He added nothing more. And He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
translation: LORD i tokim dispela komandoments long voys bilong strongim long halivim assembli bilong yu, nau long paia, klaut na depe daknes long maunten; Em i no addim samting moa. Na Em i raitim ol long tu tablet bilong ston na em i givim ol long me.

original: And when you heard the voice out of the darkness while the mountain was blazing with fire, all the heads of your tribes and your elders approached me,
translation: Na bihainim, yumi harim voys long naite i go nau, wail maunten i bin kaikai pinis wantaim faia, ol hevi bilong ol tribe bilong yu na ol bikpela manmeri bilong yu i kam bek gen long me.

original: and you said, “Behold, the LORD our God has shown us His glory and greatness, and we have heard His voice out of the fire. Today we have seen that a man can live even if God speaks with him.
translation: Na yu tokim, 'Lukim, LORD God bilong yumi sampela showim mipela glori na gret nes blong em, na mipela harim voис blong em long narapela sait bilong faia. Tudei mipela lukim olsem man i ken livim nogat stap dai tasol bikos God i tokim wantaim em.

original: But now, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us, and we will die, if we hear the voice of the LORD our God any longer.
translation: Nau, wal sinting bai me dei? Faia bikpela i go kilim mipela, na mipela bai dai, if mipela harim vosis bilong LORD God bilong mipela gen.

original: For who of all flesh has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the fire, as we have, and survived?
translation: Hu na olgeta bodili i harim voys bilong God i gat laip, em i tok olsem nau long paipa bilong faia, olsem mipela, na i stap yet?

original: Go near and listen to all that the LORD our God says. Then you can tell us everything the LORD our God tells you; we will listen and obey.”
translation: Kam klost na harim olgeta wod bilong Papa God bilong mipela. Na bihain yu ken tokim mipela olgeta samting we Papa God bilong mipela i tokim yu; mipela bai harim na kam bek long bihainim.

original: And the LORD heard the words you spoke to me, and He said to me, “I have heard the words that these people have spoken to you. They have done well in all that they have spoken.
translation: Na Bikpela i harim tok ples yu tokim mi, na Em i tokim mi, “Mi harim tok ol pipol i tokim yu. Ol i wok gut long olgeta samting ol i tok.”

original: If only they had such a heart to fear Me and keep all My commandments always, so that it might be well with them and with their children forever.
translation: Mipela laikim ol i haten long poisen Meka na halivim ol laen bilong Meka oltaim, bilong mekim gude long ol na long pikinini bilong ol foreva.

original: Go and tell them: ‘Return to your tents.’
translation: Go na tokim ol: 'Yupela go bak long haus bilong yufala.'

original: But you stand here with Me, that I may speak to you all the commandments and statutes and ordinances you are to teach them to follow in the land that I am giving them to possess.”
translation: Bikos yu stap hia wantaim mi, na mi bai tokim yu olgeta komanda, lo bilong ples, na law na ordinance, olsem na yu ken tisim ol i go bihain long graun we mi givim ol i bamim na holim.

original: So be careful to do as the LORD your God has commanded you; you are not to turn aside to the right or to the left.
translation: Komo strong long mekim olsem Jehovah God bilong yu hem i tokim; yu no inap raitim na lft.

original: You must walk in all the ways that the LORD your God has commanded you, so that you may live and prosper and prolong your days in the land that you will possess.
translation: Yu mas wokabaut long olgeta wei we Bikpela i givim tok, na yu ken i stap na i kamap strong, na yu pilim yu yet long taim long graun we yu bai kisim.

original: These are the commandments and statutes and ordinances that the LORD your God has instructed me to teach you to follow in the land that you are about to enter and possess,
translation: Dispela em i komandments, statits, na ordonans we LORD God bilong yu em i tokim mi olsem yu mas folo long graun yu go kamap na bai yu takem.

original: so that you and your children and grandchildren may fear the LORD your God all the days of your lives by keeping all His statutes and commandments that I give you, and so that your days may be prolonged.
translation: Na yu na pikinini bilong yu na generation bilong yumi i ken i bikim respek long Lod iet, ol dei bilong yufala laip, inap long mekim ol loa na tok bilong em, na bai yufala i ken stap planti long taim.

original: Hear, O Israel, and be careful to observe them, so that you may prosper and multiply greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your fathers, has promised you.
translation: Harim, O Isrel, yu mas wachim gut na kaikim ol despal, sapos yu wan bai kamap strong na i go long olpela na nupela jenarason, long kantri we i gat plenti milk na honey, olsem Jehovah, God bilong papa na tumbuna bilong yu, promisim yu.

original: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is One.
translation: Harim, o Isrel: Bikpela GOD bilong yumi, GOD em i wan tasol.

original: And you shall love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.
translation: Yu mas livenim LORD God bilong yu wantaim olgeta haret bilong yu, wantaim olgeta spirut bilong yu, na wantaim olgeta strong bilong yu.

original: These words I am commanding you today are to be upon your hearts.
translation: Ol dispela tokwan em mi givim yu today, ol i mas stap long hevi bilong yu.

original: And you shall teach them diligently to your children and speak of them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
translation: Yu mas skulim ol i go strong long pikinini, na tokaut long dispela taim yu sindaun long haus, taim yu i go long rot, taim yu i slip, na taim yu kirap.

original: Tie them as reminders on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
translation: Lusim olsem simbol long han bilong yu na binim ol long hevi bilong yu.

original: Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates.
translation: Raitim ol i go long hap bilong haus bilong yu na long gate bilong yu.

original: And when the LORD your God brings you into the land He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, that He would give you—a land with great and splendid cities that you did not build,
translation: Na wën Long God bai yu go long graun bilong promis, em i promis ol tumbuna bilong yu, Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob, olsem em i givim yu - wanpela graun we i gat bikpela na nais cities we yupela no bin bilim.

original: with houses full of every good thing with which you did not fill them, with wells that you did not dig, and with vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and when you eat and are satisfied,
translation: Na hus na i fulap long olgeta samting gut we yu no filim, na wel na vineyard na olive grove we yu no wokim, yu no planim - na wankain yu kaikai na bel isi,

original: be careful not to forget the LORD who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Kamdai i go long wei, no ken foryet Bikpela we i bam bringim yumi i kam long kantri bilong Ijip, long haus bilong slaviri.

original: Fear the LORD your God, serve Him only, and take your oaths in His name.
translation: Poroim na iet long GOD bilong yu, sarvim em tasol, na kisim ots long nem bilong em.

original: Do not follow other gods, the gods of the peoples around you.
translation: No bihainim kumo narapela, kumo bilong ol pipol i stap arondim yu.

original: For the LORD your God, who is among you, is a jealous God. Otherwise the anger of the LORD your God will be kindled against you, and He will wipe you off the face of the earth.
translation: Long ol bikpela God bilong yu, em i stap namel long yu, em i God i gat jelos. Inap bikpela iai bilong ol bikpela God bilong yu bai i pas long yu, na em bai wipim yu long graun.

original: Do not test the LORD your God as you tested Him at Massah.
translation: No ken tryim Lord God bilong yu olsem yu bin tryim Em long taim bilong Massah.

original: You are to diligently keep the commandments of the LORD your God and the testimonies and statutes He has given you.
translation: Yu mas kisim strong long ol komandyu bilong Lod bilong yu God, na testemoni na statut we em i givim yu.

original: Do what is right and good in the sight of the LORD, so that it may be well with you and that you may enter and possess the good land that the LORD your God swore to give your fathers,
translation: Wokim ol samting i gut na rait long ai bilong LORD, bilong yu inap kamap strong na gut, na yu inap go insait na kisim bikpela graun i gut we LORD God bilong yu promis long tumbuna bilong yu.

original: driving out all your enemies before you, as the LORD has said.
translation: Usim strong long rausim ol enemy bilong yu long bifor yu, olsem LORD i tok.

original: In the future, when your son asks, “What is the meaning of the decrees and statutes and ordinances that the LORD our God has commanded you?”
translation: Bai nau long taim, wanpela dei pikinini bilong yu em i askim, "Meaning bilong dispela lo bilong ol tok, tok save, na lo bilong wok ol LORD God bilong yumi givim instruction long yu?"

original: then you are to tell him, “We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, but the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
translation: Tokim em, mipela i bin servis bilong Faraon long Egip, tasol Bikpela i bringim mipela i go long nambis bilong Egip wantaim maiti han.

original: Before our eyes the LORD inflicted great and devastating signs and wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his household.
translation: Long ai bilong yumi, LORD i bin mekim sain na wanda bikpela na nogut tru long Egypt, long Faraon, na long haus famili bilong em.

original: But He brought us out from there to lead us in and give us the land that He had sworn to our fathers.
translation: Baine em i kam bek long hap bilong en, na lusim mipela go long graun, givim mipela grain bilong promis olsem em i promis long kalaja bilong tumbuna.

original: And the LORD commanded us to observe all these statutes and to fear the LORD our God, that we may always be prosperous and preserved, as we are to this day.
translation: Na Bikpela i givim tokim bilong kisim hed long ol dispela statut, na io tasol i gat respek long Bikpela bilong yumi, bilong yumi kamap strong na kisim laip olsem tude, long taim yumi stap.

original: And if we are careful to observe every one of these commandments before the LORD our God, as He has commanded us, then that will be our righteousness.”
translation: Sapos yumus lukim olgeta hap komandmen long dispela bifor LORD God bilong yumi, olsem em i tokim mipela, dispela bai i kamap derek na tru bilong yumi.

original: When the LORD your God brings you into the land that you are entering to possess, and He drives out before you many nations—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations larger and stronger than you—
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela God bilong yu bringim yu go insait long kantri we yu stap go poses, na Bikpela i kirapim ol Hittait, Girgasit, Amorait, Kanaanit, Perisait, Hiwit, na Jebusit, seven narapela tribe we i bikpela moa strong long yu, na Bikpela i drivim ol bifo yu —

original: and when the LORD your God has delivered them over to you to defeat them, then you must devote them to complete destruction. Make no treaty with them and show them no mercy.
translation: Na taim LORD God bilong yu em i givim ol i go long yu, long yu winim ol, bai yu mas putim ol i go long daun na nait, ol i no stap. Yu no mas makim peis wantaim ol, yu no mas givim ol kros.

original: Do not intermarry with them. Do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons,
translation: Yu no maritim wantaim ol. Yu no givim pikinini meri bilong yu long ol pikinini man bilong ol, na yu no kisim pikinini meri bilong ol i go long ol pikinini man bilong yu.

original: because they will turn your sons away from following Me to serve other gods. Then the anger of the LORD will burn against you, and He will swiftly destroy you.
translation: Bikos ol bai kisim pikinini bilong yu na salim wai long servisis narapela deua, na ol i go bek long mi. Na bai aria bilong LORD i pas, na Em bai i bagarapim yupela hap tasol.

original: Instead, this is what you are to do to them: tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, cut down their Asherah poles, and burn their idols in the fire.
translation: Nogat, dispela em i wok bilong yu: rukim daun alta bilong ol, smasim pilia bilong ol i go het, kotim daun poles bilong Asherah, na jakim idols bilong ol i go long faia.

original: For you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD your God has chosen you to be a people for His prized possession out of all peoples on the face of the earth.
translation: Yu stap olgeta pipol we i holihol long ai bilong LORD yu God. LORD yu God ibin chusim yu olsem yu ken stap olgeta pipol bilong pris long en, long narapela hap bilong graun, na ibin makim yu oli pipol we em i laikim tru long en.

original: The LORD did not set His affection on you and choose you because you were more numerous than the other peoples, for you were the fewest of all peoples.
translation: Bikpela i no bin putim hari long yu na bikim yu pipol bilong en bikos yu pilai i moa long ol narapela pepela, nogat, yu pilai i lais long olgeta pipel.

original: But because the LORD loved you and kept the oath He swore to your fathers, He brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
translation: Bikos LORD i lavim yu na i holim promis we i promis long tumbuna bilong yu, na i kam bekim yu, na i usim strongpela han bilong en, na i bikim yu fri long haus bilong slaviri, long han bilong Faraon king bilong Egip.

original: Know therefore that the LORD your God is God, the faithful God who keeps His covenant of loving devotion for a thousand generations of those who love Him and keep His commandments.
translation: Sios, therefore, LORD God bilong yu em i God husat i stap tru, em i ikisim kot bilong en long ol genarashun thousand bilong ol manmeri husat i lavim em na halivim komanda bilong en.

original: But those who hate Him He repays to their faces with destruction; He will not hesitate to repay to his face the one who hates Him.
translation: Na ol i no likim Em, Em i givim bek long ol long pes bilong ol na i bringim bagarap; Em i no bin girua long givim bek long pes bilong man i no likim Em.

original: So keep the commandments and statutes and ordinances that I am giving you to follow this day.
translation: Kisim na holim komandmen, statut na ol loa we mi givim yu, na foloem ol long dei.

original: If you listen to these ordinances and keep them carefully, then the LORD your God will keep His covenant and the loving devotion that He swore to your fathers.
translation: Sapos yu harim tok bilong dispela loa na yu yet long mekim ol i go wel, na yu holim ol dispela ordinasen long het bilong yu, tajta LORD God bilong yu bai I holim covenant bilong En na dios long tingim tumbuna bilong yu, olsem En i bin tok bilong Jehovah long ol.

original: He will love you and bless you and multiply you. He will bless the fruit of your womb and the produce of your land—your grain, new wine, and oil, the young of your herds and the lambs of your flocks—in the land that He swore to your fathers to give you.
translation: Em bai i lovim yu na bai givim yu blessin na kisim i go long olgeta. Em bai blesim pikinini i kam long bel bilong yu na ka i kam long graun bilong yu, olsem kaukau, wain nupela, na oil bilong kokonas, bulmakau na sip - long graun em i promis long papa bilong yu ol long givim yu.

original: You will be blessed above all peoples; among you there will be no barren man or woman or livestock.
translation: Bai yu bai blessim antap long olgeta narapela ples; na long yu, i no gat man o meri o animals we i no inap karim pikinini.

original: And the LORD will remove from you all sickness. He will not lay upon you any of the terrible diseases you knew in Egypt, but He will inflict them on all who hate you.
translation: Na Papa God bai rausim olgeta sik long yu. Em i no bai putim ol narapela sickness bikhet long yu we yu pilai save long en bihaen long Egip, tasol em bai givim ol dispela sickness bikhet long ol i hatim yu.

original: You must destroy all the peoples the LORD your God will deliver to you. Do not look on them with pity. Do not worship their gods, for that will be a snare to you.
translation: Yu mas daunim olgeta ples we Bikpela God bilong yu bai kisim bek long yu. No lookim ol long ai bilong yu, no sori long ol. Yu no wosipim god bilong ol, bikos em bai noken bagarap yu.

original: You may say in your heart, “These nations are greater than we are; how can we drive them out?”
translation: Yu inap tokim long het bilong yu, “Ol narapela kantri i bikpela moa long yapela; yumyu inap pusim ol i go?”

original: But do not be afraid of them. Be sure to remember what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and all Egypt:
translation: No ken bekim afred long ol. Yu mas remember ol samting we LORD God bilong yu mekim long Faraon na olgets long Ijip:

original: the great trials that you saw, the signs and wonders, and the mighty hand and outstretched arm by which the LORD your God brought you out. The LORD your God will do the same to all the peoples you now fear.
translation: Ol bikpela trai ol i lukim, ol sahn em ol wondas, na ol strongpela han em ol arm ol i stap longwe we bilong LORD God bilong yu bai kamautim yu. LORD God bilong yu bai mekim olsem long ol pipel ol i fear nau.

original: Moreover, the LORD your God will send the hornet against them until even the survivors hiding from you have perished.
translation: Na LORD God bilong yu bai sendim winim hornet long ol, na ol i dai finis, olsem na ol i stap yet bikos ol i kaikaim, tasol ol bai peris.

original: Do not be terrified by them, for the LORD your God, who is among you, is a great and awesome God.
translation: No ken skelim long ol, Bikpela LORD God bilong yu em i stap long yu, em i bikpela na i gat graun.

original: The LORD your God will drive out these nations before you little by little. You will not be enabled to eliminate them all at once, or the wild animals would multiply around you.
translation: Papa bilong yu, LORD, bai i drivim ol nesen i go liklik bihain. Yu no ken finishim olgeta narapela taim, tasol bikos ol busna kai bai i multiples long yu.

original: But the LORD your God will give them over to you and throw them into great confusion, until they are destroyed.
translation: Bikpela God bilong yu bai givim ol i go long yu, na ol i kirap strong long konfusen, na bai ol i dai pinis.

original: He will hand their kings over to you, and you will wipe out their names from under heaven. No one will be able to stand against you; you will annihilate them.
translation: Em bai givim king bilong ol i go long yu, na yu bai rausim nem bilong ol long aninit long heven. Nogat wan man bai inap stap agensim yu; yu bai bagarapim ol.

original: You must burn up the images of their gods; do not covet the silver and gold that is on them or take it for yourselves, or you will be ensnared by it; for it is detestable to the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas katim olgeta piksa bilong god blo ol; no ken kam bek long silva na gol, nogat ken kisim, nogat yu bai katim long em, bikos em i strongpela Hevi long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: And you must not bring any detestable thing into your house, or you, like it, will be set apart for destruction. You are to utterly detest and abhor it, because it is set apart for destruction.
translation: Yu no ken kisim samting we i no inap i go insait haus bilong yu, na yu, olsem dispela, bai i bagarap tu. Yu mas hatim strong na amamas long hatim, bikos em i stap long bagarap.

original: You must carefully follow every commandment I am giving you today, so that you may live and multiply, and enter and possess the land that the LORD swore to give your fathers.
translation: Yupela mas bihainim olkaen komandom we mi givim yupela tede, na bai yupela i stap na i multiplicem, na go insait na taker ov eria we LORD promis long givim long papa na mama bilong yupela.

original: Remember that these forty years the LORD your God led you all the way in the wilderness, so that He might humble you and test you in order to know what was in your heart, whether or not you would keep His commandments.
translation: Rimembiri olsem dispens long 40 yia ikam, LORD God bilong yu, em i lidim yu olgeta long ples kanu, na em i mekim yu belis na katim yu, olsem em i laik save long dispela samting i stap insait long het bilong yu, bilong yu bai iusim komandim bilong em o nogat.

original: He humbled you, and in your hunger He gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your fathers had known, so that you might understand that man does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.
translation: Em i mekim yu kam daun, na long taim yu bel isi, em i givim yu manna, kaikai bilong heven, yu na papa bilong yu no save long em, so yu mas save olsem, man i no inap long kaikai bret nomo, tasol i kam long every wod bilong mupla bilong Bikpela.

original: Your clothing did not wear out and your feet did not swell during these forty years.
translation: Rausim pes bilong yu i no klos, na lek bilong yu i no bin swel long dispela forty yia.

original: So know in your heart that just as a man disciplines his son, so the LORD your God disciplines you.
translation: Save long hap bilong yu, olsem papa i skulim pikinini bilong em, nau LORD God bilong yu i skulim yu.

original: Therefore you shall keep the commandments of the LORD your God, walking in His ways and fearing Him.
translation: Bikpela i givim yumi komando, ole yumi mas kisim komando na holim, wokabaut long we bilong Em, na prijin long Em olsem saen bilong respek na obidiens.

original: For the LORD your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of brooks and fountains and springs that flow through the valleys and hills;
translation: Bikos LORD God bilong yu i bringim yu i go long graun i gutpela, graun we i gat ol pikinini river na fonten na spring, ol i ran i go daun long bolus na mauntin;

original: a land of wheat, barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of olive oil and honey;
translation: Wanpela ples we i gat whea, balei, vaine, fig rip, na pomegranate; wanpela ples we i gat oil bilong oliv na hani.

original: a land where you will eat food without scarcity, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and whose hills are ready to be mined for copper.
translation: Wanpela ples we yu ken kaikai kaikai long nating, ina nau no gat skarasi, we yu no ken missim notin; wanpela ples we rok bilong em i aian, na hil bilong en i redi long wokim kopa.

original: When you eat and are satisfied, you are to bless the LORD your God for the good land that He has given you.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kaikai na bel isi, yu mas blessim Lod yu God long goodnaiti gras bilong en i givim yu.

original: Be careful not to forget the LORD your God by failing to keep His commandments and ordinances and statutes, which I am giving you this day.
translation: Kam bek gen i no ken lusim LORD God bilong yu, bikim ol i no holim komando, lo bilong ol tinging, na lo bilong pabilik kantri we mi givim yu long dey.

original: Otherwise, when you eat and are satisfied, when you build fine houses in which to dwell,
translation: Wanpela taim yu kaikai na yu bel isi, wanpela taim yu bilong yupela i save wokim haus nais bilong hap blong yu.

original: and when your herds and flocks grow large and your silver and gold increase and all that you have is multiplied,
translation: Na wane ol bikpela mani na ol kanu bilong yu i go long, na ol sila na gol bilong yu i kisim planti, na olgeta samting bilong yu i multiplicatim,

original: then your heart will become proud, and you will forget the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Bai yumi het i kamap strongpela, na yu bai lusim LORD God bilong yu we i bringim yu aus long kantri Egypt, long haus bilong slav.

original: He led you through the vast and terrifying wilderness with its venomous snakes and scorpions, a thirsty and waterless land. He brought you water from the rock of flint.
translation: Em i bringim yu long bus wel i gat snek i gat poin na skorpion, gras na dai bilong wara. Em i kamautim wata bilong yu long ston flint.

original: He fed you in the wilderness with manna that your fathers had not known, in order to humble you and test you, so that in the end He might cause you to prosper.
translation: Em i givim kaikai long yu, maná, long bus, we papa na mama bilong yu i no save, olsem em i laik bringim yu daun, mekim yu hamas, na traiim yu, olsem yu ina save, na bihain olgeta, em i laik i kamap strong.

original: You might say in your heart, “The power and strength of my hands have made this wealth for me.”
translation: Yu inap tokim long het bilong yu, “Powa na strong bilong han bilong mi ol i mekim dispela moni bilong mi.”

original: But remember that it is the LORD your God who gives you the power to gain wealth, in order to confirm His covenant that He swore to your fathers even to this day.
translation: Rukim olsem, em i LORD Bikpela yu, i givim yu strong bilong kamap rich, bilong confirmim covenant we Em i promis long tumbuna bilong yu, na em i stap strong yet long dispela de.

original: If you ever forget the LORD your God and go after other gods to worship and bow down to them, I testify against you today that you will surely perish.
translation: Sapos yu forgetim Lord God bilong yu na yu go bek gena long narapela kina god, yu pilai i worship ol, na katim hed i go daun long ol, today mi givim witness agenst yu, na bai yu i dai pinis.

original: Like the nations that the LORD has destroyed before you, so you will perish if you do not obey the LORD your God.
translation: Olsem naesen ol naesen we Papa bilong mipela i bin dai pinis long taim bipo, na yu bai i dai, sapos yu no bihainim Bikpela.

original: Hear, O Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and stronger than you, with large cities fortified to the heavens.
translation: Harim, O Isrel: Tudei yu go kamap long krosim river Jordan, na yu go insait na troweim ol narion bikpela moa strong olsem yu, wantaim bikpela taun bung long heven.

original: The people are strong and tall, the descendants of the Anakim. You know about them, and you have heard it said, “Who can stand up to the sons of Anak?”
translation: Ol manmeri i strong na long, ol desenden bilong Anakim. Yu save long ol, yu harim tok bilong ol, "Hu ina bai stap na kaikaim long ol pikinini bilong Anak?"

original: But understand that today the LORD your God goes across ahead of you as a consuming fire; He will destroy them and subdue them before you. And you will drive them out and annihilate them swiftly, as the LORD has promised you.
translation: Bipo tru long tede, LORD God bilong yu i go bifo yu olsem faia i kaikai; em bai bagarapim ol komplet, na em bai daunim ol bifo yu. Na yu bai rausim ol, na yu bai bagarapim ol i go kviktaim, olsem LORD i promisim yu.

original: When the LORD your God has driven them out before you, do not say in your heart, “Because of my righteousness the LORD has brought me in to possess this land.” Rather, the LORD is driving out these nations before you because of their wickedness.
translation: Wanpela taim LORD God bilong yu driva ol i go bifo yu, yu no ken tok long het bilong yu, "LORD i bringim mi kam bekim dispela graun bikos mi i gat jastis." Sapos, LORD i driva ol nesen i go bifo yu bikos ol i mekim ol samting nogut.

original: It is not because of your righteousness or uprightness of heart that you are going in to possess their land, but it is because of their wickedness that the LORD your God is driving out these nations before you, to keep the promise He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
translation: Em i no bikos yu gat daif lo hati o streit lo hati, nau yu go insait long tekim ova graun bilong ol, bai em i bikos ol i gat wikidnes, tasol LORD God bilong yu em i draivim ovaside ol nesen bifoa yu, long mekim promis em i tokim long papa bilong yu, long Abram, Aisak, na Yakob.

original: Understand, then, that it is not because of your righteousness that the LORD your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a stiff-necked people.
translation: Understanding nau, em i no bikos yu gat daon righteousness, tasol LORD God bilong yu em i givim yu dispela gutpela graun long bungim, bikos yu ol i stap olsem pipol i gat nek we i no inap raitim.

original: Remember this, and never forget how you provoked the LORD your God in the wilderness. From the day you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have been rebelling against the LORD.
translation: Rimembiri dispela, yumi no ken forgeten olsem wanem yumi harim tok bilong Bikpela, yumi raisim bel bilong en long bus. Oltaim yumi lusim Egypt kantri, na kam bek long hap em yumi stap nau, yumi go bek long Bikpela, yumi no obedi.

original: At Horeb you provoked the LORD, and He was angry enough to destroy you.
translation: Long Horeb yu mekim bel hevi long LORD, na em i bel koloss long kilim yu.

original: When I went up on the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant that the LORD made with you, I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I ate no bread and drank no water.
translation: Wanpela taim mi go ap long maunten, bai mi kisim pilakai bilong ston, em i pilakai bilong kivaman we LORD mekim wantaim yu. Mi stap yet long maunten forti de na forti nait, na mi no kaikai bret na mi no dring wa.

original: Then the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, inscribed by the finger of God with the exact words that the LORD spoke to you out of the fire on the mountain on the day of the assembly.
translation: Na LORD i givim mi tupla taula pes bilong ston, i raitim olgeta long han bilong God, na i kamapim olka wod nau i tokim yupela long paipa baihe long maunten de bihain long miting bilong ol pipol.

original: And at the end of forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
translation: Na long ol forty de na forty nait, LORD i givim mi tupela tabalet bilong ston, ol tabalet bilong kaivenan.

original: And the LORD said to me, “Get up and go down from here at once, for your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have corrupted themselves. How quickly they have turned aside from the way that I commanded them! They have made for themselves a molten image.”
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim mi, “Kam daun na go nau yet, bikos ol pipol bilong yu, ol yu brom bringim nau long Ijip, ol i bagarap yet ol yet. Ol i lusim rot bilong trai ol i go insait long wankain samting, ol i wokim piksa i meltim bilong ol yet.”

original: The LORD also said to me, “I have seen this people, and they are indeed a stiff-necked people.
translation: Papa God i tokim olsem long me, “Mi lukim piple ia, na ol i pikinini harim bek, ogasta.”

original: Leave Me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. Then I will make you into a nation mightier and greater than they are.”
translation: Lusim mi, nau mi bai distroyim ol, na paitim nem bilong ol i go daun long aninit long heven. Olsem, nau bai mekim yu kamap narapela nesen, strongpela moa na bikpela long ol.

original: So I went back down the mountain while it was blazing with fire, with the two tablets of the covenant in my hands.
translation: Na mi go bek gen long montan, montan i blowim Solomon fire, wantaim tupela ston bilong kaen i stap long han bilong mi.

original: And I saw how you had sinned against the LORD your God; you had made for yourselves a molten calf. You had turned aside quickly from the way that the LORD had commanded you.
translation: Na mi lukim olsem yu bin sin long Bikpela, yu bin mekim ol sel bilong yuself wanpela kalf bilong bronz. Yu bin lusim rot bilong Bikpela i go hap kas, rot we Bikpela bin givim tok long yu.

original: So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, shattering them before your eyes.
translation: Mi kisim tupela ston bilong wrote, na mi rausim nau long han bilong mi, na brikim ol i go antap long ai bilong yu.

original: Then I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, as I had done the first time. I did not eat bread or drink water because of all the sin you had committed in doing what was evil in the sight of the LORD and provoking Him to anger.
translation: Na mi pilai daun bifor Lod long fohti de na fohti nait, olsem mi bin mekim taim pastaim. Mi no kaikai bret na dring wa bilong ol sin yu hamas bin mekim, wokim ol samting nogut long ai bilong Lod, makim em i cross long Lod.

original: For I was afraid of the anger and wrath that the LORD had directed against you, enough to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me this time as well.
translation: Mi bin pised long kros na popoia we LORD im go bekim strong long yu, planti long mekim yu mati. Tasol LORD im harim tok bilong mi tena.

original: The LORD was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, but at that time I also prayed for Aaron.
translation: Bikpela i kros tumas long Aaron olsem i ken kilim em, tasol bai mi go yet na bihain mi prea fo Aaron.

original: And I took that sinful thing, the calf you had made, and burned it in the fire. Then I crushed it and ground it to powder as fine as dust, and I cast it into the stream that came down from the mountain.
translation: Na mi kisim kalv ya, sampela samting i no gut yu mipela mekim, na mi burnim i olgeta long paia. Olsem nau, mi daunim i, mi pilim i i go dasol long powda olsem dasol i lain, na mi tromoi i i go long wara i kam doun long maunten.

original: You continued to provoke the LORD at Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.
translation: Yupela i go hetim Bikpela long Taberah, long Massah, na long Kibroth-hattaavah.

original: And when the LORD sent you out from Kadesh-barnea, He said, “Go up and possess the land that I have given you.” But you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You neither believed Him nor obeyed Him.
translation: Na taim Bikpela i sendim yu go long Kadesh-barnea, olsem toktok bilong en, “Yu go ap long na kisim kantri we mi givim yu.” Tasol yu no obadia tok bilong Bikpela God bilong yu. Yu no bilivim em na yu no harim tok bilong en.

original: You have been rebelling against the LORD since the day I came to know you.
translation: Yu bin paitim bek long Bikpela long taim mi kam save long yu.

original: So I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, because the LORD had said He would destroy you.
translation: Mi bin kirap long graun bifor Lod long fourti dei na fourti nait, wantaim Lod i tokim olsem bai em i kirapim yu.

original: And I prayed to the LORD and said, “O Lord GOD, do not destroy Your people, Your inheritance, whom You redeemed through Your greatness and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
translation: Mi pilai long LORD na mi tokim olsem, "O Lord GOD, no ken dim ol pipol bilong yu, inheritans bilong yu, ol pipol we yu bin bekim bek long pawa bilong yu, na yu bin bringim olt long Egip long han strong.

original: Remember Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Overlook the stubbornness of this people and the wickedness of their sin.
translation: Rimembirim servantram bilong yu Abraham, Aisak, na Yakob. Lukim i go longlong ol i no wanpela bilong dispela ples na ol birua bilong sin blong ol.

original: Otherwise, those in the land from which You brought us out will say, ‘Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land He had promised them, and because He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’
translation: Nogat, ol pipol i stap long kantri we yu bringim mipela out long hem bai tok, ‘LORDE i no inap bringim ol long kantri we hem promis long ol, na bihain LORDE i birua long ol, hem i bringim ol i go kilim ol long bus.’

original: But they are Your people, Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your great power and outstretched arm.”
translation: Bikos ol i pikinini bilong yu, inhetitans bilong yu, yu bin bringim ol long pawa bikpela bilong yu na han istretchim olt.

original: At that time the LORD said to me, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the originals, come up to Me on the mountain, and make an ark of wood.
translation: Long taim i go, LORD i tokim mi, “Kamautim tu tebol ston olsem original, kam ap long maunten na kom iona long mi, na wokim bikpela bokis long diwai.”

original: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke; and you are to place them in the ark.”
translation: Na mi bai raitim ol tkt long tabla, ol tkt i bin stap long tabla bilong bembe, yu bromim; na yu mas putim ol i go insait arka.

original: So I made an ark of acacia wood, chiseled out two stone tablets like the originals, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.
translation: Mi mekim bek bilong mi long diwai bilong akasia, na mi kisim ston na kamautim tupela pilakai bilong ston olsem orijinal, na mi go antap long maunten wantaim tupela pilakai bilong ston long han bilong mi.

original: And the LORD wrote on the tablets what had been written previously, the Ten Commandments that He had spoken to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the assembly. The LORD gave them to me,
translation: Na LORD i raitim long tikets olgeta samting we i bin raitim bifo, Ten Komanda we em i bin tokim long yu antap long maunten long paipa bai faya long de bikos bilong assembli. LORD i givim ol i go long mi.

original: and I went back down the mountain and placed the tablets in the ark I had made, as the LORD had commanded me; and there they have remained.
translation: Na mi go bek daun long maunten, na mi putim tablets long bokis bilong agrikos we mi mekim, olsem LORD i givim tok bilong em long mi; na ol i stap yet.

original: The Israelites traveled from Beeroth Bene-jaakan to Moserah, where Aaron died and was buried, and Eleazar his son succeeded him as priest.
translation: Olipela Isarel i go from Beeroth Bene-jaakan long Moserah, we ol Aaron i dai na kisim bek long graun, na Eleazar sut pikinini bilong em i kamap pries bilong em.

original: From there they traveled to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with streams of water.
translation: Ol i go wakabaut long Gudgodah, na ol i go bek gen long Jotbathah, wanpela ples we i gat streems na wara.

original: At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to serve Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name, as they do to this day.
translation: Long dispela taim, LORD i makim tribe bilong Levi olsem speshal tribe, ili karim bek long ak bilong kovenaunt bilong LORD, stap bifor LORD, warkim servis bilong En, na givim blessing long nem bilong En, olsem ol i wokim yet long taim bai i kam.

original: That is why Levi has no portion or inheritance among his brothers; the LORD is his inheritance, as the LORD your God promised him.
translation: Em i bikos olsem, Levi i no gat pepa o senis long en long ol brata bilong en; LORD em i inheris bilong en, olsem LORD God bilong yu promisim em.

original: I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, like the first time, and that time the LORD again listened to me and agreed not to destroy you.
translation: Mi stap long maunten foerti de na foerti nait, olsem taim bilong fastaem, na Bikpela i harim tok bilong mi, na Bikpela orait nogat bai bagarapim yu.

original: Then the LORD said to me, “Get up. Continue your journey ahead of the people, that they may enter and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”
translation: Ol Masalai i tokim mi, “Kam daun nau, wokabaut bihain long ol pipol, na olgeda inap go insait na taker olgeta graun we Ol Masalai i promis long tok bilong promis bilong en long tumbuna olta.”

original: And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you but to fear the LORD your God by walking in all His ways, to love Him, to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
translation: Na nau, O Isrel, wanem Bikpela i askim yu long yu yet, but long yu pem na ikam long Bikpela yu, bai yu i go wankain long ol wei bilong Em, yu mas lakim Em, na yu mas sarvim Bikpela yu long haret bilong yu yet na long soul bilong yu yet.

original: and to keep the commandments and statutes of the LORD that I am giving you this day for your own good?
translation: Na bilong holim komanda na lo bilong law bilong Papa bilong olgeta, we mi givim yu tede long stap gutpela bilong yu?

original: Behold, to the LORD your God belong the heavens, even the highest heavens, and the earth and everything in it.
translation: Susa, lukim, heven i go antap longpela, na heven i go daun, graun na ol samting i inside, ol i bilong Bikpela i God bilong yu.

original: Yet the LORD has set His affection on your fathers and loved them. And He has chosen you, their descendants after them, above all the peoples, even to this day.
translation: Papa God i laikim tumbuna bilong yu olgeta tumas, na em i lakim ol. Na em i pikinim yu, ol pikinini bilong ol, long ol pipol, stap long taem hait long despela dei.

original: Circumcise your hearts, therefore, and stiffen your necks no more.
translation: Katem skin bilong het bilong yu, na strongim nek bilong yu i no inap harim gen.

original: For the LORD your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, mighty, and awesome God, showing no partiality and accepting no bribe.
translation: Bilong Bikpela God bilong yu, em i God bilong ol god na Lord bilong ol lord, bikpela, strongpela, na aweka God, i no gat pasin bilong kisim sisi, na i no tek bribe.

original: He executes justice for the fatherless and widow, and He loves the foreigner, giving him food and clothing.
translation: Em i mekim raitim pinis long pikinini we i no stap wantaim papa na meri we husband i dai pinis, na Em i lakim man i kam long hap nau, i givim kaikai na klos long em.

original: So you also must love the foreigner, since you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
translation: Yu mas lakim tu man i kam anz, long taim bifo yu yet mas bubu i go bek long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: You are to fear the LORD your God and serve Him. Hold fast to Him and take your oaths in His name.
translation: I gat respek long Jehovah God bilong yu na servim Hem. Yu holim tasol long Hem na yu nouma ol ka bilong yu long nem bilong Hem.

original: He is your praise and He is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome wonders that your eyes have seen.
translation: Em i praiz bilong yu, na em i God bilong yu, noken tasol, em i mekim ol samting bikpela na dainamait wanem yu lukim.

original: Your fathers went down to Egypt, seventy in all, and now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.
translation: Tumbuna bilong yu i go daun long Ejip, sebente na nau Bikpela God bilong yu im mekim yu olsem plenti olsem sta long heven.

original: You shall therefore love the LORD your God and always keep His charge, His statutes, His ordinances, and His commandments.
translation: Yu mas lukim na ramim Bikpela i gat ol powa, YHWH, na yu mas holim strong long tok bilong En, loa bilong En, wok bilong En i givim, na komando bilong En.

original: Know this day that it is not your children who have known and seen the discipline of the LORD your God: His greatness, His mighty hand, and His outstretched arm;
translation: Witi long dispela de olsem, pikinini bilong yu yet, ol i no save long dikplin bilong Lod God bilong yu: Bikpela i bilong em, han bilong em i strong, na arm bilong em i stret;

original: the signs and works He did in Egypt to Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;
translation: Saen na wok ies em mekim long Enet long Pharaoh king bilong Enet na olgeta graun bilong en;

original: what He did to the Egyptian army and horses and chariots when He made the waters of the Red Sea engulf them as they pursued you, and how He destroyed them completely, even to this day;
translation: Olsem nau long ol samting em i mekim long ples bilong armi bilong Ijip, hores na kareta bilong paitim, long taim em i mekim wata bilong Solwara Red i go daun na kisim ol, long taim ol i bihainim yu, na olsem nau em i bagarapim ol gutpela, sapos ol i no stap, riweit na igo inap long tude.

original: what He did for you in the wilderness until you reached this place;
translation: Olsem nau Em mekim olgeta samting long yu long bus na yu kamap long hap dispela.

original: and what He did in the midst of all the Israelites to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, their households, their tents, and every living thing that belonged to them.
translation: Na olsem em mekim long mitsef bilong ol Israelait, long Datan na Abiram, pikinini bilong Eliab Reubenit, wapo graun i opim maus bilong en na kaikai ol, ol husat bilong ol, tent bilong ol, na olgeta samting bilong laip bilong ol.

original: For it is your own eyes that have seen every great work that the LORD has done.
translation: Em i ai bilong yu yet i lukim ol bikpela wok olgeta we LORD i mekim.

original: You shall therefore keep every commandment I am giving you today, so that you may have the strength to go in and possess the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,
translation: Yupela mas holim strong ol komando yet, na bai yupela inap gat strong long go insait na taker ov graun, em i stap long hap pasim wara Jordan na taker ov.

original: and so that you may live long in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give them and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
translation: Na husat i mekim yu stap planti long kantri we LORD i tok strong long papa bilong yu, ol papa bilong yu na ol pikinini bilong ol, long givim ol kantri i gat plenti liklik milksup na hanisup.

original: For the land that you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and irrigated on foot, like a vegetable garden.
translation: Kantri we yu go insait long em na bai yu takem, em i no olsem kantri bilong Ijip, weyu plantim pikinini na yu wataim na yu go wakabaut, olsem gaden kumu.

original: But the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks in the rain from heaven.
translation: Bikos plaika we yu go kroisim Jodan ili go holim em i stap long maunten na bol, na em i draikim ren water long heven.

original: It is a land for which the LORD your God cares; the eyes of the LORD your God are always on it, from the beginning to the end of the year.
translation: Em i wanpela graun we Bikpela LORD God bilong yu i stap tok ba, na ai bilong Bikpela LORD God bilong yu i stap lukim em oltaim, stat long hap bilong yia go long las bilong yia.

original: So if you carefully obey the commandments I am giving you today, to love the LORD your God and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,
translation: Sapos yu harim gut na kisim ka long komanda i go, long bilip strongim LORD God bilong yu, na servim Em long halivim yu yet long olgeta spirit bilong yu,

original: then I will provide rain for your land in season, the autumn and spring rains, that you may gather your grain, new wine, and oil.
translation: Nambis, bai mi givim ren water long graun bilong yu long taim bilong kalap na kukim olsem, kidim yu ken kisim ka, wain nupela, na moil.

original: And I will provide grass in the fields for your livestock, and you will eat and be satisfied.
translation: Mi bai givim gras long ples gras bilong yu, na ol kaikai bilong aninit bai kaikai na yu bai amamas.

original: But be careful that you are not enticed to turn aside to worship and bow down to other gods,
translation: Bikos yu mas bekim yu yet, inap long yu go longwey na kukim i go long ol narapela kina god, na yu mekim worship na bend daun long ol.

original: or the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you. He will shut the heavens so that there will be no rain, nor will the land yield its produce, and you will soon perish from the good land that the LORD is giving you.
translation: LORD i mas bosim tok bilong en, na em bai katim heven, so nau ol ren bai i no kam, gras bilong kantri bai i no kisim ka, na yu bai daun kikim olgeta long kantri nais bilong LORD i givim yu.

original: Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as reminders on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
translation: Plantim wod bilong mi long hevi na tingting bilong yumi, binim olsem skulim i go bek long han bilong yumi, na binim ol long hevi bilong ai bilong yumi.

original: Teach them to your children, speaking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
translation: Skulim ol i go long pikinini bilong yu, toktok long dispela wakati yu sindaun long haus, na wakati yu wokabaut long rot, na wakati yu lusim ai, na wakati yu kamap.

original: Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates,
translation: Wraiim olsem long hap bilong hus na long gate bilong yu,

original: so that as long as the heavens are above the earth, your days and those of your children may be multiplied in the land that the LORD swore to give your fathers.
translation: Olsem long olheven i stap abovim graun, dei bilong yu na bilong pikinini bilong yu bai i gat planti long lan we LORD i tokstrong long givim papa bilong yu.

original: For if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you to follow—to love the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, and to hold fast to Him—
translation: Sapos yu jikim gut olgeta komando ya, na yu long bilip strongim LORD God bilong yu, na yu long warkabaut long ol rot bilong em, na yu long hap bikpela em i stap —

original: then the LORD will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and stronger than you.
translation: Na Bikpela bai kirapim olgeta narapela kantri long bian bilong yupela, na yupela bai taitim olgeta kantri i gret mo strong long yupela.

original: Every place where the sole of your foot treads will be yours. Your territory will extend from the wilderness to Lebanon, and from the Euphrates River to the Western Sea.
translation: Olgeta ples we sol bilong foot blong yu kamdaun, em bai bilong yu. Boundary bilong yu bai go longwe, stat long bus na go inap long Lebanon, na stat long Riv Euphrates na go inap long Solwara Not.

original: No man will be able to stand against you; the LORD your God will put the fear and dread of you upon all the land, wherever you set foot, as He has promised you.
translation: No man bai inawe no ken stanap long yu; LORD God bilong yu bai putim fea na wikim i go long olgeta graun, we bilong yu go kamdaun, olsem em i promise long yu.

original: See, today I am setting before you a blessing and a curse—
translation: Lukim, tude long taim mipela katim tok bilong yu, bai yumi givim yu blesin na kros.

original: a blessing if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I am giving you today,
translation: Wanpela blesing i kam long yu if yu bihainim komandom bilong LORD God bilong yu we mi givim yu tude.
