original: but a curse if you disobey the commandments of the LORD your God and turn aside from the path I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known.
translation: Bai yu kisim kakaruk ifyu no bihainim tok save blong Bikpela God bilong yu, na yu lusim rot bilong trai we mi tokim yu tude, na yu go bek gen bihainim god nodor long wei we yu no save.

original: When the LORD your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
translation: Wanpela taim olsem bikos LORD God bilong yu bringim yu go long kantri yu laik takeda i kam, yu mas kamdai tok blesim long Maunt Gerizim na tok birua long Maunt Ebal.

original: Are not these mountains across the Jordan, west of the road toward the sunset, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah opposite Gilgal near the Oak of Moreh?
translation: Dispela munten i stap kros long Jordan, wes long sait bilong rod i go daun sun, long kantri bilong Kananaits ol i stap long Araba klostu long Gilgal, nambis long Oak bilong Moreh?

original: For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you. When you take possession of it and settle in it,
translation: Yupela i go long kam bek gen long Jordan, igo insait na kisim ken gras long Graun bilong Promis, Makingsens bilong go bek gen long Jordan, igo insait long Ipelang bilong Bikpela, em Bikpela i givim yupela. Wanpela taim yupela kisim ken gras long en na stet long en,

original: be careful to follow all the statutes and ordinances that I am setting before you today.
translation: Yu mas kisim hevi long bihainim ol loa na kaanon bilong mipela we mi mekim gen pinis tude.

original: These are the statutes and ordinances you must be careful to follow all the days you live in the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess.
translation: Dispela lo bilong yumi na ol loa, yumi mas bekim gut na bihainim ol, long ol dei yumi stap long kantri, we Bikpela, God bilong tumbuna bilong yumi, givim yumi long bungim.

original: Destroy completely all the places where the nations you are dispossessing have served their gods—atop the high mountains, on the hills, and under every green tree.
translation: Bagarapim olgeta hap bilong ples we ol nesen i servim god bilong ol – longtop hap bilong maunten, long hap bilong kilik, na aninit long ol kalip bilong diwai i gat gris.

original: Tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, burn up their Asherah poles, cut down the idols of their gods, and wipe out their names from every place.
translation: Tukim dai alta bun, brisim pilia bilong halivim, kaim ol Asherah poles i go, kisim na katim ol idols bilong ol god bilong ol, na wisim aut nem bilong ol long ol ples.

original: You shall not worship the LORD your God in this way.
translation: Yu no ken worshipim LORD God bilong yu long dispela wei.

original: Instead, you must seek the place the LORD your God will choose from among all your tribes to establish as a dwelling for His Name, and there you must go.
translation: Inste, yu mas sukim ples we LORD God bilong yu bai chusim long ol lain bilong yu, na wokim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong En, na yupela mas go long hap.

original: To that place you are to bring your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and heave offerings, your vow offerings and freewill offerings, as well as the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
translation: Long hap bilong em, yu bringim ofa bilong bun, sakrifais, tithes, hevi ofa, ofa bilong promis, ofa givim frei, na pikinini birisen bilong bulmakau na sipil bilong yu.

original: There, in the presence of the LORD your God, you and your households shall eat and rejoice in all you do, because the LORD your God has blessed you.
translation: Long ol pipel bilong Jehovah God yu, yu na husat i stap wantaim yu, bai yu kaikai na hap hap long ol samting yu mekim, bikos dispela Jehovah God yu i givim yu planti gud.

original: You are not to do as we are doing here today, where everyone does what seems right in his own eyes.
translation: Yupela no ken do olsem mipela i mekim tude, hap man i mekim olsem i tingim i orait long ai bilong em yet.

original: For you have not yet come to the resting place and the inheritance that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Yu stil i no kam long ples bilong rip na ka bilong yu we Bikpela LORD God bai givim yu.

original: When you cross the Jordan and live in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and He gives you rest from all the enemies around you and you dwell securely,
translation: Wanpela taim yu go pas long Jordan, stap long kantri Bikpela God bilong yu bai givim yu olgeta as kantri bilong yu, na em i givim yu bodi i kamap klia long ol nemigis bilong yu, na yu stap nogut tru,

original: then the LORD your God will choose a dwelling for His Name. And there you are to bring everything I command you: your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice offerings you vow to the LORD.
translation: Na bai Lod God bilong yu kisim ples bilong em yet na balusim olsem, na em bai stap. Na bihain yu bringim ol samting we mi givim yu ol tok: ol birua yu mekim, ol sakrifis yu ofa, ol tenth yu givim, na ol spesal gif yu givim, na ol bikpela ofa yu promis long Lod.

original: And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.
translation: Na yu mas hapim bek long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu - yu, susa na pikinini bilong yu, manmeri na hap meri bilong yu, na Levait i stap long gate na vilij bilong yu, bikos em i no gat ka na brigina long yu.

original: Be careful not to offer your burnt offerings in just any place you see;
translation: Usim gut, inap yu no ken kisim ofa bilong yu kotim long hap tasol;

original: you must offer them only in the place the LORD will choose in one of your tribal territories, and there you shall do all that I command you.
translation: Yu mas givim ol i go long ples we LORD I chusim long wanpela bilong yuprovin, na long hap yu mas mekim olgeta samting we mi tokim yu.

original: But whenever you want, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your gates, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you. Both the ceremonially clean and unclean may eat it as they would a gazelle or deer,
translation: Waneva taim yu laik, yu ken kilim na kaikai mit long olgeta gate bilong yu, olsem bleising we LORD GOD bilong yu givim i kam long yu. Pipia na klin bilong seremoni ol i ken kaikai, olsem ol i kilim kangal na walusi.

original: but you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
translation: Bikos yu no ken kaikai blod; yu mas pilim i daun long graun olsem wara.

original: Within your gates you must not eat the tithe of your grain or new wine or oil, the firstborn of your herds or flocks, any of the offerings that you have vowed to give, or your freewill offerings or special gifts.
translation: Long stretpela graun bilong yu, yu no ken kaikai tithe (em 10%) bilong graun, wain nupela, oda oli, pikinini birua bilong bulmakau oda sip, olgetsamting ofa yu promis long givim, oda ofa yu laik givim, oda gif we yu laik givim.

original: Instead, you must eat them in the presence of the LORD your God at the place the LORD your God will choose—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates. Rejoice before the LORD your God in all you do,
translation: Inste, yu mas kai ol samting long lok bilong LORD God bilong yu long ples we LORD God bilong yu baim choosim - yu, yu husat, yu meri, man serpent, meri serpent, na Levai long geit bilong taun. Yu mas amamas long LORD God bilong yu long ol samting yu mekim.

original: and be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land.
translation: No ken lusim Ol Levitiko, kisim hevi long ol, olsem long ol lif blo yu long graun blo yumi.

original: When the LORD your God expands your territory as He has promised, and you crave meat and say, “I want to eat meat,” you may eat it whenever you want.
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela bilong yu stap strongim graun bilong yu olsem em i promis, na yu laik kaikai mit na yu tok, "Mipela laik kaikai mit," yu ken kaikai olgeta taim yu laik.

original: If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His Name is too far from you, then you may slaughter any of the herd or flock He has given you, as I have commanded you, and you may eat it within your gates whenever you want.
translation: Sapos ples we LORD God bilong yu bikim nem bilong En i go long way long yu, na yu ken kilim eni animal husat i givim yu, ol sel na pipel husat i givim yu, olsem na mi tokim yu, na yu ken kaikai gen inside gatem bilong yu, wanem taim yu laik.

original: Indeed, you may eat it as you would eat a gazelle or deer; both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it.
translation: Inan, yu ina kaikai em olsem yu kaikai kalakal na man; na ol pipel i no klia na ol klia ina kaikai em.

original: Only be sure not to eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat.
translation: Yu mas sikir, nogat kukim blod wantaim mit, bikos laip em i kalabus long blod, na yu no ken kaikai laip wantaim mit.

original: You must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
translation: Yupela no ken kaikai blod; pusa i go daun olsem wara long graun.

original: Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
translation: Yu no kaikai, bai yu gat gutpela de, na pikinini bilong yu, bihainim yu, olsem nau yu wokim ol samting we i orait long ai bilong Bikpela.

original: But you are to take your holy things and your vow offerings and go to the place the LORD will choose.
translation: Kisim pinis samting bilong yu we em i holy na ofa bilong promis, na go long ples we LORD bai chusim.

original: Present the meat and blood of your burnt offerings on the altar of the LORD your God. The blood of your other sacrifices must be poured out beside the altar of the LORD your God, but you may eat the meat.
translation: Kisim olkaen na blod bilong ol kaikai we yu barim pinis i go antap long altiya bilong LORD God bilong yu. Blod bilong ol nara samting yu givim long LORD mas pipia i go daun besaida long altiya bilong LORD God bilong yu, tasol yas, yu ken kaikai olkaen.

original: Be careful to obey all these things I command you, so that it may always go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas tok orait long mekim olgetting bilong mi, bai olgeta samting bambai i go wel wantaim yu na pikinini i kam bihain long yu, bikos yu mekim ol sampela gup na ret long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: When the LORD your God cuts off before you the nations you are entering to dispossess, and you drive them out and live in their land,
translation: Wanpela taim ol LORD God bilong yu katim bifor yu nesen ol tormwei pipol i stap, na yu go insait long paitim na drivim ol pipol i go aus, na yu stap long graun bilong ol,

original: be careful not to be ensnared by their ways after they have been destroyed before you. Do not inquire about their gods, asking, “How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise.”
translation: Kam bek gen, ina bai yu no katim long olsem wok bilong ol. Ol i go daun na bikos ol i bin mekim olgeta samting i no gut. Yu no ken askim long god bilong ol, nogut yu tok, "Olsem wanem ol dispela nesen i servim god bilong ol? Mi bai mekim olsem tu."

original: You must not worship the LORD your God in this way, because they practice for their gods every abomination which the LORD hates. They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.
translation: Yupela no ken worshipim Lord God bilong yumi long wei olsem, bikos ol i praktisim ol samting nogut bilong ol god bilong ol, olgeta samting ol i mekim em i nogut long ai bilong Lord, ol i kilim ol pikinini bilong ol manmeri na ol meri long faia bilong ol sacrifice long ol god bilong ol.

original: See that you do everything I command you; do not add to it or subtract from it.
translation: Sios long yu yet, olgeta samting mi tokim yu, yumas; olgeta samting mi givim yu, yu mas mekim, yu no ken kisim moa long en, na yu no ken tekewe kaikai long en.

original: If a prophet or dreamer of dreams arises among you and proclaims a sign or wonder to you,
translation: I gat man prophet o man we i save sindaun long stap i kamap long yu, em i tokpela sindaun o mirakol long yu,

original: and if the sign or wonder he has spoken to you comes about, but he says, “Let us follow other gods (which you have not known) and let us worship them,”
translation: Na sain i kamap o wonder i kamap, tasol em i tok, "Yumi go bek gen long narapela god ol i no bin save long bipo, na yumi folim ol, yumi worshipim ol."

original: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer. For the LORD your God is testing you to find out whether you love Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
translation: Yu no ken harim tok bilong prat na man we i save long draim. Bikos LORD God bilong yu em i testim yu, from olsem bai yu inap show olsem yu lovim em wantaim het bilong yu na spirit bilong yu.

original: You are to follow the LORD your God and fear Him. Keep His commandments and listen to His voice; serve Him and hold fast to Him.
translation: Yu mas bihain long Bikpela LORD God bilong yu, i gat respek long Em. Yu holim strong long tok bilong Em, yu harim toktok bilong Em; yu warkim servis long Em, yu gripim strong long Em.

original: Such a prophet or dreamer must be put to death, because he has advocated rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery; he has tried to turn you from the way in which the LORD your God has commanded you to walk. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: Man propesi o man i save driman olsem, em i mas dai, bikos em i tokim yumi larim Jehovah God bilong yu, God i bringim yu komota long kantri bilong Ijip na holim yu na kisim yu komota long haus bilong slaviri; em i laik tromweim yu long rot bilong Jehovah God bilong yu we em i tokim yu long go. Nogat, yumi mas rausim ol samting nogut na kilim ol long mekim nogut long miyet bilong yumi.

original: If your very own brother, or your son or daughter, or the wife you embrace, or your closest friend secretly entices you, saying, “Let us go and worship other gods” (which neither you nor your fathers have known,
translation: Sapos brata bilong yu yet, o sapos son o daughter bilong yu, o meri bilong yu husat yu kisim i kam, o poroman bilong yu husat i tokim yu long ka, tok olsem, “Mipela go na worship ol kina god i no save long mipela” (ol gods husat ni yumi yet o ni papa bilong yumi i no save long taim bifo),

original: the gods of the peoples around you, whether near or far, whether from one end of the earth or the other),
translation: Devels bilong ol piple klostu long yu, na i gat long nara na far, long wanpela hap bilong graun o long nather hap,

original: you must not yield to him or listen to him. Show him no pity, and do not spare him or shield him.
translation: Yu no ken givim ap long em, yu no ken harim toktok bilong em. Yu no ken givim em meri, yu no ken skiptim em, na yu no ken kisim kaer bilong em.

original: Instead, you must surely kill him. Your hand must be the first against him to put him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
translation: Yu mas kilim em stap, na han bilong yu em i mas kam first long en, mekim em i dai, na bai han bilong ol pipol i go longen.

original: Stone him to death for trying to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Kwasim ston i go daun long en, em i laik tromwe yu nau long LORD God bilong yu, we i bringim yu komota long kantri Ipig, komota long haus bilong slaviri.

original: Then all Israel will hear and be afraid, and will never again do such a wicked thing among you.
translation: Ol Israel yumi hariam na poret, na bai no ken go bek long mekim gen ol samting nogut dispela kain tasol longyu.

original: If, regarding one of the cities the LORD your God is giving you to inhabit, you hear it said
translation: I kam long wanpela bilong ol siti we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu oli stap long en, na yu harim ol tok

original: that wicked men have arisen from among you and have led the people of their city astray, saying, “Let us go and serve other gods” (which you have not known),
translation: Ol man i no gat laik long tok bilong God, ol i kamap nau long mipela, na ol i bringim confusion long ol pipel bilong taun bilong ol, ol i tok, "Mipela i go na wokim servos long olegoda" (we ol i no save long dispela).

original: then you must inquire, investigate, and interrogate thoroughly. And if it is established with certainty that this abomination has been committed among you,
translation: Bai yu mas askim, wariim, na krosim ol i go insait long nogut. Na bai ol i lukim strong long troto, na samting nogut tru em i kamap long mipela,

original: you must surely put the inhabitants of that city to the sword. Devote to destruction all its people and livestock.
translation: Yupela mas kilim olgeta ol pipel i stap long taun, na ol animals, bagarap olgeta. Tahen ol long daun na kilim, bikos ol i mas dai.

original: And you are to gather all its plunder in the middle of the public square, and completely burn the city and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the LORD your God. The city must remain a mound of ruins forever, never to be rebuilt.
translation: Na yu mas kisim olgeta bilong en i go bek long hap bilong ples, na burnim taun na olgeta bilong en long ofa bilong bungim olgeta olsem ofa bilong bungim olgeta long Bikpela, God bilong yu. Taun igat i stap olsem wanpela mun ikon long ruina foreva, inap long wokim gen.

original: Nothing devoted to destruction shall cling to your hands, so that the LORD will turn from His fierce anger, grant you mercy, show you compassion, and multiply you as He swore to your fathers,
translation: Nogat samting we i kam long desroi bai stap long han bilong yu, na LORD bai lusim nakamal anga bilong en, givim yu amamas, showim yu klostu, na i multiplai yupela olsem em promis long tumbuna bilong yupela.

original: because you obey the LORD your God, keeping all His commandments I am giving you today and doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
translation: Bikos yu harim tok bilong Bikpela, yu bihainim ol lain bilong en, na yu kisim holim ol wok bilong en, na yu mekim olgeta samting nau, na yu wokim gutpela samting long ai bilong Bikpela.

original: You are sons of the LORD your God; do not cut yourselves or shave your foreheads on behalf of the dead,
translation: Yupela i pikinini bilong LORD God bilong yupela; no ken katim sking bilong yupela, na no ken sapa hed bilong yupela long ai bilong ol dai.

original: for you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD has chosen you to be a people for His prized possession out of all the peoples on the face of the earth.
translation: Yupela i stap ol pipol we halo long LORD, Bikpela yupela. LORD im choosim yupela olsem em i pris bilong mipela long olgeta ol pipol long fas bilong earth.

original: You must not eat any detestable thing.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai ol samting we i nogat gutpela.

original: These are the animals that you may eat: The ox, the sheep, the goat,
translation: Ol dispela animal husat yu ken kaikai: bulmakau, sip, be kambing.

original: the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
translation: Dei bilong bus, gazelle, roe dei bilong bus, pisin i go long bus we i no stap long ples, ibex, antelope, na sheep bilong maunten.

original: You may eat any animal that has a split hoof divided in two and that chews the cud.
translation: Yu ina kaikai ol kain animal husat i gat fula tupela hap, em i katim i go long tupela hap, na em i kai kai bek gen.

original: But of those that chew the cud or have a completely divided hoof, you are not to eat the following: the camel, the rabbit, or the rock badger. Although they chew the cud, they do not have a divided hoof. They are unclean for you,
translation: Bikos ol animal i kaikai gras bilong kuk o i gat hoof bilong ol i go daun olsem, yu no ken kaikai dispela: kamel, kon, rok badja. Ol i kaikai gras bilong kuk tasol ol i no gat hoof bilong ol i go daun olsem. Ol i no ino gat klea long yu.

original: as well as the pig; though it has a divided hoof, it does not chew the cud. It is unclean for you. You must not eat its meat or touch its carcass.
translation: Olsem na pig; em i gat fut bilong anim we i katim i go raun, tasol em i no kaikai gras na kamarim. Em i no inap long yupela. Yupela no ken kaikai mit bilong em, na yupela no ken tetim bodi bilong em.

original: Of all the creatures that live in the water, you may eat anything with fins and scales,
translation: Long olgeta kain krea ol i stap long wara, yu ken kaikai ol krea ol i gat pinis na eskela.

original: but you may not eat anything that does not have fins and scales; it is unclean for you.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai ol samting we i no gat pinis blong pis na skel blong pis; em i no inap long yu.

original: You may eat any clean bird,
translation: Yu ken kaikai eni pisin i klia,

original: but these you may not eat: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
translation: Bain olsem niuigim ol i no inap kaikai: ol igil, ol kuskus na ol buk,

original: the red kite, the falcon, any kind of kite,
translation: Kilip balus rot, falikan, nambis kain kilip,

original: any kind of raven,
translation: Ol kain birua,

original: the ostrich, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
translation: Malom, kaikai ol i save singaut i go het long nait, pisin bilong solwara, na ol kain bird bilong prey.

original: the little owl, the great owl, the white owl,
translation: Pikinini kukukuku, kukukuku bikpela, kukukuku wei,

original: the desert owl, the osprey, the cormorant,
translation: Malukuk bilong bus, osprey, manukul,

original: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, or the bat.
translation: Stok, ol kain heron, hoopoe, o balus.

original: All flying insects are unclean for you; they may not be eaten.
translation: Ol samting i go long skai, ol i no inap long yupela, yupela no inap kaikai ol.

original: But you may eat any clean bird.
translation: Bikos yu ken kaikai ol pisin i kamap na klia.

original: You are not to eat any carcass; you may give it to the foreigner residing within your gates, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a holy people belonging to the LORD your God. You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai nek bilong eni animal i dai pinis; yu ina ken givim long ol yangpela man o meri i stap long ples bilong yu, na em ina ken kaikai, o yu ina ken selim long ol yangpela man o meri. Bikos yu ol i narapela pisin, na bilon Bibelo Got bilong yu. Yu no ken kukim pikinini goat long susu bilong mama.

original: You must be sure to set aside a tenth of all the produce brought forth each year from your fields.
translation: Yu mas putim asi desepel taen porsen bilong ol ka i kamap nau long yia long graun bilong yu.

original: And you are to eat a tenth of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the LORD your God at the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name, so that you may learn to fear the LORD your God always.
translation: Na yu mas kaikai 10% bilong yu grain, wain nupela, na oil bilong olive, na pikinini bilong papa bilong ol bulmakau na ol sip, long wei bilong LORD God yu, long ples we em i laik chusim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong en, so na yu ken larim fearim LORD God yu oltaim.

original: But if the distance is too great for you to carry that with which the LORD your God has blessed you, because the place where the LORD your God will choose to put His Name is too far away,
translation: Sikir em i go long olsem, na distans i heavy tumas long yu karim ol samting we GOD yu bikim planti i givim yu, bikos ples we GOD yu bai choosim long putim Nem bilong En i stap longwe.

original: then exchange it for money, take the money in your hand, and go to the place the LORD your God will choose.
translation: Switim em long moni, kisim moni i go long han bilong yu, na go long ples we LORD Bikpela yu God baim yu chusim.

original: Then you may spend the money on anything you desire: cattle, sheep, wine, strong drink, or anything you wish. You are to feast there in the presence of the LORD your God and rejoice with your household.
translation: Bai yu ken usim moni long eni samting yu laik: bulmakau, sip, wain, drik strongpela, o eni samting yu laik. Yu mas kaikai olgeta i go hap long ples we LORD God bilong yu stap, na hamamas wantaim ol famili bilong yu long wei bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: And do not neglect the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.
translation: Na yu no ken kisim olsem Levai long bilong yu yet, long tok bilong dispela, em i no gat pepa o lond long mipela.

original: At the end of every three years, bring a tenth of all your produce for that year and lay it up within your gates.
translation: Long olpela tres ia i go daun, yu mas kisim tent olof ka moni bilong yia, bungim na bringim i go, putim i insait long gate bilong yu.

original: Then the Levite (because he has no portion or inheritance among you), the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow within your gates may come and eat and be satisfied. And the LORD your God will bless you in all the work of your hands.
translation: Na Levait, em i no gat hap o inheritans long yu, na ol i kam long nesen, pikinini we i no haben papa, na meri we i no haben husban, ol i ken kam long olpela gate bilong yu, bai i kam na kaikai na bel isi. Na LORD God bilong yu bai givim yu blessin long olgeta wok bilong han bilong yu.

original: At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.
translation: Long las piksa bilong ka kalenda yia seven, yu mas kankel ol det.

original: This is the manner of remission: Every creditor shall cancel what he has loaned to his neighbor. He is not to collect anything from his neighbor or brother, because the LORD’s time of release has been proclaimed.
translation: Dispela em i wais bilong remisen: Olgeta man i save moni long han i mas kisim bek moni bai ol i givim long brata na nebér. Ol i no ken bekim moni, bikos taim bilong LORD long lusim sin ol i praklisim pinis.

original: You may collect something from a foreigner, but you must forgive whatever your brother owes you.
translation: Yu ken kisim ol samting long man i kam long naiten, be yu mas forgivim ol samting we brata bilong yu i dae i oweim yu.

original: There will be no poor among you, however, because the LORD will surely bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance,
translation: Nogat ol i no ken bikim po na i kamap long yu, wantaim Ol Masalai bai givim yu bleksing tru long lan i go Ol Masalai God bilong yu i givim yu inaid long en.

original: if only you obey the LORD your God and are careful to follow all these commandments I am giving you today.
translation: Sapos yu hariap long Bikpela, na yu ken i save long mekim olgeta dispela tok bilong law em mi givim yu tude.

original: When the LORD your God blesses you as He has promised, you will lend to many nations but borrow from none; you will rule over many nations but be ruled by none.
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela God bilong yu i givim yu bleessim olsem em promis, yu bai lendim moni long planti narapela kantri tasol Yu no go kisim long narapela kantri; yu bai bosim planti narapela kantri tasol narapela kantri i no bosim yu.

original: If there is a poor man among your brothers within any of the gates in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, then you are not to harden your heart or shut your hand from your poor brother.
translation: I gat man i no save long moni long olgeta gate bilong ples long kantri we LORD GOD bilong yu i givim yu, then yu no ken skulim het bilong yu, yu no ken kisim han bilong yu aweyte from brata bilong yu i no save long moni.

original: Instead, you are to open your hand to him and freely loan him whatever he needs.
translation: Yu mas opim han bilong yu long em, na givim em lenden long eni samting em i nidim.

original: Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought in your heart: “The seventh year, the year of release, is near,” so that you look upon your poor brother begrudgingly and give him nothing. He will cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
translation: Biporot long tingim olsem na yogel nogut i go insait long bek bilong yu: “Yia bilong lusim olgeta debt, em i kamap gen,” na yu no lookim brother bilong yu i nogat samting olsem i bagarap, na yu givim em i nothing. Em bai karim tok go long LORD olsem yu mekim rong, na yu bai bagarap long sin.

original: Give generously to him, and do not let your heart be grieved when you do so. And because of this the LORD your God will bless you in all your work and in everything to which you put your hand.
translation: Givim planti long em, no ken let haret bilong yu sori wanpela taim yu mekim olsem. Na bikos olgeta dispela, LORD God bilong yu, em bai givim birua long yu long olgeta wok bilong yu, na long olgeta samting yu putim han bilong yu long en.

original: For there will never cease to be poor in the land; that is why I am commanding you to open wide your hand to your brother and to the poor and needy in your land.
translation: Ol pobre bai I stap olsem long taim nau long kantri; em i bikos olsem, nau mi aman bilong yu, opim wel gutpela han bilong yu long brata bilong yu na long ol pobre na ol i gat biknem long gras bilong kantri.

original: If a fellow Hebrew, a man or a woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you must set him free.
translation: Igat brata bilong yumi Hebrew, man o meri, inem bai salim i go long yu, na em i wok servis long yu long wik six, tasol long yia sevén, yu mas givim em fri.

original: And when you release him, do not send him away empty-handed.
translation: Wanpela taim yu lusim em, no ken sendim em i go nogat samting long han.

original: You are to furnish him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress. You shall give to him as the LORD your God has blessed you.
translation: Yu mas givim i planti long em, givim i planti from bus bilong yu, long ples bilong yu wokim ka, na long ples bilong yu kisim wain. Yu susu givim i long em olsem Jehovah God bilong yu givim yu planti.

original: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you; that is why I am giving you this command today.
translation: Yumi rimembir olsem yumi bin slave long kantri bilong Ijip, na LORD God bilong yumi bin beiem yumi bek long han bilong en; dispela em i ritim bilong wei nau God i givim dispela tok instrksen long yumi tude.

original: But if your servant says to you, ‘I do not want to leave you,’ because he loves you and your household and is well off with you,
translation: Bai yu servit i tokim olsem long yu, 'Mipela no laik lusim yu,' bikos em i lakim yu na husat i kam wantaim yu, na olgeta samting i go wel wantaim yu,

original: then take an awl and pierce it through his ear into the door, and he will become your servant for life. And treat your maidservant the same way.
translation: Kisim wanpela nidl na pokim em long ek bilong em insait long dor, na em bai bikim servant bilong yu foreva. Na yu mas tritim meri servan bilong yu olsem.

original: Do not regard it as a hardship to set your servant free, because his six years of service were worth twice the wages of a hired hand. And the LORD your God will bless you in all you do.
translation: No ken long narapela i stap olsem kros long givim servan bilong yu i go fri, bikos sikis yia servisis bilong en i stap woth tupela taim moni bilong man i wok hire. Na LORD God bilong yu bai blesim yu long olgetsamting yu mekim.

original: You must set apart to the LORD your God every firstborn male produced by your herds and flocks. You are not to put the firstborn of your oxen to work, nor are you to shear the firstborn of your flock.
translation: Yu mas skelim ap long LORD God bilong yu, olgeta man pikinini bilong yu we i kam bek gen long ol cattle na ol sheep. Yu no ken salim wokim ol pikinini bilong ol bulmakau, na yu no ken katim wool bilong ol pikinini sheep.

original: Each year you and your household are to eat it before the LORD your God in the place the LORD will choose.
translation: Long ol yia, yu na husat i stap wantaim yu, yupela i go kaikai olgeta long ples we Lod bai chusim, bifor Lod God bilong yu.

original: But if an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.
translation: Sapos animal i gat birua, lek na wara, ai i papait, o i gat dokisens bin i kamap strong, yupela no ken givim i go long LORD God bilong yupela olsem.

original: Eat it within your gates; both the ceremonially unclean and clean may eat it as they would a gazelle or a deer.
translation: Kaikai long lo bilong yu; na ol i nogat kleen long lotu na ol i klia i mas kaikai, olsem ol i kaikai kalakal na walusi.

original: But you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
translation: Bai yu no ken kaikai blod; yu salim i go daun olsem wara.

original: Observe the month of Abib and celebrate the Passover to the LORD your God, because in the month of Abib the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
translation: Kisim tok bilong mun Abib i go, na ol i kirapim Pasaka long GOD bilong ol, Bikpela, wantaim ol samting, bikos long mun Abib GOD bilong ol, Bikpela bam i karim yu komot long Egip long nait.

original: You are to offer to the LORD your God the Passover sacrifice from the herd or flock in the place the LORD will choose as a dwelling for His Name.
translation: Yu mas givim long LorD God bilong yu sakrifis bilong Pasowa husat i kam long bulmakau o husat i kam long pik, long ples we LorD bambai chusim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong En.

original: You must not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you are to eat with it unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, because you left the land of Egypt in haste—so that you may remember for the rest of your life the day you left the land of Egypt.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai bret i gat yeast wantaim; yu mas kaikai bret i no gat yeast, em i bret bilong sori, long seven dei, bikos yumi oli lusim kantri Egip long hastam — olsem na yu mas remembera long ol taim bilong yumi dey yumi lusim kantri Egip.

original: No leaven is to be found in all your land for seven days, and none of the meat you sacrifice in the evening of the first day shall remain until morning.
translation: I no ken stap yiest long olgeta graun bilong yu fo sevnde de, na non blo mikpela kai bilong kilim bai i no ken stap til mornin.

original: You are not to sacrifice the Passover animal in any of the towns that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Yu no ken skarifais animal bilong Pasowa long olgeta taun we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu.

original: You must only offer the Passover sacrifice at the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name. Do this in the evening as the sun sets, at the same time you departed from Egypt.
translation: Yu mas givim sakrifis bilong Pasova long ples we LORD God bilong yu bai chusim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong En. Yu mas mekim dispela wok naitaira long taem san i go daun, long taem yumi lusim Egypt olsem.

original: And you shall roast it and eat it in the place the LORD your God will choose, and in the morning you shall return to your tents.
translation: Na yu mas kukim em na kai kai long ples wei LorD God bilong yu bikim choos, na long moning yu mas go bek long hanus bilong yu.

original: For six days you must eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day you shall hold a solemn assembly to the LORD your God, and you must not do any work.
translation: For sikis de yu mas kaikai bret i no gat yeast, na long de namba seven yu ken harim tok bilong bikpela long Bikpela God bilong yu, na yu no ken wokim wok.

original: You are to count off seven weeks from the time you first put the sickle to the standing grain.
translation: Yu mas kauntim na kalap seven wiks from taim yu pusim sikil i go long graun em i stap yet.

original: And you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the LORD your God with a freewill offering that you give in proportion to how the LORD your God has blessed you,
translation: Na yu mas hapim Kaen Wik long LORD, GOD bilong yu, wantaim ofa i kam long yu yet olsem olgetsela GOD, Baba bilong yu, i givim yu planti.

original: and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God in the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.
translation: Na yumi bai halim pambe long LORD God bilong yu long ples we em bai chusim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong En - yumi, pikinini bilong yu, manmeri saris na hap meri saris bilong yu, Levait i stap insait long geng bilong yu, na ol man i kam from nesen, pikinini we papamama i dai, na meri we husat i dai i stap namel long yu.

original: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and carefully follow these statutes.
translation: Yumi rememba olgeta, yumi bin slav long Ejip, na yumi mas folo stret despela lo bilong ples.

original: You are to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days after you have gathered the produce of your threshing floor and your winepress.
translation: Yu mas rejoisim Tabanakl Fest long seven de, bihaenim yu kamdaunim kumu long graun na kolim olgeta kai kai na samting ol i save mekim long ples bilong wokim baret na ples bilong kisim wine.

original: And you shall rejoice in your feast—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.
translation: Na yu mas hapim long ol feis bilong yu, yu, ol boi na ol meri bilong yu, ol boi bilong wok na ol meri bilong wok bilong yu, na Levai, ol man i kam bek gen, ol pikinini we missim papa, na ol meri we missim husban i stap long midst bilong yu.

original: For seven days you shall celebrate a feast to the LORD your God in the place He will choose, because the LORD your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, so that your joy will be complete.
translation: Long sewen de, yupela mas kirapim ka bilong ples long Papa God Bikpela long ples we em i laik choosim, bikos Papa God Bikpela bai givim barkis long olgeta kain kai yu gat na long wok bilong han bilong yu, na jubeli bilong yu bai i kamap strong.

original: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the LORD your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles. No one should appear before the LORD empty-handed.
translation: Tripela taim long yia, ol man bilong yu mas kamap bipo long papa bilong Jehovah God bilong yu long ples we em bai choosim: long Kaikai bilong bred naaira, long Kaikai bilong wik, na long Kaikai bilong haus bilong leaves. Nogat wan man i mas kam bipo long Jehovah na han blong en i empty.

original: Everyone must appear with a gift as he is able, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you.
translation: Yupela olgeta mas kam ap, na bringim givim samting olsem brom i givim bikos bilong blesing we Bikpela Jehovah God bilong yu i givim yupela.

original: You are to appoint judges and officials for your tribes in every town that the LORD your God is giving you. They are to judge the people with righteous judgment.
translation: Yu mas apointim jujes na ofisal long ol clan bilong yu long ol ples we LORD Bikpela bilong yu i givim yu. Ol i mas jijim ol pipol wantaim jujment bilong righteousness.

original: Do not deny justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous.
translation: No ken denyim jusis o givim santing i favorit long wanpela hap tasol. No ken kisim moni long han bilong man i gat pawa, bikos moni long han i kirapim ai bilong ol i gat save na i bagarapim toksave bilong man i gat laif tru.

original: Pursue justice, and justice alone, so that you may live, and you may possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Bihainim na jusis tasol, olegeta samting i go wel long yu, na yu ken kisim na bai graun i go long yu, graun we LORD God bilong yu i givim long yu.

original: Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole next to the altar you will build for the LORD your God,
translation: Yu no ken plantim pul bilong spirit meri Asherah klostu long kaa bilong ofa we yu bai mekim long LORD God bilong yu.

original: and do not set up for yourselves a sacred pillar, which the LORD your God hates.
translation: Na yu no ken plantim ap long yu yet sika bilong spirut, olsem LORD God bilong yu i amamas.

original: You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep with any defect or serious flaw, for that is detestable to the LORD your God.
translation: Yu no ken skarifais long bikpela God bilong yu bulmakau o sip wantaim eni samting i no ino gat gutpela kisim o i gat bikpela hevi, ol samting bilong bagarapim long ai bilong bikpela God bilong yu.

original: If a man or woman among you in one of the towns that the LORD your God gives you is found doing evil in the sight of the LORD your God by transgressing His covenant
translation: Igat man o meri long yu long wanpela taun we LORD God bilong yu givim yu, na igat i kamap long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu olsem i mekim ol samting nogut, ol i go pasis long kovena bilong Em.

original: and going to worship other gods, bowing down to them or to the sun or moon or any of the host of heaven—which I have forbidden—
translation: na i go long lotu long debil bilong narapela, i kisim hed na kileng long ol, san, mun, o ol birua bilong heven - we mi banim olsem.

original: and if it is reported and you hear about it, you must investigate it thoroughly. If the report is true and such an abomination has happened in Israel,
translation: Sapos em i raitim olsem, yu harim tok bilong em, yu mas wari long en klostu. Sapos tok bilong dispela i tu tru, na wanem abominashen olsem i kamap long Iserel,

original: you must bring out to your gates the man or woman who has done this evil thing, and you must stone that person to death.
translation: Yu mas kisim na karim go long gate bilong yu man o meri husat i wokim dispela ken samting, na yu mas iusim ston na kilim em.

original: On the testimony of two or three witnesses a man shall be put to death, but he shall not be executed on the testimony of a lone witness.
translation: Long tok bilong tu o tri wanes, man i ken go long dai, tasol em ina ken kisim des long tok bilong wanpela wanes tasol.

original: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first in putting him to death, and after that, the hands of all the people. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: Han bilong ol witnes bai i go bek long kilim man i go dai, na bihain bai han bilong ol pipol kam bek long rausim. Na yu mas rausim olgeta samting nogut na i stap long yu.

original: If a case is too difficult for you to judge, whether the controversy within your gates is regarding bloodshed, lawsuits, or assaults, you must go up to the place the LORD your God will choose.
translation: Sapos wanpela kisim desisan i harim olsem i bikpela tumas long yu, sapos tait bilong pait long ples balus em i go long shedim blod, kisim kot, o kilim ol man, yu mas go apo long ples we LORD God bilong yu bai chusim.

original: You are to go to the Levitical priests and to the judge who presides at that time. Inquire of them, and they will give you a verdict in the case.
translation: Yu mas go long priest na ol i kam long Levi, na jaj we i wok bung long em i go. Yu askim tok bilong ol, na ol bai givim yu desis long kes.

original: You must abide by the verdict they give you at the place the LORD will choose. Be careful to do everything they instruct you,
translation: Yu mas holim strong long desisipn ol bai givim long ples we LORD bai chusim, na yu mas lukaut i go long mekim olgeta samting ol bai tok.

original: according to the terms of law they give and the verdict they proclaim. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from the decision they declare to you.
translation: Olsem loa i tok, resul ikam long ol, yu no ken go bek long wan sis na wan sis long desisen ol i givim i go long yu.

original: But the man who acts presumptuously, refusing to listen either to the priest who stands there to serve the LORD your God, or to the judge, must be put to death. You must purge the evil from Israel.
translation: Bai man i wok ol i kam bek long hap bilong en, em i no lissen, na em i no lissen long prist i stap servim Jehovah God bilong yu, o long jaj, emas i ken go daun long deat. Musu yumi rausim ol samting nogut long Israel.

original: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and will no longer behave arrogantly.
translation: Ol pipel yumi harim na bai yu mas poret, na yumi no ken bihain olsem long taim bipo, wei yumi stap long hed strong nau Bai yumi lusim despai olsem.

original: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, “Let us set a king over us like all the nations around us,”
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long graun we LORD God bilong yu i givim mipela, na yu kisim i tanim na yusim, stap na wakem haus long em, na yu tok, "Mipela mas putim wan king i stap long mipela olsem ol nesen i stap arond mipela,"

original: you are to appoint over yourselves the king whom the LORD your God shall choose. Appoint a king from among your brothers; you are not to set over yourselves a foreigner who is not one of your brothers.
translation: Yu mas apointim king long yu yet, king we LORD God bilong yu yet bai choosim. Yu mas apoinim king long ol brata bilong yu; yu no ken putim man i kam long narapela hap long hed bilong yu, man we i no brata bilong yu.

original: But the king must not acquire many horses for himself or send the people back to Egypt to acquire more horses, for the LORD has said, ‘You are never to go back that way again.’
translation: King i no ken get planti hos bilong en, nem li bikim ol pipol go bek long Egip olsem ples bilong slavery o bondage, bilong kisim moa hos, wantaim LORD i tok, ‘Yupela no ken go bek gen long wel kona, long ples ya.’

original: He must not take many wives for himself, lest his heart go astray. He must not accumulate for himself large amounts of silver and gold.
translation: Em i mas no kisim planti meri, nogat em bai i go daun long rong rot. Em i mas no kisim moa sila na gol long han bilong en.

original: When he is seated on his royal throne, he must write for himself a copy of this instruction on a scroll in the presence of the Levitical priests.
translation: Wanpela em i siddaun long thrown bilong kiya, em mas writim kaopii bilong dispela toktok long banis, na em i mas mekim olsem long present bilong pastors Levitikal.

original: It is to remain with him, and he is to read from it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the LORD his God by carefully observing all the words of this instruction and these statutes.
translation: Em i mas stap wantaim em, na em i mas ri long hap bilong en long ol dei bilong laip bilong en, Olsen em i ken larim tremol long LORD God bilong en, na bihainim klosim ol tok save na lo bilong ples, na ol statit bilong em.

original: Then his heart will not be exalted above his countrymen, and he will not turn aside from the commandment, to the right or to the left, in order that he and his sons may reign many years over his kingdom in Israel.
translation: Na haret bilong en i no go antap long olgeta man, na en bai lusim komando, i go raun long sait rait oa sait left, bilong mekim en na brata na susa bilong en i bos olpela taim long ples bilong en long Isrel.

original: The Levitical priests—indeed the whole tribe of Levi—shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel. They are to eat the offerings made by fire to the LORD; that is their inheritance.
translation: Ol priest Levitikal, ol tribe holep long Levi, ol i no gat ples ikam na shar long Israel. Ol i kaikai ofa ol i bikim long paia long LORD, em i ples ikam bilong ol.

original: Although they have no inheritance among their brothers, the LORD is their inheritance, as He promised them.
translation: Maski ol i no gat inherita long bratas bilong ol, LORD em i inherita bilong ol, olsem em i promisim ol.

original: This shall be the priests’ share from the people who offer a sacrifice, whether a bull or a sheep: the priests are to be given the shoulder, the jowls, and the stomach.
translation: Dispela bai i kamap hap bilong prist: long ol pipol i givim sakrifis, em tasol bulmakau o sip, prist igo gitim skaul, jowl bilong pik, na bel.

original: You are to give them the firstfruits of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the first wool sheared from your flock.
translation: Yu mas givim olgeta kakai bilong taim bifo long grain bilong yu, waain nupela, na oil, na firstfla wul husat yu kisim long sheep bilong yu.

original: For the LORD your God has chosen Levi and his sons out of all your tribes to stand and minister in His name for all time.
translation: Papa God i biruxim Levi na ol pikinini bilong em long ol tribi bilong yu, olsem oli mas stap na sarvis long nem bilong Em, minista, long taim olgeta.

original: Now if a Levite moves from any town of residence throughout Israel and comes in all earnestness to the place the LORD will choose,
translation: Sapos Levit i go long ol bilong em tasol na kam bek long het bilong en, na i kam inap long ples we LORD bai chusim long Isrel.

original: then he shall serve in the name of the LORD his God like all his fellow Levites who stand there before the LORD.
translation: Na em bai wokim servis long nem bilong LORD God bilong en olsem ol arapela Levait i stap, ol brata, na stap bek long ples bilong LORD.

original: They shall eat equal portions, even though he has received money from the sale of his father’s estate.
translation: Ol i kaikai olsem wanwan, tasol em i kam bek long salim ples bilong papa bilong en, na moni i go long en.

original: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, do not imitate the detestable ways of the nations there.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long kantri we Bikpela God bilong yu i givim yu, yu no ken kopi wok nogut blong ol narapela ples i stap.

original: Let no one be found among you who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire, practices divination or conjury, interprets omens, practices sorcery,
translation: I gat narapela man husat i sakrifais pikinini man o meri long faia, i wokim divination o conjury, i tokaut long singsing bilong hevi, o i mekim sorcery, inap bai i stap long yu.

original: casts spells, consults a medium or spiritist, or inquires of the dead.
translation: I mekim magik strong, i go bekim tok bilong maman spirit na man spirit, o i askim tok bilong ol i dai pinis.

original: For whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD. And because of these detestable things, the LORD your God is driving out the nations before you.
translation: Husat i mekim ol dispela samting, em i bagarap long ai bilong LORD. Na long ol dispela samting i bagarap, LORD God bilong yu em i kirapim ol narapela kantri bifo yu.

original: You must be blameless before the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas igat hevi nogut long han bilong yu, LORD God bilong yu.

original: Though these nations, which you will dispossess, listen to conjurers and diviners, the LORD your God has not permitted you to do so.
translation: Nesen oli go we, wanem yu bai kisim bek long han bilong ol, ol i harim tok bilong ol man i save mekim magik na ol man i save toktok wantaim spirit, tasol LORD God bilong yu, em i no givim yu permisyon long mekim ol samting olsem.

original: The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers. You must listen to him.
translation: Papa God bilong yu em bai kirapim wanpela propet olsem mi long ol braza bilong yu. Yu mas harim tok bilong em.

original: This is what you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly, when you said, “Let us not hear the voice of the LORD our God or see this great fire anymore, so that we will not die!”
translation: Em i tok olsem long han bilong Yogupas bilong yu long Horeb na dei bilong bembe, wannem yumi mekim tok, "Mipela no laik harim vois bilong Yogupas bilong mipela o lukim faia bikpela olsem long taim bifo gen, bikos yumi no laik dai."

original: Then the LORD said to me, “They have spoken well.
translation: Na Lod i tokim ol long me, “Ol i tok stret.”

original: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their brothers. I will put My words in his mouth, and he will tell them everything I command him.
translation: Mi bai bringim prophet naba olsem yu long narapela brata bilong ol. Mi go putim tok bilong mi long maus bilong em, na em bai toktok ol samting we mi givim em.

original: And I will hold accountable anyone who does not listen to My words that the prophet speaks in My name.
translation: Mi bai holim akount long olgeta man meri em i no harim tok bilong Mi we propet i tok olsem long nem bilong Mi.

original: But if any prophet dares to speak a message in My name that I have not commanded him to speak, or to speak in the name of other gods, that prophet must be put to death.”
translation: Sampela profet i maspeka i tokautim pesin long nem bilong mi we mi no bin givim aninit long em yet, o i tokaut long nem bilong olegota, dispela profet i mas dai.

original: You may ask in your heart, “How can we recognize a message that the LORD has not spoken?”
translation: Yu ken askim long het bilong yu, “Olsem wanem yumi inap save tok bilong Bikpela i kam?”

original: When a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD and the message does not come to pass or come true, that is a message the LORD has not spoken. The prophet has spoken presumptuously. Do not be afraid of him.
translation: Wanpela propet i tok olsem i go long nem bilong LORD, na em i no tok save, o tok bilong em i no kam bek gen, tok bilong em i no kam true, em i tok we LORD i no tok. Em i tok long olbaigim, No ken afraid long em.

original: When the LORD your God has cut off the nations whose land He is giving you, and when you have driven them out and settled in their cities and houses,
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela Ol Masalai bilong yu kirapim ol nesen wos plas em i givim yu, na wanpela taim yu driva ol i go, yu kam kaikai i stap long ol taun na haus bilong ol.

original: then you are to set apart for yourselves three cities within the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
translation: Inap makim olsem long ap, bai yumi makim tri taun bilong piden long lamen bilong kantri we LORD God bilong yu i givim i go long yumi, na yumi ken kisim bek.

original: You are to build roads for yourselves and divide into three regions the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that any manslayer can flee to these cities.
translation: Yupela mas wokim rot bilong yupela, na dividim graun long tripela hap, olsem ranawe man i kilim man i go long dispela tripela siti bilong refuj, graun em LORD God bilong yumi i givim yupela olsem inheritans bilong yumi.

original: Now this is the situation regarding the manslayer who flees to one of these cities to save his life, having killed his neighbor accidentally, without intending to harm him:
translation: Nau dispela em i stori bilong man i kilim man, i ranawe go long wanpela bilong dispela siti bilong refuge, bilong sevim laip bilong en, em i kilim nekiba bilong en long akisident, without intending to harmim.

original: If he goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut timber and swings his axe to chop down a tree, but the blade flies off the handle and strikes and kills his neighbor, he may flee to one of these cities to save his life.
translation: Em i go long bus wantaim neiba bilong en, kisim timba na katim, na em swingsim akis bilong en long katim diwai, tasol blaed i ranawe na kilim neiba bilong en, em inap ranawe i go long wanpela bilong dispela siti bilong refij, na bai em i save laip bilong en.

original: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue the manslayer in a rage, overtake him if the distance is great, and strike him dead though he did not deserve to die, since he did not intend any harm.
translation: Nogat tasol, avenger of blood i mas paitim man i kilim man, na em ina go bekim em long strong bilong em, em i go hetim em long we, sapos rot i long, em i kilim em, maski em i no bin mekim rong, olsem na em i no bin laik mekim ken.

original: This is why I am commanding you to set apart for yourselves three cities.
translation: Em i bikos bilong dispela, na mi am i givim yu komando long skelim ap long yuself tripela taun olsem ples bilong sip.

original: And if the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land He promised them,
translation: Sipos Lod God bilong yu i stap strongim moa graun bilong yu, olsem Hem i promis long tumbuna bilong yu, na i givim yu olgeta graun we Hem i promis ol long,

original: and if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you today, loving the LORD your God and walking in His ways at all times, then you are to add three more cities to these three.
translation: Sapos yu kepeim ol komando ya dispela klostu, na yu i lukim na i laikim LORD God bilong yu, na yu i go long wei bilong em long ol taim, tasol yu mas addim moa tripela taun long dispela tripela.

original: Thus innocent blood will not be shed in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that you will not be guilty of bloodshed.
translation: Olsem bai bled bilong pigin ol i no ken shedim long graun na LORD God bilong yu em i givim yu olgeta long inheritance, na yu no bai katim gilti long shedim bled.

original: If, however, a man hates his neighbor and lies in wait, attacks him and kills him, and then flees to one of these cities,
translation: Sapos man i hatim narapela man, na em i stap wait long ples we em i ken go kusim, tasol em i kukim da, na em i ranawe go long wanpela bilong dispela siti bilong refuj,

original: the elders of his city must send for him, bring him back, and hand him over to the avenger of blood to die.
translation: Bikman meri bilong ples ikam ina sendim em i go, kisim em i go back, na givim em i go long han bilong man i kam bekim blood ol i kilim em.

original: You must show him no pity. You are to purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, that it may go well with you.
translation: Yu no ken givim em meri. Yu mas rausim skul bilong shedim bled bilong innocent long Israel, na bai yu go gut.

original: You must not move your neighbor’s boundary marker, which was set up by your ancestors to mark the inheritance you shall receive in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
translation: Yu no ken muvim mak bilong nek bilong yu, we ol tumbuna bilong yu bin setim ap long taim bifo olsem simbol bilong owenership bilong papa, putim sin bilong inhiritans bilong yu long graun, we yu kisim ka long kantri we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu long bosim.

original: A lone witness is not sufficient to establish any wrongdoing or sin against a man, regardless of what offense he may have committed. A matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.
translation: Wanpela witnes i no inap long stretim olgetting long nogo o sin long narapela man, bikos olsem em i mekim olsem kain pasal. Mater i mas go stretpela long toktok bilong tu o tri witnes.

original: If a false witness testifies against someone, accusing him of a crime,
translation: I sika wanes man i givim lies i kam, em i mekim tokstrong long narapela man olsem em mekim samting nogut.

original: both parties to the dispute must stand in the presence of the LORD, before the priests and judges who are in office at that time.
translation: Olgets i kam bek long dispela ka, ol i stap long ples bilong Jehovah, long ol priest na jaj husat i wok long taim em.

original: The judges shall investigate thoroughly, and if the witness is proven to be a liar who has falsely accused his brother,
translation: Jaj bilong kot igo wai long enquire strong, na sapos witness i kamap olsem man bilong tok bokis husat i kisim tok bokis long narapela brata bilong en.

original: you must do to him as he intended to do to his brother. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: Yu mas wokim long em olsem em laik wokim long brata bilong en, na yu mas rausim olgeta samting nogut long miyet bilong yu.

original: Then the rest of the people will hear and be afraid, and they will never again do anything so evil among you.
translation: Na ol pipel i go harim na bai ol i pem, na ol bai no inap long mekim ol samting nogut olsem gen long mitupela.

original: You must show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, and foot for foot.
translation: Yu no ken givim skul: laip bilong laip, ai bilong ai, tut bilong tut, han bilong han, fut bilong fut.

original: When you go out to war against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and an army larger than yours, do not be afraid of them; for the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, is with you.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go long war long poisen, na yu lukim hores, kareta, na armi bigpela olsem yu, no ken tikim fear long ol; bikpela LORD God bilong yu, we i bringim yu out long kantri bilong Ejip, i stap wantaim yu.

original: When you are about to go into battle, the priest is to come forward and address the army,
translation: Wanpela taim yu kam bek long pait, pris i mas kam na toktok long arwi, bipo yu go long wail go long pait.

original: saying to them, “Hear, O Israel, today you are going into battle with your enemies. Do not be fainthearted or afraid; do not be alarmed or terrified because of them.
translation: Tokim ol long, "Haren, O Isrel, tudei yu go long raun bilong fait wantaim enimi bilong yu. No ken slip na no ken bikim pret long hert; no ken bikim pret na no ken save long tok long ol."

original: For the LORD your God goes with you to fight for you against your enemies, to give you the victory.”
translation: Bikpela bilong yu i go wantaim yu, na i holim peles long ol enimis bilong yu, givim yu win.

original: Furthermore, the officers are to address the army, saying, “Has any man built a new house and not dedicated it? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man dedicate it.
translation: Ofisa bai tokaut long ples bilong solja, olsem: “Husat i bin mekim haus nupela na i no bin givim bek long God? Em bai go bek long hus, or em ina dai long hap bilong tait, na narapela man i dedikihaus.”

original: Has any man planted a vineyard and not begun to enjoy its fruit? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man enjoy its fruit.
translation: I gat man i planim wanpela vineya, i no bin stat long enji fruits bilong em? Em i go bek long haus bilong en, or em i ken dai long fight, na nara man i enji fruits bilong em.

original: Has any man become pledged to a woman and not married her? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man marry her.”
translation: I gat man we i kamap promis long meri, tasol em i no mari wantaim? Em i mas go bek long haus, or em i ken dai long fight, na narapela man i ken mari wantaim.

original: Then the officers shall speak further to the army, saying, “Is any man afraid or fainthearted? Let him return home, so that the hearts of his brothers will not melt like his own.”
translation: Ofisa tokim armi, oligin toktok, “Yu save pem na nogutpela hat? Em i go bak long hus, bikos haret bilong brata bai i no bung olsem haret bilong em yet.”

original: When the officers have finished addressing the army, they are to appoint commanders to lead it.
translation: Taim ofisa i winim tok bilong en, ol bai appointmentim kapten na ol liklik man ibehain long lidim army bilong God i go.

original: When you approach a city to fight against it, you are to make an offer of peace.
translation: Wanpela taim yu klostu long wanpela siti, bai yu mas pairap long en na givim peis long em.

original: If they accept your offer of peace and open their gates, all the people there will become forced laborers to serve you.
translation: I stap akseptim ofa bilong yu na oleta gate bilong ol, olgeta manmeri i stap insait bai kamap wokman bilong servim yu.

original: But if they refuse to make peace with you and wage war against you, lay siege to that city.
translation: Bai yolika i no gat hamas long pispis, na bai yolika i mekim fait gen, kisim fait long yolika, katim solwara i go antap long ples, na ronim ol i go daun.

original: When the LORD your God has delivered it into your hand, you must put every male to the sword.
translation: Wanpela taim LORD God bilong yu givim kantri i go bek long yu, yu mas kilim ol man husat i stap long sord.

original: But the women, children, livestock, and whatever else is in the city—all its spoil—you may take as plunder, and you shall use the spoil of your enemies that the LORD your God gives you.
translation: Bareket, meri, pikinini, anus, na olgeta samting i stap long taun - olgeta plunda bilong em, yu inap tek ol samting, na yusim ol samting bilong enimi, samting bilong win tasol LORD God bilong yu givim yu.

original: This is how you are to treat all the cities that are far away from you and do not belong to the nations nearby.
translation: Dispela em i pasin bilong tritim olgeta taun longwe nau long yu, na i no bilong narapela kantri klostu long yu.

original: However, in the cities of the nations that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, you must not leave alive anything that breathes.
translation: Bikos, long ol bikpela taun bilong narapela kantri we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu olsem inheritans, yu no ken lusim eni samting i stap, husat i breathim.

original: For you must devote them to complete destruction—the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,
translation: Yu mas tok aut long Hiti, Amori, Kanaan, Perisi, Hiwi, na Jebusi, na wasim ol long woning strong, na mekim ol dispela i no stap, olsem Jehovah God bilong yu em i givim komando long yu.

original: so that they cannot teach you to do all the detestable things they do for their gods, and so cause you to sin against the LORD your God.
translation: Na bai ol i no inap long kam teisinim yu long ol samting nogut ol i mekim long spirits poisen bilong ol, na bai yu kisim bagarap long karim yu long sin against LORD God bilong yu.

original: When you lay siege to a city for an extended time while fighting against it to capture it, you must not destroy its trees by putting an axe to them, because you can eat their fruit. You must not cut them down. Are the trees of the field human, that you should besiege them?
translation: Wanpela taim yumi go long fight na kisim kaunti, yumi no ken bagarap ol diwai bilong en. Yumi inap kaikai fruit bilong ol, olsem yumi save serim ol yet. Yumi no ken katim ol diwai, bikos ol diwai em i no man, ol i no inap fight.

original: But you may destroy the trees that you know do not produce fruit. Use them to build siege works against the city that is waging war against you, until it falls.
translation: Bai yu ken distroi ol diwai we yu save ol i no kisim frut. Yusim ol long wokim bariketi gen taun i kam bek long wari wantaim yu, na i no fal dun yet.

original: If one is found slain, lying in a field in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,
translation: Sapos wan man i kamap kilim, na em i slip long graun long laine i LORD God bilong yu i givim yu long bungim, na ino save long husat i kilim em,

original: your elders and judges must come out and measure the distance from the victim to the neighboring cities.
translation: Ol bikpela na jaj iu kam aut na mesa distans long viktim i go kas long nambis sitis.

original: Then the elders of the city nearest the victim shall take a heifer that has never been yoked or used for work,
translation: Ol bikpela man bilong ples we i klostu long dispela man we i dai, oli mas kisim wan pik we i no bin yet yuksim na i no bin wok yet.

original: bring the heifer to a valley with running water that has not been plowed or sown, and break its neck there by the stream.
translation: Kisim na karamapim na bulmakau i go long wanpela valley we i gat wara i rin, we i no bin mekim garden yet, na i no bin plantim yet, na birua nek bilong em long wara.

original: And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, for the LORD your God has chosen them to serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name and to give a ruling in every dispute and case of assault.
translation: Na ol priist, ol pikinini bilong Levi, bai inap kam bek i go, wantaim Bikpela God bilong yu, em i choosim ol, ol bai sarveim Em na bosim bikpela tok bilong blessing long nem bilong Em, na ol bai givim desisipn long ol kesan na palog bilong faet.

original: Then all the elders of the city nearest the victim shall wash their hands by the stream over the heifer whose neck has been broken,
translation: Olgets bikpela man meri bilong siti nambis long bodi i kamapim ofisa, ol i wasim han bilong ol long sangana antap long bulmakau we nek bilong em i bin bruk.

original: and they shall declare, “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it.
translation: Ol bai tokim, "Han bilong yumi i no kilim dispela blood, na mat bilong yumi i no lukim."

original: Accept this atonement, O LORD, for Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, and do not hold the shedding of innocent blood against them.” And the bloodshed will be atoned for.
translation: Kabim dispela peis blong pipia, o Bikpela, long ol pipol bilong yu Israel, ol wa yu bin beiim bek long han bilong yu, na no ken holim skil blo shedim blo innocent man i go long ol. Na blodaed i kamapim peis gen.

original: So you shall purge from among you the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
translation: Na mipela bai rausim olsem long mipela gilt bilong spilim blod bilong man i no gat skul, bikos mipela wokim ol samting we i gut long ai bilong Bikpela.

original: When you go to war against your enemies and the LORD your God delivers them into your hand and you take them captive,
translation: Wanpela taim yu go long war bilong yu gen poisen, na LORD Bikpela yu em i givim ol i go long yu, na yu i kisim ol i holim,

original: if you see a beautiful woman among them, and you desire her and want to take her as your wife,
translation: Sapos yu lukim meri sweetpela ibelong ol, na yu hamamas long en na yu laik kisim meri, na yu lak bilong kisim i go long yu,

original: then you shall bring her into your house. She must shave her head, trim her nails,
translation: Bai yu kisim i go insait long haus bilong yu. Em bai kupim hevi bilong em, na kisim na katim neil bilong em.

original: and put aside the clothing of her captivity. After she has lived in your house a full month and mourned her father and mother, you may have relations with her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.
translation: Na lusim klia bilong kapchua. Bihaen long em i stap long haus bilong yu, na i bin sorry long taim bilong wan mun, na sorry long papa na mama bilong en, bihaen yu ken kamap husat bilong em, na yu mas wok bung wantaim em, na em bai meri bilong yu.

original: And if you are not pleased with her, you are to let her go wherever she wishes. But you must not sell her for money or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
translation: Sikir em i no inap long yu, yu mas lusa im na lusim i go we long hap i laik. Yu no ken selim em olsem samting bilong moni, na yu no ken tritim em olsem wokmeri, long bikos yu mekim em i skul.

original: If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other unloved, and both bear him sons, but the unloved wife has the firstborn son,
translation: Igat man wanpela husat i gat wais tu, wanpela i lukim gut, na narapela i no lukim gut, tupela wais i karim pikinini bilong em, tasol wais we i no lukim gut i karim pikinini bilong taim bilong em.

original: when that man assigns his inheritance to his sons he must not appoint the son of the beloved wife as the firstborn over the son of the unloved wife.
translation: Wanpela man i givim bris bilong en long pikinini bilong en, em ina no ken appointim pikinini bilong meri bilong laipim olsem pikinini bilong kantri ibaikim bikos bilong pikinini bilong meri bilong nogat laip.

original: Instead, he must acknowledge the firstborn, the son of his unloved wife, by giving him a double portion of all that he has. For that son is the firstfruits of his father’s strength; the right of the firstborn belongs to him.
translation: Em mas sori long pikinini bilong en i kam first, pikinini bilong meri we em i no laikim, na givim em dupela hap bilong olgeta samting em i gat. Ka bilong strong bilong papa bilong en i stap long dispela pikinini, na raita bilong pikinini first i stap long en, bikos em i kam first long strong bilong papa bilong en.

original: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and does not listen to them when disciplined,
translation: Man i gat pikinini man i stronghed na i no lisin, em i no harim tok bilong papa na mama, na i no lisen wanpela taim ol i skulim em.

original: his father and mother are to lay hold of him and bring him to the elders of his city, to the gate of his hometown,
translation: Papa na mama bilong em i mas kamdaun long en, na broughtim i go long ol bic man bilong ples bilong em, long gate bilong hap bilong ples bilong em.

original: and say to the elders, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
translation: Tokim ol bikpela, “Desi bilong mipela em i stap stronghed na i no givim han long mipela. Em i man bilong kaikai planti na dring planti.”

original: Then all the men of his city will stone him to death. So you must purge the evil from among you, and all Israel will hear and be afraid.
translation: Ol man meri bilong ples i go kilim em wantaim ston, na yu mas skulim bel hevi long namel bus, olsem ol Israel olgets harem na bai ol i bikim fear.

original: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,
translation: Igat man i go kamapim bikos bilong sin, na wati long dai, na ol i kilim em, na ol hangim bodi bilong en long diwai.

original: you must not leave the body on the tree overnight, but you must be sure to bury him that day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God’s curse. You must not defile the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
translation: Yu no ken lusim bodi i hang long tree overnight, bai yu mas burim em dispela de, bikos olsem wanpela i go hang long diwai em i stap long kurse bilong God. Yu no ken pilim bagarap graun we Papa bilong yu olgeta i givim yu ol long eni heritage.

original: If you see your brother’s ox or sheep straying, you must not ignore it; be sure to return it to your brother.
translation: Sapos yu lukim oks bilong brata yumi i go longwe, yu no ken lusim i go; bekim i go bak long brata.

original: If your brother does not live near you, or if you do not know who he is, you are to take the animal home to remain with you until your brother comes seeking it; then you can return it to him.
translation: Sapos brotha bilong yu no stap klostu long yu, o yu no save husat em i bilong yu, yu ken kisim animal i go bek long haus bilong yu stap wantaim yu, waintaim brotha bilong yu i kam painim, olgeta yu ken givim bek long em.

original: And you shall do the same for his donkey, his cloak, or anything your brother has lost and you have found. You must not ignore it.
translation: Yu mas wok olsem long donki bilong brata, klos bilong en, o eni samting em i los na yu i finim. Yu no ken ling long, yu mas helpim.

original: If you see your brother’s donkey or ox fallen on the road, you must not ignore it; you must help him lift it up.
translation: I givim yu: Sapos yu lukim donki bilong brata yuma i pundaun long rot o ox i pundaun long rot, yu no ken lisim nogut; yu mas helpim em i kirap gen.

original: A woman must not wear men’s clothing, and a man must not wear women’s clothing, for whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD your God.
translation: Meri i no ken werim rausim bilong man, na man i no ken werim rausim bilong meri, bikos husat i mekim olgeta dispela samting, em i nogut tru long ai bilong Bikpela God yu.

original: If you come across a bird’s nest with chicks or eggs, either in a tree or on the ground along the road, and the mother is sitting on the chicks or eggs, you must not take the mother along with the young.
translation: Yupela i go long ples na kisim nest bilong pisin, em i gat pikinini pisin o egg, na mama i siti long hap bilong ol, yu no ken bekim mama wantaim ol pikinini. Yu mas leukim mama i stap, na yu kisim ol pikinini pisin o egg tasol.

original: You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may be well with you and that you may prolong your days.
translation: Yu ken kisim ol pikinini, tasol lusa mami i go, nau olgeta samting bai i gut long yu, na yu bai i stap long taim.

original: If you build a new house, you are to construct a railing around your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if someone falls from it.
translation: Sapos yu mekim haus nupela, yu mas wokim banis long ruf bilong yu, kalabus yu no ken kisim blod kol long aus bilong yu taim sampela man i pundaun na i dai.

original: Do not plant your vineyard with two types of seed; if you do, the entire harvest will be defiled—both the crop you plant and the fruit of your vineyard.
translation: Yu no ken plantim vineya bilong yu wantaim tupela kain seed; bikos ifyu mekim olsem, holesale harvest bai i bagarap – planti na fruit bilong vineya bilong yu.

original: Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.
translation: No ken planti wantaim bulmakau na donki long wanem samting, tulaitim na joi bilek.

original: Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.
translation: Yu no ken kisim klos blong wol na linin we i bin woven long tupela.

original: You are to make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.
translation: Yu mas wokim tassels long foa korner bilong klos yu gat.

original: Suppose a man marries a woman, has relations with her, and comes to hate her,
translation: Sapos man i maritim meri, na em i gat wes long en, na bihain em i kam bikhat long en,

original: and he then accuses her of shameful conduct and gives her a bad name, saying, “I married this woman and had relations with her, but I discovered she was not a virgin.”
