translation: Na em yet i tok harim olsem meri i gat pasin nogut, i givim em nem bilong shame, em i tok olsem, "Mi mari wantaim meri ia, na mi go stap wantaim em, tasol mi lukim em i no inap, em i no gat kantri bilong meri."

original: Then the young woman’s father and mother shall bring the proof of her virginity to the city elders at the gate
translation: Papa na mama bilong yung meri bai bringim samting bilong provim em i meri i no gat husban bifo go long ol elder bilong taun we istat long gate bilong taun.

original: and say to the elders, “I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he has come to hate her.
translation: Tokim ol bikpela man, ‘Mi givim meri bilong mi long mariage wantaim man dispela, tasol em i kam bek i birua long en.’

original: And now he has accused her of shameful conduct, saying, ‘I discovered that your daughter was not a virgin.’ But here is the proof of her virginity.” And they shall spread out the cloth before the city elders.
translation: Na em i kam bekim olsem, em i tok olsem, 'Mi lukim ol wok nogut long pikinini bilong yu, em i no meri we i no bin gat husban yet.' Tasol hia i stap bikos bilong provin olsem laip bilong meri i klia. Na ol bai katim klos i go raun long ol papa bilong taun.

original: Then the elders of that city shall take the man and punish him.
translation: Na ol birua bilong ples ia bai kisim man ia, na bai givim penati long em.

original: They are also to fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give them to the young woman’s father, because this man has given a virgin of Israel a bad name. And she shall remain his wife; he must not divorce her as long as he lives.
translation: Tupela i mas penaltim em hundred shekel silva, na yu mas givim ol long papa bilong meri yung, bekas man ya i givim nem nogut long meri birua bilong Israel. Na meri bai i stap wantaim em, na em i bikos husat bilong em, em i no ken lusim meri, em i mas holim meri oltaim em i stap.

original: If, however, this accusation is true, and no proof of the young woman’s virginity can be found,
translation: Sapos dispela tok bilong krosim em i treu, na ina bai no inap finautim pruf long wik i meri,

original: she shall be brought to the door of her father’s house, and there the men of her city will stone her to death. For she has committed an outrage in Israel by being promiscuous in her father’s house. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: Em bai i go long dor bilong haus bilong papa, na ol man bilong ples bai i kilim em long ston na tromoi i dai. Wantaim em wokim samting nogut tru long Israel long em i gat planti meri long haus bilong papa. Olsem nau, yu mas rausim ol samting nogut long mipela.

original: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. You must purge the evil from Israel.
translation: I gat man i stap klia wantaim meri bilong narapela man, bai tupela ol i dai. Bai yu rausim olgeta nogut long Isrel.

original: If there is a virgin pledged in marriage to a man, and another man encounters her in the city and sleeps with her,
translation: Sapos wanpela meri i pikinini yet na em i promis long marit long namba wan man, na namba tu man i go beklong en na kisim em long taun na tupela i slip togeta,

original: you must take both of them out to the gate of that city and stone them to death—the young woman because she did not cry out in the city, and the man because he has violated his neighbor’s wife. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: Yu mas kisim tupela ol i go long gate bilong taun na ol i dai nau long ston - meri yangpela bikos em i no singaut i go long taun, na man bikos em i bagarap meri bilong neioba. Olsem nau yu mas rausim olgets samting nogut long mipela.

original: But if the man encounters a betrothed woman in the open country, and he overpowers her and lies with her, only the man who has done this must die.
translation: Bai yumui i go long ples op, na i kisim meri i bin bilong man, na i strongim meri na i go stap wantaim, orait nambis, yumui i mekim des laif bai i dai tasol.

original: Do nothing to the young woman, because she has committed no sin worthy of death. This case is just like one in which a man attacks his neighbor and murders him.
translation: Nogat wanpela samting yu ken mekim long pikinini meri, em i no komitim rong tru olsem i mas dai. Kes ya em i olsem narapela long taim man i kilim neba bilong en na ol murdma.

original: When he found her in the field, the betrothed woman cried out, but there was no one to save her.
translation: Taim em finim em long graun, meri i bin krai aut, tasol i no gat narapela man i ken saveim.

original: If a man encounters a virgin who is not pledged in marriage, and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,
translation: I gatpela man i skelim meri i no marit, na em i kisim meri na i go na slip wantaim, na ol i kirap long ol,

original: then the man who lay with her must pay the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver, and she must become his wife because he has violated her. He must not divorce her as long as he lives.
translation: Na man i go stap wantaim em, em i mas baim pris bilong papa bilong meri yung long fifty sikil sipara silva, na em i mas stap wantaim em olgeta taim em i stap, na em i no ken lusim em bikos em i bagarapim em.

original: A man is not to marry his father’s wife, so that he will not dishonor his father’s marriage bed.
translation: Man no inogat meri bilong papa bilong em, bai no bagarap bet bilong marit bilong papa.

original: No man with crushed or severed genitals may enter the assembly of the LORD.
translation: Ol man husat genital blong ol ibin krushim o katim of, ol i no inap go insait long haus lotu bilong Jehovah.

original: No one of illegitimate birth may enter the assembly of the LORD, nor may any of his descendants, even to the tenth generation.
translation: Nogat wanpela pikinini we i kam long papa na mama i no marit i inap go insait long haus lotu bilong Lotu, na nogat tu ol desenden bilong en, rit moa long jenarason numba ten.

original: No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the LORD, even to the tenth generation.
translation: Olek Ammonite na Moabite na ol pikinini bilong ol i no inap go long assemble bilong LORD, na em i go inap long jenarason nap numbus ten.

original: For they did not meet you with food and water on your way out of Egypt, and they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Aram-naharaim to curse you.
translation: Ol i no strongim bel bilong yu wantaim kaikai na wara long wei yu go aut long Egip, na ol i kirapim Balaam man bilong Beor long Pethor long Aram-naharaim i go kilim yu.

original: Yet the LORD your God would not listen to Balaam, and the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.
translation: Bikpela bilong yu i no lisin long tok bilong Balaam, na Bikpela i kisim karim na wail long blessing bilong yumi, bikos Bikpela bilong yu em i lukim yu gut.

original: You are not to seek peace or prosperity from them as long as you live.
translation: Yu no ken go bek long sukim pis na gutpela laip wantaim ol long ol taim yu stap.

original: Do not despise an Edomite, for he is your brother. Do not despise an Egyptian, because you lived as a foreigner in his land.
translation: No ken dispisim Edomite, em i brata bilong yu. No ken dispisim Ijipita, bikos yu stap olsem man i kam long kantri bilong em.

original: The third generation of children born to them may enter the assembly of the LORD.
translation: Genarason namba tri bilong pikinini i kamap long ol, inap go insait long husat i bilong Jehovah.

original: When you are encamped against your enemies, then you shall keep yourself from every wicked thing.
translation: Wanpela taim yu i kam kaer long ples bilong yu, na yu go harim ol birua, yu mas kisim ka long yuself, bai yu no ken gat sindaon long ol samting i no gut.

original: If any man among you becomes unclean because of a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp and stay outside.
translation: Yupela man husat i kamap narapela klost long bodi bekas wara i kam long bodi na yumi no save harim, em i mas lusim ples bilong ol na stap long wei.

original: When evening approaches, he must wash with water, and when the sun sets he may return to the camp.
translation: Wanpela apinun i kam, em i mas wasim skin bilong en long wara, na wanpela san i go daun, em inawe i kam bek long ples bilong ol.

original: You must have a place outside the camp to go and relieve yourself.
translation: I gat ples long ousait bilong kanu, inap yu go na kisim i go.

original: And you must have a digging tool in your equipment so that when you relieve yourself you can dig a hole and cover up your excrement.
translation: Yu mas havim pail ka long ol samting bilong yu, na bai when yu kisim bel i go daun, yu ken digim hole na kavarapim pipia.

original: For the LORD your God walks throughout your camp to protect you and deliver your enemies to you. Your camp must be holy, lest He see anything unclean among you and turn away from you.
translation: Bikpela i wokabaut long ples bilong yumi, na i bikim strong na salvim ol eni bilong yumi, na tu birua ol enemies bilong yumi. Ples bilong yumi mas kamap holy, bereka Bikpela i si sampela pipia long mitupela, na lem i go bek long yumi.

original: Do not return a slave to his master if he has taken refuge with you.
translation: No ken go bek wokman long bos bilong en if en i kam na kisim hevi wantaim yu, stap gen na wark long ples bilong hevi.

original: Let him live among you wherever he chooses, in the town of his pleasing. Do not oppress him.
translation: Imas i stap wantaim yupela long ples we i laikim, we bilong en tasol i lak. Yu no ken dunaim.

original: No daughter or son of Israel is to be a shrine prostitute.
translation: Ino ken meri no ken man bilong Isrel i mas warkim sindaun long ples sin.

original: You must not bring the wages of a prostitute, whether female or male, into the house of the LORD your God to fulfill any vow, because both are detestable to the LORD your God.
translation: Yu no ken bringim pe bilong meri bus o man husat i save go na lukim long nait, i go insait long haus bilong LORD God bilong yu olsem yu mas pai promis, bikos ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: Do not charge your brother interest on money, food, or any other type of loan.
translation: Yu no ken charga brata yumi intres long moni, ka, o loa bilong narapela kain.

original: You may charge a foreigner interest, but not your brother, so that the LORD your God may bless you in everything to which you put your hand in the land that you are entering to possess.
translation: Yu ken kisim bek moni long man i kam from anor plaes, tasol nogat long brata bilong yu, na LORD God bilong yu bai blessim yu long olgeta samting we yu putim han bilong yu long en, long graun i go long ples bilong yu.

original: If you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not be slow to keep it, because He will surely require it of you, and you will be guilty of sin.
translation: Sapos yu wokim promis long Bikpela, no ken bi siol long holim i go, bikos em bai askim bek long yu, na yu bikim kros long sin.

original: But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty of sin.
translation: Sapos yu nogat makim promis, yu no bikim gilty long sin.

original: Be careful to follow through on what comes from your lips, because you have freely vowed to the LORD your God with your own mouth.
translation: Yu mas lukaut long bihainim ol samting i kam long maus bilong yu, wantaim yu fri nau yu tokim promis long LORD God bilong yu.

original: When you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat your fill of grapes, but you must not put any in your basket.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait banis bilong narapela i go, yu ken kaikai grapes olgeta, inap long yu yet, tasol yu no ken putim bek long bilum bilong yu.

original: When you enter your neighbor’s grainfield, you may pluck the heads of grain with your hand, but you must not put a sickle to your neighbor’s grain.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait ples graun bilong nambis, yu ken yusim han bilong yu yet kisim hed bilong graun, tasol yu no ken putim sikil long graun bilong nambis.

original: If a man marries a woman, but she becomes displeasing to him because he finds some indecency in her, he may write her a certificate of divorce, hand it to her, and send her away from his house.
translation: Igat man i marit wanpela meri, na em i no laikim meri, bikos em i lukim ol samting nogut long en, em bai ken raitim sertifiket bilong divoris, givim long em, na em i sendim i go long haus bilong papa mama bilong em.

original: If, after leaving his house, she goes and becomes another man’s wife,
translation: Em livaim haus bilong en, na em i go wif bilong man narak,

original: and the second man hates her, writes her a certificate of divorce, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house, or if he dies,
translation: Na sekend man i no laikim meri, em raitim pepa bilong divos long en, givim pepa long em, na rausim em long haus bilong en, o em i dai.

original: then the husband who divorced her first may not remarry her after she has been defiled, for that is an abomination to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
translation: Na husban i givim divorce long en bipo, em i no ken go bek gen long en after ol i bin mekim olgeta samting nogut long en, bikos dispela em i bagarap tumas long ai bilong LORD. Yupela no ken bringim sin long graun olsem wanpela inheritans we LORD God bilong yupela i givim long yupela.

original: If a man is newly married, he must not be sent to war or be pressed into any duty. For one year he is free to stay at home and bring joy to the wife he has married.
translation: Man em i marit nau, em i no ken go long wok war, na ol i no ken kirapim em long wok. Em i fri long stap hap home long wanpela yia, na bringim bel hevi long meri em i marit.

original: Do not take a pair of millstones or even an upper millstone as security for a debt, because that would be taking one’s livelihood as security.
translation: No ken skulim pepa milston, niu apataun milston, olsem sekiriti long det, bikos em i skulim laip bilong bai moni.

original: If a man is caught kidnapping one of his Israelite brothers, whether he treats him as a slave or sells him, the kidnapper must die. So you must purge the evil from among you.
translation: I kam kot na kisim wanpela brata Israel long we bilong kidnepim, bai hem i wokim em i go olsem slaev o salim em, kidnepa bai i mas die. Olsem na yu mas rausim olgeta samting nogut long mipela.

original: In cases of infectious skin diseases, be careful to diligently follow everything the Levitical priests instruct you. Be careful to do as I have commanded them.
translation: Long sickness skin i go daun, olsem leprosi, yu mas kisim hed, tokantais, na lusim olgeta samting long han bilong prist bilong tribe Levai, ol i tokim yu. Yu mas wokim gut, olsem mi bin givim ol prist bilong tribe Levai, ol i wok long templa bilong God, na yu mas mekim olgeta samting olsem ol i tok.

original: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you came out of Egypt.
translation: Yumi rememberim olsem LORD God bilong yumi mekim long Meriam long rot bilong yumi bihaenim yumi kamaut long Egip.

original: When you lend anything to your neighbor, do not enter his house to collect security.
translation: Wanpela yu givim samting long nek bilong yu, no go insait long haus bilong em i go kisim samting bilong sekuriti.

original: You are to stand outside while the man to whom you are lending brings the security out to you.
translation: Yu mas stap ausait, na man yu givim moni long em, bai bringim sekuriti i kam aut long yu.

original: If he is a poor man, you must not go to sleep with the security in your possession;
translation: Em i man bilong kukuk, yupela no ken go slip wantaim sekuriti ibin stap long han bilong yu;

original: be sure to return it to him by sunset, so that he may sleep in his own cloak and bless you, and this will be credited to you as righteousness before the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas bringim bek laplap bilong em bifo saksak bilong san, olsem em i ken slip long em yet, na em bai blesim yu, na dispela bai kamap olsem jastis bilong yu bifor LORD God bilong yu.

original: Do not oppress a hired hand who is poor and needy, whether he is a brother or a foreigner residing in one of your towns.
translation: No ken slipim wan man i wok hap kas, i nogat moni, i bikim hungri, bai em i brata, bai em i man i kam long nesen anar, i stap long wanpela ples bilong yu.

original: You are to pay his wages each day before sunset, because he is poor and depends on them. Otherwise he may cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
translation: Yu mas peim wajes bilong en bipo san i go daun, bikos em i poboi na i stap long ol. Inap em kisim voice, karim na krai long LORD, na yu bai yumi gilty long sin.

original: Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin.
translation: Papa i no ken dai bekim ol pikinini, na ol pikinini i no ken dai bekim papa bilong ol; nen igat dai bikos bilong sin bilong em yet.

original: Do not deny justice to the foreigner or the fatherless, and do not take a widow’s cloak as security.
translation: Yu no ken lusim jusis i go long man i kam from narapela kantri, pikinini we missim papa, na meri we husat i dai pinis. Yu no ken kisim kokomo bilong widou na usim olsem sekioriti.

original: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you from that place. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.
translation: Yumi remember olsem yumi bin saveman long Ijip, na LORD God bilong yumi bin bekim yumi long hap bilong ia. Olegeta, mi amirs tu yumi long mekim dispela.

original: If you are harvesting in your field and forget a sheaf there, do not go back to get it. It is to be left for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
translation: Yupela i save kaikai kaukau long ples bilong yupela na yupela lusim wanpela bun bilong kaukau i stap, no go bek long kisim. Em i mas i stap long ol man meri outsider, ol pikinini we i no gat papa, na ol meri we husband i dai, na bai Ol Masalai God bilong yupela i givim yupela plenti blessin long ol wok bilong han bilong yupela.

original: When you beat the olives from your trees, you must not go over the branches again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kilim oliv long diwai bilong yu, yu no ken go bek gen long branis. Oliv na branches we i stap yet bai i go long man i kam from naiton anather, pikinini we papa i dai, na meri we husban i dai.

original: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you must not go over the vines again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
translation: Wanpela taim yu pilim grape long gardan bilong vine, yu no ken go bek long vine gen. Ol samting i stap nabaut bai bilong man i kam from anor pla, pikinini we missim papa, na meri we husat i dai.

original: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.
translation: Yumi remember olsem yumi bin slave long gras bilong Ejip. Olegeda, mi am komanda yu long mekim dispela.

original: If there is a dispute between men, they are to go to court to be judged, so that the innocent may be acquitted and the guilty condemned.
translation: Sapos i gat birua long ol man, bai ol i go long kot na bai yumi jusim ol, olsem ol i nogat birua bai skulim, na ol i mekim birua bai kisim penalty.

original: If the guilty man deserves to be beaten, the judge shall have him lie down and be flogged in his presence with the number of lashes his crime warrants.
translation: Man i gat giltil i mas bagarap, jaj bai mekim em sidoun na kisim nemblipela piksa we em i mas kisim bikos blon em long hap bilong en.

original: He may receive no more than forty lashes, lest your brother be beaten any more than that and be degraded in your sight.
translation: Em i mas rekivim forty lain bilong het tasol, nogat moa, bikos brata bilong yu i no inap bekim olsem na yu no salim em i daun long ai bilong yu.

original: Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.
translation: No ken slipim maus bilong bulmakau wail em i stap tromoiwan grain.

original: When brothers dwell together and one of them dies without a son, the widow must not marry outside the family. Her husband’s brother is to take her as his wife and fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law for her.
translation: Wanpela taim bratha i stap long wanpela ples na wanpela i dai na i no go het husat i ken karim nem bilong en, meri we husband i dai pinis i no inap mary long narapela famili. Bratha bilong husat i mari em i mas bekim em meri bilong em yet na wokim waj bilong bratha bilong husat i mari long em.

original: The first son she bears will carry on the name of the dead brother, so that his name will not be blotted out from Israel.
translation: Pikinini namba wan em i karim bek long susa, bai karim nem bilong bropa ded i go, olsem nogat ken olsem nem bilong em i pilim pinis long Isrel.

original: But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, she is to go to the elders at the city gate and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to preserve his brother’s name in Israel. He is not willing to perform the duty of a brother-in-law for me.”
translation: Sapos man i no gat laik maritim widow bilong brata, em bai go long gate bilong taun, go long ol bikpela man i stap, na tokim ol: "Brata bilong husban bilong mi i no laik saveim nem bilong brata long Israel. Em i no laik wokim wok bilong han husban long me."

original: Then the elders of his city shall summon him and speak with him. If he persists and says, “I do not want to marry her,”
translation: Bikman bilong ples ia bai katim em i kam, na mipela bai toktok wantaim em. I em i stap yet long dispela, em bai tok, "Mi no laik maritim meri."

original: his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, remove his sandal, spit in his face, and declare, “This is what is done to the man who will not maintain his brother’s line.”
translation: Widow bilong brata i go ap long em long hap bilong olegta papa, na kisim sandal bilong em na kisim wei, spit long feis bilong em, na tokaut, "Em i narapela kain man husat no gat bel bilong mekim lain bilong brata em i go daun."

original: And his family name in Israel will be called “The House of the Unsandaled.”
translation: Na nem bilong ples bilong em long Isrel bai i kolim "Haus Bilong Ol I Go Barabare Foot".

original: If two men are fighting, and the wife of one steps in to rescue her husband from the one striking him, and she reaches out her hand and grabs his genitals,
translation: Igat tu man i fait, na meri bilong wan man i go bekim na skelim husban bilong en long man i paitim em, na em i stretim han na kisim kabak bilong em.

original: you are to cut off her hand. You must show her no pity.
translation: Yu mas katim han bilong em. Yu no ken givim em meri.

original: You shall not have two differing weights in your bag, one heavy and one light.
translation: Yu no ken havim tu kain ston weits olsem, wan em i hevi, na wan em i lait, long bag bilong yu.

original: You shall not have two differing measures in your house, one large and one small.
translation: Yu no ken havim tu kain bilong minamina long haus bilong yu, wanpela bikpela na wanpela liklik.

original: You must maintain accurate and honest weights and measures, so that you may live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Yu mas holim wett na mesure bilong yu tru na stap longol tru, na yu bai kaikaim planti yia long kantri we Bikpela LORD God bilong yu em i givim yu.

original: For everyone who behaves dishonestly in regard to these things is detestable to the LORD your God.
translation: Olgeta husat i wok kranki long dispela samting, em i ianu long Jehovah God bilong yu.

original: Remember what the Amalekites did to you along your way from Egypt,
translation: Rimemba olsem Amalekiti i mekim long wei bilong yu from Egip,

original: how they met you on your journey when you were tired and weary, and they attacked all your stragglers; they had no fear of God.
translation: Ol i kam stap long ples bilong yu, na yu go long rot, wankain taim yu bin les na isiT, na ol i kilim ol i go behain long ples; ol i no gat respek long God.

original: When the LORD your God gives you rest from the enemies around you in the land that He is giving you to possess as an inheritance, you are to blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela God i givim yu ripos long ol enemies i kamdaun nabauta long yumi long graun em i givim yumi long bai ka, na yumi holim olsem inheritance, yupela mas pilim nem bilong Amalek long anidas. Yu no ken lusim!

original: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and settle in it,
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long graun God promis, na Bikpela inaunal i givim yu, na yu kisim bek i go, stap long em,

original: you are to take some of the firstfruits of all your produce from the soil of the land that the LORD your God is giving you and put them in a basket. Then go to the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name,
translation: Yu mas kisim olgeta ka moning bilong yu, ol i kam long graun bilong kantri we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu, na putim ol long basket. Den yu go long ples we LORD God bilong yu i chusim olsem haus bilong Nem bilong En.

original: to the priest who is serving at that time, and say to him, “I declare today to the LORD your God that I have entered the land that the LORD swore to our fathers to give us.”
translation: Long pries we i wokim servis olsem taim bipo, yu tokim em, "Today mi akisim long LORD Bikpela God bilong yu, mi tok olsem, mi go insait long kantri we Bikpela promis long givim tumbuna bilong mipela."

original: Then the priest shall take the basket from your hands and place it before the altar of the LORD your God,
translation: Na prist i kisim basket long han bilong yu na putim i daun bifor altar bilong LORDE GOD.

original: and you are to declare before the LORD your God, “My father was a wandering Aramean, and he went down to Egypt few in number and lived there and became a great nation, mighty and numerous.
translation: Na yu mas tok bifor Jehovah papa bilong yu, 'Papa bilong mi em i man bilong Aram we i go wankain, na em i go daun long Egypt, na stap liklik tasol, na ol i kamap bikpela nesen, strongpela na plenti.'

original: But the Egyptians mistreated us and afflicted us, putting us to hard labor.
translation: Ijip ol i bagarapim mipela, ol i daunim mipela, na ol i wokim mipela long wok harim.

original: So we called out to the LORD, the God of our fathers; and the LORD heard our voice and saw our affliction, toil, and oppression.
translation: Mipela karim i go long LORD, God bilong tumbuna bilong mipela; na LORD harim tok bilong mipela na bam see hap bilong mipela, warka bilong mipela, na painim bilong mipela.

original: Then the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with great terror, signs, and wonders.
translation: Bikpela i bringim mipela long Egypt, wantaim han bilong pawa na arm bilong stretim oiap, wantaim kros, sain, na wondas bilong bikpela.

original: And He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
translation: Na em bringim mipela i kam long hap bilong dispela, em givim mipela dispela graun, wanpela graun we i flowe long susu na hani.

original: And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land that You, O LORD, have given me.” Then you are to place the basket before the LORD your God and bow down before Him.
translation: Nau, lukim, mi bringim ka moninga bilong graun we yu, LORD, givim mipela. Bai yu putim basket ikam long ples bilong LORD God bilong yu, na yu kakaruk i go daun bifo Em.

original: So you shall rejoice—you, the Levite, and the foreigner dwelling among you—in all the good things the LORD your God has given to you and your household.
translation: Yu mas hapim – yu, Levai, na man i kam long nait i stap long yu – long ol samting gut LORD God i givim long yu na hus lain bilong yu.

original: When you have finished laying aside a tenth of all your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, you are to give it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat and be filled within your gates.
translation: Wanpela taim yu finisim putim asi tenpela hap long kai bilong graun, long tripela yia, yia bilong tithe, yu mas givim i go long man Levai, man i kam from narapela hap, pikinini we missim papa, na meri we missim husban, olgeta oli kaikai na bel isi insait long ples bilong yu.

original: Then you shall declare in the presence of the LORD your God, “I have removed from my house the sacred portion and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all the commandments You have given me. I have not transgressed or forgotten Your commandments.
translation: Ol i tok klia long wei bilong Jehovah God bilong yu, "Mi kisim olt long haus bilong mi na takiwe ka i stap strong, na mi givim ol i go long Levait, ol i stap ansait long kantri, ol pikinini i no save painim papa mama, na ol meri i no save painim husban, olsem ol wok narapela we yu givim mi. Mi no go pasim olegta komando bilong yu, na mi no forgetim tu."

original: I have not eaten any of the sacred portion while in mourning, or removed any of it while unclean, or offered any of it for the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done everything You commanded me.
translation: Mi no kai kaikai bilong plesen God yet taim mi stap long sorow, na mi no teke bekim na kisim ol i go wail taim mi stap long birua, na mi no ofa ol i go long ol dai. Mi bihainim Tok bilong Bikpela, na mi mekim olgeta samting yu tokim mi.

original: Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the land You have given us as You swore to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.”
translation: Kukim i go daun long heven, long hap graun bilong yu, givim blesing long piple Israel bilong yu na lauran em i givim mipela – lauran i stap strong long susu na hanibisuki, olsem yu promis long tumbuna bilong mipela.

original: The LORD your God commands you this day to follow these statutes and ordinances. You must be careful to follow them with all your heart and with all your soul.
translation: Papa God bilong yu em i givim yu dispela tok ples na ol kalabus, olsem yu mas folo dispela lo bilong ples na ol kalabus. Yu mas kisim hevi long folo ol dispela wantaim hap blo yumi yet na wantaim spirit blo yumi.

original: Today you have proclaimed that the LORD is your God and that you will walk in His ways, keep His statutes and commandments and ordinances, and listen to His voice.
translation: Tude yu tok narafin olsem Bikpela em i God bilong yu, na yu wok long rot bilong Em, yu holim statut bilong En, kaunsil bilong En, na lo bilong En, na yu harim voys bilong En.

original: And today the LORD has proclaimed that you are His people and treasured possession as He promised, that you are to keep all His commandments,
translation: Tude Long Bilong Jehovah i tokaut long yupela olsem yupela i pikinini bilong Em na samting bilong pris bilong Em, olsem Em i promis, na yupela i mas holim ol lak bilong Em.

original: that He will set you high in praise and name and honor above all the nations He has made, and that you will be a holy people to the LORD your God, as He has promised.
translation: Bamim long givim yu hait long preis na nem na hona iboks long olgeta nesen em i mekim, na bai yu pilim ples narapela long Jehovah God bilong yu, olsem em i promis.

original: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people: “Keep all the commandments I am giving you today.
translation: Na Moses na ol bikpela man bilong Isrel i tokim ol pipel: Yu mas holim ol loa we mi givim yu tude.

original: And on the day you cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, set up large stones and coat them with plaster.
translation: Na long dei yu go pas Jordan, yu go insait long Lain bilong Prenis we Bikpela God yu givim yu, plantim bigpela ston na kaverim olgeta wantaim plasta.

original: Write on them all the words of this law when you have crossed over to enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your fathers, has promised you.
translation: Raaitim olgeta wod bilong disla lo, nau yu go pas long go insait long kantri, kantri i gat plenti milk na honey, olsem Jehovah, God bilong papa bilong yu, promisim yu.

original: And when you have crossed the Jordan, you are to set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I am commanding you today, and you are to coat them with plaster.
translation: Na wanpela taim yu go pas long Jordan, bai yu plantim dispela ston i go antap long Maunt Ebal, olsem na mi am tokim yu tude, na bai yu kamakim ol wantaim plasta.

original: Moreover, you are to build there an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. You must not use any iron tool on them.
translation: Na yu mas wokim ai olsem altar long Bikpela God bilong yu, wokim long ston, yu no ken usim eni ais kapul long en.

original: You shall build the altar of the LORD your God with uncut stones and offer upon it burnt offerings to the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas wokim altia bilong Bikpela iet yu long ston nogat kotim, na bringim ofing em ofa bung long Bikpela.

original: There you are to sacrifice your peace offerings, eating them and rejoicing in the presence of the LORD your God.
translation: Long hap bilong yu, sakrifisim peis ofring bilong yu, kaikai na hap Tok bilong yu long wei bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: And you shall write distinctly upon these stones all the words of this law.”
translation: Na yu mas raitim klia long dispela ston olgeta wod bilong desla lo.

original: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel: “Be silent, O Israel, and listen! This day you have become the people of the LORD your God.
translation: Na Moses na prist Levitikal i go tok long ol Isrel: "Kisim ka, O Isrel, na harim! Tede yupela kamap ol pikinini bilong LORD God bilong yupela.

original: You shall therefore obey the voice of the LORD your God and follow His commandments and statutes I am giving you today.”
translation: Yu mas harim tok bilong Bikpela na folowim komando na statut bilong En, olsem mi givim yu tude.

original: On that day Moses commanded the people:
translation: Long dispela de Moses i givim komando long ol pipol:

original: “When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go pas long Jordan, ol tribe namba: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, na Benjamin, bai stap long Maunt Gerizim bilong blesim ol pipol.

original: And these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal to deliver the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
translation: Na dispela tribu i mas stat long Maunt Ebal na givim kros: Ruben, Gad, Esara, Sebulon, Dan, na Naphtali.

original: Then the Levites shall proclaim in a loud voice to every Israelite:
translation: Na Levaita bai ken tokautim long ol voys i go daun olgeta Israel:

original: ‘Cursed is the man who makes a carved idol or molten image—an abomination to the LORD, the work of the hands of a craftsman—and sets it up in secret.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: Man i go long hel, i go long hel, em i mekim idol we ol man i katim o piksa molten - olsem bagarap long ai bilong Jehovah, wok bilong han bilong wanpela karamut, na em i putim i daun long ples i no save. Na ol pipel oli tok, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who dishonors his father or mother.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: I go long ol i go dae em i no giv respek long papa o mama bilong em. Na ol pipol mas tok olsem: Amen!

original: ‘Cursed is he who moves his neighbor’s boundary stone.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: I go bekim kat, em i kirapim ston bilong paia bilong narapela man. Na ol pipel oli sei, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who lets a blind man wander in the road.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: I go backend long hap, em i, i larim man i no save si i go wail long rot, na ol piple hariap i tok, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who withholds justice from the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: ‘I go bekim kat kat man i no givim jusis long man i kam from narapela hap, pikinini we i no gat papa, o meri we i no gat husband.’ Na olgeta man meri i tok, ‘Amen!’

original: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his father’s wife, for he has violated his father’s marriage bed.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: Em i katpella em i go pas long meri bilong papa bilong em, olsem na em i bagarapim bet bilong marit bilong papa bilong em. Na ol pipol oli tok olsem: Amen!

original: ‘Cursed is he who lies with any animal.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: Husat i lusim tru wantaim ol kain animal, em i go long ples bilong ol samting nogut. Na ol pipol oli tok, ‘Amena!’

original: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: I go long ol i kilang man i slip wantaim susa bilong em, ikam long papa bilong em o ikam long mama bilong em. Na ol pipol oli tok, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his mother-in-law.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: Tok baksait i go long man i slip wantaim mama bilong meri bilong em. Na ol pipol oli tok, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who strikes down his neighbor in secret.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: ‘Bikhet i stap long dispela man husat i kilim nekaba bilong en i go insait.’ Na ol pipol yumi tok ole, ‘Amen!’

original: ‘Cursed is he who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: I go long ol bikmaus, i gat moni na kilim man we i no mekim rong. Na ol pipol oli tok, 'Amen!'

original: ‘Cursed is he who does not put the words of this law into practice.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’
translation: ‘I go long ol i GO, em i husat i no mekim tok bilong desla lo, mipela i save long tok bilong desla lo bilong mekim olgeta samting.’ Na ol pipel oli ken tok olsem, ‘Amen!’

original: “Now if you faithfully obey the voice of the LORD your God and are careful to follow all His commandments I am giving you today, the LORD your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
translation: Sapos yu trustum na harim tok bilong LORD God bilong yu, na yu yet long bihainim ol lo bilong En we mi givim yu tude, tasol LORD God bilong yu bai putim yu antap long ol nesen long graun.

original: And all these blessings will come upon you and overtake you, if you will obey the voice of the LORD your God:
translation:
Na olgeta blesing igat bai kam long yu, na bai kam behainim yu, if you will obey the voice of the LORD your God: 
translate to:
 Na olgeta blesing i gohet long yu, na bai i kam behainim yu, yapm yu harim na bilipim tok bilong LORD God bilong yu.

original: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.
translation: Yu bai blessim long taun na yu bai blessim long bus.

original: The fruit of your womb will be blessed, as well as the produce of your land and the offspring of your livestock—the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks.
translation: Frut bilong bel yu, pikinini bilong yu, bai givim blesing, olsem na ka bilong graun yu, na pikinini bilong animals yu - kol bilong grup bilong animals yu na lamb bilong grup bilong pikinini animals yu.

original: Your basket and kneading bowl will be blessed.
translation: Ol basket na bol bilong yu husim bai blesim.

original: You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
translation: Yupela bai bikim bekim blessim wän yupela i kam insait, na yupela bai bikim bekim blessim wän yupela i go autsait.

original: The LORD will cause the enemies who rise up against you to be defeated before you. They will march out against you in one direction but flee from you in seven.
translation: Papa God i go bagarap ol i stap agensim yu. Ol i go kam aut na go harim long wanpela hap, tasol ol i go ranawe long 7 hap na lusim yu.

original: The LORD will decree a blessing on your barns and on everything to which you put your hand; the LORD your God will bless you in the land He is giving you.
translation: LORD bai tok birua long haos bilong pisin bilong yu, na long olgeta samting yu wokim; LORD God bilong yu bai birua yu long kantri we em i givim yu.

original: The LORD will establish you as His holy people, just as He has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.
translation: LORD bai plantim yu olsem pipo bilong Hem i stap holiholi, olsem Hem i promis long yu, sapos yu halivim tok bilong law bilong Bikpela LORD God bilong yu na yu wokabaut long rot bilong Hem.

original: Then all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will stand in awe of you.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong graun olgeta bai lukim yu kola long nem bilong LORD, na ol bai stap long friht bilong yu.

original: The LORD will make you prosper abundantly—in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land—in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give you.
translation: Papa God bai mekim yu kamap strong na katol - long mun bilong yu, ol pikinini bilong ol aninal bilong yu, na ka bilong graun bilong yu - long graun we Papa God promis long ol tumbuna bilong yu long givim yu.

original: The LORD will open the heavens, His abundant storehouse, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations, but borrow from none.
translation: Papa God bai opim heven, em stoa haus bilong en, na salim ren i go daun long graun bilong yu long taim bilong, na bai givim bikpela bles long ol wok bilong han bilong yu. Yu bai givim moni long planti nesen, tasol yu no salim moni long narapela.

original: The LORD will make you the head and not the tail; you will only move upward and never downward, if you hear and carefully follow the commandments of the LORD your God, which I am giving you today.
translation: Papa God bai mekim yu hed na nogat tail; yu bai go ap long na nogat i go daun, sapos yu harim tok bilong Papa God na bihainim klostu ol komandaemon bilong en we mi givim yu tude.

original: Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from any of the words I command you today, and do not go after other gods to serve them.
translation: No ken go kam bek long raite na long lef from olgeta wod mipela tok ples today, na yu no go bihain narapela kina god bilong wokim servos long hem.

original: If, however, you do not obey the LORD your God by carefully following all His commandments and statutes I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:
translation: Sapos yupela no bihainim LORD God bilong yu, na yupela i no go bek long olgeta tok bilong Em na statit bilong Em we mi givim yupela today, olgeta kros besena bai i kam long yupela na i kisim yupela.

original: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country.
translation: Yu bai i kamapim bekim long taun na yu bai i kamapim bekim long bus.

original: Your basket and kneading bowl will be cursed.
translation: Bol bilong yu na baskit bai i stap long kakaruk.

original: The fruit of your womb will be cursed, as well as the produce of your land, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks.
translation: Fruiti bilong bel yu bai i kamapim curse, olsem na ka bilong graun yu, kakaruk bilong busnakai bilong yu, na pikinini bilong mop bilong yu.

original: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
translation: Yu bai i kamapim bekim ol curse long yu, wanpela taim yu kakarim i go insait na wanpela taim yu kakarim i go aut.

original: The LORD will send curses upon you, confusion and reproof in all to which you put your hand, until you are destroyed and quickly perish because of the wickedness you have committed in forsaking Him.
translation: Papa God bai senisim katikati long yu, gelo na kros, na skulim yu long olgeta samting yu putim han long, until yu perisim kwiktaim na yu dai olsem bikos yu mekim nogut long lusim Em.

original: The LORD will make the plague cling to you until He has exterminated you from the land that you are entering to possess.
translation: LORD bai mekim sik na em i go long olsem na i kamapim yu, na tasol bai em i finisim yu long kantri we yu go insait long en i stap.

original: The LORD will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, and with blight and mildew; these will pursue you until you perish.
translation: Papa God bai kilim yu long sickness i go daunim yu, feva, bodili i painim, hot i kali, wara no kam, na pipia bilong pisin; ol dispela bai pursuiim yu na kilim yu pinis, na yu bai dai pinis.

original: The sky over your head will be bronze, and the earth beneath you iron.
translation: Skaei ibever long hed bilong yu em bai kamap olsem bronis, na gras bilong erth anak long yu em bai kamap olsem ain.

original: The LORD will turn the rain of your land into dust and powder; it will descend on you from the sky until you are destroyed.
translation: Papa God bai katim ren bilong yu long das na poda, na em bai kam daun long yu from skai, na yu bai bagarap olgeta.

original: The LORD will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will march out against them in one direction but flee from them in seven. You will be an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
translation: Papa God bai mekim yu kamdaun i go back. Yu bai go pasim ol long wara long wanpela sait tasol yu ranawe long ol long sevenpela sait. Yu bai kamap olsem samting we i mekmak ol man i pret long ol kingdoms bilong graun.

original: Your corpses will be food for all the birds of the air and beasts of the earth, with no one to scare them away.
translation: Bodi ded bilong yulpai kam bek na kaikai long pisin bilong heven na ol binatang long graun, na nogat man i save rausim ol.

original: The LORD will afflict you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors and scabs and itch from which you cannot be cured.
translation: Papa God bai bagarapim yu wantaim bubu bilong Egip, tumora, skab, na kilanat, na yu no ina save kam bek gen.

original: The LORD will afflict you with madness, blindness, and confusion of mind,
translation: Bikpela bai bagarapim yu long ol samting bilong doti, bikhet, na konfusen bilong man, olsem pipia i go bagarapim yu.

original: and at noon you will grope about like a blind man in the darkness. You will not prosper in your ways. Day after day you will be oppressed and plundered, with no one to save you.
translation: Na long taem middei, yu bai stap tukim hap bilong yu yet olsem man i no save si long dokisnogut. Yu no inap kamap strong long rot bilong yu. Dei bihain dei, yu bai kisim trabel na man i bai stilim sampela samting bilong yu, na i no gat man i save helpim yu.

original: You will be pledged in marriage to a woman, but another man will violate her. You will build a house but will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard but will not enjoy its fruit.
translation: Yu bai i stap long plan long marij, na narapela man bai i bagarap em. Yu bai i bikim haus,bai yu no stap insait long en. Yu bai i plantim vineya, bai yu no kaikai fruit bilong en.

original: Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will not eat any of it. Your donkey will be taken away and not returned to you. Your flock will be given to your enemies, and no one will save you.
translation: Oks bilong yu bai i slop long ai bilong yu, tasol yu no ken kaikai samting nau. Donki bilong yu bai i tekewe, na em i no kam bek long yu. Ol pikinini bilong yu bai i givim long eni bilong yu, na nobody bai i saveim yu.

original: Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, while your eyes grow weary looking for them day after day, with no power in your hand.
translation: Pikinini man na pikinini meri bilong yu bai givim i go long narapela nesen, wail ol i go bek long lukim ol de po de, na yu no gat strong long han bilong yu.

original: A people you do not know will eat the produce of your land and of all your toil. All your days you will be oppressed and crushed.
translation: Pipol we yu no save, bai kaikai klim bilong wok long olgeta hapsain bilong yu, na yu bai i stap daun, yu bai i bagarap olgeta dei bilong yu.

original: You will be driven mad by the sights you see.
translation: Yu bai go longlong long ol bikpela samting yu lukim.

original: The LORD will afflict you with painful, incurable boils on your knees and thighs, from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
translation: LORD bai bagarapim yu long boil ol i save sakit na ken stap, ina ken kamap strong, long kni na leg bilong yu, stat long lek bilong yu go long hed bilong yu.

original: The LORD will bring you and the king you appoint to a nation neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will worship other gods—gods of wood and stone.
translation: LORD bai bringim yupela na king yupela bai appoint long narapela kantri we yupela na tumbuna bilong yupela i no save long en, na bipor long en yupela bai servisim olegata gods - gods bilong diwai na ston.

original: You will become an object of horror, scorn, and ridicule among all the nations to which the LORD will drive you.
translation: Yu bai kamap olsem samting bilong vilivat, bagarap nogut, na lusim long olgeta nesen we Bikpela bai lusim yu go long en.

original: You will sow much seed in the field but harvest little, because the locusts will consume it.
translation: Yupela bai planim planti sik bilong yu long graun, tasol bai kamap ol i kisim biknait i no gutpela, bilong dispela em locusts bai kaikaim.

original: You will plant and cultivate vineyards, but will neither drink the wine nor gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.
translation: Yupela bai plantim na wokim banis long vineyards, bai no dringim wine na no kam bekim grape, bikos ol maggot bai kaikaim ol.

original: You will have olive trees throughout your territory but will never anoint yourself with oil, because the olives will drop off.
translation: Bai yu ken havim olivim taris long olgeta ples bilong yu, tasol yu no ken putim olsen oil long skin bilong yu gen, wantaim dispela olivim bai i go daun.

original: You will father sons and daughters, but they will not remain yours, because they will go into captivity.
translation: Yu bai ikam papa bilong mani pikinini man na meri, tasol ol i no stap long yu, bikos ol bai go long hap kasal.

original: Swarms of locusts will consume all your trees and the produce of your land.
translation: Ol lokis i go na kai kai olgeta ol diwai bilong yu, na tu ol kaine moni bilong graun bilong yu.

original: The foreigner living among you will rise higher and higher above you, while you sink down lower and lower.
translation: Man i kam from naiton ananit i stap long mipela bai i go ap long long, na yu yet bai i sindaun lo lo.

original: He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him. He will be the head, and you will be the tail.
translation: Em bai lendim moni long yu, yu no bai lendim moni long em. Em bai i kamap hed, yu bai i kamap tail.

original: All these curses will come upon you. They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, since you did not obey the LORD your God and keep the commandments and statutes He gave you.
translation: Olgeta dispela kros i kam long yu, oli i go bek long yu na oli i kisim yu, long ol i bagarapim yu, emas yu no bihainim tok bilong LORD God bilong yu, na yu no holim tok orait bilong na lo bilong ol lida we em i givim long yu.

original: These curses will be a sign and a wonder upon you and your descendants forever.
translation: Dispela kros bai i kamap wanpela singsing na wondar long yupela na ol desenden pepa bilong yupela foreva.

original: Because you did not serve the LORD your God with joy and gladness of heart in all your abundance,
translation: Bikos yu no sarve LORD God bilong yu wantaim joi na glades long hart, long olgeta samting yu gat,

original: you will serve your enemies the LORD will send against you in famine, thirst, nakedness, and destitution. He will place an iron yoke on your neck until He has destroyed you.
translation: Yupela bai sarve enemi bilong yupela we LORD bai sendim long yupela, na bai yupela kisim trabel long beli biksim, torst, klos no stap, na kisim trabel olgeta. Em bai putim yok bilong aian long nek bilong yupela, na em yet kam distroyim yupela.

original: The LORD will bring a nation from afar, from the ends of the earth, to swoop down upon you like an eagle—a nation whose language you will not understand,
translation: Papa God bai bringim wanpela nesen longwe na farawe, long long hap bilong graun, i bai kam daunupan yu olsem agil bird—nesen we yu no save tok ol tok bilong ol.

original: a ruthless nation with no respect for the old and no pity for the young.
translation: Nesen i strong tupela, i no gat respek long ol bikpela, na i no gat bel hevi long ol pikinini.

original: They will eat the offspring of your livestock and the produce of your land until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain or new wine or oil, no calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks, until they have caused you to perish.
translation: Ol bai kaikai ol pikinini bilong ol anus bilong yu, na ol ka bilong graun bilong yu, na go long yu i go daun yet. Ol no lusim yu gat grain, wine nupela, olio, no kalvs bilong ol anus bilong yu, no lambs bilong ol fok bilong yu, long ol i mekim yu i dai pinis.

original: They will besiege all the cities throughout your land, until the high and fortified walls in which you trust have fallen. They will besiege all your cities throughout the land that the LORD your God has given you.
translation: Ol i go kasem ol ples bilong yu yet, na bai ol i go daunim ol wal ibin strong na ibin antap longen gras bilong yu putim trast. Ol i go kasem ol ples bilong yu yet longen gras we LORD God bilong yu givim yu.

original: Then you will eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of the sons and daughters whom the LORD your God has given you, in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you.
translation: Na bai yu kaikai ikon bilong bel yu, long taim bilong paitim na bikmus we ol i mas pokim yu, na ol dispela i götpela Pita God bilong yu givim yu.

original: The most gentle and refined man among you will begrudge his brother, the wife he embraces, and the rest of his children who have survived,
translation: Man i gat het kamap na i swit moa, bai i no laik gim brata bilong em, meri em i kamon long bodi bilong em, na ol pipol pikinini bilong em ol i stap yet.

original: refusing to share with any of them the flesh of his children he will eat because he has nothing left in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within all your gates.
translation: I no ken givim bosom bilong pikinini em bai kaikai, bikos em i no gat moa long taim bilong faet na haritim ol i kam bek long yu, insi long olgeta gaten bilong yu.

original: The most gentle and refined woman among you, so gentle and refined she would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground, will begrudge the husband she embraces and her son and daughter
translation: Meri i moa na swit moa long yupela, em i dainti tru, bai em i no ken go daun long graun, nogat, bai em i sori long hap bilong em, na pikinini man na pikinini meri bilong em.

original: the afterbirth that comes from between her legs and the children she bears, because she will secretly eat them for lack of anything else in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within your gates.
translation: Plasenta i kam long narapela hap bilong leg bilong meri na pikinini ol i karim, bikos meri bai kaikai ol long bel isi, long nait, bikos nogat samting narapela, long taim bilong faet na sorere ol enemy bai mekim long yu, long geit bilong yu.

original: If you are not careful to observe all the words of this law which are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and awesome name—the LORD your God—
translation: Sapos yu no kisim hevi long lukautim olgeta wod bilong lo dispela, ol i raitim long dispela buk, na yu mas poret long dispela nem glori na awosom—LORDE GOD bilong yu—

original: He will bring upon you and your descendants extraordinary disasters, severe and lasting plagues, and terrible and chronic sicknesses.
translation: Em bai bringim ol pes bilong gavman i go long yu na ol desenden bilong yu, plag we i bikpela na i stap long taim, na sik bilong yurok long taim na sik bilong laip na i no inap stop.

original: He will afflict you again with all the diseases you dreaded in Egypt, and they will cling to you.
translation: Em bai i bagarapim yu gen wantaim ol sickness yu bin pikinam long Egip, na ol dispela sickness bai i stap wantaim yu.

original: The LORD will also bring upon you every sickness and plague not recorded in this Book of the Law, until you are destroyed.
translation: Papa God bai bringim olgeta sik na pogula i no bin rakim long Buk Bilong Lotu, na yusupela i go daun, na bai yumi bagarap olgeta.

original: You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left few in number, because you would not obey the voice of the LORD your God.
translation: Yu ol i save olsem sta bilong heven, tasol bikos yu no bin harim tok bilong LORD God bilong yu, yu ol i go bek i liklik tasol.

original: Just as it pleased the LORD to make you prosper and multiply, so also it will please Him to annihilate you and destroy you. And you will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess.
translation: Olsem Papa God i ambisim bai yu kamap strong na i go ap long olsem na plenti, olsem nau bai em i ambisim bai yu dai na bai nogut tumas, na bai yu lusim graun we yu wokim long kisim.

original: Then the LORD will scatter you among all the nations, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your fathers have known.
translation: Na Bipo God bai mekim yu go ol ples long wanpela hap bilong wol na go long narapela hap, na bai yu servis god bilong diwai na stoan, ol god we yu no save long en, na tumbuna bilong yu, ol i no save long en.

original: Among those nations you will find no repose, not even a resting place for the sole of your foot. There the LORD will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a despairing soul.
translation: Long ol narapela kantri, ino gat ples bilong ris, nogat ples bilong stap bilong lek. LORD bai givim yu hat bilong trau, ai i no inap luk gut, na soul bilong bikim sorimi.

original: So your life will hang in doubt before you, and you will be afraid night and day, never certain of survival.
translation: Laip bilong yu bai hang long doute bifor yu, na yu bai bikimafet long nait na de, na yu no save long levem.

original: In the morning you will say, ‘If only it were evening!’ and in the evening you will say, ‘If only it were morning!’—because of the dread in your hearts of the terrifying sights you will see.
translation: Bai moning yu bai tok, 'Oi, inap long apinun i kam!' na long apinun yu bai tok, 'Oi, inap long moning i kam!' - bikos long haret bilong yu i gat lek i dai long siktis we i bringim fright na yu bai luk.

original: The LORD will return you to Egypt in ships by a route that I said you should never see again. There you will sell yourselves to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”
translation: GOD bilong ol bai bringim yuself go bek long Egip insait long sip, long rot i mi tok olsem yu no ken go bek gen. Bai yu selim yuself long enemy bilong yu olsem man na meri i wok long servisis, tasol nogat man i ken baim yu.

original: These are the words of the covenant that the LORD commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant He had made with them at Horeb.
translation: Dispela em i tok bilong kaivet we LORD i givim oda long Mosese wokim wantaim ol Israelit long Moab, plano long dispela kaivet we em i mekim gen wantaim ol long Horeb.

original: Moses summoned all Israel and proclaimed to them, “You have seen with your own eyes everything the LORD did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to all his land.
translation: Moses i kirapim ol Israel, na i tokaut long ol, “Yu lukim wantaim ai bilong yu ol samting we Bikpela i mekim long Egip, long King bilong Egip, long ol ofisa bilong gavman, na long ol hap bilong kantri bilong en.”

original: You saw with your own eyes the great trials, and those miraculous signs and wonders.
translation: Yu lukim long ai bilong yu yet ol bikpela trael na painim, na ol samting mak bilong God na ol wondar.

original: Yet to this day the LORD has not given you a mind to understand, eyes to see, or ears to hear.
translation: Na todei yet, LORDE em i no givim yu tingting bilong undastan, ai bilong lukim, o erelo bilong harim.

original: For forty years I led you in the wilderness, yet your clothes and sandals did not wear out.
translation: Long forti yia, mi bin lidim yu long bus, na klotes na sandal bilong yu i no bin bugam.

original: You ate no bread and drank no wine or strong drink, so that you might know that I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yu no kaikai bret, yu no dring waire o drunk strong, bilong yu save tok olsem, Papa bilong yu em i Bikpela.

original: When you reached this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out against us in battle, but we defeated them.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kamap long ples ini, Sihon king bilong Heshbon na Og king bilong Bashan i kom bek gen long mipela long fait, tasol mipela winim ol.

original: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Mipela tken long graun bilong ol, na mipela givim ol i go long Reubinitis, Gaditis, na hap-tribe bilong Manase olsem inaidans.

original: So keep and follow the words of this covenant, that you may prosper in all you do.
translation: Kisim na bihainim tok bilong dispela kaivosen, na yu ken kamap strong na wail long ol samting yu mekim.

original: All of you are standing today before the LORD your God—you leaders of tribes, elders, officials, and all the men of Israel,
translation: Yupela olgeta i stap tude long ples bilong LORD — yupela bikpela man bilong tribe, ol bikpela i stap, ol ofisa, na ol man bilong Israel.

original: your children and wives, and the foreigners in your camps who cut your wood and draw your water—
translation: Ol pikinini na meri bilong yu, na ol yangpela i kam nau long ples bilong yu ol i katim diwai bilong yu na ol i bekim wara bilong yu —

original: so that you may enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which He is making with you today, and into His oath,
translation: Inap yu go insait long kaovenan bilong LORD God bilong yu, dispela we Em i mekim wantaim yu tude, na insait long promis bilong En.

original: and so that He may establish you today as His people, and He may be your God as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
translation: Na Em i mekim deso olsem Em i stapim yu tudei olsem pipol bilong Em, na Em i bamdaon God bilong yu, olsem Em i promisim yu, na olsem Em i tokstrong long papa bilong yu, long Abraham, Aisak, na Yakob.

original: I am making this covenant and this oath not only with you,
translation: Mi mekim kavenan bilong mipela na oat bilong mipela nasal long yu tu.

original: but also with those who are standing here with us today in the presence of the LORD our God, as well as with those who are not here today.
translation: Bai olsem tu wantaim ol pipol i stap hia tude long wei bilong LORD God bilong yumi, na wantaim ol pipol i no stap hia tude.

original: For you yourselves know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we passed through the nations on the way here.
translation: Yupela yet yu save mipela i stap long kantri bilong Ijip na mipela i pas long ol narapela kantri long rot bilong kam hare.

original: You saw the abominations and idols among them made of wood and stone, of silver and gold.
translation: Yu lukim oleta samting nogut na hevi i stap long ol, ol i mekim bilong diwai, bilong stoan, bilong silva, na bilong gol.

original: Make sure there is no man or woman, clan or tribe among you today whose heart turns away from the LORD our God to go and worship the gods of those nations. Make sure there is no root among you that bears such poisonous and bitter fruit,
translation: Makim ol i no gat man o meri, clan o tribe long yumi tudei husat het bilong em i kam bek gen long LORD God bilong yumi, bai em i go wosipim god bilong narapela kantri. Makim ol i no gat ruut bilong yu yet olsem i karim ka o posin na bita kaukau.

original: because when such a person hears the words of this oath, he invokes a blessing on himself, saying, ‘I will have peace, even though I walk in the stubbornness of my own heart.’ This will bring disaster on the watered land as well as the dry.
translation: Bikos long taim dispela man harim tok bilong dispela oati, em ibin kolim blesing long em yet, olsem: 'Bai mi kisim peis,maski mi wokabaut long hed na oganisi bilong mi yet.' Dispela bikhet bai i kam long ples we i gat wara na ples we i drai tu.

original: The LORD will never be willing to forgive him. Instead, His anger and jealousy will burn against that man, and every curse written in this book will fall upon him. The LORD will blot out his name from under heaven
translation: Papa God bai no wanbel long forgivim em. Em i mas garim bel kol na sori long man husat, na ol kain curse we i write long buk igo i kamdaun long em. Papa God bai rausim nem bilong em nau long aninit long heven.

original: and single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this Book of the Law.
translation: Na makim em i stap wanpela tasol long olgeta trib long Isrel, long wei bilong bagarap, olsem olgeta kat kat bilong kovenant i raitim long Buk Bilong Lo.

original: Then the generation to come—your sons who follow you and the foreigner who comes from a distant land—will see the plagues of the land and the sicknesses the LORD has inflicted on it.
translation: Genarashen bai kam, pikinini bilong yu ol i go behain na man i kam long ples i go we, ol i lukim bikpela pes bilong graun na sik ol Bikpela i givim long em.

original: All its soil will be a burning waste of sulfur and salt, unsown and unproductive, with no plant growing on it, just like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His fierce anger.
translation: Olgeta graun bilong en bai i go daun long salfata na solwara sol, i no growim planti, maski wanpela plant no grow long en, olsem dispela bagarapim Sodom na Gomorrah, Admah na Zeboiim, we Papa God i bin kilim long bel hot bilong em.

original: So all the nations will ask, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this land? Why this great outburst of anger?’
translation: Olgeta nesen bai askim, 'Bilong wanem LORD i mekim samting olsem long dispela kantri? Bilong wanem dispela bikpela pasal i kam?'

original: And the people will answer, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD, the God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Na ol pipel bai tokim, 'Em i bikos ol i lusim kot bilong LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, we em i mekim long ol taim em i kam bekim ol long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: They went and served other gods, and they worshiped gods they had not known—gods that the LORD had not given to them.
translation: Ol i go na servisis long ol kina god, na ol i worsip ol kina god ol yet i no save - ol kina god em Bikpela i no givim long ol.

original: Therefore the anger of the LORD burned against this land, and He brought upon it every curse written in this book.
translation: Nogat, iri bilong Jehovah i bagarap long ples, na em i kamapim olgeta kilakilai long buk.

original: The LORD uprooted them from their land in His anger, rage, and great wrath, and He cast them into another land, where they are today.’
translation: Papa God i kirapim ol long graun bilong ol long rausim, popoia, na bikpela iangin bilong En, na em i tromoi ol long narapela graun, we ol i stap nau.

original: The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may follow all the words of this law.
translation: Ol samting husat i hidim i bilong LORD God bilong mipela, tasol ol samting we i lukim nau ol i bilong mipela na ol pikinini bilong mipela forever, bile mipela i ken folowim ol toktok bilong laia dispela.

original: “When all these things come upon you—the blessings and curses I have set before you—and you call them to mind in all the nations to which the LORD your God has banished you,
translation: Wanpela taim ol samting i kam long yu – blesings na katikati we mi putim befop long yu – na yu mas thinkim bek long ol, long ol kantri we LORD God bilong yu drivim yu go olsem penalti, em Yu mas kisim bek long ol.

original: and when you and your children return to the LORD your God and obey His voice with all your heart and all your soul according to everything I am giving you today,
translation: Na when yu go bek long LORD Bikpela bilong yu, na yu harim tok bilong Em, kadim tok bilong Bikpela wantaim halivim yu yet long olgeta hap na olgeta soul bilong yu, olsem olgeta samting mi givim yu today,

original: then He will restore you from captivity and have compassion on you and gather you from all the nations to which the LORD your God has scattered you.
translation: Na em bai bringim yu bek long klostu, givim yu kros, na kisim yu long olgeta nesen we LORD God bilong yu scaterim yu go long en.

original: Even if you have been banished to the farthest horizon, He will gather you and return you from there.
translation: I gatim yu longwe hap bilong heven, tasol em bai kisim na bringim yu gen, na bekim yu i kam.

original: And the LORD your God will bring you into the land your fathers possessed, and you will take possession of it. He will cause you to prosper and multiply more than your fathers.
translation: Na LORD Bikpela bilong yu bai bringim yu go long graun ol tumbuna bilong yu i gat, na yu ken takem i go. Em bai mekim yu i kamap strong na i multipul moa long ol tumbuna bilong yu.

original: The LORD your God will circumcise your hearts and the hearts of your descendants, and you will love Him with all your heart and with all your soul, so that you may live.
translation: LORD God bai katim sken long het bilong yu na long het bilong pikinini bilong yu yet, na yu bai luvim em wantaim het bilong yu na wantaim sol bilong yu, oleza yu ken i stap.

original: Then the LORD your God will put all these curses upon your enemies who hate you and persecute you.
translation: Na Bikpela bilong yu i go putim olgeta kros bes long ol eni i no likim yu na ol i biruaim yu.

original: And you will again obey the voice of the LORD and follow all His commandments I am giving you today.
translation: Na yu bai kam bek gen, yu mas haren vois bilong Bikpela, na bihainim ol komando bilong Em, olgeta samting we mi tokim yu tede.

original: So the LORD your God will make you abound in all the work of your hands and in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land. Indeed, the LORD will again delight in your goodness, as He delighted in that of your fathers,
translation: Bikpela LORD God bilong yu bai mekim yu kamap i plenti long olgeta wok bilong han bilong yu, na long ol pikinini bilong yu, ol generations bilong busna bilong yu, na ol ka bilong graun bilong yu. Bikpela LORD bai hamamas long gutpela bilong yu gen, olsem nem bilong tumbuna bilong yu.

original: if you obey the LORD your God by keeping His commandments and statutes that are written in this Book of the Law, and if you turn to Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
translation: Sapos yu obedim Long Bilong Yumi, bikos yu holim komando na statut bilong Em ol i stap wokbek long Buk Bilong Lotu, na sapos yu wokbek long Em wantaim hap bilong het bilong yumi na spiriet bilong yumi.

original: For this commandment I give you today is not too difficult for you or beyond your reach.
translation: Long dispela tok orait, mi givim yu tude, em i no bikim tumas long yu, nogat i go pasim han bilong yu.

original: It is not in heaven, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will ascend into heaven to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’
translation: Em i no stap long heven, nasel nau yu no ken askim, ‘Husat bai go antap long heven na kisim i kam bek long mipela, tokautim na mipela bihaenim olsem?’

original: And it is not beyond the sea, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will cross the sea to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’
translation: Em i no bihain long solwara, nau yu no ken askim, 'Husat bai go krosim solwara na kisim i kam long nau na tukim olsem, mipela bai holim?'

original: But the word is very near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may obey it.
translation: Tok bilong God i kamap bikos em i klosim; em i insait long maus bilong yu na long bel bilong yu, bile yu ken rullim.

original: See, I have set before you today life and goodness, as well as death and disaster.
translation: Mi putim i go bikosim yu tude, laip na gutpela, na dea na bagarap.

original: For I am commanding you today to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, statutes, and ordinances, so that you may live and increase, and the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are entering to possess.
translation: Mipela i amandanin yu tude, inap lovim LORD God bilong yu, i go longpela wei bilong em, na yu holim komando, statutes, na ordinances bilong em, mipela bai yu ken stap na i grow strong, na LORD God bilong yu bai givim yu bikpela blessin long hap bilong en yu go insait long en.

original: But if your heart turns away and you do not listen, but are drawn away to bow down to other gods and worship them,
translation: Bai yu hart i turnawe bek gen na yu no harim tok, na yu i go daun long mekim servis long narapela kina god, na yu i servisim ol.

original: I declare to you today that you will surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
translation: Mi tok olsem long tude, yupela bai daiPinis tru; yupela no ken stap planti yia long kantri ya, we yupela go pinis karim ka long Jordan, na kisim grap.

original: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing. Therefore choose life, so that you and your descendants may live,
translation: Mi kolim heven na graun bilong yumi olsem witnes tudei, bicom mi putim laip na ded, blessing na karim long tok, long front bilong yu. Oli tasol, yu pilim laip, so olsem yu na pikinini bilong yu i ken stap.

original: and that you may love the LORD your God, obey Him, and hold fast to Him. For He is your life, and He will prolong your life in the land that the LORD swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”
translation: Na yu mas lovim LORD God bilong yu, obedim em, na holim strong long em. Em i laip bilong yu, na bai yu kaival long taim long graun we LORD i promis long givim long tumbuna bilong yu, olsem Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob.

original: When Moses had finished speaking these words to all Israel,
translation: Taim Mosese i winim tok bilong en, i tokim olgeta Israel,

original: he said to them, “I am now a hundred and twenty years old; I am no longer able to come and go, and the LORD has said to me, ‘You shall not cross the Jordan.’
translation: Em i tokim ol, "Mi nau 120 yia na mi bikhet; mi no inap go na kam bek gen, na LORD i tokim mi, 'Yu no ken go pas Jodan.'"

original: The LORD your God Himself will cross over ahead of you. He will destroy these nations before you, and you will dispossess them. Joshua will cross ahead of you, as the LORD has said.
translation: Papa God bilong yu yet, em yet mas go bifo yu. Em bai bagarapim ol nesenol oli i go bifo yu, na yu bai kisim graun bilong ol. Yosua bai go bifo yu, olsem Papa God i tok.

original: And the LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, when He destroyed them along with their land.
translation: Na Papa God bai mekim olsem na long ol, olsem em i mekim long Sihon na Og, king bilong Amoriti, wän em i bagarapim ol longolong wantaim graun bilong ol.

original: The LORD will deliver them over to you, and you must do to them exactly as I have commanded you.
translation: Papa God bai bekim ol i go long yu, na yu mas wokim olsem nau, olgeta samting we mi tokim pinis.

original: Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid or terrified of them, for it is the LORD your God who goes with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you.”
translation: Kirapim na strong; no ken afraid o sem tasol, no ken kirapim tumas long ol, wantaim bikos LORD God bilong yu em i go wantaim yu; bai em i no lusim yu, na bai em i no lakim yu.

original: Then Moses called for Joshua and said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you will go with this people into the land that the LORD swore to their fathers to give them, and you shall give it to them as an inheritance.
translation: Na Moses i kolim Joshua, na i tokim em long olgeta Israel, "Kam strong na harim gut, bikos yu go wantaim ol pipol ya long laine we LORD i promis long tumbuna ol bilong ol long givim ol, na yu mas givim ol long ol as inherita.

original: The LORD Himself goes before you; He will be with you. He will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid or discouraged.”
translation: Bikpela i go bifor yu; em i stap wantaim yu. Em i no livaunai yu na em i no bikim yu slip long en. No ken bekim fright o no ken bikim belhat long tingting.

original: So Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.
translation: Moses raitim daun dispela lo, na givim i go long prist, ol pikinini bilong Levi, husat i karim bokis bilong agrikim pinis bilong LORD, na long ol bikpela man bilong Israel.

original: Then Moses commanded them, “At the end of every seven years, at the appointed time in the year of remission of debt, during the Feast of Tabernacles,
translation: Mosis i givim ol tok bilong en, "Long las piksa bilong yia sewen, long taim we em i laik, long yia we deb bilong ol man i kamaut, long Fest bilong Tabernakol,"

original: when all Israel comes before the LORD your God at the place He will choose, you are to read this law in the hearing of all Israel.
translation: Wen ol Isrel i kam bifo LORD God bilong yu long hap em i laikim, yu mas ridim dispela loa olsem praektis bilong lotu long han bilong ol Isrel, na olgeta i harim.
