original: Assemble the people—men, women, children, and the foreigners within your gates—so that they may listen and learn to fear the LORD your God and to follow carefully all the words of this law.
translation: Bikim ol pipol kam tanim, ol man, ol meri, ol pikinini, na ol man i kam from othesan kantri long geit bilong yu, olgeta i kam, ili harim na lernim, ili poret long LORD God bilong yu, na folom carefuli olgeta wod bilong desla lo, ili respek long lo bilong God.

original: Then their children who do not know the law will listen and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as you live in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong ol i no save long loa, bai ol harim na lern long tekim fright long LORD God bilong yu, olsem long ol taim yu stap long kantri we yu go pas long Jodan long take em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, the time of your death is near. Call Joshua and present yourselves at the Tent of Meeting, so that I may commission him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, "Nau taim bilong yu dai i kam antap. Kolim Josa na yu go bek long en long Haus Bilong Miting, na mi bai givim em autoriti." Na Mosis na Josa i go na tupela i bek long en long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Then the LORD appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the cloud stood over the entrance to the tent.
translation: Na Bikpela i kamap long wanpela kol na klaut, na klaut i stap we long top long entris long husat.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “You will soon rest with your fathers, and these people will rise up and prostitute themselves with the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will forsake Me and break the covenant I have made with them.
translation: Na GOD Bilong Yumi i tokim Mosis, "Yu bai yu rip long papa bilong yu, na dispela pipol bai kamap na go bekim suis wantaim dai bilong narapela kantri ol i go insait long en. Ol bai lusim Mi na brukim agrirement Mi mekim wantaim ol.

original: On that day My anger will burn against them, and I will abandon them and hide My face from them, so that they will be consumed, and many troubles and afflictions will befall them. On that day they will say, ‘Have not these disasters come upon us because our God is no longer with us?’
translation: Long dei nau, rausim ai bilong mi bai i kukim ol, na mi bai lusim ol na karamapim pes bilong mi long ol, so ol bai i kamdaun nau, na planti trabel na sorere bai i kam long ol. Long dei nau, ol bai i tok, "Oli dagara ia i kam long mipela bikos God bilong yumi em i no stap wantaim yumi gen?"

original: And on that day I will surely hide My face because of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.
translation: Na long dispela de, Mi bai kaivim pes bilong mi bilong olgeta nogut ol i mekim, em i go bek long narapela kina god.

original: Now therefore, write down for yourselves this song and teach it to the Israelites; have them recite it, so that it may be a witness for Me against them.
translation: Nau therefore, raitaun gen long pepa bilong yu yet dispela sang, tisaim ol Israel long em, ol bai tokautim em, na em bai kamap wanpela wei blong mi bihaenim ol.

original: When I have brought them into the land that I swore to give their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey, they will eat their fill and prosper. Then they will turn to other gods and worship them, and they will reject Me and break My covenant.
translation: Wanpela taim mi bringim ol i go insait long graun we mi promis long give ol papa bilong ol, wanpela graun i flowe long milk na honey, ol i kai belkol na strongim. Olgeta bihain ol i turnim i go long narapela gog na worshipim ol, na ol i rausim Mi na brukim covenant bilong Mi.

original: And when many troubles and afflictions have come upon them, this song will testify against them, because it will not be forgotten from the lips of their descendants. For I know their inclination, even before I bring them into the land that I swore to give them.”
translation: Na wanken trabel na sori i kam long ol, sang ini bai tok bes long ol, em no bai lus long maus bilong descendants ol. Mi save long tok bilong ol, bifo mi bringim ol i go long graun we mi promis long givim ol.

original: So that very day Moses wrote down this song and taught it to the Israelites.
translation: Nupela de bes, Mosis i raitim dispela song na i laikim i go long ol Israel.

original: Then the LORD commissioned Joshua son of Nun and said, “Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land that I swore to give them, and I will be with you.”
translation: Na Lod i givim Joshua pikinini bilong Nun wok, na i tok, "Yu mas strong na brav, bikos yu bai bringim Israelites i go long laine we Mi promis long givim ol, na Mi bai stap wantaim yu."

original: When Moses had finished writing in a book the words of this law from beginning to end,
translation: Mosis finisim raitem ol wods bilong desla loi long buk, frm bikpela hed igo long las hed.

original: he gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD:
translation: Em i givim dispela tok long ol Levait, ofisala bilong lotu, ol i karim na kokim ark bilong kaen bilong Bikpela.

original: “Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you.
translation: Kisim Buk bilong Lotu i go, na putim i besaid bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD God bilong yu, na i stap yet long hap bilong yu olsem wan witness againstim yu.

original: For I know how rebellious and stiff-necked you are. If you are already rebelling against the LORD while I am still alive, how much more will you rebel after my death!
translation: Mi save olsem yu yet yu hardhead na ogogel long kokomo, na yu already wokim bikhet long Bikpela, mi yet stap, olgeta moa bai yu bagarap afta mi dai!

original: Assemble before me all the elders of your tribes and all your officers so that I may speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
translation: Kam long ples bilong me nau, ol bikpela man meri bilong ol trib Long pipel, na ol ofisa bilong yu, na mipela bai tokim ol dispela tok long han bilong ol, na mipela bai kisim heven na graun i kam bekim waines long ol.

original: For I know that after my death you will become utterly corrupt and turn from the path I have commanded you. And in the days to come, disaster will befall you because you will do evil in the sight of the LORD to provoke Him to anger by the work of your hands.”
translation: Mi save olsem bihaenim dei bilong mi, yupela bai bagarap pinis na lusim rot bilong kam we mi givim tok long en. Na long taim i kam, disasta bai i kam bekim yupela, bikos yupela bai mekim olgetsik long ai bilong Papa God, na bai mekim em i papalai bekim wok bilong han bilong yupela.

original: Then Moses recited aloud to the whole assembly of Israel the words of this song from beginning to end:
translation: Na Mosis i tok olsem long maus sang bilong en long hap asamble bilong Israel, statim na igo long taim bilong las.

original: Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak; hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
translation: Harim tok, O heven, na mi bai tok; harim, O graun, tok bilong maus bilong mi.

original: Let my teaching fall like rain and my speech settle like dew, like gentle rain on new grass, like showers on tender plants.
translation: Bai tisa bilong mi pilim olsem ren, na tok bilong mi stap olsem diwai, olsem ren i kam daun i slow long gras nupela, olsem ren i kam antap long planis i no strong yet.

original: For I will proclaim the name of the LORD. Ascribe greatness to our God!
translation: Mi bai tokautim nem bilong LORD. Mipela i mas givim bikpela respek long God bilong mipela!

original: He is the Rock, His work is perfect; all His ways are just. A God of faithfulness without injustice, righteous and upright is He.
translation: Em i bikpela Sten, wok bilong em i perfek; ol ples bilong em i stret. God bilong trut na nogat gat hevi, em i dai na stret, em i stap long trut.

original: His people have acted corruptly toward Him; the spot on them is not that of His children, but of a perverse and crooked generation.
translation: Pipol blong Em i wok long wei i no gut long Hem; mak i stap long ol i no blong Pikinini blong Em, king em blong jeneresen i birua na i krok.

original: Is this how you repay the LORD, O foolish and senseless people? Is He not your Father and Creator? Has He not made you and established you?
translation: Em i bikim pe bilong Jehovah olsem, o pikinini i no save na i no tingting? Em i Papa na Makar bilong yu, ikam bekim yu na strongim yu, inap long mekim yu i stap?

original: Remember the days of old; consider the years long past. Ask your father, and he will tell you, your elders, and they will inform you.
translation: Rimemba dei bilong bipo; tingim ol yia i go pas. Askim papa bilong yu, na em bai tokim yu, ol big man bilong yu, na ol bai givim yu save.

original: When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, when He divided the sons of man, He set the boundaries of the peoples according to the number of the sons of God.
translation: Taim God bilong hei givim nations olgeta inheritance bilong ol, taim em i dividim pikinini bilong man, em i setim boundary bilong ol pipol olsem numa bilong pikinini bilong God.

original: But the LORD’s portion is His people, Jacob His allotted inheritance.
translation: Kae bilong LORD em i pipol bilong en, Jakob em i inheritans bilong en.

original: He found him in a desert land, in a barren, howling wilderness; He surrounded him, He instructed him, He guarded him as the apple of His eye.
translation: Em i finim em long graun kol kilakil, long kantry kol na wailis; Em i kamautim em, Em i givim em tok, Em i lukautim em olsem apul bilong ai bilong Em.

original: As an eagle stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, He spread His wings to catch them and carried them on His pinions.
translation: Olsem agla i kirapim nest bilong en, na em i hang we long hap bilong ol pikinini bilong en, Em i spredim wing bilong en long kam daun kisim ol, na em i kisim ol long ak bilong en.

original: The LORD alone led him, and no foreign god was with him.
translation: Papa God i lukautim em wanpela tasol, na god bilong narapela kantri i no bin go wantaim em.

original: He made him ride on the heights of the land and fed him the produce of the field. He nourished him with honey from the rock and oil from the flinty crag,
translation: Em i bin givim em ride long hap bilong kantri, na i bin givim em kaikai long produs bilong graun. Em i bin strongim em wantaim hanis bilong rok, na oil bilong ston nogut, olsem oil bilong flinty crag.

original: with curds from the herd and milk from the flock, with the fat of lambs, with rams from Bashan, and goats, with the choicest grains of wheat. From the juice of the finest grapes you drank the wine.
translation: Wantaim kakai long herde na milk long fok, wantaim fat long lambs, wantaim ram long Bashan, na goat, wantaim ka long wheat we i gat pepea. Long juice bilong grape namba wan yumi dringim wine.

original: But Jeshurun grew fat and kicked—becoming fat, bloated, and gorged. He abandoned the God who made him and scorned the Rock of his salvation.
translation: Bare Jeshurun i kamap bik, pulum i go daun, na i pulap - em i kamap strong na kikim. Em lusim God we mekim em na bilasim Roc bilong savesen em.

original: They provoked His jealousy with foreign gods; they enraged Him with abominations.
translation: Ol i kirapim jelos blong Em wantaim gods bilong narapela kantri; ol i makim Em i masalai wantaim samting nogut tru.

original: They sacrificed to demons, not to God, to gods they had not known, to newly arrived gods, which your fathers did not fear.
translation: Ol i sakrifais long demon, not long God, long god ol i no save long en, long god ol i kam nupela, we ol papa bilong yu no bin fearim.

original: You ignored the Rock who brought you forth; you forgot the God who gave you birth.
translation: Yu lusim Sten bilong yu i kam bringim yu i go; yu fergetim God bilong yu i givim yu laip.

original: When the LORD saw this, He rejected them, provoked to anger by His sons and daughters.
translation: Taim LORD i lukim ol dispela, em i tromwe ol, provoc long birua na veks long pikinini man na meri bilong em.

original: He said: “I will hide My face from them; I will see what will be their end. For they are a perverse generation—children of unfaithfulness.
translation: Em i tok: "Mi bai kaibrukim bek long ol; mi bai lukim ol i go long ples bilong ol. Ol i stap long genarason i no orait — ol pikinini bilong bikpela hevi."

original: They have provoked My jealousy by that which is not God; they have enraged Me with their worthless idols. So I will make them jealous by those who are not a people; I will make them angry by a nation without understanding.
translation: Ol i kisim bek long jealousy bilong me na ol i makim me cross long idols nogut bilong ol. Nau mi bai kirapim jealousy long ol olgeta long ol manmeri i no save, na mi bai bringim popoi long ol olgeta long nesen isave nogut.

original: For a fire has been kindled by My anger, and it burns to the depths of Sheol; it consumes the earth and its produce, and scorches the foundations of the mountains.
translation: Faia i kamap strong long bel hevi bilong Mipela, na em i pakim ol samting long ples daun na i go inap long Sheol; em i kaikaim graun na ol samting em i growim, na i susim ol fonisen blong ol maunten.

original: I will heap disasters upon them; I will spend My arrows against them.
translation: Mi go stapim ol narapela kasal long ol; Mi go usim ol paila bilong mi long ol.

original: They will be wasted from hunger and ravaged by pestilence and bitter plague; I will send the fangs of wild beasts against them, with the venom of vipers that slither in the dust.
translation: Ol i bai i bin kukim na i no gat kaikai, na olgeta sickness i kam na i bagarapim ol, sickness i painim tru; mi bai senisim bek long ol animal i barabar i save krai na katim ol, wantaim poin long ol sip i save krai long graun.

original: Outside, the sword will take their children, and inside, terror will strike the young man and the young woman, the infant and the gray-haired man.
translation: Bilong outside, sop bilong kilim ol pikinini, ol man bilong gris na ol pikinini bai i go, na bilong inside, kenkiman bai i kam long ol man bilong klostu na meri bilong klostu.

original: I would have said that I would cut them to pieces and blot out their memory from mankind,
translation: Mi bai tok olsem, mi bai katim ol i go het long plet na wipim oltaim nem bilong ol long mankind.

original: if I had not dreaded the taunt of the enemy, lest their adversaries misunderstand and say: ‘Our own hand has prevailed; it was not the LORD who did all this.’”
translation: Mi bin poret long bikim olsem, ol i no ken skelim tok bilong ol eni yet, tupela i tok: 'Han bilong yumi yet i win, em i no bihain LORD i mekim olgeta dispela.'

original: Israel is a nation devoid of counsel, with no understanding among them.
translation: Isrel em i wanpela kantri, i no gat kaunsil, na i no gat save long ol.

original: If only they were wise, they would understand it; they would comprehend their fate.
translation: Mai bebego long tok, ol i ken tok, ol i save bikos bilong ol.

original: How could one man pursue a thousand, or two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, unless the LORD had given them up?
translation: Olsem wanpela man i ken ranawe bekim na kilim daun ten thousand, o tasol tupela i putim ten thousand long ran, inap long ol papa Bilong Ol I Stap i salim ol, inap long LOD i givim olap?

original: For their rock is not like our Rock, even our enemies concede.
translation: Rok bilong ol i no olsem Rok bilong mipela, nau even enimi bilong mipela itok.

original: But their vine is from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are poisonous; their clusters are bitter.
translation: Vain bilong ol i kam long vain bilong Sodom, na ol i kam long planis bilong Gomorah. Grapes bilong ol i poisen, bunch bilong ol i biter.

original: Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras.
translation: Wain bilong ol i stap olsem paison bilong sip, paison i kilim ol long ples bilong kabra.

original: “Have I not stored up these things, sealed up within My vaults?
translation: Ino mi save kisim ol dispela samting i go, na ol i staple long hap bilong mi?

original: Vengeance is Mine; I will repay. In due time their foot will slip; for their day of disaster is near, and their doom is coming quickly.”
translation: Pikininiu Bilong Mi Em I Kam; Mi bai pei bek. Bipoaira bai lek bilong ol i slip; bikos de poisen bilong ol i kam antap, na dokis bilong ol i kam harim.

original: For the LORD will vindicate His people and have compassion on His servants when He sees that their strength is gone and no one remains, slave or free.
translation: Bikpela i go bekim ol pipol bilong em, na i givim kros long ol wokman bilong en, wanpela taim em i lukim ol i no inap, strong bilong ol i pinis, na i no gat narapela man, wokman oa bos.

original: He will say: “Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge,
translation: Em bai tok: "Gode bilong ol i stap we, roka bilong ol i go kisim strong long em, ples bilong birua bilong ol?"

original: which ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let them rise up and help you; let them give you shelter!
translation: Ol i kaikai fat bilong sakrifis ol bin mekim, na ol i dringim wain bilong ofring ol bin givim, ol i kamap na helpim yu; ol i givim yu ples bilong kimbak!

original: See now that I am He; there is no God besides Me. I bring death and I give life; I wound and I heal, and there is no one who can deliver from My hand.
translation: Nau yu lukim, mi yet; i no gat God narakain long sais bilong mi. Mi bringim dae na mi givim laip; mi kilim na mi hevim, na i no gat man i ken skulim yu long han bilong mi.

original: For I lift up My hand to heaven and declare: As surely as I live forever,
translation: Mi tok strong long ai bilong God na kilim han bilong mi long heven, na mi tok olsem: mipela i save long laip bilong tumbuna oltaim, em i stap tru.

original: when I sharpen My flashing sword, and My hand grasps it in judgment, I will take vengeance on My adversaries and repay those who hate Me.
translation: Wanpela taim mi sharpenim maus bilong mi we i brikit, na han bilong mi i kisim long tok bilong jus, mi bai tek bek long ol i no likim mi, na mi bai givim bek long ol i hatim mi.

original: I will make My arrows drunk with blood, while My sword devours flesh—the blood of the slain and captives, the heads of the enemy leaders.”
translation: Mai go nau long paitim blod i go daunol long arua bilong mi, na sord bilong mi i kaikai flesh - blod bilong ol i bin dai na ol i bin kisim, hed bilong bikpela eni bilong enemy.

original: Rejoice, O heavens, with Him, and let all God’s angels worship Him. Rejoice, O nations, with His people; for He will avenge the blood of His children. He will take vengeance on His adversaries and repay those who hate Him; He will cleanse His land and His people.
translation: Hamamas, Heven i go hap wihtim, na olgeta enjel bilong God bai worshipim. Hamamas, ol nesen i go hap wantaim pipol bilong En; em bai kilim bek blo od bilong pikinini bilong En, em bai kisim bek long ol i no laikim, na em bai givim bek long ol i hatim. Em bai klinim graun bilong en na pipol bilong en.

original: Then Moses came with Joshua son of Nun and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
translation: Na Mosese i kam wantaim Yoshua, sun bilong Nun, na itokautim olgeta wod bilong dispela sang long han bilong ol pipol.

original: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
translation: Taim Moses i winim tok bilong en, na tokim ol dispela tok long ol Israel,

original: he said to them, “Take to heart all these words I testify among you today, so that you may command your children to carefully follow all the words of this law.
translation: Em i tokim ol long stret, "Kamap strong long het bilong yu, husat ol wod  em i givim witness long mipela todai, na bai yu iusim tokstrong long pikinini bilong yu, olsem nau oli bai bihain i go long wei we lo bilong God i laik, na oli save karim tokstory na kastom long genaration.

original: For they are not idle words to you, because they are your life, and by them you will live long in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
translation: Bikos ol tok isi, em i no tok nating olsem long yu, ol i laip bilong yu, na bai yu usim ol i stap long taim olsem long kantri we yu go daun Jodan i go kisim.

original: On that same day the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Long hap same dei Bikpela i tokim Mosis,

original: “Go up into the Abarim Range to Mount Nebo, in the land of Moab across from Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites as their own possession.
translation: Go apo long Rang Abarim, ka lukim Maunt Nebo, long kantri bilong Moab, we i stap klostu long Jeriko, na lukim kantri Kanaan, olsem propati bilong ol, we mi givim long Israelites.

original: And there on the mountain that you climb, you will die and be gathered to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people.
translation: Na long maunten we yu go ap, yu bai dai, na yu bai kamap wantaim ol brata bilong yu, olsem Aron brata bilong yu i dai long Maunten Hor na em i kamap wantaim ol pikinini bilong em.

original: For at the waters of Meribah-kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin, both of you broke faith with Me among the Israelites by failing to treat Me as holy in their presence.
translation: Long wanpela Meribah-kadesh wata insait long Zin Desert, yupela i bin brukim bilip long mi among ol Israel pipol, long dispela yapela i no respektem mi olsem santing wei i holy long ol pipol.

original: Although you shall see from a distance the land that I am giving the Israelites, you shall not enter it.”
translation: Wanpela dei yu yet ken si longwe bilong hap kain graun we mi givim long ol Israelait, tasol yu no ken go insait long en.

original: This is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced upon the Israelites before his death.
translation: Dispela em i blesing bilong God we Moses man bilong God i tokaut long ol Israel long taim bifo em i dai.

original: He said: “The LORD came from Sinai and dawned upon us from Seir; He shone forth from Mount Paran and came with myriads of holy ones, with flaming fire at His right hand.
translation: Em i tok olsem: “LORD i kam bek long Sinai na em i laitim stap long Seir, em i go daun long yu; Em i kisim lait long Maunt Paran, na em i kam wantaim miliana bilong ol samting narakain, wantaim faia i bungim stap long han rait bilong em.

original: Surely You love the people; all the holy ones are in Your hand, and they sit down at Your feet; each receives Your words—
translation: Yu lovim ol pipol; ol holi pipol i stap long han bilong yu, na ol i siddaun klostu long lek bilong yu; ol i kam bek long hap tok bilong yu.

original: the law that Moses gave us, the possession of the assembly of Jacob.
translation: Lo bilong Mosis i givim mipela, em propati bilong assembli bilong Yakob.

original: So the LORD became King in Jeshurun when the leaders of the people gathered, when the tribes of Israel came together.
translation: Na Bikpela i kamap King long Jeshurun taim bikhed bilong ol pipol i kam togeta, taim ol tribu bilong Israel i kam tunas.

original: Let Reuben live and not die, nor his men be few.”
translation: Reuben i mas stap na no ken dai, na man bilong em i no liklik.

original: And concerning Judah he said: “O LORD, hear the cry of Judah and bring him to his people. With his own hands he defends his cause, but may You be a help against his foes.”
translation: Na long Yuda, em i tok olsem: “O GOD bilong yumi, harim rorona bilong Yuda na kisim i go bek long ol pisin bilong en. Wantaim han bilong en yet, em i stap bekim pasin bilong en, tasol yu yet, i kamap strong long em against ol birua bilong en.”

original: Concerning Levi he said: “Give Your Thummim to Levi and Your Urim to Your godly one, whom You tested at Massah and contested at the waters of Meribah.
translation: Long ol Levi em i tok olsem: "Givim Thummim bilong yu long Levi, na Urim bilong yu long man bilong God, whos yu trai long ples Masah, na yu fight long wara Meribah.

original: He said of his father and mother, ‘I do not consider them.’ He disregarded his brothers and did not know his own sons, for he kept Your word and maintained Your covenant.
translation: Em i tok long papa na mama bilong em, ‘Mi no tingim ol.’ Em i no givim bel hevi long brata bilong em, na em i no save pikinini bilong em yet, bikos em i holim wod bilong yu na em i stap long kaiven bilong yu.

original: He will teach Your ordinances to Jacob and Your law to Israel; he will set incense before You and whole burnt offerings on Your altar.
translation: Em bai teachim ol kaanu bilong Yu long Jacob na lo bilong Yu long Israel; em bai putim insens long bifor Yu na ofa ol geta i go long alta bilong Yu.

original: Bless his substance, O LORD, and accept the work of his hands. Smash the loins of those who rise against him, and of his foes so they can rise no more.”
translation: Blessim bel hevi bilong en, O Jehovah, na sikarim wok bilong han bilong en. Bagarapim bung bilong ol i toktok strong i go long en, na poisen bilong en, na ol i no inap kam bek gen.

original: Concerning Benjamin he said: “May the beloved of the LORD rest secure in Him; God shields him all day long, and upon His shoulders he rests.”
translation: Long tok bilong Benjamin em i tok olsem: “Em i man bilong laip bilong GOD, mas i amamas long en, GOD i harim em oldei, na long shoulders bilong Em em i stap klostu.”

original: Concerning Joseph he said: “May his land be blessed by the LORD with the precious dew from heaven above and the deep waters that lie beneath,
translation: Long Joseph em i tok olsem: “Mipela i laikim graun bilong em i blesim long han bilong LORD, bikos dew i kam daka long heven i go antap na wara i de bikim i stap klostu, we i go daun bek gen.”

original: with the bountiful harvest from the sun and the abundant yield of the seasons,
translation: Wantaim harves bilong plenti ka long san na plenti ka bilong taim bilong yia,

original: with the best of the ancient mountains and the bounty of the everlasting hills,
translation: Wantaim gutpela bilong ol mun bilong tumbuna na planti ka long mun bilong stap oltaim,

original: with the choice gifts of the land and everything in it, and with the favor of Him who dwelt in the burning bush. May these rest on the head of Joseph and crown the brow of the prince of his brothers.
translation: Wantaim givim bikpela gift bilong graun, na wantaim bikpela hariap long en i stap insait long bus i bake. Dispela mas stap antap long hed bilong Joseph, na pu tingim kraun long ai bilong prins bilong brata.

original: His majesty is like a firstborn bull, and his horns are like those of a wild ox. With them he will gore the nations, even to the ends of the earth. Such are the myriads of Ephraim, and such are the thousands of Manasseh.”
translation: Majesti bilong em i olsem bul mak bilong papa, na horn bilong em i olsem horn bilong oks saveman. Em bai kisim na kilim nesen olgeta longwei long hap bilong graun. Ol dispela i go long miliun bilong Ephraim, na go long tausen bilong Manasseh.

original: Concerning Zebulun he said: “Rejoice, Zebulun, in your journeys, and Issachar, in your tents.
translation: Long Zebulun em i tok olsem: “Hariap, Zebulun, long ples balus bilong yu, na Issachar, long haus bilong yu.”

original: They will call the peoples to a mountain; there they will offer sacrifices of righteousness. For they will feast on the abundance of the seas and the hidden treasures of the sand.”
translation: Ol i kolim ol ples long maunten, na long hap ol bai bringim sakrifis bilong jastis. Ol bai kaikai i gat planti ai bilong solwara, na ol bai usim pipia bilong san we i hid igo long sindaun.

original: Concerning Gad he said: “Blessed is he who enlarges the domain of Gad! He lies down like a lion and tears off an arm or a head.
translation: Long Gad olsem: Em i blessem, blessem, em i kirapim gras bilong Gad! Em i slip olsem lain na em i bikim arm na hed i kat.

original: He chose the best land for himself, because a ruler’s portion was reserved for him there. He came with the leaders of the people; he administered the LORD’s justice and His ordinances for Israel.”
translation: Em i pikimipim bekim beste graun bilong en, wantaim wanpela hap bilong bikpela man i stap long en. Em i kam wantaim ol bikpela man bilong ples; em i warkim jusis bilong LORD na ol loa bilong en long Israel.

original: Concerning Dan he said: “Dan is a lion’s cub, leaping out of Bashan.”
translation: Long Dan i go: “Dan em i kubul bilong lion, jumpim long Haus Bik na Bashan.”

original: Concerning Naphtali he said: “Naphtali is abounding with favor, full of the blessing of the LORD; he shall take possession of the sea and the south.”
translation: Long Naphtali em i tok: “Naphtali i gat plenti faevor, em i fulap bilong blessing bilong LORD; em bai kisim hap bilong solwara na saut.”

original: And concerning Asher he said: “May Asher be the most blessed of sons; may he be the most favored among his brothers and dip his foot in oil.
translation: Na long toktok bilong Asa em i tok olsem: “Mai Asa i stap moa blessing long ol pikinini; bai em i stap moa lukim chek long ol brata bilong en, na putim lek bilong en long oil.

original: May the bolts of your gate be iron and bronze, and may your strength match your days.”
translation: Mai balto bilong gate bilong yu bai kamap ayon na bronz, na mai strong bilong yu bai i stap olsem dei bilong yu.

original: “There is none like the God of Jeshurun, who rides the heavens to your aid, and the clouds in His majesty.
translation: Inogat God olsem God bilong Jeshurun i no stap, hu i sailim heven long helpim yu, na kloud i go long majesti bilong Em.

original: The eternal God is your dwelling place, and underneath are the everlasting arms. He drives out the enemy before you, giving the command, ‘Destroy him!’
translation: God bilong taim i go i go em i stap long ples bilong yu, na ananit long arm bilong em i strong olsem. Em i kirap enemy long bihain bilong yu, em i givim tok, 'Kisim i kilim!'

original: So Israel dwells securely; the fountain of Jacob lives untroubled in a land of grain and new wine, where even the heavens drip with dew.
translation: Na Isrel i stap gutpela, wel bilong Jakob i stap belis long kantri bilong graun na wain nupela, na heven i sipakasim dew.

original: Blessed are you, O Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the LORD? He is the shield that protects you, the sword in which you boast. Your enemies will cower before you, and you shall trample their high places.”
translation: Yu blesim ol, O Isrel! Hu lik yu, pipol we i save long han bilong LORD? Em i skil bilong yu, i stap protektim yu, na em i sowrd we yu bilip long en. Enimi bilong yu bai kirap i go daun bifor yu, na yu bai daunim ples hait bilong ol.

original: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which faces Jericho. And the LORD showed him the whole land—from Gilead as far as Dan,
translation: Na Mosis i go ap long Maun Nebo, long tap bilong Pisga, we i lukim Jeriko. Na Bikpela i showim em hap bilong kantri long Gilead na i stap klostu long Dan,

original: all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Western Sea,
translation: Olgeta long Naphtali, laine bilong Efrem na Manase, olgeta graun bilong Juta inap long Solwara West,

original: the Negev, and the region from the Valley of Jericho (the City of Palms) all the way to Zoar.
translation: Negev, na rikon bilong Jeriko (Siti bilong Palms) i go long Zoar.

original: And the LORD said to him, “This is the land that I swore to give Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you will not cross into it.”
translation: Papa God i tokim em, "Dispela graun em i stap, mi bin pakim tok bai givim Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob, ol tumbuna bilong Jiu pipol, long taim mi tok olsem, 'Mi bai givim i go long ol pikinini bilong yu.' Mi larim yu lukim i na matanagu bilong yu yet, tasol yu no ken go insait long en."

original: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, as the LORD had said.
translation: Na Mosis, servant bilong LORD, i dai long hap bilong Moab, olsem LORD i tok bifo.

original: And He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab facing Beth-peor, and no one to this day knows the location of his grave.
translation: Na Em i kisim na kilim em long wanpela vali long lan Moab, olookim Beth-peor, na inap long tude nogat man i save ples we em holem graun.

original: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, yet his eyes were not weak, and his vitality had not diminished.
translation: Moses em i bikim hundred twenty yia na em i dai, tasol mati bilong em i no ken les, na strongpela laip bilong em i no kam daun.

original: The Israelites grieved for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days, until the time of weeping and mourning for Moses came to an end.
translation: Oli Israel i sori long Moses long plano bilong Moab triati dei, na taim bilong wailim na sorim long Moses i kam pinis.

original: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him. So the Israelites obeyed him and did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Nau Josaia sone bilong Non i gat fulup spirit bilong wisdom bikos Moses em putim han bilong en long em. Ol Israelites ol i bihainim em na mekim olsem LORD i tokim Moses.

original: Since that time, no prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face—
translation: Bikos taim em i go pinis, nogat wanpela prophet i kamap gen long Israel olsem Mosis, whom LORD i save gut long en, ai i mekim wanwara long ai bilong arapela.

original: no prophet who did all the signs and wonders that the LORD sent Moses to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his officials and all his land,
translation: I no gutpela propet em i mekim ol samting mak bilong sain na wondas, ol samting we LORD i bin salim Mosis long mekim long laine bilong Ijip, long Pharaoh na long ol ofisa bilong en na long ol ples bilong en.

original: and no prophet who performed all the mighty acts of power and awesome deeds that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
translation: Na i no gat profet we em i mekim ol samting bikpela na wok bilong paiawe olsem wok bilong Moses i mekim long ai bilong ol Israel.

original: Now after the death of His servant Moses, the LORD spoke to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ assistant, saying,
translation: Long olsem Mosi i dai pinis, LORD i tokim Josaia, sukul boi bilong Nun, wokman bilong Mosi, olsem:

original: “Moses My servant is dead. Now therefore arise, you and all these people, and cross over the Jordan into the land that I am giving to the children of Israel.
translation: Moses, servant bilong mi, em i dai pinis. Nau olgeta, kam daun, yu na ol pipol ya, na go pas long Jordan, i go long graun we God i givim long ol pikanini bilong Israel.

original: I have given you every place where the sole of your foot will tread, just as I promised to Moses.
translation: Mi givim yu long olgeta ples we yu putim fut, olsem mi promis long Moses.

original: Your territory shall extend from the wilderness and Lebanon to the great River Euphrates—all the land of the Hittites—and west as far as the Great Sea.
translation: Planti graun bai yumi holim bai extend from bikpela bus na Lebanon long rin i go long bikpela river Euphrates—olgeta graun bilong Hittites—na wes olsem long Bikpela Solwara.

original: No one shall stand against you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so will I be with you; I will never leave you nor forsake you.
translation: Nobodi no ken stap agensim yu ol dei bilong laip blong yu. Olsem mi bin stap wantaim Moses, olsem nau mi bai stap wantaim yu; Mi no bai lusim yu na mi no bai bikim yu.

original: Be strong and courageous, for you shall give these people the inheritance of the land that I swore to their fathers I would give them.
translation: Klostu strong na kros, no fear, bikos yu yet kam givim dispela pipol inheritem bilong graun we mi promis long papa na ol tumbuna bilong ol long givim ol.

original: Above all, be strong and very courageous. Be careful to observe all the law that My servant Moses commanded you. Do not turn from it to the right or to the left, so that you may prosper wherever you go.
translation: Long olgeta samting, yu stap strong na kros long nerve. Yu lukautim ol loa we Moses i givim, Servant bilong mi Moses, i kamandim yu. Yu no lusim i go long rait na long lef, nau yu ken winsim long olgeta hap yu go.

original: This Book of the Law must not depart from your mouth; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. For then you will prosper and succeed in all you do.
translation: Buk Bilong Lotu i mas no ken go pasim maus bilong yu; yu mas tingting long em olsem de na nait, na bai yu mas kisim kek long wokim olgeta samting i writim long em. Na bai yu kamap strong na winim olgeta samting yu mekim.

original: Have I not commanded you to be strong and courageous? Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”
translation: Mi bin givim yu komanda yet olsem yu mas krosim na strongpela! No ken skulim, no ken bikim bel hevi, bikos LORD God bilong yu i stap wantaim yu everywhere yu go.

original: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people:
translation: Na Joshuwa i givim tok long ofisa bilong ol pipol:

original: “Go through the camp and tell the people, ‘Prepare your provisions, for within three days you will cross the Jordan to go in and take possession of the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.’”
translation: Go long olgeta ples i go, tokim ol pipol, ‘Preparim kaikai na suplies bilong yu, bikos long tri dei yu bai krosim wara Jordan na go insait na kisim bos long lond we Bikpela God bilong yu i givim yu.’

original: But to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said,
translation: Bareket, Joshua i tok long Reubeniti, Gaditi, na hap-tribe bilong Manase,

original: “Remember what Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you when he said, ‘The LORD your God will give you rest, and He will give you this land.’
translation: Rimemba olsem Musa, wokman bilong LORD, i tokim pinis, 'LORD God bilong yu bai givim yu ripos, na em bai givim yu kantri ia.'

original: Your wives, your young children, and your livestock may remain in the land that Moses gave you on this side of the Jordan. But all your mighty men of valor must be armed for battle to cross over ahead of your brothers and help them,
translation: Meri bilong yu, pikinini bilong yu, na animals bilong yu inap i stap long sait bilong river Jordan we Moses i givim yu. Tasol ol man bilong yu ol i gat strong na i gat kaur, ol i mas katim bus na go long war, bai ol i go bifo long brata bilong yu na halivim ol.

original: until the LORD gives them rest as He has done for you, and your brothers also possess the land that the LORD your God is giving them. Then you may return to the land of your inheritance and take possession of that which Moses the servant of the LORD gave you on the east side of the Jordan.”
translation: Na Lod God bilong yu i givim ol rest olsem olsem em i mekim long yu, na brata bilong yu tu i ken kaikai graun we Lod God bilong yu i givim ol. Bihaenim yu ken go bek long ples bilong inheritance bilong yu, na yu ken tek graun we Mosees servant bilong Lod i givim yu long sait bilong solwara Joden.

original: So they answered Joshua, “Everything you have commanded us we will do, and everywhere you send us we will go.
translation: Ol i ansa long Josaia, “Mipela ol bai mekim olgeta samting yu givim ordinance, na long wel everywhere yu sendim mipela, mipela ol bai go.”

original: Just as we obeyed Moses in all things, so we will obey you. And may the LORD your God be with you, as He was with Moses.
translation: Olsem nau yumi bin folo Moses, na dispela em i go, yumi yet long yu, na mipela hop Bikpela LORD God bilong yu i stap wantaim yu olsem em i stap wantaim Moses.

original: Anyone who rebels against your order and does not obey your words, all that you command him, will be put to death. Above all, be strong and courageous!”
translation: Ol i bagarapim ol lo bilong yu, em i no hilipim tok bilong yu, olgeta samting yu tokim em, bai ol kilim em long dai. Long olgeta hap, yu mas strong na kros!

original: Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim, saying, “Go, inspect the land, especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab and stayed there.
translation: Na Josaia salim twopela spies i go klostu long Sittim, ol i tok, "Lum go lukim gras, plauseda long Jeriko." Ol i go na go insait long haus bilong Rahab, meri i ken givim bodi, na ol i stap we.

original: And it was reported to the king of Jericho: “Behold, some men of Israel have come here tonight to spy out the land.”
translation: Na i kam bek long king bilong Jeriko: "Behold, ol man bilong Isrel i kam hariap long nait i go lukim gut ka."

original: So the king of Jericho sent to Rahab and said, “Bring out the men who came to you and entered your house, for they have come to spy out the whole land.”
translation: King bilong Jeriko sendim man go long Rahab na tok, "Kamaut na kisim olt man we i kam long yu na go insait long haus bilong yu, bikos ol i kam bilong lukluk (bekim spy) olgeta hap bilong kantri."

original: But the woman had taken the two men and hidden them. So she said, “Yes, the men did come to me, but I did not know where they had come from.
translation: Meri ia kisim man twopela na kisim hem i go hap long ples. Na em ia tok olsem, "Yes, ol man ia kam bek long me, tasol mi no save long ples we ol i kam."

original: At dusk, when the gate was about to close, the men went out, and I do not know which way they went. Pursue them quickly, and you may catch them!”
translation: Long san i go daun, taim gate i rede long sarim i go insait, ol man i go aut, mi no save long we ol i go. Puspus ol i go kvik, yu ina catchim ol!

original: (But Rahab had taken them up to the roof and hidden them among the stalks of flax that she had laid out there.)
translation: Bareket, Rahab im bin kisim ol i go hap long rum bilong haus, na im bin kaivim ol long stap bilong flaksa we im bin laikim ol i stap dae.

original: So the king’s men set out in pursuit of the spies along the road to the fords of the Jordan, and as soon as they had gone out, the gate was shut.
translation: Na ol man bilong king i go bek long pasin, ol i folowim ol spai lon rot bilong go daun i go long ples ol i kalim Fod bilong Joden, na olsem wanpela taim ol i go ausait, geta ibin sarim.

original: Before the spies lay down for the night, Rahab went up on the roof
translation: Bifoa ol spia i go daun kaikai moninga, Rahab i go antap long ruf.

original: and said to them, “I know that the LORD has given you this land and that the fear of you has fallen on us, so that all who dwell in the land are melting in fear of you.
translation: Na tokim ol long, "Mi save olsem LORDE ibin givim yu displa graun, na féar bilong yu i kam daun long mipela, so ol pipel we i stap long dispela graun i skul nau long féar bilong yu."

original: For we have heard how the LORD dried up the waters of the Red Sea before you when you came out of Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two kings of the Amorites across the Jordan, whom you devoted to destruction.
translation: Mipela harm, LORD i drai wara bilong Solwara Reo bifo yu, na yu kamap long Egip. Mipela i harm tu ol samting yu mekim long Sihon na Og, kipla kwin bilong Amorait i stap klostu long Jodan, ol dispela yu bin tokim ol i go long dae.

original: When we heard this, our hearts melted and everyone’s courage failed because of you, for the LORD your God is God in the heavens above and on the earth below.
translation: Wanpela taim yumui harim tok ples, harten bilong mipela i olsem ai bilong solwara tasol, hap bel bilong ol man i kisim fear, bikos LORD God bilong yu em i God long heven na graun.

original: Now therefore, please swear to me by the LORD that you will indeed show kindness to my family, because I showed kindness to you. Give me a sure sign
translation: Nau olsem, tok bai bihain long nem bilong LORD, bikim promis long me, olsem yu mas shoim gutpela pasin long ples bilong mi, em i got strong kuz mi shoim gutpela pasin long yu. Givim mi santing we i stap strong.

original: that you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them, and that you will deliver us from death.”
translation: Mipela i askim yu, bai yu lekim lif blong papa, mama, brata, susa, na ol bilong ol yet, na bai yu kisim yumai bilong mipela long dae.

original: “Our lives for your lives!” the men agreed. “If you do not report our mission, we will show you kindness and faithfulness when the LORD gives us the land.”
translation: Laip bilong mipela long laip bilong yu, ol man i akuse. Ifyu no ripotim wok misin bilong mipela, mipela bai showim yu gutpela na trutru wanpela taim Bikpela i givim mipela graun.

original: Then Rahab let them down by a rope through the window, since the house where she lived was built into the wall of the city.
translation: Na Rahab i birua ol i daun long rop tumas winwo, wantaim haus bilong em i stap klostu long barak bilong taun.

original: “Go to the hill country,” she said, “so that your pursuers will not find you. Hide yourselves there for three days until they have returned; then go on your way.”
translation: “Go long hap bilong maunten,” em i tok, “olsem ol i wokabaut bihain bai no inap finim yu. Kam hidim yuself i go long tri de, na bihaen ol i kam bak, katim na go long rot bilong yu.”

original: The men said to her, “We will not be bound by this oath you made us swear
translation: Ol man i tokim em, "Mipela no ina bikim long dispela oth iyu mekim mipela kisim, em i yu tok bai oth."

original: unless, when we enter the land, you have tied this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down, and unless you have brought your father and mother and brothers and all your family into your house.
translation: Sapos mipela no go insait long graun, yu mas katim rop bilong red long wino we yu wesai mipela i daun, na yu bringim papa, mama, brata, na ol famili bilong yu i go insait long haus.

original: If anyone goes out the door of your house into the street, his blood will be on his own head, and we will be innocent. But if a hand is laid on anyone with you in the house, his blood will be on our heads.
translation: I go aut bilem dor bilong hus, i go long stret, bled bilong em i kam bek long hed bilong em, na mipela i nogat gilti. Tasol, sapos han i kamap longgen wanpela i stap wantaim yumi insait long haus, bled bilong em i kam bek long hed bilong yumi.

original: And if you report our mission, we will be released from the oath you made us swear.”
translation: Na sipos yu ripotim mipela wok, mipela bai kamautim promis yu tok strong long mipela.

original: “Let it be as you say,” she replied, and she sent them away. And when they had gone, she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
translation: Na meri i tok olsem, "Olsem yu tok, olsem bai i kam," na meri i driva ol i go we. Taim ol i go pinis, na meri i bin klosem korde ret long wino.

original: So the spies went out into the hill country and stayed there three days, until their pursuers had returned without finding them, having searched all along the road.
translation: Na sipai i go aut na i kam long kantri bilong maunten, na ol i stap we long tri de, kamap taem ol i go bek gen, tasol ol i no finim, bekos ol i wokabaut na ol i lukluk long rot.

original: Then the two men started back, came down from the hill country, and crossed the river. So they came to Joshua son of Nun and reported all that had happened to them.
translation: Tupela man i go bek gen, ol i kam daun from hevi kantri, na ol i pas warra. Ol i kam bek gen, na toktok long Josaia sot bilong Nun, na ol i tokim em olgeta samting we i hapn long ol.

original: “The LORD has surely delivered the entire land into our hands,” they said to Joshua. “Indeed, all who dwell in the land are melting in fear of us.”
translation: Papa God i salim ol i kam long han bilong yumi, oli tokim Josua. Ripoti i kam olsem: ol pipol i stap long kantri i bikim olsem wata long fear bilong yumi.

original: Early the next morning Joshua got up and left Shittim with all the Israelites. They went as far as the Jordan, where they camped before crossing over.
translation: Bikos em i go bek long moning, Joshua i kamap na ol Pipol bilong Israel i lusim Shittim. Ol i go inap long Jordan, na ol i kam punda na kamping bifor ol i go akros.

original: After three days the officers went through the camp
translation: Bihaenim tripe de, ofisa i go thro long ken.

original: and commanded the people: “When you see the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God being carried by the Levitical priests, you are to set out from your positions and follow it.
translation: Na em i givim olsem long pipol: “Wanpela taim yu lukim bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD God bilong yu i go bek long han bilong prist bilong tribe Levai, yu mas kam bek long ples bilong yu na bihainim i go.

original: But keep a distance of about two thousand cubits between yourselves and the ark. Do not go near it, so that you can see the way to go, since you have never traveled this way before.”
translation: Stap bek long distans bilong tu tousan kibit long namel bilong yu na ark. No go klostu long em, so yu ken lukim rot bilong go, bikos yu yet never go long dispela rot bifo.

original: Then Joshua told the people, “Consecrate yourselves, for tomorrow the LORD will do wonders among you.”
translation: Na Joshuwa i tokim ol pipol, "Pipol, bel isi, na yu yet go long, bikos LORD bai mekim wonda long mipela tumora."

original: And he said to the priests, “Take the ark of the covenant and go on ahead of the people.” So they carried the ark of the covenant and went ahead of them.
translation: Em i tokim prist long ol, "Kisim bek bilong kaanu na go bifo ol pipol." Ol i karim bek bilong kaanu na i go bifo ol.

original: Now the LORD said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so they may know that I am with you just as I was with Moses.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Joshua, "Tudei mi bai kamap strongim yu long ai bilong ol Israel, olgeta bai save olsem Mi stap wantaim yu olsem Mi stap Gen long taim bilong Moses."

original: Command the priests carrying the ark of the covenant: ‘When you reach the edge of the waters, stand in the Jordan.’”
translation: Imsave long ol priest i karryim ark bilong kaunsil: ‘Long yupela kamap long hap edg bilong wara, inap stanap long wara Jordan.’”

original: So Joshua told the Israelites, “Come here and listen to the words of the LORD your God.”
translation: Na Josaia i tokim ol Israel, "Kam hia na harim tok bilong LORD God bilong yu."

original: He continued, “This is how you will know that the living God is among you and that He will surely drive out before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites.
translation: Em i go bek long stap, “Dispela em i rot bilong yupela save olsem, God i stap namel long yupela, na Em bai kirapim Kanaanit, Hitait, Hivait, Perizait, Girgasit, Amorait, na Jebusit long graun bifo yupela.

original: Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth will go ahead of you into the Jordan.
translation: Lukim, bokis bilong kaanu long Lod bilong olgeta graun em bai go bifoa yu long song bilong Jodan.

original: Now choose twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
translation: Nau yu skalim twelv man, wan long wan traib, long traib ol Isrel.

original: When the feet of the priests who carry the ark of the LORD—the Lord of all the earth—touch down in the waters of the Jordan, its flowing waters will be cut off and will stand up in a heap.”
translation: Wanpela taim leg na han bilong pisin i karim bokis bilong Lod, Lod bilong olgeta graun, i kat daun long wara bilong Jordan, wara bai i katim pinis, na olgeta bai i punda i stap antap long wanpela hap.

original: So when the people broke camp to cross the Jordan, the priests carried the ark of the covenant ahead of them.
translation: Taim ol pipol i go bek gen, bai ol krosim river Jordan, pries bamabusim husat i karim bek na kot bilong agrikman i go bifo ol.

original: Now the Jordan overflows its banks throughout the harvest season. But as soon as the priests carrying the ark reached the Jordan and their feet touched the water’s edge,
translation: Nau Jordan i kamap strong na i go ovasa long sait bilong en long olgeta taim bilong harisim ka. Tasol olsem pris i karim bokis bilong God i kamap long Jordan, lek bilong ol i teteken long hed bilong wara,

original: the flowing water stood still. It backed up as far upstream as Adam, a city in the area of Zarethan, while the water flowing toward the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea) was completely cut off. So the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
translation: Wara i flow i stap yet long ples na i no inap go bek. I go bak olsem na i stop klostu long Adam, wanpela taun long aria bilong Zarethan, wail ol wara i go i kamap klia long Solwara Arabah, em i Solwara Salt, i pinis nau. Na ol pipel i go daun olsem na i pas long sait bilong Jeriko.

original: The priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan, while all Israel crossed over the dry ground, until the entire nation had crossed the Jordan.
translation: Pries ol i karim ark bilong kaunsil bilong LORD i stap strong long graun drai long mitim bilong Joden, wail ol Isrel i pas long graun drai, na tasol olgeta ples i go daun Joden.

original: When the whole nation had finished crossing the Jordan, the LORD said to Joshua,
translation: Wanpela taim olgeta nasyon i go daun pinis long Jordan, LORD i tokim Joshua,

original: “Choose twelve men from among the people, one from each tribe,
translation: Tusim tokola man, wan long ol tokola traib, long ol ples.

original: and command them: ‘Take up for yourselves twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan where the priests were standing, carry them with you, and set them down in the place where you spend the night.’”
translation: Givim ol tok instrukshun: ‘Kisim na kam bek gen long yupela twelve ston long mitim bilong Jordan, we pris istap, karim i go wantaim yupela, na pilim i daun long ples we yupela bai slip.’”

original: So Joshua summoned the twelve men he had appointed from the Israelites, one from each tribe,
translation: Na Josua em i kirapim na kalim dispela twelve man, ol i chusim igo long ol Israel, wanpela husat i kam long wanpela tribe bilong ol.

original: and said to them, “Cross over before the ark of the LORD your God into the middle of the Jordan. Each of you is to take a stone upon his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of Israel,
translation: Na em tokim ol, "Go pas long arka bilong Bikpela bifo, kaeram i go insait long mit blo Jordan. Yupela yet, husat i mas kisim wanpela ston na putim long shoulder bilong en, olsem nem bilong tribes bilong Israel,"

original: to serve as a sign among you. In the future, when your children ask, ‘What do these stones mean to you?’
translation: Ol i servis olsem santing bilong tok bilong yupela. Bai long taim bai, wampela de na pikinini bilong yu tanim askim, 'Stoan ol i min bilong wanem long yu?'

original: you are to tell them, ‘The waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the LORD. When it crossed the Jordan, the waters were cut off.’ Therefore these stones will be a memorial to the Israelites forever.”
translation: Yu mas tokim ol, ‘Wara bilong Jodan i kamapim hap, wara i go daun aninit long taim bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD i pas long em.’ Taim em i pas, wara i go apart, wara i stap long wanem hap. Na stoun ol i stap olsem memoriol long ol Israelit foreva.”

original: Thus the Israelites did as Joshua had commanded them. They took up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, one for each tribe of Israel, just as the LORD had told Joshua; and they carried them to the camp, where they set them down.
translation: Bai ol Pipol Israel i mekim olsem Josua i tokim. Ol i kisim ston twelev long mit bilong Jodan, wan bilong yuri taim bilong pipol Israel, olsem na GOD i tokim Josua; na ol i karim i go long kaem, na ol i plantim i daun.

original: Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, in the place where the priests who carried the ark of the covenant stood. And the stones are there to this day.
translation: Joshua plantim twelv ston long mit bilong Jordan, long hap we prist i karim bokis bilong kaunsil i stap. Na ston i stap yet long taim bai i kam.

original: Now the priests who carried the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until the people had completed everything the LORD had commanded Joshua to tell them, just as Moses had directed Joshua. The people hurried across,
translation: Na ol pris we karim bokis blong ka i stap yet olsem long mit blong Jordan, kwila ol pipel i go pinis na mekim olgeta samting we Lod i givim Joshuwa, olsem Musa i tokim Joshuwa. Ol pipel i go kisim taem kas i pas,

original: and after everyone had finished crossing, the priests with the ark of the LORD crossed in the sight of the people.
translation: Na olgeta pinis go daun, prist igo antap long ark bilong Jehovah long ai bilong ol pipol.

original: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over before the Israelites, armed for battle as Moses had instructed them.
translation: Ol Reubenites, ol Gadites, na hap-tribe bilong Manasseh i go pas bifor ol Israelites, ol i kamap strong long pait olsem Moses i tokim ol.

original: About 40,000 troops armed for battle crossed over before the LORD into the plains of Jericho.
translation: Wanpela tasen foati thousand solja i armasim yet i go bek long pait, ol i go daun long bikpla hap bilong Jehovah i go daun long plein bilong Jeriko.

original: On that day the LORD exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they revered him all the days of his life, just as they had revered Moses.
translation: Long dispela de Papa God i givim Joshua bikpela namel long en long ai bilong ol Israel, na ol i stap respektem em ol dei bilong laip blong en, olsem ol i bin respektem Mosese.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Joshua,

original: “Command the priests who carry the ark of the Testimony to come up from the Jordan.”
translation: Iusim pinis long ol priests husat karim bokis bilong tok tru, kamdaun nau long Jordan.

original: So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up from the Jordan.”
translation: Nau Josua i tokim prets: "Kamap nau long Jordan."

original: When the priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD came up out of the Jordan and their feet touched the dry land, the waters of the Jordan returned to their course and overflowed all the banks as before.
translation: Taim prist i karim bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD i kam ap long Jordan, na lek bilong ol i tac long graun i dai, wara bilong Jordan i go bek long rot bilong en, na i ovafloim olgeta banis olsem bifo.

original: On the tenth day of the first month the people went up from the Jordan and camped at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
translation: Long 10de de bilong mun em i kam first, ol pipol i go apo long Jordan na kamp long Gilgal long boda eastern bilong Jeriko.

original: And there at Gilgal Joshua set up the twelve stones they had taken from the Jordan.
translation: Na long Gilgal, Josa i plantim ston twelev ol i kisim from Jodan.

original: Then Joshua said to the Israelites, “In the future, when your children ask their fathers, ‘What is the meaning of these stones?’
translation: Na Joshua i tokim ol Pipol Israel, "Bai longwe yutupela i go, wän pikinini bilong yumi yet askim tumbuna bilong ol, 'Bikos wanem dispela ston i stap?' "

original: you are to tell them, ‘Israel crossed the Jordan on dry ground.’
translation: Yu mas tokim ol, 'Isrel i go pas long Jordan long graun i drai.'

original: For the LORD your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you had crossed over, just as He did to the Red Sea, which He dried up before us until we had crossed over.
translation: Bikpela Gott i drai wara bilong Jodaan bifor yu, long yu go pas, olsem em i mekim long Red Sii, em i drai wara bilong em, bifor mipela, long mipela go pas.

original: He did this so that all the peoples of the earth may know that the hand of the LORD is mighty, and so that you may always fear the LORD your God.”
translation: Em i mekim dispela, bilong mekim ol piple long graun i save, han bilong LORD i strongpela, na bilong yu inap i stap frik long LORD God bilong yu oltaim.

original: Now when all the Amorite kings west of the Jordan and all the Canaanite kings along the coast heard how the LORD had dried up the waters of the Jordan before the Israelites until they had crossed over, their hearts melted and their spirits failed for fear of the Israelites.
translation: Nau ol papa bilong Amori kings long wes sai bilong Jodan na ol papa bilong Kanaan kings long kos bilong solwara harim olsem Ol Masalai i drai wara bilong Jodan bifo Israelites, ol hart bilong ol i kam antap na ol spirit bilong ol i lus, na ol i save fear long Israelites.

original: At that time the LORD said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and circumcise the sons of Israel once again.”
translation: Long taim ya, Bikpela i tokim Joshua olsem, "Wokim naips bilong flint na katim skin bilong buk long ol pikinini bilong Israel gen."

original: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the sons of Israel at Gibeath-haaraloth.
translation: Na Yusua i makim naif bilong flint, na i circumcise ol pikinini man bilong Israel long Gibeath-haaraloth.

original: Now this is why Joshua circumcised them: All those who came out of Egypt—all the men of war—had died on the journey in the wilderness after they had left Egypt.
translation: Em i bikos long olsem nau Yosua i katim skin bilong ol: Ol man bilong war i kam aut bilong Ijip, ol i dai long rot bilong desert, na ol i lusim Ijip.

original: Though all who had come out were circumcised, none of those born in the wilderness on the journey from Egypt had been circumcised.
translation: Ol i kam bek long en, na ol i katim skin bilong peni, tasol noten yet ya i kamap long bus long rod bilong yumi go bek long Egip i katim skin bilong peni.

original: For the Israelites had wandered in the wilderness forty years, until all the nation’s men of war who had come out of Egypt had died, since they did not obey the LORD. So the LORD vowed never to let them see the land He had sworn to their fathers to give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
translation: Pipol Israel ol i go wail long bus na wilderness forty yia, na ol solida bilong nesen i dai pinis, bilong dispela, ol i no bihainim tok bilong LORD. Na LORD i promis olsem bai ol no inap lukim graun we i promis long tumbuna ol, grain bai i kamap olsem susu na honey i flow.

original: And Joshua raised up their sons in their place, and these were the ones he circumcised. Until this time they were still uncircumcised, since they had not been circumcised along the way.
translation: Na Joshua i karim ap ol pikinini bilong ol long hap bilong ol, na em i katim sken bilong ol. I go long taim ini yet, ol i no katim sken, bikos ol i no katim sken long rot bilong ol.

original: And after all the nation had been circumcised, they stayed there in the camp until they were healed.
translation: Na bihainim olgeta ples kantri i kamap pinis long katuim skin bilong ol, ol i stap yet long hap, long ples bilong army, waitim ol i strong pinis.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.” So that place has been called Gilgal to this day.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Josaia, "Tede mi kisim awe dispela shambling bilong Ijip long yu na putim i go." Na ol i kallim ples bilong em Gilgal yet, long taim bilong tede.

original: On the evening of the fourteenth day of the month, while the Israelites were camped at Gilgal on the plains of Jericho, they kept the Passover.
translation: Long moningi san bilong de 14, wail Oro Israel i kamapim pinis long Gilgal long plen bilong Jeriko, ol i holim Pasova.

original: The day after the Passover, on that very day, they ate unleavened bread and roasted grain from the produce of the land.
translation: De na pasim Pesover, long dispela dei tut, ol i kaikai bret bai ol i no save mekim yet, na grain ol i kukim long moninga bilong kantri.

original: And the day after they had eaten from the produce of the land, the manna ceased. There was no more manna for the Israelites, so that year they began to eat the crops of the land of Canaan.
translation: Na de nadat ol i kaikai produis bilong kantri, mana i stap pinis. Ol Isrelait no ina kaikai mana gen, na yia ia ol i statim kaikai kru bilong kantri Kanaan.

original: Now when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him with a drawn sword in His hand. Joshua approached Him and asked, “Are You for us or for our enemies?”
translation: Taim Josa i kam klostu long Jeriko, em i lukup na si man i stap bifor em, wantaim sop bilong fait i kilim i stap long han bilong em. Josa i go klostu long em na em i askim, "Yu bilong yumi o yu bilong enemy bilong yumi?"

original: “Neither,” He replied. “I have now come as Commander of the LORD’s army.” Then Joshua fell facedown in reverence and asked Him, “What does my Lord have to say to His servant?”
translation: “Em i tok bek,” Jisas itok. “Nau mi kam olsem Komanda bilong ples bilong LORD.” Na Joshua i go daun long graun, i kilim gris na i PRAY long em, then i askim, “Whatu ken Lord baim yusim servant bilong em?”

original: The Commander of the LORD’s army replied, “Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy.” And Joshua did so.
translation: Kapten bilong ples bilong LORD em i tok bek, "Kisim sandal bilong yu na putim daun, bikos ples we yu stanap em i halow." Na Joshua i mekim olsem.

original: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the Israelites. No one went out and no one came in.
translation: Nau Jeriko i kamap strong olsem barak bikos long Israelit. Nogat man i go aut, nogat man i kam insait.

original: And the LORD said to Joshua, “Behold, I have delivered Jericho into your hand, along with its king and its mighty men of valor.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Joshua, "Luke! Mi bin givim Jeriko long han bilong yu, wantaim king bilong em na ol man strong na gutpela bilong em."

original: March around the city with all the men of war, circling the city one time. Do this for six days.
translation: Wokabaut olsem long siti wantaim ol man bilong win, na ol i go raunim siti wanpela taim. Yu mekim dispela sixpela de.

original: Have seven priests carry seven rams’ horns in front of the ark. Then on the seventh day, march around the city seven times, while the priests blow the horns.
translation: Seven pris i mas karim seven horn bilong ram i go bifor bokis bilong bondari. Na long de saptain, yu mas makarim kauntri long saptain taem, wail pris i blohim horn.

original: And when there is a long blast of the ram’s horn and you hear its sound, have all the people give a mighty shout. Then the wall of the city will collapse and all your people will charge straight into the city.”
translation: Na wane em i givim blast longpela long kundu bilong ram na yumi harim saun bilong em, ol pipel oli ken givim wail bilong powa. Orait, banis bilong taun bai i pulapim na ol pipel bilong yu olgeta bai go insait long taun stret.

original: So Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said, “Take up the ark of the covenant and have seven priests carry seven rams’ horns in front of the ark of the LORD.”
translation: Na Josaia sambai Nun i singautim pries, olsem: "Yu karim bek long bokis bilong kaen na sevén pries yet i karim sevén horn bilong ram i go bifor long bokis bilong GOD."

original: And he told the people, “Advance and march around the city, with the armed troops going ahead of the ark of the LORD.”
translation: Na em i tokim ol pipol, "Yu mas go na i go raitlong long sindaun i stap long siti, wantaim solja i kam bifo bek bilong Lod."

original: After Joshua had spoken to the people, seven priests carrying seven rams’ horns before the LORD advanced and blew the horns, and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed them.
translation: Long Joshua i tok pisin finis, seven pris na karim seven horn bilong rams bifor LORD i go bek na bulumim horn, na bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD i kam bihain ol.

original: While the horns continued to sound, the armed troops marched ahead of the priests who blew the horns, and the rear guard followed the ark.
translation: Wail na ol horms i go antap pinis, ol solja i arim i go bifo long ol padi i blowim horms, na grup ol i stap bihain long ak.

original: But Joshua had commanded the people: “Do not give a battle cry or let your voice be heard; do not let one word come out of your mouth until the day I tell you to shout. Then you are to shout!”
translation: Bareta em i bin givim tok impot long ol pipol: “Yu no ken kisim saut long wok bilong yu, na yu no ken wokim tok bilong yu i kam aut; yu no ken tok strong olsem wanpela wod nating long mupla bilong yu, tasol long taem wei bai mi tokim yu long kisim saut. Na bai yu ken kisim saut!”

original: So he had the ark of the LORD carried around the city, circling it once. And the people returned to the camp and spent the night there.
translation: Na em i kisim bek bilong Lod i go, ol i karim bek long raun bilong taun, ol i wokabaut long wan taim. Na ol i go bak long ples bilong ol na stap, ol i katim naet long hap.

original: Joshua got up early the next morning, and the priests took the ark of the LORD.
translation: Josaia i kamap bikos em i go ap long moning, na prist i kisim bek arks bilong Lod.

original: And the seven priests carrying seven rams’ horns kept marching ahead of the ark of the LORD and blowing the horns. The armed troops went in front of them and the rear guard followed the ark of the LORD, while the horns kept sounding.
translation: Na sewen prist i karryim na bungim sewen horn bilong ram, ol i kep go daun bifor ark bilong LORD, na ol i blowim horn. Ol solja i gat weapon i go bifor ol, na grup bilong baksait i folo ark bilong LORD, wail ol i save blowim horn.

original: So on the second day they marched around the city once and returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
translation: Long sekond de, ol i go wokabaun long siti wanpela taim na ol i go bek long kamp. Ol i mekim dispela wok long sikis de.

original: Then on the seventh day, they got up at dawn and marched around the city seven times in the same manner. That was the only day they circled the city seven times.
translation: Long long seventh de, em i go ap bilong moningtaim na ol i wok raun long siti seben taim, olsem olsem. Em i de namba wan tasol ol i wok raun long siti seben taim.

original: After the seventh time around, the priests blew the horns, and Joshua commanded the people, “Shout! For the LORD has given you the city!
translation: Bihaen long namba sevun taim ol i go raun, ol priis i blowim horn, na Joshua i tokimapim long ol pipol, "Singaut! Bikos LORD i givim yu sip into!"

original: Now the city and everything in it must be devoted to the LORD for destruction. Only Rahab the prostitute and all those with her in her house will live, because she hid the spies we sent.
translation: Nau sip na olgeta samting i inside bai i go long LORD, na yumi mas kilim ol. Tasol Rahab meri blo sampela man na ol pipel i stap wantaim em i gat laip, bikos em i harim spy bai yumi sendim go na em i hidim ol.

original: But keep away from the things devoted to destruction, lest you yourself be set apart for destruction. If you take any of these, you will set apart the camp of Israel for destruction and bring disaster upon it.
translation: Bai yu stap we long samting we dekatim pinis, nau bai yu yet em i go daun. Yu no ken kisim sampela bilong dispela, nau bai yu setim ap kamp bilong Israel ol i go daun, na yu bringim bagarap i kam.

original: For all the silver and gold and all the articles of bronze and iron are holy to the LORD; they must go into His treasury.”
translation: Long olgeta silva na gol na olgeta samting bilong bronze na aian, em i santing bilong pari long Jehovah; olgeta em i mas go insait long treasuri bilong em.

original: So when the rams’ horns sounded, the people shouted. When they heard the blast of the horn, the people gave a great shout, and the wall collapsed. Then all the people charged straight into the city and captured it.
translation: Tasol bai wanpela taim trumper bilong ram i save, ol pipel i kirap na singsing bik. Ol pipel i harim soun bilong horn, na ol i mekim bikpela singsing, na barier i pulapim. Na ol pipel i go insait long taun stret na kisim taun.

original: At the edge of the sword they devoted to destruction everything in the city—man and woman, young and old, oxen, sheep, and donkeys.
translation: Long hap bilong sward, ol i kamapim narapela rot bilong bagarap, olgeta samting i stap long taun - man, meri, yangpela, olpela, oksen, sip, na donki.

original: Meanwhile, Joshua told the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the house of the prostitute and bring out the woman and all who are with her, just as you promised her.”
translation: Josua i tokim twopela man i go lusim na lukim graun, "Inap yu go long haus bilong meri i warkim bodi, kisim olt long meri na ol i stap wantaim em, olsem yu promisim em."

original: So the young spies went in and brought out Rahab, her father and mother and brothers, and all who belonged to her. They brought out her whole family and settled them outside the camp of Israel.
translation: Na yangpela spies i go insait na kisim Rahab, papa bilong em, mama bilong em, na brata bilong em, na oltorokim ol i stap long em. Ol i kisim oltorokim na bringim oltorok long famili bilong em, na plantim ol long bodi, long wei ousait long kemp bilong Israel.

original: Then the Israelites burned up the city and everything in it. However, they put the silver and gold and articles of bronze and iron into the treasury of the LORD’s house.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i kae i pasim city na olgeta samting i insait long en. Tasol, ol i putim silva, gol, na artils bilong bronze na iron long tresari bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: And Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute, with her father’s household and all who belonged to her, because she hid the men Joshua had sent to spy out Jericho. So she has lived among the Israelites to this day.
translation: Na Josaia i skulim Rahab, meri blong wokim singsing, wantaim husat papa bilong em na ol i kaivim man ol desla, bikos em i kaivim man ol i go lusim long Jeriko. Na em i stap long ol Israelites inap dispela de.

original: At that time Joshua invoked this solemn oath: “Cursed before the LORD is the man who rises up and rebuilds this city, Jericho; at the cost of his firstborn he will lay its foundations; at the cost of his youngest he will set up its gates.”
translation: Long taim ya, Yosua i makim dispela oth strongpela: “Man i go bekim taun Jeriko, em i kukim long LOD, bikos em i go opim gen; at kost bilong pikinini nambawan bilong en, em bai pilim fondesen bilong taun dispela; na at kost bilong pikinini las bilong en, em bai putim gaten bilong taun.”

original: So the LORD was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout the land.
translation: Na Soba LORD i stap wantaim Josaia, na nema bilong en i go olabaot long kantri.

original: The Israelites, however, acted unfaithfully regarding the things devoted to destruction. Achan son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of what was set apart. So the anger of the LORD burned against the Israelites.
translation: Pipol Israel, ol i wok kol os long ol samting em i bin tokim bai bagarap. Akan, Pikinini bilong Kami, pikinini bilong Sabdi, pikinini bilong Sera, long taim bilong Juda, i tek sampela bilong ol samting em i bin set-ap. Na aria bilong LORD i bin kaikai hot gen long Pipol Israel.

original: Meanwhile, Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth-aven to the east of Bethel, and told them, “Go up and spy out the land.” So the men went up and spied out Ai.
translation: Josua bingim ol man long Jeriko, ol i go long Ai, we i klostu long Bet-aven antap long saut bilong sun bilong Betel, na tokim ol: "Go antap na lukim gras bilong kantri." Ol man i go antap na lukim Ai.

original: On returning to Joshua, they reported, “There is no need to send all the people; two or three thousand men are enough to go up and attack Ai. Since the people of Ai are so few, you need not wear out all our people there.”
translation: Tuna em i go bek long Joshua, ol i tokim story, “Inap long sendim ol pipol olgeta; tupela tasen man husat i nap long go antap na givim war long Ai. Bikos ol pipol bilong Ai i liklik tasol, yu no ken wariim ol pipol bilong yumi olgeta long hap bilong en.”

original: So about three thousand men went up, but they fled before the men of Ai.
translation: Olsem three thousand man i go ap, tasol ol i ranawe long narapela hap bilong man bilong Ai.

original: And the men of Ai struck down about thirty-six of them, chasing them from the gate as far as the quarries and striking them down on the slopes. So the hearts of the people melted and became like water.
translation: Na man bilong Ai i kilim ol thirty-sik bilong ol, ol i ranawe ol long gate na kweya, na ol i kilim ol long slops. Na haret bilong ol pipel i dringail na kam olsem wara.

original: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell facedown before the ark of the LORD until evening, as did the elders of Israel; and they all sprinkled dust on their heads.
translation: Na Josaia i brukim kus bilong en, i kat i dai boro long ak bilong LORD, long taim bilong apinun, ol bikman bilong Israel tu, ol mekim samting olsem; na ol i stap wail pi long het bilong ol.

original: “O, Lord GOD,” Joshua said, “why did You ever bring this people across the Jordan to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites to be destroyed? If only we had been content to stay on the other side of the Jordan!
translation: O, Pita God, mipela Joshua i tok olsem, long bikim wanem yu bringim piple i go antap long Jordan, na givim mipela i go long han bilong Amorait mipela i dai pinis? Mipela mas kontent stap klostu long sait narak long Jordan!

original: O Lord, what can I say, now that Israel has turned its back and run from its enemies?
translation: O PAPA bilong mipela, mipela inap tok wanem, nau Isrel i go bek, i ranawe long eni aibam?

original: When the Canaanites and all who live in the land hear about this, they will surround us and wipe out our name from the earth. Then what will You do for Your great name?”
