translation: Wanpela taim Kanani na ol pipol we i stap long kantri harim tok bilong dispela, ol bai kam raunim mipela na biruaim nem bilong mipela long graun. Na bai yu mekim wanem long nem bilong yu we i gat bikpela?

original: But the LORD said to Joshua, “Stand up! Why have you fallen on your face?
translation: Bikpela i tokim Joshua, "Kam daun na sanap! Wai yu pilai daun na katim gras?"

original: Israel has sinned; they have transgressed My covenant that I commanded them, and they have taken some of what was devoted to destruction. Indeed, they have stolen and lied, and they have put these things with their own possessions.
translation: Isrel i go pasim; ol i braik kaan long mi, na ol i kisim samting we em i bin tok olsem bai i go daun. Ol i stilim na ol i givim lie, na ol i putim dispela samting wantaim olgeta plesa bilong ol.

original: This is why the Israelites cannot stand against their enemies. They will turn their backs and run from their enemies, because they themselves have been set apart for destruction. I will no longer be with you unless you remove from among you whatever is devoted to destruction.
translation: Em i bikos ol Pipol Israel no ina save stap agensim enemy bilong ol. Ol i lusim na rin from enemy bilong ol, bikos ol i stap long ples we dai i kam. Mi no go stap wantaim yumi gen, unless yumi rausim ol samting i setap long dai na bagarap out from among yumi.

original: Get up and consecrate the people, saying, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, for this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Among you, O Israel, there are things devoted to destruction. You cannot stand against your enemies until you remove them.
translation: Kam daun na makim ol manmeri i hol imp, olsem: Makim yuself tumora, wantaim LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok olsem: Long mipela, O Israel, i gat samting we i wail bek long destroksen. Yupela no inap stap astreng long enimi yupela, na bai yupela mas kisim olt long en, bekas ol i stap.

original: In the morning you must present yourselves tribe by tribe. The tribe that the LORD selects shall come forward clan by clan, and the clan that the LORD selects shall come forward family by family, and the family that the LORD selects shall come forward man by man.
translation: Long moning yumi mas kam bek long ples tribe na tribe. Tribe we Bikpela i pikinim bai i kam ananit klan na klan, na klan we Bikpela i pikinim bai i kam ananit famili na famili, na famili we Bikpela i pikinim bai i kam ananit man na man.

original: The one who is caught with the things devoted to destruction must be burned, along with all that belongs to him, because he has transgressed the covenant of the LORD and committed an outrage in Israel.’”
translation: Man i kisim samting ol i save long dai, em i mas i burn, wantaim ol samting bilong em, bikos em i go agenspela kaontrak bilong Lod na i mekim bagarap long Israel.

original: So Joshua arose early the next morning and had Israel come forward tribe by tribe, and the tribe of Judah was selected.
translation: Na Josaia i kamap erli bikos kalapela de, na i bringim Israel i kam bek long front, taim taim ol kabila i sanap, kabila Judah i skelim.

original: He had the clans of Judah come forward, and the clan of the Zerahites was selected. He had the clan of the Zerahites come forward, and the family of Zabdi was selected.
translation: Em i bringim ol clan bilong Yuda i kam annaet, na clan bilong Zerahaiti i skelim. Em i bringim clan bilong Zerahaiti i kam annaet, na famili bilong Zabdi i skelim.

original: And he had the family of Zabdi come forward man by man, and Achan son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was selected.
translation: Na em i kirapim famili bilong Zabdi, ol man i kirap, wanman wanman, na Akan, sun bilong Kami, sun bilong Zabdi, sun bilong Sera, long kauntri grupe bilong Juda, em i skelim.

original: So Joshua said to Achan, “My son, give glory to the LORD, the God of Israel, and make a confession to Him. I urge you to tell me what you have done; do not hide it from me.”
translation: Joshua i tokim Achan, "Pikinini bilong me, givim glori long LORD, God bilong Israel, na mekim konfeshen long Em. Mi laik yu tusim mi long ol samting yu mekim; no ken hidim long mi."

original: “It is true,” Achan replied, “I have sinned against the LORD, the God of Israel. This is what I did:
translation: Em i triu, mi tok, mi gripim sin long han bilong LORD, God bilong Israel. Dispela em olsem na mi mekim:

original: When I saw among the spoils a beautiful cloak from Shinar, two hundred shekels of silver, and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels, I coveted them and took them. They are hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath.”
translation: Taim mi lukim long ol samting bilong war, mi lukim wanpela klos bilong winim solwara from Sinar, tu hundred sikel silva, na wanpela bar gol weiting fifiti sikel, mi bel isi, na mi laikim ol, na mi kisim ol. Ol i stap hait long graun insait long haus bilong mi, wantaim silva i go daun.

original: So Joshua sent messengers who ran to the tent, and there it all was, hidden in his tent, with the silver underneath.
translation: Na Josaia salim mesa, mesa i rin i go long haus bilong en, na ol i lukim, klostu insait long haus bilong en, wantaim silva i stap underneath.

original: They took the things from inside the tent, brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and spread them out before the LORD.
translation: Ol i kisim ol samting insait long haus bilong ples nakam, bringim ol i go long Joshua na ol Israel, na waisim ol i go long graun bifor Bikpela.

original: Then Joshua, together with all Israel, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the cloak, the bar of gold, his sons and daughters, his oxen and donkeys and sheep, his tent, and everything else he owned, and brought them to the Valley of Achor.
translation: Josaia, wantaim ol Israel, i kisim Akan, pikinini bilong Zera, silva, klos, bar bilong gol, ol pikinini bilong em, okson, donki, na ship bilong em, haus bilong em, na ol samting em i gat, na i bringim ol i go long Valeli bilong Akor.

original: “Why have you brought this trouble upon us?” said Joshua. “Today the LORD will bring trouble upon you!” And all Israel stoned him to death. Then they stoned the others and burned their bodies.
translation: “Wahn i bringim dispela hevi long mipela?” tok Joshua. “Tude LORD bai bringim dispela hevi long yu!” Na ol Israel i kilim em na tromoi ston long en. Ol i kilim ol arapela na jaim bodi bilong ol.

original: And they heaped over Achan a large pile of rocks that remains to this day. So the LORD turned from His burning anger. Therefore that place is called the Valley of Achor to this day.
translation: Na ol i kisim stap long hap Akan na wasem bigpela pilai bilong stoan, em i stap yet long taim igo inap. Na LORD i kam bek gen long en de bilong birua hotpela bel. Na ples ia i kolim Valley of Akor long taim igo inap, bikos em i stonin olsem penati na givim nem long ples bilong stori oa man.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid or discouraged. Take the whole army with you, and go up and attack Ai. See, I have delivered into your hand the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Josaia, “No ken skul na bikhet long hed. Kari i go wantaim ol solda, go antap na harim Ai. Mi givim king bilong Ai, ol pipol bilong em, taun bilong em, na gras bilong em i go long yu.”

original: And you shall do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king, except that you may carry off their plunder and livestock for yourselves. Set up an ambush behind the city.”
translation: Na yu mas mekim olsem long Ai na king bilong Ai olsem yu mekim long Jeriko na king bilong en, tasol yu ken kisim plunda na anus long ol animal bilong ol, na kus bilong ol, long yuself. Yu go yet setim waitpin long bihain bilong taun.

original: So Joshua and the whole army set out to attack Ai. Joshua chose 30,000 mighty men of valor and sent them out at night
translation: Na Josua wantaim ol solja yet, ol i go kamap na i go bekim Ai. Josua em choosim 30,000 man bilong pait, ol i strong na gutpela, na em sendim ol long nait.

original: with these orders: “Pay attention. You are to lie in ambush behind the city, not too far from it. All of you must be ready.
translation: Wantaim dispela tok: “Lisin gut, yupela mas go bekim ambush behain long taun, nogat longwe tru. Bekim yupela i redi.

original: Then I and all the troops with me will advance on the city. When they come out against us as they did the first time, we will flee from them.
translation: Mi na ol soja igo long mi bai i go nap long ples, na taim ol i kam aut long mipela olsem ol i mekim gen bipka, yumi bai ranawe long ol.

original: They will pursue us until we have drawn them away from the city, for they will say, ‘The Israelites are running away from us as they did before.’ So as we flee from them,
translation: Ol i pursuiim mipela yet, na mipela i stap long ran, ripot long ol, na ol i tok, 'Isrelait i ran i go awewe olsem ol i mekim bifo.' Na mipela i ranawe, ol i kam bek long mipela, na mipela i pulim ol i go longwe bilong sip.

original: you are to rise from the ambush and seize the city, for the LORD your God will deliver it into your hand.
translation: Yu mas kamap bek long hambus na kisim tumbuna ples, bikos LORD Bikpela yu givim i go long yu.

original: And when you have taken the city, set it on fire. Do as the LORD has commanded! See, I have given you orders.”
translation: Na bihain yu kisim citi, yu mas putim em long faia. Yu mas mekim olsem LORD i givim tok! Lukim, mi givim yu tok nau.”

original: So Joshua sent them out, and they went to the place of ambush and lay in wait between Bethel and Ai, to the west of Ai. But Joshua spent that night among the people.
translation: Na Josua i sendim ol go, na ol i go klostu long ples bilong ambus na stap waitim long biksait bilong Betel na Ai, long wes bilong Ai. Tasol Josua i slip long nait ibelong ol pipel.

original: Joshua got up early the next morning and mobilized his men, and he and the elders of Israel marched before them up to Ai.
translation: Josua i go ap long moning bung we i kam bihain, na em i pilimapim ol soldier bilong em, na em wantaim ol bikpela manmeri bilong Isrel i masalai i go bifor ol, go long Ai.

original: Then all the troops who were with him marched up and approached the city. They arrived in front of Ai and camped to the north of it, with the valley between them and the city.
translation: Ol solja i go apo na kam klostu long taun Ai, ol i makim ka long not bilong Ai, na vali i stap long mit bilong ol na taun. Ol i pundaon formation bilong fight long lae bilong taun Ai, long not bilong em.

original: Now Joshua had taken about five thousand men and set up an ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city.
translation: Na Josaia i kisim ol man five thousand, na ol i go wai long hap pas long Betel na Ai, long wes long taun.

original: So the forces were stationed with the main camp to the north of the city and the rear guard to the west of the city. And that night Joshua went into the valley.
translation: Ol solja i stap yet long ples wantaim kampani bikpela long not bilong siti, na rear guard i stop long wes bilong siti. Na dispela nait Joshua i go daun long bele.

original: When the king of Ai saw the Israelites, he hurried out early in the morning with the men of the city to engage them in battle at an appointed place overlooking the Arabah. But he did not know that an ambush had been set up against him behind the city.
translation: Taim ki ya bilong Ai i lukim ol Israel, em i go bek i go aplau long moning na i holim faet long ol ol man bilong taun long ples we ol i skelim long Arabah. Tasol em i no save olsem ol i setim trap long en bihain long taun.

original: Joshua and all Israel let themselves be beaten back before them, and they fled toward the wilderness.
translation: Josaia na ol Isrel i kisim bek long pait na kat bek, na ol i ran i go insait long bus.

original: Then all the men of Ai were summoned to pursue them, and they followed Joshua and were drawn away from the city.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Ai i go kam, na ol i foloim Josa, bihainim ol i go, na ol i pulapela long siti.

original: Not a man was left in Ai or Bethel who did not go out after Israel, leaving the city wide open while they pursued Israel.
translation: Nogat man i stap long Ai na Betel, ol i go bek long Israel, ol i leevim siti bung, wail ol i bihainim Israel.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua, “Hold out your battle lance toward Ai, for into your hand I will deliver the city.” So Joshua held out his battle lance toward Ai,
translation: Bikpela i tokim Joshua, “Stretim han bilong yu na holim wei bilong pik bilong fight long Ai, bikos mi bai givim yu sipos bilong ples.” Na Joshua i holim han bilong en na stretim wei bilong pik bilong fight long Ai.

original: and as soon as he did so, the men in ambush rose quickly from their position. They rushed forward, entered the city, captured it, and immediately set it on fire.
translation: Olsem em i mekim, ol man bilong sep bilong kilim i kamap harim long ples bilong ol, ol i ron i go, ol i go insait long taun, ol i kisim taun, na ol i burnim taun.

original: When the men of Ai turned and looked back, the smoke of the city was rising into the sky. They could not escape in any direction, and the troops who had fled to the wilderness now became the pursuers.
translation: Taim man meri bilong Ai turnim bek na lukibek, smok bilong siti i go antap long skai. Inogat wei bilong ranawe long eni sait, na ol soldia i ranawe go long bus, nau ol i kamap pursuers.

original: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the men in ambush had captured the city and that smoke was rising from it, they turned around and struck down the men of Ai.
translation: Wanpela taim Josua na ol Israel i si ol man i go bek long bus na kisim taun Ai, na smok i go antap long em, ol i tornabaut na kilim daun ol man Ai.

original: Meanwhile, those in the ambush came out of the city against them, and the men of Ai were trapped between the Israelite forces on both sides. So Israel struck them down until no survivor or fugitive remained.
translation: Wanpela taim, ol man i go hait long bus na kam aut bilong siti, na ol man bilong Ai i kisim long tupela sait, ol i go bek long siporo bilong Israel. Na ol i kilim ol man bilong Ai, ol i no lusim man i save na man i ranawe, tasol ol i dai pinis.

original: But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
translation: Be ol i kisim king bilong Ai na usim em i stap, na brungim em i go long Joshua.

original: When Israel had finished killing all the men of Ai who had pursued them into the field and wilderness, and when every last one of them had fallen by the sword, all the Israelites returned to Ai and put it to the sword as well.
translation: Wanpela taim Isrel i pinis na kilim ol man bilong Ai ol i go bek gen long bus na bel het na persev ol, na ol i go bek gen long Ai, ol Israelites i kilim ol long swod, na olgeta i pundaun, hamskulpim.

original: A total of twelve thousand men and women fell that day—all the people of Ai.
translation: Olsem, twelve tausen man na meri i pundaun na dei - ol pipol bilong Ai.

original: Joshua did not draw back the hand that held his battle lance until he had devoted to destruction all who lived in Ai.
translation: Joshua i no kisim han go bek we i holim strongpela lans bilong pait, na em i dediketim ol i stap long Ai ol long dae.

original: Israel took for themselves only the cattle and plunder of that city, as the LORD had commanded Joshua.
translation: Isrel i kisim long han bilong ol yet bulmakau na loot bilong taun ia, olsem Jehovah i tokim Josua.

original: So Joshua burned Ai and made it a permanent heap of ruins, a desolation to this day.
translation: Nausa, Joshua i bikim Ai i pas, na em i mekim olsem wanpela hap bilong rusim oltaim, wanpela ples we i no gat kantri, na em i stap olso long tude.

original: He hung the king of Ai on a tree until evening, and at sunset Joshua commanded that they take down the body from the tree and throw it down at the entrance of the city gate. And over it they raised a large pile of rocks, which remains to this day.
translation: Em hangim king bilong Ai long diwai until evening, na long sankam Joshua i givim komando ol i kisim bodi bilong em na katim long diwai, ol i puskim i go daun bung long entris bilong gati bilong taun. Na ol i kirapim hevi pilai bilong stoan ibaksait, em i stap yet inap long tudei.

original: At that time Joshua built an altar on Mount Ebal to the LORD, the God of Israel,
translation: Long taim ia, Josa i bikim altar long Maunt Ebal long LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel.

original: just as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded the Israelites. He built it according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses: “an altar of uncut stones on which no iron tool has been used.” And on it they offered burnt offerings to the LORD, and they sacrificed peace offerings.
translation: Olsem Mosis, servant bilong LORD, em i givim komando long Israelites. Em i bikim alta bilong ston nogat katim olsem tok bilong Buk Bilong Lotu Bilong Mosis: "alta bilong ston nogat katim, iron nogat usim". Na long en, ol i givim ofing bilong bun na ol i kilim pikinini bus na animal bilong peis long LORD.

original: And there in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua inscribed on the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he had written.
translation: Na long hap olsem, Josua raitim kopi bilong laen bilong Mosesi long ston, na em i mekim olsem long as bilong ol Israelait.

original: All Israel, foreigners and citizens alike, with their elders, officers, and judges, stood on both sides of the ark of the covenant of the LORD facing the Levitical priests who carried it. Half of the people stood in front of Mount Gerizim and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded earlier, to bless the people of Israel.
translation: Ol Israel, pipol bung na ol i kam long nesen, wantaim ol bikpela man meri, ofisa na ofisal, na jaj, ol i stan long both sait bilong ark bilong kaovenan bilong LORD, na ol i lukim pris long sait bilong Levitikal pris we i karim. Half bilong ol pipol i stan bifo Maunt Gerizim na half bilong ol i stan bifo Maunt Ebal, olsem Moses, servant bilong LORD, i mekim komand long taim bipo, bilong givim blessing long pipol bilong Israel.

original: Afterward, Joshua read aloud all the words of the law—the blessings and the curses—according to all that is written in the Book of the Law.
translation: Nambis, Josua ritim olsem wanpela bokis olgeta wod bilong lo, bikos em i gat blesin na karai, olsem olgeta samting i raun long Buk Bilong Lo.

original: There was not a word of all that Moses had commanded that Joshua failed to read before the whole assembly of Israel, including the women, the little ones, and the foreigners who lived among them.
translation: I no bin gat wanpela tok olsem Moses ibin givim oda, olsem Joshua i no bin autim long redim bifora olgeta assembli bilong Israel, inklusim ol meri, ol pikinini, na ol yangpela man ol i stap long ol.

original: Now when news of this reached all the kings west of the Jordan—those in the hill country, the foothills, and all along the coast of the Great Sea toward Lebanon (the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites)—
translation: Nau nus bilong dispela i go kam long ol king bilong wes sais bilong Jordan—ol i stap long maunten, pati bilong maunten, na ol ples long kos bilong Bikpela Solwara i go inap long Lebanon (Hittites, Amorites, Kanaanitis, Perizitis, Hivitis, na Jebusitis)—

original: they came together to wage war against Joshua and Israel.
translation: Ol i kam long olgeta long mekim faet gen Joshua na Isrel.

original: But the people of Gibeon, having heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,
translation: Tasol ol pikinini bilong Gibeon i harim dispela tok bilong Joshua i mekim long Jeriko na Ai,

original: acted deceptively and set out as envoys, carrying on their donkeys worn-out sacks and old wineskins, cracked and mended.
translation: Ol i wok long bikhet na ol i go kam bek long olsem ambasada, karim sampela sak ol i paul na wain skin ol i paul, i krak na repem, long donki ol i usim long karim kago.

original: They put worn, patched sandals on their feet and threadbare clothing on their bodies, and their whole supply of bread was dry and moldy.
translation: Ol putim sol sipos ol i bin katim na stap long hap daun long lek bilong ol, na katim klos i no gat eni de antap long bodi bilong ol, na olgeta ka bilong ol i drai na i bin i kamap graon.

original: They went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and the men of Israel, “We have come from a distant land; please make a treaty with us.”
translation: Tupela i go kam long Joshua olsem lip leader long ples bilong army, Gilgal, na ol i tokim em na ol man bilong Israel, "Mipela i kam longwe na farawe ples; mipela i askim yu, makim peis wantaim mipela."

original: But the men of Israel said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you dwell near us. How can we make a treaty with you?”
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i tokim Hivitis olsem, "Em inap yu kam stap klostu long mipela. Mipela bai tok olsem wanem long mekim pe wantaim yu?"

original: “We are your servants,” they said to Joshua. Then Joshua asked them, “Who are you and where have you come from?”
translation: “Mipela i servist na yu,” ol i tokim Josua. Na Josua i askim ol, “Yu husat na bai yu kam long we?”

original: “Your servants have come from a very distant land,” they replied, “because of the fame of the LORD your God. For we have heard the reports about Him: all that He did in Egypt,
translation: Mipela wokmanmeri i kam long ples bilong mipela we istap longwe bikos longwei, ol i tok, bikos nem bilong LORD God yu em i gat bikpela nam. Mipela i harim tktok bilong Em: olgeta wei em i mekim long Ijip,

original: and all that He did to the two kings of the Amorites beyond the Jordan—Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth.
translation: Na olgeta wei em mekim long tupela king bilong Ol Amoriti bikos long sait bilong Wara Jordan - Sihon king bilong Heshbon na Og king bilong Bashan, we ol i bin rul long Ashtaroth.

original: So the elders and inhabitants of our land told us, ‘Take provisions for your journey; go to meet them and say to them: We are your servants. Please make a treaty with us.’
translation: Ol bikman meri na man na ol papa graun i tokim mipela, 'Kisim ka moni bilong wokim kamap long jiap, go bek long harim ol, na tokim ol: Mipela em i servan bilong yu. Pekami pasin wantaim mipela.'

original: This bread of ours was warm when we packed it at home on the day we left to come to you. But take a look, it is now dry and moldy.
translation: Bread bilong yumi i wán wén yumi bin putim i go long haus long de yumi bin lusim haus kam bek gen. Kam bek lukim, em i drai na moldi nau.

original: These wineskins were new when we filled them, but look, they are cracked. And these clothes and sandals are worn out from our very long journey.”
translation: Dispela wineskin i stap nupela wen yumi fulim ol, tasol lukim, ol i brok. Na dispela klos na sandal i paul pinis longpela journey bilong yumi.

original: Then the men of Israel sampled their provisions, but did not seek the counsel of the LORD.
translation: Na ol man bilong Isrel i trai kaikai bilong ol, tasol ol i no askim tok bilong Kot.

original: And Joshua made a treaty of peace with them to let them live, and the leaders of the congregation swore an oath to them.
translation: Na Josua i wokim pispis long peis wantaim ol, na givim spaes olsem bai oli stap, na olegis bilong lotu i tok strong long ol.

original: Three days after they had made the treaty with the Gibeonites, the Israelites learned that they were neighbors, living among them.
translation: Tri dei bihain ol Israelites i mekim pepe bilong pisin wantaim Gibeonites, ol Israelites i save long em, ol i nambis, na ol i stap long ol.

original: So the Israelites set out and on the third day arrived at their cities—Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i go bek long rodpela wok, na ol i kamap long dei thrid, ol i kamap long siti bilong ol - Siti Gibeon, Siti Chephirah, Siti Beeroth, na Siti Kiriath-jearim.

original: But the Israelites did not attack them, because the leaders of the congregation had sworn an oath to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. And the whole congregation grumbled against the leaders.
translation: Pipol Israel i no go autsait, bikos Bikman bilong asamble i makim oth long han bilong LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, long ol. Na asamble ol i tok strong long Bikman.

original: All the leaders answered, “We have sworn an oath to them by the LORD, the God of Israel, and now we cannot touch them.
translation: Olgeta bikman i tok, "Mipela i kam bek long ples bilong promis long LORD, God bilong Israel, na nau mipela i no inap tetchem."

original: This is how we will treat them: We will let them live, so that no wrath will fall on us because of the oath we swore to them.”
translation: Mipela bai lusiim ol i stap, na bai no ken dai pinis i kam bek long mipela, em i pundaun long mipela, bikos mipela i makim othes long ol.

original: They continued, “Let them live, but let them be woodcutters and water carriers for the whole congregation.” So the leaders kept their promise.
translation: Ol i go on, "Lusim ol i stap, na ol i paulim diwai na ol i kisim wara long ples bilong lotu olgeta." Na lida i holim toktok bilong ol.

original: Then Joshua summoned the Gibeonites and said, “Why did you deceive us by telling us you live far away from us, when in fact you live among us?
translation: Josaia i kirapim Gibeonaites na i tokim ol, "Yu dusim mipela long bilip masalai, ol bain tokim mipela yu stap longwe farawe, tasol Yu stap long mipela."

original: Now therefore you are under a curse and will perpetually serve as woodcutters and water carriers for the house of my God.”
translation: Nau therefore yu stap aninit long kukim ol, bai yu wok oltaim olsem ol man i katim diwai na ol man i kam bek long wata long haus bilong God bilong mi.

original: The Gibeonites answered, “Your servants were told clearly that the LORD your God had commanded His servant Moses to give you all the land and wipe out all its inhabitants before you. So we greatly feared for our lives because of you, and that is why we have done this.
translation: Gibeonitisis i tokim, “Servant yumi i bin hear kam klia olsem LORD God bilong yumi i bin givim komando long Moses olsem servant bilong en, long givim yumi olgeta graun na bagarapim ol pipol bilong en bifo yumi. Yumi save pilim bikpela fear long laip bilong yumi bikos long yumi, na em i bilong dispela yumi mekim ol samting.”

original: Now we are in your hands. Do to us whatever seems good and right to you.”
translation: Nau yumi stap long han bilong yu. Wokim long yumi olgeta samting i luk gut na rait long yu.

original: So Joshua did this and delivered them from the hands of the Israelites, and they did not kill the Gibeonites.
translation: Na Yosua mekim desoil na bam bikim ol i kamaut long hap bilong Israel, na ol i no kilim Gibeonit.

original: On that day he made them woodcutters and water carriers, as they are to this day for the congregation of the LORD and for the altar at the place He would choose.
translation: Long dei ya na em i mekim ol i kam na kaitim diwai, na ol i kam na kisim wara, olsem ol i stap yet long bihain bilong LORD, na long altiya bilong ples we GOD baim i chusim.

original: Now Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had captured Ai and devoted it to destruction—doing to Ai and its king as he had done to Jericho and its king—and that the people of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were living near them.
translation: Nau Adoni-zedek king bilong Jerusalem i harim olsem Josaua ibin kisim Ai, na ibin tokaut long dispela dei bilong bagarapim - mekim olsem em i mekim long Jeriko na king bilong em, na ol pipol bilong Gibeon ibin wokim pis wantaim Israel, na ol i stap klostu long ol.

original: So Adoni-zedek and his people were greatly alarmed, because Gibeon was a great city, like one of the royal cities; it was larger than Ai, and all its men were mighty.
translation: Na Adoni-zedek na ol pipol bilong en i bikim afraid tumas, wantaim Gibeon em i gat bikpela taun, olsem wanpela taun bilong king; em i bikpela long Ai, na ol man bilong em ol i strong.

original: Therefore Adoni-zedek king of Jerusalem sent word to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish, and Debir king of Eglon, saying,
translation: Na Adoni-zedek, papa bilong Jerusalema, i givim tok long Hoham, papa bilong Hebron, na long Piram, papa bilong Jarmuth, na long Japhia, papa bilong Lachish, na long Debir, papa bilong Eglon, em i tok olsem:

original: “Come up and help me. We will attack Gibeon, because they have made peace with Joshua and the Israelites.”
translation: Kam na halivim mi, mipela bai go atakim taun bilong Gibeon, bikos ol i wokim peis wantaim Joshua na Pipol bilong Isrel.

original: So the five kings of the Amorites—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon—joined forces and advanced with all their armies. They camped before Gibeon and made war against it.
translation: Na kaenpela faiv kings bilong pipel Amorait - kings bilong taun Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, na Eglon - ol i kam apo long wok togeta na go befon, ol i kisim faet long olgeta soldier bilong ol. Ol i pundaun bifor Gibeon na ol i kisim faet long em.

original: Then the men of Gibeon sent word to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal: “Do not abandon your servants. Come quickly and save us! Help us, because all the kings of the Amorites from the hill country have joined forces against us.”
translation: Na man bilong Gibeon salim wod long Joshua long kamp bilong em long Gilgal: “No lusim servant bilong yumi. Kam hariap na savim mipela! Helpim mipela, bikos ol king bilong Amorites long kantri bilong maunten i joiim fors long paitim mipela.”

original: So Joshua and his whole army, including all the mighty men of valor, came from Gilgal.
translation: Josa na solja i kam, wantaim olgeta man bilong pait, strong na gutpela, long Gilgal.

original: The LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I have delivered them into your hand. Not one of them shall stand against you.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Josaia, “Yu no ken afraid long ol, bikos mi bin givim ol i go long han bilong yu. Not wan bilong ol bai stap bek gen long yu.”

original: After marching all night from Gilgal, Joshua caught them by surprise.
translation: Josaia i go dai pinis na i go bek long nait from Gilgal, na ol i kam bekim ol long sopesa.

original: And the LORD threw them into confusion before Israel, who defeated them in a great slaughter at Gibeon, pursued them along the ascent to Beth-horon, and struck them down as far as Azekah and Makkedah.
translation: Na Bikpela i kirapim confusion long ol bifor Isrel, na Isrel i winim ol long we wara bikpela slaughta long Gibion, ol i go bek long ol long rod bilong go ap long Bet-Horon, na ol i kilim ol long Aseka na Makeda.

original: As they fled before Israel along the descent from Beth-horon to Azekah, the LORD cast down on them large hailstones from the sky, and more of them were killed by the hailstones than by the swords of the Israelites.
translation: Ol i ranawe long Israel long rod bilong Bet-horon i go daun long Aseka, LORD i pilim i daun ston hail bikpela long heven, na ol i dai bekas long ston hail i mo dan ol i dai bekas long sord bilong Israel.

original: On the day that the LORD gave the Amorites over to the Israelites, Joshua spoke to the LORD in the presence of Israel: “O sun, stand still over Gibeon, O moon, over the Valley of Aijalon.”
translation: Long de dai ol Masalai i givim Amorait long Israel, Joshua i tokim long Masalai olsem wanpela man i stap na lukim long ai bilong Israel: “O san, yu no inap go yet, yu mas stap yet olsem long Gibeon, O mun, yu stap yet olsem long Valei bilong Aijalon.”

original: So the sun stood still and the moon stopped until the nation took vengeance upon its enemies. Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? “So the sun stopped in the middle of the sky and delayed going down about a full day.”
translation: Sana i stap yet na mun i stop until nesen i kisim bek long enemy bilong en. Olsem i rais long Buk Jasar, "Sana i stop long mit blong ska na i bihain long go daun olsem wanpela de."

original: There has been no day like it before or since, when the LORD listened to the voice of a man, because the LORD fought for Israel.
translation: Nogat dei olsem long taim bipo na nau, wail LORD i harim tok bilong man, bikos LORD i fait long side bilong Israel.

original: Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.
translation: Na Josaia i go bek gen long ples bilong army, long Gilgal, wantaim ol Isrel.

original: Now the five kings had fled and hidden in the cave at Makkedah.
translation: Nau ol faiv king i ranawe na ol i kaipim long holep bilong stone long Makkesa.

original: And Joshua was informed: “The five kings have been found; they are hiding in the cave at Makkedah.”
translation: Na Yoshua i harm tok: "Faivpela kingly ibin kamap nau, ol i kaipim insait long hole bilong Makkedah."

original: So Joshua said, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and post men there to guard them.
translation: Na Yuswa i tok olsem, "Rulim ston bikpela i go kas long maus bilong hole, na sindaun man i stap bek long lukautim ol.

original: But you, do not stop there. Pursue your enemies and attack them from behind. Do not let them reach their cities, for the LORD your God has delivered them into your hand.”
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem: “Yu, no stap yet, go long! Pursem eni bilong yu, kilim ol bek-quarter na bihain. No lusim ol i go long ples bilong ol, Bikpela LORD God bilong yu i givim ol long han bilong yu.”

original: So Joshua and the Israelites continued to inflict a terrible slaughter until they had finished them off, and the remaining survivors retreated to the fortified cities.
translation: Joshua na Pipol Israel i wail kisim i go longwe na i mekim bikpela bel het long ol, na ol i pinisim ol, na ol i stap i withdraw long taun bung bilong wara.

original: The whole army returned safely to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah, and no one dared to utter a word against the Israelites.
translation: Olgeta solja i go bek long ples na stap gut, na stap long Joshua insait long kanu long Makkedah, na nogat wanpela man i ken toktok strong long Israel.

original: Then Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave and bring those five kings out to me.”
translation: Na Joshua i tok, "Opim maut bilong gua na kisim faivpela king ol i kam long me."

original: So they brought the five kings out of the cave—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon.
translation: Ol i kamautim king faiv igo longwe na kave – king bilong Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, na Eglon.

original: When they had brought the kings to Joshua, he summoned all the men of Israel and said to the army commanders who had accompanied him, “Come here and put your feet on the necks of these kings.” So the commanders came forward and put their feet on their necks.
translation: Taim ol i bringim ol king i go long Joshua, em i singautim ol man meri bilong Isrel, na tokim ol kapten bilong army, "Kam daun na putim lek bilong yu long nek bilong ol king." Na ol kapten i kam bek na putim lek bilong ol long nek bilong ol, ol i simbolizim win na papa bilong ol.

original: “Do not be afraid or discouraged,” Joshua said. “Be strong and courageous, for the LORD will do this to all the enemies you fight.”
translation: “No ken stap i go het,” Joshua i tokim. “Yu mas i go strong na katol long het bilong yu, bikos LORD bai mekim dispela long ol poisen ya yu kisim fait wantaim.”

original: After this, Joshua struck down and killed the kings, and he hung their bodies on five trees and left them there until evening.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, Joshua i paitim ol kings na killim ol, na hangim bodi bilong ol long faiv diwai, na lusim ol bihaen until apinun.

original: At sunset Joshua ordered that they be taken down from the trees and thrown into the cave in which they had hidden. Then large stones were placed against the mouth of the cave, and the stones are there to this day.
translation: Long san go daun Joshua i tokim ol, ol i kisim i kam daun long diwai, na ol i tromwe long hole ol i kaivim em. Ol putim bikpela ston long maus bilong hole, na dispela ston i stap yet inap dispela de.

original: On that day Joshua captured Makkedah and put it to the sword, along with its king. He devoted to destruction everyone in the city, leaving no survivors. So he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
translation: Long hap tumas Joshua i kamapim Makkedah, na em i kilim king bilong en, na em i birua ol long dei, na ol i no lus, em i no leevim bek sinisen. Na em i mekim king bilong Makkedah olsem em i mekim king bilong Jeriko.

original: Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Makkedah to Libnah and fought against Libnah.
translation: Na Joshua wantaim ol Isrel i go bek gen long Makkedah, go inap long Libnah, na ol i kisim fait wantaim ol pipol long Libnah.

original: And the LORD also delivered that city and its king into the hand of Israel, and Joshua put all the people to the sword, leaving no survivors. And he did to the king of Libnah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
translation: Na Bikpela i givim siiti na king bilong em long han bilong Isrel, na Josua i kilim ol long pati bilong surod, i no lusim bek wan man o meri. Na em i mekim long king bilong Libna olsem em i mekim long king bilong Jeriko.

original: And Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Libnah to Lachish. They laid siege to it and fought against it.
translation: Na Josua wantaim ol Isrel i go pas long Libnah, na em i kamap long Lachish. Ol i kisim strongpela hap long en, na ol i fait long en.

original: And the LORD delivered Lachish into the hand of Israel, and Joshua captured it on the second day. He put all the people to the sword, just as he had done to Libnah.
translation: Na Papa God i givim Lachish long hap bilong Isrel, na Josa i kisim em long dei namba tu. Em i kilim olgeta manmeri wantaim sward, olsem em i mekim long Libna.

original: At that time Horam king of Gezer went to help Lachish, but Joshua struck him down along with his people, leaving no survivors.
translation: Long taim ia, Horam king bilong Gezer go halivim Lakis, tasol Josua i kilim i dai wantaim ol pikinini bilong en, na i no leve nak.

original: So Joshua moved on from Lachish to Eglon, and all Israel with him. They laid siege to it and fought against it.
translation: Na Josua i movе pas long Lakis, na i go long Egolon, na Isrel i kam wantaim em. Ol i kisim strong Egolon na ol i fait long en.

original: That day they captured Eglon and put it to the sword, and Joshua devoted to destruction everyone in the city, just as he had done to Lachish.
translation: Ol i kisim Eglon, na ol i kilim olgeta long sord, na Yosua i lakim olgeta long bubu, olsem em i mekim long Lachish.

original: Then Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron and fought against it.
translation: Na Josua wants ol Isrel ibin go apo long Eglon na i kamap long Hebron, na ol i fait long em.

original: They captured it and put to the sword its king, all its villages, and all the people. Joshua left no survivors, just as he had done at Eglon; he devoted to destruction Hebron and everyone in it.
translation: Ol i kisim Hebron, katim king bilong em na ol vilij, pipel we i save long en, ol i bagarap. Joshua i lusim nobody, em i mekim ol go daun, olsem em i mekim long Eglon; em i mak Hebron i bagarap, na ol pipel we i stap long en, ol i dai tasol.

original: Finally Joshua and all Israel with him turned toward Debir and fought against it.
translation: Finally Yosua na ol Israel husat i kam wantaim em, ol i turn arere long Debir na ol i go fait wantaim.

original: And they captured Debir, its king, and all its villages. They put them to the sword and devoted to destruction everyone in the city, leaving no survivors. Joshua did to Debir and its king as he had done to Hebron and as he had done to Libnah and its king.
translation: Na ol i kisim Debir, king bilong em, na ol vilij bilong em. Ol i kilim ol long swod na ol i makim ol long daun nau, Bikpela i bin autim ol long dai, i no lakim bek wanpela man. Joshua i mekim long Debir na king bilong em olsem em i bin mekim long Hebron, na olsem em i bin mekim long Libnah na king bilong em.

original: So Joshua conquered the whole region—the hill country, the Negev, the foothills, and the slopes, together with all their kings—leaving no survivors. He devoted to destruction everything that breathed, just as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded.
translation: Na Yuswa winim ap long olgeta hap - kantri bilong maunten, Negeb, pati bilong maunten i go daun, na sait bilong maunten, olgeta king bilong ol, nogat wanpela i stap. Na em bin givim olgeta samting i gat laip long en i go daun na dai, olsem Jehovah, God bilong Israel, i tok.

original: Joshua conquered the area from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza, and the whole region of Goshen as far as Gibeon.
translation: Josua winim hap bilong ples long Kadesi-barnea, na i kam inap long Gasa, na olgeta hap bilong ples bilong Gosen, longwe go inap long Gibion.

original: And because the LORD, the God of Israel, fought for Israel, Joshua captured all these kings and their land in one campaign.
translation: Na bikos Bikpela, God bilong Israel, i fait bilong Israel, Josua i kisim olgeta king na graun bilong ol long wanpela kampein.

original: Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.
translation: Na Joshua i kam bek gen long ol Israel, na ol i go bek long hap bilong Gilgal.

original: Now when Jabin king of Hazor heard about these things, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon; to the kings of Shimron and Achshaph;
translation: Nau Jabin king bilong Hazor em i harim ol samting, em i sen tok long Jobab king bilong Madon, na long ol king bilong Shimron na Achshaph;

original: to the kings of the north in the mountains, in the Arabah south of Chinnereth, in the foothills, and in Naphoth-dor to the west;
translation: Long ol kings bilong not long montain, long Araba saut bilong Chinnereth, long ples gras bilong maunten, na long Naphoth-dor long wes;

original: to the Canaanites in the east and west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites at the foot of Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
translation: long ol Kanaanites long east na west; long ol Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, na Jebusites long kantri bilong maunten; na long ol Hivites long fut bilong Maunten Hermon long kantri bilong Mizpah.

original: So these kings came out with all their armies, a multitude as numerous as the sand on the seashore, along with a great number of horses and chariots.
translation: Nupela king i kam aut, wantaim ol solja bilong ol, ol i plenti olsem san long bikpela wara, na planti hors na kar i go wes.

original: All these kings joined forces and encamped at the waters of Merom to fight against Israel.
translation: Ol kingly i joiim ol i go, na ol i kamp long wara bilong Merom, oli preparim long fait long Isrel.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for by this time tomorrow I will deliver all of them slain before Israel. You are to hamstring their horses and burn up their chariots.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Joshua, “No ken kirap long ol, bipo nau kalabai tumora mi bai givim ol i go daun bifor Israel. Yu mas pokim lek bilong ol horsem, yu mas jakim autim ol kare.”

original: So by the waters of Merom, Joshua and his whole army came upon them suddenly and attacked them,
translation: Long wahta bilong Merom, Joshua na armi bilong en i kamap long ol sudden na pasim ol.

original: and the LORD delivered them into the hand of Israel, who struck them down and pursued them all the way to Greater Sidon and Misrephoth-maim, and eastward as far as the Valley of Mizpeh. They struck them down, leaving no survivors.
translation: Na Papa God i givim ol long han bilong Israel, na bamim i kilim daun ol, na bamim i go bek long en, olsem long Sidon Bikpela na Misrephoth-maim, na long east sait olsem Vali bilong Mizpeh. Bamim i kilim ol, na inap lusim niupela man.

original: Joshua treated them as the LORD had told him; he hamstrung their horses and burned up their chariots.
translation: Yosua i mekim gut long ol olsem Jehovah i tokim em; em i bugum leg bilong hors ol, na em i bakim chariot ol.

original: At that time Joshua turned back and captured Hazor and put its king to the sword, because Hazor was formerly the head of all these kingdoms.
translation: Long taim ia, Joshua i go bek gen, i kisim Hazor, na i kilim king bilong em wantaim sord, bikos Hazor olsem hed bilong ol ples bilong king bifo.

original: The Israelites put everyone in Hazor to the sword, devoting them to destruction. Nothing that breathed remained, and Joshua burned down Hazor itself.
translation: Pipal Israel i kilim olgeta wantaim sord long Hausa, ol i go long daunpinga. Nogat samting i stap, olgeta i dai pinis, na Josa i bakarim Hausa itself.

original: Joshua captured all these kings and their cities and put them to the sword. He devoted them to destruction, as Moses the LORD’s servant had commanded.
translation: Josua i kisim pinis ol kings ya na ol taun bilong ol, na ol i kilim ol long suwod. Ol i makim ol i go daun long destraksen, olsem Mose, wan servant bilong LORD, i bin tokim.

original: Yet Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds, except Hazor, which Joshua burned.
translation: Isrel i no bunim siti, eksept Hazor, we Joshua im bin bunim.

original: The Israelites took for themselves all the plunder and livestock of these cities, but they put all the people to the sword until they had completely destroyed them, not sparing anyone who breathed.
translation: Israelites i kisim loot na aninit na kus bilong ol siti ya, tasol ol i kilim ol long svord, na ol i no sparim niuwan hat, nogat, ol i brukim pinis.

original: As the LORD had commanded His servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua. That is what Joshua did, leaving nothing undone of all that the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Olsem Jehovah i givim tok, na Moses i givim tok long Joshua olsem, Na Joshua i mekim olsem, i no lusim wanpela samting tasol bilong olgeta Jehova i bin givim tok long Moses.

original: So Joshua took this entire region: the hill country, all the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the western foothills, the Arabah, and the mountains of Israel and their foothills,
translation: Na Yuswa em i tekim hap pasal dispela hap ples: maunten kandre, olgeta Negev, olgeta graun bilong Goshen, sait bilong maunten long wes, Arabah, na maunten bilong Israel na fut bilong ol.

original: from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, as far as Baal-gad in the Valley of Lebanon at the foot of Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings and struck them down, putting them to death.
translation: Long Mount Halak, we i go ap long Seir, stret long Baal-gad istap long Labinon Vali, kaundia long Mount Hermon, em i kisim ol king bilong ol, na em i kilim ol, na em i bringim ol i dai.

original: Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long period of time.
translation: Josaia i wokim war long ol king na king bilong ol, long taim olsem, i go wokim birua strong.

original: No city made peace with the Israelites except the Hivites living in Gibeon; all others were taken in battle.
translation: Nogat naitaun i mekim peis wantaim Pipal bilong Isrel, eksept pipal bilong Hivi i stap long Gibeon; ol narapela i go daun long bikpela fait.

original: For it was of the LORD to harden their hearts to engage Israel in battle, so that they would be set apart for destruction and would receive no mercy, being annihilated as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Em i bikos bilong Bikpela olsem, i stap strong ol hart bilong ol, ol i go long fight wantaim Isrel, na ol i pasim ol long dai, ol no ken kisim meri, na ol i dai pinis, olsem Bikpela i tokim Mosis.

original: At that time Joshua proceeded to eliminate the Anakim from the hill country of Hebron, Debir, and Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah and of Israel. Joshua devoted them to destruction, along with their cities.
translation: Long taim i kam, Josua i go na rausim ol Anakim long maunten bilong Hebron, Debir, na Anab, na long maunten bilong Judah na bilong Isrel. Ol i givim ol i go long destrukshen, wantaim ol taun bilong ol.

original: No Anakim were left in the land of the Israelites; only in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod did any survive.
translation: Oli Anakim i no stap long lan bilong Israel; bek long Gaza, Gath, na Ashdod ol i stap yet.

original: So Joshua took the entire land, in keeping with all that the LORD had spoken to Moses. And Joshua gave it as an inheritance to Israel according to the allotments to their tribes. Then the land had rest from war.
translation: Na Josaia i tekim olgeta kantri, long stap wantaim olgetsamting Papa God i tokim Mosese. Na Josaia i givim ol kantri long Isrel olsem ka moning, long ol ka moning bilong ol tribe. Na kantri i stap bek long wok war.

original: Now these are the kings of the land whom the Israelites struck down and whose lands they took beyond the Jordan to the east, from the Arnon Valley to Mount Hermon, including all the Arabah eastward:
translation: Nau dispela i stap: king bilong kantri olsem wan Pipal Israel i kilim daun na ol i tumbuna na kisim kantri long sait bilong Jodan, bodi long Lambi Arnon go long Maunten Hermon, na olgeta Plen Araba long sais bilong solwara, na i go dasol.

original: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon. He ruled from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley, along the middle of the valley, up to the Jabbok River (the border of the Ammonites), that is, half of Gilead,
translation: Sihon king bilong Amoriti, em i stap long Heshbon. Em i rulim from Aroer long ai bilong Arnon Valley, long mit bilong valley, go long Jabbok River (em i border bilong Ammoniti), em i tok olsem, hap bilong Gilead,

original: as well as the Arabah east of the Sea of Chinnereth to the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea), eastward through Beth-jeshimoth, and southward below the slopes of Pisgah.
translation: Olsem na Arabah, bikosi long Solwara Chinnereth, go long Solwara Arabah (Solwara Salt), i go long bikosi troim long Beth-jeshimoth, na long sait bilong sospen na unda long Pisgah.

original: And Og king of Bashan, one of the remnant of the Rephaim, who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei.
translation: Na Og king bilong Bashan, wanpela husat i kam bek long ol Rephaim, em i stap long Ashtaroth na Edrei.

original: He ruled over Mount Hermon, Salecah, all of Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and half of Gilead to the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
translation: Em i bos long Maunten Hermon, Saleka, olgeta hap bilong Basan inap long borda bilong Geshuraitis na Maakatis, na hap bilong Gilead inap long borda bilong Sihon king bilong Heshbon.

original: Moses, the servant of the LORD, and the Israelites had struck them down and given their land as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Moses, i meri bilong LORD, na Ol Israel, ol i kilim ol daun, na givim kantri bilong ol long kantri bilong en long Ol Reubeni, Ol Gadi, na hap tribe bilong Manase.

original: And these are the kings of the land that Joshua and the Israelites conquered beyond the Jordan to the west, from Baal-gad in the Valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir (according to the allotments to the tribes of Israel, Joshua gave them as an inheritance
translation: Na dispela i stap: king bilong kantri ol i winim long sait bilong Jordan go wes, from Baal-gad long Vale bilong Lebanon go long Mount Halak, em i go antap long Seir, olsem laen bilong tribe bilong Israel, Joshua na Israelites i givim ol dispela kantri long ol tribe bilong Israel olsem inheritance.

original: the hill country, the foothills, the Arabah, the slopes, the wilderness, and the Negev—the lands of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites):
translation: Kantri bilong maunten, pati bilong maunten i go daun, Arabah, saits bilong maunten, bus, na Negev – ol lain bilong Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, na Jebusites:

original: the king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is near Bethel, one;
translation: King bilong Jeriko, wan; king bilong Ai, we i kamap long hap bilong Betel, wan;

original: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
translation: King bilong Jerusalem, wan; king bilong Hebron, wan;

original: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
translation: King bilong Jarmuth, wan; king bilong Lachish, wan;

original: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
translation: King bilong Eglon, wan; king bilong Gezer, wan;

original: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
translation: Kwin bilong Debir, wan; kwin bilong Geder, wan;

original: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
translation: King bilong Hormah, wan; king bilong Arad, wan;

original: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
translation: King bilong Libnah, wan; king bilong Adullam, wan;

original: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
translation: King bilong Makkedah, wan; king bilong Betel, wan;

original: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
translation: King bilong Tappuah, wan; king bilong Hepher, wan;

original: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;
translation: King bilong Aphek, wan; king bilong Lasharon, wan;

original: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
translation: King bilong Madon, wan; king bilong Hazor, wan;

original: the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
translation: King bilong Shimron-meron, wan; king bilong Achshaph, wan;

original: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
translation: King bilong Taanak, wan; king bilong Megido, wan;

original: the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
translation: King bilong Kedesh, wan; king bilong Jokneam long Carmel, wan;

original: the king of Dor in Naphath-dor, one; the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one;
translation: King bilong Dor long Naphath-dor, wan; king bilong Goiim long Gilgal, wan;

original: and the king of Tirzah, one. So there were thirty-one kings in all.
translation: Na king bilong Tirzah, wanpela. Olsem, tripli wan kings i stap olgeta.

original: Now Joshua was old and well along in years, and the LORD said to him, “You are old and well along in years, but very much of the land remains to be possessed.
translation: Nau Joshua em i go long olsem, em i go dae pinis long taim, na LORD i tokim em, "Yu olsem tua na i go dae pinis long taim, tasol planti peles i stap yet, i gat bikpela hap, yu mas was long mekim bilong yu."

original: This is the land that remains: All the territory of the Philistines and the Geshurites,
translation: Dispela i stap yet, em i graun: Olgeta hap kauntri bilong Filistia na Geshuria

original: from the Shihor east of Egypt to the territory of Ekron on the north (considered to be Canaanite territory)—that of the five Philistine rulers of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron, as well as that of the Avvites;
translation: Long stretem Shihor bilong isi long Egip go long hap graun bilong Ekron long not, ol i save em i ples bilong Kanana, em i inkludim ples bilong faiv lida bilong Filistia: Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, na Ekron, olsem na bilong Aviti.

original: to the south, all the land of the Canaanites, from Mearah of the Sidonians to Aphek, as far as the border of the Amorites;
translation: Long namel, olgeta graun bilong Kananaits, from Mearah bilong Sidonias to Aphek, inap long bun griw bilong Amoraitis;

original: the land of the Gebalites; and all Lebanon to the east, from Baal-gad below Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath.
translation: Kantri bilong Gebalites; na olgeta Lebanon long east sait, from Baal-gad aninita long Mount Hermon go long Lebo-hamath.

original: All the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim—all the Sidonians—I Myself will drive out before the Israelites. Be sure to divide it by lot as an inheritance to Israel, as I have commanded you.
translation: Ol pipol ol i stap long kantri bilong maunten, stat long Libanon go na kam long Misrephot-maim—ol Saidonia yet—Mi yet mas pilim ol i go bifo Israel. Yu mas skulim em i go long lot olsem inheritem long Israel, olsem Mi bin givim yu instruction.

original: Now therefore divide this land as an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
translation: Nau therefore, yu dividim dispela graun olsem brisbilong papa long nainpela tribe na hap tribe bilong Manase.

original: The other half of Manasseh, along with the Reubenites and Gadites, had received the inheritance Moses had given them beyond the Jordan to the east, just as Moses the servant of the LORD had assigned to them:
translation: Nap halp long Manase, wantaim ol Reubin na Gad, ol i kakarim inheritance bilong ol, olsem Musa, servant bilong LORD, i givim long ol, bihain wara Jordan long sindaun sun.

original: The area from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley, along with the city in the middle of the valley, the whole plateau of Medeba as far as Dibon,
translation: Plis long Aroer long sait bilong valley Arnon, olsem na tu city insait long mitim blo valley, olgeta hap graun blo Medeba go long Dibon.

original: and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the border of the Ammonites;
translation: Na olgeta taun bilong Sihon king bilong ol Amoriti, i bin king long Heshbon, long border yet bilong ol Ammoniti;

original: also Gilead and the territory of the Geshurites and Maacathites, all of Mount Hermon, and all Bashan as far as Salecah—
translation: Gilead na graun bilong em, olgeta lepen bilong Pipol Geshur na Pipol Maacath, algeta Maunt Hermon, na algeta Bashan long wei i go kas long Salecah—

original: the whole kingdom of Og in Bashan, who had reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei and had remained as a remnant of the Rephaim. Moses had struck them down and dispossessed them,
translation: Kingdom olgeta bilong Og king bilong Bashan, we em i bin reign long Ashtaroth na Edrei, na em i bin stap olsem ripaim bilong ol pipol bilong spirit Rephaim. Moses i bin kilim ol na tormewe ol long graun.

original: but the Israelites did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maacathites. So Geshur and Maacath dwell among the Israelites to this day.
translation: Na Israelait i no draivim olt long Geshurait na Maacathait. Olsem na, Geshur na Maacath i stap wantaim Israelait long tude.

original: To the tribe of Levi, however, Moses had given no inheritance. The offerings made by fire to the LORD, the God of Israel, are their inheritance, just as He had promised them.
translation: Long taim bilong Levi, Moses i no givim ol bilong en long ol. Ol samting we ol i bring long faia go long LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, em i stap long ol bilong ol, olsem em i promis long ol.

original: This is what Moses had given to the clans of the tribe of Reuben:
translation: Em i go bekim olsem Moses i givim long klans bilong traipe bilong Reuben:

original: The territory from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley, along with the city in the middle of the valley, to the whole plateau beyond Medeba,
translation: Ol hap graun from Aroer long sait bilong Arnon Valley, olsem na tu city insait long middle bilong valley, i go long olgeta ples flat i go bikos Medeba,

original: to Heshbon and all its cities on the plateau, including Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,
translation: Long Heshbon na ol geta ples bilong em long hanwes, olsem Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,

original: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
translation: Yahats, Kedemot, Mefaath,

original: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, Zereth-shahar on the hill in the valley,
translation: Kiriataim, Sibma, Seret-sahar long maunten i stap insait long vali.

original: Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth—
translation: Bet-Pio, daun bilong Pisga, na Bet-Jesimot —

original: all the cities of the plateau and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon until Moses killed him and the chiefs of Midian (Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba), the princes of Sihon who lived in the land.
translation: Olgeta siti long hap graun na olgeta kingdom bilong Sihon king bilong Amorites, we em i stap rulim Heshbon yet, na Mosese i kilim em, na olgeta bif bilong Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, na Reba, olgeta prins bilong Sihon we i stap long lan.

original: The Israelites also killed the diviner Balaam son of Beor along with the others they put to the sword.
translation: Olia Isrelaita i kilim man i save harim tok bilong spirit, Balaam Pikinini bilong Beor, olgeta manmeri i go daun long sod.

original: And the border of the Reubenites was the bank of the Jordan. This was the inheritance of the clans of the Reubenites, including the cities and villages.
translation: Na kauntri bilong ol Reubenites i go daun long Rip bilong Jordan. Dispela em i brigina bilong ol kaen Reubenites, na i includim ol taun na vilij bilong ol.

original: This is what Moses had given to the clans of the tribe of Gad:
translation: Em i go nau long stori bilong Moisi, em i givim long klana bilong taip bilong Gad:

original: The territory of Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites as far as Aroer, near Rabbah;
translation: Kauntri bilong Jazer, ol siti bilong Gilead, na hap kauntri bilong Ammonites longwe go Aroer, klostu long Rabbah;

original: the territory from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir;
translation: Olgeta ples long Heshbon na Ramath-mizpeh, na Betonim, na long Mahanaim ikam inap long bonda bilong Debir;

original: and in the valley, Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, with the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon (the territory on the east side of the Jordan up to the edge of the Sea of Chinnereth).
translation: Na long valley, Bet-Haram, Bet-Nimra, Sukot, na Safon, wantaim ol arere kingdoms bilong kingdom bilong Sihon king bilong Heshbon (ol ples long sait bilong solwara Jordan, long sait eastern, i go inap long Solwara Chinneret).

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the Gadites, including the cities and villages.
translation: Em i brigeta bilong ol clan bilong Gadit, inklusiv taun na vilij.

original: This is what Moses had given to the clans of the half-tribe of Manasseh, that is, to half the tribe of the descendants of Manasseh:
translation: Em i go bikim olsem Moses i givim long klans bilong hap-tribe bilong Manasseh, em i tok olsem, long hap tribe bilong ol desenden bilong Manasseh.

original: The territory from Mahanaim through all Bashan—all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, including all the towns of Jair that are in Bashan, sixty cities;
translation: Ol lanan long Mahanaim na olgeta hap bilong Bashan - ol kingdom bilong Og king bilong Bashan, inklusiv ol ples bilong Jair i stap long Bashan, olgeta, sikisiti taon;

original: half of Gilead; and Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og in Bashan. All this was for the clans of the descendants of Machir son of Manasseh, that is, half of the descendants of Machir.
translation: Hap bilong Gilead, na Ashtaroth na Edrei, em i sitibilo bilong king bilong Og long Bashan. Ol dispela i go long ol clan bilong desenden bilong Machir, pikinini bilong Manasseh, em i hap bilong desenden bilong Machir.

original: These were the portions Moses had given them on the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan, east of Jericho.
translation: Em i narapela hap bilong ol, mosese i givim ol long taim bipo long plaen bilong Moab, long sait bilong Jordan i go daun, long east sait bilong Jeriko.

original: To the tribe of Levi, however, Moses had given no inheritance. The LORD, the God of Israel, is their inheritance, just as He had promised them.
translation: Long tribe bilong Levi, Moses i no givim inheritance olsem. LORD, God bilong Israel, em i inheritance bilong ol, olsem em i promis long ol.

original: Now these are the portions that the Israelites inherited in the land of Canaan, as distributed by Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of Israel.
translation: Nau em i kam wantaim ol portion ol Israelites i inheritance long lan bilong Kanaan, ol i bin dividim olgeta long taim Eleaza prist, Josua sun bilong Nun, na ol bikpela hap bilong ol famili bilong ol tribe bilong Israel i bin givim.

original: Their inheritance was assigned by lot for the nine and a half tribes, as the LORD had commanded through Moses.
translation: Inheritance bilong ol i go dasol long we bilong nain na hap tripes, olsem LORD i tok from Mosese.

original: For Moses had given the inheritance east of the Jordan to the other two and a half tribes. But he granted no inheritance among them to the Levites.
translation: Moses i givim inheretans long ol narapela tu na hap tribes long sait bilong Jordan. Tasol em i no givim inheretans long en long ol Levites.

original: The descendants of Joseph became two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim. And no portion of the land was given to the Levites, except for cities in which to live, along with pasturelands for their flocks and herds.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Yosep i kamap tu tribe, Manase na Efraim. Na ino pati bilong graun i givim long ol Levit, apart from tauns olsem ples bilong ol wankain bai i stap, longsait wantaim graun bilong ol kisim bek bilong ol bulmakau na ol pig.

original: So the Israelites did as the LORD had commanded Moses, and they divided the land.
translation: Na Pipol bilong Israel i mekim olsem Jehovah i tokim Mose, na ol i dividim graun.

original: Then the sons of Judah approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know what the LORD said to Moses the man of God at Kadesh-barnea about you and me.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Yuda i kam klostu long Yosua hait long Gilgal, na Kalebu, papa bilong Jefuneh, Kenizita, i tokim em: "Yu save olsem LORD i tok long Mosesi, man bilong God, long Kadesi-Barnea, tok bilong yu na mine."

original: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the LORD sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I brought back to him an honest report.
translation: Mi bin 40 yia olsem, Moses, hambut bilong Bikpela, i sendim mi from Kadesi-barnea go lukim graun, na mi kisim bek i go long em, ripot i kam true.

original: Although my brothers who went with me made the hearts of the people melt with fear, I remained loyal to the LORD my God.
translation: Maski ol brata bilong me i go wantaim me, ol i wailakim het bilong ol pipol long bikpela fear, mi yet stap strong long han bilong LORD God bilong mi.

original: On that day Moses swore to me, saying, ‘Surely the land on which you have set foot will be an inheritance to you and your children forever, because you have wholly followed the LORD my God.’
translation: Long dei em, Moses i kam bekim promis long me, olsem, 'Graun we yu go wakabaut long en bai kam bekim inharent long yu na ol pikinini bilong yu oltaim, bikos yu trai olgeta bihain Lord God bilong mi stret.'

original: Now behold, as the LORD promised, He has kept me alive these forty-five years since He spoke this word to Moses, while Israel wandered in the wilderness. So here I am today, eighty-five years old,
translation: Nau lukim, olsem LORD i promis, Em i save me long life forty-five yia, tain bai em i tok dispela to Moses, wail Israel i wankain long bus. Na mi stap hariap long tede, eighty-five yia nau.

original: still as strong today as I was the day Moses sent me out. As my strength was then, so it is now for war, for going out, and for coming in.
translation: Mi stap strong yet olsem na mi bin go long taim Moses bin sendim mi go, Strongpela bilong mi em i nogat birua, olsem nau em i kam bek gen long war, long go na long kam.

original: Now therefore give me this hill country that the LORD promised me on that day, for you yourself heard then that the Anakim were there, with great and fortified cities. Perhaps with the LORD’s help I will drive them out, as the LORD has spoken.”
translation: Nau therefore givim mi dispela hap graun we LORD promisim mi long de, bikos yuselves harim tok bilong en ten, na Anakim i stap, wantaim taun ol i gat bikpela wal. Em ino, long help bilong LORD bai mi ken driveim ol i go, olsem LORD i tok.

original: Then Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.
translation: Na Yosua i blesim Kaleb, pikinini bilong Jefuneh, na i givim Hebron long em olsem inheritance bilong em.

original: Therefore Hebron belongs to Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite as an inheritance to this day, because he wholly followed the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Hebron i bilong Caleb sussa Jephunneh ol Kenizzite, olsem inheritance long tede, yet, bikos em i go bihain pinis long LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: (Hebron used to be called Kiriath-arba, after Arba, the greatest man among the Anakim.) Then the land had rest from war.
translation: Hebron bifo em i kolim Kiriath-arba, long taim bilong Arba, em i bikpela man tasol long ol Anakim. Na gras bilong kantri i pundaun, nabek war igat pinis.

original: Now the allotment for the clans of the tribe of Judah extended to the border of Edom, to the Wilderness of Zin at the extreme southern boundary:
translation: Nau, kaikai bilong clan bilong taim bilong Yuda i go long hap boundary bilong Edom, long Wilerness bilong Zin, long sait bilong sauten moa yet.

original: Their southern border started at the bay on the southern tip of the Salt Sea,
translation: Boda bilong ol i stat long saut, long bem bilong solwara, long hap bilong Sautip, long Saut Sea.

original: proceeded south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, continued on to Zin, went over to the south of Kadesh-barnea, ran past Hezron up to Addar, and curved toward Karka.
translation: I go daun sait bilong Asens bilong Akrabbim, em i kontinu long go long Zin, em i go daun sait bilong Kadesh-barnea, em i ran i pas Hezron go long Addar, na em i bin kurv i kam long Karka.

original: It proceeded to Azmon, joined the Brook of Egypt, and ended at the Sea. This was their southern border.
translation: Em i go inap long Azmon, em i bin jonim Wator Musong long Egip, na em i pinis long Solwara. Dispela em i borda bilong sauten blong ol.

original: The eastern border was the Salt Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan. The northern border started from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan,
translation: Boda eastern em i Salt Si longwe go na kam bek long maus bilong Jordan. Boda northern em i stat long bey bilong solwara long maus bilong Jordan,

original: went up to Beth-hoglah, proceeded north of Beth-arabah, and went up to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
translation: Ol i go ap long Beth-hoglah, em i prosid nabaut long Beth-arabah, na em i go ap long Stoun bilong Bohan pikinini bilong Reuben.

original: Then the border went up to Debir from the Valley of Achor, turning north to Gilgal, which faces the Ascent of Adummim south of the ravine. It continued along the waters of En-shemesh and came out at En-rogel.
translation: Boda i go ap long Debir from Vali bilong Akor, i turn long not long Gilgal, we em i luk i go daun long Asens bilong Adumim klostu long sait bilong raven. I stap olsem long wara bilong En-shemesh na i kam aut long En-rogel.

original: From there the border went up the Valley of Hinnom along the southern slope of the Jebusites (that is, Jerusalem) and ascended to the top of the hill that faces the Valley of Hinnom on the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Long hap, boda i go ap long Vale Hinnom, long sait bilong sauten bilong Jebusait (em i Jerusalem) na i kam ap igo long top bilong hil we em i lukim daun Vale Hinnom long wes, long hap em i northern end bilong Vale Rephaim.

original: From the hilltop the border curved to the spring of the Waters of Nephtoah, proceeded to the cities of Mount Ephron, and then bent around toward Baalah (that is, Kiriath-jearim).
translation: Long hap bilong maunten i kaunti igo raun, i go long Wata Nephtoah, olsem wara, i go long ol taun bilong Maunten Ephron, na i beng raun go long Baalah, em i Kiriath-jearim.

original: The border curled westward from Baalah to Mount Seir, ran along the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Chesalon), went down to Beth-shemesh, and crossed to Timnah.
translation: Borana i karim na go wes from Baala long Maunt Seir, i ran i go long sait bilong noran bilong Maunt Jearim (emas Tesalon), i go daun i go long Bet-Semes, na i krus i go long Timna.

original: Then it went out to the northern slope of Ekron, curved toward Shikkeron, proceeded to Mount Baalah, went on to Jabneel, and ended at the Sea.
translation: Em i go long sait bilong not Ekron, i karim na i kisim daunoa long Shikkeron, ol i go inap long Maunt Baalah, ol i go long Jabneel, na i pinis long Solwara.

original: And the western border was the coastline of the Great Sea. These are the boundaries around the clans of the descendants of Judah.
translation: Na boda bilong wes em i stap kos bilong Solwara Bikpela. Dispela olgeta kauntri bilong ol klan bilong ol desenden bilong Yuda.

original: According to the LORD’s command to him, Joshua gave Caleb son of Jephunneh a portion among the sons of Judah—Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron. (Arba was the forefather of Anak.)
translation: Olsem LORD i givim tok, Joshua i givim Caleb son of Jephunneh ka long ol pikinini bilong Judah - Kiriath-arba, em i Hebron. (Araba em i papa bilong Anak).

original: And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak—the descendants of Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
translation: Na Kaleba rausim ol long hap: ol three pikinini bilong Anak - ol desenden bilong Sesai, Ahiman, na Talmai, ol pikinini bilong Anak.

original: From there he marched against the inhabitants of Debir (formerly known as Kiriath-sepher).
translation: Na em i go bek long ples, i kam bek gen long ol pipol bilong Debir, ples we bilong taim bifo ol i save kolim Kiriath-sepher.

original: And Caleb said, “To the man who strikes down Kiriath-sepher and captures it, I will give my daughter Acsah in marriage.”
translation: Na Kalebu i tok, “Ol man husat i kilim Kiriath-sepher na kisim em, mi bai givim pikinini meri Aksa long marit.”

original: So Othniel son of Caleb’s brother Kenaz captured the city, and Caleb gave his daughter Acsah to him in marriage.
translation: Otniel, pikinini bilong brata bilong Keleb Kenaz, im bin kisim taun, na Keleb i givim daughta bilong en Aksa long em olsem meri.

original: One day Acsah came to Othniel and urged him to ask her father for a field. When she got off her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What do you desire?”
translation: Wanpela de Acsah i kam klostu long Othniel na em i askim Othniel long go bek askim papa bilong em olsem givim em wanpela ples. Taim em i kambek long graun from donki, Caleb i askim em, "Yu laikim wanem?"

original: “Give me a blessing,” she answered. “Since you have given me land in the Negev, give me springs of water as well.” So Caleb gave her both the upper and lower springs.
translation: “Givim mi blesing,” em i tok. “Yusim yu givim mi graun long Negev, givim mi ol spring water tu.” Na Kaleba i givim em yet bot ol spring bilong op na ol spring bilong daun.

original: This is the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Judah.
translation: Em i inheritis bilong ol clans bilong tribe bilong Yuda.

original: These were the southernmost cities of the tribe of Judah in the Negev toward the border of Edom: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
translation: Dispela i stap long siti mosbi long saut bilong taip bilong Joda long ples Negev i go long kauntri Edom: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur.

original: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
translation: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah, ol nem bilong ples i stap long Baibel.

original: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
translation: Kedes, Hazor, Ithnan, ol nem bilong ples bilong Baibel.

original: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
translation: Sip, Telim, Bialot,

original: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron (that is, Hazor),
translation: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron (em i Hazor tasol)

original: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
translation: Amam, Shema, Moladah, ol nem bilong ples i stap long ples bilong Baibel.

original: Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, Beth-pelet,
translation: Hazar-gada, Hesmon, Bet-Pele,

original: Hazar-shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
translation: Hajasual, Bia Siba, Bisiotia,

original: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
translation: Baala, Iim, Ezem, ol nem bilong ples long lokeshon bilong graun.

original: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
translation: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah, ol nem bilong ples bilong Baibol.

original: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
translation: Siklag, Madimana, Sansana,

original: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon—twenty-nine cities in all, along with their villages.
translation: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, na Rimmon—taun 29 olgeta, wantaim vilij bilong ol.

original: These were in the foothills: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
translation: Ol i stap long bun bilong maunten: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah

original: Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
translation: Zanoa, En-Ganin, Tappua, Enam, ol ples i stap long nem bilong ples bilong Baibol.

original: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
translation: Jarmut, Adulam, Sokoh, Aseka, ol siti hait long lis bilong siti we i kam long ol ples we istap long taim bipo long Israel.

original: Shaaraim, Adithaim, and Gederah (or Gederothaim)—fourteen cities, along with their villages.
translation: Shaaraim, Adithaim, na Gederah (o Gederothaim)—pati foa taun, wantaim ol vilij bilong ol.

original: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal-gad,
translation: Sinen, Hadasa, Migdal-gad,

original: Dilan, Mizpeh, Joktheel,
translation: Dilan, Mizpeh, Joktheel, nem bilong ples long Baibel

original: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
translation: Lakisi, Boskath, Egolon,

original: Cabbon, Lahmas, Chitlish,
translation: Kabon, Ramaz, Sitlis

original: Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah—sixteen cities, along with their villages.
translation: Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, na Makkedah – taun sikis, wantaim vilij ol bilong ol.

original: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
translation: Libnai, Ezer, Asani,

original: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
translation: Iphta, Asna, Nezib,

original: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah—nine cities, along with their villages.
translation: Keilah, Achzib, na Mareshah—nain siti, longlong ol vilij bilong ol.

original: Ekron, with its towns and villages;
translation: Ekron, wantaim tauns bilong em na vilij bilong em;

original: from Ekron to the sea, all the cities near Ashdod, along with their villages;
translation: Long Ekron i go kas long solwara, ol taun narak long Ashdod, wantaim ol vilij long ol;

original: Ashdod, with its towns and villages; Gaza, with its towns and villages, as far as the Brook of Egypt and the coastline of the Great Sea.
translation: Asod, wantaim taun na vilij long em, Gaza, wantaim taun na vilij long em, ol i stap long wei na rivi bilong Ijip na kos long bikpela solwara.

original: These were in the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
translation: Dispela i bist long kantri hailan: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,

original: Dannah, Kiriath-sannah (that is, Debir),
translation: Dannah, Kiriath-sannah (em i Debir)
