original: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
translation: Anap, Estimoh, Anim, ol i stap long ol nem bilong ples nau.

original: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh—eleven cities, along with their villages.
translation: Gosen, Holon, na Giloh—siti eleben, longol namba vilij bilong ol.

original: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
translation: Aleb, Damak, Esan,

original: Janim, Beth-tappuah, Aphekah,
translation: Janim, Bet-Tapua, Aphekah

original: Humtah, Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior—nine cities, along with their villages.
translation: Humtah, Kiriath-arba em i go bikos Hebron, na Zior – nain sities, wantaim vilij long ol.

original: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
translation: Maon, Kamel, Sip, Juta,

original: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
translation: Jezirel, Jokdeam, Sanoa,

original: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah—ten cities, along with their villages.
translation: Kain, Gibeah, na Timnah—tenpela towns, wantaim olgeta vilij long ol.

original: Halhul, Beth-zur, Gedor,
translation: Halhul, Bet-sur, Gedor, ol ples i stap long nem bilong ples bilong Baibol.

original: Maarath, Beth-anoth, and Eltekon—six cities, along with their villages.
translation: Maarath, Beth-anoth, na Eltekon—sikisiti taun, olgeta vilij long namel, wantaim vilij ol i bilong ol.

original: Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim), and Rabbah—two cities, along with their villages.
translation: Kiriath-baal, em i Kiriath-jearim, na Rabbah - tu taun, wantaim ol vilij bilong ol.

original: These were in the wilderness: Beth-arabah, Middin, Secacah,
translation: Dispela i ol stap long stret bilong bus: Bet-Arabah, Middin, Sekakah,

original: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En-gedi—six cities, along with their villages.
translation: Nibshan, Siti bilong Sol, na En-gedi—sikis siti, olgeta vilij long ol.

original: But the descendants of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites living in Jerusalem. So to this day the Jebusites live there among the descendants of Judah.
translation: Bikos ol desenden bilong Yuda no inap kasim aut ol Jebusait i stap long Jerusalem, na todei ol Jebusait i stap yet beklong ol desenden bilong Yuda.

original: The allotment for the descendants of Joseph extended from the Jordan at Jericho to the waters of Jericho on the east, through the wilderness that goes up from Jericho into the hill country of Bethel.
translation: Ka long ol desenden bilong Yosep i go long Jordan lon Jeriko, na i kam bes long wara bilong Jeriko long hap east, na i go insait long bus long hap go antap long Jeriko go long maunten bilong Betel.

original: It went on from Bethel (that is, Luz) and proceeded to the border of the Archites in Ataroth.
translation: Em i go pas long Bethel, ples bilong lotu, (emas em i Luz) na i kam inap long boundary bilong Archites long Ataroth.

original: Then it descended westward to the border of the Japhletites as far as the border of Lower Beth-horon and on to Gezer, and it ended at the Sea.
translation: Em i kam daun wes, long ren na Japhletait, inap long ren bilong Lo Beth-horon, go inap long Gezer, em i pinis long Solwara.

original: So Ephraim and Manasseh, the sons of Joseph, received their inheritance.
translation: Na Efraim na Manase, ol pikinini bilong Yosep, ol i patin tumas long inherita bilong ol.

original: This was the territory of the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: The border of their inheritance went from Ataroth-addar in the east to Upper Beth-horon
translation: Dispela em ipla grawn bilong pikinini Ephraim ol i kamap long ol clan bilong ol: Baingrawn bilong inhitan bilong ol i go long Ataroth-addar long sindaun sun i go inap long Beth-horon hap.

original: and out toward the Sea. From Michmethath on the north it turned eastward toward Taanath-shiloh and passed by it to Janoah on the east.
translation: Na em i go long nau long Solwara. Long Michmethath long not, em i go bek long east susa i kam kas long Taanath-shiloh, na em i pasim i go long Janoah long east.

original: From Janoah it went down to Ataroth and Naarah, and then reached Jericho and came out at the Jordan.
translation: Long Janoa em i go daun i kam long Atarot na Naara, na em i kam reach long Jeriko, na em i kam aut long Jordan.

original: From Tappuah the border went westward to the Brook of Kanah and ended at the Sea. This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Ephraim,
translation: Bai boundari i go wes long Tappuah, i pas long Wara Kanah, na i pinis long Solwara. Dispela em i brigina bilong clan ol long tribe bilong Efraim.

original: along with all the cities and villages set apart for the descendants of Ephraim within the inheritance of Manasseh.
translation: Wantaim olgeta taun na viles i skelim ap long nambis, i kamap long pinis bilong ol desenden bilong Efrem long laman bilong Manase.

original: But they did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer. So the Canaanites dwell among the Ephraimites to this day, but they are forced laborers.
translation: Bai ol i no ken driveim otside Ol Kanani husat i stap long Geza. Nogat, Ol Kanani i stap wantaim Ol Efrayimi long taim nau, tasol ol i wokman husat i wok bung.

original: Now this was the allotment for the tribe of Manasseh as Joseph’s firstborn son, namely for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh and father of the Gileadites, who had received Gilead and Bashan because Machir was a man of war.
translation: Nau dispela em i go long tribe bilong Manasse olsem pikinini namba wan bilong Joseph, bikos em i papa bilong Machir, mama bilong Gileadi, na em i man bilong paiya, na em i kisim Gilead na Bashan.

original: So this allotment was for the rest of the descendants of Manasseh—the clans of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These are the other male descendants of the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph.
translation: Dispensesen i go long ol narapela pikinini bilong Manasseh – ol clan bilong Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, na Shemida. Dispela ol man i narapela pikinini bilong ol clan bilong Manasseh, pikinini bilong Joseph.

original: But Zelophehad son of Hepher (the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh) had no sons but only daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
translation: Bata Zelophehad a pikinini bilong Hepher, ai bilong Gilead, ai bilong Machir, ai bilong Manasseh, i no gat man, tasol i gat ol meri pikinini. Dispela em i nem bilong ol meri pikinini bilong em: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, na Tirzah.

original: They approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders, and said, “The LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers.” So Joshua gave them an inheritance among their father’s brothers, in keeping with the command of the LORD.
translation: Ol i go klostu long Eleazar priester, Josa bin Nun, na ol bikpela, na ol i tokim, "Papa God i givim toksave long Moses olsem: givim mipela kantri bilong mipela long ol brata bilong mipela." Na Josa i givim ol kantri bilong ol long ol brata bilong papa bilong ol, strongim pasin bilong priester, na ol i bihainim toksave bilong Papa God.

original: Thus ten shares fell to Manasseh, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan beyond the Jordan,
translation: Thus ten hap bilong Manasseh i kam bek long em, bikosi sait long graun bilong Gilead na Bashan, longsait long Jordan.

original: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons. And the land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the sons of Manasseh.
translation: Bikos daughters bilong Manase i kamapim shar blong en long ol pikinini man bilong en, na gras bilong Gilead i bilong ol narapela sons bilong Manase.

original: Now the border of Manasseh went from Asher to Michmethath near Shechem, then southward to include the inhabitants of En-tappuah.
translation: Kauntri bilong Manase i go long Asha na stop long Michimethat, klostu long Sikem, na saposa i go daun na kisim ol pipel bilong En-tappuah.

original: The region of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but Tappuah itself, on the border of Manasseh, belonged to Ephraim.
translation: Distrik bilong Tappuah i bin bilong Manasseh, tasol Tappuah em yet i bilong Ephraim long boda bilong Manasseh.

original: From there the border continued southward to the Brook of Kanah. There were cities belonging to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh, but the border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook and ended at the Sea.
translation: Na win go i go daunbung long sait, long hap em i stap, i go long wanpela wara i kolim Kanah. I gat towns bilong Ephraim i mekim wan wantaim ol towns bilong Manasseh, tasol banis bilong Manasseh i stap long hap sait bilong wara na i pinis long Solwara.

original: Ephraim’s territory was to the south, and Manasseh’s was to the north, having the Sea as its border and adjoining Asher on the north and Issachar on the east.
translation: Efraim ilaun i stap long sait, na Manasi ilaun i stap long not, i gat Solwara olsem banis, na i jikim wantaim Asa long not na Isakara long east.

original: Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh was assigned Beth-shean, Ibleam, Dor (that is, Naphath), Endor, Taanach, and Megiddo, each with their surrounding settlements.
translation: Long ol Isakara na Asa, Manasi i kamapim Bet-Shean, Ibilema, Do, em i tok olsem Nafata, Endo, Taanaki, na Megido, olgeta wanpela wantaim vilij bilong ol.

original: But the descendants of Manasseh were unable to occupy these cities, because the Canaanites were determined to stay in this land.
translation: Tasol ol desenden bilong Manase no inap bai stap i go long en, bikos dispela ol Canaanites i gat bel kol wantim bai stap long graun em.

original: However, when the Israelites grew stronger, they put the Canaanites to forced labor; but they failed to drive them out completely.
translation: Taim Israeliti i kamap strongpela, ol i wokim Canaaniti long wok forcim, tasol ol i no inap drivim ol aut gut.

original: Then the sons of Joseph said to Joshua, “Why have you given us only one portion as an inheritance? We have many people, because the LORD has blessed us abundantly.”
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Yosep i tokim Yosua, “Bikpela, yu givim mipela wanpe na infield long pasin bilong papa na mama tasol. Mipela i gat planti manmeri, bikos Bikpela i blesim mipela plenti.”

original: Joshua answered them, “If you have so many people that the hill country of Ephraim is too small for you, go to the forest and clear for yourself an area in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim.”
translation: Joshua i ansa ol long tok, “Yupela i gat planti manmeri, kantri bilong maunten bilong Efrem i no narak long yupela, orait yupela go long bus na kisim ples na kliaim grasn bilong Perizzites na Rephaim.”

original: “The hill country is not enough for us,” they replied, “and all the Canaanites who live in the valley have iron chariots, both in Beth-shean with its towns and in the Valley of Jezreel.”
translation: “Kantri long han bilong maunten i no inap long mipela,” ol i tok, “na olgeta Kananaits husat i stap long vale i gat kareta iron, long Beth-shean wantaim ol towns bilong en na long Vale Jezreel.”

original: So Joshua said to the house of Joseph—to Ephraim and Manasseh—“You have many people and great strength. You shall not have just one allotment,
translation: Josaia i tokim husat i kam long Josef - Efrayim na Manase, "yu gat planti manmeri na strongpela streng, yu no inap long hap wanpela alitom bilong tribe."

original: because the hill country will be yours as well. It is a forest; clear it, and its farthest limits will be yours. Although the Canaanites have iron chariots and although they are strong, you can drive them out.”
translation: Bikos kantri long han bilong yu, em i go long yu tu. Em i stap long bus, kisim oltait na rausim, na boundary bilong en i go long yu. Maski Kanaanit i gat kareta long aisen, na ol i strong, yu ken drivim ol i go.

original: Then the whole congregation of Israel assembled at Shiloh and set up the Tent of Meeting there. And though the land was subdued before them,
translation: Na olgeta asamble bilong Isrel i kam tu long Shiloh na ol i setim ap Haus Bilong Miting long hap bembe. Na kuntry i winim, stap daun bifo ol.

original: there were still seven tribes of Israel who had not yet received their inheritance.
translation: I gat stap yet tribe sewen bilong Isrel, na ina em i no kam bek yet, ol i no katim ka moning long ol.

original: So Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you put off entering and possessing the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, has given you?
translation: Ol i tokim ol Israel, "Oli lang bai yu putim of go insait na taker ovana graun we LORD, God bilong papa bilong yu, em i givim yu?"

original: Appoint three men from each tribe, and I will send them out to survey the land and map it out, according to the inheritance of each. Then they will return to me
translation: Tukim tripela man long bek bilong yumi, na bai mi salim ol i go lukim graun, ol bai mapim graun, strongim ples bilong inait bilong yumi. Ol bai kam bek gen long me.

original: and divide the land into seven portions. Judah shall remain in their territory in the south, and the house of Joseph shall remain in their territory in the north.
translation: Na dividim graun long sevén hap. Juda i mas stap insait long en teritori long saut, na haus bilong Joseph i mas stap insait long en teritori long not.

original: When you have mapped out the seven portions of land and brought it to me, I will cast lots for you here in the presence of the LORD our God.
translation: Wanpela taim yu ken makim pepa bilong seven ples, na brin Gim i kam long me, bai mi kisim ston long lukim wei bilong yu long hia, long ai bilong LORD God bilong yumi.

original: The Levites, however, have no portion among you, because their inheritance is the priesthood of the LORD. And Gad, Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh have already received the inheritance that Moses the servant of the LORD gave them beyond the Jordan to the east.”
translation: Ol Levit i no gat pepa long mipela, bikos inheritance bilong ol em i priesthood bilong LORD. Na Gad, Reuben, na hap tribe bilong Manasseh ol i kisim inheritance already, we Moses servant bilong LORD i givim ol long en, bihain long Jordan i go long east sait.

original: As the men got up to go out, Joshua commanded them to map out the land, saying, “Go and survey the land, map it out, and return to me. Then I will cast lots for you here in Shiloh in the presence of the LORD.”
translation: Ol man i get up nau long go aut, Josua i tokim ol, "Mipela laik makim ples," olsem toktok, "Yu go na lukim ples, mapim ples, na kam bek long me. Na bai mipela kirap ston long yu hap inpas long Silo bilong Bikpela."

original: So the men departed and went throughout the land, mapping it city by city into seven portions. Then they returned with the document to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.
translation: Ol man i go daun, na ol i go wail long graun, mappingim ples bilong en taun long taun long sevén hap. Na bai ol i kam bek gen long dokiment, na brin Gim long Joshua long ples Silo we ol i stap.

original: And Joshua cast lots for them in the presence of the LORD at Shiloh, where he distributed the land to the Israelites according to their divisions.
translation: Na Josua i kastim ston long hap bilong LORD long Silo, na givim graun long Israelites ol bikos bilong ol grup.

original: The first lot came up for the clans of the tribe of Benjamin. Their allotted territory lay between the tribes of Judah and Joseph:
translation: Em i kamap nambar wan long ol clan bilong tribe Benjimin. Grain bilong ol, boundari bilong ol i stap long mipela bilong tribe Juda na Josep.

original: On the north side their border began at the Jordan, went up past the northern slope of Jericho, headed west through the hill country, and came out at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
translation: Long sait bilong not, boda bilong ol i statim long Jordan, i go pas long sait bilong maunten long not bilong Jeriko, i go wes konnek long kantri bilong maunten, na i kam aut long bus bilong Bet-aven.

original: From there the border crossed over to the southern slope of Luz (that is, Bethel) and went down to Ataroth-addar on the hill south of Lower Beth-horon.
translation: Na stap boundary i go pas long hap sait bilong Luz (em i Betel) na i kam daun long Ataroth-addar long maunten sait bilong Beth-horon lo.

original: On the west side the border curved southward from the hill facing Beth-horon on the south and came out at Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim), a city of the sons of Judah. This was the western side.
translation: Long sait bilong wes, bauerlain i go daun long saut from hap bilong mauntin we i luk daun long Beth-horon long saut na i kam aut long Kiriath-baal (em i Kiriath-jearim), taun bilong pikinini bilong Yuda. Em i sait bilong wes.

original: On the south side the border began at the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim and extended westward to the spring at the Waters of Nephtoah.
translation: Long sait bilong sout, baira i kamapim long Kiriath-jearim na i go baket long wes kasol long spring long Wata bilong Nephtoah.

original: Then it went down to the foot of the hill that faces the Valley of Hinnom at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim and ran down the Valley of Hinnom toward the southern slope of the Jebusites and downward to En-rogel.
translation: Na em i go daun long fut bilong hil we i lukim Vali bilong Hinnom long hap bilong nort bilong Vali bilong Rephaim, na ol i ran i go daun long Vali bilong Hinnom long sait bilong Jebusites long saut, na em i kam daun long En-rogel.

original: From there it curved northward and proceeded to En-shemesh and on to Geliloth facing the Ascent of Adummim, and continued down to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
translation: Em i bin go apo long not na i go long ples En-shemesh, na ol i luk lu long Geliloth, ol i luk lu long Asens bilong Adummim, na em i go daun i kamap long Stoun bilong Bohan man bilong Ruben.

original: Then it went on to the northern slope of Beth-arabah and went down into the valley.
translation: Em i go nap long sait bilong nort bilong Bet-Arabah na em i go daun long vali.

original: The border continued to the northern slope of Beth-hoglah and came out at the northern bay of the Salt Sea, at the mouth of the Jordan. This was the southern border.
translation: Boreda i go on long saitep notan bilong Beth-hoglah na i kam aut long notan bae bilong Solwara Salt, long maus bilong Jordan. Em i bodija sauden.

original: On the east side the border was the Jordan. These were the borders around the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Benjamin.
translation: Long sais bilong east, kaunti em i stap long Jordan. Dispela olgeta araon long inheritance bilong clan bilong tribe bilong Benjamin.

original: These were the cities of the clans of the tribe of Benjamin: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
translation: Dispela i stap: siti bilong sip bilong klans bilong taim bilong Benjimin: Jeriko, Bet-hogla, Emek-keziz,

original: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
translation: Bet-Arabah, Zemaraim, Betel,

original: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
translation: Avvim, Para, Ofra,

original: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, and Geba—twelve cities, along with their villages.
translation: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, na Geba—twelve siti, nem bilong siti olgeta, inkludivm ples bilong vilij.

original: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
translation: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth, nem bilong tripela ples i go: Gibeon, Ramah, na Beeroth.

original: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
translation: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah, ples tri nem bilong ples i stap long Buk Baibol.

original: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
translation: Rikem, Ipil, Tarlalak, nem bilong ples i stap long Baibel.

original: Zelah, Haeleph, Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath-jearim—fourteen cities, along with their villages. This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Benjamin.
translation: Zelah, Haeleph, Jebus (em i tok olsem Jerusalem), Gibeah, na Kiriath-jearim – siti foatinen, watpo long ol vilij bilong ol. Dispela em i inheritans bilong clan bilong tribe Benjamin.

original: The second lot came out for the clans of the tribe of Simeon: Their inheritance lay within the territory of Judah
translation: Sekond ples ikam aut long clan bilong tribe bilong Simeon: Inheritance bilong ol i stap inside grin bilong Yuda

original: and included Beersheba (or Sheba), Moladah,
translation: na kamapim Bia Siba (oa Siba), Moladah,

original: Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,
translation: Hajasuwal, Bala, Ezem, ol i stap long nem bilong ples bilong lokeshon bilong graun.

original: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
translation: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah, ol nem bilong ples i stap long Baibel.

original: Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susah,
translation: Siklag, Bet-Markabot, Hasa-Susa,

original: Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen—thirteen cities, along with their villages.
translation: Bet Lebao, na Saruhena—kampela taun thirteen, wantaim vilij olgeta bilong ol.

original: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan—four cities, along with their villages,
translation: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, na Ashan – foa taun, wantaim ol vilij blong ol,

original: and all the villages surrounding these cities as far as Baalath-beer (Ramah of the Negev). This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Simeon.
translation: Na ol vilij long ailan bilong siti, long wei i go inap Baalath-beer (Ramah bilong Negev). Em i brigim pe na inheritance bilong ol clan bilong tribe bilong Simeon.

original: The inheritance of the Simeonites was taken from the territory of Judah, because the share for Judah’s descendants was too large for them. So the Simeonites received an inheritance within Judah’s portion.
translation: Ineritas bilong Simeonites igat i kam long teritori bilong Judah, bikos sha bilong ol desenden bilong Judah i bikpela tumas long ol. Olsem na Simeonites igat ineritas insait long posen bilong Judah.

original: The third lot came up for the clans of the tribe of Zebulun: The border of their inheritance stretched as far as Sarid.
translation: Lot namba tri kamap long clan bilong taim bilong Zebulun: Boda bilong olgeta inheritance em i stret long Sarid.

original: It went up westward to Maralah, reached Dabbesheth, and met the brook east of Jokneam.
translation: I go ap long wes tasol i kamap long Maralah, i kamap long Dabbesheth, na i kisim i stop long bun bisnis Jokneam.

original: From Sarid it turned eastward along the border of Chisloth-tabor and went on to Daberath and up to Japhia.
translation: Long Sarid em i go long east sai, em i go long sait bilong borda bilong Chisloth-tabor, em i go inap long Daberath, na em i go ap inap long Japhia.

original: From there it crossed eastward to Gath-hepher and to Eth-kazin; it extended to Rimmon and curved around toward Neah.
translation: Long hap em i go pas long sindaun bai, i kam stret olsem go long Gat-hefa na Et-kazin; em i stret olsem go long Rimmon na karim kaunti go long Nea.

original: Then the border circled around the north side of Neah to Hannathon and ended at the Valley of Iphtah-el.
translation: Kaunti i go raun raun long sait bilong not i kam bek gen long Nia, na em i stap pinis long Vali Iphta-el.

original: It also included Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem. There were twelve cities, along with their villages.
translation: Em i inkludim tu Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, na Bethlehem. Na stap twelve ples bilong taun, wantaim ol vile bilong ol.

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Zebulun, including these cities and their villages.
translation: Dispela brigeba bilong ol klana bilong taib Zebulun, ikam wantaim ol siti na vilij long ol.

original: The fourth lot came out for the clans of the tribe of Issachar:
translation: Em i kamaut bilong foa long ol klan bilong tribe bilong Isakara.

original: Their territory included Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
translation: Olia i gat graun long Jezirel, Chesuloth, Sunem,

original: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
translation: Hafaraim, Sion, Anaharat,

original: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
translation: Rabiti, Kisio, Ebes, em i givim nem bilong ol ples o ples long Bibikal refrens.

original: Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.
translation: Remet, En-ganin, En-hada, na Bet-pazez.

original: The border reached Tabor, Shahazumah, and Beth-shemesh, and ended at the Jordan. There were sixteen cities, along with their villages.
translation: Bain grimas i go long Tabor, Shahazumah, na Beth-shemesh, na i stap pinis long Wara Jordan. Na ol i gat sikisipela tauns, oltaim wantaim ol vilij long ol.

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Issachar, including these cities and their villages.
translation: Em iheritim bilong klana bilong traib bilong Isakar, olsem na ol siti na vilij long ol.

original: The fifth lot came out for the clans of the tribe of Asher:
translation: Lot namba faiv i kam aut long ol klana bilong taem Asher:

original: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
translation: Olgeta hap bilong ol i kamapim Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph.

original: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal. On the west the border touched Carmel and Shihor-libnath,
translation: Alamamek, Amat, na Misal. Long saut, bonda i kamap long Kamel na Siholibanat,

original: then turned eastward toward Beth-dagon, touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah-el, and went north to Beth-emek and Neiel, passing Cabul on the left.
translation: Na bai em i kam bek gen long east, sindaun i go long Beth-dagon, stap klostu long Zebulun na Valley of Iphtah-el, na i go ap long not i go long Beth-emek na Neiel, na em i pas long lef sid long Cabul.

original: It went on to Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as Greater Sidon.
translation: Em i go long Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, na Kanah, olsem long Sidon Bikpela.

original: The border then turned back toward Ramah as far as the fortified city of Tyre, turned toward Hosah, and came out at the Sea in the region of Achzib,
translation: Bipoila kaikai i go bek gen long Ramah, inap long taun bung bilong toktok Taia, i turn long Hosah, na em i kam aut long Solwara hap bilong Achzib.

original: Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob. There were twenty-two cities, along with their villages.
translation: Ummah, Aphek, na Rehob. Namba bilong taun ol i kamap twenty-two, wantaim vilij ol bilong ol.

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Asher, including these cities and their villages.
translation: Dispela em i inheritance bilong ol klans bilong traib blong Aser, wantaim ol sitis na vilij bilong ol.

original: The sixth lot came out for the clans of the tribe of Naphtali:
translation: Lot namba sikis i kamaut long clan clan bilong traibe Naphtali:

original: Their border started at Heleph and the great tree of Zaanannim, passing Adami-nekeb and Jabneel as far as Lakkum and ending at the Jordan.
translation: Borona bilong ol i stat long Elep na gret diwai bilong Saananim, i pas long Adami-Nekib na Jabneel astail long Lakem na pinis long Jordan.

original: Then the border turned westward to Aznoth-tabor and ran from there to Hukkok, touching Zebulun on the south side, Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan on the east.
translation: Boda i go bak long wes, i ran nau long hap bilong Hukkok, na i kamap long sait bilong Zebulun long saut, inap long Asher long wes, na inap long Judah long Jordan long is. Boda ia i go bak long wes, pati long Asnot-Tabor, na i ran nau long hap bilong Hukkok.

original: The fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
translation: Ol bikpela towns we i gat barak em i Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,

original: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
translation: Adama, Rama, Hezor,

original: Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
translation: Kedes, Edere, En-Hazọ, tripla ples i stap long nem bilong ples bilong Baibol.

original: Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh. There were nineteen cities, along with their villages.
translation: Aian, Migdal-el, Horem, Bet-anat, na Bet-semes. Ol i gat nainbilong taun, wantaim vilij bilong ol.

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Naphtali, including these cities and their villages.
translation: Dispela em i inheritance bilong ol clan bilong tribe Naphtali, wantaim ol siti na vilij ol i gat.

original: The seventh lot came out for the clans of the tribe of Dan:
translation: Lot namba seven i kam aut bilong klan bilong traibe bilong Dan:

original: The territory of their inheritance included Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
translation: Lain bilong inheritance ol i stap, em i inkludim Zora, Estaul, Ir-Semes.

original: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
translation: Sialabin, Aiylon, Itla, ol nem bilong ples long Baibel.

original: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
translation: Ilon, Timna, Ekron,

original: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
translation: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath, ol ples i stap long graun bilong Israel.

original: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
translation: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon, ol nem bilong ples i stap long jografi bilong Hebre.

original: Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, including the territory across from Joppa.
translation: Me-jarkon, na Rakkon, olgeta ples we i stap klostu long Jopa.

original: (Later, when the territory of the Danites was lost to them, they went up and fought against Leshem, captured it, and put it to the sword. So they took possession of Leshem, settled there, and renamed it after their father Dan.)
translation: Bihain, wën long taim grun bilong Danait i go los long ol, ol i go ap na fait long Leshem, ol plantim sot long en, na ol taker possess long em. Ol stap we long ples ia, na ol givim nem bilong tupa ol Dan, em i spik olsem Dan, bikos em i nem bilong tumbuna ol.

original: This was the inheritance of the clans of the tribe of Dan, including these cities and their villages.
translation: Dispela em i inheritans bilong ol clan bilong traib bilong Dan, inklusim olgeta citi na vilij long ol.

original: When they had finished distributing the land into its territories, the Israelites gave Joshua son of Nun an inheritance among them,
translation: Taim ol Pipol Israel i pinis long dikim länd long ol hap bilong en, ol i givim Joshua pikinini bilong Nun wanpela hap bilong en long ol.

original: as the LORD had commanded. They gave him the city of Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim, as he requested. He rebuilt the city and settled in it.
translation: Olsem Jehovah i givim komando. Na ol i givim em town Timnath-serah long kantri bilong Efraim we i go backstage, olsem em i laik. Na em i wokim gen town na i stap insait long em.

original: These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families distributed by lot to the tribes of Israel at Shiloh before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. So they finished dividing up the land.
translation: Dispela i brigeta long ol descent ol i dio long wei bilong lot, we Eleazar prist, Joshua son bilong Nun, na hed bilong ol famili i mekim long Shiloh, bifor LORD, long entris bilong Tent bilong Miting, long ol tripe bilong Israel. Ol i pinis na divelopim kantri.

original: Then the LORD said to Joshua,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Joshua,

original: “Tell the Israelites to designate the cities of refuge, as I instructed you through Moses,
translation: Tokim ol Israel long peim namel long ples bilong sikis, olsem mi bin tokim yu long taim bipo bikos Mosese.

original: so that anyone who kills another unintentionally or accidentally may flee there. These will be your refuge from the avenger of blood.
translation: Olsem, bai husat i kilim man i go nogat nius, em bai ranawe go long ples we em ina kisim bekim long han bilong man i kam bekim blod, na olsem bai i stap long ples we em ina punda i go bekim long hap, bai i nogo long taun ol i givim ples long ranawe.

original: When someone flees to one of these cities, stands at the entrance of the city gate, and states his case before its elders, they are to bring him into the city and give him a place to live among them.
translation: Wanpela man i ranawe go long wanpela ples, em i stap klostu long entris bilong gembens, em tok stret long kaunsil bilong ol bikpela man bilong ples, ol i bringim i go insait long ples na givim em ples bilong stil long ol.

original: Now if the avenger of blood pursues him, they must not surrender the manslayer into his hand, because that man killed his neighbor accidentally without prior malice.
translation: Sapos man i go bekim em i kam, ol i no ken givim manslaia i go, bikos dispela man i kilim nambawan nek bilong en long akisident, na i no mekim olsem long taim bifo i mekim olsem.

original: He is to stay in that city until he stands trial before the assembly and until the death of the high priest serving at that time. Then the manslayer may return to his own home in the city from which he fled.”
translation: Man i kilim man em i mas stap i go long taun bung, na em i go long kot long assembli, tasol long taim bilong dei bilong pries bikpela bifor, em i ken go bek long haus bilong em yet long taun we em i ranawe long em.

original: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
translation: Ol i skelim ap Kedes long Galili long kantri bilong maunten bilong Naphtali, Sikem long kantri bilong maunten bilong Efrayim, na Kiriath-arba (emas, Hebron) long kantri bilong maunten bilong Juda.

original: And beyond the Jordan, east of Jericho, they designated Bezer on the wilderness plateau from the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Na long hap side bipo Jordan, long east sait bilong Jeriko, ol i makim Bezer long ples wilderness i go antap long dispurisoin bilong tribe Reuben, Ramoth long Gilead long dispurisoin bilong tribe Gad, na Golan long Bashan long dispurisoin bilong tribe Manasseh.

original: These are the cities appointed for all the Israelites and foreigners among them, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood prior to standing trial before the assembly.
translation: Dispela ol ples i save long ol Israel na ol narapela manmeri, nasel olsem, bai eni man i kilim narapela man long wei we em i no laik kilim, em bai ranawe go na stap long dispela ol ples, na bai no dai long han bilong man i kam bekim blut, prior long em i kam bek long kot na kot i harim tok bilong em long asamble.

original: Now the family heads of the Levites approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the other tribes of Israel
translation: Bikpela hap bilong Levaita i kam klostu long Eleaza, prist, Joshua, pikinini bilong Nun, na hap bilong narapela trib na tribes bilong Israel.

original: at Shiloh in the land of Canaan and said to them, “The LORD commanded through Moses that we be given cities in which to live, together with pasturelands for our livestock.”
translation: Long Shiloh long kantri bilong Canaan, na ol i tokim ol, “Bikpela i givim komando olsem Moses i kam, sipos ol i givim taun long mipela i stap, wantaim gras bilong animol bilong mipela.”

original: So by the command of the LORD, the Israelites gave the Levites these cities and their pasturelands out of their own inheritance:
translation: Long tok bilong GOD, Israelites i givim Levites desepela taun na gras bilong animal long graun bilong ol yet.

original: The first lot came out for the Kohathite clans. The Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest received thirteen cities by lot from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
translation: Em i kam bek long namba wan long Ol clan bilong Kohath. Ol Levait husat ol i desenden bilong Aron em prist, ol i kakato thirteen ples long wei bilong lotu from tribes bilong Yuda, Simeon, na Benjamin.

original: The remaining descendants of Kohath received ten cities by lot from the tribes of Ephraim, Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Ol desenden sisa bilong Kohath i kamapim tenpela ples long wei bilong klosim long tripe bilong Ephraim, Dan, na hap tripe bilong Manasseh.

original: The descendants of Gershon received thirteen cities by lot from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Gershon i kamapim thirteen ples long wei bilong kamon bilong lot long ol trib bilong Isaka, Asa, Nafetali, na hap-trib bilong Manase long hap bilong Bashan.

original: And the descendants of Merari received twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
translation: Na ol desenden bilong Merari i kamapim twelv ples long ol ples bilong tribe Reuben, Gad, na Zebulun.

original: So the Israelites allotted to the Levites these cities, together with their pasturelands, as the LORD had commanded through Moses.
translation: Israelites i givim ples long Levi, wantaim graun oli i kaikim ol animal, olsem LORD i tokim Moses.

original: From the tribes of Judah and Simeon, they designated these cities by name
translation: Long ol tribe bilong Yuda na Simeon, ol i givim nem long dispela towns.

original: to the descendants of Aaron from the Kohathite clans of the Levites, because the first lot fell to them:
translation: Long ol desenden bilong Aron, husat i kam from ol klana Kohati bilong Levai, bikos laip lot i bin kakarim i go long ol:

original: They gave them Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), with its surrounding pasturelands, in the hill country of Judah. (Arba was the father of Anak.)
translation: Ol i givim Kiriath-arba (em i Hebron) long ol, wanem em i gat graun bilong wain em i kamap long en, long maunten bilong Yuda. (Arba em papa bilong Anak).

original: But they had given the fields and villages around the city to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his possession.
translation: Tupela i givim gras bilong ka na vilej long bilong siti olsem propati bilong Kalebo, Pikinini bilong Jefunneh.

original: So to the descendants of Aaron the priest they gave these cities, together with their pasturelands: Hebron, a city of refuge for the manslayer, Libnah,
translation: Na ol i go long ol desenden bilong Aaron priester, ol i givim ol dispela taun, waintaim wantaim graon bilong ol: Hebron, taun bilong birua long man i kilim man, Libnah.

original: Jattir, Eshtemoa,
translation: Jatiri, Estimoa,

original: Holon, Debir,
translation: Holon, Debir

original: Ain, Juttah, and Beth-shemesh—nine cities from these two tribes, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Ain, Juttah, na Beth-shemesh—nain siti husat i kam long tu ol lain, watpo long olgeta nem bilong grass bilong animol i kaikai.

original: And from the tribe of Benjamin they gave them Gibeon, Geba,
translation: Na long tripe bilong Benjimin ol i givim ol Gibeon, Geba,

original: Anathoth, and Almon—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Anathoth, na Almon—em i gat foa siti, wantaim ol grazin graun bilong ol.

original: In all, thirteen cities, together with their pasturelands, were given to the priests, the descendants of Aaron.
translation: Olgeta, tenpela taun olsem thirteen, waintaim graun bilong ol animal, i kam long hand bilong pris, pikinini bilong Aron.

original: The remaining Kohathite clans of the Levites were allotted these cities: From the tribe of Ephraim
translation: Ol clan we i stap yet long Kohathite bilong Ol Levit, olis i givim despela taun olgeta: Long taun bilong Ephraim

original: they were given Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim (a city of refuge for the manslayer), Gezer,
translation: Ol i givim Sikem long kantri bilong maunten bilong Ephraim, wanpela taun bilong bikim hap long ol man i kilim man, Geza.

original: Kibzaim, and Beth-horon—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Kibzaim na Bet-Horon—fopla sipos, long wantaun bilong ol.

original: From the tribe of Dan they were given Elteke, Gibbethon,
translation: Long hap bilong Dan, ol i givim long ol Elteke, Gibbethon.

original: Aijalon, and Gath-rimmon—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Aijalon, na Gath-rimmon—hap bilong siti fo, wantaim nem bilong ol pastureland bilong ol.

original: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh they were given Taanach and Gath-rimmon—two cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Na long hap tribe bilong Manase, ol i givim Taanach na Gath-rimmon - tu siti, wantaim gras bilong ol.

original: In all, ten cities, together with their pasturelands, were given to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
translation: Olgeta, ten tauns, wantaim gras bilong animol, i kam bek long ol narapela clans bilong Kohat.

original: This is what the Levite clans of the Gershonites were given: From the half-tribe of Manasseh they were given Golan in Bashan, a city of refuge for the manslayer, and Beeshterah—two cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Em i tok olsem: ol klana Levait bilong Gershonites igo long ol. Long hap tribe bilong Manase, ol i givim ol Golan long Bashan, taun bilong sikirim skeliman, na Beeshterah - tu taun, wantaim gras bilong animal bilong ol.

original: From the tribe of Issachar they were given Kishion, Daberath,
translation: Long klain bilong Isakar ol i givim Kishion, Daberath,

original: Jarmuth, and En-gannim—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Jarmut, na En-Ganin—foa sipos, wantaim graun bilong ol.

original: From the tribe of Asher they were given Mishal, Abdon,
translation: Long tripe bilong Esara, ol i givim Misal, Abdon

original: Helkath, and Rehob—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Helkath, na Rehob—four nem bilong siti, i inkludim ples bilong betel nut na graon.

original: And from the tribe of Naphtali they were given Kedesh in Galilee (a city of refuge for the manslayer), Hammoth-dor, and Kartan—three cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Na long tribo bilong Naphtali, ol i givim Kedesh long Galili, em taun bilong skulim ol manmeri i save kilim man, Hammoth-dor, na Kartan - ol taun tri, wantaim gras bilong ol animal.

original: In all, thirteen cities, together with their pasturelands, were given to the Gershonite clans.
translation: Long olgeta, tenpela taun thirteen, longol pasture na graun bilong ol, em i go long klan bilong Gershon.

original: This is what the Merarite clan (the rest of the Levites) were given: From the tribe of Zebulun they were given Jokneam, Kartah,
translation: Em i dispela pes wa Merarait kin (ol narapela Levitikaines) i givim: Long traib blong Zebulun ol i givim Jokneam, Kartah,

original: Dimnah, and Nahalal—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Dimnah, na Nahalal—namba bilong siti em four, long nem bilong siti, i inkludim gras bilong animol.

original: From the tribe of Reuben they were given Bezer, Jahaz,
translation: Long klain bilong Ruben ol i givim Beza, Jahaz,

original: Kedemoth, and Mephaath—four cities, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Kedemoth, na Mephaath—foa taun, longolong na graun bilong ol.

original: And from the tribe of Gad they were given Ramoth in Gilead, a city of refuge for the manslayer, Mahanaim,
translation: Na long taem ol i kam bek long tribe bilong Gad, ol i givim Ramoth long Gilead, em i wanpela taun bilong skulim ol meri na man i kirap, Mahanaim.

original: Heshbon, and Jazer—four cities in all, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Hesbon, na Jaza—siti foa olgeta, wantaim witu long graun bilong ol.

original: In all, twelve cities were allotted to the clans of Merari, the remaining Levite clans.
translation: Olgeta, twelv siti i go long klans bilong Merari, narpela klans bilong Levait.

original: For the Levites, then, there were forty-eight cities in all, together with their pasturelands, within the territory of the Israelites.
translation: Long Levites, na i gat forty-ait kilim taun olsem, wantaim grazing lan bilong ol, long en long bilong teritori bilong Israelites.

original: Each of these cities had its own surrounding pasturelands; this was true for all the cities.
translation: Ol sais city long dispela ol i gat graun bilong animal long sindaun bilong ol yet, dispela em i truth long olgeta city.

original: Thus the LORD gave Israel all the land He had sworn to give their fathers, and they took possession of it and settled in it.
translation: Thus Bikpela i givim Israel olgeta graun we em i promis long tumbuna bilong ol, na ol i kisim bek long en, na ol i pundaon kot long en.

original: And the LORD gave them rest on every side, just as He had sworn to their fathers. None of their enemies could stand against them, for the LORD delivered all their enemies into their hand.
translation: Na Papa bilong ol i givim ol kaikai i kamap strong long olgeta sait, olsem Hem i promis long tumbuna bilong ol. Nogat wanpela poisen bilong ol i ken stap agensim ol, bikos Papa bilong ol i givim olgeta poisen bilong ol long hand bilong ol.

original: Not one of all the LORD’s good promises to the house of Israel had failed; everything was fulfilled.
translation: Maski wan gupuna namba wan bilong Bikpela long hap bilong Israel i no bihainim, olgeta samting i kamap pinis.

original: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh
translation: Na Joshua i kirapim ol Reubin, ol Gadi, na hap-tribe bilong Manasi

original: and told them, “You have done all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, and you have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you.
translation: Ol tokim ol, “Yupela mekim olgeta samting we Moses hambut bilong LORD i givim tok bilong en long yupela, na yupela i hiriim vosis bilong mi long olgeta samting we mi givim tok bilong mi long yupela.”

original: All this time you have not deserted your brothers, up to this very day, but have kept the charge given you by the LORD your God.
translation: Olgeta taim ya, yu no lusim brata bilong yu, long wei nau yet, tasol yu mekim wach long displa, na yu halivim ol wok we Bikpela God bilong yu givim yu.

original: And now that the LORD your God has given your brothers rest as He promised them, you may return to your homes in the land that Moses the servant of the LORD gave you across the Jordan.
translation: Nau olsem LORD God bilong yu em i givim brata bilong yumi resis olsem em i promisim ol, yu ken go bek long hus na hus bilong yumi long hap side bilong Jordan, we em i Moses, servant bilong LORD, i givim yumi.

original: But be very careful to observe the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of the LORD gave you: to love the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, to keep His commandments, to hold fast to Him, and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
translation: Bihainim gut ka, i go longwe na bihainim tok orait na lo bilong ples Moses i givim yu: long bilip strong i go long LORD God bilong yu, i go wokabaut long ol wei bilong em, i holim strong long ol tok bilong em, i gripim strong long em, na i servim em wantaim het bilong yu na spirit bilong yu.

original: So Joshua blessed them and sent them on their way, and they went to their homes.
translation: Joshua i givim bikim ol, na i senisim ol i go, na ol i go bek long hus na hus.

original: (To the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given land in Bashan, and to the other half Joshua gave land on the west side of the Jordan among their brothers.) When Joshua sent them to their homes he blessed them,
translation: Mosis i givim graun long hap-tribe bilong Manase long Basan, na Yosua i givim graun long hap-narapela bilong ol long saed wes bilong Joden, long midst bilong brata ol. Na taim Yosua i sendim ol i go long hus, em i blesim ol.

original: saying, “Return to your homes with your great wealth, with immense herds of livestock, with silver, gold, bronze, iron, and very many clothes. Divide with your brothers the spoil of your enemies.”
translation: “Go bek long haus bilong yu, wantaim wel bilong yu i bikpela, ol animol bilong graun i namba plenti, silva, gold, bronz, ain, na klostu klot i namba plenti. Divelop strong long brata bilong yu loot bilong eni bilong yu.”

original: So the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh in the land of Canaan to return to their own land of Gilead, which they had acquired according to the command of the LORD through Moses.
translation: Na Ripenait, Gadait, na hap-tribe bilong Manase i lusim Yisrael long Silo, gras bilong Kanaan, go bek long ples bilong ol yet, Gilead, ol i winim bek long han bilong LORD thru Moses.

original: And when they came to Geliloth near the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an imposing altar there by the Jordan.
translation: Na taim ol i kam long Geliloth, klostu long Jordan, insait long gras bilong Kanaan, Ol Reubeni, Ol Gadi, na hap tribu bilong Ol Manasi, ol i wokim alta bikpela i stap long sait bilong Jordan.

original: Then the Israelites received the report: “Behold, the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar on the border of the land of Canaan, at Geliloth near the Jordan on the Israelite side.”
translation: Isreaeli i kamau long ripot: “Sios, Reubeniti, Gaditi, na hap-tribe bilong Manase ol i bikim wanpela altar long grens bilong kantri Canaan, long Geliloth klostu long Jodan sait bilong Isreaeli.”

original: And when they heard this, the whole congregation of Israel assembled at Shiloh to go to war against them.
translation: Wewan i harim dispela, olgeta asamble bilong Israel i kam tu long Shiloh, na ol i go long war gen ol.

original: The Israelites sent Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest to the land of Gilead, to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Oli Israelait i go sendim Finias, pikinini bilong Eleasa pries, long long lan bilong Gilead, long ol Reubeni, Gadi, na hap tribe bilong Manasi.

original: With him they sent ten chiefs—one family leader from each tribe of Israel, each the head of a family among the clans of Israel.
translation: Wantaim ol i go bek long em, ten bikpela man: wan leda bilong famili moa long wanwan tribe bilong Israel, ol i kolim hed bilong famili long ol klan bilong Israel.

original: They went to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and said to them,
translation: Tupela i go long ol Reubenites, ol Gadites, na hap tribe bilong Manase long lan bilong Gilead na em i tokim ol:

original: “This is what the whole congregation of the LORD says: ‘What is this breach of faith you have committed today against the God of Israel by turning away from the LORD and building for yourselves an altar, that you might rebel against the LORD this day?
translation: Olgeta asamble ya bilong LORD i tok: 'Wanem samting ol i mekim bagarapim trast long tok bilong GOD bilong Israel today? Yupela i turnim bek long LORD, na wokim bikhet long LORD, na yupela i mekim altar bilong yupela yet, olsem yupela i man bilong wokim bikhet long LORD dispela de.

original: Was not the sin of Peor enough for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves to this day? It even brought a plague upon the congregation of the LORD.
translation: Sin bilong Peor yet nogat inap long mipela, pes we-yet-ol i-no-gat klinim yet na tu? Em-i-kisim plak bilong pamin bilong LORD ol i-kam.

original: And now, would you turn away from the LORD? If you rebel today against the LORD, tomorrow He will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.
translation: Nau, bai yu lusim bek long LORD? Yu bagarap i go long LORD tede, na tomorrow em bai i gat bel hevi wantaim olgeta kongres bilong Isael.

original: If indeed the land of your inheritance is unclean, then cross over to the land of the LORD’s possession, where the LORD’s tabernacle stands, and take possession of it among us. But do not rebel against the LORD or against us by building for yourselves an altar other than the altar of the LORD our God.
translation: Sapos tru graun bilong klia bilong papa na mama bilong yupela i no klia, then go bek long graun bilong posesen bilong LORD, we husat haus bilong Sabit bilong LORD i stap, na kisim bek long dispela graun na halivim long mipela. Bata ken bagarap i against LORD o against mipela long salim kaul bilong ofa gen bilong yuselves long wei bilong kaul bilong ofa bilong LORD God bilong mipela.

original: Was not Achan son of Zerah unfaithful regarding what was set apart for destruction, bringing wrath upon the whole congregation of Israel? Yet it was not only Achan who perished because of his sin!’”
translation: Achan, pikinini bilong Zerah, i no bihainim olgeta ka? Em i bringim birua long olgeta asambilasjon bilong Israel, tasol em tasol i no dai bikos blon em sin.

original: Then the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered the leaders of the clans of Israel:
translation: Ol Reubenites, ol Gadites, na hap-tribe bilong Manasseh i tokim ol lida bilong clan bilong Israel:

original: “The LORD, the Mighty One, is God! The LORD, the Mighty One, is God! He knows, and may Israel also know. If this was in rebellion or breach of faith against the LORD, do not spare us today.
translation: LORD, Bikpela i gat strong, em i God! LORD, Bikpela i gat strong, em i God! Em i save, na Israel i mas save tu. Ifrayt em i kam long taim bilong bagarap o long taim bilong brokim trast long LORD, yu no ken kisim us tude.

original: If we have built for ourselves an altar to turn away from Him and to offer burnt offerings and grain offerings on it, or to sacrifice fellowship offerings on it, may the LORD Himself hold us accountable.
translation: Sapos yumi mitim bikim ol altar bilong yumi yet na yumi lusim Bikpela, na yumi bringim ofa ol burnt offerings na grain offerings long en, o yumi sakrifaisim ofa fellowship offerings long en, orait Bikpela em yet bai kam bek long yumi.

original: But in fact we have done this for fear that in the future your descendants might say to ours, ‘What have you to do with the LORD, the God of Israel?
translation: Bikos yumy ol i tingim olsem, em ino namane long taim bai ol desenden bilong yumi yet harim long ol desenden bilong mipela, ol bai tok, 'Wanem samting i gat long yumi wantaim LORD, God bilong Israel?'

original: For the LORD has made the Jordan a border between us and you Reubenites and Gadites. You have no share in the LORD!’ So your descendants could cause ours to stop fearing the LORD.
translation: Papa God i mekim Jodan em i baunden bilong mipela na yupela Ol Reuben na Ol Gad. Yu no gat pepa long Papa God! Olsem na ol desenden bilong yu bai i mekim bikim ol desenden bilong mipela i stop bibimaf long Papa God.

original: That is why we said, ‘Let us take action and build an altar for ourselves, but not for burnt offerings or sacrifices.
translation: Em i wanem nau mipela tok, ‘Mipela mas aktim, bilden em altar bilong yumi yet, tasol nogat long ofa bilong bren o sakrifis.’

original: Rather, let it be a witness between us and you and the generations to come, that we will worship the LORD in His presence with our burnt offerings, sacrifices, and peace offerings.’ Then in the future, your descendants cannot say to ours, ‘You have no share in the LORD!’
translation: Em i mas go bek long witness bamaim yumi na yupela na genarasion i kam bihain, olsem yumi bai worshipim Lord long ples bilong em wantaim ofa bilong yumi i bruk, sacrifice, na peis offering. Na bai ol desenden bilong yu no ken tokim ol desenden bilong mipela, 'Yu no gat pe bilong yu long Lord!'

original: Therefore we said, ‘If they ever say this to us or to our descendants, we will answer: Look at the replica of the altar of the LORD that our fathers made, not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you.’
translation: Mipela tokim, 'If nau ol i tokim dispela klostu long mipela o long descendan bilong mipela, mipela bai tokim: Lukim kopi bilong alta bilong LORD, papa bilong mipela wokim, nogat long ofa bilong bun o saksis, tasol olsem wanpela witness pila long mipela na yu.'

original: Far be it from us to rebel against the LORD and turn away from Him today by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings, or sacrifices, other than the altar of the LORD our God, which stands before His tabernacle.”
translation: Nogat ken olsem long yumi bagarap long LORD, na turnim bek long em tude na wokim narapela altar bilong ofa i go daun, ofa bilong ka, o sakis, long olgeta altar, narapela long altar bilong LORD God bilong yumi, we istand long front long haus lotu bilong en.

original: When Phinehas the priest and the chiefs of the congregation—the heads of Israel’s clans who were with him—heard what the descendants of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh had to say, they were satisfied.
translation: Taim Phinehas man bilong lotu na bikpela manmeri bilong assembli – ol bikpela hed bilong famili bilong Israel ol i stap wantaim em – harim tok bilong ol desenden bilong Reuben, Gad, na Manasseh, ol i kamap strong narapela.

original: Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest said to the descendants of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh, “Today we know that the LORD is among us, because you have not committed this breach of faith against Him. Consequently, you have delivered the Israelites from the hand of the LORD.”
translation: Finehas, man bilong Eleazar prijest i tok long ol desenden bilong Ruben, Gad, na Manase, "Tude wi save olsem Jehovah i stap namel long mipela, bikos yu no bin mekim dispela bagarap trast long em. Olsem nau, yu bin skulim Israelites long han bilong Jehovah."

original: Then Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, together with the other leaders, returned to the Israelites in the land of Canaan and brought back a report regarding the Reubenites and Gadites in the land of Gilead.
translation: Finehas, man bilong Elezar prist, wantaim ol narapela bikman, i kam bek long ples Israel long gras bilong Kanaan na ol i bringim ripot i kam long ol Reubeniti na Gaditi long gras bilong Gilead.

original: The Israelites were satisfied with the report, and they blessed God and spoke no more about going to war against them to destroy the land where the Reubenites and Gadites lived.
translation: Israelaiti ol i kontent long ripot, na ol i blesim God, na ol i no tok bek gen long go long war ibain distroiim kantri we Reubenaiti na Gaditi ol i stap.

original: So the Reubenites and Gadites named the altar Witness, for they said, “It is a witness between us that the LORD is God.”
translation: Na Ol Reubenites na Ol Gadites i givim nem altan Witness, long ol i tok, em i witness bilong yupela na mipela, ol i tok, "LORD em i God tru".

original: A long time after the LORD had given Israel rest from all the enemies around them, when Joshua was old and well along in years,
translation: Long taim igo pinis, Bikpela i givim Isrel pes fraim ol enemies bilong ol long raun ol, na taim Josua i bikim old na i go long we,

original: he summoned all Israel, including its elders, leaders, judges, and officers. “I am old and well along in years,” he said,
translation: Em i kirapim ol Israel hariam, inkusim bikos olla bikman meri, lida, kot, na ofisa. "Mi old pinis na mi go long ol yia," em i tok.

original: “and you have seen everything that the LORD your God has done to all these nations for your sake, because it was the LORD your God who fought for you.
translation: Na yu lukim olgeta samting we Bikpela Gott bilong yu i mekim long ol narapela kantri, bilong yu mas, bikos em i Bikpela Gott bilong yu i go bekim yu.

original: See, I have allotted as an inheritance to your tribes these remaining nations, including all the nations I have already cut off, from the Jordan westward to the Great Sea.
translation: Mi bin givim ol nesen i stap yet, ol i no bin pinis, long ol clan bilong yu, stat long Jordan wes na go long Solwara Bikpela.

original: The LORD your God will push them out of your way and drive them out before you, so that you can take possession of their land, as the LORD your God promised you.
translation: LORD God bilong yu bai pusim ol i go long wei bilong yu, na bai driva ol i go long biksan bilong yu, na yu bai kisim gras long graun bilong ol, olsem LORD God bilong yu promisim yu.

original: Be very strong, then, so that you can keep and obey all that is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, not turning aside from it to the right or to the left.
translation: Iu strong tru, na yu ken kisim na obaiim olgeta samting i writim long Buk Bilong Lotu Moses, no ken go bek long sait ora long lef, bai yu no wokim banis long ret oa long lef.

original: So you are not to associate with these nations that remain among you. You must not call on the names of their gods or swear by them, and you must not serve them or bow down to them.
translation: Yu no ken go wankain wantaim ol narapela kantri we i stap yet long ples. Yu no ken kisim nem bilong ol spirit poisen, yu no ken nemim long nem bilong ol, yu no ken wokim servis long ol, yu no ken kumbak i go daun long ol.

original: Instead, you shall hold fast to the LORD your God, as you have done to this day.
translation: Yupela mas holim strong long LORD Bikpela yu, olsem yu duim nau tasol.

original: The LORD has driven out great and powerful nations before you, and to this day no one can stand against you.
translation: Papa God i kirapim ol narapela kantri i gat strong bifor yu, na inap long tude nogat man i ken stap agensim yu.

original: One of you can put a thousand to flight, because the LORD your God fights for you, just as He promised.
translation: Wanpela bilong yupela i ken paitim tausen na ronawe, bikos LORD God bilong yupela i fait long side bilong yupela, olsem Hem i promis.

original: Therefore watch yourselves carefully, that you love the LORD your God.
translation: Kisim hevi long yuself, lukaut gut, na iu mas lakim Godepela bilong yu.

original: For if you turn away and cling to the rest of these nations that remain among you, and if you intermarry and associate with them,
translation: Long bihain, sipos yu lusim na holim pas long ol narapela ples i stap yet long kantri, na yu mekim mariwi na stap wantaim ol,

original: know for sure that the LORD your God will no longer drive out these nations before you. Instead, they will become for you a snare and a trap, a scourge in your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the LORD your God has given you.
translation: Save nau olsem, LORD God bilong yu, bai hem no drivim olt namel longDispela nesen befor yu. Insited, oli bambai kamapim snare na trap long yu, palim ol i birua long sait bilong yu, na grip na kros long ai bilong yu, until yu pinis long stap insait long kantri gutpela dispela we LORD God bilong yu i givim long yu.

original: Now behold, today I am going the way of all the earth, and you know with all your heart and soul that not one of the good promises the LORD your God made to you has failed. Everything was fulfilled for you; not one promise has failed.
translation: Nau lukim, tudei mi go long wei bilong olgeta graun, na yu save long olgeta haret na spirik olsem Bikpela GOD i makim promis long yu, nogat wan bilong dispela promis i gat fail. Olgeta samting i kamap strong long yu; nogat wan promis i stap.

original: But just as every good thing the LORD your God promised you has come to pass, likewise the LORD will bring upon you the calamity He has threatened, until He has destroyed you from this good land He has given you.
translation: Bareket olgeta gutpela samting we Papa God i promisim yu, em i kam tru na stap, olsem nau Papa God bai bringim bekim long yu olkaikai we em i tok long bihain, na bai em i bagarapim yupela long laine gudepela em i givim yupela.

original: If you transgress the covenant of the LORD your God, which He commanded you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, then the anger of the LORD will burn against you, and you will quickly perish from this good land He has given you.”
translation: Sapos yu bagarapim covenant bilong LORD Bikpela, em i givim law long yu, na yu go servisim god nogat i stap long yu, na kuku grub long ol, tasol anger bilong LORD bai kaikaim yu, na yu bai katol long kantri nau i gat gutpela em i givim long yu.

original: Then Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned the elders, leaders, judges, and officers of Israel, and they presented themselves before God.
translation: Na Josua i singautim olgeta tribe bilong Isrel i kam olsem wanpela long Sikem. I singautim ol bikpela man, lidaman, jaj, na ofisa bilong Isrel, na ol i kam bek long front bilong God.

original: And Joshua said to all the people, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Long ago your fathers, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the Euphrates and worshiped other gods.
translation: Na Joshuva i tokim ol pipol oli, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD, God bilong Israel: 'Taim bipo ol tumbuna bilong yu, olsem Terah papa bilong Abraham na Nahor, i stap long hap bilong Euphrates na ol i servisim god nodor.'"

original: But I took your father Abraham from beyond the Euphrates and led him through all the land of Canaan, and I multiplied his descendants. I gave him Isaac,
translation: Mi kisim papa bilong yu Abraham long wei bilong bihain Euphrates, na mi bringim i go ol ples long Kanan, na mi plenti descendent bilong em. Mi givim Isaac long em.

original: and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau Mount Seir to possess, but Jacob and his sons went down to Egypt.
translation: Na long Aisak mi givim Jakob na Esau, na mi givim Esau Maunt Seir olsem propati bilong en, tasol Jakob na ol pikinini bilong en i go daun long Egip.

original: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I afflicted the Egyptians by what I did there, and afterward I brought you out.
translation: Na mi sendim Moses na Aaron, na mi bin givim sik long Egyptian olsem ol samting mi mekim long hap, na bihain mi kam bringim yumi i go.

original: When I brought your fathers out of Egypt and you reached the Red Sea, the Egyptians pursued them with chariots and horsemen as far as the Red Sea.
translation: Mi bringim papa bilong yu i kam aus long Egip, na yu go i kamap long Solwara Red, Egipian i go bek long arere na kisim ol, oli usim kareta na man husat i raisim hors, olsem longwe ol i kamap long Solwara Red.

original: So your fathers cried out to the LORD, and He put darkness between you and the Egyptians, over whom He brought the sea and engulfed them. Your very eyes saw what I did to the Egyptians. Then you lived in the wilderness for a long time.
translation: Papa bilong tumbuna i kisim strongpela voise karim long LORD, na em i putim daro antap long yu na pipol bilong Ijip, olsem em i bringen solwara i kam na i kalabim ol. Ai bilong yu yet i lukim ol samting we mi mekim long pipol bilong Ijip. Na yu stap long bus long taim olgeta.

original: Later, I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived beyond the Jordan. They fought against you, but I delivered them into your hand, that you should possess their land when I destroyed them before you.
translation: Bihain, mi bringim yu go long kantri bilong Amoraitis ol i stap long sai bilong wata Jordan. Ol i fait againstim yu, tasol mi givim ol long han bilong yu, na yu mas bosim graun bilong ol, na mi bagarapim ol long bifo long yu.

original: Then Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, set out to fight against Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to curse you,
translation: Na Balak, pikinini bilong Zippor, king bilong Moab, i go kamap long pair wantaim Israel. Em i sendem man i go kalim Balaam, pikinini bilong Beor, i kam kat olsem yu.

original: but I would not listen to Balaam. So he blessed you again and again, and I delivered you from his hand.
translation: Mi no lisin i go long Balaam, na em i givim blessing long yu tena na tena, na mi skulim yu long han bilong em.

original: After this, you crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The people of Jericho fought against you, as did the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites, and I delivered them into your hand.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, yu go pas long Jordan na kam long Jeriko. Ol pipol long Jeriko, Amorait, Perizait, Kanaanit, Hitait, Girgasit, Hibit, na Jebusit, ol i fight gen yu, tasol Mi givim ol i go long han bilong yu.

original: I sent the hornet ahead of you, and it drove out the two Amorite kings before you, but not by your own sword or bow.
translation: Mi sendim hornet i go bifor yu, na em i drivim aut tu Amori kwin bifor yu, tasol nogat bikos long sword na banar bilong yu.

original: So I gave you a land on which you did not toil and cities that you did not build, and now you live in them and eat from vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.’
translation: Mi givim yu graun we yu no wok harde long en, na towns we yu no bilong buildim, na nau yu stap insait long ol, na yu kaikai long paip vine na oliv tre we yu no planim.

original: Now, therefore, fear the LORD and serve Him in sincerity and truth; cast aside the gods your fathers served beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve the LORD.
translation: Nau, olsem na, poret long LORD, na servim God long trut na siporo; lusim ol gog na totem papa bilong yu servim beyond long Euphrates na long Ijip, na servim LORD.

original: But if it is unpleasing in your sight to serve the LORD, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your fathers served beyond the Euphrates, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living. As for me and my house, we will serve the LORD!”
translation: Bai yu no laik servim LORD, orait, yu yet mas lukluk long dei na choosim hu yu bai servim, em bai servim gods bilong tumbuna bilong yu ol we i stap beyond hap bilong Euphrates, o em bai servim gods bilong Amorites long graun bilong ol we yu stap. Long mi na husat bilong mi, mipela bai servim LORD!

original: The people replied, “Far be it from us to forsake the LORD to serve other gods!
translation: Ol pipol i tokim, “Nogat ken olsem long yumi lusim LORD na go wokim servis long narapela dei!

original: For the LORD our God brought us and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, and performed these great signs before our eyes. He also protected us throughout our journey and among all the nations through which we traveled.
translation: LORD God bilong mipela bam bringim mipela na papa bilong mipela i kam aut long kantri bilong Ijip, aut long haus bilong slaviri, na wokim dispela bikpela saen long ai bilong mipela. Na em i lokautim mipela long ol wei bilong mipela, long ol nesen ol i go daun, na mipela i stap wakabaut.

original: And the LORD drove out before us all the nations, including the Amorites who lived in the land. We too will serve the LORD, because He is our God!”
translation: Na Bikpela i kirapim ol nesin Amoriti na ol pipol long bush bifo mipela, mipela tu, mipela tasol bai sarve LORD, bikos em i God bilong mipela!

original: But Joshua said to the people, “You are not able to serve the LORD, for He is a holy God; He is a jealous God; He will not forgive your rebellion or your sins.
translation: Josaia i tokim ol pipol, “Yupela no inap servim Lord, bikos Em i God santing; Em i God i gat jelos; Em no bai forgivim rong bilong yu na sin bilong yu.

original: If you forsake the LORD and serve foreign gods, He will turn and bring disaster on you and consume you, even after He has been good to you.”
translation: Yu livaun na bikim LORD, na yu servisim gode bilong nesen narakai, em bai tarn aurait na bringim bagarap long yu, na em bai kaikaim yu, nau em hamamas long givim yu gude.

original: “No!” replied the people. “We will serve the LORD!”
translation: Ol pipel i tokim, "Nogat! Mipela bai sarvim LORD!"

original: Then Joshua told them, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the LORD.” “We are witnesses!” they said.
translation: Joshua i tokim ol, “Yupela i witnes long yuself yet olsem yupela choosim servisim Jehovah.” “Mipela i witnes!” ol i tok.

original: “Now, therefore,” he said, “get rid of the foreign gods among you and incline your hearts to the LORD, the God of Israel.”
translation: Nau, olsem na, em tok, “Kisim wei ol geta god bilong narapela kantri i stap long yupela, na bihainim het bilong yupela long LORD, God bilong Israel.”

original: So the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the LORD our God and obey His voice.”
translation: Ol pipol i tokim Joshua, "Mipela oli servim Lord God bilong mipela na mipela oli harim na kamapim tok bilong em."

original: On that day Joshua made a covenant for the people, and there at Shechem he established for them a statute and ordinance.
translation: Long de bipoa, Josua i mekim pakt long ol pipol, na long ples Sekem, i setim ka na law long ol.

original: Joshua recorded these things in the Book of the Law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up there under the oak that was near the sanctuary of the LORD.
translation: Josua i rakim stap ol dispela tinging long Buk Bilong Lotu Bilong God. Na em i kisim wanpela bigpela ston na i setim em daun bilo sakabus, we i kamap klostu long Haus Lotu bilong LORD.

original: And Joshua said to all the people, “You see this stone. It will be a witness against us, for it has heard all the words the LORD has spoken to us, and it will be a witness against you if you ever deny your God.”
translation: Na Yoshua i tokim ol pipol olgeta, “Yu lukim stoun i go. Em bai kam bek long tok strong olsem mipela, long em i harim ol tok GOD i tokim mipela, na em bai tok strong olsem yu if yu lusim Bikpela bilong yu.”

original: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to his own inheritance.
translation: Na Joshua i lusim ol pipol i go, ol i go long ples brigina bilong en bilong en.

original: Some time later, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of 110.
translation: Oli bin go pas, Josaia sot bilong Nun, wokman bilong LORD, i dai long taim em i 110 yia.

original: And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
translation: Ol i kisim na bekim em long lan bilong en de papa graun, long Timnath-serah long kantri bilong maunten bilong Efrem, long sait bilong not bilong Maunten Gaash.

original: Israel had served the LORD throughout the days of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had experienced all the works that the LORD had done for Israel.
translation: Isrel i servisim Lord olegeta de bilong Joshua na bilong ol bikpela man i stap long laip bilong en, na ol i experiensim olgeta wok we Lord i mekim bilong Isrel.

original: And the bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up out of Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the plot of land that Jacob had purchased from the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred pieces of silver. So it became an inheritance for Joseph’s descendants.
translation: Na bon bilong Yosep, ol Israelit i kisim i kam bek long Ijip, ol i biruaim long Sikem long ples we Yakob i baim long pikinini bilong Hamor, papa bilong Sikem, long hanred piesa silva. Na em i kamap long inheritance bilong descent bilong Yosep.

original: Eleazar son of Aaron also died, and they buried him at Gibeah, which had been given to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.
translation: Eleazar sisi bilong Aaron tu i dai pinis, na ol i bikim em i go daun long Gibeah, ples em i givim long pikinini bilong em Phinehas, long maunten bilong Ephraim.

original: After the death of Joshua, the Israelites inquired of the LORD, “Who will be the first to go up and fight for us against the Canaanites?”
translation: Long taim Joshua i dai pinis, ol Isrel i go askim LORD, “Husat bai i go bek na harim bek long pait bilong mipela gen Canaanit?”

original: “Judah shall go up,” answered the LORD. “Indeed, I have delivered the land into their hands.”
translation: “Juda bai go apo,” tok GOD bilong yumi. “Mi bin givim kantri long ol, olegeta em i go long hand bilong ol.”

original: Then the men of Judah said to their brothers the Simeonites, “Come up with us to our allotted territory, and let us fight against the Canaanites. And we likewise will go with you to your territory.” So the Simeonites went with them.
translation: Na ol man meri bilong Yuda i tokim brata bilong ol Simeon, "Kam na go apo wantaim mipela long graun bilong mipela, na mipela yet bai go kisim fait wantaim ol Kanaan. Na mipela yet bai go wantaim yupela long graun bilong yupela." Ol Simeonites i go wantaim ol Yuda.

original: When Judah attacked, the LORD delivered the Canaanites and Perizzites into their hands, and they struck down ten thousand men at Bezek.
translation: Taim Judah i go autsait, LORD i givim Kanaanit na Perizit long han bilong ol, na ol i kilim daun ten thousand man long Bezek.

original: And there they found Adoni-bezek and fought against him, striking down the Canaanites and Perizzites.
translation: Na ol i kanamas Adoni-bezek na ol i go bekim em, na ol i kilim daun Kanaan na Perisait.

original: As Adoni-bezek fled, they pursued him, seized him, and cut off his thumbs and big toes.
translation: Tamas Adoni-bezek i ranawe, ol i go bekensim i hap, ol i kisim i hap, na ol i katim banis bilong liklik finga na bihain toe bilong em.

original: Then Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings with their thumbs and big toes cut off have gathered the scraps under my table. As I have done to them, so God has repaid me.” And they brought him to Jerusalem, where he died.
translation: Na Adoni-bezek i tok olsem, "Seventi king ol i katim ol finga na ol toe big bilong ol, ol i kam kisim ol kaikai i stap ananit long tebol bilong mi. Olsem na mi mekim long ol, olsem God i bebim bek long mi." Na ol i bringim i go long Jerusalem, na em i dai there.

original: Then the men of Judah fought against Jerusalem and captured it. They put the city to the sword and set it on fire.
translation: Ol man bilong Yuda i fight na kisim Yerusalem. Ol i kilim ol pipol long taun na ol i setim taun long faia.

original: Afterward, the men of Judah marched down to fight against the Canaanites living in the hill country, in the Negev, and in the foothills.
translation: Bihaen, ol man bilong Judah i go daun i go kas gen Kanaanit i stap long kantri bilong maunten, long Negev, na long ples gras bilong maunten.

original: Judah also marched against the Canaanites who were living in Hebron (formerly known as Kiriath-arba), and they struck down Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.
translation: Juda i go autsait long Kanaanit ol i stap long Hebron, em triu bilong Kiriath-arba, na ol i godown pinis Sheshai, Ahiman, na Talmai.

original: From there they marched against the inhabitants of Debir (formerly known as Kiriath-sepher).
translation: Ol i go bek long hap, na ol i kam bak gen long ol pipol bilong Debir, we em i kolim Kiriath-sepher biktaim.

original: And Caleb said, “To the man who strikes down Kiriath-sepher and captures it, I will give my daughter Acsah in marriage.”
translation: Na Kalebe i tok, “Olsem man husat i kilim daun Kiriath-sefer na i kisim, mi bai givim daugta bilong mi Aksa long em ol i go long marij.”

original: So Othniel son of Caleb’s younger brother Kenaz captured the city, and Caleb gave his daughter Acsah to him in marriage.
translation: Othniel, pikinini brata bilong Kenaz, i go kisim taun, na Caleb i givim Aksa, meri bilong en, long em olsem meri.

original: One day Acsah came to Othniel and urged him to ask her father for a field. When she got off her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What do you desire?”
translation: Wanpela de Aksa i kam long Otniel na i tok strong long em, bai em abi askim papa bilong en long wanpela gras bilong planim. Na taim em i kisim lek bilong donki na i daun long graun, Kalebu i askim en, "Wanem samting yu laik?"
