original: “Give me a blessing,” she answered. “Since you have given me land in the Negev, give me springs of water as well.” So Caleb gave her both the upper and lower springs.
translation: “Givim mi blesing,” em i tok. “Yusim yu givim mi graun long Negev, nau givim mi springs bilong wara tu.” Na Kaleb i givim em tupela springs, wan bilong antap na wan bilong doun.

original: Now the descendants of Moses’ father-in-law, the Kenite, went up with the men of Judah from the City of Palms to the Wilderness of Judah in the Negev near Arad. They went to live among the people.
translation: Nau ol desenden bilong Kenite, papa bilong meri bilong Moses, i go apo wantaim ol man bilong Yuda from Jeriko, Siti bilong Palms, go long wilanes bilong Yuda long Negev klosap Arad. Ol i go bai stap among ol pipol.

original: Then the men of Judah went with their brothers the Simeonites, attacked the Canaanites living in Zephath, and devoted the city to destruction. So it was called Hormah.
translation: Ol man bilong Yuda i go wantaim brata bilong ol Simeonait, na ol i atakim Kanananit i stap long Zephath, na ol i makim siati ia bilong destro. Na hambak tru, em i kolim Hormah.

original: And Judah also captured Gaza, Ashkelon, and Ekron—each with its territory.
translation: Na Judah i kamapim Gaza, Askelon, na Ekron – ol siti yanpela wanpela stap long en nen grun na boundari.

original: The LORD was with Judah, and they took possession of the hill country; but they could not drive out the inhabitants of the plains because they had chariots of iron.
translation: GOD i stap wantaim Yuda, na ol Yuda i kisim bos long kantri we i go hap; tasol ol i no inap rausim ol pipol bilong ples i go daun, bikos ol i gat kareta bilong aipis.

original: Just as Moses had promised, Judah gave Hebron to Caleb, who drove out the descendants of the three sons of Anak.
translation: Olsem Moses i promis, Judah i givim Hebron long Caleb, na Caleb i tromoi aut ol descendent bilong olgeta three sons bilong Anak.

original: The Benjamites, however, failed to drive out the Jebusites living in Jerusalem. So to this day the Jebusites live there among the Benjamites.
translation: Benjamaitis i no inap driim aut Jebusaitis i stap long Jerusalem. Nogat, Jebusaitis i stap yet long ol Benjamaitis long tude.

original: The house of Joseph also attacked Bethel, and the LORD was with them.
translation: Haus bilong Yosef i go atakim Betel, na LORD i stap wantaim ol.

original: They sent spies to Bethel (formerly known as Luz),
translation: Ol i sendim spia long Betel, we em i bin kolim Lus bikosim taim bifo.

original: and when the spies saw a man coming out of the city, they said to him, “Please show us how to get into the city, and we will treat you kindly.”
translation: Na taim spais i lukim man i kam aut bilong siti, ol i tokim em, “Plezi soim mipela rot bilong go insait long siti, na bai yumi givim yu gutpela.”

original: So the man showed them the entrance to the city, and they put the city to the sword but released that man and all his family.
translation: Na man i showim entrins long ples, na ol i kilim ples na mekim ol i dai, tasol ol i lusim man na ol famili bilong en.

original: And the man went to the land of the Hittites, built a city, and called it Luz, which is its name to this day.
translation: Na man i go long graun bilong Hitaitis, ol i bikim taun, na ol i kolim Luz, dispela em i nem bilong en inap long tude.

original: At that time Manasseh failed to drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shean, Taanach, Dor, Ibleam, Megiddo, and their villages; for the Canaanites were determined to dwell in that land.
translation: Long taem, Manase i no inap drivim olt ol pipol bilong Bet-Shean, Taanak, Dor, Ibleam, Megido, na ol vilij bilong ol; ol Kanaanit i laik stap yet long ples, ol i bin desis long stap.

original: When Israel became stronger, they pressed the Canaanites into forced labor, but they never drove them out completely.
translation: Taim Israel i kamap strongpela, ol i mekim wok kanak long ol Kanaanit, tasol ol i no inap rausim ol komplet.

original: Ephraim also failed to drive out the Canaanites living in Gezer; so the Canaanites continued to dwell among them in Gezer.
translation: Efraim i no inap drivim aut Kanaanit i stap yet long Geza, na Kanaanit i stap long midst bilong ol long Geza.

original: Zebulun failed to drive out the inhabitants of Kitron and Nahalol; so the Canaanites lived among them and served as forced laborers.
translation: Zebulun i no inap driim aut ol pipal i stap long Kitron na Nahalol, na so Canaanites i stap wantaim ol, na ol i wok olgeta long wok forced.

original: Asher failed to drive out the inhabitants of Acco, Sidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, and Rehob.
translation: Asa i no bin karim aut ol pipol bilong Akko, Sidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, na Rehob.

original: So the Asherites lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, because they did not drive them out.
translation: Na Ol Asher i stap wantaim ol pipol Kanani i stap long graun, bikos ol i no ken drivim ol longwe go.

original: Naphtali failed to drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath. So the Naphtalites also lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, but the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath served them as forced laborers.
translation: Naphtali i no ken drivim ol i go long Beth-shemesh na Beth-anath. Olsem, Ol Naphtalites tu i stap long ol pipol Canaanite i stap long graun, tasol ol pipol i stap long Beth-shemesh na Beth-anath i wok strong long ol olsem wokman i no bin pas.

original: The Amorites forced the Danites into the hill country and did not allow them to come down into the plain.
translation: Ol Amori i draivim ol Daniti i go long kantri, na ol i no givim spaes long ol i kam daun long ples flatt.

original: And the Amorites were determined to dwell in Mount Heres, Aijalon, and Shaalbim. But when the house of Joseph grew in strength, they pressed the Amorites into forced labor.
translation: Na Amoraitis i mak olsem bai ol stap long Maun Heres, Aijalon, na Shaalbim. Tasol husat haus bilong Josep i kamap strong, ol i kukim wok bilong Amoraitis long force.

original: And the border of the Amorites extended from the Ascent of Akrabbim to Sela and beyond.
translation: Kauntri bilong Amori em i go longwe from Asens bilong Akrabbim, go long Sela na bihain.

original: Now the angel of the LORD went up from Gilgal to Bochim and said, “I brought you up out of Egypt and led you into the land that I had promised to your fathers, and I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you,
translation: Nau, ein bilong LORD i go ap gen from Gilgal long Bochim na tok, "Mi bringim yu up nau long ai bilong Egypt, na mi leadim yu i go insait long kantri we mi promis long papa bilong yu, na Mi tok, 'Mi no bai bagarap covenant bilong mi na yu.'"

original: and you are not to make a covenant with the people of this land, but you shall tear down their altars.’ Yet you have not obeyed My voice. What is this you have done?
translation: Na yu no ken mekim pakt long ol pipol bilong dispela lan, bai yu rukim daun altar bilong ol. Yet yu no bihainim voisis bilong Mi. Wanem samting yu mekim dispela?

original: So now I tell you that I will not drive out these people before you; they will be thorns in your sides, and their gods will be a snare to you.”
translation: Nau mipela tok olsem, mipela no ken kikim ol long wei, ol i kamapim strongpela pasis long sid bilong yu, na god bilong ol, em i kamapim rop long yu.

original: When the angel of the LORD had spoken these words to all the Israelites, the people lifted up their voices and wept.
translation: Wanpela taim ein angel bilong LORD i tok already ol dispela wod long olgeta Israelait, ol pipel i kisim voz bilong ol na ol irap.

original: So they called that place Bochim and offered sacrifices there to the LORD.
translation: Ol i givim nem long ples ia, Bokim, na ol i bringim sakrifis long LORD.

original: After Joshua had dismissed the people, the Israelites went out to take possession of the land, each to his own inheritance.
translation: Long Joshua i lusim ol pipol, Ol Israelites i go aut na kisim ken gras long graun, ol wanwan i go long inpatakim bilong en.

original: And the people served the LORD throughout the days of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him, who had seen all the great works that the LORD had done for Israel.
translation: Na ol pipol i servim Lord oltaim long taim bilong Josaia na bikpela manmeri i stap longtaim na Josaia i go pinis, ol i lukim bikpela wok ol Lord i mekim long Isrel.

original: And Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of 110.
translation: Na Joshua pikinini bilong Nun, wokman bilong Jehovah, i dai we em i 110 yia.

original: They buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath-heres in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
translation: Ol i kisim na kaberim em long lan bilong en i kam doun, long Timnath-heres long kantri bilong Efrem, long sait bilong Maunten Gaash i go hap.

original: After that whole generation had also been gathered to their fathers, another generation rose up who did not know the LORD or the works that He had done for Israel.
translation: Olgeta hap generaion i go daun long tumbuna, nupela generaion i kamap nau, ol i no save long LORD, na wok olsem em i mekim long Israel.

original: And the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD and served the Baals.
translation: Na Israelites i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD na ol i sarve Baals.

original: Thus they forsook the LORD, the God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt, and they followed after various gods of the peoples around them. They bowed down to them and provoked the LORD to anger,
translation: Ol lēvim pinis LONG, God bilong tumbuna ol, we i kisim olaut na was long kantri Egip, na ol folo bihain long planti kinda god bilong ples ol i stap arondim ol. Ol i kukim daun long ol, na wariim belly bilong LONG, bikos ol mekim em i angry.

original: for they forsook Him and served Baal and the Ashtoreths.
translation: Ol i lakim Em, na ol i sarve Baal na Ashtoreths.

original: Then the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He delivered them into the hands of those who plundered them. He sold them into the hands of their enemies all around, whom they were no longer able to resist.
translation: Na anga bilong LORD i braik, na em i givim Israel long han bilong ol poitpinis i plunda ol, na em i salim ol long han bilong ol enemies bilong ol long ol sia, ol i no inap winim gen.

original: Wherever Israel marched out, the hand of the LORD was against them to bring calamity, just as He had sworn to them. So they were greatly distressed.
translation: Wanpela taim Israel i go na kam, han bilong LORD i stap agensim ol long bringim hevi, olsem hem i promis long ol. Na ol i sori tru.

original: Then the LORD raised up judges, who saved them from the hands of those who plundered them.
translation: Na Papa God i kirapim jij, na em i save ol long han bilong ol i bin bagarapim ol.

original: Israel, however, did not listen to their judges. Instead, they prostituted themselves with other gods and bowed down to them. They quickly turned from the way of their fathers, who had walked in obedience to the LORD’s commandments; they did not do as their fathers had done.
translation: Israel, tasol, i no harim tok bilong jujes ol i gat. Ol i go bek long olegata god na mekim sampela samting nogut wantaim, na klostemai ol i go daun long ol. Ol i lusim rot bilong tumbuna ol i stap, ol i warka long obidiens bilong tok bilong LORD, na ol i no mekim olsem tumbuna ol i mekim.

original: Whenever the LORD raised up a judge for the Israelites, He was with that judge and saved them from the hands of their enemies while the judge was still alive; for the LORD was moved to pity by their groaning under those who oppressed them and afflicted them.
translation: Taim olgeta LORD i kirapim wanpela juj long Israel, em i stap wantaim juj, na i save ol long han bilong ol enemy wail em i stap yet; bikos LORD i kisim sori long ol olsem tisa ol i guria long ne ka ol i bagarapim ol.

original: But when the judge died, the Israelites became even more corrupt than their fathers, going after other gods to serve them and bow down to them. They would not give up their evil practices and stubborn ways.
translation: Bain ol i dai pinis long jaj, Israelites i kamap moa strong long sindok, ol i go bek long narapela kina god na servim ol, katim hed long ol. Ol i no lusim wok strong hed na sindok bilong ol.

original: So the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He said, “Because this nation has transgressed the covenant I laid down for their fathers and has not heeded My voice,
translation: Na iari bilong Jehovah i bamim long Israel, na Em i tok, "Ol i go pas long kaivet we mi putim daun long tumbuna bilong ol, na ol i no lisen long tok bilong mi."

original: I will no longer drive out before them any of the nations Joshua left when he died.
translation: Mi no go draivim ovas gen long hap bilong ol nesen ol i stap, ol nesen ol Tisaia lusim taim em i dai.

original: In this way I will test whether Israel will keep the way of the LORD by walking in it as their fathers did.”
translation: Olsem nau, mi bai tri bilong Israel, bai ol i save kaipim rot bilong Jehovah, wokabaut long em olsem tumbuna ol i wokabaut.

original: That is why the LORD had left those nations in place and had not driven them out immediately by delivering them into the hand of Joshua.
translation: Em i bikos bilong Bikpela, olsem na em i lusim ol narapela nesen ol i stap yet long ples, na em i no kilim ol i go quiq fast, givim ol long han bilong Josaia.

original: These are the nations that the LORD left to test all the Israelites who had not known any of the wars in Canaan,
translation: Dispela i nem bilong nesen ol i stap long han bilong Bikpela, na ol i mekim traen long ol Israelita ol i no save long eni kain bikpela faet long kantri Canaan.

original: if only to teach warfare to the subsequent generations of Israel, especially to those who had not known it formerly:
translation: I gat wanpela wok tasol long skulim tait bilong fait long nenpela jenarason bilong Israel, espeshili long ol pikinini we we no save long biktaim:

original: the five rulers of the Philistines, all the Canaanites, the Sidonians, and the Hivites who lived in the mountains of Lebanon from Mount Baal-hermon to Lebo-hamath.
translation: Faif bilong Philistines, olgeta Canaanites, Sidonians, na Hivites ol i stap long maunten bilong Lebanon, stat long Maunten Baal-hermon go long Lebo-hamath.

original: These nations were left to test the Israelites, to find out whether they would keep the commandments of the LORD, which He had given their fathers through Moses.
translation: Nesen olgeta dispela kantri i stap yet long triam Pipol Israel, long lukim ipas wa bai ol i strongim komanding bilong GOD, we dispensela komanding em i givim tumbuna bilong ol long Moses.

original: Thus the Israelites continued to live among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i stap yet long ol pipol Kanaan, Hiti, Amori, Perizi, Hivi, na Jebusi.

original: And they took the daughters of these people in marriage, gave their own daughters to their sons, and served their gods.
translation: Na ol i kisim daughta bilong ol dispela manmeri na i marit long ol, ol i givim daughta bilong ol yet long ol son bilong ol, na ol i sarve god bilong ol.

original: So the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD; they forgot the LORD their God and served the Baals and the Asherahs.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong Jehovah; ol lusim Jehovah God bilong ol na ol i sarve Baals na Asherahs.

original: Then the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He sold them into the hand of Cushan-rishathaim king of Aram-naharaim, and the Israelites served him eight years.
translation: Nogut bilong Jehovah i bung long Israel, na Em inim ol sellim long han bilong Kushan-rishathaim king bilong Aram-naharaim, na Israelait i sarvim em eight yia.

original: But when the Israelites cried out to the LORD, He raised up Othniel son of Caleb’s younger brother Kenaz as a deliverer to save them.
translation: Bai pipol Israel kalabus long kisim skelim na kalap long Jehovah, nau em i kamap olsem Otniel, pikinini bilong Kenaz, bratpi bilong Kalep, i kamap wanpela man i save ol, long savesim ol.

original: The Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he became Israel’s judge and went out to war. And the LORD delivered Cushan-rishathaim king of Aram into the hand of Othniel, who prevailed against him.
translation: Spirits bilong LORD i kam antap long em, na em i bikim jaj bilong Israel, i go aut long war. Na LORD i givim Cushan-rishathaim king bilong Aram i go long han bilong Othniel, na Othniel i winim em.

original: So the land had rest for forty years, until Othniel son of Kenaz died.
translation: Kantri i kamap stil na strong long forti yia, na Otniel sussa bilong Kenaz i dai pinis.

original: Once again the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD. So He gave Eglon king of Moab power over Israel, because they had done evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Ol Israelites i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD. Na Bikpela i givim strong long Eglon king bilong Moab ibin bosim ol Israel, bikos ol i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: After enlisting the Ammonites and Amalekites to join forces with him, Eglon attacked and defeated Israel, taking possession of the City of Palms.
translation: Eglon i kam long paitim Ammonitis na Amalekitis, ol i joiim ol i go wantaim em, na ol i kisim faet na winim Israel, tasol Eglon i takim ova na bosim Palms Siti.

original: The Israelites served Eglon king of Moab eighteen years.
translation: Oli Israelait i sarve Eglon king bilong Moab eighteen yia.

original: And again they cried out to the LORD, and He raised up Ehud son of Gera, a left-handed Benjamite, as their deliverer. So they sent him with tribute to Eglon king of Moab.
translation: Na ol i kisim aut na krai long LORD, na Em i kirapim Ehud, Pikinini bilong Gera, lefo-han Benjamite, olsem saviour bilong ol. Ol i sendim em wantaim kaikai long Eglon, king bilong Moab.

original: Now Ehud had made for himself a double-edged sword a cubit long. He strapped it to his right thigh under his cloak
translation: Na Ehud i bin mekim sampela sord we i gat tu ain, lonpela wan fut kubit. Em i bin bekim i go long lek bilong en rait, anakai long kalimap bilong en.

original: and brought the tribute to Eglon king of Moab, who was an obese man.
translation: Na ol i kisim na kisim i go pinis tok bilong pei long Eglon king bilong Moab, man i gat bikpela bel.

original: After Ehud had finished presenting the tribute, he ushered out those who had carried it.
translation: Nar Ehud i pinis long givim kauntri bilong en, na em i karim aut ol i kam bilong bringim em.

original: But upon reaching the idols near Gilgal, he himself turned back and said, “I have a secret message for you, O king.” “Silence,” said the king, and all his attendants left him.
translation: Long taim em i kam bek long hain bilong idol klostu long Gilgal, em yet i turnim bek na tok olsem, "Mi gat wanpela tok secret long yu, King." "Mauswara," King i tok olsem, na ol workea bilong en i lusim em.

original: Then Ehud approached him while he was sitting alone in the coolness of his upper room. “I have a word from God for you,” Ehud said, and the king rose from his seat.
translation: Na Ehud i kam klostu long em wail na em sindaun lone long kol kilim na rum bilong antap. “Mi gat tok bilong God long yu,” Ehud i tok, na king i stand up nau.

original: And Ehud reached with his left hand, pulled the sword from his right thigh, and plunged it into Eglon’s belly.
translation: Na Ehud em i raitim wan han klostu long lefbak bilong en, em i kilim na em i pulim olt sword bilong en long thai bilong raithan, na em i pusim i go insait long bel bilong Eglon.

original: Even the handle sank in after the blade, and Eglon’s fat closed in over it, so that Ehud did not withdraw the sword from his belly. And Eglon’s bowels emptied.
translation: Hanol i go insait bihainim blad, na Eglon i gat bikpela graun na i kam bek gen ovasit, so Ehud i no pulim olt swoord long bel bilong en. Na Eglon i bel hat pilai, gut bilong en i kam aut.

original: Then Ehud went out through the porch, closing and locking the doors of the upper room behind him.
translation: Na Ehud i go aut tha roung bilong veranda, klosing na lokim diwa bilong rum bubu behain im.

original: After Ehud was gone, Eglon’s servants came in and found the doors of the upper room locked. “He must be relieving himself in the cool room,” they said.
translation: Ehud i go pinis, servants bilong Eglon i kam insait, ol i lukim dei bikim door i lokim. Ol i tok, "Em i stap kotim sklep long rum kol."

original: So they waited until they became worried and saw that he had still not opened the doors of the upper room. Then they took the key and opened the doors—and there was their lord lying dead on the floor.
translation: Ol wait pinis, na ol i kamap nating long wonem na ol lukim em i no openim door yet long rum bilong antap. Ol kisim ki na openim door—na ol lukim papa bilong ol i lapun, i pundaun dai long flor.

original: Ehud, however, had escaped while the servants waited. He passed by the idols and escaped to Seirah.
translation: Ehud i ranawe nau wail na servas i waitim. Em i pas long hap bilong idoli na em i ranawe go long Seirah.

original: On arriving in Seirah, he blew the ram’s horn throughout the hill country of Ephraim. The Israelites came down with him from the hills, and he became their leader.
translation: Taim em i kamap long Seirah, em i blowim horn bilong ram oltaim yusim long singaut long ol long kantri bilong Efrem we i go antap. Israelites i jionim em na kamdaun wantaim em long ples balus, na em i kamap leda bilong ol.

original: “Follow me,” he told them, “for the LORD has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand.” So they followed him down and seized the fords of the Jordan leading to Moab, and did not allow anyone to cross over.
translation: “Bihainim mi,” em tok, “Bikpela i givim ol enemy bilong yu Ol Man Moab long han bilong yu.” Nogat, ol i go daun bihainim em, ol i kisim ol ples we i go daun long wara Jordan we i go long Moab, na ol i no allowim eni man i go pas.

original: At that time they struck down about ten thousand Moabites, all robust and valiant men. Not one of them escaped.
translation: Long taim ia, ol i kilim ten tausen Ol Moab, ol man strongpela na i gat kuraj. Not wan bilong ol i stap.

original: So Moab was subdued under the hand of Israel that day, and the land had rest for eighty years.
translation: Moab i kukim na i daun aninit long han bilong Israel olsem de, na kantri i amamas moa long taim eighty yia.

original: After Ehud came Shamgar son of Anath. And he too saved Israel, striking down six hundred Philistines with an oxgoad.
translation: Bihaen long Ehud, Shamgar sun bilong Anath i kam. Na em tu i save Israel, i kilim daun sikis hundred Philistine wantaim stik bilong bulmakau.

original: After Ehud died, the Israelites again did evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Long taim Ehud i dai pinis, Pipol Israel olsem yet nau i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: So the LORD sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor. The commander of his forces was Sisera, who lived in Harosheth-hagoyim.
translation: Na LORD i salim ol i go long han bilong Jabin king bilong Kanaan, em i king stap long Hazor. Kapten bilong solja bilong em, Sisera, i stap long ples bilong Harosheth-hagoyim.

original: Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, because Jabin had nine hundred chariots of iron, and he had harshly oppressed the Israelites for twenty years.
translation: Olam Israel i karim hap long LORD, bikos Jabin i gat naipela 900 kareta bilong aisen, na em i mekim ol Israelit i suffa strong long 20 yia.

original: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, was judging Israel at that time.
translation: Nau Deborah, meri prophet bilong Lappidoth, em i jaj long Israel long dispela taim.

original: And she would sit under the Palm of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim, where the Israelites would go up to her for judgment.
translation: Na em i save sindaun ananait long Palma bilong Debora, long wiket bihain long Ramah na Bethel, long kantri bilong maunten bilong Efraim, olsem na Pipol Israel i go ap i go klostu long en long taim bilong jus.

original: She summoned Barak son of Abinoam from Kedesh in Naphtali and said to him, “Surely the LORD, the God of Israel, is commanding you: ‘Go and march to Mount Tabor, taking with you ten thousand men of Naphtali and Zebulun.
translation: Em i kirapim Barak sun bilong Abinoam long Kedesh insait long Naphtali na em i tokim olsem long em, “Bikpela God bilong Israel i givim tok long yu: ‘Yu go na makim i go long Maunt Tabor, na yu kisim wanpela ten tausen man bilong taim bilong tribe Naphtali na Zebulun.’”

original: And I will draw out Sisera the commander of Jabin’s army, his chariots, and his troops to the River Kishon, and I will deliver him into your hand.’”
translation: Na mi bai bekim Sisera komanda bilong armi bilong Jabin, ol kariot bilong en, na solja bilong en, ol i go long River Kishon, na givim em i go long han bilong yu.

original: Barak said to her, “If you will go with me, I will go; but if you will not go with me, I will not go.”
translation: Barak i tokim em, “Yupela i go wantaim mi, orait mi go; but long as yu no laik go wantaim mi, mi no go.”

original: “I will certainly go with you,” Deborah replied, “but the road you are taking will bring you no honor, because the LORD will be selling Sisera into the hand of a woman.” So Deborah got up and went with Barak to Kedesh,
translation: “Mi go wantaim yu definit,” Deborah i tok, “bai rot yumi i go long en bai ol i no givim yu gutpela nem, bikos LORD bai salim Sisera long han bilong meri.” Na Deborah i kam daun na i go wantaim Barak long Kedesh.

original: where he summoned Zebulun and Naphtali. Ten thousand men followed him, and Deborah also went with him.
translation: Em i kirapim Zebulun na Naphtali. Ten tasen man i go bek gen long en, na Deborah tu i go wantaim em.

original: Now Heber the Kenite had moved away from the Kenites, the descendants of Hobab the father-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent by the great tree of Zaanannim, which was near Kedesh.
translation: Nau Eba Keniti i go bek long ol Keniti, ol desenden bilong Hobab, papa bilong meri bilong Moses, na em i planim haus bilong en klostu long gret tri bilong Zaananim, em i klostu long Kedesh.

original: When Sisera was told that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up Mount Tabor,
translation: Taim Sisera harim tok, Barak, pikinini bilong Abinoam, i go antap long Maunt Tabor,

original: he summoned all nine hundred of his iron chariots and all the men with him, from Harosheth-hagoyim to the River Kishon.
translation: Em i kirapim olsem nain hundred iron kareta bilong en, na ol man husat i kam wantaim em, from Harosheth-hagoyim long go pas long Kishon River.

original: Then Deborah said to Barak, “Arise, for this is the day that the LORD has delivered Sisera into your hand. Has not the LORD gone before you?” So Barak came down from Mount Tabor with ten thousand men following him.
translation: Na Deborah i tokim Barak, "Kam daun, tasol em i de nau, Papa God i givim Sisera long han bilong yu. Papa God i go bifor yu?" Na Barak i kam daun long Maunt Tabor, na ten thousand man i foloem i go daun.

original: And in front of him the LORD routed with the sword Sisera, all his charioteers, and all his army. Sisera abandoned his chariot and fled on foot.
translation: Na long hap bilong em, Papa God ol i kilim ol long suwrd Sisera, ol driva bilong kar, na ol soldia. Sisera lusim kar em na Sisera ranawe long lek.

original: Then Barak pursued the chariots and army as far as Harosheth-hagoyim, and the whole army of Sisera fell by the sword; not a single man was left.
translation: Na Barak i go bek long kar na arimi ol, na go inap long Harosheth-hagoyim, na ol i pundaun na kisim dai long sop; ikamau man no stap, ol i dai pinis, arimi bilong Sisera i hamar long sop.

original: Meanwhile, Sisera had fled on foot to the tent of Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, because there was peace between Jabin king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.
translation: Wanpela taim, Sisera i ranawe long fut go long han bilong Jael, meri bilong Heber Eba Keniti, bikos dispela em i gat pis long Jabin king bilong Hazor na husat bilong Heber Eba Keniti.

original: Jael went out to greet Sisera and said to him, “Come in, my lord. Come in with me. Do not be afraid.” So he entered her tent, and she covered him with a blanket.
translation: Jael i go aut long greetim Sisera na ol i tokim em, “Yu kam klostu long me, papa bilong mipela. Yu no ken bikim fear.” Na em i go insait long haus bilong en, na Jael i kisim laplap na kova em stap long en.

original: Sisera said to her, “Please give me a little water to drink, for I am thirsty.” So she opened a container of milk, gave him a drink, and covered him again.
translation: Sisera i tokim em, “Givim mi liklik waia blong drink, bikos mi tumbuna.” Na em i opim bikpela kontena susumilk, givim em tumi, na kisim bek i go bek gen.

original: “Stand at the entrance to the tent,” he said, “and if anyone comes and asks you, ‘Is there a man here?’ say, ‘No.’”
translation: Stap klostu long entris bilong haus, sapos eni i kam na askim yu, 'I gat man hia?' yu tok, 'Nogat.'

original: But as he lay sleeping from exhaustion, Heber’s wife Jael took a tent peg, grabbed a hammer, and went silently to Sisera. She drove the peg through his temple and into the ground, and he died.
translation: Buat em i slip long nait, na i amamas long ples, meri bilong Heber Jael i kisim wanpela pek bilong tent, kisim hamala, na i go bek i go inap long Sisera. Em thrustim pek gen long temple bilong em, na pek i go daun long graun, na em i dai.

original: When Barak arrived in pursuit of Sisera, Jael went out to greet him and said to him, “Come, and I will show you the man you are seeking.” So he went in with her, and there lay Sisera dead, with a tent peg through his temple.
translation: Taim Barak i kam bek long pursuim Sisera, Jael i go aut long greetim em na tokim em, "Kam, na mi bai soim yu man yu wari long lukim." Na em i go insait wantaim em, na ol i lukim Sisera i dai pinis, peg bilong tent i stap insait long temple bilong en.

original: On that day God subdued Jabin king of Canaan before the Israelites.
translation: Long dispela de God i winim Jabin king bilong Kanaan bifor ai bilong Israel.

original: And the hand of the Israelites grew stronger and stronger against Jabin king of Canaan until they destroyed him.
translation: Na han bilong Pipol Israel i kam strong na strong gen long Jabin king bilong Kanaan, olsem na ol i bagarapim em.

original: On that day Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang this song:
translation: Long dispela de Deborah na Barak sambai Abinoam singim dispela sang:

original: “When the princes take the lead in Israel, when the people volunteer, bless the LORD.
translation: Wanpela taim prinis ol i bikpela leda long Isrel i go bek, wanpela taim ol pikinini manmeri i kam antap long volentea, blesim LORD.

original: Listen, O kings! Give ear, O princes! I will sing to the LORD; I will sing praise to the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Harim, o kwinis! Kam herem, o prinsis! Mipela bai singim sang long LORD, na mipela bai givim peis long LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: O LORD, when You went out from Seir, when You marched from the land of Edom, the earth trembled, the heavens poured out rain, and the clouds poured down water.
translation: Papa bilong olgeta, wane Yu go aut bilong mauntin Seir, wane Yu i kamdaun bilong kantri Edom, gras i shakem, heven i katim rain, klaut i katim daun wara.

original: The mountains quaked before the LORD, the One of Sinai, before the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Ol maunten i shake long wei bilong LORD, Wan i stap long Sinai, long wei bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: In the days of Shamgar son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were deserted and the travelers took the byways.
translation: Long taim bilong Shamgar, Pikinini bilong Anath, long taim bilong Jael, rod bilong kantry i bikim olsem ples i no gut, ol man i no wokabaut, na ol trvela i go na wokabaut long rot bilong bahn.

original: Life in the villages ceased; it ended in Israel, until I, Deborah, arose, a mother in Israel.
translation: Laip long ples i go daun, em i stap pinis long Israel, na mi, Deborah, mama long Israel, mi kamap.

original: When they chose new gods, then war came to their gates. Not a shield or spear was found among forty thousand in Israel.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i bikim god nupela, na war i kam insait long boundary bilong ol. Maski skild na spia em i no stap long ol forty tausand man long Isrel.

original: My heart is with the princes of Israel, with the volunteers among the people. Bless the LORD!
translation: Hart bilong me i stap wantaim prins bilong Israel, wantaim ol volentea i stap long narapela manmeri. Blessim LORD!

original: You who ride white donkeys, who sit on saddle blankets, and you who travel the road, ponder
translation: Yu husat ridim donki waits, husat save sitdaun long karpet bilong sadel, na yu husat wakabaot lon stua, tingim.

original: the voices of the singers at the watering places. There they shall recount the righteous acts of the LORD, the righteous deeds of His villagers in Israel. Then the people of the LORD went down to the gates:
translation: Vois bilong singaspela i save harim long ples bilong painim wara. Ol i go dai tok aut i gat tok bilong stret taim bilong LORD, stret wok bilong pisin bilong em long Israel. Na ol pipol bilong LORD i go daun long gate:

original: ‘Awake, awake, O Deborah! Awake, awake, sing a song! Arise, O Barak, and take hold of your captives, O son of Abinoam!’
translation: Kam bek, kam bek, o Debora! Kam bek, kam bek, singim sang! Stanap, o Barak, kisim ol prisner bilong yu, o susa bilong Abinoam!

original: Then the survivors came down to the nobles; the people of the LORD came down to me against the mighty.
translation: Ol savim i kam daun long ol bifmen; ol pipel bilong LORD i kam daun long me against ol strongpela.

original: Some came from Ephraim, with their roots in Amalek; Benjamin came with your people after you. The commanders came down from Machir, the bearers of the marshal’s staff from Zebulun.
translation: Ol i kam from Ephraim, ol i gat rif na rot long Amalek; Benjamin i kam wantaim ol pipol bilong yu bihainim yu. Ol komandan i kam daun from Machir, ol i karim stik bilong komanda from Zebulun.

original: The princes of Issachar were with Deborah, and Issachar was with Barak, rushing into the valley at his heels. In the clans of Reuben there was great indecision.
translation: Prins bilong Esakar i stap wantaim Debora, na Esakar i stap wantaim Barak, ol i ran i go daun long bele long hili bilong en. Long clan bilong Ruben, i gat bikpela tok pikinini.

original: Why did you sit among the sheepfolds to hear the whistling for the flocks? In the clans of Reuben there was great indecision.
translation: Wai yu sindaun mong ol yapila long harim tok bilong ol fok long ol pipol i save pulim animal? Long klans bilong Reuben, i gat nogat klea tru.

original: Gilead remained beyond the Jordan. Dan, why did you linger by the ships? Asher stayed at the coast and remained in his harbors.
translation: Gilead i stap bek long Jordan. Dan, wil yu bin hang bek long ship? Asher i stap long kos na i stap insait long havens bilong en.

original: Zebulun was a people who risked their lives; Naphtali, too, on the heights of the battlefield.
translation: Zebulun em i stap long pipol we isave lusim laip bilong ol; Naphtali, tu, long hap bilong ples bilong fait.

original: Kings came and fought; then the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach by the waters of Megiddo, but they took no plunder of silver.
translation: Ol kingly bilo i kam na fight; king bilong Kanana i fight long Taanak long wara bilong Megido, tasol ol i no tek bek bilong silva.

original: From the heavens the stars fought; from their courses they fought against Sisera.
translation: Longo heven sta tutu i go aplau long rot bilong ol, na ol i go aplau gen Sisera.

original: The River Kishon swept them away, the ancient river, the River Kishon. March on, O my soul, in strength!
translation: Kishon River i kisim ol i go long, olpela Kishon River. Kam na, o sori bilong me, i go ap long streng!

original: Then the hooves of horses thundered—the mad galloping of his stallions.
translation: Plak bilong lek bilong hors i go danis strong - gallop i go olsem mani long stallion bilong em.

original: ‘Curse Meroz,’ says the angel of the LORD. ‘Bitterly curse her inhabitants; for they did not come to help the LORD, to help the LORD against the mighty.’
translation: ‘Meroz i go long ol bikpela karai,’ ol i tok long ainjel bilong ol bikpela God. ‘Karaiim Meroz i go long ol bikpela pain, ol pipol bilong en i stap, bikos ol i no kam helpim ol bikpela God, helpim ol bikpela God against ol strongpela.’

original: Most blessed among women is Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, most blessed of tent-dwelling women.
translation: I Jael, meri bilong Heber Keniti, i blesimd bikos long ol meri, na i blesimd sori long ol meri i stap long haus bilong gras.

original: He asked for water, and she gave him milk. In a magnificent bowl she brought him curds.
translation: Em i askim wara, na em i givim susu long hem. Long bowl bilong winim prais em i bringim kaed long hem.

original: She reached for the tent peg, her right hand for the workman’s hammer. She struck Sisera and crushed his skull; she shattered and pierced his temple.
translation: Em i go hap tumas long pin bilong haus, han rait bilong en i go long hamar bilong wokman. Em i kilim Sisera na i brukim skul bilong en; em i spikim na i pasim tempal bilong en.

original: At her feet he collapsed, he fell, there he lay still; at her feet he collapsed, he fell; where he collapsed, there he fell dead.
translation: Na em i pundaun long lek bilong en, em i pilai, na em i stap yet long hap bilong en; na em i pundaun long lek bilong en, em i pilai, na we em i pundaun, em i pilai dai.

original: Sisera’s mother looked through the window; she peered through the lattice and lamented: ‘Why is his chariot so long in coming? What has delayed the clatter of his chariots?’
translation: Mama bilong Sisera i lukim thru wino; i kisim i go bek long betel nut pece, na i bin mekim sori: ‘Wai kar bilong em i kam bihain olgeta? Wai nais bilong kar em i stop olsem?’

original: Her wisest ladies answer; indeed she keeps telling herself,
translation: Ol meri bilong en i wis, ol i tok, em i stap tokim em yet.

original: ‘Are they not finding and dividing the spoil—a girl or two for each warrior, a plunder of dyed garments for Sisera, the spoil of embroidered garments for the neck of the looter?’
translation: Ol i no painim na diposim ol samting bilong war – wanpela gel o tu bilong ol soldia, ol klos we i bin mekim red i go long Sisera, na ol samting bilong war we i gat klos painim bilong ol nek bilong ol man bilong stilim samting?

original: So may all Your enemies perish, O LORD! But may those who love You shine like the sun at its brightest.” And the land had rest for forty years.
translation: Mipela hop ol enemies bilong Yu, Papa bilong olgeta, ol i dai pinis! Bai ol dispela i lakim Yu, mipela hop bai ol i shine olsem san we i kamap strong tumas.” Na graun i stap pas long poro yia.

original: Again the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD; so He delivered them into the hand of Midian for seven years,
translation: Bihain long dispela, Pipol Israel i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD; na em i givim ol long han bilong Midian long seven yia,

original: and the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel. Because of the Midianites, the Israelites prepared shelters for themselves in the mountains, caves, and strongholds.
translation: Na han bilong Midian i win long Israel. Ol Israel, bikos ol i afraid long Ol Midian, ol i preparim haus bilong ol yet long maunten, hol bilong maunten, na ples strong bilong ol.

original: Whenever the Israelites would plant their crops, the Midianites, Amalekites, and other people of the east would come up and invade them,
translation: Waneva taim Israelites i planim graun bilong ol, Midianites, Amalekites, na pipol bilong ist i kam antap long kantri na bagarapim ol.

original: encamping against them as far as Gaza and destroying the produce of the land. They left Israel with no sustenance, neither sheep nor oxen nor donkeys.
translation: Ol i kamp long ples bilong Israel, stat long Gaza na go inap, distroyim produis bilong graun. Ol i lusi Israel na i no gat kaikai, sip, bulmakau, na donki.

original: For the Midianites came with their livestock and their tents like a great swarm of locusts. They and their camels were innumerable, and they entered the land to ravage it.
translation: Midianaitis i kam wantaim ol animal na tent bilong ol, olsem wanpela bikpela swarm bilong lokas. Na ol kemel bilong ol, ol i no gat nap, ol i go insait long kantri na bagarapim em.

original: Israel was greatly impoverished by Midian, and the Israelites cried out to the LORD.
translation: Isrel i go daun long poverty bikos Midian, na ol Isrel i kisim voz long Jehovah.

original: Now when the Israelites cried out to the LORD because of Midian,
translation: Nau ol Isrel pipo kisim voz long tok bilong God bikos Midian,

original: He sent them a prophet, who told them, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: I brought you up out of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Em i sendim man prophet long ol, i tokim ol, “Dispela em i toktok bilong Papa God, Bikpela God bilong Israel, olsem: Mi bringim yu kom bek long Egip, long haus bilong slaviri.

original: I delivered you out of the hands of Egypt and all your oppressors. I drove them out before you and gave you their land.
translation: Mi birua yu long han bilong Ijip na ol i bagarapim yu. Mi puskim ol i go bifo yu na givim yu lain bilong ol.

original: And I said to you: ‘I am the LORD your God. You must not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell.’ But you did not obey Me.”
translation: Na mi bin tokim yu: 'Mi em i God bilong yu. Yu no ken bikim fear long god bilong Amori, long graun we yu stap.' Tasol yu no lusim tok bilong mi.

original: Then the angel of the LORD came and sat down under the oak in Ophrah that belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, where his son Gideon was threshing wheat in a winepress to hide it from the Midianites.
translation: Na Engel bilong LORD i kam, i sindaun aninit long diwai oak long Ophrah, em i bilong Joash Abiezrite, ples we Gideon, pikinini bilong en, i save waisim wheat long paip bilong wain, bilong hikim em friom Midianites.

original: And the angel of the LORD appeared to Gideon and said, “The LORD is with you, O mighty man of valor.”
translation: Na Aenjel bilong LORD i kamap, ol i tokim Gideon, "LORD i stap wantaim yu, o man strongpela na gat kuraj."

original: “Please, my Lord,” Gideon replied, “if the LORD is with us, why has all this happened to us? And where are all His wonders of which our fathers told us, saying, ‘Has not the LORD brought us up out of Egypt?’ But now the LORD has forsaken us and delivered us into the hand of Midian.”
translation: “Ple, Lord bilong mi,” Gideon i tok, “odinai i stap wantaim yumpla, ol dispela wondas olsem tumbuna bilong yumpla tokim mipela, em i kamap long yumpla long taim bifo? Odinai i karim yumpla i kam bek long Egip, tasol nau odinai i lusim yumpla na yumpla i givim long han bilong Midian.”

original: The LORD turned to him and said, “Go in the strength you have and save Israel from the hand of Midian. Am I not sending you?”
translation: Papa God i turnim face long em na tokim, “Yu go long streng yu gat na savim Israel long han bilong Midian. Mi no salim yu bek?”

original: “Please, my Lord,” Gideon replied, “how can I save Israel? Indeed, my clan is the weakest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in my father’s house.”
translation: "Pipia, Pita bilong mi," Gideon i tok, "mi no save wol-save Israel. Klan bilong mi i stap daun long ol long Manase, na mi pikinini tasol long hous bilong papa bilong mi."

original: “Surely I will be with you,” the LORD replied, “and you will strike down all the Midianites as one man.”
translation: “Bikpela i tok olsem, ‘Mi bai stap wantaim yu,’ ya, na yu bai kilim ol Midianitis olsem wan man tasol.”

original: Gideon answered, “If I have found favor in Your sight, give me a sign that it is You speaking with me.
translation: Gideon i tokim, “Mi finis fakim fait long yu, givim mi sait, nau olsem yu yet yu tokim wantaim mi.”

original: Please do not depart from this place until I return to You. Let me bring my offering and set it before You.” And the LORD said, “I will stay until you return.”
translation: No go wai long happla, stap yet until mi kam bek long Yu. Mi bringen mipela ofing na putim i go long ples bilong Yu.” Na Bikpela i tok, “Mi stap yet olsem yu kam bek.”

original: So Gideon went in and prepared a young goat and unleavened bread and an ephah of flour. He placed the meat in a basket and the broth in a pot and brought them out to present to Him under the oak.
translation: Na Gideon i go insait na i prepaem kik bilong yangpela pik, bret bilong paia i no gat yau, na epa bilong flauer. Em i putim mit bilong ol i go long biket na brinigm ol i kom aut long givim long Em aninit long diwai oak.

original: And the angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened bread, lay them on this rock, and pour out the broth.” And Gideon did so.
translation: Na enjel bilong God i tokim em, "Kisim mit na bret bai i no gat yaus, putim ol i go antapela rock, na kisim bruk na kalakal i go daun." Na Gideon i mekim olsem.

original: Then the angel of the LORD extended the tip of the staff that was in his hand and touched the meat and the unleavened bread. And fire flared from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. Then the angel of the LORD vanished from his sight.
translation: Na ein bilong Lod i stretchim hap bilong stik we i holim na i tok pisin na bret bai i no gat yaus. Na faia i kamap long rok na i kaikaim pisin na bret bai i no gat yaus. Na ein bilong Lod i los from sik bilong em.

original: When Gideon realized that it was the angel of the LORD, he said, “Oh no, Lord GOD! I have seen the angel of the LORD face to face!”
translation: Taim Gideon i save em i tok, "Oro, Lord GOD! Mi lukim engel bilong LORD face to face!"

original: But the LORD said to him, “Peace be with you. Do not be afraid, for you will not die.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim em, "Peis i kamap long yu. No ken bikim afraid, yu no bai dai."

original: So Gideon built an altar to the LORD there and called it The LORD Is Peace. To this day it stands in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
translation: Na Gideon i bikim wanpela aita long LORD olsem na i kisim nem LORD Em I Pis. I stap yet long Ophrah bilong Abiezrites.

original: On that very night the LORD said to Gideon, “Take your father’s young bull and a second bull seven years old, tear down your father’s altar to Baal, and cut down the Asherah pole beside it.
translation: Long namel nau LORD i tokim Gideon, “Kisim bulmakau yangpela bilong papa bilong yu na namba tu bulmakau we i gat sevén yia, bekim altia bilong Baal bilong papa bilong yu, na kisim daun pos Asherah we i stap besait long em.

original: Then build a proper altar to the LORD your God on the top of this stronghold. And with the wood of the Asherah pole you cut down, take the second bull and offer it as a burnt offering.”
translation: Wokim wanpela altar bilong trai long han bilong Jehovah God bilong yu long tap bilong dispela strongpela ples. Na, wantaim diwai bilong polo Asherah yu kisim, kisim sekend bull na ofa em olsem bun samting.

original: So Gideon took ten of his servants and did as the LORD had told him. But because he was too afraid of his father’s household and the men of the city, he did it by night rather than in the daytime.
translation: Na Gideon i kisim ten hap servant bilong em na mekim olsem LORD i tokim em, tasol em i bikim traipela bekos em i pekpek long haus bilong papa na respek long ol man bilong taun, o em i mekim olsem long nait insted long de.

original: When the men of the city got up in the morning, there was Baal’s altar torn down, with the Asherah pole cut down beside it and the second bull offered up on the newly built altar.
translation: Ol man bilong taun i kam antap long moning, na alta bilong Baal i pulimapim, pole bilong Asherah i kotim daun besain, na sekend bul i ofrim ap long nupela alta i wokim.

original: “Who did this?” they said to one another. And after they had investigated thoroughly, they were told, “Gideon son of Joash did it.”
translation: Ol i tokim ol yet long ol, "Husat i mekim dispela?" Na ol i investigatem strong na ol i finisim wail long en, ol i harm rim, "Gideon pikinini bilong Joash em i mekim dispela."

original: Then the men of the city said to Joash, “Bring out your son. He must die, because he has torn down Baal’s altar and cut down the Asherah pole beside it.”
translation: Ol man bilong siti i tok long Joash, "Kamautim pikinini bilong yu. Em i mas dai, bikos em i kilim daun alta bilong Baal na katim daun pul bilong Asherah we i stap klostu long en."

original: But Joash said to all who stood against him, “Are you contending for Baal? Are you trying to save him? Whoever pleads his case will be put to death by morning! If Baal is a god, let him contend for himself with the one who has torn down his altar.”
translation: Joash i tokim ol i stap agensim em, “Yupela i go bekim lotu Baal? Yupela i laik savesim em? Em husat i tokautim kesa bilong en, bai mipela i kilim em bai moning! I sapos em i biceman, orait bai em yet kontenda longen wantaim man i tromwe kaunten bilong en.”

original: So on that day Gideon was called Jerubbaal, that is to say, “Let Baal contend with him,” because he had torn down Baal’s altar.
translation: Long dispela de, Gideon em i kolim Jerubbaal, olsem, mipela i tok olsem, "Baal i fait wantaim em," bikos em i kisim daun alta baalen.

original: Then all the Midianites, Amalekites, and other people of the east gathered together, crossed over the Jordan, and camped in the Valley of Jezreel.
translation: Na ol Midianaitis, Amalekaitis, na ol pipol bilong is i kam tugeta, ol i pas long Jordan, na ol i kampa long Valei bilong Jezreel.

original: So the Spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon, who blew the ram’s horn and rallied the Abiezrites behind him.
translation: Na Spiriti bilong Jehovah i kam antap long Gideon, na em i blowim horn bilong rame, na Abiezrites i tulim i go bek gen long en.

original: Calling them to arms, Gideon sent messengers throughout Manasseh, as well as Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, so that they came up to meet him.
translation: Gideon i tok strong long ol, na em i sendim messenga long ol hap long Manasi, Asa, Sebulun, na Nafatali, olesem ol i kam antap long metim.

original: Then Gideon said to God, “If You are going to save Israel by my hand, as You have said,
translation: Na Giden i tokim God long taim ia, "Igo yu bin promis long save Israel bikos yu tok olsem, saveman Israel long han bilong mi, olsem yu bin tok.

original: then behold, I will place a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If there is dew only on the fleece and all the ground is dry, then I will know that You are going to save Israel by my hand, as You have said.”
translation: Na lukim olgeta, Mi go putim wanpela kanda bilong ul bilong sheep long ples we oli krungim ka. Sapos i gat kalip (deu) tasol long kanda na graun i drai, na bai mi save olsem yu go savim Israel long han blong mi, olsem yu tok.

original: And that is what happened. When Gideon arose the next morning, he squeezed the fleece and wrung out the dew—a bowlful of water.
translation: Na olsem wanem kamap. Bihain long moning, Gideon em i kirap, na em i pisim fleece, na kirapim dew – em i kamautim wara long wanpela bowlful bilong wara.

original: Then Gideon said to God, “Do not be angry with me; let me speak one more time. Please allow me one more test with the fleece. This time let it be dry, and the ground covered with dew.”
translation: Gideon i tokim God, “No ken kaikai bel bilong yu long mi; lamim mi tokim wanpela gen. Givim mi wanpela test gen long wool bilong sheep. Dispela taim, wool bai i drai, na graun bai i kap bilong dew.”

original: And that night God did so. Only the fleece was dry, and dew covered the ground.
translation: Na nempela nau God mekim olsem. Wul bilong animal tasol i dry, na dew i kamap long graun.

original: Early in the morning Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon) and all the men with him camped beside the spring of Harod. And the camp of Midian was north of them in the valley near the hill of Moreh.
translation: Long moningtaim bai Jerubbaal, em i Gideon tasol, na ol man bilong en i kam pundaun na kamped besaid spring bilong Harod. Na kamp bilong Midian i stap not bilong ol long valley kus bilong maunten bilong Moreh.

original: Then the LORD said to Gideon, “You have too many people for Me to deliver Midian into their hands, lest Israel glorify themselves over Me, saying, ‘My own hand has saved me.’
translation: Bikpela i tokim Gideon, “Yu gat tumas manmeri, nau bikos long hap bilong mi bai Mi kisim Midian i go daun long han bilong ol, na Israel bai tok, ‘Han bilong mi yet em i save mi,’ na ol bai no ken i stap strong long Me.”

original: Now, therefore, proclaim in the hearing of the people: ‘Whoever is fearful and trembling may turn back and leave Mount Gilead.’” So twenty-two thousand of them turned back, but ten thousand remained.
translation: Nau, olsem na, kisim na toktok long han bilong ol pipol: ‘Husait i poret na i skulim inap turnim bek na lus na liva Maunten Gilead.’ Olsem, ten tusen two hap thousand bilong ol i turnim bek, tasol ten tusen i stap yet.

original: Then the LORD said to Gideon, “There are still too many people. Take them down to the water, and I will sift them for you there. If I say to you, ‘This one shall go with you,’ he shall go. But if I say, ‘This one shall not go with you,’ he shall not go.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Gideon, “Ol pipol i masiti. Kisim ol i go daun long wara, na mi bai skelim ol long hap ia. If i tok olsem, ‘Dispela man i go wantaim yu,’ em i go. Tasol if i tok olsem, ‘Dispela man i no go wantaim yu,’ em i no go.”

original: So Gideon brought the people down to the water, and the LORD said to him, “Separate those who lap the water with their tongues like a dog from those who kneel to drink.”
translation: Na Gideon i bringim ol pipol i kam daun long wara, na Bikpela i tokim em, “Makim wanpela lain: ol pipol i sukim wara wantaim tetem olsem dog, na ol pipol i kampasim wok long drinkim wara.”

original: And the number of those who lapped the water with their hands to their mouths was three hundred men; all the others knelt to drink.
translation: Namba bilong ol i drai wara wantaim han bilong ol long maus bilong ol em tri hanred man; ol arapela i go daun knek bilong ol long graun na drai.

original: Then the LORD said to Gideon, “With the three hundred men who lapped the water I will save you and deliver the Midianites into your hand. But all the others are to go home.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Gideon, “Ol man tri hundred we i kam daun long wara, bai mi savim yu na bai mi givim Midian ol i go long han bilong yu. Tasol ol arapela i mas go bak long hus.”

original: So Gideon sent the rest of the Israelites to their tents but kept the three hundred men, who took charge of the provisions and rams’ horns of the others. And the camp of Midian lay below him in the valley.
translation: Na Gideon i salim ol narapela Israelites i go bek long tent bilong ol, tasol i stop ol hap-hundred man, ol i kisim chaj long ka Monica na horn bilong ram bilong ol arapela. Na kamp bilong Midian i stap aninit long valei aninit long en.

original: That night the LORD said to Gideon, “Get up and go down against the camp, for I have delivered it into your hand.
translation: Nait i kam, Papa God i tokim Gideon, “Kam daun na go long ples bilong eni, olgeta em i stap long han bilong yu, givim i go long yu.”

original: But if you are afraid to do so, then go down to the camp with your servant Purah
translation: Sapos yu fear, kamdaun i go wantaim haus boi Purah long ples kanuak.

original: and listen to what they are saying. Then your hands will be strengthened to attack the camp.” So he went with Purah his servant to the outposts where armed men were guarding the camp.
translation: Na harim tok bilong ol, orait han bilong yu bai i strongim yupela long go bekim hos. Na em i go wantaim Purah man servant bilong en long ples we ol man i gat abus na i stap bekim hos.

original: Now the Midianites, Amalekites, and all the other people of the east had settled in the valley like a swarm of locusts, and their camels were as countless as the sand on the seashore.
translation: Nau Midianites, Amalekites, na ol pipol long east ol i pundaun i stap long vale olsem na ol masalai i kam, na ol kemel bilong ol i hamarim olsem sand long bikpela wara i go daun.

original: And as Gideon arrived, a man was telling his friend about a dream. “Behold, I had a dream,” he said, “and I saw a loaf of barley bread come tumbling into the Midianite camp. It struck the tent so hard that the tent overturned and collapsed.”
translation: Na Gideon i kamap, wanpela man i tokim friend bilong em wantaim draim, “Mipela lukim,” em i tok, “mi bin harim wanpela draim, na mi lukim bun bilong barley i kalap i go insait long kamp bilong Midiani. Em i paitim strong olsem haus bilong sabit, na tilim na kalap, haus bilong sabit i paul insait.”

original: His friend replied: “This is nothing less than the sword of Gideon son of Joash, the Israelite. God has delivered Midian and the whole camp into his hand.”
translation: Nem bilong narapela i tok: “Dispela em i no les na sword bilong Gideon sain bilong Joash, man bilong Pipol Israel. God i givim Midian na olgeta ka bilong ol i go long han bilong em.”

original: When Gideon heard the dream and its interpretation, he bowed in worship. He returned to the camp of Israel and said, “Get up, for the LORD has delivered the camp of Midian into your hand.”
translation: Wanpela taim Gideon harim tok bilong drim na toktok long em, em i kisim hevi i go daun long graun. Em i go bek long ples bilong Israel na em i tokim ol, "Kamdaun, bikos LORD i givim ples bilong Midian long han bilong yumi."

original: And he divided the three hundred men into three companies and gave each man a ram’s horn in one hand and a large jar in the other, containing a torch.
translation: Na em i divelopim ol man tri hundred long tripela kompeni na i givim koronet bilong ram long wan han bilong ol na bikpela bek long narak han bilong ol, bek i kontenim lait.

original: “Watch me and do as I do,” Gideon said. “When I come to the outskirts of the camp, do exactly as I do.
translation: “Lukim mi na mekim olsem na mi,” Gideon i tok. “Wanpela taim mi go long bahnabeha bilong kaamp, yu mas mekim olsem wei mi mimas.”

original: When I and all who are with me blow our horns, then you are also to blow your horns from all around the camp and shout, ‘For the LORD and for Gideon!’”
translation: Wanpela taim mi na ol i stap wantaim mi putim horn bilong mipela, den yu tu mas putim horn bilong yu olsem long olgeta hap bilong ples kamp, na singaut, ‘Long Jehova na long Gideon!’”

original: Gideon and the hundred men with him reached the outskirts of the camp at the beginning of the middle watch, just after the changing of the guard. They blew their horns and broke the jars that were in their hands.
translation: Gideon na ol hundred man bilong en i kamap long autsid long kanu, long nait, taim em i go pas, justa afta ol i chanjim gard. Ol i bulimapim horn bilong ol na ol i brukim besen bilong ol.

original: The three companies blew their horns and shattered their jars. Holding the torches in their left hands and the horns in their right hands, they shouted, “A sword for the LORD and for Gideon!”
translation: Ol i bulim horn bilong ol, na ol i bromim bek pot bilong ol. Ol i holim tanua long lef han bilong ol, na horn long rait han bilong ol, na ol i singaut, “Sop bilong LORD na bilong Gideon!”

original: Each Israelite took his position around the camp, and the entire Midianite army fled, crying out as they ran.
translation: Man Israel i kam bek long ples bilong en, na Man Midian army i ranawe, kisim traus na cry out olsem ol i kirap, wail na cry out olsem ol i ran.

original: And when the three hundred rams’ horns sounded, the LORD set all the men in the camp against one another with their swords. The army fled to Beth-shittah toward Zererah as far as the border of Abel-meholah near Tabbath.
translation: Na tripela hantered rams' horns i save ol i go, LORD i mekim ol man long ples bilong army i kam bek gen long en wantaim sipene bilong ol. Army i ranawe go long Beth-shittah na i go daun long Zererah, na i go inap long borda bilong Abel-meholah, klostu long Tabbath.

original: Then the men of Israel were called out from Naphtali, Asher, and all Manasseh, and they pursued the Midianites.
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel, husat i kam long Naphtali, Asa, na olgeta Manase, i go antap, na ol i birua na raget ol Midian.

original: Gideon sent messengers throughout the hill country of Ephraim to say, “Come down against the Midianites and seize the waters of the Jordan ahead of them as far as Beth-barah.” So all the men of Ephraim were called out, and they captured the waters of the Jordan as far as Beth-barah.
translation: Gideon salim messenja i go olta long kantri bilong maunten bilong Ephraim, i tok olsem: “Kam daun gen long Midianitis, kisim wara bilong Jordan i go inap long Beth-barah.” Ol man bilong Ephraim i kam antap, ol i kisim wara bilong Jordan i go inap long Beth-barah.

original: They also captured Oreb and Zeeb, the two princes of Midian; and they killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb and Zeeb at the winepress of Zeeb. So they pursued the Midianites and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon on the other side of the Jordan.
translation: Ol i kisim Oreb na Zeeb, tu prins bilong Midian; ol i kilim Oreb long rok bilong Oreb na Zeeb long paipa bilong wain bilong Zeeb. Ol i go bek gen long paitim ol Midianiti na ol i bringim hed bilong Oreb na Zeeb i go long Gideon long sait narakat bilong Jordan.

original: Then the men of Ephraim said to Gideon, “Why have you done this to us? Why did you fail to call us when you went to fight against Midian?” And they contended with him violently.
translation: Ol man bilong Efrayim tokim Gideon, "Bai yumus tumas long yumi, yupela i go fait wantaim Midian, yumi no go wail long yumi, taim yu go fait wantaim Midian?" Na ol i kisim faet stret wantaim em.

original: But Gideon answered them, “Now what have I accomplished compared to you? Are not the gleanings of Ephraim better than the grape harvest of Abiezer?
translation: Gideon i tokim ol, "Nau mi mekim wanem samting ikai long yu? Ol pikinini kua na grapes bilong Ephraim i gat bikpela valu long taim bilong grapes bilong Abiezer?"

original: God has delivered Oreb and Zeeb, the two princes of Midian, into your hand. What was I able to do compared to you?” When he had said this, their anger against him subsided.
translation: God i givim Oreb na Zeeb, bilong ples Midian ol bikpela man i stap, ol i kolim prince, i go long han bilong yu. Mi no inap harim olgeta sampela samting we yu mekim, na mi mas tok olsem: Wanem tasol mi ken mekim ikam long yu? Em i tok olsem, anger bilong ol i kam daun, na ol i no cross long en igen.

original: Then Gideon and his three hundred men came to the Jordan and crossed it, exhausted yet still in pursuit.
translation: Na Gideon wantaim ol man tri hundred bilong en, ol kam long Jordan na ol crossim em, ol tired nau bek gen ol i go bek long bihain.

original: So Gideon said to the men of Succoth, “Please give my troops some bread, for they are exhausted, and I am still pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”
translation: Gideon i tokim ol man meri bilong Sukkot, “Mipela i askim yu, givim bred long ol solja bilong mi, ol i peni nogut, na mi yet kam bek long paitim Zebah na Zalmunna, king bilong Midian.”

original: But the leaders of Succoth asked, “Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your possession, that we should give bread to your army?”
translation: Ol lida bilong Sukkot i askim, “Hap mak bilong Zebah na Zalmunna i kam long han bilong yu, bai yumi givim ka bik na moni long ol solja bilong yu?”

original: “Very well,” Gideon replied, “when the LORD has delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, I will tear your flesh with the thorns and briers of the wilderness!”
translation: “Em i orait,” Gideon i tok, “wánem Ol Get long givim Zebah na Zalmunna long han bilong mi, bai mi kisim skinpela yu wantaim ponki na draipela bus olsem bus ol hap bilong het na pain!”

original: From there he went up to Penuel and asked the same from them, but the men of Penuel gave the same response as the men of Succoth.
translation: Na em i go ap long Penuel na askim olsem long ol, tasol ol man meri bilong Penuel i givim sampela tok bek olsem ol man meri bilong Sukot.

original: So Gideon told the men of Penuel, “When I return in triumph, I will tear down this tower!”
translation: Gideon i tokim ol man bilong Penuel, “Mi bai kam bek long wailis, na mi bai kilim daun haus bilong ta!”

original: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor with their army of about fifteen thousand men—all that were left of the armies of the people of the east. A hundred and twenty thousand swordsmen had already fallen.
translation: Nau Zebah na Zalmunna i stap long Karkor wantaim ol solja bilong ol, ol i gat klosep long fifteen thousand man - ol i stap yet, nau ol i lus pinis long ples bilong army bilong pipel bilong east. Hundret twenty thousand man i kamap strong na go daun pinis.

original: And Gideon went up by way of the caravan route east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and he attacked their army, taking them by surprise.
translation: Na Gideon i go ap long rot bilong karava, i kam long hap siad long Nobah na Jogbehah, na em i winim ol sipalai, ol i kisim ol longpela taim.

original: When Zebah and Zalmunna fled, Gideon pursued and captured these two kings of Midian, routing their entire army.
translation: Taim Zebah na Zalmunna ranawe, Gideon i pursued and captured tupela papa bilong Midian, na winim olgeta soljaman bilong ol, na lusim ol.

original: After this, Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle along the Ascent of Heres.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, Gideon, pikinini bilong Joash, i kam bek gen long bihain bilong faet long rod bilong Apinun Heres.

original: There he captured a young man of Succoth and interrogated him. The young man wrote down for him the names of the seventy-seven leaders and elders of Succoth.
translation: Em i go kisim wanpela yong man long Sakot na em i askim em plenti quesin. Yong man ia i raitim gen i go nem bilong seveti-sevn bikpela man na papa bilong Sakot.

original: And Gideon went to the men of Succoth and said, “Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you taunted me, saying, ‘Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your possession, that we should give bread to your weary men?’”
translation: Na Gideon i go long ol man bilong Sukkot na tokim ol, “Hare Zeba na Zalmuna, ol man we yumi laik pilim mi, yumi tok olsem, ‘Hand bilong Zeba na Zalmuna i kam long yu yet, bilong yumi givim ka long ol man bilong yu ol i peni?’”

original: Then he took the elders of the city, and using the thorns and briers of the wilderness, he disciplined the men of Succoth.
translation: Em i kisim ol bikpela man bilong taun, na ol i usim naip na kokomo long bus, na em i strongim ol man bilong Sukot.

original: He also pulled down the tower of Penuel and killed the men of the city.
translation: Em i kilim daun haus bilong tower bilong Penuel, na em i kilim ol man bilong siti.

original: Next, Gideon asked Zebah and Zalmunna, “What kind of men did you kill at Tabor?” “Men like you,” they answered, “each one resembling the son of a king.”
translation: Nambawan, Gideon askim Zebah na Zalmunna, “Yupela kilim wanem kain man ol i go daun long Tabor?” Ol i ankla, “Ol man olsem yumi,” ol tok, “wanwan i liklik moning pikinini bilong king.”

original: “They were my brothers,” Gideon replied, “the sons of my mother! As surely as the LORD lives, if you had let them live, I would not kill you.”
translation: “Ol i brotha bilong me,” Gideon i tokim, “ol pikinini bilong mama bilong me! Olsem Papa God i stap, if yu hariapim ol i stap, mi no kilim yu.”

original: So he said to Jether, his firstborn, “Get up and kill them.” But the young man did not draw his sword; he was fearful because he was still a youth.
translation: Em i tokim Jeter, pikinini namba wan bilong en, “Kam daun na kilim ol.” Tasol yangpela man em i no pulim sop long han bilong en; em i binpela i stap bekos em i stil wok bilong pikinini.

original: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Get up and kill us yourself, for as the man is, so is his strength.” So Gideon got up and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescent ornaments from the necks of their camels.
translation: Na Zebah na Zalmunna i tok, “Kam daun na kilim mipela yet, olsem man i stap, olsem strong bilong em.” Na Gideon i kam daun na kilim Zebah na Zalmunna, na i tekim ornaments bilong mun em i krismas long nek bilong kemel ol.

original: Then the Israelites said to Gideon, “Rule over us—you and your son and grandson—for you have saved us from the hand of Midian.”
translation: Na Pipol Israel tokim Gideon, “Yu bossim mipela, yu, pikinini bilong yu, na grandpikinini bilong yu – bikos yu save mipela long han bilong Midian.”

original: But Gideon replied, “I will not rule over you, nor will my son. The LORD shall rule over you.”
translation: Gideon i tok thus, "Mi no go kilim yu, na siki yu, na pikinini bilong mi. LORD bai i bosim yu."

original: Then he added, “Let me make a request of you, that each of you give me an earring from his plunder.” (For the enemies had gold earrings because they were Ishmaelites.)
translation: Na em i bin addim, "Mipela i askim yu, yu olgeta givim mi wanpela kaul long stua bilong en." (Namba enemy ol i gat gol kaul olsem stua bilong ol, wantaim ol i Ishmaelait.)

original: “We will give them gladly,” they replied. So they spread out a garment, and each man threw an earring from his plunder onto it.
translation: Mipela bai givim ol i friymi, ol i tok. Na ol i kisim napkin na wasim oltabaun long en, na nen bai putim wanpela pisin bilong en long hap bilong plunder long en.

original: The weight of the gold earrings he had requested was 1,700 shekels, in addition to the crescent ornaments, the pendants, the purple garments of the kings of Midian, and the chains from the necks of their camels.
translation: Wet bilong gol klosim em i askim i go 1,700 sikil, longpaus long crescent ornaments, pendants, na purple bilas bilong king bilong Midian, na chain bilong nek bilong camel.

original: From all this Gideon made an ephod, which he placed in Ophrah, his hometown. But soon all Israel prostituted themselves by worshiping it there, and it became a snare to Gideon and his household.
translation: Long ol dispela, Gideon wokim wanpela ephod, na em putim i go long Ophrah, taun bilong em. Tasol bihaenm, Israel olgeta i go bekim idol long hap em, na em kamapim trap long Gideon na husat bilong em.

original: In this way Midian was subdued before the Israelites and did not raise its head again. So the land had rest for forty years in the days of Gideon,
translation: Olsem nau Midian em bin katim i go long taim bipo bifor Israel, na em i no kamap gen. Na graun i amamas long forti yia ol i stap long taim bilong Gideon,

original: and he—Jerubbaal son of Joash—returned home and settled down.
translation: Na Jerubbaal, pikinini bilong Joash, i go bak long haus bilong en, em i pundaun.

original: Gideon had seventy sons of his own, since he had many wives.
translation: Gideon i gat seventi pikinini man bilong en, em i gat plenti meri.

original: His concubine, who dwelt in Shechem, also bore him a son, and he named him Abimelech.
translation: Meri bilong em, we em i gat olsem wai, i stap long Sikem, i karim bebi, na i banisim man pikinini long em, na em i givim nem Abimeleki long pikinini.

original: Later, Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
translation: Gideon pikinini bilong Joash i dai long taim em i bikim olsem, na em i go daun long holep bilong papa bilong em, Joash, long Ophrah bilong Abiezrites.

original: And as soon as Gideon was dead, the Israelites turned and prostituted themselves with the Baals, and they set up Baal-berith as their god.
translation: Olsem Gideon i dai pinis, Pipol Israel i turnim bek na mekim bosim na produsim yet olself long Baals, na ol i setim Baal-berith olsem god bilong ol.

original: The Israelites failed to remember the LORD their God who had delivered them from the hands of all their enemies on every side.
translation: Israelites i no gat memori long LORD Bikpela bilong ol, em i poisen bilong ol, nau em i savim ol long han bilong ol eni enemies ol long olgeta sait.

original: They did not show kindness to the house of Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon) for all the good things he had done for Israel.
translation: Ol i no showim kimna' long haus bilong Yerubbaal, em i min Gideon, long olgeta gutpela samting em bin mekim long Isrel.

original: Now Abimelech son of Jerubbaal went to his mother’s brothers at Shechem and said to them and to all the clan of his mother,
translation: Nau Abimelech, pikinini bilong Jerubbaal, i go long brata bilong mama bilong en long Sikem na i tokim ol, na long ol klan bilong mama bilong en.

original: “Please ask all the leaders of Shechem, ‘Is it better for you that seventy men, all the sons of Jerubbaal, rule over you, or just one man?’ Remember that I am your own flesh and blood.”
translation: Akiim olgeta lida bilong Shechem, em i gutpela long yu ol seventy man, ol pikinini bilong Jerubbaal, i givim bos long yu, o tasol wan man? Yumi remember, mipela wantaim blut na bon.

original: And when his mother’s brothers spoke all these words about him in the presence of all the leaders of Shechem, their hearts were inclined to follow Abimelech, for they said, “He is our brother.”
translation: Na taim brata bilong mama i tok ol dispela tok long wei bilong ol bikpela man bilong Sihem, ol het bilong ol i kam antap long folo Abimelek, ol yarn i sei, "Em i brata bilong yumi."

original: So they gave him seventy shekels of silver from the temple of Baal-berith, with which Abimelech hired some worthless and reckless men to follow him.
translation: Ol i givim Abimelek 70 shekel silva long haos bilong Baal-berith, na em i usim dispela moni long kisim ol man i no ino gat save na i nogut tru, na em i painim wok long ol, ol i go bihainim em.

original: He went to his father’s house in Ophrah, and on one stone murdered his seventy brothers, the sons of Jerubbaal. But Jotham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, survived, because he hid himself.
translation: Em i go haus bilong papa bilong en long Ophrah, na long wanpela ston em i kilim ol bratim seventy bilong Jerubbaal. Tasol Jotham, pikinini nanamel bilong Jerubbaal, i savem laif, bikos em i kaivim em yet.

original: Then all the leaders of Shechem and Beth-millo gathered beside the oak at the pillar in Shechem and proceeded to make Abimelech their king.
translation: Olgeta bikman bilong Shekem na Bet-milo i katol gather besaid long oak antap long pilia, na ol i go long makim Abimelek olsem king bilong ol.

original: When this was reported to Jotham, he climbed to the top of Mount Gerizim, raised his voice, and cried out: “Listen to me, O leaders of Shechem, and may God listen to you.
translation: Taim ol i ripotim stori ia long Jotam, na em i go antap long top bilong Maunten Gerizim, em i laikim bek voz im, na em i singaut: “Harim mi, o lida bilong Sikehem, na God i harim yupela.

original: One day the trees set out to anoint a king for themselves. They said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’
translation: Wanpela dey ol trees i go wok long anointim king bilong ol yet. Ol i tokim olive tree, 'Yu bos long lidim mipela.'

original: But the olive tree replied, ‘Should I stop giving my oil that honors both God and man, to hold sway over the trees?’
translation: Oliva tri em i tok bek, ‘Husat ol i stopim olila bilong me, bilong me givim respek long God na man, bai mi yet holdim pawa long ol diwai?’

original: Then the trees said to the fig tree, ‘Come and reign over us.’
translation: Na diwai i tok olsem long fig diwai: 'Kam na yu bosim mipela.'

original: But the fig tree replied, ‘Should I stop giving my sweetness and my good fruit, to hold sway over the trees?’
translation: Diwai figi i tokim bek, ‘Inap mi haitim long givim switnis na kakaruk na guinea bilong mi, ibin i gat pawa long diwai?’

original: Then the trees said to the grapevine, ‘Come and reign over us.’
translation: Diwai i tok long waip, 'Kam na yu bosim mipela.'

original: But the grapevine replied, ‘Should I stop giving my wine that cheers both God and man, to hold sway over the trees?’
translation: Kaul vine i tok bek, ‘Mipela I go stap long givim win blong mi we i mekim Bikpela na man i hap hap, bilong mipela holim bos bilong diwai?’

original: Finally all the trees said to the thornbush, ‘Come and reign over us.’
translation: Finally ol geta ol i tok long prik bush, ‘Yu bosim mipela.’

original: But the thornbush replied, ‘If you really are anointing me as king over you, come and find refuge in my shade. But if not, may fire come out of the thornbush and consume the cedars of Lebanon.’
translation: Bus na thorn i tok bek, 'Ol i save mekim olsem king bilong yupela, kam na kisim hevi long shade bilong mipela. Tasol sori, mipela i laikim fire i kam aut long bus na thorn na kaikaim diwai cedars bilong Lebanon.'

original: Now if you have acted faithfully and honestly in making Abimelech king, if you have done well by Jerubbaal and his family, and if you have done to him as he deserves—
translation: Nau sapos yuhamas wok bilong en i go strong na tru long mekim Abimelech king, sapos ol i wok gut long Jerubbaal na famili bilong en, na sapos ol i givim em olgeta samting we em i deserve—

original: for my father fought for you and risked his life to deliver you from the hand of Midian,
translation: Papa bilong mi faight strong long yu, em i putim laip bilong em long ris, bai yu kamaut na yu fri long han bilong Midian.

original: but you have risen up against my father’s house this day and killed his seventy sons on a single stone, and you have made Abimelech, the son of his maidservant, king over the leaders of Shechem because he is your brother—
translation: Bikos yu go bekim pait long haus bilong papa bilong mi dispela de, na yu kilim seventi san bilong em long wanpela ston, na yu mekim Abimelech, santing bilong meri bilong wok bilong papa bilong mi, i kam king iberen ol lida bilong Sihem tasol bikos em i brata bilong yu —
