original: if you have acted faithfully and honestly toward Jerubbaal and his house this day, then may you rejoice in Abimelech, and he in you.
translation: Sapos yu wok bilong en i kamap strong na treu long Jerubabal na haus bilong em dispela de, orait yu ken hamamas long Abimelek, na em tu hamamas long yu.

original: But if not, may fire come from Abimelech and consume the leaders of Shechem and Beth-millo, and may fire come from the leaders of Shechem and Beth-millo and consume Abimelech.”
translation: Bai mi no ken, mabe faia i kam long Abimilek kaikai ol bikpela man bilong Shekem na Bet-Milo, na mabe faia i kam long ol bikpela man bilong Shekem na Bet-Milo kaikai Abimilek.

original: Then Jotham ran away, escaping to Beer, and he lived there for fear of his brother Abimelech.
translation: Na Jotam i rinawe, i go bek long Bir, na i stap bek long hap bilong en long bikpela fear bilong en, long Abimelek brata bilong en.

original: After Abimelech had reigned over Israel for three years,
translation: Abimelech i go na bikim chief long Israel, na tripela yia i pas,

original: God sent a spirit of animosity between Abimelech and the leaders of Shechem and caused them to treat Abimelech deceitfully,
translation: God i salim spirut bilong birua bifor Abimelech na ol bikman bilong Sichem, na ol i wokim ol sem long Abimelech we i no triu.

original: in order that the crime against the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come to justice and their blood be avenged on their brother Abimelech and on the leaders of Shechem, who had helped him murder his brothers.
translation: Olsem wanem na krim long seventi pikinini bilong Jerubbaal i kamap i go long jusis, na blood bilong ol i paitim bek long brata bilong ol, Abimelek, na long bic man i stap long Shekem, ol i hepim em long kilim ol brata bilong em.

original: The leaders of Shechem set up an ambush against Abimelech on the hilltops, and they robbed all who passed by them on the road. So this was reported to Abimelech.
translation: Bikman bilong Sikem i wokim bekim long antap long mauntin, na ol i stilim ol samting bilong ol pipol i pas long rot. Na ol i tisasim Abimelek.

original: Meanwhile, Gaal son of Ebed came with his brothers and crossed into Shechem, and the leaders of Shechem put their confidence in him.
translation: Wanpela taim, Gaal sussa bilong Ebed i kam wantaim brata bilong en, na ol i go insait long Shechem, na bikman bilong Shechem ol i putim trast blong ol long em.

original: And after they had gone out into the fields, gathered grapes from their vineyards, and trodden them, they held a festival and went into the house of their god; and as they ate and drank, they cursed Abimelech.
translation: Na ol i go pinis long bus, ol kisim win bilong grape long gan bilong ol, daunim win bilong grape, mekim festal, na ol i go insait long haus bilong god bilong ol. Na ol i kaikai na dring, na tok strong long Abimelech.

original: Then Gaal son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubbaal, and is not Zebul his officer? You are to serve the men of Hamor, the father of Shechem. Why should we serve Abimelech?
translation: Na Gaal sut bilong Ebed i tok, “Husat i Abimelech, husat i Sikem, mipela mas sarveim? Em i stap bilong Jerubbaal tasol, na Zebul i ofisa bilong en. Yu mas sarve ol man bilong Hamor, papa bilong Sikem. Bilong wanem mipela mas sarve Abimelech?

original: If only this people were under my authority, I would remove Abimelech; I would say to him, ‘Muster your army and come out!’”
translation: Mi laikim olsem pipol i stap aninit long hap bilong mi, mi bai katim aut Abimelech; mi bai tokim em, ‘Kam, bel isi, armi, na kam aut!’”

original: When Zebul the governor of the city heard the words of Gaal son of Ebed, he burned with anger.
translation: Taim Zebul gavman bilong siti harim ol toktok bilong Gaal sun bilong Ebed, em i bagarap strong long en.

original: So he covertly sent messengers to Abimelech to say, “Look, Gaal son of Ebed and his brothers have come to Shechem and are stirring up the city against you.
translation: Em i sendim mesijen i go bek long naait long Abimelek, ol i tok, "Lukim, Gaal pikinini bilong Ebed na brata bilong em ol i kam long Sikem na ol i wokim birua long siti against yu."

original: Now then, tonight you and the people with you are to come and lie in wait in the fields.
translation: Nau olgeta, tonait yu na ol manmeri wantaim yu mas kam na litimapim long bus.

original: And in the morning at sunrise, get up and advance against the city. When Gaal and his men come out against you, do to them whatever you are able.”
translation: Na long moningtaim bai sun i kamap, yu kam daun na go pas wantaim, go against ples. Wanem Gaál na ol man bilong em i kem bek gen against yu, yu wokim olsem yu ina save.

original: So Abimelech and all his troops set out by night and lay in wait against Shechem in four companies.
translation: Abimelek na ol solja bilong en i go long namel ol nait, stap raitim bekim long Sikem, na ol i stap divelop long foa hap grup.

original: Now Gaal son of Ebed went out and stood at the entrance of the city gate just as Abimelech and his men came out from their hiding places.
translation: Nau Gaal sussa bilong Ebed i go aut na em i stap long entris bilong geit bilong taun, olsem na Abimelech wantaim ol man bilong en i kam aut gen from hap bilong ol.

original: When Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, “Look, people are coming down from the mountains!” But Zebul replied, “The shadows of the mountains look like men to you.”
translation: Taim Gaal lukim ol pipol, na em i tokim Zebul, “Lookim, ol pipol i kam daun long maunten!” Ma Zebul i bekim, “Shedowa bilong maunten ol i luk olsem man long ai bilong yu.”

original: Then Gaal spoke up again, “Look, people are coming down from the center of the land, and one company is coming by way of the Diviners’ Oak.”
translation: Na Gaal i tok gen, "Lukim, ol man i kam dauen long senta bilong kantri, na wanpela grup i kam na i go long rot bilong Oak bilong Diviners."

original: “Where is your gloating now?” Zebul replied. “You said, ‘Who is Abimelech that we should serve him?’ Are these not the people you ridiculed? Go out now and fight them!”
translation: We bilong gloating bilong yu i go we? Zebul i tok. Yu tokim olsem, ‘ Husat i Abimelech na bai yumitupela i sarvim em?’ Ol pipol ia em i no ol pipol yu laikim ol long wail? Kam daun nau na go faitim ol!

original: So Gaal went out before the leaders of Shechem and fought against Abimelech,
translation: Na Gaal i go bifo ol lida bilong Sikem na em i fait long Abimelek.

original: but Abimelech pursued him, and Gaal fled before him. And many Shechemites fell wounded all the way to the entrance of the gate.
translation: Abimelek i go bekim em, na Gaal i ranawe long en. Na olgeta Shekem man i kisim matamat, stat long ples balus i kam inap long ges.

original: Abimelech stayed in Arumah, and Zebul drove Gaal and his brothers out of Shechem.
translation: Abimelech i stap long Arumah, na Zebul i draivim Gaal na brata bilong em out long Shechem.

original: The next day the people of Shechem went out into the fields, and this was reported to Abimelech.
translation: Dae nambawan i go, ol pipol bilong Sikem i go aut long bus, na ol i tokim Abimelek.

original: So he took his men, divided them into three companies, and lay in wait in the fields. When he saw the people coming out of the city, he rose up against them and attacked them.
translation: Em i kisim ol man bilong en, em i dividim ol long tripela kompeni, na ol i stap hait long bus. Wanem ol i lukim ol pipel i kam aut long taun, em i kirap na go bek gen, na em i harim pinis ol.

original: Then Abimelech and the companies with him rushed forward and took their stand at the entrance of the city gate. The other two companies rushed against all who were in the fields and struck them down.
translation: Na Abimeleki wantaim grup bilong solja i ran i go pas, na ol i stap klostu long geit bilong taun. Na nupela tupela grup i go pas, ol i paitim ol i dai ol i stat long gras bilong ka.

original: And all that day Abimelech fought against the city until he had captured it and killed its people. Then he demolished the city and sowed it with salt.
translation: Na Abimelech i go bekim i stap long siti oldei, na ol i kisim siti na ol i kilim ol pipol bilong en. Ol i bagarapim siti, na ol i planim solwara long siti olsem sindaun bilong bagarap o kileng.

original: On hearing of this, all the leaders in the tower of Shechem entered the inner chamber of the temple of El-berith.
translation: Long ol i harim dispela stori, olgeta bikpela man meri long taun bilong Sikem i go insait long rum bilong temple bilong El-berith we i depe na i sot long en.

original: And when Abimelech was told that all the leaders in the tower of Shechem were gathered there,
translation: Taim ol i tokim Abimelech, ol bikpela man meri long haus tikus bilong Sikeem i kam olgeta.

original: he and all his men went up to Mount Zalmon. Abimelech took his axe in his hand and cut a branch from the trees, which he lifted to his shoulder, saying to his men, “Hurry and do what you have seen me do.”
translation: Abimelek na ol man bilong en i go antap long Maun Zalmon. Abimelek i kisim aks i hap long han bilong en, na i katim wan branis bilong diwai, na i liftim i go long susa bilong en, na i tokim ol man bilong en, "Hariap na mekim olsem yu lukim mi mekim."

original: So each man also cut his own branch and followed Abimelech. Then they piled the branches against the inner chamber and set it on fire above them, killing everyone in the tower of Shechem, about a thousand men and women.
translation: Yupela man i kisim branis bilong en na katim, ol i follem Abimelech. Ol i piletim branis long hap bilong rum insait na lusim paia antap long ol, na kilim ol mana na ol meri, olgeta long haus tai bilong Sikem, wanpela tausen man na meri.

original: Then Abimelech went to Thebez, encamped against it, and captured it.
translation: Na Abimelech i go long Thebez, ol i kam bek gen long em, na ol i winim em, ol i bikim em i faol.

original: But there was a strong tower inside the city, and all the men, women, and leaders of the city fled there. They locked themselves in and went up to the roof of the tower.
translation: I gat wanpela strongpela haus bilong paitim ol i stap insait long taun, na ol man, meri, na ol bikman bilong taun i ranawe go dai. Ol i lukim hus na go antap long rum bilong haus.

original: When Abimelech came to attack the tower, he approached its entrance to set it on fire.
translation: Taim Abimeleki kam bek long harim tower i go, em i kam klostu long entris bilong em long putim fire insait.

original: But a woman dropped an upper millstone on Abimelech’s head, crushing his skull.
translation: Meri wan pundaun stoun bilong enjesim diwai long hed bilong Abimeleki, na bromim skul bilong en.

original: He quickly called his armor-bearer, saying, “Draw your sword and kill me, lest they say of me, ‘A woman killed him.’” So Abimelech’s armor-bearer ran his sword through him, and he died.
translation: Em i kolim kvik i go long man i kari armor bilong em, em i tok, 'Kam beksaitim sword bilong yu na kilim mi, bai ol i tok long me, "Meri i kilim em".' Na Abimelech i sendim man i kari armor bilong em i pusim sword long en, na em i dai.

original: And when the Israelites saw that Abimelech was dead, they all went home.
translation: Taim Izraeli pipol i lukim Abimelek i dai, ol Izraeli i go bak long hus.

original: In this way God repaid the wickedness that Abimelech had done to his father in murdering his seventy brothers.
translation: Olsem nau God i bekim ol nogut long Abimelech ol samting em i mekim long papa bilong en long kilim ol sebenty brotha bilong en.

original: And God also brought all the wickedness of the men of Shechem back upon their own heads. So the curse of Jotham son of Jerubbaal came upon them.
translation: Na God i bringim olgeta nogut klostu bilong ol man meri long Sikem i kam bek gen, na ol i kisim bek nogut long hed bilong ol yet. Na kat kat bilong Jotam pikinini bilong Jerubbaal i kam antap long ol.

original: After the time of Abimelech, a man of Issachar, Tola son of Puah, the son of Dodo, rose up to save Israel. He lived in Shamir, in the hill country of Ephraim.
translation: Bihaen taim bilong Abimelech, man bilong Issachar, Tola susa bilong Puah, susa bilong Dodo, i kamap nau long salvim Israel. Em i stap long Shamir, long kantri bilong maunten bilong Ephraim.

original: Tola judged Israel twenty-three years, and when he died, he was buried in Shamir.
translation: Tola i bosim Israel long twenty-three yia, na em i dai, ol i kisim em i go kisim stap long Shamir.

original: Tola was followed by Jair the Gileadite, who judged Israel twenty-two years.
translation: Tola i go bifo, na Jair man Gilead i kam bihain, em i bin jujim Israel long twenty-two yia.

original: He had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkeys. And they had thirty towns in the land of Gilead, which to this day are called Havvoth-jair.
translation: Em i gat thirty pikinini, na ol i raisim thirty donki. Na ol i gat thirty ples long lan bilong Gilead, we i kolim ol Haven-jair yet tasol.

original: When Jair died, he was buried in Kamon.
translation: Taim Jair i dai pinis, ol i kisim em i go kam na ol i biruaim em long Kamon.

original: And again the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD. They served the Baals, the Ashtoreths, the gods of Aram, Sidon, and Moab, and the gods of the Ammonites and Philistines. Thus they forsook the LORD and did not serve Him.
translation: Na gen pipol Israel i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD. Ol i sarve Baals, Ashtoreths, god bilong Aram, Sidon, na Moab, na god bilong Pipol Ammon na Pipol Filisti. Ol i lusim LORD na ol i no sarve Him.

original: So the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He sold them into the hands of the Philistines and Ammonites,
translation: Naaira bilong Jehovah i bungim strong long Israel, na Em inim ol sellim ol long hap bilong Filistia na Amonait.

original: who that very year harassed and oppressed the Israelites, and did so for eighteen years to all the Israelites on the other side of the Jordan in Gilead, the land of the Amorites.
translation: Ol i harim na i bagarapim Israelites, na ol i mekim olsem long eighteen yia long olgeta Israelites long sait bilong Jordan in Gilead, grun bilong Amorites.

original: The Ammonites also crossed the Jordan to fight against Judah, Benjamin, and the house of Ephraim, and Israel was in deep distress.
translation: Amunait i go pas Jordan, na ol i kam fight long Judah, Benjamen, na husat Efrem, na Isrel i stap in bikpela sorere.

original: Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, saying, “We have sinned against You, for we have indeed forsaken our God and served the Baals.”
translation: Na Pipol Israel i kisim bek long ol tok stret na krai long Jehovah, ol i tok: "Mipela i go het long yu, mipela i sin, mipela i lusim God bilong yumi na mipela i wark long Baals."

original: The LORD replied, “When the Egyptians, Amorites, Ammonites, Philistines,
translation: Papa God i tokim, “Taim Egypt, Amori, Amoni, Filistia,”

original: Sidonians, Amalekites, and Maonites oppressed you and you cried out to Me, did I not save you from their hands?
translation: Saidonia, Amalekita, na Maonita i bagarapim yu, na yu krai long mi, ino mi no save yu long han bilong ol?

original: But you have forsaken Me and served other gods, so I will no longer save you.
translation: Barekt, yu lusim Mimi na servim god bilong arapela, olsem nau mi no moa inap savem yu gen.

original: Go and cry out to the gods you have chosen. Let them save you in your time of trouble.”
translation: Go na kisim bek long voice, kirap long debele yu pikinini i lukautim. Ol i salv yu long taim yu stap katol.

original: “We have sinned,” the Israelites said to the LORD. “Deal with us as You see fit; but please deliver us today!”
translation: Mipela i go hevi, ol Pipol Israel i tokim Papa God, “Wokim long mipela olsem yu laik; bikim mipela i kamaut nau!”

original: So they put away the foreign gods from among them and served the LORD, and He could no longer bear the misery of Israel.
translation: Ol i wikim na god bilong narapela kantri long namel bilong ol, na ol i sarve LOD, na em i no ina bekim sori moa long sori bilong Israel.

original: Then the Ammonites were called to arms and camped in Gilead, and the Israelites assembled and camped at Mizpah.
translation: Na Ammonait i kam na katim wain, ol i go kisim ples long Gilead, na Israelait i kam tu na kisim ples long Mizpa.

original: And the rulers of Gilead said to one another, “Whoever will launch the attack against the Ammonites will be the head of all who live in Gilead.”
translation: Na ol bos bilong Gilead i tok ol yet long ol yet, “Husat i kamap nau na go long bikpela faet gen Ammonait, em bai i stap long hap olgeta, na em i bos bilong olgeta wei i stap long Gilead.”

original: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor; he was the son of a prostitute, and Gilead was his father.
translation: Nau Jephthah bilong Gilead em i man strong na gat kuraj; em i pikinini bilong wan meri ol i save usim bodi, na Gilead em i papa bilong en.

original: And Gilead’s wife bore him sons who grew up, drove Jephthah out, and said to him, “You shall have no inheritance in our father’s house, because you are the son of another woman.”
translation: Meri bilong Gilead i karim ol pikinini, ol i grow up strong, ol i pusim Jephthah i go, na ol i tokim em, "Yu no ken kisim hap long haus bilong tumbuna, bikos yu em i pikinini bilong meri narakai."

original: So Jephthah fled from his brothers and settled in the land of Tob, where worthless men gathered around him and traveled with him.
translation: Na Jephta i rin i go ap long ol brata bilong em, na i go sioslong long kantri bilong Tob, na ol raskol i kam antap long en, na ol i warkabai wantaim em.

original: Some time later, when the Ammonites fought against Israel
translation: Oli bin pas, wanpela taim igo, taim Ammonait i go fait wantaim Isrel.

original: and made war with them, the elders of Gilead went to get Jephthah from the land of Tob.
translation: Na ol i wok braik gen, bikpela manmeri bilong Gilead i go lukim Jephthah long gras bilong Tob.

original: “Come,” they said, “be our commander, so that we can fight against the Ammonites.”
translation: “Kam,” ol i tok, “bai yu yet bilong mipela i bosim, na mipela bai go fait long Ammonits.”

original: Jephthah replied to the elders of Gilead, “Did you not hate me and expel me from my father’s house? Why then have you come to me now, when you are in distress?”
translation: Jeftha i givim tok bak long ol bikpela bilong Gilead, “Yuhati mie na rausim mie long haus bilong papa? Nau yu stap long trabel, kam bek long me nau, bilong wanken yu?”

original: They answered Jephthah, “This is why we now turn to you, that you may go with us, fight the Ammonites, and become leader over all of us who live in Gilead.”
translation: Ol i ansa Jeftha, "Em bilong dispela pasin bai mipela karim yu go wantaim mipela, pairap long ol Ammonit, na yu bikim lidia ibigpela long mipela olgeta husat i stap long Gilead."

original: But Jephthah asked them, “If you take me back to fight the Ammonites and the LORD gives them to me, will I really be your leader?”
translation: Jephthah i askim ol, "Yupela i kisim me bek long paitim Ammonitis, na LORD i givim ol long me, orait yupela bai tok tru long me stap bilong yupela lidah?"

original: And the elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “The LORD is our witness if we do not do as you say.”
translation: Na ol bikman bilong Gilead i tokim Jeftha, “LORD em i witness bilong yumi, yumi mas mekim olsem yu tok.”

original: So Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him their leader and commander. And Jephthah repeated all his terms in the presence of the LORD at Mizpah.
translation: Na Jephthah i go wantaim ol big man bilong Gilead, na ol pipol i bikim em leda na komanda bilong ol. Na Jephthah i tokim olgeta kondishen bilong en long hap bilong LORD lonng Mizpah.

original: Then Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites, saying, “What do you have against me that you have come to fight against my land?”
translation: Na Jeftha sendim mesija long king bilong Ammon, ol tok: “Wusai yumi gat hevi long me, na bai yumi kam na pairp long kantri bilong mi?”

original: The king of the Ammonites answered Jephthah’s messengers, “When Israel came up out of Egypt, they seized my land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok and all the way to the Jordan. Now, therefore, restore it peaceably.”
translation: King bilong Ammonaiti i tokim messenja bilong Jefte, "Taim Isrel i kam ap ausait long Ijip, ol i kisim graun bilong mi, from Arnon to Jabok na go long Jordan. Nau, olsem nau, givim bek long peac."

original: Jephthah again sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites
translation: Jefte gen kam bek long sentim mesenja long king bilong Ammon

original: to tell him, “This is what Jephthah says: Israel did not take away the land of Moab or of the Ammonites.
translation: Long tokim em, olsem Jephthah i tok: Isrel i no bin taitim gras bilong Moab na Ammonites.

original: But when Israel came up out of Egypt, they traveled through the wilderness to the Red Sea and came to Kadesh.
translation: Tasol wiken Iserel i kamap long komuniti bilong Egip, ol i wokabaut long bus na pas long Siamani Rot, na ol i kamap long Kadesh.

original: Then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Please let us pass through your land,’ but the king of Edom would not listen. They also sent messengers to the king of Moab, but he would not consent. So Israel stayed in Kadesh.
translation: Na Isrel salim messija long king bilong Edom, ol i tok, 'Mipela i laik pasim tung long kantri bilong yu,' tapi king bilong Edom yu no bin harim. Ol i salim messija long king bilong Moab, tapi em i yu no givim tok agri. Na Isrel i stap long Kadesh.

original: Then Israel traveled through the wilderness and bypassed the lands of Edom and Moab. They came to the east side of the land of Moab and camped on the other side of the Arnon. But they did not enter the territory of Moab, since the Arnon was its border.
translation: Na Isrel i wokabaut long bus na pasim sais long Edom na Moab. Ol i kam long sai bilong solwara long lan bilong Moab na kamb na stap long sait narak long Arnon. Tasol ol i no go insait long graun bilong Moab, wantaim Arnon em i boda bilong Moab.

original: And Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, and said to him, ‘Please let us pass through your land into our own place.’
translation: Na Isrel i sendim mesijer long Sihon king bilong Amorait, husat i bin bos long Heshbon, na ol tokim em, 'Mipela i go long ples na mipela i go long, bikos, inap yu givim pas long mipela, mipela i go long papa bilong ples.'

original: But Sihon would not trust Israel to pass through his territory. So he gathered all his people, encamped in Jahaz, and fought with Israel.
translation: Sihon i no bin bilivim Israel long pas long graun bilong em. Em bin kam bek gen ol piple bilong en, em ol i go autsait long Jahaz, na em bin fight wantaim Israel.

original: Then the LORD, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, who defeated them. So Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites who inhabited that country,
translation: Na Bikpela God bilong Israel i givim Sion na bamim bilong en i go daun long han bilong Israel, ol i kilim ol, na Israel i tambuaim olgeta grain bilong Ol Amori husat i stap long kantri ia.

original: seizing all the land from the Arnon to the Jabbok and from the wilderness to the Jordan.
translation: Kisim olgeta graun long Arnon go long Jabbok na long wikkan go long Jodan.

original: Now since the LORD, the God of Israel, has driven out the Amorites from before His people Israel, should you now possess it?
translation: Nau long taim Papa bilong yupela, Bikpela bilong Israel, em i pusim Amori long bifo ol manmeri bilong Israel, yu mas i kam bek na bosim plaes, o igat kan?

original: Do you not possess whatever your god Chemosh grants you? So also, we possess whatever the LORD our God has granted us.
translation: Yupela i no gat olsem god bilong yu, Chemosh, i givim yupela? Na mipela, olsem Bikpela, God bilong mipela, i givim mipela tu.

original: Are you now so much better than Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever contend with Israel or fight against them?
translation: Yupela nau i stap strong olgeta long Balak sambai bilong Zippor, king bilong Moab? Em ever kasim war long Israel, o paitim war long ol?

original: For three hundred years Israel has lived in Heshbon, Aroer, and their villages, as well as all the cities along the banks of the Arnon. Why did you not take them back during that time?
translation: Ol Isrel i stap long Heshbon, Aroer, na vilij long ol, olsem na long taun long sait bilong wara Arnon, long taim 300 yia. Wai yu no kisim bek ol long dispela taim?

original: I have not sinned against you, but you have done me wrong by waging war against me. May the LORD, the Judge, decide today between the Israelites and the Ammonites.”
translation: Mi no bin mekim sin long yu, tapi yu bin mekim rong long mi, na yu i kam bekim war long mi. LORD, Jaj bilong mipela, em i desis tude long Ol Israel pipol na Ol Amonit pipol.

original: But the king of the Ammonites paid no heed to the message Jephthah sent him.
translation: King bilong Amuni i no givim atensen long toksave em Jefte salim em.

original: Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah, and he passed through Gilead and Manasseh, then through Mizpah of Gilead. And from there he advanced against the Ammonites.
translation: Na Siritu bilong Jehovah i kam antap long Jephta, na em i pas trasol long Gilead na Manase, na em i go bek gen long Mizpa bilong Gilead. Na husat em i kam bek gen, em i go fait wantaim Ammonait.

original: Jephthah made this vow to the LORD: “If indeed You will deliver the Ammonites into my hand,
translation: Jephthah makolim voto long Papa God: “Sapos yu tru bai yu givim Amuniatis i go long mi,

original: then whatever comes out the door of my house to greet me on my triumphant return from the Ammonites will belong to the LORD, and I will offer it up as a burnt offering.”
translation: Wanpela samting bai kam aut long doa bilong haus bilong mi, bai kam gretim mi long taim bai mi kisim win long Ammonites, olgeta bai bilong LORD, na mi bai ofa em olsem ofing bilong bun.

original: So Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites to fight against them, and the LORD delivered them into his hand.
translation: Na Jephta i go pas long Ammonait, bikim em i ken fight gen long ol, na LORD i givim ol long han bilong em.

original: With a great blow he devastated twenty cities from Aroer to the vicinity of Minnith, as far as Abel-keramim. So the Ammonites were subdued before the Israelites.
translation: Long wanpela bikpela kileng em i bagarapim twenty towns, olsem long Aroer kas long Minnith, na i go inap long Abel-keramim, na Pipol Ammon i kam daun bifo Pipol Israel.

original: And when Jephthah returned home to Mizpah, there was his daughter coming out to meet him with tambourines and dancing! She was his only child; he had no son or daughter besides her.
translation: Na Jeftea i go bek long haus bilong en long Mizpa, na lukim, pikinini meri bilong em i kam aut long meetim em, wantaim tamborin na danis! Em i pikinini bilong em tasol; em i no gat pikinini man o meri naran, em meri bilong en tasol.

original: As soon as Jephthah saw her, he tore his clothes and said, “No! Not my daughter! You have brought me to my knees! You have brought great misery upon me, for I have given my word to the LORD and cannot take it back.”
translation: Tasol Jephthah harim em, na em i bin kirapim kus bilong en na em i tok, "Nogat! Nogat pikinini bilong mi! Yu bringim mi daun, yu mekim mi bagarap tru, yu bringim bikpela sorimi upon mi, long mi go pinis long tok ples bilong LORD, na mi no inap bungim bek."

original: “My father,” she replied, “you have given your word to the LORD. Do to me as you have said, for the LORD has avenged you of your enemies, the Ammonites.”
translation: “Papa bilong mi,” em i tok, “yu givim tok bilong yu long LORD. Wokim long me olsem yu tok, long bikpela LORD i bin givim bek long eni aipas bilong yu, ol Pipol Ammon.”

original: She also said to her father, “Let me do this one thing: Let me wander for two months through the mountains with my friends and mourn my virginity.”
translation: Em i tokim papa bilong em, “Lem mi mekim dispela wanpela samting: Mi bai go wankain long tupela mun olsem long maunten na stap wantaim poroman, susa, na brata bilong mi, na mi bai binisim maidengrim bilong mi.”

original: “Go,” he said. And he sent her away for two months. So she left with her friends and mourned her virginity upon the mountains.
translation: “Em i kirapim em,” em i tok. Na em i sendim em i go bek gen long mun tu. Ol i go wantaim frend bilong em, na em i bin bilas i kisim sorimi long biknem bilong em long maunten olsem hap blong kisim sorimi.

original: After two months, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. And she had never had relations with a man. So it has become a custom in Israel
translation: Afta tu mun, em i go bek long papa bilong em, na em i mekim olsem em i promis. Na em i yet no gat save long man. Na olsem i kamap laik bilong Israel.

original: that each year the young women of Israel go out for four days to lament the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite.
translation: Nambis yia, pikinini meri bilong Isrel i go aut na kisim sori long foa de olsem, ol i sori long daata meri bilong Yefte Gileadi.

original: Then the men of Ephraim assembled and crossed the Jordan to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah, “Why have you crossed over to fight the Ammonites without calling us to go with you? We will burn your house down with you inside!”
translation: Ol man bilong Efraim i kam olsem wan na go pas long Jordan, na go long Zapon. Ol i tokim Jefte, "Wai yu go kros olsem bai fight wantaim Ammonait long bush witout yu singautim mipela? Mipela bai burnim haus bilong yu, na yu yet kam insait!"

original: But Jephthah replied, “My people and I had a serious conflict with the Ammonites, and when I called, you did not save me out of their hands.
translation: Jephthah itokim bek, "Ol pipol bilong me na ol Ammonitis i gat bikpela faet, na em ol i kolim long yu, yu no savim mie long han bilong ol."

original: When I saw that you would not save me, I risked my life and crossed over to the Ammonites, and the LORD delivered them into my hand. Why then have you come today to fight against me?”
translation: Mi lukim olsem yu no save me, na mi go long wei na kamakim, na mi cross over long Ol Amonait, na Ol Masalai i givim ol i go long mi. Long we ol i kam pisin bipo long paitim mi?

original: Jephthah then gathered all the men of Gilead and fought against Ephraim. And the men of Gilead struck them down because the Ephraimites had said, “You Gileadites are fugitives in Ephraim, living in the territories of Ephraim and Manasseh.”
translation: Jeftha kam na ol man i kam olgeta long Gilead, igo na fight gensim Ol Efrayimi. Na Ol Gileadi i kilim ol, wantaim olsem: "Yu Gileadi i ranawe long Efrayim, yu stap long ol ples bilong Efrayim na Manase."

original: The Gileadites captured the fords of the Jordan leading to Ephraim, and whenever a fugitive from Ephraim would say, “Let me cross over,” the Gileadites would ask him, “Are you an Ephraimite?” If he answered, “No,”
translation: Ol Gileadi i kisim ol ples bilong wata long Jordan i go long Ephraim, na wanpela man i ranawe from Ephraim i tok, "Mipela crossim ovaside," ol Gileadi i askim em, "Yu bilong Ephraim?" If hem i ansa, "Nogat,"

original: they told him, “Please say Shibboleth.” If he said, “Sibboleth,” because he could not pronounce it correctly, they seized him and killed him at the fords of the Jordan. So at that time 42,000 Ephraimites were killed.
translation: Ol i tokim em, "Pleez tok 'Shibboleth'". Em i tok olsem "Sibboleth", bikos bilong em i no inap tokim gut, ol i kisim em na kilim em long ples ol i wari long wara Jordan. Bihaen long dispela taim, 42,000 Pipol bilong Ephraim i kilim.

original: Jephthah judged Israel six years, and when he died, he was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
translation: Jephta im bijim Israel sikis yia, na em i dai, ol i birim em long wanpela taun bilong Gilead.

original: After Jephthah, Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.
translation: Bihaen long Jefte, Ibsan bilong Betlehem i kam jujim Isrel.

original: He had thirty sons, as well as thirty daughters whom he gave in marriage to men outside his clan; and for his sons he brought back thirty wives from elsewhere. Ibzan judged Israel seven years.
translation: Em i gat thirty pikinini man, na thirty pikinini meri we em i givim long marij long ol man i no stap wantok long en, na em i kam bek wantaim thirty meri long ol pikinini man bilong en. Ibzan i bin jujim Israel long seven yia.

original: Then Ibzan died, and he was buried in Bethlehem.
translation: Na Ibzan i dai pinis, na ol i kisim em go wai long Betlehem, na ol i birikim em.

original: After Ibzan, Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel ten years.
translation: Bihaen long Ibzan, Elon bilong Zebulun i kam biruaim Israel gen tenpela yia.

original: Then Elon the Zebulunite died, and he was buried in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.
translation: Na Elon man Zebulunite i dai pinis, na ol i bin plantim em long Aijalon long lan bilong Zebulun.

original: After Elon, Abdon son of Hillel, from Pirathon, judged Israel.
translation: Bihaen long Elon, Abdon sussa bilong Hillel, long Pirathon, im bin jujim Israel.

original: He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy donkeys. And he judged Israel eight years.
translation: Em i göt foiti pikinini na teti ol pikinini bilong ol pikinini, na ol i raisim seventy donki olsem wei bilong wokabaut. Na em i bin jujim Israel long eight yia olsem bos bilong jujim Israel.

original: Then Abdon son of Hillel, from Pirathon, died, and he was buried at Pirathon in Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.
translation: Na Abdon pikinini bilong Hillel, husat i kam long Pirathon, i dai, na ol i kisim i go buri em long Pirathon inap long Efraim, long maunten bilong Amalekait.

original: Again the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD, so He delivered them into the hand of the Philistines for forty years.
translation: Genesis  ol i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em i givim Israel long han bilong Filistia olsem yia fourti.

original: Now there was a man from Zorah named Manoah, from the clan of the Danites, whose wife was barren and had no children.
translation: I gat man wanpela, em i kolim Manoa, long hap bilong Zora, em i bilong lain bilong Danait, na meri bilong em i no inap karim bebi, i no gat pikinini.

original: The angel of the LORD appeared to the woman and said to her, “It is true that you are barren and have no children; but you will conceive and give birth to a son.
translation: Engel bilong LORD i kamap long meri na i tokim em, "Em i tru olsem yu i no inap karim na yu i no gat pikinini; tapi yu bai karim na yu bai banisim wanpela man."

original: Now please be careful not to drink wine or strong drink, and not to eat anything unclean.
translation: Nau yumi mas kisim hevi, no ken dring wain o drik strong, na no ken kaikai pipel nogat klea.

original: For behold, you will conceive and give birth to a son. And no razor shall come over his head, because the boy will be a Nazirite to God from the womb, and he will begin the deliverance of Israel from the hand of the Philistines.”
translation: Na lukim, yu bai karim bebe na salim man i kam. Nekis razo inogat harim hed bilong en, bikos em bai i go long ol Nazirait bilong God long bel bilong mama, na em bai i statim wail long Israel long tait bilong ol Israel na Filistia.

original: So the woman went and told her husband, “A man of God came to me. His appearance was like the angel of God, exceedingly awesome. I did not ask him where he came from, and he did not tell me his name.
translation: Meri i go tokim husban bilong em, "Man bilong God i kam kisim me, na em i luk olsem eitel bilong God, namba wan tumas i kirap. Mi no askim em husat i kam long wanem hap, na em i no givim mi nem bilong en."

original: But he said to me, ‘Behold, you will conceive and give birth to a son. Now, therefore, do not drink wine or strong drink, and do not eat anything unclean, because the boy will be a Nazirite to God from the womb until the day of his death.’”
translation: Em i tokim mi, ‘Abraham, yu bai karim na salim man i go. Nau, bikos em i laik, no kukim win nogo strong dring, na no kaikai samting nogat klia, wantaim boi bai man bilong Nazirite long God long bel bilong em na go long dei em i dai.’

original: Then Manoah prayed to the LORD, “Please, O Lord, let the man of God You sent us come to us again to teach us how to raise the boy who is to be born.”
translation: Manoah praizim LORD, "Pleez, LORD, lain man bilong God yu sendim i kam bek gen long mipela, na tisim mipela long wanem fasin mipela i bringim upi pikinini i go kam."

original: And God listened to the voice of Manoah, and the angel of God returned to the woman as she was sitting in the field; but her husband Manoah was not with her.
translation: Na God i harim tok bilong Manoa, na emanuel bilong God i kam bek gen long meri em i sidaun i stap long bus; tasol husband bilong em, Manoa, i no stap wantaim em.

original: The woman ran quickly to tell her husband, “Behold, the man who came to me the other day has reappeared!”
translation: Meri i ranawe kwiktaim long tokim husban bilong em, "Suso, man i kam long me bistati i kam bek gen!"

original: So Manoah got up and followed his wife. When he came to the man, he asked, “Are you the man who spoke to my wife?” “I am,” he said.
translation: Na Manowa em i kirap na i go bek. Em i kam kasol long man, na em i askim, "Yu em i man husat i tokim meri bilong me?" Na em i tokim, "Aiya, mi em i man husat i tokim."

original: Then Manoah asked, “When your words come to pass, what will be the boy’s rule of life and mission?”
translation: Manoah askim, "Ol tok bilong yu kam truth, bikos em i gat lo bilong givim laip na wok misin long pikinini?"

original: So the angel of the LORD answered Manoah, “Your wife is to do everything I told her.
translation: Ein angel bilong Jehovah i ansa Manoah, "Meri bilong yu mas mekim olgeta samting mi tokim em."

original: She must not eat anything that comes from the vine, nor drink any wine or strong drink, nor eat anything unclean. She must do everything I have commanded her.”
translation: Em ina nau no ken kaikai sampela samting husat i kam long vain, nau no ken dringim wain o dringol strongpela, nau no ken kaikai ol samting i no klia. Em mas wokim olgeta samting mi bin givim instruction long em.

original: “Please stay here,” Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “and we will prepare a young goat for you.”
translation: “Bai yu stap hare,” Manoah i tokim ainjel bilong LORD, “na mipela bai kisim kid na kukim i go long yu.”

original: And the angel of the LORD replied, “Even if I stay, I will not eat your food. But if you prepare a burnt offering, offer it to the LORD.” For Manoah did not know that it was the angel of the LORD.
translation: Na aenjel bilong LORD i tok bek, “Mai mi stap, mai no kam kaikai bikos bilong yu. Tasol yu kirapim ofing bifo, inap yu givim i go long LORD.” Bilong Manoah em i no save olsem em i aenjel bilong LORD.

original: Then Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “What is your name, so that we may honor you when your word comes to pass?”
translation: Na Manoa i tok long angel bilong LORD, "Nem bilong yu husat, kalabus bai yumitim i givim respek long yu wcn yu tok igo i kamap?"

original: “Why do you ask my name,” said the angel of the LORD, “since it is beyond comprehension?”
translation: Olsem angel bilong GOD i tok, “Bekim nem bilong mi, longwe go pasim understanding?”

original: Then Manoah took a young goat and a grain offering and offered them on a rock to the LORD. And as Manoah and his wife looked on, the LORD did a marvelous thing.
translation: Na Manowa em i kisim kid goat na ofing bilong graun, na ol i givim ol dispela long wanpela rok igo long Lod. Na Manowa wantaim meri bilong em ol i luk, na Lod em i mekim wok bilong sori tru.

original: When the flame went up from the altar to the sky, the angel of the LORD ascended in the flame. When Manoah and his wife saw this, they fell facedown to the ground.
translation: Wanpela taim flaem i go antap long alta na i kamap long heven, enjel bilong LORD i kam antap long flaem. Manoah na meri bilong en i lukim dispela, ol i pilakai daun olgeta long graun.

original: And when the angel of the LORD did not appear again to Manoah and his wife, Manoah realized that it had been the angel of the LORD.
translation: Na taim angel bilong LORD i no kam bek gen long Manoa na meri bilong em, Manoa i save olsem em i bin angel bilong LORD.

original: “We are going to die,” he said to his wife, “for we have seen God!”
translation: “Mipela ol i go dai,” em i tokim meri bilong em, “bikos mipela ol i lukim God!”

original: But his wife replied, “If the LORD had intended to kill us, He would not have accepted the burnt offering and the grain offering from our hands, nor would He have shown us all these things or spoken to us this way.”
translation: Meri bilong em i tok, “I sapos LORD i bin laik kilim mipela, em i no bin akseptim ofa bilong bun na ofa bilong ka olsem wok bilong lotu from han bilong mipela, na em i no bin sho mipela olgeta dispela samting, na em i no bin tokim mipela long dispela wei.”

original: So the woman gave birth to a son and named him Samson. The boy grew, and the LORD blessed him.
translation: Meri i karim man i kamap long en, na tupela i givim nem Samson long em. Yut i go ap, na LORD i givim barkis long em.

original: And the Spirit of the LORD began to stir him at Mahaneh-dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
translation: Na Siritu bilong Jehovah i kam wakim em long ples Mahaneh-dan, long namel long Zorah na Eshtaol.

original: One day Samson went down to Timnah, where he saw a young Philistine woman.
translation: Wanpela de Samson i go daun long Timna, na em i lukim pikinini meri bilong Filistia.

original: So he returned and told his father and mother, “I have seen a daughter of the Philistines in Timnah. Now get her for me as a wife.”
translation: Em i go bek na tokim papa na mama bilong em, "Mi lukim meri bilong Filistia long Timna. Nau kisim i go long me."

original: But his father and mother replied, “Can’t you find a young woman among your relatives or among any of our people? Must you go to the uncircumcised Philistines to get a wife?” But Samson told his father, “Get her for me, for she is pleasing to my eyes.”
translation: Tasol papa na mama bilong em i tok, “Inap yu no finisim meri wan yet long wantok bilong yu o long ol pipel bilong mipela? Yu mas go long ol pipel Philisti we nogat katim skin bilong ol long kisim meri?” Tasol Samson i tokim papa bilong em, “Kisim meri ia bringim i kam, em i luk good long ai bilong mi.”

original: (Now his father and mother did not know this was from the LORD, who was seeking an occasion to move against the Philistines; for at that time the Philistines were ruling over Israel.)
translation: Papa na mama bilong em i no save long dispela, em i bikos Bikpela i lukim taim bilong harim ap long Filistia; long dispela taim Filistia i kamap bos bilong Israel.

original: Then Samson went down to Timnah with his father and mother and came to the vineyards of Timnah. Suddenly a young lion came roaring at him,
translation: Na Samson i go daun long Timnah wantaim papa na mama bilong en, na ol i kam long ples vine bilong Timnah. Na wanpela taim, wanpela liklik lion i kam na skirapim vot long en.

original: and the Spirit of the LORD came powerfully upon him, and he tore the lion apart with his bare hands as one would tear a young goat. But he did not tell his father or mother what he had done.
translation: Na Spirit bilong Jehovah i kam strong long en, na em i kilim laion raun long han blong en tasol olsem man i lakai kilim kid goat i no inarapela. Na em i no tokim papa na mama bilong en long dispela olgeta samting em i mekim.

original: Then Samson continued on his way down and spoke to the woman, because she was pleasing to his eyes.
translation: Na Samson i go bek long we na i tokim meri, bikos em i gutpela long ai bilong en.

original: When Samson returned later to take her, he left the road to see the lion’s carcass, and in it was a swarm of bees, along with their honey.
translation: Wanpela taim Samson i kam bek gen long taim igo na kisim em, na em i lusim rot na go lukim kakaruk bilong laion, na em i lukim wanpela swarm bilong bi, wantaim honey bilong ol i stap insait long kakaruk.

original: So he scooped some honey into his hands and ate it as he went along. And when he returned to his father and mother, he gave some to them and they ate it. But he did not tell them that he had taken the honey from the lion’s carcass.
translation: Na em i kisim huni, putim long han bilong en, na kaikai go long wei bilong en. Olsem em i go bek long papa na mama bilong en, em i givim sampela long ol, na ol i kaikai. Tasol em i no tokim ol long dispela: em i kisim huni nau long bodi bilong laion.

original: Then his father went to visit the woman, and Samson prepared a feast there, as was customary for the bridegroom.
translation: Na papa bilong em i go bikim visit long meri, na Samson i makolim kaikai bilong hap olsem i birua long bridegroom.

original: And when the Philistines saw him, they selected thirty men to accompany him.
translation: Taim Filistia i lukim em, ol i skelim thirty man i go wantaim em.

original: “Let me tell you a riddle,” Samson said to them. “If you can solve it for me within the seven days of the feast, I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty sets of clothes.
translation: “Mipela tok ples bilong yumi, mipela harim wanpela tok piksa,” Samson i tokim ol. “Yu helpim mi solim em long Tepel Dei, long ka 7 dei bilong bikpela kaen kai, na mi baim yu thirty kaliko rausim na thirty set bilong klotes.”

original: But if you cannot solve it, you must give me thirty linen garments and thirty sets of clothes.” “Tell us your riddle,” they replied. “Let us hear it.”
translation: Sapos yu no inap solim, yu mas givim mi thirty laplap bilong mulai na thirty set bilong klos. Tokim mipela long stori bilong yu, mipela harim tok bilong yu.

original: So he said to them: “Out of the eater came something to eat, and out of the strong came something sweet.” For three days they were unable to explain the riddle.
translation: Em i tokim ol: "Long monika i kam kaikai, na long strongpela i kam switpinis." Ol i no inap explinem tok pilai ia long tripe de.

original: So on the fourth day they said to Samson’s wife, “Entice your husband to explain the riddle to us, or we will burn you and your father’s household to death. Did you invite us here to rob us?”
translation: Long fourth dei, ol i tokim meri bilong Samson, “Switim husban bilong yu long explinem riddle ia, o nara bai mipela kaikai yu na haus bilong papa bilong yu. Yu invitim mipela i kam hari long bilakim mipela?”

original: Then Samson’s wife came to him, weeping, and said, “You hate me! You do not really love me! You have posed to my people a riddle, but have not explained it to me.” “Look,” he said, “I have not even explained it to my father or mother, so why should I explain it to you?”
translation: Na meri bilong Samson i kam kisim em, taitim ai, na em i tokim em, "Yu hatim mi! Yu no lavim mi tru! Yu givim ples bilong ol manmeri bilong mi wanpela tok piksa, tasol yu no eksplinem long mi." Em i tok, "Lukim, mi no bin eksplinem yet long papa bilong mi o mama bilong mi, longwe bilong wanem mi mas eksplinem long yu?"

original: She wept the whole seven days of the feast, and finally on the seventh day, because she had pressed him so much, he told her the answer. And in turn she explained the riddle to her people.
translation: Em i krai pinis we olgeta de namba seven bilong kaikai bilong ples, na bistup long de namba seven, bikos em i pulim em i kam, em i givim answer long em. Na em tu, em i explanim tok piksa long ol pipol bilong en.

original: Before sunset on the seventh day, the men of the city said to Samson: “What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion?” So he said to them: “If you had not plowed with my heifer, you would not have solved my riddle!”
translation: Bipo san i go daun long dei sevén, ol man bilong taun i tokim Samson: “Wanem i swit moa ole honey? Na wanem i strong moa ole laion?” Na em i tokim ol: “If yu no skulim gras long heifer bilong mi, yu no inap solim riddle bilong mi!”

original: Then the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon, killed thirty of their men, took their apparel, and gave their clothes to those who had solved the riddle. And burning with anger, Samson returned to his father’s house,
translation: Na Spiriti bilong Lod i kam strong long em, na em i go daun long Askelon, kilim thirty blo ol man bilong ol, kisim ol klot bilong ol, na givim ol i go long ol man i winim riddle. Na em i birua long ken, na Samson i go bek long haus bilong papa bilong em.

original: and his wife was given to one of the men who had accompanied him.
translation: Meri bilong em i go wantaim wanpela blo ol man husat i go wantaim em.

original: Later on, at the time of the wheat harvest, Samson took a young goat and went to visit his wife. “I want to go to my wife in her room,” he said. But her father would not let him enter.
translation: Bihain olsem, taim bilong kaiviti bilong whea, Samson i kisim pikinini goat na i go bek long visit meri bilong em. “Mi laik go long rum bilong meri bilong mi,” em i tok. Tasol papa bilong meri ia, em i no givim em chans long go insait.

original: “I was sure that you thoroughly hated her,” said her father, “so I gave her to one of the men who accompanied you. Is not her younger sister more beautiful than she? Please take her instead.”
translation: “Mi birua olsem yu hamasim hatim gut long em,” tok papa bilong em, “so mi givim em i go long wanpela blo ol man i kam wantaim yu. I no susa meri bilong em, em i luk stronga long form bilong em? Plis, yu kisim em istaed.”

original: Samson said to them, “This time I will be blameless in doing harm to the Philistines.”
translation: Samson i tokim ol, "Taim i go, mi bai kamap nambawan, nogat bibisa long me kim na bagarapim Filistia."

original: Then Samson went out and caught three hundred foxes. And he took torches, turned the foxes tail-to-tail, and fastened a torch between each pair of tails.
translation: Na Samson i go na kisim kukuk 300. Ol i kisim torcis, ol raitim tet bilong ol kukuk i kam bagen, na ol sutim torcis long tet bilong ol.

original: Then he lit the torches and released the foxes into the standing grain of the Philistines, burning up the piles of grain and the standing grain, as well as the vineyards and olive groves.
translation: Na em i lakitim toris na letim pisin i ranawe long graun i stap bilong Filistia, burnim hevi piles bilong graun na graun i stap yet long graun, longsing vine na oliv grov tu.

original: “Who did this?” the Philistines demanded. “It was Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite,” they were told. “For his wife was given to his companion.” So the Philistines went up and burned her and her father to death.
translation: Ol Philistines i tok strong, “Husat i mekim dispela?” Ol i tokim ol, “Em i Samson, husband bilong papa bilong Timnite.” Bikos meri bilong en i givim long narapela man. Na ol Philistines i go antap na jakim em na papa bilong em ol i dai.

original: And Samson told them, “Because you have done this, I will not rest until I have taken vengeance upon you.”
translation: Na Samson i tokim ol, "Long ol i mekim dispela, mi no bai sindaun yet, na mi bai kisim bek long yu."

original: And he struck them ruthlessly with a great slaughter, and then went down and stayed in the cave at the rock of Etam.
translation: Na em i kilim ol brutali, ol i dai i go long wei bikpela slahta, na em i go daun na em i stap long hole bilong guinea inside rock bilong Etam.

original: Then the Philistines went up, camped in Judah, and deployed themselves near the town of Lehi.
translation: Filistia i go apa, ol i kampe long Judah, na ol i stap yet klostu long ples Lehi.

original: “Why have you attacked us?” said the men of Judah. The Philistines replied, “We have come to arrest Samson and pay him back for what he has done to us.”
translation: Ol man bilong Yuda i tok, "Wai yus i go kam bekim mipela?" Filistia i bekim tok, "Mipela i kam long hukim Samson baimbekim em long ol samting em i mekim long mipela."

original: In response, three thousand men of Judah went to the cave at the rock of Etam, and they asked Samson, “Do you not realize that the Philistines rule over us? What have you done to us?” “I have done to them what they did to me,” he replied.
translation: Long tok bilong respons, tri tausen man bilong Juta i go long hole bilong rok bilong Etam, na ol i askim Sanson, “Yu no save olsem Filistia i bosim mipela? Wanem yu mekim long mipela?” “Mi mekim long ol long wanem ol mekim long mi,” na em i tok.

original: But they said to him, “We have come down to arrest you and hand you over to the Philistines.” Samson replied, “Swear to me that you will not kill me yourselves.”
translation: Ol i tokim em, "Mipela i kam daun long arimapim yu, na mipela i wilmolim yu long Filistia." Samson i tok bek, "Yu mas susu long me olsem yupela no kilim mi yet."

original: “No,” they answered, “we will not kill you, but we will tie you up securely and hand you over to them.” So they bound him with two new ropes and led him up from the rock.
translation: Ol i tokim, "Nogat, mipela no go kilim yu, mipela bai tetim yu strong na mipela bai givim yu long ol." Ol i bin baindim em wantaim tupela rop new na ol i bin karim em i go antap long rak.

original: When Samson arrived in Lehi, the Philistines came out shouting against him. And the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him. The ropes on his arms became like burnt flax, and the bonds broke loose from his hands.
translation: Taim Samson i kam long Lehi, Filistia ol i kam aut i singaut olsem long en. Na Spirits bilong Jehovah i kam strong long en. Rop bilong arm blong en i kam olsem flak we i bin burnt, na bonds bilong han blong en i katim na i go loose.

original: He found the fresh jawbone of a donkey, reached out his hand and took it, and struck down a thousand men.
translation: Em findim fresh jawbon long dok, na em strechim han bilong en, taked it, na em i kilim daun thousand man olgeta.

original: Then Samson said: “With the jawbone of a donkey I have piled them into heaps. With the jawbone of a donkey I have slain a thousand men.”
translation: Na Samson i tok: "Long jawbon bilong donki, mi pilim ol i go antap long heap. Long jawbon bilong donki, mi kilim thousand man."

original: And when Samson had finished speaking, he cast the jawbone from his hand; and he named that place Ramath-lehi.
translation: Na taim Samson i winim tok bilong en, na em i kisim banis bilong ol pua bai i go long han bilong en, na em i givim nem "Ramath-lehi" long ples ia.

original: And being very thirsty, Samson cried out to the LORD, “You have accomplished this great deliverance through Your servant. Must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?”
translation: Na Samson i dai pinis long drai, na em i krai aut long Lod, “Yu wokim dispela bigpela sipres long wokman yu, nau bai mi dai pinis long drai, na mipela bai go daun long han bilong ol i no katim skin bilong ol?”

original: So God opened up the hollow place in Lehi, and water came out of it. When Samson drank, his strength returned, and he was revived. That is why he named it En-hakkore, and it remains in Lehi to this day.
translation: Na God i opim hap tumara long Lehi, wara i kam aut bilong en. Samson dring, strong bilong en i kam bek, em i wakem gen. Em i givim nem En-hakkore, na inap i stap yet long Lehi tude.

original: And Samson judged Israel for twenty years in the days of the Philistines.
translation: Na Sampson i bin jujim Israel long twenty yia, long taim bilong Filistia.

original: One day Samson went to Gaza, where he saw a prostitute and went in to spend the night with her.
translation: Wanpela de Samson i go long Gaza, na em i lukim meri bubu, na em i go insait long en long Slip.

original: When the Gazites heard that Samson was there, they surrounded that place and lay in wait for him all night at the city gate. They were quiet throughout the night, saying, “Let us wait until dawn; then we will kill him.”
translation: Taim Gaziti harim tok olsem Samson i stap, ol i go raunim ples ia na kisim hem long geit bilong taun. Ol i stap quiet ol nait, ol i tok, "Mipela w8 til dai bun; orait mipela kilim en."

original: But Samson lay there only until midnight, when he got up, took hold of the doors of the city gate and both gateposts, and pulled them out, bar and all. Then he put them on his shoulders and took them to the top of the mountain overlooking Hebron.
translation: Be Samson i stap yet na mipela i go long midnait, na em i kam, kisim haptim na dok bilong gat bilong taun, wantaim pos bilong gat, na em i pulum olt, wantaim bar yet. Na em i putim ol long shoulder bilong en, na em i karim ol i go long top bilong maunten we i lukautim Hebron.

original: Some time later, Samson fell in love with a woman in the Valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Samson i kam inap long harim wanpela meri long Sorek Valley, na nem bilong meri em i Delilah.

original: The lords of the Philistines went to her and said, “Entice him and find out the source of his great strength and how we can overpower him to tie him up and subdue him. Then each one of us will give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.”
translation: Ol bos bilong Filisitia i go kam long em na ol i tok, "Kisim nem bilong en, na lukim ples we bilong en i strong olgeta, na ol yet i ken harim wai bilong winim em, bindim em, na daunim em. Na yumi yet, yumi givim yu sikil silva eleven hundred."

original: So Delilah said to Samson, “Please tell me the source of your great strength and how you can be tied up and subdued.”
translation: Delila i askim Samson, "Tusim mi long as bilong wanem yu gat strongpela streng, na olsem wanem yu inap i holim strong na daunim, na ol i no inap kirap?"

original: Samson told her, “If they tie me up with seven fresh bowstrings that have not been dried, I will become as weak as any other man.”
translation: Samson i tokim em, "If ol i bin baindim mi wantaim sevenpela narapela string bilong banis i fres olsem ia, husat ino bin drai yet, orait bai mi kamap wei olsem narapela man husat i no strong."

original: So the lords of the Philistines brought her seven fresh bowstrings that had not been dried, and she tied him up with them.
translation: Ol bos bilong Filistia i kam bringim sep bin bowstrings nupela we i no drai pinis, na em i bingim Samson long ol.

original: While the men were hidden in her room, she called out, “Samson, the Philistines are here!” But he snapped the bowstrings like a strand of yarn seared by a flame. So the source of his strength remained unknown.
translation: Wanpela taim ol man i kaivim i go insait long rum bilong en, na em i singaut, “Samson, Filistia i kam!” Na em i brokim string bilong banar olsem yarn i pakim long flae. Na ol i no save long wanem samting i givim strong long em.

original: Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have mocked me and lied to me! Now please tell me how you can be tied up.”
translation: Delilah i tokim Samson, "Yu pilim masalai long me na yu givim mi lies! Nau bikos, yu tokim mi we bilong holim yu."

original: He replied, “If they tie me up with new ropes that have never been used, I will become as weak as any other man.”
translation: Em i tok, “Bai yu baindim mi wantaim reples strongpela rop we i no bin usim yet, orait na mi bai i kam weak olsem ol man nating.”

original: So Delilah took new ropes, tied him up with them, and called out, “Samson, the Philistines are here!” But while the men were hidden in her room, he snapped the ropes off his arms like they were threads.
translation: Na Delila i kisim rop nau, i bin baindim Samson ap long rop, na i singaut, "Samson, Filistia i kam!" Tasol ol man i stap hait long rum blong em, Samson i brukim rop long arm bilong en olsem thread.

original: Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have mocked me and lied to me all along! Tell me how you can be tied up.” He told her, “If you weave the seven braids of my head into the web of a loom and tighten it with a pin, I will become as weak as any other man.”
translation: Delilah i tokim Samson, “Yu kam laif na bihainim mi olgeta taim! Yu tokim mi husat inap long binim yu.” Em i tokim em, “Ifyu wivim granes seven bilong hed bilong mi long lopm bilong wokim klos na pinis, mi bai kam weak olsem ol man narapela.”

original: So while he slept, Delilah took the seven braids of his hair and wove them into the web. Then she tightened it with a pin and called to him, “Samson, the Philistines are here!” But he awoke from his sleep and pulled out the pin with the loom and the web.
translation: Wail em i slip, Delilah kisim na karamapim hap braids bilong hed bilong Samson, em wilm ol dispela braids long nambis, em tromwe dispela nambis wantaim pin. Em singautim, "Samson, Filistia i kam!" Tasol em kam bek gen long slip bilong en, na em pulim aut pin wantaim loom na web.

original: “How can you say, ‘I love you,’” she asked, “when your heart is not with me? This is the third time you have mocked me and failed to reveal to me the source of your great strength!”
translation: Olsem wanem yu ken tok “mi lavim yu” wahnem het bilong yu i no stap wantaim mi? Em i kam tripelel taim yu pilaiim mi na yu no bin sho imap long streng bilong yu.

original: Finally, after she had pressed him daily with her words and pleaded until he was sick to death,
translation: Pinis olgeta, em i bin katim i go longen de dai wantaim tok bilong en, na i birua susa na i bikim em i siki tru.

original: Samson told her all that was in his heart: “My hair has never been cut, because I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother’s womb. If I am shaved, my strength will leave me, and I will become as weak as any other man.”
translation: Samson i tokim em olgeta samting we i stap long het bilong em: "Hed bilong mi yet ino bin kisim hap, bekos mi bin Nazirite long God from mama bilong mi i karim me. I sapos hed bilong mi kisim hap, strong bilong me bai i lus, na mi bai i kamap olsem man narakain, we i no gat strong."

original: When Delilah realized that he had revealed to her all that was in his heart, she sent this message to the lords of the Philistines: “Come up once more, for he has revealed to me all that is in his heart.” Then the lords of the Philistines came to her, bringing the money in their hands.
translation: Taim Delila kisim save long tok bilong en, na em bingim dispela mesij long ol bic man bilong Filistia: "Kam bek gen, kam bek gen, olsem em tokautim olgeta samting i stap inside haret bilong em." Na ol bic man bilong Filistia i go kam kasal long en, na kisim moni i go long han bilong ol.

original: And having lulled him to sleep on her lap, she called a man to shave off the seven braids of his head. In this way she began to subdue him, and his strength left him.
translation: Na em i bringim em i go long slip long lek bilong en, na em i kisim man i kam kutim olt bipma hap braet bilong en. Olsem na em i statim winim em, na strong bilong en i go daun.

original: Then she called out, “Samson, the Philistines are here!” When Samson awoke from his sleep, he thought, “I will escape as I did before and shake myself free.” But he did not know that the LORD had departed from him.
translation: Na em i singaut, “Samson, Filistia ol i kam!” Samson em kam bek long slip bilong en, na em i ting, “Mi birua yet na mi kam fri olsem mi mekim bifo.” Tasol em i no save olsem LORD em i go wei long en.

original: Then the Philistines seized him, gouged out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza, where he was bound with bronze shackles and forced to grind grain in the prison.
translation: Na Filistia i kisim em bes, ol i kirap long ai bilong em, ol i bringim i daun long Gaza, na ol i binim em wantaim selib bronze, na ol i laikim em wok long grisim kunai long haus kuk.

original: However, the hair of his head began to grow back after it had been shaved.
translation: Gras bilong hed bilong em i kam bek gen long taim em i kutim pinis.

original: Now the lords of the Philistines gathered together to offer a great sacrifice to their god Dagon. They rejoiced and said, “Our god has delivered Samson our enemy into our hands.”
translation: Nau lop man bilong Filistia i kam long wankain stap na ofaim bikpela sakrifis long bic bilong Dagon. Ol i amamas na tok, “Bic bilong yumi igivim Samson, poi bilong mipela, long han bilong yumi.”

original: And when the people saw him, they praised their god, saying: “Our god has delivered into our hands our enemy who destroyed our land and multiplied our dead.”
translation: Taim ol pipol i lukim em, ol i givim thanks long god bilong ol, oligat tok olsem: “God bilong mipela i kam bek long hap bilong mipela, enemy bilong mipela i go daun, i bagarapim kantri bilong mipela, na i kalapim ol dai bilong mipela.”

original: And while their hearts were merry, they said, “Call for Samson to entertain us.” So they called Samson out of the prison to entertain them. And they stationed him between the pillars.
translation: Na long taim ol i amamas long hare blong ol, ol i tok, “Mipela i kolim Samson long mekim mipela i amamas.” Ol i kolim Samson ausait long hap blong klem na ol i putim em namel long bikpela kol.

original: Samson said to the servant who held his hand, “Lead me where I can feel the pillars supporting the temple, so I can lean against them.”
translation: Samson i tokim servent we i holim han bilong em, "Lusim mi go we na mi ken kisim apinun long pilas i sapotim haos lotu, na bai mi ken lusim skul long ol."

original: Now the temple was full of men and women; all the lords of the Philistines were there, and about three thousand men and women were on the roof watching Samson entertain them.
translation: Na haos i kamap fulap long ol man na meri; ol geta bilong Filistia i stap, na tri tausen man na meri i go antap long rooftop bilong haus i lukim Samson givim skulim igo long ol.

original: Then Samson called out to the LORD: “O Lord GOD, please remember me. Strengthen me, O God, just once more, so that with one vengeful blow I may pay back the Philistines for my two eyes.”
translation: Na Samson kalabusim long ol LORD, "O LORD GOD, tingim mi. Givim mi strong wanpela taim yet, na mipela kilim ol Filisitia bekim bek moni long pais blong pekpek bilong mi."

original: And Samson reached out for the two central pillars supporting the temple. Bracing himself against them with his right hand on one pillar and his left hand on the other,
translation: Na Samson em i stilim han bilong en go kisim tupela pilia bilong mit i stap suportim haus lotu, na em i holim strong olsem, han dain bilong en i stap long wanpela pilia, na han kisim bilong en i stap long narpela pilia.

original: Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines.” Then he pushed with all his might, and the temple fell on the lords and all the people in it. So in his death he killed more than he had killed in his life.
translation: Samsom i tok, "Mipela i dai wantaim Filistia." Kama em i pus pinis wantaim strong bilong en, na haos bilong god i pulapim ol bos na ol pipol i stap insait. Na long taim em i dai, em i kilim moa yet long ol pipol nau em i kilim bihain long laip bilong en.

original: Then Samson’s brothers and his father’s family came down, carried him back, and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of his father Manoah. And he had judged Israel twenty years.
translation: Bratas bilong Samson na famili bilong papa bilong em i kam daun, ol i kisim em i go bek, na ol i bin plantim em long hap bilong Zorah na Eshtaol long tomb bilong papa bilong em Manoah. Na em i bin jujaim Israel twenty yia.

original: Now a man named Micah from the hill country of Ephraim
translation: Wanpela man we em i kolim Micah, i stap long kantri bilong maunten bilong Ephraim.

original: said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you and about which I heard you utter a curse—I have the silver here with me; I took it.” Then his mother said, “Blessed be my son by the LORD!”
translation: Em i tokim mami bilong en, "Eleven hundred shekel silva i go daun long yu na yu tokim katkati long dispela - mipela i gat silva dispela hier; mipela i kisim." Na mama bilong em i tok, "Papa bilong yu i stap na blesim yu long han bilong LORD!"

original: And when he had returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, she said, “I wholly dedicate the silver to the LORD for my son’s benefit, to make a graven image and a molten idol. Therefore I will now return it to you.”
translation: Na em i kam bek gen long eleven hundred shekels silva, mama i tokim em, “Bai mi dedikim olgeta silva ya long Jehova bilong benefis bilong pikinini bilong me, wokim skulpua na idol we i meltim.” Nau bai mi givim bek long yu.

original: So he returned the silver to his mother, and she took two hundred shekels of silver and gave them to a silversmith, who made them into a graven image and a molten idol. And they were placed in the house of Micah.
translation: Na em i bringim bek silva, na mama bilong en i kisim tu handred shekel silva, na em i givim ol i go long wan man i wok abaut silva, na ol i mekim ol i go long nap na ol i mekim ol i go long idol we i meltim. Na ol i putim ol i insait haus bilong Mikah.

original: Now this man Micah had a shrine, and he made an ephod and some household idols, and ordained one of his sons as his priest.
translation: Na man Mika em i gat haus lotu, na em i wokim ephod na idols bilong hus, na em i bin ordain wanpela pikinini bilong em olsem pris bilong en.

original: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
translation: Long dispela taim i no bin gat king long Israel; ol man i mekim ol samting narapela we i ting baik long ai bilong en.

original: And there was a young Levite from Bethlehem in Judah who had been residing within the clan of Judah.
translation: Na em i stap yungpela Levi long Bethlehem insait long Judah, na em i wankain stap long clan bilong Judah.

original: This man left the city of Bethlehem in Judah to settle where he could find a place. And as he traveled, he came to Micah’s house in the hill country of Ephraim.
translation: Man ini i lusim siti Betelehem long Juda, we bilong em ina finisim ples stap long ples. Olsem na em i go, na em i kam long haus bilong Mika long kantri long maunten bilong Efrayim.

original: “Where are you from?” Micah asked him. “I am a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah,” he replied, “and I am on my way to settle wherever I can find a place.”
translation: "Yu kam long wanem hap?" Mika askim em. "Mi Levit man, mi from Betlehem, long Juda," em i tok, "na mi go long ples bilong mi yet, bai mi kisim ples na stap."

original: “Stay with me,” Micah said to him, “and be my father and priest, and I will give you ten shekels of silver per year, a suit of clothes, and your provisions.” So the Levite went in
translation: “Bai yu stap wantaim mi,” Mika i tokim em, “bai yu papa na prist bilong mi, na mi bai givim yu ten shekel silva bek long yia, wan set klotes, na kaikai bilong yu.” Na Levait i go insait.

original: and agreed to stay with him, and the young man became like a son to Micah.
translation: Na ol i mak olsem bai stap wantaim em, na man pikinini em i kamap olsem pikinini bilong Micah.

original: Micah ordained the Levite, and the young man became his priest and lived in his house.
translation: Mika hem appointim Levait i go het, na yanpela man i kamap prist bilong em, na i stap long haus bilong en.

original: Then Micah said, “Now I know that the LORD will be good to me, because a Levite has become my priest.”
translation: Na Mikai i tok thus, "Nau mi save olsem Jehovah bai i givim mi gutpela, bikos wanpela Levait i kam prist bilong mi."

original: In those days there was no king in Israel, and the tribe of the Danites was looking for territory to occupy. For up to that time they had not come into an inheritance among the tribes of Israel.
translation: Long dispela taim, i no bin gat king long Israel, na trip bilong Danites i lukim graun olsem bai ol i kam na occupy. Ol yet i no bin kam insait long eni inheritance long ol trip bilong Israel.

original: So the Danites sent out five men from their clans, men of valor from Zorah and Eshtaol, to spy out the land and explore it. “Go and explore the land,” they told them. The men entered the hill country of Ephraim and came to the house of Micah, where they spent the night.
translation: Na Daniti i sendim faiv man husat i kam long clan bilong ol, man bilong strongim husat i kam long Zorah na Eshtaol, ol i go lukim kantri na tarmba explorim. "Yu go na explorim kantri," ol i tokim ol. Ol i go insait long kantri bilong Ephraim we i got maunten, na ol i kam kasal long haus bilong Micah, na ol i stap long hap tumora.

original: And while they were near Micah’s house, they recognized the voice of the young Levite; so they went over and asked him, “Who brought you here? What are you doing in this place? Why are you here?”
translation: Wail ol i stap klostu long haus bilong Mikah, ol i save harim voys bilong yungpela Levait; so ol i go kasal go askim em, “Husat i bringim yu kam? Wanem yu mekim long dispela hap? Bilong wanem yu stap long hap?”

original: “Micah has done this and that for me,” he replied, “and he has hired me to be his priest.”
translation: Mika en i mekim ol samting long me, em i tok, na em i pai me long wokim wok bilong prist bilong en.

original: Then they said to him, “Please inquire of God to determine whether we will have a successful journey.”
translation: Ol i tokim em, "Plez askim tok bilong God, wari long tingim bai yu ka moning i go gut, o ilet."

original: And the priest told them, “Go in peace. The LORD is watching over your journey.”
translation: Na prist i tokim ol, "Go long peis. LORD i lukautim wok bai yumi go."

original: So the five men departed and came to Laish, where they saw that the people were living securely, like the Sidonians, tranquil and unsuspecting. There was nothing lacking in the land and no oppressive ruler. And they were far away from the Sidonians and had no alliance with anyone.
translation: Na ol man i faiv desla i go na i kam long Laish, na ol i lukim ol pipo i stap gutpela, olsem ol Sidonian, stil na i no save susa. I no gat dispela bikman i bagarapim long kantri, na  i no lakim samting, na ol i stap longwe bilong ol Sidonian na i no gat pakt long eni man.

original: When the men returned to Zorah and Eshtaol, their brothers asked them, “What did you find?”
translation: Taim ol man i go bek long Zorah na Eshtaol, bratas ol i askim ol long tok, "Wanem yu finis?"

original: They answered, “Come on, let us go up against them, for we have seen the land, and it is very good. Why would you fail to act? Do not hesitate to go there and take possession of the land!
translation: Ol i tok, "Kam na! Mipela go apo long ol, mipela lukim graun, na em i switmoa tru. Wai yu nogat wok yet? No ken givim tim, go na tumbuna i takem graun, o tambuaim graun, mipela!

original: When you enter, you will come to an unsuspecting people and a spacious land, for God has delivered it into your hand. It is a place where nothing on earth is lacking.”
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait, yu kam long piple i no save na graun we i bigpela, bikos God i givim i long han bilong yu. Em i ples we nothing long graun i no lak.

original: So six hundred Danites departed from Zorah and Eshtaol, armed with weapons of war.
translation: Sikis hundret Daniti lusim Zora na Eshtaol, ol i go wail long samting bilong fait.

original: They went up and camped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. That is why the place west of Kiriath-jearim is called Mahaneh-dan to this day.
translation: Ol i go ap na kam kemp long Kiriath-jearim long lænd Judah. Na dispela em i kolim Mahaneh-dan yet long tude, bikos ol i bin kemp long hap wes bilong Kiriath-jearim.

original: And from there they traveled to the hill country of Ephraim and came to Micah’s house.
translation: Na oli go long kantri bilong maunten bilong Efrayim, na oli kam long haus bilong Mikah.

original: Then the five men who had gone to spy out the land of Laish said to their brothers, “Did you know that one of these houses has an ephod, household gods, a graven image, and a molten idol? Now think about what you should do.”
translation: Na ol man pipl faiv we i go lusim bek long lukim gras bilong Laish i tok long ol brata bilong ol, "Yu save olsem wanpela hus bilong ol i gat ephod, gods bilong haus, piksa i wail skulpim, na idol i mekim long ai bilong sol? Nau yu tingim olsem bai yu mekim wanem."

original: So they turned aside there and went to the home of the young Levite, the house of Micah, and greeted him.
translation: Ol i wokim shar bikos na ol i go long haus bilong yungpela Levait, haus bilong Maika, na ol i givim greetings long em.

original: The six hundred Danites stood at the entrance of the gate, armed with their weapons of war.
translation: Sikis hundred Daniti i stap klostu long entris bilong gat, na ol i gat wpn bilong war, i ready long harim wai.

original: And the five men who had gone to spy out the land went inside and took the graven image, the ephod, the household idols, and the molten idol, while the priest stood at the entrance of the gate with the six hundred armed men.
translation: Na faiv man i go lukim graun, ol i go insait na takedaun kakaruk na wokim long han, ephod, idols bilong hus, na idol i moul long ais, wail pries i stanap long entris bilong gat wantaim sikis hundred man i arm ol yet.

original: When they entered Micah’s house and took the graven image, the ephod, the household idols, and the molten idol, the priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
translation: Taim ol i go insait long haus bilong Mika na kisim statu we ol i wokim, ephod, idols bilong husat, na statu molten, pries i tokim ol, “Wanem yu mekim?”

original: “Be quiet,” they told him. “Put your hand over your mouth and come with us and be a father and a priest to us. Is it better for you to be a priest for the house of one person or a priest for a tribe and family in Israel?”
translation: “Kisim ka,” ol i tokim em. “Pitim han bilong yu na kam wantaim mipela, na bikim papa na prist long mipela. Em i gutpela long yu olsem, yu bai stap olsem prist bilong wan man, tasol em i nogut long yu olsem, yu ken stap olsem lidaman long ol samting spiritual bilong wan tribe na famili long Isrel?”

original: So the priest was glad and took the ephod, the household idols, and the graven image, and went with the people.
translation: Na pris i hamamas, em kisim ephod, idol bilong haus, na carving bilong debdeb, na em i go wantaim ol pipel.

original: Putting their small children, their livestock, and their possessions in front of them, they turned and departed.
translation: Oli putim ol pikinini liklik bilong ol, animit, na propati bilong ol long hap bilong ol, oli turnim bek na oli go.
