original: After they were some distance from Micah’s house, the men in the houses near Micah’s house mobilized and overtook the Danites.
translation: Ol i go bek long haus bilong Mikah, ol man long hus na karim na katim warka, ol paulim Daniti.

original: When they called out after them, the Danites turned to face them and said to Micah, “What is the matter with you that you have called out such a company?”
translation: Wanpela taim ol i singaut bihain long ol, Danaitis ol i tunim bek long ol na tokim Mikai, “Wusai stap long yu, bikos yu singautim ol i kam?”

original: He replied, “You took the gods I had made, and my priest, and went away. What else do I have? How can you say to me, ‘What is the matter with you?’”
translation: Em i tok bek, “Yu bin kisim ol gogol bilong mi, na prist bilong mi, na em i goawe. Mi no gat narapela samting we? Olsem wanem yu ken tok long me, ‘Wanem i stap long yu?’”

original: The Danites said to him, “Do not raise your voice against us, or angry men will attack you, and you and your family will lose your lives.”
translation: Danait i tokim em, "Yu no ken kisim hap na singaut longlain agensim mipela, nau ol man i masalai bai bagarapim yu, na yu na famili bilong yu bai lusim laip bilong yumi."

original: So the Danites went on their way, and Micah turned to go back home, because he saw that they were too strong for him.
translation: Na Daniti i go na lukim wail, Maika i turnim bek long go bak long haus, bikos em i lukim ol i strong tumas long en.

original: After they had taken Micah’s idols and his priest, they went to Laish, to a tranquil and unsuspecting people, and they struck them with their swords and burned down the city.
translation: Ol i kisim ol idol bilong Mikai na prist bilong em, na ol i go long Laish, long wanpela ples stil na quiat, na ol i no save long tingting. Ol i kilim ol long swod bilong ol, na ol i barim daun taun.

original: There was no one to deliver them, because the city was far from Sidon and had no alliance with anyone; it was in a valley near Beth-rehob. And the Danites rebuilt the city and lived there.
translation: Ino bin gat man i save ol, bikos siti ia i longwe nau long Sidon na i no gat pakt long nanpela; em i stap long bele klostu long Bet-rehob. Na Danitis i wokim gen siti na ol i stap hap.

original: They named it Dan, after their forefather Dan, who was born to Israel—though the city was formerly named Laish.
translation: Ol i givim nem bilong em Dan, ol i tok long ol tumbuna bilong ol, Dan, em i man bilong Israel, taim bifo, taun ia i kolim Laish.

original: The Danites set up idols for themselves, and Jonathan son of Gershom, the son of Moses, and his sons were priests for the tribe of Dan until the day of the captivity of the land.
translation: Danaiti i statim apim idols long ol yet, na Jonathan siki bilong Gershom, siki bilong Moses, na ol pikinini bilong em ol i bin prist bilong tribe bilong Dan, long taim bilong kapchua bilong graun.

original: So they set up for themselves Micah’s graven image, and it was there the whole time the house of God was in Shiloh.
translation: Ol i makim ap long olgeta yet kaskas bilong Mikah, na em i stap long ol taim husat haus bilong God i stap long Shiloh.

original: Now in those days, when there was no king in Israel, a Levite who lived in the remote hill country of Ephraim took for himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
translation: Long long taim bipo, wail em i no gat king yet long Isrel, wanpela Levai husat i stap long hap graun bilong Efraim, i kisim meri bilong en, we i no bikpela meri, long Betlehem long länd bilong Juda.

original: But she was unfaithful to him and left him to return to her father’s house in Bethlehem in Judah. After she had been there four months,
translation: Tasol em i no tru long em, na em i lusim em, go bek long haus bilong papa long Betlehem, long Judah. Na em i stap we long foa manis,

original: her husband got up and went after her to speak kindly to her and bring her back, taking his servant and a pair of donkeys. So the girl brought him into her father’s house, and when her father saw him, he gladly welcomed him.
translation: Man bilong meri i kam bek na i go bihain long em, tok gut long en na kisim em i kam bek, tasol i kisim wokman na pikinini bek tu. Ol i bringim em i go insait long haus bilong papa bilong em, na papa bilong em i lukim em, ol i welkomim em wantaim bel hevi.

original: His father-in-law, the girl’s father, persuaded him to stay, so he remained with him three days, eating, drinking, and lodging there.
translation: Papa bilong wife bilong em, papa bilong pikinini, i winim em na em i stap wantaim em long tri de, ol i kaikai, dring, na slip olsem.

original: On the fourth day, they got up early in the morning and prepared to depart, but the girl’s father said to his son-in-law, “Refresh your heart with a morsel of bread, and then you can go.”
translation: Long de befó, ol i go aphne long moning, na ol i rede long go, tasol papa bilong pikinini meri i tokim man husban bilong pikinini meri, "Givim kaikai long yumui, inap yu kaikai liklik kaikai, na bihain yu ken go, yumui bilong yu i kamap strong gen."

original: So they sat down and the two of them ate and drank together. Then the girl’s father said to the man, “Please agree to stay overnight and let your heart be merry.”
translation: Ol i siddaun na ol i kaikai na dring toretha. Na papa bilong pikinini meri i tokim man, "Plezi yu stap ol nait, na bel bilong yu kam ap long hap."

original: The man got up to depart, but his father-in-law persuaded him, so he stayed there that night.
translation: Man i kam daun bilong lusim, tasol papa bilong meri i konvikim em, na em i stap we long nait.

original: On the fifth day, he got up early in the morning to depart, but the girl’s father said, “Please refresh your heart.” So they waited until late afternoon and the two of them ate.
translation: Long dei namba five, em i go bek long moning i go lusim, tasol papa bilong pikinini i tok, "Givim yu hed i kam strong gen." Ol i w8 na apinun tru long afternoon, na tupela i kaikai.

original: When the man got up to depart with his concubine and his servant, his father-in-law, the girl’s father, said to him, “Look, the day is drawing to a close. Please spend the night. See, the day is almost over. Spend the night here, that your heart may be merry. Then you can get up early tomorrow for your journey home.”
translation: Taim man i kamap na go long rot wantaim meri bilong haus na boi bilong en, papa bilong wife i tokim em, "Luke, dei i go daun pinis. Givim ka long ol pela i stap nait, spendim nait. Ol i kirapim bel, dei i go daun pinis, inap yu spendim nait hia, na bel bilong yu bai i hamamas. Kamap erli tumora, yu ken go long wokim journey bilong yu i go bek long haus."

original: But the man was unwilling to spend the night. He got up and departed, and arrived opposite Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), with his two saddled donkeys and his concubine.
translation: Bikos man i no bin wan stap long nait, em i kam bek na i go, na ol i kam kasal long hap opisit Jebus, em i Jerusalem tasol, wantaim tupela donki bilong ridim i redi na meri bilong hambut.

original: When they were near Jebus and the day was almost gone, the servant said to his master, “Please, let us stop at this Jebusite city and spend the night here.”
translation: Wanpela taim ol i klos long Jebus na de i go daun pinis, wokman i tokim bos bilong en, “Plezi, mipela mas stap long taun bilong ol Jebus na slip long hap.”

original: But his master replied, “We will not turn aside to the city of foreigners, where there are no Israelites. We will go on to Gibeah.”
translation: Bos bilong em i tok, "Mipela no go bak long taun bilong ol i kam, olgeta hap bilong Isreaeli i no stap. Mipela go inap long Gibea."

original: He continued, “Come, let us try to reach one of these towns to spend the night in Gibeah or Ramah.”
translation: Em i go bek, “Kam, uspai yumi troim kaikai long wanpela bilong dispela taun ol, ibin Gibe o Rama, na yumi slip nogut.”

original: So they continued on their journey, and the sun set as they neared Gibeah in Benjamin.
translation: Ol i go i go long wei yet, na san i go daun long taim ol i kam klostu long Gibea, ples bilong ol ancestor long Benjamen.

original: They stopped to go in and lodge in Gibeah. The Levite went in and sat down in the city square, but no one would take them into his home for the night.
translation: Oli stop long go insait, kam lusim long Gibea. Levit i go insait na sindaun long ples bilong maket, tasol nobody karim ol i go long haus bilong em long nait.

original: That evening an old man from the hill country of Ephraim, who was residing in Gibeah (the men of that place were Benjamites), came in from his work in the field.
translation: Long taem bai i go dae, ol man bilong kantri hap bilong Efrayim, we em i stap long Gibe, na ol man bilong ples ia ol i Bilong tribe Bilong Benjimin, i kam insait from wok bilong en long graun.

original: When he looked up and saw the traveler in the city square, the old man asked, “Where are you going, and where have you come from?”
translation: Tumbuna man i kisim head i go ap long na lukim traveler i stap long hap tasol bilong ples, em i tanim olsem, “Yu go we, na yu kam long we?”

original: The Levite replied, “We are traveling from Bethlehem in Judah to the remote hill country of Ephraim, where I am from. I went to Bethlehem in Judah, and now I am going to the house of the LORD; but no one has taken me into his home,
translation: Levai i tok, "Mipela i go long rot, mipela kam long Betlehem long Juda, na nau yumi go long maunten lonlon i stap farawe bilong Efraim, hap bilong mi. Mi kam long Betlehem long Juda, na nau mi go long haus bilong LORD; tasol no one inim tokim mipela in go insait long haus bilong en."

original: even though there is both straw and feed for our donkeys, and bread and wine for me and the maidservant and young man with me. There is nothing that we, your servants, lack.”
translation: Maski ol i gat gras bilong animol na givim ka long donki, na bret na wain long mipela, long mi, meri saris, na man bilong klostu, nogat samting mipela i lak, bikos mipela i servistaba long yu, relesen bilong bos na wokman.

original: “Peace to you,” said the old man. “Let me supply everything you need. Only do not spend the night in the square.”
translation: Pis i kam long yu, mipela bai kisim ol samting yu pilim, na mipela bai givim long yu, tasol yu no ken slip long skwasi bilong taun.

original: So he brought him to his house and fed his donkeys. And they washed their feet and ate and drank.
translation: Na em i bringim man i go long haus bilong en, givim kaikai long donki bilong en. Ol i wasim lek bilong ol, kaikai na dring.

original: While they were enjoying themselves, suddenly the wicked men of the city surrounded the house. Pounding on the door, they said to the old man who owned the house, “Bring out the man who came to your house, so we can have relations with him!”
translation: Wail ol i stap enji, ol raskol bilong siti i kam aut na i go raunim haus, ol i kilim bikmus long dor, na ol i tokim olegta man husat i bosim haus, “Kisim bekim man husat i kam stap long haus bilong yu, na givim em bun bilong planti!

original: The owner of the house went out and said to them, “No, my brothers, do not do this wicked thing! After all, this man is a guest in my house. Do not commit this outrage.
translation: Masta bilong haus i go aut na em tokim ol: "Nogat, brata, yu no ken mekim dispela olgeta samting i nogut! Em i stap long haus bilong mi olsem gas. Yu no ken mekim dispela pasal nogut."

original: Look, let me bring out my virgin daughter and the man’s concubine, and you can use them and do with them as you wish. But do not do such a vile thing to this man.”
translation: Mi bai kisim olt long nau, dikplela meri we i no bin gat husband yet, na meri we i stap wantaim man tasol i no bin mari, na yu yet long mekim olsem yu laik long ol. Tasol, yu no ken mekim samting i nogut tru olsem long dispela man.

original: But the men would not listen to him. So the Levite took his concubine and sent her outside to them, and they raped her and abused her throughout the night, and at dawn they let her go.
translation: Bareket ol man i no lisnen long em. Olsem Levait i kisim meri bilong en, em pusim i go autsaid long ol, na ol i bagarapim na i vuritim meri tasol long nait, na bihain long moningtaim ol i lusim meri i go.

original: Early that morning, the woman went back to the house where her master was staying, collapsed at the doorway, and lay there until it was light.
translation: Long moning bai i kam, meri i go bak long haus bilong bos, i pilak long entrance bilong doorway, na i stap we til ai bai i lait.

original: In the morning, when her master got up and opened the doors of the house to go out on his journey, there was his concubine, collapsed in the doorway of the house, with her hands on the threshold.
translation: Long moning, taim em maser i kam bek, na em i opim hus dor i go wokabaut long wik, na i lukim meri bilong em, i pundaun klostu long pa botol bilong dor bilong haus, han bilong em i stap yet long pa botol.

original: “Get up,” he told her. “Let us go.” But there was no response. So the man put her on his donkey and set out for home.
translation: “Kam daun,” em i tokim. “Yumi go nau.” Tasol i no gat tok bak. Olsem na man i ritim meri long donki, kukim i go bek long ples bilong ol.

original: When he reached his house, he picked up a knife, took hold of his concubine, cut her limb by limb into twelve pieces, and sent her throughout the territory of Israel.
translation: Tisa i kamap long haus bilong en, na i kisim naif bilong en, i klem i holim meri bilong servis bilong en, i katim ol birua bilong en, na i salim em i go long ol hap bilong graun bilong Israel.

original: And everyone who saw it said, “Nothing like this has been seen or done from the day the Israelites came out of the land of Egypt until this day. Think it over, take counsel, and speak up!”
translation: Na olgeta i lukim em i tok, "Nogat samting olsem ikamap o ibin mekim long taim Yiseliti i kamap long Graun Egypt na kas olsem long taim nau." Tingim i gut, tokim bek, na tok!

original: Then all the Israelites from Dan to Beersheba and from the land of Gilead came out, and the congregation assembled as one man before the LORD at Mizpah.
translation: Ol Israelait i kam aut, stat long Dan na i go inap long Beersheba, na olgeta long lad Gilead, na oli kalap long wan man tasol, na oli kam bung wantaim bifor LORD long Mizpah.

original: The leaders of all the people and all the tribes of Israel presented themselves in the assembly of God’s people: 400,000 men on foot, armed with swords.
translation: Ol bikman na olgeta tribe bilong Israel i kam bek long ples bilong mipela long assembli bilong pippel bilong God: 400,000 man i go long graun, ol i gat suis long han.

original: (Meanwhile the Benjamites heard that the Israelites had gone up to Mizpah.) And the Israelites asked, “Tell us, how did this wicked thing happen?”
translation: Bai olsem Benjamina ol i harim ol Israelites ol i go-ap long Mizpa, wanpela hap bilong bung. Na ol Israelites ol i askim, "Yumi tok, ol samting nogut ol i kamap long wanem?"

original: So the Levite, the husband of the murdered woman, answered: “I and my concubine came to Gibeah in Benjamin to spend the night.
translation: Levait, husban bilong meri i bin dai long han bilong ol, i givim tok: "Mai na meri bilong wantok, mipela kam long Gibea, long ples bilong tribe Benjamin, mipela go stap long nait."

original: And during the night, the men of Gibeah rose up against me and surrounded the house. They intended to kill me, but they abused my concubine, and she died.
translation: Long nait, ol man bilong Gibea i kamap bek genston against mi, na ol i kam raitim haus bilong mi. Ol i laik kilim mi, tasol ol i bagarap meri bilong mi we em i gat bikpela bel, na em i dai.

original: Then I took my concubine, cut her into pieces, and sent her throughout the land of Israel’s inheritance, because they had committed a lewd and disgraceful act in Israel.
translation: Na mi kisim meri bilong mi, wanpela i no mari bilong mi tasol, na mi katim em i go olsem long ol hap, na mi salim em i go long ol hap bilong kantri bilong Israel. Ol i wokim wok bilong袋 i nogat maneri, wok bilong bagarap tru long kantri bilong Israel, ol i pkinini long tumbuna.

original: Behold, all you Israelites, give your advice and verdict here and now.”
translation: Lukim, all yumi Israelait, givim tok bilong yu na tos' bilong yu hia na nau.

original: Then all the people stood as one man and said, “Not one of us will return to his tent or to his house.
translation: Ol pipol i sanap wanpela na tok olsem: “Nogat wanpela blo mipela bai go bek long rum bilong en, tasol i no gat hus na go bek long haus bilong en.”

original: Now this is what we will do to Gibeah: We will go against it as the lot dictates.
translation: Nau wusai yumi bai mekim long Gibea: Yumi bai go long agensim olsem bilong drai i tok.

original: We will take ten men out of every hundred from all the tribes of Israel, and a hundred out of every thousand, and a thousand out of every ten thousand, to supply provisions for the army when they go to Gibeah in Benjamin to punish them for the atrocity they have committed in Israel.”
translation: Mipela bai kisim ten man i go long ol hundred, na hundred man i go long ol tausen, na tausen man i go long ol ten tausen, long ol trib long Israel, bai givim kaikai long army wennem i go long Gibeah long Benjamin, bai penalisim ol long wiket bilong ol tasol.

original: So all the men of Israel gathered as one man, united against the city.
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i kam together olsem wan man, na tupela i go antap long go agensim siti.

original: And the tribes of Israel sent men throughout the tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What is this wickedness that has occurred among you?
translation: Na ol trib pes bilong Israel ol bingim man i go olsem long stret bilong trib pes bilong Benjamin, ol tokim ol, “Dispela kais nogut tru i kamap long yu?”

original: Hand over the wicked men of Gibeah so we can put them to death and purge Israel of this evil.” But the Benjamites refused to heed the voice of their fellow Israelites.
translation: Givim ol man i go long wei bilong satan long Gibea, kilim ol, na bai ol i dai, na rausim bel hevi long Israel. Tasol Benjamin i no lissen tok bilong brata Israel.

original: And from their cities they came together at Gibeah to go out and fight against the Israelites.
translation: Na ol i kam long olgeta sins bilong ol long Gibe, ol i go aut na fight gen long Pipol bilong Isrel.

original: On that day the Benjamites mobilized 26,000 swordsmen from their cities, in addition to the 700 select men of Gibeah.
translation: Long dispela de, Benjamait i kirapim man i gat sord 26,000 long ples bilong ol, long hap tu na 700 man i gat skil bilong Gibe.

original: Among all these soldiers there were 700 select left-handers, each of whom could sling a stone at a hair without missing.
translation: Long olgeta soldier ya, na i gat 700 man i skelim long lefthand, ol i save sutim ston yet long hair bilong man na i no missim.

original: The Israelites, apart from Benjamin, mobilized 400,000 swordsmen, each one an experienced warrior.
translation: Olia Israel, Benjamin i no kam, ol i kamapim 400,000 man i save paitim na kisim spia, nen igat ekspiriens olsem solja.

original: The Israelites set out, went up to Bethel, and inquired of God, “Who of us shall go up first to fight against the Benjamites?” “Judah will be first,” the LORD replied.
translation: Pipol bilong Israel i go na i kam antap long Betel, na ol i bin askim God, “Hu bilong yumi bai go antap first long paitim ol Benjamen?” “Juda bai go antap first,” LORD i tok.

original: The next morning the Israelites set out and camped near Gibeah.
translation: Bihainim moning Pipol Israel i go na i go, na ol i kamp klostu long Gibe.

original: And the men of Israel went out to fight against Benjamin and took up their battle positions at Gibeah.
translation: Na man meri bilong Isrel i go aut na fight gen Benjamin, na ol i kam na sindaun long ples bilong ol long faet long Gibea.

original: And the Benjamites came out of Gibeah and cut down 22,000 Israelites on the battlefield that day.
translation: Na Benjamait i kamap long Gibea na kilim 22,000 Israelait long ples bilong faet long de.

original: But the Israelite army took courage and again took their battle positions in the same place where they had arrayed themselves on the first day.
translation: Bikos armi bilong Israel ol i kisim kuraj, yet ol i go bek gen long ples bilong fare na ol i oraitim yet long dispela dei ol i bin oraitim long em.

original: They went up and wept before the LORD until evening, inquiring of Him, “Should we again draw near for battle against our brothers the Benjamites?” And the LORD answered, “Go up against them.”
translation: Ol i go antap na kisim tarangau bifor Bikpela LORD yet long taem bilong apartheid, mipela bin askim em, "Mipela inap go klus gen wantaim bratas Benjamites long faet?" Na Bikpela LORD i givim tok, "Yu kam klus wantaim ol, go antap na harim despla faet."

original: On the second day the Israelites advanced against the Benjamites.
translation: Long sekond dei, Pipol bilong Orael i go pas wantaim, na ol i harim long pipol bilong Benjamin.

original: That same day the Benjamites came out against them from Gibeah and cut down another 18,000 Israelites, all of them armed with swords.
translation: Long dispela de, Benjaminiti i kam bek gen long ol Isrelait husat i stat long Gibe, na ol katim daun 18,000 Isrelait, olgeta i gat sepik.

original: Then the Israelites, all the people, went up to Bethel, where they sat weeping before the LORD. That day they fasted until evening and presented burnt offerings and peace offerings to the LORD.
translation: Na Israelites, ol pipol, i go ap long Bethel, na ol i sidaun kisim teba bifo LORD. Dispela de ol i fait olsem kas long san na ol i bringim ofa bilong bun na ofa bilong peis long LORD.

original: And the Israelites inquired of the LORD. (In those days the ark of the covenant of God was there,
translation: Na Israeliti i go askim long LORD. (Long dispela taim, bikpela ark bilong tok bilong God em i stap)

original: and Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, served before it.) The Israelites asked, “Should we again go out to battle against our brothers the Benjamites, or should we stop?” The LORD answered, “Fight, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hand.”
translation: Na Finias, pikinini bilong Eleasa, pikinini bilong Aron, servis bifoa em. Ol Israel talim, “Inap mi go aut gen long pait wantaim brata bilong mipela Ol Benjamina, o inap mi stopim?” Bikpela anserim, “Go aut long pait, bikos tumora mi givim ol i go long han bilong yu.”

original: So Israel set up an ambush around Gibeah.
translation: Na Isrel i wokim bekim long ples, long sait bilong Gibea.

original: On the third day the Israelites went up against the Benjamites and arrayed themselves against Gibeah as they had done before.
translation: Long dei thrid, ol Pipol Israel i go ap gen long na kam bek gen against ol Pipol Benjamen na sindaun ol yet long Taun Gibe, olsem ol i mekim bifo.

original: The Benjamites came out against them and were drawn away from the city. They began to attack the people as before, killing about thirty men of Israel in the fields and on the roads, one of which led up to Bethel and the other to Gibeah.
translation: Benjamait i kam bek gen long ol, na ol i pil bak gen long siti. Ol i statim bekim ol pipol olsem bipo, na ol i kilim ol man husat i stap long Israel, long hap thirty, long bus na long rot, wanpela i go antap long Betel na narpela i go long Gibe.

original: “We are defeating them as before,” said the Benjamites. But the Israelites said, “Let us retreat and draw them away from the city onto the roads.”
translation: Benjamait i tok olsem: "Mipela i winim ol long taim bipo." Batas, Israelit i tok olsem: "Yumi go bek gen na lusim ol i kam long siti na kalap long rot."

original: So all the men of Israel got up from their places and arrayed themselves at Baal-tamar, and the Israelites in ambush charged from their positions west of Gibeah.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Isrel i kamap strong long ples bilong ol, na ol i dressim ap gen long Baal-tamar, na Ol Israel i stap long kaivakava, na ol i ranawe long ples bilong ol long wes bilong Gibea.

original: Then 10,000 select men from all Israel made a frontal assault against Gibeah, and the battle was fierce. But the Benjamites did not realize that disaster was upon them.
translation: Na 10,000 man meri bilong pikinini husat i selekta tumas long olgeta Isrel i go aplaut long ples bilong Gibe, na pelet bilong war ibin strong tumas. Tasol Benjamait i no save olsem bagarap em i kamdaun long ol.

original: The LORD defeated Benjamin in the presence of Israel, and on that day the Israelites slaughtered 25,100 Benjamites, all armed with swords.
translation: Papa God i winim Ol Benjamini long hap bilong Israel, na long dei nemeli, Ol Israel i kilim 25,100 manmeri bilong Benjamin, olgeta i gat sot long han.

original: Then the Benjamites realized they had been defeated. Now the men of Israel had retreated before Benjamin because they were relying on the ambush they had set against Gibeah.
translation: Na ol Benjamait i save ol i bin kilim pinis. Ol man bilong Isrel i go bek gen long ples bilong en na lusim Benjamin, bikos ol i putim hope long ambus ol i mekim long Gibeah.

original: The men in ambush rushed suddenly against Gibeah; they advanced and put the whole city to the sword.
translation: Ol man i go hap kas, na tumas ol i ron na kam bek gen long Siti bilong Gibea; ol i go na winim em long sop.

original: The men of Israel had arranged a signal with the men in ambush: When they sent up a great cloud of smoke from the city,
translation: Man meri bilong Israel ol i arapim singnal wantaim ol i waitim long ambush: Wanpela taim ol i senaupim smok bilong ples i go long we,

original: the men of Israel would turn in the battle. When the Benjamites had begun to strike them down, killing about thirty men of Israel, they said, “They are defeated before us as in the first battle.”
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel bai tokim go bek long faipela bikpela fait. Wanpela taim ol Benjamaiti bin statim kilim ol, na kilim weaving thirty man bilong Isrel, ol i tok, "Tumbuna i go daun bifor mipela olsem laip bilong faipela bikpela fait."

original: But when the column of smoke began to go up from the city, the Benjamites looked behind them and saw the whole city going up in smoke.
translation: Tasol taim em i kamap smok bilong kol i go antap, Benjamait i luke behain ol i si hap bilong siti i go daun long smok.

original: Then the men of Israel turned back on them, and the men of Benjamin were terrified when they realized that disaster had come upon them.
translation: Ol man bilong Israel i tun baks long ol, na ol man bilong Benjimin i bikim afraid tumas long taim ol save olsem birua ibin kamap long ol.

original: So they fled before the men of Israel toward the wilderness, but the battle overtook them, and the men coming out of the cities struck them down there.
translation: Ol i ranawe long bun leg na ol man meri bilong Isrel, ol i go na i kamap long bus, tasol fait i kam behainim ol, na ol man i kam aut long taun i kilim ol long hap tan.

original: They surrounded the Benjamites, pursued them, and easily overtook them in the vicinity of Gibeah on the east.
translation: Benjamites i kam ronim na klostu ol, ol i bihainim ol, na ol i kapim ol long sait bilong Gibe na sindaun i go bek quer long east.

original: And 18,000 Benjamites fell, all men of valor.
translation: Na 18,000 Ol Man Benjamine i pundaun, ol man husat i gat strong bilong spirit.

original: Then the Benjamites turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, and Israel cut down 5,000 men on the roads. And they overtook them at Gidom and struck down 2,000 more.
translation: Na Benjamins turnim bek na ranawe, ol i ran i go insait long bus, na Isrel i kilim daun 5,000 man long rot. Na ol i kisim backend ol na kilim daun 2,000 moa long Gidom.

original: That day 25,000 Benjamite swordsmen fell, all men of valor.
translation: Dispela de 25,000 Man bilong Benjamen i pundaun, ol man bilong sindaun na katim, ol man bilong strong.

original: But 600 men turned and fled into the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, where they stayed four months.
translation: Barek 600 man turnim bek i ranawe, ol i go insait long bus, na stap long roka bilong Rimmon, na ol stap we fourpela manis.

original: And the men of Israel turned back against the other Benjamites and put to the sword all the cities, including the animals and everything else they found. And they burned down all the cities in their path.
translation: Na man meri bilong Isrel turnim bek long narapela Benjamait na kilim ol na kisim bek long sord, ol tauns, animals, na ol samting ol i stap, na burnim daun ol hus long rot bilong ol.

original: Now the men of Israel had sworn an oath at Mizpah, saying, “Not one of us will give his daughter in marriage to a Benjamite.”
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i makim oas long Mizpah, ol i tok, "Nogat wanpela blo mipela bai givim pikinini meri bilong en long mariji long Benjamine."

original: So the people came to Bethel and sat there before God until evening, lifting up their voices and weeping bitterly.
translation: Ol kam long Betel, sindaun yet long ples bilong God, kola i go daun, ol i kisim voys bilong ol, ol i singaut, na ol i traevilaik is.

original: “Why, O LORD God of Israel,” they cried out, “has this happened in Israel? Today in Israel one tribe is missing!”
translation: O Tasol, LORD God bilong Israel, dispela kam long ol ples bilong Israel, tudei long Israel wanpela hap i stap!

original: The next day the people got up early, built an altar there, and presented burnt offerings and peace offerings.
translation: Nex dei ol pipol i kamap erli, ol i go bikim wanpela altar long hap em, na ol i bringim ofa bilong bun na ofa bilong peis.

original: The Israelites asked, “Who among all the tribes of Israel did not come to the assembly before the LORD?” For they had taken a solemn oath that anyone who failed to come up before the LORD at Mizpah would surely be put to death.
translation: Oli Israelait i askim, “Husat yet long ol tribe bilong Israel i no kam long assembli bifor Yap Long God?” Yus, ol i mekim oat bilong promis strong olsem, husat i no inap go antap bifor Yap Long God long ples Mizpah, em bai putim i go long dei.

original: And the Israelites grieved for their brothers, the Benjamites, and said, “Today a tribe is cut off from Israel.
translation: Na Pipol bilong Israel i sori long ol brata bilong ol, Pipol bilong Benjimin, na ol i tok, "Tude wanpela wantok im katim long Israel."

original: What should we do about wives for the survivors, since we have sworn by the LORD not to give them our daughters in marriage?”
translation: Wanem bai yumi mekim long ol meri bilong ol man i stap yet, long as husat yumi promis long LORD, olsem yumi no inap givim daughta bilong yumi long ol long marij?

original: So they asked, “Which one of the tribes of Israel failed to come up before the LORD at Mizpah?” And, in fact, no one from Jabesh-gilead had come to the camp for the assembly.
translation: Ol i askim, “Husat wanem trib bilong Israel i no inap kamap bifo LORD long Mizpah?” Tru olsem, nobodi husat i kom from Jabesh-gilead i no kam long kamp bilong assemblies.

original: For when the people were counted, none of the residents of Jabesh-gilead were there.
translation: Long taim ol pipol i kam kilim olgeta, not a single wan bilong Jabesh-gilead ibin stap, ikam inap long kilim olgeta.

original: So the congregation sent 12,000 of their most valiant men and commanded them: “Go and put to the sword those living in Jabesh-gilead, including women and children.
translation: Kongregesen i sendim 12,000 man bilong ol, ol i strong nogut, na ol givim ol tok instruksin: "Go na kilim ol long sepik ol i stap long Jabesh-gilead, inklusim meri na pikinini."

original: This is what you are to do: Devote to destruction every male, as well as every female who has had relations with a man.”
translation: Dispela em i wanem yu mas mekim: Kisim ol i go long destrukshen, ol man na meri husat i wok bung wantaim man.

original: So they found among the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead four hundred young women who had not had relations with a man, and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh in the land of Canaan.
translation: Ol i kisim four hundred liklik meri we em i no gat klostu long man long Jabesh-Gilead, na ol i bringim ol bek long kamp long Shiloh inside kantri Kanan.

original: Then the whole congregation sent a message of peace to the Benjamites who were at the rock of Rimmon.
translation: Olgeta asambli i sendim pes bilong peis long ol Benjemin we i stap long rok Rimmon.

original: And at that time the Benjamites returned and were given the women who were spared from Jabesh-gilead. But there were not enough women for all of them.
translation: Long taim ia, Benjamaiti i kam bek gen na ol i givim ol meri we ibin sklep long Jabesh-Gilead. Tasol ol meri i no nuf long ol.

original: The people grieved for Benjamin, because the LORD had made a void in the tribes of Israel.
translation: Ol pipol i sakim long Benjamin, bikos LORD em i mekim hevi i kamap long ol clan bilong Isrel.

original: Then the elders of the congregation said, “What should we do about wives for those who remain, since the women of Benjamin have been destroyed?”
translation: Ol bikpela i tok long ol mama belong asambli, "Yumi mas mekim wanem long meri bilong ol man i stap, long ol Benjamen, bikos ol meri bilong ol Benjamen i bin dai pinis?"

original: They added, “There must be heirs for the survivors of Benjamin, so that a tribe of Israel will not be wiped out.
translation: Ol i kamapim, “I gat ken ol desenden long ol ivanu long Benjimin, bilong mekim ples na ol grup long Isrel i no ken lus pinis.

original: But we cannot give them our daughters as wives.” For the Israelites had sworn, “Cursed is he who gives a wife to a Benjamite.”
translation: Bipo, mipela i no inawe givim daughta bilong mipela ol meri long ol man bilong Benjamin. Pipol Israel i bin tok long ples bilong promis, ol i bin tok: "Man i go long hevi, em i givim meri bilong en long Man bilong Benjamin."

original: “But look,” they said, “there is a yearly feast to the LORD in Shiloh, which is north of Bethel east of the road that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and south of Lebonah.”
translation: Ol i tok, “Kisim luk, kaikai bikos bilong GOD ol i mekim long yia i kam long ples Shiloh, we bilong not bilong Betel, long sais bilong rot we i go antap long Sikem, na long saut bilong Lebonah.”

original: So they commanded the Benjamites: “Go, hide in the vineyards
translation: Ol i givim tok bilong Benjamini: "Yu go, klostu i go kaip bilong harim long paia"

original: and watch. When you see the daughters of Shiloh come out to perform their dances, each of you is to come out of the vineyards, catch for himself a wife from the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.
translation: Kisim i go na lukim, wanem taim yu si daughters bilong Shiloh i kam aut na kamaut long danis ol i wokim, yumi yet ol i kam aut long gaden vaine, kisim meri bilong en long han, na i go long grun bilong Benjamin.

original: When their fathers or brothers come to us to complain, we will tell them, ‘Do us a favor by helping them, since we did not get wives for each of them in the war. Since you did not actually give them your daughters, you have no guilt.’”
translation: Wanpela taim papa na brata bilong ol i kam kisim bek long mipela, mipela bai tokim ol, 'Mipela i askim yu long helpim ol long wanpela samting, bikos mipela no bin kisim meri long ol long taim bilong faet. Yu yet, bikos yu no givim ol pikinini bilong yu long ol, yu no bin mekim rong.'

original: The Benjamites did as instructed and carried away the number of women they needed from the dancers they caught. They went back to their own inheritance, rebuilt their cities, and settled in them.
translation: Benjamait i mekim olsem ol i bin instruktim na kisim na karim namba meri ol i lak long dansar ol i kisim. Ol i go bek long inhitim bilong ol yet, wokim gen town bilong ol, na stap i stap long em.

original: And at that time, each of the Israelites returned from there to his own tribe and clan, each to his own inheritance.
translation: Na long taim i kam, Pipol Israel yet i go bek gen long ples bilong en, long tribe na clan bilong en yet, i go bek long inheretans bilong en yet.

original: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
translation: Long dispela taim, i no bin gat king long Israel; ol man i mekim olsem ol tink ol i gut long ai bilong ol.

original: In the days when the judges ruled, there was a famine in the land. And a certain man from Bethlehem in Judah, with his wife and two sons, went to reside in the land of Moab.
translation: Long taim bilong jijes i kam bekim bos, klostu siki i kamap long kantri. Na wanpela man husat i kom from Betlehem long Judah, wantaim meri na tu pikinini bilong em, i go wokabaut long kantri bilong Moab.

original: The man’s name was Elimelech, his wife’s name was Naomi, and the names of his two sons were Mahlon and Chilion. They were Ephrathites from Bethlehem in Judah, and they entered the land of Moab and settled there.
translation: Man i go het bilong em Elimelech, meri bilong em i go het Naomi, na het bilong tupela pikinini bilong em Mahlon na Chilion. Ol i Ephrathites from Bethlehem long Judah, na ol i go insait long kantri bilong Moab na ol i stap we.

original: Then Naomi’s husband Elimelech died, and she was left with her two sons,
translation: Naomi husban bilong em Elimelech i dai, na em i lusim naik wan long ol pikinini bilong em tu.

original: who took Moabite women as their wives, one named Orpah and the other named Ruth. And after they had lived in Moab about ten years,
translation: Ol i kisim meri Moab long ol, wan nem Orpah na naran nem Rut. Na bihain long ten yia ol i stap long Moab,

original: both Mahlon and Chilion also died, and Naomi was left without her two sons and without her husband.
translation: Na Mahlon na Chilion i dai tu, na Naomi i stap wanpela, em i losim two pikinini man bilong en, na em i no gat husban bilong en.

original: When Naomi heard in Moab that the LORD had attended to His people by providing them with food, she and her daughters-in-law prepared to leave the land of Moab.
translation: Taim Naomi harim long Moab olsem LORD i kamap long ol pipol bilong en, na em inap givim kaikai long ol, na em na ol meri bilong ol man bilong em i redi long lusim grun bilong Moab.

original: Accompanied by her two daughters-in-law, she left the place where she had been living and set out on the road leading back to the land of Judah.
translation: I gat klostu long tupela nambis meri bilong ol man bilong en, na em i go pinis long ples we em i stap bikos, em i kamap long rot bilong go bek long kantri bilong Yuda.

original: Then Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, “Go back, each of you to your mother’s home. May the LORD show you loving devotion, as you have shown to your dead and to me.
translation: Naomi i tokim meri bilong ol man bilong em, “Yu go bek long haus bilong mama bilong yu. Mai Olgeta Papa i stap long yu na i givim yu kisim gutpela lav, olsem yu hamarim ol dai na hamarim mi.”

original: May the LORD enable each of you to find rest in the home of your new husband.” And she kissed them as they wept aloud
translation: Mipela i gat bel isi long LORD, bai yu ol i pundaun kot longhaus bilong poro man. Na mari i kisim ol long taem ol i raun strong.

original: and said, “Surely we will return with you to your people.”
translation: Na tokim, “Mipela bai kam bek gen long stap wantaim yu, na mipela bai go long ol pipol bilong yu.”

original: But Naomi replied, “Return home, my daughters. Why would you go with me? Are there still sons in my womb to become your husbands?
translation: Naomi i tok bek, "Go bak long haus, pikinini meri bilong mi. Wanem yu kam wantaim mi? Mi yet mas i gat pikinini man i stap insait long bel bilong mi olsem husban bilong yu?"

original: Return home, my daughters. Go on, for I am too old to have another husband. Even if I thought there was hope for me to have a husband tonight and to bear sons,
translation: Go bek long ples, pikinini meri bilong me. Mi olsem i bikim olgeta, inap mi no inap gat husban gen. Nupela hope i kamap long me, na bai mi karim man, tasol mi tingim husban i no inap kamap gen long me.

original: would you wait for them to grow up? Would you refrain from having husbands? No, my daughters, it grieves me very much for your sakes that the hand of the LORD has gone out against me.”
translation: Yu bai weti ol i gro up? Yu nogat laik marit husban? Nogat, mipela daughters, em i sori tru long mipela olgeta long bikpela han bilong GOD i go bek gen long mi.

original: Again they wept aloud, and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law goodbye, but Ruth clung to her.
translation: Ol i krai gen, na Orpah i piksa mami bilong papa bilong em goodbye, tasol Ruth i holim tasol mami bilong papa bilong em.

original: “Look,” said Naomi, “your sister-in-law has gone back to her people and her gods; follow her back home.”
translation: “Lukim,” tok Naomi, “susa bilong husban bilong yu i go bek gen long ol pipol bilong em na spirit bilong bai em i servim; bihainim em i go bek long haus bilong em.”

original: But Ruth replied: “Do not urge me to leave you or to turn from following you. For wherever you go, I will go, and wherever you live, I will live; your people will be my people, and your God will be my God.
translation: Rut i tokim ol: "Yu no ken kisim me long lusim yu, na yu no ken turnaround long lusim folo behind yu. We bilong go wanpela hap, na mi go bek long hap; pipol bilong yu, em i pipol bilong mi, na Bikpela bilong yu, em i bikpela bilong mi."

original: Where you die, I will die, and there I will be buried. May the LORD punish me, and ever so severely, if anything but death separates you and me.”
translation: Wanpela hap yu dai, mi tu bai dai, na mipela bai kisim bodi go long ples burial. Lod i givim mi pain, strong long wei, if sampela samting waida dai i kam wuida yu na mi.

original: When Naomi saw that Ruth was determined to go with her, she stopped trying to persuade her.
translation: Naomi i lukim olsem Ruth i strong long go wantaim em, na em i stap tasol long tokim, em i no tokim gen.

original: So Naomi and Ruth traveled until they came to Bethlehem. When they entered Bethlehem, the whole city was stirred because of them, and the women of the city exclaimed, “Can this be Naomi?”
translation: Naomi na Ruth i go wakabaut, ol i kam long Betlehem. Taun i stilim olgeta long ol, meri bilong taun i tok aut, "Em ino Naomi ia?"

original: “Do not call me Naomi,” she replied. “Call me Mara, because the Almighty has dealt quite bitterly with me.
translation: Yu no kolim mi Naomi, kolim mi Mara, wantaim Pawa Gret i wokim olgeta samting i kamap strong long mi.

original: I went away full, but the LORD has brought me back empty. Why call me Naomi? After all, the LORD has testified against me, and the Almighty has afflicted me.”
translation: Mi go na kamap ful, tasol LORD i bringim mi bak na nogat samting. Bai yumi usim nem Naomi long me? LORD i tok bes long me, na Almighty i givim mi sik.

original: So Naomi returned from the land of Moab with her daughter-in-law Ruth the Moabitess. And they arrived in Bethlehem at the beginning of the barley harvest.
translation: Naomi i kam bek long kantri Moab wantaim doti bilong man Ruth Meri bilong Moab, na ol i kamap long Betlehem long taim bilong harvest bilong barley.

original: Now Naomi had a relative on her husband’s side, a prominent man of noble character from the clan of Elimelech, whose name was Boaz.
translation: Naomi i gat wanem famili long sait bilong husban bilong em, man strongpela, i gat gutpela spirit, long lain bilong Elimelech, na nem bilong em Boaz.

original: And Ruth the Moabitess said to Naomi, “Please let me go into the fields and glean heads of grain after someone in whose sight I may find favor.” “Go ahead, my daughter,” Naomi replied.
translation: Na Ruth meri bilong Moab i tokim Naomi, "Mi go long busna, na mi pilim hevi bilong graun bihainim man husat Bai mi finis gat gutpela tingting long ai bilong em." "Yu go daon, pikinini," Naomi i bekim tok.

original: So Ruth departed and went out into the field and gleaned after the harvesters. And she happened to come to the part of the field belonging to Boaz, who was from the clan of Elimelech.
translation: Na Rut i go na i kam aut, i go long bus, na em i kisim ol ka i stap behain long ol wokman husat i save harim bus. Na em i kam kasual long hap bilong bus bilong Boaz, husat em i man bilong brata bilong Elimelak.

original: Just then Boaz arrived from Bethlehem and said to the harvesters, “The LORD be with you.” “The LORD bless you,” they replied.
translation: Olsem taim Boaz i kam from Betlehem, na em i tokim harim na ol man i wokim ka, "Papa God i stap wantaim yu." Na ol i mekim tok baksait, "Papa God i givim yu blessin."

original: And Boaz asked the foreman of his harvesters, “Whose young woman is this?”
translation: Na Boaz i akisim bos bilong wok harim ka, "Meri yangpela husat i belong long em?"

original: The foreman answered, “She is the Moabitess who returned with Naomi from the land of Moab.
translation: Bos i skelim tok, “Em i Meri bilong Moab i kam bek wantaim Naomi long kantri bilong Moab.”

original: She has said, ‘Please let me glean and gather among the sheaves after the harvesters.’ So she came out and has continued from morning until now, except that she rested a short time in the shelter.”
translation: Em i tok, ‘Plis, mipela pilim na kisim buk bihaen long ol harvesa.’ Na em i kam aut, na i go on from moning tasol, bekas em i isap long haf paits long haus sik.

original: Then Boaz said to Ruth, “Listen, my daughter. Do not go and glean in another field, and do not go away from this place, but stay here close to my servant girls.
translation: Boaz i tokim Ruth, "Harim, pikinini meri bilong yu. Yu no go na kisim bikos long narapela hap, na yu no go wai long hap i go, stap hiri klostu long gelservant bilong mi."

original: Let your eyes be on the field they are harvesting, and follow along after these girls. Indeed, I have ordered the young men not to touch you. And when you are thirsty, go and drink from the jars the young men have filled.”
translation: Kam na lukim graun ol i katim kaukau long en, bihain i go bek gen long dispela meri. Mi bin tokim ol yangpela man olsem, ol no ken rausim han long yu. Na taim yu thiirsty, kam na dring water long ol kina ol yangpela man i filimapim.

original: At this, she fell on her face, bowing low to the ground, and said to him, “Why have I found such favor in your eyes that you should take notice of me, even though I am a foreigner?”
translation: Na em i pilai daun long graun, em i bikim respek tru, ikisim hed bilong en, katim daun long graun, na em i tokim em, “Wai yu givim dispela favret long ai bilong yu, na yu lukim me, olsem man i kam long ples anather?”

original: Boaz replied, “I have been made fully aware of all you have done for your mother-in-law since the death of your husband, how you left your father and mother and the land of your birth, and how you came to a people you did not know before.
translation: Boaz i tok bek, "Mi save long olgeta samting yu mekim bilong mama bilong husban yu, bia time husban yu i dai pinis, olsem yu lusim papa na mama na graun bilong birto yu, na yu kam bek long ol pipel yu no save long bifo.

original: May the LORD repay your work, and may you receive a rich reward from the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have taken refuge.”
translation: Mipela Lord bai givim bek pe yu mekim, na yu bai kisim riki reward long han bilong Mipela Lord, God bilong Israel, under whose wings yu go klostu ansait long wing bilong en.

original: “My lord,” she said, “may I continue to find favor in your eyes, for you have comforted and spoken kindly to your maidservant, though I am not like one of your servant girls.”
translation: “Papa bilong yu,” em i tok, “mi hop long gat moa bikpela hamamas long ai bilong yu, long yu habarim mi, tok swei long meri servan bilong yu, maski mi no olsem hap servan bilong yu.”

original: At mealtime Boaz said to her, “Come over here; have some bread and dip it into the vinegar sauce.” So she sat down beside the harvesters, and he offered her roasted grain, and she ate and was satisfied and had some left over.
translation: Taim bilong kaikai Boaz i tokim em, “Kam daun hia; kaikai rot na putim long sos viniga.” Na em i sindaun besain ol harim rin, na em i givim em kaikai taro i bin kukim, na em i kaikai tasol na i amamas mo i stap olsem.

original: When Ruth got up to glean, Boaz ordered his young men, “Even if she gathers among the sheaves, do not insult her.
translation: Taim Ruth em i go bekim ka long ples bilong en, Boaz em i tokim ol yangpela man bilong en, "Even long taim em i bekim ka klostu long sheav, yu no ken krosim em."

original: Rather, pull out for her some stalks from the bundles and leave them for her to gather. Do not rebuke her.”
translation: Kisim na putim besaid long em ol hap bilong graas husat i stap long bilum bilong graas, na lusim ol i go, na em yet bungim. No ken skulim em.

original: So Ruth gathered grain in the field until evening. And when she beat out what she had gleaned, it was about an ephah of barley.
translation: Na Ruth i go bekim ka long san, na i winim ol ka, tasol long apinun. Na em i kilim aot ol ka em i winim, na em i kamap olsem efaa barli.

original: She picked up the grain and went into the town, where her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned. And she brought out what she had saved from her meal and gave it to Naomi.
translation: Em i kisim ka moninga na em i go insait long taun, na mama bilong husband ikam lukim ol samting em i kisim behain long graun. Na em i bringim otside ol samting em i save long kaikai na givim i long Naomi.

original: Then her mother-in-law asked her, “Where did you glean today, and where did you work? Blessed be the man who noticed you.” So she told her mother-in-law where she had worked. “The name of the man I worked with today is Boaz,” she said.
translation: Na mama bilong husband bilong em i askim her, “Yu painim ka bilong yu pikinap long graun we, na yu wok long we? Blessed i stap long man i lukim yu.” Na em i tokim mama bilong husband bilong em long ples em i go wok. “Nem bilong man em i Boaz,” em i tok.

original: Then Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, “May he be blessed by the LORD, who has not withdrawn His kindness from the living or the dead.” Naomi continued, “The man is a close relative. He is one of our kinsman-redeemers.”
translation: Naomi i tokim meri bilong man husban bilong em, "Em bai God i givim bikpela blessim long en, em i no lusim gutpela karema long ol samting i ail o i dai." Naomi i go on, "Man i kalabus bilong famili, em i wanpela brata bilong papa na mama, em i ken givim bek ol samting bilong mipela."

original: Then Ruth the Moabitess said, “He also told me, ‘Stay with my young men until they have finished gathering all my harvest.’”
translation: Na Ruth meri bilong Moab i tok olsem, "Na em i tokim mi, 'Bai yu stap wantaim ol yung man bilong em, kamwei ol i pinis kisim olegeda ka bilong garden bilong em.'"

original: And Naomi said to her daughter-in-law Ruth, “My daughter, it is good for you to work with his young women, so that nothing will happen to you in another field.”
translation: Naomi i tokim meri bilong man bilong em, Ruth, "Namba wan pikinini, em i gutpela yu wok wantaim ol meri pikinini bilong en, nasampela kain birua no inap kam long yu long narapela ples."

original: So Ruth stayed close to the servant girls of Boaz to glean grain until the barley and wheat harvests were finished. And she lived with her mother-in-law.
translation: Ruta i stap klos long gelservis bilong Boazi long pikinim grin na taim ya barli na witi i kamap pinis, na i stap wantaim mami bilong husat.

original: One day Ruth’s mother-in-law Naomi said to her, “My daughter, should I not seek a resting place for you, that it may be well with you?
translation: Wanpela de, mama bilong husban Naomi i tokim Ruth, "Mama, inap mi go sikim ples bilong kat klostu bilong yu, na bai ol samting bai kamap gut long yu?"

original: Now is not Boaz, with whose servant girls you have been working, a relative of ours? In fact, tonight he is winnowing barley on the threshing floor.
translation: Nau i no Boaz, husat i givim wok long gelservis, em i wantok bilong mipela? Em i nait, em i winim barli long ples bilong kilim graun.

original: Therefore wash yourself, put on perfume, and wear your best clothes. Go down to the threshing floor, but do not let the man know you are there until he has finished eating and drinking.
translation: Wosim yu yet, putim parfuem long yu, kisim klotes nogut tru na wapim long yu. Go daun long ples bilong kilim graas, tasol no ken givim man i save yu stap til em i kaikai na dring pinis.

original: When he lies down, note the place where he lies. Then go in and uncover his feet, and lie down, and he will explain to you what you should do.”
translation: Wanpela em i go daun, kisim ples we em i laip. Bihaen yu go insait na stilim ka bilong en, na yu go daun, na em bai tok klia long yu long ol samting yu mas mekim.

original: “I will do everything you say,” Ruth answered.
translation: “Mi bai mekim olgeta samting yu tok,” Rut i ansa.

original: So she went down to the threshing floor and did everything her mother-in-law had instructed her to do.
translation: Na em i go daun long ples bilong kilim graas na wokim olgeta samting em mama bilong husband i tokim em.

original: After Boaz had finished eating and drinking and was in good spirits, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain. Then Ruth went in secretly, uncovered his feet, and lay down.
translation: Na Boaz i kai na dring pinis, em i stap strong bilong spirit, em i go lain long hap bilong hol bilong ka. Na Ruth i go insait i go klostu, kilim kot bilong liklik han bilong Boaz, na em i slip.

original: At midnight, Boaz was startled, turned over, and there lying at his feet was a woman!
translation: Long midnait, Boaz i kirap na i surprised, em i turnim bek, na womankain i stap klostu long lek bilong en.

original: “Who are you?” he asked. “I am your servant Ruth,” she replied. “Spread the corner of your garment over me, for you are a kinsman-redeemer.”
translation: “Yu hu nem?” em i askim. “Mi servan bilong yu, Rut,” em i tok. “Kamap na kisim korner bilong karimapim yu, pilai i go antap long mi, olsem yu em i brata bilong papa, o brata bilong mama, we i mas helim famili.”

original: Then Boaz said, “May the LORD bless you, my daughter. You have shown more kindness now than before, because you have not run after the younger men, whether rich or poor.
translation: Na Boaz i tok, "Mipela Lord i givim yu bles, pikinini meri. Yu showim moa kain kindi nau wei yu no ran i go bek long man meri yong, olsem rich o poor."

original: And now do not be afraid, my daughter. I will do for you whatever you request, since all my fellow townspeople know that you are a woman of noble character.
translation: Na nau no ken skul bilong yu, meri. Mi bai mekim olgeta samting yu kirapim, long ol brata bilong ples ol i save olsem nau: yu meri i gat karakta i gat gutpela pasin.

original: Yes, it is true that I am a kinsman-redeemer, but there is a redeemer nearer than I.
translation: Em i treu, mi wanpela man bilong famili na bai mi baim bek propati, tasol i gat wanpela man bilong famili i kam bek gen long hap bilong yu, em i arapela kinsman-redeemer, na em i nidim olsem nau.

original: Stay here tonight, and in the morning, if he wants to redeem you, good. Let him redeem you. But if he does not want to redeem you, as surely as the LORD lives, I will. Now lie here until morning.”
translation: Stap hia tonight, na moning, if hem i laik baim yu bek, orait. Im bai baim yu bek. Baine hem no laik baim yu bek, olsem LORD i stap, mi bai baim yu bek. Lay ikam long moning.

original: So she lay down at his feet until morning, but she got up before anyone else could recognize her. Then Boaz said, “Do not let it be known that a woman came to the threshing floor.”
translation: Na em i lakai klostu long lek bilong en kwila moning, tasol em i kamap bifo ol narapela i ken rekognaisim em yet. Boaz i tok, "No ken givim nius long ol manmeri, olsem meri i go daun long ples bilong krungim paia."

original: And he told her, “Bring the shawl you are wearing and hold it out.” When she did so, he shoveled six measures of barley into her shawl. Then he went into the city.
translation: Na em i tokim em, "Kisim laplap bilong yu na stretim em aut." Na em i mekim olsem, na em i kilim barley sipis six insait long laplap bilong em. Na em i go insait long taun.

original: When Ruth returned to her mother-in-law, Naomi asked her, “How did it go, my daughter?” Then Ruth told her all that Boaz had done for her.
translation: Ruth i kam bek gen long mama bilong husband, Naomi, na Naomi i askim em, "Olsem wanem nao, pikinini meri?" Na Ruth i tokim em olgeta samting Boaz i mekim long em.

original: And she said, “He gave me these six measures of barley, for he said, ‘Do not go back to your mother-in-law empty-handed.’”
translation: Em i tok, “Em i givim mi dispela sikis kaikai bilong bareli, olsem em i tok, ‘Yu no go bek wentaim nogat samting long han, yu go bek long mama bilong man.’”

original: “Wait, my daughter,” said Naomi, “until you find out how things go, for he will not rest unless he has resolved the matter today.”
translation: Wet tumas, pikinini bilong mi, na bai yu laik save long olsem wanem bai kamap, em i no ken slip olsem tasol, na em i mas kisim desisen long dispela de.

original: Meanwhile, Boaz went to the gate and sat down there. Soon the kinsman-redeemer of whom he had spoken came along, and Boaz said, “Come over here, my friend, and sit down.” So he went over and sat down.
translation: Wail nau, Boaz i go long gate na sindaun gen. Nogat long taem, brata bilong ples bilong en, man husat i mas bekim olsem mama bilong en, i kam bek long rot. Boaz i tokim em, "Kam daun hare, brata, na sindaun." Na em i go daun na sindaun gen.

original: Then Boaz took ten of the elders of the city and said, “Sit here,” and they did so.
translation: Na Boaz i kisim ten bilong ol bikman bilong taun, na ol i tok, 'Sinduan long hia', na ol i mekim olsem.

original: And he said to the kinsman-redeemer, “Naomi, who has returned from the land of Moab, is selling the piece of land that belonged to our brother Elimelech.
translation: Em i tokim long man bilong ples na famili, “Naomi, em meri we i kam bek gen from Moab, i salim smolpela graun we ibin bilong brata Elimelech.”

original: I thought I should inform you that you may buy it back in the presence of those seated here and in the presence of the elders of my people. If you want to redeem it, do so. But if you will not redeem it, tell me so I may know, because there is no one but you to redeem it, and I am next after you.” “I will redeem it,” he replied.
translation: Mi thinkim olsem mi mas tokim yu, baiyu baiyum bek long wei ol i sit daun here na long wei ol big man bilong ples bilong mi. Yu laik baiyum bek, yu ken du. Bai yu no laik baiyum bek, yu tokim mi nas mi save, bikos igat no wan man moa i kam redeemim, na mi i kam bihain long yu.” “Mi bai baiyum bek,” em i tok.

original: Then Boaz said, “On the day you buy the land from Naomi and also from Ruth the Moabitess, you must also acquire the widow of the deceased in order to raise up the name of the deceased on his inheritance.”
translation: Boaz i tok, "Long de yaú yu baim graun na yu kisim em from Naomi na Ruth Meri bilong Moab, yu mas kisim widow bilong dai pinis olsem yu marit long famili bilong dia hap, na kamapim nem bilong em long inaheritans bilong en."

original: The kinsman-redeemer replied, “I cannot redeem it myself, or I would jeopardize my own inheritance. Take my right of redemption, because I cannot redeem it.”
translation: Bilong ples brigada i tok, "Mi no inap baim bek gen ipsum, or Mi bai bagarapim inheritance bilong mi yet. Kisim raite bilong baim bek gen, bikos mi no inap baim bek gen ipsum."

original: Now in former times in Israel, concerning the redemption or exchange of property, to make any matter legally binding a man would remove his sandal and give it to the other party, and this was a confirmation in Israel.
translation: Long taim bifo long Isrel, toking long propati em i go bek long en o tucker em i go long narapela, ol i usim wanpela kastom: man i kisim susa bilong en na givim long narapela man, na dispela em i kamap konfirmeson long Isrel, olsem wanem samting i kamap strong long lo.

original: So the kinsman-redeemer removed his sandal and said to Boaz, “Buy it for yourself.”
translation: Na brata bilong papa na mama i kirapim sosol blong em, ol i tokim Boaz, “Baim olgeta long han bilong yu.”

original: At this, Boaz said to the elders and all the people, “You are witnesses today that I am buying from Naomi all that belonged to Elimelech, Chilion, and Mahlon.
translation: Long taim dispela, Boazi i tokim ol bikpela man na ol pipol, "Yupela i stap witnis long tede, mi baim dispela propati bilong Naomi, olgeta samting bilong Elimileki, Kilion, na Mahlon."

original: Moreover, I have acquired Ruth the Moabitess, Mahlon’s widow, as my wife, to raise up the name of the deceased through his inheritance, so that his name will not disappear from among his brothers or from the gate of his home. You are witnesses today.”
translation: Mi kisim Ruut Meri bilong Moab, widow meri bilong Mahlon, olsem meri bilong mi, olsem yumi mas karim na lukautim nem bilong dei pinis man i go long ka bilong papa, olsem nem bilong em i no ken los long bromna bilong em, na long gate bilong hus bilong em. Yupela i stap witnes long tede.

original: “We are witnesses,” said the elders and all the people at the gate. “May the LORD make the woman entering your home like Rachel and Leah, who together built up the house of Israel. May you be prosperous in Ephrathah and famous in Bethlehem.
translation: Mipela i witnes, ol bikman na ol pipol long gate i tok olsem. O LORD ina mekim meri i go insait long hus bilong yu olsem Raechel na Lea, ol i bikim haus bilong Israel i go up. Yu ken i kamap strong long Ephrata, na yu ken i famus long Betlehem.

original: And may your house become like the house of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, because of the offspring the LORD will give you by this young woman.”
translation: Na husat bilong yu em i mas kamap olsem haus bilong Perez, we Tamar i karim na borne long Judah, bikos long ol descendent GOD i givim yu long dispela yangpela meri.

original: So Boaz took Ruth, and she became his wife. And when he had relations with her, the LORD enabled her to conceive, and she gave birth to a son.
translation: Na Boaz i kamap husban bilong Ruth, na Ruth i stap long hap bilong Boaz na i kamap meri bilong em. Na ol i gat wok bilong manna wantaim, na Bikpela i givim strength long bel bilong Ruth, na em i karim bebi. Na Ruth i karim bebi man, na em i kamap pikinini.

original: Then the women said to Naomi, “Blessed be the LORD, who has not left you this day without a kinsman-redeemer. May his name become famous in Israel.
translation: Na meri ol i tokim Naomi, “Praizim Bikpela, hu igo nau i no lusim yu na tede bai yu i no gat nesman bilong yu. Mipela hop i go nem bilong em i bikim famos long Israel.”

original: He will renew your life and sustain you in your old age. For your daughter-in-law, who loves you and is better to you than seven sons, has given him birth.”
translation: Em bai renuim lif blong yu, na bai givim yu strong long taim yu olgeda. Bikos wif blong pikinini blong yu, we em i lakim yu-strong na i go long yu, i narapela long sevén pikinini man, em i givim birthim.

original: And Naomi took the child, placed him on her lap, and became a nurse to him.
translation: Naomi tainim pikinini, putim em long kapul bilong en, na bam bekim nesis i go long en.

original: The neighbor women said, “A son has been born to Naomi,” and they named him Obed. He became the father of Jesse, the father of David.
translation: Meri bilong nexdor i tok, "Wanpela man i kamap long Naomi," ol i givim em nem Obed. Em bicom papa bilong Jesse, papa bilong David.

original: Now these are the generations of Perez: Perez was the father of Hezron,
translation: Dispela i stap long genarashon bilong Perez: Perez em i papa bilong Hezron,

original: Hezron was the father of Ram, Ram was the father of Amminadab,
translation: Hezron em papa bilong Ram, Ram em papa bilong Amminadab

original: Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, Nahshon was the father of Salmon,
translation: Amminadab i papa bilong Nahshon, Nahshon i papa bilong Salmon,

original: Salmon was the father of Boaz, Boaz was the father of Obed,
translation: Salmon em papa bilong Boaz, na Boaz em papa bilong Obed,

original: Obed was the father of Jesse, and Jesse was the father of David.
translation: Obed em papa bilong Jesse, na Jesse em papa bilong David.

original: Now there was a man named Elkanah who was from Ramathaim-zophim in the hill country of Ephraim. He was the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
translation: Na i stap wanpela man, nam bilong em Elkana, em i kam long Ramataim-zofim long kantri bilong Efrem. Em i pikinini bilong Jeroham,Jeroham em i pikinini bilong Elihu, Elihu em i pikinini bilong Tohu, Tohu em i pikinini bilong Zuph, Zuph em i man bilong Efrem.

original: He had two wives, one named Hannah and the other Peninnah. And Peninnah had children, but Hannah had none.
translation: Em i gat tu meri, wan em i kolim Hannah na nnarapela em i kolim Peninnah. Na Peninnah i gat pikinini, tasol Hannah i no gat.

original: Year after year Elkanah would go up from his city to worship and sacrifice to the LORD of Hosts at Shiloh, where Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were priests to the LORD.
translation: Yia bihain long yia Elkana i go apo long siti bilong en long Silo wosipim na ofa long LORD bilong ol ples, na Eli ibin givim tu pikinini bilong em, Hofni na Finehas, ol i bin pris long LORD.

original: And whenever the day came for Elkanah to present his sacrifice, he would give portions to his wife Peninnah and to all her sons and daughters.
translation: Waneva de bai kamap long de, Elkanah i go long givim sakrifis bilong en, em bai givim kaikai long wife bilong en Peninnah na long ol pikinini manmeri na pikinini womanmeri bilong em.

original: But to Hannah he would give a double portion, for he loved her even though the LORD had closed her womb.
translation: Bareket, tisa em bai givim dupela hap long Hannah, olsem em i laikim em, bekas LORD i bin klinim bel bilong en, na em i no inap karim pikinini.

original: Because the LORD had closed Hannah’s womb, her rival would provoke her and taunt her viciously.
translation: Bikos Papa God i kirapim bel bilong Ana, meri i tambuim em, na i harim tok pikinini long em, meri i givim em tok strong bilong kilim em.

original: And this went on year after year. Whenever Hannah went up to the house of the LORD, her rival taunted her until she wept and would not eat.
translation: Na dispela i go pinis yar bihain yar. Nasal Hana i go ap long haus bilong Jehovah, waitman bilong em i kilim tok harim till em i krai na em i no ken kaikai.

original: “Hannah, why are you crying?” her husband Elkanah asked. “Why won’t you eat? Why is your heart so grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?”
translation: Hana, wai yu kaikai? Man bilong yu, Elkanah, askim. Wai yu no kaikai? Wai bel bilong yu i stap sori tumas? Mi oraitim olsem tenpela Pikinini bilong yu, nogat?

original: So after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh, Hannah stood up. Now Eli the priest was sitting on a chair by the doorpost of the temple of the LORD.
translation: Ol i kamil pinis kaikai na dring long Silo, Hana em i sanap. Eli priast i sindaun long cha bilong en klostu long pos bilong dor bilong haus lotu bilong LORD.

original: In her bitter distress, Hannah prayed to the LORD and wept with many tears.
translation: Long taim Hana i bin kasam, em i go praefu long Jehovah, na em i kisim tes bilong em, na em i rai i go.

original: And she made a vow, pleading, “O LORD of Hosts, if only You will look upon the affliction of Your maidservant and remember me, not forgetting Your maidservant but giving her a son, then I will dedicate him to the LORD all the days of his life, and no razor shall ever come over his head.”
translation: Na em mekim tok bilong promis, kisim bek long Lod Bilong Ol Ples, “O Lod Bilong Ol Ples, sapos yu laik kisim pait long sufaring bilong meri i wok servos, na yumi rememberim mi, nogat lusim mi, na givim meri i wok servos wanpela pikinini, den bai me dediketim em long han bilong Lod ol dei bilong life bilong em, na nogat katting ais bilong em bai kam long hevi.”

original: As Hannah kept on praying before the LORD, Eli watched her mouth.
translation: Hana i go on na prai yet long hap bilong LORD, Eli i lukim maus bilong em.

original: Hannah was praying in her heart, and though her lips were moving, her voice could not be heard. So Eli thought she was drunk
translation: Hana em i praipim insait long het bilong en, na lus bilong en i kilim i go, voisi bilong en i no inap harim. Olsem nau Eli tingim em i dring strong.

original: and said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Put away your wine!”
translation: Ol i tokim em, “Oli long we yu bai stap momo? Kisim wine bilong yu, alkol, na putim i go!”

original: “No, my lord,” Hannah replied. “I am a woman oppressed in spirit. I have not had any wine or strong drink, but I have poured out my soul before the LORD.
translation: Nogat, Papa bilong yu, Hannah itok. Mi meri spirit bilong mi i kam daun, spirits bilong mi i no gut, mi no kai wain na kaikai dreg i strong, tasol mi putim ol samting insait long soul bilong mi long LORD.

original: Do not take your servant for a wicked woman; for all this time I have been praying out of the depth of my anguish and grief.”
translation: No ken tu takeim man i servis bilong yu olsem meri i nogut; from taim bung mi bin prai nau longwei insait long hevi bilong mi na sore.

original: “Go in peace,” Eli replied, “and may the God of Israel grant the petition you have asked of Him.”
translation: “Go long wei peis,” Eli i tok, “na mipela hop God bilong Israel i givim petition yu askim long em.”

original: “May your maidservant find favor with you,” said Hannah. Then she went on her way, and she began eating again, and her face was no longer downcast.
translation: Mipela meri bilong yu, Yu helpim mipela, tok Hannah. Na em i go we long rod bilong em, na em i kaikai gen, na face bilong em i no stap daun olsem bifo, em i kamap strong gen.

original: The next morning Elkanah and Hannah got up early to bow in worship before the LORD, and then returned home to Ramah. And Elkanah had relations with his wife Hannah, and the LORD remembered her.
translation: Bipoa long moning, Elkanah na Hannah i go-ap long taim bipo na katikati long lotu bilong moning bifora LORD, na bihain i kam bek long haus bilong em long Ramah. Na Elkanah i gat wes long meri bilong em Hannah, na LORD i memorim em.

original: So in the course of time, Hannah conceived and gave birth to a son. She named him Samuel, saying, “Because I have asked for him from the LORD.”
translation: Long taem i go, Hana i kamapim baby na i karim. Ol i givim nem bilong em Samuel, olsem Hana i tok, "Bikos mi bin askim em long han bilong LORD."

original: Then Elkanah and all his house went up to make the annual sacrifice to the LORD and to fulfill his vow,
translation: Na Elkanah wantaim ol famili bilong en i go ap long ples bilong sacrifis ya, em i kamap taim bilong yia, na em i mekim promis bilong en long Bikpela.

original: but Hannah did not go. “After the boy is weaned,” she said to her husband, “I will take him to appear before the LORD and to stay there permanently.”
translation: Hana i no go. “Bihaen long pikinini i kamap bikpela na i tanim susu,” ol i tokim husban bilong en, “Bai mi kisim em i go bek long lukim Pesena LORD, na em bai stap we long ples.”

original: “Do what you think is best,” her husband Elkanah replied, “and stay here until you have weaned him. Only may the LORD confirm His word.” So Hannah stayed and nursed her son until she had weaned him.
translation: “Wokim olsem yu ting ol i gutpela,” poro man Elkanah i tokim em, “na yu stap hia yet long yu painim em i kamap bikpela. Mipela i hop LORD bai confirmim tok bilong En.” Na Hana i stap na i susim pikinini bilong en, long taem em i liti yet, olsem na em i painim em i kamap bikpela.

original: Once she had weaned him, Hannah took the boy with her, along with a three-year-old bull, an ephah of flour, and a skin of wine. Though the boy was still young, she brought him to the house of the LORD at Shiloh.
translation: Bihaen long em i pinis nau long susu bilong mama, Hana i karim boy bilong en, bek bilong flour we i gat hap tripela lit, na skinpela wine, na em i bringim i go long haus bilong LORD long ples Shiloh, tasol boy yet i liklik, na Hana i bringim i go wail.

original: And when they had slaughtered the bull, they brought the boy to Eli.
translation: Na ol kilim bulmakau, oli kam bekim pikinini i go long Eli.

original: “Please, my lord,” said Hannah, “as surely as you live, my lord, I am the woman who stood here beside you praying to the LORD.
translation: Pipia, papa bilong mi, olsem yu stap yet, olsem true, mi mere husat i stap hirap long sait bilong yu na mi pray long LORD.

original: I prayed for this boy, and since the LORD has granted me what I asked of Him,
translation: Mi bin pray long dispela boi, na Bikpela im givim mi olsem na mi bin askim.

original: I now dedicate the boy to the LORD. For as long as he lives, he is dedicated to the LORD.” So they worshiped the LORD there.
translation: Nau mi wan dedikiim bai boy, long ol taim we em i stap, em i stap long han bilong LORD. Na ol i wosipim LORD hap long ples.

original: At that time Hannah prayed: “My heart rejoices in the LORD in whom my horn is exalted. My mouth speaks boldly against my enemies, for I rejoice in Your salvation.
translation: Long taim ya Hana i padi: "Het bilong mi i amamas long LORDE, horn bilong mi i go antap. Maus bilong mi i toktok strong gen gegen ol poisen, bikos mi amamas long salvesen bilong yu."

original: There is no one holy like the LORD. Indeed, there is no one besides You! And there is no Rock like our God.
translation: Inogat i no stap olsem LORD, sori, i no gat narapela wei bilong yu! Na i no gat Roc we same olsem God bilong mipela.

original: Do not boast so proudly, or let arrogance come from your mouth, for the LORD is a God who knows, and by Him actions are weighed.
translation: No ken tok ples bilong yu yet long olsem, strong head i no kam long mupela, wantem LORD em i God we i save olgeta, na ol wok bilong yumi bai i measurim long en.

original: The bows of the mighty are broken, but the feeble are equipped with strength.
translation: Banara bilong ol strongpela i break, tasol ol weakpela i kamp bek gen long streng.

original: The well-fed hire themselves out for food, but the starving hunger no more. The barren woman gives birth to seven, but she who has many sons pines away.
translation: Ol i save kaikai planti, na ol harm rim wel long kaikai, tasol ol i nogat kaikai, ol i no inap hungre gen. Meri i no inap karim bebi, em bai karim sevenpela pikinini, na meri i gat planti pikinini, em i paul.

original: The LORD brings death and gives life; He brings down to Sheol and raises up.
translation: Bikpela i bringim daeth na i givim laip; i kirapim i go daun long Heli na i liftim up.

original: The LORD sends poverty and wealth; He humbles and He exalts.
translation: Papa God i sendim kisim nogut na plaenta; Em i bringim daun na em i liftim up.

original: He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap. He seats them among princes and bestows on them a throne of honor. For the foundations of the earth are the LORD’s, and upon them He has set the world.
translation: Em i kirapim ol pikinini i no gat samting long graun na lusim ol i no gat samting long as heap, na bringim ol kam, em i sibisim ol long ol prins, na givim ol bikpela het bilong ol. Bikos stret bilong graun em i bilong LORD, na em i setim wol long en, na LORD i mekim ol samting.

original: He guards the steps of His faithful ones, but the wicked perish in darkness; for by his own strength shall no man prevail.
translation: Em i lukautim stept bilong ol faitful, tasol ol bikhet i dai insait long dek; bikos long strong bilong em yet, man i no ken winim.

original: Those who oppose the LORD will be shattered. He will thunder from heaven against them. The LORD will judge the ends of the earth and will give power to His king. He will exalt the horn of His anointed.”
translation: Ol i kamapim lakai long Papa God bai i bagarap strong. Em bai karim tok bilong thunder from heven long ol. Papa God bai givim sentens long hap graun na bai givim strong long king bilong em. Em bai lifimapim banis bilong man bilong em i laik.

original: Then Elkanah went home to Ramah, but the boy began ministering to the LORD before Eli the priest.
translation: Na Elkanah i go bek long Ramah, tasol bikpela i stat long sarvis long GOD bifor pris Eli.

original: Now the sons of Eli were wicked men; they had no regard for the LORD
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Eli i no gat gutpela hati, oli no bin givim respek long LORD.

original: or for the custom of the priests with the people. When any man offered a sacrifice, the servant of the priest would come with a three-pronged meat fork while the meat was boiling
translation: Oraait, long tok bilong pries wantaim ol pipol. Wanpela man i bringim sakrifis, hambut bilong pries i kam wantaim tinpela stik bilong kisim mit wail em mit i boil olsem.

original: and plunge it into the pan or kettle or cauldron or cooking pot. And the priest would claim for himself whatever the meat fork brought up. This is how they treated all the Israelites who came to Shiloh.
translation: Na putim i go daun long pen, ketol, o posin, o kukim pot. Na pris i kisim bilong en, olgeta wei fork bilong mit i kamap. Dispela em i wok bilong ol pris long ol Israel ol i kam long Silo.

original: Even before the fat was burned, the servant of the priest would come and say to the man who was sacrificing, “Give the priest some meat to roast, because he will not accept boiled meat from you, but only raw.”
translation: Bipo ol i kaikai kol bong, manmeri bilong pries i kam, ol i tokim man i mekim sakrifis, “Givim pries samting kukim long paia, bikos em i no laik kukim long wara, tasol nogat kuk yet.”

original: And if any man said to him, “The fat must be burned first; then you may take whatever you want,” the servant would reply, “No, you must give it to me right now. If you refuse, I will take it by force!”
translation: Na em i tokim em olsem, "Yu mas bikim ka long ol i go pastaim, na bihain yu ken kisim wanem yu laik," na sarvan i tokim em olsem, "Nogat, yu mas givim mi nau yet. I yu no givim, bai mi kisim bekside."
