original: Thus the sin of these young men was severe in the sight of the LORD, for they were treating the LORD’s offering with contempt.
translation: Sin bilong ol yangpela man desi i bikpela long ai bilong LORD, wantaim ol i lak Kisim ofing bilong LORD olsem nating.

original: Now Samuel was ministering before the LORD—a boy wearing a linen ephod.
translation: Nau Samuel i wok servos long han bilong LORD - em i boi nambawan we i werim apron bilong pris.

original: Each year his mother would make him a little robe and bring it to him when she went with her husband to offer the annual sacrifice.
translation: Mama bilong em bekim yia igo pinis, wokim klos bilong en i go, na bringim i go long em taim em i go wantaim husban bilong en givim sakrifis bilong yia.

original: And Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, saying, “May the LORD give you children by this woman in place of the one she dedicated to the LORD.” Then they would go home.
translation: Na Eli i blesim Elkanah na meri bilong en, i tok olsem: “Mai LORD i givim yu ol pikinini long hap bilong dispela meri, long hap bilong em i dedikeim long LORD.” Na bai ol i go bak long haus.

original: So the LORD attended to Hannah, and she conceived and gave birth to three sons and two daughters. Meanwhile, the boy Samuel grew up in the presence of the LORD.
translation: Na Papa God i lukautim Hannah, na Hannah i karim bebi na i kamap na i bekim threepela mani na twopela meri. Na bikos long dispela taim, Samuel i bikim olsem man long wei bilong Papa God.

original: Now Eli was very old, and he heard about everything his sons were doing to all Israel and how they were sleeping with the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Nau Eli em i bikpela tumas, na em harim tok bilong olgeta samting ol pikinini bilong en i mekim long ol Israel, na ol i stap wantaim meri ol i wark long hap bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: “Why are you doing these things?” Eli said to his sons. “I hear about your wicked deeds from all these people.
translation: Eli i tokim ol pikinini bilong en: "Wai yusim na mekim ol dispela? Mi harim tok long nogut wok bilong yu long ol pipel."

original: No, my sons; it is not a good report I hear circulating among the LORD’s people.
translation: Nogat, ol pikinini bilong mi; em i no gutpela tok ol i harim i go olsem long ol pipol bilong LORD.

original: If a man sins against another man, God can intercede for him; but if a man sins against the LORD, who can intercede for him?” But they would not listen to their father, since the LORD intended to put them to death.
translation: Igat man i bikim sin long narapela man, God i ken go antap long en; bat igat man i bikim sin long LORD, husat i ken go antap long en? Bat ol i no lisen long tumbuna ol, wantaim LORD i laik kilim ol.

original: And the boy Samuel continued to grow in stature and in favor with the LORD and with man.
translation: Na bai yung Samuel i go on long strong, i kamap bikpela long bodi, na gat bikpela hap bilong Jehovah na ol man.

original: Then a man of God came to Eli and told him, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Did I not clearly reveal Myself to your father’s house when they were in Egypt under Pharaoh’s house?
translation: Na Man bilong God i kam kaikai long Eli na i tokim em, "LORD i tok olsem: 'Inap mi kisim wail long me yet long haus bilong papa yu, taim ol i stap long Egip, aninit long haus bilong Pharaoh?'"

original: And out of all the tribes of Israel I selected your father to be My priest, to offer sacrifices on My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod in My presence. I also gave to the house of your father all the offerings of the Israelites made by fire.
translation: Na long olgeta tribe bilong Isrel, mi pilim papa bilong yu yet, i go bekim pris bilong Mi, i go bringim sakrifis long altabila bilong Mi, i go burnim insens, na i go werem ephod long ples bilong Mi. Mi tu givim hus bilong papa bilong yu olgeta ofing bilong Isrelites i go makim na kisim paia.

original: Why then do you kick at My sacrifice and offering that I have prescribed for My dwelling place? You have honored your sons more than Me by fattening yourselves with the best of all the offerings of My people Israel.’
translation: Long olgeta taim, bai yu kikim long sakrifis na ofing bilong Mi, ol samting we Mi bin givim kaantri bilong Mi yet long haus bilong Mi? Yu bin givim respek long pikinini bilong yu olsem yu givim respek long Mi, bikos yu i save kai kai gutpela samting long ol ofing bilong Pipol Israel bilong Mi.

original: Therefore, the LORD, the God of Israel, declares: ‘I did indeed say that your house and the house of your father would walk before Me forever. But now the LORD declares: Far be it from Me! For I will honor those who honor Me, but those who despise Me will be disdained.
translation: Olsem, LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok olsem: 'Mi bin tok olsem tru, hus bilong yu na hus bilong papa bilong yu bai wok wantaim mi foreva.' Tasol nau LORD i tok olsem: Nogat long me! Bikos mi bai givim respek long ol man meri i givim respek long mi, tasol ol i no givim respek long mi, ol bai bilakim.

original: Behold, the days are coming when I will cut off your strength and the strength of your father’s house, so that no older man will be left in your house.
translation: Lukim, dei i kam wanpela taim bai mi katim streng bilong yu na streng bilong haus bilong papa, na no ol man bai i stap long haus bilong yu.

original: You will see distress in My dwelling place. Despite all that is good in Israel, no one in your house will ever again reach old age.
translation: Yu bai lukim i gat sori long ples stap bilong Mi. Nogut long olgeta gutpela samting long Isrel, nambis na em i no gat man i kamap bikpela na dai long haus bilong yu.

original: And every one of you that I do not cut off from My altar, your eyes will fail and your heart will grieve. All your descendants will die by the sword of men.
translation: Na olgeta long yu, mi no kat aut long alta bilong mi, ai bilong yu bai bagarap, haret bilong yu bai sori. Ol pikinini bilong yu olgeta bai dai long sipao bilong ol man.

original: And this sign shall come to you concerning your two sons Hophni and Phinehas: They will both die on the same day.
translation: Dispela saen bilong dispela i kam long yu: long tupela pikinini bilong yu, Hofni na Finehas, Tupela bai dai long wanpela de.

original: Then I will raise up for Myself a faithful priest. He will do whatever is in My heart and mind. And I will build for him an enduring house, and he will walk before My anointed one for all time.
translation: Na bai mi kamapim bekim pris we i trai long me. Em bai wokim ol samting we i stap insait long het na mengen bilong me. Na mi bai bilong en bikosim haus we i orait, na em bai go bifo anointed man bilong me oltaim, long taim oltaim.

original: And everyone left in your house will come and bow down to him for a piece of silver or a morsel of bread, pleading, “Please appoint me to some priestly office so that I can eat a piece of bread.”’”
translation: Na olgeta we i stap insait long haus bilong yu, bai ol i kam na inim go daun long en, bekim olsem, “Plis, apoinim mi long wanpela ofis bilong priester, bilevem olsem na bai mi ken kaikai wanpela smol kaikai,” olsem na bai ol bego long en, “Givim mi wanpela silva o wanpela smol pikininini bred, bikos mi laik wok wantaim yu, na mi ken kaikai.””

original: And the boy Samuel ministered to the LORD before Eli. Now in those days the word of the LORD was rare and visions were scarce.
translation: Na bikpela Samuel i servis long han bilong Jehovah bipo long ai bilong Eli. Long dispela taim, tok bilong Jehovah i no olsem planti na vip visions i no olsem planti.

original: And at that time Eli, whose eyesight had grown so dim that he could not see, was lying in his room.
translation: Na long taem nau, Eli, woswe em i kamap bikpela na is tumas, olsem sait bilong en i no inap luk gut, i slip insait long rum bilong en.

original: Before the lamp of God had gone out, Samuel was lying down in the temple of the LORD, where the ark of God was located.
translation: Bifora lampa bilong God i go daun, Samuel i slip i go long haus lotu bilong LORD, we bilong ark bilong God i stap.

original: Then the LORD called to Samuel, and he answered, “Here I am.”
translation: Na Bikpela i singautim Samuel, na em i ansa, “Mi stap hare.”

original: He ran to Eli and said, “Here I am, for you have called me.” “I did not call,” Eli replied. “Go back and lie down.” So he went and lay down.
translation: Em i ran i go long Eli na em i tok, "Mipela i stap, yu kolim mipela." Eli i tok bek, "Mi no kolim, go bak na kalap long ples." Na em i go na kalap.

original: Once again the LORD called, “Samuel!” So Samuel got up, went to Eli, and said, “Here I am, for you have called me.” “My son, I did not call,” Eli replied. “Go back and lie down.”
translation: Ol Masalai i kolim gen, "Samuel!" Na Samuel i kam, em i go long Eli, na em i tokim, "Mi stap hare, yu kolim mi." "Pikinini bilong mi," Eli i tok, "mi no kolim yu. Go bak na kalap."

original: Now Samuel did not yet know the LORD, because the word of the LORD had not yet been revealed to him.
translation: Nau Samuel i no save long olgeta we bilong Jehovah yet, wantaim tok bilong Jehovah i no bin kamap long em yet.

original: Once again, for the third time, the LORD called to Samuel. He got up, went to Eli, and said, “Here I am, for you have called me.” Then Eli realized that it was the LORD who was calling the boy.
translation: Tispai, tripla taim, Bikpela i singautim Samuel. Em i kam bek, i go long Eli, i tok, "Mi stap hare, yu singautim mi." Na Eli i save olsem Bikpela em i singautim boy.

original: “Go and lie down,” he said to Samuel, “and if He calls you, say, ‘Speak, LORD, for Your servant is listening.’” So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
translation: “Go na klostu,” em i tokim Samuel, “na sapos Em i kolim yu, yu tok, ‘Tok, Lod, bikos servant bilong yu i harim.’” Na Samuel i go na klostu long ples bilong en.

original: Then the LORD came and stood there, calling as before, “Samuel! Samuel!” And Samuel answered, “Speak, for Your servant is listening.”
translation: Bikpela i kam na em i stap, i singaut olsem bipo, “Samuel! Samuel!” Na Samuel i tok, “Tok, bikos servant bilong yu em i harim.”

original: Then the LORD said to Samuel, “I am about to do something in Israel at which the ears of all who hear it will tingle.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Samuel, “Mi go kam na wokim samting long Israel, we olgeta harem i go bel hevi long yapela i harim.”

original: On that day I will carry out against Eli everything I have spoken about his family, from beginning to end.
translation: Long dispela de mi bai mekim gen olgeta samting mi tok long Eli na famili bilong en, frum bikpela pasinda long en i go inap long las.

original: I told him that I would judge his house forever for the iniquity of which he knows, because his sons blasphemed God and he did not restrain them.
translation: Mi tokim em, bai God i kam jakim hus bilong en na ol pikinini bilong en olsem taitim ol long nogut pasin we em save, wantaim ol pikinini bilong en i bin bagarap nem bilong God, na em i no inap stopim ol.

original: Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli, ‘The iniquity of Eli’s house shall never be atoned for by sacrifice or offering.’”
translation: Mi go hammamas long haus bilong Eli, ol hevi bilong haus bilong Eli inap bem tokoro long wanem taim, bekos saksak na ofa ol i no inap kirapim hevi bilong ol.

original: Samuel lay down until the morning; then he opened the doors of the house of the LORD. He was afraid to tell Eli the vision,
translation: Samuel lidim i go long moning; bihain em i opim door bilong haus bilong Lod. Em i bikhet olsem toktok long Eli vip.

original: but Eli called to him and said, “Samuel, my son.” “Here I am,” answered Samuel.
translation: Na Eli i singautim em, ol i tok, 'Samuel, pikinini bilong me.' Samuel i ansa, 'Mi stap hare.'

original: “What was the message He gave you?” Eli asked. “Do not hide it from me. May God punish you, and ever so severely, if you hide from me anything He said to you.”
translation: “Wanem samting em i givim yu?” Eli i askim. “Yu no ken hide long me. Mipela i harim yu long han bilong God, bai em i givim yu penati strong long narapela, yap em i dai, if yu hide long me eni tok He i tokim yu.”

original: So Samuel told him everything and did not hide a thing from him. “He is the LORD,” replied Eli. “Let Him do what is good in His eyes.”
translation: Na Samuel i tokim em olgeta, em i no ken hidim sampela. “Em i Papa God,” ol i tok, “Letim Em mekim ol gutpela samting long ai bilong Em.”

original: And Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him, and He let none of Samuel’s words fall to the ground.
translation: Na Samuel i go ap long, na Bikpela i stap wantaim em, na ol toks bilong Samuel i no ken slip i go daun.

original: So all Israel from Dan to Beersheba knew that Samuel was confirmed as a prophet of the LORD.
translation: Ol Israel i save long ol dan go long Beersheba, na ol i laik tokolim Samuel em i kamap olsem wanpela propet bilong Bikpela.

original: And the LORD continued to appear at Shiloh, because there He revealed Himself to Samuel by His word.
translation: Na Bikpela i go kam bek gen long Shiloh, bikos em i showim em yet long Samuel olsem tok bilong en.

original: Thus the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now the Israelites went out to meet the Philistines in battle and camped at Ebenezer, while the Philistines camped at Aphek.
translation: Na tok bilong Samuwel i kam long ol Israel. Ol Israelit i go aut long harim Philistines long bikpela fait, na ol i pundaun klostu long Ebeneza, wail ol Philistines i pundaun klostu long Aphek.

original: The Philistines arrayed themselves against Israel, and as the battle spread, Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who struck down about four thousand men on the battlefield.
translation: Filistia ol i kamap strong long Israel, na fait bilong war i go waid, Israel i lus long Filistia, na ol Filistia i kilim ol man long ples bilong fait, olsem four thousand.

original: When the troops returned to the camp, the elders of Israel asked, “Why has the LORD brought defeat on us before the Philistines today? Let us bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Shiloh, so that it may go with us to save us from the hand of our enemies.”
translation: Taitim ol solja i go bek long kampon, bikpela manmeri bilong Israel i askim, “Olsem wanem LORD i bringim bikhet long mipela, na mipela i lus long Filistia tede? Mipela yet i kisim bikpela bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD long Shiloh, yu yet go wantaim mipela na saveim mipela long han bilong enemy bilong mipela.”

original: So the people sent men to Shiloh, and they brought back the ark of the covenant of the LORD of Hosts, who sits enthroned between the cherubim. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.
translation: Ol bingtim man go long Silo, na ol i kisim bek ark bilong kaen kovena bilong Papa bilong ol ples, em i sios long sit bilong en, na cherubim olsem bikpela spirut bilong heven i stap klostu long en. Na tu sons bilong Eli, Hophni na Phinehas, ol i stap wantaim ark bilong kovena bilong God.

original: When the ark of the covenant of the LORD entered the camp, all the Israelites raised such a great shout that it shook the ground.
translation: Wanpela taim bokis bilong kaunsil pisin bilong Lod i go insait long kamp, ol Israelites i kirap strongpela rais tasol, graun i skruim.

original: On hearing the noise of the shout, the Philistines asked, “What is this loud shouting in the camp of the Hebrews?” And when they realized that the ark of the LORD had entered the camp,
translation: Long ol i harim dispela nois, Filistia ol i askim, "Dispela ol i singautim bikpela i minam Haus bilong Ibrim?" Na wcn tnem ol i save olsem bokis bilong LORD i go insait long kemp,

original: the Philistines were afraid. “The gods have entered their camp!” they said. “Woe to us, for nothing like this has happened before.
translation: Filistia i stap inafraid. “God i go insait long kanu bilong ol,” ol i tok. “Woi long yumi, bikos dispela kain samting i no kamap long taim bifo.”

original: Woe to us! Who will deliver us from the hand of these mighty gods? These are the gods who struck the Egyptians with all kinds of plagues in the wilderness.
translation: Ai i go long yumi! Husat bai kisim yumi long han bilong dispela bikpela gods? Dimpela gods i strikim Egyptians long ol kain plagi insait long bus.

original: Take courage and be men, O Philistines! Otherwise, you will serve the Hebrews just as they served you. Now be men and fight!”
translation: Kisim kourij na kamap ol man, o Filistia! Nogat, bai yupela i sarve ol Hepri olsem ol i sarve yupela. Nau kamap ol man na fight!

original: So the Philistines fought, and Israel was defeated, and each man fled to his tent. The slaughter was very great—thirty thousand foot soldiers of Israel fell.
translation: Na Filistia i go daris, Israel i lus, na ol man i ranawe na i go long haus bilong en. Slaughta em i bikpela tru — thirty thousand soldia i go long graun bilong Israel i pundaun.

original: The ark of God was captured, and Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, died.
translation: Bokis bilong God i go daun, na tu ol pikinini bilong Eli, Hofni na Finehas, i dai.

original: That same day a Benjamite ran from the battle line all the way to Shiloh, with his clothes torn and dirt on his head.
translation: Long de same dei, wanpela man bilong Benjimin i rinawe long ples bilong fait, go pinis long wei, go long Shiloh, klos i bin kolim, na dus i stap long hed bilong em.

original: When he arrived, there was Eli, sitting on his chair beside the road and watching, because his heart trembled for the ark of God. When the man entered the city to give a report, the whole city cried out.
translation: Taim em i kam, na Eli i sindaun long chair bilong en besaida lon rot na wachim, bilong dispela ol heart bilong en i bel hevi long ark bilong God. Taim man i go insait long taun long givim ripot, hole taun i cry out.

original: Eli heard the outcry and asked, “Why this commotion?” So the man hurried over and reported to Eli.
translation: Eli harim tok bilong ol, na em askim, 'Wanem nau i kamap long dispela hevi?' Na man i ran i go klostu, na i ripotim stori long Eli.

original: Now Eli was ninety-eight years old, and his gaze was fixed because he could not see.
translation: Nau Eli em nineti-et yia olsem na, na mati bilong em i stap yet long en bikos em i no ina save luk.

original: “I have just come from the battle,” the man said to Eli. “I fled from there today.” “What happened, my son?” Eli asked.
translation: Mi kam pinis nau long ples bilong faet, ol man i tokim Eli. Nau today mi ranawe i go. Wanem kamap, pikinini bilong mi? Eli i askim.

original: The messenger answered, “Israel has fled before the Philistines, and there has been a great slaughter among the people. Your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are both dead, and the ark of God has been captured.”
translation: Mesinjara i tokim, “Isrel i ranawe long Philisti, na planti man i dai pinis long ples. Yu tu pikinini, Hofni na Finehas, i dai pinis, na bokis bilong God i kisim ol i kaibarim.”

original: As soon as the ark of God was mentioned, Eli fell backward from his chair by the city gate, and being old and heavy, he broke his neck and died. And Eli had judged Israel forty years.
translation: Taim ol i bikim tok long arki bilong God, Eli i slip bek long sit bilong en klostu long geit bilong taun, na em i pikinini na hatwok, nek bilong en i bruk na em i dai. Na Eli i bosim Israel long forty yia.

original: Now Eli’s daughter-in-law, the wife of Phinehas, was pregnant and about to give birth. When she heard the news of the capture of God’s ark and the deaths of her father-in-law and her husband, she collapsed and gave birth, for her labor pains overtook her.
translation: Nau meri bilong Eli, meri bilong Phinehas, i kamap bek gen, em i redi long karim bebi. Em i harim stori bilong kapen na tumbuna bilong bokis bilong God, olsem papa bilong em, Eli, na husban bilong em, Phinehas, i dai. Stori em i kam long em, em i pundaun na karim bebi, pain bilong karim i kam strong long en, em i no inap long w8, em i karim bebi wantaim.

original: As she was dying, the women attending to her said, “Do not be afraid, for you have given birth to a son!” But she did not respond or pay any heed.
translation: Taim em i dai pinis, meri i wok long en i tok olsem, “No ken bikim afraid, yu karim man i kam!” Tasol em i no bin harim o i no bin simbek long tok bilong ol.

original: And she named the boy Ichabod, saying, “The glory has departed from Israel,” because the ark of God had been captured and her father-in-law and her husband had been killed.
translation: Na em i givim nem Ai Kabot long pikinini, olsem, "Glori i go daun bikos Isrel," bikos bokis bilong God i bin kisim na papa bilong husband na husband i bin kilim.

original: “The glory has departed from Israel,” she said, “for the ark of God has been captured.”
translation: “Glory i go daun long Israel,” em i tok, “bikos bokis bilong God em i bin kaemen.”

original: After the Philistines had captured the ark of God, they took it from Ebenezer to Ashdod,
translation: Ol Filistia i kam kap na tekim bokis bilong God, ol i kisim i go long Ebeneza na i karim i go long Asdod.

original: carried it into the temple of Dagon, and set it beside his statue.
translation: Ol i kisim i go insait long tempel bilong Dagon, na ol i putim besaid figur bilong em.

original: When the people of Ashdod got up early the next morning, there was Dagon, fallen on his face before the ark of the LORD. So they took Dagon and returned him to his place.
translation: Ol pipol bilong Asod em i go ap long moning nambawan dei, na Dagon i pilai daun long graun, facim daun, bifo bokis bilong LORD. Ol i kisim Dagon na bringim em bek long ples bilong em.

original: But when they got up early the next morning, there was Dagon, fallen on his face before the ark of the LORD, with his head and his hands broken off and lying on the threshold. Only the torso remained.
translation: Tasol em i go ap long moning nambawan dei, ol i lukim Dagon, godepela bilong Filistia, em i pilai gras na kanak' long ran bilong bokis bilong LORD, hed bilong en na han bilong en i katim na brok, na ol i slip long doa bilong haus. Bodili bilong en yet, em i stap tasol.

original: That is why, to this day, the priests of Dagon and all who enter the temple of Dagon in Ashdod do not step on the threshold.
translation: Nasel long taim, pris bilong Dagon na olgeta husat i go insait long haus lotu bilong Dagon long Asdod, oli no ken go antap long tanim haus.

original: Now the hand of the LORD was heavy on the people of Ashdod and its vicinity, ravaging them and afflicting them with tumors.
translation: Nau han bilong Lod i hevi long ol pipol bilong Asdod na graun bilong em, ol i bagarapim ol yet, na ol i kisim sik bilong buk na kok.

original: And when the men of Ashdod saw what was happening, they said, “The ark of the God of Israel must not stay here with us, because His hand is heavy upon us and upon our god Dagon.”
translation: Na ol man bilong Ashdod i lukim olgeta samting i kamap, ol i tok, "Bokis bilong God bilong Israel i no ken stap hia wantaim yumi, bikos Han bilong Em i hevi long yumi na long god bilong yumi Dagon."

original: So they called together all the rulers of the Philistines and asked, “What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel?” “It must be moved to Gath,” they replied. So they carried away the ark of the God of Israel.
translation: Olgeta bikman bilong Filistia i kam long wankain, na tok askim ol long mekim wanem long ark bilong God bilong Israel. Ol tokim ol sei, "Em i mas i go long Gat." Na ol i kisim ark bilong God bilong Israel i karim i go.

original: But after they had moved the ark to Gath, the LORD’s hand was also against that city, throwing it into great confusion and afflicting the men of the city, both young and old, with an outbreak of tumors.
translation: Bikos ol i karim bek ark na go long Gath, han bilong LORD i stap agensim siti, makim olgeta samting long siti i bagarap, na mekim siki bilong kul long ol man bilong siti, bikos ol i liklik na ol i bikpela.

original: So they sent the ark of God to Ekron, but as it arrived, the Ekronites cried out, “They have brought us the ark of the God of Israel in order to kill us and our people!”
translation: Tupela i salim bek arki bilong God i go long Ekron, na long taim em i kam ap, ol Ekronait i kirap strong, ol i kisim tok, "Ol i bringim arki bilong God bilong Israel i kam long yumipela, ol i laik killim mipela na ol pikinini bilong mipela!"

original: Then the Ekronites assembled all the rulers of the Philistines and said, “Send away the ark of the God of Israel. It must return to its place, so that it will not kill us and our people!” For a deadly confusion had pervaded the city; the hand of God was heavy upon it.
translation: Ekronites i kam olsem wan, olgeta bikman bilong Filistia, na tok olsem: “Lusim bek arka bilong God bilong Israel, em i go bek long ples bilong en, kalektim mipela na pipel bilong mipela!” Wantaim, biknem kros i go daun long taon; han bilong God i kam strong long ol, na i bringim bodi long ol.

original: Those who did not die were afflicted with tumors, and the outcry of the city went up to heaven.
translation: Ol i no dai yet, ol i kisim sik tumora, na hap bilong ples i go antap long heven.

original: When the ark of the LORD had been in the land of the Philistines seven months,
translation: Taim bokis bilong LORD i stap long kantri bilong Philistine seven manis,

original: the Philistines summoned the priests and diviners, saying, “What shall we do with the ark of the LORD? Tell us how to send it back to its place.”
translation: Filistia i kolim pries na man ol i save tokaut long spirit, ol i tok, "Bai yumi mekim wanem long ark bilong Lord? Tokim mipela long wanem sampela wei bai yumi kisim i go bek long ples bilong en."

original: They replied, “If you return the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it away empty, but by all means return it to Him with a guilt offering. Then you will be healed, and you will understand why His hand has not been lifted from you.”
translation: Ol i tok bek, “Sapos yu bringim bek bokis bilong God bilong Israel, no ken kisim i go empti, tasol long olgeta samting, yu mas bringim bek long em wantaim samting bilong pe bilong helium. Den yu bai i kamap strong gen, na yu bai i save laik wanem han bilong Em i no go ap long yu.”

original: “What guilt offering should we send back to Him?” asked the Philistines. “Five gold tumors and five gold rats,” they said, “according to the number of rulers of the Philistines, since the same plague has struck both you and your rulers.
translation: Watpela gilty ofing bai yumi senem bak long em? ol Philistia i askim. Faiv gol tumas na faiv gol rats, ol i tok, olsem nem bilong ples philistia i gat bikman, bikos em i kam bekim yupela na bikman bilong yupela.

original: Make images of your tumors and of the rats that are ravaging the land. Give glory to the God of Israel, and perhaps He will lift His hand from you and your gods and your land.
translation: Wokim piksa bilong tumor bilong yu na bilong ol rat bilong i kam daunim graun. Givim glori long God bilong Israel, bai em inap long lusim han bilong En, na yu, na god bilong yu, na graun bilong yu.

original: Why harden your hearts as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened theirs? When He afflicted them, did they not send the people on their way as they departed?
translation: Olsem Egipeta na Farao i hariam hart bilong ol, bai yu hariam ol hart bilong yu? Wanpela taim Em i bringim trabel long ol, ol i salim piple go we na ol i go bek.

original: Now, therefore, prepare one new cart with two milk cows that have never been yoked. Hitch the cows to the cart, but take their calves away and pen them up.
translation: Nau, bilong dispela, preparim wanpela nupela karet wantaim tu kuk i kamapim susu ol i no bin jompela yet. Kisim ol kuk na haitim long karet, bekim ol pikinini kuk longwe na palim long haus.

original: Take the ark of the LORD, set it on the cart, and in a chest beside it put the gold objects you are sending Him as a guilt offering. Then send the ark on its way,
translation: Kisim bek na Lod long ol, putim i go antap long kar, na long bokis besaida, putim gol objek ol i mekim bilong pei bakim Lod olsem ofing aibils. Lusim bek go long wei.

original: but keep watching it. If it goes up the road to its homeland, toward Beth-shemesh, it is the LORD who has brought on us this great disaster. But if it does not, then we will know that it was not His hand that punished us and that it happened by chance.”
translation: Bai yupela harim i go. I go antap long rot bilong ples bilong em, long wei bilong Bet-Semes, em i God tasol i bringim bikpela pes bilong dispela kastom long mipela. Bai mipela save olsem em i no han bilong em i punishim mipela, na em i kamap olsem bihain tasol.

original: So the men did as instructed. They took two milk cows, hitched them to the cart, and penned up their calves.
translation: Ol man i mekim olsem ol i bin tok. Ol i kisim tupela kok bilong susu, ol i bin hetim long kar, na ol i bin ppenim pikinini bilong kok.

original: Then they put the ark of the LORD on the cart, along with the chest containing the gold rats and the images of the tumors.
translation: Tisa ol i putim bek bilong LORD long kar, olsem na ol i go wantaim bokis i gat rats bilong gol na man bilong sik mun.

original: And the cows headed straight up the road toward Beth-shemesh, staying on that one highway and lowing as they went, never straying to the right or to the left. The rulers of the Philistines followed behind them to the border of Beth-shemesh.
translation: Na bulmakau i go stret olsem long rot, i stap yet long wanpela hait, ol i kol kol olsem ol i go, na i no lusim rot long sait na long lef. Pipia bilong Filistia i bihaind long bodi bilong ol, ol i kam inap long boda bilong Bet-Semes.

original: Now the people of Beth-shemesh were harvesting wheat in the valley, and when they looked up and saw the ark, they were overjoyed at the sight.
translation: Na ol pipol long Beth-shemesh i kamap harvestim wheat long vali, na taim ol i lukup na lukim bek arka, ol i amamas long dispela sik.

original: The cart came to the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh and stopped there near a large rock. The people chopped up the cart and offered the cows as a burnt offering to the LORD.
translation: Kar em i kam long graun bilong Josaia long Bet-Semes na i stap tasol beside bikpela rock. Ol man i katim kar i go na ol i givim kukai ol bulmakau long LORD olsem ofing.

original: And the Levites took down the ark of the LORD and the chest containing the gold objects, and they placed them on the large rock. That day the men of Beth-shemesh offered burnt offerings and made sacrifices to the LORD.
translation: Na Levait i tokim bek i kamdaun ark bilong LORD na bokis bilong gopas na samting bilong gol, na ol i putim ol long rok bikpela. Long dei em, manmeri bilong Bet-Semes ol i bringim ofing bung na ofing bung i go daun, na ol i mekim sakrifis long LORD.

original: And when the five rulers of the Philistines saw this, they returned to Ekron that same day.
translation: Taim faiv ples bilong Philistines i lukim dispela, ol i go bek long Ekron still long despela de.

original: As a guilt offering to the LORD, the Philistines had sent back one gold tumor for each city: Ashdod, Gaza, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron.
translation: Olsem guiltofing long pe, ol Filistia i salim bek wanpela gołd sik tumor long han bilong Jehovah long bikos bilong everi siti: Asod, Gaza, Askalon, Gat, na Ekron.

original: The number of gold rats also corresponded to the number of Philistine cities belonging to the five rulers—the fortified cities and their outlying villages. And the large rock on which they placed the ark of the LORD stands to this day in the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh.
translation: Namba bilong golpela rats i kamapim na i go hen long namba bilong taun bilong Filistia i belong long faiv pipel i gat autoriti - taun i gat betel na vilij ol i stap karai. Na bikpela stoan we oli putim ak bilong LORD long em i stap yet long tude long ples bilong Josaia bilong Bet-Semes.

original: But God struck down some of the people of Beth-shemesh because they looked inside the ark of the LORD. He struck down seventy men, and the people mourned because the LORD had struck them with a great slaughter.
translation: Bikos ol i lukim insait long ark bilong LORD, God i kilim sampela man meri bilong Bet-Semes. Em i kilim seventy man, na ol man meri i mekim sori bikos LORD i kilim ol long slahta bikpela.

original: The men of Beth-shemesh asked, “Who can stand in the presence of the LORD, this holy God? To whom should the ark go up from here?”
translation: Ol man bilong Bet-Semes askim, “Husat ina bai stap klostu long ples bilong LORD, God bilong halivim? Blong ham mas ark i go apo long hia?”

original: So they sent messengers to the people of Kiriath-jearim, saying, “The Philistines have returned the ark of the LORD. Come down and take it up with you.”
translation: Ol i sendim messija long ol pipol bilong Kiriath-jearim, tokim olsem: “Filistia i bringim bek bokis bilong Lod. Kam daun na kam bihaen long yu.”

original: Then the men of Kiriath-jearim came for the ark of the LORD and took it into Abinadab’s house on the hill. And they consecrated his son Eleazar to guard the ark of the LORD.
translation: Na ol man bilong Kiriath-jearim i kam na kisim bik box bilong LORD, na ol i karim i go insait long haus bilong Abinadab long han bilong maunten. Na ol i makim Eleazar, pikinini bilong em, i stap holim, na ol i givim em wok bilong lukautim bik box bilong LORD.

original: And from that day a long time passed, twenty years in all, as the ark remained at Kiriath-jearim. And all the house of Israel mourned and sought after the LORD.
translation: Na em i go lang long taim, twenty years olgeta, ak i stap yet long Kiriath-jearim. Na olgesen hus bilong Isrel i birua na ol i lukluk bek long LORD.

original: Then Samuel said to all the house of Israel, “If you are returning to the LORD with all your hearts, then rid yourselves of the foreign gods and Ashtoreths among you, prepare your hearts for the LORD, and serve Him only. And He will deliver you from the hand of the Philistines.”
translation: Samuel i tokim ol haus bilong Israel, "If yu kam bek long LORD wantaim ol het bilong yu, rausim ol pagan gods na Ashtoret (gods bilong kastom) long yu, preparim het bilong yu long LORD, na servim Hem tasol. Na Em bai salvimirim yu long han bilong Filistia (neman bilong musuh)."

original: So the Israelites put away the Baals and Ashtoreths and served only the LORD.
translation: Na Pipol Israel lusim spirits bikpela i kam long kantri Kanaan na meri spirits i kam long kantri Kanaan, na wokim servos long GOD tasol.

original: Then Samuel said, “Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray to the LORD on your behalf.”
translation: Na Samuel i tok olsem, "Bai yumi garem ol Israel long Mizpa, na mi bai go na beten long Lod long ai bilong yu."

original: When they had gathered at Mizpah, they drew water and poured it out before the LORD. On that day they fasted, and there they confessed, “We have sinned against the LORD.” And Samuel judged the Israelites at Mizpah.
translation: Taim ol i kam bihain long Mizpah, ol i kisim wara na kirapim i go long ples bilong Bikpela. Long de ya, ol i stap hungri, na ol i tokautim, "Mipela i mekim sin long Bikpela." Na Samuel i givim desisen long Israelites long Mizpah.

original: When the Philistines heard that the Israelites had gathered at Mizpah, their rulers marched up toward Israel. And when the Israelites learned of this, they feared the Philistines
translation: Taim Filistia harim dispela toktok ol Israeli i kam tanim tu long Mizpa, ol bikpela man bilong ol i go antap long Israel. Na taim ol Israeli pipol i save long dispela, tifa i kirap long ol.

original: and said to Samuel, “Do not stop crying out to the LORD our God for us, that He may save us from the hand of the Philistines.”
translation: Tokim olsem long Samuel, “No ken stop krai i go long Bikpela LORD God bilong yumi, mipela i mas save nau long han bilong Filistia.”

original: Then Samuel took a suckling lamb and offered it as a whole burnt offering to the LORD. He cried out to the LORD on behalf of Israel, and the LORD answered him.
translation: Na Samuel em i kisim lampun pik na em i givim olgeta em as ofa bilong bungim long LORD. Em i singaut i go long LORD long hap bilong Israel, na LORD i givim ansa long em.

original: As the Philistines drew near to fight against Israel, Samuel was sacrificing the burnt offering. But that day the LORD thundered loudly against the Philistines and threw them into such confusion that they fled before Israel.
translation: Long taim Filistia i kam klus long paitim gen Israel, Samuwel i bringim ofa bilong bun. Tasol GOD i givim ren i santing strong long dia, na Filistia ol i kalap long konfusen, na ol i ranawe long Israel.

original: Then the men of Israel charged out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, striking them down all the way to an area below Beth-car.
translation: Na ol man meri bilong Israel ranawe long Mizpah na go bekim Philistines, na paitim ol i dai, ol i go daun i kam inap long hap buk bilong Beth-car.

original: Afterward, Samuel took a stone and set it up between Mizpah and Shen. He named it Ebenezer, saying, “Thus far the LORD has helped us.”
translation: Nambis, Samuel kisim wanpela ston na em i putim i go ap long halivim bihain long Mizpa na Shen. Em i givim nem Ebeneza, olsem em i tok, “Inap long taim bilong dispela LORD i helpim mipela.”

original: So the Philistines were subdued, and they stopped invading the territory of Israel. And the hand of the LORD was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.
translation: Na Filistia i kam daun jet, na ol i stopim invadam länd bilong Isrel. Na han bilong LORD i birua long Filistia long oldei bilong Samuwel.

original: The cities from Ekron to Gath, which the Philistines had taken, were restored to Israel, who also delivered the surrounding territory from the hand of the Philistines. And there was peace between the Israelites and the Amorites.
translation: Siti long Ekron i go inap long Gath, ol Filistia i bin tken, i kam bek gen long Israel, na Israel i givim bek ilak i pundaun long han bilong Filistia. Na Israel na Amorait i gat pis.

original: So Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.
translation: Na Samuel i bosim Israel olgeta de poitin bilong laip bilong en.

original: Every year he would go on a circuit from Bethel to Gilgal to Mizpah, judging Israel in all these places.
translation: Em bai go long rot, from Betel to Gilgal to Mizpa, na em bai jujim Israel long ol ples ya.

original: Then he would return to Ramah because his home was there, and there he judged Israel and built an altar to the LORD.
translation: Na em i go bek gen long Ramah, bikos haus bilong em i stap there, na em i jujim Israel, na em i bildim wanpela wansel long Altar bilong Bikpela.

original: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons as judges over Israel.
translation: Taim Samuel i bikim olsem kina, na em i apoinim pikinini bilong em olsem jujis long Israel.

original: The name of his firstborn son was Joel, and the name of his second was Abijah. They were judges in Beersheba.
translation: Nem bilong pikinini namba wan em i Joel, na nem bilong namba tu em i Abijah. Ol i bin jujis long Bia Siba.

original: But his sons did not walk in his ways; they turned aside toward dishonest gain, accepting bribes and perverting justice.
translation: Bikos ol pikinini bilong em i no go long we bilong en; ol i turnim asait long moni nogut, ol i akseptim bribe na paulim jusis.

original: So all the elders of Israel gathered together and came to Samuel at Ramah.
translation: Olgeta bikman bilong Isrel i kam olsem wan na ol i go kas long Samuwel long Ramah.

original: “Look,” they said, “you are old, and your sons do not walk in your ways. Now appoint a king to judge us like all the other nations.”
translation: Lukim, yu ol i bik, na pikinini bilong yu i no i go long we bilong yu. Nau appointim wan king long jujumim mipela olsem nesen olgeda.

original: But when they said, “Give us a king to judge us,” their demand was displeasing in the sight of Samuel; so he prayed to the LORD.
translation: Tasol ol i tok, "Mipela i mas havim wanpela king bilong jujim mipela," strongpela askim bilong ol i no inap long kam long ai bilong Samuwel; olsem na em i birua long Bikpela.

original: And the LORD said to Samuel, “Listen to the voice of the people in all that they say to you. For it is not you they have rejected, but they have rejected Me as their king.
translation: Na Papa bilong Heaven i tokim Samuwel, “Harim tok bilong ol pipol long olgeta samting ol i tok long yu. Ol i no bikim yu long wei, tasol ol i bikim me long wei, ol i lusim Papa bilong Heaven olsem pits bilong kantri bilong ol.”

original: Just as they have done from the day I brought them up out of Egypt until this day, forsaking Me and serving other gods, so they are doing to you.
translation: Olsem nau ol i mekim bian taim mi bekim ol i kam long lan Egypt klostu long dei nao, ol i lusim Mi na servim god narapela, nau ol i mekim olsem long yu.

original: Now listen to them, but you must solemnly warn them and show them the manner of the king who will reign over them.”
translation: Nau harim tok long ol, na yu mas givim ol warning strongim mosong, na shanem ol long wei bilong king bai i kam rain ovetim ol.

original: So Samuel spoke all the words of the LORD to the people who were asking him for a king.
translation: Na Samuel i tok olgeta wod bilong Bikpela long ol pipol we bai ol i askim em long papa bilong kantry.

original: He said, “This will be the manner of the king who will reign over you: He will take your sons and appoint them to his own chariots and horses, to run in front of his chariots.
translation: Em i tok, “Dispela em i wok bilong king we i go bosim yu: Em bai kisim pikinini bilong yu, givim wok long en long kar bilong en na hos, na ol i ran i go stap bifor kar bilong en.”

original: He will appoint some for himself as commanders of thousands and of fifties, and others to plow his ground, to reap his harvest, to make his weapons of war, and to equip his chariots.
translation: Em i appointim ol samting bilong en: ol kapten bilong tausen na bilong fifiti, na narapela i go plauim graun bilong en, kisim ka bilong en, wokim pasin bilong win war, na savim ol kareta bilong en long war.

original: And he will take your daughters to be perfumers, cooks, and bakers.
translation: Em bai kisim pikinini meri bilong yu olsem smel strong maket, kuk, na bekim.

original: He will take the best of your fields and vineyards and olive groves and give them to his servants.
translation: Em bai kisim gras bilong planim, gaden bilong drai, na olive gaden bilong yu, na bai givim ol i go long servants bilong en.

original: He will take a tenth of your grain and grape harvest and give it to his officials and servants.
translation: Em bai kisim 10% bilong ka harves na grape harves bilong yu, na givim long ofisala na wokman bilong en.

original: And he will take your menservants and maidservants and your best cattle and donkeys and put them to his own use.
translation: Na em bai kisim hausboi na hapkas bilong yu, na bulmakau na donki bilong yu, na raitim ol long ples bilong en, na wokim ol i stap long papa na bos bilong en.

original: He will take a tenth of your flocks, and you yourselves will become his slaves.
translation: Em bai kisim 10% bilong ol pikinini moninga bilong yu, na yupela yet bai bekim servant bilong em.

original: When that day comes, you will beg for relief from the king you have chosen, but the LORD will not answer you on that day.”
translation: Wanpela dea bai kam, yu bai kisim bel hevi na kisim skul long tokim king yu chusim, tasol Bikpela LORD no bilong harim yu long dei.

original: Nevertheless, the people refused to listen to Samuel. “No!” they said. “We must have a king over us.
translation: Be, ol pipol i refus long harim tok bilong Samuel. “Nogat!” ol i tokim. “Mipela mas havim wanpela king ibox long mipela.”

original: Then we will be like all the other nations, with a king to judge us, to go out before us, and to fight our battles.”
translation: Na mipela bai olsem ol narapela kantri, na mipela bai havim wanpela king bilong jujim mipela, i go bifo mipela, na i fait long bikpela faits bilong mipela.

original: Samuel listened to all the words of the people and repeated them in the hearing of the LORD.
translation: Samuwel harim olgeta wod nau na tok olgeta wod long han bilong Papa bilong yu olgeta.

original: “Listen to their voice,” the LORD said to Samuel. “Appoint a king for them.” Then Samuel told the men of Israel, “Everyone must go back to his city.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Samuel, “Harim tok bilong ol, appointim wan king long ol.” Nan Samuel i tokim ol man meri bilong Isrel, “Yupela yet, yupela go bek long ples balus.”

original: Now there was a Benjamite, a powerful man, whose name was Kish son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah of Benjamin.
translation: Em i man bilong Benjimin, man strongpela, nes em Kish, pikinini bilong Abiel, ai bilong Zeror, ai bilong Becorath, ai bilong Aphiah, bilong tribe Benjimin.

original: And he had a son named Saul, choice and handsome, without equal among the Israelites—a head taller than any of the people.
translation: Na em i gat wanpela pikinini man, nem bilong em Saul, em i gutpela na hanos, i no gat narapela olsem long ol Israel—em i longpela hed igo long ol pipol.

original: One day the donkeys of Saul’s father Kish wandered off, and Kish said to his son Saul, “Take one of the servants and go look for the donkeys.”
translation: Wanpela de ol donki bilong papa bilong Saul, Kish, harim i go bek, na Kish i tokim sakem na bilong en, Saul, "Kam bek, yu go wantaim wanpela wokman, go lukim ol donki."

original: So Saul passed through the hill country of Ephraim and then through the land of Shalishah, but did not find the donkeys. He and the servant went through the region of Shaalim, but they were not there. Then they went through the land of Benjamin, and still they did not find them.
translation: Na Saul i pasim go long kantri bilong Efraim, na bihain i go long grun bilong Shalishah, tasol ol i no finim donki. Em na yangpela manmeri yet i go long hap bilong Shaalim, tasol ol i no stap. Ol i go yet long grun bilong Benjamin, na yet ol i no finim.

original: When they reached the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant, “Come, let us go back, or my father will stop worrying about the donkeys and start worrying about us.”
translation: Taim ol i kamap long kantri bilong Zuph, Saul i tokim servant bilong em, "Kam, mipela go bek gen, pap bilong mi bai lisim wori long donki, nau em bai kisim hed long mipela."

original: “Look,” said the servant, “in this city there is a man of God who is highly respected; everything he says surely comes to pass. Let us go there now. Perhaps he will tell us which way to go.”
translation: Lukim, long citei ia gat man bilong God we i gat respek bikpela; olsem olsem em i tok, em i kam tru. Yumi go nau. Em bai inap tokim mipela long rot we yumi mas go.

original: “If we do go,” Saul replied, “what can we give the man? For the bread in our packs is gone, and there is no gift to take to the man of God. What do we have?”
translation: Sapos yumui go, Saul i tok, wanem samting bai yumui givim man? Ka long bilum bilong yumi i pinis, na i no gat kisim gif long go long man bilong God. Wanem samting yumui get?

original: The servant answered him again. “Look,” he said, “I have here in my hand a quarter shekel of silver. I will give it to the man of God, and he will tell us our way.”
translation: Sarvan i givim tok bak long em. "Look," ol i tok, "mi holim hia na mi gat kwata shekel silva. Bai mi givim moni bilong silva i go long man bilong God, na em bai tokim mipela long rot bilong mipela."

original: (Formerly in Israel, a man on his way to inquire of God would say, “Come, let us go to the seer.” For the prophet of today was formerly called the seer.)
translation: Long taim bipo long Israel, man i go askim God olsem, em i kirapim tok, "Mipela i go long man we i save tok bilong God." Na prophet long tudei em i kolim "man we i save tok bilong God" bipo.

original: “Good,” said Saul to his servant. “Come, let us go.” So they set out for the city where the man of God was.
translation: “Nais,” Saul i tokim servis man bilong em, “yumi go nau.” Ol i go i kam bek long siti we man bilong God i stap.

original: And as they were climbing the hill to the city, they met some young women coming out to draw water and asked, “Is the seer here?”
translation: Na ol i go ap long maunten, klimimapim hap bilong taun, ol i kamapim sampela wanchain i kam aut long kamaut long draipim wara, na ol i askim, "Istad seer i stap hia?"

original: “Yes, he is ahead of you,” they answered. “Hurry now, for today he has come to the city because the people have a sacrifice on the high place.
translation: "Em i go bifor yu," ol i tok. "Hariap nau, long tede em i kam long taun bikos ol pipel i gat sakrifis long ples hait."

original: As soon as you enter the city, you will find him before he goes up to the high place to eat. The people will not eat until he comes, because he must bless the sacrifice; after that, the guests will eat. Go up at once; you will find him.”
translation: Olsem yu go insait long taun, yu ken finim em bifo em i go antap long ples bilong aiya kaikai. Ol pipel no ken kaikai yet, ol i wait na em i kam, em i mas givim berek long sakrifis; bihaen long dispela, ol guests bai kaikai. Go antap nau, yu ken finim em.

original: So Saul and his servant went up toward the city, and as they were entering it, there was Samuel coming toward them on his way up to the high place.
translation: Na Saul na husat i stap wantaim em i go apl long siti, na ol i kam insait long em, Samuel i kam i kom long ol, i stap go antap long ples hait.

original: Now on the day before Saul’s arrival, the LORD had revealed to Samuel,
translation: Long moning bipo taim Saul i kam, LORD ibin shoim Samuel.

original: “At this time tomorrow I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you are to anoint him leader over My people Israel; he will save them from the hand of the Philistines. For I have looked upon My people, because their cry has come to Me.”
translation: Bai tumora long taim ia, mi bai sendim man i go long yu, husat i kam from Benjimin, na yu mas givim em autoriti olsem bikman bilong piple Israel bilong Mi, na em bai savim ol long han bilong Filistia. Na Mi laik lookim piple bilong Mi, bikos ol ka ol i kam long me.

original: When Samuel saw Saul, the LORD told him, “Here is the man of whom I spoke; he shall rule over My people.”
translation: Taim Samuel i lukim Saul, Bikpela i tokim em, "Man husat mi bin tok ba olsem na mi bin tok, em bai bosim plesen bilong Mi."

original: Saul approached Samuel in the gateway and asked, “Would you please tell me where the seer’s house is?”
translation: Saul i kam klostu long Samuel long geit peles na em i askim, "Yu tokim mi plis, hus bilong man pros pes i stap we?"

original: “I am the seer,” Samuel replied. “Go up before me to the high place, for you shall eat with me today. And when I send you off in the morning, I will tell you all that is in your heart.
translation: “Mi bikpela siar bilong God,” Samuel i tokim. “Yu go ap gen long ples bilong lotu, bifo olgeta man, na yu ken kaikai wantaim mi tude. Na bihain mi salim yu i go moning, mi bai tokim yu ol samting i stap inside bel bilong yu.”

original: As for the donkeys you lost three days ago, do not worry about them, for they have been found. And upon whom is all the desire of Israel, if not upon you and all your father’s house?”
translation: Ol donki husat iu lusim tri dei bek, no ken wori long ol, ol i kamap nau. Na dispela laik bilong Israel i stap long wanem, tasol long yu na haus bilong papa bilong yu?

original: Saul replied, “Am I not a Benjamite from the smallest tribe of Israel, and is not my clan the least of all the clans of Benjamin? So why would you say such a thing to me?”
translation: Saul i tok bek, “Mipela ol Benjamini no ken long nambauta liklik tribe bilong Isrel, na klana bilong mipela em i las olgeta long ol klan bilong Benjimin? Wai yu tok olsem long me?”

original: Then Samuel took Saul and his servant, brought them into the hall, and seated them in the place of honor among those who were invited—about thirty in all.
translation: Na Samuel i kisim Saul na sarvan bilong em, ol i bringim ol long Haus bilong Kaunsel, na ol i siutin ol long ples bilong respek, long namel bilong ol i kam long invita – ol i stap, ol i kontim ol, tasol i stap long hap tripati.

original: And Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion I gave you and told you to set aside.”
translation: Na Samuel i tokim kuk olsem, "Kisim ka na i bringim, mi givim yu na mi bin tokim yu long putim asiade."

original: So the cook picked up the leg and what was attached to it and set it before Saul. Then Samuel said, “Here is what was kept back. It was set apart for you. Eat, for it has been kept for you for this occasion, from the time I said, ‘I have invited the people.’” So Saul dined with Samuel that day.
translation: Kuk i kisim leg na olsem samting i stap long em, na putim i bifoa Saul. Samuel i tok, "Olsem samting i stop, em i pasim apart long yu, kaikai, nau, bikos em i save long taim we mi tok, 'Mi invaitim ol pipol.' " Na Saul i kaikai wantaim Samuel that dei.

original: And after they had come down from the high place into the city, Samuel spoke with Saul on the roof of his house.
translation: Na Samuwel i tok taktok wantaim Saul long rum bilong haus bilong em, after ol i kam daun long ples hait i go daun long taun.

original: They got up early in the morning, and just before dawn Samuel called to Saul on the roof, “Get ready, and I will send you on your way!” So Saul arose, and both he and Samuel went outside together.
translation: Ol i kamap bikos em i go long moning, na bifor san i go daun yet, Samuel i kirap long Saul long rof, “Bekim yu yet, na yu kam go na mi baim yu i go!” Na Saul i kamap, na tupela i go autsaid long wankain.

original: As they were going down to the edge of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us, but you stay for a while, and I will reveal to you the word of God.” So the servant went on.
translation: Samuwel i tokim Sau, "Tokim hausboi bilong i go befoa mipela, na yu stap liltime yet, na mi bai givim yu save long tok bilong God." Na hausboi i go.

original: Then Samuel took a flask of oil, poured it on Saul’s head, kissed him, and said, “Has not the LORD anointed you ruler over His inheritance?
translation: Na Samuel i kisim wanpela botol ol, em i pourim ol long hed bilong Saul, na em i kisim Saul, em i tok, "Nogo LORD i no bin anointim yu olsem bikman long eni inheritance?"

original: When you leave me today, you will find two men at Rachel’s tomb in Zelzah on the border of Benjamin. They will say to you, ‘The donkeys you seek have been found, and now your father has stopped worrying about the donkeys and started worrying about you, asking, “What should I do about my son?”’
translation: Wanpela taim yu lusim mi tude, yu go finisim twopela man long tambuan bilong Rekel long Zelzah, we bilong kauntri bilong Benjamin. Ol bai tokim yu, 'Mipela kisim donki bilong yu, na nau papa bilong yu i no wori long donki mo, em i kisim wori long yu tasol, em i askim, "Mi mas mekim wanem long pikinini bilong mi?"'

original: Then you will go on from there until you come to the Oak of Tabor. Three men going up to God at Bethel will meet you there, one carrying three young goats, another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a skin of wine.
translation: Bai yu go long nau, na kam long Oak bilong Tabor. Tripela man i go antap long Bethel, stap wantaim God, bai mipela ikam long hap, wanpela i karim tripela youngpela kabim, narakain i karim tripela loaf bilong bret, na naran i karim skin bilong wain.

original: They will greet you and give you two loaves of bread, which you will accept from their hands.
translation: Ol bai givim yu greetings na baim yu givim yu tu loaf bread, na yu mas holim tok bilong ol.

original: After that you will come to Gibeah of God, where the Philistines have an outpost. As you approach the city, you will meet a group of prophets coming down from the high place, preceded by harps, tambourines, flutes, and lyres, and they will be prophesying.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, yu go kas long Gibea bilong God, we ol Filisitia i stap wachim ples. Wanem taim yu i kam klostu long taun, yu go kilim wanpela grup bilong profet i kam doun long ples hait, ol i go bifor wantaim hap, tamborin, flaut, na lai, na ol i stap profet.

original: Then the Spirit of the LORD will rush upon you, and you will prophesy with them; and you will be transformed into a different person.
translation: Spirits bilong Jehovah bai kam harim yu, na yu bai tok strong moning wantaim ol, na yu bai chanj long narapela man.

original: When these signs have come, do as the occasion demands, for God is with you.
translation: Wanpela taim singsingsi i kamap, wokim ol samting we tok bilong taim i askim, bikos Bikpela i stap wantaim yu.

original: And you shall go before me to Gilgal, and surely I will come to you to offer burnt offerings and to sacrifice peace offerings. Wait seven days until I come to you and show you what you are to do.”
translation: Yu go longlong bifo mi long Gilgal, na tru, mi kam bek long yu long me ofa ol burnt ofring na sakrifaisim ol pis ofring. Waitim seven de yet, until mi kam long yu na showim yu ol samting we yu mas mekim.

original: As Saul turned to leave Samuel, God changed Saul’s heart, and all the signs came to pass that day.
translation: Wanpela taim Saul i turnim bek long lusim Samuel, Bikpela i chanim bel bilong Saul, na ol sain bilong prophest i kamap olsem wanpela de.

original: When Saul and his servant arrived at Gibeah, a group of prophets met him. Then the Spirit of God rushed upon him, and he prophesied along with them.
translation: Taim Saul na servan bilong em i kamap long Gibeah, wanpela grup bilong ol prophets i go ap long en. Na Spirut bilong God i paul long en, na em i prophesied wantaim ol.

original: All those who had formerly known Saul and saw him prophesying with the prophets asked one another, “What has happened to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?”
translation: Ol pipel we ol i save long Saul bikos em i stap bifora, na ol i lukim em i prophesy wantaim ol prophet, ol i askim wanwan bilong ol, "Wanem nau i kamap long pikinini bilong Kish? Saul i stap wantaim ol prophet tu o?"

original: Then a man who lived there replied, “And who is their father?” So the saying became a proverb: “Is Saul also among the prophets?”
translation: Wanpela man we i stap berepela ples i tok, “Na papa bilong ol i husat?” Na tok bilong ol i kamap tok bilong ol: “Saul tu ibin go bek gen long ol man bilong spirit?”

original: And when Saul had finished prophesying, he went up to the high place.
translation: Na Saul em i winim tok bilong Spirit, em i go apo long ples hait.

original: Now Saul’s uncle asked him and his servant, “Where did you go?” “To look for the donkeys,” Saul replied. “When we saw they were not to be found, we went to Samuel.”
translation: Pikinini bilong papa bilong Saul i askim em na sariman bilong en, "Yu go we?" Saul i tok, "Mipela go lukim donki." Em i tok, "Tasol mipela no findim donki, mipela go long Samuwel."

original: “Tell me,” Saul’s uncle asked, “what did Samuel say to you?”
translation: Ambra bilong Saul i askim, "Samuel i tokim yu long wanem samting?"

original: And Saul replied, “He assured us that the donkeys had been found.” But Saul did not tell his uncle what Samuel had said about the kingship.
translation: Na Saul i tokim ol, "Em i givim mipela konfides ol donki ibin sampai." Tasol Saul i no tokim ples bilong em wusai Samuel i bin tokim em long pipia.

original: After this, Samuel summoned the people to the LORD at Mizpah
translation: Nambis i go, Samuwel i kalim ol pipol long han bilong LORD long Mizpa.

original: and said to the Israelites, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I brought Israel up out of Egypt, and I rescued you from the hands of the Egyptians and of all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’
translation: Ol i tokim long ol Israel, “Dispela em i tok bilong LORDE, GOD bilong Israel: ‘Mi bringim Israel i kam bek long Egip, na mi savim yu long hen bilong ol Egip na long hen bilong ol kingdom we i bagarapim yu.’”

original: But today you have rejected your God, who saves you from all your troubles and afflictions, and you have said to Him, ‘No, set a king over us.’ Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes and clans.”
translation: Tudei yu rimsim bikos yu lusim God bilong yu, hu igo long sev yu frem ol geta hevi na sorere, na yu tokim em, 'Nogat, mipela ilaikim king i kam bosim mipela.' Nau olsem, yu mas kam bekim yuself bifor LORD, ol ples grupe na ol famili grupe.

original: Thus Samuel had all the tribes of Israel come forward, and the tribe of Benjamin was selected.
translation: Na Samuwel i tokim olgeta tribe bilong Isrel i kam nau, na tribe bilong Benjamin em i pikinim.

original: Then he had the tribe of Benjamin come forward by its clans, and the clan of Matri was selected. Finally, Saul son of Kish was selected. But when they looked for him, they could not find him.
translation: Na tribe bilong Benjamin i kam bek i go, klans bilong em i go, na klan bilong Matri i skelim. Na Saul sambai bilong Kish i skelim tu. Tasol taim ol i lukim em, ol i no inap finim em.

original: So again they inquired of the LORD, “Has the man come here yet?” And the LORD replied, “Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage.”
translation: Ol i askim LORD gen, "Man i kam hia yet?" Na LORD i tok, "Yu lukim, em i kaivim em yet long ol samting bilong ol."

original: So they ran and brought Saul, and when he stood among the people, he was a head taller than any of the others.
translation: Ol i ran na bringim Saul, na em i stap namel long ol pipol, em i long wan hed moa long ol.

original: Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see the one the LORD has chosen? There is no one like him among all the people.” And all the people shouted, “Long live the king!”
translation: Samuel i tokim ol pipol olgeta, “Yupela lukim dispela wanpela we Bikpela i pikinim? Ino gat narapela man olsem em long ol pipol olgeta.” Na ol pipol ol i singaut, “Papa bilong kantri i stap oltaim!”

original: Then Samuel explained to the people the rights of kingship. He wrote them on a scroll and laid it up before the LORD. And Samuel sent all the people away, each to his own home.
translation: Na Samuel i tok klia long ol pipol raits bilong kingly ship. Em i wraitim ol samting long banis na lakim i go hap long LORD. Na Samuel i sendim ol pipol i go bek, yú yet long husat, i go long haus bilong em.

original: Saul also went to his home in Gibeah, and the men of valor whose hearts God had touched went with him.
translation: Saul i go long haus bilong en long Gibea, na ol man bilong strong ol hart bilong ol i bin točim ol long han bilong God, ol i go wantaim em.

original: But some worthless men said, “How can this man save us?” So they despised him and brought him no gifts; but Saul remained silent about it.
translation: Bikos ol man i no gat pekela tok i talk, ol i tok, "Hamas long olsem man i saveim mipela?" Na ol i biruaim em, ol i no bringim gif long en; tasol Saul i stap silent olsem sain bilong respek o isip long birua.

original: Soon Nahash the Ammonite came up and laid siege to Jabesh-gilead. All the men of Jabesh said to him, “Make a treaty with us, and we will serve you.”
translation: Nahash bilong Ammon i kam up na i kam wai long Jabesh-gilead. Ol man bilong Jabesh i tokim em, “Mekim pepa bilong pisi wantaim mipela, na mipela bai sarvim yu.”

original: But Nahash the Ammonite replied, “I will make a treaty with you on one condition, that I may put out everyone’s right eye and bring reproach upon all Israel.”
translation: Nahash king bilong Ammonite em i tok bek, “Mipela i mekim pinis treaty wantaim yu long wan condishen tasol, dat mipela i rausim ai klost long ol, na mipela i bringim sham long ol Israel.”

original: “Hold off for seven days,” replied the elders of Jabesh, “and let us send messengers throughout Israel. If there is no one to save us, we will surrender to you.”
translation: “Bai yumi go bak long seven dei,” ol Bikpela i wok long Jabesh tok, “na yumi salim messenja ol i go long ol ples bilong Israel. I sapos igat narapela man i ken saveim mipela, tasol sapos inogat, mipela bai givim yupla.”

original: When the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul and relayed these words in the hearing of the people, they all wept aloud.
translation: Taim em ol messenja i kam long Gibeat bilong Saul na ol i tokim ol dispela wod long han bilong piple, ol i kisim bikmus na kalap.

original: Just then Saul was returning from the field, behind his oxen. “What troubles the people?” asked Saul. “Why are they weeping?” And they relayed to him the words of the men from Jabesh.
translation: Taim olsem Saul i kam bek long bus, i stap bihain long ol bulmakau. “Wanem samting i wari ol pipol?” asked Saul. “Ol i kirap olsem wanem?” Na ol i toktok long em ol tok bilong ol man bilong Jabesh.

original: When Saul heard their words, the Spirit of God rushed upon him, and he burned with great anger.
translation: Taim Saul harim toktok bilong ol, Spirut bilong God i kam aut na go long en, na bel bilong en i bagarap strong.

original: He took a pair of oxen, cut them into pieces, and sent them by messengers throughout the land of Israel, proclaiming, “This is what will be done to the oxen of anyone who does not march behind Saul and Samuel.” Then the terror of the LORD fell upon the people, and they turned out as one man.
translation: Em i kisim tupela bulmakau, em i katim ol i go het long pisin, na em i sendim ol go long ol messenja bilong en na wasim ol long graun bilong Israel, ol i autim tok bilong wen: “Dispela em i nid bilong kamap long bulmakau bilong eni man husat no inap maras bihain long Saul na Samuel.” Na guiriau bilong LORD i kam panim ol pipel, na ol i kamap wanpain tasol.

original: And when Saul numbered them at Bezek, there were 300,000 Israelites and 30,000 men of Judah.
translation: Taim Saul i kam kauntim ol long Bezek, na i gat 300,000 Israelait bilong yumi na 30,000 man bilong Judah.

original: So they said to the messengers who had come, “Tell the men of Jabesh-gilead: ‘Deliverance will be yours tomorrow by the time the sun is hot.’” And when the messengers relayed this to the men of Jabesh, they rejoiced.
translation: Ol i tokim mesija: “Tokim ol man bilong Jabesh-Gilead: ‘Bai yu kamap fri long tude, long taem san i hot.’” Na mesija i tokim dispela, ol i amamas.

original: Then the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Tomorrow we will come out, and you can do with us whatever seems good to you.”
translation: Na ol man bilong Jabesh i tok long Nahash, “Tude mipela bai kam aut, na yu ina mekim wanem olsem yu ting ba yu gat gutpela long mipela.”

original: The next day Saul organized the troops into three divisions, and during the morning watch they invaded the camp of the Ammonites and slaughtered them, until the hottest part of the day. And the survivors were so scattered that no two of them were left together.
translation: Nekis dei Saul i organisim solja long tripela gris, na long taem moning bifo de i go antap long kanua bilong Amunait na wasim ol, na ol i kilim ol, stat long moning tasol, na i go inap long taem wea de i hot. Na ol i birua yet, na no tupela i stap long wan ples, ol i skatera everever.

original: Then the people said to Samuel, “Who said that Saul should not reign over us? Bring those men here so we can kill them!”
translation: Ol pipel i tokim Samuel, “Husat i tok olsem Saul no ken wokim gavman long yumi? Kam na bringim ol man ya i kam, nau yumi ken kilim ol!”

original: But Saul ordered, “No one shall be put to death this day, for today the LORD has worked salvation in Israel.”
translation: Bikos Saul i givim orden, “Inap emas kilim ol dispela de, long tajm nau Bikpela i wokim salvesen long Isrel.”

original: Then Samuel said to the people, “Come, let us go to Gilgal and renew the kingship there.”
translation: Na Samuel i tokim ol pipol, "Kam, yumui yet go long Gilgal na renuim kingship gen long hap."

original: So all the people went to Gilgal and confirmed Saul as king in the presence of the LORD. There they sacrificed peace offerings before the LORD, and Saul and all the Israelites rejoiced greatly.
translation: Olgeta man i go long Gilgal na tupla i konfirmim Saul olsem king long ai bilong Bikpela. Oli i bringim peis ofa bifor Bikpela, na Saul na olgeta Israel pipol i amamas tru.

original: Then Samuel said to all Israel, “I have listened to your voice in all that you have said to me, and I have set over you a king.
translation: Na Samuel i tok long ol Israel, "Mi haren i go long voys bilong yu olgeta we yu tokim mi, na mi putim wan king i kam autim bikos yu."

original: Now here is the king walking before you, and I am old and gray, and my sons are here with you. I have walked before you from my youth until this day.
translation: Nau em i king i kam bifo yumi, na mi ol i go na graun, na pikinini bilong mi ol i stap wantaim yumi. Mi warkabaut bihain yumi long tumbuna nau tasol, stat long tumbuna bilong mi yet, kam inap long dei nau.

original: Here I am. Bear witness against me before the LORD and before His anointed: Whose ox or donkey have I taken? Whom have I cheated or oppressed? From whose hand have I accepted a bribe and closed my eyes? Tell me, and I will restore it to you.”
translation: Mi stap here. Kam witnes long me bifor Long GOD na bifor em i govena: Bulmakau o donki bilong husat mi tekem? Husat mi bin giaman o bin bagarap? Long han bilong husat mi kisim moni bilong bikim pes na painim ai bai mi? Tusim, na bai mi givim bek long yu.

original: “You have not wronged us or oppressed us,” they replied, “nor have you taken anything from the hand of man.”
translation: Yu no bin mekim rong long mipela, yu no bin bagarapim mipela, nau yu no bin kisim samting long han bilong man.

original: Samuel said to them, “The LORD is a witness against you, and His anointed is a witness today, that you have not found anything in my hand.” “He is a witness,” they replied.
translation: Samuel i tokim ol long ol, “Papa God em i witnes agenst yumupela, na anointed bilong Em i witnes tude, olsem yumupela no finim sampela samting long han bilong mi.” Ol i tok, “Em i witnes.”

original: Then Samuel said to the people, “The LORD is the One who appointed Moses and Aaron, and who brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Na Samuel i tokim ol pipol, “LORD em i man bilong paitim Moses na Aaron, na ol i karim tumbuna bilong yupela long kantri Egypt.”

original: Now present yourselves, so that I may confront you before the LORD with all the righteous acts He has done for you and your fathers.
translation: Nau bai yumas yet long ai bilong yuself, em i kam bekim yu bifor ol i go long LORD, na em i tokautim ol wok nem bung ol gutpela em i mekim long yupela na tumbuna bilong yupela.

original: When Jacob went to Egypt, your fathers cried out to the LORD, and He sent them Moses and Aaron, who brought your fathers out of Egypt and settled them in this place.
translation: Taim Yakob i go long Ijip, papa bilong yu ol i kirap strong long LORD, na em i salim Mosis na Aron i go long ol, ol i bringim papa bilong yu ol i kamaut long Ijip, na ol i pisin plantim ol long hap gras.

original: But they forgot the LORD their God, and He sold them into the hand of Sisera the commander of the army of Hazor, and into the hands of the Philistines and the king of Moab, who fought against them.
translation: Tasol ol lusim ol i forgot long Bikpela God bilong ol, na em salim ol i go long han bilong Sisera kapten bilong armi bilong Hazor, na long han bilong Filistia na king bilong Moab, ol i fait wantaim ol.

original: Then they cried out to the LORD and said, ‘We have sinned, for we have forsaken the LORD and served the Baals and Ashtoreths. Now deliver us from the hands of our enemies, that we may serve You.’
translation: Ol i kirap long LorD na tukim tok, 'Mipela i sin, mipela lusi tru go long LorD, mipela servim Baals na Ashtoreths. Nau kisim mipela long han bilong ol enemies mipela, mipela inap sarve Yu.'

original: So the LORD sent Jerubbaal, Barak, Jephthah, and Samuel, and He delivered you from the hands of your enemies on every side, and you dwelt securely.
translation: Na LORD i sendim Jerubbaal, Barak, Jephthah, na Samuel, na bam bikim yu fri long han bilong yu enemy long olgeta sait, na yu stap gut long ples.

original: But when you saw that Nahash king of the Ammonites was moving against you, you said to me, ‘No, we must have a king to rule over us’—even though the LORD your God was your king.
translation: Bikos yu lukim olsem Nahash king bilong Ammonites i kam narak long yu, yu tokim mi, 'Nogat, mipela mas havim wanpela king bilong rulim mipela' – ol i go we, tasol GOD bilong yu em i king bilong yu.

original: Now here is the king you have chosen, the one you requested. Behold, the LORD has placed a king over you.
translation: Nau em i king yu bin askim, em i wanpela yu bin chusim. Nau em i, LORD ibin putim em i go long yu ol, na em i bikhet long yu.

original: If you fear the LORD and serve Him and obey His voice, and if you do not rebel against the command of the LORD, and if both you and the king who reigns over you follow the LORD your God, then all will be well.
translation: Sapos yu i saving tambuasim Lord, servisim Em, harim tok bilong Em, na yu no givim bagarap long tok bilong Lord, na sapos yu na king bilong yu we i rein long yu folowim Lord God bilong yu, orait olgeta bai i gut.

original: But if you disobey the LORD and rebel against His command, then the hand of the LORD will be against you as it was against your fathers.
translation: Sapos yu no kamapim laut na yu wari long Komando bilong LORD, orait han bilong LORD bai i kam against yu olsem em i bin kam against tumbuna bilong yu.

original: Now, therefore, stand and see this great thing that the LORD will do before your eyes.
translation: Nau, olsem na, stap na lukim dispela bikpela wok we LORDE bai mekim bifor ai bilong yu.

original: Is it not the wheat harvest today? I will call on the LORD to send thunder and rain, so that you will know and see what a great evil you have committed in the sight of the LORD by asking for a king.”
translation: Nogat tasol hariap long taim bilong ka haris tude? Mi bai kolim LORD na hem bai senisim ren na thanda, na yu bai save na lukim pikinini iu gat bikpela hatwok long askim papa bilong ol kantri long ai bilong LORD.

original: So Samuel called to the LORD, and on that day the LORD sent thunder and rain. As a result, all the people greatly feared the LORD and Samuel.
translation: Na Samuel i harim tok bilong Jehovah, na Jehovah i bikim thunder na ren long dei nem. Ol pipol i gat Bikpela fear nau long Jehovah na Samuel, bikos ol i si how Jehovah i wark long ol pipol thruim dispela geta rain na thunder.

original: They pleaded with Samuel, “Pray to the LORD your God for your servants so that we will not die! For we have added to all our sins the evil of asking for a king.”
translation: Ol i kirapim Samuel, “Prae long tok bilong Bikpela, na bikos yumi wokman meri, praem long em bilong me na yumi no ken dai! Bipos yumi kisim sin bilong yumi yet, yumi wokim moa, olsem na yumi askim papa bilong kantri, tasol em i nogat gutpela.”

original: “Do not be afraid,” Samuel replied. “Even though you have committed all this evil, do not turn aside from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart.
translation: No ken slip long fear, Samuel i tok. Olsem yu mekim olgeta samting nogut, no lem i go bek gen long rot bilong LORD, tasol sarve LORD wantaim hap bilong yu.

original: Do not turn aside after worthless things that cannot profit you or deliver you, for they are empty.
translation: No ken go na wai long ol samting nogut, olgetting i no ken givim strong long yu o no ken saveim yu, wantaim ol i no gat kain samting, bilong ol i emti.

original: Indeed, for the sake of His great name, the LORD will not abandon His people, because He was pleased to make you His own.
translation: Tru, long namel bilong Em i gat bikpela nem, LORD bai no lusim ol pipol bilong En, wantaim em i laik makim yu bilong En yet.

original: As for me, far be it from me that I should sin against the LORD by ceasing to pray for you. And I will continue to teach you the good and right way.
translation: Long mi, nogat samting long me, bai bagarap agensim LORD, haitim prea long yu. Na mi bai kontinu long tisim yu long wei gutpela na rait.

original: Above all, fear the LORD and serve Him faithfully with all your heart; consider what great things He has done for you.
translation: Long olgeta samting, yu mas gat respek long Lod na servim em olsem yu tru wantaim hap bel; tingim bikpela samting em i mekim long yu.

original: But if you persist in doing evil, both you and your king will be swept away.”
translation: Bikos if yu kontinu long mekim ol samting nogut, yu na papa bilong yu yet, biceman, bai ol i go daun, na yu na king bilong yu bai i go long wei, ol geta i kalabusim yu.

original: Saul was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel forty-two years.
translation: Saul em i 30 yia na em bin kamap king, na em i bin kilim gavman long Israel 42 yia.

original: He chose for himself three thousand men of Israel: Two thousand were with Saul at Michmash and in the hill country of Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin. And the rest of the troops he sent away, each to his own home.
translation: Em i pikim 3000 man bilong Isrel, na em yet kam: 2000 i stap wantaim Saul long Michmash na klostu maunten bilong Betel, na 1000 i stap wantaim Jonatan long Gibea bilong Benjamen. Na ol arapela solja em i sendim bek, yupla i go bek long ples bilong yupela.

original: Then Jonathan attacked the Philistine outpost at Geba, and the Philistines heard about it. So Saul blew the ram’s horn throughout the land, saying, “Let the Hebrews hear!”
translation: Na Jonathan i go bekim ples bilong Philistine long Geba, na ol Philistine i harim tok bilong em. Olsem Saul i blowim horn bilong ram long halivim kantri, i tok: "Hebrews i harm!"

original: And all Israel heard the news: “Saul has attacked an outpost of the Philistines, and now Israel has become a stench to the Philistines!” Then the people were summoned to join Saul at Gilgal.
translation: Na ol Isrel i harim tok bilong dispela: "Saul i go bekim wanpela hap bilong Philistines, na nau Israel i kamap strong smel long ol Philistines!" Den ol pipol i kalim i go joiim Saul long Gilgal.

original: Now the Philistines assembled to fight against Israel with three thousand chariots, six thousand horsemen, and troops as numerous as the sand on the seashore. They went up and camped at Michmash, east of Beth-aven.
