translation: Nau Filistia ol i kam long pait na go fight gen Isrel, wantaim tri tausen kareta, sikis tausen soldia husat i ridim hors, na ol solida i plenti olsem san long becia. Ol i go apo na kamp long Mikmas, long sait bilong east bilong Bet-aven.

original: Seeing that they were in danger because their troops were hard-pressed, the men of Israel hid in caves and thickets, among the rocks, and in cellars and cisterns.
translation: Ol manmeri bilong Isrel i kaipim long hol bilong guinea, bus na graas, long roks, ples bilong paipe, na hul bilong wata, bikos ol i stap long trabel na soldia bilong ol i kisim presha.

original: Some Hebrews even crossed the Jordan into the land of Gad and Gilead. Saul, however, remained at Gilgal, and all his troops were quaking in fear.
translation: Ol Jiwai yet kam bek long riva Jordan, go insait long grun bilong Gad na Gilead. Saul, tasol i stap yet long Gilgal, na ol soja bilong em i skelim olgeta long bikpela fears.

original: And Saul waited seven days for the time appointed by Samuel, but Samuel did not come to Gilgal, and the troops began to desert Saul.
translation: Na Saul i wail long seven de olsem taim we Samuwel i tokim, tasol Samuwel i no kam long Gilgal, na ol soja i stat long lusim Saul.

original: So he said, “Bring me the burnt offering and the peace offerings.” And he offered up the burnt offering.
translation: Em tok, "Kisim long me kae bilong faia na peis ofing." Na em lil tanim na ofim ap kae bilong faia.

original: Just as he finished offering the burnt offering, Samuel arrived, and Saul went out to greet him.
translation: Olsem em i pinis long ofa sakrament, Samuel i kam, na Saul i go aut long welkamim em.

original: “What have you done?” Samuel asked. And Saul replied, “When I saw that the troops were deserting me, and that you did not come at the appointed time and the Philistines were gathering at Michmash,
translation: Samuel askim, “Wanem yu mekim?” Saul i tok bak, “Mi lukim ol soja i lusim mi, na yu no kam long taim we yumi planim, na Filistia i kam olgeta long Mikmas,”

original: I thought, ‘Now the Philistines will descend upon me at Gilgal, and I have not sought the favor of the LORD.’ So I felt compelled to offer the burnt offering.”
translation: Mi bin ting, ‘Nau Filistia ol i kam daun long me long Gilgal, na mi no bin bilip strong long mana bilong LORD.’ Na mipela bin gat strepela pasin long givim ofing we bilong bungim.

original: “You have acted foolishly,” Samuel declared. “You have not kept the command that the LORD your God gave you; if you had, the LORD would have established your kingdom over Israel for all time.
translation: “Yu wok olsem nating,” Samuel tok. “Yu no holim komando we LORD, Bikpela bilong yu, givim yu; iga yu holim, LORD bai plantim kingdom bilong yu long Israel foreva.”

original: But now your kingdom will not endure; the LORD has sought a man after His own heart and appointed him ruler over His people, because you have not kept the command of the LORD.”
translation: Bai nau ples bilong yu no ken stap; LORD em i lukim man we i gat het bilong em yet na em i nemim em olsem papa bilong ol pipol, bikos yu no bihainim tok impoten bilong LORD.

original: Then Samuel set out from Gilgal and went up to Gibeah in Benjamin. And Saul numbered the troops who were with him, about six hundred men.
translation: Na Samuel i go ap long Gilgal na i go long Gibea i stap long Benjamin. Na Saul i kaunim solja i stap wantaim em, olsem sikis hundred man.

original: Now Saul and Jonathan his son and the troops with them were staying in Geba of Benjamin, while the Philistines camped at Michmash.
translation: Nau Saul na Jonathan i stap, soljas ol i stap wantaim ol long Geba bilong Benjimin, wail Filistia i kam pundaun, oli stap long Michmash.

original: And raiders went out of the Philistine camp in three divisions. One headed toward Ophrah in the land of Shual,
translation: Na ol raider i go aut long tripela lain bilong kamp bilong Filistia. Wanpela i go long wei bilong Ophrah long lan bilong Shual,

original: another toward Beth-horon, and the third down the border road overlooking the Valley of Zeboim facing the wilderness.
translation: Wanpela i go long Bet-Horon, na thaad i go daun long rot bilong borda we i lukdaon long hap bilong Vali bilong Zeboim em i facin desert.

original: And no blacksmith could be found in all the land of Israel, because the Philistines had said, “The Hebrews must not be allowed to make swords or spears.”
translation: Na i no bin pikinim smith blak long ples Isrel, bikos Filistia ol i tok, "Judah man i no inap long mekim sords na spia."

original: Instead, all the Israelites would go down to the Philistines to sharpen their plowshares, mattocks, axes, and sickles.
translation: Nogat, ol Pipol Israel oli go daun long Philistia na paitim shaap long ol pis bilong bilum, katana, akisa, na sipika.

original: The charge was a pim for sharpening a plowshare or mattock, a third of a shekel for sharpening a pitchfork or an axe, and a third of a shekel for repointing an oxgoad.
translation: Kos em i bin pim long sharpenim pati bilong plau o hap kasal, na tripod shekel long sharpenim fork bilong pukim kaukau o akisa, na tripod shekel long wokim pinis gen sip bilong droim bulmakau.

original: So on the day of battle not a sword or spear could be found in the hands of the troops with Saul and Jonathan; only Saul and his son Jonathan had weapons.
translation: Long de bikpela de peles, maski sop na spia i no inap komap long han bilong ol solja wantaim Saul na Jonathan; tasol Saul na Jonatan inap havim wep.

original: And a garrison of the Philistines had gone out to the pass at Michmash.
translation: Na wanpela garison bilong Filistia i go aut long pas bilong Mikmas.

original: One day Jonathan son of Saul said to the young man bearing his armor, “Come, let us cross over to the Philistine outpost on the other side.” But Jonathan did not tell his father.
translation: Wanpela de Jonathan sussa bilong Saul i tokim man i kisim armob long han bilong en, "Kam, mipela i go pas long hap side, long ples bilong Filistia." Tasol Jonathan i no tokim papa bilong en.

original: Meanwhile, Saul was staying under the pomegranate tree in Migron on the outskirts of Gibeah. And the troops who were with him numbered about six hundred men,
translation: Wanpela taim, Saul i stap aninit long diwai pomegranate long Migron, long wei igo long Gibeah. Na ol solja i stap wantaim em, rabi six hundred man.

original: including Ahijah, who was wearing an ephod. He was the son of Ichabod’s brother Ahitub son of Phinehas, the son of Eli the priest of the LORD in Shiloh. But the troops did not know that Jonathan had left.
translation: Inklusiv Ahija, i bin werem ephod. Em i pikinini bilong brata bilong Ikabod Ahitub, sun bilong Fineas, sun bilong Eli praist bilong LORD long Silo. Bat ol solder no save olsem Jonatan i go pinis.

original: Now there were cliffs on both sides of the pass that Jonathan intended to cross to reach the Philistine outpost. One was named Bozez and the other Seneh.
translation: Long long hap bilong tu olgeta sait i stap, na klip i go daun long olgeta sait bilong pas we Jonathan laik pas long en, ol i kamap long ples Philisti bilong wachim. Wanpela klip em i kolim Bozez, na narapela klip em i kolim Seneh.

original: One cliff stood to the north toward Michmash, and the other to the south toward Geba.
translation: Wanpela klip i stap long not tumas Michmash, na narta wan i stap long saut tumas Geba.

original: Jonathan said to the young man bearing his armor, “Come, let us cross over to the outpost of these uncircumcised men. Perhaps the LORD will work on our behalf. Nothing can hinder the LORD from saving, whether by many or by few.”
translation: Jonatan i tokim yung man we i karim armo bilong en, “Kam, mipela go karim go long ples outpost bilong ol man we i no katim skin bilong ol. Em bai LORD wok long han bilong mipela. Noting i stap harim LORD long save, bikos em i save olgeta, sapos em i usim planti o few.”

original: His armor-bearer replied, “Do all that is in your heart. Go ahead; I am with you heart and soul.”
translation: Man i kisim skitu bilong warrior em i tok bek, “Wokim ol samting we i stap long het bilong yu, go na; mi stap wantaim yu long het na long sol.”

original: “Very well,” said Jonathan, “we will cross over toward these men and show ourselves to them.
translation: “Em i orait,” Jonatan i tok, “yumi go pas long sindaun i go, na yumi kam bek long ol, ili ol i harim yumi.”

original: If they say, ‘Wait until we come to you,’ then we will stay where we are and will not go up to them.
translation: Olaki ol i tok, 'Wet na yumai kam long mipela,' then mipela bai stap yet long ples na bai no go antap long ol.

original: But if they say, ‘Come on up,’ then we will go up, because this will be our sign that the LORD has delivered them into our hands.”
translation: Bai oliki bilem tok, "Kam na kam antap," dispenser yumi bai go antap, bikos dispela bai bilong yumi sindaun bilong Papa God, olsem Papa God i givim ol long han bilong yumi.

original: So the two of them showed themselves to the outpost of the Philistines, who exclaimed, “Look, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes in which they were hiding!”
translation: Na tupela i sanap long ples bilong wachim bilong Filisitia, na ol i krikim, "Lookim, Ibrim i kam apo, ol i kam aut bilong hole ol i hide pinis!"

original: So the men of the outpost called out to Jonathan and his armor-bearer, “Come on up, and we will teach you a lesson!” “Follow me,” Jonathan told his armor-bearer, “for the LORD has delivered them into the hand of Israel.”
translation: Ol man i stap long ples bilong wara, ol kalim ol i go long Jonathan na man i karim wei bilong pait bilong en, "Kam na kam i go antap, mi bai lusim yu save!" "Bihain me," Jonathan i tokim man i karim wei bilong pait bilong en, "Bikpela i givim fri long ol long han bilong Israel."

original: So Jonathan climbed up on his hands and feet, with his armor-bearer behind him. And the Philistines fell before Jonathan, and his armor-bearer followed and finished them off.
translation: Na Jonatan i go ap long han na leg, wantaim man i karim armas i stap bihain long em. Na Filistia ol i pilak long graun bifo Jonathan, na man i karim armas i follem na i kilim ol.

original: In that first assault, Jonathan and his armor-bearer struck down about twenty men over half an acre of land.
translation: Long hap bilong em i kam, Jonatan na man i kisim kot bilong en i kilim daun ol man long hap twenty long hap halv acre bilong graun.

original: Then terror struck the Philistines in the camp, in the field, and among all the people. Even those in the outposts and raiding parties trembled. Indeed, the earth quaked and panic spread from God.
translation: Na win blong fear i kam long Filistia, long kamp, long gras, na long ol pipol. Ol pipol long ples bilong wachim na grup bilong man i go bagarapim, ol i skelim strong long fea. Gras blong earth i shake, na wari i go ol abaot, kikim win blong dei i kam long ol, long banis bilong God.

original: Now when Saul’s watchmen at Gibeah in Benjamin looked and saw the troops melting away and scattering in every direction,
translation: Taim ol wachman bilong Saul long Gibea na Benjamen i luk, ol i si dispela trop i go daun na bikim ol sel bilong en i sak long olgeta hap.

original: Saul said to the troops who were with him, “Call the roll and see who has left us.” And when they had called the roll, they saw that Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not there.
translation: Saul i tokim solja i stap wantaim em, “Kisim nem bilong ol, lukim husat i go pinis.” Na taim ol i kisim nem bilong ol, ol i lukim Jonathan na man i kisim armoh bilong em i no stap.

original: Then Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring the ark of God.” (For at that time it was with the Israelites.)
translation: Na Saul i tokim Ahijah, “Kam bekim bokis bilong God.” (Bikos em i stap wantaim Israel long taim ia.)

original: While Saul was talking to the priest, the commotion in the Philistine camp continued to increase. So Saul said to the priest, “Withdraw your hand.”
translation: Wail Saul i tok long pris, ol geta long kamp bilong Filistia i go antap moa yet. Na Saul i tok long pris, "Kam bek gen han bilong yu."

original: Then Saul and all his troops assembled and marched to the battle, and they found the Philistines in total confusion, with each man wielding the sword against his neighbor.
translation: Saul na olgeta solja bilong em i kam together, ol i go long war, na ol i lukim Philistines i stap long bikpela konfusen, ol i kilim ol yet, nen bilong en i holim sup ia na i kilim nem bilong en.

original: And the Hebrews who had previously gone up into the surrounding camps of the Philistines now went over to the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
translation: Na Hebre pipal i go apa long kampong bilong Filistia bipo, nau ol i go klostu long Yisrael i stap wantaim Saul na Jonatan.

original: When all the Israelites who had been hiding in the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines were fleeing, they also joined Saul and Jonathan in the battle.
translation: Wanpela taim ol Israeliti ol i save hide long bus bilong maunten Efrayim harim dispela tok, ol Philistine i ranawe, na ol joi Saul na Jonathan long bikpela fait.

original: So the LORD saved Israel that day, and the battle moved on beyond Beth-aven.
translation: Na Papa God i savem Israel ol i dai, na gen i go pas long Beth-aven.

original: Now the men of Israel were in distress that day, for Saul had placed the troops under an oath, saying, “Cursed is the man who eats any food before evening, before I have taken vengeance on my enemies.” So none of the troops tasted any food.
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i stap in trabel na dei, bikos Saul i makim solwara long ol soldier, i tok, "Man husat i kaikai bek bifora san i go doun, bai em i masalai, na mi yet kam kilim aibek long enemy bilong mi." Olsem nau, i no gat sipsip man yet long ol soldier.

original: Then all the troops entered the forest, and there was honey on the ground.
translation: Olgeta soljia i go insait long bus, na ol i lukim hani i stap long graun.

original: And when they entered the forest and saw the flowing honey, not one of them put his hand to his mouth, because they feared the oath.
translation: Taim ol i go insait long bus, na ol i lukim honey i flow, not wanpela bilong ol i putim han bilong en long maus bilong en, bikos ol i bikim fear long promis.

original: Jonathan, however, had not heard that his father had charged the people with the oath. So he reached out the end of the staff in his hand, dipped it into the honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes brightened.
translation: Yonatan, tasol, em i no harim olsem tata bilong em i bin kisim olegomen long piple. Na em i stretim hap blo stick bilong em i holim, paulim i go daun igo insait long bek blo sirope, na putim han bilong en igo long maus bilong en; na ei bilong en i kamap braait.

original: Then one of the soldiers told him, “Your father bound the troops with a solemn oath, saying, ‘Cursed is the man who eats food today.’ That is why the people are faint.”
translation: Wanpela bilong ol soja i tokim em, “Papa bilong yu i bin bainim ol yet long hap tumora, i tok, ‘Man i kaikai kaikai today i kros.’ Ol pipel i no inap strong bikos ol i no kaikai, na tasol ol i lak luk strong.”

original: “My father has brought trouble to the land,” Jonathan replied. “Just look at how my eyes have brightened because I tasted a little of this honey.
translation: Jonatan i tok, "Papa bilong mi bringim hevi long ples. Lukim ai bilong mi i kamap braait bikos mi kaikai liklik hap bilong hinis."

original: How much better it would have been if the troops had eaten freely today from the plunder they took from their enemies! Would not the slaughter of the Philistines have been much greater?”
translation: Em bai bikos em i gutpela, ol solja i kaikai fri long tude na kisim olgeta poisen bilong ol Philistines! Emas long olsem bikos em i gutpela, kisim olgeta na kilim ol Philistines bai bringim moa ded bilong ol.

original: That day, after the Israelites had struck down the Philistines from Michmash to Aijalon, the people were very faint.
translation: Dispela de, bihaen long ol Israelait i kilim Philistine from Michmash kaikai go long Aijalon, ol pipol i bikimela tru.

original: So they rushed greedily to the plunder, taking sheep, cattle, and calves. They slaughtered them on the ground and ate meat with the blood still in it.
translation: Ol i oli go long kaikai iet bilong en, na kisim sip, bulmakau, na kokomo. Ol i kilim ol dispela kain animal long graun, na kaikai mit wantaim blod i stap yet.

original: Then someone reported to Saul: “Look, the troops are sinning against the LORD by eating meat with the blood still in it.” “You have broken faith,” said Saul. “Roll a large stone over here at once.”
translation: Ol i ripotim stori long Saul: “Lookim, soldia i stap sin long Jehovah olsem kaikai mit na bled i stap.” “Yupela i bikim birua long pkin bilong,” ol i tok long Saul. “Kisim wanpela bikpela stoan na bringim i kam hia at once na karamapim.”

original: Then he said, “Go among the troops and tell them, ‘Each man must bring me his ox or his sheep, slaughter them in this place, and then eat. Do not sin against the LORD by eating meat with the blood still in it.’” So that night everyone brought his ox and slaughtered it there.
translation: Em i tok, "Go long ol soldier na tolem ol, 'Narapela man mas bringim mi bulmakau o sip bilong en, ol mas kilim ol hap ia, na bihain yu kam kaikai. No ken sindaun agens Long Bikpela bai yumi kaikai mit na blod i stap yet.'" Na nait i kam, ol i bringim bulmakau bilong ol, na ol i kilim ol hap ia.

original: Then Saul built an altar to the LORD; it was the first time he had built an altar to the LORD.
translation: Na Saul i bikim wanpela altia long Lod; em i kam first time long en i mekim altia long Lod.

original: And Saul said, “Let us go down after the Philistines by night and plunder them until dawn, leaving no man alive!” “Do what seems good to you,” the troops replied. But the priest said, “We must consult God here.”
translation: Na Saul i tok, "Mipela i go daun bihainim Filistia na nait, mipela i plunda ol i go long taim bilong moning, na leevim man husat i stap!" "Wokim ol samting we yu ting yu mas wokim," ol soja i tok. Tasol pries i tok, "Mipela mas askim God long help hia."

original: So Saul inquired of God, “Shall I go down after the Philistines? Will You give them into the hand of Israel?” But God did not answer him that day.
translation: Na Saul bin askim God, "Mi bai go daun bihain Pilipitines? Yu bai givim ol i go long han bilong Iserel?" Tasol God no bin givim ansa long dispela de.

original: Therefore Saul said, “Come here, all you leaders of the troops, and let us investigate how this sin has occurred today.
translation: Oleh dispela, Saul i tok, "Kam harim, yupela ol lida bilong solja olsem, mipela wari long sindaun na lukim bekim olsem sin bilong dispela de i kamap."

original: As surely as the LORD who saves Israel lives, even if it is my son Jonathan, he must die!” But not one of the troops said a word.
translation: Olsem LORD husat i save Israel i stap, tasol em Jonathan pikinini bilong mi yet, em mas dai! Bai i no gat wanpela solja i save tok.

original: Then Saul said to all Israel, “You stand on one side, and I and my son Jonathan will stand on the other side.” “Do what seems good to you,” the troops replied.
translation: Na Saul i tokim ol Israel, "Yu stap long wanpela sait, na mi na pikinini bilong mi Jonathan bai mipela stap long narapela sait." "Mipela wokim ol samting we yu ting yu liklik," ol solja i tok.

original: So Saul said to the LORD, the God of Israel, “Why have You not answered Your servant this day? If the fault is with me or my son Jonathan, respond with Urim; but if the fault is with the men of Israel, respond with Thummim.” And Jonathan and Saul were selected, but the people were cleared of the charge.
translation: Na Saul i tokim long LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, olsem: "Bai yumus tumas, yu no givim ansa long servant bilong yu tude? I sori long me o long Jonathan sun bilong me, givim ansa na usim Urim; bai sori long ol man bilong Israel, givim ansa na usim Thummim." Na Jonathan na Saul i kamap tasol, na ol pipel i kom out klia.

original: Then Saul said, “Cast the lot between me and my son Jonathan.” And Jonathan was selected.
translation: Na Saul i tok, "Wokim pilai bung long mi na Jonathan pikinini bilong mi." Na Jonathan i kamap.

original: “Tell me what you have done,” Saul commanded him. So Jonathan told him, “I only tasted a little honey with the end of the staff that was in my hand. And now I must die?”
translation: “Tokim ol long ol samting yu mekim,” Saul i tokim. Na Jonathan i tokim, “Mi katim liklik hap honey na kaikai tasol long hed bilong stik bilong mi. Nau mi mas dai?”

original: And Saul declared, “May God punish me, and ever so severely, if you, Jonathan, do not surely die!”
translation: Na Saul i tok olsem, "Mipela i go long wei, God bai i wariim mi strong long wei, if yu, Jonathan, yu no ken dai bikos!"

original: But the people said to Saul, “Must Jonathan die—he who accomplished such a great deliverance for Israel? Never! As surely as the LORD lives, not a hair of his head will fall to the ground, for with God’s help he has accomplished this today.” So the people rescued Jonathan, and he did not die.
translation: Ol pipol i tokim Saul, "Jonathan mas dei - em i mekim bikpela sekurim long Iserel? Nogat! Em i bikpela, em i stap yet, na krangket bilong em bai i no bagarap, long hap bilong God em i mekim dispela tude." Na ol pipol i save Jonathan, na em i no dei.

original: Then Saul gave up his pursuit of the Philistines, and the Philistines returned to their own land.
translation: Na Saul i limepim bek i go long bikmus bilong em, na Filistia i go bak long kantri bilong ol.

original: After Saul had assumed the kingship over Israel, he fought against all his enemies on every side—the Moabites, the Ammonites, the Edomites, the kings of Zobah, and the Philistines. Wherever he turned, he routed them.
translation: Bihaen long Saul i kamap king bilong Isrel, na em i go fait long ol poisin bilong en - Moaibita, Amonaita, Edomaita, king bilong Sobaha, na Filisitia - long ol sait. We bilong en i turn, em i kilim ol.

original: He fought valiantly and defeated the Amalekites, delivering Israel from the hands of its plunderers.
translation: Em i paitim strong long narapela, na em winim Amalekites, em savim Israel long han bilong ol despoila.

original: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, Ishvi, and Malchishua. His two daughters were named Merab (his firstborn) and Michal (his younger daughter).
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Saul em i gat Jonathan, Ishvi, na Malchishua. Na tupela meri bilong em i gat nem, Merab (em i pikinini bilong papa) na Michal (em i meri i kam bihain).

original: His wife’s name was Ahinoam daughter of Ahimaaz. The name of the commander of his army was Abner, the son of Saul’s uncle Ner.
translation: Meri bilong em i kolim Ahinoam, daughter bilong Ahimaaz. Nem bilong komanda bilong army bilong em i Abner, son bilong ner bilong Saul.

original: Saul’s father Kish and Abner’s father Ner were sons of Abiel.
translation: Papa bilong Saul, Kish, na papa bilong Abner, Ner, ol i stap long ol pikinini bilong Abiel.

original: And the war with the Philistines was fierce for all the days of Saul. So whenever he noticed any strong or brave man, Saul would enlist him.
translation: Na tait bilong war wantaim Philisti i birua tru long olgeta de bilong Saul. Waneva em i lukim man strongpela o bravepela, em i strong tumas, Saul bai bekim em i go wok.

original: Then Samuel said to Saul, “The LORD sent me to anoint you king over His people Israel. Now therefore, listen to the words of the LORD.
translation: Na Samuel i tokim Saul, "Papa God i sendim me kam anointim yu king long ol pipol Israel bilong En. Nau olgeta, harim tok bilong Papa God."

original: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: ‘I witnessed what the Amalekites did to the Israelites when they ambushed them on their way up from Egypt.
translation: Olsem LORD bilong ol ples i tok: 'Mi lukim ol samting ol Amalekiti i mekim long ol Israeliti wanka long ol i go ap long rot bilong ol kamap from Egip.

original: Now go and attack the Amalekites and devote to destruction all that belongs to them. Do not spare them, but put to death men and women, children and infants, oxen and sheep, camels and donkeys.’”
translation: Nau go na harim ap long Amalekait na givim olgeta samting bilong ol i go long dae. No givim chans long ol, bat kilim ol man, ol meri, ol pikinini, ol bikpela, ol bulmakau, ol ship, ol kemel, na ol donki.’”

original: So Saul summoned the troops and numbered them at Telaim—200,000 foot soldiers and 10,000 men of Judah.
translation: Na Saul i kirapim ol solja, na i kauntim ol long Telaim – 200,000 ol solja agraun na 10,000 ol man meri bilong Yuda.

original: Saul came to the city of Amalek and lay in wait in the valley.
translation: Saul i kam long siti bilong Amalek na ol i stap bihain long vali.

original: And he warned the Kenites, “Since you showed kindness to all the Israelites when they came up out of Egypt, go on and get away from the Amalekites. Otherwise I will sweep you away with them.” So the Kenites moved away from the Amalekites.
translation: Na em i givim wara long ol Keniti, “Olsem yu mekim guidi long ol Israeliti wen ol i kamap nau long Ijip, yu go na lusim ol Amalekiti. Sapos yu no lusim, bai yu go daun wantaim olgeta.” Na ol Keniti i mus pinis na lusim ol Amalekiti.

original: Then Saul struck down the Amalekites all the way from Havilah to Shur, which is east of Egypt.
translation: Na Saul i kilim daun ol Amalekit olsem longwe fraun Havila go long Shur, em i stap long sipos bilong Egip.

original: He captured Agag king of Amalek alive, but devoted all the others to destruction with the sword.
translation: Em i kisim Agag king bilong Amalek i stap yet, tasol em i birua ol narapela long swod na was.

original: Saul and his troops spared Agag, along with the best of the sheep and cattle, the fat calves and lambs, and the best of everything else. They were unwilling to destroy them, but they devoted to destruction all that was despised and worthless.
translation: Saul, bikman bilong Israel, na ol solja bilong em sazem Agag, king bilong Amalek, longwan ol bikpela sheep na ol bulmakau, ol pikinini bulmakau bilong graun na ol pikinini sheep. Ol i no laik bagarapim ol, tasol ol i bin givim ol samting nogut na ol samting we i no value long ded.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Samuel, saying,
translation: Na kalabus bilong Gol, Bikpela, kem olsem toktok long Samuel.

original: “I regret that I have made Saul king, for he has turned away from following Me and has not carried out My instructions.” And Samuel was distressed and cried out to the LORD all that night.
translation: Mi sorry tru long ol tingting bilong mi, long mi bin mekim Saul king, em i go bekwe na i no folow mipela i go, na em i no mekim ol wok bilong mipela. Na Samuel i sori tru na em i kisim voice i go aut long LORD ol nait.

original: Early in the morning Samuel got up to confront Saul, but he was told, “Saul has gone to Carmel, and behold, he has set up a monument for himself and has turned and gone down to Gilgal.”
translation: Long moning bai i kam, Samuwel i kirap na em i go bekim Sau, tasol ol i tokim em, "Sau i go long Karmel, na lukim, em i kisim ston bilong memori na wail putim, na em i turnim na i go daun long Gilgal."

original: When Samuel reached him, Saul said to him, “May the LORD bless you. I have carried out the LORD’s instructions.”
translation: Taim Samuel i kam apostim em, Saul i tokim em olsem, "Mipela i hop long LORD ina givim blesing long yu. Mi bin kamapim ol wok bilong LORD."

original: But Samuel replied, “Then what is this bleating of sheep and lowing of cattle that I hear?”
translation: Em i tok bek, “Dispela krai bilong sheep na bus bilong bulmakau olsem mi harim, wanem samting dispela?”

original: Saul answered, “The troops brought them from the Amalekites; they spared the best sheep and cattle to sacrifice to the LORD your God, but the rest we devoted to destruction.”
translation: Saul i tokim, “Soljas ibin kisim ol i kam long Amalekait; ol i sklepim gutpela sip na bulmakau long sacrifice givim long LORD God bilong yu, tasol ol narapela mipela iprim garim long daun.”

original: “Stop!” exclaimed Samuel. “Let me tell you what the LORD said to me last night.” “Tell me,” Saul replied.
translation: “Stap!” tok strong Samuel. “Mipela harim tok bilong Bikpela we em i tokim mi asde bek.” “Yu tokim mi,” bekim tok Saul.

original: And Samuel said, “Although you were once small in your own eyes, have you not become the head of the tribes of Israel? The LORD anointed you king over Israel
translation: Na Samuel i tok, "Yu bin liklik long ai bilong yu, tasol yu nau bamdaun i go hed bilong ol tribes bilong Israel. LORD im bin givim yu king ibin givim yu autoriti long Israel."

original: and sent you on a mission, saying, ‘Go and devote to destruction the sinful Amalekites. Fight against them until you have wiped them out.’
translation: Na God i sendim yu go long wok, olsem: 'Yu go putim Amalekait ol bikhet long sin long destruksen. Faitim gen ol, na yu wokim ol pinis, no moa i stap.'

original: So why did you not obey the LORD? Why did you rush upon the plunder and do evil in the sight of the LORD?”
translation: Wal long bilong yu, yu no bihainim Bikpela? Yu harim na ron i go daun long bagarapim sampela samting bilong ol narapela, na wok olsem nogut long ai bilong Bikpela?

original: “But I did obey the LORD,” Saul replied. “I went on the mission that the LORD gave me. I brought back Agag king of Amalek and devoted the Amalekites to destruction.
translation: “Bai mi bilipim pinis long LORD,” Saul i tokim. “Mi go kam bek long wok misin em LORD i givim mi. Mi kisim bek Agag king bilong Amalek na mi dedisetim Amalekit long dai.”

original: The troops took sheep and cattle from the plunder, the best of the things devoted to destruction, in order to sacrifice them to the LORD your God at Gilgal.”
translation: Solja i takim ol sheep na bulmakau long taim bilong plunder, ol gutpela samting we i kamap long taim bilong katim won, ol i mekim sacrifice long LORD God bilong yu long Gilgal.

original: But Samuel declared: “Does the LORD delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obedience to His voice? Behold, obedience is better than sacrifice, and attentiveness is better than the fat of rams.
translation: Bain Samuel i tokarak: "Papa God i amusim long ol burnt offerings na sacrifices olsem wok bilong lotu, tasol em i laikim moa long kisim hap bilong em? Sapos yu givim ear long tok bilong em, em i gutpela mo dan sakrifais, na kisim hap i gutpela mo dan ol fat bilong ram."

original: For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and arrogance is like the wickedness of idolatry. Because you have rejected the word of the LORD, He has rejected you as king.”
translation: Bikhet i olsem sin bilong divination, na pride i olsem bikhet bilong idolatri. Bikos yu no givim values long tok bilong LORD, Em i rimsaim yu olsem king.

original: Then Saul said to Samuel, “I have sinned; I have transgressed the LORD’s commandment and your instructions, because I feared the people and obeyed their voice.
translation: Na Saul i tokim Samuel, "Mi go pinis, mi mezim rong; mi braikim komando bilong LORD na toksave bilong yu, bikos mi bikim fear long ol pipol na bihainim toksave bilong ol."

original: Now therefore, please forgive my sin and return with me so I can worship the LORD.”
translation: Nau olsem, painim utu long sin bilong mi, kam bek gen long mi, na mi ken worship Lod long we.

original: “I will not return with you,” Samuel replied. “For you have rejected the word of the LORD, and He has rejected you as king over Israel.”
translation: “Mi no go bek long yu,” Samuwel i tok. “Yu rausim tok bilong Jehovah, na em i trowe yu long king olsem Israel.”

original: As Samuel turned to go, Saul grabbed the hem of his robe, and it tore.
translation: Samuwel i turnim go, Sauwul i givim pulim hap bilong rokwe, na rokwe i pullap.

original: So Samuel said to him, “The LORD has torn the kingdom of Israel from you today and has given it to your neighbor who is better than you.
translation: Na Samuel i tokim em olsem, "Papa God i kisim kingdom bilong Israel long yu tude na i givim i go long neiya bilong yu we i gutpela moa long yu.

original: Moreover, the Glory of Israel does not lie or change His mind, for He is not a man, that He should change His mind.”
translation: Moa yet, Glory bilong Isrel i no gat laik bilakim toktok, na bai hem i no sakim tingting bilong en, bikos em i no man, olsem bai em i sakim tingting bilong en.

original: “I have sinned,” Saul replied. “Please honor me now before the elders of my people and before Israel. Come back with me, so that I may worship the LORD your God.”
translation: “Mi bin sin,” Saul i tokim. “Ba yu givim mi respek nau long ol big man bilong ples bilong mi na long ol Israel. Kam bek gen wantaim mi, bai mi ken worship LORD God bilong yu.”

original: So Samuel went back with Saul, and Saul worshiped the LORD.
translation: Na Samuel i go bek gen long namel wantaim Saul, na Saul i worshipim LORD.

original: Then Samuel said, “Bring me Agag king of the Amalekites.” Agag came to him cheerfully, for he thought, “Surely the bitterness of death is past.”
translation: Na Samuel i tok, "Kisim Agag king bilong Ol Amalekites, bringim i kam long me." Na Agag i kam long em, i kam ap long hed, em i ting, "Pain i strong tumas long dai i pinis finis."

original: But Samuel declared: “As your sword has made women childless, so your mother will be childless among women.” And Samuel hacked Agag to pieces before the LORD at Gilgal.
translation: Bareket, Samuwel i tok olsem: "Olsem sword bilong yu i mekim meri i no gat pikinini, na mama bilong yu bai i stap nating long ol meri." Na Samuwel i kilim Agag i go daun long ples we i klosap long LORD long Gilgal.

original: Then Samuel went to Ramah, but Saul went up to his home in Gibeah of Saul.
translation: Na Samuel i go long Ramah, tasol Saul i go antap long em haus long Gibea bilong Saul.

original: And to the day of his death, Samuel never again visited Saul. Samuel mourned for Saul, and the LORD regretted that He had made Saul king over Israel.
translation: Na long long taim bai i dai, Samuel i no go bek gen long ples bilong Saul. Samuel i sori tru long Saul, na Bikpela i sori long desisen em mekim long Saul olsem king bilong Israel.

original: Now the LORD said to Samuel, “How long are you going to mourn for Saul, since I have rejected him as king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil and go. I am sending you to Jesse of Bethlehem, for I have selected from his sons a king for Myself.”
translation: Nau LORD i tokim Samuel, “Oli mas kam long we bilong yu mournim Saul, bikos mi throweim i go long king olsem long Israel? Kambei horn bilong yu wantaim oll na go, mi salim yu go long Jesse bilong Betlehem, bikos mi selektim wanpela bilong em i kam bekim king bilong mi.”

original: “How can I go?” Samuel asked. “Saul will hear of it and kill me!” The LORD answered, “Take a heifer with you and say, ‘I have come to sacrifice to the LORD.’
translation: “Mi bai go we?” Samuwel i askim. “Saul bai harim tok na bai kilim mi olsem desla bilong papa graun!” LORD i ansa, “Yu kam bek long bulmakau bikpela meri wantaim yu na yu tok, ‘Mi kam bihaenim sacrifice long LORD’, olsem tumbuna Iraeli i save mekim.”

original: Then invite Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you are to do. You are to anoint for Me the one I indicate.”
translation: Kisim Jesse i kam lusim bikpela ka, na mi bai sho yu long olgeta samting yu mas mekim. Yu mas givim osem fer mi long dispela man we mi bai tok olsem.

original: So Samuel did what the LORD had said and went to Bethlehem. When the elders of the town met him, they trembled and asked, “Do you come in peace?”
translation: Na Samuel i mekim olsem LORD i tok, na i go long Betlehem. Taim ol bikpela man bilong ples i kamapim em, ol i bel hevi na tanim askim, "Yu kam long ples bilong mipela, yu kam na stap gut?"

original: “In peace,” he replied. “I have come to sacrifice to the LORD. Consecrate yourselves and come with me to the sacrifice.” Then he consecrated Jesse and his sons and invited them to the sacrifice.
translation: “Long peis,” em i tok. “Mi kam bek long ofa sakrifis long LORD. Puripim yuself na kam wantaim mi long sakrifis.” Na bai em i puripim Jesse na ol pikinini bilong em na em i kolim ol i kam long sakrifis.

original: When they arrived, Samuel saw Eliab and said, “Surely here before the LORD is His anointed.”
translation: Taim ol i kam, Samuel i lukim Eliab na i tok, “Em i orait, bai kem moa long LORD, em i man i givim oili.”

original: But the LORD said to Samuel, “Do not consider his appearance or height, for I have rejected him; the LORD does not see as man does. For man sees the outward appearance, but the LORD sees the heart.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Samuel, “Yu no ken lukim apinun bilong em, bikos mi throwim we em; Bikpela i no lukim olsem man. Man i lukim skin bilong outside, tasol Bikpela i lukim haret.”

original: Then Jesse called Abinadab and presented him to Samuel, who said, “The LORD has not chosen this one either.”
translation: Na Jesi i kolim Abinadab, na i kam bek long Samuel, na Samuel i tok, "Papa God i no bin choosim dispela man tu."

original: Next Jesse presented Shammah, but Samuel said, “The LORD has not chosen this one either.”
translation: Nek Jesse i bringim Shammah, tasol Samuel i tok, "Papa God i no chusim dispela man tu."

original: Thus Jesse made seven of his sons pass before Samuel, but Samuel told him, “The LORD has not chosen any of these.”
translation: Na Jesi i makim sevenpela pikinini bilong em i go bek long Samuel, tasol Samuel i tokim em, “LORD i no choosim nona yet.”

original: And Samuel asked him, “Are these all the sons you have?” “There is still the youngest,” Jesse replied, “but he is tending the sheep.” “Send for him,” Samuel replied. “For we will not sit down to eat until he arrives.”
translation: Na Samuel i askim em, "Ol pikinini yaupela bilong yu olgeta?" Iese i mekim tok, "I gat wanpela namba las yet, tasol em i wokim kuk long ol sheep." Samuel i tok, "Sindaun go long en, bikos yumit bai sidos long kaikai yet, na em i no kam."

original: So Jesse sent for his youngest son and brought him in. He was ruddy, with beautiful eyes and a handsome appearance. And the LORD said, “Rise and anoint him, for he is the one.”
translation: Na Jesi i kirapim pikinini bilong em yet, na ol i bringim i kam. Em i gat sking bilong em i redim, ai bilong em i switmoa, na em i luk strong na finis. Na LORD i tok, "Kamdaun na painim em wantaim oil, em i man husat yumi laik painim."

original: So Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers, and the Spirit of the LORD rushed upon David from that day forward. Then Samuel set out and went to Ramah.
translation: Na Samuel em i kisim horn bilong oil na em i givim anointing long David, long ai bilong bratas bilong em, na Spirut bilong LORD i kam antap strong long David from dei tasol. Afta em i go na em i go long Ramah.

original: After the Spirit of the LORD had departed from Saul, a spirit of distress from the LORD began to torment him.
translation: Bihaenim Spirit bilong GOD i go bek long Saul, wanpela spirit bilong sori na trabel i kam pinis long en, i statim wariim em.

original: Saul’s servants said to him, “Surely a spirit of distress from God is tormenting you.
translation: Wokman bilong Saul i tokim em, "Spirits nogut bilong God i wari long yu."

original: Let our lord command your servants here to seek out someone who can skillfully play the harp. Whenever the spirit of distress from God is upon you, he is to play it, and you will be well.”
translation: Bikim tok bilong bikpela long yumi, wokmanmeri, suskim ol i go painim man i gat save wokim saun bilong hap. Wanem taim spirits bilong sori na trabel bilong God i kam long yu, em i mas wokim saun, na yu stap strong.

original: And Saul commanded his servants, “Find me someone who plays well, and bring him to me.”
translation: Na Saul i givim tok bilong en long ol i wokman bilong en, “Painim wan man we i pilai gut, na kisim i kam long me.”

original: One of the servants answered, “I have seen a son of Jesse of Bethlehem who knows how to play the harp. He is a mighty man of valor, a warrior, eloquent and handsome, and the LORD is with him.”
translation: Wanpela i kam bek long ol servant i tok, "Mi lukim wanpela pikinini bilong Jesi bilong Betlehem, em i save pila hap. Em i man bilong strong, i gat kura, em i man bilong pait, em i tok gut moa, em i man bilong hap, na Papa God i stap wantaim em."

original: So Saul sent messengers to Jesse and said, “Send me your son David, who is with the sheep.”
translation: Saul i salim bosboi i go, na ol i tokim Jese, "Yu salim pikinini Dafid bilong yu i kam, em i wok shepherd long sip."

original: And Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, a skin of wine, and one young goat, and sent them to Saul with his son David.
translation: Na Jesi i kisim donki we i lusim bret, skinnip wain, na kambek yangpela, na i givim ol long Saul wom ol i sendim Daud.

original: When David came to Saul and entered his service, Saul admired him greatly, and David became his armor-bearer.
translation: Taim David i kam long Saul, na i go insait long servis bilong en, Saul i amirasim em bikpela, na David i wok olsem karai bilong armour bilong en.

original: Then Saul sent word to Jesse, saying, “Let David remain in my service, for I am pleased with him.”
translation: Na Saul i sendim tok long Jese, olsem, "Let David i stap yet long servos bilong mi, bikos mi amaze long em."

original: And whenever the spirit from God came upon Saul, David would pick up his harp and play, and Saul would become well, and the spirit of distress would depart from him.
translation: Na hap kasol Spiret bilong God i kam stap long Saul, David i kisim harp bilong en na i pilai, na Saul i strong na gutpela gen, na spiret bilong hebis i lusim em.

original: Now the Philistines gathered their forces for war at Socoh in Judah, and they camped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes-dammim.
translation: Nau Filistia i kam na karim ol soldia bilong ol long harim war long Sokoh i stap long Juda, na ol i pundaon klostu long Sokoh na Azeka long Epes-Damim.

original: Saul and the men of Israel assembled and camped in the Valley of Elah, arraying themselves for battle against the Philistines.
translation: Saul na man meri bilong Israel i go tasol i kam na kampedon long Boslong Elah, na ol i redi long fait wantaim Filistia.

original: The Philistines stood on one hill and the Israelites stood on another, with the valley between them.
translation: Filistia i stap long wanpela han bilong maunten na Isiraelite i stap long narakain han bilong maunten, wantaim vaili i stap long bikim spes long ol.

original: Then a champion named Goliath, who was from Gath, came out from the Philistine camp. He was six cubits and a span in height,
translation: Na wei bikpela i kamap long kamp bilong Filistia, namel Golaya, em i go long sikis cubit na wan span long hap, em i bin kam long Gat.

original: and he had a bronze helmet on his head. He wore a bronze coat of mail weighing five thousand shekels,
translation: Na em i gat helmut bronzi long hed bilong en. Em i wapim kot bilong meil bronzi, em i pipia long Sikels ten tausand.

original: and he had armor of bronze on his legs and a javelin of bronze slung between his shoulders.
translation: Na em i gat armog long bronz long lek bilong en, na wanpela jaret long bronz i go daun namel long baksait bilong em.

original: The shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam, and its iron point weighed six hundred shekels. In addition, his shield bearer went before him.
translation: Stik bilong spia em i go olsem bem bilong wiva, na het bilong spia em i wei sikis hundred shekel. Olsem na, man i karim skild i go bifor em.

original: And Goliath stood and shouted to the ranks of Israel, “Why do you come out and array yourselves for battle? Am I not a Philistine, and are you not servants of Saul? Choose one of your men and have him come down against me.
translation: Na Goliath i stap na singaut long ol solja bilong Israel, “Wai yumi kam bek long ples na kamap strong olsem solja long bikpela fait? Mipela i no Filistia, ya mipela wokman bilong Saul? Pikim wanpela man bilong yu na kam daun na harim mi.

original: If he is able to fight me and kill me, then we will be your servants. But if I prevail against him and kill him, then you shall be our servants and labor for us.”
translation: Sapos em i gat strong long paitim me na kilim me, den yumi bai i servis ol i go long yu. Tasol sapos mi strong yet long paitim em na kilim em, den yupela bai i servis ol i go long mipela na wokim wok long mipela.

original: Then the Philistine said, “I defy the ranks of Israel this day! Give me a man to fight!”
translation: Nambis Philisti na em i tok olsem, "Mi laikim ol long hap kaunti bilong Israel today! Givim mi man wan bilong painim!"

original: On hearing the words of the Philistine, Saul and all the Israelites were dismayed and greatly afraid.
translation: Long ol harim tok bilong Filistia, Saul na ol Israel i bikim silip na ol i gat bikpela fea.

original: Now David was the son of a man named Jesse, an Ephrathite from Bethlehem of Judah who had eight sons in the days of Saul. And Jesse was old and well along in years.
translation: Nau David em i pikinini bilong man Jesse, Efratai bilong Betlehem bilong Yuda, na Jesse i gat eight pikinini long taim bilong Saul. Na Jesse em i olsem bikman na i go long yia.

original: The three older sons of Jesse had followed Saul into battle: The firstborn was Eliab, the second was Abinadab, and the third was Shammah.
translation: Ol pika three bilong Jesse i go bifo, ol i folo Saul go long pait: Pikinini namba wan em i Eliab, namba tu bilong en em i Abinadab, na namba tri bilong en em i Shammah.

original: And David was the youngest. The three oldest had followed Saul,
translation: Na Daudi em i pikinini. Ol three olpela brata bilong en i go bek long Saul,

original: but David went back and forth from Saul to tend his father’s sheep in Bethlehem.
translation: Daud i go bek na i kam bek long Saul from we i ken go lukauta ol sheep bilong papa i stap long Betlehem.

original: For forty days the Philistine came forward every morning and evening to take his stand.
translation: Long foida de pe, Filistia i kam ananit long moning na apinun, em i stap strong.

original: One day Jesse said to his son David, “Take this ephah of roasted grain and these ten loaves of bread for your brothers and hurry to their camp.
translation: Wanpela de Jesse i tokim son bilong em David, “Kisim dispela ephah bilong grin bai yumiyumi na dispela ten loaves bilong bret, na givim ol long brata bilong yu, na yu yet go kisim hap long kamp bilong ol, harim yu?

original: Take also these ten portions of cheese to the commander of their unit. Check on the welfare of your brothers and bring back an assurance from them.
translation: Kisim tu dispela ten hap bilong sis, na kisim i go long komanda bilong grup ol i stap. Lu lukim gut long hevi bilong brata na susa bilong yu, na brinim bek tok orait bilong ol.

original: They are with Saul and all the men of Israel in the Valley of Elah, fighting against the Philistines.”
translation: Ol i stap wantaim Saul na ol man meri bilong Israel long vale bilong Elah, ol i fait long Philistine.

original: So David got up early in the morning, left the flock with a keeper, loaded up, and set out as Jesse had instructed him. He reached the camp as the army was marching out to its position and shouting the battle cry.
translation: Na Dauid em i go apologen long moning, i leevim ol flock long han bilong keeper, olgeta samting i redi nau, em i go olsem Ise i tokim em. Em i kamap long ples bilong army olsem army i wokabaut go long ples bilong en, na ol i singaut strong long wail bilong fight.

original: And Israel and the Philistines arrayed in formation against each other.
translation: Na Isrel na Filistia i kamap strong olsem wanpela armi, ol i fait long ol.

original: Then David left his supplies in the care of the quartermaster and ran to the battle line. When he arrived, he asked his brothers how they were doing.
translation: Na Davide i lusim suplies bilong en long han bilong kwata-masta, na i ran i go long lain bilong fait. Na bihain i kamap, i askim brata bilong en olsem, "Wanem nau, stap olsem wanem?"

original: And as he was speaking with them, suddenly the champion named Goliath, the Philistine from Gath, came forward from the Philistines and shouted his usual words, which David also heard.
translation: Na em i toktok wantaim ol, wanpela man i strong, Goliya, Philistine i kam bek long Gath, kam bek long ol Philistine, na em i singautim wail ol yakati bilong en, na Daved i harim tu.

original: When all the men of Israel saw Goliath, they fled from him in great fear.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Isrel i lukim Goliath, na ol i ranawe friom em long bikpela fea.

original: Now the men of Israel had been saying, “Do you see this man who keeps coming out to defy Israel? To the man who kills him the king will give great riches. And he will give him his daughter in marriage and exempt his father’s house from taxation in Israel.”
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i bin tok, "Yu lukim man ya we i kam aut long givim bek long Isrel? King bai givim planti ka long man husat i kilim em, na bai givim meri bilong en long marit, na haus bilong papa bilong em bai nogat pe long pekpek long Isrel."

original: David asked the men who were standing with him, “What will be done for the man who kills this Philistine and removes this disgrace from Israel? Just who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?”
translation: Dauid arim tok long ol man i stap wantaim em, “Ol bai mekim wanem long man husat i kilim dispela Filistine na birua dispela sham long Israel? Husat i dispela Filistine we i no katim skin bilong kok, nasel ol i laikim armi bilong God i alive?”

original: The people told him about the offer, saying, “That is what will be done for the man who kills him.”
translation: Ol pipol i tokim em long toktok bilong ofa, ol i tok, “Em i wusai bai mekim long man husat i kilim em.”

original: Now when David’s oldest brother Eliab heard him speaking to the men, his anger burned against David. “Why have you come down here?” he asked. “And with whom did you leave those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and wickedness of heart—you have come down to see the battle!”
translation: Tasol bra Eliab, brata numba wan bilong David, harim toktok bilong em, na sem bilong Eliab i bagarap long David. Em tok, "Yu kam daun hia bilong yu? Na husat i lukim olpela sheep i go long bus wail em yu lusim ol? Mi save long pait imo na ogogo bilong het bilong yu - yu kam daun hia bilong lukim fait!"

original: “What have I done now?” said David. “Was it not just a question?”
translation: “Oli bin mekim wanem nau?” tok David. “Em ino stret wanpela kwestion tasol?”

original: Then he turned from him toward another and asked about the offer, and those people answered him just as the first ones had answered.
translation: Em i turnim bek long en, na em i go long narapela, na em i askim long ofa bilong en, na ol pipol ia i givim ansa long em, olsem olgeta pipol ibin ansa long en bifo.

original: Now David’s words were overheard and reported to Saul, who called for him.
translation: Wods bilong Daud i go bek long ausat na ol i tokim Saul, nao em i kalim em.

original: And David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail on account of this Philistine. Your servant will go and fight him!”
translation: Daud i tokim Saul, “Nogat man i mas pilim hat bilong en i kol long dispela filistia. Man belong yu, mi go na fightim em!”

original: But Saul replied, “You cannot go out against this Philistine to fight him. You are just a boy, and he has been a warrior from his youth.”
translation: Na Saul i tokim, "Yu no inogat go long pairapim Filistia man bilong pait long paitim em. Yu yet yu yangpela man, na em i man bilong pait tasol long taim bilong em i pikinini yet."

original: David replied, “Your servant has been tending his father’s sheep, and whenever a lion or a bear came and carried off a lamb from the flock,
translation: David i tokim ol, "Manmeri bilong mi, em i lukautim sheep bilong papa bilong em, na wanpela lion o wanpela bear i kam, i kisim i go wanpela lamb long flock.

original: I went after it, struck it down, and delivered the lamb from its mouth. If it reared up against me, I would grab it by its fur, strike it down, and kill it.
translation: Mi go bekim, kilim i dai, na savim lamb long mous bilong en. Em i kirap against mipela, mipela kisim gras bilong en, paitim i dai, na kilim olgeta.

original: Your servant has killed lions and bears; this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, for he has defied the armies of the living God.”
translation: Wokman bilong yu kilim laion na bears; dispela hapkas Philistine ya bai olsem wanpela bilong ol, nau em i bin tokhat long armi bilong God bilong laip.

original: David added, “The LORD, who delivered me from the claws of the lion and the bear, will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.” “Go,” said Saul, “and may the LORD be with you.”
translation: Na Davide i tokim ol, "Papa God, em i save halivim mi long krangap na long bek, bai em i kam na halivim mi long han bilong dispela Filistia." "Go nau," Sauil i tokim, "Papa God i stap wantaim yu."

original: Then Saul clothed David in his own tunic, put a bronze helmet on his head, and dressed him in armor.
translation: Na Saul i givim tunik blong en i go long David, i putim het blong bronze antap long hed blong em, na i dressim em long armola.

original: David strapped his sword over the tunic and tried to walk, but he was not accustomed to them. “I cannot walk in these,” David said to Saul. “I am not accustomed to them.” So David took them off.
translation: Davide i kisim sword bilong en na putim long tunik, na bai em i go wok, yet em i no saves long ol. “Mi no inap go wok long dispela,” Davide i tokim Saul. “Ol i no olsem, mi no saves long ol.” Na Davide i rausim ol.

original: And David took his staff in his hand, selected five smooth stones from the brook, and put them in the pouch of his shepherd’s bag. And with his sling in hand, he approached the Philistine.
translation: Na Dauid i kisim stik bilong en i go long han bilong en, i pilim faiv ston naispela i kam long naraba, na i putim ol ston i go insait long bag bilong shepherd bilong en. Na wantaim sling bilong en i go long han, i go klus beside Filistia.

original: Now the Philistine came closer and closer to David, with his shield-bearer before him.
translation: Nau Filistia i kam antap, antap long Daved, wantaim man i kari shiled bilong em i go bifor em.

original: When the Philistine looked and saw David, he despised him because he was just a boy, ruddy and handsome.
translation: Taim Philisti em i lukim na si David, em i bilonghatim em bikos em i pikinini yet, sking i reddim, na em i man husat i gutpela tru.

original: “Am I a dog,” he said to David, “that you come at me with sticks?” And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
translation: “Dog em i no?” em i tokim Daud, “yu kam long mi wantaim stik?” Na Filistia i krosim Daud olsem na olgeta god bilong em.

original: “Come here,” he called to David, “and I will give your flesh to the birds of the air and the beasts of the field!”
translation: “Kam daun hia,” em i kolim David, “na mi bai givim flesh bilong yu long pisin bilong heven na ol kaine bilong bus!”

original: But David said to the Philistine, “You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the LORD of Hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.
translation: Daud i tokim Filistia, "Yu kam bek gen me wantaim sord na spia na tromoi, tasol mi kam bek gen yu long nem bilong LORD bilong ol pata, God bilong ol armi bilong Israel, we yu tromoim."

original: This day the LORD will deliver you into my hand. This day I will strike you down, cut off your head, and give the carcasses of the Philistines to the birds of the air and the creatures of the earth. Then the whole world will know that there is a God in Israel.
translation: Tede LORD bai givim yu long han bilong mi. Tede mi bai kilim yu, katim hed bilong yu, na mipela bai givim ol bodi bilong Filistia i dai long pisin bilong heven na ol kreas bilong graun. Olgeta hap bilong wol bai save olsem: em i gat God long Israel.

original: And all those assembled here will know that it is not by sword or spear that the LORD saves; for the battle is the LORD’s, and He will give all of you into our hands.”
translation: Na olgeta we i kam asamble long hia bai save olsem, em i no bílong sop o spia tasol LORD i saveman, fakat faint i bilong LORD, na Em bai givim yupela olgeta long han bilong mipela.

original: As the Philistine started forward to attack him, David ran quickly toward the battle line to meet him.
translation: Filistia i kam bek gen long mekim bek, Daved i ron i go kisim hap long lain bilong faet.

original: Then David reached into his bag, took out a stone, and slung it, striking the Philistine on the forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell facedown on the ground.
translation: Na David em i kirap long bag bilong en, em i kisim wanpela ston, pilim ston long sling, na paitim Filistia long forehed. Ston i go insait long forehed bilong en, na em i kilim i go daun olgeta, em i pirimapim daun long graun.

original: Thus David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone; without a sword in his hand he struck down the Philistine and killed him.
translation: Na Davide em winim Philistia wantaim wanpela ston na rop bilong shot, na em no gat sord long han bilong en, em i kilim Philistia na i dai.

original: David ran and stood over him. He grabbed the Philistine’s sword and pulled it from its sheath and killed him; and he cut off his head with the sword. When the Philistines saw that their hero was dead, they turned and ran.
translation: Daud i ran na em i stap antap long em. Em i kisim sord bilong Filistia, kilim em na katim hed bilong em wanpela tasol. Long taim Filistia i lukim ol i save se totem bilong ol i dai pinis, ol i wend na ranawe.

original: Then the men of Israel and Judah charged forward with a shout and pursued the Philistines to the entrance of Gath and to the gates of Ekron. And the bodies of the Philistines were strewn along the Shaaraim road to Gath and Ekron.
translation: Na ol man bilong Isrel na Juda i go bek long wanem, ol i kirap na singaut, ol i bihainim Filistia, i go inap long entris bilong Gat na gate bilong Ekron. Na bodi bilong ol Filistia i stap stret long rod bilong Saaraim, i go long Gat na Ekron.

original: When the Israelites returned from their pursuit of the Philistines, they plundered their camps.
translation: Wanpela taim Pipol Israel i go bek gen from we ol i go harim Filistia, ol i stilim i go long ples bilong ol.

original: David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem, and he put Goliath’s weapons in his own tent.
translation: Daud i kisim hed bilong Filistia na i kam bek long Yerusalem, na i putim weapom bilong Golaya insait long tent bilong em.

original: As Saul had watched David going out to confront the Philistine, he said to Abner the commander of the army, “Abner, whose son is this young man?” “As surely as you live, O king,” Abner replied, “I do not know.”
translation: Saul i lukim David i go aut go bekim Philistine, na em i tokim Abner komanda bilong ples na armi, “Abner, husat pikinini man i kam long husat?” “Olsem yu stap, O king,” Abner i tok, “Mi no save.”

original: “Find out whose son this young man is!” said the king.
translation: “Kisim save, husat i papa bilong dispela man pikinini!” king i tok.

original: So when David returned from killing the Philistine, still holding his head in his hand, Abner took him and brought him before Saul.
translation: Taim Daved i kam bek long kilim Filistia, yet kam hap long han bilong en, Abena i kisim em, na i bringim em go long Saul.

original: “Whose son are you, young man?” asked Saul. “I am the son of your servant Jesse of Bethlehem,” David replied.
translation: “Husat i pikinini bilong yu, man i no ol yet?” Saul i askim. “Mi pikinini bilong servant bilong yu Jesse long Betlehem,” David i tok.

original: After David had finished speaking with Saul, the souls of Jonathan and David were knit together, and Jonathan loved him as himself.
translation: Long David i winim tok bilong en, spirit bilong Jonathan na David i kam antap wantaim, na Jonathan i laikim em olsem em yet.

original: And from that day Saul kept David with him and did not let him return to his father’s house.
translation: Long dispela de Saul i kisim David i go wantaim em, na i no lusim em i go bek long haus bilong papa.

original: Then Jonathan made a covenant with David because he loved him as himself.
translation: Na Jonathan wokim pinis pikinani long David bikos em i lavim em olsem em yet.

original: And Jonathan removed the robe he was wearing and gave it to David, along with his tunic, his sword, his bow, and his belt.
translation: Na Jonathan tokim rop bilong en i go, na givim rop bilong en long David, wantaim tu nik bilong en, soid, bow na arao, na bet bilong en.

original: So David marched out and prospered in everything Saul sent him to do, and Saul set him over the men of war. And this was pleasing in the sight of all the people, and of Saul’s officers as well.
translation: Na Daud i go na kamap strong long ol samting Saul i sendim em go wokim, na Saul i putim em i stap bos long ol man bilong faet. Na dispela samting i amenas long ai bilong ol pipol, na long ai bilong ol ofisa bilong Saul tu.

original: As the troops were returning home after David had killed the Philistine, the women came out of all the cities of Israel to meet King Saul with singing and dancing, with joyful songs, and with tambourines and other instruments.
translation: Solja i go bak long hus afta David i kilim Filistia, ol meri i kam aut long ol ples bilong Israel, ol i go mitim King Saul, wantaim singaut na dans, ol i sing sang bilong hamamas, wantaim tamburin na sampela instrument.

original: And as the women danced, they sang out: “Saul has slain his thousands, and David his tens of thousands.”
translation: Na meri i dans olsem, ol i singaut: “Saul i kilim ten thousand, na Daud i kilim hundred thousand.”

original: And Saul was furious and resented this song. “They have ascribed tens of thousands to David,” he said, “but only thousands to me. What more can he have but the kingdom?”
translation: Na Saul em i pasalai na em i sori tumas long dispela song. “Ol i kisim ten tausen long hap bilong David,” em i tok, “tasol long hap bilong mi, ol i kisim tausen pepe. Wanem moa i ken hav, kingdam tasol?”

original: And from that day forward Saul kept a jealous eye on David.
translation: Na bilong dei em i go, Saul i wachim David olsem i mas gelos.

original: The next day a spirit of distress sent from God came upon Saul, and he prophesied inside the house while David played the harp as usual. Now Saul was holding a spear,
translation: Dia nambawan de, spirut bilong hevi i kam stap long Saul, na em i prophesy insait long haus traol olsem wok bilong prophesy, wail David i pilim harp olsem taim bifo, na Saul i holum spea.

original: and he hurled it, thinking, “I will pin David to the wall.” But David eluded him twice.
translation: Na em i kirapim ston, em i think, “Mi bai pinim Davit long wal.” Tasol Davit i slip awe twaim.

original: So Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with David but had departed from Saul.
translation: Saul i bikim traipela wei long David, bikos Bikpela i stap wantaim David, na i kamaut nau long Saul.

original: Therefore Saul sent David away and gave him command of a thousand men. David led the troops out to battle and back,
translation: Na Saul i sendim David i go, na i givim em komando long thousand man. David i lidim solja i go na kambak long bikpela fait.

original: and he continued to prosper in all his ways, because the LORD was with him.
translation: Na em i go strong olsem na winim long olgeta wei bilong en, bikos LORD i stap wantaim em.

original: When Saul saw that David was very successful, he was afraid of him.
translation: Taim Saul i lukim David i winnim gut, i bikim nem bilong en i stap ino long en, na Saul i belis long em.

original: But all Israel and Judah loved David, because he was leading them out to battle and back.
translation: Ol Israel na Judah i lakim Daved, wantaim em i bringim ol long go nau bek gen long pait.

original: Then Saul said to David, “Here is my older daughter Merab. I will give her to you in marriage. Only be valiant for me and fight the LORD’s battles.” But Saul was thinking, “I need not raise my hand against him; let the hand of the Philistines be against him.”
translation: Na Saul i tokim David, "Merab, daugta bilong mi em i bikpela. Mi bai givim em meri long yu. Bai yu strong long me na go fight ol samting bilong LORD." Tasol Saul i ting, "Mi no nid long mi raisim han long en; bai pipel bilong Filistia i go daunim en."

original: And David said to Saul, “Who am I, and what is my family or my father’s clan in Israel, that I should become the son-in-law of the king?”
translation: Na Davide i tokim Saul, “Mipela olsem wanem, na famili bilong mipela o clan bilong papa bilong mipela long Israel i stap, olsem nau mipela mas kamap husban bilong pikinini meri bilong king?”

original: So when it was time to give Saul’s daughter Merab to David, she was given in marriage to Adriel of Meholah.
translation: Taim i kamap, ol i givim Merab, pikini bilong Saul, long David, tasol em i go long Adriel bilong Meholah olsem meri.

original: Now Saul’s daughter Michal loved David, and when this was reported to Saul, it pleased him.
translation: Nau pikinini meri bilong Saul, Mikal, i lakim David, na taim ol i tokim Saul long dispela, em i amenesim hart bilong en.

original: “I will give her to David,” Saul thought, “so that she may be a snare to him, and the hand of the Philistines may be against him.” So Saul said to David, “For a second time now you can be my son-in-law.”
translation: Mi bai givim em i go long David, bai em i kamap olsem wanpela snare long en, na han bilong Filistia i no inamap long en. Na Saul i tokim David olsem, "Yu ken bekim suna bilong mi gen, em i go na yu."

original: Then Saul ordered his servants, “Speak to David privately and tell him, ‘Behold, the king is pleased with you, and all his servants love you. Now therefore, become his son-in-law.’”
translation: Na Saul i oraitim ol wokman bilong en, 'Toktok longwe tok ples long David, Sios, lukim, king i amamas long yu, na ol wokman bilong en ol i lakim yu. Nau, yu inap kam biain husat i stap klostu long king.'

original: But when Saul’s servants relayed these words to David, he replied, “Does it seem trivial in your sight to be the son-in-law of the king? I am a poor man and lightly esteemed.”
translation: Taim servant bilong Saul i tok deskael pes em nau long David, na em i mekim ansa olsem: "Ol i luk liklik long ai bilong yu long tingim bai yu kamap husban bilong pikinini meri bilong king? Mine tasol man i no gat moni, yu no tingim em olgeta."

original: And the servants told Saul what David had said.
translation: Na ol serkas i tokim Saul olsem Davide i mekim tok.

original: Saul replied, “Say to David, ‘The king desires no other dowry but a hundred Philistine foreskins as revenge on his enemies.’” But Saul intended to cause David’s death at the hands of the Philistines.
translation: Saul i tokim, "Yu tokim Dauid, 'King i laik praiz olsem ripot long eni, em hundred skina bilong Filistia tasol, olsem ripot long eni long han bilong eni i starvet na bagarap.''' Tasol Saul i bin laik ol Filistia i kilim Dauid.

original: When the servants reported these terms to David, he was pleased to become the king’s son-in-law. Before the wedding day arrived,
translation: Taim ol i kam bilong tokim dispela tok long David, em i amaze tru long kamap king sin-in-law. Bifoa dei bilong wedding i kam,

original: David and his men went out and killed two hundred Philistines. He brought their foreskins and presented them as payment in full to become the king’s son-in-law. Then Saul gave his daughter Michal to David in marriage.
translation: Daud na ol man bilong en i go na kilim tu hundret Filistia. Ol i bringim bek skuken bilong ol, na givim ol dispela long king, long pe bilong strongim, na em i kamap sun bilong king. King Saul i givim gel bilong en, Mikal, long Daud, na em i marit wantaim.

original: When Saul realized that the LORD was with David and that his daughter Michal loved David,
translation: Taim Saul i save olsem Lod i stap wantaim David, na meri bilong en Michal i lakim David,

original: he grew even more afraid of David. So from then on Saul was David’s enemy.
translation: Saul i kamap nau long ken, tok strongim bel long David. Bihaen long dispela, em i pokok bilong David.

original: Every time the Philistine commanders came out for battle, David was more successful than all of Saul’s officers, so that his name was highly esteemed.
translation: Taim ol bikman bilong Filistia i kam aut long faet, David i winpim ol ofisa bilong Saul, na nem bilong em i stap strong tru.

original: Then Saul ordered his son Jonathan and all his servants to kill David. But Jonathan delighted greatly in David,
translation: Na Saul i oraitim long ol wokmanmeri bilong en, olsem: "Yu mas kilim Daavid." Tasol Jonatan i amenas longlong long Daavid,

original: so he warned David, saying, “My father Saul intends to kill you. Be on your guard in the morning; find a secret place and hide there.
translation: Em wariim David, olsem: "Papa Saul i laik kilim yu, nau yu mas kisim bek long yu yet long moning; painim ples i no gat manmeri na klostu, na yu go kLostu."

original: I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where you are, so I can ask about you. And if I find out anything, I will tell you.”
translation: Mipela bai mi go aut na stap klostu long tumbuna bilong mipela long gras bilong ka, bek yu stap, na mipela bai askim long yu. Na mipela i lainim olgeta samting, orait mipela bai tokim yu.

original: Then Jonathan spoke well of David to his father Saul and said to him, “The king should not sin against his servant David; he has not sinned against you. In fact, his actions have been highly beneficial to you.
translation: Jonaten i tok gut long Davide long papa bilong en Saul na i tokim em, “King mas no ken sindaen long wokman bilong en Davide; em i no sindaen long yu. Em i gat bikpela benfit long yu, olsem na.”

original: He took his life in his hands when he struck down the Philistine, and the LORD worked a great salvation for all Israel. You saw it and rejoiced, so why would you sin against innocent blood by killing David for no reason?”
translation: Em i kisim laip bilong en i go long han bilong en tasol em i kilim Filistia, na LORD i wokim savaison bikpela long ol Israel. Yu lukim na bal yu i amamas, long nating, tasol bai yu sin long shedim blod innocent? Oli birua long kilim David long nating?

original: Saul listened to the voice of Jonathan and swore an oath: “As surely as the LORD lives, David will not be put to death.”
translation: Saul harim tok bilong Jonathan na em tok strongpela promis: "Olsem Bikpela i stap tasol, David no ken dai."

original: So Jonathan summoned David and told him all these things. Then Jonathan brought David to Saul to serve him as he had before.
translation: Na Jonathan i kalim David, na i tokim em ol dispela samting. Olsem na Jonathan i bringim David i go long Saul, long sarveim em olsem em i mekim bifo.

original: When war broke out again, David went out and fought the Philistines and struck them with such a mighty blow that they fled before him.
translation: Taim bilong fait i kamap gen, Daud i go aut na fight ol Filistia na i givim ol wik bikpela igo long ol, nasal ol i ranawe bikos long em.

original: But as Saul was sitting in his house with his spear in his hand, a spirit of distress from the LORD came upon him. While David was playing the harp,
translation: Bareket, Saul i sindaun long haus bilong en wantaim spia bilong en i stap long han bilong en, na speret bilong birua from GOD i kam aupanem. Wail David i pilai lap harp,

original: Saul tried to pin him to the wall with his spear. But the spear struck the wall and David eluded him, ran away, and escaped that night.
translation: Saul try pinim David long wal na spia bilong en i go klostu long wal, tasol David i slip long en, ranawe, na eskep long nait i go.

original: Then Saul sent messengers to David’s house to watch him and kill him in the morning. But David’s wife Michal warned him, “If you do not run for your life tonight, tomorrow you will be dead!”
translation: Na Saul salim messija i go long haus bilong David, ol i harim em na kilim em bikos kalapela moning. Tasol meri bilong David, Michal, givim warming long em, "Sapos yu no rann i go bai life dispela nait, tumoro yu dai!"

original: So Michal lowered David from the window, and he ran away and escaped.
translation: Mikali i lakim Daude doun long wino, na em i ranawe na skulim.

original: Then Michal took a household idol and laid it in the bed, placed some goat hair on its head, and covered it with a garment.
translation: Na Michal em i kisim wanpela idoli bilong hus, na em i lusim i go daun long bet, na em i putim hap bagarap bilong goat long hed bilong em, na em i kisim klot i go antap long en.

original: When Saul sent the messengers to seize David, Michal said, “He is ill.”
translation: Taim Saul sendim mesenja i go holim Dauid, Mikal tok, "Em i sik."

original: But Saul sent the messengers back to see David and told them, “Bring him up to me in his bed so I can kill him.”
translation: Na Saul i sendim mesija i go bek, ol i lukim Dauid, ol i tokim ol, "Kam bek long mi na kisim em i kam long bet bilong en, na mi ken kilim em."

original: And when the messengers entered, there was the idol in the bed with the quilt of goats’ hair on its head.
translation: Taim em ol mesenja i go insait, na idol i stap long bet wantaim kuilt bilong hari bilong goat pon diwai.

original: And Saul said to Michal, “Why did you deceive me like this? You sent my enemy away and he has escaped!” Michal replied, “He said to me, ‘Help me get away, or I will kill you!’”
translation: Na Saul i tokim Michal, “Wai yu givim rong wanpela toktok long me? Yu ranawe leta long eni, na em i ranawe olsem nau!” Michal i tok bek, “Em i tokim mi, ‘Helpim mi ranawe, o nara kilim yu!’”

original: So David ran away and escaped. And he went to Samuel at Ramah and told him all that Saul had done to him. Then he and Samuel went to Naioth and stayed there.
translation: Na Dafid i rin i go na ronwe na sikim. Na em i go long Samuwel long Ramah na i tokim em olgeta long ol samting Saul i mekim long em. Ol i go long Naiot na istap there.

original: When Saul was told that David was at Naioth in Ramah,
translation: Taim ol i tokim Saul, Daudi i stap long Naioth bilong Ramah.

original: he sent messengers to capture him. But when they saw the group of prophets prophesying, with Samuel leading them, the Spirit of God came upon them, and Saul’s messengers also began to prophesy.
translation: Em sendim mesija i go long kamdaunim, tasol w hen ol i lukim grup bilong prophet i tok bilong prophet, na Samuel i lidim ol, Spirut bilong God i kam antap long ol, na mesija bilong Saulu tu i stat prophesy.

original: When this was reported to Saul, he sent more messengers, but they began to prophesy as well. So Saul tried again and sent messengers a third time, and even they began to prophesy.
translation: Taim ol i ripotim dispela stori long Saul, na em baim moa pipol i go bek, ol i stat long tok bilong Spirit. Saul try gen, na em sendim pipol i go bek gen long tisa taim, na olgets i stat long tok bilong Spirit.

original: Finally, Saul himself left for Ramah and came to the large cistern at Secu, where he asked, “Where are Samuel and David?” “At Naioth in Ramah,” he was told.
translation: Bihain, Saul em yet kam bek long Ramah na i kam bek long bikpela hol water long Seku, na em askim, 'Samuel na Dawid i stap we?' Ol i tokim em, 'Ol i stap long Naiot long Ramah.'

original: So Saul went to Naioth in Ramah. But the Spirit of God came upon even Saul, and he walked along prophesying until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
translation: Na Saul i go long Naioth bilong Ramah. Tasol Spirits bilong God i kam apostim em, na Saul, na em i wokabaut prophesying, tok bilong profet, til em i kam apostim long Naioth bilong Ramah.

original: Then Saul stripped off his robes and also prophesied before Samuel. And he collapsed and lay naked all that day and night. That is why it is said, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”
translation: Na Saul i kisim of ros bilong en, na em tu i tokaut ol spirit bipo long Samuel. Na em i pilak ai na katim gras, na i stap olsem ol nait na dei. Ol i tok olsem, "Saul tu bai i stap wantaim ol man proses?"

original: Then David fled from Naioth in Ramah. He came to Jonathan and asked, “What have I done? What is my iniquity? How have I sinned against your father, that he wants to take my life?”
translation: Dauid ranawe long ples Naioth long Ramah. Em i kam bek long Jonathan na em askim, "Mi mekim wanem? Iniquiti bilong mi igo we? Mi bagarapim wanem long Papa bilong yu, na bai em i kisim laif bilong mi?"

original: “Far from it!” Jonathan replied. “You will not die. Indeed, my father does nothing, great or small, without telling me. So why would he hide this matter from me? This cannot be true!”
translation: “Nogat olsem,” Jonathan i tokim. “Yu no ken dai. Papa bilong me i no wok bekim dispela samting na i no tokim mi, bikos em i wok bigpela o smolpela, olgeta em i tokim mi. Wai bilong em bai i kailem dispela samting long mi? Dispela samting em i no inogat tru!”

original: But David again vowed, “Your father knows very well that I have found favor in your eyes, and he has said, ‘Jonathan must not know of this, or he will be grieved.’ As surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, there is but a step between me and death.”
translation: Dauid i tok alek again, “Papa bilong yu save wel olsem mi finim favore long ai bilong yu, na em i tok, ‘Yonatan no ken harmonic long dispela, nogat em bai i sori tru.’ Olsem LORD i stap na olsem yu yet, i gat wanpela step tasol long me na dei.”

original: Then Jonathan said to David, “Whatever you desire, I will do for you.”
translation: Na Jonathan i tokim David, “Olsem wanem yu laik, mi bai mekim olgets long yu.”

original: So David told him, “Look, tomorrow is the New Moon, and I am supposed to dine with the king. Instead, let me go and hide in the field until the third evening from now.
translation: David i tokim em, "Lookim, tumora Mun Nupela i kam, na mi mas kaikai wantaim king. Insed, mipela bai mi go hait long bus, was long eveving tri nem, bipo nau."

original: If your father misses me at all, tell him, ‘David urgently requested my permission to hurry to Bethlehem, his hometown, because there is an annual sacrifice for his whole clan.’
