translation: Tasol papa bilong yu lusim mi ating, yu tokim em, 'Daud i askim permison bilong mi i kam strong long go Bethlehem, ples bilong em, bikos igat sakrifis bilong yia bilong ol clan bilong em.'

original: If he says, ‘Good,’ then your servant is safe, but if he is enraged, you will know he has evil intentions.
translation: Em i tok olsem, 'Gutpela,' na servan bilong yu em i stap gut, tasol em i papara masalai, yu bai save em i gat longlong.

original: Therefore deal faithfully with your servant, for you have brought me into a covenant with you before the LORD. If there is iniquity in me, then kill me yourself; why should you bring me to your father?”
translation: Wok stret long servis man bilo, yu bringim mi go insait long kaivenant wantaim yu bifoa LORD. Sapos mi gat hevi pasin long me, yu yet kilim mi masen; long we bilong bringim mi go long papa bilong yu?

original: “Never!” Jonathan replied. “If I ever found out that my father had evil intentions against you, would I not tell you?”
translation: “Nogat!” Jonathan i tok. “Sapos papa bilong mi i gat tingting i no gut long yu, ina bai mi no tok igo long yu?”

original: Then David asked Jonathan, “Who will tell me if your father answers you harshly?”
translation: Na David harim tok long Jonathan, “Hu ina tokim mi if papa bilong yu i tok strong olsem long yu?”

original: “Come,” he replied, “let us go out to the field.” So the two of them went out into the field,
translation: “Kam na yumui go,” em i tok, “yumui i go long bus.” Na tupela i go long bus,

original: and Jonathan said, “By the LORD, the God of Israel, I will sound out my father by this time tomorrow or the next day. If he is favorable toward you, will I not send for you and tell you?
translation: Na Jonatan i tok, "Long han bilong Bikpela, God bilong Israel, bai mi hevim tok bilong tumbuna bai mende long tude o namba de. Sapos em i luk yu gut, ina bai mi sendem man i go bikim yu saves na yarnim yu."

original: But if my father intends to bring evil on you, then may the LORD punish me, and ever so severely, if I do not tell you and send you on your way in safety. May the LORD be with you, just as He has been with my father.
translation: Sapos papa bilong mi i laik bringim ol samting nogut long yu, Mai Lod i penalisim mi, na bai i penalisim mi strong tumas, sapos mi no tokim yu na mi no salim yu go long wei bilong yu long sindaun gut. Mai Lod i stap wantaim yu, olsem olsem em i stap wantaim papa bilong mi.

original: And as long as I live, treat me with the LORD’s loving devotion, that I may not die,
translation: Na olsem long taem bai mi stap, tritim mi wantaim lavin blong LORD, na mi no ken dai.

original: and do not ever cut off your loving devotion from my household—not even when the LORD cuts off every one of David’s enemies from the face of the earth.”
translation: Na no ken katim olsem na lovingselo bilong mi long husat i stap long haus bilong mi - nogat taem LORD i katim olgeta enemy bilong Daud long pes bilong graun.

original: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, “May the LORD hold David’s enemies accountable.”
translation: Na Jonatan wokim pakt wantaim haus bilong Davit, olsem: "Bikpela i givim ansa long ol i stap i kasem enemy bilong Davit."

original: And Jonathan had David reaffirm his vow out of love for him, for Jonathan loved David as he loved himself.
translation: Na Jonathan i askim David long promis bilong hert, long ol getters bilong lov blong hem, ol i lavim David olsem em yet lavim em yet.

original: Then Jonathan said to David, “Tomorrow is the New Moon, and you will be missed if your seat is empty.
translation: Na Jonathan i tokim David, “Nupela mun i kam tumora, na yu go na mipela bai missim yu, plesi bilong yu i stap we.

original: When you have stayed three days, hurry down to the place you hid on the day this trouble began, and remain beside the stone Ezel.
translation: Wanpela taim yu stap olsem three dei, harry i go daun long ples yu kaivim long dei trable ibin stat, na yu mas stap klostu long ston Ezel.

original: I will shoot three arrows to the side of it, as if I were aiming at a target.
translation: Mi bai shotim tripela banar long sait bilong en, olsem mi laikim igo long tok tama.

original: Then I will send a boy and say, ‘Go, find the arrows!’ Now, if I expressly say to him, ‘Look, the arrows are on this side of you; bring them,’ then come, because as surely as the LORD lives, it is safe for you and there is no danger.
translation: Mipela bai sendim boy, nau yu golukim pana bilong banis! Nau, sapos mipela tok klia long em, ' Lukim, pana bilong banis i stap daunisa long sait bilong yu; kisim ol i kam,' nau yu ken kam, olsem Papa bilong mipela i lukim, emi gutpela long yu na ino gat toksik.

original: But if I say to the young man, ‘Look, the arrows are beyond you,’ then you must go, for the LORD has sent you away.
translation: Mi tok olsem long man pikinini, 'Abraham, aela i stap longwe bilong yu,' den bai yu mas go, bikos LORD i kirapim yu i go.

original: And as for the matter you and I have discussed, the LORD is a witness between you and me forever.”
translation: Na long dispela samting yu na mi bin tok togeta, LORD em i stap long witnes bitwen yu na mi oltaim.

original: So David hid in the field, and when the New Moon had come, the king sat down to eat.
translation: Na Daudi i klostu i go hap long bus, na wren Mun Nupela i kam, king i sindaun na kaikai.

original: He sat in his usual place by the wall, opposite Jonathan and beside Abner, but David’s place was empty.
translation: Em sit long ples bilong em yet long sait bilong wal, opisite Jonathan na besain Abner, tasol ples bilong David i stap wei.

original: Saul said nothing that day because he thought, “Something has happened to David to make him ceremonially unclean—surely he is unclean.”
translation: Saul i no tok, em i ting, “Samting i kamap long David na mekim em i no inaf long wei bilong poro” – em i ting olsem, “Em i tambu, i no inaf.”

original: But on the day after the New Moon, the second day, David’s place was still empty, and Saul asked his son Jonathan, “Why hasn’t the son of Jesse come to the meal either yesterday or today?”
translation: Long moning afta Mun i kamap bikim nupela mun, ples bilong Dauid i stap yet, i no kam. Sauel arim tok long Jonathan, pikinini bilong em, “Pikinini bilong Jesi i no kam kaikai wantaim mipela, tude na gede.”

original: Jonathan answered, “David urgently requested my permission to go to Bethlehem,
translation: Yonatan i tokim, “Daudi i bihaim nau long me long givim em i go long go long Betlehem.”

original: saying, ‘Please let me go, because our clan is holding a sacrifice in the city, and my brother has told me to be there. So now, if I have found favor in your eyes, please let me go and see my brothers.’ That is why he did not come to the king’s table.”
translation: Em i tok, ‘Plis, lusim mi go, bekos klan bilong mipela i stap long kaikai bilong sacrifais long taun, na brata bilong mi i tokim mi long go. Nau, mi finis gat gutpela bikpela stap long ai bilong yu, plis lusim mi go lukim brata bilong mi.’ Em i no kam long tebol bilong king.

original: Then Saul’s anger burned against Jonathan, and he said to him, “You son of a perverse and rebellious woman! Do I not know that you have chosen the son of Jesse to your own shame and to the disgrace of the mother who bore you?
translation: Kros bilong Saul i bung long Jonathan, na em i tokim em, "Yu pikinini bilong meri i stap long pasis na bagarap! Mi no save olsem yu bin chusim pikinini bilong Jesee long sham bilong yu yet na long bikhat bilong mama i karim yu?"

original: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on this earth, neither you nor your kingship shall be established. Now send for him and bring him to me, for he must surely die!”
translation: Olsem long olsem Pikinini bilong Jesse i stap long graun, yu no, na pitsipit bilong king bilong yu yet bai strongim na stap. Nau salim man bung go lukim em, kisim em i kam klostu long me, wantaim em mas dai pinis!

original: “Why must he be put to death?” Jonathan replied. “What has he done?”
translation: Jonatan i tok bek, “Bai wanem i mas kilim man? Em i mekim wanem?”

original: Then Saul hurled his spear at Jonathan to kill him; so Jonathan knew that his father was determined to kill David.
translation: Na Saul i paitim spia long Jonatan, long kilim em; na Jonatan i save olsem papa bilong en i strong long kilim Dauid.

original: Jonathan got up from the table in fierce anger and did not eat any food that second day of the month, for he was grieved by his father’s shameful treatment of David.
translation: Yonatan em i go ap long tebol, bel hevi i kamap, na em i no kaikai bikos em i birua tru long wok nogut tru papa bilong em i mekim long David, olsem na dei namba tu bilong mun.

original: In the morning Jonathan went out to the field for the appointment with David, and a small boy was with him.
translation: Long moning Jonatan i go aut go long ples gras long hap blong em na David, na liklik boy i stap wantaim em.

original: He said to the boy, “Run and find the arrows I shoot.” And as the boy ran, Jonathan shot an arrow beyond him.
translation: Em i tokim boy long tok, “Ran i go finaum pilai mi bung.” Na long boy i ran, Jonathan i bung pilai i go pasim em.

original: When the boy reached the place where Jonathan’s arrow had fallen, Jonathan called to him, “Isn’t the arrow beyond you?”
translation: Taim pikinini kamap long ples we aeo bilong Jonatan i pundaun, Jonatan harim i tokim em, "Aeo i no stap longwe bilong yu?"

original: Then Jonathan cried out, “Hurry! Make haste! Do not delay!” So the boy picked up the arrow and returned to his master.
translation: Na Jonathan ropaikim aut, "Harim bikosai! Hirim i go! Bia nogat wari!" Na bai pikinim upela areo, i kam bek long masita bilong en.

original: But the boy did not know anything; only Jonathan and David knew the arrangement.
translation: Bai yupela harim, pikinini i no save long dispela; Jonathan na Daud tasol i save long dispela arangmen.

original: Then Jonathan gave his equipment to the boy and said, “Go, take it back to the city.”
translation: Na Jonathan i givim olgeta samting bilong en long yuang pikinini, na i tok, “Go, kisim bek i go long taun.”

original: When the young man had gone, David got up from the south side of the stone, fell facedown, and bowed three times. Then he and Jonathan kissed each other and wept together—though David wept more.
translation: Taim yangpela man i go pinis, Daud i kam bek long sait bilong sios bilong ston, i pilakai daun, na i bikim hed tri taem. Ol sem, Daud na Jonatan i paitim skintul igo, na ol i krai istap - Daud i krai moa.

original: And Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace, for the two of us have sworn in the name of the LORD, saying, ‘May the LORD be a witness between you and me, and between your descendants and mine forever.’” Then David got up and departed, and Jonathan went back into the city.
translation: Na Jonathan i tokim David, “Go longwe pes, bikos yu na mi ol i swear long nem bilong LORD, ol i tok olsem, ‘LORD i mas waines bikosim yu na mi, na bikosim pikinini bilong yu na pikinini bilong mi oltaim.’” Na David i kam bek gen na i go, na Jonathan i go bak gen long taun.

original: Then David came to Nob, to Ahimelech the priest. And when Ahimelech met David, he trembled and asked him, “Why are you alone? Why is no one with you?”
translation: Daud i kam long Nob, long hap bilong Ahimelek pries. Na em Ahimelek i go bekim Daud, em i skelim trausim na em askim, "Wai yu kam wanpela? Wai iyok i no stap wantaim yu?"

original: “The king has given me a mission,” David replied. “He told me no one is to know about the mission or charge. And I have directed my young men to meet me at a certain place.
translation: “King i givim mi wok,” David i tok. “Em i tok olsem nogat man i mas save long dispela wok na bos. Na mi bin diktedim ol yangpela man bilong mi long go kaikaim long wanpela ples.”

original: Now then, what do you have on hand? Give me five loaves of bread, or whatever can be found.”
translation: Nau, wanem samting yu gat long han bilong yu? Givim mi faiv loaf bread, o wanem samting bai i kamap.

original: “There is no common bread on hand,” the priest replied, “but there is some consecrated bread—provided that the young men have kept themselves from women.”
translation: Prist i tokim ol, "i no got bred komon long han, tasol i got bred we i bin dedikeit - long ting bai yung man i holim yas yet, ol i stap strong long birua, i no go narpel."

original: David answered, “Women have indeed been kept from us, as is usual when I set out. And the equipment of the young men is holy, as it is even on common missions, and all the more at this time.”
translation: Daud i bekim tok, "Meri ol i no kam long mipela, olsem em i wankain bilong tumbuna. Samting bilong yangpela man em i stap holy, olsem na em i wankain long wok bilong ol pipol, tasol long dispela taim em i holy moa."

original: So the priest gave him the consecrated bread, since there was no bread there but the Bread of the Presence, which had been removed from before the LORD and replaced with hot bread on the day it was taken away.
translation: Na prist i givim bread bilong halivim long em, bikos no kengot long hap, tasol got Bread bilong Presens, we i raun long bifo LORD, na em i go daun, na bread nupela i kam inap long hap, i replisim.

original: Now one of Saul’s servants was there that day, detained before the LORD. And his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chief shepherd for Saul.
translation: Wanpela hau bos bilong Saol i stap long haus bilong Saol, em i stop olsem long lip bilong Jehovah. Nem bilong em Doeg Edomait, em i bigpela pasor bilong Saol.

original: Then David asked Ahimelech, “Is there not a spear or sword on hand here? For I have brought neither my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king’s business was urgent.”
translation: Na Davide hem askim Ahimelek, “Ina spia o sowrd igat long han? Bikos mi no bringim sowrd na wundim bilong mi i kam wantaim mi, olsem na bikpela nep bilong ples bilong king em i klia tru.”

original: The priest replied, “The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you killed in the Valley of Elah, is here; it is wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod. If you want, you may take it. For there is no other but this one.” And David said, “There is none like it; give it to me.”
translation: Prist i tokim ol, “Sord bilong Goliath bilong Philistine, whos yu kilim long Vali bilong Elah, em i stap; em i wapim long klos bihain long ephod. Yu laik, yu ken kisim. No gat narapela hap pasis long dispela wan.” Na Daud i tok, “I gat narapela olsem; givim mi.”

original: That day David fled from Saul and went to Achish king of Gath.
translation: Davedi rinawe long Saul, na em i go long Achish king bilong Gath.

original: But the servants of Achish said to him, “Is this not David, the king of the land? Did they not sing about him in their dances, saying: ‘Saul has slain his thousands, and David his tens of thousands’?”
translation: Servant blo Achish i tokim em, “Em i no Davide, king bilong kantri? Ol i no singaut long en bilong ol yet long danis ol i mekim, ol i tok: 'Saul i kilim ol tausen, na Davide i kilim ol hundred tausen'?”

original: Now David took these words to heart and was very much afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
translation: Na Daud i holim dispela tok long het bilong en, na em i poret tumas long Akis king bilong Gat.

original: So he changed his behavior before them and feigned madness in their hands; he scratched on the doors of the gate and let his saliva run down his beard.
translation: Em i chanim behaviir bilong en, em i bin pasim olsem hed i go long wei, na em i raitim long dok bilong gat, em i lusim drool bilong en i ran i go daun long baird bilong en.

original: Then Achish said to his servants, “Look, you can see that the man is insane! Why have you brought him to me?
translation: Achish i tokim servistim bilong en, “Lukim, yu ina luk, man ia i go long hap bilong spirit! Wanem ol i kam bringim i go long me?

original: Am I in need of madmen, that you have brought this man to rave in my presence? Must this man come into my house?”
translation: I gat bikpela nidi long ol man i go long olsem kukuk, dat yuhu bringim man i go long tok strong long me? Em i mas kam insait long haus bilong mi?

original: So David left Gath and took refuge in the cave of Adullam. When his brothers and the rest of his father’s household heard about it, they went down to him there.
translation: Na Daud i lusim Gath, go bek long hole bilong Adullam. Braitna na haus bilong papa bilong em i harim tok bilong em, ol i go daun kam klostu long em.

original: And all who were distressed or indebted or discontented rallied around him, and he became their leader. About four hundred men were with him.
translation: Na ol i gat trabel, ol i wail long debt, ol i no nap long lif, ol i kam antap long en, na em i kamap bilong ol long lip leader. I stap wantaim em, ol man i gat hap netasent, em i stap.

original: From there David went to Mizpeh of Moab, where he said to the king of Moab, “Please let my father and mother stay with you until I learn what God will do for me.”
translation: Na long hap David i go long Mizpeh bilong Moab, na tokim king bilong Moab olsem, "Papa na mama bilong me inap stap wantaim yu, kam long taem mi yet laik save olsem God bai mekim wanem long me."

original: So he left them in the care of the king of Moab, and they stayed with him the whole time David was in the stronghold.
translation: Na em lusiim ol long hap bilong king bilong Moab, na ol i stap wantaim em long olgeta taim David i stap long ples strong.

original: Then the prophet Gad said to David, “Do not stay in the stronghold. Depart and go into the land of Judah.” So David left and went to the forest of Hereth.
translation: Na profet Gad i tokim Davide, “Yu no stap long ples strong. Kam daun na go long laine bilong Yuda.” Na Davide i lus na i go long bus bilong Hereth.

original: Soon Saul learned that David and his men had been discovered. At that time Saul was in Gibeah, sitting under the tamarisk tree on the hill at Gibeah, with his spear in hand and all his servants standing around him.
translation: Nau na Saul i save long olgeta: Daved na ol man bilong em ol i kamap. Long dispela taim Saul i stap long Gibe, i sindaun ananit long diwai Tamarisk long han bilong maunten long Gibe, wantaim spia bilong en long han, na ol servant bilong en i stanadaroundim em.

original: Then Saul said to his servants, “Listen, men of Benjamin! Is the son of Jesse giving all of you fields and vineyards and making you commanders of thousands or hundreds?
translation: Na Saul i tokim servant im, "Haroim, ol man bilong Benjamin! Pikinini bilong Jesse em i givim yupela olgeta graun na vine, na em i mekim yupela ol kapten bilong tausen o hundred?"

original: Is that why all of you have conspired against me? Not one of you told me that my own son had made a covenant with the son of Jesse. Not one of you has shown concern for me or revealed to me that my son has stirred up my own servant to lie in wait against me, as is the case today.”
translation: Em i pas long ol, ol i paitim pilai long me? Nogat wanpela i tokim mi long olsem, pikinini bilong mi i mekim akor wantaim pikinini bilong Jesee. Nogat wanpela i soim concern long me, nogat wanpela i givim nau long me olsem, pikinini bilong mi i wokim servist bilong mi i go het long we, olsem em i kamap tude.

original: But Doeg the Edomite, who had stationed himself with Saul’s servants, answered: “I saw the son of Jesse come to Ahimelech son of Ahitub at Nob.
translation: Doeg bilong Edom i stap wantaim servants bilong Saul, na em i tok: "Mi lukim pikinini bilong Jesse i kam long Ahimelech, pikinini bilong Ahitub, long Nob.

original: Ahimelech inquired of the LORD for him and gave him provisions. He also gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”
translation: Ahimelek askim tok bilong Jehovah olsem nau, na givim kaikai long em. Na em i givim em suk bilong Goliath Filistia.

original: Then the king sent messengers to summon Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and his father’s whole family, who were priests at Nob. And all of them came to the king.
translation: King i sendim mesa long bekim Ahimelech pris, pikinini bilong Ahitub, na ol famili bilong papa i kam, ol pris husat i wok long Nob. Na ol i kam long king.

original: “Listen now, son of Ahitub,” said Saul. “Here I am, my lord,” he replied.
translation: “Harim nau, susa bilong Ahitub,” olsem Saul i tok. “Mi stap hia, papa bilong yu,” na em i ansa.

original: And Saul asked him, “Why have you and the son of Jesse conspired against me? You gave him bread and a sword and inquired of God for him so that he could rise up against me to lie in wait, as he is doing today.”
translation: Na Saul tokim em, “Ol i paitim plan long me, yu na pikinini bilong Jesse? Yu givim em bret na sot, na yu askim God long en, olsem em i kamap na go long me stret long wail, olsem em i mekim tude.”

original: Ahimelech answered the king, “Who among all your servants is as faithful as David, the king’s son-in-law, the captain of your bodyguard who is honored in your house?
translation: Ahimelek i tokim king, “Husat long ol saris bilong yu olsem David, sun bilong wife bilong king, kapten bilong bodigad bilong yu, stap strong long tok bilong en, na yu givim respek long em long hus bilong yu?”

original: Was that day the first time I inquired of God for him? Far be it from me! Let not the king accuse your servant or any of my father’s household, for your servant knew nothing of this whole affair—not in part or in whole.”
translation: Em i dai birua mi go askim God longen? Nogat, em i no ken olsem! King no ken skulim servant bilong yu, na nogat wanpela man husat i kam long haus lain bilong papa bilong mi. Mi no save long dispela whole samting – bikos em i nogat, na mi no harim tok bilong en, na em i no kam long hed bilong mi, na mi no save long en, na nogat.

original: But the king replied, “You will surely die, Ahimelech, you and all your father’s house!”
translation: King i tokim, “Yu bai dai pinis, Ahimelech, yu na olgeta haus bilong papa bilong yu!”

original: Then the king ordered the guards at his side, “Turn and kill the priests of the LORD, because they too sided with David. For they knew he was fleeing, but they did not tell me.” But the king’s servants would not lift a hand to strike the priests of the LORD.
translation: King i givim orden long ol bodyguard bilong en, "Turnim na kilim ol prist na minista bilong LORD, bikos ol i kamap sampela na sindaun wantaim David. Ol i save em i ranawe, tasol ol i no talem pasin bilong ol long mi." Tasol wokman bilong king i no lifim han bilong ol i paitim ol prist na minista bilong LORD.

original: So the king ordered Doeg, “You turn and strike down the priests!” And Doeg the Edomite turned and struck down the priests himself. On that day he killed eighty-five men who wore the linen ephod.
translation: King i givim tok long Doeg, "Yupela turim na kilim daun ol pris!" Na Doeg Edomite i turim na kilim daun ol pris em yet. Long hap de, i kilim daun eighty-five man we i wessim epod bilong priis long mat.

original: He also put to the sword Nob, the city of the priests, with its men and women, children and infants, oxen, donkeys, and sheep.
translation: Em i kilim Nob, taun bilong priis, wantaim ol man, meri, pikinini, pikinini nogut yet, bulmakau, donki, na sip, ol i punda long swod.

original: But one of the sons of Ahimelech son of Ahitub escaped. His name was Abiathar, and he fled to David.
translation: Wanpela bilong pikinini belong Ahimelek, pikinini belong Ahitub, i ranawe. Nem bilong em Abiatar, na em i go inap long Davit.

original: And Abiathar told David that Saul had killed the priests of the LORD.
translation: Na Abiathar i tokim David olsem, Saul i kilim ol prist bilong Lod.

original: Then David said to Abiathar, “I knew that Doeg the Edomite was there that day, and that he was sure to tell Saul. I myself am responsible for the lives of everyone in your father’s house.
translation: Na Davidson i tokim Abiatar, "Mi save olsem Doeg Edomait i stap tasol long dei nau, na em bai strongim tok long Sau. Mi yet em i responcibol long olgeta life long haus bilong papa bilong yu."

original: Stay with me; do not be afraid, for he who seeks your life is seeking mine as well. You will be safe with me.”
translation: Bai yu stap wantaim mi; no ken bikim fear, bikos man i skelim laip bilong yu em i skelim laip bilong mi tu. Yu bai stap strong wantaim mi, nogat ken harmim yu.

original: Now it was reported to David, “Look, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah and looting the threshing floors.”
translation: Ol i tokim Davide, " Lukim, Filistia i go finis long Keila na ol i stilim hevi long ples bilong bungim paits."

original: So David inquired of the LORD, “Should I go and attack these Philistines?” And the LORD said to David, “Go and attack the Philistines and save Keilah.”
translation: Na Daud i askim tok bilong Jehovah, "Me mas go na harim despla Filistia?" Na Jehovah i tokim Daud, "Yu go na attackim despla Filistia na salim Keilah."

original: But David’s men said to him, “Look, we are afraid here in Judah; how much more if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?”
translation: Man bilong Daud i tokim em, "Lukim, mipela i stap fear hare long Judah; olgeta moa yet bai yumi go long Keilah na katim hap bilong ol arme bilong Filistia?"

original: Once again, David inquired of the LORD, and the LORD answered him: “Go at once to Keilah, for I will deliver the Philistines into your hand.”
translation: Daud i askim Tok bilong Jehovah gen, na Jehovah i givim ansa long em: "Go nau long Keilah, bikos mi bai givim Filistia i kam long han bilong yu."

original: Then David and his men went to Keilah, fought against the Philistines, and carried off their livestock, striking them with a mighty blow. So David saved the people of Keilah.
translation: Na Davide na ol man bilong em i go long Keila, i fight long Philisti, na ol i kisim ol animals bilong ol, na i kilim ol wantaim bikpela pek. Na hambak, Davide i saveim ol pipol bilong Keila.

original: (Now Abiathar son of Ahimelech had brought the ephod with him when he fled to David at Keilah.)
translation: Na Abiathar pikinini bilong Ahimelech bin kisim epod i kam na em rin go long David long Keilah.

original: When Saul was told that David had gone to Keilah, he said, “God has delivered him into my hand, for he has trapped himself by entering a town with gates and bars.”
translation: Taim ol i tokim Saul, David i go kam long Keilah, em i tok, "God i givim em long han bilong me, em i kamap trap long en tasol, olsem na em i go insait long taun we i gat gate na bar."

original: Then Saul summoned all his troops to go to war at Keilah and besiege David and his men.
translation: Saul i kamapim ol soldia bilong en go long war long Keilah, na ol i beleh David na ol man bilong en.

original: When David learned that Saul was plotting evil against him, he said to Abiathar the priest, “Bring the ephod.”
translation: Daud i save olsem Saul i wok long pilim bikhet gen long en, na em i tokim Abiatar pries, “Kam bringim ephod i go.”

original: And David said, “O LORD, God of Israel, Your servant has heard that Saul intends to come to Keilah and destroy the city on my account.
translation: Na Davide i tok, "O Papa bilong olgeta, Bikpela bilong Israel, Wokman bilong yu harim, Saul i laik kam long Keilah na distroi siti long me.

original: Will the citizens of Keilah surrender me into his hand? Will Saul come down, as Your servant has heard? O LORD, God of Israel, please tell Your servant.” “He will,” said the LORD.
translation: Bai ol pipol bilong Keilah i givim mi long hem? Bai Saul i kam daun, olsem servantsu i harim? O LORDE, God bilong Israel, please tokim servantsu.” “Em bai mekim,” tok LORDE.

original: So David asked, “Will the citizens of Keilah surrender me and my men into the hand of Saul?” “They will,” said the LORD.
translation: Daud i askim, “Ol pisin bilong Keila bai yu mas givim mipela na ol man bilong mipela long han bilong Sau?” “Bai ol i givim,” LORD i tok.

original: Then David and his men, about six hundred strong, set out and departed from Keilah, moving from place to place. When Saul was told that David had escaped from Keilah, he declined to go forth.
translation: Na Davide wantaim ol man bilong en, sikis handred man strong, ol i go na lusim Keila, waka long hap bilong ples ibilong ples. Wen Sau em i harim olsem Davide im go bek long Keila, em i no laik kisim ka na go, em i no laik go bek long ples.

original: And David stayed in the wilderness strongholds and in the hill country of the Wilderness of Ziph. Day after day Saul searched for him, but God would not deliver David into his hand.
translation: Na Daud i stap yet long ples strong bilong bus na long kantri bilong maunten bilong Bus Ziph. Dei bihain dei Saul i wailisim em, tasol Bikpela i no ken givim em long han bilong Saul.

original: While David was in Horesh in the Wilderness of Ziph, he saw that Saul had come out to take his life.
translation: Wail Dauid i stap long Hores long bus long Zif, em i lukim olsem Sauel i kam aut long lusim laip bilong en.

original: And Saul’s son Jonathan came to David in Horesh and strengthened his hand in God,
translation: Na Jonatan, pikinini bilong Saul, i kam klostu long David long hap Horesh na i givim strong long han bilong em insait long Bikpela.

original: saying, “Do not be afraid, for my father Saul will never lay a hand on you. And you will be king over Israel, and I will be your second-in-command. Even my father Saul knows this is true.”
translation: No ken stret long fear, papa Saul nogat man i go kilim yu. Yu bai kamap king bilong Israel, na mi bai stap bihain long yu olsem nem bilong yu. I gat save long dispela, even papa Saul i save tu, bikos em i pikinini bilong en, na em i save olsem yu bai bosim Israel, na mi bai man i stap bihain long yu.

original: So the two of them made a covenant before the LORD. And David remained in Horesh, while Jonathan went home.
translation: Na ol i mekim kaivakai long hap bilong Jehovah. Na Davit i stap yet long Horesh, nasel Jonathan i go bak long haus.

original: Then the Ziphites came up to Saul at Gibeah and said, “Is not David hiding among us in the strongholds at Horesh, on the hill of Hachilah south of Jeshimon?
translation: Na Zifait i kam apostol long Saul long Gibe, na ol i tok, “Daved em i no kaiv pinis em long mipela inap long strong ol ples bilong wara long Horesh, antap long maunten bilong Hakila, sait bilong sauten long Jesimon?”

original: Now, O king, come down whenever your soul desires, and we will be responsible for delivering him into your hand.”
translation: Nau, o king, kam daun wanem taim soul bilong yu i laik, na mipela bai bekim responsibol long givim em long han bilong yu.

original: “May you be blessed by the LORD,” replied Saul, “for you have had compassion on me.
translation: Na Saul i tok bek, “Yu ken bless olgeta long han bilong LORDE, bikos yu showim pitim na karim tumas long mi.”

original: Please go and prepare further. Investigate and watch carefully where he goes and who has seen him there, for I am told that he is extremely cunning.
translation: Go na prepa gen, isap long tokstalk na wachim gut wei em i go na husat i lukim em, ol i tokim mi em i kwin tumas.

original: Observe and find out all the places where he hides. Then come back to me with certainty, and I will go with you. If he is in the land, I will search him out among all the clans of Judah.”
translation: Lukim na kisim save long ol ples we em i hait, kam bek long me, na mi go wantaim yu. I sosaem em long klia bilong Yuda, na bai mi susaem em.

original: So they set out and went to Ziph ahead of Saul. Now David and his men were in the Wilderness of Maon in the Arabah south of Jeshimon,
translation: Ol i go na ol i wok long Sip bifo Sau. Na Davide na ol man bilong en i stap long bus bilong Maon long Araba sait bilong Jesimon,

original: and Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told about it, he went down to the rock and stayed in the Wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard of this, he pursued David there.
translation: Na Saul na man bilong en i go bekim em. Ol i tokim David long dispela, na em i go daun long rak na stap long Bus long Maon. Na em i harim dispela, na Saul i pursuim David long hap.

original: Saul was proceeding along one side of the mountain, and David and his men along the other side. Even though David was hurrying to get away, Saul and his men were closing in on David and his men to capture them.
translation: Saul i go wankain wanpela sait bilong maunten, na Daud na ol man bilong en i go wankain nather sait. Daud i ranawe i go bek, tasol Saul na ol man bilong en i kamap kukim Daud na ol man bilong en olsem wanem nau bai ol i kisim.

original: Then a messenger came to Saul, saying, “Come quickly, for the Philistines have raided the land!”
translation: Wanpela ran i bringim stori i kam long Saul, tok olsem, 'Kam hariap, Filistia, papa na mama bilong eni kantri, i bagarapim kantri!'

original: So Saul broke off his pursuit of David and went to meet the Philistines. That is why that place is called Sela-hammahlekoth.
translation: Na Saul em i stopim bek pursit bilong en long David na em i go bek long harim Filistia. Em ol i kolim ples ia Sela-hammahlekoth.

original: And David went up from there and lived in the strongholds of En-gedi.
translation: Na Dauid i go ap long hap na i stap long ol ples strong bilong En-geti.

original: After Saul had returned from pursuing the Philistines, he was told, “David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.”
translation: After Saul i kam bek na pinis pursuim long Filistia, ol i tokim em, “David i stap long bus bilong En-Gedi.”

original: So Saul took three thousand chosen men from all Israel and went to look for David and his men in the region of the Rocks of the Wild Goats.
translation: Saul kisim man tri tausen we i gat nem long Isrel, na i go lukim David na ol man bilong em long hap bilong Rok bilong Kid Bilong Bus.

original: Soon Saul came to the sheepfolds along the road, where there was a cave, and he went in to relieve himself. And David and his men were hiding in the recesses of the cave.
translation: Saul i kam apost long hap bilong ol sip, we istap hol bilong waitman, na em i go insait long mekim klia bodi bilong en. Na Daud na ol man bilong en ol i kaivim i stap long ol korner bilong hol.

original: So David’s men said to him, “This is the day about which the LORD said to you, ‘Behold, I will deliver your enemy into your hand, that you may do with him as you wish.’” Then David crept up secretly and cut off a corner of Saul’s robe.
translation: Ol man bilong David i tokim em, "Nau em i de, we LORD i tok olsem, 'Behold, Mi bai givim poisen bilong yu long han bilong yu, na yu ken wokim olsem yu laik long em.'" Na David i go bek gen, i katim korner bilong kalimap bilong Saul.

original: Afterward, David’s conscience was stricken because he had cut off the corner of Saul’s robe.
translation: Bihaen long taim, hati bilong Daude i bin katim olsem em i kisim hap bilong rok bilong Saul.

original: So he said to his men, “The LORD forbid that I should do such a thing to my master, the LORD’s anointed. May I never lift my hand against him, since he is the LORD’s anointed.”
translation: Em i tokim man meri bilong en, "Bikpela i stap agensim long ol samting olsem. Mi no ken duim ol samting olsem long bos bilong mi, man i gat oili bilong Bikpela. Mi no ken lusim han bilong mi long en, bikos em i bos, na em i gat oili bilong Bikpela."

original: With these words David restrained his men, and he did not let them rise up against Saul. Then Saul left the cave and went on his way.
translation: Na Daud i holim bek long ol man bilong em, na i no givim pinis ol man bilong en i go ap long Saul. Saul i lusim hole, na i go we long rod bilong en.

original: After that, David got up, went out of the cave, and called out to Saul, “My lord the king!” When Saul looked behind him, David bowed facedown in reverence
translation: Na bihain, Davide i get up, i go aus long hol bilong stoan, na i singautim tok long Saul, “Papa bilong ol, king!” Wanem taim Saul i luk behain bilong en, Davide i kuku kaukau daun olsem long respek.

original: and said to Saul, “Why do you listen to the words of men who say, ‘Look, David intends to harm you’?
translation: Ol i tokim Saul, “Wai yumi harim tok bilong ol man ol i tok, ‘David i laik kisim bek long yu’?”

original: Behold, this day you have seen with your own eyes that the LORD delivered you into my hand in the cave. I was told to kill you, but I spared you and said, ‘I will not lift my hand against my lord, since he is the LORD’s anointed.’
translation: Lukim, tude na yu pilai si wantaim ai bilong yu olsem Papa God i givim yu long mi han long cave. Ol i tokim mi long kilim yu, tasol mi skulim yu, mi tok olsem, "Mi no go liftim han bilong mi against lorman bilong mi, bikos em i anoint bilong Papa God."

original: See, my father, look at the corner of your robe in my hand. For I cut it off, but I did not kill you. See and know that there is no evil or rebellion in my hands. I have not sinned against you, even though you are hunting me down to take my life.
translation: Papa bilong mi, lukim na lukim korner bilong rok bilong yu yet long han blong mi. Mi kisim i go, tasol mi no kilim yu. Lukim na save olsem i no gat evil o rebellion long han blong mi. Mi no mekim sin long yu, even though yu wokim olsem yu laik kilim laif blong mi.

original: May the LORD judge between you and me, and may the LORD take vengeance on you, but my hand will never be against you.
translation: Mipela i go long LORD, em i mas jugisim between yu na mi, na mipela i go long LORD, em i mas kisim bek long yu, tasol han bilong mi no inap harim yu.

original: As the old proverb says, ‘Wickedness proceeds from the wicked.’ But my hand will never be against you.
translation: Olsem tok bokis bilong tumbuna i tok, ‘Bikhet i kam long ol bikhet.’ Bai mi han no inap harim yu.

original: Against whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom are you pursuing? A dead dog? A flea?
translation: King bilong Isrel i kam bekim husat? Yu go bekim hu? Dok i dai o pispis?

original: May the LORD be our judge and decide between you and me. May He take notice and plead my case and deliver me from your hand.”
translation: Mipela i laik LORD i kam jusisim mipela, i givim desisipn long yu na mi. I lukim na toktok long kesa bilong mi, na i skulim mi long han bilong yu.

original: When David had finished saying these things, Saul called back, “Is that your voice, David my son?” Then Saul wept aloud
translation: Taim Davide finisim tok ol dispela, Saul i kolim bek, “Em i boz bilong yu, Davide pikinini bilong mi?” Na Saul i kisim bikim wara nogut.

original: and said to David, “You are more righteous than I, for you have rewarded me with good, though I have rewarded you with evil.
translation: Ol i tokim David, “Yu raitim moa long me, yu givim mi gutpela, tasol mi bin givim yu ol sem.”

original: And you have shown this day how well you have dealt with me; for when the LORD delivered me into your hand, you did not kill me.
translation: Na yu bin sho despe long tede olsem yu bin givim gutpela hap long mi; long taim LORD i salim mi i go long han bilong yu, yu no bin kilim mi.

original: When a man finds his enemy, does he let him go away unharmed? May the LORD reward you with good for what you have done for me this day.
translation: Wanpela man i kam bekim enemy bilong en, em bai lusim enemy bilong en i go bek we? LORD i bekim yu goed long olgeta samting yu mekim long me today.

original: Now I know for sure that you will be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be established in your hands.
translation: Nau mi save longwey olsem yu bai kamap king, na ples kantri bilong Israel bai istap long han bilong yu.

original: So now, swear to me by the LORD that you will not cut off my descendants or wipe out my name from my father’s house.”
translation: Nau, tok strong long Bikpela, kisim olegami long yu olsem yu no bagarapim stori bilong papa na mama bilong mi, no stopim ol pikinini bilong mi, na no waisim wei nem bilong mi long haus bilong papa bilong mi.

original: So David gave his oath to Saul. Then Saul returned home, but David and his men went up to the stronghold.
translation: Daud i givim tok bai i long Sauel. Olsem nau, Sauel i go bak long haus bilong en, tasol Daud na ol man bilong en i go antap long blessim ples.

original: When Samuel died, all Israel gathered to mourn for him; and they buried him at his home in Ramah. Then David set out and went down to the Wilderness of Paran.
translation: Taim Samuel dai pinis, ol Israel i kam olgeta na kisim sori long em; na ol i pakim em long haus bilong em long Ramah. David i go daun na i go long bus long Paran.

original: Now there was a man in Maon whose business was in Carmel. He was a very wealthy man with a thousand goats and three thousand sheep, which he was shearing in Carmel.
translation: I gat man wanpela long Maon, bisnis bilong em i stap long Karmel. Em i man bilong planti moni, i gat kambing thousand wan na sip three thousand, na em i kisim hap bilong shearing long Karmel.

original: His name was Nabal, and his wife’s name was Abigail. She was an intelligent and beautiful woman, but her husband, a Calebite, was harsh and evil in his dealings.
translation: Em i kolim Nabal, na meri bilong em i kolim Abigail. Em i gutpela i go long tok, na em i swit moa, tasol husband bilong em, em i man bilong Kalebit, em i strongpela na hatwok long ol samting em i mekim.

original: While David was in the wilderness, he heard that Nabal was shearing sheep.
translation: Wail David i stap long bus, em i harim olsem Nabal i kaikai bilong sheep.

original: So David sent ten young men and instructed them, “Go up to Nabal at Carmel. Greet him in my name
translation: Na Daved i sentim ten yangpela man, em i givim tok instruct long ol, "Go ap long Nabal long Karmel. Givim greetings long em long nem bilong mi."

original: and say to him, ‘Long life to you, and peace to you and your house and to all that belongs to you.
translation: Tokim olsem long em, 'Laip moa i kam long yu, na peace i kam long yu na husat i stap long haus bilong yu, na olgeta samting bilong yu.'

original: Now I hear that it is time for shearing. When your shepherds were with us, we did not harass them, and nothing of theirs was missing the whole time they were in Carmel.
translation: Nau mi harim olsem em i taim bilong kotim pilai. Taim ol yangpela man bilong yu i stap wantaim mipela, mipela i no givim ol samting strong long ol, na nogat samting bilong ol i los holem taim ol i stap long Karmel.

original: Ask your young men, and they will tell you. So let my young men find favor with you, for we have come on the day of a feast. Please give whatever you can afford to your servants and to your son David.’”
translation: Bai yumi akisim manmeri yangpela bilong yu, na bai ol i tokim yu. Na bai manmeri yangpela bilong mipela i kamap strong long ai bilong yu, wantaim mipela i kam long dei bilong kaikai bikpela. Yu givim olgeta samting we yu ina save pei long wokman bilong yu na long son David.

original: When David’s young men arrived, they relayed all these words to Nabal on behalf of David. Then they waited.
translation: Taim Pikinini man bilong David i kam, ol i tokim ol dispela tok olgeta long Nabal long hap bilong David. Na ol i stap wait.

original: But Nabal asked them, “Who is David? Who is this son of Jesse? Many servants these days are breaking away from their masters.
translation: Na Nabal harim ol i askim, "Husat i David? Husat i disped bilong Jesse? Planti wokman long taim nau i go bek gen long ol mas."

original: Why should I take my bread and water and the meat I have slaughtered for my shearers, and give them to these men whose origin I do not know?”
translation: Wai mi mas kisim bret na wara bilong me, na mit mi bin kilim long kaikai bilong ol man i kam krabim gris bilong mi, na givim ol i go long dispela man ol we ples bilong orijin bilong em we mi no save?

original: So David’s men turned around and went back, and they relayed to him all these words.
translation: Man meri bilong Daud i turnim bek, ol i kam bek gen, na ol i tokim em olgeta wod nau.

original: And David said to his men, “Strap on your swords!” So David and all his men put on their swords, and about four hundred men followed David, while two hundred stayed with the supplies.
translation: Na Davide i tokim ol man bilong em, “Putim swoed long bodi bilong yumi!” Na Davide na ol man bilong en i putim swoed long bodi bilong ol, na kostim fore hundred ol man bilong em i follem Davide, wail tu hundred i stap bek long ka bilong ol.

original: Meanwhile, one of Nabal’s young men informed Nabal’s wife Abigail, “Look, David sent messengers from the wilderness to greet our master, but he scolded them.
translation: Wanpela taim wanpela yangpela man bilong Nabal i go tokim meri bilong Nabal, Abigail, "Lookim, Daud i sendim messenja bilong en i kam long bus na bungim greeting long papa bilong mipela, tasol em i krosim ol".

original: Yet these men were very good to us. When we were in the field, we were not harassed, and nothing of ours went missing the whole time we lived among them.
translation: Yet ol man meri dispela i stap gut long mipela. Wanpela taim mipela i stap long bus, mipela i no inaf, na nogat samting bilong mipela i los from hale tim mipela i stap wantaim ol.

original: They were a wall around us, both day and night, the whole time we were herding our sheep near them.
translation: Ol i stap olsem banara long mipela long dei na nait, olgeta taim mipela i stap klostu long ol, herdim ol sip.

original: Now consider carefully what you must do, because disaster looms over our master and all his household. For he is such a scoundrel that nobody can speak to him!”
translation: Nau yu mas tingim gut longlong, bikos dai i kam bek long bos na ol pipol bilong haus moning. Em i man bilong bagarap, tasol nobodi ken tokim em, olsem dai i stap long hevi!

original: Then Abigail hurried and took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five butchered sheep, five seahs of roasted grain, a hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs. She loaded them on donkeys
translation: Na Abigail i go kisim ka, i harimapim, na i kisim kaikai olsem: tupela hanred loaf blo bret, tupela sak blo wain, faiv sip blo pik, faiv sihs blo grain i bin rausim, wan hundred kalab blo resins, na tupela hanred keks blo figs. Na i lusim ol kaikai long donki.

original: and said to her young men, “Go ahead of me. I will be right behind you.” But she did not tell her husband Nabal.
translation: Na em i tokim ol yangpela man bilong en, “Go bek long me. Mi bai kam bihain long yu.” Tasol em i no tokim husat bilong em, Nabal.

original: As Abigail came riding her donkey into a mountain ravine, she saw David and his men coming down toward her, and she met them.
translation: Abigail i ridim donki bilong en i go insait long kunai gorgo long maunten, na em i lukim David na ol man bilong em i kam daun komo long en, na em i go bek gen long ol.

original: Now David had just finished saying, “In vain I have protected all that belonged to this man in the wilderness. Nothing that belongs to him has gone missing, yet he has paid me back evil for good.
translation: Nau David em i winim tok bilong en, "Mi lukautim olgeta samting bilong dispela man long bus, nogat wari longen, tasol em i givim mi bikhet long gud."

original: May God punish David, and ever so severely, if I let one of Nabal’s men survive until morning.”
translation: God i kilim David, winim strong longlong, if mi lusim wanpela man bilong Nabal i stap alive til moning.

original: When Abigail saw David, she quickly got off the donkey, fell facedown, and bowed before him.
translation: Wanpela taim Abigail i lukim Dauid, na i kikim i kambak dawn long donki, i lusim hed bilong en i go daun, na i pilakai i go daun, ai i kirapim bungim hed bilong en long graun.

original: She fell at his feet and said, “My lord, may the blame be on me alone, but please let your servant speak to you; hear the words of your servant.
translation: Em i go daun long lek bilong em, na tok olsem: "Papa bilong mipela, hambis i stap long mi tasol, bikos mi servent bilong yu, herim toktok bilong servant bilong yu, na servant bilong yu yet, em i tokim yu."

original: My lord should pay no attention to this scoundrel Nabal, for he lives up to his name: His name means Fool, and folly accompanies him. I, your servant, did not see my lord’s young men whom you sent.
translation: Papa, no givim atenson long dispela raskol Nabal, wantaim em i stap long nem bilong en: Nem bilong en ol i kolim Foul, na ol i no save i go wail long en. Mi, wokman bilong yu, em i no lukim yangpela man bilong papa whos yu sendim.

original: Now, my lord, as surely as the LORD lives and you yourself live, the LORD has held you back from coming to bloodshed and avenging yourself with your own hand. May your enemies and those who seek harm for my lord be like Nabal.
translation: Nau, papa bilong mi, olsem olgeta long laip bilong LORD, LORD im holim yu bek from go long shedim blod nabekim bek long han bilong yu yet. Mipela hope enemy bilong yu ol i kamap olsem Nabal, ol man i no save toksave long LORD, na ol i wail nogut olsem taim bipo.

original: Now let this gift your servant has brought to my lord be given to the young men who follow you.
translation: Nau, givim dispela kamo servant bilong yu bringim long papa bilong olgeta, i go long ol yut na i kam bihain long yu.

original: Please forgive your servant’s offense, for the LORD will surely make a lasting dynasty for my lord, because he fights the LORD’s battles. May no evil be found in you as long as you live.
translation: Papaiim rong bilong servan, bikos LORD bai mekim kain ples ba i stap long taim olgeta long han bilong lordan, olsem na em i painim bikpela fait wantaim LORD. Nogat ken ol i kamap long yu oltaim yu i stap.

original: And should someone pursue you and seek your life, then the life of my lord will be bound securely by the LORD your God in the bundle of the living. But He shall fling away the lives of your enemies like stones from a sling.
translation: Na sapos man i go behain long yu na luk save life bilong yu, bai lif bilong papa bilong yu bai i bin bindim strong olsem na long han bilong LORD God bilong yu, i stap inside balus bilong ol samting i laip. Bai em i pilaiwe o sutim olsem ston bilong sling laif bilong enemy bilong yu.

original: When the LORD has done for my lord all the good He promised, and when He has appointed you ruler over Israel,
translation: Wanpela taim Bilong Pikinini i mekim pinis ol guten em i promis, na em i givim yu bos bilong Isrel,

original: then my lord will have no remorse or guilt of conscience over needless bloodshed and revenge. And when the LORD has dealt well with my lord, may you remember your maidservant.”
translation: Na bai mipela lord i no bin gat sori na hati i papaira long blod i spil we no gat kukim na painim bek. Na taim LORD em i mekim gud long yu, mipela bai yumi remember meri bilong yu.

original: Then David said to Abigail, “Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who sent you to meet me this day!
translation: Na David i tokim Abigail, “Praiz i go long Lod, God bilong Israel, we bilong hem i salim yu kam mitim mi today!

original: Blessed is your discernment, and blessed are you, because today you kept me from bloodshed and from avenging myself by my own hand.
translation: Blessed i kam long tok save bilong yu, na blessed yu stap, bikos tude yu stopolim mi long shedim blod, na mi no inap bekim rausim skelim bilong mi wantaim han bilong mi.

original: Otherwise, as surely as the LORD, the God of Israel, lives, who has restrained me from harming you, if you had not come quickly to meet me, then surely no male belonging to Nabal would have been left alive by morning light.”
translation: Inap long olgeta, olsem Jehovah, God bilong Israel, i kam na i stap, hu igo pinisim mi long mekim iet bilong yu, sapos yu no kam hariap long kisim mipela, orait, nogat man bilong Nabal bai i stap alive bikos em i go daun long mosong.

original: Then David accepted from her hand what she had brought him, and he said to her, “Go home in peace. See, I have heeded your voice and granted your request.”
translation: Dauid i akseptim ol samting em meri ibin bringim long han bilong en, na em i tokim em, "Go hait i go long peis. Mikam tok na mipela i harim tok bilong yu, na mipela i givim request bilong yu olsem sampela sindaun bilong respekta."

original: When Abigail returned to Nabal, there he was in the house, holding a feast fit for a king, in high spirits and very drunk. So she told him nothing until morning light.
translation: Taim Abigail i go bek long Nabal, em i stap insait long haus, i mekim kaikai bilong kinkin, spirit i stap strong, na em i dring olgeta, harim bikpela. Na husat i tokim em notin yet long ta, tasol i witim tilim lait bilong moning.

original: In the morning when Nabal was sober, his wife told him about these events, and his heart failed within him and he became like a stone.
translation: Long moningtaim, taim Nabal i kam bikim brain nogut, meri bilong em i tokim em long ol dispela stori, na het bilong en i paul long bodi bilong en, na em i biruaol olsem wanpela ston.

original: About ten days later, the LORD struck Nabal dead.
translation: Long tupela de pe, na LORD i kilim Nabal finis.

original: On hearing that Nabal was dead, David said, “Blessed be the LORD, who has upheld my cause against the reproach of Nabal and has restrained His servant from evil. For the LORD has brought the wickedness of Nabal down upon his own head.” Then David sent word to Abigail, asking for her in marriage.
translation: Long taim em i harim Nabal i dai pinis, Daud i tok, "Praiz long Lod olgeta taim, we bilong em i stap bekim kwestin bilong mi againstim tok bung long Nabal, na i holim servant bilong em na i no lusim em go long bikhet. Praiz long Lod, we em i kamdaunim nogut bilong Nabal i go daun long hed bilong em yet." Na Daud i sendim wod long Abigal, i askim em long marit.

original: When his servants came to Abigail at Carmel, they said, “David has sent us to take you as his wife.”
translation: Taim wokman bilong Daud i kam long Abigail long Karmel, ol i tok, “Daud i salim mipela long karim yu, na yu bai kaikai bilong em, olsem na yu bai meri bilong en.”

original: She arose, then bowed facedown and said, “Here is your maidservant, ready to serve and to wash the feet of my lord’s servants.”
translation: Em i kamap, em i paul ai klostu long graun, na em i tok, "Hausmeri bilong yu stap hare, em i redi long sarve na long wasim lek bilong wokman bilong papa."

original: So Abigail hurried and got on a donkey, and attended by five of her maidens, she followed David’s messengers and became his wife.
translation: Na Abigail i go kisim spid olsem, i sindaun long donki, na ol meri bilong en i stap wantaim em, i folowa mesija bilong David, na i kamap meri bilong em.

original: David had also married Ahinoam of Jezreel. So she and Abigail were both his wives.
translation: Dauid i kisim Ahinoam meri bilong Jezreel. Na ol i stap wantaim Abigail, olgeta i stap long hap tumas bilong en, ol tu i bikim meri bilong em.

original: But Saul had given his daughter Michal, David’s wife, to Palti son of Laish, who was from Gallim.
translation: Na Saul i givim daughter bilong em Michal, meri bilong David, long Palti man bilong Laish, em i man bilong Gallim.

original: Then the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah and said, “Is not David hiding on the hill of Hachilah, opposite Jeshimon?”
translation: Ol Zifait i kam go long Saul long Gibe, na ol i tokim Saul, "Daudi i no kaiv pinis long maunten Hachilah, we i stap klostu long ples Jesimon?"

original: So Saul, accompanied by three thousand chosen men of Israel, went down to the Wilderness of Ziph to search for David there.
translation: Na Saul, wantaim tri tausen man husat em i pikinim long Isrel, i go daun long Bus long Zif na wokim serch long Davide.

original: Saul camped beside the road at the hill of Hachilah opposite Jeshimon, but David was living in the wilderness. When he realized that Saul had followed him there,
translation: Saul i-kamp besaida rot longpela han bilong Hachilah we i kamap oposisim Jeshimon, tasol David i-stap long bus. Taim em i save olsem Saul i-kam behainim,

original: David sent out spies to verify that Saul had arrived.
translation: Daved i salim go bekim ol skaut olsem long konfirmim Sau i kamap already.

original: Then David set out and went to the place where Saul had camped. He saw the place where Saul and Abner son of Ner, the general of his army, had lain down. Saul was lying inside the inner circle of the camp, with the troops camped around him.
translation: Na Daved i wakabaut na go, ikam pundaun long ples we Saul i kam pundaun. Em i lukim ples we Saul na Abner Pikinini bilong Ner, kapten bilong solja, ol i slip. Saul i stap insait long ples bilong army, na ol solja i kam pundaun long en, ol i stap raunim em.

original: And David asked Ahimelech the Hittite and Abishai son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, “Who will go down with me to Saul in the camp?” “I will go with you,” answered Abishai.
translation: Na Daved i askim Ahimelek Hitaite na Abisai, pikinini bilong Seruia, brata bilong Joab, “Hu ia bai go daun wantaim mi long kamp bilong Saul?” “Mi go wantaim yu,” Abisai i tok.

original: That night David and Abishai came to the troops, and Saul was lying there asleep in the inner circle of the camp, with his spear stuck in the ground by his head. And Abner and the troops were lying around him.
translation: Nait i go pinis, na Davide na Abisai i kam long troppas, na Saul i slip olsem, i lai longpela ples insait long kamp, na spia bilong em i stap long graun klostu long hed bilong em. Na Abena na ol troppas i slip olsem, i karim rundem.

original: Abishai said to David, “Today God has delivered your enemy into your hand. Now, therefore, please let me thrust the spear through him into the ground with one stroke. I will not need to strike him twice!”
translation: Abishai i tokim David, "God i givim poisin bilong yu long han bilong yu tudei. Nau, bai mi putim spia long en na kilim en long graun wantaim wanpela pait. Mi no ken strikeim en twis!"

original: But David said to Abishai, “Do not destroy him, for who can lift a hand against the LORD’s anointed and be guiltless?”
translation: Bata David i tokim Abishai, “Yu no ken kilim em, bikos husat ina ken kamap long paitim han bilong odii bilong LORD, na stap olsem nogat gilty?”

original: David added, “As surely as the LORD lives, the LORD Himself will strike him down; either his day will come and he will die, or he will go into battle and perish.
translation: Na Davide i mekim moa, "Olsem Papa God i stap, em yet bai i kilim em; dei bilong en bai i kam na em bai dai, o em bai go long fait na perisim."

original: But the LORD forbid that I should stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed. Instead, take the spear and water jug by his head, and let us go.”
translation: Bare Pipia i no kamapim, mi no ken stretim han bilong mi against Pipia i daubim. Insed, yumi kisim spia na jag bilong wara klostu long hed bilong en, na yumi go nau.

original: So David took the spear and water jug by Saul’s head, and they departed. No one saw them or knew about it, nor did anyone wake up; they all remained asleep, because a deep sleep from the LORD had fallen on them.
translation: Na Davide em i kisim spia na bilong wata, na ol i go. Nogat wanpela i lukim ol, nogat wanpela i save long dispela, na nogat wanpela i wokap, bikos Bikpela i givim ol sip mak i strong, na ol i stap i slep, tasol sip i kam autim ol.

original: Then David crossed to the other side and stood atop the mountain at a distance; there was a wide gulf between them.
translation: Na Dauid i go pas long hap sid, na em i stap antap long maunten longwe beyonde; na spes welabig gap longwe beyonde i stap betwen ol tu.

original: And David shouted to the troops and to Abner son of Ner, “Will you not answer me, Abner?” “Who calls to the king?” Abner replied.
translation: Na Daavid singautim strong long ol soldier na long Abena susa bilong Ner, “Yupela no ken harm me, Abena?” “Husat i karim tok long king?” Abena i tok bek.

original: So David said to Abner, “You are a man, aren’t you? And who in Israel is your equal? Why then did you not protect your lord the king when one of the people came to destroy him?
translation: Na Davidson i tokim Abner, "Yu man, yu? Husat long Israel olsem yu? Bai yu no save lukautim papa bilong yu king taim wanpela man kam daiim em?"

original: This thing you have done is not good. As surely as the LORD lives, all of you deserve to die, since you did not protect your lord, the LORD’s anointed. Now look around. Where are the king’s spear and water jug that were by his head?”
translation: Wanpela samting yu mekim em i no gut. Olsem God yet i stap, em i tok, yupela mas dai, long yupela no save kisim bek long lukim bihain long man bilong God i gat oyli. Nau kam lukluk, king bilong yumi spear na jag bilong wara i go we, ol i stap long hais bilong em?

original: Then Saul recognized David’s voice and asked, “Is that your voice, David my son?” “It is my voice, my lord and king,” David said.
translation: Na Saul i harim voys bilong David, na em i askim, "Em i voys bilong yu, David pikinini bilong mi?" "Em i voys bilong mi, papa na king bilong yu," olsem David i tok.

original: And he continued, “Why is my lord pursuing his servant? What have I done? What evil is in my hand?
translation: Na em i go yet, bikman, bai yu go bekim servant bilong yu? Mi mekim wanem? I gat wanem kain olgeta samting nogut long han bilong mi?

original: Now please, may my lord the king hear the words of his servant: If the LORD has stirred you up against me, then may He accept an offering. But if men have done it, may they be cursed in the presence of the LORD! For today they have driven me away from sharing in the inheritance of the LORD, saying, ‘Go, serve other gods.’
translation: Nau bai mi askim, lord king, harim tok bilong servant blong em: I f Lord i hamamasim yu gen long me, bai Em i mas lukim ofing na kisim. Bai ol man i mekim dispela, ol i mas karim ket long ai bilong LORD! Tudei ol i draivim mi longwe nau bai mi no inap kaikaim inheritance bilong LORD, ol i tok, 'Yu go wokim servos long narapela kina god.'

original: So do not let my blood fall to the ground far from the presence of the LORD. For the king of Israel has come out to look for a flea, like one who hunts a partridge in the mountains.”
translation: No ken allow blooding bilong me i go daun long graun longwe na wei long ples bilong LORD. King bilong Israel i kam aut long lukim wanpela sik, olsem wanpela man i go haitim birduk long maunten.

original: Then Saul replied, “I have sinned. Come back, David my son. I will never harm you again, because today you considered my life precious. I have played the fool and have committed a grave error!”
translation: Na Saul i tok bek, "Mi sinisim. Kam bek, David Pikinini bilong me. Mi no go bagarapim yu gen, bikos yu bin tingim laip bilong me olsem samting bilong value. Mi go aktim olsem man i les, na mi mekim mistake nogut tru!"

original: “Here is the king’s spear,” David answered. “Let one of the young men come over and get it.
translation: “King i givim sper ia,” David i tok. “Wanpela yong man i kam bek ken kisim.”

original: May the LORD repay every man for his righteousness and faithfulness. For the LORD delivered you into my hand today, but I would not stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed.
translation: Papa God iambakim bekim ol man long drek bilong righteousness na faithful bilong ol. Papa God ibin givim yu long mi tedei, tasol mi no ken stretim han bilong mi long man bilong Papa God, em i anointim, nogat bagarapim leda.

original: As surely as I valued your life today, so may the LORD value my life and rescue me from all trouble.”
translation: Olsem mi bin save gutpela lif blong yu tede, so mas Lod bai save gutpela lif blong mi na baim mi long ol kain trabel.

original: Saul said to him, “May you be blessed, David my son. You will accomplish great things and will surely prevail.” So David went on his way, and Saul returned home.
translation: Saul i tokim em, "Mipela hope yu kamap gut, Davidson bilong mi. Yu bai kamapim wok bigna na strong na yu bai winim." Na Davidson i go i go long we, na Saul i go bek long haus bilong en.

original: David, however, said to himself, “One of these days now I will be swept away by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than to escape to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will stop searching for me all over Israel, and I will slip out of his hand.”
translation: Daud i tokim long en self, “Bai wanpela dei nau bai mi paitim i go long han bilong Saul. Inogat samting gutpela moa long me olsem ranawe go long kantri bilong Filistia. Olsem Saul bai hap no lukim me long Isreael, na bai mi slip long han bilong en.”

original: So David set out with his six hundred men and went to Achish son of Maoch, the king of Gath.
translation: Na Dauid i go bek long ol man bilong en, six hundred man, na i go kam bek long Achish, pikinini bilong Maoch, king bilong Gath.

original: David and his men settled in Gath with Achish. Each man had his family with him, and David had his two wives: Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail of Carmel, the widow of Nabal.
translation: Daved na ol man bilong em i stap long Gath wantaim Achish. Ol man yet, ol i gat famili bilong ol wantaim ol, na Daved i gat meri tu bilong em: Ahinoam bilong Jezreel na Abigail bilong Carmel, widow bilong Nabal.

original: And when Saul learned that David had fled to Gath, he no longer searched for him.
translation: Taim Saul harim tok olsem David i ranawe go long Gath, i no moa sanap long sokim em.

original: Then David said to Achish, “If I have found favor in your eyes, let me be assigned a place in one of the outlying towns, so I can live there. For why should your servant live in the royal city with you?”
translation: Na Davide i tokim Achis olsem, "Yu laikim mi long ai bilong yu, inap yu givim mi wanpela hap long wanpela taun i stap long wei, na mipela bai ki stap. Na wai servant bilong yu mas stap long taun bilong king wantaim yu?"

original: That day Achish gave him Ziklag, and to this day it still belongs to the kings of Judah.
translation: Achish i givim Ziklag long em that dei, na inap long tudei, Ziklag i stap yet, emas i bilong king bilong Yuda.

original: And the time that David lived in Philistine territory amounted to a year and four months.
translation: Na taim we David i stap long graun bilong Filistia em i kamap long wanpela yia na foa mun.

original: Now David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. (From ancient times these people had inhabited the land extending to Shur and Egypt.)
translation: Nau Daud na ol man bilong em i go ap na harim Geshurites, Girzites, na Amalekites. (Long taim bilong bipo, dispela pipel i stat long graun we i stret go long Shur na Egip.)

original: Whenever David attacked a territory, he did not leave a man or woman alive, but he took the flocks and herds, the donkeys, camels, and clothing. Then he would return to Achish,
translation: Wanem taim Daved i go bekim eria, i no lusim man o meri i stap, tasol i kisim olpela animal na olpela bulmakau, ol donki, kamel, na ol klos. Na bai em i go bek gen long Achish.

original: who would ask him, “What have you raided today?” And David would reply, “The Negev of Judah,” or “The Negev of Jerahmeel,” or “The Negev of the Kenites.”
translation: Husat bai askim em, “Yu hamasim wanem tudei?” Na Daud bai tok bek, “Negev bilong Juda,” o “Negev bilong Jerahmeel,” o “Negev bilong Kenites.”

original: David did not leave a man or woman alive to be brought to Gath, for he said, “Otherwise they will report us, saying, ‘This is what David did.’” And this was David’s custom the whole time he lived in Philistine territory.
translation: Dauid i no leevim man na meri stap, olsem oli kam long Gath, em i tok, "Nogat, ol i ritim tok bilong yumi, ol i tok, 'David i mekim olsem'." Na dispela em i kastom bilong Dauid olgeta taim em i stap long kantri bilong Filisitia.

original: So Achish trusted David, thinking, “Since he has made himself an utter stench to his people Israel, he will be my servant forever.”
translation: Achish i trastim David, i stap long tingting, "Em i mekim em yet olsem mamas balus long ol pipol bilong em Israel, em bai i servim mi foreva."

original: Now in those days the Philistines gathered their forces for warfare against Israel. So Achish said to David, “You must understand that you and your men are to go out to battle with me.”
translation: Long taim bifo, Filistia ol i kam tu na i redi long faet agenst Isrel. Achis i tokim Daved, "Yu mas save, yu na yu ol man, bai yu go long mi go faet."

original: David replied, “Then you will come to know what your servant can do.” “Very well,” said Achish. “I will make you my bodyguard for life.”
translation: Daavid i tokim, "Na yu yet bai save long wok bilong servant bilong yu." "Orait," Achish i tokim. "Mi bai mekim yu gard bilong mi ol taim, long laip bilong yu."

original: Now by this time Samuel had died, and all Israel had mourned for him and buried him in Ramah, his own city. And Saul had removed the mediums and spiritists from the land.
translation: Nau bai Samuel i dai pinis, na ol Israel i bin mekim sore long em na katim em i go long Ramah, ples bilong em. Na Saul i bin rausim ol meri bilong spirik na ol man bilong spirik long kantri.

original: The Philistines came together and camped at Shunem, while Saul gathered all Israel and camped at Gilboa.
translation: Filistia ol i kam long nau na kam pasin long Sunem, wail Saul i garem ol Isrel na ol i kam pasin long Gilboa.

original: When Saul saw the Philistine army, he was afraid and trembled violently.
translation: Taim Saul i lukim army bilong Filisitia, em i bin pikinini long sem, na em i shake olsem san i go daun.

original: He inquired of the LORD, but the LORD did not answer him by dreams or Urim or prophets.
translation: Em askim Lord, tasol Lord i no givim ansa long em, nogat long drem, nogat long Urim bilong ol Israelit, nogat long ol profet bilong God.

original: Then Saul said to his servants, “Find me a woman who is a medium, so I can go and consult her.” “There is a medium at Endor,” his servants replied.
translation: Na Saul i tokim servant bilong em, “Painim meri wan bilong spirit spiral, na mipela i go bek na toktok wantaim.” “I gat woman spiral bilong spirit long Endor,” ol servants bilong em i tok.

original: So Saul disguised himself by putting on different clothes, and he set out with two of his men. They came to the woman at night, and Saul said, “Consult a spirit for me. Bring up for me the one I name.”
translation: Na Saul i putim different klos bilong kamap olsem narapela man, na i go wwanpela trip wantaim tu bilong ol man bilong en. Ol i kam long meri naip, na Saul i tok, "Mikpom spirit bilong mi, toksave long, na bekim man i dai we mi bai yusim nem bilong en."

original: But the woman replied, “Surely you know what Saul has done, how he has killed the mediums and spiritists in the land. Why have you set a trap to get me killed?”
translation: Meri i tok bek, “Yu save long ol samting Saul i mekim, em i kilim ol naromon na ol spirit man long kantri. Wai yu kam setim trap long me, bai mi dai?”

original: Then Saul swore to her by the LORD: “As surely as the LORD lives, no punishment shall come upon you for this.”
translation: Na Saul i kamapim tok long ol meri long han bilong Jehovah, olsem Jehovah i stap, em i liv, inap no penati bai i kam long yu.

original: “Whom shall I bring up for you?” the woman asked. “Bring up Samuel,” he replied.
translation: Hus i bai mi kisim long go stap na bringim i kam bek long yu? Meri i akselem. Kisim Samuel i kam, em i tok.

original: But when the woman saw Samuel, she cried out in a loud voice and said to Saul, “Why have you deceived me? You are Saul!”
translation: Taim meri si Samuel, em i kisim aut na krai i go hap, tokim Saul, “Yu givim rong ples long mi! Yu yet yu em Saul!”

original: “Do not be afraid,” the king replied. “What do you see?” “I see a god coming up out of the earth,” the woman answered.
translation: “Nogat bekimpe,” king i tok. “Wanem yu lukim?” “Mi lukim god i kam ap long graun,” meri i ansa.

original: “What does he look like?” asked Saul. “An old man is coming up,” she replied. “And he is wearing a robe.” So Saul knew that it was Samuel, and he bowed facedown in reverence.
translation: Saul i askim, "Em i luk olsem wanem?" Em i tok, "Man i go antap nau, em i bikpla, na em i wapim lo bilas." Saul i save olsem em Samuel, na em i paul ai klostu long graun, em i givim respek.

original: Then Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you disturbed me by bringing me up?” “I am deeply distressed,” replied Saul. “The Philistines are fighting against me, and God has turned away from me. He no longer answers me, either by prophets or by dreams. So I have called on you to tell me what to do.”
translation:
Na Samuel i tokim Saul, "Yu bringim me i go hap, na me disturbum, bekos?" 
Saul i tok, "Me i stap strong long sorow, Filistia i faight agenst me, na Bikpela i turnim bek gen long me, em i no moa harim tok bilong me, nai tupela ol profet nai swap bilong nait. 
Mi bin kolim yu long givim me save long wanem mi mas mekim."

original: “Why do you consult me,” asked Samuel, “since the LORD has turned away from you and become your enemy?
translation: “Wai yu kisim konsal long me,” samuel i askim, “wai Papa bilong olgeta im go bek gen long yu, na im kam bek bilong yu poisin?”

original: He has done exactly what He spoke through me: The LORD has torn the kingship out of your hand and given it to your neighbor David.
translation: Em i mekim olsem em i tok long mi: LORD ibin kirapim kwinship ikam long han bilong yu na ibin givim i go long neiwa David bilong yu.

original: Because you did not obey the LORD or carry out His burning anger against Amalek, the LORD has done this to you today.
translation: Bikos yu no bin harim tok bilong LORD, na yu no wokim pasin bilong faia bilong em long ol pipol Amalek, LORD em i mekim dispela olgeta tinging long yu tede.

original: Moreover, the LORD will deliver Israel with you into the hand of the Philistines, and tomorrow you and your sons will be with me. And the LORD will deliver the army of Israel into the hand of the Philistines.”
translation: Na Papa God bai salvarim Israel, i go long han bilong Filisitia, na yumui na ol pikinini bilong yu bai stap wantaim mi. Na Papa God bai salvarim armi bilong Israel i go long han bilong Filisitia.

original: Immediately Saul fell flat on the ground, terrified by the words of Samuel. And his strength was gone, because he had not eaten anything all that day and night.
translation: Saul i pundaun flat long graun, i bin kirap long tok bilong Samuwel, na strong bilong en i go daun, bikos em i no kai sampela ka o nait.

original: When the woman came to Saul and saw how distraught he was, she said to him, “Look, your maidservant has obeyed your voice. I took my life in my hands and did as you told me.
translation: Taim meri i kam klostu long Saul, na ol i lukim husat i birua tru, nau em i tokim em, " Lukim, hausmeri bilong yu harim tok na bihainim. Mi putim laip bilong mi long han bilong mi na mekim olsem yu tokim mi."

original: Now please listen to your servant and let me set a morsel of bread before you so you may eat and have the strength to go on your way.”
translation: Nau, harim tok bilong servant blo yu, na mi bai putim samting ol i kaikai, olsem bun bilong bred, bifor yu, na yu bai kaikai, na yu bai gat strong long go long rot bilong yu.

original: Saul refused, saying, “I will not eat.” But his servants joined the woman in urging him, and he heeded their voice. He got up from the ground and sat on the bed.
translation: Saul i refusim, olsem, “Mi no bambai kaikai.” Tasol servants bilong em i joinim meri na ol i askim em strong. Em i lisen pinis toktok bilong ol, na em i kamdaun nau long graun, em i siddaun long bet olsem saen bilong respek.

original: The woman had a fattened calf at her house, and she quickly slaughtered it. She also took flour, kneaded it, and baked unleavened bread.
translation: Meri i gat bek we i bin kukim i stap insait long haus bilong en, na em i kisim quiq slaiktim. Em i kisim powda, wokim, na bakim bret isi.

original: She served it to Saul and his servants, and they ate. And that night they got up and left.
translation: Em serveim ka long Saul na hau boi bilong en, na ol i kaikai. Na nait i kam, ol lem go na liva.

original: Now the Philistines brought all their forces together at Aphek, while Israel camped by the spring in Jezreel.
translation: Nau Filistia i bringim olgeta strong bilong ol yet long Aphek, while Isrel i kampe klostu spring long Jezreel.

original: As the Philistine leaders marched out their units of hundreds and thousands, David and his men marched behind them with Achish.
translation: Bikman meri bilong Filistia i kamautim yunit olgeta bilong hundred na thousand, Daud na manmeri bilong en i go bihain long ol wantaim Akis.

original: Then the commanders of the Philistines asked, “What about these Hebrews?” Achish replied, “Is this not David, the servant of King Saul of Israel? He has been with me all these days, even years, and from the day he defected until today I have found no fault in him.”
translation: Komandan bilong Filisitia i askim, "Wha yet long dispela Hebu?" Achish i tok bek, "Em i no ino David, servant bilong King Saul bilong Israel? Em i stap wantaim mi ol dei hap, yen i go daun long nem, na sinds im i go daun long mipela, mi no finim rong bilong em."

original: But the commanders of the Philistines were angry with Achish and told him, “Send that man back and let him return to the place you assigned him. He must not go down with us into battle only to become our adversary during the war. What better way for him to regain the favor of his master than with the heads of our men?
translation: Komanda bilong Filistia i kros long Achish na tokim em, "Senisim man ia bek gen, imas go bek long ples we yu givim im. Em no ken go daun long mipela long fait, olsem em bai bikim adversary bilong mipela long taim bilong war. Wanem rot bilong em kisim bek faver bilong masta na tasol long hed bilong man bilong mipela?

original: Is this not the David about whom they sing in their dances: ‘Saul has slain his thousands, and David his tens of thousands’?”
translation: Em i no David husat ol i singaut long danis ol i mekim: ‘Saul i kilim ten thousand, na David i kilim hundred thousand’?

original: So Achish summoned David and told him, “As surely as the LORD lives, you have been upright in my sight, and it seems right that you should march in and out with me in the army, because I have found no fault in you from the day you came to me until this day. But you have no favor in the sight of the leaders.
translation: Na Achish i kirapim Davide, i tokim em, "Olsem Bikpela i stap, yu kamap straikt long ai bilong mi, em i luk olsem yu mas i go wakabaut wantaim mi long ples bilong armi, bikos mi no finisim rong bilong yu sinds yu kam stap gen long mi, kas ol dei nau. Tasol, yu no gat bikpela hap long ai bilong bikman.

original: Therefore turn back now and go in peace, so that you will not do anything to displease the leaders of the Philistines.”
