translation: Kam bek nau na go long peis, bilong yu no ken harmim bikpela hedhek long ol biceman bilong Filistia.

original: “But what have I done?” David replied. “What have you found against your servant, from the day I came to you until today, to keep me from going along to fight against the enemies of my lord the king?”
translation: Bain tu, olsem wanem samting mi mekim? Wanem yu lukim long mi, servant bilong yu, olsem wanem nau, bai mi no inap go wantaim na fight long poisen bilong papa bilong mipela, king, from de bikos dei mi kam stap wantaim yu, na kam inap long tude?

original: Achish replied, “I know that you are as pleasing in my sight as an angel of God. But the commanders of the Philistines have said, ‘He must not go into battle with us.’
translation: Achish i tokim, "Mi save olsem yu swit moa long ai bilong mi olsem engel bilong God. Tasol komanda bilong Filistia i tok, 'Em i no inap go long fait wantaim yumi.'"

original: Now then, get up early in the morning, along with your master’s servants who came with you, and go as soon as it is light.”
translation: Nau yet, kam daun bikos em i kolim olgeta wokman bilong papa bilong yu long moning, na go na go baiynde long taem em i lait.

original: So David and his men got up early in the morning to return to the land of the Philistines. And the Philistines went up to Jezreel.
translation: Na Daved na ol man bilong em i go ap long moning, ia ol i go bek long grain bilong Filistia. Na Filistia i go ap long Jezirel.

original: On the third day David and his men arrived in Ziklag, and the Amalekites had raided the Negev, attacked Ziklag, and burned it down.
translation: Long dei thri, Daud na ol man bilong em i kamap long Ziklag, na Amalekitis i go daun long Negev, ol i atakim Ziklag, na ol i bakarim em.

original: They had taken captive the women and all who were there, both young and old. They had not killed anyone, but had carried them off as they went on their way.
translation: Ol i kisim ol meri na ol pipel ol i stap, lapun na yangpela, ol i kisim ol i go long rot bilong ol. Ol i no kilim nobody, tasol ol i kisim ol i go na i stap.

original: When David and his men came to the city, they found it burned down and their wives and sons and daughters taken captive.
translation: Taim Daud na ol man bilong em i kam long siti, ol i lukim haus i bung na rausim, na meri, pikinini man, na pikinini meri bilong ol i kisim na karamapim long enemy.

original: So David and the troops with him lifted up their voices and wept until they had no strength left to weep.
translation: Na Davidson wantaim ol solida i go wantaim em i kisim voz bilong ol, na ol i krai, ol i krai tasol, na ol i pinis, no inap krai gen.

original: David’s two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel, had been taken captive.
translation: Meri tu bilong Daud, Ahinoam bilong Jezreel na Abigail widu meri bilong Nabal bilong Carmel, ol i bin kisim nau na karam long en.

original: And David was greatly distressed because the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of every man grieved for his sons and daughters. But David found strength in the LORD his God.
translation: Na Daudi i bin bikim masalai i go long way bikos ol pipol i tok long kam stonim em, bikos spirits bilong ol man i bin katol long pikinini bilong ol, manmeri na liklik. Tasol Daudi i stap strong long LORD God bilong en.

original: Then David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, “Bring me the ephod.” So Abiathar brought it to him,
translation: Na Daud i tok long Abiatar prist, susa bilong Ahimelek, “Kisim epod i kam long me.” Na Abiathar i kisim epod i kam long em.

original: and David inquired of the LORD: “Should I pursue these raiders? Will I overtake them?” “Pursue them,” the LORD replied, “for you will surely overtake them and rescue the captives.”
translation: Na Davide askim tok bilong Jehovah: “Inap mi bihainim ol despla raider i go? Inap mi kisim bek ol despla raider?” “Bihainim ol!”, Jehovah i tok, “trakim ol, na yu bai skulim bek ol prisen.”

original: So David and his six hundred men went to the Brook of Besor, where some stayed behind
translation: Na Daved wantaim ol manmeri sikis hanred i go daun long Wata Besor, na ol samting i stap bihain.

original: because two hundred men were too exhausted to cross the brook. But David and four hundred men continued in pursuit.
translation: Bikos tu hundred man i wail tasol na ol no inap pas wara, tasol David wantaim ol four hundred man i go behain long harim.

original: Now his men found an Egyptian in the field and brought him to David. They gave the man water to drink and food to eat—
translation: Na ol man bilong em i kamau long wanpela Ijip long bus na ol i bringim i go long Davide. Ol i givim man i drink wara na kaikai —

original: a piece of a fig cake and two clusters of raisins. So he ate and was revived, for he had not had any food or water for three days and three nights.
translation: Wanpela pis fig kek na tu ples raisin i kam long cluster. Na em i kaikai tasol na em i strong nogud, bikos em i no kai kai na em i no drink water long tri dei na tri nait.

original: Then David asked him, “To whom do you belong, and where are you from?” “I am an Egyptian,” he replied, “the slave of an Amalekite. My master abandoned me three days ago when I fell ill.
translation: Na Davide askim em, "Yu bilong wanem, na yu kam long ples we?" "Mi Ejipita," em i tok, "na mi wokman bilong Amalekait. Bos bilong mi lusim mi tri de taim mi sik."

original: We raided the Negev of the Cherethites, the territory of Judah, and the Negev of Caleb, and we burned down Ziklag.”
translation: Mipela go nau long Negev bilong Ol Cherethi, mipela katim i go long graun bilong Yuda, na Negev bilong Kalep, na mipela brenim haus bilong Ziklag.

original: “Will you lead me to these raiders?” David asked. And the man replied, “Swear to me by God that you will not kill me or deliver me into the hand of my master, and I will lead you to them.”
translation: “Yu ken ladim mi go long ol desalitori?” Daud i askim. Na man i tok, “Kam bek long God na tok strong long mi olsem yu no ken kilim mi oslem usim mi go long han bilong bikman, na bai mi ladim yu go long ol.”

original: So he led David down, and there were the Amalekites spread out over all the land, eating, drinking, and celebrating the great amount of plunder they had taken from the land of the Philistines and the land of Judah.
translation: Na em i karim David i go daun, na Amalekait i stap olabaite long kantri, ol i kaikai, ol i dring, na ol i hap long planti samting ol i winim long kantri bilong Filistia na kantri bilong Juda.

original: And David struck them down from twilight until the evening of the next day. Not a man escaped, except four hundred young men who fled, riding off on camels.
translation: Na Davide i kilim ol long wei em i go daun apostol long apinun bilong de namba tu. No man i stap, ol i ranawe, eksept 400 ol yangpela man i raitim na igo long kamal.

original: So David recovered everything the Amalekites had taken, including his two wives.
translation: Na Daudi winim bek olgeta samting Amalekaiti i pilim olgeta, wantaim meri tu bilong em.

original: Nothing was missing, young or old, son or daughter, or any of the plunder the Amalekites had taken. David brought everything back.
translation: Nogat samting i missim, liklik o bigpela, man o meri, o olgeta samting bilong winim war bilong Amalekait. David bringim bek olgeta samting.

original: And he recovered all the flocks and herds, which his men drove ahead of the other livestock, calling out, “This is David’s plunder!”
translation: Na em kam bek gen olgeta mob na bulmakau, ol man bilong em i driva i go bifor ol narapela kain animal, ol i singaut, "Dispela lo bilong Dauid!"

original: When David came to the two hundred men who had been too exhausted to follow him from the Brook of Besor, they came out to meet him and the troops with him. As David approached the men, he greeted them,
translation: Taim Daavid i kam long ol two hundred man we i bin tire pinis olsem ino inamu folo em from Warai Besor, ol i kam aut long mekim welkam long em na solja i bin stap wantaim em. Taim Daavid i approch long ol man, ol i givim welkam long em,

original: but all the wicked and worthless men among those who had gone with David said, “Because they did not go with us, we will not share with them the plunder we recovered, except for each man’s wife and children. They may take them and go.”
translation: Olgeta man i no gat hevi na i no woksik long ol i go wantaim David i tok, "Bikos ol i no go wantaim mipela, mipela no salim bek long ol lo ot bilong kisim bek, apa long meri na pikinini bilong ol. Ol i mas kisim ol na i go."

original: But David said, “My brothers, you must not do this with what the LORD has given us. He has protected us and delivered into our hands the raiders who came against us.
translation: Bikpela i givim mipela dispela, brata, yu no ken duim dispela. Em i save pipol bilong yumi, na ol man i save bagarap i kam bek long hand bilong yumi, ol i kam bek long mipela, Bikpela i birua long mipela.

original: Who will listen to your proposal? The share of the one who went to battle will match the share of the one who stayed with the supplies. They will share alike.”
translation: Husait bai harim tok bilong yu? Ples bilong dispela man i go daun fight bai i kalewa wantaim ples bilong dispela man i stap lukautim ka, olgeta bai wankain.

original: And so it has been from that day forward. David established this statute as an ordinance for Israel to this very day.
translation: Na olsem wanpela loa i kamap bikos dei em i go, Davidson i kamapim dispela loa bilong taim long Yisel.

original: When David arrived in Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to his friends, the elders of Judah, saying, “Here is a gift for you from the plunder of the LORD’s enemies.”
translation: David i kamap long Ziklag, na em i salim sampela bilong ol samting em bungim long ol bikpela man bilong Yuda, ol i tok, “Mipela givim yu desk bilong yu long ol samting em bungim bilong poisen bilong Lod.”

original: He sent gifts to those in Bethel, Ramoth Negev, and Jattir;
translation: Em i sendim gif na samting long ol pipol i stap insait Betel, Ramot Nigev, na Jatir;

original: to those in Aroer, Siphmoth, and Eshtemoa;
translation: Long ol pipol bilong Aroer, Siphmoth, na Eshtemoa;

original: to those in Racal and in the cities of the Jerahmeelites and Kenites;
translation: Long ol pipol bilong Racal na long ples bilong Jerahmeelites na Kenites;

original: to those in Hormah, Bor-ashan, and Athach;
translation: Long ol pela i stap long Hormah, long Bor-ashan, na long Athach;

original: and to those in Hebron and in all the places where David and his men had roamed.
translation: na long ol ples Hebron, na long olgeta hap we ol ples David na man bilong em i go waka.

original: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
translation: Nau Filistia i go antap long Israel, na ol man bilong Israel i ranawe bek long ol, na planti i pundaikai pinis long Maunt Gilboa.

original: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua.
translation: Filistia i go beklem long tromoi bihainim Saul na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol i kilim Jonathan, Abinadab, na Malchishua, ol pikinini bilong Saul.

original: When the battle intensified against Saul, the archers overtook him and wounded him critically.
translation: Taim bilong faet i kam strong long Saul, ol archa i go pasim em na kilim em i dai, em i sak i go daun.

original: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and run it through me, or these uncircumcised men will come and run me through and torture me!” But his armor-bearer was terrified and refused to do it. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
translation: Na Saul i tokim han blong em we i karim armar blong en, “Kam bekim sword bilong yu na kilim mi, bos long ol man i no katim skin bilong ol i kam na kilim mi na painim mi!” Be tasol han blong em i bin poret na i no laik mekim. Na Saul i kisim sword blong en na i go daun long en.

original: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his own sword and died with him.
translation: Taim em i lukim Saul i dai pinis, na man i kisim armor bilong en i kilim yet long suk bilong en, na em tu i dai wantaim em.

original: So Saul, his three sons, his armor-bearer, and all his men died together that same day.
translation: Saul, pikinini tri bilong em, man i kam bek long armagun bilong em, na ol man bilong em, Saul na ol i stap wantaim em pinis, ol i pinis wankain dei.

original: When the Israelites along the valley and those on the other side of the Jordan saw that the army of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their cities and ran away. So the Philistines came and occupied their cities.
translation: Taim Israelait long vali na ol papa lain long sait bilong Jordan i lukim na armi bilong Israel i ranawe, na Saul na pikinini bilong en i dai, ol i lusim siti bilong ol na ol i rusim na ranawe. Na Filistia i kam na ol i tekeva siti bilong ol.

original: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
translation: Nekis dei, when ol Philistine i kam bek long rausim ol bodi i dai finis, ol i kisim Saul na ol thri pikinini bilong em ol i pundaun long Maunt Gilboa.

original: They cut off Saul’s head, stripped off his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temples of their idols and among their people.
translation: Tupela i kirapim hed bilong Saul, pulim of armor bilong em, na sendim mesenga long ol ples bilong Filistia olsem wanem nau oli mas kirapim stori long haus lotu bilong ol hevi na long ol pipol bilong ol.

original: They put his armor in the temple of the Ashtoreths and hung his body on the wall of Beth-shan.
translation: Ol i putim armor bilong en long tempel bilong spirits bilong Ashtoreth na ol i hangim bodi bilong en long banis bilong Bethsan.

original: When the people of Jabesh-gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
translation: Taim ol pipol bilong Jabesh-Gilead harim ol samting ol Filistia i mekim long Saul,

original: all their men of valor set out, journeyed all night, and retrieved the bodies of Saul and his sons from the wall of Beth-shan. When they arrived at Jabesh, they burned the bodies there.
translation: Ol man bilong strong bilong ol i go pinis, wokabaut ol nait, na kisim bek bodi bilong Saul na suss bilong em long banis bilong Bet-San. Wanpela taim ol i kamap long Jabes, ol i burnim bodi bilong ol long hap.

original: Then they took their bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.
translation: Ol i kisim olgeta banis bilong ol, na ol i pakim ol long anidas bilong tamalis ti long Jabesh, na ol i stap hungri na praech seven de.

original: After the death of Saul, David returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites and stayed in Ziklag two days.
translation: Long taim Saul i dai pinis, na Daudi i kam bek gen long winim Amaleki, na i stap insait long Ziklag olsem de pepe two.

original: On the third day a man with torn clothes and dust on his head arrived from Saul’s camp. When he came to David, he fell to the ground to pay him homage.
translation: Long deya three, wanpela man i kam from kanuapela Saul, ausan klos, na daubim dust long hed. I kam kas ol i go long David, na i pilakai i go daun bung gris long en, givim respek.

original: “Where have you come from?” David asked. “I have escaped from the Israelite camp,” he replied.
translation: “Bilong wanem hap yu kam?” David askim. “Mi rinawe long kanu bilong Israel,” em i tok.

original: “What was the outcome?” David asked. “Please tell me.” “The troops fled from the battle,” he replied. “Many of them fell and died. And Saul and his son Jonathan are also dead.”
translation: Ol i go kam long wanem? David i askim. Yu tokim mi. Ol soja i ranawe long bikpela fait, em i tok. Plenti ol i pundaun na i dai. Na Saul na jonatan yangu i dai tu.

original: Then David asked the young man who had brought him the report, “How do you know that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?”
translation: Na Davidson em askim yong man hu ibringim ripot i kam long em, "Yu save olsem wanem na Saul na Jonatan i dai finish?"

original: “I happened to be on Mount Gilboa,” he replied, “and there was Saul, leaning on his spear, with the chariots and the cavalry closing in on him.
translation: Mi kamap long Maunt Gilboa, na mi lukim Saul, em i stap sindaun long spia bilong em, na kareta na soja bilong horse i go daun wantaim, ol i kam bek gen long en.

original: When he turned around and saw me, he called out and I answered, ‘Here I am!’
translation: Em i turnim bek na lukim mi, em i singaut na mi i ansa, ‘Mi stap hare!’

original: ‘Who are you?’ he asked. So I told him, ‘I am an Amalekite.’
translation: ‘Yu hu nam?’ em askim. Na mi tokim em, ‘Mi man Amalekait.’

original: Then he begged me, ‘Stand over me and kill me, for agony has seized me, but my life still lingers.’
translation: Em i bikim bek long me, ‘Yu stap we long top bilong me na kilim me, pain i kamap strong long me, tasol life bilong me i stap yet.’

original: So I stood over him and killed him, because I knew that after he had fallen he could not survive. And I took the crown that was on his head and the band that was on his arm, and I have brought them here to my lord.”
translation: Mi stap antap long em na mi kilim em, bikos mi save olsem em i go daun, em i no inap surviva. Na mi kisim krone na banis we i stap long hed na arm bilong em, na mi bringim ol i kam hia long papa.

original: Then David took hold of his own clothes and tore them, and all the men who were with him did the same.
translation: Na Daud em i pulum ap klos blong en, na ol man i stap wantaim em, ol i mekim olsem.

original: They mourned and wept and fasted until evening for Saul and his son Jonathan, and for the people of the LORD and the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword.
translation: Ol i bin kisim sori, ol i bin cry, na ol i bin kaikai nothin long taem nogat, kas long san i go daun, long Saul na Jonathan, pikinini bilong em, long ol pipol bilong Jehovah, na long haus bilong Israel, bikos ol i bin paitim ol wantaim sord.

original: And David inquired of the young man who had brought him the report, “Where are you from?” “I am the son of a foreigner,” he answered. “I am an Amalekite.”
translation: Na Daud i askim young man i bringim ripot long em, "Yu kam bek long whe?" "Mi bikos mi pikinini blo man i kam long narapela kantri," em i ansa. "Mi Amalekiti."

original: So David asked him, “Why were you not afraid to lift your hand to destroy the LORD’s anointed?”
translation: Na Davide em askim hem, "Wai yu no bin poret long kamap na bagarap pikinini i gat anointing bilong LORD?"

original: Then David summoned one of the young men and said, “Go, execute him!” So the young man struck him down, and he died.
translation: Na David em i kirapim wanpela yong man, em i tok, "Go, kilim em!" Na yong man em i paitim em, na em i dai.

original: For David had said to the Amalekite, “Your blood be on your own head because your own mouth has testified against you, saying, ‘I killed the LORD’s anointed.’”
translation: David i tok olsem long Amalekait, "Blaubol bilong yu i go long hed bilong yu yet, wantaim maus bilong yu yet i tok bagarap long yu, olsem yu tok, 'Mi kisim laif bilong man i kontri bilong papa God, Bikpela i bin ordainim.'"

original: Then David took up this lament for Saul and his son Jonathan,
translation: Na Daud i kisim tok antap long han, i bin tok singaut olsem long Saul na Jonatan pikinini bilong en.

original: and he ordered that the sons of Judah be taught the Song of the Bow. It is written in the Book of Jashar:
translation: Na em i tokim ol pikinini bilong Yuda long lernim Sang bilong Bau. Em i raitem long Buk bilong Jasa:

original: “Your glory, O Israel, lies slain on your heights. How the mighty have fallen!
translation: Glory bilong yu, Isrel, i pundaun pinis longpela hap graun bilong yu. Ol strongpela man i go daun!

original: Tell it not in Gath; proclaim it not in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, and the daughters of the uncircumcised exult.
translation: No tok olsem long Gath, no singautim olsem long strit bilong Ashkelon, mipela no wanbel, bai meri bilong Filistia i amamas, na meri bilong ol i no katim skina bipo i hamamas.

original: O mountains of Gilboa, may you have no dew or rain, no fields yielding offerings of grain. For there the shield of the mighty was defiled, the shield of Saul, no longer anointed with oil.
translation: O maunten bilong Gilboa, karim kurse o baran long yu, no graun i givim ka na bikbus long grain. Bilong em tyok, skil bilong papa i bin bagarap, skil bilong Saul, we i no longer anointim wantaim olio.

original: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan did not retreat, and the sword of Saul did not return empty.
translation: Long blod bilong ol i paitim, long gis bilong ol bikpela man, banar bilong Jonatan i no go bek, na sord bilong Saul i no kam bek i go antap.

original: Saul and Jonathan, beloved and delightful in life, were not divided in death. They were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
translation: Saul na Jonathan, nambawan pikinini na swit moa long laip, ol i stap wantaim na nais, tupela i no seperea long dae bifo. Tupela i go fasta olsem bikpela pisin, tupela i stronga olsem lion.

original: O daughters of Israel, weep for Saul, who clothed you in scarlet and luxury, who decked your garments with ornaments of gold.
translation: O pikinini meri bilong Israel, kisim i go long Saul, hu igo long kisim yu long skarlet na bikpela samting, hu painim kolos bilong yu long orniment bilong gol.

original: How the mighty have fallen in the thick of battle! Jonathan lies slain on your heights.
translation: Ol bikpela man i go daun long taim bilong fait! Jonatan i bin dai pinis long mauntin hap yu.

original: I grieve for you, Jonathan, my brother. You were delightful to me; your love to me was extraordinary, surpassing the love of women.
translation: Mipela i sori long yu, Jonathan, brata bilong mi. Yu hamamas long mi; yu laikim mi i go longwe tru, olsem laikim bilong meri i no inap kamap.

original: How the mighty have fallen and the weapons of war have perished!”
translation: Ol strongpela i go daun na wapen bilong fait i stap bagarap!

original: Some time later, David inquired of the LORD, “Should I go up to one of the towns of Judah?” “Go up,” the LORD answered. Then David asked, “Where should I go?” “To Hebron,” replied the LORD.
translation: Olsem taim igo pinis, Daved i askim long LORD, “Yu go apo long wanpela taun bilong Yuda?” LORD i tok, “Go apo.” Daved yet i askim, “Mi mas go we?” LORD i tok, “Go long Hebon.”

original: So David went there with his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel.
translation: Na Daved i go stap gen wantaim tupela meri bilong en, Ahinoam bilong Jezreel na Abigail widow meri bilong Nabal bilong Karmel.

original: David also took the men who were with him, each with his household, and they settled in the towns near Hebron.
translation: Daavid i kisim ol manmeri we istap wantaim em, hus na ol, na ol i go daun stap long ples narapela kus kus long Hebron.

original: Then the men of Judah came to Hebron, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. And they told David, “It was the men of Jabesh-gilead who buried Saul.”
translation: Ol man bilong Yuda i kam long Hebron, na long hap bilong Hebron, ol i givim anointing long David olsem king bilong haus bilong Yuda. Na ol i tokim David, "Ol man bilong Jabesh-gilead ol i biruaum Saul."

original: So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-gilead to tell them, “The LORD bless you, because you showed this kindness to Saul your lord when you buried him.
translation: Na Davide salim messija long tokim ol man meri long Jabesh-gilead, "Papa God i givim blesing long yu, bekos yu i mekim dispela kain gutpela long Saul, bos bilong yu, wann yu birua em.

original: Now may the LORD show you loving devotion and faithfulness, and I will also show you the same favor because you have done this.
translation: Nau bai Papa God i mekim yu lukim dio long stap na strongpela bilip, na mi tu bai givim yu mani ka long dispela, em i bikos yu mekim dispela.

original: Now then, be strong and courageous, for though Saul your lord is dead, the house of Judah has anointed me as their king.”
translation: Nau, i go strong na kros, bikos Saul papa bilong yu em i dai pinis, haus bilong Yuda im i givim mi lain bilong king.

original: Meanwhile, Abner son of Ner, the commander of Saul’s army, took Saul’s son Ish-bosheth, moved him to Mahanaim,
translation: Wanpela taim, Abner pikinini bilong Ner, komanda bilong armi bilong Saul, kisim Pikinini Saul Ish-bosheth, karim i go long Mahanaim.

original: and made him king over Gilead, Asher, Jezreel, Ephraim, and Benjamin—over all Israel.
translation: Na ol i mekim em king long Gilead, Asa, Jezreel, Efraim, na Benjamin – long olgeta Israel.

original: Saul’s son Ish-bosheth was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and he reigned for two years. The house of Judah, however, followed David.
translation: Saul i papa bilong Ish-bosheth, na em i 40 yia wen em i kam bek long ples bilong en, na em i statim bos long Israel, na em i bos olsem tu yia. Haus bilong Yuda, ol i go behain long David.

original: And the length of time that David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
translation: Taim longpela we David em i king long Hebron long hap bilong Yuda em i sekhen pala yia na sikis mun.

original: One day Abner son of Ner and the servants of Ish-bosheth son of Saul marched out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.
translation: Wanpela de Abner, pikinini bilong Ner, na ol i wokman bilong Ish-bosheth, pikinini bilong Saul, marchim go long Mahanaim na i go long Gibeon.

original: So Joab son of Zeruiah, along with the servants of David, marched out and met them by the pool of Gibeon. And the two camps took up positions on opposite sides of the pool.
translation: Na Joab sussa bilong Zeruiah, wantaim wokman bilong Davide, i go aut na kim ol long hol bilong Gibeon. Na tupela ka bilong ol i stap long sait opisit, klostu long hol.

original: Then Abner said to Joab, “Let us have the young men get up and compete before us.” “Let them get up,” Joab replied.
translation: Abner i tokim Joab, “Uskim ol yangpela man i go ap na paitim wanpela bikpela wok long sindaun bilong mipela.” “Ol i go ap,” Joab i bekim tok.

original: So they got up and were counted off—twelve for Benjamin and Ish-bosheth son of Saul, and twelve for David.
translation: Ol i kam daun na kanim ol long ol – twelve bilong tribe Benjimin na Is-Boset susa bilong Saule, na twelve bilong lain bilong king Davide.

original: Then each man grabbed his opponent by the head and thrust his sword into his opponent’s side, and they all fell together. So this place, which is in Gibeon, is called Helkath-hazzurim.
translation: Na ol man i kisim bek long hed bilong ol man i pait, na ol i thrustim spia bilong ol long sait bilong ol pait, na ol i pundaun olgeta. Na ples ia, em i stap long Gibeon, ikamap long nem Helkath-hazzurim.

original: The battle that day was intense, and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated by the servants of David.
translation: Taitim bilong de bikim strong olsem, na Abner na manmeri bilong Israel i lus long han bilong wokman bilong Daud.

original: The three sons of Zeruiah were there: Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Now Asahel was fleet of foot like a wild gazelle,
translation: Tripe sun bilong Zeruiah i kam: Joab, Abishai, na Asahel. Na Asahel em i man bilong ren na i go i go olsem gazelle wail.

original: and he chased Abner, not turning to the right or to the left in his pursuit.
translation: Na em i go bekim Abner, i no lusim rot long sait na long lef long ran i go.

original: And Abner glanced back and said, “Is that you, Asahel?” “It is,” Asahel replied.
translation: Na Abner i lusim ai bilong en i go bek, na toktok olsem, “Yu em Asahel?” Asahel i tok olsem, “Yes, mi em.”

original: So Abner told him, “Turn to your right or to your left, seize one of the young men, and take his equipment for yourself.” But Asahel would not stop chasing him.
translation: Na Abena i tokim em, "Wokim sharp long rait na long left, kisim wanpela blop yong man, na tekim ol samting bilong em." Tasol Asael i no ken stap bihainim em.

original: Once again, Abner warned Asahel, “Stop chasing me. Why should I strike you to the ground? How could I show my face to your brother Joab?”
translation: Gen again, Abner tok strong long Asahel, "Stop i go bek long me. Wanem mak sindaun yu yet? Mi no inap paitim yu daun long graun. Mi showim pes bilong me long brata Joab bai mipela kisim hevi?"

original: But Asahel refused to turn away; so Abner thrust the butt of his spear into his stomach, and it came out his back, and he fell dead on the spot. And every man paused when he came to the place where Asahel had fallen and died.
translation: Barekat Asael i no givim ap long en; olsem Abena i kilim spia bilong en, na i go insait long bel bilong en, na i kam aut bihain bek bilong en, na i pundaun dead long ples. Na ol man i stap wen i kam long ples we Asael i pundaun dead long em.

original: But Joab and Abishai pursued Abner. By sunset, they had gone as far as the hill of Ammah opposite Giah on the way to the wilderness of Gibeon.
translation: Na Joab na Abishai i go bekim Abner. Long sait bilong san, ol i go kamap long han bilong maunten bilong Ammah, we bilong Giah long rot bilong bus bilong Gibeon.

original: The Benjamites rallied to Abner, formed a single unit, and took their stand atop a hill.
translation: Benjamaitis i kam bek long Abner, ol i stap wantaim olsem wan gris, na ol i go stap strong long maunten.

original: Then Abner called out to Joab: “Must the sword devour forever? Do you not realize that this will only end in bitterness? How long before you tell the troops to stop pursuing their brothers?”
translation: Na Abner kirap long tokim Joab: “Inap sua i kaikai oltaim? Yu no save long dispela, em i kamap strong bilong sore tasol? Oli bai lusim wok bilong pursui brata bilong yumi long wanem taim?”

original: “As surely as God lives,” Joab replied, “if you had not spoken up, the troops would have continued pursuing their brothers until morning.”
translation: “Olsem God i stap, em i liv,” Joab i tokim, “sapos yu no tokim, soljas bai ol i go bek long paitim bratas bilong ol yet, na i go inap long moning.”

original: So Joab blew the ram’s horn, and all the troops stopped; they no longer pursued Israel or continued to fight.
translation: Yoab blokim horn bilong ram, na olgeta solja i stap; ol i no givim chas long Israel gen, na ol i hariap long pait.

original: And all that night Abner and his men marched through the Arabah. They crossed the Jordan, marched all morning, and arrived at Mahanaim.
translation: Na Abner wantaim ol solja bilong en i go daun thromo long Arabah, ol i kakap long Jordan, ol i go wakabaut olsem long moning, na ol i kamap long Mahanaim.

original: When Joab returned from pursuing Abner, he gathered all the troops. In addition to Asahel, nineteen of David’s servants were missing,
translation: Wanpela taim Yoab i kam bek gen long ranim na i go bek gen long Abner, na em yet i girapim olgeta solja, na Asahel na nainpela wokman bilong David i los.

original: but they had struck down 360 Benjamites who were with Abner.
translation: Bai ol i kilim daun 360 man bilong tribe bilong Benjamin ol i stap wantaim Abner.

original: Later, they took Asahel and buried him in his father’s tomb in Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men marched all night and reached Hebron at daybreak.
translation: Ol i kisim Asahel na ol i birikim em long hol bilong papa na mama em long Betlehem. Joab na ol man bilong em i go dai pinis long nait, na bai dagai ol i kamap long Hebron.

original: Now the war between the house of Saul and the house of David was protracted. And David grew stronger and stronger, while the house of Saul grew weaker and weaker.
translation: Nau pait bilong haus bilong Saul na haus bilong Davit i go em i go long. Na Davit i go stronga yet, stronga yet, tasol haus bilong Saul i go daun, daun yet.

original: And sons were born to David in Hebron: His firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam of Jezreel;
translation: Na pikinini i kamap long David long Hebron: Pikinini bilong papa em, Amnon, mama bilong em Ahinoam, meri bilong Jezreel;

original: his second was Chileab, by Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel; his third was Absalom, the son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;
translation: Namba tu bilong em i Chileab, long Abigail bibi bilong Nabal bilong Carmel; namba tri bilong em i Absalom, pikinini bilong Maacah meri bilong King Talmai bilong Geshur;

original: his fourth was Adonijah, the son of Haggith; his fifth was Shephatiah, the son of Abital;
translation: Numbu foa bilong en i Adonijah, pikinini bilong Haggith; numbu faiwa bilong en i Shephatiah, pikinini bilong Abital;

original: and his sixth was Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah. These sons were born to David in Hebron.
translation: Na nambasikis igo Ithream, long wei bilong meri David, Eglah. Despela man i kamap long David long Hebron.

original: During the war between the house of Saul and the house of David, Abner had continued to strengthen his position in the house of Saul.
translation: Long taim bilong war bikos long husat i bilong Saul na husat i bilong David, Abner i go strongim pes bilong em insait long husat i bilong Saul.

original: Meanwhile, Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah. So Ish-bosheth questioned Abner, “Why did you sleep with my father’s concubine?”
translation: Wanpela taim, Saul i gat meri bilong kabana, em Rizpah, dai bilong Aiah. Na Ish-bosheth i askim Abner, "Why yu sleep wantaim meri bilong papa bilong mi?"

original: Abner was furious over Ish-bosheth’s accusation. “Am I the head of a dog that belongs to Judah?” he asked. “All this time I have been loyal to the house of your father Saul, to his brothers, and to his friends. I have not delivered you into the hand of David, but now you accuse me of wrongdoing with this woman!
translation: Abner i masalai tumas long akusesen bilong Ish-bosheth. "Mi stap hed bilong dog bilong Juda?" em i askim. "Olgeta taim mi kamap tru long haus bilong papa Saul, na ol brata na ol poroman bilong em. Mi no givim yu long han bilong David, tasol nau yu akusim mi long wok nogut wantaim meri dispela!

original: May God punish Abner, and ever so severely, if I do not do for David what the LORD has sworn to him:
translation: Bikpela i givim peni long Abner, strong long nogut, if mi no mekim olgeta samting long han bilong David olsem LORD i tokim em.

original: to transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul and to establish the throne of David over Israel and Judah, from Dan to Beersheba.”
translation: Long kam transferim kingdom bikos long setim troin bilong Daved ibin go pas long Israel na Judah, stat long Dan go bek long Beersheba.

original: And for fear of Abner, Ish-bosheth did not dare to say another word to him.
translation: Na bikos Ish Boset i save tromoi long Abena, hem no bin kirap tok gen.

original: Then Abner sent messengers in his place to say to David, “To whom does the land belong? Make your covenant with me, and surely my hand will be with you to bring all Israel over to you.”
translation: Na Abner sendim messinger ol i go long hap bilong en, ol i tokim Davit, “Lan i belong long whos? Mekim pek pes bilong yu gen mi, na han bilong mi bai stap wantaim yu, bringim olgeta Isrel i kam bek long yu.”

original: “Good,” replied David, “I will make a covenant with you. But there is one thing I require of you: Do not appear before me unless you bring Saul’s daughter Michal when you come to see me.”
translation: Na Davide i tok bek, "Mipela i mekim pinis covenant wantaim yu, mipela i nap tu, tasol i gat wanpela samting mi laik askim yu long en: Yu no ken kam bek long me, maski yu kam na bringim Michal, gel bilong Saul, orait yu ken kam."

original: Then David sent messengers to say to Ish-bosheth son of Saul, “Give me back my wife, Michal, whom I betrothed to myself for a hundred Philistine foreskins.”
translation: Na Davide salim messenja i go tokim Ish-bosheth pikinini bilong Saul, "Givim bek meri bilong me, Mikali, we mi bin promis long em husban meri, na mi bin peim long hundred skín bilong Philistine ol i kisim long ol man bilong en."

original: So Ish-bosheth sent and took Michal from her husband Paltiel son of Laish.
translation: Na Ish-bosheth salim go na kisim Mikal long Paltiel man bilong Laish, husat i man bilong em.

original: Her husband followed her, weeping all the way to Bahurim. Then Abner said to him, “Go back.” So he returned home.
translation: Hosbin bilong em i go bek gen long en, i krai olsem tasol i go long ples Bahurim. Na Abner i tokim em olsem, “Go bak.” Na em i go bek long haus bilong em.

original: Now Abner conferred with the elders of Israel and said, “In the past you sought David as your king.
translation: Nau Abner i tokaut wantaim bikman bilong Israel na em i tok, "Long taim bifo yumus lukim Dauid olsem king bilong yu."

original: Now take action, because the LORD has said to David, ‘Through My servant David I will save My people Israel from the hands of the Philistines and of all their enemies.’”
translation: Nau wokim akshan, bikos Bikpela i tok olsem long Davide, ‘Olsem mi servit Davide, mi bai save pipol bilong mi Isrel from hambis bilong Filistia na bilong ol hambis bilong ol.’”

original: Abner also spoke to the Benjamites and went to Hebron to tell David all that seemed good to Israel and to the whole house of Benjamin.
translation: Abena i tokim Ol Benjamin, na em i go long Hebron tokim Davide olgeta samting ol i tingim gut long ai bilong Israel na long haus bilong Benjamin.

original: When Abner and twenty of his men came to David at Hebron, David held a feast for them.
translation: Taim Abner na twenty man bilong em i kam long David long Hebron, David i makim bikpela kaikai bilong en, na i givim welkam long ol.

original: Then Abner said to David, “Let me go at once, and I will gather all Israel to my lord the king, that they may make a covenant with you, and that you may rule over all that your heart desires.” So David dismissed Abner, and he went in peace.
translation: Na Abner i tokim Davide, “Lusim mi nau tasol, na mi kisim ol Israel i go long lord bilong yu king, ol bai me and yu watai pakt, na yu bos bilong ol samting we yu laik.” Na Davide i dimisim Abner, na em i go i stap long peis.

original: Just then David’s soldiers and Joab returned from a raid, bringing with them a great plunder. But Abner was not with David in Hebron because David had sent him on his way in peace.
translation: Soljata bilong David na Joab i kam bek long raim, ol i bringim bikpela lo bilong ol i winim. Abner i no stap wantaim David long Hebron bikos David i sendim em i go long pis.

original: When Joab and all his troops arrived, he was informed, “Abner son of Ner came to see the king, who sent him on his way in peace.”
translation: Taim Joab na ol soldier bilong em i kam, em i save harim, "Abner pikinini bilong Ner i kam lukim king, we em i lusim go long ples bilong en long peis."

original: So Joab went to the king and said, “What have you done? Look, Abner came to you. Why did you dismiss him? Now he is getting away!
translation: Yoab i go kam long king, em tokim king olsem, "Wanem yu mekim? Abena i kam long yu, yu kisim bek i go, na nau em i lus pinis!

original: Surely you realize that Abner son of Ner came to deceive you and to track your movements and all that you are doing.”
translation: Sapos yu save long tok, Abner sun bilong Ner i kam bilong givim yu long bikpela lie, na ol i wachim pas bilong yu, na ol samting yu mekim.

original: As soon as Joab had left David, he sent messengers after Abner, who brought him back from the well of Sirah; but David was unaware of it.
translation: Olsem Joab i go bek long David, na em i sendim man bung wantaim Abner, ol hamarim i kam bek gen long wel bilong Sirah; tasol David i no save long dispela.

original: When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab pulled him aside into the gateway, as if to speak to him privately, and there Joab stabbed him in the stomach. So Abner died on account of the blood of Joab’s brother Asahel.
translation: Taim Abner i go bek gen long Hebron, Joab i pulim em aside long gate we bilong ples, olsem wanem tok togeta mipela i tok secret, na Joab i kilim em na prik em long bel. Na Abner i dai bekos bilong shedim blod bilong brata bilong Joab, Asahel.

original: Afterward, David heard about this and said, “I and my kingdom are forever guiltless before the LORD concerning the blood of Abner son of Ner.
translation: Bihain, Davide harim tok bilong dispela, na em i tok, "Mi na ples bilong mi em i stap oltaim innocents long han bilong Bikpela God tasol long blood bilong Abner, pikinini bilong Ner."

original: May it whirl over the heads of Joab and the entire house of his father, and may the house of Joab never be without one having a discharge or skin disease, or one who leans on a staff or falls by the sword or lacks food.”
translation: Em i go wail long hap bilong Joab na olgeta haus bilong papa bilong em, na husat i no gat taim em i stap we, man husat i gat sik bilong pipel i kam aut na skin bilong en i bagarap, or man husat i sindaun long stik, or i pundaun na i dai long sip, o i no gat ka.

original: (Joab and his brother Abishai murdered Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel in the battle at Gibeon.)
translation: Joab na brata bilong em Abishai i kilim Abner bikos em i kilim brata bilong ol, Asahel, long bikpela fait bilong Gibeon.

original: Then David ordered Joab and all the people with him, “Tear your clothes, put on sackcloth, and mourn before Abner.” And King David himself walked behind the funeral bier.
translation: Na David i tokim Joab na ol pipol i go wantaim em, “Kisim klotes na rausim ol i go, kisim sakklot na putim long bodi, na i kam daun long mourne bifo Abner.” Na King David em yet i go behain long bier bilong dei.

original: When they buried Abner in Hebron, the king wept aloud at Abner’s tomb, and all the people wept.
translation: Taim ol i kisim Abner i go kisim gras long Hebron, king i kisim tok harim strong long ples bilong miamus bilong Abner, na ol pipol i kisim tok harim.

original: And the king sang this lament for Abner: “Should Abner die the death of a fool?
translation: King i singaut ol sorim na kisim pain long Abena: “Abena inap dai olsem man i no save?”

original: Your hands were not bound, your feet were not fettered. As a man falls before the wicked, so also you fell.” And all the people wept over him even more.
translation: Han bilong yu i no bin baind, leq bilong yu i no bin katim. Yu pilai daun bifor ol i stap long wei bilong ol nogut, olsem man i pilai daun. Na ol pipel i krai olsem long en, mekim sori long ples publiq, strongim moa yet.

original: Then all the people came and urged David to eat something while it was still day, but David took an oath, saying, “May God punish me, and ever so severely, if I taste bread or anything else before the sun sets!”
translation: Ol pipol i kam na toktok strong long David, ol i bikimim David kaikai samting yet long de, tasol David i kisim oas, i tok, "Mipela God i givim penati long me, na penati i kam strongpela, if mipela kaikai bret o samting nating bifor san i go daun!"

original: All the people took note and were pleased. In fact, everything the king did pleased them.
translation: Ol pipol i save lukim na ol i amamas, olgeta samting king i mekim em i amamas long ol.

original: So on that day all the troops and all Israel were convinced that the king had no part in the murder of Abner son of Ner.
translation: Long hap bilong dei, olgeta solja na ol Israel i belivim strong olsem king i no mekim kilim olsem long Abner sun bilong Ner.

original: Then the king said to his servants, “Do you not realize that a great prince has fallen today in Israel?
translation: King i tokim servant bilong em, "Yu no save, wanpela bikpela prins ibin kuk boil long tude na i dai long Israel?"

original: And I am weak this day, though anointed as king, and these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too fierce for me. May the LORD repay the evildoer according to his evil!”
translation: Na mi les tude, masina ol i givim anointing long mi olsem king, na ol pikinini bilong Zeruiah, ol i strong tumas long me. LORD bai pe em i go long bodi bilong man i mekim ol samting nogut olsem nem bilong en!

original: Now when Ish-bosheth son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost courage, and all Israel was dismayed.
translation: Taim Ish-bosheth Pikinini bilong Sau hearim Abner i dai pinis long Hebron, em i bikim silip, na Olegta Israel i bikim wari.

original: Saul’s son had two men who were leaders of raiding parties. One was named Baanah and the other Rechab; they were sons of Rimmon the Beerothite of the tribe of Benjamin—Beeroth is considered part of Benjamin,
translation: Saul i gat tu ol man, ol bikman bilong ol seliman. Wan em i kolim Baanah, na nnar em i kolim Rechab; ol i pikinini bilong Rimmon Beerothite bilong tribe Benjamin - Beeroth em i kam long hap bilong Benjamin.

original: because the Beerothites fled to Gittaim and have lived there as foreigners to this day.
translation: Bikos Beerothites i ranawe go long Gittaim na ol i stap we long ples narapela olsem man bus, na ol i stap yet long tude.

original: And Jonathan son of Saul had a son who was lame in his feet. He was five years old when the report about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel. His nurse picked him up and fled, but as she was hurrying to escape, he fell and became lame. His name was Mephibosheth.
translation: Na Jonathan sone bilong Saul i gat wanpela sike, em i no save wok long leg, em i five yia olsem ripot long Saul na Jonathan i kam from Jezreel. Nus i kisim em na wokim spid long ron igo, tasol em i pundaun na leg im i bagarap. Nem bilong em Mepiboset.

original: Now Rechab and Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, set out and arrived at the house of Ish-bosheth in the heat of the day, while the king was taking his midday nap.
translation: Nau Rekab na Baana, ol pikinini bilong Rimmon man Beeroth, i go na kamap, ol i kamap long haus bilong Is-boset long taem bilong het, wail king i go slip long middae.

original: They entered the interior of the house as if to get some wheat, and they stabbed him in the stomach. Then Rechab and his brother Baanah slipped away.
translation: Tupela i go insait long haus olsem i kam bekim wiat, na tupela i kirapim em long bel. Na Rekab na brata bilong em Bananah, tupela i slip awe.

original: They had entered the house while Ish-bosheth was lying on his bed, and having stabbed and killed him, they beheaded him, took his head, and traveled all night by way of the Arabah.
translation: Ol i go insait long house traem Ish-bosheth i slip i stap long bet bilong en, na ol i kilim en na ol i katim nep bilong en, ol i kisim nep bilong en, na ol i warkabai nogut long nait long rot bilong Araba.

original: They brought the head of Ish-bosheth to David at Hebron and said to the king, “Here is the head of Ish-bosheth son of Saul, your enemy who sought your life. Today the LORD has granted vengeance to my lord the king against Saul and his offspring.”
translation: Ol i kam bringim hed bilong Ish-bosheth long David long Hebron na ol i tokim king, "Em hem i hed bilong Ish-bosheth, pikinini bilong Saul, yu enemy we i bin go lusim laip bilong yu. Nau LORD i givim bekim long yu king long han bilong Saul na pikinini bilong em."

original: But David answered Rechab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, “As surely as the LORD lives, who has redeemed my life from all distress,
translation: Baat David i tokim Rechab na brother bilong em Baanah, ol pikinini bilong Rimmon man Beeroth, “Olsem God i stap, em i liv, we husat i skulim laip bilong mi long ol kros na trabel,”

original: when someone told me, ‘Look, Saul is dead,’ and thought he was a bearer of good news, I seized him and put him to death at Ziklag. That was his reward for his news!
translation: Wanpela man i tokim mi, 'Luke, Saul i dai pinis,' na em i tingim em yet olsem man i kam bilong givim gutpela stori, mi kisim em na mi kilim em long Ziklag. Bekim pekenga long em olsem nem bilong stori em i bringim.

original: How much more, when wicked men kill a righteous man in his own house and on his own bed, shall I not now require his blood from your hands and remove you from the earth!”
translation: Olsem na olsem, taim ol man i no gat laif i kilim man i stap long wei tu long haus bilong em, na long bet bilong em, bai mi bihainim blod bilong em long han bilong yu, na mi kirapim yu long graun!

original: So David commanded his young men, and they killed Rechab and Baanah. They cut off their hands and feet and hung their bodies by the pool in Hebron, but they took the head of Ish-bosheth and buried it in Abner’s tomb in Hebron.
translation: Na Davide i givim tok impris long ol yong man bilong en, na ol i kilim Rechab na Baanah. Ol i katim of han bilong ol na liklik bilong ol, na ol i hangim bodi bilong ol nambis ai bilong pukari long Hebron, tasol ol i kisim hed bilong Ish-bosheth na ol i birim em long mun bilong Abner long Hebron.

original: Then all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and said, “Here we are, your own flesh and blood.
translation: Olgeta tribe bilong Isrel i kam long David long Hebron na tok, 'Mipela i stap, ken bilong yu, flesh na blood bilong yu.'

original: Even in times past, while Saul was king over us, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them back. And to you the LORD said, ‘You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be ruler over them.’”
translation: Even long taim bifo, wail em Saul i bin king ibeken long yumi, yupela i bin bringim Israel i go na kam bek gen. Na long yu LORD i tok olsem, 'Yu yet bai shepherd piple bilong yu Israel, na yu bai bos bilong ol.'

original: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, where King David made with them a covenant before the LORD. And they anointed him king over Israel.
translation: Olgeta bikpela man meri bilong Israel i kam long king long Hebron, ples bikpela, na King David i mekim wong long ol long ai bilong LORD. Na ol i givim em oili, na em i bikpela king bilong Israel.

original: David was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years.
translation: David em i 30 yia na em bikim king, na em i rulim kantri 40 yia.

original: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years over all Israel and Judah.
translation: Long Hebron em i bin king olsem sampela yia seven na mun sis, na long Yerusalem em i bin king tripela ten na thrim yia olsem king bilong Israel holem tasol na Yuda.

original: Now the king and his men marched to Jerusalem against the Jebusites who inhabited the land. The Jebusites said to David: “You will never get in here. Even the blind and lame can repel you.” For they thought, “David cannot get in here.”
translation: Nau king na ol man bilong em i go bek long Jerusalem, ol i go bek long Jebusait, ol pipol i stap long kantri. Jebusait i tokim Davide: “Yu no inap go insait long hap. Sogeri na ol man i no save luk, ol i ken paitim yu.” Ol i tingim olsem, “Davide no inap go insait long hap.”

original: Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion (that is, the City of David).
translation: Na Daavid i kamapim strongpela haus bilong Saion, em i Siti bilong Daavid.

original: On that day he said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites must use the water shaft to reach the lame and blind who are despised by David.” That is why it is said, “The blind and the lame will never enter the palace.”
translation: Long hap dei em i tok, “Hu i go bagarap Jebusi, emas i usim pait bilong wara i go kas long ol i no inap warka na ol i pokia, ol i no lukim gud long ai bilong Daved.” Bikos long hap em i tok olsem, “Ol i no inap warka na ol i pokia, bai ol i no inap go insait long haus bilong king.”

original: So David took up residence in the fortress and called it the City of David. He built it up all the way around, from the supporting terraces inward.
translation: Na Davidson i kam bilong stap long fos na ol i kolim em Siti bilong Davit. Ol i wokim em i go antap, stat long tres bilong sapotim na i go inap.

original: And David became greater and greater, for the LORD God of Hosts was with him.
translation: Na Dauid i go ap long long, bikos Bikpela God LORD God bilong ol ples i stap wantaim em.

original: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent envoys to David, along with cedar logs, carpenters, and stonemasons, and they built a palace for David.
translation: Na Hiram king bilong Taire i salim emba bilong en i go long David, tasol i kam wantaim timber bilong seda, karpenta, na stonmasin, na ol i bikim haus bilong kwin bilong David.

original: And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and had exalted his kingdom for the sake of His people Israel.
translation: Na David i save olsem LORD i strongim em yet long bilong king bilong Israel, na i lifim up kingdom bilong en long longlong bilong ples Israel.

original: After he had arrived from Hebron, David took more concubines and wives from Jerusalem, and more sons and daughters were born to him.
translation: Nachinal em i kam long Hebron, Daudi i kisim moa meri na bikpela meri long Jerusalem, na moa pikinini man na pikinini woman i kamap long en.

original: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
translation: Dispela i nem bilong pikinini i kamap long em i go long Yerusalem: Shamuwa, Shobab, Natan, Solomon,

original: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia,
translation: Aibha, Elishua, Nefeg, Japhia, ol i kam long lis blo Bibikal nem.

original: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
translation: Elishama, Eliada, na Eliphelet.

original: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel, they all went in search of him; but David learned of this and went down to the stronghold.
translation: Taim Filisitia harim tok, Daud i kamap king nau long Israel, ol i go bek long en; tasol Daud i save long dispela, na Daud i go daun long ples strongpela.

original: Now the Philistines had come and spread out in the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Nau Filistia i kam, na ol i skat i go long Valeli bilong Rephaim.

original: So David inquired of the LORD, “Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?” “Go,” replied the LORD, “for I will surely deliver the Philistines into your hand.”
translation: Na Davidson askim tok bilong Jehovah, "Mi mas go apla gen long paitim Filistia? Yu bai savesim ol i go long mi?" Jehovah i tok, "Go, mi bai givim ol Filistia i go long yu."

original: So David went to Baal-perazim, where he defeated the Philistines and said, “Like a bursting flood, the LORD has burst out against my enemies before me.” So he called that place Baal-perazim.
translation: Na Daubid i go long Baal-perazim, na em i winim Filistia, na em i tok, "Olsem wara i kam antap strong, LORD i kirap strong agenst ol eni i no likim mipela bifor mia." Na em i kisim nem bilong ples ia, Baal-perazim, olsem ples we i gat bikpela meaning.

original: There the Philistines abandoned their idols, and David and his men carried them away.
translation: Long hap em Filistia lusim ol idol bilong ol, na Daved wantaim ol man bilong en karim ol i go.

original: Once again the Philistines came up and spread out in the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Gen gen Filistia i kamap na ol i skelimapim long Bog na Rephaim.

original: So David inquired of the LORD, who answered, “Do not march straight up, but circle around behind them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.
translation: Na Davide askim tok bilong Jehovah, na Jehovah i tok, "Yu no ken march stret na go stap, bek yu wokabaut bihain long ol, na kilim ol long fron bilong diwai balsam."

original: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move quickly, because this will mean that the LORD has marched out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
translation: Olsem yu harim sain bilong i go na wakabaut long top bilong diwai balsam, yu go bek hak, bikos dispela em i min, LORD i go bifor yu, i ledim yu, na i kilim ka long ples bilong Filistia olsem enemy.

original: So David did as the LORD had commanded him, and he struck down the Philistines all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.
translation: Na Davit i mekim olsem Lod i bin tokim em, na em i kilim Philistines olegeta wei from Gibeon long go inap long Gezer.

original: David again assembled the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand in all.
translation: David i kam bek gen, i pilim tripela ten thousand bilong ol man husat i laik long Israel.

original: And he and all his troops set out for Baale of Judah to bring up from there the ark of God, which is called by the Name—the name of the LORD of Hosts, who is enthroned between the cherubim that are on it.
translation: Na em, wantaim ol soja bilong en, i go kam long Baale bilong Yuda, ol i kisim i go apo long ark bilong God, we em i kolim Nem—nem bilong LORD bilong ol pait bilong em, we em i sindaun namel long cherubim i stap long en.

original: They set the ark of God on a new cart and brought it from the house of Abinadab, which was on the hill. Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, were guiding the new cart,
translation: Ol i putim bek bilong God long nupela karet na kisim i kam long haus bilong Abinadab, em i stap long han bilong maunten. Uzza na Ahio, ol pikinini bilong Abinadab, ol i lei i go long nupela karet.

original: bringing with it the ark of God. And Ahio was walking in front of the ark.
translation: I kam wantaim bokis bilong God, na Ahio em i wok i go bifor bokis.

original: David and all the house of Israel were celebrating before the LORD with all kinds of wood instruments, harps, stringed instruments, tambourines, sistrums, and cymbals.
translation: Daud na olgeta haus bilong Isrel i stap rejois bifor LORD wantaim ol kain instrumens bilong timbar, hapas, instrumens bilong string, tamborin, sistrum, na simbal.

original: When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark of God, because the oxen had stumbled.
translation: Taim ol i kam long ples bilong kilim graun bilong Nakon, Uza em strechim han na kisim bokis bilong God, bikos ol bulmakau i slip.

original: And the anger of the LORD burned against Uzzah, and God struck him down on the spot for his irreverence, and he died there beside the ark of God.
translation: Naaira bilong Jehovah i bum longen, na God i kilim Uzzah long hap tu long ol i no givim respek, na em i dai there besait long bokis bilong God.

original: Then David became angry because the LORD had burst forth against Uzzah; so he named that place Perez-uzzah, as it is called to this day.
translation: Na Davide em i masalai tumas bekos LORD i kisim strongpela samting long Uzzah, na em i givim nem Perez-uzzah long ples ia, na tisas ol i kolim olsem yet.

original: That day David feared the LORD and asked, “How can the ark of the LORD ever come to me?”
translation: Long dei Daud i fearim LORD olgeta, na em i askim, “Ark bilong LORD bai kam kasol long me?”

original: So he was unwilling to move the ark of the LORD to the City of David; instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
translation: Na em i no bin wan go bek, olsem na em i kisim bokis bilong Jehovah i go long haus bilong Obed-Edom Gittait, tasol em i no go long Siti bilong Daud.

original: Thus the ark of the LORD remained in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite for three months, and the LORD blessed him and all his household.
translation: Bokis Bilong Jehovah i stap long haus bilong Obed-Edom Giti long tripela mun, na Jehovah i givim berkat long em na long ol arapela long husat i stap wantaim em.

original: Now it was reported to King David, “The LORD has blessed the house of Obed-edom and all that belongs to him, because of the ark of God.” So David went and had the ark of God brought up from the house of Obed-edom into the City of David with rejoicing.
translation: Ol i tokim King Davit, “LORD i givim blesing long haus bilong Obed-Edom na ol samting bilong em, bikos bilong ark bilong God.” Na King Davit i go na kisim ark bilong God i kam insait long siti bilong em wantaim bel hevi.

original: When those carrying the ark of the LORD had advanced six paces, he sacrificed an ox and a fattened calf.
translation: Taim ol i kam anhavirim na karim bokis bilong Lod, ol i go nap longpela, na em i kirap oks na pikin we i pulap longpela.

original: And David, wearing a linen ephod, danced with all his might before the LORD,
translation: Na Davide, i kaikai epodo bilong laplap, i dansi strong olsem bifoa LORD.

original: while he and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of the LORD with shouting and the sounding of the ram’s horn.
translation: Em na olgeta haus bilong Isrel i bringim ark bilong LORD i go antap long hap wantaim kalabus na saunin bilong kon bilong ram.

original: As the ark of the LORD was entering the City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked down from a window and saw King David leaping and dancing before the LORD, and she despised him in her heart.
translation: Bokis bilong Lod i go insait long Siti bilong Davit, Meri bilong Saul, Mikal i kam daun lukim bek long wanpela windoa, na i lukim King Davit i dansi na wail long ples bilong Lod, na em i biruaim em long het bilong en.

original: So they brought the ark of the LORD and set it in its place inside the tent that David had pitched for it. Then David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the LORD.
translation: Ol i kisim bek bilong LORD i kam, plantim em insait long haus bikman David en. Na David i wokim ofing bung bilong bun na ofing bung bilong peis bifor ai bilong LORD.

original: When David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD of Hosts.
translation: Wanpela taim David i kamap long wok bungim hevi bilong bung na hevi bilong pis, em i givim bikpela banis long ol pipol long nem bilong LORD God bilong ol ples.

original: Then he distributed to every man and woman among the multitude of Israel a loaf of bread, a date cake, and a raisin cake. And all the people departed, each for his own home.
translation: Na em i salim buo bilong bret, kek bilong det, na kek bilong pasin long ol man na meri i kamap long ol pipol i gat planti long Isrel. Na ol pipol i go bek, wanwan go long hus na em.

original: As soon as David returned home to bless his own household, Saul’s daughter Michal came out to meet him. “How the king of Israel has distinguished himself today!” she said. “He has uncovered himself today in the sight of the maidservants of his subjects, like a vulgar person would do.”
translation: Long taim David i kam bek long hus na blesim ples bilong em yet, Meri bilong Saul, Mikal, i kam aut long metim em. "King bilong Israel em mekim namel long tude," ol i tok. "Em hevim skirt long ai bilong meri bilong wok haus bilong pipol bilong kantri, olsem man bilong hevi tok i duim."

original: But David said to Michal, “I was dancing before the LORD, who chose me over your father and all his house when He appointed me ruler over the LORD’s people Israel. I will celebrate before the LORD,
translation: Na Davide i tokim Mikal, "Mi bin dans bifo LONG WE, hu i pilim me nau long pa blo yu na olgeta haus bilong em, na GOD yet inap im appointim me olsem bikpela bos bilong piple Israel bilong GOD. Bai mi go dans i hap bilong LONG WE."

original: and I will humiliate and humble myself even more than this. Yet I will be honored by the maidservants of whom you have spoken.”
translation: Na mi bai i stap long kanua na bilipim masel olsem yet, na mi bai gat respek long hap meri bilong servis we yu tokim.

original: And Michal the daughter of Saul had no children to the day of her death.
translation: Na Mikael daughta bilong Saul i no go het pikinini long dei bilong em i dai.

original: After the king had settled into his palace and the LORD had given him rest from all his enemies around him,
translation: Bihaen long king i go daun i stap insait long haus bilong en, na LORD i givim em ripos long ol enemis bilong en we i stap rondom em.

original: he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of God remains in a tent.”
translation: Em i tokim Natan propet, “Mi stap hir, mi stap insait long haus bilong seda, tasol ak bilong God i stap yet long tent.”

original: And Nathan replied to the king, “Go and do all that is in your heart, for the LORD is with you.”
translation: Natan i tokim king, “Go na wokim ol samting we i stap inside haret bilong yu, bikos LORD i stap wantaim yu.”

original: But that night the word of the LORD came to Nathan, saying,
translation: Bai nait i go dawn, tok bilong LORD i kam long Natan, i tok olsem:

original: “Go and tell My servant David that this is what the LORD says: Are you the one to build for Me a house to dwell in?
translation: Go na tokim Wokman David dispela em i tok olsem: Yu yet, bai yumui long hus na bauim haus bilong Mi stap?

original: For I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought the Israelites up out of Egypt until this day, but I have moved about with a tent as My dwelling.
translation: Mi no stap long haus from dei mi kisim Israel pipol i kamap nau long Egip, until dei, tasol Mi go wankain wantaim tent olsem ples bilong Mi.

original: In all My journeys with all the Israelites, have I ever asked any of the leaders I appointed to shepherd My people Israel, ‘Why haven’t you built Me a house of cedar?’
translation: Long olgeta ples we go, na mi go wantaim ol Israel, mi ever askim sampela bilong ol lida i appointim ol i lukautim ples bilong mi, Israel, ‘Wai yu no buildim haus bilong mi long diwai cedar?’

original: Now then, you are to tell My servant David that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be the ruler over My people Israel.
translation: Nau yet, yu mas tokim Servant bilong mi David olsem bos bilong LORD bilong ol ples: Mi kisim yu long bus, long bihainim ol dok, na nau mi putim yu olsem rula ibilong pipol bilong mi Israel.

original: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make for you a name like the greatest in the land.
translation: Mi bin stap wantaim yu we yu go, na mi bin kisim oltab long ol eni yu long bihain yu. Nau mi bai mekim nem bilong yu olsem nem bilong greatest long kantri.

original: And I will provide a place for My people Israel and will plant them so that they may dwell in a place of their own and be disturbed no more. No longer will the sons of wickedness oppress them as they did at the beginning
translation: Mi bai givim ples long Pipol bilong mi Israel, na bai plantim ol, Olsen ol bai stap long ples bilong ol yet, na ol no ino bagarap gen. Susa bilong ol ietim man ol bagarapim ol long taim bipo, tasol ol i no ino bagarapim ol gen.

original: and have done since the day I appointed judges over My people Israel. I will give you rest from all your enemies. The LORD declares to you that He Himself will establish a house for you.
translation: Na mi bin mekim despin sinds dai mi bin appointim jujes ovenim piple Israel bilong Mi. Mi bai givim yu ripos long ol enebis bilong yu. LORD i tok long yu, Em yet i bambai kirapim haus bilong yu.

original: And when your days are fulfilled and you rest with your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, who will come from your own body, and I will establish his kingdom.
translation: Wannem de pe, taim bilong yu kam pinis, yu go stap wantaim papa bilong yu, na mi bai kirapim desenden bilong yu, husat i kam long bodi bilong yu, na mi bai strongim kingdom bilong em.

original: He will build a house for My Name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.
translation: Em bai mekim haus bilong Nem Bilong Mi, na mi bai strongim trohn bilong ples bilong en, na em bai stap oltaim.

original: I will be his Father, and he will be My son. When he does wrong, I will discipline him with the rod of men and with the blows of the sons of men.
translation: Bai mi bai Papa bilong em, na em bai i kam bek long me olsem pikinini bilong me. Wanpela taim em meikim rong, mi bai skulim em wantaim sau bilong ol manmeri na wantaim paitim bilong ol pikinini manmeri.

original: But My loving devotion will never be removed from him as I removed it from Saul, whom I moved out of your way.
translation: Lovink bilong mi i no bai i go daun long taim, olsem nau mi rusim long han bilong Saul, we mi tokim ol i go, na mi lusim ruw bilong yu.

original: Your house and kingdom will endure forever before Me, and your throne will be established forever.”
translation: Haus bilong yu na kingdom bilong yu bai i stap olsem foreva bifor Mi, na thon bilong yu bai i stap strong olsem foreva.

original: So Nathan relayed to David all the words of this entire vision.
translation: Na Natan i givim tok bilong em long Davit, i kam autim olgeta wod bilong dispela bikpela sisen.

original: Then King David went in, sat before the LORD, and said, “Who am I, O Lord GOD, and what is my house, that You have brought me this far?
translation: King Davi i go insait, i siddown bifor Bikpela, na i tokim: “Mi hu nam, o God Bikpela, na hus bilong mi i wanem, dat yu bringim mi kam long hap?

original: And as if this was a small thing in Your eyes, O Lord GOD, You have also spoken about the future of the house of Your servant. Is this Your custom with man, O Lord GOD?
translation: Na olsem em i bikpela samting long ai bilong yu, Papa God, Yu tok tu long tumbuna bilong haus bilong servanu. Em i kastom bilong yu long ol man, Papa God?

original: What more can David say to You? For You know Your servant, O Lord GOD.
translation: O Dauid i mas tokim olgeta wanem long yu, pasin yu save ol servist na yu kola, O Loid God.

original: For the sake of Your word and according to Your own heart, You have accomplished this great thing and revealed it to Your servant.
translation: Long namel bilong tok bilong Yu, olsem haret bilong Yu, Yu mekim dispela bikpela wok, na yu shouim long servants bilong Yu.

original: How great You are, O Lord GOD! For there is none like You, and there is no God but You, according to everything we have heard with our own ears.
translation: Yu gret tumas, o Lod God! Bikos yu pepeza, i no gat narapela olsem yu, na i no gat bodi God nogut. Olsem olgeta samting mipela harim wantaim yutupela ip.

original: And who is like Your people Israel—the one nation on earth whom God went out to redeem as a people for Himself and to make a name for Himself? You performed great and awesome wonders by driving out nations and their gods from before Your people, whom You redeemed for Yourself from Egypt.
translation: Na husat olsem piple Israel bilong yu - neshon wan bilong yumi long graun, we Bikpela i go bekim long ransomim ol long mekim nem bilong em yet? Yu mekim wonda moa bigibigi na awesome long drivim aut neshon na god bilong ol long bifo piple bilong yu, we yu ransomim long yu yet long Ijip.

original: For You have established Your people Israel as Your very own forever, and You, O LORD, have become their God.
translation: Long taim bai i go, yu bin mekim pipo Israel olsem pipo bilong yu genyen, na yu, o LORDE, yu kamap God bilong ol.

original: And now, O LORD God, confirm forever the word You have spoken concerning Your servant and his house. Do as You have promised,
translation: Na nau, o Bikpela God, stampim strong olsem forever ol wod yu tokim long servant bilong yu na hus bilong em. Wokim olsem yu promis.

original: so that Your name will be magnified forever when it is said, ‘The LORD of Hosts is God over Israel.’ And the house of Your servant David will be established before You.
translation: Na nem bilong yu bai i go antap long hevi, olsem ol bai tok, 'LORD bilong ol ples em i god igo long Israel.' Na haus bilong servant yu David bai i stap strong bipo yu.

original: For You, O LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, have revealed this to Your servant when You said, ‘I will build a house for you.’ Therefore Your servant has found the courage to offer this prayer to You.
translation: Long yu, LORD bilong ol paitim meri, God bilong Israel, yu bin sho im long servant bilong yu, yu bin tok olsem, 'Mipela bai bikim haus bilong yu.' Olegeda long dispela, servant bilong yu bin kisim hart long bihainim praer ni, na em i go long yu.

original: And now, O Lord GOD, You are God! Your words are true, and You have promised this goodness to Your servant.
translation: Na nau, Papa God bilong mipela, Yu em God! Tok bilong yu em truth, na yu promisim dispela gutpela long wokman bilong yu.

original: Now therefore, may it please You to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You. For You, O Lord GOD, have spoken, and with Your blessing the house of Your servant will be blessed forever.”
translation: Nau olsem, inap long ples blong Yu, givim blesen long haus blong servanu bilong Yu, na em i stap oltaim bifor Yu. Pasal Papa God yu tok already, wantaim blesen blong Yu, husat i kam long servanu bilong Yu, em i blessim oltaim.

original: Some time later, David defeated the Philistines, subdued them, and took Metheg-ammah from the hand of the Philistines.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Dafid i winim Philistia, i daunim ol, na i kisim Meteg-Ama long han bilong Philistia.

original: David also defeated the Moabites, made them lie down on the ground, and measured them off with a cord. He measured off with two lengths those to be put to death, and with one length those to be spared. So the Moabites became subject to David and brought him tribute.
translation: Na Davide i winim Moabiti, i mekim ol i lid down long graun, na i mesim ol long rop. I mesim ol gen two lain bilong kilim, wantaim wan lain bilong spem ol. Na Moabiti i kamap subjet long Davide na bingim em tribut.

original: David also defeated Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah, who had marched out to restore his dominion along the Euphrates River.
translation: Na Daudi i winim Hadadeza, papa bilong Rehob, king bilong Zoba, ol i go bek long bringim baksait kingdom bilong em long Riv Efrates.

original: David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand charioteers, and twenty thousand foot soldiers, and he hamstrung all the horses except a hundred he kept for the chariots.
translation: Daud i kisim bek gen wanpela tasen kar, na seven tasen draiva bilong kar, na twenty tasen soldia i go long graun, na em i brukim lek bilong ol hors, eksept wan hundred em i save usim long kar.

original: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand men.
translation: Taim Aramen long Damaskas i kam halivim King Hadadezer bilong Zoba, Daud i kilim twenti-tu tasen man.

original: Then he placed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to David and brought him tribute. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
translation: Na em plantim solja i go bek long Aram bilong Damascus, na Aramea i kam bikim servent long David, ol i bringim gif na kisim ap long em. Na LORD i mekim David win i go we bilong em i go.

original: And David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
translation: Na Daavid i kisim tok i pikimapim shield bilong gol i belonng ol ofisa bilong Hadadeza, na bam bringim ol i go long Yerusalem.

original: And from Betah and Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, King David took a large amount of bronze.
translation: Na long Betah na Berothai, sipos bilong Hadadezer, King Davi kisim planti bropesa.

original: When King Toi of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer,
translation: Taim King Toi bilong Hamath harim, David winim pinis plato bilong Hadadezer.

original: he sent his son Joram to greet King David and bless him for fighting and defeating Hadadezer, who had been at war with Toi. Joram brought with him articles of silver and gold and bronze,
translation: Em i sendim Joram, pikinini bilong em, go long greeting King David, blessim em long paot na winim Hadadezer, ol i bin faet long Toi. Joram i kam wantaim ol samting bilong silva, gold, na bronz.

original: and King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had dedicated from all the nations he had subdued—
translation: Na King Davi i dediim dispela olgeta long tok bilong Jehovah, wantaim sila na gol em i bin dediim bilong ol narion em i bin winim.

original: from Edom and Moab, from the Ammonites and Philistines and Amalekites, and from the spoil of Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
translation: Long Edom na Moab, long Ammonaitis na Filistia na Amalekitis, na long ol samting em i bin kisim long Hadadeza, Pikinini bilong Rehob, King bilong Soba.

original: And David made a name for himself when he returned from striking down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
translation: Na Daud i mekim nem bilong en taim em i kam bek gen long paitim daun edomait eighteen thousand long Vali bilong Sol.

original: He placed garrisons throughout Edom, and all the Edomites were subject to David. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
translation: Em putim soljas long ol ples bilong Edom, na ol Edomites i stap anakai long David. Na Saba Lotu i mekim David winim olgeta we i go.

original: Thus David reigned over all Israel and administered justice and righteousness for all his people:
translation: Daud i bin king bilong yusim pawa long ol Israel, na i bin givim sentens na stret jusis long ol pipol bilong en.

original: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder;
translation: Yoab sori bilong Zeruiah em i bos bilong ol solja; Yehoshafat sori bilong Ahilud em i man bilong raitim stori;

original: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Seraiah was the scribe;
translation: Zadok pikinini bilong Ahitub na Ahimelech pikinini bilong Abiathar i bin priis; Seraiah em i bin skriva.

original: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were priestly leaders.
translation: Benaiah son bilong Jehoiada i stap long top bilong Ol Cherethites na Ol Pelethites; na sons bilong David i stap olgeta lida pastor.

original: Then David asked, “Is there anyone left from the house of Saul to whom I can show kindness for the sake of Jonathan?”
translation: Na Davidson em askim, "I gat sampela man i stap yet long husat i kam long haus bilong Saul olsem na mi ken mekim gutpela long hem long namel bilong Jonathan?"

original: And there was a servant of Saul’s family named Ziba. They summoned him to David, and the king inquired, “Are you Ziba?” “I am your servant,” he replied.
translation: I gat wanpela sarvan long famili bilong Saul, em i kolim Ziba. Ol i kisim em go long Davit, na king i askim, “Yu Ziba?” Em i tok, “Mi servat bilong yu.”
