original: But a young man did see them and told Absalom. So the two left quickly and came to the house of a man in Bahurim. He had a well in his courtyard, and they climbed down into it.
translation: Buat em i go, wanpela yangpela man i lukim ol, na i tokim Absalom. Ol tu i go kisim hap na lus, na ol i kam insait long haus bilong wanpela man long Bahurim. Em i gat wara istil long kae bilong haus, na ol i go daun istil long em.

original: Then the man’s wife took a covering and spread it over the mouth of the well, scattering grain over it so nobody would know a thing.
translation: Meri bilong man i kisim wanpela kapul na i spredim antap long mao bilong weli, ol i pulim ka antap long em, nogat ken samting.

original: When Absalom’s servants came to the woman at the house, they asked, “Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?” “They have crossed over the brook,” she replied. The men searched but did not find them, so they returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Taim servist na i kam bilong Absalom long meri i stap insait long haus, ol i askim, "Ahimaaz na Jonathan i stap we?" Em i tok, "Ol i go pasis wara." Ol man i salim tasol ol i no findim ol, na bai ol i go bek gen long Jerusalemu.

original: After the men had gone, Ahimaaz and Jonathan climbed up out of the well and went to inform King David, saying, “Get up and cross over the river at once, for Ahithophel has given this advice against you.”
translation: Ol man i go pinis, Ahimaaz na Jonathan i kamap long wel na i kamlup, na i go bekim King David, ol i tokim em, "Kam daun na kas ol iet long nariva nau, wantaim dispela Ahithophel i givim dispela toktok long yu."

original: So David and all the people with him got up and crossed the Jordan. By daybreak, there was no one left who had not crossed the Jordan.
translation: Na Daved wantaim ol pipel bilong en i kamap na ol i go akros long Jordan. Bikos em i kale, i no gat narapela man i stap, ol i hamamas crossim Jordan finish.

original: When Ahithophel saw that his advice had not been followed, he saddled his donkey and set out for his house in his hometown. He put his affairs in order and hanged himself. So he died and was buried in his father’s tomb.
translation: Taim Ahithophel i lukim olsem tok bilong em i no bin folow, em i sadlim donki bilong en na i go bek long ples bilong en. Em i putim ol samting bilong em orait, na em i hangim himself olsem wei bilong kilim himself. Na em i dai, na ol i birua im long hol bilong ol bin dia bilong papa bilong en.

original: Then David went to Mahanaim, and Absalom crossed the Jordan with all the men of Israel.
translation: Na Daud i go long Mahanaim, na Absalom i krosim river Jordan, wantaim ol man meri bilong Isrel.

original: Absalom had appointed Amasa over the army in place of Joab. Amasa was the son of a man named Ithra, the Ishmaelite who had married Abigail, the daughter of Nahash and sister of Zeruiah the mother of Joab.
translation: Absalom em i apoinim Amasa long army long hap bilong Joab. Amasa em i pikinini bilong man namba wan Ithra, Ismaeli, em i marit Abigail, susa bilong Nahash, na susa bilong Zeruiah mama bilong Joab.

original: So the Israelites and Absalom camped in the land of Gilead.
translation: Na Ol Isrelait na Absalom i go kamping long lan bilong Gilead.

original: When David came to Mahanaim, he was met by Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbah of the Ammonites, Machir son of Ammiel from Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim.
translation: Taim Daud kam long Mahanaim, em i kirapim Shobi sot bilong Nahash from Rabbah, bikpela taon bilong Ammon, Machir sot bilong Ammiel from Lo-debar, ples we i no gat man long en, na Barzillai, man bilong Gilead, hap bilong Israel, from Rogelim.

original: They brought beds, basins, and earthen vessels, as well as wheat, barley, flour, roasted grain, beans, lentils,
translation: Ol i bringim bek na bed, basin, kaps olsem klay, wheat, bari, flour, grain we i rostim, bins, lentil.

original: honey, curds, sheep, and cheese from the herd for David and his people to eat. For they said, “The people have become hungry, exhausted, and thirsty in the wilderness.”
translation: Honi, kakaruk bilong kuk, sip, na ches bilong hap bilong sip ol i kam long David na ol pipol bilong em kaikai. Ol i tok, "Ol pipol i bel kamap bikos het, lesa na taravau long bus."

original: Then David reviewed his troops and appointed over them commanders of hundreds and of thousands.
translation: Na David i lukim ol solja bilong en, na em i givim bos long ol: bos bilong hundret na bos bilong tausen ol i stap lo ol solja.

original: He sent out the troops, a third under Joab, a third under Joab’s brother Abishai son of Zeruiah, and a third under Ittai the Gittite. And the king said to the troops, “I will surely march out with you as well.”
translation: Em i sendim ol solja i go, wanpela tausen i stap aninit long Joab, wanpela tausen i stap aninit long Abishai pikinini bilong Zeruiah, brata bilong Joab, na wanpela tausen i stap aninit long Ittai man bilong Gath. King i tokim ol solja olsem, "Mi bai yu yet, mi mas i go wantaim yupela tu."

original: But the people pleaded, “You must not go out! For if we have to flee, they will pay no attention to us. Even if half of us die, they will not care; but you are worth ten thousand of us. It is better for now if you support us from the city.”
translation: Bai ol pipol i kirap strong, yu no ken go aut! Sapos yumui mas ranawe, ol bai no lisin long yumui. Even if hap halp bilong yumui i dai, ol bai no kisim hed long yumui; yu wankain nau bilong ten tausen bilong mifala. Em i gutpela nau sapos yu sapotim mipela long siti.

original: “I will do whatever seems best to you,” the king replied. So he stood beside the gate, while all the troops marched out by hundreds and by thousands.
translation: “Mi bai mekim olgeta samting we i luk gut long yu,” kip i tok. Na em i stap klostu long gat, wail olgeta solja i kam aut na march i go bek long hundret na tausen.

original: Now the king had commanded Joab, Abishai, and Ittai, “Treat the young man Absalom gently for my sake.” And all the people heard the king’s orders to each of the commanders regarding Absalom.
translation: King i givim tok long Joab, Abishai, na Ittai, ol komanda, "Yu mas pilim i as bilong yusim Absalom gentli long wei bilong mi." Na ol pipol i harim tok bilong king i go long ol komanda gen regarding Absalom.

original: So David’s army marched into the field to engage Israel in the battle, which took place in the forest of Ephraim.
translation: Armii bilong Daud i go daun long plan ol i kam bek gen long pait bilong Isrel, em i hapen insait long bus bilong Efrayim.

original: There the people of Israel were defeated by David’s servants, and the slaughter was great that day—twenty thousand men.
translation: Ol pipol bilong Isrel i kisim bikos long han bilong sampela saris bilong Dauid, na planti man i bin lus pinis long dei - twenty thousand man.

original: The battle spread over the whole countryside, and that day the forest devoured more people than the sword.
translation: Pait i go ol abaot long olgeta hap graun, na bus i kaikai ol manmeri moa long dispela de olsem sop.

original: Now Absalom was riding on his mule when he met the servants of David, and as the mule went under the thick branches of a large oak, Absalom’s head was caught fast in the tree. The mule under him kept going, so that he was suspended in midair.
translation: Nau Absalom i ridim long mul na em i kam beklong wantaim servant bilong David, na mul i go daun ananit long branis bikpela bilong oak tri, hed bilong Absalom i kisim strong olsem long tri. Mul i stap go daun nau, Absalom i hang long eria.

original: When one of the men saw this, he told Joab, “I just saw Absalom hanging in an oak tree!”
translation: Wanpela man i lukim dispela, na em i tokim Joab, "Mi lukim Absalom i hang yet long narapela oak tri!"

original: “You just saw him!” Joab exclaimed. “Why did you not strike him to the ground right there? I would have given you ten shekels of silver and a warrior’s belt!”
translation: "Yu jus lukim em!" Joab  eksklaim. "Wai yu no kilim em i go daun rait long hap? Mi bai givim yu ten sikl bilong silva na bilum bilong warrior!"

original: The man replied, “Even if a thousand shekels of silver were weighed out into my hands, I would not raise my hand against the son of the king. For we heard the king command you and Abishai and Ittai, ‘Protect the young man Absalom for my sake.’
translation: Man i tokim olsem, “I sipsip tausen sikel silva i go daun long han bilong mi, mi no ken lifim han bilong mi against pikinini bilong king. Mipela harim tok bilong king i givim yu na Abishai na Ittai, olsem ‘Protektim yung man Absalom long wei bilong mi.’”

original: If I had jeopardized my own life—and nothing is hidden from the king—you would have abandoned me.”
translation: Mi go pinis long bikim olsem na bai mi losim laif bilong mi—nogat samting i hidim igo long king—yu bai lusim mi.

original: But Joab declared, “I am not going to wait like this with you!” And he took three spears in his hand and thrust them through the heart of Absalom while he was still alive in the oak tree.
translation: Bai Joab i tokarak, "Mi no laik wait olsem wantaim yu!" Na em i kisim tripea long han bilong en, na em i pusim ol i go insait long het bilong Absalom, wail em i stap yet long diwai oak, na em i stap ailan yet.

original: And ten young men who carried Joab’s armor surrounded Absalom, struck him, and killed him.
translation: Na tenpela yangpela man i kisim armo bilong Joab, ol i go raunim Absalom, ol i paitim em, ol i kilim em.

original: Then Joab blew the ram’s horn, and the troops broke off their pursuit of Israel because Joab had restrained them.
translation: Na Joab i blowim horn bilong ram, na solja i stopim pursuitem long Israel, bikos Joab i holim bek ol.

original: They took Absalom, cast him into a large pit in the forest, and piled a huge mound of stones over him. Meanwhile, all the Israelites fled, each to his home.
translation: Ol i kisim Absalom, tromweim i go daun long wanpela hap graun big long bus, na ol i kisim ston moa na ol i stap long en, mekim maunten bilong ston. Wanpela taim ol Israelites i ranawe, yarn i go nen long ples bilong en.

original: During his lifetime, Absalom had set up for himself a pillar in the King’s Valley, for he had said, “I have no son to preserve the memory of my name.” So he gave the pillar his name, and to this day it is called Absalom’s Monument.
translation: Long taim Absalom i stil alive, em raitim wanpela ston i go antap long Vali bilong King, olsem na mipela i mas save nem bilong mi, bikos em tok, "Mipela i no gat pikinini yet olsem na bai mipela i mas foryetim nem bilong mi." Em givim ston ia nem bilong em yet, na inap todei ol manmeri i kolim em Absalom's Monument.

original: Then Ahimaaz son of Zadok said, “Please let me run and tell the king the good news that the LORD has avenged him of his enemies.”
translation: Na Ahimaaz, pikinini bilong Zadok i tok, “Lami go na ran na tisa king gutpela stori olsem LORD i bin givim bek long en i go long em yet, em i bin kilim poisin bilong em.”

original: But Joab replied, “You are not the man to take good news today. You may do it another day, but you must not do so today, because the king’s son is dead.”
translation: Joab i tok bek, “Yupela i no man bilong kisim gutpela stori tude. Yupela ken wokim namba de, bikos Pikinini bilong king i dai, nogat ken wokim tude.”

original: So Joab said to a Cushite, “Go, tell the king what you have seen.” The Cushite bowed to Joab and took off running.
translation: Yoab i tokim man bilong Kus, “Go, tokim king long dispela yol yu lukim.” Man bilong Kus i kona i go daun long Yoab na i ran i go.

original: Ahimaaz son of Zadok, however, persisted and said to Joab, “Regardless of whatever may happen, please let me also run behind the Cushite!” “My son,” Joab replied, “why do you want to run, since you will not receive a reward?”
translation: Ahimaaz, pikinini bilong Zadok, i go antap moa na tokim Joab, "Bai olgeta samting i kam, nogat, plaesa mi tu wan ran bihain man bilong kantri Kush, ples bilong tumbuna!" Joab i tokim, "Pikinini bilong mi, wai yu laik ran, wantaim yu no ken kisim pekela?"

original: “No matter what, I want to run!” he replied. “Then run!” Joab told him. So Ahimaaz ran by way of the plain and outran the Cushite.
translation: “Nogat samting, mi laik ran,” em i tok. “Bihaen bai yu ran,” Joab i tokim em. Na Ahimaaz i ran longpela ples na i winim man bilong Cush.

original: Now David was sitting between the two gates when the watchman went up to the roof of the gateway by the wall, looked out, and saw a man running alone.
translation: Daubid i sidaun bihain long tu gepeta olsem wachman i go apo long rof bilong gateway, i lukim olsem na lukim man i ran i go wanpela tasol.

original: So he called out and told the king. “If he is alone,” the king replied, “he bears good news.” As the first runner drew near,
translation: Na em i singautim na toktok long king. King i tok, "Em i wanpela tasol, em i karim gutpela stori." Olsem na ranų em i kam klostu,

original: the watchman saw another man running, and he called out to the gatekeeper, “Look! Another man is running alone!” “This one also brings good news,” said the king.
translation: Wachman i lukim man narakain i ran, na em i singaut long gatemana, “Luke! Man narakain i ran i go solwara!” “Dispela tu i bringim gutpela stori,” olsem king i tok.

original: The watchman said, “The first man appears to me to be running like Ahimaaz son of Zadok.” “This is a good man,” said the king. “He comes with good news.”
translation: Wachman i tok, "Man em i kamp behein i lukim long ai bilong mi olsem ran i go olsem Ahimaaz sambai bilong Zadok." "Em i man i gat gutpela hati," king i tok. "Em i kam wantaim gutpela stori."

original: Then Ahimaaz called out to the king, “All is well!” And he bowed facedown before the king. He continued, “Blessed be the LORD your God! He has delivered up the men who raised their hands against my lord the king.”
translation: Na Ahimaaz i singautim go long king, “Olgeta i orait!” Na em i paulim face na dai bifor king. Em i tok, “Bikpela i givim bikpela bajet! Em i biruaim ol man i liftim han wantaim long bihainim king.”

original: The king asked, “Is the young man Absalom all right?” And Ahimaaz replied, “When Joab sent the king’s servant and your servant, I saw a great tumult, but I do not know what it was.”
translation: King i askim, “Absalom i stap orait?” Na Ahimaaz i tok bek, “Taim Joab salim hambis bilong king na hambis bilong yu, mi lukim bikpela kabinu, tasol mi no save long wanem em i kamap.”

original: “Move aside,” said the king, “and stand here.” So he stepped aside.
translation: “Muvim na sakim,” tok King, “stap hia.” Na em i go bek.

original: Just then the Cushite came and said, “May my lord the king hear the good news: Today the LORD has avenged you of all who rose up against you!”
translation: Olsem taim Kusait i kam na i tok, "Papa bilong mipela king bai harim gutpela stori: Nau LORD i bin givim pe long ol man i bin kamap na go het long yu!"

original: The king asked the Cushite, “Is the young man Absalom all right?” And the Cushite replied, “May what has become of the young man happen to the enemies of my lord the king and to all who rise up against you to harm you.”
translation: King i askim Cusait, "Absalom i orait nau?" Na Cusait i tok bek, "Mipela hop ol samting ol i kamap long enemy bilong papa bilong yu, na ol man i kamap strong na bagarapim yu, bai ol i kisim poisen."

original: The king was shaken and went up to the gate chamber and wept. And as he walked, he cried out, “O my son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you, O Absalom, my son, my son!”
translation: King i skulim na i go antap long rum bilong yet na kisim tarangau. Na olsem na em i wokabaut, em i kirap strong, "O pikinini Absalom! Pikinini bilong mi, pikinini Absalom! Mi laik dai bek long hap bilong yu, o Absalom, pikinini bilong mi, pikinini!"

original: Then it was reported to Joab, “The king is weeping and mourning over Absalom.”
translation: Em i kamap long Joab, “King i krai na i bisusi long Absalom.”

original: And that day’s victory was turned into mourning for all the people, because on that day they were told, “The king is grieving over his son.”
translation: Na wik i stap long dei bilong win i kamap ai bilong sori long ol pipol, bikos long dei em ol i harim tok, "King i sori long pikinini bilong en."

original: So they returned to the city quietly that day, as people steal away in humiliation after fleeing a battle.
translation: Oli go bek gen long siti quiet na stilim i go na i go bek gen long sham, olsem ol man i ranawe nau long faet.

original: But the king covered his face and cried out at the top of his voice, “O my son Absalom! O Absalom, my son, my son!”
translation: King i kisim han bilong en, na em i singaut strong olsem wara, “O pikinini bilong me Absalom! O Absalom, pikinini bilong me, o pikinini bilong me!”

original: Then Joab went into the house and said to the king, “Today you have disgraced all your servants who have saved your life and the lives of your sons and daughters, of your wives, and of your concubines.
translation: Na Joab i go insait long haus na em tokim king, "Tude yu bring shem long ol servan bilong yu olsem ol man we saev laif bilong yu, laif bilong pikinini man na pikinini meri bilong yu, laif bilong meri bilong yu, na laif bilong meri bilong wokim bel bilong yu.

original: You love those who hate you and hate those who love you! For you have made it clear today that the commanders and soldiers mean nothing to you. I know today that if Absalom were alive and all of us were dead, it would have pleased you!
translation: Yu lovim ol i no likim yu, na yu hatim ol i lovim yu! Yu trai long tok klia tede, ol ofisa na solja i no gat pekela long yu. Mi save tede, em bai stap long hap blong yu, na mipela i dai, Absalom i stap, em bai kamap strong long yu!

original: Now therefore get up! Go out and speak comfort to your servants, for I swear by the LORD that if you do not go out, not a man will remain with you tonight. This will be worse for you than all the adversity that has befallen you from your youth until now!”
translation: Nau therefore kam daun na go aut, tok gut long servants bilong yu, bikos mi hamamas long LORD, olsem tok, if yu no go aut, trai man bai i stap wantaim yu tede, na dispela bai i bagarapim yu moa yet long olgeta sickness na trabel i kam antap long yu long tait pin bilong yu.

original: So the king got up and sat in the gate, and all the people were told: “Behold, the king is sitting in the gate.” So they all came before the king. Meanwhile, the Israelites had fled, each man to his home.
translation: King i kirap na sindaun long gat, na ol pipel ol i harim tok: "Behold, king i sindaun long gat." Ol i kam bifo king. Traim, Israelites ol i ranawe, yupela ol i go bak long hus.

original: And all the people throughout the tribes of Israel were arguing, “The king rescued us from the hand of our enemies and delivered us from the hand of the Philistines, but now he has fled the land because of Absalom.
translation: Na ol pipel long ol traib bilong Isrel i kisim tok strong, "King ibin savim mipela long han bilong enimi mipela na ibin givim mipela fri long han bilong Filistia, tasol nau em i ranawe long kantri bikos bilong Absalom."

original: But Absalom, the man we anointed over us, has died in battle. So why do you say nothing about restoring the king?”
translation: Mipela bin givim oli long hed igrasim bilong Absalom, na em i dai pinis long pait. Sapos olsem, longwe tru, wai yumi no ken tok long bringim bek king gen?

original: Then King David sent this message to Zadok and Abiathar, the priests: “Say to the elders of Judah, ‘Why should you be the last to restore the king to his palace, since the talk of all Israel has reached the king at his quarters?
translation: King Devid i salim pes long Zadok na Abiathar, ol priis, olsem: “Tokim ol bikpela man bilong Judah, ‘Bilong wanem yu yet kam las long bringim king i go bek long em haus, wai? Tok bilong ol Israel i kam reachim king long ples bilong en na nau.”

original: You are my brothers, my own flesh and blood. So why should you be the last to restore the king?’
translation: Yupela i brotha bilong mi, mipela ol i wan bodili na blooding. Long we bilong wanem yupela i no bringim bak king?

original: And say to Amasa, ‘Aren’t you my flesh and blood? May God punish me, and ever so severely, if from this time you are not the commander of my army in place of Joab!’”
translation: Tokim long Amasa, ‘Yu klostu bilong mi na blod bilong mi! Gott i penalisim mi, na bikim olsem strong mama, if from nau yu no komanda bilong ples bilong armi long hap bilong Joab!’”

original: So he swayed the hearts of all the men of Judah as though they were one man, and they sent word to the king: “Return, you and all your servants.”
translation: Em i bringim bel bilong ol man bilong Juda i go wanpela sais, olsem igat wanpela man tasol, na ol i sendim tok long king: “Kam bek, yu na ol wokman bilong yu.”

original: So the king returned, and when he arrived at the Jordan, the men of Judah came to Gilgal to meet him and escort him across the Jordan.
translation: King i kam bek, na taim em i kam long Jordan, ol man meri bilong Juda i kam long Gilgal i go metim em, na ol i helpim em i pas long Jordan.

original: Then Shimei son of Gera, a Benjamite from Bahurim, hurried down with the men of Judah to meet King David,
translation: Na bihain Shimei man bilong Benjimin, pikinini bilong Gera, ol i ran i go doun wantaim ol man bilong Yuda from Bahurim, i go mitim King David,

original: along with a thousand men of Benjamin, as well as Ziba the steward of the house of Saul and his fifteen sons and twenty servants. They rushed down to the Jordan before the king
translation: Olsem na tupela tausen man bilong Benjamin, wantaim Ziba han blong kisim ka bilong haus bilong Saul na fiften sons bilong em na twenti servant, ol i ran i go daun long Jordan bifo king.

original: and crossed at the ford to carry over the king’s household and to do what was good in his sight. When Shimei son of Gera crossed the Jordan, he fell down before the king
translation: Na ol i krosim wara long Jordan, ol i karim husait bilong king i go, na wokim ol samting gut long ai bilong en. Wanem taim Shimei sussa Gera i krosim Jordan, em i pundaun i go daun bifo king

original: and said, “My lord, do not hold me guilty, and do not remember your servant’s wrongdoing on the day my lord the king left Jerusalem. May the king not take it to heart.
translation: Papa, yu no holim mi long gilti, na yu no rimembim rong bilong servant yu long dei king yu lusim Jerusalem. King bai no kisim dispela olgeta long het.

original: For your servant knows that I have sinned, so here I am today as the first of all the house of Joseph to come down to meet my lord the king.”
translation: Long servant bilong mi save olsem mi kam sin, nau mipela husat i kam first long olgeta haus bilong Yosef i go daun kam mitim yu, papa bilong mipela, king.

original: But Abishai son of Zeruiah said, “Shouldn’t Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD’s anointed?”
translation: Abishai pikinini bilong Zeruiah i tok, "Shimei i mas go long dei olsem, bikos em i bin kurusim LORD i bikim chief?"

original: And David replied, “Sons of Zeruiah, what have I to do with you, that you should be my adversaries today? Should any man be put to death in Israel today? Am I not indeed aware that today I am king over Israel?”
translation: Na Davide i tokim ol, "Pikinini bilong Zeruiah, wanem samting yu mekim wantaim mi, nau yu kam bek long enemi nau? Ol i go daun long deat long Israel tude? Mi no save yet olsem tude mi king bilong yumi ol Israel?"

original: So the king said to Shimei, “You shall not die.” And the king swore an oath to him.
translation: King i tokim Shimei, “Yu no ken dai.” Na king i kisim olegisasyon long em.

original: Then Mephibosheth, Saul’s grandson, went down to meet the king. He had not cared for his feet or trimmed his mustache or washed his clothes from the day the king had left until the day he returned safely.
translation: Na Mepiboset, granbilong Saul, i go daun bilong mikim king. Em i no kisim keklek long lek bilong en, em i no kutim bus bilong en, na em i no wasim klot bilong en, stat long dei king i go, na kasal olsem em i kam bek gen saf.

original: And he came from Jerusalem to meet the king, who asked him, “Mephibosheth, why did you not go with me?”
translation: Na em i kam from Jirosalem i go long mikim king, king i askim em, “Mefiboset, long we bilong go wantaim mi, yu no go?”

original: “My lord the king,” he replied, “because I am lame, I said, ‘I will have my donkey saddled so that I may ride on it and go with the king.’ But my servant Ziba deceived me,
translation: Papa bilong mi king, mipela tok thus, bikos mi les long lek, nambis mi tok olsem, bai mi salim dok bilong mi i go long ples bilong en, na bai yu go wantaim king. Tasol wokman bilong mi Ziba im bin givim mi long solwara.

original: and he has slandered your servant to my lord the king. Yet my lord the king is like the angel of God, so do what is good in your eyes.
translation: Na em i bin bagarap nem bilong servant blo yu long papa bilong mi, king. Papa bilong mi, king em i olsem angel bilong God, so wokim olgeta samting i gut long ai blo yu.

original: For all the house of my grandfather deserves death from my lord the king, yet you have set your servant among those who eat at your table. What further right, then, do I have to keep appealing to the king?”
translation: Olgeta haus bilong tumbuna bilong mi i deserves deat long lord king bilong yu, yet yu putim servant bilong yu em long ol i kaikai wantaim yu long tebol bilong yu. Nau, wha moa rait imas hav yet bai mi go bek long kisim tok bilong king?

original: The king replied, “Why say any more? I hereby declare that you and Ziba are to divide the land.”
translation: King i tokim ol, “Wai yumi tokim moa? Mi autim dispela toktok, yu na Ziba bai divelopim graun.”

original: And Mephibosheth said to the king, “Instead, since my lord the king has safely come to his own house, let Ziba take it all!”
translation: Na Mepiboset i tokim king olsem, "King bilong mipela i kam bek long haus bilong en na i stap gut, Ziba inap kaikai olgeta!"

original: Now Barzillai the Gileadite had come down from Rogelim to cross the Jordan with the king and send him on his way from there.
translation: Nau Barzillai man Gilead i kam daun from Rogelim i go akros long Jordan, na em i wan skotim king, givim em i go from hap dere.

original: Barzillai was quite old, eighty years of age, and since he was a very wealthy man, he had provided for the king while he stayed in Mahanaim.
translation: Barzillai em i olsem klosim em yet, em i gat age eighty yia, na em i man i gat planti moni, em i givim ka moni long king from long taim king i stap long Mahanaim.

original: The king said to Barzillai, “Cross over with me, and I will provide for you at my side in Jerusalem.”
translation: King i tokim Barzillai, “Kam bek gen long na kam na go wankain wantaim mi, na mi bai givim ka long yu besaid long mi long Jerusalem.”

original: But Barzillai replied, “How many years of my life remain, that I should go up to Jerusalem with the king?
translation: Barzillai i tok bek, “Hamas yia i stap yet long laip blo mi, bai mi go apo long Jerusalema wantaim king?

original: I am now eighty years old. Can I discern what is good and what is not? Can your servant taste what he eats or drinks? Can I still hear the voice of singing men and women? Why should your servant be an added burden to my lord the king?
translation: Nau mi go bek gen 80 yia olred. Inap long mi save ronim wanem i gut na wanem i no gut? Servant bilong yu inap liklik kaikai na dring? Mi ken harim yet voys bilong ol man na meri sing? Wanem servant bilong Bilong yu papa king i mas go bek gen i kamap bagarap long Bilong yu papa king?

original: Your servant could go with the king only a short distance past the Jordan; why should the king repay me with such a reward?
translation: Hausboi bilong yu inap go wail long king olsem liklik pas long Jordan; king mas bekim peim long mi olsem niupela givim?

original: Please let your servant return, that I may die in my own city near the tomb of my father and mother. But here is your servant Chimham. Let him cross over with my lord the king, and do for him what is good in your sight.”
translation: Ol i go bak long servant bilong yu, na mi laik dai long ples bilong mi nambis long graun bilong tumbuna na mama bilong mi. Bat Chimham, servant bilong yu, em i go klostu wantaim lori king bilong mipela, na wokim gutpela samting long ai bilong yu.

original: The king replied, “Chimham will cross over with me, and I will do for him what seems good in your sight, and I will do for you whatever you desire of me.”
translation: King i tok bek, “Chimham bai go wantaim mi, na mi bai mekim gen long en, olsem i luk gut long ai bilong yu, na pesta ol samting we yu laik long mi.”

original: So all the people crossed the Jordan, and then the king crossed over. The king kissed Barzillai and blessed him, and Barzillai returned home.
translation: Ol pipol i go pas long Jordan, na king i go pas na kam. King i kisim Barzillai na givim birua long em, na Barzillai i go bek long haus bilong en.

original: Then the king went on to Gilgal, and Chimham crossed over with him. All the troops of Judah and half the troops of Israel escorted the king.
translation: King i go nau long Gilgal, na Chimham i kam akompani em. Ol solja bilong Juda na hap bilong ol solja bilong Isrel i kam bekim king.

original: Soon all the men of Israel came to the king and asked, “Why did our brothers, the men of Judah, take you away secretly and bring the king and his household across the Jordan, together with all of David’s men?”
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel i kam bek long king na ol i askim, "Bai yumi karim yu go longpela taim, nogat man i si, na bai yumi bringim yu acros long Jordan, wantaim haus bilong king na ol man bilong Dauid? Wanem ol man bilong Juta i tokim yumi long dispela, bai yumi no save?"

original: And all the men of Judah replied to the men of Israel, “We did this because the king is our relative. Why does this anger you? Have we ever eaten at the king’s expense or received anything for ourselves?”
translation: Na ol man bilong Juta i tokim ol man bilong Isrel, "Mipela mekim dispela bikos king em i brata bilong yumi. Wai dispela i raisim bel bilong yu? Mipela ever eat kaikai long moni bilong king o mipela ever kisim samting bilong mipela yet?"

original: “We have ten shares in the king,” answered the men of Israel, “so we have more claim to David than you. Why then do you despise us? Were we not the first to speak of restoring our king?” But the men of Judah pressed even harder than the men of Israel.
translation: Mipela i gat ten hap bilong king, olsem nau mipela i gat moa rait long David na yupela. Bai yumas long wanem yupela i lakuisim mipela? Mipela bin tok pamina long bringim bekim king bilong mipela, tasol ol man bilong Yuda i winim olgeta long ol man bilong Israel.

original: Now a worthless man named Sheba son of Bichri, a Benjamite, happened to be there, and he blew the ram’s horn and shouted: “We have no share in David, no inheritance in Jesse’s son. Every man to his tent, O Israel!”
translation: Nau, man nogut wan namel Sheba, pikinini bilong Bichri, em i man bilong Benjimin, em i stap yet long hap, na em i bulimapim horn bilong ram na em i singaut: "Mipela i no gat hap long Dauid, mipela i no gat brigina long Pikinini bilong Jesse. Yupela ol man, go long haus bilong yupela, O Isrel!"

original: So all the men of Israel deserted David to follow Sheba son of Bichri. But the men of Judah stayed by their king all the way from the Jordan to Jerusalem.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Isrel i leevim Daavid, na ol i bihainim Sheba Pikinini bilong Bichri. Tasol, ol man meri bilong Juda i stap bihain king bilong ol, olsem frai Jordan long go kam insait long Jerusalem.

original: When David returned to his palace in Jerusalem, he took the ten concubines he had left to care for the palace, and he placed them in a house under guard. He provided for them, but he no longer slept with them. They were confined until the day of their death, living as widows.
translation: Wanpela taim Dauid i go bek long haus bilong en long Jerusalem, na i kisim ten meri pasin i leevim ol long lukautim haus, na i putim ol long wanpela haus na i givim ol ka long bodi. I sopim ol, tasol i no sleep wantaim ol gen. Ol i stap olsem meri husat man bilong ol i dai, na ol i kilim taim ol i dai.

original: Then the king said to Amasa, “Summon the men of Judah to come to me within three days, and be here yourself.”
translation: King i tokim Amasa, “Kisim ol man bilong Yuda, ol i kam long tripela de, na yu yet mas kam gen.”

original: So Amasa went to summon Judah, but he took longer than the time allotted him.
translation: Na Amasa i go bekim Yuda, tasol em i usim taim long olgeta long taim we em i gat.

original: And David said to Abishai, “Now Sheba the son of Bichri will do us more harm than Absalom. Take your lord’s servants and pursue him, or he will find fortified cities and elude us.”
translation: Na Daud i tokim Abisai, “Nau Sheba pikinini bilong Bichri em bai mekim bagarap moa long yumi than Absalom. Kam bek gen long servis man bilong bikman na bihainim em, or em bai painim siti we i strong na karamim yumi.”

original: So Joab’s men, along with the Cherethites, the Pelethites, and all the mighty men, marched out of Jerusalem in pursuit of Sheba son of Bichri.
translation: Ol man bilong Joab, na Ol Cherethites, Ol Pelethites, na ol man strongpela, i go bek long pati Jeremiah, na ol i wokabaut bihain long Sheba pikinini bilong Bichri.

original: And while they were at the great stone in Gibeon, Amasa joined them. Now Joab was dressed in military attire, with a dagger strapped to his belt. And as he stepped forward, he slipped the dagger from its sheath.
translation: Na wail em i stap klostu long bikpela ston long Gibeon, Amasa i kam joiim ol. Joab i drai klot bilong solja, na naip i bet long bet bilong en. Na em i kam anan, na ip slipim naip bilong en long sip.

original: “Are you well, my brother?” Joab asked Amasa. And with his right hand Joab grabbed Amasa by the beard to kiss him.
translation: Joab askim Amasa, "Yu stap gut, brata bilong mi?" Na Joab usim han bilong rait kisim Amasa long beard bilong en na tekim em kissim.

original: Amasa was not on guard against the dagger in Joab’s hand, and Joab stabbed him in the stomach and spilled out his intestines on the ground. And Joab did not need to strike him again, for Amasa was dead. Then Joab and his brother Abishai pursued Sheba son of Bichri.
translation: Amasa i no bin saveim yet long naip bilong Joab, na Joab i kilim nep bilong en, ka bilong en i kam aut, ol i kilim nep bilong en klostu long graun. Ol i no nid tasim em gen, bikos Amasa i dai pinis. Na Joab wantaim brata bilong en Abishai i go bekim Sheba sussa bilong Bichri.

original: One of Joab’s young men stood near Amasa and said, “Whoever favors Joab, and whoever is for David, let him follow Joab!”
translation: Wanpela yangpela man bilong Joab i stap klostu long Amasa na em i tok, "Hu i givim hamat long Joab, na hu i bilong David, em i mas go bek gen long Joab!"

original: But Amasa wallowed in his blood in the middle of the road, and when the man saw that all the troops were stopping there, he dragged the body off the road into a field and threw a garment over it.
translation: Bareket Amasa i bin kisim blod bilong en i go daun long mit blo ol road, na taim man i lukim olgeta solja i stap tasol, em i karim bodi i go bek long bus na i putim klot i go antap long em.

original: As soon as Amasa’s body was removed from the road, all the men went on with Joab to pursue Sheba son of Bichri.
translation: Olsem mama Amasa ikam long bodi igo pinis long rot, ol man i go wantaim Joab bekim Sheba sussa bilong Bichri.

original: Sheba passed through all the tribes of Israel to Abel-beth-maacah and through the entire region of the Berites, who gathered together and followed him.
translation: Seba i go pinis long olgeta traib bilong Isrel, na i kam kas long Abel-bet-maka, na long olgeta hap bilong ol Berait, ol i kam tugether na i folo em.

original: And Joab’s troops came and besieged Sheba in Abel-beth-maacah and built a siege ramp against the outer rampart of the city. As all the troops with Joab were battering the wall to topple it,
translation: Na solja bilong Joab i kam na i kisim Sheba long Abel-beth-maacah, na ol i wokim wanpela rod bilong bihainim barakai bilong taun. Ol solja wantaim Joab i bagarapim barakai, ol i tirim i pas, na ol i laik bagarapim em.

original: a wise woman called out from the city, “Listen! Listen! Please tell Joab to come here so that I may speak with him.”
translation: Meri strongpela long tok i kam longaus bilong siti, “Harim! Harim! Plez joim Joab i kam hia na mi bai tokim em.”

original: When he had come near to her, the woman asked, “Are you Joab?” “I am,” he replied. “Listen to the words of your servant,” she said. “I am listening,” he answered.
translation: Taim em i kam klostu long en, meri i askim, “Yu Joab?” Em i tok bek, “Aiya.” Em i tok, “Harim tok bilong wokman yu,” meri i tok. Em i tok, “Mi harim,” em i givim ansa.

original: Then the woman said, “Long ago they used to say, ‘Seek counsel at Abel,’ and that is how disputes were settled.
translation: Na meri i tok, "Longlong taim bipo ol i usim tok, 'Go askim konsel long Abel,' na em i husat ol i peisim heve long dispela."

original: I am among the peaceable and faithful in Israel, but you are trying to destroy a city that is a mother in Israel. Why would you swallow up the LORD’s inheritance?”
translation: Mi stap long ol pipol i gat pes na ol pipol i traustum long Israel, batem yupela i laik bagarapim wanpela town we em i wanpela mama long Israel. Wai yupela bai kaikaim inheritance bilong LORD olsem?

original: “Far be it!” Joab declared. “Far be it from me to swallow up or destroy!
translation: “Nogat longwe taem” Yoab  tokim. “Nogat longwe taem long me i kaikai olgeta o bripim!”

original: That is not the case. But a man named Sheba son of Bichri, from the hill country of Ephraim, has lifted up his hand against the king, against David. Deliver him alone, and I will depart from the city.” “Look,” the woman replied, “his head will be thrown to you over the wall.”
translation: Em i no kamap olsem. Bat em i gat man wanpela, nem bilong en Sheba, pikinini bilong Bichri, husat i kam long kantri hailan bilong Ephraim, em i go opim han bilong en long king, long David. Kisim em wanpela, na mi bai lusim taun. Meri i tok, "Ol i bai kisim hed bilong em na putim ibrakim ovasit long feniks."

original: Then the woman went to all the people with her wise counsel, and they cut off the head of Sheba son of Bichri and threw it to Joab. So he blew the ram’s horn and his men dispersed from the city, each to his own home. And Joab returned to the king in Jerusalem.
translation: Na meri i go bekim ol pipol wantaim tok bilong wisdom, na ol i katim hed bilong Sheba son bilong Bichri na i tromoi long Joab. Olsem Joab i bullem horn bilong ram, na ol man bilong en i skateramapim long siti, ol i go long nen long ples bilong ol. Na Joab i kam bek gen long king long Jerusalem.

original: Now Joab was over the whole army of Israel; Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites;
translation: Nau Joab em i bikpela bos bilong holep army bilong Israel; Benaiah son bilong Jehoiada em i bos bilong Cherethites na Pelethites.

original: Adoram was in charge of the forced labor; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder;
translation: Adoram em i bos bilong wok bembe long strongim kantri; Jehoshaphat, yanpela son bilong Ahilud, em i man bilong rakim stori.

original: Sheva was the scribe; Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
translation: Sheva em i man bilong raitim buk; Zadok na Abiathar ol i pris.

original: and Ira the Jairite was David’s priest.
translation: Na Aira Jairit em i pries bilong Dauid.

original: During the reign of David there was a famine for three successive years, and David sought the face of the LORD. And the LORD said, “It is because of the blood shed by Saul and his family, because he killed the Gibeonites.”
translation: Long taim bilong rulim bilong David, kongra i kam strong long tripela yia, na David i go bekim pes bilong LORD. Na LORD i tok, "Em i kam bikos long shedim blod bilong Saul na famili bilong en, bikos em i kilim Gibeonait."

original: At this, David summoned the Gibeonites and spoke to them. (Now the Gibeonites were not Israelites, but a remnant of the Amorites. The Israelites had taken an oath concerning them, but in his zeal for Israel and Judah, Saul had sought to kill them.)
translation: Long olsem, Daud i kirapim Gibeonaites na i tokim ol. Ol Gibeonaites i no Israelait, nogat, tasol ol i narapela lain bilong Amoraites. Israelait i makim oas long ol, tasol long pasin bilong en, Saul i laik strong long Israel na Judah, na em i go long killim ol.

original: So David asked the Gibeonites, “What shall I do for you? How can I make amends so that you may bless the inheritance of the LORD?”
translation: Na Davidson harim tok long ol Gibeonite, "Mi mas mekim wanem long yu? Olsem wanem mi ken kisim bek bilong yumi, na yu ken givim blessing long stret bilong LORD?"

original: The Gibeonites said to him, “We need no silver or gold from Saul or his house, nor should you put to death anyone in Israel for us.” “Whatever you ask, I will do for you,” he replied.
translation: Gibeoniti ol i tokim em, “Mipela no gat bekim sila na gol long haus bilong Saul, na yu no ken kilim man long Israel long mipela.” “Wanem samting yu askim, mipela bai mekim gen,” em i tok.

original: And they answered the king, “As for the man who consumed us and plotted against us to exterminate us from existing within any border of Israel,
translation: Ol i givim tok long king, “Long hap man we i katim gutpela laif bilong yumi, na i mekim plan long bagarapim yumi, from stretem yumi long stap insait long eni boda bilong Isrel,”

original: let seven of his male descendants be delivered to us so that we may hang them before the LORD at Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the LORD.” “I will give them to you,” said the king.
translation: Kisim sevenpela man pikinini bilong em, na givim ol long yumi, nas yumi ken hangim ol long ai bilong LORD long Gibeah bilong Saul, pikinini i lukim bilong LORD.” “Mi bai givim ol long yu,” king i tok.

original: Now the king spared Mephibosheth son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, because of the oath before the LORD between David and Jonathan son of Saul.
translation: Nau king i lakem Mepiboset, pikinini bilong Jonatan, jonatan bilong Saul, bikos bilong promis i go bifor LORD, long taim Dauid na Jonatan, jonatan bilong Saul, i gat pinis agrikman.

original: But the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons whom Rizpah daughter of Aiah had borne to Saul, as well as the five sons whom Merab daughter of Saul had borne to Adriel son of Barzillai the Meholathite.
translation: King i kisim Armoni na Mepiboset, ol tu pikinini man we Rispa, daughta bilong Aiah, ibin karim long Sau, olsem na ol faiv pikinini man we Merab, daughta bilong Sau, ibin karim long Adriel, man bilong Barzillai bilong tripe Meholati.

original: And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them on the hill before the LORD. So all seven of them fell together; they were put to death in the first days of the harvest, at the beginning of the barley harvest.
translation: Na em i givim ol long han bilong Gibeonites, na ol i haitim ol long maunten bifor Bikpela. Ol sebén yet ol i pundaun na kilim long difren taim bilong kaukau i kamap, long taim bilong diwai bilong barley, em i taim bilong bikpela importans.

original: And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it out for herself on a rock. From the beginning of the harvest until the rain from heaven poured down on the bodies, she did not allow the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.
translation: Na Rizpah, daughta bilong Aiah, em i kisim sakklot na em i spredim long wanpela rok bilong en. From wei harves i kamap long taim bifo olsem na rain i kam doun from heven long bodi bilong ol, em i no inap alaunim ol pisin bilong heven long ol long de, na ol beasts bilong bus no inap go long ol long nait.

original: When David was told what Saul’s concubine Rizpah, daughter of Aiah, had done,
translation: Taim Davide harim tok olsem wanem Saul i gat meri Rizpah, Pikinini meri bilong Aiah, ibin mekim.

original: he went and took the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the public square of Beth-shan where the Philistines had hung the bodies after they had struck down Saul at Gilboa.
translation: Em i go na kisim bon bilong Saul na Jonatan long ol man bilong Jabesh-gilead, ol i stilim ol bon bilong ol long ples bilong maket bilong Beth-san, we ol Filistia i hangim bodi bilong ol long hap bihaenim ol i kilim daun Saul long Gilboa.

original: So David had the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan brought from there, along with the bones of those who had been hanged.
translation: Na Dauid i askim ol i bringim skelton bilong Saul na Jonatan, na skelton bilong ol man i hangim, na ol i kam bek long hap.

original: And they buried the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan in Zela in the land of Benjamin, in the tomb of Saul’s father Kish. After they had done everything the king had commanded, God answered their prayers for the land.
translation: Na ol i kisim boun long Saul na Jonathan, kakarapim long graun long Zela long lan bilong Benjamin, long holep bilong Kish, papa bilong Saul. Ol i mekim olgets we king i givim tok, na God i harim na givim ansa long beten bilong ol long graun.

original: Once again the Philistines waged war against Israel, and David and his servants went down and fought against the Philistines; but David became exhausted.
translation: Olsen Filistia i go bek long war gen against Isrel, na David na servan bilong em i go daun na fight against ol Filistia; but David i kamap taida.

original: Then Ishbi-benob, a descendant of Rapha, whose bronze spear weighed three hundred shekels and who was bearing a new sword, resolved to kill David.
translation: Na bihain Ishbi-benob, wanpela desenden bilong Rapha, em i gat spia bilong bronz we i bikim tripela handred sikul, na em i gat sop na niupela sindao long han bilong en, em i desis long kilim Daavid.

original: But Abishai son of Zeruiah came to his aid, struck the Philistine, and killed him. Then David’s men swore to him, “You must never again go out with us to battle, so that the lamp of Israel may not be extinguished.”
translation: Bare Abishai pikinini bilong Zeruiah i kam ap longen em, i paitim Philistine na i kilim em. Na ol man bilong Daud i tok strong long em, "Yu no ken go wailis long mipela go lusim na kaem bek long pait, so dat lait bilong Israel i no bai pulap."

original: Some time later at Gob, there was another battle with the Philistines. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, one of the descendants of Rapha.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis long Gob, narapela birua ibin kamap wantaim Filistia. Long hap tumas, Sibbecai Hushathite i kilim Saph, wanpela bilong ol desenden bilong Rapha.

original: Once again there was a battle with the Philistines at Gob, and Elhanan son of Jair the Bethlehemite killed the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
translation: GenGEN yet nau i kam bek battle long Filistia long Gob, na Elhanan, man bilong Jair, Man bilong Betlehem, i kilim brata bilong Goliath, Man bilong Get, banis bilong spia bilong em i bikolosan banis bilong welka.

original: And there was still another battle at Gath, where there was a man of great stature with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot—twenty-four in all. He too was descended from Rapha,
translation: Na i gat narapela bikpela faight gen long Gat, na i got man bilong bikpela bodi, em i gat sikis finga long hap han na sikis toe long hap fut - olgeta twenty-four. Em tu bai bilong Rafa,

original: and when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of David’s brother Shimei killed him.
translation: Na taim em laikim ol i tok harim long Israel, Jonatan, pikinini bilong brotha bilong Davit Shimei, i kilim em.

original: So these four descendants of Rapha in Gath fell at the hands of David and his servants.
translation: Dispela four pikinini bilong Rapha long Gat ol i pundaun long han bilong David na servants bilong em.

original: And David sang this song to the LORD on the day the LORD had delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.
translation: Na Daud singim dispela sang long LORDE long de LORDE bingim em long han bilong ol enemies bilong en na long han bilong Sau.

original: He said: “The LORD is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer.
translation: Em i tok: “Bikpela i stap long mi olsem rok, em i olsem klega bilong mi, na em yet i saveman bilong mi.”

original: My God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield, and the horn of my salvation. My stronghold, my refuge, and my Savior, You save me from violence.
translation: God bilong me em i bikpela rock bilong me, ples bilong hevi blong mi, skild bilong mi, na horn bilong selvershan bilong mi. Em i bikpela ples bilong hevi bilong mi, ples bilong hevi, na Jisas Kristus bilong mi, Yu saveman mi long strepela pasin.

original: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised; so shall I be saved from my enemies.
translation: Mi bai karim long LORD, hu i worti long bikim pris, na mi bai sev long enemy bilong mi.

original: For the waves of death engulfed me; the torrents of chaos overwhelmed me.
translation: Wara bilong dea i kalabusim mi; wara bilong kaos i winim mi.

original: The cords of Sheol entangled me; the snares of death confronted me.
translation: Ol rop bilong Sheol i kam bek long mi; ol pitpit bilong dei i go antap long mi.

original: In my distress I called upon the LORD; I cried out to my God. And from His temple He heard my voice, and my cry for help reached His ears.
translation: Long taim mi stap i go dasol, mi kisim nem bilong LORD na kalim em, mi kirap na mi singaut long God bilong mi. Na long haus lotu bilong en, em harim toktok bilong mi, na singaut bilong mi i kam aninit long ek bilong en.

original: Then the earth shook and quaked; the foundations of the heavens trembled; they were shaken because He burned with anger.
translation: Gras i skelim na shake; pepa bilong heven i train na rausim; ol i skelim bikos Em i kolos tasol.

original: Smoke rose from His nostrils, and consuming fire came from His mouth; glowing coals blazed forth.
translation: Smoak i go antap long nus bilong En, na faia i kaikai olgeta i kam long maus bilong En; kol blazim ap olsem kol i tan.

original: He parted the heavens and came down with dark clouds beneath His feet.
translation: Em i kirapim heven na kam daun wantaim klaut dus aninit long lek bilong En.

original: He mounted a cherub and flew; He soared on the wings of the wind.
translation: Em i go antap long wanpela kerabim na em i flai; em i sindaun antap long wing bilong win.

original: He made darkness a canopy around Him, a gathering of water and thick clouds.
translation: Em mekim dak i kamap olsem kanopi bilong en, na ol wara na klau thick i kamap olsem sabit long en.

original: From the brightness of His presence coals of fire blazed forth.
translation: Long balus bilong ples bilong em, kol bilong faia i kamap strong.

original: The LORD thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded.
translation: Papa God i go bamai dari heven; vois bilong God I gat bikpela namel i resound.

original: He shot His arrows and scattered the foes; He hurled lightning and routed them.
translation: Em i paitim araos bilong En, na em i spredim ol enemy; em i kirapim laitning, na em i drivim ol i go.

original: The channels of the sea appeared, and the foundations of the world were exposed at the rebuke of the LORD, at the blast of the breath of His nostrils.
translation: Ol ren bilong solwara i kamap, na ol fonissen bilong wol i kisim long toktok i kam bek gen long LORD, long win blong breth bilong nosel bilong Em.

original: He reached down from on high and took hold of me; He drew me out of deep waters.
translation: Em i kam daun long hevi na em i kisim hol long mi; em i pulum mi nating long solwara i go daun i stap.

original: He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from foes too mighty for me.
translation: Em i save mi long enemy bilong mi we i strong, na long ol enemy bilong mi we i gat strongpela olsem ia.

original: They confronted me in my day of calamity, but the LORD was my support.
translation: Ol i kam konfrontim mi long de bilong trabel na Ogasta', tasol LORD em i stap bekim supot bilong mi.

original: He brought me out into the open; He rescued me because He delighted in me.
translation: Em i kam bek long stap long ples ai open; Em i save me bikos em i laik long mi.

original: The LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness; He has repaid me according to the cleanness of my hands.
translation: Papa God i givim mi bek long datsel bilong mi; Em i bekim mipela olsem na klia bilong han bilong mipela.

original: For I have kept the ways of the LORD and have not wickedly departed from my God.
translation: Mi bin holim wei bilong Lod na mi no go olsem nogut lusim God bilong mi.

original: For all His ordinances are before me; I have not disregarded His statutes.
translation: Ol loa bilong Em i stap bifor ai; mi no rausem ol statut bilong En.

original: And I have been blameless before Him and kept myself from iniquity.
translation: Na mi nogat skul long em, na mi biruaim olgeta hevi i go long wei.

original: So the LORD has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in His sight.
translation: Bikpela i pe em i stap long me olsem jastis bilong mi, olsem klia bilong mi i kamap long ai bilong Em.

original: To the faithful You show Yourself faithful, to the blameless You show Yourself blameless;
translation: Long ol pipel we bilivim yu, yu yet kamap tru long ol; long ol pipel we nogat kros, yu yet kamap nogat kros long ol.

original: to the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the crooked You show Yourself shrewd.
translation: Long ol pipel i kamap klia, yu wailisim yuself olsem man i kamap strongpela, tasol long ol pipel i birua, yu wailisim yuself olsem man i save planim bikhet.

original: You save an afflicted people, but Your eyes are on the haughty to bring them down.
translation: Yu save ol pipol i katik na kisim trabel, tasol ai bilong yu i luk i go long ol pipol i gat bikpela hed, long bringim ol i daun.

original: For You, O LORD, are my lamp; the LORD lights up my darkness.
translation: Long yu, GOD Papa, yu bilong me lamppi; GOD Papa em i lakim daonk darkness bilong me.

original: For in You I can charge an army; with my God I can scale a wall.
translation: Long yu, mi ken go antap long armi; wantaim Bikpela bilong mi, mi ken klem hap barak.

original: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the LORD is flawless. He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.
translation: Long God olsem, wey bilong em i kamap strong tru; tok bilong LORD i strong na stretpela. Em i bikpela sihld long ol mana meri i go kisim ka long en.

original: For who is God besides the LORD? And who is the Rock except our God?
translation: Husat i God bana bes long LORD? Na husat i Rocks noken bilong God bilong yumi?

original: God is my strong fortress and He makes my way clear.
translation: Bikpela i stap long strongpela kibung, na em i mekim rot bilong mi i klar.

original: He makes my feet like those of a deer and stations me upon the heights.
translation: Em i mekim lek bilong mi olsem lek bilong dikin, na em i stapim mi long hap.

original: He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
translation: Em i skulim han bilong me long fait; arm bilong me ina save bengim banis bilong bronzi.

original: You have given me Your shield of salvation, and Your gentleness exalts me.
translation: Yu givim mi skid bilong sevensesen yu, na gentlnes bilong yu i bringim mi i go hap.

original: You broaden the path beneath me so that my ankles do not give way.
translation: Yu waidenim rot bilo long mi, na hak bilong mi i no ken givim wei.

original: I pursued my enemies and destroyed them; I did not turn back until they were consumed.
translation: Mi go bek gen long eni a, na mi bin kilim poi na ol birua, mi no tanim bek, na ol i pinis long taim ol i kamap dai.

original: I devoured and crushed them so they could not rise; they have fallen under my feet.
translation: Mi kaikai ol i go na mi daunim ol, ol i no inap long kam bek, na ol i pundaun klostu long lek bilong mi.

original: You have armed me with strength for battle; You have subdued my foes beneath me.
translation: Yu givim mi strong bilong kamap long bikpela fait; Yu daunim ol eni bilong mi aninit long mi.

original: You have made my enemies retreat before me; I put an end to those who hated me.
translation: Yu kisim eni bilong mi i go bek; Mi putim pinis ol i no likim mi.

original: They looked, but there was no one to save them—to the LORD, but He did not answer.
translation: Ol i luk, tasol i no gat narapela man i salim ol - ol i go bek long Bikpela, tasol Hem i no ansa.

original: I ground them as the dust of the earth; I crushed and trampled them like mud in the streets.
translation: Mi krungim ol olsem daulo bilong graun; mi daunim na mi tambuim ol olsem mami long rot.

original: You have delivered me from the strife of my people; You have preserved me as the head of nations; a people I had not known shall serve me.
translation: Yu kisim bek long tait bilong piple bilong me; Yu saveim me olsem hed bilong ol nesen; ol piple we mi no save bai sarvim me.

original: Foreigners cower before me; when they hear me, they obey me.
translation: Ol i pilas long mi; long ol harem tok bilong mi, ol i harim na bihainim mi.

original: Foreigners lose heart and come trembling from their strongholds.
translation: Man i kam dari narapela hap i lakim het na kam bek i go inawe long ples strong bilong ol.

original: The LORD lives, and blessed be my Rock! And may God, the Rock of my salvation, be exalted—
translation: Papa God i stap, blessim bikos Tupela i givim mi Roc! Na Papa God, Roc bilong selvation bilong mi, em i go antap longpela—

original: the God who avenges me and brings down nations beneath me,
translation: God bilong ples na em i givim bek long mi, em i bringim daun ol nesen isis long mi

original: who frees me from my enemies. You exalt me above my foes; You rescue me from violent men.
translation: Husat i lakim mi long enemy bilong mi. Yu givim mi bikpela respek long ol i no likim mi; Yu savim mi long ol man i gat bel hevi.

original: Therefore I will praise You, O LORD, among the nations; I will sing praises to Your name.
translation: Mipela bai givim prais long Bikpela, long olgeta nesen; mipela bai singim sang long nem bilong yu.

original: Great salvation He brings to His king. He shows loving devotion to His anointed, to David and his descendants forever.”
translation: Em i bringim bikpela saveman long king bilong em, na em i showim lanu long stap na kisim gutpela long man bilong em we em i givim oli bilong spirit, long Dauid na ol desenden bilong en foreva.

original: These are the last words of David: “The oracle of David son of Jesse, the oracle of the man raised on high, the one anointed by the God of Jacob, and the sweet psalmist of Israel:
translation: Dispela em i las wod bilong Daud: “Tok bilong Daud, pikinini bilong Ise, tok bilong man i go ap, em i man God bilong Yakob i givim anointing, na em i man bilong sang bilong Israel, singing man i gat swit ilesen.

original: The Spirit of the LORD spoke through me; His word was on my tongue.
translation: Spiret bilong Jehovah i tok thruim mi; Wod bilong em i stap long tung bilong mi.

original: The God of Israel spoke; the Rock of Israel said to me, ‘He who rules the people with justice, who rules in the fear of God,
translation: God bilong Isrel i tok; Rok bilong Isrel i tokim mi, ‘Em i givim rul long pipo na em i mekim ol samting gut long jastis, em i rul long fefor bilong God.

original: is like the light of the morning at sunrise of a cloudless dawn, the glistening after the rain on the sprouting grass of the earth.’
translation: Olsem lait bilong moning long sait bilong san long taim klia, brisin i kam bihainim ren long gras i karim i kamap long graun.

original: Is not my house right with God? For He has established with me an everlasting covenant, ordered and secured in every part. Will He not bring about my full salvation and my every desire?
translation: Em i orait long Haus bilong mi wantaim God, bikos Em i makim wanpela covenant long taim tru bilong mi, olgeta samting i orait na strong tumas. Em bai bringim bikpela victori na olgeta laik bilong mi?

original: But the worthless are all like thorns raked aside, for they can never be gathered by hand.
translation: Bai ol narapela i no gat pekina, olsem spik na kankar, na bai ol i pilim na kisim long sait, wantaim ol i no inogat man i ken kisim bek long han.

original: The man who touches them must be armed with iron or with the shaft of a spear. The fire burns them to ashes in the place where they lie.”
translation: Man i kam bilong tikim ol, em i mas holim aipon o bos long spia, na faia i barim ol long as long ples we ol i slip.

original: These are the names of David’s mighty men: Josheb-basshebeth the Tahchemonite was chief of the Three. He wielded his spear against eight hundred men, whom he killed at one time.
translation: Dispela i nem bilong strongpela man bilong Daved: Josheb-basshebet Tahchemonit em i bigman bilong Tri. Em i usim spia bilong em yet, na kilim man olsem ate hundred, ol i dai tete wanpela taim.

original: Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite. As one of the three mighty men, he went with David to taunt the Philistines who had gathered for battle at Pas-dammim. The men of Israel retreated,
translation: Nambawan long komanda em i Eleaza sun bilong Dodo Ahohiti. Em i wanpela long ol man bilong pait, strongpela tri, i go wantaim Daavid long givim Filistia moninga ol i kam yunaitim long pait long Pas-dammim. Ol man bilong Israel tanim i go bek.

original: but Eleazar stood his ground and struck the Philistines until his hand grew weary and stuck to his sword. The LORD brought about a great victory that day. Then the troops returned to him, but only to plunder the dead.
translation: Na Eleaza i stap strong olsem na i kilim ol Philistines, tasol han bilong en i les long na i holim sup long sop. Bikpela i kamapim win mosbi i go long dei. Soljas i kam bek long em, tasol oli go long bagarap o pilim ol samting bilong ol dai.

original: And after him was Shammah son of Agee the Hararite. When the Philistines had banded together near a field full of lentils, Israel’s troops fled from them.
translation: Na bihaen long em, Shammah, Pikinini bilong Agee, man Hararite. Ol Filistia i kam tugeta klostu wanpela ples we i gat planti lenzits, na ol soja bilong Isael i ranawe long ol.

original: But Shammah took his stand in the middle of the field, defended it, and struck down the Philistines. So the LORD brought about a great victory.
translation: Shama i stap strong long mit blo field, i bekim em, na i kilim ol Filistia. Na Bikpela i kamapim win mosbi, em i bikpela win tru.

original: At harvest time, three of the thirty chief men went down to David at the cave of Adullam, while a company of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Long taim bilong ka, tripela i go daun long Davide klostu long holi bilong Adulam, wail ol Filistia i stap klostu long Valle bilong Rephaim.

original: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was at Bethlehem.
translation: Long dispela taim Daudi i stap inside ples strongim, na grup bilong soljaman Philisti i stap long Betlehem.

original: David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”
translation: Daudi i tasol laik drinkim wara, na em i tok, "O, masalai wanpela man i kisim mipela wara long wel baisen besain long gait bilong Bethlehem!"

original: So the three mighty men broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the LORD,
translation: Na tripela manmeri strong i go insait long kanu bilong Filistia, ol i drai wara long wel klostu long gate bilong Betlehem, na kisim i kam bek long Daud. Tasol em i no laik dringim, insed long em powaotim i go long LORD,

original: saying, “Far be it from me, O LORD, to do this! Is this not the blood of the men who risked their lives?” So he refused to drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.
translation: Olsem, 'Nogat, PAPA, mi no ken duim dispela!' Dispela em i blod bilong ol man we i go long ples gras na i lusim laip bilong ol? Na em i refus long drinkim. Olsem na i stap ol kaman bilong tripela strongpela man.

original: Now Abishai, the brother of Joab and son of Zeruiah, was chief of the Three, and he lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name along with the Three.
translation: Nau Abisai, brata bilong Joab na pikinini bilong Seruia, em i bikpela long ol Tri, na em i kisim spia bilong en, kilim ol man tri hanred, na ol i save nem bilong en long taem ya, toktok wantaim ol Tri.

original: Was he not more honored than the Three? And he became their commander, even though he was not included among the Three.
translation: Em i no moa bikim pes bilong Tripol? Na em i kamap komanda bilong ol, maski em i no katol long ol Tripol.

original: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a man of valor from Kabzeel, a man of many exploits. He struck down two champions of Moab, and on a snowy day he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
translation: Na Benaiah susa bilong Jehoiada em i man bilong mekim planti wok strong, em i man bilong Kabzeel, em i man bilong strongim na kisim planti win. Em i kilim tupela man bilong paiya long Moab, na long de bile igo daun insait hole na kilim lapun dog.

original: He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man. Although the Egyptian had a spear in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club, snatched the spear from his hand, and killed the Egyptian with his own spear.
translation: Na Benaia i kilim wanpela Ijipia, em i man bilong strong. Maski Ijipia i gat spia long han bilong en, Benaia i go bek gen long en wantaim klab, em i pilim spia long han bilong Ijipia, na kilim Ijipia wantaim spia bilong en yet.

original: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who won a name alongside the three mighty men.
translation: Dispela i stap ol strongpela wok bilong Benaiah, pikinini bilong Jehoiada, ol i winim nem tasol wantaim tripela man strong.

original: He was most honored among the Thirty, but he did not become one of the Three. And David appointed him over his guard.
translation: Em i man bilong het long ol Teti, tasol em i no kamap wanpela bilong Tri. Na Daud i apoinim em olsem ka bilong en long gadi.

original: Now these were members of the Thirty: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
translation: Nau ol i memba bilong Thirty: Asahel brata bilong Joab, Elhanan pikinini bilong Dodo bilong Betlehem

original: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
translation: Shama man Harod, Elika man Harod,

original: Helez the Paltite, Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
translation: Helez bilong Paltite, Ira sut bilong Ikkesh bilong Tekoite,

original: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
translation: Abiezer bilong Anatoti, Mebunnai bilong Hushi,

original: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
translation: Zalmon bilong Ahohite, Maharai bilong Netophathite,

original: Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the Benjamites,
translation: Heled sussa bilong Baanah, man bilong Netofa, Ittai sussa bilong Ribai, long Gibea bilong Benjamin

original: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai from the brooks of Gaash,
translation: Benaiah bilong Pirathon, Hiddai husat i kam long saliwa bilong Gaash,

original: Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
translation: Abi-albon man bilong Arbath, Azmaveth man bilong Barhumite,

original: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan
translation: Eliahba bilong Shaalbon, ol pikinini bilong Jashen, Jonatan

original: son of Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam son of Sharar the Hararite,
translation: Susa bilong Shamma Hararait, Ahiam susa bilong Sharar Hararait,

original: Eliphelet son of Ahasbai the Maacathite, Eliam son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
translation: Eliphelet pikinini bilong Ahasbai, man bilong Maakati, Eliam pikinini bilong Ahithophel, man bilong Giluni,

original: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
translation: Hezro bilong Carmelite, Paarai bilong Arbite

original: Igal son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
translation: Igal sussa bilong Nathan bilong Zobah, Bani man bilong Gad

original: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
translation: Zelek bilong Ammon, Naharai bilong Beeroth, man i kisim arma bilong Joab, pikinini bilong Zeruiah,

original: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
translation: Aira man Ithrait, Gareb man Ithrait

original: and Uriah the Hittite. There were thirty-seven in all.
translation: Na Uriah bilong Hiti. Ol i kamap thirty-seven olgeta.

original: Again the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He stirred up David against them, saying, “Go and take a census of Israel and Judah.”
translation: Iari bilong Jehovah i barna gen against Israel, na Em i kisim bek Daudi long ol, i tokim em, “Go na kisim namba bilong Israel na Judah.”

original: So the king said to Joab the commander of his army, who was with him, “Go now throughout the tribes of Israel from Dan to Beersheba and register the troops, so that I may know their number.”
translation: King i givim tok long Joab komanda bilong armi, ol i stap wantaim em, “Go nau long Dan go long Beersheba, raitim nem bilong solja, na mi bai save namba bilong ol.”

original: But Joab replied to the king, “May the LORD your God multiply the troops a hundred times over, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it. But why does my lord the king want to do such a thing?”
translation: Bareta, Joab i tokim king, “Papa bilong mipela Bikpela i kisim moa solja hundred taim moa, na lukim long ai bilong yu, king. Baina yu, king, laik mekim samting olsem we?”

original: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab and against the commanders of the army. So Joab and the commanders of the army departed from the presence of the king to count the troops of Israel.
translation: Nem mind, tok bilong king i winim Joab na komanndo bilong armi. Olsem, Joab na komanndo bilong armi i go bek gen long ples bilong king, na ol i go kaunim soldia bilong Israel.

original: They crossed the Jordan and camped near Aroer, south of the town in the middle of the valley, and proceeded toward Gad and Jazer.
translation: Ol i kam bek long Jordan na ol i punda klostu long Aroer, long sait bilong taun long mit na vali, na ol i go inap long Gad na Jazer.

original: Then they went to Gilead and the land of Tahtim-hodshi, and on to Dan-jaan and around to Sidon.
translation: Ol i go long Gilead na kantri bilong Tahtim-hodshi, na ol i go inap long Dan-jaan, na raun long Sidon.

original: They went toward the fortress of Tyre and all the cities of the Hivites and Canaanites. Finally, they went on to the Negev of Judah, to Beersheba.
translation: Ol i go kam long forteks bilong Taire na ol siti bilong Hiviti na Kanani. Bihain ol i go long Negev bilong Juta, i go long Beesheba.

original: At the end of nine months and twenty days, having gone through the whole land, they returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Long nain mons na tweinte de, ol i go raunim pinis hap graun, na ol i kam bek gen long Jiusalem.

original: And Joab reported to the king the total number of the troops. In Israel there were 800,000 men of valor who drew the sword, and in Judah there were 500,000.
translation: Na Joab i ripotim nau long king namba bikpela bilong ol soldia. Long Israel, ol i gat 800,000 man bilong strongim het bilong draim sord, na long Judah, ol i gat 500,000.

original: After David had numbered the troops, his conscience was stricken and he said to the LORD, “I have sinned greatly in what I have done. Now, O LORD, I beg You to take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”
translation: Long taim David i bin kauntim ol solja, konsiens bilong em i bin katim na em i tokim LORD olsem: "Mi bin sin gret na true long ol samting mi bin mekim. Nau, LORD, mi bai bihainm Yu inap rausim ol bikhet long mi, bikos mi bin wokim ol samting bilong fool long wei bilong mi."

original: When David got up in the morning, a revelation from the LORD had come to Gad the prophet, David’s seer:
translation: Daavid i kamap namel long moning, na wanpela tok bilong revelesen i kam dari LORD i go long Gad, propet bilong em, man bilong spirit.

original: “Go and tell David that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am offering you three options. Choose one of them, and I will carry it out against you.’”
translation: Go na toktok long David, dispela em i tok olsem long LORD: 'Mi givim yu tri kindim chuis, pikinini chuis wanpela, na bai mi wokim i kam bek long yu.'

original: So Gad went and said to David, “Do you choose to endure three years of famine in your land, three months of fleeing the pursuit of your enemies, or three days of plague upon your land? Now then, think it over and decide how I should reply to Him who sent me.”
translation: Na Gad i go na tokim Davidson, "Yu laik kisim famin long tripela yia long kantri bilong yu, obegeda ranawe long bekim bilong enimi, o obegeda sik long kantri bilong yu? Nau olgeta, tingim gut na desisim olsem wanem samting mi mas repli long Hem i senim mi."

original: David answered Gad, “I am deeply distressed. Please, let us fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.”
translation: David i tokim Gad, "Mi tasol i stap sori tru. Mipela i go daun long han bilong LORD, olsem na bai marimari bilong en i kam, nogut pasin bilong marimari bilong God; be mi no ken givim mi i go daun long han bilong ol man."

original: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel from that morning until the appointed time, and seventy thousand of the people from Dan to Beersheba died.
translation: Na Bikpela i sindaun sik long ol pipol long moning em i go antap long taim we em i laik, na seventy thousand bilong ol pipol long Dan go antap long Beersheba i dai.

original: But when the angel stretched out his hand to destroy Jerusalem, the LORD relented from the calamity and said to the angel who was destroying the people, “Enough! Withdraw your hand now!” At that time the angel of the LORD was by the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
translation: Tasol bai enjel em strechim han bilong en long bagarapim Jerusalem, LORD ibin kisim bek long hevi na tokim olsem long enjel i stap bagarapim ol pipol, “Inap! Witdrawim han bilong yu nau!” Bai em i kam na enjel bilong LORD i stap klostu long ples bilong krungim paia bilong Araunah Jebusait.

original: When David saw the angel striking down the people, he said to the LORD, “Surely I, the shepherd, have sinned and acted wickedly. But these sheep, what have they done? Please, let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house.”
translation: Taim David harim engel i kilim ol pipol, na em i tokim long LORD, “Tru, mi, pasifa, mi bin sindaun na mekim ol samting nogut. Bai yumy, dispela sheep, wusai ol i mekim? Ples, LORD, bai han bilong yu i kam daun long mi na long husat bilong papa bilong mi.”

original: And that day Gad came to David and said to him, “Go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.”
translation: Na dispela de Gad i kam long David na tokim em, “Go ap long en buildim ai bilong LORD long plaen bilong winim Araunah bilong Jebusite.”

original: So David went up at the word of Gad, just as the LORD had commanded.
translation: Na Daved i go ap long toktok bilong Gad, olsem Papa God i givim tok.

original: When Araunah looked out and saw the king and his servants coming toward him, he went out and bowed facedown before the king.
translation: Taim Araunah i lukim na si king na wokman bilong en i kam, em i go aut na bungim hed klostu long graun bifor king, ol i mekim respek long king nau.

original: “Why has my lord the king come to his servant?” Araunah said. “To buy your threshing floor,” David replied, “that I may build an altar to the LORD, so that the plague upon the people may be halted.”
translation: Wai ol i kam long servant bilong yu, king? Araunah i tok. Mipela laik baim ples bilong husim kukim kaukau bilong yu, David i tok, mipela mekim ston bilong meka long LORD, olsem sik long bodi ol i dai i stopim.

original: Araunah said to David, “My lord the king may take whatever seems good and offer it up. Here are the oxen for a burnt offering and the threshing sledges and ox yokes for the wood.
translation: Arauna i tokim Davide, “Papa bilong mipela king, em inap tekim ol sampela gutpela samting na yu inap ofim em up. Hiri i stap ol bulmakau long ofim na bungim ol, na ol pipel i usim long krangim trausim na ol yoks bilong bulmakau long givim ol i go antap long God.”

original: O king, Araunah gives all these to the king.” He also said to the king, “May the LORD your God accept you.”
translation: O king, Araunah i givim olgeta dispela long king. Na em i tokim king olsem, "Mipela hope Papa God bilong yu apim yu."

original: “No,” replied the king, “I insist on paying a price, for I will not offer to the LORD my God burnt offerings that cost me nothing.” So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
translation: “Nogat,” king i tok bek, “mi laik pei pis, bikos mi no ken givim ofa long bun smok go long LORD God bilong mi we i no kostim mi sampela.” Na David i baim flo na bulmakau long 50 sikil sipara silva.

original: And there he built an altar to the LORD and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. Then the LORD answered the prayers on behalf of the land, and the plague upon Israel was halted.
translation: Na em baim altar long Papa God, givim ofing na peis ofing. Papa God i givim ansa long tepere long hap bilong Iserel, na bikpela sik i stopim.

original: Now King David was old and well along in years, and though they covered him with blankets, he could not keep warm.
translation: Nau King David em i ol bere, em i go long long na yia, na ol i kisim blanget na kova im stap long en, tasol em ina paitim warma.

original: So his servants said to him, “Let us search for a young virgin for our lord the king, to attend to him and care for him and lie by his side to keep him warm.”
translation: Na wokman bilong en i tokim em olsem, "Inap mi yusim susa i go lukim meri yangpela i no mari, i ken wok long servisim Papa bilong ol king, kisim ka long en, lekalek long en, na slip i go beside long en, bikos em i mas kol."
