original: Then they searched throughout Israel for a beautiful girl, and they found Abishag the Shunammite and brought her to the king.
translation: Ol i serch long ol ples bilong Isrel, ol i kisim meri sweetpela Apisag bilong Sunami, na ol i bringim i kam long king.

original: The girl was unsurpassed in beauty; she cared for the king and served him, but he had no relations with her.
translation: Meri i bikpela tumas long luk strong; ol i tokautim king, na em i warkim servis longen, tasol i no gat wes long en.

original: At that time Adonijah, David’s son by Haggith, began to exalt himself, saying, “I will be king!” And he acquired chariots and horsemen and fifty men to run ahead of him.
translation: Long taim ia, Adonija, pikinini bilong Daud, we i kamap long Hagis, em i statim mekim em yet long hap, olsem, "Mi bai king!" Na em i kisim kareta na soldia riding horse, na fifty man i go bifor em.

original: (His father had never once reprimanded him by saying, “Why do you act this way?” Adonijah was also very handsome, born next after Absalom.)
translation: Papa bilong em i no bin tokim em strong yet, i mekim tok olsem, "Yu mekim olsem wanem?" Adonijah em i luk strong tru long bodi, em i born bihain long Absalom.

original: So Adonijah conferred with Joab son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest, who supported him.
translation: Na Adonija i tokim olsem wantaim Joab, pikinini bilong Zeruia, na Abiata, man pris, ol i givim strong long em.

original: But Zadok the priest, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David’s mighty men would not join Adonijah.
translation: Ma Zadok priist, Benaiah sussa bilong Jehoiada, Natan profet, Shimei, Rei, na Maiti man bilong Dauid, ol i no joinim Adoniya.

original: And Adonijah sacrificed sheep, oxen, and fattened calves near the stone of Zoheleth, which is next to En-rogel. He invited all his royal brothers and all the men of Judah who were servants of the king.
translation: Na Adonija i slipim ol pipol, ol bulmakau, na ol krok Bus long ston bilong Zoheleth, we istap klostu long En-rogel. Emi i kamapim ol brata bilong em yet, ol manmeri bilong Yuda, ol i wok servisis bilong king, na tus ol i go wai long en.

original: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the mighty men, or his brother Solomon.
translation: Em i no invitim Natan propet, Benaiah, ol man strong, na brata Solomon bilong em.

original: Then Nathan said to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, “Have you not heard that Adonijah son of Haggith has become king, and our lord David does not know it?
translation: Na Natan i tokim Batsheba mama bilong Solomon, "Yu no harim yet, Adonija pikinini bilong Hagith em i kamap king, na lod David bilong yumi i no save long dispela?"

original: Now please, come and let me advise you. Save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.
translation: Nau plis, kam na mi givim yu toktok. Saveim laip bilong yu yet na saveim laip bilong pikinini Solomon.

original: Go at once to King David and say, ‘My lord the king, did you not swear to your maidservant, “Surely your son Solomon will reign after me, and he will sit on my throne”? Why then has Adonijah become king?’
translation: Go nau long go long King David na tokim papa bilong mi king, 'Papa bilong mi king, yu no swera long meri bilong yu, "Son Solomon bai i kam bihain long yu na em bai siddaun long thrown bilong yu"? Olsem wanem nau Adonijah i kamap king?'

original: Then, while you are still there speaking with the king, I will come in after you and confirm your words.”
translation: Long taim yu yet stap, tok save long papa bilong kantri, mi bai kam bihain long yu na statim mi bai givim apim tok ples bilong yu.

original: So Bathsheba went to see the king in his bedroom. Since the king was very old, Abishag the Shunammite was serving him.
translation: Bathsheba i go lukim king insait long rum bilong en. King em i bikpela i stap, Abishag bilong Shunam em i servim em.

original: And Bathsheba bowed down in homage to the king, who asked, “What is your desire?”
translation: Na Batsheba i go daun long graun na em i kirap long bikpela, king i askim, "Yu laik wanem?"

original: “My lord,” she replied, “you yourself swore to your maidservant by the LORD your God: ‘Surely your son Solomon will reign after me, and he will sit on my throne.’
translation: “Papa bilong olgeta,” na em i tok bek, “yu promis long servat meri bilong yu bai LORD Bikpela: ‘Son Solomon bai i kam kaikai bihain long me, na em bai i siddaun long thrown bilong yu.’”

original: But now, behold, Adonijah has become king, and you, my lord the king, did not know it.
translation: Nau dispela, lukim, Adonijah em i kamap king nau, na yu, lorom bilong mi, i no save long dispela.

original: And he has sacrificed an abundance of oxen, fattened calves, and sheep, and has invited all the other sons of the king, as well as Abiathar the priest and Joab the commander of the army. But he did not invite your servant Solomon.
translation: Na em i kilim planti ol bulmakau, kalvs we i pulap, na ol sip, na em i askim ol narapela sut bilong king, Abiathar prist, na Joab komanda bilong armi, tasol em i no askim servant Solomon bilong yu.

original: And as for you, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are upon you to tell them who will sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
translation: Na long yu, papa bilong mi king, ol i tok: ai bilong yumi ol Israel i stap long yu, bikosim ol manmeri i laik harim husat i go sidaun long thron bilong papa bilong mi king bihain long em.

original: Otherwise, when my lord the king rests with his fathers, I and my son Solomon will be counted as criminals.”
translation: Nogat, taim papa bilong mi, king, i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, orait, na mi na pikinini bilong mi, Solomon, yumi bai i kamap ol kriminal.

original: And just then, while Bathsheba was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet arrived.
translation: Olgeta em i kamap long taim, wail Bathsheba i stap tok yet wantaim king bilong yumi, Natan profet bilong God i kam.

original: So the king was told, “Nathan the prophet is here.” And Nathan went in and bowed facedown before the king.
translation: King i harim tok, "Natan man bilong Spirit i kam." Natan i go insait, na i kisa bek long graun bifo king.

original: “My lord the king,” said Nathan, “did you say, ‘Adonijah will reign after me, and he will sit on my throne’?
translation: “Papa bilong mi king,” Natan i tok, “yu tok olsem, ‘Adoniya bai i kam bihain long yu, na em bai i sindaun long throne bilong yu’?”

original: For today he has gone down and sacrificed an abundance of oxen, fattened calves, and sheep, and has invited all the sons of the king, the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest. And behold, they are eating and drinking before him, saying, ‘Long live King Adonijah!’
translation: Tedei em i go daun na em i kilim bek plenti bulmakau, kakaruk bilong bekim fat, na sip, na em i askim olgeta pikinini bilong king, ofisa bilong army, na Abiathar prist, ol i kam. Na sios, ol i kaikai na dring bere long en, ol i tok, ‘King Adonijah i stap long taim! ’

original: But me your servant he did not invite, nor Zadok the priest, nor Benaiah son of Jehoiada, nor your servant Solomon.
translation: Mi servent bilong yu, em i no invitim, nogat Zadok prist, nogat Benaiah susa bilong Jehoiada, nogat mi servent Solomon.

original: Has my lord the king let this happen without informing your servant who should sit on the throne after my lord the king?”
translation: Papa bilong olgeta king, em i givim dispela strongim long kam bek gen, tasol em i no givim tok long servit man husat i mas sit long thron bihain long yu?

original: Then King David said, “Call in Bathsheba for me.” So she came into the king’s presence and stood before him.
translation: King Daoud i tok, "Kisim Bathseba i kam klostu long me." Na em i kam insait long presens bilong king na i sanap long en.

original: And the king swore an oath, saying, “As surely as the LORD lives, who has redeemed my life from all distress,
translation: King i mekautim olegis, ol i tok, “Olsem mama long olgeta we LORD i stap, we i skulim laip bilong mi from olgeta kros,”

original: I will carry out this very day exactly what I swore to you by the LORD, the God of Israel: Surely your son Solomon will reign after me, and he will sit on my throne in my place.”
translation: Mi bai kisim na wokim dispela de exaktli olsem mi bin tokarak long ai bilong Papa God, Papa God bilong Israel: Sapos Solomon i stap, em bai i kam bihain long mi, na em bai siddown long throne bilong mi long ples bilong mi.

original: Bathsheba bowed facedown in homage to the king and said, “May my lord King David live forever!”
translation: Bathsheba i go daun long graun, i bikim respek long king, na i tok, "Lordan King David em i stap oltaim!"

original: Then King David said, “Call in for me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada.” So they came before the king.
translation: King Davi i tok, "Kisim bek long me Zadok pris, Natan propet, na Benaia son bilong Jehoiada." Ol man i kam bifo king.

original: “Take my servants with you,” said the king. “Set my son Solomon on my own mule and take him down to Gihon.
translation: Kisim servant bilong me, ol i go wantaim yu, king i tok. Putim pikinini bilong me Solomon long mule bilong me, na bek i go daun long Gihon.

original: There Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet are to anoint him king over Israel. You are to blow the ram’s horn and declare, ‘Long live King Solomon!’
translation: Hapkas, Zadok priest na Nathan propet bai paitim em king bilong Israel. Yupela mas bulimapim horn bilong ram na singaut, 'Solomon King i stap oltaim!'

original: Then you shall go up with him, and he is to come and sit on my throne and reign in my place. For I have appointed him ruler over Israel and Judah.”
translation: Yupela yet go ap long em, na em kam na sidaun long thrown bilong mi, wokim gavman long behaf bilong mi. Tasol, mi appointim em olsem bos bilong Israel na Judah, na em inap wokim gavman long plac bilong mi.

original: “Amen,” replied Benaiah son of Jehoiada. “May the LORD, the God of my lord the king, so declare it.
translation: “Amen,” Benaiah bin Jehoiada i tok. “Mai Bikpela Papa bilong Pikinini bilong king, em i tok olsem.

original: Just as the LORD was with my lord the king, so may He be with Solomon and make his throne even greater than that of my lord King David.”
translation: Olsem ol i go, LORD i stap wantaim papa bilong mi king, na em i mas stap wantaim Solomon, na makim sinisim bikpela tron bilong em long olgeta we tron bilong papa bilong mi king David.

original: Then Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada, along with the Cherethites and Pelethites, went down and set Solomon on King David’s mule, and they escorted him to Gihon.
translation: Na Zadok priast, Nathan propet, na Benaiah pikinini bilong Jehoiada, wantaim Cherethites na Pelethites ol bodigad bilong King David, i go daun, ol i putim Solomon long mul bilong King David, na ol i karim em i go long Gihon.

original: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. Then they blew the ram’s horn, and all the people proclaimed, “Long live King Solomon!”
translation: Zadok priester bungim horn bilong oil long tabernakul na givim Solomon anointing. Ol i bulimapim horn bilong rami, na ol pipel ol i kirapim, "King Solomon i stap long taim, em i king!"

original: All the people followed him, playing flutes and rejoicing with such a great joy that the earth was split by the sound.
translation: Ol pipol i go bihainim em, ol i pilai flaut na i amamas olsem wankain celebrisen long wanpela bikpela joy, na saut bilong ol i brukim graun.

original: Now Adonijah and all his guests were finishing their feast when they heard the sound of the ram’s horn. “Why is the city in such a loud uproar?” asked Joab.
translation: Nau Adonija na ol ges i stap long en, bai pinis ol i kaikai, taim ol i harim sain bilong horn bilong ram. Joab em i askim, "Siti i go daun long trabel, long giten na strongpela trabel, bekim wanem?"

original: As he was speaking, suddenly Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest arrived. “Come in,” said Adonijah, “for you are a man of valor. You must be bringing good news.”
translation: Wanpela taim em i tok, na Jonatan susa bilong Abiathar prist i kam bek long nowhere. “Kam in,” olsem Adonijah i tok, “yu man bilong strong, yu kam bringim gutpela stori tasol.”

original: “Not at all,” Jonathan replied. “Our lord King David has made Solomon king.
translation: “Nogat tasol,” Jonatan i tok. “Papa bilong mipela Kwin Dauid i bin mekim Soloman king.”

original: And with Solomon, the king has sent Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada, along with the Cherethites and Pelethites, and they have set him on the king’s mule.
translation: Na long taim bilong Solomon, king i sendim Zadok priest, Nathan profet, na Benaiah pikinini bilong Jehoiada, wantaim Cherethites na Pelethites, na ol i putim em long mul bilong king.

original: Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king at Gihon, and they have gone up from there with rejoicing that rings out in the city. That is the noise you hear.
translation: Zadok priest na Nathan propet im bin anointim em king long Gihon, na ol i go ap gen from hap ia wantaim rejoising, na em i mak olsem bel bilong singsing insait long taon. Em i sios bilong dispela nogut yu harim.

original: Moreover, Solomon has taken his seat on the royal throne.
translation: Na Solomon i go sidaun long thrown bilong king.

original: The king’s servants have also gone to congratulate our lord King David, saying, ‘May your God make the name of Solomon more famous than your own name, and may He make his throne greater than your throne.’ And the king has bowed in worship on his bed,
translation: Servas bilong king i go bikim hamamas long papa bilong olgeta King David, na ol i tok, 'Mipela hop God bai mekim nem bilong Solomon i bikpela moa long nem bilong yu, na bai mekim beta plas bilong em i bikpela moa long beta plas bilong yu.' Na king i katol daun long bet bilong en, stap katol.

original: saying, ‘Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel! Today He has provided one to sit on my throne, and my eyes have seen it.’”
translation: “Praise i go long LORD, God bilong Israel! Nau em i givim man wan i sit long throne bilong me, na mai eyes i lukim.”

original: At this, all the guests of Adonijah arose in terror and scattered.
translation: Long dispela, ol yariman bilong Adonijah i go ap long tokio na ol i sindaun klostu, ol i ranawe.

original: But Adonijah, in fear of Solomon, got up and went to take hold of the horns of the altar.
translation: Adonija, em i bikim Solomon na i kirap na i go kisim horn bilong alta.

original: It was reported to Solomon: “Behold, Adonijah fears King Solomon, and he has taken hold of the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let King Solomon first swear to me not to put his servant to the sword.’”
translation: Ol i tokim Solomon: “Adonija i bikimafet long King Solomon, na em i kamap klostu long horn bilong alta, olsem, ‘King Solomon mas bekim tok ples long me first, bai em i no kilim wokman bilong em wanpela soid.’”

original: And Solomon replied, “If he is a man of character, not a single hair of his will fall to the ground. But if evil is found in him, he will die.”
translation: Na Solomona i tokim, "Sapos em i man bilong tru na save, nogat wanpela gras bilong en bai i pas long graun. Sapos olgeta samting nogut i kamap long en, bai em i dai."

original: So King Solomon summoned Adonijah down from the altar, and he came and bowed down before King Solomon, who said to him, “Go to your home.”
translation: King Solomona i kisim Adonijah i kam daun from alta, na em i kam na i pakim head long King Solomona, na King Solomona i tokim olsem long em, “Yu go long ples bilong yu.”

original: As the time drew near for David to die, he charged his son Solomon,
translation: Long taim bilong David bai i dai pinis, na David i givim tok strong long pikinini bilong em Solomon.

original: “I am about to go the way of all the earth. So be strong and prove yourself a man.
translation: Mi go nau long rot bilong olgeta graun. Orait yu kamap strong na kisim saves, yu yet olsem man.

original: And keep the charge of the LORD your God to walk in His ways and to keep His statutes, commandments, ordinances, and decrees, as is written in the Law of Moses, so that you may prosper in all you do and wherever you turn,
translation: Na yu ken kisim kerala bilong Bikpela LORD God bilong yu, wokabaut long rot bilong Em, na kisim statut, komandoment, odinans, na desisen bilong En, olsem i writen long Lo bilong Moses, bilong yu inap kamap strong long olgeta samting yu mekim, na long olgeta hap yu go.

original: and so that the LORD may fulfill His promise to me: ‘If your descendants take heed to walk faithfully before Me with all their heart and soul, you will never fail to have a man on the throne of Israel.’
translation: Na Bikpela i fulfilim promis bilong Em: 'Ol desenden bilong yu i tingim gut long go bek long rot bilong Mipela, na ol i wark long Mipela wantaim olgeta haret na sol bilong ol, orait yu no bin fail long gat man i sit long throne bilong Israel.'

original: Moreover, you know what Joab son of Zeruiah did to me—what he did to Abner son of Ner and Amasa son of Jether, the two commanders of the armies of Israel. He killed them in peacetime to avenge the blood of war. He stained with the blood of war the belt around his waist and the sandals on his feet.
translation: Yu save long olsem Joab sone bilong Zeruiah em i mekim long mi, olsem na em i mekim long Abner sone bilong Ner na Amasa sone bilong Jether, tu komanda bilong armi bilong Israel. Em i kilim ol long taim bilong peis, long ripresim blod bilong war. Em i stainim skat bilong em na sop bilong em long blod bilong war.

original: So act according to your wisdom, and do not let his gray head go down to Sheol in peace.
translation: Wok akordig long wisdom bilong yu, na no lusim hed gris bilong en i go daun i stap long Sheol long peis.

original: But show loving devotion to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be among those who eat at your table, because they stood by me when I fled from your brother Absalom.
translation: Mi mas showim lovong devotion long pikinini bilong Barzillai man Gilead, na bai ol i kam kaikai long tebol bilong yu, bikos ol i stap besaida long mi taim mi ronawe long brata tru bilong yu, Absalom.

original: Keep an eye on Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite from Bahurim who is with you. He called down bitter curses against me on the day I went to Mahanaim, but when he came down to meet me at the Jordan, I swore to him by the LORD: ‘I will never put you to the sword.’
translation: Kisim i tokaut long Shimei man bilong Gera, man meri bilong Benjimin from Bahurim we i stap wantaim yu. Em i singaut kurse kurse i kam doun against mi long de ol i go long Mahanaim, tasol em i kam doun na mitim mi long Jordan, na mi taka nem bilong LORD: 'Mi no bin promis long yu, mi no go kilim yu na bikim yu i go daun na i dai.'

original: Now therefore, do not hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man. You know what you ought to do to him to bring his gray head down to Sheol in blood.”
translation: Nau therefore, no ken givim em free long sin, bikos yu man bilong save. Yu save wetem yu mas mekim long em, brumim hed bilong em i go daun long ples bilong dei long blod.

original: Then David rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David.
translation: Na bihain David i stap wantaim papa bilong en na ol i bin plantim em long siti bilong Daud.

original: The length of David’s reign over Israel was forty years—seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
translation: Taim bilong kiwai we David i bos bilong Israel em i 40 yia - 7 yia long Hebron na 33 yia long Jerusalem.

original: So Solomon sat on the throne of his father David, and his kingdom was firmly established.
translation: Na Solomon i go sindaun long troin bilong papa bilong em, Davidson, na kingdom bilong em i strongim tru.

original: Now Adonijah son of Haggith went to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, and she asked, “Do you come in peace?” “Yes, in peace,” he replied.
translation: Nau Adonija pikinini bilong Hagis i go long Bethesiba mama bilong Solomon, na em i akim, 'Yu kam bek long peis?' Adonija i tok, 'Yes, long peis.'

original: Then he said, “I have something to tell you.” “Say it,” she answered.
translation: Em i tok, “Mi gat wanpela stori bai mi tokim yu.” “Tok olsem,” em i ansa.

original: “You know that the kingship was mine,” he said. “All Israel expected that I should reign, but the kingship has turned to my brother, for it has come to him from the LORD.
translation: Yu save olsem ki kingdom bilong Israel em i bilong mi, Ol Israel i expextim olsem mi mas bos, tasol kingdom em i go bek long brata bilong mi, long wanem Papa God bilong ol Israel i givim ikam long hem.

original: So now I have just one request of you; do not deny me.” “State your request,” she told him.
translation: Nau mi tasol i gat wanpela bekim, yu no ken dusim mi. “Tokim bekim bilong yu,” em i tokim.

original: Adonijah replied, “Please speak to King Solomon, since he will not turn you down. Let him give me Abishag the Shunammite as my wife.”
translation: Adonijah i tok bek, "Yu tokim King Solomon, em i no ken tok nogut. Bai em i givim mi Abishag meri Shunamite olsem meri bilong mi."

original: “Very well,” Bathsheba replied. “I will speak to the king for you.”
translation: “Em i orait,” Batiseba i tok. “Mi go tokim king long yu.”

original: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him for Adonijah. The king stood up to greet her, bowed to her, and sat down on his throne. Then the king had a throne brought for his mother, who sat down at his right hand.
translation:
Na Batsheba i go kam long King Solomona, king i stanap na welkomim her, na king i sindaun gen. King i kisim wanem throne ibin bringim i go long mama bilong en, na mama i sindaun klostu long han bilong rait bilong em, long King Solomon, olsem na toktok bilong Adonija i kam
King Solomona i stanap na welkomim Batsheba, na Batsheba i tokim king long stori bilong Adonija.

original: “I have just one small request of you,” she said. “Do not deny me.” “Make your request, my mother,” the king replied, “for I will not deny you.”
translation: “Mipela i gat wanpela liklik tok nau long yu,” em i tok. “Yu no ken karamim mi.” “Tokim yu yet long mipela, mama bilong mipela,” king i birua, “bikos mipela no ken karamim yu.”

original: So Bathsheba said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as his wife.”
translation: Batsheba i tok, “Abishag Meri Shunam i givim long brata yufela Adonijah olsem meri bilong em.”

original: King Solomon answered his mother, “Why do you request Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Since he is my older brother, you might as well request the kingdom for him and for Abiathar the priest and for Joab son of Zeruiah!”
translation: King Solomon i ankim tok long mama bilong em, “Bai yu askim Abishag meri bilong Shunam olsem wanem long Adonijah? Em i bira bilong mi, olsem yu mas bai askim kingdom bilong en tu, na Abiathar pries, na Joab pikinini bilong Zeruiah!”

original: Then King Solomon swore by the LORD: “May God punish me, and ever so severely, if Adonijah has not made this request at the expense of his life.
translation: King Solomona i tok strong olega long LORDE: Mai GOD i pasim mi strong tumas, na em i bikim olsem long laip bilong en, if Adoniya i mekim desepela tok askim olsem.

original: And now, as surely as the LORD lives—the One who established me, who set me on the throne of my father David, and who founded for me a dynasty as He promised—surely Adonijah shall be put to death today!”
translation: Na nau, olsem olgeta Lod i stap – em i bikim me, em i putim me long sit bilong papa Davit, na em i planim kaunsil bilong mi olsem im promis – olsem olgeta, tude Adonija bai i dai!

original: So King Solomon sent the order to Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who struck down Adonijah, and he died.
translation: King Solomona i salim tok instruksin long Benaiah susa bilong Jehoiada, na em i kilim daun Adonijah, na em i dai.

original: Then the king said to Abiathar the priest, “Go back to your fields in Anathoth. Even though you deserve to die, I will not put you to death at this time, since you carried the ark of the Lord GOD before my father David, and you suffered through all that my father suffered.”
translation: King i tokim Abiathar priester, "Yu go bek gen long ples bilong yu long Anathoth. Yu mas dai, tasol mi no kilim yu yet, bikos yu kisim bek arka bilong LORD GOD bifo papa bilong mi David, na yu suf long ol samting we papa bilong mi suf."

original: So Solomon banished Abiathar from the priesthood of the LORD and thus fulfilled the word that the LORD had spoken at Shiloh against the house of Eli.
translation: Na Solomon i rausim Abiathar long pastorim bilong Jehovah na ol i fulfilim tok ples ol i bin tokim long Silo, em i go long husat bilong Eli.

original: When the news reached Joab, who had conspired with Adonijah but not with Absalom, he fled to the tent of the LORD and took hold of the horns of the altar.
translation: Taim ol i harim stori, Joab em i bin mekim plan long han bilong Adonijah tasol, nogat long han bilong Absalom, em i rinawe i go long haus bilong Jehovah na em kamap kisim horn bilong alta.

original: It was reported to King Solomon: “Joab has fled to the tent of the LORD and is now beside the altar.” So Solomon sent Benaiah son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go, strike him down!”
translation: Ol i tokim King Solomon: “Joab i ranawe go long haus bilong LORD na em i stap nau besaid long altar.” Na Solomon i sendim Benaiah son bilong Jehoiada, i mekim tok, "Go, kilim em!"

original: And Benaiah entered the tent of the LORD and said to Joab, “The king says, ‘Come out!’” But Joab replied, “No, I will die here.” So Benaiah relayed the message to the king, saying, “This is how Joab answered me.”
translation: Na Benaiah i go insait long haus bilong Lod na i tokim Joab, “King i tok, 'Kam aut!'” Tasol Joab i tok, “Nogat, mi bai dai hare.” Na Benaiah i karim tok bilong king i go, na i tok, “Joab i ansa olsem long me.”

original: And the king replied, “Do just as he says. Strike him down and bury him, and so remove from me and from the house of my father the innocent blood that Joab shed.
translation: King i tok bek, “Yu mas mekim olsem em i tok. Yu mas kilim em na kisim em i go daun long graun, na bai yu rausim long mi na long haus bilong papa bilong mi bled bilong man we nogat samting ibai we Joab i shed.”

original: The LORD will bring his bloodshed back upon his own head, for without the knowledge of my father David he struck down two men more righteous and better than he when he put to the sword Abner son of Ner, commander of Israel’s army, and Amasa son of Jether, commander of Judah’s army.
translation: Papa God i bringim bek blood bilong en i go bek long hed bilong en yet, bikos papa David i no save, na em i kilim twelvela man moa rait na betta long en, olsem Abner son of Ner, bikman bilong army bilong Israel, na Amasa son of Jether, bikman bilong army bilong Yuda, em i kilim ol wantaim sord.

original: Their blood will come back upon the heads of Joab and his descendants forever; but for David, his descendants, his house, and his throne, there shall be peace from the LORD forever.”
translation: Blaud bilong ol i kam bek long hed bilong Joab na ol desenden bilong em foreva; bat long David, ol desenden bilong em, haus bilong em, na tron bilong em, bai i gat pis from LORD foreva.

original: So Benaiah son of Jehoiada went up, struck down Joab, and killed him. He was buried at his own home in the wilderness.
translation: Na Benaiah son bilong Jehoiada i go ap, i kilim Joab, na i kilim em. Ol i biruwim em long ples bilong em long bus.

original: And the king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada in Joab’s place over the army, and he appointed Zadok the priest in Abiathar’s place.
translation: King i go long apoinim Benaiah, pikinini bilong Jehoiada, long hap bilong Joab, olsem leda bilong armi, na i apoinim Zadok pris long hap bilong Abiathar.

original: Then the king summoned Shimei and said to him, “Build a house for yourself in Jerusalem and live there, but do not go anywhere else.
translation: King i kirapim Shimei long go, na ol i tokim em, “Wokim haus bilong yu yet long Jerusalem, na yu mas stap we, bai yu no go long hap bilong narapela.”

original: On the day you go out and cross the Kidron Valley, know for sure that you will die; your blood will be on your own head.”
translation: Long de ya yu go aut na yu pas Kidron Vale, yu save long tok bilong God olsem yu kam dai pinis; blod bilong yu bai i stap long hed bilong yu em yet.

original: “The sentence is fair,” Shimei replied. “Your servant will do as my lord the king has spoken.” And Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.
translation: “Sentens i fare,” Shimei i tokim. “Hausboi bilong yu bai mekim olsem lord king bilong mi i tok.” Na Shimei i stap long Jerusalem long taim.

original: After three years, however, two of Shimei’s slaves ran away to Achish son of Maacah, king of Gath. And Shimei was told, “Look, your slaves are in Gath.”
translation: Bihaenim tripea yia, tu bilong Shimei i ranawe na go long Achish, pikinini bilong Maacah, papa bilong kantri Gath. Na ol i tokim Shimei, "Luukim, wokmanmeri bilong yu i stap long Gath."

original: So Shimei saddled his donkey and set out to Achish at Gath in search of his slaves, and he brought them back from Gath.
translation: Na Shimei i salim donki bilong en, i go kam bek long Achish lon Gath, i go painim servan bilong en, na bungim ol i kam bek gen long Gath.

original: When Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had returned,
translation: Taim Solomon i harim tok olsem Shimei i go bek long Gath from Jerusalem na i kam bek gen,

original: the king summoned Shimei and said to him, “Did I not make you swear by the LORD and warn you, ‘On the day you leave and go elsewhere, know for sure that you will die’? And you told me, ‘The sentence is fair; I will comply.’
translation: King i kolim Shimei long kam, na ol i tokim em, “Mi no mekim yu promis long LORD, na givim yu waning, ‘Long de ya yu lusim na go long hap antap, yu save nau olsem yu bai dai’? Na yu tokim mi, ‘Desisan i fare; mi bai kamapim’.”

original: So why have you not kept your oath to the LORD and the command that I gave you?”
translation: Long we bilong mekim pekpek, Bikpela, na toksave em mi givim yumi, tasol yumi i no holim pikinini bai ya?

original: The king also said, “You know in your heart all the evil that you did to my father David. Therefore the LORD will bring your evil back upon your head.
translation: King i tok tu olgeta, "Yupela save long hap bilong yupela olgeta nau, ol narapela hevi yupela mekim long papa David bilong mi. LORD bai bringim bek evil bilong yu long hed bilong yu."

original: But King Solomon will be blessed and David’s throne will remain secure before the LORD forever.”
translation: King Solomon bai katol bilong bikpela blessings, na Throne bilong David bai stap strong long as bilong Bikpela oltaim.

original: Then the king commanded Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and he went out and struck Shimei down, and he died. Thus the kingdom was firmly established in the hand of Solomon.
translation: King i givim tok long Benaiah, son bilong Jehoiada, na em i go na kilim daun Shimei, na em i dai pinis. Olsem kingdom i kamap strong nau long han bilong Solomon.

original: Later, Solomon formed an alliance with Pharaoh king of Egypt by marrying his daughter. Solomon brought her to the City of David until he had finished building his palace and the house of the LORD, as well as the wall around Jerusalem.
translation: Solomen i mekim wok bung wantaim Faraon king bilong Ijip olsem em i givim bel meri bilong en. Solomen i kam bek long Siiti bilong Daud, na em i stap we til em i pinis wokim haus bilong en, haus bilong LORD, na banis long Jerusalemu.

original: The people, however, were still sacrificing on the high places because a house for the Name of the LORD had not yet been built.
translation: Ol pipol i stap sacrifice long ples hait yet bikos haus bilong nem bilong LORD i no bin mekim yet.

original: And Solomon loved the LORD and walked in the statutes of his father David, except that he sacrificed and burned incense on the high places.
translation: Na Solomon i lakim LORD na i wok kamap long statut long papa David, tasol em i makim sakrifis na i barim insens long ples hai.

original: Now the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for it was the great high place. Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on the altar there.
translation: Nau king i go long Gibeon na i sacrificim olsem long ples hait tru, wantaim Solomon i bringim na ofa wan tasen bun olsem long alta.

original: One night at Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream, and God said, “Ask, and I will give it to you!”
translation: Wan nait long Gibeon, LORD i kamap long Solomon long tupela ai bilong en, na God i tok, "Begim, na mi bai givim i go long yu!"

original: Solomon replied, “You have shown much loving devotion to Your servant, my father David, because he walked before You in faithfulness, righteousness, and uprightness of heart. And You have maintained this loving devotion by giving him a son to sit on his throne this very day.
translation: Solomon i tok bek, “Yu showim planti lavin kantri long servant bilong yu, papa bilong mi David, bikos em i wok bifor yu long wei bilong trast, jus, na streit bilong het. Na yu yet ol i holim dispela lavin kantri long em, bai givim man pikinini bilong em bai sitdaun long trohn bilong en long dei narak.”

original: And now, O LORD my God, You have made Your servant king in my father David’s place. But I am only a little child, not knowing how to go out or come in.
translation: Na nau, o Bikpela bilong mi, yu bin mekim hambis bilong yu king long hap bilong papa bilong mi, Daavid. Mi yet liklik na no save long go na kam bek, stap long go na kam.

original: Your servant is here among the people You have chosen, a people too numerous to count or number.
translation: Wokman bilong yu i stap long ol pipol we yu pikinim, em i go daun olgeta, pipol i kamap bikpela olgeta, i no gat nambar.

original: Therefore give Your servant an understanding heart to judge Your people and to discern between good and evil. For who is able to govern this great people of Yours?”
translation: O Father, givim servan bilong yu haret i stap klia, ili em i ken jijim pisin bilong yu, na givim save long em long dispela, ili em i ken no gat save long dispela gupela na nogut. Bika husat ina ken lidaim pisin bilong yu i stap strong?

original: Now it pleased the Lord that Solomon had made this request.
translation: Masalai i amenes long Solomon long em i mekim dispela tok.

original: So God said to him, “Since you have asked for this instead of requesting long life or wealth for yourself or death for your enemies—but you have asked for discernment to administer justice—
translation: God i tokim em, "Long ol dispela yu bin askim, yu no bihainim laip bongpela o rasem moni bilong yuself, o deth long ol enemy bilong yu, tapi yu bin askim save long diskasim ol samting na givim sentens, em i tokol bilong jusis."

original: behold, I will do what you have asked. I will give you a wise and discerning heart, so that there has never been nor will ever be another like you.
translation: Lukim, mi go hamamas long dispela ol samting yu bin askim. Mi go givim yu haret i stap strong na save gut, olesem nogat wanpela man i kam bifo na nogat wanpela man i kam bihain olsem yu.

original: Moreover, I will give you what you did not request—both riches and honor—so that during all your days no man in any kingdom will be your equal.
translation: Mi bai givim yu ol samting yu no bin askim, rikis na gat respek, wankain na yu, na ol taim yu stap long ples bilong king, i no gat man wankain na yu.

original: So if you walk in My ways and keep My statutes and commandments, just as your father David did, I will prolong your days.”
translation: Sapos yu wokabaut long we bilong me, holim statut bilong me na komandoment bilong me, olsem papa bilong yu, Davidson i mekim, mi bai givim yu de long taim.

original: Then Solomon awoke, and indeed it had been a dream. So he returned to Jerusalem, stood before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. Then he held a feast for all his servants.
translation: Na Solomon i kam bek long slip, na em i bin wanpela dram tasol. So i go bek long Jerusalem, i stap bifor bokis bilong kaen bilong Papa God, na i bring ol kain ofring i go daun long paia na peis ofring. Na Solomon i mekim bun pikinini long ol servan bilong en.

original: At that time two prostitutes came to the king and stood before him.
translation: Long taim ia, tu meri bosim i kam bek long king na tu i stap bifor em.

original: One woman said, “Please, my lord, this woman and I live in the same house, and I gave birth while she was in the house.
translation: Wan meri tok, "Papa bilong yu, dispela meri na mi stap long wanpela haus, na mi karim bek belly long em tasol."

original: On the third day after I gave birth, this woman also had a baby. We were alone, with no one in the house but the two of us.
translation: Long dei thrid nau, bihainim mi karim bebe, meri igat bebe tu. Mipela i stap wanpela, na i no gat narapela man i stap insait long haus, bikos mipela tupela pepe.

original: During the night this woman’s son died because she rolled over on him.
translation: Long nait, pikinini bilong meri igat dai bikos meri i go daun klostu long en.

original: So she got up in the middle of the night and took my son from my side while I was asleep. She laid him in her bosom and put her dead son at my bosom.
translation: Na em i kamap long nait, na em i go ap, tasol em i kisim pikinini bilong me na putim i daun beside en, na em i lidim pikinini bilong en i dai insait long susu bilong me, na em i putim pikinini bilong me insait long susu bilong en, wail em i slip.

original: The next morning, when I got up to nurse my son, I discovered he was dead. But when I examined him, I realized that he was not the son I had borne.”
translation: Bikos nem bilong morning i go, taim mi kirap long susim pikinini bilong mi, na mi lukim em i dai pinis. Tasol taim mi wariim em, na mi save olsem em i no pikinini bilong mi we mi karim.

original: “No,” said the other woman, “the living one is my son and the dead one is your son.” But the first woman insisted, “No, the dead one is yours and the living one is mine.” So they argued before the king.
translation: “Nogat,” ol i tok olsem bilong meri narak, “pikinini bilong me em i stap yet na pikinini bilong yu em i dai pinis.” Tasol meri namba wan i birua olsem, “Nogat, pikinini bilong yu em i dai pinis na pikinini bilong me em i stap yet.” Ol i kisim hevi long King.

original: Then the king replied, “This woman says, ‘My son is alive and yours is dead,’ but that woman says, ‘No, your son is dead and mine is alive.’”
translation: King i tokim, “Meri ia i tok, ‘Pikinini bilong me i stap, na pikinini bilong yu i dai,’ taso meri namba tu i tok, ‘Nogat, pikinini bilong yu i dai, na pikinini bilong me i stap.’”

original: The king continued, “Bring me a sword.” So they brought him a sword,
translation: King i go antap, “Bringim mi sop.” Ol i bringim sop long em.

original: and the king declared, “Cut the living child in two and give half to one and half to the other.”
translation: King i tok, "Katim pikinini i stap yet long tu, givim hap long wan mama na hap long narapela mama."

original: Then the woman whose son was alive spoke to the king because she yearned with compassion for her son. “Please, my lord,” she said, “give her the living baby. Do not kill him!” But the other woman said, “He will be neither mine nor yours. Cut him in two!”
translation: Na meri husat i gat pikinini i stap yet, tokim king bilong en kisim kros long hap bilong en. "Papa bilong mi," em tok, "givim bek baby i stap. No kilim em!" Tasol narapela meri tok, "Em i no bilong mi, na em i no bilong yu. Kotim em i go antap long tu!"

original: Then the king gave his ruling: “Give the living baby to the first woman. By no means should you kill him; she is his mother.”
translation: King i givim desisioN: “Givim bekim baby i stap na i go long mama birua. Nogat ken tru, yu no ken kilim em, bikos em i mama bilong em.”

original: When all Israel heard of the judgment the king had given, they stood in awe of him, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him to administer justice.
translation: Taim ol Isrel harim nau long jajman we papa bilong kantri ibin givim, ol i stap long fear bilong en, bikos ol i lukim wisdem bilong God i stap long en long givim raitim skul.

original: So King Solomon ruled over Israel,
translation: King Solomona i bos bilong Israel.

original: and these were his chief officials: Azariah son of Zadok was the priest;
translation: Na ofisal bilong em i gat autoriti ol i bikpela: Azaria i pikinini bilong Zadok em i prist;

original: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, were secretaries; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder;
translation: Elihoreph na Ahijah, ol pikinini belong Shisha, ol i bin wokman bilong raitim stori; Jehoshaphat, pikinini belong Ahilud, em i bin man bilong skrivim stori.

original: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was in charge of the army; Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
translation: Benaiah pikinini bilong Jehoiada i stap long hap bilong armi; Zadok na Abiathar ol i praist.

original: Azariah son of Nathan was in charge of the governors; Zabud son of Nathan was a priest and adviser to the king;
translation: Azariah sot bilong Nathan em i stap long hap bilong gavman; Zabud sot bilong Nathan em i wes pries na advaiza bilong king;

original: Ahishar was in charge of the palace; and Adoniram son of Abda was in charge of the forced labor.
translation: Ahishar em i lukautim haus bilong ki, na Adoniram, pikinini bilong Abda, em i lukautim wok bilong poroman.

original: Solomon had twelve governors over all Israel to provide food for the king and his household. Each one would arrange provisions for one month of the year,
translation: Solomon i gat twelve ol governer long halivim Israel, ol i save kaikai long king na husat i stap wantaim em. Nambauten tupela i mas oraitim kaikai long wanpela mun long yia.

original: and these were their names: Ben-hur in the hill country of Ephraim;
translation: Na dispela i stap: Ben-hur em i narim nem bilong ol long maunten hap graun bilong Efrem;

original: Ben-deker in Makaz, in Shaalbim, in Beth-shemesh, and in Elon-beth-hanan;
translation: Ol ples bilong Ben-deker i stap: Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth-shemesh, na Elon-beth-hanan;

original: Ben-hesed in Arubboth (Socoh and all the land of Hepher belonged to him);
translation: Ben-hesed i stap long Arubboth (Socoh na olgeta graun bilong Hepfer i bilong em);

original: Ben-abinadab in Naphath-dor (Taphath, a daughter of Solomon, was his wife);
translation: Ben-abinadab i stap long Naphath-dor, Tafat, meri bilong Solomon, em i meri bilong en;

original: Baana son of Ahilud in Taanach, in Megiddo, and in all of Beth-shean next to Zarethan below Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah and on past Jokmeam;
translation: Baana sisi bilong Ahilud i bin bos long Taanach, long Megiddo, na long olgeta hap bilong Beth-shean, we beside Zarethan i stap anidas long Jezreel, stat long Beth-shean go long Abel-meholah, na go pas long Jokmeam;

original: Ben-geber in Ramoth-gilead (the villages of Jair son of Manasseh in Gilead belonged to him, as well as the region of Argob in Bashan with its sixty great cities with walls and bronze bars);
translation: Ben-geber long Ramoth-gilead (ol vilis bilong Jair man bilong Manasseh long Gilead i bilong em, na hap graun long Argob long Bashan wantaim sixty ples big na gat banis na rod long bronzu);

original: Ahinadab son of Iddo in Mahanaim;
translation: Ahinadab suk bilong Iddo long Mahanaim;

original: Ahimaaz in Naphtali (he had married Basemath, a daughter of Solomon);
translation: Ahimaaz long Naphtali, em i bin marit wantaim Basemath, meri bilong Solomon;

original: Baana son of Hushai in Asher and in Aloth;
translation: Baana sussa bilong Hushai long hap bilong Asher na long hap bilong Aloth;

original: Jehoshaphat son of Paruah in Issachar;
translation: Jehosapat sori bilong Parua long hap bilong Isaakara

original: Shimei son of Ela in Benjamin;
translation: Shimei pikinini bilong Ela long Benjamin;

original: Geber son of Uri in the land of Gilead, including the territories of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan. There was also one governor in the land of Judah.
translation: Geber man bilong Uri long lan bilong Gilead, wantaim ol lanan i go hed long King Sihon bilong Amorites na King Og bilong Bashan. Na em i gat wanpela gavana tu long lan bilong Judah.

original: The people of Judah and Israel were as numerous as the sand on the seashore, and they were eating and drinking and rejoicing.
translation: Ol pipol bilong Yuda na Isrel i gat planti olsem san long sait bilong solwara, na ol i kaikai, ol i dring, na ol i hamamas.

original: And Solomon reigned over all the kingdoms from the Euphrates to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt. These kingdoms offered tribute and served Solomon all the days of his life.
translation: Na Solomon i bos long ol kingdom olgeta from Euphrates i go pas long laine bilong Philistines, inap long bun grin bilong Egypt. Ol kingdom ol dispela i kam givim samting na servim Solomon long ol dei bilong life blong em.

original: Solomon’s provisions for a single day were thirty cors of fine flour, sixty cors of meal,
translation: Ka moning long taim bilong Solomon, em i save kisim thirty kor long painim flor na sixty kor long painim mit long wanpela dei tasol.

original: ten fat oxen, twenty range oxen, and a hundred sheep, as well as deer, gazelles, roebucks, and fattened poultry.
translation: Ten bigpela okis we i gat moa gris, twenty okis we i kukim loa, na wan hundred pipel sheep, olsem na deer, gazel, roebuk, na ol ka we i stap long haus.

original: For Solomon had dominion over everything west of the Euphrates—over all the kingdoms from Tiphsah to Gaza—and he had peace on all sides.
translation: Solomon em i gat pawa long en wes long riva Euphrates, ol kingdom frum Tiphsah go long Gaza, na em i gat pis long olgeta sait.

original: Throughout the days of Solomon, Judah and Israel dwelt securely from Dan to Beersheba, each man under his own vine and his own fig tree.
translation: Oltaim long taim bilong Solomon, Juda na Isrel i stap gutpela na sindaun, from Dan long Beersheba, ol man meri i stap nen long en binatang bilong en, na unda figurim bilong en.

original: Solomon had 4,000 stalls for his chariot horses and 12,000 horses.
translation: Solomon i gat 4,000 bilong kareta horses stap na 12,000 horses.

original: Each month the governors in turn provided food for King Solomon and all who came to his table. They saw to it that nothing was lacking.
translation: Long mun, gavman bilong provins i givim kaikai long King Solomon na ol pipol i kam na sindaun long tebol bilong en, ol i lukautim olsem nau, inap long wonem samting, nogat samting i kam daun.

original: Each one also brought to the required place their quotas of barley and straw for the chariot horses and other horses.
translation: Yupela yet, ol i bringim bari na straw long ples we em i mas, long wei bilong has bilong karet na has narakai.

original: And God gave Solomon wisdom, exceedingly deep insight, and understanding beyond measure, like the sand on the seashore.
translation: Na Bikpela i givim Solomon save na diskresen, save longlong tru, nogut na save we no ken kisim hap, olsem san long sait bilong solwara.

original: Solomon’s wisdom was greater than that of all the men of the East, greater than all the wisdom of Egypt.
translation: Wisdom bilong Solomon i bikpela moa long olgeta wisdom bilong ol man meri bilong Isa, na moa strong long olgeta wisdom bilong Ijip.

original: He was wiser than all men—wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, and wiser than Heman, Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol. And his fame spread throughout the surrounding nations.
translation: Em i wis moa long ol man meri, em i wis moa long Ethan bilong Ezrahait, na em i wis moa long Heman, Kalakol, na Dada, ol Pikinini bilong Mahol. Stori bilong em i go ol abaot long ol narapela kantri.

original: Solomon composed three thousand proverbs, and his songs numbered a thousand and five.
translation: Solomen i raitim proverv three thousand, na singsing bilong em i gat namba wan thousand na faiv.

original: He spoke of trees, from the cedar in Lebanon to the hyssop growing in the wall, and he taught about animals, birds, reptiles, and fish.
translation: Em i tok long diwai, stat long sedaa bilong Libanon na rik long hysop i karim long wara, na em i tisim olsem long animals, pisin, snak na krokodail, na ol pis.

original: So men of all nations came to listen to Solomon’s wisdom, sent by all the kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
translation: Ol man meri bilong ol nesen i kam harim save nogut bilong Solomen, ol ki ya bilong king bilong graun i sendim, na ol i harim tok bilong em,Solomon, husat i gat save nogut tru, na ol king bilong ol graun i harim tok bilong wisdom bilong em.

original: Now when Hiram king of Tyre heard that Solomon had been anointed king in his father’s place, he sent envoys to Solomon; for Hiram had always been a friend of David.
translation: Nau Hiram king bilong Tire harim stori long Solomon, olsem em ibin bel anointed king long ples bilong papa bilong em, Hiram sendim ambasadora go long Solomon, wantaim Hiram em i stap long taim bifo olsem friend bilong David.

original: And Solomon relayed this message to Hiram:
translation: Na Solomona i givim dispela tok long Hiram:

original: “As you are well aware, due to the wars waged on all sides against my father David, he could not build a house for the Name of the LORD his God until the LORD had put his enemies under his feet.
translation: Ol i save long ol dispela, long ol wok bilong pait namel long ol sait, papa bilong mi, Davit, em i no inap long buildim haus bilong Nem bilong LORD, na LORD i no inap yet kamdaun mekim enemy bilong em i go daun unda fut bilong em.

original: But now the LORD my God has given me rest on every side, and there is no adversary or crisis.
translation: Nau Bikpela God bilong mi givim mi rip long olgeta sait, na i no gat eni man i harim o bug balus.

original: So behold, I plan to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God, according to what the LORD said to my father David: ‘I will put your son on your throne in your place, and he will build the house for My Name.’
translation: Mi laik bilden haus long Nem bilong LORD God bilong mi, olsem LORD i tokim papa bilong mi, David: 'Mi bai putim pikinini bilong yu long throne bilong yu, na em bai bildim haus long Nem bilong Mi.'

original: Now therefore, order that cedars of Lebanon be cut down for me. My servants will be with your servants, and I will pay your servants whatever wages you set, for you know that there are none among us as skilled in logging as the Sidonians.”
translation: Nau olsem, mipela i askim yu long kamdaun timber cedar bilong Lebanon. Wokman bilong mi bai stap wantaim wokman bilong yu, na mipela bai peim wokman bilong yu olgeta ka na yu setim, bikos yu save olsem i no gat skil yet long logging olsem Ol Sidonians.

original: When Hiram received Solomon’s message, he rejoiced greatly and said, “Blessed be the LORD this day! He has given David a wise son over this great people!”
translation: Taim Hiram harim tok bilong Solomon, em i amamas long hap bilong en na em i tok, "Praiz i go long LORD todai! Em i givim David wanpela pikinini i gat save long dispela bikpela ples!"

original: Then Hiram sent a reply to Solomon, saying: “I have received your message; I will do all you desire regarding the cedar and cypress timber.
translation: Hiram i givim bek tok long Solomon, i tok olsem: “Mi receivim tok bilong yu; Yu mekim ol samting we yu laik long timber cedar na timba cypress.”

original: My servants will haul the logs from Lebanon to the Sea, and I will float them as rafts by sea to the place you specify. There I will separate the logs, and you can take them away. And in exchange, you can meet my needs by providing my household with food.”
translation: Sarvim man bai karim timba long Lebanan i go long Solwara, na mi bai tirim ol i go long solwara olsem rak, na yu inap putim long ples we yu laik. Long ples ya, mi bai wailisim timba, na yu ken kisim ol i go. Na inap yu givim ka long mi, bai yu supliesim husat bilong mipela long kai kai.

original: So Hiram provided Solomon with all the cedar and cypress timber he wanted,
translation: Na Hiram king bilong Taire i givim Solomon king bilong Israel olgeta kad ar palm bilong cedar na sipres em i laik.

original: and year after year Solomon would provide Hiram with 20,000 cors of wheat as food for his household, as well as 20,000 baths of pure olive oil.
translation: Na Solomon i save givim Hiram kai-kai, em i 20,000 kors bilong whea, olsem kaikai bilong husat i stap long haus bilong em, na tu 20,000 baths bilong oil olive, yia bihain long yia.

original: And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as He had promised him. There was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty.
translation: Na Papa God i givim Solomon save, olsem Hem i promis long em. Hiram na Solomon i gat pipel, na tupela i mekim pinis treaty.

original: Then King Solomon conscripted a labor force of 30,000 men from all Israel.
translation: King Solomona i kam bek long wokim wan grup strong bilong 30,000 man long olgeta Israel.

original: He sent them to Lebanon in monthly shifts of 10,000 men, so that they would spend one month in Lebanon and two months at home. And Adoniram was in charge of the forced labor.
translation: Em i sendim ol go long Lebanan long mun wik shift, ten tausen man, ol i wokim wan mun long Lebanan na tu mun long hus. Na Adoniram i stap bos long wok bilong fos.

original: Solomon had 70,000 porters and 80,000 stonecutters in the mountains,
translation: Solomon i gat 70,000 ol i karim kakaruk na 80,000 ol i katim ston long maunten.

original: not including his 3,300 foremen who supervised the workers.
translation: Ol bos bilong em, 3,300 man, i no inkludim, ol i lukautim wok long ol wokman.

original: And the king commanded them to quarry large, costly stones to lay the foundation of the temple with dressed stones.
translation: King i givim tok long ol, oli mas kam autim ston bilong bai pris, bikpela na kos, na oli mas usim dispela ston i dressim long planim bun bilong haos lotu.

original: So Solomon’s and Hiram’s builders, along with the Gebalites, quarried the stone and prepared the timber and stone for the construction of the temple.
translation: Wokman bilong Solomon na Hiram, ol i hamstring wantaim Ol pipol bilong Gebal, ol i katim ston, na ol i preparim timber na ston long taim bilong wokim Haus Lotu.

original: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt, in the month of Ziv, the second month of the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, he began to build the house of the LORD.
translation: Long 480 yia igo pinis olsem Israeliti ikam long graun bilong Egypt, long mun Ziv, mun namba tu bilong yia namba fo bilong Solomon i bos bilong Israel, em i statim wokim haus bilong LORD.

original: The house that King Solomon built for the LORD was sixty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.
translation: Haus we King Solomona wokim bilong Bikpela i go long sixty kan, em i go wide twenty kan, na em i go antap thirty kan.

original: The portico at the front of the main hall of the temple was twenty cubits long, extending across the width of the temple and projecting out ten cubits in front of the temple.
translation: Poris bilong fron bilong long haus bikpela bilong tempple em i gat twenti kubiti, i go raun long wik bilong tempple, na i kam aut i stap bifor tempple ten kubiti.

original: He also had narrow windows framed high in the temple.
translation: Em i gat tu winowo narakain i kamapim longwe loa long hap bilong tempele.

original: Against the walls of the temple and the inner sanctuary, Solomon built a chambered structure around the temple, in which he constructed the side rooms.
translation: Long sait bilong templa na inner hap santuari, Solomon i bin mekim wanpela haus we i go raunim templa, na long em, em i mekim rum bilong sai.

original: The bottom floor was five cubits wide, the middle floor six cubits, and the third floor seven cubits. He also placed offset ledges around the outside of the temple, so that nothing would be inserted into its walls.
translation: Fla bung long en i go wid five kibit, fla mitella i go wid six kibit, na fla thrid i go wid seven kibit. Na em pila wampi long autsid bilong templa, bilong mekim narapela samting i no ken go insait long wal bilong en.

original: The temple was constructed using finished stones cut at the quarry, so that no hammer or chisel or any other iron tool was heard in the temple while it was being built.
translation: Haus lotu em i bin mekim olsem, ol i usim ston finish nau, ol i katim long ples we ol i kisim ston, naso nogat hamar, nogat sel, nogat narapela tola ais i bin harim insait long haus lotu wail em i bin mekim.

original: The entrance to the bottom floor was on the south side of the temple. A stairway led up to the middle level, and from there to the third floor.
translation: Entrens long saut sais bilong haos bilong God i go inap long pundaun flo. Wan stairwei i go ap long mitel levul, na from hap ia i go long thrid flo.

original: So Solomon built the temple and finished it, roofing it with beams and planks of cedar.
translation: Na Solomon i bikim haus lotu, i kamapim pinis, na i putim bem na plank bilong seda antap long ruf.

original: He built chambers all along the temple, each five cubits high and attached to the temple with beams of cedar.
translation: Em i bikim rum bilong en longlong olgeta hap bilong haos bilong Lotu, narapela ai ka five hap mit i go apo, na em i joineim wantaim haos bilong Lotu long bem bilong sedar.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Solomon, saying:
translation: Neken tok bilong GOD i kam long Solomon, i mekim tok:

original: “As for this temple you are building, if you walk in My statutes, carry out My ordinances, and keep all My commandments by walking in them, I will fulfill through you the promise I made to your father David.
translation: Long hap tumas, haus lotu yu bilong buildim, sikir yu i go long wei bilong statuts bilong Mi, yu strongim ol lo bilong Mi, yu holim strongim ol ka bilong Mi na go long wei bilong ol, Mi bai kamapim promis bilong Mi i mekim long tumbuna David.

original: And I will dwell among the Israelites and will not abandon My people Israel.”
translation: Mi bai stap klostu long ol Yisrael na mi no go lusim pipo bilong mi Yisrael.

original: So Solomon built the temple and finished it.
translation: Na Solomone i bikim haus lotu na i winim gut.

original: He lined the interior walls with cedar paneling from the floor of the temple to the ceiling, and he covered the floor with cypress boards.
translation: Em i kamapim bek bilong wal i stap insait long panelling bilong seda, stat long flur bilong haus lotu igo go long rof bilong haus, na em i kisim flur wantaim bord bilong saipres.

original: He partitioned off the twenty cubits at the rear of the temple with cedar boards from floor to ceiling to form within the temple an inner sanctuary, the Most Holy Place.
translation: Em i partitionam apart olgeta twenty kubit long baksait bilong templa na i kisim bod na timbar cedar fraim floa go long seling, ili mekim narapela hap insait long templa, hap em i kolim Holi of the Holies.

original: And the main hall in front of this room was forty cubits long.
translation: Na hap bilong hus long hap bilong rum ini emi bin forty kibit lon.

original: The cedar paneling inside the temple was carved with gourds and open flowers. Everything was cedar; not a stone could be seen.
translation: Kapul bilong seda i stap inside long haus lotu, na ol i kamapim ol gourds na flawa i op. Olegta samting i stap seda; nakarai ston i no inap lukim.

original: Solomon also prepared the inner sanctuary within the temple to set the ark of the covenant of the LORD there.
translation: Solomon i redi stap long ples bilong God insait long temple, we bilong ples bilong Bikpela, ol i putim ark bilong kaovenan bilong Bikpela i go insait.

original: The inner sanctuary was twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and twenty cubits high. He overlaid the inside with pure gold, and he also overlaid the altar of cedar.
translation: Haus lotu insait em i go twenti cubit long, twenti cubit wide, na twenti cubit high. Em i kisim gol we i kalek na putim insait, na em i putim gol long alta we em wokim long diwai cedar.

original: So Solomon overlaid the inside of the temple with pure gold, and he extended gold chains across the front of the inner sanctuary, which was overlaid with gold.
translation: Na Solomon i kova insait long haus lotu wantaim gol pu, na em i stretim chain bilong gol longwe long sait bilong plaes bilong beten i stap, inner santuari, em i kova wantaim gol pu.

original: So he overlaid with gold the whole interior of the temple, until everything was completely finished. He also overlaid with gold the entire altar that belonged to the inner sanctuary.
translation: Em i kapim gild longen holi insait bilong templa, na olgeta wok i go pinis. Em i kapim gild long halivim bilong ofa, bilong holi ples insait long templa.

original: In the inner sanctuary he made two cherubim, each ten cubits high, out of olive wood.
translation: Long insait bilong templa em i mekim tupela kerubim, nau tupela i go long 10 kibit, ol i kam long diwai oliv.

original: One wing of the first cherub was five cubits long, and the other wing was five cubits long as well. So the full wingspan was ten cubits.
translation: Wan wing bilong cherub em i kam first i go long five kibit, na nather wing em i go long five kibit tu. Olsem na wingspan i go ol loa ten kibit.

original: The second cherub also measured ten cubits; both cherubim had the same size and shape,
translation: Nambatu kerubim i mas long ten cubits; botu tu kerubim i gat wankain sais na shap,

original: and the height of each cherub was ten cubits.
translation: Hait bilong cherub ol i go yet, em i stap ten kyub.

original: And he placed the cherubim inside the innermost room of the temple. Since their wings were spread out, the wing of the first cherub touched one wall, while the wing of the second cherub touched the other wall, and in the middle of the room their wingtips touched.
translation: Na em putim ain bilong God i go insait long rum bilong indaida long haus lotu bilong Israel. Bikos wing bilong ol i stret ol i go, wing bilong cherubim namba wan i kisim wanpela wal, na wing bilong cherubim namba tu i kisim narapela wal, na long mit bilong rum poin bilong wing bilong ol i kisim.

original: He also overlaid the cherubim with gold.
translation: Em i kovava kerubim wantaim gol.

original: Then he carved the walls all around the temple, in both the inner and outer sanctuaries, with carved engravings of cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers.
translation: Em kam kutim banis long wal long olgeta sait bilong hais temppel, long insait na outsait bilong ples bilong holiholi, wantaim ol gravings i kamap bilong cherubim, palmtrees, na flauna i op.

original: And he overlaid the temple floor with gold in both the inner and outer sanctuaries.
translation: Em kapautim floa bilong temple wantaim gol long inner na outer santuari.

original: For the entrance to the inner sanctuary, Solomon constructed doors of olive wood with five-sided doorposts.
translation: Long entrens bilong ples insanctuari, Solomon i mekim diwai oliv bilong doa wantaim door post we i gat faiv kona.

original: The double doors were made of olive wood, and he carved into them cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers and overlaid the cherubim and palm trees with hammered gold.
translation: Debe tupela i mak olsem diwai bilong olive, na em i katim pinis cherubim, palmtrees, na flauna i op pinis long ol, na ol i kisim gol i paitim pinis na kisim i go ap long en cherubim na palmtrees.

original: In the same way he made four-sided doorposts of olive wood for the sanctuary entrance.
translation: Olsem nau em i mekim post bilong door long four kona long diwai oliv long entris bilong ples santuari.

original: The two doors were made of cypress wood, and each had two folding panels.
translation: Tupela daor i mak ol i usim timber cypress, na narapela i gat tupela panel i go bung.

original: He carved into them cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers; and he overlaid them with gold, hammered evenly over the carvings.
translation: Em i karam long ol kerubim, palmti, na flawa i op; na em i kapim gol na kova long ol, em i hamarim olsem wankain long karam.

original: Solomon built the inner courtyard with three rows of dressed stone and one row of trimmed cedar beams.
translation: Solomon i bin mekim kaunteri insait long haus wantaim tripela lain bilong ston i bin katim na pakim na wanpela lain bilong timba cedar i bin katim na kisim.

original: The foundation of the house of the LORD was laid in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign, in the month of Ziv.
translation: Basis bilong haus bilong LORD i go daun long yia namba fo bilong paitim Solomon i bos, long mun Ziv.

original: In his eleventh year and eighth month, the month of Bul, the temple was finished in every detail and according to every specification. So he built the temple in seven years.
translation: Long yia ikam eleven na mun namba ate, mun Bul, haos em i kamap pinis long olgeta detel, olgeta samting i go wel long plan. Na em i bikim haos bilong Lotu long sevenpela yia.

original: Solomon, however, took thirteen years to complete the construction of his entire palace.
translation: Solomon i usim thirteen yia, na em i kamapim pinis bilding bilong haus bilong em yet.

original: He built the House of the Forest of Lebanon a hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high, with four rows of cedar pillars supporting the cedar beams.
translation: Em i bikim Haus bilong Bus bilong Lebanon, em i gat hundred kubiti long, fifty kubiti wide, na thirty kubiti high, wantaim foa lain bilong silians cedar i sapotim bim cedar.

original: The house was roofed with cedar above the beams that rested on the pillars—forty-five beams, fifteen per row.
translation: Haus i kamap na i kisim rif wantaim seda lonshan long beams, ol i stap long sait bilong pillars—forti-faiv beams, fifteen long wanpela row.

original: There were three rows of high windows facing one another in three tiers.
translation: Tripla lain bilong windoa i go antap, ol i luk tung daun long en, long tripela lebel.

original: All the doorways had rectangular frames, with the openings facing one another in three tiers.
translation: Olgeta entri long haus i gat frem rectangular, wantaim ol i kamapim hap bilong en i go wankain long tripela laip.

original: Solomon made his colonnade fifty cubits long and thirty cubits wide, with a portico in front of it and a canopy with pillars in front of the portico.
translation: Solomon wokim kolonad bilong en, long 50 kibit, na wide 30 kibit, wantaim portiko long front bilong em, na kanopi wantaim pilia long front bilong portiko.

original: In addition, he built a hall for the throne, the Hall of Justice, where he was to judge. It was paneled with cedar from floor to ceiling.
translation: Em i bikim Haus Bilong Jastis, em i haus bilong throne, we em i mas jujumit, na em i koverd long cedar long graun na go antap long punda.

original: And the palace where Solomon would live, set further back, was of similar construction. He also made a palace like this hall for Pharaoh’s daughter, whom he had married.
translation: Na haus kiak bilong Solomon i go stap i go bek gen, em i olsem nau long wokim. Na em i wokim haus namba tu olsem haus bilong miting long meri bilong Pharaoh, em i bin maritim.

original: All these buildings were constructed with costly stones, cut to size and trimmed with saws inside and out from the foundation to the eaves, and from the outside to the great courtyard.
translation: Ol gebou yumi wokim, ol i usim ston i go long moni, em i katem long saz, na ol i bikim klia na strongim insait na ausait, stat long we bilong ples i go antap long ivs bilong haus, na stat long ouside i go insait long ples bilong bikpela kot.

original: The foundations were laid with large, costly stones, some ten cubits long and some eight cubits long.
translation: Bun bilong haus i go daun, ol i usim ston bilong moni, ston nogut i gat ten kibit lon, na ston narak i gat eight kibit lon.

original: Above these were high-grade stones, cut to size, and cedar beams.
translation: Long olsem stoun bilong hap graun i kamap strong na katim olsem size, na timba bilong seda.

original: The great courtyard was surrounded by three rows of dressed stone and a row of trimmed cedar beams, as were the inner courtyard and portico of the house of the LORD.
translation: Bikpela ka long ples ili bin go raunim triya lain bilong ston i kamap strongim na wanpela lain bilong timbar cedar i katim, olsem na inner ka long ples ili na porc ili bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: Now King Solomon sent to bring Huram from Tyre.
translation: Nau King Solomona i sendem man go bringim Hurama from Tairusi.

original: He was the son of a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a craftsman in bronze. Huram had great skill, understanding, and knowledge for every kind of bronze work. So he came to King Solomon and carried out all his work.
translation: Huram em i pikinini bilong widow, em i man bilong tripe bilong Naphtali. Papa bilong em i man bilong Tyre, na em i wokman long bronz, gat bikpela save, understanding, na knowlege long olgeta kain kina wok long bronz. Em i kam bek long King Solomon, na wokim pinis olgeta wok bilong em.

original: He cast two pillars of bronze, each eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference.
translation: Em i kamapim twopela pilia kalabus, nen long 18 kubiti, na 12 kubiti long bikim.

original: He also made two capitals of cast bronze to set on top of the pillars, each capital five cubits high.
translation: Em i mekim tu kabonet bilong bronz kas, long putim antap long pilia, na igap long en, em i go hap long faiv kyubiti.

original: For the capitals on top of the pillars he made a network of lattice, with wreaths of chainwork, seven for each capital.
translation: Long kapitol i go antap long pilia em mekim wanpela netwok bilong kapa kapa, wantaim ol wreaths bilong chain wok, seven long wanpela kapitol.

original: Likewise, he made the pillars with two rows of pomegranates around each grating to cover each capital atop the pillars.
translation: Em mekim pilia olsem, wantaim tu raon pomegranet i go raun long sampela gris long en, na bilong kova sampela kapital ibaksa long tep bilong pilia.

original: And the capitals atop the pillars in the portico were shaped like lilies, four cubits high.
translation: Na kapital i stap antap long pilia long poriko ol i kamap olsem lilai, four kibit long.

original: On the capitals of both pillars, just above the rounded projection next to the network, were the two hundred pomegranates in rows encircling each capital.
translation: Long hap bilong tupela pilia i go, just abuvim rounded projekshon nambis aide long netwok, em i gat two hundred pomegranate i rait long lain, ol i go raun long hap bilong pilia.

original: Thus he set up the pillars at the portico of the temple. The pillar to the south he named Jachin, and the pillar to the north he named Boaz.
translation: Em plantim pilia i go long paus bilong hause lotu. Pilia long sait bilong saut em i givim nem Jachin, na pilia long sait bilong not em i givim nem Boaz.

original: And the tops of the pillars were shaped like lilies. So the work of the pillars was completed.
translation: Na hap bilong pilia i kamap olsem lilai. Na wok bilong pilia i go pinis.

original: He also made the Sea of cast metal. It was circular in shape, measuring ten cubits from rim to rim, five cubits in height, and thirty cubits in circumference.
translation: Na em i mekim was Solwara bilong metalmixim. Em i krismas olsem bola, em i mesurim ten cubit from rim go long rim, faiv cubits long hap, na teti cubits long sait bilong em.

original: Below the rim, ornamental buds encircled it, ten per cubit all the way around the Sea, cast in two rows as a part of the Sea.
translation: Bilo long rim, ol ornamental buds i go raunim em, ten kubiti olsem yunit bilong mesuremen, long ol wei raunim Solwara, wail ol i kamap strong long tu row olsem part bilong Solwara.

original: The Sea stood on twelve oxen, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south, and three facing east. The Sea rested on them, with all their hindquarters toward the center.
translation: Solwara i stap antap long twelve bulmakau, tripela i luk i go long not, tripela i luk i go long wes, tripela i luk i go long saut, na tripela i luk i go long ist. Solwara i stap i go daun long ol, na hinda pa bilong ol i kam insait long mitim.

original: It was a handbreadth thick, and its rim was fashioned like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It could hold two thousand baths.
translation: Em i thick olsem wan han wantaim, na rim bilong en i wokim olsem brim bilong kap, olsem flawa bilong lili, na inap holim tu tousan baths.

original: In addition, he made ten movable stands of bronze, each four cubits long, four cubits wide, and three cubits high.
translation: Em mekim ten stap bilong karim i go olsem longpela bronze, nen long four kibit, wide four kibit, na hai three kibit.

original: This was the design of the stands: They had side panels attached to uprights,
translation: Em i plan bilong ol stends: Ol i gat panel long sait i kamap long poro.

original: and on the panels between the uprights were lions, oxen, and cherubim. On the uprights was a pedestal above, and below the lions and oxen were wreaths of beveled work.
translation: Na long panal i go antap long post na klosem, i gat lion, bulmakau, na keribim. Long post, i gat pesal i go antap, na aninit long ol lion na bulmakau i gat wok bilong katim na kisim hap olsem samting bilong winim.

original: Each stand had four bronze wheels with bronze axles and a basin resting on four supports, with wreaths at each side.
translation: Nambis olgeta i gat fours bronzwil wantaim akse bronzwil na bekken i stap antap long foap hap bilong en, wantaim klosim leif i stap long sampela hap.

original: The opening to each stand inside the crown at the top was one cubit deep, with a round opening like the design of a pedestal, a cubit and a half wide. And around its opening were engravings, but the panels of the stands were square, not round.
translation: Opensing bilong dispela ston na ol stand insait long krone bilong hap, long top, em i depp long wan kubit, wantaim opensing bilong em olsem desain bilong betel, em i gat braod long wan kubit na hap. Na arond long opensing bilong en i gat gravim, tasol panel bilong dispela ston ol i stap squar, no raun.

original: There were four wheels under the panels, and the axles of the wheels were attached to the stand; each wheel was a cubit and a half in diameter.
translation: Fo wils i go daun bilo panio, na aksel bilong ol i jonap long ston;wiket wiol em i gat sait hap fut in diameter, olsem wanpela kubit na hap fut.

original: The wheels were made like chariot wheels; their axles, rims, spokes, and hubs were all of cast metal.
translation: Ol wil motoka i kamap olsem wil bilong kareta; ol aksel, ol rim, ol spok, na ol senta bilong ol i mekim apaun sampela metal i kampim.

original: Each stand had four handles, one for each corner, projecting from the stand.
translation: Evri wanpela ston i gat foa hap, wan long eni kona bilong ston, na ol i kam aut long ston.

original: At the top of each stand was a circular band half a cubit high. The supports and panels were cast as a unit with the top of the stand.
translation: Long hap bilong iviri wanpela ston i gat banis circular, em i halfla kubit hi. Supots na panel i go wankain cast wantaim hap bilong ston.

original: He engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees on the surfaces of the supports and panels, wherever each had space, with wreaths all around.
translation: Em i kisim na karim kerubim, lain, na palmti long sampela hap bilong ol strong bilong boaden, we bilong en i gat spes, olgeta i go, wantaim korona i go raun olgeta.

original: In this way he made the ten stands, each with the same casting, dimensions, and shape.
translation: Em i mekim despela ten ston na wara, wanwan bilong ol i gat sem tumora, siz, na faom.

original: He also made ten bronze basins, each holding forty baths and measuring four cubits across, one basin for each of the ten stands.
translation: Em i mekim ten bekens bronze, na wan bekhen i holim forty baths, bekhen em i gat wik four cubits, na em i putim wan bekhen long wanpela bilong dispela ten ston.

original: He set five stands on the south side of the temple and five on the north, and he put the Sea on the south side, at the southeast corner of the temple.
translation: Em plantim five pepa bilong karai long sait bilong not bilong Haus Lotu na five long sait bilong sais, na em putim Solwara long sait bilong sais, long koner bilong saut-east bilong Haus Lotu.

original: Additionally, Huram made the pots, shovels, and sprinkling bowls. So Huram finished all the work that he had undertaken for King Solomon in the house of the LORD:
translation: Huram wokim pot, speda, na bol bilong sprinklem. Na so Huram finisim olgeta wok we em bin statim longen bilong King Solomona long haus bilong LORD:

original: the two pillars; the two bowl-shaped capitals atop the pillars; the two sets of network covering both bowls of the capitals atop the pillars;
translation: Tupela pilia; tupela geta bilong kapitel we i stap antap long pilia; tupela set bilong netwok i kaevim tupela bol bilong kapitel we i stap antap long pilia.

original: the four hundred pomegranates for the two sets of network (two rows of pomegranates for each network covering both the bowl-shaped capitals atop the pillars);
translation: Em i stap four hundred pomegranat long tupela set bilong netwok, we tupela lain pomegranat i go long wanem samting ia bilong netwok, na kambekim tu olgeta kapital bilong baret i stap antap long sulum.

original: the ten stands; the ten basins on the stands;
translation: Tenpela stend; tenpela was basin long tenpela stend;

original: the Sea; the twelve oxen underneath the Sea;
translation: Solwara; twelv bilong ol oxen i go daun bilo Solwara;

original: and the pots, shovels, and sprinkling bowls. All the articles that Huram made for King Solomon in the house of the LORD were made of burnished bronze.
translation: Na pot, na spedi, na bol ip long mekim ren. Ol samting Huram i mekim long King Solomon long haus bilong Jehovah i mekim olsem nau, olgeta i bin mekim long bronz we i bin polishim.

original: The king had them cast in clay molds in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zarethan.
