translation: King i kisim ol i go long molding bilong klai long plein bilong river Jordan, long bihain bilong Sukot na Zarethan.

original: Solomon left all these articles unweighed, because there were so many. The weight of the bronze could not be determined.
translation: Solomon lusim olgeta samting long hap, em i no waim bilong ol i planti tasol. Wet bilong mami em i no inap long kamap.

original: Solomon also made all the furnishings for the house of the LORD: the golden altar; the golden table on which was placed the Bread of the Presence;
translation: Solomon wokim pinis ol samting bilong Haus Sindaun bilong Lod: alta bilong gol; tebol bilong gol we i kamap long en, na Bred bilong Presens, Ka bilong Pipia, i save putim.

original: the lampstands of pure gold in front of the inner sanctuary, five on the right side and five on the left; the gold flowers, lamps, and tongs;
translation: Ol lait hus long gol pua i stap long sait bilong rumu i go insait, faiv long sait rait na faiv long sait left; ol flawa long gol, lait, na tong.

original: the pure gold basins, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and censers; and the gold hinges for the doors of the inner temple (that is, the Most Holy Place) as well as for the doors of the main hall of the temple.
translation: basin bilong golpela gold we i paiawer, ol samting bilong kisim wail, ol bol bilong sprinklem, ol sip bilong karim, na ol pes bilong bungim smel; na henges bilong golpela gold bilong door bilong Haus Bilong Oltaim Lotu (em i temple insait, Hus Bilong Bikpela Lotu) na henges bilong golpela gold bilong door bilong haus bilong bikpela lotu.

original: So all the work that King Solomon had performed for the house of the LORD was completed. Then Solomon brought in the items his father David had dedicated—the silver, the gold, and the furnishings—and he placed them in the treasuries of the house of the LORD.
translation: Olgeta wok we King Solomona bin mekim pinis long haus bilong LORD em i kamap pinis. Solomona bin bringim iet long ol samting we papa David ibin dedike, olsem silva, gołd, na ol samting bilong decorate, na em i putim ol iet ya long hap bilong save ol samting bilong value bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: At that time Solomon assembled before him in Jerusalem the elders of Israel—all the tribal heads and family leaders of the Israelites—to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Zion, the City of David.
translation: Long taem ya, Solomon i kam asamble oda bilong Israel, ol bikpela man bilong tribe na ol bikpela man bilong famili bilong Israel, bifo em long Yerusalem, i go bringim ark bilong kaen kot bilong LORD hait long Sayan, Taun bilong Dauid.

original: And all the men of Israel came together to King Solomon at the feast in the seventh month, the month of Ethanim.
translation: Na ol man meri bilong Isrel i kam tugeta long King Solomona long kaen feis long mun seventh, mun Ethanim.

original: When all the elders of Israel had arrived, the priests took up the ark,
translation: Wanpela taim ol big man bilong Isrel i kam pinis, ol pries i kisim arka.

original: and they brought up the ark of the LORD and the Tent of Meeting with all its sacred furnishings. So the priests and Levites carried them up.
translation: Na ol i kisim bek arka bilong Lod na Haus Bilong Miting wantaim ol samting bilong holidei. Na prist na Levai i karim ol i go antap.

original: There, before the ark, King Solomon and the whole congregation of Israel who had assembled with him sacrificed so many sheep and oxen that they could not be counted or numbered.
translation: Bifor bokis bilong Gad, King Solomon na olgeta yangpela Isael i bin katim long en, ol i kilim planti sheep na bulmakau, tasol ol i no inap kaunim o nambautim.

original: Then the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, the Most Holy Place, beneath the wings of the cherubim.
translation: Na prist i kam bekim ark bilong kovena bilong LORD i go insait long Ples Bilong Singsing Olsem, Haus Lotu, aninit long wing bilong kerubim.

original: For the cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark and overshadowed the ark and its poles.
translation: Kerubim i go pasim wing bilong ol long ples arka i stap, na ol i kambek ikaikim bek arka na pole bilong em.

original: The poles extended far enough that their ends were visible from the Holy Place in front of the inner sanctuary, but not from outside the Holy Place; and they are there to this day.
translation: Stik i go long olsem, poroman bilong ol i kukim long Holi Ples bifo inner santuari, tasol i no kukim long nait bilong Holi Ples; na ol i stap yet long tude.

original: There was nothing in the ark except the two stone tablets that Moses had placed in it at Horeb, where the LORD had made a covenant with the Israelites after they had come out of the land of Egypt.
translation: I no got narapela samting long bokis, tasol tupela ston bilong la i stap, moses putim long em long Horeb, we bilong LORD i mekim agriement wantaim Israelites bihaenim ol i kamaut long kantri Egypt.

original: And when the priests came out of the Holy Place, the cloud filled the house of the LORD
translation: Na wén priest igo kamaut long Ples Bilong Holi Spirit, klau i kamap fulim haus bilong LORD.

original: so that the priests could not stand there to minister because of the cloud; for the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD.
translation: Na prist i no inap stap long ples bilong en, ol i no inap wark long sabis bikos kol bilong heven i kam, glori bilong LORD i fulim haus bilong LORD.

original: Then Solomon declared: “The LORD has said that He would dwell in the thick cloud.
translation: Na Solomon i tok olsem: “Papa God i tok olsem, em bai i stap long kloud i bikpela.”

original: I have indeed built You an exalted house, a place for You to dwell forever.”
translation: Mi bin bilipim haus bilong yu we i go het long heaven, ples bilong yu bai yu stap oltaim.

original: And as the whole assembly of Israel stood there, the king turned around and blessed them all
translation: Na ol assembli bilong Israel i stap olgeta, king i kam bek gen na em i givim blesing long ol.

original: and said: “Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who has fulfilled with His own hand what He spoke with His mouth to my father David, saying,
translation: Tokim: "Praiz i go long Lod, God bilong Israel, we i kamap strong olgeta from han bilong en, em i tokim mouth bilong en i tok long tupela papa David,"

original: ‘Since the day I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I have not chosen a city from any tribe of Israel in which to build a house so that My Name would be there. But I have chosen David to be over My people Israel.’
translation: Sinds long wei mi bringim pipo bilong mi Israel i kamap long Egip, mi no bin choosim wanpela siti long ol clan bilong Israel, olsem mi bai mekim haus go long en, olsem nem bilong mi bai stap long en. Bai mi choosim Dauid, em i go bosim pipo bilong mi Israel.

original: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a house for the Name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Em i stap insait long het bilong papa bilong me, Papa David, long mekim wanpela haus bilong nem bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: But the LORD said to my father David, ‘Since it was in your heart to build a house for My Name, you have done well to have this in your heart.
translation: Papa God i tok long tumbuna David bilong yu, "Long hart bilong yu, yu laik bikim haus bilong Nem bilong Mi, yu mekim gutpela tru olsem yu gat dispela tingting long hart bilong yu."

original: Nevertheless, you are not the one to build it; but your son, your own offspring, will build the house for My Name.’
translation: Nogatweika, yu no stap long buildim; bikos pikinini bilong yu, em yet, bai buildim haus long Nem Bilong Mi.

original: Now the LORD has fulfilled the word that He spoke. I have succeeded my father David, and I sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised. I have built the house for the Name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Nau LORD i kamapim tok ol i tokim. Mi go pinis long ples bilong tumbuna David, na mi sidaun long sit bilong Israel, olsem LORD i promis. Mi buildim haus bilong Nem bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: And there I have provided a place for the ark, which contains the covenant of the LORD that He made with our fathers when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.”
translation: Na mi bin givim ples long bokis, em i gat kaivenant bilong LORD, we em bingim long tumbuna bilong mipela, long taim em i kamautim ol stap long kantri Egypt.

original: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in front of the whole assembly of Israel, spread out his hands toward heaven,
translation: Na Solomon i stap bifo altiya bilong Papa God, tafel bilong sacrfis, bifoa long ol pipol bilong Isrel i kam togeta, na i mekim prea long Papa God, i waisim han bilong en i go apo long heven.

original: and said: “O LORD, God of Israel, there is no God like You in heaven above or on earth below, keeping Your covenant of loving devotion with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts.
translation: Na tokim long LORD: “O LORD, God bilong Israel, i no gat God narakai yu long heven antap o long graun bolo, yu yet i holim kaanu bilong lovingsik wantaim wokmanmeri bilong yu ol i wok bifor yu wantaim ol hart bilong ol.

original: You have kept Your promise to Your servant, my father David. What You spoke with Your mouth You have fulfilled with Your hand this day.
translation: Yu kilim promis bilong yu long servant bilong yu, papa bilong mi, David. Olsem yu tokim long mow bilong yu, yu mekim gen olgeta long han bilong yu dispela dei.

original: Therefore now, O LORD, God of Israel, keep for Your servant, my father David, what You promised when You said: ‘You will never fail to have a man to sit before Me on the throne of Israel, if only your descendants guard their way to walk before Me as you have done.’
translation: Olong nau, LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, bihainim promis bilong yu long sarvim man bilong yu, papa David bilong mi, olsem yu tokim olsem: 'Yu no go larim man sibaken long sit long throne bilong Israel, long tingting ol descendent bilong yumi yet strongim rot bilong yumi long warkabaut bifo yu olsem na yu yet kam.'

original: And now, O God of Israel, please confirm what You promised to Your servant, my father David.
translation: Na nau, O God bilong Israel, ples konfirmim olsem yu promis long servant bilong yu, papa bilong mi, David.

original: But will God indeed dwell upon the earth? Even heaven, the highest heaven, cannot contain You, much less this temple I have built.
translation: Olsem, God bai I stap long graun? Hapin heven, heven i go antap, inap holim Yu, maski olsem dispela haus lotu mi bin mekim i no inap holim Yu.

original: Yet regard the prayer and plea of Your servant, O LORD my God, so that You may hear the cry and the prayer that Your servant is praying before You today.
translation: Bikpela, lukim na harim prea na kisim bek bilong wokman yu, olsem yu harim kisim bek na prea bilong wokman yu, em i praen tude bifo yu.

original: May Your eyes be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My Name shall be there,’ so that You may hear the prayer that Your servant prays toward this place.
translation: Mai ol i go op long ai bilong Yu long hap bilong tempel nau na nait, long ples we Yu tokim, 'Nem bilong Yu i stap long hap,' Olsem na bai yu harim praer bilong wokman bilong Yu ol i pray long dispela ples.

original: Hear the plea of Your servant and of Your people Israel when they pray toward this place. May You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place. May You hear and forgive.
translation: Harim tok bilong wokman yu na pipol Israel wanpela taim oli prea long dispela hap, bihainim prea long dispela temple. Yu yet harim tok long heven, haus painim bilong yu. Harim na givim sin, Strongpela Papa bilong heaven.

original: When a man sins against his neighbor and is required to take an oath, and he comes to take an oath before Your altar in this temple,
translation: Wanpela man i givim bikpela sin long narapela man, na em i kam long tekim oth, na em i go long tekim oth bifo altare bilong Yu inside dispela haus lotu,

original: then may You hear from heaven and act. May You judge Your servants, condemning the wicked man by bringing down on his own head what he has done, and justifying the righteous man by rewarding him according to his righteousness.
translation: Bai yu harim tok long heven na wokim. Yu jijim servant bilong yu, kondemn ol man i no gat laif, bringim bek long hed bilong em yet ol samting em mekim, na givim rait long ol man i gat laif, bekim ol gutpela pasin bilong ol.

original: When Your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against You, and they return to You and confess Your name, praying and pleading with You in this temple,
translation: Wanpela taim pipol bilong Israel i lukim dai bifor enemy bekis ol i mekim sin long Yu, na ol i kam bek long Yu na tokaut nem bilong Yu, ol i praid na beten long Yu insait haos bilong Lotu hia,

original: then may You hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your people Israel. May You restore them to the land You gave to their fathers.
translation: Na bai yumi harim tok bilong heven, forgivim sin blong pipol Israel, na bringim baksantaim ol long lan we yumi givim long tumbuna blong ol.

original: When the skies are shut and there is no rain because Your people have sinned against You, and they pray toward this place and confess Your name, and they turn from their sins because You have afflicted them,
translation: Wanpela taim heven i kamap strong na ren i no kam bekus pipol bilong yu bin sin agensim yu, na ol i go pray long wanpela hap spesal bilong dispela, na ol i taitim nem bilong yu, na ol i lusim sin bilong ol bekus yu bin bikim ol i suf,

original: then may You hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, so that You may teach them the good way in which they should walk. May You send rain on the land that You gave Your people as an inheritance.
translation: Na bai yu harim i kam bek long heven, forgivim sin bilong servants yu, pipol Israel, na tisim ol long gutpela rot ol mas wokim. Salim ren i kam daun long graun we yu givim ol long inheritans.

original: When famine or plague comes upon the land, or blight or mildew or locusts or grasshoppers, or when their enemy besieges them in their cities, whatever plague or sickness may come,
translation: Wanem taim hangre o sos orait i kam long graun, o ikon na mamiwar na lokis o gras hopa, o wane taim enemy bilong ol i kam na sarim ol long town bilong ol, wanem kain sos o sickness bai i kam,

original: then may whatever prayer or petition Your people Israel make—each knowing his own afflictions and spreading out his hands toward this temple—
translation: Olgeta praer na ribuet long yu, pipol bilong yu, Israel, ol i mekim - husat i save bek long trabel na sori blong em yet, na em i stretim han bilong en i go long hap tempple —

original: be heard by You from heaven, Your dwelling place. And may You forgive and act, and repay each man according to all his ways, since You know his heart—for You alone know the hearts of all men—
translation: Harim i go antap long heven, ples bilong yu stap. Na forgivim na wokim, givim bek long ol man olsem ol i wok, wantaim yu save tokim bel bilong ol man, bikos yu alone save save tokim bel bilong ol man, yu save harim i go insait long het bilong ol.

original: so that they may fear You all the days they live in the land that You gave to our fathers.
translation: Na ol i save pem na i respekim Yu long ol dei ol i stap long kantri we Yu givim long tumbuna bilong yumi.

original: And as for the foreigner who is not of Your people Israel but has come from a distant land because of Your name—
translation: Na olsem, long ol man husat i no bilong piple Israel, husat i kam bek long ples i go daun, i kam insait long kantry bilong en, bikos bilong nem bilong yu —

original: for they will hear of Your great name and mighty hand and outstretched arm—when he comes and prays toward this temple,
translation: Bilong dem olsem, ol i harim nem bilong yu, i gat bikpela nam, na han bilong yu i strong, na arm bilong yu i stret - wanken em i kam na em i go prai long hap temppel,

original: then may You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place, and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to You. Then all the peoples of the earth will know Your name and fear You, as do Your people Israel, and they will know that this house I have built is called by Your Name.
translation: Bikos yu harim bikos long heven, ples bilong yu stap, na wokim ol samting we man i kam long kantri narak i kol long yu. Ol ples long graun bai save nem bilong yu, na bai i gat respek long yu olsem pkin bilong yu Israel i gat, na oli save tu husat dispela haus mi bin mekim em i kol long nem bilong yu.

original: When Your people go to war against their enemies, wherever You send them, and when they pray to the LORD in the direction of the city You have chosen and the house I have built for Your Name,
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipol bilong yu i go long war gen long ol poisen bilong ol, we yu sendim ol go, na taim ol i prea long Lod i go daun long hap bilong taun we yu chusim, na long haus bilong Nem bilong yu we mi bin mekim,

original: then may You hear from heaven their prayer and their plea, and may You uphold their cause.
translation: Bikpela, yumi harim tok bilong heven, prea na askim help bilong ol, na strongim kaos bilong ol.

original: When they sin against You—for there is no one who does not sin—and You become angry with them and deliver them to an enemy who takes them as captives to his own land, whether far or near,
translation: Wanpela taim ol i bagarap long Yu — em i nogat man we i no bagarap — na Yu bai kros long ol, yu inap givim ol i go long han bilong eni, na ol i go bek gen long kantri bilong em, em i nara o em i farawe, ol i stap long hem.

original: and when they come to their senses in the land to which they were taken, and they repent and plead with You in the land of their captors, saying, ‘We have sinned and done wrong; we have acted wickedly,’
translation: Na wail, bai ol i kam bek gen long tok bilong ol long kantri we ol i go daun, na ol i humi i go bek na kisim ap, ol i praen long Yu long kantri bilong ol enemies, ol i Tok 'Mipela i sindaun', mipela i mekim nogut, mipela i warkim long wei bilong nogut.

original: and when they return to You with all their heart and soul in the land of the enemies who took them captive, and when they pray to You in the direction of the land that You gave to their fathers, the city You have chosen, and the house I have built for Your Name,
translation: Na when ol i kam bek long Yu gen, olgeta harte na soul bilong ol, long kantri bilong ol man i bin kisim ol i go, na when ol i praen long Yu long sait bilong kantri yu givim long tumbuna bilong ol, taun we yu chusim, na haus mi bin bilong bikim long nem bilong Yu,

original: then may You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place, their prayer and petition, and may You uphold their cause.
translation: Na bai yumi harim tok bilong heven, husat i stap long ples bilong yu, pritna bilong ol na toksave, na bai yu holim bek long ol.

original: May You forgive Your people who have sinned against You and all the transgressions they have committed against You, and may You grant them compassion in the eyes of their captors to show them mercy.
translation: Yu mas forgivim pipol bilong yu ol i mekim sin long yu, na olgeta samting nogut ol i mekim long yu, na yu mas givim ol gutpela hari long ai bilong ol i kam bekim ol, na mekim ol i stap klostu long ol, na igivim ol meri.

original: For they are Your people and Your inheritance; You brought them out of Egypt, out of the furnace for iron.
translation: Ol i pikinini bilong Yu, na ina inherits bilong Yu; yu kam bekim ol long lan Egypt, long plaia blo ais.

original: May Your eyes be open to the pleas of Your servant and of Your people Israel, and may You listen to them whenever they call to You.
translation: Mai ai bilong yu i op long bekim pes bilong servant bilong yu na bilong pipol Israel, na yu yet harim tok bilong ol wail ol i kirap long yu.

original: For You, O Lord GOD, as Your inheritance, have set them apart from all the peoples of the earth, as You spoke through Your servant Moses when You brought our fathers out of Egypt.”
translation: Papa God, yu givim olsem wanpela grup long ol, olsem inheritance bilong yu, long olgeta hap bilong graun, olsem yu tok througu servent Moses bilong yu, whenen God bai bringim tumbuna bilong mipela long Egypt.

original: Now when Solomon had finished praying this entire prayer and petition to the LORD, he got up before the altar of the LORD, where he had been kneeling with his hands spread out toward heaven.
translation: Na Solomon em i pinis pregan na askim dispela prea na tokpisin long Bikpela, em i kam bek long altare bilong Bikpela, na em i kilaik na katim han bilong en, stret ol i go long heven, long hap bilong em i bin kilaik na pregan long Bikpela.

original: And he stood and blessed the whole assembly of Israel in a loud voice, saying:
translation: Na em i stap, em i blesim olgeta assembli bilong Isrel long voys bilong em, olsem em i tok:

original: “Blessed be the LORD, who has given rest to His people Israel according to all that He promised. Not one word has failed of all the good promises He made through His servant Moses.
translation: Praiz i go long LORD, em i givim rip long ol piple Israel olsem em i promis olgeta. No wanpela tok igo daun yet long ol gupela promis em i mekim thru wokman Moses.

original: May the LORD our God be with us, as He was with our fathers. May He never leave us nor forsake us.
translation: Mai Bikpela God i stap wantaim yumi, olsem em i stap wantaim tumbuna yumi. Mai em i no lusim yumi na em i no lakim yumi.

original: May He incline our hearts to Himself, to walk in all His ways and to keep the commandments and statutes and ordinances He commanded our fathers.
translation: Em i mas helpim bel bilong yumi, inap long yumi i go long ol wei bilong Em, na inap long yumi i kaikim ol lao, statut, na odinans ol i kam long tumbuna bilong yumi.

original: And may these words with which I have made my petition before the LORD be near to the LORD our God day and night, so that He may uphold the cause of His servant and of His people Israel as each day requires,
translation: Na mipela hop i olsem, dispela tok bilong mi, mi mekim prea bilong mi long ples bilong LORD, i kam klostu long LORD God bilong yumi, de na nait, olsem em i sapot ka bilong servant bilong em, na bilong piple Israel, olgeta de i askim.

original: so that all the peoples of the earth may know that the LORD is God. There is no other!
translation: Olgeta ples long graun i ken amamas, na ol i save long Bikpela, bikos em i God, Ino gat narapela.

original: So let your heart be fully devoted to the LORD our God, as it is this day, to walk in His statutes and to keep His commandments.”
translation: Ol harte bilong yu, bai yu i go kol pas long Bikpela LORD God bilong yumi, olsem tude, Yu wok long statut bilong Em, na yu holim komandom bilong Em.

original: Then the king and all Israel with him offered sacrifices before the LORD.
translation: Kip na ol Isrel i go wantaim em, na ol i bringim sakrifis bifo LONG GOD.

original: And Solomon offered as peace offerings to the LORD 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep. So the king and all the Israelites dedicated the house of the LORD.
translation: Na Solomon i givim peis ofing long LORD, 22,000 bulmakau na 120,000 sip. Olsem na king na ol Israelites ol i dedikeim haus bilong LORD.

original: On that same day the king consecrated the middle of the courtyard in front of the house of the LORD, and there he offered the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, since the bronze altar before the LORD was too small to contain all these offerings.
translation: Long dispela de, king i makam olsem hap mai bilong ka niuhaus long sait bilong aus hus bilong LORD, na em i bringim ofa bilong anim, ofa bilong saksak, na ol i go het long ofa bilong pis, bikos bronza altar ibefore LORD i no inap long kisim ol dispela ofa.

original: So at that time Solomon and all Israel with him—a great assembly of people from Lebo-hamath to the Brook of Egypt—kept the feast before the LORD our God for seven days and seven more days—fourteen days in all.
translation: Long taem, Solomon na ol Isrel wantaim - mupela i gat planti manmeri from Lebo-hamath go long Buk bilong Ijip - ol i stap long fest bifor LORD God bilong yumi seven de na seven de naba - fourteen de olgeta.

original: On the fifteenth day Solomon sent the people away. So they blessed the king and went home, joyful and glad in heart for all the good things that the LORD had done for His servant David and for His people Israel.
translation: Long dei fifteenth, Solomon rausim ol pipol. Ol i givim bikim king, na ol i go hoom, glat na hap long hart, bikos LORD i mekim planti gutpela samting long manmeri sernant David na long pipol Isrel.

original: Now when Solomon had finished building the house of the LORD and the royal palace, and had achieved all that he had desired to do,
translation: Taim Solomon finis long builim haus bilong LORD na haus bilong king, na olgeta samting em i mekim pinis we em i laik mekim,

original: the LORD appeared to him a second time, as He had appeared to him at Gibeon.
translation: Bikpela i kam ap long en wanpela gen, olsem Bikpela i bin kam ap long em long Gibeon.

original: And the LORD said to him: “I have heard your prayer and petition before Me. I have consecrated this temple you have built by putting My Name there forever; My eyes and My heart will be there for all time.
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim em: “Mi harim praer na askim bilong yu we yu mekim go long ai bilong mi. Mi bin makim dispela haus lotu yu bin mekim, na mi putim Nem bilong mi stap long hap foreva; Mai ai na Mai bel i stap bek long hap oltaim.”

original: And as for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked, with a heart of integrity and uprightness, doing all I have commanded you, and if you keep My statutes and ordinances,
translation: Na long yu, i go bifor mi olsem tumbuna David bilong yu, wantaim het bilong kamap strong na stret, wokim ol samting we mi tokim yu, lidim statut bilong mi na lo bilong mi.

original: then I will establish your royal throne over Israel forever, as I promised your father David when I said, ‘You will never fail to have a man on the throne of Israel.’
translation: Mipela bai plantim tron bilong yu yet long Israel oltaim, olsem mipela promis long tumbuna David bilong yu, mipela tok olsem, 'Yu no ina fail long gat man i sit long tron bilong Israel.'

original: But if indeed you or your sons turn away from following Me and do not keep the commandments and statutes I have set before you, and if you go off to serve and worship other gods,
translation: Bai yu oa sun bilong yu lusim go long bihainim Mipela, na yusua no holim komando na statut Mipela putim i go long hap, na yu go dasol na sarvim na wosipim god bilong narapela,

original: then I will cut off Israel from the land that I have given them, and I will banish from My presence this temple I have sanctified for My Name. Then Israel will become an object of scorn and ridicule among all peoples.
translation: Na mipela bai katim Israel long graun bilong mipela, na mipela bai draivim haus lotu bilong mipela we mipela woksap long Nem bilong Mipela. Na Israel bai kamap samting bilong jogol na katkat long ol ples bilong mipela.

original: And when this temple has become a heap of rubble, all who pass by it will be appalled and will hiss and say, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this land and to this temple?’
translation: Wanem hap haus lotu i go daun olsem ston na graun, ol pipol i go wawkabaut long en i kirap strong imas, ol i sipsip na tok, ol bai tok, ‘Bikpela i mekim olsem wanem long kantri na long dispela haus lotu?’

original: And others will answer, ‘Because they have forsaken the LORD their God who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and have embraced other gods, worshiping and serving them—because of this, the LORD has brought all this disaster upon them.’”
translation: Na arapela manmeri bai tok, ‘Bilong wanem ol i lusim LORD God bilong ol, em i bringim papa bilong ol long kantri Egypt, na ol i kisim god bilong narapela, wosipim na sarvim ol – bilong dispela, LORD i bringim olgeta dispela bagarap long ol.’”

original: Now at the end of the twenty years during which Solomon built these two houses, the house of the LORD and the royal palace,
translation: Nau long ol twenty yia i go daun we Solomon i usim bilipim haus tu, husat em i haus bilong Lod na palas bilong king,

original: King Solomon gave twenty towns in the land of Galilee to Hiram king of Tyre, who had supplied him with cedar and cypress logs and gold for his every desire.
translation: King Solomon i givim twenti ples long lan bilong Galili to Hiram king bilong Tairu, hu i saplainim em long cedar, cypress log, na gold long olgeta laik bilong en.

original: So Hiram went out from Tyre to inspect the towns that Solomon had given him, but he was not pleased with them.
translation: Na Hiram i go aut long Taun bilong Tyre from long lukim ol taun em King Solomon i givim em, tasol em i no likim ol.

original: “What are these towns you have given me, my brother?” asked Hiram, and he called them the Land of Cabul, as they are called to this day.
translation: Husatpela taun ol i yu givim mi, brata? Hiram i askim, na em i kolim olgeta hap graun em Cabul, olsem yumi usim nem bilong en yet long taim igo inap.

original: And Hiram had sent the king 120 talents of gold.
translation: Na Hiram bin sendim king 120 tael bilong gol.

original: This is the account of the forced labor that King Solomon imposed to build the house of the LORD, his own palace, the supporting terraces, and the wall of Jerusalem, as well as Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.
translation: Dispela em i stori bilong wok forced ol i mekim, King Solomon i kisim desisen long mekim, ol i mekim haus bilong LORD, em i mekim haus bilong em yet, teres ol i sapotim, banis bilong Jerusalem, na ol ples Hazor, Megiddo, na Gezer.

original: Pharaoh king of Egypt had attacked and captured Gezer. He had set it on fire, killed the Canaanites who lived in the city, and given it as a dowry to his daughter, Solomon’s wife.
translation: Faraon king bilong Ejip i bin go na kisim Gezer, im bin burnim em, kilim Kananaits i stap long taon, na givim em olsem pris bilong mari long pikinini meri bilong en, wife bilong Solomon.

original: So Solomon rebuilt Gezer, Lower Beth-horon,
translation: Solomon im rebuildim Gezer, Beth-horon Lo.

original: Baalath, and Tamar in the Wilderness of Judah,
translation: Baalat, na Tamar long bus bilong Yuda,

original: as well as all the store cities that Solomon had for his chariots and horses—whatever he desired to build in Jerusalem, Lebanon, and throughout the land of his dominion.
translation: Olsem olgeta ples bilong ka long stua, we Solomon i gat long kar na hos, ol samting we em laik bilden long Jerusalem, Lebanon, na long olgeta hap bilong lainskip.

original: As for all the people who remained of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites (the people who were not Israelites)—
translation: Long olgeta manmeri ol i stap yet bilong Amorait, Hitait, Perizait, Hivait, na Jebusait — ol pipol we ol i no bin Israelait —

original: their descendants who remained in the land, those whom the Israelites were unable to devote to destruction—Solomon conscripted these people to be forced laborers, as they are to this day.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong ol i stap yet long graun, ol man meri husat Pipol Israel i no inap kilim ol long taim bifo, King Solomon i kisim ol man husat i mekim wok bilong en, wok bilong prisner, na ol i wok olsem tasol long taim nau.

original: But Solomon did not consign any of the Israelites to slavery, because they were his men of war, his servants, his officers, his captains, and the commanders of his chariots and cavalry.
translation: Bare Solomona em i no bin givim Israelites ol long slavery, bikos ol i bin man bilong war bilong en, servant bilong en, ofisa bilong en, kapten bilong en, na bos bilong kar bilong en na hos bilong en.

original: They were also the chief officers over Solomon’s projects: 550 supervisors over the people who did the work.
translation: Ol i bikpela ofisa tu long ol wok bilong Solomon: 550 i lukautim ol manmeri i wok.

original: As soon as Pharaoh’s daughter had come up from the City of David to the palace that Solomon had built for her, he built the supporting terraces.
translation: Tumas meri bilong Pharaoh i kamap long hap, long Siti bilong Daud na go long haus kibung we Solomon i bin mekim bilong em, na em i mekim balusai bilong en.

original: Three times a year Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar he had built for the LORD, burning incense with them before the LORD. So he completed the temple.
translation: Tripe taim Solomon i bringim ofing na peis ofing long alta em i bin mekim bilong Bikpela, i barim smel wantsail wantaim long ai bilong God. Na husat olsem nau em i kamapim haus lotu.

original: King Solomon also assembled a fleet of ships at Ezion-geber, which is near Eloth in Edom, on the shore of the Red Sea.
translation: King Solomon yarn i tok olsem: Em i kamasaua wanpela flotilla bilong ship long Ezion-geber, we em i klostu long Eloth long Edom, long sait bilong Red Sea.

original: And Hiram sent his servants, men who knew the sea, to serve in the fleet with Solomon’s servants.
translation: Na Hiram i salim servant bilong en, ol man we save long solwara, i go wok wantaim ship bilong Solomon.

original: They sailed to Ophir and imported gold from there—420 talents—and delivered it to Solomon.
translation: Ol i sail i go long Ophir, ol i kisim gol long hap plas - em i 420 hanfred na kilo - na ol i givim i go long Solomon.

original: Now when the queen of Sheba heard about the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to test him with difficult questions.
translation: Nau kwin bilong Siba harim tok bilong Solomon i go ol abaot long namel bilong LORD, na em i kam bekim em long keskes pikinini.

original: She arrived in Jerusalem with a very large caravan—with camels bearing spices, gold in great abundance, and precious stones. So she came to Solomon and spoke to him all that was on her mind.
translation: I kamap long Jerusalem wantaim karamel bilong kisim kakao moni, kemel i karim spais, gold na stoun bilong value olgeta. Na bikpela meri i go bek long Solomon, i tokim Solomon olgeta samting i stap long mind bilong en.

original: And Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was too difficult for the king to explain.
translation: Na Solomona i bekim tok long olgeta quesin em i askim, nothing i stap hard tumas long king ibin toktok.

original: When the queen of Sheba saw all the wisdom of Solomon, the palace he had built,
translation: Taim quin bilong Siba i lukim olgeta save bilong Solomon, haus king em i bin mekim,

original: the food at his table, the seating of his servants, the service and attire of his attendants and cupbearers, and the burnt offerings he presented at the house of the LORD, it took her breath away.
translation: Ka moni long tepel bilong en, ol servistoda i go long ples bilong ol, wok bung long ol samting bilong ol wokman na ol i save kisim kava, na ol bikpela sacrifices em i bin givim long haus bilong Lod, em i winim brek bilong en.

original: She said to the king, “The report I heard in my own country about your words and wisdom is true.
translation: Em i tokim king olsem, "Ripot we mi harim long kantri bilong mi long tok bilong yu na wisdom bilong yu em i treu."

original: But I did not believe these things until I came and saw with my own eyes. Indeed, not even half was told to me. Your wisdom and prosperity have far exceeded the report I heard.
translation: Mi no bilipim ol samting dispela na mi kam bek long lukim wantaim ai bilong mi. Ina tru, narapela hap i no gat tok long me. Wisdome na gudpela laif bilong yu i go pas long ripot i harm bilong mi.

original: How blessed are your men! How blessed are these servants of yours who stand continually before you and hear your wisdom!
translation: Win blong ol wokman bilong yu em i bikpela! Win blong ol servants bilong yu em i bikpela, ol i stap longwe na klostu long yu, na ol i harim tokwisdom bilong yu!

original: Blessed be the LORD your God, who has delighted in you to set you on the throne of Israel. Because of the LORD’s eternal love for Israel, He has made you king to carry out justice and righteousness.”
translation: Praiz i go long Bikpela, we bilong em i laik long yu, nau em putim yu long throne bilong Israel. Long taim bai Bikpela i gat lav bilong em long Israel, nau em makim yu king bilong mekim jusis na ret righteousness.

original: Then she gave the king 120 talents of gold, a great quantity of spices, and precious stones. Never again was such an abundance of spices brought in as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
translation: Na em givim king 120 talents bilong gol, planti spices long kam, na stoun bilong vale. Nogat wanpela taim moa i stap olsem plenti spices ol i bringim kam olsem kwin bilong Siba i givim long King Solomon.

original: (The fleet of Hiram that brought gold from Ophir also brought from Ophir a great cargo of almug wood and precious stones.
translation: Flita bilong Hiram i go kisim gol na kam bek long Ophir, na tu, flita bilong em i kisim kargo bilong Ophir i go longwe, diwai almug na ston bilong valiu.

original: The king made the almug wood into steps for the house of the LORD and for the king’s palace, and into lyres and harps for the singers. Never before had such almug wood been brought in, nor has such been seen to this day.)
translation: King i makim diwai almug i go long stap bilong haus lotu bilong Jehovah na long haus king, na long gitaa bilong sang na hap bilong sang bilong ol singaut. Nogat yet ol i bringim samting olsem, na nogat yet ol i lukim olsem yet.

original: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all she desired—whatever she asked—besides what he had given her out of his royal bounty. Then she left and returned to her own country, along with her servants.
translation: King Solomona i givim kwin bilong Siba olsem em i laik, olgeta samting em i askim, plis long ol samting em i givim ol long royali bilong en. Na em i go bek gen long kantri bilong em yet, wantaim ol wokman bilong en.

original: The weight of gold that came to Solomon each year was 666 talents,
translation: Wet bilong gol na i kam klostu long Solomon long yia em i goat 666 talen.

original: not including the revenue from the merchants, traders, and all the Arabian kings and governors of the land.
translation: Nogat incleming moni bilong sala long ol siposala, ol treda, na ol kwin na gavana bilong Arabia bilong graun.

original: King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred shekels of gold went into each shield.
translation: King Solomona i mekim tupela handred bigpela siel bilong gildim em i go hamared; sikis shekel bilong gildim i go insait long wanpela shield.

original: He also made three hundred small shields of hammered gold; three minas of gold went into each shield. And the king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
translation: Na em i mekim tripela hanred smol piksa bilong paitim na gol i bin hammered; tripela mina bilong gol i go insait long wanpela piksa bilong paitim. Na king i putim ol piksa bilong paitim i go insait long Haus bilong Bus bilong Lebanon.

original: Additionally, the king made a great throne of ivory and overlaid it with pure gold.
translation: King i mekim wanpela bikpela thrown bilong ivori na kisim gold paiabaut na kamapim em.

original: The throne had six steps, and its back had a rounded top. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, with a lion standing beside each armrest.
translation: Sin bilong king i stap long sikis steptu, na baksait bilong en i go raun. Long both sait bilong sit bilong en i gat armrests, wantaim wanpela lion i stap besait long wanpela armrest, na wanpela lion i stap besait long narakpela armrest.

original: Twelve lions stood on the six steps, one at either end of each step. Nothing like this had ever been made for any kingdom.
translation: Twelv liones i stanap long sikis steps, wan bilong ol i stap long wan en bilong bek step. Nogat samting olsem ini bin mekim bifor long eni ples bilong king.

original: All King Solomon’s drinking cups were gold, and all the utensils of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. There was no silver, because it was accounted as nothing in the days of Solomon.
translation: Ol kap bilong draik bilong King Solomon ol i go bek long gołd, na ol samting bilong Haus bilong Bus bilong Lebanan ol i gołd tut. I no gat silva, bikos long taim bilong King Solomon, ol i tingim olsem nogat, ol thing i stap olsem nogat.

original: For the king had the ships of Tarshish at sea with Hiram’s fleet, and once every three years the ships of Tarshish would arrive bearing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
translation: King i gat ship bilong Tarshish i go long solwara wantaim flot bilong Hiram, na wanpela taim olgeta three yia, ship bilong Tarshish bai i kam bek, karim gol, silva, tifal bilong tifala ol animal, mangi, na paua bilong paradis.

original: So King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
translation: King Soloman i winim olgeta king bilong graun long moni na save.

original: The whole world sought an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had put in his heart.
translation: Olgeta wol i go daun bekim Solomon, ol i harim tokwisdom we God i givim i go insait long het bilong en.

original: Year after year, each visitor would bring his tribute: articles of silver and gold, clothing, weapons, spices, horses, and mules.
translation: Yia bihain yia, namba wan besig visitor i kam, em i bringim tokges bilong en: samting bilong silva na gol, klos, win bilong pait, spais, hores, na mol.

original: Solomon accumulated 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses, which he stationed in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem.
translation: Solomon i kamap na em i gat 1,400 kar na 12,000 hos, ol ikam long ples chariot na wantaim em long Jerusalem.

original: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as abundant as sycamore in the foothills.
translation: King i mekim silva i kamap olsem ston long graun long Jerusalema, na ceda i kamap olsem planti olsem sycamore long bus kamap long ples.

original: Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and Kue; the royal merchants purchased them from Kue.
translation: Hos bilong Solomona i kam long Ijip na Kue; mashal bilong king ibin baim ol hos long Kue.

original: A chariot could be imported from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty. Likewise, they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and to the kings of Aram.
translation: Kareta bilong faet inawe ili kam insait long kantri long prais bilong shekel silva 600, na hos long prais bilong shekel silva 150. Olsem tu, ol i salim olsen go long papa bilong ol Hiti na go long papa bilong ol Aram.

original: King Solomon, however, loved many foreign women along with the daughter of Pharaoh—women of Moab, Ammon, Edom, and Sidon, as well as Hittite women.
translation: King Solomona i lakim planti meri bilong narapela kantri, long nap long dahta bilong Pharaoh, meri bilong Moab, Amon, Edom, na Sidon, olsem na meri bilong Hittite.

original: These women were from the nations about which the LORD had told the Israelites, “You must not intermarry with them, for surely they will turn your hearts after their gods.” Yet Solomon clung to these women in love.
translation: Ol meri ol i kam long narapela kantri we LORD i tokim ol Israel long taim bifo, "Yupela no ken maritim wantaim ol, bikos bai ol i turnim bek bilong yupela long bodi bilong ol god bilong ol." Tasol Solomon i holim strong ol meri long love.

original: He had seven hundred wives of royal birth and three hundred concubines—and his wives turned his heart away.
translation: Em i gat seven hundred meri bilong pikinini bilong king na em i gat three hundred hamas meri – na meri bilong en i biruaim hat bilong en.

original: For when Solomon grew old, his wives turned his heart after other gods, and he was not wholeheartedly devoted to the LORD his God, as his father David had been.
translation: Wanpela taim Solomon i go antap long taim, meri bilong en i kisim hert bilong en, na hert bilong en i go bek gena long odah god, na em i no stap gut olgeta long Bikpela God bilong en, olsem tambu David i bihainim.

original: Solomon followed Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians and Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
translation: Solomon i go bek long Ashtoreth, goddess bilong Ol Sidonians, na Milcom, samting nogut bilong Ol Ammonites.

original: So Solomon did evil in the sight of the LORD; unlike his father David, he did not follow the LORD completely.
translation: Na Solomon i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD; em i no bihain GOD olgeta taim, strong long hap olsem papa bilong em, David.

original: At that time on a hill east of Jerusalem, Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab and for Molech the abomination of the Ammonites.
translation: Long taem, Solomon wokim ples hait long wanpela han bilong Jerusalem, ikon long east saed, olsem ples hait bilong Chemosh, samting nogut tru bilong Moab, na Molech, samting nogut tru bilong Ammonites.

original: He did the same for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and sacrificed to their gods.
translation: Em i mekim olsem long ol meri igat dispela kantri, ol i bungim smok na ofa long bikpela spirit bilong ol.

original: Now the LORD grew angry with Solomon, because his heart had turned away from the LORD, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice.
translation: Nau LORD i masalai wantaim Solomon, bikos harten bilong en i go bek long narapela rot, long LORD, God bilong Israel, we i kamapim em twaise igo long en.

original: Although He had warned Solomon explicitly not to follow other gods, Solomon did not keep the LORD’s command.
translation: Masisu em i bin givim waning long Solomona klia olsem i no inap folo god bilong arapela ples, tasol Solomona i no holim komando bilong LORD.

original: Then the LORD said to Solomon, “Because you have done this and have not kept My covenant and My statutes, which I have commanded you, I will tear the kingdom away from you and give it to your servant.
translation: Papa God i tokim Solomon, “Yu mekim dispela, na yu no holim kot bilong mi na statut bilong mi, olsem mi bin givim instruksin long yu, nogat. Mi bai karim kingdom bilong yu i go, na bai givim long wokman bilong yu.

original: Nevertheless, for the sake of your father David, I will not do it during your lifetime; I will tear it out of the hand of your son.
translation: Nogat, long olsem bilong papa Davit, mi no ken harim dispela wail yumi stap yet; mi kisim i go bek long han bilong Pikinini bilong yu.

original: Yet I will not tear the whole kingdom away from him. I will give one tribe to your son for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen.”
translation: Mi no go biruaim autonomy olgeta long hem. Mi givim wanpela tribe long pikinini bilong yu long stap bilong servant David bilong Mi na long stap bilong Jerusalem, we mi bin chusim.

original: Then the LORD raised up against Solomon an adversary, Hadad the Edomite, from the royal line of Edom.
translation: Bikpela i kamap strong long Solomon, Hadad man Edom, i kam long lain bilong king Edom.

original: Earlier, when David was in Edom, Joab the commander of the army had gone to bury the dead and had struck down every male in Edom.
translation: Bipo, long taim David i stap long Edom, Yoab komanda bilong armi i go bungim ol dai na i kilim ol man husat i stap long Edom.

original: Joab and all Israel had stayed there six months, until he had killed every male in Edom.
translation: Joab na ol Isrel i stap long Edom sikis mana, na em i kilim olgeta man husat i bin stap, til em i finisim ol.

original: But Hadad, still just a young boy, had fled to Egypt, along with some Edomites who were servants of his father.
translation: Hadad, em i stil nau pikinini yet, na em i ranawe go long Egip, wampa long ol Edomait husat i servis ol mana meri bilong papa bilong em.

original: Hadad and his men set out from Midian and went to Paran. They took men from Paran with them and went to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave Hadad a house and land and provided him with food.
translation: Hadad na ol man bilong en i kam long narapela hap bilong Midian, na i go long Paran. Ol i kisim man olsem long Paran, na ol i go long Egip, long Faraon king bilong Egip, na em i givim haus long Hadad na graun, na ol i givim kaikai long em.

original: There Hadad found such great favor in the sight of Pharaoh that he gave to him in marriage the sister of Queen Tahpenes, his own wife.
translation: Hadad kisim bikpela grazim long ai bilong Pharaoh, na Pharaoh i givim meri bilong Kwin Tahpenes, susa bilong wife bilong em, long Hadad olsem meri.

original: And the sister of Tahpenes bore Hadad a son named Genubath. Tahpenes herself weaned him in Pharaoh’s palace, and Genubath lived there among the sons of Pharaoh.
translation: Na susa bilong Tahpenes i karim pikinini long Hadad, em i kolim Genubath. Tahpenes i putim bel bilong em long haus bilong Pharaoh, na Genubath i stap wantaim ol pikinini bilong Pharaoh.

original: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David had rested with his fathers and that Joab, the commander of the army, was dead, he said to Pharaoh, “Let me go, that I may return to my own country.”
translation: Taim Hadad harim long Egip dat Daud i go back long ples bilong en, na klostu i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na Yoab, kapten bilong solja, i dai pinis, em i tokim Pharaoh, “Lusim mi, na mi go bek long ples bilong mi.”

original: But Pharaoh asked him, “What have you lacked here with me that you suddenly want to go back to your own country?” “Nothing,” Hadad replied, “but please let me go.”
translation: Faraon em i askim Hadad, “Yu bin missim wanem long hap bilong mi, nau yu laik go bek long kantri bilong yu?” Hadad i tok, “Mipela no bin missim notin, tasol lek mi go.”

original: And God raised up against Solomon another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliada, who had fled from his master, Hadadezer king of Zobah,
translation: Na God i kamap gen long Solomon namba wan anisa eni, Rezon man bilong Eliada, em i ranawe long han bilong masta, Hadadezer king bilong Zobah.

original: and had gathered men to himself. When David killed the Zobaites, Rezon captained a band of raiders and went to Damascus, where they settled and gained control.
translation: Na Rezon i kam geda long en, na taim Daud i kilim ol Zobaites, Rezon i lidim ol grubu bilong raipela man na i go long Damaskas, na ol i stap na i kisim kontol.

original: Rezon was Israel’s enemy throughout the days of Solomon, adding to the trouble caused by Hadad. So Rezon ruled over Aram with hostility toward Israel.
translation: Rezon em i eni bilong Israel, na em i kam bekim planti i mas wantaim het long ol dei bilong Solomon, olsem Hadad. Na Rezon i bihain em i king bilong Aram, na em i stap wantaim het long Israel.

original: Now Jeroboam son of Nebat was an Ephraimite from Zeredah whose mother was a widow named Zeruah. Jeroboam was a servant of Solomon, but he rebelled against the king,
translation: Nau Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat em i man bilong Ephraim, em i kam long Zeredah, mama bilong em i meri we i no gat husban, nem bilong em Zeruah. Jeroboam i wokman bilong Solomon, tasol em i go bekgen king.

original: and this is the account of his rebellion against the king. Solomon had built the supporting terraces and repaired the gap in the wall of the city of his father David.
translation: Na dispela em i stori bilong pait bilong em long kwin. Solomon i bin mekim hap simbu na i repim hole long banis bilong taun bilong papa bilong em, David.

original: Now Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor. So when Solomon noticed that the young man was industrious, he put him in charge of the whole labor force of the house of Joseph.
translation: Nau Jeroboam em i man strong na gutpela. Ol i lukim yu yet yu sindaun na wok harde, Solomon i kisim notis long dispela na givim em bos bilong ol wokman meri bilong haus bilong Yosef.

original: During that time, the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite met Jeroboam on the road as he was going out of Jerusalem. Now Ahijah had wrapped himself in a new cloak, and the two of them were alone in the open field.
translation: Long taim ia, man prophets Ahijah man bilong Selo i kam bek gen long rot bilong Jeroboam i go aut long Jerusalem. Na Ahijah i kisim klip nupela laplap i wapim em yet, na tupela i stap wanpela long ples wei.

original: And Ahijah took hold of the new cloak he was wearing, tore it into twelve pieces,
translation: Na Ahija i kisim holim nupela klos i wap long en, pulim i apart long twelve hap.

original: and said to Jeroboam, “Take ten pieces for yourself, for this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and I will give you ten tribes.
translation: Ol i tokim Jeroboam, “Kisim tenpela peis long han bilong yu, wantaim olsem LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok olsem: ‘Mipela lukim, mi bai kirapim kingdom nau long han bilong Solomon, na mipela bai givim yu ten tribes, ol pipol bilong ten tribe.”

original: But one tribe will remain for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.
translation: Bai wanpela tribe i stap olsem long moninga long servant bilong mi, Davidsone, na long moninga long Jerusalem, taun we mi chusim long olgeta tribes bilong Israel.

original: For they have forsaken Me to worship Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the Ammonites. They have not walked in My ways, nor done what is right in My eyes, nor kept My statutes and judgments, as Solomon’s father David did.
translation: Ol i lusim Mipela, na oli go wosipim Ashtoreth bikpela meri bilong Sidonians, Chemosh god bilong Moabites, na Milcom god bilong Ammonites. Ol i no wok long wei bilong Mipela, na ol i no mekim ol samting bilong stret long ai bilong Mipela, na ol i no holim lo bilong Mipela na jus, olsem tumbuna bilong Solomon, Davit.

original: Nevertheless, I will not take the whole kingdom out of Solomon’s hand, because I have made him ruler all the days of his life for the sake of David My servant, whom I chose because he kept My commandments and statutes.
translation: Nogat, mi no go tekeim kingdom olgeta long han bilong Solomon, bikos mi bin mekim em i stap na bos olpela taim bilong laip im, long moninga bilong Daud, servanim bilong Mi, whos em mi bin chusim em bikos em i holim komando bilong Mi na statut bilong Mi.

original: But I will take ten tribes of the kingdom from the hand of his son and give them to you.
translation: Mi bai kisim ten tob us long han bilong pikinini bilong em, na mi bai givim ol i go long yu.

original: I will give one tribe to his son, so that My servant David will always have a lamp before Me in Jerusalem, the city where I chose to put My Name.
translation: Bai mi givim wanpela tribe long pikinini bilong en, na servant David bilong mi, em bai alwe i go het long laip bilong em bifoa Mi long Jerusalem, taun we mi chusim long putim Nem bilong Mi.

original: But as for you, I will take you, and you shall reign over all that your heart desires, and you will be king over Israel.
translation: Bai mi kisim yu, na yu ken rulim olgets we haret bilong yu i laik, na yu ken bikim kwin long Isrel.

original: If you listen to all that I command you, walk in My ways, and do what is right in My sight in order to keep My statutes and commandments as My servant David did, then I will be with you. I will build you a lasting dynasty just as I built for David, and I will give Israel to you.
translation: Sapos yu harim olgeta we mi tokim, yu i go long wei bilong mi, na yu wokim ol gutpela samting long ai bilong mi olsem yu holim ol lo bilong mi na komanda bilong mi olsem David husat i servisim mi, orait, mi bai stap wantaim yu. Mi bai mekim balus bilong yu i go inap long taim olsem na mi mekim long David, na mi bai givim Israel long yu.

original: Because of this, I will humble David’s descendants—but not forever.’”
translation: Olsem nau, mi bai i bringim daun ol desenden bilong Daud, bas na stap oltaim.

original: Solomon therefore sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose and fled to Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, where he remained until the death of Solomon.
translation: Solomon sahtim ol i go kilim Jeroboam. Tasol Jeroboam i kam bek nau na ranawe, i go long Ijip, klostu long Shishak papa bilong kantri Ijip, na i stap yet olsem na tilim Solomon i dai.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Solomon—all that he did, as well as his wisdom—are they not written in the Book of the Acts of Solomon?
translation: Long olgeta samting nau bilong Solomona, olgeta samting em i mekim, olsem na wisdom bilong em, i no writim long Buk bilong Stori bilong Solomona?

original: Thus the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
translation: Na taim Solomon i bin king long Jerusalem iberi ol Israel em i go we forty yia.

original: And Solomon rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of his father David. And his son Rehoboam reigned in his place.
translation: Na Solomon i istap long ples bilong tumbuna olsem na em i go daun klostu long ples balus bilong tumbuna David. Na Rehoboam, pikinini bilong em, i kam bek gen long hap bilong em, na i bikim king.

original: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had gone there to make him king.
translation: Na Rehoboam i go long Shekem, bikos ol Israel i go daunapela hap long mekim em king.

original: When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard about this, he was still in Egypt where he had fled from King Solomon and had been living ever since.
translation: Taim Jeroboam samba Nebat harim tok bilong dispela, em i stap yet long Egip, olgeta taim em i ranawe frm King Solomon bikpela chief, na em i stap olsem tisa long ples bilong birua na sel bilong sori.

original: So they sent for Jeroboam, and he and the whole assembly of Israel came to Rehoboam and said,
translation: Tusa ol i kisim Jeroboam, na em tasol, wantaim kaonferens bilong Isrel, kam i go long Rehoboam na ol i tok.

original: “Your father put a heavy yoke on us. But now you should lighten the burden of your father’s service and the heavy yoke he put on us, and we will serve you.”
translation: Papa bilong yu putim bikpela yoke long yumipla. Nau yu mas lilim daun hevi bilong servis bilong papa na bikpela yoke i putim long yumipla, na mipela servim yu.

original: Rehoboam answered, “Go away for three days and then return to me.” So the people departed.
translation: Rehoboam i tokim ol, “Goh bikos three dey na bihain yu kam bek long me.” Na ol pipol i go dasol.

original: Then King Rehoboam consulted with the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. “How do you advise me to respond to these people?” he asked.
translation: King Rehoboam i go bek long ol bikpela man we i wok servis papa bilong en Solomon long taim bilong life. “Yu save mekim wanem tok long dispela ol pipol ya?” em i askim.

original: They replied, “If you will be a servant to these people and serve them this day, and if you will respond by speaking kind words to them, they will be your servants forever.”
translation: Ol i tok bek, “Igo yu bam masalai long ol pipol ya, sarvim ol dispela de, na givim toktok gutpela long ol, ol bai bam wokman bilong yu foreva.”

original: But Rehoboam rejected the advice of the elders; instead, he consulted the young men who had grown up with him and served him.
translation: Rehoboam im bikim kros long toksave bilong ol bigman, na istaed im go askim yong manmeri we ol i grow up wantaim em, na ol i wok bilong servim em.

original: He asked them, “What message do you advise that we send back to these people who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Lighten the yoke your father put on us’?”
translation: Em askim ol, "Wanem kain tok save yu givim mipela i go bek long ol pipol ya we i tokim mi, ol i lukim papa bilong mipela i putim yoke long ol, na ol i laik mipela loisim wail yoke olsem?"

original: The young men who had grown up with him replied, “This is how you should answer these people who said to you, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but you should make it lighter.’ This is what you should tell them: ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s waist!
translation: Ol yangpela man i bikimup wantaim em i tokim, "Dispela em i toksave yu mas givim long ol pipol i tokim yu olsem, 'Papa bilong yu i mekim yok bilong mipela i hevi, tasol yu mas mekim em i lait.' Dispela em i tok yu mas tokim ol olsem: 'Finga bilong han bilong mi i bikpela moa long hap bilong bel bilong papa bilong mi!'"

original: Whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke. Whereas my father scourged you with whips, I will scourge you with scorpions.’”
translation: Papa bilong me i kirapim yu long yok bilong hevi, na mi bai katim i go long nek bilong yu. Papa bilong me i bin katim yu long whip, na mi bai katim yu long skorpion.

original: After three days, Jeroboam and all the people returned to Rehoboam, since the king had said, “Come back to me on the third day.”
translation: Bihaen long tripe de, Jeroboam na ol pipol i kam bek long Rehoboam, bikos king Rehoboam i tok already, “Yu mas kam bek long me long dei thrid.”

original: And the king answered the people harshly. He rejected the advice of the elders
translation: King i ansa long ol pipol wetem tok stret na i rijejim tok bilong ol bikpela manmeri.

original: and spoke to them as the young men had advised, saying, “Whereas my father made your yoke heavy, I will add to your yoke. Whereas my father scourged you with whips, I will scourge you with scorpions.”
translation: Na em i tokim ol olsem ol yangpela man i givim tok, em i tok: "Papa bilong mi bai yu putim hevi i go long nek bilong yu, na nau mi bai katim moa i go long nek bilong yu. Papa bilong mi bai paitim yu wantaim swip, na nau mi bai paitim yu wantaim skorpion."

original: So the king did not listen to the people, and indeed this turn of events was from the LORD, to fulfill the word He had spoken to Jeroboam son of Nebat through Ahijah the Shilonite.
translation: King i no harim tok bilong ol pipol, na rot bilong ol samting i go olsem nau from long han bilong Bikpela, Em i Papa bilong olgeta, bilong fulfilledim wod i spikim bifo long Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat through Ahijah man bilong Shiloh.

original: When all Israel saw that the king had refused to listen to them, they answered the king: “What portion do we have in David, and what inheritance in the son of Jesse? To your tents, O Israel! Look now to your own house, O David!” So the Israelites went home,
translation: Wanpela taim ol Israel i lukim king i no lissen long tok bilong ol, ol i givim ansa long king: “Pora bilong yumi we? Inheritasin bilong yumi long pikinini bilong Jesi we? Go bak long hanus bilong yu, O Israel! Nau yu mas lukautim hap bilong yu, O David!” Na ol Israel i go bak long hus.

original: but Rehoboam still reigned over the Israelites living in the cities of Judah.
translation: Be Rehoboam i stap yet olsem king long pipol Israel husat i stap long towns bilong Yuda.

original: Then King Rehoboam sent out Adoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but all Israel stoned him to death. And King Rehoboam mounted his chariot in haste and escaped to Jerusalem.
translation: King Rehoboam i sendim Adoram, man we i lukautim wok forced, go, tasol ol Israel i kilim em wantaim ston. Na King Rehoboam i go antap long kareta bilong en i go kisim spid, na ranawe na go bek long Jerusalem.

original: So to this day Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David.
translation: Na todi, Isrel i stap yet long bus na kaikai ikam long haus bilong Dauid.

original: When all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they summoned him to the assembly and made him king over all Israel. Only the tribe of Judah followed the house of David.
translation: Taim ol Isrel harim dat Jeroboam i kam bek, ol i kisim em go long hus asi blong ol, na ol i mekim em king bilong ol Isrel holem. Tasol tribe blong Yuda i folo riwa lain bilong king, haus blong Davit.

original: And when Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he mobilized the whole house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin—180,000 chosen warriors—to fight against the house of Israel and restore the kingdom to Rehoboam son of Solomon.
translation: Na Rehoboam i kamap long Jerusalem, na em i wokim ol i kam, olgeta haus bilong Yuda na tribe bilong Benjamin - 180,000 soldia bilong pait - i fait long haus bilong Israel, ili bringim bek again kingdom bilong Rehoboam, pikinini bilong Solomon.

original: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God:
translation: Wod bilong God i kam long Shemaiah, man bilong God:

original: “Tell Rehoboam son of Solomon king of Judah, all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and the rest of the people
translation: Tokim Rehoboam susa bilong Solomon king bilong Juda, olgeta haus bilong Juda na Benjamin, na ol narapela manmeri.

original: that this is what the LORD says: ‘You are not to go up and fight against your brothers, the Israelites. Each of you must return home, for this word is from Me.’” So they listened to the word of the LORD and turned back according to the word of the LORD.
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem: "Yu no ken go ap long fight long ol brata bilong yu, ol Israelites. Yu yet mas go bek long haus bilong yu, bikos dispela tok i kam from Bikpela." Ol i harim tok bilong Bikpela na turnim bek olsem tok bilong Bikpela i tok.

original: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and lived there. And from there he went out and built Penuel.
translation: Na Jeroboam i go wokim Sikem long maunten bilong Efraim, na i stap dae long hap. Na i go aut na wokim Penuel.

original: Jeroboam said in his heart, “Now the kingdom might revert to the house of David.
translation: Jeroboam tokim long hes, “Nau ples king i go bek gen long haus bilong Daud.”

original: If these people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, their hearts will return to their lord, Rehoboam king of Judah; then they will kill me and return to Rehoboam king of Judah.”
translation: Ol pipol i go ap long mekim sakrifis long haus bilong LORD long Jerusalem, harten bilong ol i kam bek gen long lord bilong ol, Rehoboam king bilong Judah; orait ol bai kilim mi na go bek gen long Rehoboam king bilong Judah.

original: After seeking advice, the king made two golden calves and said to the people, “Going up to Jerusalem is too much for you. Here, O Israel, are your gods, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.”
translation: Bihaen long kot bilong toktok, king i mekim tupela kala bulmakau bilong gol na i tokim ol pipel, "I go antap long Jerusalem em i bikpela tumas long yu. Here, o Isrel, dispela ol bikpela spirit i stap, ol i karim yu kam long kantri Egypt."

original: One calf he set up in Bethel, and the other in Dan.
translation: Em i stapim wanpela kalf long Bethel, na narapela long Dan.

original: And this thing became a sin; the people walked as far as Dan to worship before one of the calves.
translation: Na dispela samting i kamapim sindaun; ol pipol i go kasol long Dan, oli go beked long wanpela kalv.

original: Jeroboam also built shrines on the high places and appointed from every class of people priests who were not Levites.
translation: Jeroboam i bikim haus lotu long ol ples hait na em i appointim ol preist na ol i kam long ol klas bilong manmeri, ol preist ia, ol i no bilong tribe bilong Lewi.

original: And Jeroboam ordained a feast on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, like the feast that was in Judah, and he offered sacrifices on the altar; he made this offering in Bethel to sacrifice to the calves he had set up, and he installed priests in Bethel for the high places he had set up.
translation: Na Jeroboam i kamapim kaika long dei fifteenth bilong mun namba eat, olsem kaika i stap long Juda, na ol i bringim sakrifis long altia; ol i mekim ofing bilong dispela kalf i plantim, na ol i apoinim pris long Betel long ples bilong hait ol i plantim, na ol i sacrifis long kalf ol i stap.

original: On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, a month of his own choosing, Jeroboam offered sacrifices on the altar he had set up in Bethel. So he ordained a feast for the Israelites, offered sacrifices on the altar, and burned incense.
translation: Long fifteenth dei bilong eighth manis, manis we em laik choosim, Jeroboam wokim sakrifis long alta em i setim ap long Betel. Na em i givim kaerem long Israelait, wokim sakrifis long alta, na burnim insens.

original: Suddenly, as Jeroboam was standing beside the altar to burn incense, there came a man of God from Judah to Bethel by the word of the LORD.
translation: Nau olsem wanpela taim, olsem Jeroboam i stap klostu long altare long banarim smel, wanpela man bilong God i kam from Yuda go long Beteli long tok bilong LORD.

original: And he cried out against the altar by the word of the LORD, “O altar, O altar, this is what the LORD says: ‘A son named Josiah will be born to the house of David, and upon you he will sacrifice the priests of the high places who burn incense upon you, and human bones will be burned upon you.’”
translation: Na em i kirap strong long altan long tok bilong LORD, “O altan, o altan, LORD i tok olsem: ‘Wanpela man bilong husat em i Josiah bai i kam long haus bilong David, na em bai i kilim pris long ples hai we i mekim smel bilong givim respek long yu, na ol bon bilong man bai i burn long yu.’”

original: That day the man of God gave a sign, saying, “The LORD has spoken this sign: ‘Surely the altar will be split apart, and the ashes upon it will be poured out.’”
translation: Dispela de man bilong God i givim sain, olsem: "LORD i tokim dispela sain: 'Altar i bungim i go apo, na ases i stap antap long em bai i pilim i go daun.'"

original: Now when King Jeroboam, who was at the altar in Bethel, heard the word that the man of God had cried out against it, he stretched out his hand and said, “Seize him!” But the hand he stretched out toward him withered, so that he could not pull it back.
translation: Wen King Jeroboam harim tok long alta long Betel, em krai aut genston long en, em stretim han bilong en, "'Kisim man bilong God i!' em tok, taso han we em stret long en i bin katim, naso em no inap pulim i bek.

original: And the altar was split apart, and the ashes poured out, according to the sign that the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.
translation: Na alta i braking i go ap, na ashes istap i kam daun, olsem sahn em man bilong God i givim long toksave bilong LORD.

original: Then the king responded to the man of God, “Intercede with the LORD your God and pray that my hand may be restored.” So the man of God interceded with the LORD, and the king’s hand was restored to him as it was before.
translation: King i bekim tok long man bilong God, “Birua long Jehovah na prai na lega bilong mi i kam bek gen.” Na man bilong God i birua long Jehovah, na lega bilong king i kam bek gen olsem mamus.

original: Then the king said to the man of God, “Come home with me and refresh yourself, and I will give you a reward.”
translation: King i tok long man bilong God, "Kam bek long hus bilong me, kisim kaikai na malolo, na Mi baim yu givim samting olsem klostu bilong tokim tenkyu."

original: But the man of God replied, “If you were to give me half your possessions, I still would not go with you, nor would I eat bread or drink water in this place.
translation: Man bilong God i tok bek, "Sapos yu givim mi hap bilong yu olgeta propati, mi nogat bai go wantaim yu, na mi no bai kaikai bret nau dring water long ples ia."

original: For this is what I was commanded by the word of the LORD: ‘You must not eat bread or drink water or return by the way you came.’”
translation: Mi bin kisim dispela tok instruksin long tok bilong Jehovah, olsem: ‘Yu no ken kaikai bret, os yu no ken dring wata, os yu no ken go bek gen long rot bilong yu i kam.’”

original: So the man of God went another way and did not return by the way he had come to Bethel.
translation: Man bilong God i go long nara kai, na em i no kam bek long wei em i kam pinis long Betel.

original: Now a certain old prophet was living in Bethel, and his sons came and told him all the deeds that the man of God had done that day in Bethel. They also told their father the words that the man had spoken to the king.
translation: Wanpela ol prophet i stap long taim bipo long Betel, na susa bilong en i kam na toktok long em olsem, ol samting ol i mekim finis na man bilong God i mekim long dispela dey long Betel. Ol i tokim papa bilong ol long ol tok ol i talk long king tu.

original: “Which way did he go?” their father asked. And his sons showed him the way taken by the man of God, who had come from Judah.
translation: Papa bilong ol i askim, "Hamas long en i go?" Na pikinini man bilong en i shoim em rot bilong man bilong God, i kam bek long han bilong Juda.

original: So the prophet said to his sons, “Saddle the donkey for me.” Then they saddled the donkey for him, and he mounted it
translation: Porofet i tokim pikinini bilong em, “Sakim donki bilong mi.” Na ol sakim donki bilong em, na em i go antap long en.

original: and went after the man of God. He found him sitting under an oak tree and asked, “Are you the man of God who came from Judah?” “I am,” he replied.
translation: Na em i go bihainim man bilong God. Em i kupim em siting andaun diwai oak na em i askim em, "Yu em i man bilong God we i kam long Juda?" Em i tok olsem, "Yes, mi em i man bilong God."

original: So the prophet said to the man of God, “Come home with me and eat some bread.”
translation: Man profet i tokim man bilong God, "Kam na go haus wantaim mi, na yu kaikai sampela bret."

original: But the man replied, “I cannot return with you or eat bread or drink water with you in this place.
translation: Bipoleta man i tok, “Mi no inap go bak gen long stap wantaim yu, o kaikai bret wantaim yu, o dring wara wantaim yu long hap ples.”

original: For I have been told by the word of the LORD: ‘You must not eat bread or drink water there or return by the way you came.’”
translation: Ol i tokim mi long toktok bilong Jehovah: ‘Yu no ken kaikai bret na dring wara long hap em, na yu no ken kom bek long wei yu kam.’”

original: Then the prophet replied, “I too am a prophet like you, and an angel spoke to me by the word of the LORD, saying, ‘Bring him back with you to your house, so that he may eat bread and drink water.’” The old prophet was lying to him,
translation: Prafit i tok bek, “Mi tu prafet olsem yu, na enjel i tok long mi from we bilong LORD, i tok olsem, ‘Kisim i go bek long haus bilong yu, na em i kaikai bret na dring wara.’” Prafit i lapun i stap givim toktok i no tru long em.

original: but the man of God went back with him, ate bread in his house, and drank water.
translation: Man bilong God i go bek gen wantaim em, na ol i kaikai bret insait long haus bilong em, na ol i drink water.

original: While they were sitting at the table, the word of the LORD came to the prophet who had brought him back,
translation: Wail ol i siddown long tebol yet, wod bilong God i save kom long man proses, man i givim tok bilong GOD, we i bringim bek i.

original: and the prophet cried out to the man of God who had come from Judah, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Because you have defied the word of the LORD and have not kept the commandment that the LORD your God gave you,
translation: Na propet i krai aut long man bilong God we i kam from Juda, “Dispela em tok bilong LORD: ‘Bikos yu kam bekainim tok bilong LORD, na yu no holim komando we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu,’”

original: but you went back and ate bread and drank water in the place where He told you not to do so, your body shall never reach the tomb of your fathers.’”
translation: Bikos yu i go bak na ol i kaikai bret na dring wara long ples we em i tok olsem yu no ken duim so, bodi bilong yu no ken ric kam long hole bilong tumbuna bilong yu.

original: And after the man of God had finished eating and drinking, the old prophet who had brought him back saddled the donkey for him.
translation: Na bihain long taim man bilong God i kisim kaikai na dring, em i go pinis, old profet i kam bekim em, na ol i putim sak bilong donki long em.

original: As he went on his way, a lion met him on the road and killed him, and his body was left lying in the road, with the donkey and the lion standing beside it.
translation: Em i go long we, na lion i kam bek gen long rot na i kilim em, na bodi bilong em ol i lusim em i lai klostu long rot, wantaim donki na lion i stap klostu besaid.

original: And there were men passing by who saw the body lying in the road with the lion standing beside it, and they went and reported this in the city where the old prophet lived.
translation: Na ol man i go pinis, ol i lukim bodi i lapun i stap klostu long rot wantaim lion i stap besait, na ol i go raitim tok long taun we profet bilong taim bifo i stap.

original: When the prophet who had brought him back from his journey heard this, he said, “It is the man of God who disobeyed the command of the LORD. Therefore the LORD has delivered him to the lion, and it has mauled him and killed him, according to the word that the LORD had spoken to him.”
translation: Taim prophit i harim dispela tok, em i tok, "Em i man bilong God we i no bihainim tok bilong LORD. Olsem na LORD i givim em i go long liklik bekside, na liklik bekside i kisim em na kilim em, olsem tok we LORD i tok bembe long em."

original: Then the old prophet instructed his sons, “Saddle the donkey for me.” So they saddled it,
translation: Na ol prophet i go tokim pikinini bilong en, “Sakim donki bilong me.” Nao ol i sakim.

original: and he went and found the body lying in the road, with the donkey and the lion standing beside it. The lion had not eaten the body or mauled the donkey.
translation: Na em i go finim bodi i lapun i stap long rot, wantaim donki na lain i stap besaida. Lain i no kukim bodi yet, na i no mausim donki.

original: So the old prophet lifted up the body of the man of God, laid it on the donkey, and brought it back to his own city to mourn for him and bury him.
translation: Na prifet i go pas i kisim bodi bilong man bilong God, ol i leim em long donki, ol i bringim bek i go long taun bilong en, oli karim sori long en na oli tanim skel bilong en.

original: Then he laid the body in his own tomb, and they lamented over him, “Oh, my brother!”
translation: Em i laikim bodi bilong en i go insait long hole bilong en, na ol i bin kisim sori long em, "O, brata bilong me!"

original: After he had buried him, the prophet said to his sons, “When I die, you must bury me in the tomb where the man of God is buried. Lay my bones beside his bones,
