translation: Na em i kukim em, na bihain prophet i tokim pikinini bilong en, "Wanpela de bai mi dai, yu mas kukim mi long holep bilong dai we man bilong God i kukim long em. Pitim banis bilong mi klostu long banis bilong em."

original: for the message that he cried out by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel and against all the shrines on the high places in the cities of Samaria will surely come to pass.”
translation: Pasin em i singautim long tok bilong LORD against altar long Bethel na against ol haus lotu olsem long ples i go hap long taun ol bilong Samaria bai kam tru.

original: Even after these events, Jeroboam did not repent of his evil ways, but again he appointed priests for the high places from every class of people. He ordained anyone who desired to be a priest of the high places.
translation: Na olgeta dispela i kam bek long en, na em i no bihainim tok bilong God, na em i no lusim ol wisai nogut bilong en, em i appointmentim prist long ples bilong aiwil long ol lain olsem, olgeta kain man meri, em i givim rait long ol man meri i laik bung wantaim ol prist bilong ples aiwil.

original: And this was the sin of the house of Jeroboam that led to its extermination and destruction from the face of the earth.
translation: Na dispela em i bin sin bilong haus bilong Jeroboam, olsem na i birua long mekim ol i pas, na bagarap na i no stap long fas bilong graun.

original: At that time Abijah son of Jeroboam became ill,
translation: Long dispela taim Abija pikinini bilong Jeroboam i sakit,

original: and Jeroboam said to his wife, “Now get up, disguise yourself so they will not recognize you as my wife, and go to Shiloh. For Ahijah the prophet is there; it was he who spoke about my kingship over this people.
translation: Na Jeroboam i tokim meri bilong en, “Kam daun, kovaraupim yuself na ol no inap save givim yu, go long Shiloh. Kapula, Ahijah propet i stap, em i bin tok olsem long kingship bilong mi long dispela pipol.

original: Take with you ten loaves of bread, some cakes, and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will become of the boy.”
translation: Kam bek long yu ten loaf bilong bread, keksi, na botol honey, na go long em. Em bai tokim yu olsem wanem bai kamap long liklik man.

original: Jeroboam’s wife did as instructed; she arose and went to Shiloh and arrived at Ahijah’s house. Now Ahijah could not see, for his eyes were dim because of his age.
translation: Misis Jeroboam i mekim olsem ol i tok, em i kamap na i go long Silo, na em i kamap long haus bilong Ahija. Ahija i no ina save lukim, bikos ai bilong em i dai pinis na em i olgeta bigatol.

original: But the LORD had said to Ahijah, “Behold, the wife of Jeroboam is coming to ask you about her son, for he is ill. You are to say such and such to her, because when she arrives, she will be disguised.”
translation: Papa God i tok long Ahija, "Lukim, meri bilong Jeroboam i kam bek long askim yu about pikinini bilong em, olsem na em i sik. Yu mas tok olsem na olsem long em, bikos wen em i kam, em bai go hait long kastom o ruksave bilong lotu."

original: So when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet entering the door, he said, “Come in, wife of Jeroboam! Why are you disguised? For I have been sent to you with bad news.
translation: Taim Ahijah harim saund bilong fut bilong yu i kam insait long doa, na em i tok, "Kam inap, meri bilong Jeroboam! Wai yu i kam biksim? Mi bin salim long yu wantaim stori nogut.

original: Go, tell Jeroboam that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I raised you up from among the people and appointed you ruler over My people Israel.
translation: Go, tokim Jeroboam dispela em i tok olsem: LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok: 'Mi bin karim yu antap long ol pipol na mi bin givim yu bos bilong ples Israel.'

original: I tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you. But you were not like My servant David, who kept My commandments and followed Me with all his heart, doing only what was right in My eyes.
translation: Mi biruaun kingdam long haus bilong David na givim i go long yu. Tasol yu i no olsem wokman David bilong Mi, em i holim komando bilong Mi, na em i folo mi wantaim olgeta harte bilong en, mekim tasol olgetsamting i stret long ai bilong Mi.

original: You have done more evil than all who came before you. You have proceeded to make for yourself other gods and molten images to provoke Me, and you have flung Me behind your back.
translation: Yu kaman long mekim planti ol samting nogut na ol samting bilong bagarap nau, yu go hed long mekim narapela kinda gods bilong yu yet na figa bilong molten olsem samting bilong worship, long bringim bikpela bel hevi long Mi, na yu kisim Mi na putim Mi bihain baksait long yu.

original: Because of all this, behold, I am bringing disaster on the house of Jeroboam: I will cut off from Jeroboam every male, both slave and free, in Israel; I will burn up the house of Jeroboam as one burns up dung until it is gone!
translation: Bikos olsem na, mi kam bringim bagarap long haus bilong Jeroboam: Mi bai katim pinis ol man servant na freeman husat i bilong Jeroboam long Israel; Mi bai barim na rausim olgeta haus bilong Jeroboam olsem kakaa, na bai i pinis!

original: Anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and anyone who dies in the field will be eaten by the birds of the air.’ For the LORD has spoken.
translation: Ol man bilong Jeroboam we i dai insait long taun, ol dog na kai bai kaikai ol, na ol man we i dai long bus, ol pisin bilong heven bai kaikai ol. Bikos LORD i tok.

original: As for you, get up and go home. When your feet enter the city, the child will die.
translation: Yu yet, kam daun na go hoom. Long taem lek bilong yu go insait long siti, pikinini bai dai.

original: All Israel will mourn for him and bury him. For this is the only one belonging to Jeroboam who will receive a proper burial, because only in him has the LORD, the God of Israel, found any good in the house of Jeroboam.
translation: Ol Israel ol i go sori long em na ol i kilim em. Dispela em i lon man belong Jeroboam husat i kamap gut long ples bilong en, bikos Bikpela God bilong Israel i lukim ol gutpela samting long em, na long hap bilong Jeroboam hus, em i man husat i gat gutpela.

original: Moreover, the LORD will raise up for Himself a king over Israel who will cut off the house of Jeroboam. This is the day—yes, even today!
translation: Papa God bai katim ap long en king i go long Isrel, na bai ketim haus bilong Yerovoam. Em i dei – yeah, dei nau!

original: For the LORD will strike Israel as a reed is shaken in the water. He will uproot Israel from this good land that He gave their fathers, and He will scatter them beyond the Euphrates, because they have made their Asherah poles, provoking the LORD to anger.
translation: LORD bai kilim Isrel olsem reid i go antap long wara. Em bai kisim Isrel long kantri gutpela we em givim long tumbuna ol, na em bai kirapim ol i go long hap bilong wara Euphrates, bikos ol i wokim pokok Asherah, na ol i mekim LORD i masalai.

original: So He will give Israel over on account of the sins Jeroboam has committed and has caused Israel to commit.”
translation: Em bai givim Isrel i go long ol sin blong Jeroboam em i mekim na i kamapim Isrel i mekim tu.

original: Then Jeroboam’s wife got up and departed for Tirzah, and as soon as she stepped over the threshold of the house, the boy died.
translation: Na meri bilong Yeroboam i go na i stap long Tirzah, na taim em i kamot ikam long doa bilong haus, pikinini i dai.

original: And they buried him, and all Israel mourned for him, according to the word that the LORD had spoken through His servant Ahijah the prophet.
translation: Na ol i kisim na kilim em, na Ol Israel holim sore long em, olsem ol wod bilong LORD i tok thru wokman bilong en, Ahijah prophets.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he waged war and how he reigned, they are indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long ol tok bilong Jeroboam, olsem na em i go bekim wok fait, olsem na em i bihainim rain, ol i raitim pinis long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Israel.

original: And the length of Jeroboam’s reign was twenty-two years, and he rested with his fathers, and his son Nadab reigned in his place.
translation: Na taim we Jeroboam i bos, em i stap olsem twenty-two yia, na em i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na susa bilong en Nadab i kam bos bihain long en.

original: Meanwhile, Rehoboam son of Solomon reigned in Judah. He was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the LORD had chosen from all the tribes of Israel in which to put His Name. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonite.
translation: Wanpela taim, Rehoboam, pikinini bilong Solomon, i kam bekim king long Judah. Em i 41 yia olsem em i kamap king, na em i bekim king we 17 yia long Jerusalem, taun LORD i chusim long olgeta tribe bilong Israel putim Nem bilong Em. Mama bilong em i kolim Naamah, meri bilong Ammonite.

original: And Judah did evil in the sight of the LORD, and by the sins they committed they provoked Him to jealous anger more than all their fathers had done.
translation: Na Judah i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD, na bikos ol i kirapim em i angri bilong sel, na ol sipia ol i wokim, em i kam daunim desisipn long ol, moa long ol tumbuna bilong ol.

original: They also built for themselves high places, sacred pillars, and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every green tree.
translation: Ol i bikim ples bilong paiawor, poal bilong spirut, na poal bilong Asherah long bek na hap graun, aninit long kalina tru.

original: There were even male shrine prostitutes in the land. They imitated all the abominations of the nations the LORD had driven out before the Israelites.
translation: I gat man ol i wark long haus lotu long kantri. Ol i kisim bek ol samting nogut bilong ol narapela kantri we LORD bai drivaunawe long bikmus bilong ol Israel.

original: In the fifth year of Rehoboam’s reign, Shishak king of Egypt came up and attacked Jerusalem.
translation: Long namba faiv yia bilong rain bilong Rehoboam, Shishak king bilong Ijip i kam ango pinis na i harim Jerusalem.

original: He seized the treasures of the house of the LORD and of the royal palace. He took everything, including all the gold shields that Solomon had made.
translation: Em i kirapim olgeta bilip long husat i bilong LORD na long haus bilong king. Em i kisim everything, ol skild bilong gol Solomon i mekim, na ol samting bilong haus.

original: Then King Rehoboam made bronze shields in their place and committed them to the care of the captains of the guard on duty at the entrance to the royal palace.
translation: King Rehoboam wokim skild i go bronzi na em i givim ol i go long han bilong kapten bilong solju ol i stap wok long entris bilong haus bilong king.

original: And whenever the king entered the house of the LORD, the guards would bear the shields, and later they would return them to the guardroom.
translation: Wewan tru king i go insait long haus bilong Lod, gaad i kisim skild long karim, na bai ol i bringim bek gen long rum bilong gaad.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, along with all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting na wantaim olgeta samting Rehoboam i mekim, ol i no raitim long Buk bilong Taim bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout their days.
translation: Bikpela fait i bin stap long Rehoboam na Jeroboam olgeta taim bilong ol.

original: And Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David; his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonite. And his son Abijam reigned in his place.
translation: Na Rehoboam i go bek long ples bilong tumbuna, na ol i bin plantim em wantaim ol long Siti bilong David. Nem bilong mama bilong em Naamah, meri bilong Ammon. Na susa bilong en, Abijam, i kam bihain long en, i bos bilong Israel.

original: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijam became king of Judah,
translation: Long namba etenpela yia bilong rain bilong Jeroboam man bilong Nebat, Abijam i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: and he reigned in Jerusalem three years. His mother’s name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
translation: Na em i stap king long Jerusalem long tiri yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Maaka, bikmeri bilong Abisalom.

original: And Abijam walked in all the sins that his father before him had committed, and his heart was not as fully devoted to the LORD his God as the heart of David his forefather had been.
translation: Na Abijam i go wakabaut long ol sin blong papa bilong em, na haret bilong en i no inap long tokim gut olsem haret bilong Dauid tumbuna bilong en, i birua long LORD God bilong en.

original: Nevertheless, for the sake of David, the LORD his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem by raising up a son to succeed him and to make Jerusalem strong.
translation: Nogat yet, long olsem Davidson, Papa God Bikpela givim em laip long Jerusalema olsem i kisim i go bekim pikinini bihaen long en, na olsem Jerusalema i kamap strong.

original: For David had done what was right in the eyes of the LORD and had not turned aside from anything the LORD commanded all the days of his life, except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
translation: Bikos Davide im mekim olgeta samting wei i orait long ai bilong LORD, na em i no lusim rot long eni givim tok LORD i givim, olgeta de long laip bilong em, bikos long hap bilong Uriah Hittit man.

original: And there was war between the houses of Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of Abijam’s life.
translation: Na i gat faet long taim bilong Rehoboam na Jeroboam long bihain bilong hus na hus olsem, long ol dei bilong laip bilong Abijam.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Abijam, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
translation: Long olgeta samting bilong Abijam, wantaim ol samting em i mekim, i no raitim long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Yuda? Na i gat wot bilong Abijam wantaim Jeroboam.

original: And Abijam rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David, and his son Asa reigned in his place.
translation: Na Abijam i go stap wantaim papa bilong en, ol i kisim em i go biruaim long siti bilong Dauid, na susa bilong en Asa i kam bihain long em i bos.

original: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam’s reign over Israel, Asa became king of Judah,
translation: Long namba twenty yarn long taem Jeroboam i bos bilong Israel, Asa i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: and he reigned in Jerusalem forty-one years. His grandmother’s name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
translation: Na em i bin kilim gavman long Jerusalem long yia forty-one. Nem bilong granny bilong en, Maka, meri bilong Abisalom.

original: And Asa did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, as his father David had done.
translation: Na Asa wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem tumbuna bilong en David i mekim.

original: He banished the male shrine prostitutes from the land and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
translation: Em i rausim ol man husat i stap long ples namel long kantri na em i takedaun ol idol ol tumbuna bilong en i wokim.

original: He also removed his grandmother Maacah from her position as queen mother because she had made a detestable Asherah pole. Asa chopped down the pole and burned it in the Kidron Valley.
translation: Asa rausim niningu Maacah kwin meri mama long posisen bilong en, long ol samting nogut em wokim post bilong Asherah i no gutpela. Asa kisim naikim knife katim post, burnim em long Kidron Valley.

original: The high places were not removed, but Asa’s heart was fully devoted to the LORD all his days.
translation: Ol ples bilong dei bipo i no go daun, tasol hati bilong Asa i stap strong long LORD long oldei bilong en.

original: And he brought into the house of the LORD the silver and gold and other articles that he and his father had dedicated.
translation: Na em bin bringim i go insait long haus bilong Lod silva na gol na ol samting naru em na papa bilong em ol i makim bilong hem.

original: Now there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their days.
translation: Na Asa na Baasha king bilong Israel, ol i gat bikpela faet long olgeta dei bilong ol.

original: Baasha king of Israel went to war against Judah and fortified Ramah to prevent anyone from leaving or entering the territory of Asa king of Judah.
translation: Baasha papa bilong Isrel i go long war gen long Juda, na em i strongim Ramah yet, baim ol pipel i no inap go aut o kamo insait long kantri bilong Asa papa bilong Juda.

original: So Asa withdrew all the silver and gold that remained in the treasuries of the house of the LORD and the royal palace. He entrusted it to his servants and sent them with this message to Ben-hadad son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion king of Aram, who was ruling in Damascus:
translation: Na Asa em i kisim olgeta moni i stap yet long haus moni bilong LORD na haus bilong king. Em i givim olsem long servant i bilong en, na em i sendim ol long dispela tok long Ben-hadad man bilong Tabrimmon, pikinini bilong Hezion king bilong Aram, we i stap bos long Damascus:

original: “Let there be a treaty between me and you, between my father and your father. See, I have sent you a gift of silver and gold. Now go and break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, so that he will withdraw from me.”
translation: Mipela i mas stap long peis, mipela tete na yu tete. Mi sendim silva na goled olsem tok guddi long yu. Nau yu go brekim peis bilong yu wantaim Baasha king bilong Israel, na em bai lusim mi go.

original: And Ben-hadad listened to King Asa and sent the commanders of his armies against the cities of Israel, conquering Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maacah, and the whole land of Naphtali, including the region of Chinnereth.
translation: Na Ben-hadad i harim tok bilong King Asa, na em baim papa bilong army i go bek gen, ol i winim Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maacah, na olgeta ples balus bilong Naphtali, inklusiv Chinnereth.

original: When Baasha learned of this, he stopped fortifying Ramah and withdrew to Tirzah.
translation: Wanpela taim Baasha harim dispela stori, em i stap stopim wok long kisim strongim Ramah, na em i go bek gen long Tirzah.

original: Then King Asa summoned all the men of Judah, with no exceptions, and they carried away the stones of Ramah and the timbers Baasha had used for building. And with these materials King Asa built up Geba of Benjamin, as well as Mizpah.
translation: Na King Asa i singautim ol man meri bilong Yuda long olgeta hap, na ol i kisim stone bilong Ramah na timba Baasha i usim long bikim haus, nau ol i kirapim. King Asa i usim dispela samting long bikim Geba bilong Benjamin, na Mizpah, i kamap strong.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Asa, along with all his might, all his accomplishments, and the cities he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? In his old age, however, he became diseased in his feet.
translation: Nau ol narapela wok bilong Asa, olgeta strong bilong en, ol samting em bin mekim, na tauns em bin bilongen, i no stap raun long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King Bilong Yuda? Taim em bin go dae, em i sick long lek bilong en.

original: And Asa rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the city of his father David, and his son Jehoshaphat reigned in his place.
translation: Na Asa i go stap wantaim papa bilong en, na ol i bin plantim em wantaim ol long taun bilong papa Daud, na sut bilong en Jehoshaphat i kam bihain long en.

original: In the second year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Nadab son of Jeroboam became king of Israel, and he reigned two years.
translation: Long namba tu yia bilong taim bilong rulim bilong Asa king bilong Yuda, Nadab, pikinini bilong Jeroboam, i kamap king bilong Isrel, na em i stap king long tu yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the way of his father and in his sin, which he had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em i go wankim i go long rot bilong papa bilong en, na long sin bilong en, olsem em i bin mekim Israel i sindaun long en.

original: Then Baasha son of Ahijah of the house of Issachar conspired against Nadab, and Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon of the Philistines while Nadab and all Israel were besieging the city.
translation: Baasha Pikinini bilong Ahijah husat i stap long haus bilong Isaka, em i mekim birua gen Nadab, na Baasha i kilim daun Nadab long Gibbethon bilong Filistia, wail olsem Nadab na ol Israel ol i kamautim siti.

original: In the third year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Baasha killed Nadab and reigned in his place.
translation: Long yia three bilong rein bilong Asa i bos bilong Yuda, Baasha i kilim Nadab na i bos bihain long em.

original: As soon as Baasha became king, he struck down the entire household of Jeroboam. He did not leave to Jeroboam anyone that breathed, but destroyed them all according to the word that the LORD had spoken through His servant Ahijah the Shilonite,
translation: Taim Baasha i kamap king, na em i kilim ol famili bilong Jeroboam. Em i no leivim wanpela man bilong Jeroboam we i stap breathim yet, tasol em i bagarapim ol long wei bilong tok bilong GOD we em i spikim thru wokman bilong em, Ahijah bilong Shiloh.

original: because of the sins Jeroboam had committed and had caused Israel to commit, and because he had provoked the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger.
translation: Bilong ol sin Jeroboam i mekim na i kisim Israel long mekim, na bilong em i wariim LORD, God bilong Israel, long bel.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Nadab, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Nadab, long namel olgeta strongpela wok im bin mekim, i no bin writim yet long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their days.
translation: Na narapela gen war i kam long Asa na Baasha king bilong Israel olgeta dei bilong ol.

original: In the third year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king of all Israel, and he reigned in Tirzah twenty-four years.
translation: Long yia three bilong taim bilong Asa i bos bilong Yuda, Baasa sun bilong Ahija i kamap king bilong Isrel, na i bos long Tirza gen long yia twenty-four.

original: And Baasha did evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin, which he had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na Baasha i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em i wokabaut long rot bilong Jeroboam, na long sin bilong en, olsem nau em i kisim Israel i go long sin.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha, saying:
translation: Na tok bilong GOD i kam long Iehu, Pikinini bilong Hanani, olsem, tokim Baasa:

original: “Even though I lifted you out of the dust and made you ruler over My people Israel, you have walked in the way of Jeroboam and have caused My people Israel to sin and to provoke Me to anger by their sins.
translation: Mi bin kilim yu antap long graun na mi bin mekim yu bos bilong pipo balus Israel, yu i go wankain long rot bilong Yeroboam, na yu mekim pipo balus Israel i sindaun, na yu makim mi kros long sin bilong ol, na ol i provocim mi long anga.

original: So now I will consume Baasha and his house, and I will make your house like that of Jeroboam son of Nebat:
translation: Nau mi bai kaikai Baasha na haus bilong em, na mi bai mekim haus bilong yu olsem haus bilong Jeroboam sone bilong Nebat.

original: Anyone belonging to Baasha who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and anyone who dies in the field will be eaten by the birds of the air.”
translation: Ol man i bilong Baasha i dai insait long taun, dok i kaikai, na ol i dai long bus, pisin bilong heven i kaikai.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Baasha, along with his accomplishments and might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Olsem na, long olgeta samting nara bilong Baasha, longsait ol bikpela wok na strong im i mekim, i no writim long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Baasha rested with his fathers and was buried in Tirzah, and his son Elah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Baasha i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na em i go daun long graun long Tirzah, na yusum Elah i bos olpela hap bilong em.

original: Moreover, the word of the LORD came through the prophet Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha and his house, because of all the evil he had done in the sight of the LORD, provoking Him to anger with the work of his hands and becoming like the house of Jeroboam, and also because Baasha had struck down the house of Jeroboam.
translation: Na tok bilong LORD i kam gen long han bilong propet Jehu san bilong Hanani, tok strong long Baasha na haus bilong en, bikos olgeta hevi em i mekim namel long ai bilong GOD, na wokim GOD i bel kol wantaim wok bilong han, na em i kamap olsem haus bilong Jeroboam, na tu em i kilim haus bilong Jeroboam.

original: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Elah son of Baasha became king of Israel, and he reigned in Tirzah two years.
translation: Long yia twenty-sik bilong rein bilong Asa olsem bos bilong Yuda, Elah man bilong Baasha i kamap king bilong Israel, na i bos long Tirzah long tupela yia.

original: However, while Elah was in Tirzah getting drunk in the house of Arza the steward of his household there, Elah’s servant Zimri, the commander of half his chariots, conspired against him.
translation: Bipo long taim we Elah i stap long Tirzah i dring ol i dai long haus bilong Arza husat i steward bilong em, na i lukautim hous, Zimri sarvan bilong Elah, komanda bilong hap chariot bilong en, i mekim birua long en.

original: So in the twenty-seventh year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Zimri went in, struck Elah down, and killed him. And Zimri reigned in his place.
translation: Long twenty-seventh yia bilong taim bilong rul blong Asa ibin king olpela Juda, Zimri i go insait, winim Elah i go daun, na kilim em. Na Zimri i rulim bihain long en.

original: As soon as Zimri began to reign and was seated on the throne, he struck down the entire household of Baasha. He did not leave a single male, whether a kinsman or friend.
translation: Long taim Zimri i kamap na em i bin bekim ples bilong en, em i sitten long thrown, na em i kilim olgeta long haus bilong Baasha. Em i no levim wanpela man, brata, poroman, rod bilong man, em i kilim ol.

original: So Zimri destroyed the entire household of Baasha, according to the word that the LORD had spoken against Baasha through Jehu the prophet.
translation: Na Zimri i bin bagarapim husat yua i bilong Baasha, olsem tok bilong GOD i tokim long Baasha przez Jehu propet.

original: This happened because of all the sins Baasha and his son Elah had committed and had caused Israel to commit, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.
translation: Em i kamap olsem bikos long olgeta sin blong Baasha na sussa blong em Elah ol i mekim na ol i kisim Israel long mekim, long bringim bel hevi long LORD, Bikpela God blong Israel, wantaim ol hain-hain idol blong ol.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Elah, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting nau bilong Elah, longol save na olgeta strongpela wok em i mekim, i no writim ol dispela tinging long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong Ol King Bilong Israel?

original: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Zimri reigned in Tirzah for seven days. Now the troops were encamped against Gibbethon of the Philistines,
translation: Long twenty-seventh yia Asa i bos bilong Yuda, Zimri i bos long Tirza, na i bos sampela seven de. Ol solja i kampe long ples Gibeson bilong Filistia.

original: and the people in the camp heard that Zimri had not only conspired but had also struck down the king. So there in the camp that very day, all Israel proclaimed Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel.
translation: Na ol pipol i harim tok long ples, Zimri i mekim birua tasol, na i kilim king. Ol Israel i makim Omri, kaptin bilong solja, king bilong Israel, long ples ia, long de namba.

original: Then Omri and all the Israelites marched up from Gibbethon and besieged Tirzah.
translation: Na Omri na olgeta pipol bilong Israel i go antap long Gibbeton na ol i kam bekim Tirzah.

original: When Zimri saw that the city was captured, he entered the citadel of the royal palace and burned it down upon himself. So he died
translation: Taim Zimri harim olsem taun i go daun, em go insait long haus bilong king, na em bakim Haus bilong em yet, na em i dai.

original: because of the sins he had committed, doing evil in the sight of the LORD and following the example of Jeroboam and the sin he had committed and had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Bikin ol sin em i mekim, wokim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na follem sampela we bilong Jeroboam, king bilong Israel, na sin em i mekim na i bringim Israel, ol pipol bilong God, i mekim tu.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Zimri and the treason he committed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Zimri na bagarap em i mekim, i no bin raitim yet long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong Kings Bilong Israel?

original: At that time the people of Israel were divided: Half of the people supported Tibni son of Ginath as king, and half supported Omri.
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipel bilong Isrel i go aplis: hap bilong ol pipel i sapotim Tibni sambai bilong Ginath olsem king, na hap narak i sapotim Omri.

original: But the followers of Omri proved stronger than those of Tibni son of Ginath. So Tibni died and Omri became king.
translation: Ol i go bek long Omri, na ol i bikim strong moa long ol i go bek long Tibni bin Ginath. Nogat, Tibni i dai pinis, na Omri i kamap king.

original: In the thirty-first year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Omri became king of Israel, and he reigned twelve years, six of them in Tirzah.
translation: Long 31st yia bilong rein bilong Asa i bos bilong Yuda, Omri i kamap king bilong Israel, na em i bos twelv yia, sikis yia bilong ol i bin stap long Tirzah.

original: He bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver and built a city there, calling it Samaria after the name of Shemer, who had owned the hill.
translation: Em baimim ples hap bilong Samaria long Shemer olsem tu talen silva, na em mekim taun long hap, em kolim olsem Samaria bihaen long nem bilong Shemer, husat i bin ownim ples hap.

original: But Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD and acted more wickedly than all who were before him.
translation: Omri i mekim nogut long ai bilong Jehovah na i wokim bagarap olgeta long wei bilong bikim samting nogut, na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long wei bilong bagarap more than ol pipol bifo em.

original: For he walked in all the ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat and in his sins, which he caused Israel to commit, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.
translation: Em i go olsem long olgeta wei blong Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat na long sin blong en, olsem em i mekim Israel long bihainim, wokim LORD, God bilong Israel, i masalai wantaim idol nogut.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Omri, along with his accomplishments and the might he exercised, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long ol aktibiti bilong Omri, tugela na strongpela wok em i mekim, ol i no raitim long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Omri rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria, and his son Ahab reigned in his place.
translation: Na Omri i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i bin plantim em long Samaria, na susa bilong en Ahab i kam bihain long em, i bos.

original: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Ahab son of Omri became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria twenty-two years.
translation: Long yia 38 bilong rein bilong Asa long Judah, Ahab, pikinini bilong Omri, ibin kamap king bilong Isrel, na ibin rulim long Samaria long 22 yia.

original: However, Ahab son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD, more than all who were before him.
translation: Ahab sak na Omri i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD, moa yet long ol pipel we i stap biforim.

original: And as if it were not enough for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, he even married Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and he then proceeded to serve and worship Baal.
translation: Na olsem nogat i nap long em, em i wokabaut long sin bilong Jeroboam suten bilong Nebat, em i maritim Jezebel, pikinini meri bilong Ethbaal king bilong Sidonians, na em i servisis na wosipim Baal.

original: First, Ahab set up an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal that he had built in Samaria.
translation: Ahap i stapim wanpela altar long haos bilong priester bilong Baal, lotu bilong Baal, we i bin mekim long Samaria.

original: Then he set up an Asherah pole. Thus Ahab did more to provoke the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel before him.
translation: Na em plantim polo bilong Asherah. Olsem na Ahab wokim plenti ka long Bikpela, God bilong Israel, long popoia, moa yet long ol king bilong Israel i bin wokim bifo em.

original: In Ahab’s days, Hiel the Bethelite rebuilt Jericho. At the cost of Abiram his firstborn he laid its foundation, and at the cost of Segub his youngest he set up its gates, according to the word that the LORD had spoken through Joshua son of Nun.
translation: Long taim bilong Ahab, Hiel man bilong Betel en rebuildim Jeriko. Em bin mekim fonasion bilong em long praiz bilong Abiram esbol i go, na em plantim gatem bilong em long praiz bilong Segub em i pikinini tumas, olsem word i kam long LORD i tok thru Joshua pikinini bilong Nun.

original: Now Elijah the Tishbite, who was among the settlers of Gilead, said to Ahab, “As surely as the LORD lives—the God of Israel before whom I stand—there will be neither dew nor rain in these years except at my word!”
translation: Nau Eliya bilong Tisibe, em i wanpela husat i stap long Gilead, em i tokim Ahab, “Olsem Bikpela LORD i stap, Bikpela God bilong Israel we mi stap bikosim – no ken hav dew na ren long yia i kam bek, eksept mi yet tok!”

original: Then a revelation from the LORD came to Elijah:
translation: Wanpela tok bilong Jehovah kam long Eliya:

original: “Leave here, turn eastward, and hide yourself by the Brook of Cherith, east of the Jordan.
translation: Lusim hap bilong yu, tarn ol i go long sindaun, kaivim yu yet long Wara Cherith, long sindaun bilong Jordan.

original: And you are to drink from the brook, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there.”
translation: Na yu mas dringim wara long streem, na mi bin tokim birddok ol i go givim kaikai long yu long hap bilong yu.

original: So Elijah did what the LORD had told him, and he went and lived by the Brook of Cherith, east of the Jordan.
translation: Na Elia en hem mekim olsem Jehovah i tokim em, na em i go na istap klostu long Cherith Creek, long sais bilong Jordan.

original: The ravens would bring him bread and meat in the morning and evening, and he would drink from the brook.
translation: Kakamus i bringim bret na mit longen moning na apinun, na em i dringim wara long rokroko.

original: Some time later, however, the brook dried up because there had been no rain in the land.
translation: Olsen taim bihain, wara i drai pinis bikos no gat ren yet long kantri.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah:
translation: Namba wanpela tok bilong GOD kam long Elijah:

original: “Get up and go to Zarephath of Sidon, and stay there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to provide for you.”
translation: Kam daun na go long Sarefat bilong Saideon, na stap we. Lukele, Mi bin givim tok long widow meri ipas long hap provide olgeta samting long yu.

original: So Elijah got up and went to Zarephath. When he arrived at the city gate, there was a widow gathering sticks. Elijah called to her and said, “Please bring me a little water in a cup, so that I may drink.”
translation: Na Eliya i kam bek na i go long Zarepata. Em i kam ap long gate bilong taun, na em i lukim wanpela widou i bikim ka. Eliya i singautim em, "Kisim wata liklik bungim mi, mi drink."

original: And as she was going to get it, he called to her and said, “Please bring me a piece of bread.”
translation: Na em i go kisim, em kalim i go long em, "Ples bringingim mi wanpela ka."

original: But she replied, “As surely as the LORD your God lives, I have no bread—only a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug. Look, I am gathering a couple of sticks to take home and prepare a meal for myself and my son, so that we may eat it and die.”
translation: Em i tokim, “Olsem LORD God bilong yu i stap, bread mipela i no gat – dispela hanful balus i stap insait long bokis na liklik ol i stap insait long jag. Mi lukim, mipela i kisim tupela liklik stik long go hap home na mekim ka long mipela na long pikinini bilong mipela, bilong mipela i kai na i dai.”

original: “Do not be afraid,” Elijah said to her. “Go and do as you have said. But first make me a small cake of bread from what you have, and bring it out to me. Afterward, make some for yourself and your son,
translation: “Noken afred,” Elias i tokim em. “Go na mekim olsem yu tokim. Tasol, bikim mipela samting bilong kaikai olsem bun bilong bred na kisim i kam aut long mipela. Na bihain, wokim sampela bilong yu yet na bilong pikinini bilong yu.”

original: for this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘The jar of flour will not be exhausted and the jug of oil will not run dry until the day the LORD sends rain upon the face of the earth.’”
translation: LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, i tok: “Klosim ol man i no ronwei, na bikpela bilong powa bai i no pinis, long taem LORD i salim ren i kam daun long graun.”

original: So she went and did according to the word of Elijah, and there was food every day for Elijah and the woman and her household.
translation: Na em i go na mekim olsem Elijah i tok, na ka i kamap strong long olgeta de, na i gat kaikai every day long Elijah na meri na hous Pikinini bilong em.

original: The jar of flour was not exhausted and the jug of oil did not run dry, according to the word that the LORD had spoken through Elijah.
translation: Kup bilong powa i no ken finish na jag bilong oil i no ken bungim, olsem wod bilong LORD i tok tumas long Elija.

original: Later, the son of the woman who owned the house became ill, and his sickness grew worse and worse, until no breath remained in him.
translation: Nupela pikinini bilong meri husat i owena haus i susa i sik, na sik bilong em i go daun, i go daun olsem na olsem, until no win i stap long en.

original: “O man of God,” said the woman to Elijah, “what have you done to me? Have you come to remind me of my iniquity and cause the death of my son?”
translation: “O man bilong God,” ol meri tokim Eliya, “wanem yu mekim long me? Yu kam bekim mi long sin bilong me, na kilim pikinini bilong me?”

original: But Elijah said to her, “Give me your son.” So he took him from her arms, carried him to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed.
translation: Elijas i askim olsem, "Givim mi pikinini bilong yu." Na em yet i kisim pikinini, karim i go long rum bubui we em i stap, na laipim i daun long bet bilong em yet.

original: Then he cried out to the LORD, “O LORD my God, have You also brought tragedy on this widow who has opened her home to me, by causing her son to die?”
translation: Em i kirap strong long LORD, "O LORD God bilong mi, yu bringim bekim traumi tu long dispela widu meri we em i opim haus bilong em long me, na makim pikinini bilong em i dai?"

original: Then he stretched himself out over the child three times and cried out to the LORD, “O LORD my God, please let this boy’s life return to him!”
translation: Na em i stilim bodi bilong en longuspela child tripe, na em i singaut i go long Bikpela, "O Bikpela, God bilong mi, givim laip long dispela boy i kam bek!"

original: And the LORD listened to the voice of Elijah, and the child’s life returned to him, and he lived.
translation: Na Bikpela i harim voz bilong Elijah, na laip bilong pikinini i kam bek gen, na em i stap.

original: Then Elijah took the child, brought him down from the upper room into the house, and gave him to his mother. “Look, your son is alive,” Elijah declared.
translation: Na Eliaj i kisim pikinini, i kam daun long rum bubu i go daun long haus, na i givim bek long mama bilong em. Eliaj i tok olsem: "Lukim, pikinini bilong yu i stap alive."

original: Then the woman said to Elijah, “Now I know that you are a man of God and that the word of the LORD from your mouth is truth.”
translation: Meri i tokim Eliya, “Nau mi save olsem yu em i man bilong God na tok bilong LORD we yu tok em i truth.”

original: After a long time, in the third year of the drought, the word of the LORD came to Elijah: “Go and present yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain upon the face of the earth.”
translation: Long taem igo pinis, long yia three bilong draut, tok bilong LORD i kam long Elijah: “Go na shooim yupela long Ahab, na mi bai senisim ren i pundaon long pes bilong graun.”

original: So Elijah went to present himself to Ahab. The famine was severe in Samaria,
translation: Na Elijia i go bekim em yet long ples bilong King Ahab. Kaukau i kamap strong olsem long Samaria.

original: and Ahab summoned Obadiah, who was in charge of the palace. (Now Obadiah greatly feared the LORD,
translation: Na Ahap i kirapim Obadia, man i stap long ples bilong king, (na Obadia i got bikpela respek long LORD,)

original: for when Jezebel had slaughtered the prophets of the LORD, Obadiah had taken a hundred prophets and hidden them, fifty men per cave, providing them with food and water.)
translation: Long taim Jezebel i kilim profet bilong LORD olgeta, Obadia i kisim hundred profet na i kaivim ol long hole, fifty man long wanpela hole, na i givim ol kaikai na wara.

original: Then Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go throughout the land to every spring and every valley. Perhaps we will find grass to keep the horses and mules alive so that we will not have to destroy any livestock.”
translation: Ahab i tokim Obadiah, “Go olsem long kantri, go long wara na vali. Em inap long yumi kisim gras bilong kaikai na i stap long laip bilong hores na mules, bilong bai yumi no ken dagalagim ol aninit long ples.”

original: So they divided the land to explore. Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went the other way by himself.
translation: Ol i diwaisim gras bilong kantri. Ahab i go wanpela rot long en, Obadia i go narpela rot long en.

original: Now as Obadiah went on his way, Elijah suddenly met him. When Obadiah recognized him, he fell facedown and said, “Is it you, my lord Elijah?”
translation: Na Obadia i go long we, Elijah i kamapim em. Na em i harim Elijah, i kilim fac long graun, tukim tok, “Yu yet, papa bilong mipela Elijah?”

original: “It is I,” he answered. “Go tell your master, ‘Elijah is here!’”
translation: Em mi yet, mi tok, “Go tokim papa bilong yu, ‘Elija i stap hia!’”

original: But Obadiah replied, “How have I sinned, that you are handing your servant over to Ahab to put me to death?
translation: Mipela Ol Obidia tokim bek, “Mi bin mekim sin wanem, nau yu givim mi i go long han bilong Ahab, i kilim mi?

original: As surely as the LORD your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent someone to search for you. When they said, ‘He is not here,’ he made that kingdom or nation swear that they had not found you.
translation: Olsem olgeta long tok bilong Bikpela em i alive, i no gat kantri o kingdom we papa bilong yu em i no salim man go painim yu. Taim ol i tok, ‘Em i no stap hia’, em i wokim kingdom oa kantri i kamap strong long promis olsem ol i no painim yu.

original: And now you say, ‘Go tell your master that Elijah is here!’
translation: Na nau yu tok, "Go tokim papa bilong yu, ol Elijah i kam!"

original: I do not know where the Spirit of the LORD may carry you off when I leave you. Then when I go and tell Ahab and he does not find you, he will kill me. But I, your servant, have feared the LORD from my youth.
translation: Mi no save whe Spirit bilong LORD bai karim yu go wane mi lusim yu. Na wane mi go tukim Ahab na em i no findim yu, em bai kilim mi. Tasol mi, servant bilong yu, miepela i fearim LORD olsem long taim bilong yut.

original: Was it not reported to my lord what I did when Jezebel slaughtered the prophets of the LORD? I hid a hundred prophets of the LORD, fifty men per cave, and I provided them with food and water.
translation: Ina tok pisin i no kam bek long han bilong bikpela, olgeta samting nau mi mekim wanem taim Jezebel i kilim ol profet bilong LORD? Mi kisim na hidim hundred profet bilong LORD, fifty man long wan hole, na mi givim ol kaikai na wara.

original: And now you say, ‘Go tell your lord that Elijah is here!’ He will kill me!”
translation: Nau yu tok, 'Go tekem i go long papa bilong yu, Eliya i kam!' Em bai bringim daunfall bilong mi!

original: Then Elijah said, “As surely as the LORD of Hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will present myself to Ahab today.”
translation: Na Elijah i tok, "Olsem Papa bilong ol ples i stap, na mi tu stap bifo em, nau bai mi go kam bek long Ahab tude."

original: So Obadiah went to inform Ahab, who went to meet Elijah.
translation: Na Obadia i go pinis long tokim Ahabu, na Ahabu i go long kamapim Elija.

original: When Ahab saw Elijah, he said to him, “Is that you, O troubler of Israel?”
translation: Taim Ahab i lukim Eliya, na em i tokim em, "Yu yet yu, o man i save mekim Israel i bagarap?"

original: “I have not troubled Israel,” Elijah replied, “but you and your father’s house have, for you have forsaken the commandments of the LORD and have followed the Baals.
translation: Mi no bin givim trabel long Israel, Elijah i tok, “Bikos yu na haus bilong papa bilong yu i troublem, long ol i lusim tok bilong LORD na i go bek long Baals.

original: Now summon all Israel to meet me on Mount Carmel, along with the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal and the four hundred prophets of Asherah who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
translation: Nau, kalim ol Israel i kam meet wantaim mipela long Maunt Karmel, kaikai wantaim ol profet bilong Baal, em four hundred and fifty, na ol profet bilong Asherah, em four hundred, ol i kaikai long tebol bilong Jezebel.

original: So Ahab summoned all the Israelites and assembled the prophets on Mount Carmel.
translation: Na Ahabu i kisim olgeta Israelites i kam, na i birua olgeta profet long Maunten Karmel.

original: Then Elijah approached all the people and said, “How long will you waver between two opinions? If the LORD is God, follow Him. But if Baal is God, follow him.” But the people did not answer a word.
translation: Na Eliya i go klostu long olgeta manmeri na i tok, “Bai yumui stap beklong twe hap bilong tok olsem wanem? I sori, Bikpela em God, bihainim Em. Bai Baal em God, bihainim em.” Tasol olgeta manmeri i no givim wanpela toktok.

original: Then Elijah said to the people, “I am the only remaining prophet of the LORD, but Baal has four hundred and fifty prophets.
translation: Eliya tokim long ol pipol, “Mi wanpela tasol i stap yet na bilong Lod, tasol Baal i gat planti prophets, four hundred and fifty.”

original: Get two bulls for us. Let the prophets of Baal choose one bull for themselves, cut it into pieces, and place it on the wood but not light the fire. And I will prepare the other bull and place it on the wood but not light the fire.
translation: Kisim tupela bulmakau bilong yumi. Liam prophet bilong Baal i ken choosim wanpela bulmakau, kilim em i go olsem hap, na putim em long diwai tasol ina ligim faia yet. Na mi bai preparim narakain bulmakau na putim em long diwai tasol ina ligim faia yet.

original: Then you may call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of the LORD. The God who answers by fire, He is God.” And all the people answered, “What you say is good.”
translation: Yupela inap kolim nem bilong biceman bilong yupela, na mi bai kolim nem bilong LORD. God i givim ansa long paia, Em i God.” Na olgeta manmeri tok, “Dispela yumi tok, em i gut.”

original: Then Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Since you are so numerous, choose for yourselves one bull and prepare it first. Then call on the name of your god, but do not light the fire.”
translation: Ilia i tokim long profet bilong Baal, “Yupela i masi, chusim wan bulmakau na raitim em i rede. Klem namel bilong bikpela god bilong yu, tasol yu no ken lakit paia.”

original: And they took the bull that was given them, prepared it, and called on the name of Baal from morning until noon, shouting, “O Baal, answer us!” But there was no sound, and no one answered as they leaped around the altar they had made.
translation: Na ol i kisim bulmakau we i givim ol, ol i prepearim, na ol i kalim nem bilong Baal from moning ka moning til bikos, singaut, "O Baal, harim mipela!" Tasol ino gat sain, na nobodi i ansa ol, ol i dans i go raun long alti ol i mekim.

original: At noon Elijah began to taunt them, saying, “Shout louder, for he is a god! Perhaps he is deep in thought, or occupied, or on a journey. Perhaps he is sleeping and must be awakened!”
translation: Long taon em i go, Elia i statim tok bilong jakim ol, em i mekim tok, “Singautim strong, bikos em i god! Em bai ino tingim hed, o em i wokim samting, o em i go wankain long ples. Em bai i kaikai sindaun na em i mas bekim!”

original: So they shouted louder and cut themselves with knives and lances, as was their custom, until the blood gushed over them.
translation: Ol i kirapim tokstrong, na ol i katim sking bilong ol yet gen knife na spia, olsem tumbuna bilong ol, na blod i kamautim ol.

original: Midday passed, and they kept on raving until the time of the evening sacrifice. But there was no response; no one answered, no one paid attention.
translation: Em i go pinis long midde, na ol i stap yet long tok bokis, kas olsem taim bilong sakramen bilong apinun, tasol i no givim bek, nobody i harm, nogat man i save.

original: Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” So all the people approached him, and he repaired the altar of the LORD that had been torn down.
translation: Na Elia i tokim ol pipol, "Kam klostu long me." Ol pipol i kam klostu long em, na em i redim altan bilong LORD we i bin brok.

original: And Elijah took twelve stones, one for each tribe of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the LORD had come and said, “Israel shall be your name.”
translation: Na Eliya i kisim twelve ston, wanbilong eni trib long ol pikinini bilong Yakob, olsem tok bilong LORD i kam na tokim ol, “Isrel bai bi naitpela nem bilong yu.”

original: And with the stones, Elijah built an altar in the name of the LORD. Then he dug a trench around the altar large enough to hold two seahs of seed.
translation: Na Elias i usim ston long bikim alta long nem bilong Papa God. Na em i dikim wanpela hol long sait bilong alta, hol i gat spes olsem igat ruum long kamapim pipia bilong si, twe seah.

original: Next, he arranged the wood, cut up the bull, placed it on the wood,
translation: Nambawan, em arapim diwai, em katim bulmakau i go, em putim i antap long diwai.

original: and said, “Fill four waterpots and pour the water on the offering and on the wood.” “Do it a second time,” he said, and they did it a second time. “Do it a third time,” he said, and they did it a third time.
translation: Em i tok, "Filim foa wata pots na putim wata i go daun long ofing na long diwai." "Me kirap gen," em i tok, na ol i mekim gen. "Me kirap tripe," em i tok, na ol i mekim tripe.

original: So the water ran down around the altar and even filled the trench.
translation: Wara i ran i daun arond long sait bilong alta na i filim ol gres.

original: At the time of the evening sacrifice, Elijah the prophet approached the altar and said, “O LORD, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known this day that You are God in Israel and that I am Your servant and have done all these things at Your command.
translation: Taim bilong sakris long apinun, Eliaja profet i kam klostu long alta na em i tok, "O LORD, God bilong Abraham, Isaac, na Israel, em i mas klia long dey olsem Yu tasol em i God long Israel na mi servit bilong Yu, na mi wokim olgeta dispela samting long komando bilong Yu.

original: Answer me, O LORD! Answer me, so that this people will know that You, the LORD, are God, and that You have turned their hearts back again.”
translation: Bikpela, givim me tok, Bikpela, givim me tok, na so ol pipol bai save olsem Yu, Bikpela, em i Bikpela, na Yu bin bringim bek gen haret bilong ol.

original: Then the fire of the LORD fell and consumed the sacrifice, the wood, the stones, and the dust, and it licked up the water in the trench.
translation: Na faia bilong Lod i kam daun, i pundaun na i kaikai olgeta sacrifis, ol narapela wara, ston, na goton, na i lamusim olgeta wara i stap long trench.

original: When all the people saw this, they fell facedown and said, “The LORD, He is God! The LORD, He is God!”
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipol i lukim dispela, ol i pidim face na graun na ol i tok, "Bikpela, Em i God! Bikpela, Em i God!"

original: Then Elijah ordered them, “Seize the prophets of Baal! Do not let a single one escape.” So they seized them, and Elijah brought them down to the Kishon Valley and slaughtered them there.
translation: Eliya i tokim ol, "Kamdaun na kisim ol profet bilong Baal! No ken let nepa wan escape." Ol i kamdaun na kisim ol, na Eliya i bringim ol i daun long Kishon Valley, na kilim ol hap there.

original: And Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink, for there is the sound of a heavy rain.”
translation: Na Elaija i tokim Ahab, “Go ap, kaikai na dring, wantaim saut bilong ren i gat wail i kam.”

original: So Ahab went up to eat and drink. But Elijah climbed to the summit of Carmel, bent down on the ground, and put his face between his knees.
translation: Na Ahab i go ap long kaikai na dring. Tasol Elijah i klamap long hap bilong Karmel, i kruk long graun, na i putim pes bilong en bikos long kni bilong en.

original: “Go and look toward the sea,” he said to his servant. So the servant went and looked, and he said, “There is nothing there.” Seven times Elijah said, “Go back.”
translation: “Go na lukim olgeta long solwara,” Elijia i tokim servant bilong en. Na servant i go na lukim, na i tok, “Inogat samting i stap.” Elijia i tok seven taem, “Go bek gen.”

original: On the seventh time the servant reported, “There is a cloud as small as a man’s hand rising from the sea.” And Elijah replied, “Go and tell Ahab, ‘Prepare your chariot and go down before the rain stops you.’”
translation: Long namba seven, husat i wok servos i raitim, “Klau i kam up olsem smol bilong han bilong man long solwara.” Na Elija i tok, “Go na toktok wantaim Ahab, ‘Mipela preparim kare na yu go daun bifo ren i harim yu.’”

original: Meanwhile, the sky grew dark with clouds and wind, and a heavy rain began to fall. So Ahab rode away and went to Jezreel.
translation: Wanpela taim, skai na klau na win i kamap dai, na ren i bikim strong nau. Ahab i ridim na go long Jezreel.

original: And the hand of the LORD came upon Elijah, and he tucked his cloak into his belt and ran ahead of Ahab all the way to Jezreel.
translation: Na han bilong LORD i kam apostim Elijah, na em i tubum klos bilong en i go insait long bel bilong en, na em i ran i go bifo long Ahab olsem ol i go kas long Jezreel.

original: Now Ahab told Jezebel everything that Elijah had done and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.
translation: Ahap i tokim Jezabel olgeta samting we Elija i mekim, na olsem em i kilim olgeta propet long sop.

original: So Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “May the gods deal with me, and ever so severely, if by this time tomorrow I do not make your life like the lives of those you killed!”
translation: Jezebel sendim man i go long Eliya, olsem, "Bai devils i wokim gen long me, strong long wel, if bai tude nanight bai mi no me kim olsem yu, olsem ol pipol yu kilim!"

original: And Elijah was afraid and ran for his life. When he came to Beersheba in Judah, he left his servant there,
translation: Na Iliya i bikimafet, i ranawe long laip bilong en. Tasol i kam bek long Beesheba long Juda, na i lusim servant bilong en i stap.

original: while he himself traveled on a day’s journey into the wilderness. He sat down under a broom tree and prayed that he might die. “I have had enough, LORD,” he said. “Take my life, for I am no better than my fathers.”
translation: Em i go wanpela de journey insait long bus, na em i sidaun klostu long wanpela broom tri. Em i prey olsem: "Bikpela, mi pinis. Yu yet kam bek gen, tisa olsem na kilim mi, bikos mi no gut moa long ol tumbuna bilong mi."

original: Then he lay down under the broom tree and fell asleep. Suddenly an angel touched him and said, “Get up and eat.”
translation: Na em i go daun klostu long broom tri na em i slip. Olsem wanem, enjel i kam tapim em, tachim em, na tokim em, “Kirap, kaikai.”

original: And he looked around, and there by his head was a cake of bread baked over hot coals, and a jar of water. So he ate and drank and lay down again.
translation: Na em i lukim rundim, na em i harim ka bikpela bret i stap klostu long hed bilong en, bret em i bikim long stoan i hot, na biliken wara. Na em i kaikai, em i dring, na em i slip again.

original: A second time the angel of the LORD returned and touched him, saying, “Get up and eat, or the journey will be too much for you.”
translation: Aenjel bilong Jehovah i kam bek gen, na i tokim em, "Kam daun, kaikai, na kat, bikos wok bai i bikpela long yu."

original: So he got up and ate and drank. And strengthened by that food, he walked forty days and forty nights until he reached Horeb, the mountain of God.
translation: Na em i kam daun na kai kai na dring. Na ol kaikai na dring i givim strong long en, na bihain em i wok long 40 de na 40 nait, til em i kamap long Horeb, maunten bilong God.

original: There Elijah entered a cave and spent the night. And the word of the LORD came to him, saying, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
translation: Elija i go insait long hole, na i slip nogut long ples. Na tok bilong GOD i kam long em, i tok, "Yu mekim wanem ya, Elija?"

original: “I have been very zealous for the LORD, the God of Hosts,” he replied, “but the Israelites have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and killed Your prophets with the sword. I am the only one left, and they are seeking my life as well.”
translation: “Mi bin iambap strong long Jehovah, God bilong ol ples,” em i tok, “king oli Israelites ibin lusim kot bilong yu, oli ibin kilim altars bilong yu, na oli ibin kilim ol profet bilong yu wantaim sord. Mi tasol i stap, na nau oli i kam lukim laip bilong mi tu.”

original: Then the LORD said, “Go out and stand on the mountain before the LORD. Behold, the LORD is about to pass by.” And a great and mighty wind tore into the mountains and shattered the rocks before the LORD, but the LORD was not in the wind. After the wind there was an earthquake, but the LORD was not in the earthquake.
translation: Bikpela i tok, "Kam daun na stap long maunten bifo Bikpela. Lukim, Bikpela i pasim nau." Na win blong bikpela i kam strong na i paitim maunten, na i brokim rok bifo Bikpela, tasol Bikpela i no stap long win. Bihaen long win, gurunai i kamap, tasol Bikpela i no stap long gurunai.

original: After the earthquake there was a fire, but the LORD was not in the fire. And after the fire came a still, small voice.
translation: Bihaen long eropoten em i kamap nau na faia i kam, tasol LORD igat no insait long faia. Na bihaen long faia na bosom tru, voice smol i kam.

original: When Elijah heard it, he wrapped his face in his cloak and went out and stood at the mouth of the cave. Suddenly a voice came to him and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
translation: Taim Eliya harim tok, em i kisim apinun bilong en na i rapim pes bilong en long em, na i go aut na i stap klostu long maus bilong hole. Tok bilong Voice i kam klostu long em, i tok, 'Wanem yu mekim har long hap, Eliya?'

original: “I have been very zealous for the LORD, the God of Hosts,” he replied, “but the Israelites have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and killed Your prophets with the sword. I am the only one left, and they are seeking my life as well.”
translation: “Mi bin iusim bel hat long LORD, God bilong ol pait bilong we,” em i tok, “tasol Israelites ibin lusim kovenaet bilong yu, ol ibin krungim altas bilong yu, na ol ibin kilim propit bilong yu wantaim sord. Mi tasol i stap, na ol i lak luk saves long laip bilong mi tu.”

original: Then the LORD said to him, “Go back by the way you came, and go to the Desert of Damascus. When you arrive, you are to anoint Hazael as king over Aram.
translation: Bikpela i tokim em, "Go bak long rot bilong yu kam, na go long Desert bilong Damaskas. Wanpela taim yu go daris, yu mas givim Hazael ol baile long bihainim ol Aram."

original: You are also to anoint Jehu son of Nimshi as king over Israel and Elisha son of Shaphat from Abel-meholah to succeed you as prophet.
translation: Yu mas putim oil long bodi bilong Jehu san bilong Nimshi, olsem king long Israel, na putim oil long bodi bilong Elisha san bilong Shaphat from Abel-meholah, olsem em i kam bihain long yu olsem propheth.

original: Then Jehu will put to death whoever escapes the sword of Hazael, and Elisha will put to death whoever escapes the sword of Jehu.
translation: Na Jehu bai kilim ol i slipas long suword bilong Hazael, na Elisha bai kilim ol i slipas long suword bilong Jehu.

original: Nevertheless, I have reserved seven thousand in Israel—all whose knees have not bowed to Baal and whose mouths have not kissed him.”
translation: Mi bin kepit 7 thousand long Isrel, husat niu bilong ol i no go daun long Baal, na husat maus bilong ol i no pisinim em.

original: So Elijah departed and found Elisha son of Shaphat. He was plowing with twelve teams of oxen, and he was with the twelfth team. Elijah passed by him and threw his cloak around him.
translation: Na Eliya i go bek na i kam bek long Elisha sun bilong Shaphat. Em i wokim gaden long 12 grup bilong bulmakau, na em yet i stap wantaim 12th grup. Eliya i pas long em na i kisim apinon bilong en na putim long bodi bilong Elisha.

original: So Elisha left the oxen, ran after Elijah, and said, “Please let me kiss my father and mother goodbye, and then I will follow you.” “Go on back,” Elijah replied, “for what have I done to you?”
translation: Na Elisha livaim ol oksen, ran i go bek gen Elijah, na tokim, "Mi laik kisim farewel bilong papa na mama bilong me, na bihain mi bai bihain yu." Elijah tokim, "Go bek gen, wusai mi mekim long yu?"

original: So Elisha turned back from him, took his pair of oxen, and slaughtered them. With the oxen’s equipment, he cooked the meat and gave it to the people, and they ate. Then he set out to follow and serve Elijah.
translation: Na Elisha i kam bek gen long em, i kisim tupela bulmakau bilong en, na i kilim ol. I suim mit bilong ol long hap masin bilong ol, na i givim mit long ol pipol, na ol i kaikai. Olsem na Elisha i go bek long folo na sarve Eliya.

original: Now Ben-hadad king of Aram assembled his entire army. Accompanied by thirty-two kings with their horses and chariots, he marched up, besieged Samaria, and waged war against it.
translation: Nau Ben-hadad king bilong Aram i kamapim ol soldia bilong en na was long en. Em i go wantaim thirty-two kings, ol hores na ol kareta bilong ol, na ol i go apo long Samaria, ol i bekim siti, na ol i fait long em.

original: Then he sent messengers into the city to Ahab king of Israel,
translation: Em i sendim mesijer i go insait long taun long Ahab king bilong Israel,

original: saying, “This is what Ben-hadad says: ‘Your silver and gold are mine, and your best wives and children are mine!’”
translation: Ol i tok, "Dispela em i tok olsem Ben-hadad: 'Silva na gol bilong yu em belong me, na meri gutpela na pikinini gutpela bilong yu em ol belong me!'"

original: And the king of Israel replied, “Just as you say, my lord the king: I am yours, along with all that I have.”
translation: Na king bilong Israel i tokim ol, "Olsem yu tok, lork bilong mi, king: Mipela i belong yu, wantaim olgeta samting mipela i gat."

original: The messengers came back and said, “This is what Ben-hadad says: ‘I have sent to you to demand your silver, your gold, your wives, and your children.
translation: Ol mesija i kam bek na tok olsem: "Ben-hadad i tok olsem: 'Mi salim kem na bai yu givim sila bilong yu, gol bilong yu, meri bilong yu, na pikinini bilong yu.'"

original: But about this time tomorrow I will send my servants to search your palace and the houses of your servants. They will seize and carry away all that is precious to you.’”
translation: Bihain olsem taim ya bai i kam, mi bai sendim wokman bilong me ol i go lukim long big man hus bilong yu na haus bilong wokman bilong yu. Ol i kisim na karim i go olgeta samting bilong value bilong yu.

original: Then the king of Israel summoned all the elders of the land and said, “Please take note and see that this man is looking for trouble, for when he demanded my wives, my children, my silver, and my gold, I did not deny him.”
translation: King bilong Israel i kirapim ol bikpela man bilong kantri na tokim, “Yu mas lukaut i go, na yu mas harim, dispela man i go wailis lukim hevi, long taim em i askim meri bilong mi, pikinini bilong mi, sila bilong mi, na gol bilong mi, mi no bin refusim em.”

original: And the elders and the people all said, “Do not listen to him or consent to his terms.”
translation: Na ol bikman na ol pipol i tok olsem, “Yu no ken harim tok bilong em, na yu no ken agri wantaim kondishen bilong em.”

original: So Ahab answered the messengers of Ben-hadad, “Tell my lord the king, ‘All that you demanded of your servant the first time I will do, but this thing I cannot do.’” So the messengers departed and relayed the message to Ben-hadad.
translation: Na Ahab i givim tok bak long ol mesijer bilong Ben-hadad, "Yu tokim papa bilong yu, king, 'Ol samting yu askim servent bilong yu long taim bifora, mi bai mekim, tasol dispela samting mi no inap mekim.'" Na ol mesijer i go na toktok long message long Ben-hadad.

original: Then Ben-hadad sent another message to Ahab: “May the gods deal with me, and ever so severely, if enough dust remains of Samaria for each of my men to have a handful.”
translation: Na Ben-hadad sendim nupela tok bilong em long Ahab: “Debeles i birua long me, na bai i wokim birua long me yet, i sapos ol dust i stap olsem yet long Samaria, na ol man bilong me yet olgeta i ken kisim hap wantaim.”

original: And the king of Israel replied, “Tell him: ‘The one putting on his armor should not boast like one taking it off.’”
translation: King bilong Israel i tokim ol, "Yu tokim em: 'Man husat i putim armor bilong en, no ken tok bikhet olsem man husat i kisim armor bilong en i go daun.'"

original: Ben-hadad received this message while he and the kings were drinking in their tents, and he said to his servants, “Take your positions.” So they stationed themselves against the city.
translation: Ben-hadad olisim dispela tok ol i dring ka monk diwai long haus bilong ol, na em i tokim servant bilong en, “Yu go yet na statim bek gen.” Ol i go bek gen na statim yet long sait bilong taun.

original: Meanwhile a prophet approached Ahab king of Israel and declared, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Do you see this entire great army? Behold, I will deliver it into your hand this very day, and you will know that I am the LORD.’”
translation: Na wanpela propet i kam klostu long Ahab king bilong Israel na i tok, 'Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: Yu lukim dispela bikpela armi? Mi bai givim ol i go long han bilong yu tudei yet, na yu bai save olsem na yu bai know olsem mi em i LORD.'

original: “By whom?” Ahab asked. And the prophet replied, “This is what the LORD says: ‘By the young officers of the district governors.’” “Who will start the battle?” asked Ahab. “You will,” answered the prophet.
translation: Ahab i askim, “Husat bai mekim desisin?” Na prophet i tok bek, “Papa God i tok olsem: ‘Ol ofisa yangpela bilong gavana bilong distrik bai mekim desisin.’” Ahab i askim, “Hu i go kamapim pait?” Prophet i bekim tok, “Yu mas kamapim pait,” prophet i tok.

original: So Ahab assembled the young officers of the district governors, and there were 232 men. And after them, he assembled the rest of the Israelite troops, 7,000 in all.
translation: Na Ahab em i kam na winim ofisa yangpela bilong gavman bilong distrik, na i gat 232 man. Bihaen long ol, em i winim ol solja Israel i stap, 7,000 long olgeta.

original: They marched out at noon while Ben-hadad and the 32 kings allied with him were in their tents getting drunk.
translation: Ol i wakabaut long taem middei, wail Ben-Hadad na king 32 bilong em i stap insait long haus bilong ol, na ol i dring kaikai, ol i bagarap pinis.

original: And the young officers of the district governors marched out first. Now Ben-hadad had sent out scouts, who reported to him, “Men are marching out of Samaria.”
translation: Na ofisa yangpela bilong gavman provinsal i go bungim pasinda. Ben-hadad i salim skaut ol i go, ol i ripotim bek long em, “Ol man i kamaut long Samaria.”

original: “If they have marched out in peace,” he said, “take them alive. Even if they have marched out for war, take them alive.”
translation: “Sapos ol i go pinis long ples bilong peis,” em i tok, “kisim ol i go na livim ol. Sapos ol i go pinis long ples bilong faet, kisim ol i go na livim ol.”

original: Meanwhile, these young officers of the district governors marched out of the city, with the army behind them,
translation: Wanpela taim, ofisa yangpela bilong gavana bilong distrik i go bek long sip out long siti, wantaim ol soza i go behaind long ol.

original: and each one struck down his opponent. So the Arameans fled, with the Israelites in pursuit. But Ben-hadad king of Aram escaped on horseback with the cavalry.
translation: Na ol i kilim daun poisin bilong ol, na Ol Arameans i ranawe, na Ol Israelites i kam behaind. Tasol Ben-hadad king bilong Aram i eskep long hors wantaim soldia hus.

original: Then the king of Israel marched out and attacked the horses and chariots, inflicting a great slaughter on the Arameans.
translation: King bilong Isrel i go bek, na em i arapim horses na kar, em i mekim bikpela hed long Aramia.

original: Afterward, the prophet approached the king of Israel and said, “Go and strengthen your position, and take note what you must do, for in the spring the king of Aram will come up against you.”
translation: Nambautan, man bilong God i go klostu long king bilong Israel na tokim em, “Yu go strongim posisen bilong yu, na nogut long tingim ol samting yu mas mekim, bikos long wara i kam aut long graun, king bilong Aram i kam antap long yu.”

original: Meanwhile, the servants of the king of Aram said to him, “Their gods are gods of the hills. That is why they prevailed over us. Instead, we should fight them on the plains; surely then we will prevail.
translation: Wanpela taim, servants bilong king bilong Aram i tokim em, "Ol gods bilong maunten ol i stap, bekim ol i winim mipela. Insaed long dispela, yumi mas fait ol long plain; siram, orait yumi winim bai."

original: So do this: Dismiss all the kings from their positions and replace them with other officers.
translation: Lusim pinis long wok bung bilong ol king, na bamim ol narapela ofisa i kam inap long wok bilong ol.

original: And you must raise an army like the one you have lost—horse for horse and chariot for chariot—so we can fight the Israelites on the plain, where we will surely prevail.” And the king approved their plan and acted accordingly.
translation: Na yu mas kisim ol solja gen olsem ol solja yu lus - hors ita hors na kareta ita kareta, olsem nau bai mipela inap paitim Israel long bus, na mipela bai winim. Na king i laikim dispela tok bilong ol na i wok long en.

original: In the spring, Ben-hadad mobilized the Arameans and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.
translation: Long taim bilong ren, Ben-hadad i mobilaisim ol Aramia na i go ap long Aphek olsem i laik harim na paitim Isrel.

original: The Israelites also mobilized, gathered supplies, and marched out to meet them. The Israelites camped before them like two small flocks of goats, while the Arameans covered the countryside.
translation: Pipol Israel i kam, ol i skulim suplies, na ol i go aut long miksim bek long ol. Pipol Israel i kam pundaun bifo Pipol Aram olsem tupela liklik grup bilong kokomo, wail Pipol Aram i kovaun graun bilong kantri.

original: Then the man of God approached the king of Israel and said, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Because the Arameans think the LORD is a god of the hills and not of the valleys, I will deliver all this great army into your hand. Then you will know that I am the LORD.’”
translation: Man bilong God i kam klostu long king bilong Israel na i tok olsem, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'Bikos Aramia i ting olsem LORD em i god bilong maunten tasol, na no bilong vali, mi bai givim yu dispela gret army olgeta long han bilong yu. Na yu bai save olsem na yu bai know olsem, em i LORD.'"

original: For seven days the armies camped opposite each other, and on the seventh day the battle ensued, and the Israelites struck down the Arameans—a hundred thousand foot soldiers in one day.
translation: Long sip de, olgeta soljaman i-kamp long sais bilong en, na long de namba seven de, tait i-kamap, na Israelites i-winim Arameans —hundred tausan soldia i-go long graun long wanpela de.

original: The rest of them fled into the city of Aphek, where the wall fell on twenty-seven thousand of the remaining men. Ben-hadad also fled to the city and hid in an inner room.
translation: Ol i ranawe na bikim long taun bilong Aphek, na barier i pulapim pinis long twenti-sewen tausen man husat i stap yet. Ben-hadad tu i ranawe na i kaibikim long rum insait long haus.

original: Then the servants of Ben-hadad said to him, “Look now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful. Let us go out to the king of Israel with sackcloth around our waists and ropes around our heads. Perhaps he will spare your life.”
translation: Na em i tok olsem long Ben-hadad, "Lukim nau, yumi harim olsem bipo, king bilongaus Israel i gat bel. Yumi go aut na yumi putim malamal long susu bilong mipela na rop long hed bilong mipela olsem singsing bilong kamiak na givimap, na yumi go long king bilong Israel, em inogat yu yet, olsem em bai lusim yu."

original: So with sackcloth around their waists and ropes around their heads, they went to the king of Israel and said, “Your servant Ben-hadad says, ‘Please spare my life.’” And the king answered, “Is he still alive? He is my brother.”
translation: Ol i go long king bilong Israel, wantaim sakklot ibin go long waist bilong ol, ropes i bin go raun hed bilong ol, na ol i tok, "Wokman bilong yu Ben-hadad i tok, 'Ples long yu, skruim laif bilong mi.'" Na king i ansa, "Em i stap yet? Em i brata bilong mi."

original: Now the men were looking for a sign of hope, and they quickly grasped at this word and replied, “Yes, your brother Ben-hadad.” “Go and get him!” said the king. Then Ben-hadad came out, and Ahab had him come up into his chariot.
translation: Nau ol man i wailokim long lukim bekim hap bilong hop, na ol i kisim strong long dispela toksave na tupela i toklek olsem, “Yes, brata Ben-hadad.” “Go na kam bek long en!” papa bilong kantri i tok. Na Ben-hadad i kam aut, na Ahab i kam antap long karreta bilong en.

original: Ben-hadad said to him, “I will restore the cities my father took from your father; you may set up your own marketplaces in Damascus, as my father did in Samaria.” “By this treaty I release you,” Ahab replied. So he made a treaty with him and sent him away.
translation: Ben-hadad i tokim em, "Mi bai bringim bek ol taun olsem papa bilong mi bin takeda long papa bilong yu; yu ken makim ka barata bilong yu yet long Damaskas, olsem papa bilong mi bin mekim long Samaria." "Long dispela treti mi lusim yu," Ahab i tok. Na em wokim treti wantaim em na rausim em i go.

original: Meanwhile, by the word of the LORD, one of the sons of the prophets said to his companion, “Strike me, please!” But the man refused to strike him.
translation: Wanpela taim, long tok bilong LORD, wanpela bilong ol pikinini bilong ol profet tokim besen i go long poroman bilong en, “Paitim mi, plis!” Tasol man i no gat gut long paitim em.

original: Then the prophet said to him, “Because you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD, as soon as you depart from me a lion will kill you.” And when he left, a lion found him and killed him.
translation: Propet i tokim em, “Bikos yu no bihainim vosis bilong LORD, long taim yu lusim me, lion bai kilim yu.” Na taim em i go, lion i kisim em na kilim em.

original: Then the prophet found another man and said, “Strike me, please!” So the man struck him and wounded him,
translation: Na profet yet i kisim narapela man na i tok, 'Paitim mi, plis!' Na man i paitim em na i givim em suk.

original: and the prophet went and waited on the road for the king, disguising himself with a bandage over his eyes.
translation: Na propet i go na wail long rot, i waitim king, tasol i kisim bandes i kap long ai bilong en.

original: As the king passed by, he cried out to the king: “Your servant had marched out into the middle of the battle, when suddenly a man came over with a captive and told me, ‘Guard this man! If he goes missing for any reason, your life will be exchanged for his life, or you will weigh out a talent of silver.’
translation: Olsem king i go pas, em i krai aut long king: “Wokman bilong yu em i go beklem long ples bilong faet, na wanpela man i kam na tokim mi olsem, ‘Jiapim man ia! Sapos em i los, yu yet bai yu laip bai yu switim wantaim laip bilong en, o yu bai kisim aotp tael silva.’”

original: But while your servant was busy here and there, the man disappeared.” And the king of Israel said to him, “So shall your judgment be; you have pronounced it on yourself.”
translation: Bai husat i wokim wok bilong yu em i bus long hap na hap, man i los pinis. Na King bilong Israel i tokim olsem: Olsem bai palim dispela jijman bilong yu; yu mas tokim gen long yu yet.

original: Then the prophet quickly removed the bandage from his eyes, and the king of Israel recognized him as one of the prophets.
translation: Na prophet i kisim banis long ai bilong en i go, na king bilong Israel i lukim em olsem wanpela prophet.

original: And the prophet said to the king, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Because you have let slip from your hand the man I had devoted to destruction, your life will be exchanged for his life, and your people for his people.’”
translation: Na profet i tokim king olsem: "LORD i tok olsem, 'long bikos yu kisim i go long han bilong yu man we mi dediketem long destrukshon, life bilong yu bai i change wantaim laip bilong em, na piple bilong yu bai i change wantaim piple bilong em.'"
