original: Sullen and angry, the king of Israel went home to Samaria.
translation: King bilong Israel i stap strong head na cross, na i go bek long Samaria.

original: Some time later, Naboth the Jezreelite happened to own a vineyard in Jezreel next to the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Nabot man Jezreel em i bikpela man na em i gat gaden balus klostu long haus bilong ki Ahab king bilong Samaria long Jezreel.

original: So Ahab said to Naboth, “Give me your vineyard to use as a vegetable garden, since it is next to my palace. I will give you a better vineyard in its place—or if you prefer, I will give you its value in silver.”
translation: Ahab i tokim Naboth, "Givim miwan vineya bilong yu, em i besain long haus kiya bilong mi, nau mi laik wokim em long gaden kai. Mi bai givim yu wanpela vineya i gutpela moa long hap bilong em — ovisa, mi bai givim yu pris bilong em long silva."

original: But Naboth replied, “The LORD forbid that I should give you the inheritance of my fathers.”
translation: Nabot i tokim, “Papa God i stap long ai bos, mi no ken givim yu ineritas bilong tumbuna ol.”

original: So Ahab went to his palace, sullen and angry because Naboth the Jezreelite had told him, “I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers.” He lay down on his bed, turned his face away, and refused to eat.
translation: Na Ahab i go long haus bilong en, em i bel hat na kros olsem Naboth i tokim em olsem, "Mi no inap givim yu brata bilong tumbuna bilong mi." Em i sidown klostu long bet bilong en, em i wokim bek bilong en i go daun, na em i no laik kaikai.

original: Soon his wife Jezebel came in and asked, “Why are you so sullen that you refuse to eat?”
translation: Nau meri bilong en Jezebel i kam insait na askim, “Wai yu sori na yu no laik kaikai?”

original: Ahab answered, “Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite and told him, ‘Give me your vineyard for silver, or if you wish, I will give you another vineyard in its place.’ And he replied, ‘I will not give you my vineyard!’”
translation: Ahab i tok, “Bikos mi tokim Naboth bilong Jezreel, man bilong Jezreel, olsem: ‘Givim mi vain ya bilong yu long silva, o sapos yu laik, mi bai givim yu nupela vain long hap bilong em.’ Na em i tok, ‘Mi no bai givim yu vain bilong mi!’”

original: But his wife Jezebel said to him, “Do you not reign over Israel? Get up, eat some food, and be cheerful, for I will get you the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.”
translation: Bikosmeri, wife bilong em Jezebel i tokim em olsem, “Yu no gat pawa long Israel? Kam daun, kaikai sampela kaikai, na bel harim yu yet, bikos mi bai kisim vines ya Nabot Jezreelite long han bilong yu.”

original: Then Jezebel wrote letters in Ahab’s name, sealed them with his seal, and sent them to the elders and nobles who lived with Naboth in his city.
translation: Na Jezebel wraitim leta long nem bilong Ahab, salim leta long naigam em, seal em i sanap strong long autoret, na sendim leta long ol bikpela man na ol bos ol i stap wantaim Naboth long ples bilong en.

original: In the letters she wrote: “Proclaim a fast and give Naboth a seat of honor among the people.
translation: Long letter em i raitim: “Mekim wailis long ol pipol i fas, na givim Nabot sik bilong hanem we i gat respek long ol pipol.”

original: But seat two scoundrels opposite him and have them testify, ‘You have cursed both God and the king!’ Then take him out and stone him to death.”
translation: Putim tupela raskol i go opisitim em, na ol i tokaut long em, ‘Yu krosim Bikpela na king!’  Ol i birua long dispela. Karim em aut na stonim em nasel olsem.

original: So the elders and nobles who lived in Naboth’s city did as Jezebel had instructed in the letters she had written to them.
translation: Ol bikpela man na ol chief i stap long taon bilong Nabot, ol i mekim olsem Jezebel i tokim ol long leta em i raitim i go bek long ol.

original: They proclaimed a fast and gave Naboth a seat of honor among the people.
translation: Ol i kirapim taine bilong hapkas na ol i givim Nabot sip blo hem long namel bilong ol pipol.

original: And the two scoundrels came in and sat opposite Naboth, and these men testified against him before the people, saying, “Naboth has cursed both God and the king!” So they took him outside the city and stoned him to death.
translation: Na ol raskol i kam insait na sindaun opisit long Nabot, na ol man i tok besen long em bifor ol pipol, ol i birua, "Nabot i tok besen long Bikpela na king!" Ol i karim em autsait long taun na ol i stonim em na i dai.

original: Then they sent word to Jezebel: “Naboth has been stoned to death.”
translation: Ol i sendim tok long Jezabel: “Nabot i kamap dead long ston.”

original: When Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned to death, she said to Ahab, “Get up and take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, who refused to give it to you for silver. For Naboth is no longer alive, but dead.”
translation: Taim Jezebel harim tok ol i kilim Nabot wantaim ston, em i tokim Ahab, “Kam daun na kisim vineya bilong Nabot Jezreelite, dispela man em i refus long givim i go long yu long silva. Nabot igat nogat laif, dispela man i dai pinis.”

original: And when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he got up and went down to take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
translation: Taim Ahab harim olsem Nabot i dai, em i kirap na i go daun long gaden bia bilong Nabot Jezireti, na em i mekim olsem em i yusim long en.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
translation: Neken tok bilong Jehovah i kam long Elijah man Tisbiti, i tok

original: “Get up and go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who is in Samaria. See, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, of which he has gone to take possession.
translation: Kam daun na go doun, painim Ahab king bilong Israel, em i stap long Samaria. Lukim, em i stap long ples bilong vain Naboth, na em i go tumbasim ol bikos em i laik kisim.

original: Tell him that this is what the LORD says: ‘Have you not murdered a man and seized his land?’ Then tell him that this is also what the LORD says: ‘In the place where the dogs licked up the blood of Naboth, there also the dogs will lick up your blood—yes, yours!’”
translation: Tokim em olsem, Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'Yupela i kilim man na yupela tumbuna takim graun bilong en?' Bai yupela tokim em olsem, Dispela moa i tok bilong LORD: 'Long hap bilong dog ol i likim blod bilong Naboth, long hap em self dog ol bai likim blod bilong yu - ya, bilong yu!'

original: When Elijah arrived, Ahab said to him, “So you have found me out, my enemy.” He replied, “I have found you out because you have sold yourself to do evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Taim Elija i kam, Ahap i tokim em, “Yu lukim mi ausait, yu i eni bilong mi.” Em i bekim tok, “Mi lukim yu ausait bikos yu sellim yuself long mekim olgeta nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: This is what the LORD says: ‘I will bring calamity on you and consume your descendants; I will cut off from Ahab every male in Israel, both slave and free.
translation: Dispela Bikpela i tok olsem: 'Mi bai bringim bagarap long yu na kaikaim ol pikinini bilong yu; mi bai kisim oltabai ol man bilong Ahab long Israel, husat i wokman, husat i freeman.'

original: I will make your house like that of Jeroboam son of Nebat and like that of Baasha son of Ahijah, because you have provoked My anger and caused Israel to sin.’
translation: Mi bai mekim haus bilong yu olsem long haus bilong Jeroboam sot long Nebat na olsem long haus bilong Baasha sot long Ahijah, bikos yu hamarim Anga bilong Mi na yu mekim Israel i sindaun.

original: And the LORD also speaks concerning Jezebel: ‘The dogs will devour Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.’
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem: "Dok na bai kai Meri Jezebel long banis balus bilong Jezreel."

original: Anyone belonging to Ahab who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and anyone who dies in the field will be eaten by the birds of the air.”
translation: Ol man i bilong Ahab i dai insait long taun, dok bai kaikai olsem, na ol i dai long bus, pisin bilong heven bai kaikai olsem.

original: (Surely there was never one like Ahab, who sold himself to do evil in the sight of the LORD, incited by his wife Jezebel.
translation: I no gat wan man olsem Ahab, em i go long mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, strongim olgeta long upo bilong meri Jezebel.

original: He committed the most detestable acts by going after idols, just like the Amorites whom the LORD had driven out before the Israelites.)
translation: Em i wokim ol samting nogut i mas painsim, em i go behaind idoli, olsem ol Amoriti we LORD i drivim aut bifo Israel.

original: When Ahab heard these words, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth, and fasted. He lay down in sackcloth and walked around meekly.
translation: Taim Ahab harim dispela tok, em i bin kisim klotes bilong en na katim ol i go, em i bin putim sakklot, na em i bin stik long fasting. Em i laip daun i stap long sakklot, na em i wokabaut i go bek long wei bilong en, mekim ol samting long wei bilong mait.

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying:
translation: Tok bilong Jehovah i kam long Elijah man Tisbi, olsem:

original: “Have you seen how Ahab has humbled himself before Me? Because he has humbled himself before Me, I will not bring the calamity during his days, but I will bring it upon his house in the days of his son.”
translation: Yu lukim olsem Ahab i go daun klostu long ai bilong Mi? Bilong em i go daun klostu long ai bilong Mi, Mi no bai bringim dispela birua long taim bilong em, bat mi bai bringim i kam long haus bilong em long taim bilong pikinini bilong em.

original: Then three years passed without war between Aram and Israel.
translation: Tripela yia i go pinis, na i no gat war long Aram na Israel.

original: However, in the third year, Jehoshaphat king of Judah went down to visit the king of Israel,
translation: Be, long tripela yia, Jehoshaphat king bilong Yuda i go daun visitim king bilong Isrel.

original: who said to his servants, “Do you not know that Ramoth-gilead is ours, but we have failed to take it from the hand of the king of Aram?”
translation: Em i tokim servan bilong em, “Yu no save olsem Ramot-Gilead i belon gimi mipela, tasol mipela i fail long kisim bek long han bilong king bilong Aram?”

original: So he asked Jehoshaphat, “Will you go with me to fight against Ramoth-gilead?” Jehoshaphat answered the king of Israel, “I am like you, my people are your people, and my horses are your horses.”
translation: Na em askim Jehosafat, "Yu bai go wantaim mi long pairap against Ramot-Gilead?" Jehosafat ansa king bilong Israel, "Mi olsem yu, piple bilong me ol i piple bilong yu, na hors bilong me ol i hors bilong yu."

original: But Jehoshaphat also said to the king of Israel, “Please inquire first for the word of the LORD.”
translation: Bai Jehosafati tok tu olsem long king bilong Israel, “Mipela mas askim pastaim kot long tok bilong God.”

original: So the king of Israel assembled the prophets, about four hundred men, and asked them, “Should I go to war against Ramoth-gilead, or should I refrain?” “Go up,” they replied, “and the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
translation: King bilong Israel i kamasim olgeta profet, ol i stap long hap tausen, na em i askim ol, “Inap mi go long war gen Ramoth-gilead, o inap mi stap bek?” “Go ap,” ol i tok, “na Papa God bai givim i go long han bilong king.”

original: But Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there not still a prophet of the LORD here of whom we can inquire?”
translation: Jehosafati askim, “Ino moa i stap wanpela propet bilong Papa God here of wel mi yet ken go askim?”

original: The king of Israel answered, “There is still one man who can ask the LORD, but I hate him because he never prophesies anything good for me, but only bad. He is Micaiah son of Imlah.” “The king should not say that!” Jehoshaphat replied.
translation: King bilong Israel i tokim ol, "Mi gat wanpela man yet we i ken ask LORD, tasol mi hatim em bikos em i no profesi notin gud long me, tasol olgeta samting nogut. Em i Mikaia, pikinini bilong Imlah." "King no ken tok olsem," Jehosafat i bekim.

original: So the king of Israel called one of his officials and said, “Bring Micaiah son of Imlah at once.”
translation: King bilong Israel i kolim wanpela ofisas bilong en, ol i tok, "Kisim Mikaia sun bilong Imala, bringim i kam bek kwik."

original: Dressed in royal attire, the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah were sitting on their thrones at the threshing floor by the entrance of the gate of Samaria, with all the prophets prophesying before them.
translation: King bilong Israel na Jehosapat king bilong Juda i stap klia long klos bilong king, ol i sindaun long throne bilong ol long ples bilong kilim graon klostu long entris bilong gat bilong Samaria, wantaim ol profet ol i prophesy bifor ol.

original: Now Zedekiah son of Chenaanah had made for himself iron horns and declared, “This is what the LORD says: ‘With these you shall gore the Arameans until they are finished off.’”
translation: Nau Zedekiah sone bilong Chenaanah em i mekim aipas iron long en, na em i tok, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'Bai yu usim dispela i krungim Arameans ol i pinis.'"

original: And all the prophets were prophesying the same, saying, “Go up to Ramoth-gilead and prosper, for the LORD will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
translation: Na olgeta propet i go i tok olesem, ol i tok, “Yu go apo long Ramot-Gilead na bai yu winim, bikos LORD bai givim i go long han bilong king.”

original: Then the messenger who had gone to call Micaiah instructed him, “Behold now, with one accord the words of the prophets are favorable to the king. So please let your words be like theirs, and speak favorably.”
translation: Mesinjara i givim instruksin long Mikaia, “Nau, olgeta i wanbel, toktok bilong ol profet i stap gut long king. Ol presa long yu, tok bilong yu mas olsem tok bilong ol, na tok gut long.”

original: But Micaiah said, “As surely as the LORD lives, I will speak whatever the LORD tells me.”
translation: Bat Mikaia i tok, "Olsem LORD i stap na balus, mi bai tok olsem LORD i tokim mi."

original: When Micaiah arrived, the king asked him, “Micaiah, should we go to war against Ramoth-gilead, or should we refrain?” “Go up and triumph,” Micaiah replied, “for the LORD will give it into the hand of the king.”
translation: Taim Mikaia kamap, king i askim em, "Mikaia, yupela bai go long war gen Ramot-Gilead, o yupela bai stap?" Mikaia i tok, "Go ap na winim, bikos LORD bai givim i go long han bilong king."

original: But the king said to him, “How many times must I make you swear not to tell me anything but the truth in the name of the LORD?”
translation: Bikpela Man i tokim em, “Oli mas kam bek long promis olsem wanem taim bikos yu no ken givim mi tok but long trut tasol long nem bilong Bikpela?”

original: So Micaiah declared: “I saw all Israel scattered on the hills like sheep without a shepherd. And the LORD said, ‘These people have no master; let each one return home in peace.’”
translation: Mikaia igo tokim ol: “Mi lukim ol Israel i go dai wail long maunten na wara olsem sip bilong moningi i no gat sikaman bilong sip. Na GOD i tok, ‘Ol pipel i no gat bikman; let each one go bak long hus na i stap gut.’”

original: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you that he never prophesies good for me, but only bad?”
translation: King bilong Isrel i tok long Jehosafat, “Mi no bin tokim yu? Em i no profesi gude long me, tasol olgeta samting nogut?”

original: Micaiah continued, “Therefore hear the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on His throne, and all the host of heaven standing by Him on His right and on His left.
translation: Mikaia em i go bek long tok, "Orait, harim tok bilong LORD: mi lukim LORD em i sindaun long thrown bilong En, na ol hos bilong heven i stanap besain long en, long sait bilong en na long lef bilong en.

original: And the LORD said, ‘Who will entice Ahab to march up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?’ And one suggested this, and another that.
translation: Na Bikpela i tok, ‘Hu ia bai mekim Ahab i go antap na i pundaun long Ramot-Gilead?’ Na wanpela i tok olsem, na narapela i tok olsem.

original: Then a spirit came forward, stood before the LORD, and said, ‘I will entice him.’ ‘By what means?’ asked the LORD.
translation: Wan spirit i kam ananait, i stap bifor LORD, na tok olsem, ‘Mi bai lusim em i go long wan rot.’ Olsem wanem, LORD i askim.

original: And he replied, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.’ ‘You will surely entice him and prevail,’ said the LORD. ‘Go and do it.’
translation: Na em tokim bek, ‘Bai mi go aut na wokim spiret bilong dae long maus bilong ol prophet.’ ‘Yu ken entisim em na givim samting i kamap strong long en na winim,’ tok LORD. ‘Go na mekim.’

original: So you see, the LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours, and the LORD has pronounced disaster against you.”
translation: Bikpela i putim speret bilong dae long maus bilong ol profet ol, na Bikpela i tokautem biknem long yu.”

original: Then Zedekiah son of Chenaanah went up, struck Micaiah in the face, and demanded, “Which way did the Spirit of the LORD go when He departed from me to speak with you?”
translation: Na Zedekia, pikinini bilong Chenaanah, i go ap, kilim Mikaia long hes, na askim strong, “SpiriT bilong GOD i go wusai long me bai em i tokim yu?”

original: Micaiah replied, “You will soon see, on that day when you go and hide in an inner room.”
translation: Mikaia i tokim, bai yu yet go ken harim long dei ia, wail yu go kaibosim yu yet insait long rum bilong haus.

original: And the king of Israel declared, “Take Micaiah and return him to Amon the governor of the city and to Joash the king’s son,
translation: Na king bilong Israel i tokim ol, "Brinim bek Mikaia i go, givim Amon gavman bilong siti na Joash pikinini bilong king."

original: and tell them that this is what the king says: ‘Put this man in prison and feed him only bread and water until I return safely.’”
translation: Tokim ol, king i tok olsem: 'Putim man i go insait kalabus, na givim man bret na wara tasol, long wei mi kam bek gen.'”

original: But Micaiah replied, “If you ever return safely, the LORD has not spoken through me.” Then he added, “Take heed, all you people!”
translation: Mikaia i tokim, "Yu go bek gen long ples bilong yu olsem na yu kam bek gen long hap blong yu, Papa God i no tok long mi." Na em i tokim, "Yumi mas harim tok!"

original: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
translation: King bilong Israel na Jehosapat king bilong Yuda i go ap long Ramot-Gilead.

original: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you wear your royal robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself and went into battle.
translation: King bilong Isrel i tokim Jehosafat, “Mi bai kam apim skin bilong narapela man na go long fait, bai yu putim klos bilong king.” Na king bilong Isrel i kam apim skin bilong narapela man na i go long fait.

original: Now the king of Aram had ordered his thirty-two chariot commanders, “Do not fight with anyone, small or great, except the king of Israel.”
translation: Nau kin bilong Aram i givim orda long thirty-two ofisa bilong kareta bilong en, olsem: "Yu no fight wantaim eni man, liklik o bikpela, asples kin bilong Isrel tasol".

original: When the chariot commanders saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “Surely this is the king of Israel!” So they turned to fight against him, but Jehoshaphat cried out.
translation: Taim komanda bilong kar i si Jehosafat, ol i tok, 'Em i king bilong Israel, strongpela!' Ol i turnim bek long pairap against im, na Jehosafat i kirap strong.

original: And when the chariot commanders saw that he was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.
translation: Na taitim ol kapten bilong kar i lukim em i no king bilong Israel, ol i go bek gen long bihainim em.

original: However, a certain man drew his bow without taking special aim, and he struck the king of Israel between the joints of his armor. So the king said to his charioteer, “Turn around and take me out of the battle, for I am badly wounded!”
translation: Wanpela man em i kirapim banar bilong en bai em i paitim, na em i no bin lusim traipela aim, na em i paitim king bilong Israel long hap bilong armas bilong en. King itokim draiva bilong kar bilong en, “Kisim mi long pati bilong faet, olsem wanem mi bel isi, mi kisim wound bilong ked.”

original: The battle raged throughout that day, and the king was propped up in his chariot facing the Arameans. And the blood from his wound ran out onto the floor of the chariot, and that evening he died.
translation: Pait i go strong olsem long de, na king bilong yumi i stap long chariot bilong en, i holim em yet, i lukem Aramean ol pipol. Na bled bilong won bilong en i kam aut, i go daun long flor bilong chariot, na long apinun em i dai.

original: As the sun was setting, the cry rang out in the army: “Every man to his own city, and every man to his own land!”
translation: San i go daun, krai i kamap strong long armi: “Ol man i go bek long ples bilong ol, ol man i go bek long graun bilong ol!”

original: So the king died and was brought to Samaria, where they buried him.
translation: King i dai pinis, ol i kam bek long Samaria, na ol i bin plantim em.

original: And the chariot was washed at the pool of Samaria where the prostitutes bathed, and the dogs licked up Ahab’s blood, according to the word that the LORD had spoken.
translation: Na karet i go wash long ples bilong wara bilong Samaria we bilong ol meri bilong sin i go was, na ol dog i laikim blood bilong Ahab, olsem wod bilong GOD i tok.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Ahab, along with all his accomplishments and the ivory palace and all the cities he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long ol akt bilong Ahab, ol samting em i mekim, haus bilong ivory, na ol taun ol i biltim, i no writim long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Ahab rested with his fathers, and his son Ahaziah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Ahab i go stap wantaim papa bilong en, na susa bilong en Ahaziah i kam bihain long em, i bos.

original: In the fourth year of Ahab’s reign over Israel, Jehoshaphat son of Asa became king of Judah.
translation: Long namba foa yia bilong rein bilong Ahab olsem bos bilong pait bilong Israel, Jehoshaphat, pikinini bilong Asa, i kamap king bilong pait bilong Judah.

original: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-five years. His mother’s name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.
translation: Jehosafati i 35 yia nau tasol na em i kamap king, na em i rain long Jirusalem long 25 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Azuba, bikmeri bilong Shilhi.

original: And Jehoshaphat walked in all the ways of his father Asa; he did not turn away from them, but did what was right in the eyes of the LORD. The high places, however, were not removed; the people still sacrificed and burned incense on the high places.
translation: Na Jehosafati i go wok long olgeta rot bilong papa bilong em, Asa; em i no lem i go bek gen long ol samting nogut, tasol em i mekim ol samting gut long ai bilong LORD. Ol ples hait no bin rausim, tasol ol pipol i stap yet makim sakrifis na smelm smok long ol ples hait.

original: Jehoshaphat also made peace with the king of Israel.
translation: Jehoshaphat tu wokim pis wantaim king bilong Isrel.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, along with the might he exercised and how he waged war, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Jehosafati, longsaip olbaot strongpela wok im bin mekim, na olsem wanem na i go kamap long war, olgeta dispela i no stap raun long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: He banished from the land the male shrine prostitutes who remained from the days of his father Asa.
translation: Em i rausim long kantri ol man husat i wok olsem prostitutes long ples bilong deity, ol husat i stap yet long taim bilong papa bilong en Asa.

original: And there was no king in Edom; a deputy served as king.
translation: Na ino bin gat king long Edom; ofsara i wok olsem king.

original: Jehoshaphat built ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold, but they never set sail, because they were wrecked at Ezion-geber.
translation: Jehoshaphat i bikim ship bilong Tarshish ol i go long Ophir bekim gol, tasol oli no go yet long solwara, bikos ol i bagarap long Ezion-geber.

original: At that time Ahaziah son of Ahab said to Jehoshaphat, “Let my servants sail with your servants,” but Jehoshaphat refused.
translation: Long taim ia, Ahaziya pikinini bilong Ahab i tokim Jehosafat, “Wokmanmeri bilong mi sail wantaim wokmanmeri bilong yu,” tapi Jehosafat i refusim.

original: And Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the city of his father David. And his son Jehoram reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehoshaphat i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i kisim em i go bekim long ples bilong tumbuna David. Na susa bilong en Jehoram i kam bihain long en.

original: In the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat’s reign over Judah, Ahaziah son of Ahab became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria two years.
translation: Long yia seventin bilong paitim bilong Jehoshaphat long Judah, Ahaziah, pikinini bilong Ahab, i kamap king bilong Israel, na i painim tupela yia long Samaria.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and walked in the ways of his father and mother and of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em i wokabaut long rot bilong papa na mama bilong en, na long rot bilong Jeroboam son bilong Nebat, husat i bringim Israel long sin.

original: Ahaziah served and worshiped Baal, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger, just as his father had done.
translation: Ahaziah i servisim na wosipim Baal, long tok pikinini i kam bekim Bikpela, God bilong Israel, i birua, olsem papa bilong en i mekim bifor.

original: After the death of Ahab, Moab rebelled against Israel.
translation: Bihaenim long dei bilong Ahab, Moab i bagarap na hamarim Israel.

original: Now Ahaziah had fallen through the lattice of his upper room in Samaria and injured himself. So he sent messengers and instructed them: “Go inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, whether I will recover from this injury.”
translation: Nau Ahaziah i go daun thru lattis bilong rumu bilong antap em i stap long Samaria, na em i kisim sik. Olsem na em i sendim mesenja, em i tokim ol: “Yu go inquier long Baal-zebub, god bilong Ekron, bai mi recover from dispela sik o nogat.”

original: But the angel of the LORD said to Elijah the Tishbite, “Go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria and ask them, ‘Is it because there is no God in Israel that you are on your way to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron?’
translation: Ain a Bikpela i tokim Elijah olsem, "Go antap long miksim messenja bilong king bilong Samaria na askim ol, 'Em i bikos long Israel i no gat God bai yupela i go wokim pasin long baillim Baal-zebub, Bikpela bilong Ekron?'"

original: Therefore this is what the LORD says: ‘You will not get up from the bed on which you are lying. You will surely die.’” So Elijah departed.
translation: Dispela Bikpela i tok olsem: ‘Yu no ken kam bek long bet yu i slip longen. Yu mas dai bikos.’ Na Iliya i go bek.

original: When the messengers returned to the king, he asked them, “Why have you returned?”
translation: Taim ol messenja i kam bek long king, na king i askim ol, “Wai yu kam bek?”

original: They replied, “A man came up to meet us and said, ‘Go back to the king who sent you and tell him that this is what the LORD says: Is it because there is no God in Israel that you are sending these men to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? Therefore you will not get up from the bed on which you are lying. You will surely die.’”
translation: Ol i tok bek, “Wanpela man kam ap i go long mitim mipela na em i tok olsem, ‘Go bak long king i sendim yu na tusim em olsem Dispela i tok bilong Bikpela: I orait dispela yu bai sindaun long Baal-zebub, bikpela bilong Ekron, bikos Bikpela i no stap long Israel? Sapos yu mekim dispela, yu no inap kambek long bet na yu i stap, yu kamap bai dai.’”

original: The king asked them, “What sort of man came up to meet you and spoke these words to you?”
translation: King i askim ol, “Man husat i kam bek long mitim yu na i tok deswol pepa long yu?”

original: “He was a hairy man,” they answered, “with a leather belt around his waist.” “It was Elijah the Tishbite,” said the king.
translation: “Em i man bilong gras olsem dog,” ol i tokim, “wantaim belt bilong sikisus i go raunim waist bilong en.” “Em tasol Elijah man bilong Tishbe,” king i tokim.

original: Then King Ahaziah sent to Elijah a captain with his company of fifty men. So the captain went up to Elijah, who was sitting on top of a hill, and said to him, “Man of God, the king declares, ‘Come down!’”
translation: King Ahaziah i salim tok long Elijah, kapten wantaim grup bilong fifty man. Kapten i go antap long Elijah, em i sidaun antap long wanpela han bilong maunten, na i tokim em: "Man bilong God, king i tokaut, olsem: 'Kam daun!'"

original: Elijah answered the captain, “If I am a man of God, may fire come down from heaven and consume you and your fifty men.” And fire came down from heaven and consumed the captain and his fifty men.
translation: Elaija i tokim kapten, “Mi em i man bilong God, mait bai kam daun long heven na kaikaim yu na fifty man bilong yu.” Na mait i kam daun long heven na kaikaim kapten na fifty man bilong en.

original: So the king sent to Elijah another captain with his fifty men. And the captain said to Elijah, “Man of God, the king declares, ‘Come down at once!’”
translation: King i sendim namba tu kapten wantaim fifty man belong hem long Elijah. Kapten i tokim Elijah, "Man bilong God, king i ankunden, 'Kam daun nau olgeta!'"

original: Again Elijah replied, “If I am a man of God, may fire come down from heaven and consume you and your fifty men.” And the fire of God came down from heaven and consumed the captain and his fifty men.
translation: Eliya i tok gen, “Mi stap man bilong God, faia bilong God i kam daun long heven na kaikai yu na fifty man bilong yu.” Na faia bilong God i kam daun long heven na i kaikai kapten na fifty man bilong en.

original: So the king sent a third captain with his fifty men. And the third captain went up, fell on his knees before Elijah, and begged him, “Man of God, may my life and the lives of these fifty servants please be precious in your sight.
translation: Na kip i sendim kapten namba tri wes long fifty man belongen. Na kapten namba tri i go ap, i karam long kni bilong en bifo Elijah, na i bihainim em, "Man bilong God, mi laif na laif bilong dispela fifty wokman, bai ol i stap presas long ai bilong yu."

original: Behold, fire has come down from heaven and consumed the first two captains of fifty, with all their men. But now may my life be precious in your sight.”
translation: Susi, faia i kam daun long heven na i kaikai pinis kapten tupela i go hap fifty, wantaim ol man bilong ol. Nau bai laip bilong mi i presis long ai bilong yu.”

original: Then the angel of the LORD said to Elijah, “Go down with him. Do not be afraid of him.” So Elijah got up and went down with him to the king.
translation: Na engel bilong LORD i tokim Elijah, “Yu go daun gen long en. No ken kirap, yu no fear long em.” Na Elijah i kam daun, na i go daun gen wantaim em long king.

original: And Elijah said to King Ahaziah, “This is what the LORD says: Is there really no God in Israel for you to inquire of His word? Is that why you have sent messengers to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? Therefore you will not get up from the bed on which you are lying. You will surely die.”
translation: Na Elija i tokim King Ahaziah olsem: "LORD i tok olsem: Sapos God i no stap long Israel, bilong yu husat bai yu askim long tok bilong Em? Yu go sendim wokman bilong gavman go askim Baal-zebub, Bikpela bilong Ekron? Olsem na, yu no ken kamdaun bilong bed we yu slip long en. Yu mas dai."

original: So Ahaziah died according to the word of the LORD that Elijah had spoken. And since he had no son, Jehoram succeeded him in the second year of the reign of Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat over Judah.
translation: Ahaziah i dai pinis olsem yap bilong LORD, Elijah i tok bifo. Na em i no gat pikinini, Jehoram i kam bihain long em long yia namba tu bilong paitim ower bilong Jehoram, pikinini bilong Jehoshaphat, long Judah.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Ahaziah, along with his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai na wampa na ol bikpela wok bilong Ahaziah, ol i no bin writim yet long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel?

original: Shortly before the LORD took Elijah up to heaven in a whirlwind, Elijah and Elisha were on their way from Gilgal,
translation: Bipo LORD i kisim Eliya i go ap long heven, Eliya na Elisa i wokaba long rot bilong ol from Gilgal.

original: and Elijah said to Elisha, “Please stay here, for the LORD has sent me on to Bethel.” But Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, I will not leave you.” So they went down to Bethel.
translation: Na Elia i tokim Elisha, “Ple bilong yu stap hap herem, LORD i salim mi go long Bethel.” Tasol Elisha i bekim tok, “Olsem LORD i stap na yu yet yu stap, mi no bai lusim yu.” Na ol i go daun long Bethel.

original: Then the sons of the prophets at Bethel came out to Elisha and said, “Do you know that the LORD will take your master away from you today?” “Yes, I know,” he replied. “Do not speak of it.”
translation: Ol pikinini prophet long Bethel i kam aut, ol tokim Elisha, “Yu save Papa God baim i kilim Bos bilong yu tude?” “Yes, mi save,” Elisha i bekim tok long ol. “Yu no ken spikim em.”

original: And Elijah said to Elisha, “Please stay here, for the LORD has sent me on to Jericho.” But Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, I will not leave you.” So they went to Jericho.
translation: Iliya i tokim Elisa, “Bai yu stap hia, bikos LORD i salim mi go long Jeriko.” Tasol Elisa i bekim tok, “Olsem LORD i stap na bam, na olsem yu yet stap, mi no lusim yu.” Nogat, ol i go long Jeriko.

original: Then the sons of the prophets at Jericho came up to Elisha and said, “Do you know that the LORD will take your master away from you today?” “Yes, I know,” he replied. “Do not speak of it.”
translation: Ol pikinini bilong ol propet long Jeriko i kam apost long Elisha na tokim Elisha, “Yu save Bikpela bai bamim Bek Bikpela Man long yu tude?” “Yes, mi save,” Elisha ansa. “Yu no ken tok long em.”

original: And Elijah said to Elisha, “Please stay here, for the LORD has sent me on to the Jordan.” But Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, I will not leave you.” So the two of them went on.
translation: Elijam tokim Elisha, "Bai yu stap herem, bikos LORD im sendim mi go long Jordan." Elisha ansa, "Olsem LORD i stap na yu yet stap, mi no lusim yu." Tupela i go bek.

original: Then a company of fifty of the sons of the prophets went and stood at a distance, facing Elijah and Elisha as the two of them stood by the Jordan.
translation: Na bikos ol profet fifty i go stap longwe, ol i harim Elijah na Elisha wail i stap klostu long Jordan.

original: And Elijah took his cloak, rolled it up, and struck the waters, which parted to the right and to the left, so that the two of them crossed over on dry ground.
translation: Na Eliya kisim hap bilong en, em i karim i go daun, na em i kilim wara, na wara i pulap long sait na long sait, ol i wakabaut olsem long graun dri.

original: After they had crossed over, Elijah said to Elisha, “Tell me, what can I do for you before I am taken away from you?” “Please, let me inherit a double portion of your spirit,” Elisha replied.
translation: Ol i go pas pinis, Eliya i tokim Elisha, “Yu tokim mi, mi ken mekim wanem long yu bifo mi lusim yu?” “Ples, mi ken kisim tupela wail long spirit bilong yu,” Elisha i tok.

original: “You have requested a difficult thing,” said Elijah. “Nevertheless, if you see me as I am taken from you, it will be yours. But if not, then it will not be so.”
translation: “Yu bilong askim samting we i bikhet,” Elias tok. “Bare tasol, if yu lukim mi olsem mi go bek long yu, em bai bilong yu. Tasol, igo, orait em no ken kam so.”

original: As they were walking along and talking together, suddenly a chariot of fire with horses of fire appeared and separated the two of them, and Elijah went up into heaven in a whirlwind.
translation: Tupela i go wakabaut na toktok, em kamap nabena, na kariot bilong faia na hores bilong faia i kamap, em wailisim tupela long halivim, na Eliya i go ap long heven insait long wind blo samting.

original: As Elisha watched, he cried out, “My father, my father, the chariots and horsemen of Israel!” And he saw Elijah no more. So taking hold of his own clothes, he tore them in two.
translation: Wanpela taim Elisha i luk, na em i kirap strong, "Papa bilong me, papa bilong me, kareta na hosmen bilong Israel!" Na em i no see Elijah gen. Na em yet kam holim klos bilong em yet, na em i pullum i go ap long tupela hap.

original: Elisha also picked up the cloak that had fallen from Elijah, and he went back and stood on the bank of the Jordan.
translation: Elisha kisim ap long klet we i pundaun long Eliya, na em i go bek gen na stanap long banis bilong wara Jordan.

original: Then he took the cloak of Elijah that had fallen from him and struck the waters. “Where now is the LORD, the God of Elijah?” he asked. And when he had struck the waters, they parted to the right and to the left, and Elisha crossed over.
translation: Na em Elisha i kisim klak bilong Eliya, klak ia i pundaun nau, na em i kilim wara. Em i askim, "We bilong LORD, God bilong Eliya, iam nau?" Na em i kilim wara, ol i skelim raits na leftsaid, na Elisha i go pas.

original: When the sons of the prophets who were facing him from Jericho saw what had happened, they said, “The spirit of Elijah rests on Elisha.” And they went to meet him and bowed down to the ground before him.
translation: Taim pikinini bilong ol profet i lukim olsem wanem i kamap, ol i tok, "Spirut bilong Eliya i stap long Elisha." Na ol i go bek gen long en, ol i kuku grub long graun bifo em.

original: “Look now,” they said to Elisha, “we your servants have fifty valiant men. Please let them go and search for your master. Perhaps the Spirit of the LORD has taken him up and put him on one of the mountains or in one of the valleys.” “Do not send them,” Elisha replied.
translation: Luke nau, mipela servants bilong yu, mipela i gat fifty strongpela man. Yu ken lusim ol i go finim master bilong yu. Em bilev Spirit bilong LORD ibin karim em i go, putim em long wanpela maunten o long wanpela wei vali. Elisha i tok, no ken sendim ol.

original: But when they pressed him to the point of embarrassment, he said, “Send them.” And they sent fifty men, who searched for three days but did not find Elijah.
translation: Taim ol i presim em na i kam bek long shame, em i tok, “Senem olsen.” Na ol i senem fifty man, ol i sarach long tri de tasol ol i no finim Elaija.

original: When they returned to Elisha, who was staying in Jericho, he said to them, “Didn’t I tell you not to go?”
translation: Taim ol i kam bek long Elisha, em i stap long Jeriko, na em i tokim ol, "Mi no bin tokim yu inap long go?"

original: Then the men of the city said to Elisha, “Please note, our lord, that the city’s location is good, as you can see. But the water is bad and the land is unfruitful.”
translation: Ol man bilong siti i tokim Elisha, "Papa, yu mas notis, siti em i stap long ples nau, em i gutpela, olsem yu lukim. Tasol wara i no good, na gras bilong kantri i no bung."

original: “Bring me a new bowl,” he replied, “and put some salt in it.” So they brought it to him,
translation: “Kisim mipela wanpela nupela bol,” em i tok, “na putim salt insait.” Nauspei ol i kam bringim i go long em.

original: and Elisha went out to the spring, cast the salt into it, and said, “This is what the LORD says: ‘I have healed this water. No longer will it cause death or unfruitfulness.’”
translation: Na Elisha i go aut long wara, i kirapim sol i go long en, na i tok olsem, “Dispela em i tok olsem LORD i tok: ‘Mi helem dispela wara. Ina bai no ken kisim maret o i no gat krai gen.’”

original: And the waters there have been healthy to this day, according to the word spoken by Elisha.
translation: Na wara i stap gut olsem long hap em, strongim tok bilong Elisa, inap long tude.

original: From there, Elisha went up to Bethel, and as he was walking up the road, a group of boys came out of the city and jeered at him, chanting, “Go up, you baldhead! Go up, you baldhead!”
translation: Long hap, Elisa i go ap long Betel, na em i wokap long rot, ol pikinini i kam aut long siti, laikim ol, singautim, taki, "Go ap, yu hed bilong yu i paiawe! Go ap, yu hed bilong yu i paiawe!"

original: Then he turned around, looked at them, and called down a curse on them in the name of the LORD. Suddenly two female bears came out of the woods and mauled forty-two of the boys.
translation: Em turnim bek long wei, kisim luk long ol, na em praisim kileng long nem bilong LORD. Olsem wanem, tu femal bears i kamap long bus na praisim 42 boi.

original: And Elisha went on to Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.
translation: Na Elisha i go nap long Maunten Karmel, na bai i kam bek gen long Samaria.

original: In the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat’s reign over Judah, Jehoram son of Ahab became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria twelve years.
translation: Long eightin yia bilong paitim bilong Jehoshaphat olsem king bilong Judah, Jehoram, pikinini bilong Ahab, i kam king bilong Israel, na i rain twelve yia long Samaria.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, but not as his father and mother had done. He removed the sacred pillar of Baal that his father had made.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, tasol em i no mekim olsem tisa na mama bilong en i mekim. Em i kisim wei na rausim pilia sakred bilong Baal we tisa bilong en i mekim.

original: Nevertheless, he clung to the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit; he did not turn away from them.
translation: Namotru, em i holim strong long sin olsem Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat i mekim Israel long sin; em i no lusim ol.

original: Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep breeder, and he would render to the king of Israel a hundred thousand lambs and the wool of a hundred thousand rams.
translation: Nau Mesha king bilong Moab em i raisim sip, na em bai givim bek long king bilong Israel hundred tausand lambis na wool bilong hundred tausand ramis.

original: But after the death of Ahab, the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
translation: Long taim Ahab i dai pinis, king bilong Moab i bagarap long king bilong Israel.

original: So at that time King Jehoram set out from Samaria and mobilized all Israel.
translation: Long taem ya, Kingi Jehoram i go bek gen long Samaria na i raitim ol Isrel.

original: And he sent a message to Jehoshaphat king of Judah: “The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you go with me to fight against Moab?” “I will go,” replied Jehoshaphat. “I am like you, my people are your people, and my horses are your horses.”
translation: Na em i sendim mesij long Jehosafati king bilong Yuda: “King bilong Moabu i kam bek long mi. Yu go wantaim mi na fight gen Moabu?” “Mi go,” olsem Jehosafati i tok. “Mi olsem yu, piple bilong mi em piple bilong yu, na hos bilong mi em hos bilong yu.”

original: Then he asked, “Which way shall we go up?” “By way of the Desert of Edom,” replied Joram.
translation: Em i askim, “Yumi go apo long wanem rot?” Na Joram i bekim tok, “Olsem long rot bilong Desert bilong Edom.”

original: So the king of Israel, the king of Judah, and the king of Edom set out, and after they had traveled a roundabout route for seven days, they had no water for their army or for their animals.
translation: King bilong Isrel, king bilong Juta, na king bilong Edom i go olgeta, na ol i wokwe long rot bilong bikpela wik sepen de, ol i no gat wara long ol solja na long ol animals bilong ol.

original: “Alas,” said the king of Israel, “for the LORD has summoned these three kings to deliver them into the hand of Moab!”
translation: “Mai o,” ol ki bilong Isrel i tok, “LORD i kirapim dispela tripela ki long givim ol long han bilong Moab!”

original: But Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there no prophet of the LORD here? Let us inquire of the LORD through him.” And one of the servants of the king of Israel answered, “Elisha son of Shaphat is here. He used to pour water on the hands of Elijah.”
translation: Jehosafat tanim askim, "I no got prophet bilong God hia? Yumi go askim God thru hem." Na wanpela servants bilong king bilong Israel tokim, "Elisha sut bilong Shapat i stap hia. Em yusim pasim wara long han bilong Elija."

original: Jehoshaphat affirmed, “The word of the LORD is with him.” So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.
translation: Jehosafati iam konfirmim, “Wod bilong GOD i stap wantaim em.” King bilong Israel, Jehosafati, na king bilong Edom ol i go daun long en.

original: Elisha, however, said to the king of Israel, “What have we to do with each other? Go to the prophets of your father and of your mother!” “No,” replied the king of Israel, “for it is the LORD who has summoned these three kings to deliver them into the hand of Moab.”
translation: Elisha i tokim king bilong Israel, "Wanem nau i kam long mipela? Yu go long ol profet bilong papa na mama bilong yu!" King bilong Israel i tok, "Nogat, em i Lord tasol i kisim despla tripela king i kam long givim ol long han bilong Moab."

original: Then Elisha said, “As surely as the LORD of Hosts lives, before whom I stand, were it not for my regard for the presence of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, I would not look at you or acknowledge you.
translation: Na Elisha i tok olsem, "Olsem God Bilong Yumi Olgeta i stap, em i givim mi laip, we bilong en, mi go i stap, sapos mi no gat respek long ples bilong Jehoshaphat king bilong Judah, mi no bin lukim yu orokim yu.

original: But now, bring me a harpist.” And while the harpist played, the hand of the LORD came upon Elisha
translation: Nau, kisim i go long mipela wanpela man i save paitim harp. Na long taim em i paitim harp, han bilong LORD i kam stap long Elisha.

original: and he said, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Dig this valley full of ditches.’
translation: Na em tok, "Dispela em tok bilong LORD: 'Kisim vali dispela i kamap klia long pukpuk.'"

original: For the LORD says, ‘You will not see wind or rain, but the valley will be filled with water, and you will drink—you and your cattle and your animals.’
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem, yu no go si win na ren, tasol vali bai i kamap ful long wara, na yu bai dring, yu, bulmakau yu, na olgeta kain animal bilong yu.

original: This is a simple matter in the sight of the LORD, and He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand.
translation: Em i wankain samting long ai bilong LORD, na em bai kam bek i save helpim yu, birua Moabitis i givim long han bilong yu.

original: And you shall attack every fortified city and every city of importance. You shall cut down every good tree, stop up every spring, and ruin every good field with stones.”
translation: Na yu mas atakim olgeta taun bung bilong paitim na taun bilong bikpela importance. Yu mas katim daun olgeta diwai gudepela, pasim olgeta wata sip, na bagarapim olgeta graun gudepela wantaim stoan.”

original: The next morning, at the time of the morning sacrifice, water suddenly flowed from the direction of Edom and filled the land.
translation: Bikos nem moning, long taim bilong sakrifis moning, wara hamar i kamapim from hap bilong Edom na i fulim graun.

original: Now all the Moabites had heard that the kings had come up to fight against them. So all who could bear arms, young and old, were summoned and stationed at the border.
translation: Nau ol Moabitis ol i harim dispela kings i kam antap long pait, na ol i kisim tok igo long ol man husat i gat strong bilong kisim han bilong pait, bikpela na liklik, na ol i go stap long bipoa graun.

original: When they got up early in the morning, the sun was shining on the water, and it looked as red as blood to the Moabites across the way.
translation: Tupela i go ap long moning, san i shayn i stap long wara, na i luk olsem redd olsem blod long ai bilong Ol Moab long hap bilong narapela sait.

original: “This is blood!” they exclaimed. “The kings have clashed swords and slaughtered one another. Now to the plunder, Moab!”
translation: "Em i bled!" ol i sei. "Ol kingly i kolim pok na katim sords, na ol i kilim won another. Nau long go na kisim planda bilong Moab!"

original: But when the Moabites came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and attacked them, and they fled before them. So the Israelites invaded their land and struck down the Moabites.
translation: Tasol wanpela taim Ol Moab kam long kamp bilong Ol Israel, Ol Israel sanap strong na winim ol, na ol i ranawe bikos ol i kam. Na so Ol Israel go insait long graun bilong ol na winim Ol Moabites.

original: They destroyed the cities, and each man threw stones on every good field until it was covered. They stopped up every spring and cut down every good tree. Only Kir-haraseth was left with stones in place, but men with slings surrounded it and attacked it as well.
translation: Ol i bagarapim ol taun, na nambauta man i kisim ston na putim long ol gurpela fel, na ol fel i kamap kaput. Ol i paulim ol pila wata, na ol i katim ol gurpela diwai. Kir-haraseth i stap yet, na ol ston i no pulap, tasol ol man wantaim sling i go raunim na bagarapim.

original: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too fierce for him, he took with him seven hundred swordsmen to break through to the king of Edom, but they could not prevail.
translation: King bilong Moab i lukim bikos fait i go strong tumas long em, na i kisim na i go wantaim sampela man bilong wap long nait, sebén hundred man, bikim wei long go inap long king bilong Edom, tasol ol i no inap winim.

original: So he took his firstborn son, who was to succeed him, and offered him as a burnt offering on the city wall. And there was great fury against the Israelites, so they withdrew and returned to their own land.
translation: Na em i kisim pikinini namba wan bilong em, we i mas kamap king bihain, na em i givim em olsem ofing bilong faia long banis bilong taun. Na bikpela bel hevi i kamap against Israelites, na ol i withdraw na go bek gen long kantri bilong ol.

original: Now the wife of one of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, “Your servant, my husband, is dead, and you know that your servant feared the LORD. And now his creditor is coming to take my two children as his slaves!”
translation: Meri bilong wanpela blut long ol pikinini prophet i go bekim Elisha, “Servant bilong yu, husban bilong mi, em i dai pinis, na yu save olsem servant bilong yu i bin gat respek long LORD. Na nau man i bekim moni i kam bekim, bai tekim tu pikinini bilong mi olsem slave bilong em!”

original: “How can I help you?” asked Elisha. “Tell me, what do you have in the house?” She answered, “Your servant has nothing in the house but a jar of oil.”
translation: “Mipela i ken helpim yu long wanem?” Elisha i askim. “Yu tok olsem, yu gat wanem kain ka insait long haus?” Namba wan meri i ansa, “Bikos servant bilong yu i no gat nada insait long haus, mipela i gat tasol wanpela bilo na ol.”

original: “Go,” said Elisha, “borrow jars, even empty ones, from all your neighbors. Do not gather just a few.
translation: “Go,” tok Elisha, “kisim bek jar, jar emti tu, long ol narapela manmeri. No skulim pinis, tasol kisim planti.”

original: Then go inside, shut the door behind you and your sons, and pour oil into all these jars, setting the full ones aside.”
translation: Go insait, sarim diwai baiha long yu na pikinini man, putim oil insait long ol jar, na wanem jar i ful, letem asi.

original: So she left him, and after she had shut the door behind her and her sons, they kept bringing jars to her, and she kept pouring.
translation: Na em lusim em, na em paulimausim dor long behain em na pikinini bilong em, ol i kirapim bekim diwai long em, na em i stap kotim.

original: When all the jars were full, she said to her son, “Bring me another.” But he replied, “There are no more jars.” Then the oil stopped flowing.
translation: Wanem ol yar bilong em i kamap pinis, na em tokim pikinini bilong em, "Kam bringim mi narapela wan." Tasol em i tok, "Ol yar i pinis, ino gat moa." Na oli bai i stap, i no inap rin bek.

original: She went and told the man of God, and he said, “Go, sell the oil, and pay your debt. Then you and your sons can live on the remainder.”
translation: Em i go na toktok long man bilong God, na em i tok, "Go, salim ol oil, peim dets bilong yu, na bai yu na ol pikinini bilong yu i stap long ol narapela."

original: One day Elisha went to Shunem, and a prominent woman who lived there persuaded him to have a meal. So whenever he would pass by, he would stop there to eat.
translation: Wanpela de Elisha i go long Shunem, na meri bilong ples we i gat nem i kisim em long kaikai. Olsem na, bai em i pas long ples, em bai stap na kisim kaikai.

original: Then the woman said to her husband, “Behold, now I know that the one who often comes our way is a holy man of God.
translation: Meri i tokim husban bilong em, "Oro, nau mi save, hu i kam long rot bilong mipela em i man bilong God olgeta."

original: Please let us make a small room upstairs and put in it a bed, a table, a chair, and a lamp for him. Then when he comes to us, he can stay there.”
translation: Mipela i mas wokim rum liklik antap long haus, putim bet, tebol, chaer, na lamb i go insait, na em i kam long mipela, em i ken stap bere.

original: One day Elisha came to visit and went to his upper room to lie down.
translation: Wanpela de Elisha i kam bek long visitim na i go long rum blong em hap bilong slip.

original: And he said to Gehazi his servant, “Call the Shunammite woman.” And when he had called her, she stood before him,
translation: Em i tokim Gehazi haus boi bilong em, "Kisim Meri Shunamiti i kam." Na meri i kam, em i stanap long han bilong en.

original: and Elisha said to Gehazi, “Now tell her, ‘Look, you have gone to all this trouble for us. What can we do for you? Can we speak on your behalf to the king or the commander of the army?’” “I have a home among my own people,” she replied.
translation: Na Elisha i tokim Gehazi, “Nau yu tokim em, ‘Look, yu go long wei na yu mekim olgeta dispela hardek long mipela. Wanem mipela inap mekim long yu? Mipela inap tok long king igo long kapten bilong soljia bilong yu?’” “Mi stap long haus bilong ol wantok bilong mi,” em i tok.

original: So he asked, “Then what should be done for her?” “Well, she has no son,” Gehazi replied, “and her husband is old.”
translation: Em askim, "Wat ken mekim olsem long en?" "Meri ia no gat pikinini man," Gehazi i tok, "na husband bilong meri em i olpela."

original: “Call her,” said Elisha. So Gehazi called her, and she stood in the doorway.
translation: Ol i tok, Elisha i tok, "Kisim em i go." Na Gehazi i kirapim em, na em i stanap namel long dor.

original: And Elisha declared, “At this time next year, you will hold a son in your arms.” “No, my lord,” she said. “Do not lie to your maidservant, O man of God.”
translation: Na Elisha i tokautim olsem, "Long taim ya nambawan i go, yu bai karim bel isi bilong pikinini." "Nogat, lorden," meri ia i tok. "No ken givim rong toksave long meri i wok servis, o man bilong God."

original: But the woman did conceive, and at that time the next year she gave birth to a son, just as Elisha had told her.
translation: Meri i kamap bikos i katim bun, na long taim em i karim bebi man i kamap, olsem Elisha i tokim em.

original: And the child grew, and one day he went out to his father, who was with the harvesters.
translation: Na pikinini i go ap long, na wanpela de em i go aut go long papa bilong em, em i stap wantaim ol harim rin.

original: “My head! My head!” he complained to his father. So his father told a servant, “Carry him to his mother.”
translation: Hed bilong me! Hed bilong me! em i kirapim bek long papa bilong en, na papa bilong en i tokim wanpela yangpela man, “Kisim em i go long mama bilong en.”

original: After the servant had picked him up and carried him to his mother, the boy sat on her lap until noon, and then he died.
translation: Ol i go pinis, na servan i kisim em, karim em go long mama bilong em, na bikpela i siddaun long lap bilong mama long taem we bilong midde, na bai em i dai pinis.

original: And she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God. Then she shut the door and went out.
translation: Na em i go apo na lusim pikinini long bet bilong man bilong God. Em raitim door na i go aut.

original: And the woman called her husband and said, “Please send me one of the servants and one of the donkeys, that I may go quickly to the man of God and return.”
translation: Na meri i singautim husban bilong em, istap tok olsem, “Yu sendim wanpela servant na wanpela donki, bai mi go kisim spid long man bilong God na kam bek.”

original: “Why would you go to him today?” he replied. “It is not a New Moon or a Sabbath.” “Everything is all right,” she said.
translation: “Go long em tudei?” em tok. “Em i no de Moon Nupela o Sabat.” “Olgeta i orait,” em tok.

original: Then she saddled the donkey and told her servant, “Drive onward; do not slow the pace for me unless I tell you.”
translation: Na em i slipim sak sak long donki na i tokim wokman meri bilong en, “Yu go bek, yu no stap yet, no ken lilim spid, yu go i go, tasol bai mi tok long yu.”

original: So she set out and went to the man of God at Mount Carmel. When the man of God saw her at a distance, he said to his servant Gehazi, “Look, there is the Shunammite woman.
translation: Na em i go na em i wok long Maunt Karmel, go na kisim man bilong God. Ol i lukim em longwe tasol, na em i tokim servant bilong em, Geazi, olsem: "Yu look, meri Snamit em i kam."

original: Please run out now to meet her and ask, ‘Are you all right? Is your husband all right? Is your child all right?’” And she answered, “Everything is all right.”
translation: Ranningaut nau long go bekim ka, askim olsem, 'Yu orait? Poroman bilong yu orait? Pikinini bilong yu orait?' Na em i tok, 'Oli orait.'

original: When she reached the man of God at the mountain, she clung to his feet. Gehazi came over to push her away, but the man of God said, “Leave her alone, for her soul is in deep distress, and the LORD has hidden it from me and has not told me.”
translation: Taim em i go kas long man bilong God long mauntin, em i kisim holim leg bilong en. Gehazi i kam na i laik pusim i go, tasol man bilong God i tok, "Lusim na, bikos soul bilong em i stap long het pikinini, na Bikpela i kaipim secret long me, i no givim mi save."

original: Then she said, “Did I ask you for a son, my lord? Didn’t I say, ‘Do not deceive me?’”
translation: Em i tok, “Mi askim yu long pikinini, papa bilong mipela? Mi tok olsem bai, ‘Yu no givim roleng long mi?’”

original: So Elisha said to Gehazi, “Tie up your garment, take my staff in your hand, and go! If you meet anyone, do not greet him, and if anyone greets you, do not answer him. Then lay my staff on the boy’s face.”
translation: Na Elisha i tokim Gehazi olsem, "Klosim ap bel han, kisim stik bilong mi long han bilong yu, na go! Igo yu kambek long eni man, yu no ken givim em welkam, na i go eni man i skelim yu, yu no ken skelim tok igo long en. Bihaenim yu putim stik bilong mi antap face bilong pikinini."

original: And the mother of the boy said, “As surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, I will not leave you.” So he got up and followed her.
translation: Mama bilong pikinini i tok, “Olsem LORDE i stap, na yu yet, mi no bai lusim yu.” Na em i kam bek long ples, na i go bihainim.

original: Gehazi went on ahead of them and laid the staff on the boy’s face, but there was no sound or response. So he went back to meet Elisha and told him, “The boy has not awakened.”
translation: Gehazi i go bipo long ol, na i putim stik bilong em long face bilong pikinini, tasol i no bin harim soun na tok. Nogat, em i go bek gen, ken em meetim Elisha, na i talem em, "Pikinini i no kamap bek gen."

original: When Elisha reached the house, there was the boy lying dead on his bed.
translation: Taim Elisha kamap long haus, na boi i stap dae, i lid down long bet bilong en.

original: So he went in, closed the door behind the two of them, and prayed to the LORD.
translation: Na em i go insait, im bikim dorai i stap klos, na em betel long LORD.

original: Then Elisha got on the bed and lay on the boy, mouth to mouth, eye to eye, and hand to hand. As he stretched himself out over him, the boy’s body became warm.
translation: Na Elisha i go antap long bet, na i laik i stap antap long pikinini, maus to maus, ai to ai, na han to han. Na long taim em i stretim bodi i go daun antap long em, bodi bilong pikinini i kam warm.

original: Elisha turned away and paced back and forth across the room. Then he got on the bed and stretched himself out over the boy again, and the boy sneezed seven times and opened his eyes.
translation: Elisha i tam i go bek gen na i wokabaut go bek gen long rum. Na em i go antap long bet na i stretim bodi i go daun long boi gen, na boi i kusim sikis taim na i opim ai.

original: Elisha summoned Gehazi and said, “Call the Shunammite woman.” So he called her and she came. Then Elisha said, “Pick up your son.”
translation: Elisha i kalim Gehazi long go, kisim bek i go kalim Meri Shunamiti. Na Meri Shunamiti i kam. Elisha taraten i tok, "Kisim bek i go lukim pikinini bilong yu."

original: She came in, fell at his feet, and bowed to the ground. Then she picked up her son and went out.
translation: I kam insait, i pakim tupela leg bilong en, i kruk long graun. Olsem na i karim bek pikinini bilong en, i go aus.

original: When Elisha returned to Gilgal, there was a famine in the land. As the sons of the prophets were sitting at his feet, he said to his attendant, “Put on the large pot and boil some stew for the sons of the prophets.”
translation: Taim Elisha i kam bek long Gilgal, na famin i bin stap long kantri. Susa progen i sindaun klostu long lek bilong em, na em i tokim servis man bilong em, “Putim bigpela pot na kukim kaikai bilong susa progen.”

original: One of them went out to the field to gather herbs, and he found a wild vine from which he gathered as many wild gourds as his garment could hold. Then he came back and cut them up into the pot of stew, though no one knew what they were.
translation: Wanpela bilong ol i go aut long graun na kisim ol kina bus, na em i painim wanpela kain balus i karim leaf, na em i kisim ol gourd i karim skin ruw olsem planti... olsem laplap bilong em i holim. Em i kam bek na katim ol i go insait long pik, tasol nobodi save long wanem kina diwai em ol i bin kisim.

original: And they poured it out for the men to eat, but when they tasted the stew they cried out, “There is death in the pot, O man of God!” And they could not eat it.
translation: Em i kirapim bek long ol man i kaikai, tasol ol i tistem sop, na ol i singaut, “I gat deth long pot, o man bilong God!” Na ol i no inap kaikai.

original: Then Elisha said, “Get some flour.” He threw it into the pot and said, “Pour it out for the people to eat.” And there was nothing harmful in the pot.
translation: Elisha i tok, "Kisim flauer." Na em i putim i go insait pot, stap tok, "Pourim ausat long ol pipol i kaikai." Na inap pot i gat no ken harm.

original: Now a man from Baal-shalishah came to the man of God with a sack of twenty loaves of barley bread from the first ripe grain. “Give it to the people to eat,” said Elisha.
translation: Wanpela man i kam bek long Baal-shalishah, na em i go long man bilong God, na em i bringim wanpela baul bilong baret, em i gat twenty loaves kaikai, na kaikai ibin kamap pastaim. "Givim ol pipol kaikai," Elisha i tok.

original: But his servant asked, “How am I to set twenty loaves before a hundred men?” “Give it to the people to eat,” said Elisha, “for this is what the LORD says: ‘They will eat and have some left over.’”
translation: Na sarvan bilong em yet tok, "Mi bai kam save mekim twenti loaf i go long hundred man olsem wanem?" "Givim ol pipol i kaikai," Elisha i tok, "long bikos dispela em tok bilong LORD: 'Oli bai kaikai na oli gat planti was.'"

original: So he set it before them, and they ate and had some left over, according to the word of the LORD.
translation: Em putim i go bifor ol, na ol i kaikai, na i stap yet, olsem tok bilong LORD.

original: Now Naaman, the commander of the army of the king of Aram, was a great man in his master’s sight and highly regarded, for through him the LORD had given victory to Aram. And he was a mighty man of valor, but he was a leper.
translation: Nau Naaman, komanda bilong army bilong king bilong Aram, em i man bilong ken long ai bilong boss, na ol i givim respek long em, wantaim LORD i givim winim long ol. Em i man bilong strongpela na kros, be em i sindaun long sik lepra.

original: At this time the Arameans had gone out in bands and had taken a young girl from the land of Israel, and she was serving Naaman’s wife.
translation: Long taim ia, Pipol Aramen i go aut na katim ol grupe, na ol i kisim nupela meri long graun Israel, na meri ia i wok servis meri bilong Naaman.

original: She said to her mistress, “If only my master would go to the prophet who is in Samaria, he would cure him of his leprosy.”
translation: Em i tokim meri bilong em, “Sapos master bilong mipela i go long prophet i stap long Samaria, em bai kamautim skin sick bilong em.”

original: And Naaman went and told his master what the girl from the land of Israel had said.
translation: Naaman i go tokim papa bilong em olsem gel bilong lain bilong Isrel i tok.

original: “Go now,” said the king of Aram, “and I will send you with a letter to the king of Israel.” So Naaman departed, taking with him ten talents of silver, six thousand shekels of gold, and ten sets of clothing.
translation: “Go nau,” olsem king bilong Aram tok, “na mi bai sandaun yu wantaim leta long king bilong Israel.” Naaman i go bek, na karim nanas long en: ten talents bilong silva, six thousand shekels bilong gol, na ten set bilong klos.

original: And the letter that he took to the king of Israel stated: “With this letter I am sending my servant Naaman, so that you may cure him of his leprosy.”
translation: Na leta we em i kisim i tok olsem: "Wantaim leta dispela mi sendim wokman blong me Naaman, so yumou ken kurim em long sik leprosi."

original: When the king of Israel read the letter, he tore his clothes and asked, “Am I God, killing and giving life, that this man expects me to cure a leper? Surely you can see that he is seeking a quarrel with me!”
translation: Taim king bilong Israel i risim leta, na em i katim klotes bilong en na em i askim, "Mipela God oli kilim man na givim laip, bai mi ken kisim bek lepra? Dispela man i xpectim mipela long helem lepra, yupela inap lukim olsem em i laik kaikaim fait wantaim mipela!"

original: Now when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, he sent a message to the king: “Why have you torn your clothes? Please let the man come to me, and he will know that there is a prophet in Israel.”
translation: Nau long taim Elisha, man bilong God, harim dispela, na em bingim wod long king bilong Israel: "Wai yu rausim klotes bilong yu? Kiim ol man i kam long me, na em bai save olsem i gat prophet long Israel."

original: So Naaman came with his horses and chariots and stood at the door of Elisha’s house.
translation: Naaman i kam wantaim hores na karet bilong en, na i stap klostu long dor bilong haus bilong Elisha.

original: Then Elisha sent him a messenger, who said, “Go and wash yourself seven times in the Jordan, and your flesh will be restored, and you will be clean.”
translation: Na Elisha i sendim man bilong em, i tok olsem: “Yu go wosim skin bilong yu long wara bilong Jodan yet seven taim, bodi bilong yu bai i kamap gut naman, na yu bai i klia.”

original: But Naaman went away angry, saying, “I thought that he would surely come out, stand and call on the name of the LORD his God, and wave his hand over the spot to cure my leprosy.
translation: Naaman i go we longwe nau, em i bin bel kol, tokim olsem, "Mi bin tinkim olsem em bai kam bek, sanap, na kalim nem bilong Jehovah God bilong en, stretim han bilong en long ples we leposi i gat long ai bilong mi, na me hariap."

original: Are not the Abanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? Could I not have washed in them and been cleansed?” So he turned and went away in a rage.
translation: Abanah na Pharpar, ol river bilong Damaskas, i gat kaikai moa long ol wata bilong Israel? Inap mi no wasim skin bilong me long ol river ia na kleanim? Na em i turnim bek na go bek gen long hangre.

original: Naaman’s servants, however, approached him and said, “My father, if the prophet had told you to do some great thing, would you not have done it? How much more, then, when he tells you, ‘Wash and be cleansed’?”
translation: Naaman sarvisman i go klostu long em na tok, "Papa bilong mi, sapos prophet i tokim yu long mekim samting bikpela, bai yu bai mekim. Sapos olsem, orait nau, em i tok, 'Wasim na kamap klia'?"

original: So Naaman went down and dipped himself in the Jordan seven times, according to the word of the man of God, and his flesh was restored and became like that of a little child, and he was clean.
translation: Na Naaman i go daun long Jordan na wasim skin bilong en seven taem, olsem wod bilong man bilong God, na skin bilong en i kamap nupela gen olsem skin bilong pikinini, na em i kamap klia.

original: Then Naaman and all his attendants went back to the man of God, stood before him, and declared, “Now I know for sure that there is no God in all the earth except in Israel. So please accept a gift from your servant.”
translation: Naaman na ol i go bek long man bilong God, ol i stanap bifo em, na ol i tokaut, "Nau mi save nalagi, i no gat God long eni kantri bilong graun, bikos Israel tasol i gat. Olsem, yu mas givim samting long sarvan bilong yu."

original: But Elisha replied, “As surely as the LORD lives, before whom I stand, I will not accept it.” And although Naaman urged him to accept it, he refused.
translation: Elisha i tokim, "Olsem Papa God i stap, em i liv, na mi sanap long ples bilong em, mi no ken akseptim." Naaman i trai longen bai em i akseptim, tasol em i refusim.

original: “If you will not,” said Naaman, “please let me, your servant, be given as much soil as a pair of mules can carry. For your servant will never again make a burnt offering or a sacrifice to any other god but the LORD.
translation: Sapos yu no laik, givim mi, servant bilong yu, as ples bilong karamap olsem ol i save kisim long tupela mul. Bikos servant bilong yu nil go bek long mekim ofing na sakrifis long narapela god, tasol long Bikpela.

original: Yet may the LORD forgive your servant this one thing: When my master goes into the temple of Rimmon to worship there, and he leans on my arm, and I bow down in the temple of Rimmon, may the LORD forgive your servant in this matter.”
translation: Na yet LORD bai givim forgive servant bilong yu long dispela wanpela ka: Long taim master bilong mi go insait long templa bilong Rimmon na em i wokim lotu, na em i holim arm bilong me, na mi knek i go daun long templa bilong Rimmon, LORD bai givim forgive servant bilong yu long dispela matar.

original: “Go in peace,” said Elisha. But after Naaman had traveled a short distance,
translation: Ol Elisha i tok, "Go long wei peis." Tasol bihaen long Naaman i go na i kam long namba liklik distans,

original: Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said, “Look, my master has spared this Aramean, Naaman, while not accepting what he brought. As surely as the LORD lives, I will run after him and get something from him.”
translation: Gehazi, servan bilong Elisha man bilong GOD, tok, "Papa bilong mi spare despla Aramean, Naaman, na em i no tekim dispela em bringim. Olsem GOD i stap, mi go ranawe behaindim na kisim samting long em."

original: So Gehazi pursued Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running toward him, he got down from the chariot to meet him and asked, “Is everything all right?”
translation: Gehazi i go bekim Naaman. Naaman i lukim em i ran i kam, em i kambak daun long kar bilong en, na em i askim, "Olgeta samting orait?"

original: “Everything is all right,” Gehazi replied. “My master has sent me to say, ‘I have just now discovered that two young men from the sons of the prophets have come to me from the hill country of Ephraim. Please give them a talent of silver and two sets of clothing.’”
translation: “Olgeta samting i orait,” Gehazi i tok. “Bos bilong me, Elisha, i sendim mi kam tok, ‘Mi finisim diskaverim nau, na tu pikinini bilong profet i kam from kantri bilong maunten long Ephraim. Yu givim ol wan talent bilong silva na tu set bilong klos.’”

original: But Naaman insisted, “Please, take two talents.” And he urged Gehazi to accept them. Then he tied up two talents of silver in two bags along with two sets of clothing and gave them to two of his servants, who carried them ahead of Gehazi.
translation: Naaman i strongim, “Plez, yu kisim tu kina moni.” Na em i askim strong long Gehazi long akseptim. Ol i dai na givim tu kina silva insait long tu bag, wantaim tu set bilong pes klos, na givim ol i go long tu Hausboi, ol i karama i go bifor long Gehazi.

original: When Gehazi came to the hill, he took the gifts from the servants and stored them in the house. Then he dismissed the men, and they departed.
translation: Taim Gehazi i kam long maunten, na em i kisim pinis ol samting bilong gift na was long han bilong ol servan, na i putim ol long haus. Na bai em i lusim ol man, na ol i go pinis.

original: When Gehazi went in and stood before his master, Elisha asked him, “Gehazi, where have you been?” “Your servant did not go anywhere,” he replied.
translation: Wanpela taim Gehazi i go insait na em i stap bifor bos bilong en, Elisa, em i askim Gehazi, "Gehazi, yu go we?" "Mipela husat servent, mi no go wai ples," em i tok bek.

original: But Elisha questioned him, “Did not my spirit go with you when the man got down from his chariot to meet you? Is this the time to accept money and clothing, olive groves and vineyards, sheep and oxen, menservants and maidservants?
translation: Elisha askim em, “Inap spirit bilong mi i go wantaim yu wen man i katam daun long kare bilong en na kam mitim yu? Em i taem bilong yumi akseptim moni na klos, gaden bilong oliv na wein, sip na bulmakau, wokman na meri wok?”

original: Therefore, the leprosy of Naaman will cling to you and your descendants forever!” And as Gehazi left his presence, he was leprous—as white as snow.
translation: Olegta, sik leprosi bilong Naaman bai kam stap long yu na ol desenden bilong yu foreva! Na Gehazi lusim husat i stap, em i go, na em i kisim sik leprosi - em i white olsem snou.

original: Now the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “Please take note that the place where we meet with you is too small for us.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong ol profet i tokim Elisha, "Yumus lukim, hap tumuna yumu i go long em i nogut, i no inap long yumi."

original: Please let us go to the Jordan, where each of us can get a log so we can build ourselves a place to live there.” “Go,” said Elisha.
translation: Yumi go nau long Jordan River, na yumi ken kisim wanpela lak, yumi bildim haus bilong yumui long ples. "Go nau," olsem Elisha i tok.

original: Then one of them said, “Please come with your servants.” “I will come,” he replied.
translation: Wanpela bilong ol i tok, "Yu kam wantaim servant na yu, plis." "Mi bai kam," na em i tokim bek.

original: So Elisha went with them, and when they came to the Jordan, they began to cut down some trees.
translation: Na Elisha i go wantaim ol, na taim ol i kam long Jordan, ol i statim katim diwai.

original: As one of them was cutting down a tree, the iron axe head fell into the water. “Oh, my master,” he cried out, “it was borrowed!”
translation: Wanpela blo ol i kamdaunim diwai, hed bilong ais aks i go daun long wara. "O bos," em i kirap strong, "em i lain, mi bin borrowim!"

original: “Where did it fall?” asked the man of God. And when he showed him the place, the man of God cut a stick, threw it there, and made the iron float.
translation: “Wanem hap em i go daun?” man bilong God i askim. Na em i showim em hap, man bilong God i katim wan stick, i troim i go long hap, na i mekim ai bilong iron i flot.

original: “Lift it out,” he said, and the man reached out his hand and took it.
translation: “Lisim i go apo,” em i tok, na man i stretim han bilong en na em i kisim.

original: Now the king of Aram was at war against Israel. After consulting with his servants, he said, “My camp will be in such and such a place.”
translation: Nau king bilong Aram i go wok long war gen Isrel. Bihaen long em i toktok wantaim servant im, em i tok, "Ples bilong kamp bilong mi bai i stap olsem na olsem."

original: Then the man of God sent word to the king of Israel: “Be careful passing by this place, for the Arameans are going down there.”
translation: Man bilong God i salim tok long king bilong Israel: “Yu mas bekim gut long pai long ples ia, nau Aramia i go daun bihain long hap ia.”

original: So the king of Israel sent word to the place the man of God had pointed out. Time and again Elisha warned the king, so that he was on his guard in such places.
translation: King bilong Israel i sendim tok long ples we man bilong God i poinim. Olgeta taim Elisha i warisim king, na king i stap strong olsem na i save long ol ples.

original: For this reason the king of Aram became enraged and called his servants to demand of them, “Tell me, which one of us is on the side of the king of Israel?”
translation: King bilong Aram i kirap strong na i singautim servant bilong en, i askim ol long, "Oli tok tru, husat bilong yumipela i stap long sait bilong king bilong Israel?"

original: But one of his servants replied, “No one, my lord the king. For Elisha, the prophet in Israel, tells the king of Israel the very words you speak in your bedroom.”
translation: Wanpela i tok bek long en, "Nogat, papa king. Pasal Elisha, man proses long Isrel, em i tokim king bilong Isrel olgeta wod yu tok insait rum blong yu."

original: So the king said, “Go and see where he is, that I may send men to capture him.” On receiving the report, “Elisha is in Dothan,”
translation: King i givim tok, "Go na lukim husat i stap, na bai mi senim man i go kisim bek em." Ol i ripot, "Elisha i stap long Dothan,"

original: the king of Aram sent horses, chariots, and a great army. They went there by night and surrounded the city.
translation: King bilong Aram i sendim hos, kareta, na solja i go long ples ia nait, na ol i kam raitim roun long taun.
