original: When the servant of the man of God got up and went out early in the morning, an army with horses and chariots had surrounded the city. So he asked Elisha, “Oh, my master, what are we to do?”
translation: Husat i wok servos bilong man bilong God em i kirap na em i go aut long taim bifo moning, na ol i lukim army wantaim hores na kareta i kam ronraun na i surundenim sip. Em tri askim Elisha, "Papa bilong mipela, mipela inap duim wha?"

original: “Do not be afraid,” Elisha answered, “for those who are with us are more than those who are with them.”
translation: “No ken tok pisin long fear,” Elisha i tok, “kuzim ol i stap wantaim mipela i moa yet na ol i stap wantaim ol.”

original: Then Elisha prayed, “O LORD, please open his eyes that he may see.” And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man, and he saw that the hills were full of horses and chariots of fire all around Elisha.
translation: Na Elisha i praiz, "O LORD, opim ai bilong em, na em ina see." Na LORD i opim ai bilong yung man, na em see olsem bun bilong maunten i fulap long hors na karai bilong faia olsem i go raun long Elisha.

original: As the Arameans came down against him, Elisha prayed to the LORD, “Please strike these people with blindness.” So He struck them with blindness, according to the word of Elisha.
translation: Ol Aramen ol i kam daun na go bek gen im, Elisha i beten long Lod, “Lod, givim ol sipuma.” Na Lod i givim ol sipuma, strong long toktok bilong Elisha.

original: And Elisha told them, “This is not the way, and this is not the city. Follow me, and I will take you to the man you are seeking.” And he led them to Samaria.
translation: Na Elisha tokim ol, "Dispela i no wei bilong yu, na dispela i no taun bilong yu. Bihainim mi, na mi bai wokim Booker long yu i go long man we yu lukim." Na Elisha i lei ol i kam long Samaria.

original: When they had entered Samaria, Elisha said, “O LORD, open the eyes of these men that they may see.” Then the LORD opened their eyes, and they looked around and discovered that they were in Samaria.
translation: Taim ol i go insait long Samaria, Elisha i tok, “O PAPA GOD, opim ai bilong ol man ya, maka ol i ken si.” Na PAPA GOD i opim ai bilong ol, na ol i luk arond na katim nau ol i stap long Samaria.

original: And when the king of Israel saw them, he asked Elisha, “My father, shall I kill them? Shall I kill them?”
translation: Na king bilong Israel i lukim ol, na em i askim Elisha, "Papa bilong mi, inap mi kilim ol? Inap mi kilim ol?"

original: “Do not kill them,” he replied. “Would you kill those you have captured with your own sword or bow? Set food and water before them, that they may eat and drink and then return to their master.”
translation: “Noken kilim ol,” em i tok. “Yu bai kilim ol dispela ol i kam long han bilong yu yet wanpela swoord o banarang bilong yu? Putim kaikai na wara bere long ol, ol i kaikai na dring, na go bek gen long maser bilong ol.”

original: So the king prepared a great feast for them, and after they had finished eating and drinking, he sent them away, and they returned to their master. And the Aramean raiders did not come into the land of Israel again.
translation: King i makim kaikai bikpela long ol, na bihain ol i kisim kaikai na wara, em i sendim ol i go, na ol i go bek long maser bilong ol. Na Aramean rop i no kam bek gen long kantri bilong Israel.

original: Some time later, Ben-hadad king of Aram assembled his entire army and marched up to besiege Samaria.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Ben-hadad papa bilong Aram em i kamasim ol solja bilong en, na ol i go beklem na klose nap long Samaria.

original: So there was a great famine in Samaria. Indeed, they besieged the city so long that a donkey’s head sold for eighty shekels of silver, and a quarter cab of dove’s dung sold for five shekels of silver.
translation: Nupela kaikai i no kam, bikpela belo i kamap long Samaria. Ol i kam wail long siti, ol i kisim siti long taim olsem, hed bilong donki i sell long eighty shekel silva, na kwarata kab bilong dung bilong pisin i go long five shekel silva.

original: As the king of Israel was passing by on the wall, a woman cried out to him, “Help me, my lord the king!”
translation: King bilong Isrel i go waka long wal, na meri wan krai aut long em, "Halivim, papa bilong mi, king!"

original: He answered, “If the LORD does not help you, where can I find help for you? From the threshing floor or the winepress?”
translation: Em i tok, “I sori long ol, LORD bai i no holim yu, we bilong mekim havana long yu? Long ples bilong kilim graun o long ples bilong win?”

original: Then the king asked her, “What is the matter?” And she answered, “This woman said to me, ‘Give up your son, that we may eat him, and tomorrow we will eat my son.’
translation: King i askim her, “Mata bilong yu?” Na em i ansa, “Meri ia i tokim mi, ‘Givim son bilong yu, mipela bai kaikai em, na tumora bai mipela i kaikai pikinini bilong em.’”

original: So we boiled my son and ate him, and the next day I said to her, ‘Give up your son, that we may eat him.’ But she had hidden her son.”
translation: Mipela kisim pikinini bilong me, mipela kukim, na mipela kaikai, na bihainim de mipela tok pisinis long en, ‘Givim son bilong yu, mipela i kaikai.’ Tasol em harim pikinini bilong em.

original: When the king heard the words of the woman, he tore his clothes. And as he passed by on the wall, the people saw the sackcloth under his clothes next to his skin.
translation: Taim king i harim tok bilong meri, em i bin kirapim klotes bilong en. Na long taim em i pas long barier, ol pipol i lukim klos bilong sorrow i stap underneath klotes bilong en, klostu long skin bilong en.

original: He announced, “May God punish me, and ever so severely, if the head of Elisha son of Shaphat remains on his shoulders through this day!”
translation: Em i tokim, “Mipela bai God i bikim olsem long mi, na i bikim olsem nogut tru, if hed bilong Elisha sambai Shaphat i stap yet long skulim bilong en today!”

original: Now Elisha was sitting in his house, and the elders were sitting with him. The king sent a messenger ahead, but before he arrived, Elisha said to the elders, “Do you see how this murderer has sent someone to cut off my head? Look, when the messenger comes, shut the door to keep him out. Is not the sound of his master’s footsteps behind him?”
translation: Nau Elisha i sidaun long haus bilong en, na ol bikpela i sidaun wantaim em. King i sendim man bilong em i go bifo, tasol bifo em i kam, Elisha i tokim ol bikpela, "Yu lukim olsem, dispela man bilong kilim ol i salim man bilong em i katim hed bilong mi? Lukim, wankain em i kam, yu klosim door, no letim em kam insait. I no sindaun foootsteps bilong maser bilong em i kam bihain long em?"

original: While Elisha was still speaking with them, the messenger came down to him. And the king said, “This calamity is from the LORD. Why should I wait for the LORD any longer?”
translation: Wail Elisha i stap yet tok long ol, messenja i kam daun kiwan. Na king i tok, "Disasta ya i kam from Bikpela. Wai mi mas wit olsem long Bikpela yet?"

original: Then Elisha said, “Hear the word of the LORD! This is what the LORD says: ‘About this time tomorrow at the gate of Samaria, a seah of fine flour will sell for a shekel, and two seahs of barley will sell for a shekel.’”
translation: Harim tok bilong Jehovah! Dispela em tok bilong Jehovah olsem: 'Bai morngen bihain long gate bilong Samaria, wan seah bilong flauer gudepela bai sel bikos wan sikul, na tu seah bilong barli bai sel bikos wan sikul.'

original: But the officer on whose arm the king leaned answered the man of God, “Look, even if the LORD were to make windows in heaven, could this really happen?” “You will see it with your own eyes,” replied Elisha, “but you will not eat any of it.”
translation: Ofisa i tokim man bilong God, "Lookim, even if Papa bilong olgeta i me kim winowo long heven, inap dispela kamap so?" "Yu yet go si long ai bilong yu yet," Elisha i tok, "tasol yu no ken kaikai sampela."

original: Now there were four men with leprosy at the entrance of the city gate, and they said to one another, “Why just sit here until we die?
translation: Na i gat foa man we i gat sik leprosi long entris bilong gat bilong taun, na ol i tok long ol yet, “Mipela sit hara yet kamap dead, em i nogat senis.”

original: If we say, ‘Let us go into the city,’ we will die there from the famine in the city; but if we sit here, we will also die. So come now, let us go over to the camp of the Arameans. If they let us live, we will live; if they kill us, we will die.”
translation: Sapos yumu tok, 'Mipela go long taun', mipela ol i dai hap there long hangre insait long taun; tasol sapos mipela siddaun hari, mipela tu i dai. Nogat, yumu kam, mipela go karim na go long ples bilong army Aramen. Sapos ol i givim mipela laip, mipela bai i liv; sapos ol i kilim mipela, mipela bai i dai.

original: So they arose at twilight and went to the camp of the Arameans. But when they came to the outskirts of the camp, there was not a man to be found.
translation: Ol i kamap long taim bun bilong dei na i go long ples bilong army bilong Aramia. Tasol ol i kamap long hap bilong taun, maski man i no inap.

original: For the Lord had caused the Arameans to hear the sound of chariots, horses, and a great army, so that they said to one another, “Look, the king of Israel must have hired the kings of the Hittites and Egyptians to attack us.”
translation: Papa God i mekim Aramia i harim saun bilong kareta, hores, na army bikpela, ol i tok long ol yet, "Lukim, king bilong Israel emas inap baim kings bilong Hiti na Ijip i kam bekim mipela."

original: Thus the Arameans had arisen and fled at twilight, abandoning their tents and horses and donkeys. The camp was intact, and they had run for their lives.
translation: Na Aramia ol i kamap na rin i go biknait, ol i lusim haus bilong ol na hors na pinis. Kamp bilong ol i stap yet, na rin i save laip bilong ol.

original: When the lepers reached the edge of the camp, they went into a tent to eat and drink. Then they carried off the silver, gold, and clothing, and went and hid them. On returning, they entered another tent, carried off some items from there, and hid them.
translation: Wanpela taim lekros i go kamap long ain bilong ples kanaka, ol i go insait long hanus bilong kaikai na dringim. Ol karim i go sila, gol, na klos, na go na hidim ol. Ol return, go insait long narapela hanus, karim i go sampela samting long hap, na hidim ol.

original: Finally, they said to one another, “We are not doing what is right. Today is a day of good news. If we are silent and wait until morning light, our sin will overtake us. Now, therefore, let us go and tell the king’s household.”
translation: Ol i tok long ol yet, “Mipela i no wok gut. Todei em i de bilong gutpela stori. Sapos mipela i stap mute na w8 long morning lait, bikhet bilong mipela bai i kam behainim mipela. Nau, olgeta, mipela yet i go na toktok long haus bilong king.”

original: So they went and called out to the gatekeepers of the city, saying, “We went to the Aramean camp and no one was there—not a trace—only tethered horses and donkeys, and the tents were intact.”
translation: Ol i go na kisim aut long gaten ol iukim Haus bilong town, ol i tok se: "Mipela i go long ples bilong Aramea ol i kam, nogat narapela i stap - nogat traes - hap tasol hores ol i bin kisim long rop na donki, na haus bilong kalabus i stap yet, nogat bagarap."

original: The gatekeepers shouted the news, and it was reported to the king’s household.
translation: Ol kaikai i singautim nius, na ol i ripotim long haus bilong king.

original: So the king got up in the night and said to his servants, “Let me tell you what the Arameans have done to us. They know we are starving, so they have left the camp to hide in the field, thinking, ‘When they come out of the city, we will take them alive and enter the city.’”
translation: King i kam bek long nait na i tokim servis man bilong en, “Mipela lukim ol Aramen wanem oli mekim long mipela. Oli save mipela i dai pinis long hungri, oli lusim ples bilong armi na go klostu long bus, na ol i ting, ‘Taim ol i kam aut long taun, mipela ken kisim ol na go insait long taun.’”

original: But one of his servants replied, “Please, have scouts take five of the horses that remain in the city. Their plight will be no worse than all the Israelites who are left here. You can see that all the Israelites here are doomed. So let us send them and find out.”
translation: Wanpela i go bek long en, em i tok, "Plez, mipela salim skaut i go kisim faivpela hors we i stap yet long siti. Siknes bilong ol i no olsem ol Israelites ol i stap yet long hia. Olgeta Israelites long hia ol i dai pinis. Nogat, mipela salim ol i go lukim."

original: Then the scouts took two chariots with horses, and the king sent them after the Aramean army, saying, “Go and see.”
translation: Ol skaut i kisim tu chariot wantaim hores, na king i sendim ol bihain Armi bilong Aram, ol i tok, 'Go na lukim.'

original: And they tracked them as far as the Jordan, and indeed, the whole way was littered with the clothing and equipment the Arameans had thrown off in haste. So the scouts returned and told the king.
translation: Na ol i folowim bek long trak ol Arameans long Jordan, na rot i kamap moa yet olgeta hap tumas, hariap long hap na klos na ol samting bilong warkim ol Arameans i kisim long hariap. Skaut i go bak na tudakim king.

original: Then the people went out and plundered the camp of the Arameans. It was then that a seah of fine flour sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley sold for a shekel, according to the word of the LORD.
translation: Ol pipel i go aut na bai ol pilim iet bilong Aramia. Na em i kamap olsem tok bilong Bikpela, wan seah bilong ka moningi i sell long wan sikil, na tu seah bilong barli i sell long wan sikil.

original: Now the king had appointed the officer on whose arm he leaned to be in charge of the gate, but the people trampled him in the gateway, and he died, just as the man of God had foretold when the king had come to him.
translation: Nau king i apoinim ofisa we i stap long arm bilong em olsem bikman long lukautim gate, tasol ol pikinini i kisim em i go daun long ente bilong ples, na em i dai pinis, olsem man bilong God i tok bipo long king wen i go kam long em.

original: It happened just as the man of God had told the king: “About this time tomorrow at the gate of Samaria, two seahs of barley will sell for a shekel, and a seah of fine flour will sell for a shekel.”
translation: Em i kamap olsem ol man bilong God i tokim king: "Bai tumora long taem na long gate bilong Samaria, tu seahs bilong barli bai sel bembe long wanpela sikil, na wanpela seah bilong flauer finis bai sel bembe long wanpela sikil."

original: And the officer had answered the man of God, “Look, even if the LORD were to make windows in heaven, could this really happen?” So Elisha had replied, “You will see it with your own eyes, but you will not eat any of it!”
translation: Na ofisa em i ansa man bilong God olsem, “Lukim, tasol Papa bilong yumiyumi ibin meim winos long heven, inap dispela kamap bikos?” Na Elisha em i tok bek olsem, “Yu ken lukim olsem wanem long ai bilong yu, tasol yu no ken kaikai.”

original: And that is just what happened to him. The people trampled him in the gateway, and he died.
translation: Na olgeta samting ol i bin kam long en olsem. Ol pipol i kalapim em long ges bilong ples, na em i dai pinis.

original: Now Elisha had said to the woman whose son he had restored to life, “Arise, you and your household; go and live as a foreigner wherever you can. For the LORD has decreed a seven-year famine, and it has already come to the land.”
translation: Elisha i tokim meri husat i kam bek gen long laip olsem, "Kam daun, yu na hous poro bilong yu; go na stap long kantri bilong narapela we yu likim. Bikos LORD i makim desisien long famin blong yia sewen, na dispela famin i kam pinis long graun."

original: So the woman had proceeded to do as the man of God had instructed. And she and her household lived as foreigners for seven years in the land of the Philistines.
translation: Meri i go duim olsem man bilong God i tokim. Na meri wantaim husband na pikinini bilong em, oli stap long ples bilong Filistia, long taim seven yia, olsem ol man i stap long kantri bilong en.

original: At the end of seven years, when the woman returned from the land of the Philistines, she went to the king to appeal for her house and her land.
translation: Bihaen long wik seven, wanpela meri i kam bek long kantri bilong Filistia, na em i go long king igo bekim tok long haus na graun bilong em.

original: Now the king had been speaking to Gehazi, the servant of the man of God, saying, “Please relate to me all the great things Elisha has done.”
translation: King i bin tokim Gehazi, hauz boi bilong man bilong God, olsem: "Tokim mi, ol bikpela samting Elisha i mekim."

original: And Gehazi was telling the king how Elisha had brought the dead back to life. Just then the woman whose son Elisha had revived came to appeal to the king for her house and her land. So Gehazi said, “My lord the king, this is the woman, and this is the son Elisha restored to life.”
translation: Na Gehazi i tokim king olsem Elisha i bringim bek ol dai long laip. Olsem taim, meri husat i pikinini Elisha i wokim i laip gen i kam bai go long king askim help long as ples na graun bilong em. Na Gehazi i tokim king, "Papa king, meri ia, na dispela ia pikinini Elisha i wokim i laip gen."

original: When the king asked the woman, she confirmed it. So the king appointed for her an officer, saying, “Restore all that was hers, along with all the proceeds of the field from the day that she left the country until now.”
translation: Taim king i askim meri, na meri i tok strongim. Olsem king i appointim ofisa wan long en, i mekim tok: “Givim bek olgeta samting bilong en, longol save na moni bilong gras bilong planim, stat long dei em i go lfts kantri, kam lukim nau.”

original: Then Elisha came to Damascus while Ben-hadad king of Aram was sick, and the king was told, “The man of God has come here.”
translation: Na Elisha i kam long Damascus wail Ben-hadad king bilong Aram i sik, na king i save ol, “Man bilong God i kam hia.”

original: So the king said to Hazael, “Take a gift in your hand, go to meet the man of God, and inquire of the LORD through him, ‘Will I recover from this illness?’”
translation: King i tokim Hazael, "Kisim samting bilong givim i go long han bilong yu, go kam bek long man bilong God, na askim LORD bai hem i tok olsem long em, 'Bai mi strong i kam bek gen long dispela sik?'""

original: So Hazael went to meet Elisha, taking with him a gift of forty camel loads of every good thing from Damascus. And he went in and stood before him and said, “Your son Ben-hadad king of Aram has sent me to ask, ‘Will I recover from this illness?’”
translation: Na Hazael i go kam bekim Elisha, na i kisim gif long han bilong en, em i 40 karamap bilong kemel, ol samting gud long Damascus. Na i go insait na stana belos long em, na i tok, "Pit bilong yu, Ben-hadad king bilong Aram, i sendim mi kam bekim yu, bai askim olsem, 'Mi bai gat beter long dispela sik bilong mi?'".

original: Elisha answered, “Go and tell him, ‘You will surely recover.’ But the LORD has shown me that in fact he will die.”
translation: Elisha i tokim, “Go na toktok long em, ‘Yu mas kamap strong gen.’” Tasol LORD i mekim klia long ai, em bai i dai.

original: Elisha fixed his gaze steadily on him until Hazael became uncomfortable. Then the man of God began to weep.
translation: Elisha i stap luk strong olsem long em, na Hazael i kamap nating long hed. Olsem na, man bilong God i stat kry.

original: “Why is my lord weeping?” asked Hazael. “Because I know the evil you will do to the Israelites,” Elisha replied. “You will set fire to their fortresses, kill their young men with the sword, dash their little ones to pieces, and rip open their pregnant women.”
translation: “Bilong wanem papa bilong mi i kisim traebil?” Hazael i askim. “Mi save olgeta ken i bai yu mekim,” Elisha i tok. “Yu mas lusim faia long haus bilong Ol Israel, yu mas kilim ol manmeri yangpela long sop, yu mas pukim ol pikinini i go antap long graun, na yu mas kirapim bel bilong ol meri i go long susu.”

original: “But how could your servant, a mere dog, do such a monstrous thing?” said Hazael. And Elisha answered, “The LORD has shown me that you will be king over Aram.”
translation: “Bai olsem wanem servant bilong yu, nambis dok, inu mekim kain samting nogut olsem?” Hazael i tok. Na Elisha i ansa, “LORD i shoo mimas olsem yu bai kamap king bilong Aram.”

original: So Hazael left Elisha and went to his master, who asked him, “What did Elisha say to you?” And he replied, “He told me that you would surely recover.”
translation: Na Hazael i lusim Elisha na i go bek long maser blong em, na maser blong en i askim em olsem, "Elisha i tok wetem yu olsem wanem?" Na em i givim bek toktok blong Elisha, "Em i tok olsem yu truly kamap gen."

original: But the next day Hazael took a thick cloth, dipped it in water, and spread it over the king’s face. So Ben-hadad died, and Hazael reigned in his place.
translation: Bikos dia nambawan dei, Hazael i kisim klos bik, ol i kilim long wara, na ol i stapim long pes bilong king. Na Ben-hadad i dai, na Hazael i bos ol long ples bilong en, tainim kantri.

original: In the fifth year of the reign of Joram son of Ahab over Israel, Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat succeeded his father as king of Judah.
translation: Long namba faiv yia bilong rein bilong Joram, we em i pikinini bilong Ahab, king bilong Israel, Jehoram, we em i pikinini bilong Jehoshaphat, i sindaun long ples bilong papa bilong en na i kam king bilong Judah.

original: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years.
translation: Jehoram em thirty-two yia na em i kamap king, na em i rain king long Jerusalem eight yia.

original: And Jehoram walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had done. For he married a daughter of Ahab and did evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Na Jehoram i go long rot bilong king bilong Israel, olsem nau haus bilong Ahab i mekim. Bikos em i mari meri bilong Ahab na ol i mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: Yet for the sake of His servant David, the LORD was unwilling to destroy Judah, since He had promised to maintain a lamp for David and his descendants forever.
translation: Long olsem LORD i no bin wanbel kolim dai Juda, bikos em i promis long Daudi wokman bilong en, long lukautim lait bilong lamp long en na long ol desenden bilong en foreva.

original: In the days of Jehoram, Edom rebelled against the hand of Judah and appointed their own king.
translation: Long taim bilong Jehorama, Edom i bagarap long han bilong Yuda na ol i chusim chief bilong ol yet.

original: So Jehoram crossed over to Zair with all his chariots. When the Edomites surrounded him and his chariot commanders, he rose up and attacked by night. His troops, however, fled to their homes.
translation: Na Jehoram i go pinis long Zair wantaim ol ka bilong pait. Ol Pipol Edom i kam ronnda em na Ol Kepena bilong Ka, em i kamap strong na winim ol long nait. Tasol, ol soljia bilong en i ranawe i go bek long hus.

original: So to this day Edom has been in rebellion against the hand of Judah. Likewise, Libnah rebelled at the same time.
translation: Na todei yet, Edom i stap long kaikai bilong pait bilong Juda. Olsem nem, Libnah i go long kaikai bilong pait long taim olsem.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoram, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Jehoram, longol na ol bikpela wok em i mekim, i no bin writim long buk bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Judah?

original: And Jehoram rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David. And his son Ahaziah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehoram i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i kisim en i go biruaim em long siti bilong Daud. Na sut bilong en Ahaziah i kam bek na i bos ol.

original: In the twelfth year of the reign of Joram son of Ahab over Israel, Ahaziah son of Jehoram became king of Judah.
translation: Long yia twelv bilong paitim pinis long taim bilong rain bilong Joram, man bilong Ahab, i kamap king bilong Israel, Ahaziah, man bilong Jehoram, i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem one year. His mother’s name was Athaliah, the granddaughter of Omri king of Israel.
translation: Ahaziah i 22 yia nau, taim em i kamap king, na em i rul long Jerusalem wanpela yia tasol. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Athaliah, nambawan doti bilong Omri king bilong Israel.

original: And Ahaziah walked in the ways of the house of Ahab and did evil in the sight of the LORD like the house of Ahab, for he was a son-in-law of the house of Ahab.
translation: Na Ahaziah i go long rot bilong haus bilong Ahab na i mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD olsem haus bilong Ahab, bikos em i man bilong meri bilong haus bilong Ahab.

original: Then Ahaziah went with Joram son of Ahab to fight against Hazael king of Aram at Ramoth-gilead, and the Arameans wounded Joram.
translation: Na Ahaziah i go wantaim Joram, pikinini bilong Ahab, long fight gen Hazael, king bilong Aram, long Ramoth-gilead, na Arameans i kisim Joram i kisim wound.

original: So King Joram returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds that the Arameans had inflicted on him at Ramah when he fought against Hazael king of Aram. Then Ahaziah son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to Jezreel to visit Joram son of Ahab, because Joram had been wounded.
translation: King Joram i go bek long Jezreel bilong rekova from ol wund we Aramea i givim em long Ramah when em i fait against Hazael king bilong Aram. Ahaziah pikinini bilong Jehoram king bilong Judah i go daun long Jezreel bilong visitim Joram pikinini bilong Ahab, bikos Joram i bin wundet.

original: Now Elisha the prophet summoned one of the sons of the prophets and said to him, “Tuck your cloak under your belt, take this flask of oil, and go to Ramoth-gilead.
translation: Nau Elisha profet i kisim wanpela bilong ol pikinini profet, i bekim em, “Pusim kot bilong yu aninit long bel bilong yu, kisim dispela flak bilong oil, na go long Ramot-Gilead.”

original: When you arrive, look for Jehu son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi. Go in, get him away from his companions, and take him to an inner room.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kam, lukim Jehu, pikinini bilong Jehoshaphat, pikinini bilong Nimshi. Bekim em i go wanpela pes long en, kisim em i go long rum insait.

original: Then take the flask of oil, pour it on his head, and declare, ‘This is what the LORD says: I anoint you king over Israel.’ Then open the door and run. Do not delay!”
translation: Kisim flak bilong oil, putim i go antap long hed bilong em, tokaut, ‘Dispela em i tok bilong Bikpela: Mi givim yu mark bilong king olsem samting bilong sho, yu bikim King bilong Israel.’ Opim doa na ranawe, harim tok na go bek!

original: So the young prophet went to Ramoth-gilead,
translation: Na poroman bilong God yangpela i go long Ramot-Gilead,

original: and when he arrived, the army commanders were sitting there. “I have a message for you, commander,” he said. “For which of us?” asked Jehu. “For you, commander,” he replied.
translation: Taim em i kam, komandan bilong army ol i sit daun yet. "Mi gat tok save long yu," em i tok. "Husat bilong mipela i go hed long dispela?" Jehu i askim. "Yu, komandan," em i bekim.

original: So Jehu got up and went into the house, where the young prophet poured the oil on his head and declared, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I anoint you king over the LORD’s people Israel.
translation: Na Jehu em i kam bek long graun na i go insait long haus, na yung prophet i kilim olsen oi ponpela hed bilong em olsem simbol bilong givim mark bilong spirit, na em i makolim tok: "Dispela em i tok bilong Bikpela, God bilong Israel: 'Mi bai givim yu mark bilong spirit olsem papa bilong kantri Israel.'"

original: And you are to strike down the house of your master Ahab, so that I may avenge the blood of My servants the prophets and the blood of all the servants of the LORD shed by the hand of Jezebel.
translation: Na yu mas kilim haus i go daun bilong Bikpela Ahab, na mi bai bekim rausim blod i spil long prophet ol na wokman bilong LORD ol, ol i bin shedim long han bilong Jezebel.

original: The whole house of Ahab will perish, and I will cut off from Ahab every male, both slave and free, in Israel.
translation: Olgeta haus bilong Ahab bai dai pinis, na mi bai katim ol man husat i stap, husat i wok servant na ol freeman, long Israel.

original: I will make the house of Ahab like the houses of Jeroboam son of Nebat and Baasha son of Ahijah.
translation: Mi bai mekim haus bilong Ahab olsem hus bilong Jeroboam pikinini bilong Nebat na Baasha pikinini bilong Ahijah.

original: And on the plot of ground at Jezreel the dogs will devour Jezebel, and there will be no one to bury her.’” Then the young prophet opened the door and ran.
translation: Na long graun bilong Jezreel, dok na bai kaikai Jezebel, na nogat sampela man i go wapim em. Yongpela propet i opim doa na ran.

original: When Jehu went out to the servants of his master, they asked, “Is everything all right? Why did this madman come to you?” “You know his kind and their babble,” he replied.
translation: Wanpela taim Jehu i go aut long servant bilong papa bilong em, ol i askim, "Olgeta orait? Wanem makawa i kam bekim yu?" Em i tok, "Yu save laik bilong em na tok bokis bilong ol."

original: “That is a lie!” they said. “Tell us now!” So Jehu answered, “He talked to me about this and that, and he said, ‘This is what the LORD says: I anoint you king over Israel.’”
translation: “Em i no tru!” ol i tokim. “Tokim mipela nau!” Jehu i bekim, “Em i tokim mi long dispela na dispela, na em i tokim, ‘Bikpela bilong mipela i tok olsem: Mi amanai yu king bilong Israel.’”

original: Quickly, each man took his garment and put it under Jehu on the bare steps. Then they blew the ram’s horn and proclaimed, “Jehu is king!”
translation: Ol man i kisim rausim bilong ol, ol i putim aninit long Jehu long steplong ol i no katim gras. Ol i bulimapim horn bilong ram, na ol i autim olsem: "Jehu em i king!"

original: Thus Jehu son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi, conspired against Joram. (Now Joram and all Israel had been defending Ramoth-gilead against Hazael king of Aram,
translation: Olsem Jehu sone bilong Jehoshaphat, sone bilong Nimshi, i mekim birua long Joram. (Joram na ol Israel olgeta i stap difenda Ramoth-gilead long Hazael king bilong Aram,)

original: but King Joram had returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds he had suffered at the hands of the Arameans in the battle against Hazael their king.) So Jehu said, “If you commanders wish to make me king, then do not let anyone escape from the city to go and tell it in Jezreel.”
translation: Bipo King Joram i go bek long Jezreel i kam bek long rekova from ol wund he sufal long han bilong Ol Aramean long fait bilong toktok em i mekim wantaim Hazael king bilong Ol Aramean. Jehu i tok, “Yu ol kapten laik mekim mi papa bilong kantri, orait no let i go wai, make ol i dai from siiti go tokim ol long Jezreel.”

original: Then Jehu got into his chariot and went to Jezreel, because Joram was laid up there and Ahaziah king of Judah had gone down to see him.
translation: Na Jehu i go insait long karjet bilong en, na i go long Jezreel, bikos Joram i slip na em i no inap kam, na Ahaziah king bilong Judah i go daun bekim em.

original: Now the watchman standing on the tower in Jezreel saw Jehu’s troops approaching, and he called out, “I see a company of troops!” “Choose a rider,” Joram commanded. “Send him out to meet them and ask, ‘Have you come in peace?’”
translation: Nau wachman i stap long taowa long Jezreel i lukim ol solja bilong Jehu i kam, na em i singaut, 'Mi lukim ol solja i kam!' "Pikim wan rider," Joram i komanda. "Sendim i go mitim ol na askim, 'Yupela i kam long peis?'"

original: So a horseman rode off to meet Jehu and said, “This is what the king asks: ‘Have you come in peace?’” “What do you know about peace?” Jehu replied. “Fall in behind me.” And the watchman reported, “The messenger reached them, but he is not coming back.”
translation: Na wanpela man i raisim hors i go dai pinis long mekim Jehu, na em i tokim Jehu olsem: "King i askim: 'Yu kam bek long pis?'" Jehu i tokim em gen olsem: "Yu save long pikinini bilong pes?" "Yu bihain mi." Na wachman i ritopim olsem: "Mesenja i go pinis, tasol em i no kam bek gen."

original: So the king sent out a second horseman, who went to them and said, “This is what the king asks: ‘Have you come in peace?’” “What do you know about peace?” Jehu replied. “Fall in behind me.”
translation: King i sendim hap ranim man namba tu, em i go bek long ol, tokim ol: "Dispela em i tok bilong king: 'Yupela i kam long peis?'” Jehu i tokim: "Yupela save long dispela peis? Bihaenim mi."

original: Again the watchman reported, “He reached them, but he is not coming back. And the charioteer is driving like Jehu son of Nimshi—he is driving like a madman!”
translation: Wachman i ripot gen, "Em i kamap long ol, tasol em i no kam bek. Na draiva bilong kar i driva olsem Jehu sussa Nimshi - em i driva olsem man bilong ken!"

original: “Harness!” Joram shouted, and they harnessed his chariot. Then Joram king of Israel and Ahaziah king of Judah set out, each in his own chariot, and met Jehu on the property of Naboth the Jezreelite.
translation: “Hamamasim!” Joram i kisim bek long kar jet bilong en, na em i go. Na Joram king bilong Israel na Ahaziah king bilong Judah i go wankain, ol i bin kamaksim Jehu long grasn bilong Naboth Jezreelite.

original: When Joram saw Jehu, he asked, “Have you come in peace, Jehu?” “How can there be peace,” he replied, “as long as the idolatry and witchcraft of your mother Jezebel abound?”
translation: Taim Joram siusim Jehu, em askim, “Yu kam na kam long pis, Jehu?” “Olsem long olsem i no inap long pis,” em tok bek, “long taim sikir bilong idol na wok bilong wizard bilong mama yu Jezebel i stap yet.”

original: Joram turned around and fled, calling out to Ahaziah, “Treachery, Ahaziah!”
translation: Joram i turnim bek na ranawe, i singautim Ahazia, “Bikhet, Ahazia!”

original: Then Jehu drew his bow and shot Joram between the shoulders. The arrow pierced his heart, and he slumped down in his chariot.
translation: Jehu kam long stretim em i paitim banar, na em i paitim Joram long bikos. Banar i go insait long het bilong en, na em i sindaun i go daun long kar.

original: And Jehu said to Bidkar his officer, “Pick him up and throw him into the field of Naboth the Jezreelite. For remember that when you and I were riding together behind his father Ahab, the LORD lifted up this burden against him:
translation: Na Jehu i tokim Bidkar ofisa bilong em, “Kisim i go na putim i daun long ples Naboth Jezreelite. Bikos yumi mas remember we i go wankain baiha long bihain long papa bilong em Ahab, LORD i kisim up dispela het bilong en long em.”

original: ‘As surely as I saw the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons yesterday, declares the LORD, so will I repay you on this plot of ground, declares the LORD.’ Now then, according to the word of the LORD, pick him up and throw him on the plot of ground.”
translation: Olsem mi laik bilong mi see ded bilong Nabot na ded bilong pikinini bilong em asde, LORD i tok olsem, na mi bai pem bek long yu long pe bilong graun dispela, LORD i tok olsem. Nau, long hap bilong tok bilong LORD, kisim i go na tromwe i go long pe bilong graun.

original: When King Ahaziah of Judah saw this, he fled up the road toward Beth-haggan. And Jehu pursued him, shouting, “Shoot him too!” So they shot Ahaziah in his chariot on the Ascent of Gur, near Ibleam, and he fled to Megiddo and died there.
translation: Taim King Ahaziah bilong Yuda si dispela, em i ran i go long rot bilong Beth-haggan. Na Jehu i go bekim em, em i singaut, “Katim em tu!” Ol i kilim Ahaziah long kar bilong en long Asensin bilong Gur, klostu long Ibleam, na em i ran i go long Megiddo na em i dai tepela.

original: Then his servants carried him by chariot to Jerusalem and buried him with his fathers in his tomb in the City of David.
translation: Na sai sipsipman bilong em i kisim em long kareta i go, tasol ol i kisim em i go long Jerusalem na tubunasim em wantaim tumbuna bilong en long hol bilong dai long Siti bilong Dauid.

original: (In the eleventh year of Joram son of Ahab, Ahaziah had become king over Judah.)
translation: Long eleben yia bilong rein bilong Joram sussa bilong Ahab, Ahaziah i kamap king long Judah.

original: Now when Jehu arrived in Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it. So she painted her eyes, adorned her head, and looked down from a window.
translation: Wanpela taim Jehu i kamap long Jezreel, Jezebel i harim tok bilong em. Olsem na em i mekim grubu long ai bilong en, i dressim hed bilong en, na i lukudown from windoa.

original: And as Jehu entered the gate, she asked, “Have you come in peace, O Zimri, murderer of your master?”
translation: Na Jehu i go insait long gate, na em i askim, “Yu kam long peis, o Zimri, yu i kilim papa bilong yu?”

original: He looked up at the window and called out, “Who is on my side? Who?” And two or three eunuchs looked down at him.
translation: Em i lukup long wino na em i singaut, “Husat i stap long sait bilong mi? Husat?” Na tu o tri ol man husat i no inap mekim bek bek ol i lukdaun long em.

original: “Throw her down!” yelled Jehu. So they threw her down, and her blood splattered on the wall and on the horses as they trampled her underfoot.
translation: “Troweim i daun!” Jehu i singaut. Ol i troweim i daun, na bloo bilong em i spreta ol arere long barier na long hos, na ol i daunim i kileng em.

original: Then Jehu went in and ate and drank. “Take care of this cursed woman,” he said, “and bury her, for she was the daughter of a king.”
translation: Jehu i go insait na kai kai na dring. “Kisim hevi long dispela meri i gat kros,” ol i tok, “na beri em, bikos em i pikinini bilong king.”

original: But when they went out to bury her, they found nothing but her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.
translation: Taim ol i go aut na kisim em, ol i kisim tasol hek bilong em, lek, na palms bilong han bilong em.

original: So they went back and told Jehu, who replied, “This is the word of the LORD, which He spoke through His servant Elijah the Tishbite: ‘On the plot of ground at Jezreel the dogs will devour the flesh of Jezebel.
translation: Ol i go bek long Jehu na toktok, na Jehu i tok, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD, we usai i spik thru servant bilong en Elijah man Tisbit: 'Long graun bilong Jezreel, dok na bai kaikaim bodi bilong Jezebel.'"

original: And Jezebel’s body will lie like dung in the field on the plot of ground at Jezreel, so that no one can say: This is Jezebel.’”
translation: Bodi bilong Jezebel bai i stap olsem kaikai bilong dok long graun long ples Jezreel, na nobody bai inap tok: Em Jezebel.’”

original: Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. So Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria to the officials of Jezreel, to the elders, and to the guardians of the sons of Ahab, saying:
translation: Nau Ahab i gat seventy pikinini long Samaria. Jehu raitim leta na sendim ol go long Samaria, long ofisa bilong Jezreel, long bikman, na long lida bilong ol pikinini bilong Ahab, olsem:

original: “When this letter arrives, since your master’s sons are with you and you have chariots and horses, a fortified city and weaponry,
translation: Wanpela leta i go kam, long tok bilong pikinini bilong papa ol i stap wantaim yu, na yu gat kareta na hos, na taun bung imi strong na yu gat planti samting bilong pai,

original: select the best and most worthy son of your master, set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.”
translation: Bihainim pinis na skelim pinis pikinini i gat gutpela na wail tasol, plantim em long thrown bilong papa bilong em, na pairapim hous bilong bos bilong yu.

original: But they were terrified and reasoned, “If two kings could not stand against him, how can we?”
translation: Ol i stap wet long fear na ol i tok stret long ol yet, “Tupela papa bilong yumi no inap holim bek againstim em, orait yumui yet bai inap holim bek long em?”

original: So the palace administrator, the overseer of the city, the elders, and the guardians sent a message to Jehu: “We are your servants, and we will do whatever you say. We will not make anyone king. Do whatever is good in your sight.”
translation: Manejaman bilong haus kibung, bos bilong siti, ol bikpela i wok long kantri, na ol i lukautim pipel, ol i ekim tok long Jehu: "Mipela i servist bilong yu, mipela bai mekim olgeta samting olsem yu tok, mipela no go makim narapela man i kam bihain long kingsip. Mipela bai wokim olgeta samting i gut long ai bilong yu."

original: Then Jehu wrote them a second letter and said: “If you are on my side, and if you will obey me, then bring the heads of your master’s sons to me at Jezreel by this time tomorrow.” Now the sons of the king, seventy in all, were being brought up by the leading men of the city.
translation: Jehu raitim leta namba tu bilong ol, ananit long ol: “Yupela i stap long sait bilong mi, na bihain tok bilong mi, orait, kisim hed bilong pikinini bilong bos bilong yu, king, na bringim i kam long mi long Jezreel bifora tude long moning.” Na pikinini bilong king, seventy olgeta, i stap long han bilong ol bikman bilong taun.

original: And when the letter arrived, they took the sons of the king and slaughtered all seventy of them. They put their heads in baskets and sent them to Jehu at Jezreel.
translation: Taim lekta i kamap, ol i kisim pikinini bilong king na ol i kilim ol seventy long ol. Ol i katim hed bilong ol na putim long biket, na salim i go long Jehu long Jezreel.

original: When the messenger arrived, he told Jehu, “They have brought the heads of the sons of the king.” And Jehu ordered, “Pile them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until morning.”
translation: Taim mesija kamap, na em i tokim Jehu, “Oli kisim hed bilong pikinini bilong king i kam.” Na Jehu i givim ordinance, “Pilimapim ol i go long tupela heap long entris bilong gate yet na bai moning.”

original: The next morning, Jehu went out and stood before all the people and said, “You are innocent. It was I who conspired against my master and killed him. But who killed all these?
translation: Bikos kalabus i go antap long moning, Jehu i go aut na i stap bifo olgeta manmeri na i tok, "Yu hamamas, yu no gilti. Mi tasol i mekim plan long paitim na kilim masista bilong mi, tasol bai husat i kilim ol manmeri ol i dai?

original: Know, then, that not a word the LORD has spoken against the house of Ahab will fail, for the LORD has done what He promised through His servant Elijah.”
translation: Yumi save olsem, bikpela LORD i tok olsem, not a wanpela wod bai fail long haus bilong Ahab, Bikpela LORD en i mekim olsem em i promis tumas long wokman Elijah.

original: So Jehu killed everyone in Jezreel who remained of the house of Ahab, as well as all his great men and close friends and priests, leaving him without a single survivor.
translation: Na Jehu i kilim ol manmeri long Jezreel ol i stap yet long haus bilong Ahab, na ol bikman, na ol poroman bilong em, na ol priis, na i livim em without wanpela man husat i stap.

original: Then Jehu set out toward Samaria. At Beth-eked of the Shepherds,
translation: Na Jehu i go kam long Samaria. Long Bet-Eked bilong Pasinda Ol Pipol,

original: Jehu met some relatives of Ahaziah king of Judah and asked, “Who are you?” “We are relatives of Ahaziah,” they answered, “and we have come down to greet the sons of the king and of the queen mother.”
translation: Jehu i kam bek long ol famili bilong Ahaziah king bilong Yuda na em i askim, 'Yu husat?' Ol i ansa, 'Mipela i famili bilong Ahaziah, na mipela i kam daun bilong givim welkam long ol pikinini bilong king na mama queen.'

original: Then Jehu ordered, “Take them alive.” So his men took them alive, then slaughtered them at the well of Beth-eked—forty-two men. He spared none of them.
translation: Na Jehu i tokim ol, "Kisim ol i stap." Ol man bilong em yet i kisim ol na kam, ol i go dai pinis long wara bilong Beth-eked - narapela forty-two man. Em i no lusim wanpela tasol.

original: When he left there, he found Jehonadab son of Rechab, who was coming to meet him. Jehu greeted him and asked, “Is your heart as true to mine as my heart is to yours?” “It is!” Jehonadab replied. “If it is,” said Jehu, “give me your hand.” So he gave him his hand, and Jehu helped him into his chariot,
translation: Taim em i go bek long ples, em i kam Bekim Jehonadab man bilong Rechab, we i kam lukim em. Jehu i go antap long en na em i askim, "Sapos yu bilip olgeta long heart bilong yu olsem na mi bilip olgeta long heart bilong mi?" Jehonadab i se, "Em i tru!" Jehu i tok, "Sapos em i tru, givim mi han bilong yu." Na em i givim han bilong en, na Jehu i helpim em i go insait long kareta.

original: saying, “Come with me and see my zeal for the LORD!” So he had him ride in his chariot.
translation: Tokim, "Kam wantaim mi na lukim pasen blong mi long Toksave bilong LORD!" Na em i givim Jesa for sitdown long kar bilong en.

original: When Jehu came to Samaria, he struck down everyone belonging to Ahab who remained there, until he had destroyed them, according to the word that the LORD had spoken to Elijah.
translation: Jehu i kam long Samaria, na i kilim olgeta man meri bilong Ahab i stap yet, na i winim ol, olsem wod bilong Bikpela i tokim Elijah.

original: Then Jehu brought all the people together and said, “Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will serve him a lot.
translation: Jehu i kam na i tokim olgeta manmeri, "Ahab i sarve Baal liklik, tasol Jehu bai sarve im bikim moa."

original: Now, therefore, summon to me all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests. See that no one is missing, for I have a great sacrifice for Baal. Whoever is missing will not live.” But Jehu was acting deceptively in order to destroy the servants of Baal.
translation: Nau, olsem na, kisim olgeta propet bilong Baal, ol wokman bilong en, na ol padi bilong en, i kam long me. Lukim olsem nogat wan man i missim, bikos mi gat bikpela sakris pinis long Baal. Husat i missim, em bai i no laip. Tasol Jehu i wok long tingim ol, olsem na em i bin planim long bagarapim ol wokman bilong Baal.

original: And Jehu commanded, “Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal.” So they announced it.
translation: Na Jehu i tok, "Ol i mas kukim bikpela toktok long Baal." Na ol i kirapim tok bilong em.

original: Then Jehu sent word throughout Israel, and all the servants of Baal came; there was not a man who failed to show. They entered the temple of Baal, and it was filled from end to end.
translation: Na Jehu baim tok long olgeta hap bilong Isrel, na ol i stap wok long Baal i kam, nasel man no bin missim. Ol i go insait long haus lotu bilong Baal, na emi fulap long olgeta hap.

original: And Jehu said to the keeper of the wardrobe, “Bring out garments for all the servants of Baal.” So he brought out garments for them.
translation: Na Jehu i tokim dispela man i lukautim klos, “Kisim olt kleit i kam long ol servent bilong Baal olgeta.” Na em i kisim olt kleit i kam long ol.

original: Next, Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rechab entered the temple of Baal, and Jehu said to the servants of Baal, “Look around to see that there are no servants of the LORD here among you—only servants of Baal.”
translation: Nek bai Jehu na Jehonadab man bilong Rechab i go insait long haus baal, na Jehu i tokim ol iubil bilong Baal, “Kam lukluk olsem igat narapela hansen bilong LORD i stap hia ibmong yu – em tasol hansen bilong Baal.”

original: And they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had stationed eighty men outside and warned them, “If anyone allows one of the men I am delivering into your hands to escape, he will forfeit his life for theirs.”
translation: Na ol i go insait long tebol na makin sakrifis na ofa sakrifis we i burn olgeta. Na Jehu em i stapim eighty man ol i stap ausait, na em i givim warnin long ol: “Yumi no inap lusim wanpela man na em i ranawe, nau laip bilong yu bai i go daun olsem laip bilong em, i lusim laip bilong yu na tekem laip bilong ol, bikos ol i stap long han bilong yu.”

original: When he had finished making the burnt offering, Jehu said to the guards and officers, “Go in and kill them. Do not let anyone out.” So the guards and officers put them to the sword, threw the bodies out, and went into the inner room of the temple of Baal.
translation: Taim em i finisim mekim ofing bilong bun, Jehu i tokim ka na solju na ofisa, “Go insait na kilim ol. No let impas long eni man.” Na ka na solju na ofisa i meekim ol i dai long swod, troim bodi ol i go aut, na i go insait long rum bilong temple Baal.

original: They brought out the sacred pillar of the temple of Baal and burned it.
translation: Ol i kisim pila bilong spirut long haus lotu bilong Baal na ol i burnim.

original: They also demolished the sacred pillar of Baal. Then they tore down the temple of Baal and made it into a latrine, which it is to this day.
translation: Ol i krashim pilia bilong Baal we em i halivim. Ol i pullim daun temple bilong Baal, na ol i mekim em i go long toilet, na em i stap olsem yet inap long tude.

original: Thus Jehu eradicated Baal from Israel,
translation: Olsem na Jehu im kamautim lotu long Baal long Israel.

original: but he did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit—the worship of the golden calves at Bethel and Dan.
translation: Bareket, em i no lusim pas long sindaun bilong sin ol i mekim long taim bilong Jeroboam sone Nebat, lotu long bulmakau kol long Betel na Dan, we i mekim Israel long sindaun.

original: Nevertheless, the LORD said to Jehu, “Because you have done well in carrying out what is right in My sight and have done to the house of Ahab all that was in My heart, four generations of your sons will sit on the throne of Israel.”
translation: Nogat sem, Ol Mak i tokim Jehu, “Yu mekim gut na yu kisim na wokim ol samting i orait long ai bilong mi, na yu wokim ol samting long het bilong mi long haus bilong Ahab, fourpela genarashon bilong pikinini yu bai sibak long sit bilong Israel.”

original: Yet Jehu was not careful to follow the instruction of the LORD, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na Jehu i no bin pikinimo long bihainim instrksen bilong GOD bilong Israel olgeta insait long spirit bilong en. Em i no lusim bek sin bilong Jeroboam, king bilong Israel, we i mekim Israel wokim.

original: In those days the LORD began to reduce the size of Israel. Hazael defeated the Israelites throughout their territory
translation: Long dispela taim Bikpela i bin kamap redusim Israel i go daun. Hazael i winim Pipol bilong Israel olgets long olgeta ples bilong ol.

original: from the Jordan eastward through all the land of Gilead (the region of Gad, Reuben, and Manasseh), and from Aroer by the Arnon Valley through Gilead to Bashan.
translation: Long Jordan i go insait long east sait, olgeta hap graun bilong Gilead, em i bikosim ol ples bilong Gad, Reuben, na Manasseh, na stat long Aroer aninit long Arnon Valley, i go olsem olsem long Gilead na kamap long Bashan.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehu, along with all his accomplishments and all his might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Olgeta samting na wok bilong Jehu, longol na ol narapela strongpela wok em i mekim, i writim yet long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong Kings bilong Israel.

original: And Jehu rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria, and his son Jehoahaz reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehu i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, ol i bikim graun long em long Samaria, na susa bilong en Jehoahaz i kam bek long ples bilong en, i bos bilong en.

original: So the duration of Jehu’s reign over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.
translation: Na taim bilong paitim Jehu i bin king long Israel, long Samaria, em i go long tenpela eight yia.

original: When Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she proceeded to annihilate all the royal heirs.
translation: Taim Athaliah mama bilong Ahaziah harim ol i dai pinis, em bai go long bekim olgets pikinini bilong king, na kilim ol.

original: But Jehosheba daughter of King Joram, the sister of Ahaziah, took Joash son of Ahaziah and stole him away from among the sons of the king who were being murdered. She put him and his nurse in a bedroom to hide him from Athaliah, and he was not killed.
translation: Na Jehosheba, Pikinini Meri bilong King Joram, Susa bilong Ahaziah, tokm ol i kisim Joash, Pikinini bilong Ahaziah na pilim em i go long ol pikinini bilong king ol i paitim ol. Ol i putim em na nus bilong em insait long rum bilong slip na pilim em i stap, bikos Jehosheba wanpela i skelim Athaliah tasol, na Joash i no dai.

original: And Joash remained hidden with his nurse in the house of the LORD for six years while Athaliah ruled the land.
translation: Na Joash i stap hiden yet wantaim nus bilong em long haus bilong LORD olsem sikis yia, wail Athaliah i bosim kantri.

original: Then in the seventh year, Jehoiada sent for the commanders of hundreds, the Carites, and the guards, and had them brought into the house of the LORD. There he made a covenant with them and put them under oath. He showed them the king’s son
translation: Long long seven yia igo, Jehoiada em i send kot long komanda bilong hundred, Kareti, na gaad, na ol i kam insait long haus bilong LORD. Em i wokim kovenant wantaim ol, na ol i mekim pinis pramis long ol yet. Em i showim ol pikinini bilong king.

original: and commanded them, “This is what you are to do: A third of you who come on duty on the Sabbath shall guard the royal palace,
translation: Em i givim ol instruksin, "Dispela em i wanem yu mas mekim: Tripela hap bilong yumi husat i kom inap long wok long Sade, yumi mas pikinimi pikinimhaus bilong king,

original: a third shall be at the gate of Sur, and a third at the gate behind the guards. You are to take turns guarding the temple—
translation: Wanpela tausen i go long gate bilong Sur, na wanpela tausen i go behain long ol poloismen. Yusim wok abrus kaikim haus lotu —

original: the two divisions that would go off duty on the Sabbath are to guard the house of the LORD for the king.
translation: Tu hap bilong ol i go pinis wok long Sabat, oli mas kisim bek long haus bilong LORD bilong king.

original: You must surround the king with weapons in hand, and anyone who approaches the ranks must be put to death. You must stay close to the king wherever he goes.”
translation: Yu mas kambek long king wantaim wpn long han, na husat i kam bek long lain, yu mas kilim ol. Yu mas stap klos long king bilong yumi we i go nau.

original: So the commanders of hundreds did everything that Jehoiada the priest had ordered. Each of them took his men—those coming on duty on the Sabbath and those going off duty—and came to Jehoiada the priest.
translation: Na kaptin bilong hundred ol i mekim olgeta samting em Jehoiada pries i givim tok. Ol i kisim solja bilong ol yet, ol i kam wok long de bilong Sabat na ol i go pinis wok, na ol i kam bek long Jehoiada pries.

original: Then the priest gave to the commanders of hundreds the spears and shields of King David from the house of the LORD.
translation: Na prist i givim spia na sild bilong King Davit long ol bos bilong hundred, ol samting em i kam from haus bilong LORD.

original: And the guards stood with weapons in hand surrounding the king by the altar and the temple, from the south side to the north side of the temple.
translation: Na gaad i stap wantaim pinis long han, ol i kamautim bihain long alta na haus lotu, stat long sait south go long sait not.

original: Then Jehoiada brought out the king’s son, put the crown on him, presented him with the Testimony, and proclaimed him king. They anointed him, and the people clapped their hands and declared, “Long live the king!”
translation: Na Jehoiada i kamautim pikinini bilong king, i putim kraun long hed bilong em, i givim em Testameni, na i talem olgeta long em olsem king. Ol i givim em oili bilong Holy Spirit, ol i kilim han bilong ol, na ol i talem, "King i stap, em i liv!"

original: When Athaliah heard the noise from the guards and the people, she went out to the people in the house of the LORD.
translation: Taim Athaliah harim tok bilong kaibilong solwara na ol pipol, em i go aut long ol pipol long haus bilong Jehovah.

original: And she looked out and saw the king standing by the pillar, according to the custom. The officers and trumpeters were beside the king, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets. Then Athaliah tore her clothes and screamed, “Treason! Treason!”
translation: Na em i lukim na si king i stap klostu long pila, ol i bihainim kastom. Ofisa na trumpeta i stap besait long king, na ol pipol bilong kantri i hamamas na bulimapim trumpeta. Athaliah i rausim klos na i singaut, “Tret! Tret!”

original: And Jehoiada the priest ordered the commanders of hundreds in charge of the army, “Bring her out between the ranks, and put to the sword anyone who follows her.” For the priest had said, “She must not be put to death in the house of the LORD.”
translation: Na Jehoiada pris i ordaim komanda bilong hundred em i kolim komanda, “Kisim na kamlautim i go long bikos, long ol samting, na olsem wanpela man i bihainim em, i kirapim olsem wanpela man i dai.” Nogat, pris i tok olsem, “No ken givim em i dai insait long haus bilong Jehovah.”

original: So they seized Athaliah as she reached the horses’ entrance to the palace grounds, and there she was put to death.
translation: Tupela i tainim Athaliah olsem em i kamap long entris bilong hos insait long graun bilong haus kiak, na bai ol i kirap em.

original: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD and the king and the people that they would be the LORD’s people. He also made a covenant between the king and the people.
translation: Na Jehoiada i wokim pinis bikpela tupela hap long hap bilong GOD na king na piple, olsem na piple bai i kamap ol piple bilong GOD. Na i wokim tu bipela tupela hap long king na piple.

original: So all the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and tore it down. They smashed the altars and idols to pieces, and they killed Mattan the priest of Baal in front of the altars. And Jehoiada the priest posted guards for the house of the LORD.
translation: Ol pipol bilong kantri i go long haus lotu bilong Baal na ol i kilim Haus lotu bilong Baal. Ol i brokam altas na idols long hap, na ol i kilim Mattan pries bilong Baal long sait bilong altas. Na Jehoiada pries i putim gard long haus bilong LORD.

original: He took with him the commanders of hundreds, the Carites, the guards, and all the people of the land, and they brought the king down from the house of the LORD and entered the royal palace by way of the Gate of the Guards. Then Joash took his seat on the royal throne,
translation: Em i kisim komanda bilong hundret wantaim em, Kari, na ol Gadi, na ol pipel bilong kantri, na ol i kam doun king long haus bilong LORD na i go insait long haus bilong king olsem na inap long Gat bilong Gadi. Na Joash i siddown long throne bilong king.

original: and all the people of the land rejoiced. And the city was quiet, because Athaliah had been put to the sword at the royal palace.
translation: Na ol pipel bilong kantri i hamamas. Na siti i stap quiet, bikos Athaliah im bin go daun long sop insait long haus bilong king.

original: Joash was seven years old when he became king.
translation: Joash em i seven yia olsem em i kamap king.

original: In the seventh year of Jehu, Joash became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother’s name was Zibiah; she was from Beersheba.
translation: Long seventh yia bilong Jehu, Joash i kamap king, na em i bihainim Jerusalem fourti yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Zibiah; em i kam long Beersheba.

original: And Joash did what was right in the eyes of the LORD all the days he was instructed by Jehoiada the priest.
translation: Na Joash i mekim ol samting i stap gut long ai bilong Jehovah ol dei em i bin lernim na Jehoiada pris i bin skulim em.

original: Nevertheless, the high places were not removed; the people continued sacrificing and burning incense there.
translation: Nem mindua, ol ples hait i no go daun; ol pipel i kontinu long givim sakrifis na bren incense long hap.

original: Then Joash said to the priests, “Collect all the money brought as sacred gifts into the house of the LORD—the census money, the money from vows, and the money brought voluntarily into the house of the LORD.
translation: Na Joash i tokim pris ol, "Kamdaonim olgeta moni ol i bringim olsem gift bilong God i go insait long haus bilong LORD - moni bilong kaunsil, moni bilong prena, na moni ol i laikim yet i go insait long haus bilong LORD."

original: Let every priest receive it from his constituency, and let it be used to repair any damage found in the temple.”
translation: Ol prist i go ken receiveim long distrik bilong ol, na usim moni bilong fixim ol kros long haus lotu.

original: By the twenty-third year of the reign of Joash, however, the priests had not yet repaired the damage to the temple.
translation: Long yia twenty-three bilong paitim king Yoas, pris i no bin repare yet ol bagarap long haus lotu.

original: So King Joash called Jehoiada and the other priests and said, “Why have you not repaired the damage to the temple? Now, therefore, take no more money from your constituency, but hand it over for the repair of the temple.”
translation: King Joash i kolim Jehoiada na ol lida lotu na tokim ol, "Wai yumi no fixim ol bagarap long haos lotu?" Nau, inap long moni kam bek long ol pipol bilong yu, tasol givim moni go long wokim haos lotu i gut.

original: So the priests agreed that they would not receive money from the people and that they would not repair the temple themselves.
translation: Ol priests i tok olsem bai ol no ken kisim moni long ol pipo na bai ol no ken beten haus lotu yet.

original: Then Jehoiada the priest took a chest, bored a hole in its lid, and set it beside the altar on the right side as one enters the house of the LORD. There the priests who guarded the threshold put all the money brought into the house of the LORD.
translation: Na Jehoiada prist i kisim wanpela bokis, ol i borim hol long het bilong en, na ol i putim besaid altan long sait rait bilong entring haus bilong LORD. Ol prist i lukaut long plen gras bilong haus, ol i putim ol moni i kam long haus bilong LORD insait bokis.

original: Whenever they saw that there was a large amount of money in the chest, the royal scribe and the high priest would go up, count the money brought into the house of the LORD, and tie it up in bags.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i si planti moni i stap, raita bilong king na prist bilong bikpela i go ap, ol i kauntim moni i kam insait long haus bilong LORD, na ol i binim em i go insait long bag.

original: Then they would put the counted money into the hands of those who supervised the work on the house of the LORD, who in turn would pay those doing the work—the carpenters, builders,
translation: Tisa ol i putim moni i kam long kaun long han bilong ol i lukautim wok long haus bilong LORD, na ol i peim ol i wok - karpenta, bildera.

original: masons, and stonecutters. They also purchased timber and dressed stone to repair the damage to the house of the LORD, and they paid the other expenses of the temple repairs.
translation: Olgeta wokman na karamapim ston, ol hamamas long raitim ol bagarap long haus bilong Jehovah. Ol i go bekim timba na ston i dressim pinis long repotim haus temple, na ol i peim ol narakain kost bilong wokim repot.

original: However, the money brought into the house of the LORD was not used for making silver basins, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, trumpets, or any articles of gold or silver for the house of the LORD.
translation: Tasol, moni i bin bring i go insait long haus bilong LORD, em i no usim long mekim basin bilong silva, ting bung long kisim traipela hap bilong kan, bol bilong sprinklem, trumpet, o samting bilong golde o silva nating long haus bilong LORD.

original: Instead, it was paid to those doing the work, and with it they repaired the house of the LORD.
translation: Longwe olsem, em i pei long ol man i wokim wok, na ol i usim long reparim haus bilong Jehovah.

original: No accounting was required from the men who received the money to pay the workmen, because they acted with integrity.
translation: Ino bin gat akountim i kam long ol man i stap pikinam moni bilong peim wokman, bikos ol i wok wantaim trut moa.

original: The money from the guilt offerings and sin offerings was not brought into the house of the LORD; it belonged to the priests.
translation: Mani bilong ofing bai guilty na ofing bilong sin em i no bin bring long haus bilong Lod; em i bilong pris.

original: At that time Hazael king of Aram marched up and fought against Gath and captured it. Then he decided to attack Jerusalem.
translation: Long taim ia, Hazael king bilong Aram i goap long na paitim gen Gath, na kisim olsem. Olsem na em laik paitim Jerusalem.

original: So King Joash of Judah took all the sacred objects dedicated by his fathers—Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah, the kings of Judah—along with his own consecrated items and all the gold found in the treasuries of the house of the LORD and the royal palace, and he sent them to Hazael king of Aram. So Hazael withdrew from Jerusalem.
translation: King Joash bilong Yuda i kisim ol samting bilong ples kot we papa bilong en - Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, na Ahaziah, ol kings bilong Yuda - i kisim samting bilong em yet na ol geta gold long hause bilong treasury bilong haus bilong LORD na haus bilong king, na i sendim ol i go long Hazael king bilong Aram. Hazael i go bek gen, i lusim Jerusalem.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Joash, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai na olgeta wok Joash i mekim, i no bin writim long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And the servants of Joash rose up and formed a conspiracy and killed him at Beth-millo, on the road down to Silla.
translation: Na sipos bilong Yoas i kamap na go ap, ol i mekim wanpela pilai long tromoi na kilim em long Beth-milo, long rot i go daun i kam liklik long Sila.

original: His servants Jozabad son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shomer struck him down, and he died. And they buried him with his fathers in the City of David, and his son Amaziah reigned in his place.
translation: Wokman bilong em, Jozabad son bilong Shimeath na Jehozabad son bilong Shomer, i kilim em, na em i dai pinis. Ol i birim em wantaim tumbuna bilong en long Taun bilong Davit, na pikinini bilong em, Amaziah, i bos oltaim long hap bilong em.

original: In the twenty-third year of the reign of Joash son of Ahaziah over Judah, Jehoahaz son of Jehu became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria seventeen years.
translation: Long yia twenty-three bilong rein bilong Joash, man bilong Ahaziah, i stap king olsem long Judah, Jehoahaz, man bilong Jehu, i kamap king bilong Israel, na em i rain long Samaria long seventin yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and followed the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit; he did not turn away from them.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong Jehovah, na em i folowim sindaun long sindaun ol Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat i kamapim long Isrel; em i no lusim sindaun.

original: So the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He delivered them continually into the hands of Hazael king of Aram and his son Ben-hadad.
translation: Na iari bilong Jehovah i bamim agensim Isrel, na em i givim ol long han bilong Hasael king bilong Aram na Ben-Hadad, pikinini bilong em.

original: Then Jehoahaz sought the favor of the LORD, and the LORD listened to him because He saw the oppression that the king of Aram had inflicted on Israel.
translation: Na Jehoahaz sotim bikpela hap bilong Bikpela, na Bikpela harim tok bilong em, wantaim Bikpela lukim bagarap olsem king bilong Aram i mekim long Isrel.

original: So the LORD gave Israel a deliverer, and they escaped the power of the Arameans. Then the people of Israel lived in their own homes as they had before.
translation: Bikpela i givim Israel wanpela man i salusim ol, na ol i ranawe long pawa bilong Arami. Na ol Israel i stap gen long haus bilong ol, olsem taim bifo.

original: Nevertheless, they did not turn away from the sins that the house of Jeroboam had caused Israel to commit, but they continued to walk in them. The Asherah pole even remained standing in Samaria.
translation: Nogat, ol i no lusim bek long bikpela sin husat haus bilong Yerovoam i mekim Isrel, ol pipol bilong God, i kam bek long stap insait long ol. Polo bilong spirit meri Asherah i stap yet long Samaria.

original: Jehoahaz had no army left, except fifty horsemen, ten chariots, and ten thousand foot soldiers, because the king of Aram had destroyed them and made them like the dust at threshing.
translation: Jehoahaz i no gat army nau, bikos fifty man i raisim hors yet, ten kar em i go we, na ten thousand man i go wokabaut, olsem king bilong kantri Aram we i klostu long Israel i bin bagarapim ol, na mekim ol olsem aus bilong threshing, wok bilong kamautim grain long ples we i hat.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, along with all his accomplishments and his might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Jehoahazi, longol na olgeta samting em i mekim, strongpela em i gat, i no stap olsem long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Jehoahaz rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria. And his son Jehoash reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehoahaz i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i kisim en i bekim long Samaria. Na susa bilong en, Jehoash, i kam bihain long em, i bos long hap bilong en.

original: In the thirty-seventh year of the reign of Joash over Judah, Jehoash son of Jehoahaz became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned sixteen years.
translation: Long yia triati-seben bilong rein bilong Joash ibin king olsem ovet Judah, Jehoash man bilong Jehoahaz i kamap king bilong Israel long Samaria, na em i rainim sixteen yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and did not turn away from all the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit, but he walked in them.
translation: Na em wok olsem nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em no lusim bek ol sins yet ol Jeroboam Pikinini bilong Nebat i mekim Israel wok long ol, tasol em yet wok long ol.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoash, along with all his accomplishments and his might, including his war against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Jehoash, long namel tru long ol bikpela wok im bin mekim, wantaim strongim bilong en, na ina klia long war igo long Amaziah, King bilong Judah, i no writim yet long Buk Bilong Taim bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Jehoash rested with his fathers, and Jeroboam succeeded him on the throne. Jehoash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
translation: Na Jehoash i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na Jeroboam i kam bihain long sit bilong king, i tekim ples bilong en. Oli kisim Jehoash, oli kisim i go wap long Samaria wantaim king bilong Israel.

original: When Elisha had fallen sick with the illness from which he would die, Jehoash king of Israel came down to him and wept over him, saying, “My father, my father, the chariots and horsemen of Israel!”
translation: Wanpela taim Elisha i sik nau, na bai em i dai long sik bilong em, king Jehoash bilong Israel i kam daun go long en, na i tarai wara olsem saen bilong respekta, tasol i tokim em olsem: 'Papa bilong me, papa bilong me, ol katius na solja husat i riidim hors bilong Israel!'

original: Elisha told him, “Take a bow and some arrows.” So Jehoash took a bow and some arrows.
translation: Elisha i tokim em, “Kisim banara na ol arrows.” Na Jehoash i kisim banara na ol arrows.

original: Then Elisha said to the king of Israel, “Put your hand on the bow.” So the king put his hand on the bow, and Elisha put his hands on the king’s hands.
translation: Na Elisha i tokim king blong Israel olsem, “Putim han bilong yu long banar.” King i putim han bilong en long banar, na Elisha i putim han bilong en long han bilong king.

original: “Open the east window,” said Elisha. So he opened it and Elisha said, “Shoot!” So he shot. And Elisha declared: “This is the LORD’s arrow of victory, the arrow of victory over Aram, for you shall strike the Arameans in Aphek until you have put an end to them.”
translation: “Opim wino bilong ist,” olsem Elisha i tok. Na em i opim, na Elisha i tok, “Pusim!” Na em i pusim. Na Elisha i tok: “Dispela em i pilai bilong victori bilong LORD, pilai bilong victori long Ol Aramean, long Aphek, na yu bai kilim ol Aramean long Aphek, na yu putim pinis ol.”

original: Then Elisha said, “Take the arrows!” So he took them, and Elisha said to the king of Israel, “Strike the ground!” So he struck the ground three times and stopped.
translation: Na Elisha i tok, "Kisim banarang!" Na em i kisim ol, na Elisha i tokim king bilong Israel, "Paitim graun!" Na em i paitim graun tripela taim na em i stap.

original: But the man of God was angry with him and said, “You should have struck the ground five or six times. Then you would have struck down Aram until you had put an end to it. But now you will strike down Aram only three times.”
translation: Man bilong God i masalai wantaim em, na em tok, "Yu mas kilim graun faif na sikis taim. Den yu bai kilim daun Aram, na yu bai winim ol, tasol nau yu bai kilim daun Aram tri taim tasol."

original: And Elisha died and was buried. Now the Moabite raiders used to come into the land every spring.
translation: Na Elisha i dai na ol i kisim em go long ples bilong ol ancestor. Olsem, ol Moabite mangi man yet ol i usim tumas kam insait long kantri byaut long taim wara i kam aut.

original: Once, as the Israelites were burying a man, suddenly they saw a band of raiders, so they threw the man’s body into Elisha’s tomb. And as soon as his body touched the bones of Elisha, the man was revived and stood up on his feet.
translation: Wanpela taim, ol Israelait i stap planti man, nau ol i lukim ol rangger meri, so ol i kastim bodi bilong man i go insait long tomb bilong Elisha. Na bihain bodi bilong en i katim bon bilong Elisha, man i kam bek gen, i stap strong long lek.

original: And Hazael king of Aram oppressed Israel throughout the reign of Jehoahaz.
translation: Na Hazael king bilong Aram i bagarapim Israel long taim bilong pait bilong Jehoahaz.

original: But the LORD was gracious to Israel and had compassion on them, and He turned toward them because of His covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. And to this day, the LORD has been unwilling to destroy them or cast them from His presence.
translation: Bikpela i givim gras long Israel na i kamap traipela long ol, na i wendim face long ol bikos bilong papa bilong en, Abrahamu, Aisak, na Jakob, long covenant. Na inap long tude, Bikpela i no laik bagarapim ol o rausim ol long hap bilong en.

original: When Hazael king of Aram died, his son Ben-hadad reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Hazael king bilong Aram i dai, susu bilong em Ben-hadad i kam bihain long em.

original: Then Jehoash son of Jehoahaz took back from Ben-hadad son of Hazael the cities that Hazael had taken in battle from his father Jehoahaz. Jehoash defeated Ben-hadad three times, and so recovered the cities of Israel.
translation: Na Jehoash pikinini bilong Jehoahaz kisim bek ol ples we Hazael winim bek long fight tasol i kam long taim bilong Jehohaz. Jehoash winim bek Ben-hadad tripla taim, na so em kisim bek gen ol ples bilong Isrel.

original: In the second year of the reign of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz over Israel, Amaziah son of Joash became king of Judah.
translation: Long nambatu yia bilong taim bilong king Jehoash, pikinini bilong Jehoahaz, i kam bos bilong Isrel, Amaziah, pikinini bilong Joash, i kam bos bilong Yuda.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother’s name was Jehoaddan; she was from Jerusalem.
translation: Em i kamap king na em i 25 yia yet, na em i rul long Jirusalem olgeta 29 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Jehoaddan; em i kam long Jirusalem.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, but not as his father David had done. He did everything as his father Joash had done.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting gut long ai bilong Papa God, tasol em i no mekim olsem ancestor David i mekim. Em i mekim olgeta samting olsem ancestor Joash i mekim.

original: Nevertheless, the high places were not taken away, and the people continued sacrificing and burning incense on the high places.
translation: Nogat, ol ples high i no go daun yet, na ol pipel i kontinu long givim sacrifis na smok insens long ol ples high.

original: As soon as the kingdom was firmly in his grasp, Amaziah executed the servants who had murdered his father the king.
translation: Olsem wanpela kingdom i kamap strong long han bilong Amaziah, na em bai kilim ol wokman i bin kisim laif bilong papa bilong en, king.

original: Yet he did not put the sons of the murderers to death, but acted according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, where the LORD commanded: “Fathers must not be put to death for their children, and children must not be put to death for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin.”
translation: Na em i no kilim ol pikinini bilong ol man i save kilim man, tasol em i wok long we ol i rais long Buk Bilong Lotu Bilong Moisi, we GOD i tok olsem: "Papa i no inap kilim bekim bikos pikinini i mekim sinduna, na pikinini i no inap kilim bekim bikos papa i mekim sinduna; nen igat dai bilong en tasol long sinduna i mekim."

original: Amaziah struck down 10,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt. He took Sela in battle and called it Joktheel, which is its name to this very day.
translation: Amaziah i kilim daun 10,000 Pipol bilong Edom long Valley bilong Salt. Em i kisim Sela long fight na em i givim nem Joktheel, na nem ya i stap yet long tude.

original: Then Amaziah sent messengers to the king of Israel Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu. “Come, let us meet face to face,” he said.
translation: Na Amaziah salim messija long king bilong Israel, Jehoash, pikinini bilong Jehoahaz, pikinini bilong Jehu. “Yu kam, mipela bai kisim ka bilong yu yet,” ol i tok.

original: But Jehoash king of Israel replied to Amaziah king of Judah: “A thistle in Lebanon sent a message to a cedar in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son in marriage.’ Then a wild beast in Lebanon came along and trampled the thistle.
