translation: Tasol Jehoash king bilong Israel i bekim tokim Amaziah king bilong Yuda: “Wanpela prik long Lebanon i sendim tok long diwai bilong cedar, i tok olsem, ‘Givim doti bilong yu long pikinini bilong mi olsem meri.’ Tasol wanpela wild beast long Lebanon i kam na tromweim dispela prik.

original: You have indeed defeated Edom, and your heart has become proud. Glory in that and stay at home. Why should you stir up trouble so that you fall—you and Judah with you?”
translation: Yu bin winim Edom, na haret bilong yu i kamap strong na pundaun. Glori long dispela na stap hap home. Olsem wanem yu wokim hevi, na yu na Juda yumi i pundaun?

original: But Amaziah would not listen, and Jehoash king of Israel advanced. He and King Amaziah of Judah faced each other at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
translation: Bare Amaziah i no lisin, na Jehoash king bilong Israel i kam. Ol i kam fas gen, Jehoash na King Amaziah bilong Judah, ol i bin meet long Bet-Semes insait long Judah.

original: And Judah was routed before Israel, and every man fled to his home.
translation: Na Juda i kilim bek long Israel, na ol man i ran i go long hus bilong ol.

original: There at Beth-shemesh, Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Ahaziah. Then Jehoash went to Jerusalem and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate—a section of four hundred cubits.
translation: Long Beth-shemesh, Jehoash king bilong Isrel i kisim Amaziah king bilong Yuda, em Pikinini bilong Joash, em i pikinini bilong Ahaziah. Then Jehoash i go long Yerusalem na em i brukim daun wal bilong Yerusalem from Gat bilong Ephraim long go long Gat bilong Kona – wanpela hap bilong 400 cubits.

original: He took all the gold and silver and all the articles found in the house of the LORD and in the treasuries of the royal palace, as well as some hostages. Then he returned to Samaria.
translation: Em i kisim olgeta gol na silva, na ol samting em i stap long haus bilong Jehovah na long treasuries bilong empera palas, na ol man meri hostage. Na em i go bek long Samaria.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoash, along with his accomplishments, his might, and how he waged war against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Jehoash, tusolong wantaim ol bikpela wok em i mekim, strongpela em i gat, olsem em i go bekim war long Amaziah king bilong Yuda, i no writim ol dispela tinging long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Israel?

original: And Jehoash rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. And his son Jeroboam reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehoash i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i bin planim em long Samaria wantaim king bilong Israel. Na susa bilong en, Jeroboam, i kam bos long hap bilong en.

original: Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
translation: Amasia sun bilong Joas king bilong Juda i stap olsem fifteen yia bihain long taim Jeoasa sun bilong Jeoahasi king bilong Isrel i dai pinis.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta wok bilong Amaziah, em i no bin raitim yet long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And conspirators plotted against Amaziah in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish. But men were sent after him to Lachish, and they killed him there.
translation: Na ol geto wantaim i plan long bagarapim Amaziah long Yerusalem, na em i ranawe go long Lakis. Tasol ol man i salim bihain long em go long Lakis, na ol i kilim em long hap.

original: They carried him back on horses and buried him in Jerusalem with his fathers in the City of David.
translation: Ol kisim bek i go long hores na plantim em long Yerusalem wantaim tumbuna bilong en long Siti bilong Davit.

original: Then all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.
translation: Ol pipol bilong Yuda i kisim Azaria, em i 16 yia olsem, na ol i mekim em king long hap bilong papa bilong em, Amasia.

original: Azariah was the one who rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah after King Amaziah rested with his fathers.
translation: Azaria em i man i mekim gen Elath na i bringim bek long Judah bihaen long King Amaziah i go long ples bilong tumbuna.

original: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Amaziah son of Joash over Judah, Jeroboam son of Jehoash became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria forty-one years.
translation: Long fifteenth yia bilong rein bilong Amaziah, man bilong Joash, aibane long Sauten Juda, Jeroboam, man bilong Jehoash, em i kam bikim king bilong Israel, na em i rain long Samaria fortikwan yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and did not turn away from all the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i wok olsem nogut long ai bilong GOD na i no lusim bek ol bikhet nau we Jeroboam sut bilong Nebat i mekim Isrel wok olsem.

original: This Jeroboam restored the boundary of Israel from Lebo-hamath to the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word that the LORD, the God of Israel, had spoken through His servant Jonah son of Amittai, the prophet from Gath-hepher.
translation: Dispela Jeroboam im wes restore boundary bilong Isrel from Lebo-hamath go long Sea bilong Arabah, olsem ol wod LORD, God bilong Isrel, i tok bifo thru servant Jonah son bilong Amittai, prophit bilong Gath-hepher.

original: For the LORD saw that the affliction of the Israelites, both slave and free, was very bitter. There was no one to help Israel,
translation: Papa God i lukim olgeta sorere long ol Israel, ol wokman na ol freeman, i amamas olgeta, tasol i no gat narapela man i halivim ol Israel.

original: and since the LORD had said that He would not blot out the name of Israel from under heaven, He saved them by the hand of Jeroboam son of Jehoash.
translation: Na Papa God i tok olsem bai em i no brukim aut nem bilong Israel from aninit long heven, em i save ol long han bilong Jeroboam man bilong Jehoash.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, along with all his accomplishments and might, and how he waged war and recovered both Damascus and Hamath for Israel from Judah, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olsem, narapela ol samting bilong Jeroboam, longsamting nating ol bikpela wok na powa bilong en, olsem en bin go long war, na en bin kam bek gen na kisim Damaskis na Hamat bek long Israel from Juda, oli no stap writim i go insait long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong Kings Bilong Israel?

original: And Jeroboam rested with his fathers, the kings of Israel. And his son Zechariah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jeroboam i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, king bilong Israel. Na Zechariah, pikinini bilong en, i bos long ples bilong en.

original: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam’s reign over Israel, Azariah son of Amaziah became king of Judah.
translation: Long yia twenty-seben bilong paitim bilong Jeroboam long Isrel, Azaria, pikinini bilong Amaziah, i kamap king bilong Juda.

original: He was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-two years. His mother’s name was Jecoliah; she was from Jerusalem.
translation: Em i 16 yia olsem wanem taim em kamap king, na em i rul long Jerusalem long 52 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Jekolia; em i kam long Jerusalem.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father Amaziah had done.
translation: Na em wokim ol samting i gut long ai bilong Jehovah, olsem tumbuna bilong en Amaziah i mekim.

original: Nevertheless, the high places were not taken away; the people continued sacrificing and burning incense there.
translation: Nem mindyet, ol ples hait i no bin kisim wei; ol pipel i kon tin bungim bek na smokim insens long hap.

original: And the LORD afflicted the king with leprosy until the day he died, so that he lived in a separate house while his son Jotham had charge of the palace and governed the people of the land.
translation: Na LORD i givim sik leprosi long king, na king i stap na i dai. King i go stap long haus narapela, bikos em i leper, wail em i tanim oltaim. Na Jotam, pikinini bilong em, i lukautim haus bilong king, na i givim ka long ol pipol bilong kantri.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Azariah, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting narakai bilong Azaria, longol na ol samting em i mekim, i no bin writim long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And Azariah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in the City of David. And his son Jotham reigned in his place.
translation: Na Azaria i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na em i go dai, na ol i kisim em i go putim long ples we ol i bin putim tumbuna bilong en long Siti bilong Dauid. Na pikinini bilong en, Jotam, em i kam bihain long en na em i bos.

original: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah’s reign over Judah, Zechariah son of Jeroboam became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria six months.
translation: Long yia 38 bilong rain bilong Azaria i stap long Judah, Zechariah, pikinini bilong Jeroboam, i kamap king bilong Isrel, na em i rain long Samaria six mun.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, as his fathers had done. He did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, olsem tumbuna bilong en i mekim. Em i no lusim sin bilong Jeroboam sambai Nebat i kam na mekim Israel i sindaun long en.

original: Then Shallum son of Jabesh conspired against Zechariah, struck him down and killed him in front of the people, and reigned in his place.
translation: Na Salamu su, yuang long Yabes, i paitim plen long Secharia, ol i kilim em i dai long hap bilong ol pipol, na em i kam bihain long en na i bos.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Zechariah, they are indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long olgeta samting bilong wok bilong Zekaria, em i raitim long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Israel.

original: So the word of the LORD spoken to Jehu was fulfilled: “Four generations of your sons will sit on the throne of Israel.”
translation: Wod bilong GOD i tokim Iehu, na em i kamap strong: "Fo genarasion bilong pikinini man bilong yu bai sindaun long sit bilong Israel."

original: In the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah’s reign over Judah, Shallum son of Jabesh became king, and he reigned in Samaria one full month.
translation: Long ninpela yia trienti nain rain bilong Uzia ibin go olsem long Judah, Shalum, pikinini bilong Jabesh, i kam bikim king, na em i bin rain long Samaria wanpela mun ful.

original: Then Menahem son of Gadi went up from Tirzah to Samaria, struck down and killed Shallum son of Jabesh, and reigned in his place.
translation: Menahem pikinini bilong Gadi i go ap long Tirzah na i kamap long Samaria, i kilim Shallum pikinini bilong Jabesh na i winim ol, na i bosim na i takim ples bilong em.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Shallum, along with the conspiracy he led, they are indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long ol akt bilong taim bai bilong Shallum, wantaim long toktok birua em i lidim, ol i raitim finis long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Israel.

original: At that time Menahem, starting from Tirzah, attacked Tiphsah and everyone in its vicinity, because they would not open their gates. So he attacked Tiphsah and ripped open all the pregnant women.
translation: Long taim ia, Menahem, statim long Tirzah, hamarim Tipfsah na ol ples nabauta long em, bekos ol i no ken opim gate bilong ol. Na so em i hamarim Tipfsah, na kisim olt bip long ol meri i go long bel.

original: In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah’s reign over Judah, Menahem son of Gadi became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria ten years.
translation: Long yia 39 bilong paitim bilong Azaria olsem king bilong Judah, Menahem man bilong Gadi i kamap king bilong Isrel, na em i bos long Samaria long ten yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and throughout his reign he did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong Jehovah, na long taim em i stap king, em i no kam bek gen long wei bilong levem ol sin olsem Jeroboam sun bilong Nebat i larim Isrel i mekim.

original: Then Pul king of Assyria invaded the land, and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver in order to gain his support and strengthen his own grip on the kingdom.
translation: Na Pul king bilong Asiria i go insait long graun, na Menahem i givim Pul wan thousand talen bilong silva olsem em i kisim sapot bilong em, na strongim gras bilong em yet long kingdom.

original: Menahem exacted this money from each of the wealthy men of Israel—fifty shekels of silver from each man—to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria withdrew and did not remain in the land.
translation: Menahem i kukim dispela moni long ol man meri bilong Israel ol i gat planti samting - fifty sikl bilong silva long ol - bai givim long king bilong Asiria. Na king bilong Asiria i withdraw na stap tasol, em i no stap long kantri.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Menahem, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
translation: Long olgeta samting na ol samting Menahem i mekim, ol i no bin raitim yet long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong Ol King bilong Israel?

original: And Menahem rested with his fathers, and his son Pekahiah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Menahem i istap long ples bilong tumbuna ol, na Pekahiah i bos long en.

original: In the fiftieth year of Azariah’s reign over Judah, Pekahiah son of Menahem became king of Israel and reigned in Samaria two years.
translation: Long long 50 yia igo Azaria wokim papa bilong Yuda, Pekahia, pikinini bilong Menahem, kamap king bilong Israel na wokim papa long Samaria, na em i wokim papa ole two yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i mekim nogut long ai bilong LORD, na em i no lusim sin blong Jeroboam sambai bilong Nebat i mekim Israel i go long rok long sin.

original: Then his officer, Pekah son of Remaliah, conspired against him along with Argob, Arieh, and fifty men of Gilead. And at the citadel of the king’s palace in Samaria, Pekah struck down and killed Pekahiah and reigned in his place.
translation: Na ofisa bilong en, Pekah sambai bilong Remaliah, i mekim plan long harim em, wantaim Argob, Arieh, na fifty man bilong Gilead. Na long haus bilong king inside kamp bilong toksave long Samaria, Pekah i kilim Pekahiah na i dai pinis, na em i bos long en.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, along with all his accomplishments, they are indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long olgeta samting na wok bilong Pekahiah, wampa na olgeta samting em i mekim, ol i raunim ol long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong Ol King bilong Israel.

original: In the fifty-second year of Azariah’s reign over Judah, Pekah son of Remaliah became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria twenty years.
translation: Long yia fifty-tu bilong rein bilong Azaria i stap king olsem long Judah, Peka sun bilong Remalia i kamap king bilong Israel, na i bos long Samaria tweenti yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD and did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had caused Israel to commit.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong Jehovah, na em i no lusim sins bilong Jeroboam sun bilong Nebat i kirapim Israel long mekim, tasol em i stap yet long desela.

original: In the days of Pekah king of Israel, Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria came and captured Ijon, Abel-beth-maacah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, and Galilee, including all the land of Naphtali, and he took the people as captives to Assyria.
translation: Long taim bilong Pekah king bilong Israel, Tiglath-pileser king bilong Asiria i kam na kisim Ijon, Abel-beth-maacah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, na Galili, inklusiv olgeta graun bilong Naphtali, na ol i kisim ol manmeri na wail long han bilong en na i carry ol long go Asiria.

original: Then Hoshea son of Elah led a conspiracy against Pekah son of Remaliah. In the twentieth year of Jotham son of Uzziah, Hoshea attacked Pekah, killed him, and reigned in his place.
translation: Na Hoshea man bilong Elah i lidim pilai long ol, i go bek na winim Pekah man bilong Remaliah. Long yia ikaispela bilong Jotham man bilong Uzziah, Hoshea i kilim Pekah, na em i kam bek na stori long ples bilong en, nupela king i kam, na em i bos bilong ol.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Pekah, along with all his accomplishments, they are indeed written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long olgeta samting na wok bilong Pekah, longol tumas bilong em na ol samting em mekim, ol i raitim ol i go insait long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong King bilong Israel.

original: In the second year of the reign of Pekah son of Remaliah over Israel, Jotham son of Uzziah became king of Judah.
translation: Long nambawan yia bilong taim bilong rulim Peka, pikinini bilong Remalia, olsem paitim king bilong Isrel, Jotam, pikinini bilong Usija, i kamap king bilong Juda.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. His mother’s name was Jerusha daughter of Zadok.
translation: Emi bin twenty-faiv yia olsem na em i kamap king, na em i rulim long Siti bilong God sixteen yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Jerusha, gel bilong Zadok.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father Uzziah had done.
translation: Na em wokim ol samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem tisa bilong em Uzia i mekim.

original: Nevertheless, the high places were not taken away; the people continued sacrificing and burning incense there. Jotham rebuilt the Upper Gate of the house of the LORD.
translation: Nem mind, olgeta hap graun i no go daun; ol pipol i kontinu long sakrifais na bren smok long hap graun. Jotam i wokim gen Upper Gate bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jotham, along with his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting na ol samting Jotam i mekim, i no bin writim yet long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: (In those days the LORD began to send Rezin king of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah against Judah.)
translation: Long dispela taim LORD i stat long senis Rezin king bilong Aram na Pekah pikinini bilong Remaliah long agivim Judah.

original: And Jotham rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David his father. And his son Ahaz reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jotam i go stap wantaim papa bilong en, na ol i bin plantim em gen long Siti bilong Dauid papa bilong em. Na sussa bilong en Ahaz i kam bek bikos em i bos nau.

original: In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah, Ahaz son of Jotham became king of Judah.
translation: Long seventin yia bilong Pekah, papa bilong Remaliah, Ahaz, papa bilong Jotham, i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. And unlike David his father, he did not do what was right in the eyes of the LORD his God.
translation: Ahaz em i 20 yia na i kam king, na em i rain 16 yia long Jerusalem. Na em i no wokim ol samting orait long ai bilong Bikpela, olsem Papa David i bin mekim, em i mekim ol samting nogut.

original: Instead, he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and even sacrificed his son in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations that the LORD had driven out before the Israelites.
translation: Em i go long rot bilong king bilong Israel, na em i kilim pikinini bilong en long paia, olsem ol hevi bilong narapela kantry we LORD i drivim ol aut bifo long Israelites.

original: And he sacrificed and burned incense on the high places, on the hills, and under every green tree.
translation: Na em i bikim sakrifis na em i bungim insens long ples hait, long han bilong maunten, na aninit long olgeta diwai i gat kol.

original: Then Rezin king of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to wage war against Jerusalem. They besieged Ahaz but could not overcome him.
translation: Na Rezin king bilong Aram na Pekah son bilong Remaliah king bilong Israel i kam apl long mekim wer long Jerusalem. Ol i kam beset long Ahaz tasol ol i no inap winim em.

original: At that time Rezin king of Aram recovered Elath for Aram, drove out the men of Judah, and sent the Edomites into Elath, where they live to this day.
translation: Long taim i go, Rezin king bilong Aram winim bek Elath long han bilong Aram, drivim aut ol man bilong Yuda, na salim Edomites i go long Elath, na oli stap yet long hap i go.

original: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, saying, “I am your servant and your son. Come up and save me from the hands of the kings of Aram and Israel, who are rising up against me.”
translation: Na Ahaz bicom sendim mesa long Tiglath-pileser king bilong Asiria, olsem, 'Mi bilong yu, na mi pikinini bilong yu. Kam antap na saveim mi long han bilong kings bilong Aram na Isrel, ol i kam antap long me.'

original: Ahaz also took the silver and gold found in the house of the LORD and in the treasuries of the king’s palace, and he sent it as a gift to the king of Assyria.
translation: Ahazi i kisim silva na gol i stap insait long haus bilong Jehovah na long treasuries bilong haus bilong king, na em i senem olsem gif long king bilong Asiria.

original: So the king of Assyria responded to him, marched up to Damascus, and captured it. He took its people to Kir as captives and put Rezin to death.
translation: King bilong Asiria i tokim bek long em, i kam ango long Damaskas, na i kisim Damaskas. I karamim ol pipol bilong Damaskas i go long Kir olsem prisna, na i kilim Rezin.

original: Then King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria. On seeing the altar in Damascus, King Ahaz sent Uriah the priest a model of the altar and complete plans for its construction.
translation: Kingi Ahaz i go long Damaskas i go lukim Tiglath-pileser king bilong Asiria. Long taim em i lukim altap long Damaskas, Kingi Ahaz i salim model bilong altap na plaen i kamap strong bilong wokim altap i go long Uriah priist.

original: And Uriah the priest built the altar according to all the instructions King Ahaz had sent from Damascus, and he completed it by the time King Ahaz had returned.
translation: Na Uriah priester bilong God i mekim altar olgeta em i go pasis long ol instruksin King Ahaz i sendem instruksin i kam from Damascus, na em i winim wok bilong en bai tim King Ahaz i kam bek.

original: When the king came back from Damascus and saw the altar, he approached it and presented offerings on it.
translation: King i kam bek gen long Damaskas na em i lukim altan, na em i go klostu long en na i bringim ofing long en.

original: He offered his burnt offering and his grain offering, poured out his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings on the altar.
translation: Em i bringim ka buk na ofing bilong saksak, kilim win ofing, putim win ofing long graun, na sprikim blod bilong peis ofing long sten bilong ofing.

original: He also took the bronze altar that stood before the LORD from the front of the temple (between the new altar and the house of the LORD) and he put it on the north side of the new altar.
translation: Na em i kisim tu ol altar bronze we i stap bifor LORD long hap bilong tempel, long namel bilong nupela altar na haus bilong LORD, na em i putim i go long sait bilong not bilong nupela altar.

original: Then King Ahaz commanded Uriah the priest, “Offer on the great altar the morning burnt offering, the evening grain offering, and the king’s burnt offering and grain offering, as well as the burnt offerings, grain offerings, and drink offerings of all the people of the land. Sprinkle on the altar all the blood of the burnt offerings and sacrifices. But I will use the bronze altar to seek guidance.”
translation: King Ahaz i givim tok long Uriah priest, “Ofa long bikpela altar mornin bung kanaka, apinun grain ofa, king bung kanaka na grain ofa, olsem na ol pipel bung kanaka, grain ofa, na dring ofa. Sprusim ol blod bilong bung kanaka na sakrifis long altar.” Tasol King i tok, “Mi bai usim alti bilong bronzu long sautim tok.”

original: So Uriah the priest did just as King Ahaz had commanded.
translation: Na Pries Uriah i mekim olsem King Ahaz i tokim.

original: King Ahaz also cut off the frames of the movable stands and removed the bronze basin from each of them. He took down the Sea from the bronze oxen that were under it and put it on a stone base.
translation: King Ahaz, king bilong Judah, tu cutim fram we bikosi i go wankain na kisim basin bronze long olgeta. Em i kisim down Solwara (Bronze Sea) long bulmakau bronze i stap underneath na em i putim long ston base.

original: And on account of the king of Assyria, he removed the Sabbath canopy they had built in the temple and closed the royal entryway outside the house of the LORD.
translation: Na long king bilong Asiria, em i kisim wei kanopi bilong Sabat ol i bin mekim long tembol, na em i pakim gan bilong king igo long Haus bilong LORD.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Ahaz, along with his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgets we bilong Ahaz, tuger long samting em bin mekim, ol i raitem yet long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David, and his son Hezekiah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Ahazi i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i biruaim em long Siti bilong Dauid, na Hezekia, pikinini bilong em, i bos long ples bilong em.

original: In the twelfth year of the reign of Ahaz over Judah, Hoshea son of Elah became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria nine years.
translation: Long yia twelve bilong tain bilong rai bilong Ahazi oliver Judah, Hosea, pikinini bilong Elah, i kamap king bilong Israel, na i bos long Samaria nao long nain yia.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, but not like the kings of Israel who preceded him.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, tasol i no olsem king bilong Israel ol i go biforim.

original: Shalmaneser king of Assyria attacked him, and Hoshea became his vassal and paid him tribute.
translation: Shalmaneser king bilong Asiria i go autim Hoshea, na Hoshea i kam bek long em olsem servant blong en, i givim em mani na goods.

original: But the king of Assyria discovered that Hoshea had conspired to send envoys to King So of Egypt, and that he had not paid tribute to the king of Assyria as in previous years. Therefore the king of Assyria arrested Hoshea and put him in prison.
translation: King bilong Asiria iam discover olsem Hosea im bin mekim plan long sendim envois bilong pablik go long King So bilong Ijip, na em i no pei tribut long king bilong Asiria olsem yia bifo. Bilong dispela, king bilong Asiria arrestim Hosea na putim em insait long kalabus.

original: Then the king of Assyria invaded the whole land, marched up to Samaria, and besieged it for three years.
translation: King bilong Asiria i go bekim holepela graun, i kam ango long Samaria, na i bikim em i no inap go aut, three yia olsem.

original: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and carried away the Israelites to Assyria, where he settled them in Halah, in Gozan by the Habor River, and in the cities of the Medes.
translation: Long namba nain yia bilong Hoshea, king bilong Asiria i kisim Samaria na i kisim Israelites na kamil long Asiria, na ol i stap long Halah, long Gozan besait long wara Habor, na long taun bilong Medes.

original: All this happened because the people of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt. They had worshiped other gods
translation: Olgeta samting hapen so bikos piple Israel i go agensim LORD God bilong ol, em i bamim ol i kamaut long lan bilong Ijip aninit long han bilong Faraon king bilong Ijip. Ol i servis god bilong narapela.

original: and walked in the customs of the nations that the LORD had driven out before the Israelites, as well as in the practices introduced by the kings of Israel.
translation: Na oli i go long kastom bilong ol narapela we LORDE i drivim olt long bipo long ol Israel, na oli i bihainim praktis i kam long king bilong Israel.

original: The Israelites secretly did things against the LORD their God that were not right. From watchtower to fortified city, they built high places in all their cities.
translation: Pipol bilong Israel i wokim ol samting i no luk agensim LORD God bilong ol, olsem ples long antap bilong ol hevi, husat ol i bikim long antap, stat long haus bilong wachim kas ol taun strongpela, na ol i mekim olsem long tasol taun bilong ol.

original: They set up for themselves sacred pillars and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every green tree.
translation: Ol i mekim ap long ol yet pepa bilong spirut na sip bilong Asherah long bun bilong ol hap hill na aninit long ol kalip trei i go graon.

original: They burned incense on all the high places like the nations that the LORD had driven out before them. They did wicked things, provoking the LORD to anger.
translation: Ol i bungim smel long ol ples hait olsem ol nesen i go pinis bifor ol, na ol mekim ol samting nogut, na ol i bringim bel hevi long LORD.

original: They served idols, although the LORD had told them, “You shall not do this thing.”
translation: Ol i sarve lotu bilong idol, tasol Bikpela LORD i tokim ol, "Yu no ken duim dispela kain pasal."

original: Yet through all His prophets and seers, the LORD warned Israel and Judah, saying, “Turn from your wicked ways and keep My commandments and statutes, according to the entire Law that I commanded your fathers and delivered to you through My servants the prophets.”
translation: Yet olgeta purofit na ol man i gat sain long en, LORD i skulim Israel na Yuda, olsem: "Kam bek long rot bilong yu, halivim komando bilong mi na statit bilong mi, olsem loa i bin tok long tumbuna bilong yupela, na mi bin givim i go long yupela bikos em i kam from wokman purofit."

original: But they would not listen, and they stiffened their necks like their fathers, who did not believe the LORD their God.
translation: Bain ol i no gat harim, na ol i pakim nek bilong ol olsem tumbuna bilong ol, ol i no bilip long LORD God bilong ol.

original: They rejected His statutes and the covenant He had made with their fathers, as well as the decrees He had given them. They pursued worthless idols and themselves became worthless, going after the surrounding nations that the LORD had commanded them not to imitate.
translation: Ol i kirapim statot bilong Bikpela, na pakt long ol tumbuna bilong ol, olsem na desisen ol i givim ol. Ol i bihain idol we i no stret, na yumi yet masalai, ol i go beklong kantri i stap arond we Bikpela i tokim ol long nogat bihain.

original: They abandoned all the commandments of the LORD their God and made for themselves two cast idols of calves and an Asherah pole. They bowed down to all the host of heaven and served Baal.
translation: Ol i lusim pinis ol lo bilong komandi bilong Bikpela God bilong ol, na ol i wokim tupela kast idol bilong liklik bulmakau na pulip bilong Ashera. Ol i paul ai i daun long olta heven na ol i sarve Baal.

original: They sacrificed their sons and daughters in the fire and practiced divination and soothsaying. They devoted themselves to doing evil in the sight of the LORD, provoking Him to anger.
translation: Ol i kirapim pikinini bilong ol long faia, na ol i mekim magik na toktok ol i save harim. Ol i stap long wokim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na ol i larim Em i popai.

original: So the LORD was very angry with Israel, and He removed them from His presence. Only the tribe of Judah remained,
translation: Na Papa God i mas tumas i cross long Israel, na em i kisim ol i go longwe pes bilong Em. Tribi bilong Joda i stap yet.

original: and even Judah did not keep the commandments of the LORD their God, but lived according to the customs Israel had introduced.
translation: Na Judah i no holim komando bilong LORD God bilong ol, tasol ol i stap na bihainim kastom we Israel i kam bringim.

original: So the LORD rejected all the descendants of Israel. He afflicted them and delivered them into the hands of plunderers, until He had banished them from His presence.
translation: Bikpela i rausim ol desenden bilong Israel, em i wari long ol, na em i givim ol i go long han bilong ol man bilong stilim, until em i pusi ol i go long hap bilong en.

original: When the LORD had torn Israel away from the house of David, they made Jeroboam son of Nebat king, and Jeroboam led Israel away from following the LORD and caused them to commit a great sin.
translation: Wanpela taim LORD i go bek long en Israel from haus bilong David, ol i mekim Jeroboam son bilong Nebat king, na Jeroboam i lidim Israel i lusim folo long LORD, na ol i mekim bikpela sin.

original: The Israelites persisted in all the sins that Jeroboam had committed and did not turn away from them.
translation: Israelait i kontinu long ol sin blong Jeroboam, na ol i no lusim behain long dispela.

original: Finally, the LORD removed Israel from His presence, as He had declared through all His servants the prophets. So Israel was exiled from their homeland into Assyria, where they are to this day.
translation: Finile, Papa God i kisim Israel long hap bilong en, olsem en i tok long ol servist bilong en ol profet. Na Israel i go long asilio long Assyria, i lusim graun bilong ol, na ol i stap yet long hap.

original: Then the king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva, Hamath, and Sepharvaim and settled them in the towns of Samaria to replace the Israelites. They took possession of Samaria and lived in its towns.
translation: King bilong Asiria i kisim ol pipol i kam long Babilon, Kuta, Ava, Hamat, na Sefarvaim, na plantim ol pipol i stap long taun bilong Samaria, long ripleysem Israelites. Ol i takem tromoi na i stap long towns bilong en.

original: Now when the settlers first lived there, they did not worship the LORD, so He sent lions among them, which killed some of them.
translation: Taim bipo ol piple i go kam na stap, ol i no wosip LORD yet, na em i salim laions i go kas long ol, na ol i kilim sampela blo ol.

original: So they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, “The peoples that you have removed and placed in the cities of Samaria do not know the requirements of the God of the land. Because of this, He has sent lions among them, which are indeed killing them off.”
translation: Ol i tokim king bilong Asiria, olki, "Ol pisin ol i kisim ausait na i putim long siti bilong Samaria, ol i no save long usatok bilong God bilong graun. Bikos ol i no save, Em i salim laion i go beklong ol, na laion i kilim ol, ol i dai pinis."

original: Then the king of Assyria commanded: “Send back one of the priests you carried off from Samaria, and have him go back to live there and teach the requirements of the God of the land.”
translation: King bilong Asiria i givim tok: "Sendim bek wanpela pries yu kisim long Samaria, na em i go bak na stap na tisim ol pipol long tingting bilong God bilong graun."

original: Thus one of the priests they had carried away came and lived in Bethel, and he began to teach them how they should worship the LORD.
translation: Wanpela pris bilong ol i bin kisim i go, em i kam na i stap long Betel, na em i statim skulim ol pipol long olsem wanem samting ol mas mekim bilong worshipim LORD.

original: Nevertheless, the people of each nation continued to make their own gods in the cities where they had settled, and they set them up in the shrines that the people of Samaria had made on the high places.
translation: Nesen, ol pipol bilong bekim kantri i go antap long ples we ol i kam lusim, na ol i mekim god bilong ol yet, na ol i plantim ol long haus lotu olsem pipol bilong Samaria i bin mekim long ples hait.

original: The men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth, the men of Cuth made Nergal, the men of Hamath made Ashima,
translation: Ol man bilong Babilon i mekim Sukot-Benot, ol man bilong Kus i mekim Nergal, ol man bilong Hamat i mekim Asima,

original: the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burned their children in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech the gods of Sepharvaim.
translation: Avvites i mekim Nibhaz na Tartak, na Sepharvites i saksim pikinini bilong ol long faia long Adrammelech na Anammelech, bogi bilong Sepharvaim.

original: So the new residents worshiped the LORD, but they also appointed for themselves priests of all sorts to serve in the shrines of the high places.
translation: Ol nok na stap i kam worshipim LORD, tasol ol i apoinim pries bilong ol yet long olgeta samting i servism insait long haus lotu bilong hap tumora.

original: They worshiped the LORD, but they also served their own gods according to the customs of the nations from which they had been carried away.
translation: Ol i wosipim LORD, tasol ol i servim ologeta god bilong ol yet olsem kastom bilong ol narapela ples we ol i bin kisim i go long wei.

original: To this day they are still practicing their former customs. None of them worship the LORD or observe the statutes, ordinances, laws, and commandments that the LORD gave the descendants of Jacob, whom He named Israel.
translation: Na todei ol i stap long ol kastom bilong tumbuna yet. Nipla i no servim LORD, nipla i no holim statut, ordinans, lo bilong God, na komandoment we LORD i givim long ol desenden bilong Jakob, we em i kolim Iserel.

original: For the LORD had made a covenant with the Israelites and commanded them, “Do not worship other gods or bow down to them; do not serve them or sacrifice to them.
translation: Bikpela bin mekim pinis pakt wantaim Isrelait na em i givim ol tok: "Yu no worship oth spirits, yu no katim kni long ol, yu no servim ol, na yu no bringim sakrifis long ol."

original: Instead, worship the LORD, who brought you out of the land of Egypt with great power and an outstretched arm. You are to bow down to Him and offer sacrifices to Him.
translation: Wosipim Lord, bama i bringim yu nap long Graun Egypt long pawa bikpela na arm stret longpela. Yu kirap i go daun long en olsem, na yu givim sakrifis long em olsem.

original: And you must always be careful to observe the statutes, ordinances, laws, and commandments He wrote for you. Do not worship other gods.
translation: Yu mas kisim hevi long kamapim ol lo bilong ol pisin, lo bilong kastom, lo bilong gavman, na toksave bilong God Em i raitim pasal yumi. Yu no worshipim god bilong narapela, lotu bilong narapela god.

original: Do not forget the covenant I have made with you. Do not worship other gods,
translation: No ken long forgitim agrikeman bilong mipela mi mekim em long yu. Yu no lotu long spirits poisen narapela.

original: but worship the LORD your God, and He will deliver you from the hands of all your enemies.”
translation: Bai yu wosipim LORD God bilong yu, na Em bai savim yu long han bilong ol enemi bilong yu.

original: But they would not listen, and they persisted in their former customs.
translation: Ol i no bin harim, na ol i stap long ol kastom bilong tumbuna yet.

original: So these nations worshiped the LORD but also served their idols, and to this day their children and grandchildren continue to do as their fathers did.
translation: Na ol nesen i wosipim Lord, tasol ol i servim idoli bilong ol tu. Na todei, pikinini na apinuni bilong ol i stap long mekim pasin bilong tumbuna bilong ol, olsem tumbuna bilong ol i mekim.

original: In the third year of the reign of Hoshea son of Elah over Israel, Hezekiah son of Ahaz became king of Judah.
translation: Long long tripla yia bilong taim bilong Hoshea, mak bilong Elah, i kam king bilong Isrel, Hezekiah, mak bilong Ahaz, i kam bikim king bilong Yuda.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother’s name was Abi, the daughter of Zechariah.
translation: Em i 25 yia olsem na em i kamap king, na em i rulim long Jerusalem long 29 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Abi, pikinini meri bilong Zekaria.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father David had done.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem tisa Papa Davit i mekim.

original: He removed the high places, shattered the sacred pillars, and cut down the Asherah poles. He also demolished the bronze snake called Nehushtan that Moses had made, for up to that time the Israelites had burned incense to it.
translation: Em i rausim ol ples bilong hevi, em i brisim ol poro bilong spirut, em i kisim daun ol post bilong Asherah. Em i daunim snek bilong bronzu we nem bilong en Nehushtan, Moses i wokim, nau ol Israelites i save mekim smel bilong bus long en, long taim bifo.

original: Hezekiah trusted in the LORD, the God of Israel. No king of Judah was like him, either before him or after him.
translation: Hezekiah i putim trast long LORD, God bilong Israel. Nogat wanpela king bilong Yuda olsem nem, bipo na bihain long em.

original: He remained faithful to the LORD and did not turn from following Him; he kept the commandments that the LORD had given Moses.
translation: Em i stap tru long fait long GOD olgeta, na em i no lusim folo im; em i holim komanda olsem GOD i givim long Mosis man bilong Bibel.

original: And the LORD was with Hezekiah, and he prospered wherever he went. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and refused to serve him.
translation: Na Bikpela i stap wantaim Hezekia, na em i winim strong olgeta wei em i go. Em i bagarap long king bilong Asiria, na em i no laik sarveim.

original: He defeated the Philistines as far as Gaza and its borders, from watchtower to fortified city.
translation: Em i winim Philistines longwe olgeta ples, stap long Gaza na boundari bilong em, from hap bilong haus liklik we ol i save wachim long ples strong.

original: In the fourth year of Hezekiah’s reign, which was the seventh year of the reign of Hoshea son of Elah over Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria marched against Samaria and besieged it.
translation: Long fourth yia bilong rein bilong Hezekiah, we em yet long seventh yia bilong rein bilong Hoshea, pikinini bilong Elah, ibin gavanis ol Israel, Shalmaneser, king bilong Asiria, i kam bekim war long Samaria na i kam klosim em.

original: And at the end of three years, the Assyrians captured it. So Samaria was captured in the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel.
translation: Na long ol taim three yia i go pinis, ol Asiria i kam kisim Samaria. Neken Samaria i go daun long yia sikis bilong Hezekia, em i yia nain bilong Hosea king bilong Israel.

original: The king of Assyria exiled the Israelites to Assyria and settled them in Halah, in Gozan by the Habor River, and in the cities of the Medes.
translation: King bilong Asiria i raunim Israelites na kisim ol i go long Asiria, na ol i stap long Halah, long Gozan kot long Habor River, na long siti bilong Medes.

original: This happened because they did not listen to the voice of the LORD their God, but violated His covenant—all that Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded—and would neither listen nor obey.
translation: Dispela kamap bikos ol i no harim voys bilong Papa God, tasol ol i braikim Kaaran Bilong Papa God – olgeta samting Mosis Wokman bilong Papa God i tok, na ol i no harm, na ol i no obeia.

original: In the fourteenth year of Hezekiah’s reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked and captured all the fortified cities of Judah.
translation: Long 14th yia long taim Hezekia i bikim pikinini king, Sennakerib king bilong Asiria i kam wari na kisim olpela taun bilong Judah we i gat barak.

original: So Hezekiah king of Judah sent word to the king of Assyria at Lachish, saying, “I have done wrong; withdraw from me, and I will pay whatever you demand from me.” And the king of Assyria exacted from Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
translation: Hezekiah king bilong Yuda i sendim tok long king bilong Asiria lonsg Lakis, olsem, "Mi mekim rong; yu withdraw long mi, na mi bai peim olgeta we yu laik long mi." Na king bilong Asiria i bikim pe long Hezekiah king bilong Yuda, three hundred talents bilong silva na thirty talents bilong gol.

original: Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD and in the treasuries of the royal palace.
translation: Hezekia i givim em olgeta sila em i stap long haus bilong Lod na long ples bilong save moni bilong king.

original: At that time Hezekiah stripped the gold with which he had plated the doors and doorposts of the temple of the LORD, and he gave it to the king of Assyria.
translation: Long taim ia, Hezekia im kisim gol na kamautim i go long doa na pos bilong haus lotu bilong LORD, na em i givim ol i go long king bilong Asiria.

original: Nevertheless, the king of Assyria sent the Tartan, the Rabsaris, and the Rabshakeh, along with a great army, from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. They advanced up to Jerusalem and stationed themselves by the aqueduct of the upper pool, on the road to the Launderer’s Field.
translation: Nogat sem, king bilong Asiria sendim Tartan, Rabsaris, na Rabshakeh, wantaim olgeta solja i gat plenti, from Lachis go long King Hezekia bilong Jerusalem. Ol i kam ango long Jerusalem na ol i stap klostu long ples we ol i save wasim water bilong pol i go antap, long rot bilong Filip bilong ol i wosim klos.

original: Then they called for the king; and Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebnah the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder, went out to them.
translation: Na ol i kolim king, na Eliakim man bilong Hilkiah man husat i lukautim haus bilong king, Shebnah man husat i raitim buk, na Joah man bilong Asaph man husat i skrivim stori, i go aut long ol.

original: The Rabshakeh said to them, “Tell Hezekiah that this is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: What is the basis of this confidence of yours?
translation: Rabshakeh i tokim ol long ol, "Yusim tokim Hezekiah, dispela em i tok bilong bikpela king, king bilong Asiria: Basis blong konfidens bilong yumi i wanem?"

original: You claim to have a strategy and strength for war, but these are empty words. In whom are you now trusting, that you have rebelled against me?
translation: Yu tok ol i gat plan na strong long faight, tasol dispela ol i tok ol i no kamap. Bihain, yu trastim long whos, nau yu bagarap long mi?

original: Look now, you are trusting in Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff that will pierce the hand of anyone who leans on it. Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.
translation: Nau yupela i lukim, yupela i stap trast long Ijip, ol kamapim bilong stik ia, em i go dae, bai em i kisim han bilong ol manmeri husat i sios long en. Olsem Pharaoh king bilong Ijip i go long olgeta manmeri husat i trast long en.

original: But if you say to me, ‘We trust in the LORD our God,’ is He not the One whose high places and altars Hezekiah has removed, saying to Judah and Jerusalem: ‘You must worship before this altar in Jerusalem’?
translation: Bai yu tokim ol long me, 'Mipela putim trast long LORD God bilong mipela,' dispela em i papa bilong wi? Em i kisim we ples bilong deity ol i bikim na altars, Hezekiah im bin kisim we, na em i tokim Judah na Jerusalem olsem: 'Yu mas wosip long altar dispela long Jerusalem.'

original: Now, therefore, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria. I will give you two thousand horses—if you can put riders on them!
translation: Nau, olsem na, wokim pe long tok long bos bilong mi, king bilong Asiria. Mi bai givim yu tu tusen horses - sipos yu ken putim rida long ol!

original: For how can you repel a single officer among the least of my master’s servants when you depend on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
translation: Olsem wanem yu ken drivim bek wanpela ofisa namba smol bilong servis man bilong papa bilong mi, wankain tingting yu gat long putim hope long Ejip long kariot na jentema?

original: So now, was it apart from the LORD that I have come up against this place to destroy it? The LORD Himself said to me, ‘Go up against this land and destroy it.’”
translation: Nau, oli bikos LORD, mi kamap klostu long hap bilong dispela ples ili winim i go? Em nau, LORD i tok long me, “Kamap klostu long kantri bilong dispela na bagarapim.””

original: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, along with Shebnah and Joah, said to the Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. Do not speak with us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall.”
translation: Na Eliakim pikinini bilong Hilkiah, longol Shebnah na Joah, i tokim Rabshakeh, “Ples yu tok pisin long servant bilong yu long Tok Arami, bikos yumupela i save harim. No tok long yumupela long Tok Hibru long han bilong ol pipol long wal.”

original: But the Rabshakeh replied, “Has my master sent me to speak these words only to you and your master, and not to the men sitting on the wall, who are destined with you to eat their own dung and drink their own urine?”
translation: Rabshakeh i tok bek long ol, “Papa bilong mi i sendim mi kam tokim dispela kain wods nogat, blo yu na bos bilong yu, tasol blo ol man i save sindaun antap long wal, ol i go nau bai yu na ol i kaikai kakai bilong yu yet na dringpela wara bilong yu?”

original: Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out loudly in Hebrew: “Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria!
translation: Rabshakeh i stap na kisim aut strongim long tok Hebrew: “Haren i go long dispela tok bilong king bikpela, king bilong Asiria!

original: This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you; he cannot deliver you from my hand.
translation: Em i tok olsem long king: No lem Hezekia i bikim yu bilong wrong; em i no inap save yumit long han blong mi.

original: Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the LORD when he says, ‘The LORD will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.’
translation: Hezekia i no ken persuadim yu long putim trast long LORD wen em i tok, 'LORD bai salvarim mipela fo sho; taun ipini i no bai givim long han bilong king bilong Asiria.'

original: Do not listen to Hezekiah, for this is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me. Then every one of you will eat from his own vine and his own fig tree, and drink water from his own cistern,
translation: No lisnen long Hezekiah, bikos king bilong Asiria i tok olsem: Mekim pis i go kam long me. Deni yupela yet olgeta bai kaikai long vin belong yupela yet na fig tree belong yupela yet, na dringim wara long sindaun bilong yupela yet.

original: until I come and take you away to a land like your own—a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and honey—so that you may live and not die. But do not listen to Hezekiah, for he misleads you when he says, ‘The LORD will deliver us.’
translation: Na bai mi kam na kisim yu go long wanpela kantri olsem kantri bilong yu – kantri i gat ka na wain nupela, bret na gan belo wain, diwai bilong oliv na honi – na bai yu stap na yu no dai. Yu no harim tok bilong Hezekiah, bikos em i givim yu long wel, em i tok olsem, ‘Bikpela bai save kami.’

original: Has the god of any nation ever delivered his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
translation: O God bilong ol nesen inim dispela taim i save lukautim olgrun bilong en long han bilong king bilong Asiria?

original: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah? Have they delivered Samaria from my hand?
translation: Gods bilong ples Hamat na Arpad i stap we? Gods bilong Sefarvaim, Hena, na Iva i stap we? Ol i save lilim Samaria long han bilong mi?

original: Who among all the gods of these lands has delivered his land from my hand? How then can the LORD deliver Jerusalem from my hand?”
translation: Husat long olgeta god i stap, hu iam bin savim kantri bilong en long hap bilong mi? Na husat bai i stap, na Bikpela bai inap savim Jerusalema long hap bilong mi?

original: But the people remained silent and did not answer a word, for Hezekiah had commanded, “Do not answer him.”
translation: Bai ol pipel i stap mama, ol i no bin givim wanpela toktok, wantaim Hezekia i bin givim komando: “Yu no ken givim ansa long em.”

original: Then Hilkiah’s son Eliakim the palace administrator, Shebna the scribe, and Asaph’s son Joah the recorder came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and they relayed to him the words of the Rabshakeh.
translation: Na Eliakim, pikinini bilong Hilkiah, man bilo Haus sel, Shebna, man i raitim buk, na Joah, pikinini bilong Asaph, man i skrivim stori, ol i kam, ol i kisim laplap ol i birua, na ol i go kasol long Hezekiah, na ol i tokim em ole words bilong Rabshakeh.

original: On hearing this report, King Hezekiah tore his clothes, put on sackcloth, and entered the house of the LORD.
translation: Long hem harim dispela ripot, King Hezekia i katim klos bilong en, putim sakklot, na i go insait long haus bilong LOD.

original: And he sent Eliakim the palace administrator, Shebna the scribe, and the leading priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz
translation: Na em isendim Eliakim manejari bilong haus kibung, Shebna skarari, na priest i go hap, ol i go wai sakklot, long propheta Aisaia son bilong Amoz.

original: to tell him, “This is what Hezekiah says: Today is a day of distress, rebuke, and disgrace; for children have come to the point of birth, but there is no strength to deliver them.
translation: Long tokim em, "Hezekiah i tok olsem: Tudei em i de wanpela de bikos sik turut, skulim, na shame; bikos ol pikinini i go long pinis, bai i kamautim nau, tasol i no gat strong bilong savem ol.

original: Perhaps the LORD your God will hear all the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to defy the living God, and He will rebuke him for the words that the LORD your God has heard. Therefore lift up a prayer for the remnant that still survives.”
translation: Em bai LORD God bilong yu harim olgeta tok bilong Rabshakeh, we i go bek long king bilong Asiria i sendim em i go mekim nogat respek long God i stap yet, na em bai givim strongpela tok i go long em long ol tok ol i save LORD God bilong yu harim. Oli mas katim preya long ol pipol we i stap yet.

original: So the servants of King Hezekiah went to Isaiah,
translation: Ol iu servan bilong King Hezekiah i go long Isaiah,

original: who replied, “Tell your master that this is what the LORD says: ‘Do not be afraid of the words you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
translation: Em i tok bek, "Yu tokim papa bilong yu, GOD i tok olsem: No ken skul long tok ol i bin harim, wokman bilong king bilong Asiria i bin dissim Mipela.

original: Behold, I will put a spirit in him so that he will hear a rumor and return to his own land, where I will cause him to fall by the sword.’”
translation: Bai mi putim spirit i go insait long en, na em bai harim tok bilong rumor, na em bai go bek long graun bilong en, na bai mi mekim em i pundaun na i dai long pati bilong sord.

original: When the Rabshakeh heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish, he withdrew and found the king fighting against Libnah.
translation: Taim Rabshakeh harim dispela toktok, king bilong Asiria lusim Lakisi, na em go bak gen na kim bek long king bilong Asiria i go fait wantaim Libnah.

original: Now Sennacherib had been warned about Tirhakah king of Cush: “Look, he has set out to fight against you.” So Sennacherib again sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
translation: Nau Sennakerib i gat wara long Tirhakah king bilong Kas: "Luke, em i go long pait gen long yu." Olsem na Sennakerib yet i sendim mesijer gen long Hezekia, tok olsem:

original: “Give this message to Hezekiah king of Judah: ‘Do not let your God, in whom you trust, deceive you by saying that Jerusalem will not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
translation: Givim dispela tok long Hezekia king bilong Yuda: 'No ken givim yumi tok long Bikpela, bai em i bikim yumi bagarap long tok ol i talk, olsem Jerusalem no ina save kamaut long hen bilong king bilong Asiria.

original: Surely you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the other countries, devoting them to destruction. Will you then be spared?
translation: Tru, yu harim tok bilong olgeta ol king bilong Asiria i mekim long narativen kantri, ol i putim ol long decoy na bagarapim ol. Bai yu bai stap fri long hap?

original: Did the gods of the nations destroyed by my fathers rescue those nations—the gods of Gozan, Haran, and Rezeph, and of the people of Eden in Telassar?
translation: Debil bilong ol narapela kantri ol bipo bilong mipela im bin bagarapim, olsem debil bilong Gozan, Haran, na Rezeph, na ol pipol bilong Eden long Telassar, inap save ol dispela kantri?

original: Where are the kings of Hamath, Arpad, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?’”
translation: King i stap we long Hamat, Arpat, Sefarvaim, Hena, na Ivah?

original: So Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers, read it, and went up to the house of the LORD and spread it out before the LORD.
translation: Na Hezekia kisim leta bikos messenja kam bringim, na rim ol, na go apo long haus bilong Jehovah na waisim i go long ples bilong Jehovah.

original: And Hezekiah prayed before the LORD: “O LORD, God of Israel, enthroned between the cherubim, You alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.
translation: Na Hezekiah praizim prey long ples bilong LORD: “O LORD, yu God bilong Israel, yu siddown antap long kerubim, Bikosi yu alone em i God ibilong olgeta kingdom long graun. Yu mekim heven na graun.”

original: Incline Your ear, O LORD, and hear; open Your eyes, O LORD, and see. Listen to the words that Sennacherib has sent to defy the living God.
translation: Papa bilong ol, kisim klostu eria, harim tok; opim ai bilong yu, Papa bilong ol, tisa. Harim tok bilong Sennakerib i sendim long bikhatolim Bikpela God i stap.

original: Truly, O LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste these nations and their lands.
translation: PAPA bilong yumi, ol kwin bilong Asiria i bagarapim despela nesen na graun bilong ol.

original: They have cast their gods into the fire and destroyed them, for they were not gods, but only wood and stone—the work of human hands.
translation: Ol i kirapim god bilong ol long faia na buglum, bikos ol i no gods tru, nogat, tasol diwai na stoan – wok bilong han bilong man.

original: And now, O LORD our God, please save us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You alone, O LORD, are God.”
translation: Na nau, O LORDE God bilong mipela, mipela i bekim yu, savim mipela long han bilong en, olegeta kingdom long graun i ken knowim Bikos yu alone, O LORDE, yu tasol em i God.

original: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah: “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: I have heard your prayer concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria.
translation: Na Isaia siki i go bek long Amoz i salim pes long Hezekia: "Long tok bilong LORD, God bilong Israel, em i tok: Mi harem prea bilong yu olsem Sennakarib king bilong Asiria."

original: This is the word that the LORD has spoken against him: ‘The Virgin Daughter of Zion despises you and mocks you; the Daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head behind you.
translation: Dispela em i tok bilong LORD i tokim: 'Mere Virjin bilong Sion i bikhat long yu, na i lafft long yu; Mere bilong Yerusalem i kirapim hed bilong en bihain long yu.

original: Whom have you taunted and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!
translation: Husat i go long paitim na krosim? Long husat i save singautim strong na luktim ai bilong yu long praid? Long Wan Holipela bilong Israel!

original: Through your servants you have taunted the Lord, and you have said: “With my many chariots I have ascended to the heights of the mountains, to the remote peaks of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars, the finest of its cypresses. I have reached its farthest outposts, the densest of its forests.
translation: Long ol wokman bilong yu, yu kam laikim ol i no save respektem Papa God, na yu tok olsem: "Wantaim planti kareta bilong mi, mi go ap long hap bilong maunten, long ples we i farawe bilong Libanon. Mi kisim daun ol gat bigpela seda bilong en, na ol gat naispela kaipres bilong en, em i simbol bilong powa na wel. Mi go long ples we i last long ol ples bilong en, na ol ples we i gat planti bus."

original: I have dug wells and drunk foreign waters. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the streams of Egypt.”
translation: Mi wailisim wel bilong wara, na mi dringim wara bilong narapela kantri. Wantaim sol bilong lek mi, mi daunim olgeta strim bilong Ipig.

original: Have you not heard? Long ago I ordained it; in days of old I planned it. Now I have brought it to pass, that you should crush fortified cities into piles of rubble.
translation: Yu no harim yet? Long taim bifo mi bin mekim desisin, oldea taim bifo mi bin planim. Nau mi bin mekim ol i kamap, bikos yu mas krungim taun bung bilong paitim i go daun na kamap haup moa bilong ston.

original: Therefore their inhabitants, devoid of power, are dismayed and ashamed. They are like plants in the field, tender green shoots, grass on the rooftops, scorched before it is grown.
translation: Olipela i stap long ples, ol i nogat strongpela, ol i bikim surprise na gat bel, na ol i sutim bel. Ol i olsem liklik graon i karim green long bus, olsem gras long diburi bilong haus, ol i bon lon wara, i kukim olsem ais, bifo ol i kamap strong.

original: But I know your sitting down, your going out and coming in, and your raging against Me.
translation: Mi save yu siddaun, yu go na kam bek, na yu i kirap strong long me.

original: Because your rage and arrogance against Me have reached My ears, I will put My hook in your nose and My bit in your mouth; I will send you back the way you came.’
translation: Bikos rong bilong yu na pait bilong yu i kam long ek bilong mi, mi go putim krok bilong mi long nok bilong yu, na kap bilong mi long maus bilong yu; mi go sendim yu bek long rot bilong yu i kam.

original: And this will be a sign to you, O Hezekiah: This year you will eat what grows on its own, and in the second year what springs from the same. But in the third year you will sow and reap; you will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
translation: Na dispela bai sampela saen long yu, o Hezekia: Yia dispela, yu bai kaikai olsem gras i gro long en, na yarna dispela, olsem samting i kamap gen long graun. Biatin dispela, yu bai pilim na katim; yu bai plantim vine na kaikai fut bilong en.

original: And the surviving remnant of the house of Judah will again take root below and bear fruit above.
translation: Na ol i stap yet na bai planti gen long hanus bilong Yuda, bai kamap strong klostu na karim frut namel.

original: For a remnant will go forth from Jerusalem, and survivors from Mount Zion. The zeal of the LORD of Hosts will accomplish this.
translation: Wanpela ripot bai kam bek long Yerusalem, na ol i save long Maunt Sayon. Faya bilong LORD bilong ol papa i mekim dispela.

original: So this is what the LORD says about the king of Assyria: ‘He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow into it. He will not come before it with a shield or build up a siege ramp against it.
translation: Papa God i tok olsem: King bilong Asiria, em no go insait long dispela taun, no ken shot arrow i go insait long em, no ken kam bifo em wantaim siporo, na no ken mekim wal i go antap long ples we ol i harim.

original: He will go back the way he came, and he will not enter this city,’ declares the LORD.
translation: Em bai go bek long rot bilong en, na em no ken go insait long siti ya, ol tok bilong Papa God.

original: ‘I will defend this city and save it for My own sake and for the sake of My servant David.’”
translation: “Mi bai protektem ples ia, na mi bai saveim, long bilong mi yet, na long bilong servis man bilong mi, Dauid.”

original: And that very night the angel of the LORD went out and struck down 185,000 men in the camp of the Assyrians. When the people got up the next morning, there were all the dead bodies!
translation: Na nait i go yet, ainjel bilong LORD i go aut na i kilim ol man long ples bilong Asiria, 185,000 i dai. Bekim moning gen, ol pipol i kirap, na ol i lukim bodi bilong ol man i dai finis!

original: So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.
translation: Na Sennakerib king bilong Asiria i go dasol long ples, i wokawe, i go bek gen long Niniva, na i stap we.

original: One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer put him to the sword and escaped to the land of Ararat. And his son Esar-haddon reigned in his place.
translation: Wanpela de, wail em i stap woship long haus lotu bilong biciman Nisroch, ol pikinini bilong en, Adrammelech na Sharezer, kilim ol manmeri bilong en na ranawe go long kantri Ararat. Na pikinini bilong en, Esar-haddon, em i bos bilong en.

original: In those days Hezekiah became mortally ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came to him and said, “This is what the LORD says: ‘Put your house in order, for you are about to die; you will not recover.’”
translation: Long dispela taim Hezekia i go daun long sik bilong die. Profet Aisaya, pikinini bilong Amoz, i kam klostu em, na tokim em, "Bikpela i tok olsem: 'Patiim hus bilong yu, yu kamap i dai pinis; yu no ken kam bek gen.'"

original: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD, saying,
translation: Na Hezekia i tunim facim na lukim i go long wara, na i beten long Jehovah, olsem:

original: “Please, O LORD, remember how I have walked before You faithfully and with wholehearted devotion; I have done what was good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
translation: O Bikpela, yumi tok bilong lotu, ripotim olsem: mi go bifoa yu olsem traipela, wantok long hap bilong yu, na mi Mekim ol samting nogut i gut long ai bilong yu. Na Hezekia krai sindaun i stap, krai i kam antap strong.

original: Before Isaiah had left the middle courtyard, the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
translation: Bipo Aisaia i go na i kam bek long mitELA yaad, tok bilong LORD i kam long em, olsem

original: “Go back and tell Hezekiah the leader of My people that this is what the LORD, the God of your father David, says: ‘I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. I will surely heal you. On the third day from now you will go up to the house of the LORD.
translation: Go bak na toktok long Hezekiah, bikman bilong piple bilong Mi, olsem: 'God bilong papa David bilong yu, em i tok olsem: Mi harem prea bilong yu, mi lukim tay bilong yu. Bai mi strongim yu gen. Long de narapela de, yu bai go antap long haus bilong LORD.'

original: I will add fifteen years to your life. And I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city for My sake and for the sake of My servant David.’”
translation: Mi go wail long yu, bai mi kisim fiften yia i go tanim long laip bilong yu. Na bai mi saveman yu na taun igat yumi long han bilong king bilong Asiria. Bai mi defendem taun igat long nem bilong Mi, olsem long nem bilong David, servant bilong Mi.

original: Then Isaiah said, “Prepare a poultice of figs.” So they brought it and applied it to the boil, and Hezekiah recovered.
translation: Na Isaiah i tok, "Meim bikim wanpela lapun bilong fig." Ol i kisim na ol i putim long bwai, na Hezekiah i strong i kam bek.

original: Now Hezekiah had asked Isaiah, “What will be the sign that the LORD will heal me and that I will go up to the house of the LORD on the third day?”
translation: Na Hezekia em askim Isaiah, “Saen i kam bai ol i save olsem, God bai kisim strong bodi bilong mi, na bai mi go apo long haus bilong Jehovah long de treisde?”

original: And Isaiah had replied, “This will be a sign to you from the LORD that He will do what He has promised: Would you like the shadow to go forward ten steps, or back ten steps?”
translation: Na Isaya i tokim ol, "Dispela bai sampela sain long yu bilong Lod, olsem em bai mekim olgeta samting em i promis: Yu laikim shadow i go hed 10 fut, o yu laikim em i go bek 10 fut?"

original: “It is easy for the shadow to lengthen ten steps,” answered Hezekiah, “but not for it to go back ten steps.”
translation: Em i eseli long shado i go long ten steppela, Hezekiah i tokim olsem, tasol em i nogut long em i go bek gen ten steppela.

original: So Isaiah the prophet called out to the LORD, and He brought the shadow back the ten steps it had descended on the stairway of Ahaz.
translation: Na Aisaya propet i singaut i go long olgeta LORD, na bam bringim bek shadow i go back ten stepe we i kam daun long stepele bilong Ahaz.

original: At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan king of Babylon sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard about Hezekiah’s illness.
translation: Long taim em i kam, Merodach-baladan, pikinini bilong Baladan, papa bilong Babilon, i sendim leta na git long Hezekiah, bikos ol i harim tok long sickness bilong en, Hezekiah.

original: And Hezekiah received the envoys and showed them all that was in his treasure house—the silver, the gold, the spices, and the precious oil, as well as his armory—all that was found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his palace or in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
translation: Na Hezekiah i receivim ol ambasada na i shoim olgeta samting i stap insait long haus bilong treasure - silva, gold, spais, oil bilong precious, na Haus bilong armory - olgeta samting i stap insait long storehouses. I no gat samting insait long haus king bilong en o olgeta ples we em i bos, Hezekiah i no shoim ol.

original: Then the prophet Isaiah went to King Hezekiah and asked, “Where did those men come from, and what did they say to you?” “They came from a distant land,” Hezekiah replied, “from Babylon.”
translation: Prifet Aisaya i go long King Hezekia na i askim, "Husat ol man i kam from, na husat tok ol i tokim yu?" King Hezekia i mekim klia tok bilong en, "Ol i kam from wanpela lain bilong wei, from Babilon."

original: “What have they seen in your palace?” Isaiah asked. “They have seen everything in my palace,” answered Hezekiah. “There is nothing among my treasures that I did not show them.”
translation: Isaya i askim, "Wanem samting ol i lukim long haus bilong yu?" Hezekia i ansa, "Ol i lukim everything long haus bilong mi. Ino gat samting bilong vale long graun bilong mi olsem samting mi no showim ol."

original: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the LORD:
translation: Na Isaiah i tokim Hezekia, “Harim tok bilong LORD”

original: The time will surely come when everything in your palace and all that your fathers have stored up until this day will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left, says the LORD.
translation: Taim bai i kam bek, olgeta samting long haus bilong yu, na olgeta samting papa bilong yu i save putim we, olgeta bai i kisim i go long Babilon, Noting no stap, olsem GOD i tok.

original: And some of your descendants, your own flesh and blood, will be taken away to be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
translation: Na olsem, sampela bilong ol desenden bilong yu, flesh na blod bilong yu yet, bai i go we olsem eunak long haus bilong king bilong Babilon.

original: But Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the LORD that you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “Will there not at least be peace and security in my lifetime?”
translation: Hezekiah i tokim Isaiah, “Tok bilong Jehovah we yu tokim em i gutpela.” Na em i ting, “Nogat les, bai olgeta bai kamap strong na stil long taim bilong mi yet?”

original: As for the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, along with all his might and how he constructed the pool and the tunnel to bring water into the city, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long ol akt bilong Hezekia, wangang long strongim, olsem wanem na em bin mekim pul na kanal bringim wara i go insait long taun, i no writim ol dispela tings long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And Hezekiah rested with his fathers, and his son Manasseh reigned in his place.
translation: Na Hezekia i go stap wantaim papa bilong en, na man bilong en Manase i kam bek long ples bilong en na i bos.

original: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-five years. His mother’s name was Hephzibah.
translation: Manase i gat twelv yia na em i kamap king, na em i rulim long Jerusalem long fifty-faiv yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Hefzibah.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD by following the abominations of the nations that the LORD had driven out before the Israelites.
translation: Na em i mekim nogut long ai bilong LORD olsem, em i bihainim ol samting em i hevi tru long ol narapela kantri we LORD i drivim i go bifo long ol Israel.

original: For he rebuilt the high places that his father Hezekiah had destroyed, and he raised up altars for Baal. He made an Asherah pole, as King Ahab of Israel had done, and he worshiped and served all the host of heaven.
translation: Em i bikim gen pinis ol ples bilong hait tambu bilong em Hezekia i bin katim ol pinis, na em i lusim op altas bilong Baal. Em i wokim pole bilong Asherah, olsem King Ahab bilong Israel i bin mekim, na em i servis na worshipim ol spirit bilong heven.

original: Manasseh also built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD had said, “In Jerusalem I will put My Name.”
translation: Manase bilton altas long haus bilong Jehovah, olsem Jehovah i tok, "Mi bai putim Nem bilong Mi long Jerusalem."

original: In both courtyards of the house of the LORD, he built altars to all the host of heaven.
translation: Long olgeta ka bilong ples balus long haus bilong Lod, em i mekim altar long olgeta hos bilong heven.

original: He sacrificed his own son in the fire, practiced sorcery and divination, and consulted mediums and spiritists. He did great evil in the sight of the LORD, provoking Him to anger.
translation: Em i bin kilim pikinini bilong em yet long paia, em i bin mekim majik na toktok olsem man bilong spirit, na em i bin go bek long ol samting bilong spirits na ol wok bilong devil. Em i mekim bikpela evil long ai bilong GOD, na em i bin arapim em i crai.

original: Manasseh even took the carved Asherah pole he had made and set it up in the temple, of which the LORD had said to David and his son Solomon, “In this temple and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will establish My Name forever.
translation: Manase igatim em i kam long hap graun na wokim pole bilong Ashera, na putim em i go insait long haus lotu, husat LORD i tokim Davi na Solomon pikinini bilong en, "Long dispela haus lotu na long Jerusalem, we mi choosim long ol tribes bilong Israel, mi bai mekim nem bilong mi i stap oltaim.

original: I will never again cause the feet of the Israelites to wander from the land that I gave to their fathers, if only they are careful to do all I have commanded them—the whole Law that My servant Moses commanded them.”
translation: Mi no go harim tok longwe again, leks bilong Israelites i go narapela rot long lain we mi givim ol long taim bifo long tumbuna ol, long namba wan, ol i mas wokim olgeta samting we mi tok, Lo bilong ol, we servant mi Moses i tokim ol.

original: But the people did not listen and Manasseh led them astray, so that they did greater evil than the nations that the LORD had destroyed before the Israelites.
translation: Bikpela i no harim tok, na Manase i bringim ol Israelit long rot bilong bagarap, na ol i mekim bagarap moa yet long taim bilong ol, olsem nesen ol Bikpela i bin bagarapim bifor.

original: And the LORD spoke through His servants the prophets, saying,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok olsem thruim ol wokman profet bilong en, olsem:

original: “Since Manasseh king of Judah has committed all these abominations, acting more wickedly than the Amorites who preceded him, and with his idols has caused Judah to sin,
translation: Bikos Manase king bilong Yuda i mekim ol hebubu pesenis, na i wok moa strong long hebug long ol Amori husat i go bifoa em, na ol idols bilong en i mekim Yuda i sin.

original: this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I am bringing such calamity upon Jerusalem and Judah that the news will reverberate in the ears of all who hear it.
translation: Dispela em i tok olsem: LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok, "Luke! Mi kam bringim bikhet long Jerusalem na Judah, na nius bai i go antap long ol yut, na olgeta man i harim bai i raitim long yut."

original: I will stretch out over Jerusalem the measuring line used against Samaria and the plumb line used against the house of Ahab, and I will wipe out Jerusalem as one wipes out a bowl—wiping it and turning it upside down.
translation: Mi go stret long Jerusalem lain bilong mesa i usim long Samaria, na plam lain bilong mesa i usim long haus bilong Ahab, na mi go waswasim Jerusalem olsem wan man i waswasim kala—wawsim na tilim i go daun.

original: So I will forsake the remnant of My inheritance and deliver them into the hands of their enemies. And they will become plunder and spoil to all their enemies,
translation: Mipela bai lusim ol i stap yet bilong brigina mipela, na baim yu inap givim ol long han bilong ol i stap long enemi bilong ol. Na ol bai kamap lo bilong stilim na bagarap bilong ol wara bilong ol.

original: because they have done evil in My sight and have provoked Me to anger from the day their fathers came out of Egypt until this day.’”
translation: Bikos ol i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong Mi, na ol i kisim me long rausim birua, stat long dei ol papa bilong ol i kam aut long Egip, na inap long dei noodles.

original: Moreover, Manasseh shed so much innocent blood that he filled Jerusalem from end to end, in addition to the sin that he had caused Judah to commit, doing evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Manase rimpaisim planti blod innosent, na paitim Jerusalem long olgeta hap, longsaide long sin em i mekim Judah wokim, wokim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Manasseh, along with all his accomplishments and the sin that he committed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Ol narapela wok bilong Manase, ol samting em i mekim, na bikim sin em i mekim, i no raitim long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Yuda?
