original: And Manasseh rested with his fathers and was buried in his palace garden, the garden of Uzza. And his son Amon reigned in his place.
translation: Na Manase ili stap wantaim papa bilong en, na ol biruaim en na kisim i go long gaden bilong Uza, gaden bilong em haus. Na susa bilong en Amon i kam bihain long en, i bos.

original: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem two years. His mother’s name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz; she was from Jotbah.
translation: Amon i kamap king na em i gat twenty-two yia, na em i raiin long Jiusalem long two yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Meshullemeth, daughter bilong Haruz, na em i kam long Jotbah.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, as his father Manasseh had done.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, olsem tisa bilong en Manaseh i mekim.

original: He walked in all the ways of his father, and he served and worshiped the idols his father had served.
translation: Em i go wakabaut long olgeta rot bilong papa bilong em, na em i servim na wompipim hevi olgeta hevi em papa bilong em i servim.

original: He abandoned the LORD, the God of his fathers, and did not walk in the way of the LORD.
translation: Em lusim Lod, God bilong tumbuna bilong en, na em i no i go long rot bilong Lod.

original: Then the servants of Amon conspired against him and killed the king in his palace.
translation: Na wokman bilong Amon i harm na kisim plan, ol i kilim king insait long haus bilong en.

original: But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against King Amon, and they made his son Josiah king in his place.
translation: Ol pipol bilong kantri i kilim ol i mekim birua gen long King Amon, na ol i bikim Pikinini Josiah king long hap bilong en.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Amon, along with his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting nau bilong Amon, olgeta wok na samting em i mekim, i no bin raitim yet long Buk bilong Stori bilong King bilong Judah?

original: And he was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza, and his son Josiah reigned in his place.
translation: Na em i go daun long graun long tomb bilong en long ganen bilong Uzza, na susa bilong en Josiah i kam bek long ples bilong king.

original: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem thirty-one years. His mother’s name was Jedidah daughter of Adaiah; she was from Bozkath.
translation: Josiah i kamap king na em i gat eight yia, na em i painim kabana long Jerusalem long thirty-one yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Jedidah, daughter bilong Adaiah, na em i kam long Bozkath.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD and walked in all the ways of his father David; he did not turn aside to the right or to the left.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta samting i gut long ai bilong LORD, na em i go long olgeta rot bilong papa David, em i no bihaenim rot long raite o long lef.

original: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, King Josiah sent the scribe, Shaphan son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, to the house of the LORD, saying,
translation: Long long 18 yia i go pinis bikos King Josiah i king, em i salim ofisa bilong en, Shaphan pikinini bilong Azaliah, pikinini bilong Meshullam, ofisa bilong raitim buk, i go kasol long haus bilong Jehovah, em i tok olsem

original: “Go up to Hilkiah the high priest and have him count the money that has been brought into the house of the LORD, which the doorkeepers have collected from the people.
translation: Go ap long Hilkiah prist bilong hap, na mekim em i kauntim moni olgeta we i bringim i go long haus bilong LORD, we ol wokman bilong dor kisim bek long ol pipol.

original: And let them deliver it into the hands of the supervisors of those doing the work on the house of the LORD, who in turn are to give it to the workmen repairing the damages to the house of the LORD—
translation: Bai ol i kirapim long han bilong ol bos, ol bos bilong wok long haus bilong LORD, na bai ol i givim ol i long wokman i tokautim ol bagarap long haus bilong LORD.

original: to the carpenters, builders, and masons—to buy timber and dressed stone to repair the temple.
translation: Long olgeta karpenta, biloka, na stonwoka – baim timber na ston i kamapim gut olsem igat strongpela Haus Lotu, repia Haus Lotu.

original: But they need not account for the money put into their hands, since they work with integrity.”
translation: Bain ol i no ken givim eksplenasion long moni yu putim long hand bilong ol, wantaim ol wok long wei bilong trai.

original: Then Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the scribe, “I have found the Book of the Law in the house of the LORD!” And he gave it to Shaphan, who read it.
translation: Na Hilkiah, pries bilong hap, i tokim Shaphan, man bilong raitim buk, “Mi finim Buk bilong Lotu long haus bilong Lod!” Na em i givim i go long Shaphan, na Shaphan i ridim.

original: And Shaphan the scribe went to the king and reported, “Your servants have paid out the money that was found in the temple and have put it into the hands of the workers and supervisors of the house of the LORD.”
translation: Na Shaphan skarib i go kam long king na i ripot, “Mipela i pe em moni we mipela i finaim insait long haus bilong LORD na mipela i putim long han bilong ol wokman na bos manmeri bilong haus lotu.”

original: Moreover, Shaphan the scribe told the king, “Hilkiah the priest has given me a book.” And Shaphan read it in the presence of the king.
translation: Na Shaphan skarari i tokim king, “Hilkiah priis i givim mi buk.” Na Shaphan i ridim buk long ai bilong king.

original: When the king heard the words of the Book of the Law, he tore his clothes
translation: Taim king i harim toksave bilong Buk bilong Lotu, em i kilim klotes bilong en.

original: and commanded Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam son of Shaphan, Achbor son of Micaiah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the servant of the king:
translation: Na em i givim tok strong long Hilkiah pries, Ahikam sun bilong Shaphan, Achbor sun bilong Mikaiah, Shaphan skriverner, na Asaiah hausboi bilong king:

original: “Go and inquire of the LORD for me, for the people, and for all Judah concerning the words in this book that has been found. For great is the wrath of the LORD that burns against us because our fathers have not obeyed the words of this book by doing all that is written about us.”
translation: “Go na askim Lord long ol pipol bilong Juda, na long mipela, olgeta, long tok bilong buk i go, em i kamap nau. Ros i Lord i save katim i kam bek long mipela i bikpela, wantaim papa bilong mipela i no bihainim tok bilong buk, na olgeta samting i rais long mipela.”

original: So Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asaiah went and spoke to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, the keeper of the wardrobe. She lived in Jerusalem, in the Second District.
translation: Prist Hilkiah, Ahikam, Akbor, Shaphan, na Asaiah i go tok, ol i tokim Huldah prophetes, meri bilong Shallum, pikinini bilong Tikvah, pikinini bilong Harhas, man i lukautim klos. Em i stap long Jerusalem, long Distrik Secen.

original: And Huldah said to them, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Tell the man who sent you
translation: Na Hulda i tokim ol long tok, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD, God bilong Israel: 'Yu tokim man we i sendim yu'"

original: that this is what the LORD says: I am about to bring calamity on this place and on its people, according to all the words of the book that the king of Judah has read,
translation: Dispela em i tok olsem: Mi bai bringim bikos long ples dispela na long ol manmeri bilong en, olsem olgeta wod long Buk ol King bilong Yuda im bin ridim.

original: because they have forsaken Me and burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke Me to anger with all the works of their hands. My wrath will be kindled against this place and will not be quenched.’
translation: Bikos ol i lusim Me na ol i bungim smel long narapela deua, ol i bringim bel hevi long me wantaim ol wok bilong ol, bel hevi bilong Me bai i kukim long ples ia na em no bai i pundaun.

original: But as for the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the LORD, tell him that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘As for the words that you heard,
translation: Bipo long king bilong Yuda, we i sendim yu go askim LORD, yu tokim em olsem: LORD, God bilong Israel, i tok olsem: 'Long ol wod yu harim,'

original: because your heart was tender and you humbled yourself before the LORD when you heard what I spoke against this place and against its people, that they would become a desolation and a curse, and because you have torn your clothes and wept before Me, I have heard you,’ declares the LORD.
translation: Bikos het bilong yu i soft, na yu go daun klostu long LORD, wen yu harim tok bilong mi long hap bilong dispela ples na long ol pipol bilong em, olsem ol bai kamap desolation na kat kat, na bikos yu pullim apar ol klotes bilong yu na krai long mi, LORD i harim yu, olsem LORD i tok.

original: ‘Therefore I will indeed gather you to your fathers, and you will be gathered to your grave in peace. Your eyes will not see all the calamity that I will bring on this place.’” So they brought her answer back to the king.
translation: “Olsem, mi bai kam bek long ol tumbuna bilong yu, na yu bai go long graun bilong yu long peis. Ai bilong yu no go ken harim ol samting nogut ol i kam long ples ia.” Na ol i kisim toktok bilong em na karim i go long king.

original: Then the king summoned all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
translation: King i singautim olgeta bikpela manmeri bilong Yuda na Jerusalem.

original: And he went up to the house of the LORD with all the people of Judah and Jerusalem, as well as the priests and the prophets—all the people small and great—and in their hearing he read all the words of the Book of the Covenant that had been found in the house of the LORD.
translation: Na em i go ap long haus bilong LORD wantaim ol pipol bilong Yuda na Jerusalem, ol pris, profet, olgeta liklik na bikpela, na long han bilong ol, em i rinim ol wod bilong Buk Bilong Kaovenan we i stap kisim long Haus bilong LORD.

original: So the king stood by the pillar and made a covenant before the LORD to follow the LORD and to keep His commandments, decrees, and statutes with all his heart and all his soul, and to carry out the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people entered into the covenant.
translation: King i stap klostu long pila na mekim akord bipoftem LORD, bihainim LORD, holim komando, laen, na statut bilong em wantaim olgeta hait bilong en na olgeta breath bilong en, na wokim wod bilong dispela akord i raun long dispela buk. Na ol pipol yumi go insait long akord.

original: Then the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, the priests second in rank, and the doorkeepers to remove from the temple of the LORD all the articles made for Baal, Asherah, and all the host of heaven. And he burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron and carried their ashes to Bethel.
translation: King i givim tok long Hilkiah pries bilong hap, ol pries bilong sekond renk, na man i lukaut doro, olsem oli mas rausim ol samting long haus lotu bilong LORD, ol samting bilong Baal, Asherah, na ol spirit bilong heven. Na king i bakim ol long biknait long outsait Jerusalem long ples Kidron, na tupela i kisim as bilong ol i go long Bethel.

original: Josiah also did away with the idolatrous priests ordained by the kings of Judah to burn incense on the high places of the cities of Judah and in the places all around Jerusalem—those who had burned incense to Baal, to the sun and moon, to the constellations, and to all the host of heaven.
translation: Josiah i rausim ol priest na pagal i go daun, ol i bin appointim bilong ol king bilong Yuda, oli putim smok long ples high bilong ol taun bilong Yuda na long olgeta hap bilong Jerusalem – ol i bin putim smok long Baal, long san, mun, long ol stua bilong heven, na long ol spirut bilong heven.

original: He brought the Asherah pole from the house of the LORD to the Kidron Valley outside Jerusalem, and there he burned it, ground it to powder, and threw its dust on the graves of the common people.
translation: Em i kisim pole bilong Asherah na kamautim long haus bilong LORD, na em i go daun long Kidron Valley ausait long Jerusalem, na em i bunim, waisim i paudar, na tromweit i go long graun bilong ol pipol i no gat pawa.

original: He also tore down the quarters of the male shrine prostitutes that were in the house of the LORD, where the women had woven tapestries for Asherah.
translation: Em i kukim daun ol haus bilong man husat i wok ol sem bilong spirit long husat bilong Lord, na ol meri i makim klos bilong Asherah.

original: Then Josiah brought all the priests from the cities of Judah and desecrated the high places, from Geba to Beersheba, where the priests had burned incense. He tore down the high places of the gates at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which was to the left of the city gate.
translation: Na Josiah kisim ol pris long ol ples bilong Juda, na i mekim bagarap ol ples bilong hevi, stat long Geba kaikai go long Beersheba, we ol pris i smokim wira. I puldaun ol ples bilong hevi long gate bilong entris bilong gat bilong Josaia gavana bilong taun, we i stap long lef bilong gat bilong taun.

original: Although the priests of the high places did not come up to the altar of the LORD in Jerusalem, they ate unleavened bread with their fellow priests.
translation: Priest bilong ples hai i no kam ap long altia bilong LORD long Jerusalem, tasol ol i kai bret unleaven wantaim ol brata priester bilong ol.

original: He also desecrated Topheth in the Valley of Ben-hinnom so that no one could sacrifice his son or daughter in the fire to Molech.
translation: Em i mekim Topheth long Vali bilong Ben-hinnom i pkin na nogat holide, so ol narapela man i no inap kilim pinis pikinini man o meri bilong ol long paia i givim olsem long Molech.

original: And he removed from the entrance to the house of the LORD the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun. They were in the court near the chamber of an official named Nathan-melech. And Josiah burned up the chariots of the sun.
translation: Na em i kisim olt long entris bilong haus bilong Lod ol hoses ol king bilong Yuda i dedikeit long san. Ol i stap insait ples kot, long sait bilong rum bilong ofisa wan Natan-melek. Na Yosia i barim aut chariots bilong san.

original: He pulled down the altars that the kings of Judah had set up on the roof near the upper chamber of Ahaz, and the altars that Manasseh had set up in the two courtyards of the house of the LORD. The king pulverized them there and threw their dust into the Kidron Valley.
translation: Em i kilim daun ol altars ol kings bilong Yuda i mekim long rum blong hap bilong Ahaz, na ol altars Manase i mekim long ka bilong haus bilong LORD. King i krushim pinis long hap na i tromwe dast long Kidron Valley.

original: The king also desecrated the high places east of Jerusalem, to the south of the Mount of Corruption, which King Solomon of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Sidonians, for Chemosh the abomination of the Moabites, and for Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
translation: King i bin mekim bagarap ol ples bilong spirit long sait bilong Jerusalem, long saus bilong Maunten bilong Bagarap, we King Solomon bilong Israel i bin mekim bilong Ashtoreth ol samting nogut bilong Sidonians, bilong Chemosh ol samting nogut bilong Moabites, na bilong Milcom ol samting nogut bilong Ammonites.

original: He smashed the sacred pillars to pieces, cut down the Asherah poles, and covered the sites with human bones.
translation: Em i brukim pilia bilong halivim ol i go daun long ol piece, katim daun kambek long Asherah, na kisim bon bilong man i kaerem ol ples, na olsem bagarapim em.

original: He even pulled down the altar at Bethel, the high place set up by Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin. Then he burned the high place, ground it to powder, and burned the Asherah pole.
translation: Em i kilim daun altar long Bethel, ples we ol i go antap long en we Jeroboam sun bilong Nebat i mekim, we i mekim Israel sin. Na em i bakim ples, em i krungumutim ol i go daun na em i bakim polo bilong Asherah.

original: And as Josiah turned, he saw the tombs there on the hillside, and he sent someone to take the bones out of the tombs, and he burned them on the altar to defile it, according to the word of the LORD proclaimed by the man of God who had foretold these things.
translation: Na Josiah i turn arond na lukim ol graun long sait bilong maunten, na em i send wan man go kisim ol bun na karim oda, na em i burnim ol long altan olsem wan wei bilong mekim em i no inap, olsem tok bilong LORD olsem man bilong God i tok bifo long dispela.

original: Then the king asked, “What is this monument I see?” And the men of the city replied, “It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and pronounced these things that you have done to the altar of Bethel.”
translation: King i askim, "Wanem monument ya mi lukim?" Na ol man bilong taun i tokim bek, "Em i holep bilong dai bilong man bilong God ol i kam long Juta na i tok strong long dispela alta bilong Betel."

original: “Let him rest,” said Josiah. “Do not let anyone disturb his bones.” So they left his bones undisturbed, along with those of the prophet who had come from Samaria.
translation: “Laim i go,” ol tok bilong Josiah. “Yu no ken wariim bon bilong em.” Ol i leevim bon bilong em i stap, wantaim bon bilong man profet i kam long Samaria.

original: Just as Josiah had done at Bethel, so also in the cities of Samaria he removed all the shrines of the high places set up by the kings of Israel who had provoked the LORD to anger.
translation: Olsem Josiah i mekim long Betel, na olsem tu em i mekim long ol taun bilong Samaria, na em i rausim ol haitples bilong ol ples i go antap i stap, ol king bilong Israel i mekim, na ol i kisim bel hevi bilong LORD.

original: On the altars he slaughtered all the priests of the high places, and he burned human bones on them. Then he returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Em i kilim ol prist bilong ples hait long ol altar, na em i burnim bun bilong man long ol altar. Na em i go bek gen long Yerusalem.

original: The king commanded all the people, “Keep the Passover of the LORD your God, as it is written in this Book of the Covenant.”
translation: King i givim tok stret long ol piple, “Yu mas holim Pasaka bilong LORD God bilong yu, olsem ol i raaitim long Buk bilong Kovena.”

original: No such Passover had been observed from the days of the judges who had governed Israel through all the days of the kings of Israel and Judah.
translation: Nogat Pasova ol i bin observe yet tumlol long taim bilong jujis ol i bin givim laik long Israel, long ol dei bilong king bilong Israel na Judea.

original: But in the eighteenth year of Josiah’s reign, this Passover was observed to the LORD in Jerusalem.
translation: Bai long namba etin yia bilong pawa bilong Josiah, ol i bin observeim Passova long Papa God long Jerusalem.

original: Furthermore, Josiah removed the mediums and spiritists, the household gods and idols, and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem. He did this to carry out the words of the law written in the book that Hilkiah the priest had found in the house of the LORD.
translation: Na Josiah i rausim ol saman bilong spirik na ol man bilong wokim tok bilong devil, gods bilong husat, idols, na ol samting nogut ol i stap long grin bilong Yuda na long Jerusalem. Em i mekim dispela wok long wokim ol tok bilong lo we Hilkiah prist i finautim long haus bilong LORD.

original: Neither before nor after Josiah was there any king like him, who turned to the LORD with all his heart and with all his soul and with all his strength, according to all the Law of Moses.
translation: Bikos long bipo na bikos long nait, Josiah i no gat papa bilong kantri olsem en, em i kam bek long LORD wantaim ol het bilong en na wantaim ol saul bilong en na wantaim ol strong bilong en, olsem Lo Bilong Mosese.

original: Nevertheless, the LORD did not turn away from the fury of His burning anger, which was kindled against Judah because of all that Manasseh had done to provoke Him to anger.
translation: Papa God i no lusim bek long has long faya bilong popai, bilong em i kirapim bel hat long Juda, bikos olgeta wok Manase i mekim bilong wokim Papa God popai.

original: For the LORD had said, “I will remove Judah from My sight, just as I removed Israel. I will reject this city Jerusalem, which I chose, and the temple of which I said, ‘My Name shall be there.’”
translation: Bikos LORD i tok olsem, "Mi bai rausim Yuda long ai bilong mi, olsem na mi bin rausim Israel. Mi bai tromwe ka long dispela taun Jerusalem, we mi bin chusim, na haos bilong Lotu, we mi tok olsem 'Nem bilong mi bai stap long hap'."

original: As for the rest of the acts of Josiah, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting na wonem em i mekim, ol i no raitim yet long Buk Bilong Taim Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: At the end of Josiah’s reign, Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt marched up to help the king of Assyria at the Euphrates River. King Josiah went out to confront him, but Neco faced him and killed him at Megiddo.
translation: Taim we Josiah i kamap nau long rigen bilong en, Farao Neko king bilong Ijip i go antap long helpim king bilong Asiria long Rivir Euphrates. King Josiah i go aut long konfronem Neko, tasol Neko i lusim em na kilim em long Megido.

original: From Megiddo his servants carried his body in a chariot, brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah, anointed him, and made him king in place of his father.
translation: Ol i kam bek long Megido, ol sarim bilong em i kisim bodi bilong em long kar, ibin bringim i go long Yerusalem, na ol plantim em insait long hap bilong em. Ol pipol bilong kantri i makim Jehoahaz, pikinini bilong Josiah, ol givim em oili, na ol mekim em king isted long ples bilong papa bilong em.

original: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
translation: Jehoahaz i kamap king na em i gat usikain (23) yr ol, na em i bos long Potivosi tripela mun. Nem bilong mama bilong em i tok Hamutal, Pikinini meri bilong Jeremiah, i kam long Libnah.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his fathers had done.
translation: Na em wok olsem nogut long ai bilong Jehovah, olsem tumbuna bilong em i mekim bifor.

original: And Pharaoh Neco imprisoned Jehoahaz at Riblah in the land of Hamath so that he could not reign in Jerusalem, and he imposed on Judah a levy of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
translation: Na Faraon Neko i kisim Jehoahaz i go long hap longer long Riblah, long kantri bilong Hamath, bilong mekim em i no inap kambek reign long Jerusalem, na em i salim taks long Yuda, em i mekim Yuda i pei hundred talents bilong silva na talent bilong gol.

original: Then Pharaoh Neco made Eliakim son of Josiah king in place of his father Josiah, and he changed Eliakim’s name to Jehoiakim. But Neco took Jehoahaz and carried him off to Egypt, where he died.
translation: Na Pharaoh Neco i mekim Eliakim pikinini bilong Josiah king long hap bilong papa bilong em Josiah, na ol i chanjim nem bilong Eliakim long Jehoiakim. Tasol Neco i kisim Jehoahaz na karamapim i go long Egip, na bihain em i dai long hap.

original: So Jehoiakim paid the silver and gold to Pharaoh Neco, but to meet Pharaoh’s demand he taxed the land and exacted the silver and the gold from the people, each according to his wealth.
translation: Na Jehoiakim i peim silva na gol long Faraoh Neko, tasol olsem Faraoh i askim, em i tok save long moni bilong graun, na kisim silva na gol we i mas peim long ol pipol, bikpela moni ikam long ol bikpela man.

original: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Zebidah daughter of Pedaiah; she was from Rumah.
translation: Jehoiakim i kamap king, em i 25 yia yet, na em i rain long Jerusalem long 11 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Zebidah, daun meri bilong Pedaiah, na em i kam long Rumah.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his fathers had done.
translation: Na em i wok olsem nogut long ai bilong Jehovah, olsem tumbuna bilong em i bin wok.

original: During Jehoiakim’s reign, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon invaded. So Jehoiakim became his vassal for three years, until he turned and rebelled against Nebuchadnezzar.
translation: Long taim Jehoiakim i stap king, Nebukadnesa king bilong Babilon i kam na winim. Na Jehoiakim i go bek gen na bung wantaim Nebukadnesa olsem vassal bilong em long tripela yia, tasol em i turnim bek gen na nogut long Nebukadnesa.

original: And the LORD sent Chaldean, Aramean, Moabite, and Ammonite raiders against Jehoiakim in order to destroy Judah, according to the word that the LORD had spoken through His servants the prophets.
translation: Na Lod i sendim Kaldea, Aramia, Moab, na Amon poroman long Jehoiakim olsem i go daunim Yuda, olsem toktok bilong em i tok bikos em i bin tok long wokman prophets bilong en.

original: Surely this happened to Judah at the LORD’s command, to remove them from His presence because of the sins of Manasseh and all that he had done,
translation: Em i kamap long Yuda long tok bilong Lod, bilong rausim ol long hesen bilong Em, bikos ol bikhet bilong Manase na ol samting em i mekim.

original: and also for the innocent blood he had shed. For he had filled Jerusalem with innocent blood, and the LORD was unwilling to forgive.
translation: Na long bloda i nnos bilong em i spil, em i fulapim Jiusalem wantaim bloda i nnos, na LORD i no wanbel isi.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, along with all his accomplishments, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
translation: Long olgeta samting na strongpela wok bilong Jehoiakim, harim i no bin raitim ol i go insait long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King bilong Yuda?

original: And Jehoiakim rested with his fathers, and his son Jehoiachin reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehoiakim i istap long ples bilong tumbuna ol, na yusum Jehoiachin i kam bek long en, na i kisim ples.

original: Now the king of Egypt did not march out of his land again, because the king of Babylon had taken all his territory, from the Brook of Egypt to the Euphrates River.
translation: Nau king bilong Ijip i no go wai long graun bilong en tena, wantaim na king bilong Babilon ol i kisim olgeta graun bilong em, stat long Warabul bilong Ijip kaikai go long Rivibul Eufrates.

original: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. His mother’s name was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan; she was from Jerusalem.
translation: Jehoiachin i kamap king na em i gat uk18 despela yia, na em i rain long Jerusalem long tripela mun. Nem bilong mama bilong em Nehushta, gel bilong Elnathan, na em i stap long Jerusalem.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his father had done.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, olsem tisa father bilong em i mekim.

original: At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched up to Jerusalem, and the city came under siege.
translation: Long taim ia, ol iwerkman bilong Nebukadnezar king bilong Babilon i go ap long Jerusalem, na siti ia i kam antap long faet.

original: And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to the city while his servants were besieging it.
translation: Na Nebukadnesa king bilong Babilon i kam long ples, wail em yet servants bilong em i stopim ples, i mekim ol i no inap go insait na outsait.

original: Jehoiachin king of Judah, his mother, his servants, his commanders, and his officials all surrendered to the king of Babylon. So in the eighth year of his reign, the king of Babylon took him captive.
translation: Jehoiachin king bilong Yuda, mama bilong en, servan bilong en, ol komanda bilong en, na ol ofisa bilong en i givim ap long king bilong Babilon. Ol i kisim em i go we long yia namba et bilong paitim bilong em, na king bilong Babilon i kisim em i go we.

original: As the LORD had declared, Nebuchadnezzar also carried off all the treasures from the house of the LORD and the royal palace, and he cut into pieces all the gold articles that Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the LORD.
translation: Olsem Olgeta long tok bilong LORD, Nebukadnesa hamarim na kisim olgeta samting bilong value long haus bilong LORD na long haus bilong king, na katim i go olgeta artil bilong gol ol i mekim long taim bilong Solomon king bilong Israel long haus bilong LORD.

original: He carried into exile all Jerusalem—all the commanders and mighty men of valor, all the craftsmen and metalsmiths—ten thousand captives in all. Only the poorest people of the land remained.
translation: Em i kisim i go long exile ol Jerusalem olgeta - ol ofisa komanda na man bilong pait, strong na gutpela, wokman bilong han na man bilong wokim samting long metel - ten thousand prison bilong war olgeta. Tasol pikinini manmeri i stap yet long kantri.

original: Nebuchadnezzar carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon, as well as the king’s mother, his wives, his officials, and the leading men of the land. He took them into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
translation: Nebukadnezar i kisim Jeojakini na i kam bek long Babilon, mama bilong king, wives bilong en, ofisa na wokmanmeri, na ol bikpela man bilong kantri. Ol i pulim ol i go long wei, ol i kisim ol go long Babilon, tume long Jerusalem.

original: The king of Babylon also brought into exile to Babylon all seven thousand men of valor and a thousand craftsmen and metalsmiths—all strong and fit for battle.
translation: King bilong Babolon i kam long exile long Babolon olsem seven tausen man bilong pait na wan tausen ol man bilong wok kan na ol man bilong mekim samting long metal – ol i strong na inap long pait.

original: Then the king of Babylon made Mattaniah, Jehoiachin’s uncle, king in his place and changed his name to Zedekiah.
translation: King bilong Babilon i mekim Mattaniah, anglim bilong Jehoiachin, i kamap king insait long hap bilong em, na i chanim nem bilong em long Zedekiah.

original: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
translation: Zedekiah i kamap king, em i gat twenty-one yia, na em i rulim long Potisin bilong Solomon eleven yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Hamutal, meri bilong Jeremiah, na em i kam long Libnah.

original: And Zedekiah did evil in the sight of the LORD, just as Jehoiakim had done.
translation: Na Zedekiah i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, olsem olsem Jehoiakim i mekim.

original: For because of the anger of the LORD, all this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until He finally banished them from His presence. And Zedekiah also rebelled against the king of Babylon.
translation: Bikos i kam long rausim bilong LORD, olgeta dispela i kamap long Jerusalem na Yuda, na em i go inap long em i rausim ol long hes. Na Zedekia tu i bagarap long king bilong Babilon.

original: So in the ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They encamped outside the city and built a siege wall all around it.
translation: Long ninth yia bilong rein bilong Zedekiah, long tenth de bihain long tenth mun, Nebukadnezar king bilong Babilon i kam bek gen long Jerusalem wantaim ol solja bilong en. Ol i kamp besait long sitibill na mekim barakel bigpela all around.

original: And the city was kept under siege until King Zedekiah’s eleventh year.
translation: Na taun i bin halivim long siej, na go long yia eleven bilong King Zedekaya.

original: By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine in the city was so severe that the people of the land had no food.
translation: Long nain dei bilong fourth mun, famin i kam strong tumas long ples, na ol pipol bilong kantri i no gat kaikai.

original: Then the city was breached; and though the Chaldeans had surrounded the city, all the men of war fled by night by way of the gate between the two walls near the king’s garden. They headed toward the Arabah,
translation: Na siti ibin brokin; na Kaldea ol i kam ronndaun siti na klosim em, tasol ol man bilong wok war i ranawe long nait long rot bilong get bilong tu wal jus baisait long gaden bilong king. Ol i go daun long ples Arabah.

original: but the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king and overtook him in the plains of Jericho, and all his army was separated from him.
translation: Bata bilong Kaldea i go beklong king na ol i kam apim em long plains bilong Jeriko, na ol solja bilong en i stap wail long en.

original: The Chaldeans seized the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah, where they pronounced judgment on him.
translation: Kaldea i kisim king i go, bekim i go long king bilong Babilon long Riblah, na ol i givim sentens long em.

original: And they slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. Then they put out his eyes, bound him with bronze shackles, and took him to Babylon.
translation: Na ol i kilim ol pikinini bilong Zedekia bifo ai bilong em. Ol i kisim ai bilong em, binim em wantaim selib bilong bronz, na kisim em i go long Babylon.

original: On the seventh day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar’s reign over Babylon, Nebuzaradan captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.
translation: Long naiten de bilong fifis mun, long nambawan tein yia bilong pisinis Nabukadnesa i stap king bilong Babilon, Nebuzaradan kapten bilong gadi, wanpela sarviman bilong king bilong Babilon, i go insait long Yerusalem.

original: He burned down the house of the LORD, the royal palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem—every significant building.
translation: Em i bakim daun haus bilong God, haus bilong king, na ol haus bilong Jerusalem – olpela hap bilong haus i gat bikpela valiu.

original: And the whole army of the Chaldeans under the captain of the guard broke down the walls around Jerusalem.
translation: Na olgeta armi bilong Kaldea, unda long kapten bilong gadien, ol bagarapim fence bilong Jerusalem.

original: Then Nebuzaradan captain of the guard carried into exile the people who remained in the city, along with the deserters who had defected to the king of Babylon and the rest of the population.
translation: Nebuzaradan kapten bilong gadien i kisim i go long exile ol pipol i stap yet long siti, ol i ranawe i go bek gen long king bilong Babilon na ol narapela pipol.

original: But the captain of the guard left behind some of the poorest of the land to tend the vineyards and fields.
translation: Kapten bilong gadi lusim bihain ol pikinini na bikpela i no gat kantri long kantri, ol i kisim ka long ganpela vines na graun.

original: Moreover, the Chaldeans broke up the bronze pillars and stands and the bronze Sea in the house of the LORD, and they carried the bronze to Babylon.
translation: Na Kaldea i go apo, ol i brukim pila bronz na stend na Solwara Branz long haus bilong LORD, na ol i kisim bronz na karry i go long Babylon.

original: They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes, and all the articles of bronze used in the temple service.
translation: Ol i kisim na i karim i go ol pok, speda, ol samting bilong kliaim laine bilong lantana, dishes, na olgeta samting bilong bronzi ol i usim long wok bilong haos.

original: The captain of the guard also took away the censers and sprinkling bowls—anything made of pure gold or fine silver.
translation: Kapten bilong gadien i tainim we i go censas na bol bilong sprinkle - olgeta samting em i mekim long gol bilong paita o silva bilong klostre.

original: As for the two pillars, the Sea, and the movable stands that Solomon had made for the house of the LORD, the weight of the bronze from all these articles was beyond measure.
translation: Long tupela pilia, Solwara, na stend ol i go wankain olsem we Solomon i mekim long haus bilong Jehovah, wet bilong bronz na ol samting em i go longwe beyon ken.

original: Each pillar was eighteen cubits tall. The bronze capital atop one pillar was three cubits high, with a network of bronze pomegranates all around. The second pillar, with its network, was similar.
translation: Nambis pilia i go long eighteen cubit. Bronz kapital ibin go antap wanpela pilia i go long three cubit, wantaim netwok bilong bronz pomegranate ol abaut. Nanpela pilia, wantaim netwok bilong en, i samoring.

original: The captain of the guard also took away Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest of second rank, and the three doorkeepers.
translation: Kaptin bilong gadi i kisim wei Seraiah bikpela pries, Zephaniah pries bilong sekend renk, na ol thri man i lukaut doro.

original: Of those still in the city, he took a court official who had been appointed over the men of war, as well as five royal advisors. He also took the scribe of the captain of the army, who had enlisted the people of the land, and sixty men who were found in the city.
translation: Em i takim ofisal bilong kot we i stap yet long taun, nau em i bam bekim bos bilong ol man bilong wok war, na em i kisim tu ol advaiza bilong king, skarari bilong kapten bilong armi we i skulim ol pipol bilong kantri, na sixty man we i lain findim long taun.

original: Nebuzaradan captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
translation: Nebuzaradan, kapten bilong gadi, em i kisim ol, na em i bringim ol i go long king bilong Babilon lonng Riblah.

original: There at Riblah in the land of Hamath, the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death. So Judah was taken into exile, away from its own land.
translation: Long Riblah klostu long kantri Hamath, king bilong Babel i kilim ol i dai. Na Yus i go long exile, longwe ples bilong em yet.

original: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, over the people he had left behind in the land of Judah.
translation: Nebukadnezar king bilong Babel i apointim Gedalia, pikinini bilong Ahikam, we em i pikinini bilong Shaphan, olsem gavana long ol pipol we em i lusim bihain long lan bilong Yuda.

original: When all the commanders of the armies and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah as governor, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah son of the Maacathite, as well as their men.
translation: Wanpela taim ol komanda bilong ol armi na ol man bilong ol harim olsem king bilong Babilon inapointim Gedaliah olsem gavana, ol i kam kasol long Gedaliah long Mizpah - Ishmael sambai bilong Nethaniah, Johanan sambai bilong Kareah, Seraiah sambai bilong Tanhumeth na Netophathite, na Jaazaniah sambai bilong Maacathite, na ol man bilong ol yet.

original: And Gedaliah took an oath before them and their men, assuring them, “Do not be afraid of the servants of the Chaldeans. Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will be well with you.”
translation: Na Gedaliah i tok bai olem, i givim skelim i go long ol, olsem: “No ken kirap long wokman bilong Kaldea. Stap long kantri, sarvim king bilong Babilon, na olgeta bai go strong long yu.”

original: In the seventh month, however, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, who was a member of the royal family, came with ten men and struck down and killed Gedaliah, along with the Judeans and Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.
translation: Long mun seven, Ishmael sambai bilong Nethaniah, sambai bilong Elishama, i stap long famili bilong king, i kam wantaim ten man na i kilim Gedaliah, wantaim Judean na Kaldea i stap wantaim em long Mizpah.

original: Then all the people small and great, together with the commanders of the army, arose and fled to Egypt for fear of the Chaldeans.
translation: Ol pipol liklik na bikpela, long na ofisa bilong solja, ol i kamap nabauta na ranawe i go long Ijip, ol i bikim bikim tok bilong Chaldeans.

original: On the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month of the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Judah’s King Jehoiachin, in the year Evil-merodach became king of Babylon, he released King Jehoiachin of Judah from prison.
translation: Long wik 27 long mun 12 long yia 37 bilong dekpin bilong King Jehoiachin bilong Yuda, long yia Evil-merodach i kamap king bilong Babilon, i lakim King Jehoiachin bilong Yuda na lusim prisin.

original: And he spoke kindly to Jehoiachin and set his throne above the thrones of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
translation: Na em i tok swei long Jehoiachin na em i putim trohn bilong en long hap, trohn bilong en i go antap long trohn bilong ol kings narakai i stap wantaim em long Babilon.

original: So Jehoiachin changed out of his prison clothes, and he dined regularly at the king’s table for the rest of his life.
translation: Na Jehoiachin i kamap nau long nupela klos bilong en, na i kaikai olgeta taim long tebol bilong king long taim olsem.

original: And the king provided Jehoiachin a daily portion for the rest of his life.
translation: Na king i givim Jehoiachin porisen bilong dei ka moning long laip bilong en, long ol dek bilong taim bai i kam.

original: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
translation: Adam, Set, Enos,

original: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
translation: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared

original: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech.
translation: Enok, Metusalem, Lamtek.

original: The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Noa: Sem, Ham, na Jafet.

original: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jafet: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Mesek, na Tiras.

original: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, na Togarmah.

original: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, ol Kittites, na ol Rodanites.

original: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ham: Kus, Mizraim, Put, na Kanaan.

original: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, na Sabteca. Ol pikinini bilong Raamah: Sheba na Dedan.

original: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one on the earth.
translation: Kus em papa bilong Nimrod, husat i stat long kamap man strongpela long graun.

original: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,
translation: Mizraim em papa bilong Ludait, Anamait, Lehabait, Naphtuhit, na ol desenden bilong en i kamap ol narapela tribe.

original: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.
translation: Ol Pathrusites, ol Kasluites (husat i kam bek long ol Filistia), na ol Kafitorites.

original: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
translation: Na Kanaan em papa bilong Sidon, pikinini bilong en i kam first, na bilong Hiti.

original: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
translation: Ol Jebusi, ol Amori, ol Girgasiti,

original: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
translation: Ol Hiviti, Ol Arkaiti, Ol Siniti,

original: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
translation: Ol Arvadi, ol Zemari, na ol Hamati.

original: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, na Aram. Ol pikinini bilong Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, na Meshech.

original: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.
translation: Arpaksad em papa bilong Selah, na Selah em papa bilong Heber.

original: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan.
translation: Tu ol pikinini i kamap long Eber: Wan i kolim Peleg, bikos long taim bilong em, erth i go daun long hap, na brata bilong em i kolim Joktan.

original: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
translation: Na Joktan em papa bilong Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

original: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
translation: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong manmeri na ples.

original: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
translation: Obal, Abimael, Siba, nem bilong ol ples na man i stap long Nem bilong Bibel.

original: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
translation: Ofira, Havila, na Jobab. Olgeta dispela i bin pikinini bilong Joktan.

original: So from Shem came Arphaxad, Shelah,
translation: Na long ol i kam bek gen from Sem, Arpaksad, Selah

original: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
translation: Iba, Pelek, Ru, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Baibel.

original: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
translation: Serug, Nahor, Terah, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Biblikal nem na lain.

original: and Abram (that is, Abraham).
translation: Na Abram, em i mak olsem, Abraham.

original: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Abraham em i Isaac na Ishmael.

original: These are their genealogies: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
translation: Dispela em i storia bilong ol: Nebaioth em i pikanini namba wan bilong Ishmael, na bihain Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam.

original: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
translation: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, ol nem bilong ples na manmeri bilong Baibol, em i go olsem: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema.

original: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
translation: Jetur, Naphish, na Kedemah. Ol i stap pikinini bilong Ishmael.

original: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
translation: Ol pikinini i kam long Keturah, meri bilong servis bilong Abraham: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, na Shuah. Ol pikinini bilong Jokshan: Sheba na Dedan.

original: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All of these were Keturah’s sons.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Midian: Epha, Efer, Hanok, Abida, na Eldaah. Ol dispela i go we: ol i bikpela pikinini bilong Keturah.

original: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
translation: Abram em papa bilong Isak. Pikinini bilong Isak: Esau na Israel.

original: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, na Korah.

original: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, na Kenaz; na long taim bilong Timna, Amalek.

original: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, na Mizzah.

original: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, na Dishan.

original: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Lotan: Hori na Homam. Timna em sis bilong Lotan.

original: The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, na Onam. Ol pikinini bilong Zibeon: Aiah na Anah.

original: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
translation: Pikinini bilong Anah: Dishon. Ol pikinini bilong Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, na Cheran.

original: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, na Akan. Ol pikinini bilong Dishan: Uz na Aran.

original: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor. His city was named Dinhabah.
translation: Kings i bin stap na rulim kantri Edom bifora eni king i kam rulim ol Israelites: Bela man bilong Beor. Taun bilong em inap nem Dinhabah.

original: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Bela i dai pinis, Jobab sussa Zerah i kam bihain long en, i bos long hap blong en, long Bozrah.

original: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Jobab i dai pinis, Husam long kantri bilong Temanait i kam bihain long em.

original: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith.
translation: Taim Husham i dai pinis, Hadad man bilong Bedad, i winim Midian long kantri bilong Moab, i bos long hap bilong en. Na nem bilong taun bilong en em Avith.

original: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Hadad i dai pinis, Samlah from Masrekah i kam bihain long em na i bos.

original: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Samlah i dai pinis, Shaul from Rehoboth long Euphrates i kam bihain long em, na i bos long ples bilong en.

original: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Shaul i dai, Baal-hanan pikinini bilong Achbor i kam bos long hap bilong en.

original: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.
translation: Taim Baal-hanan i dai pinis, Hadad i bos long hap bilong en. Taun bilong em inap nem Pau, na meri bilong en i kolim Mehetabel, pikinini meri bilong Matred, pikinini meri bilong Me-zahab.

original: Then Hadad died. Now the chiefs of Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
translation: Na Hadad i dai pinis. Nau ol bikpela man bilong Edom i stap: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

original: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
translation: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon, ol i stap long lis bilong nem.

original: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
translation: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar, ol i stap long lis bilong nem.

original: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
translation: Magdiel, na Iram. Ol i bikpela bos bilong Edom ol i stap.

original: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
translation: Ol i stap long pikinini bilong Isrel: Ruben, Simeon, Levi, Juta, Isakar, Sebulon

original: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
translation: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, na Asher.

original: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanite. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD, who put him to death.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Juda: Er, Onan, na Shelah. Ol i kamap long en bikos Bath-shua kanaka bilong Kanaan. Er, pikinini bilong papa bilong Juda, em i bin mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, na LORD i biruaim em, na kilim em.

original: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
translation: Tamar, dota meri bilong Judah, i karim bebé long em, ol i kolim Perez na Zerah. Judah i gat faiv pikinini olgeta.

original: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Perez: Hezron na Hamul.

original: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, na Dara—em i gat faiv olgeta.

original: The son of Carmi: Achar, who brought trouble upon Israel by violating the ban on devoted things.
translation: Susa bilong Karmi: Akara, we i bringim hamarim bel hat long Israel long bilakim ban long samting bilong dediket.

original: The son of Ethan: Azariah.
translation: Pikinini bilong Ethan: Azaria.

original: The sons who were born to Hezron: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.
translation: Ol pikinini i kam long Hezron: Jerahmeel, Ram, na Caleb.

original: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, a leader of the descendants of Judah.
translation: Ram em i papa bilong Amminadab, na Amminadab em i papa bilong Nahshon, wanpela lidaman bilong ol desenden bilong Yuda.

original: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, and Salmon was the father of Boaz.
translation: Nahshon em papa bilong Salmon, na Salmon em papa bilong Boaz.

original: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.
translation: Boaz em papa bilong Obed, na Obed em papa bilong Jesse.

original: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; Abinadab was born second, Shimea third,
translation: Jesi em papa bilong Eliab, em bikpela pikinini bilong en, Abinadab i kam bihain long sekend, Shimea i kam tripa.

original: Nethanel fourth, Raddai fifth,
translation: Nethanel foa, Raddai faif,

original: Ozem sixth, and David seventh.
translation: Ozem ikis, na Daved sevendi.

original: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.
translation: Susa meri bilong ol i Zeruiah na Abigail. Na tripela man bilong Zeruiah i Abishai, Joab, na Asahel.

original: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
translation: Abigail em mama bilong Amasa, em papa bilong em Jether relisen bilong Ishmaelite.

original: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. These were the sons of Azubah: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
translation: Kaleb man bilong Hezron i gat ol pikinini long wes meri Azubah na long Jerioth. Dispela ol i stap bilong Azubah: Jesher, Shobab, na Ardon.

original: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore to him Hur.
translation: Taim Azuba i dai, Kalebu i marit Ephrata, na Ephrata i karim bebi long em Hur.

original: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.
translation: Hur i papa bilong Uri, na Uri i papa bilong Bezalel.

original: Later, Hezron slept with the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. He had married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore to him Segub.
translation: Hezron i go na kisim meri bilong Machir, papa bilong Gilead. Em i stap sixty yia olsem, na em i marit wantaim meri, meri i karim bek long em, na i banis Segub.

original: Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
translation: Segub em papa bilong Jair, em i gat twenty-three towns long lan bilong Gilead.

original: But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth-jair, along with Kenath and its sixty surrounding villages. All these were descendants of Machir the father of Gilead.
translation: Bareket, Geshur na Aram i kisim Havvoth-jair, longsides Kenath na vilij 60 i karai bilong en. Ol dispela i pikinini bilong Machir, papa bilong Gilead.

original: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, his wife Abijah bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
translation: Hezron i dai pinis long Kalebu-Efrata, meri bilong em Abijah i karim bek na bambekim Ashhur, papa bilong Tekoa.

original: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jerahmeel, pikinini namba wan bilong Hezron: Ram, pikinini namba wan bilong em, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, na Ahijah.

original: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam.
translation: Jerahmeel i gat anpela meri yet, nem bilong em Atarah, em i mama bilong Onam.

original: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ram, pikinini namba wan bilong Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, na Eker.

original: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Onam: Shammai na Jada. Ol pikinini bilong Shammai: Nadab na Abishur.

original: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, and she bore to him Ahban and Molid.
translation: Meri bilong Abishur i gat nem Abihail, na meri i karim bek long em Ahban na Molid.

original: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Nadab: Seled na Appaim. Seled i dai na em i no go het long ol pikinini.

original: The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.
translation: Pikinini bilong Appaim: Ishi. Pikinini bilong Ishi: Sheshan. Pikinini bilong Sheshan: Ahlai.

original: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jada, brata bilong Shammai, em i Jether na Jonathan. Jether i dai na i no karim pikinini.

original: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jonathan: Peleth na Zaza. Dispela i kam long ol desenden bilong Jerahmeel.

original: Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters; but he did have an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
translation: Sheshan i no go het pikinini man, na tasol hap meri; bai em i gat wanpela sarve garas bilong Egip we nem bilong em Jarha.

original: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore to him Attai.
translation: Sheshan i givim bel meri bilong en long wokman bilong en, Jarha, na meri bilong en i karim bek gen Attai.

original: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan was the father of Zabad,
translation: Attai em papa bilong Natan, Natan em papa bilong Zabad,

original: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, Ephlal was the father of Obed,
translation: Zabad i papa bilong Ephlal, na Ephlal i papa bilong Obed,

original: Obed was the father of Jehu, Jehu was the father of Azariah,
translation: Obed em papa bilong Jehu, Jehu em papa bilong Azariah,

original: Azariah was the father of Helez, Helez was the father of Elasah,
translation: Azaria o papa bilong Helez, Helez em papa bilong Elasah,

original: Elasah was the father of Sismai, Sismai was the father of Shallum,
translation: Elas em papa bilong Sismai, Sismai em papa bilong Salum

original: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.
translation: Shalum em papa bilong Jekamiah, na Jekamiah em papa bilong Elishama.

original: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and Mareshah his second son, who was the father of Hebron.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Caleb, brata bilong Jerahmeel: Mesha em i namba wan pikinini, em i papa bilong Ziph, na Mareshah em i namba tu pikinini, em i papa bilong Hebron.

original: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, na Shema.

original: Shema was the father of Raham the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem was the father of Shammai.
translation: Shema em papa bilong Raham, na Raham em papa bilong Jorkeam, na Rekem em papa bilong Shammai.

original: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.
translation: Sut bilong Shammai em i Maon, na Maon em papa bilong Bet-sur.

original: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
translation: Caleb i gat meri bun tupela, nem bilong wan em Ephah, na em i mama bilong Haran, Moza, na Gazez. Haran i papa bilong Gazez.

original: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, na Shaaph.

original: Caleb’s concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
translation: Kaleb meri blong em, Maakaa, em mama bilong Sheba na Tirhana.

original: She was also the mother of Shaaph father of Madmannah, and of Sheva father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Acsah.
translation: Em i mama tu bilong Siap, papa bilong Madimana, na bilong Seva, papa bilong Makabena na Gibe. Dauti bilong Kalep em i Akasa.

original: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
translation: Ol descentan bilong Caleb oli stap. Pikinini bilong Hur, em i papa bilong Ephrathah: Shobal em i papa bilong Kiriath-jearim.

original: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
translation: Salma papa bilong Betlehem, na Hareph papa bilong Bet-Gader.

original: These were the descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Shobal, papa bilong Kiriath-jearim, em i gat: Haroeh, hap halftaim bilong Manahathites.

original: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim—the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
translation: Na ol klans bilong Kiriath-jearim – Ol Ithrite, Ol Puthite, Ol Shumathite, na Ol Mishraite. Ol i kam bek long dispela, na ol Zorathite na Eshtaolite i kam apo long ol.

original: The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Salma: Betlehem, ol Netofati, Atrot-bet-joab, hap tok bilong ol Manahati, na ol Zoriti,

original: and the clans of the scribes who lived at Jabez—the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
translation: Na ol clan bilong ol skraba i stap long Jabez – ol Tirathites, Shimeathites, na Sucathites. Dispela i ol Kenites i kam long Hammath, papa bilong haus bilong Rechab.

original: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon by Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second was Daniel by Abigail of Carmel;
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Daudi i kamap long em Hebon: Nambawan pikinini em i Amnon, mama bilong em Ahinoam bilong Jezri; nambatu em i Daniel, mama bilong em Abigal bilong Kamel.

original: the third was Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur; the fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith;
translation: Na trista em i Absalom, sampela pikinini bilong Maacah, mana meri bilong King Talmai long hap Geshur; na foa em i Adonijah, sampela pikinini bilong Haggith;

original: the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital; and the sixth was Ithream by his wife Eglah.
translation: Namba five em i Shephatiah long Abital; na namba six em i Ithream long meri bilong en Eglah.

original: These six sons were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. And David reigned in Jerusalem thirty-three years,
translation: Sikis pikinini man i kam long Daud long Hebron, ples we em i painim bos seven yia na sikis mun. Na Daud i bos long Jerusalem thirty-three yia.

original: and these sons were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon. These four were born to him by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.
translation: Na dispela ol pikinini i kamap long em long Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Natan, na Solomon. Dispela fourpela i kamap long em olsem wain meri Bathsheba, Pikinini meri bilong Ammiel.

original: David’s other sons were Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,
translation: Olsa pikinini bilong Daud em i gat Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet.

original: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
translation: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, ol i stap long nem bilong Bikpela Buk.

original: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine in all.
translation: Elishama, Eliada, na Eliphelet—nain bilong ol.

original: These were all the sons of David, besides the sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
translation: Ol i stap, ol pikinini bilong Davide, apa long ol pikinini em i gat long ol meri em i bin givim em. Na Tamar em i susa bilong ol.

original: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam: Abijah was his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
translation: Pikinini bilong Solomon em i Rehoboam, Abijah em i pikinini bilong em, Asa em i pikinini bilong em, Jehoshaphat em i pikinini bilong em.

original: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
translation: Joram pikinini bilong en, Ahaziah pikinini bilong en, Joash pikinini bilong en,

original: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
translation: Amaziah pikinini bilong en, Azariah pikinini bilong en, Jotham pikinini bilong en,

original: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
translation: Ahaz i pikinini bilong en, Hezekiah i pikinini bilong en, Manasseh i pikinini bilong en,

original: Amon his son, and Josiah his son.
translation: Amon pikinini bilong en, na Josiah pikinini bilong en.

original: The sons of Josiah: Johanan was the firstborn, Jehoiakim the second, Zedekiah the third, and Shallum the fourth.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Josiah: Johanan em i bikpela pikinini, Jehoiakim em i namba tu, Zedekiah em i namba tri, na Shallum em i namba fo.

original: The successors of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, and Zedekiah.
translation: Ol i kam bihain long Jehoiakim: Jeconiah pikinini bilong em, na Zedekiah.

original: The descendants of Jeconiah the captive: Shealtiel his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Jeconiah, man i go long hap, i stap insait long hap: Shealtiel em i pikinini bilong em.

original: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
translation: Malikiram, Pedaiah, Shenazara, Jekamaya, Hoshama, na Nedabia.

original: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The children of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah, their sister Shelomith,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Pedaiah: Zerubbabel na Shimei. Ol pikinini bilong Zerubbabel: Meshullam na Hananiah, na susa bilong ol i go Shelomith,

original: and five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed.
translation: Na faifa narapela: Hasubuah, Ohel, Berekia, Hasadia, na Jusab-Hesed.

original: The descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah, and of Shecaniah.
translation: Olegta desenden bilong Hananiah: Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, na ol pikinini man bilong Rephaiah, bilong Arnan, bilong Obadiah, na bilong Shecaniah.

original: The six descendants of Shecaniah were Shemaiah and his sons: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat.
translation: Sik Descendant bilong Shecaniah em i Shemaiah na ol pikinini bilong em: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, na Shaphat.

original: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam—three in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, na Azrikam – ol i go tripela tasol.

original: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—seven in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Elioenai: Hodavia, Eliasib, Pelaia, Akkub, Johanan, Delaia, na Anani—seven olgeta.

original: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Yuda: Perez, Hezron, Kami, Hur, na Shobal.

original: Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
translation: Reaiah pikinini bilong Shobal em i papa bilong Jahath, na Jahath em i papa bilong Ahumai na Lahad. Ol dispela clan bilong Zorathites ol i stap.

original: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. And their sister was named Hazzelelponi.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Etam em i Jezreel, Ishma, na Idbash, na susa bilong ol i kolim Hazzelelponi.

original: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and the father of Bethlehem.
translation: Penuel em papa bilong Gedor, na Ezer em papa bilong Hushah. Ol dispela i kam bilong Hur, bikpela pikinini bilong Efrata, papa bilong Betlehem.

original: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
translation: Ashhur papa bilong Tekoa em i gat tu meri, Helah na Naarah.

original: Naarah bore to him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.
translation: Naarah i karim bekim em Ahuzam, Hefer, Temeni, na Haahashtari. Ol i stap long famili bilong Naarah, ol desenden bilong em.

original: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Helah em i ol Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan

original: and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Zobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
translation: Na Koz, em papa bilong ol, papa bilong Anub na Zobebah, na bilong ol klana bilong Aharhel, pikinini bilong Harum.

original: Now Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him in pain.”
translation: Nau Jabez i moa gat respek long ol brata bilong en. Mama bilong em i givim em dispela nem, Jabez, olsem, "Bikos mi karim em long pain."

original: And Jabez called out to the God of Israel, “If only You would bless me and enlarge my territory! May Your hand be with me and keep me from harm, so that I will be free from pain.” And God granted the request of Jabez.
translation: Na Jabez i kalim i go long God bilong Israel, “Mi laik yu givim mi bles na kirapim kauntri bilong mi! Han bilong yu i kam wantaim mi na bekim ol samting nogut long mi, na mi kamap fri long pain.” Na God i givim askim bilong Jabez.

original: Chelub the brother of Shuhah was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
translation: Chelub brata bilong Shuhah em i papa bilong Mehir, na Mehir em i papa bilong Eshton.

original: Eshton was the father of Beth-rapha, of Paseah, and of Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These were the men of Recah.
translation: Eshton em i papa bilong Bet-Rafa, Paseah, na Tehina, papa bilong Ir-Nahas. Ol man hia i stap long Reka.

original: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kenaz: Othniel na Seraiah. Ol pikinini bilong Othniel: Hathath na Meonothai.

original: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah, and Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of those living in Ge-harashim, which was given this name because its people were craftsmen.
translation: Meonothai em i papa bilong Ophrah, na Seraiah em i papa bilong Joab, papa bilong ol manmeri i stap long Ge-harashim, ol i kisim nem Ge-harashim bikos ol manmeri bilong en i wokman.

original: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Caleb, mak bilong Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, na Naam. Pikinini bilong Elah: Kenaz.

original: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, na Asarel.

original: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. And Mered’s wife Bithiah gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ezrah: Jeter, Mered, Efer, na Jalon. Na Meret meri Bithiah i karim bek na bornim Miriam, Shammai, na Ishbah papa bilong Eshtemoa.

original: These were the children of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah. Mered also took a Judean wife, who gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Pikaro meri Bithiah em i stap. Mered i kisim meri Judea, na meri Judea i karim bel na bam bikim Jered papa bilong Gedor, Heber papa bilong Soco, na Jekuthiel papa bilong Zanoah.

original: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and of Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong meri Hodiah, susa bilong Naham, em i ol papa bilong Keilah man Garmite na bilong Eshtemoa man Maacathite.

original: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, na Tilon. Ol desenden bilong Ishi: Zoheth na Ben-zoheth.

original: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth-ashbea,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shelah, papa bilong Yuda: Er papa bilong Lekah, Laadah papa bilong Maresha na ol clans bilong wokman i save mekim laplap long Bet-ashbea.

original: Jokim, the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi-lehem. (These names are from ancient records.)
translation: Jokim, ol man bilong Cozeba, na Joash na Saraph, ol i bin gavman long Moab na Jashubi-lehem. (Dispela nem i kam bek long taim bifo raun.)

original: These were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah. They lived there in the service of the king.
translation: Ol pottama ol i stap long Netaim na Gederah, na ol i wokim pot long servismet bilong king.

original: The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, na Shaul.

original: The sons of Shaul: Shallum, Mibsam, and Mishma.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shaul: Salum, Mibsam, na Mishma.

original: The sons of Mishma: Hammuel, Zaccur, and Shimei.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Mishma: Hammuel, Zaccur, na Shimei.

original: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children, so their whole clan did not become as numerous as the sons of Judah.
translation: Shimei i gat sikisipela pikinini man na sixpela pikinini meri, tasol bratas bilong em i no gat planti pikinini, nau klam bilong ol i no kamap planti olsem pikinini bilong Yuda.

original: They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,
translation: Ol i stap long Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual, ol nem bilong ples.

original: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
translation: Bilaha, Ezem, Tolad

original: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
translation: Betuel, Homah, Siklag,

original: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
translation: Bet-Markabot, Hazar-Susim, Bet-Biri, na Saaraim. Dispela ol i stap olsem taun bilong ol, long taim bilong yia bilong ol, tasol i stop long tain bilong King Daud.

original: And their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five towns—
translation: Na vilij ol i stap long Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, na Ashan – taun faiv.

original: and all their surrounding villages as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept a genealogical record:
translation: Na olgeta vilij long ailan bilong ol, long wei Baal i go, em i ples ol i stap, na ol i save mekim buk long ol famili bilong ol.

original: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
translation: Meshobab, Jamelek, Josah pikinini bilong Amasia,

original: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (son of Seraiah, son of Asiel),
translation: Joel, Jehu pikinini bilong Joshibiah (Joshibiah em pikinini bilong Seraiah, Seraiah em pikinini bilong Asiel)

original: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
translation: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Jiwipela.

original: and Ziza son of Shiphi (son of Allon, son of Jedaiah, son of Shimri, son of Shemaiah).
translation: Na Ziza pikinini bilong Shiphi, (Shiphi em pikinini bilong Allon, Allon em pikinini bilong Jedaiah, Jedaiah em pikinini bilong Shimri, Shimri em pikinini bilong Shemaiah).

original: These men listed by name were the leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,
translation: Ol man husat i kolim nem, ol i bikpela husat i lidim ol lain bilong ol. Ol pikanini bilong ol i kamap planti.

original: and they journeyed to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, in search of pasture for their flocks.
translation: Ol i go wokabaut, go long entris bilong Gedor, long sait bilong east bilong vali, ol i lukim gras bilong ka bilong ol bulmakau.

original: There they found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful, and quiet; for some Hamites had lived there formerly.
translation: Ol i finim gras na kuk i gutpela, na plaes i lap, stil, na pes; sampela man Hamiti bifo ol i stap hap.

original: These who were noted by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites and Meunites there in their dwellings, devoting them to destruction even to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
translation: Ol dispela i raitim nem bilong ol, kam long taim bilong Hezekia king bilong Yuda. Waria i go bekim ol Hamiti na ol Meuniti long haus bilong ol, na ol i makim ol pipel bilong dei i go daun, na inap long taim nau tasol. Aneh dispela, ol i stat long ples bilong ol, bikos gras bilong animap i planti, na ol animap bilong ol i save kaikai.

original: And five hundred of these Simeonites led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, went to Mount Seir
translation: Na kamap na five hundred Simeonites ol i go bek long Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, na Uzziel, ol pikinini bilong Ishi, i go long Maunt Seir.

original: and struck down the remnant of the Amalekites who had escaped. And they have lived there to this day.
translation: Na kilim ol i stap na pasim ol Amalekitis ol i ranawe na saveman, na ol i stap yet na klostu long tude.

original: These were the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel. Though he was the firstborn, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, because Reuben defiled his father’s bed. So he is not reckoned according to birthright.
translation: Ol i stap long ples Reuben, pikinini bilong bipo bilong Israel. Tasol, em i no inap long rait bilong en bikos Reuben i bagarap bed bilong papa bilong en. Rait bilong en i go long pikinini Joseph, na em i no count olsem long rait bilong bipo.

original: And though Judah prevailed over his brothers and a ruler came from him, the birthright belonged to Joseph.
translation: Na Judah i winim ol brata bilong en, na wanpela bikman i kamap long em, tasol rait bilong birith i bilong Yosep.

original: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Reuben, pikinini namba wan bilong Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, na Carmi.

original: The descendants of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Joel: Shemaiah i pikinini bilong em, Gog i pikinini bilong em, Shimei i pikinini bilong em.

original: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
translation: Mika i pikinimo Reaya i pikinimo Baal i pikinimo

original: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria carried into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.
translation: Na Beerah i pikinini bilong en, whim Tiglath-pileser king bilong Asiria i kisim i go long ples bilong banis. Beerah em i bikpela man bilong ol Reuben.

original: His relatives by their clans are recorded in their genealogy: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,
translation: Ol wantok bilong en na ol lain i stap long ol clan, ol i rakim nam na storii bilong ol: Jeiel big man, Zechariah, long stori bilong ol.

original: and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in Aroer and as far as Nebo and Baal-meon.
translation: Na Bela Pikinini bilong Azaz, azaz em pikinini bilong Shema, shema em pikinini bilong Joel. Ol i stap kamap long Aroer, longwe go long Nebo na Baal-meon.

original: They also settled in the east as far as the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in the land of Gilead.
