translation: Tudei ol i go daunim hap bilong solwara na stap longwe na rausim hap bilong kantri i go daun, ol i kamap klostu long Riv Euphrates, bikos ol kus kus bilong ol i kamap planti long kantri bilong Gilead.

original: During the days of Saul they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands, and they occupied the homes of the Hagrites throughout the region east of Gilead.
translation: Long taim bilong Saul, ol i go stap fight gen ol Hagrites, na ol Hagrites i bin los, na ol i stap long han bilong ol, na ol i go stap long haus bilong ol Hagrites long hap bilong Gilead long sindaun solwara.

original: The descendants of Gad lived next to the Reubenites in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah:
translation: Ol desenden bilong Gad i stap besait long ol Reubenites long lan bilong Bashan, inap long Salecah.

original: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Jaanai and Shaphat, who lived in Bashan.
translation: Joel em i bikpela, Shapham em i namba tu, na bihain long dispela Jaanai na Shaphat, ol i stap long Bashan.

original: Their kinsmen by families were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber—seven in all.
translation: Ol brata bilong ol long famili, em i Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, na Eber – seven olgeta.

original: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Abihail, mak bilong Huri, Jaroah, Gilead, Michael, Jeshishai, Jahdo, na Buz.

original: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.
translation: Ahi pikinini bilong Abdiel, em i pikinini bilong Guni, em i bikpela man bilong ol famili.

original: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its towns, and throughout the pasturelands of Sharon.
translation: Ol i stap long Gilead, long Bashan na vilij long em, na long olgeta hap graun bilong Sharon.

original: All of them were reckoned in the genealogies during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
translation: Ol i kamap long namba bilong ol disciplem long taim bilong Jotam king bilong Yuda na Jeroboam king bilong Israel.

original: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 warriors—valiant men who carried the shield and sword, drew the bow, and were trained for battle.
translation: Ol Reubenites, ol Gadites, na hap-tribe bilong Manasseh i gat 44,760 man bilong wok strong – ol man bilong kaisim gutpela samting, ol i karim skild na sord, ol i sho bow, na ol i lernim pinis long pait.

original: They waged war against the Hagrites, as well as Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
translation: Ol i wokim bikpela fait long ol Hagrait, olsem long Jetur, Naphish, na Nodab.

original: And because they cried out to God in battle, they were helped against their enemies, and the Hagrites and all their allies were delivered into their hands. Because they put their trust in God, He answered their prayers.
translation: Na ol i kirap long God long taim bilong faet, ol i halivim ol gen long han bilong ol, na Hagrites na ol fren bilong ol, ol i givim i go long han bilong ol. Na bikos ol i putim trast bilong ol long God, Em i ansa ol praer bilong ol.

original: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, and 2,000 donkeys. They also took 100,000 captives,
translation: Ol i kisim ol animol bilong Ol Hagrites - 50,000 kemel, 250,000 sip, na 2,000 donki. Ol i kisim tu olsem prisen 100,000 man meri.

original: and many others fell slain, because the battle belonged to God. And they occupied the land until the exile.
translation: Na olgetting i go daun na i dai, bikos dispela bikpela faet i bilong God, na ol i stap long graun, tasol i stop long taim bilong tanim exile.

original: Now the people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous. They settled in the land from Bashan to Baal-hermon (that is, Senir, also known as Mount Hermon).
translation: Nau ol pipol bilong hap tribe bilong Manasseh i gat planti. Ol i stap long graun from Bashan kas long Baal-hermon, em i Senir, mauntain em i Maunt Hermon.

original: These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of their families.
translation: Dispela i bikpela man bilong ples bilong ol: Efer, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremia, Hodavia, na Jahdiel. Ol i man strong na kuraj, ol man bikpela na welkam, na bikpela man bilong ples bilong ol.

original: But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers, and they prostituted themselves with the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
translation: Bare ol i no tru long God bilong tumbuna ol, na ol i mekim poro na sindaun wantaim kina god bilong ples ol, wel God i bin kilim bifo ol.

original: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria) to take the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. And he brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan, where they remain to this day.
translation: God bilong Israel i wokim spirit bilong Pul king bilong Asiria, em i Tiglath-pileser king bilong Asiria, i kamap strong olsem na kisim Reubenites, Gadites, na hap-tribe bilong Manase i go long we bilong dei. Na i bringim ol long Halah, Habor, Hara, na wara bilong Gozan, na ol i stap yet nau.

original: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Levi: Gershon, Kohath, na Merari.

original: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, na Uzziel.

original: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Amram: Aron, Moses, na Miriam. Ol man bilong Aron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, na Ithamar.

original: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas was the father of Abishua,
translation: Eleazar em papa bilong Phinehas, Phinehas em papa bilong Abishua,

original: Abishua was the father of Bukki, Bukki was the father of Uzzi,
translation: Abishua em papa bilong Bukki, Bukki em papa bilong Uzzi,

original: Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth,
translation: Uzzi em papa bilong Zerahiah, Zerahiah em papa bilong Meraioth,

original: Meraioth was the father of Amariah, Amariah was the father of Ahitub,
translation: Meraioth em i papa bilong Amariah, Amariah em i papa bilong Ahitub.

original: Ahitub was the father of Zadok, Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz,
translation: Ahitub em papa bilong Zadok, Zadok em papa bilong Ahimaaz,

original: Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah, Azariah was the father of Johanan,
translation: Ahimaaz em papa bilong Azariah, Azariah em papa bilong Johanan

original: Johanan was the father of Azariah, who served as priest in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem,
translation: Johanan em papa bilong Azariah, i servim olsem priester long tempel we Solomon i bilonim long Jerusalem.

original: Azariah was the father of Amariah, Amariah was the father of Ahitub,
translation: Azariah em papa bilong Amariah, Amariah em papa bilong Ahitub.

original: Ahitub was the father of Zadok, Zadok was the father of Shallum,
translation: Ahitub em papa bilong Zadok, na Zadok em papa bilong Shallum.

original: Shallum was the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah was the father of Azariah,
translation: Shallum em papa bilong Hilkiah, Hilkiah em papa bilong Azariah

original: Azariah was the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.
translation: Azaria em i papa bilong Seraiah, na Seraiah em i papa bilong Jehozadak.

original: Jehozadak went into captivity when the LORD sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
translation: Jehosadak i go long bikim prisen wen GOD bilong yapela i salim Yuda na Yerusalem i go long kantri ejen long han bilong Nabukadnesa.

original: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Levi: Gersom, Kohat, na Merari.

original: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
translation: Dispela em i nem bilong pikinini man bilong Gershom: Libni na Shimei.

original: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, na Uzziel.

original: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Merari: Mahli na Mushi. Dispela ol clan bilong Levait i skulim namel long papa bilong ol.

original: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
translation: Bilong Gershom: Libni pikinini bilong em, Jahath pikinini bilong em, Zimmah pikinini bilong em.

original: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
translation: Joah i bikim pikinini Iddo, Iddo i bikim pikinini Zerah, Zerah i bikim pikinini Jeatherai.

original: The descendants of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Kohath: Amminadab pikinini bilong em, Korah pikinini bilong em, Assir pikinini bilong em.

original: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
translation: Elkanah i pikinim Ebiasaph, Ebiasaph i pikinim Assir

original: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
translation: Tahath i bikim pikinini, na Uriel i bikim pikinini bilong Tahath, Uzziah i bikim pikinini bilong Uriel, na Shaul i bikim pikinini bilong Uzziah.

original: The descendants of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth

original: Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
translation: Elkanah i pikinim Zophai, Zophai i pikinim Nahath

original: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
translation: Eliab i pikinimo bilong en, em i Jeroham, na Jeroham i pikinimo bilong en, em i Elkanah.

original: The sons of Samuel: Joel his firstborn and Abijah his second son.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Samuwel: Yoel em i pikinini namba wan bilong en, na Abiya em i pikinini namba tu bilong en.

original: The descendants of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Merari: Mahli, Libni pikinini bilong em, Shimei pikinini bilong em, Uzzah pikinini bilong em.

original: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son.
translation: Shimea pikinini bilong em, Haggiah pikinini bilong em, na Asaiah pikinini bilong em.

original: These are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the LORD after the ark rested there.
translation: Ol man hedi, Daud i putim ol long kontol long musik long haus bilong Jehovah bihaen ark ibin stopim i go dasol.

original: They ministered with song before the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, until Solomon built the house of the LORD in Jerusalem. And they performed their duties according to the regulations given them.
translation: Ol i sarvis long sang bifor tabenakol, Haus Bilong Miting, until Solomona, King Solomona, bilden haus bilong Jehovah long Jerusalem. Na ol i wokim wok bilong ol according long lo bilong ol.

original: These are the men who served, together with their sons. From the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
translation: Ol man husat i servim, longlong wanpela tasol na ol pikinini bilong ol, long ol Kohati: Eman man i sing, pikinini bilong Joel, pikinini bilong Samuel,

original: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Elkanah, pikinini bilong Jeroham, pikinini bilong Eliel, pikinini bilong Toah

original: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
translation: Pikinini bilong Zuph, pikinini bilong Elkanah, pikinini bilong Mahath, pikinini bilong Amasai,

original: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Elkanah, pikinini bilong Joel, pikinini bilong Azariah, pikinini bilong Zephaniah,

original: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Tahath, pikinini bilong Assir, pikinini bilong Ebiasaph, pikinini bilong Korah,

original: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
translation: Pikinini bilong Izhar, pikinini bilong Kohath, pikinini bilong Levi, pikinini bilong Israel.

original: Heman’s kinsman was Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
translation: Brata bilong Heman i kolim Asaph, em i wok long han raite bilong em: Asaph, pikinini bilong Berechiah, pikinini bilong Shimea,

original: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Michael, pikinini bilong Baaseiah, pikinini bilong Malchijah,

original: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Ethni, pikinini bilong Zerah, pikinini bilong Adaiah,

original: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
translation: Pikinini bilong Ethan, pikinini bilong Zimmah, pikinini bilong Shimei,

original: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
translation: Pikinini bilong Jahath, pikinini bilong Gershom, pikinini bilong Levi.

original: On the left were their kinsmen, the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
translation: Long hap left, ol brata bilong ol, ol pikinini bilong Merari: Etan pikinini bilong Kisi, pikinini bilong Abdi, pikinini bilong Maluku.

original: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
translation: Pikinini bilong Hashabiah, pikinini bilong Amaziah, pikinini bilong Hilkiah,

original: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
translation: Pikinini bilong Amzi, pikinini bilong Bani, pikinini bilong Shemer, ol i stap long rod bilong famili.

original: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
translation: Pikinini bilong Mahli, pikinini bilong Mushi, pikinini bilong Merari, pikinini bilong Levi.

original: Their fellow Levites were assigned to every kind of service of the tabernacle, the house of God.
translation: Ol Levit bilong yumi i gat wok long tabenakl, haus bilong God, na ol i wokim ol kain servos bilong em.

original: But Aaron and his sons did all the work of the Most Holy Place. They presented the offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
translation: Barene Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en i wokim olgeta wok bilong Ples Bilong Holiholi Namba Wan. Ol i bringim ofing long alta bilong ofing bung na long alta bilong smel bung, ol i mekim pekimpais long Israel, olsem Moses i sarvan bilong God i givim tok bilong wokim.

original: These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Aaron: Eleazar pikinini bilong em, Finehas pikinini bilong em, Abishua pikinini bilong em.

original: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
translation: Bukki i pikinini bilong en, Uzzi i pikinini bilong Bukki, Zerahiah i pikinini bilong Uzzi,

original: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
translation: Meraioth pikinini bilong en, Amariah pikinini bilong en, Ahitub pikinini bilong en,

original: Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.
translation: Zadok i pikinim, na Ahimaaz i pikinim.

original: Now these were the territories assigned to the descendants of Aaron from the Kohathite clan for their settlements, because the first lot fell to them:
translation: Dispela olgeta ili tanim i kam long ol desenden bilong Aron, long Klana bilong Kohat, long ples bilong ol, bikos ka em i go daun long ol.

original: They were given Hebron in the land of Judah and its surrounding pasturelands.
translation: Ol i givim Hebron long lan bilong Yuda, wantaim graun bilong animal we olgeta animal i stap.

original: But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
translation: Bai graun na vilij long sait bilong siti i go long Kaleb, man bilong Jefune.

original: So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,
translation: Na ol desendent bilong Aron i givim Hebron, wanpela taun bilong refuj, Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,

original: Hilen, Debir,
translation: Hilen, Debir

original: Ashan, Juttah, and Beth-shemesh, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Asan, Juta, na Bet-Semes, wantaim ol gras bilong animal bilong ol.

original: And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth, and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands. So they had thirteen cities in all among their families.
translation: Na long tripe bilong Benjimin, ol i givim ol Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth, na Anathoth, wantaun long graun bilong ol pu. Ol i kaunim sipotin na ol get thirteen ples long olgeta famili bilong ol.

original: To the rest of the Kohathites, ten cities were allotted from the half-tribe of Manasseh.
translation: Long ol narapela Kohati, tenpela towns i kamap long draibosim long hap-tribe bilong Manase.

original: The Gershomites, according to their clans, were allotted thirteen cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh in Bashan.
translation: Ol Gershomites i gat ples long ol taun thirteen, long wei bilong ol clan bilong ol, stat long ol tribe Isakara, Asa, Nafatali, na Manase, long hap Bilong Basan.

original: The Merarites, according to their families, were allotted twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
translation: Ol Merarites i gitim mosim olsem famili bilong ol, na long klab bilong Ruben, Gad, na Sebulon, ol i gat twelv taun.

original: So the Israelites gave to the Levites these cities and their pasturelands.
translation: Na Isrelaiti i givim long Levaiti siti na graun bilong animal ol.

original: They assigned by lot the cities named above from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
translation: Ol i kamapim ol siti we yumi tok nau long wei bilong het, na oli kam long ol traibe bilong Yuda, Simeon, na Benjamin.

original: And some of the clans of the Kohathites were given cities from the tribe of Ephraim for their territory:
translation: Na sampela klan bilong Kohati ol i gat sais long trai bilong Efrayim olsem graun bilong ol.

original: They were given Shechem (a city of refuge) with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, and Gezer,
translation: Ol i givim Sikem, taun bilong sikir pem, wantaim gras bilong ol, long kantri hap bilong Efraim, na Geza.

original: Jokmeam, Beth-horon,
translation: Jokimeam, Bet-Horon

original: Aijalon, and Gath-rimmon, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Aijalon, na Gath-rimmon, wantaim olgeta nem bilong ples na graun bilong ol.

original: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh the remaining clans of the Kohathites were given Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Na long hap taun bilong Manase, ol klan i go bek gen long Kohati igo inap i kamapim Aner na Bileam, watpo long wane olgeta gras bilong ol.

original: The Gershomites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they were given Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Ol Gershomites i kamapim ol dispela: Long klain bilong hap-tribe bilong Manase, ol i givim Golan long Bashan olsem, wantaim Ashtaroth, na graun bilong ol pu.

original: From the tribe of Issachar they were given Kedesh, Daberath,
translation: Long klab long traibe bilong Isakar ol i givim Kedes, Daberath,

original: Ramoth, and Anem, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Ramoth, na Anem, wantaim ol gras bilong ol.

original: From the tribe of Asher they were given Mashal, Abdon,
translation: Long traib blong Esar ol i givim ol Masal, Abdon,

original: Hukok, and Rehob, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Hukok na Rehob, wantaim graun bilong ol.

original: And from the tribe of Naphtali they were given Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon, and Kiriathaim, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Na long tripe bilong Naphtali, ol i givim Kedesh long Galili, Hammon, na Kiriathaim, wantaem graun bilong ol puak.

original: The Merarites (the rest of the Levites) received the following: From the tribe of Zebulun they were given Rimmono and Tabor, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Ol Merarites, nupela hap bilong Ol Levites, i kamapim pinis: long tribe bilong Zebulun ol i givim ol Rimmono na Tabor, wantaim gras bilong animals bilong ol.

original: From the tribe of Reuben east of the Jordan opposite Jericho they were given Bezer in the wilderness, Jahzah,
translation: Long klab bilong Ruben, bikosi na win solwara bilong Jordan, namel long sait bilong Jeriko, ol i givim Bezer olsem ples long bus, Jahzah.

original: Kedemoth, and Mephaath, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Kedemoth, na Mephaath, wantaim graun bilong ol poro.

original: And from the tribe of Gad they were given Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim,
translation: Long tribe bilong Gad, ol i givim ol Ramoth long Gilead, Mahanaim,

original: Heshbon, and Jazer, together with their pasturelands.
translation: Hesbon, na Jaza, wantaim graun bilong ol poro.

original: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Isakar: Tola, Puah, Jasub, na Simron — foa olgeta.

original: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, the heads of their families. In the days of David, 22,600 descendants of Tola were numbered in their genealogies as mighty men of valor.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Tola: Uzi, Refaya, Jeriyel, Jahmay, Ibsam, na Semuel, ol bikpela man bilong ol famili. Long taim bilong Davide, 22,600 desenden bilong Tola i kamap long stori bilong ol famili olsem ol strongpela man bilong fait.

original: The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. All five of them were chiefs.
translation: Susa bilong Uzzi: Izrahiah. Ol pikinini bilong Izrahiah: Mikaol, Obadia, Joel, na Isia. Olfaiv bilong ol i bikpela.

original: In addition to them, according to their genealogy, they had 36,000 troops for battle, for they had many wives and children.
translation: Ol i kam wantaim ol, na ol i klinim namel bilong ol, na ol i gat 36,000 man i go lait long feit, bikos ol i gat planti meri na pikinini.

original: Their kinsmen belonging to all the families of Issachar who were mighty men of valor totaled 87,000, as listed in their genealogies.
translation: Ol brata bilong ol famili Isakar, ol man strongpela i gat kura, i gat 87,000, ol i skrivim namel long stori bilong ol.

original: The three sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, and Jediael.
translation: Ol tripela sun bilong Benjimin: Bela, Becher, na Jediael.

original: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, heads of their families—five in all. There were 22,034 mighty men of valor listed in their genealogies.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, na Iri, ol hed bilong ol famili – limpela tasol. Na i gat 22,034 ol man strong na gutpela i kamap long stori bilong ol tumbuna bilong ol.

original: The sons of Becher: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth; all these were Becher’s sons.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Becher i go we: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, na Alemeth; ol dispela i pikinini bilong Becher.

original: Their genealogies were recorded according to the heads of their families—20,200 mighty men of valor.
translation: Stori bilong ol ancestor ol i rakim long hed bilong ol bikpela man bilong ol famili – 20,200 strongpela man bilong fait.

original: The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
translation: Susa bilong Jediael i Bilhan. Ol susa bilong Bilhan em i Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, na Ahishahar.

original: All these sons of Jediael were heads of their families, mighty men of valor; there were 17,200 fit for battle.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jediael, ol hap bilong ol papa bilong ol famili, na ol man strongpela i gat kura, ol i gat 17,200 man redi long faet.

original: The Shuppites and Huppites were descendants of Ir, and the Hushites were descendants of Aher.
translation: Ol Shuppites na ol Huppites em i kam bes long Ir, na ol Hushites em i kam bes long Aher.

original: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum—the descendants of Bilhah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, na Shallum – ol desendan bilong Bilhah.

original: The descendants of Manasseh: Through his Aramean concubine, Asriel, as well as Machir the father of Gilead.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Manase: Long hap bilong Aramain meri pasal Asriel, olsem na Machir papa bilong Gilead.

original: Machir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. The name of his sister was Maacah. Another descendant was named Zelophehad, who had only daughters.
translation: Machir i kisim meri long hap bilong Huppites na Shuppites. Nem bilong susa bilong em i Maacah. Naraken bilong em i kolim Zelophehad, na em i gat pikinini meri tasol.

original: Machir’s wife Maacah gave birth to a son, and she named him Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rekem.
translation: Meri bilong Machir, Maaka, i karim bek, na em i kamap, na em i givim nem Peresh long em. Braza bilong em i kolim Sheresh, na ol pikinini bilong em i kolim Ulam na Rekem.

original: The son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
translation: Susa bilong Ulam i kolim Bedan. Ol i stap long ol pikinini bilong Gilead, susa bilong Makir, susa bilong Manase.

original: His sister Hammolecheth gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
translation: Susa meri bilong em, Hamaoleketh, i karim bebi long tripela man: Isod, Abiesa, na Mala.

original: And these were the sons of Shemida: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
translation: Na dispela i go ol pikinini bilong Shemida: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, na Aniam.

original: The descendants of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Efrem: Sutela, Bered i pikinini bilong em, Taath i pikinini bilong em, Eleadah i pikinini bilong em, Taath i pikinini bilong em.

original: Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son. Ezer and Elead were killed by the natives of Gath, because they went down to steal their livestock.
translation: Zabad i pikinim, na Shuthelah i pikinim. Ezer na Elead i kilim olsem na pipol bilong Gath, bikos ol i go daun lo steal ol animal bilong ol.

original: Their father Ephraim mourned for many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
translation: Tambu bilong ol Ephraim i bin kisim sor long taim olsem, na wantok bilong em ol i kam bekim em long kaikai bilong sori.

original: And again he slept with his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to a son. So he named him Beriah, because tragedy had come upon his house.
translation: Na em i go sip gen long meri bilong em, na meri i kamap susu na i karim bebi man, na i banisim bebi man. Na tupela i givim nem bilong bebi man olsem Beriah, wantaim ol i sikisim long dispela pikinini, bikos ol i tingim olgeta kain sikisim i kamap long hus bilong em.

original: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth-horon, as well as Uzzen-sheerah.
translation: Daughter bilong em i Sheerah, we em i bin mekim Beth-horon lo na Beth-horon hap, olsem na Uzzen-sheerah.

original: Additionally, Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
translation: Olsem na, Rephah em i pikinini bilong en, Resheph em i pikinini bilong en, Telah em i pikinini bilong en, Tahan em i pikinini bilong en.

original: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
translation: Ladan i pikinim, Ammihud i pikinim, Elishama i pikinim.

original: Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
translation: Nun i papa, na Josaia i pikinim.

original: Their holdings and settlements included Bethel and its villages, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its villages to the west, and Shechem and its villages as far as Ayyah and its villages.
translation: Olgeta ples ol i stap na ol vilij bilong ol, ikamapim Bethel na vilij bilong em, Naaran long sindaun bilong sun, Gezer na vilij bilong en long wes, na Shechem na vilij bilong em, inap long Ayyah na vilij bilong en.

original: And along the borders of Manasseh were Beth-shean, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor, together with their villages. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in these towns.
translation: Long border bilong Manase i gat Bet-Sian, Taanak, Megido, na Dor, wantaim vilij ol i stap. Ol desenden bilong Josep, pikinini bilong Israel, ol i stap long dispela taun ol.

original: The children of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, na susa bilong ol Serah.

original: The sons of Beriah: Heber, as well as Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Beriah: Heber, na Malchiel, em i papa bilong Birzaith.

original: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham, and of their sister Shua.
translation: Heber em papa bilong Japhlet, Shomer, na Hotham, na bilong susa ol yet, Shua.

original: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were Japhlet’s sons.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jaflet: Pasak, Bimhal, na Asvath. Dispela i ol pikinini bilong Jaflet.

original: The sons of Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, na Aram.

original: The sons of his brother Helem: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong brata Helem: Zofa, Imna, Seles, na Amal.

original: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Zofa: Suah, Harnefa, Suwal, Beri, Imra,

original: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
translation: Bezer, Hod, Shama, Shilsha, Ithran, na Beera.

original: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jeter: Jefune, Pispa, na Ara.

original: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, na Rizia.

original: All these were the descendants of Asher—heads of their families, choice and mighty men of valor, and chiefs among the leaders. The number of men fit for battle, recorded in their genealogies, was 26,000.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Esara, hed bilong ol famili bilong ol, man i gat strong na i gat kuraj, bikpela man i kam ap long ol lida, nembris bilong ol man i fit long fait, i kamap 26,000, ol i rekodim long buk bilong stori bilong ol.

original: Benjamin was the father of Bela, his firstborn; Ashbel was the second born, Aharah the third,
translation: Benjamin em papa bilong Bela, pikinini bilong en i kam first; Ashbel em pikinini namba tu, Aharah em namba tri.

original: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
translation: Noha na namba foa, na Rafa na namba faiv.

original: The sons of Bela: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Bela: Addar, Gera, Abihud

original: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
translation: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah

original: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
translation: Gera, Shephuphan, na Huram.

original: These were the descendants of Ehud who were the heads of the families living in Geba and were exiled to Manahath:
translation: Ol desenden bilong Ehud, olsem hap bilong ol papa bilong family ol i stap long Geba, ol i go long Manahath na kisim penalti.

original: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who carried them into exile and who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
translation: Naaman, Ahijah, na Gera, ol i kisim ol i go long hel, em i papa bilong Uzza na Ahihud.

original: Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
translation: Shaharaim i gat pikinini man long kantri bilong Moab bihaen em i lusim meri bilong en, Hushim na Baara.

original: His sons by his wife Hodesh: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong em long meri bilong en Hodesh: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,

original: Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.
translation: Jeuz, Sachia, na Mirmah. Em i pikinini bilong em, ol Bikpela man bilong ol famili.

original: He also had sons by Hushim: Abitub and Elpaal.
translation: Na em i gat pikinini man tu long Hushim: Abitub na Elpaal.

original: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its villages),
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Elpaal: Eba, Misam, Semed (ol i bin mekim Ono na Lod wantaim vilij bilong en)

original: and Beriah and Shema (who were the heads of families of the inhabitants of Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath).
translation: Na Beriah na Shema (ol hed bilong hap bilong papa na mama bilong ol manmeri bilong taun Aijalon, na ol i drivim aut ol manmeri bilong taun Gath).

original: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
translation: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth, ol i stap long lis bilong nem.

original: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
translation: Zebadia, Arad, Edera,

original: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
translation: Mikaol, Ishpah, na Joha ol i bikpela pikinini bilong Beriah.

original: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
translation: Zebadia, Mesulam, Hiski, Heba, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Baibol.

original: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
translation: Ishmerai, Izliah, na Jobab i stap bilong ol pikinini Elpaal.

original: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
translation: Jakim, Sikri, Sabdi, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Jiwipela.

original: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
translation: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Jiwipela.

original: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
translation: Adaiah, Beraiah, na Shimrath i stap ol pikinini bilong Shimei.

original: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
translation: Aispen, Eba, Eliel, nem bilong ol man i stap long Nem bilong Bikpela Buk.

original: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
translation: Abdon, Zikri, Hanani, ol i stap long lis bilong nem propa.

original: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
translation: Hanania, Elam, Anthothijah

original: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
translation: Iphdeiah, na Penuel i stap ol pikinini bilong Shashak.

original: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
translation: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah, ol i stap long lis bilong nem bilong Jui.

original: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
translation: Jaareshiah, Elijah, na Zichri i stap ol pikinini bilong Jeroham.

original: All these were heads of families, the chiefs according to their genealogies, and they lived in Jerusalem.
translation: Olgeta dispela i bikpela hap bilong papa na mama, olsem ol i kam long stori bilong tumbuna, na ol i stap long Jerusalema.

original: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah,
translation: Jeiel papa bilong Gibeon i stap long Gibeon, meri bilong em nem Maacah.

original: and Abdon was his firstborn son, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
translation: Na Abdon em i pikinini namba wan bilong en, na bihain ol i go, Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,

original: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,
translation: Gedor, Aho, Seza, ol i kam long lis blo nem.

original: and Mikloth, who was the father of Shimeah. These also lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem.
translation: Na Mikloth, em papa bilong Shimeah. Ol i stap wantaim ol famili bilong ol long Jerusalem.

original: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
translation: Ner em papa bilong Kish, Kish em papa bilong Saul, na Saul em papa bilong Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, na Esh-baal.

original: The son of Jonathan: Merib-baal, and Merib-baal was the father of Micah.
translation: Susa bilong Jonathan: Merib-baal, na Merib-baal em papa bilong Micah.

original: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Mika: Piton, Melek, Tarea, na Ahaz.

original: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
translation: Ahaz em papa bilong Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah em papa bilong Alemeth, Azmaveth, na Zimri, na Zimri em papa bilong Moza.

original: Moza was the father of Binea. Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
translation: Moza em papa bilong Binea. Raphah em pikinini bilong em, Eleasah em pikinini bilong em, na Azel em pikinini bilong em.

original: Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
translation: Azel i gat sikis pikinini, na dispela em i nem bilong ol: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, na Hanan. Ol dispela i pikinini bilong Azel.

original: The sons of his brother Eshek: Ulam was his firstborn, Jeush second, and Eliphelet third.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong brata Eshek: Ulam em i pikinini namba wan, Jeush em i namba tu, na Eliphelet em i namba tri.

original: The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and they had many sons and grandsons—150 in all. All these were the descendants of Benjamin.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ulam i gat strongpela man, ol man husait i save shot bilong banar, na ol i gat planti pikinini na ol bikpela – 150 olgeta. Ol dispela i bin kam bek long Benjamin.

original: So all Israel was recorded in the genealogies written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. But Judah was exiled to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
translation: Ol Israel i rakim ol stap long stori bilong ol famili, ol i raitim long Buk Bilong King bilong Israel. Tasol Yuda i go long Babylon na i no inap kom bek bikos ol i no obedi.

original: Now the first to resettle their own property in their cities were Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.
translation: Nau ol Israel, pris, Levi, na wokman bilong templa em i go bek long ples bilong ol first long taun bilong ol.

original: These were some of the descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh who lived in Jerusalem:
translation: Ol desenden bilong Yuda, Benjamin, Efraim, na Manase, ol i stap long Yerusalem.

original: Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah.
translation: Uthai pikinini bilong Ammihud, mak bilong Omri, mak bilong Imri, mak bilong Bani, wanpela desendent bilong Perez pikinini bilong Judah.

original: From the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
translation: Bilong ol Shilonites: Asaiah bikpela boron na ol pikinini bilong en.

original: From the Zerahites: Jeuel and 690 relatives.
translation: Long ol Zerahites: Jeuel na 690 wantok bilong em.

original: From the Benjamites: Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
translation: Long ol Benjamins: Sallu pikinini bilong Meshullam, pikinini bilong Hodavia, pikinini bilong Hassenuah;

original: Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
translation: Ibneiah pikinini bilong Jeroham; Elah pikinini bilong Uzzi, pikinini bilong Michri; Meshullam pikinini bilong Shephatiah, pikinini bilong Reuel, pikinini bilong Ibnijah;

original: and 956 of their relatives according to their genealogy. All these men were heads of their families.
translation: Na 956 ol arafelo bilong ol olsem ol i kam long famili bilong ol. Ol bikpela man bilong ol ibin papa bilong ol, na olgeta man hia i bikpela man bilong ol famili bilong ol.

original: From the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin;
translation: Long ol priest: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, na Jachin;

original: Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the chief official of God’s temple;
translation: Azaria, pikinini bilong Hilkia, pikinini bilong Mesulam, pikinini bilong Sadok, pikinini bilong Meraioth, pikinini bilong Ahitub, big man bos bilong haus lotu bilong God;

original: Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah; Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
translation: Adaiah pikinini bilong Jeroham, aitken bilong Pashhur, aitken bilong Malchijah; Maasai pikinini bilong Adiel, aitken bilong Jahzerah, aitken bilong Meshullam, aitken bilong Meshillemith, aitken bilong Immer;

original: and 1,760 of their relatives, the heads of their families, able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
translation: Na 1,760 long ol famili bilong ol, ol bikpela hed bilong ol famili, ol man strong bilong wok bilong sabis long haus bilong God.

original: From the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a descendant of Merari;
translation: Long ol Levites: Semaia, pikinini bilong Hasab, pikinini bilong Azrikaem, pikinini bilong Hasabia, wanpela desenden bilong Merari;

original: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
translation: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, na Mattaniah pikinini bilong Mika, pikinini bilong Zichri, pikinini bilong Asaph;

original: Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
translation: Obadia sun i go long Shemaia, sun bilong Galal, sun bilong Jedutun; na Berekia sun i go long Asa, sun bilong Elkana, ol i stap long vilij bilong Netofati.

original: These were the gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives. Shallum was their chief;
translation: Ol i bin gardia bilong gat: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, na ol wantok bilong ol. Shallum em i bikpela bos bilong ol;

original: he was previously stationed at the King’s Gate on the east side. These were the gatekeepers from the camp of the Levites.
translation: Em i bin stap bembe long plaits bilong gate bilong King long sait bilong east. Ol i bin kiapa bilong gate long hap bilong Levaita.

original: Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his relatives from the Korahites were assigned to guard the thresholds of the Tent, just as their fathers had been assigned to guard the entrance to the dwelling of the LORD.
translation: Shalum sapan bilong Kore, sapan bilong Ebiasaph, sapan bilong Korah, na ol kinsman bilong em long clan bilong Korahites i kamapim wok bilong klem ol mak bilong Tent bilong Papa, olsem ol papa bilong ol i wok long kisim karem en long haus bilong Papa bilong olgeta.

original: In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar had been in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with him.
translation: Long taim bipo Phinehas sut bilong Eleazar em i bin bos bilong ol man i lukaut gate, na LORD i stap wantaim em.

original: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Zekaria, pikinini bilong Mesilemia, em i bekim gate man long entris bilong Tent blong Miting.

original: The number of those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds was 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had appointed them to their positions of trust.
translation: Ol i pikinim bilong kamap gatekipa long paus bilong haus em 212. Ol i skrivim nem na kona long famili stori long viles ol i stap. Davide na Samuel man bilong si i appointim ol long wok bilong trast.

original: So they and their descendants were assigned to guard the gates of the house of the LORD—the house called the Tent.
translation: Olsem na ol desenden ol i go long ol, yu mas paitim gate bilong haus bilong LORD - haus we ol i kolim Haus bilong Ten.

original: The gatekeepers were stationed on the four sides: east, west, north, and south.
translation: Ol gatman i stap yet long ol four sait: solwara, san, nort, na saut.

original: Their relatives came from their villages at fixed times to serve with them for seven-day periods.
translation: Wantoks bilong ol i kam long ples bilong ol long taim tasol, oli wok wantaim ol long wik saisen de.

original: But the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the rooms and the treasuries of the house of God.
translation: Buat ol fou hed gatpisa, ol Levait, ol i kisim trast long rum na haus bilong mani long haus bilong God.

original: They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they were responsible for guarding it and opening it every morning.
translation: Ol i spen nait klostu long haus bilong God, wantaim ol i gat respon long wapim em, na ol i opim em bembe long moning.

original: Some of them were in charge of the articles used in worship, to count them whenever they were brought in or taken out.
translation: Ol i stap long hap bilong samting bilong wosip, ol i usim long kaunim, wanem samting bilong wosip ibin bringim i kam o ibin kisim i go.

original: Others were put in charge of the furnishings and other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the fine flour, wine, oil, frankincense, and spices.
translation: Ol i kamap long leda long ol samting bilong haus lotu na narapela samting, olsem flour gutpela, wain, oil, masalai, na spais.

original: And some of the sons of the priests mixed the spices.
translation: Na sampela pikinini bilong pastors i mixim smel.

original: A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with baking the bread.
translation: Wanpela man Levait i go bikim nem bilong em Mattithiah, em i pikinini namba wan bilong Shallum Korahit, na em i kisim wok long mekim bret.

original: Some of their Kohathite brothers were responsible for preparing the rows of the showbread every Sabbath.
translation: Nambis ol brata bilong Kohat long ol i save mekim rot bilong bred bilong sho long everi Sabat.

original: Those who were musicians, the heads of Levite families, stayed in the temple chambers and were exempt from other duties because they were on duty day and night.
translation: Ol i bin pila musik, ol bikpela hed bilong famili Levai, ol i stap insait long rum bilong tempel na ol i fri long wok narak, bilong ol i bin wok long dei na nait.

original: All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs according to their genealogies, and they lived in Jerusalem.
translation: Olgeta dispela i bikman long famili bilong Levit, ol i bikman long stori bilong ol tumbuna, na ol i stap long Jerusalem.

original: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah.
translation: Jeiel papa bilong Gibeon i stap long Gibeon. Meri bilong em, nem bilong em Maacah.

original: Abdon was his firstborn son, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
translation: Abdon em i pikinini namba wan bilong en, na bihain ol i go, Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab.

original: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
translation: Gedor, Aio, Secharia, na Miklos.

original: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They too lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem.
translation: Mikloth em papa bilong Shimeam. Ol i stap wantaim ol famili bilong ol long Jerusalem.

original: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
translation: Ner em papa bilong Kish, Kish em papa bilong Saul, na Saul em papa bilong Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, na Esh-baal.

original: The son of Jonathan: Merib-baal, who was the father of Micah.
translation: Susa bilong Jonatan: Merib-baal, em i papa bilong Mikah.

original: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Mika: Piton, Melek, Tahrea, na Ahaz.

original: Ahaz was the father of Jarah; Jarah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri was the father of Moza.
translation: Ahaz i papa bilong Jarah; Jarah i papa bilong Alemeth, Azmaveth, na Zimri; na Zimri i papa bilong Moza.

original: Moza was the father of Binea. Rephaiah was his son, Elasah his son, and Azel his son.
translation: Moza em papa bilong Binea. Rephaiah em pikinini bilong em, Elasah em pikinini bilong em, na Azel em pikinini bilong em.

original: And Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
translation: Na Azel i gat sikis pikinini, na dispela em nam bilong ol: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, na Hanan. Dispela i pikinini bilong Azel.

original: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
translation: Nau Filistia i go antap long Israel, na ol man bilong Israel i ranawe bikos bilong ol, na planti i pundaikai pinis long Maunt Gilboa.

original: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua.
translation: Filistia i go beklong ol longtaim Saul na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol i kilim Jonathan, Abinadab, na Malchishua, ol pikinini bilong Saul.

original: When the battle intensified against Saul, the archers overtook him and wounded him.
translation: Taim bilong fait i kam strong long Saul, asa archa i go pasim em na i givim em suk.

original: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and run it through me, or these uncircumcised men will come and torture me!” But his armor-bearer was terrified and refused to do it. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
translation: Na Saul i tok long yuwara bilong en, "Kam bek long suw na katim mi, o ol man ol i no katim skin bilong ol bai kam na painim mi!" Be yuwara bilong en i bin poret na i no laik mekim. Na Saul i kisim suw bilong en na i pakim long en.

original: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his own sword and died.
translation: Taim harenta bilong em i si olsem Saul i dai pinis, na em tu i kilim yet long sop bilong em, na em i dai.

original: So Saul died together with his three sons and all his house.
translation: Na Saul i dai pinis wantaim long ol samting tresen na pikinini bilong em, olgeta long hap bilong en.

original: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their cities and ran away. So the Philistines came and occupied their cities.
translation: Wanpela taim ol Israelait i lukim long vali, ol i si army i ranawe, na Saul na ol pikinini bilong em i dai pinis, ol i lusim ol taun bilong ol na ronewe. Na Filistia i kam na tekeva ol taun bilong ol.

original: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
translation: Bai nau long de, taim Philistia i kam na rausim ol bodi i dai pinis, ol i lukim Saul na ol pikinini bilong em i pundaun long Maunt Gilboa.

original: They stripped Saul, cut off his head, took his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temple of their idols and among their people.
translation: Ol i bin kirapim Saul, ol i bin katim hed bilong en, ol i bin kisim armor bilong en, na ol i bin sendim messenga long ol ples bilong Filistia oli autim stori inside haus bilong spirit ol i bilipim na long ol pipel.

original: They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.
translation: Ol i putim armor bilong en i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol debdeb bilong ol, na ol i kisim hed bilong en i hangim i go daun insait long haus lotu bilong Dagon.

original: When the people of Jabesh-gilead heard about everything the Philistines had done to Saul,
translation: Taim ol pipol bilong Jabesh-Gilead harim olsem Philistia i mekim long Saul,

original: all their men of valor set out and retrieved the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. And they buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh and fasted seven days.
translation: Ol man bilong strong igo na kisim bek ol bodi bilong Saul na ol pikinini bilong en, na bringim ol i go long Jabesh. Na ol planti bon bilong ol long diwai bilong strong long Jabesh, na ol fasting seven de.

original: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness to the LORD, because he did not keep the word of the LORD and even consulted a medium for guidance,
translation: Saul i dai pinis long olgetting bilong en klostu long Jehovah, bekos em i no bihainim ol wod bilong Jehovah, na em i go bekim tok long meri bilong spirit bilong dei.

original: and he failed to inquire of the LORD. So the LORD put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.
translation: Na em i no askim Bikpela, Papa bilong olgeta, long dispela ting. Olsem Bikpela i kilim em, na givim ples bilong king i go long David, Pikinini bilong Jesee, man bilong God.

original: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, “Here we are, your own flesh and blood.
translation: Ol Isrel i kam tugeta long Daved long Hebon na ol i tok, “Mipela i kam, blut na bodi bilong yu yet.”

original: Even in times past, while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them back. And the LORD your God said, ‘You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be ruler over them.’”
translation: Even long taim bipo wail em Saul i bin king, yu bin bringim Israel i go na kam bek gen. Na LORD, Bikpela God bilong yu, tok olsem, ‘Yu yet kam shepherdim piple bilong yu Israel, na yu yet kam bosim ol long taim.’”

original: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, where David made a covenant with them before the LORD. And they anointed him king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.
translation: Olgeta bikpela man bilong Israel i kam bek long king long Hebron, na David i mekim pinis wok bilong agrikmen wantaim ol long ai bilong LORD. Na ol i givim em olio, na mekim em king bilong Israel, olsem LORD i tok tru long mul bilong Samuel.

original: Then David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus), where the Jebusites inhabited the land.
translation: Daud na ol Israel i go bek long Yerusalem, em i Yebus, wampela hap ol Yebusi i stap long en.

original: The people of Jebus said to David, “You will never get in here.” Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion (that is, the City of David).
translation: Ol pipol bilong Jebus i tokim Davide, "Yu no inap go insait long hap." Tasol, Davide i kamapim forteks bilong Saion, em i Siti bilong Davide.

original: Now David had said, “Whoever is the first to strike down a Jebusite will become chief commander.” And Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and he became the chief.
translation: Daavid i tok olsem, “Husat i go nau long paitim Jebusi, em bai kamap komanda bikman.” Na Joab, pikinini bilong Zeruiah, i go antap rast, na em i kamap komanda bikman.

original: So David took up residence in the fortress; that is why it was called the City of David.
translation: Na Davide i go stap long diki bubung; olsem na em i kolim Siti bilong Davide.

original: He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
translation: Em wokim i go apo long siti, stat long terris i stap suportim olgeta na rait long banis wall, wail Joab i bringim bek gen ol narapela hap bilong siti.

original: And David became greater and greater, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.
translation: Na Daud i kamap bikpela moa yet, Bikpela Masalai bilong ol ples i stap wantaim em.

original: Now these were the chiefs of David’s mighty men, who, together with all Israel, bolstered and strengthened his kingdom, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
translation: Nau dispela i ol bif ples bilong ol strongpela man bilong David, ol i stap wantaim ol Israel, na ol i kirapim na ol i strongim kingdom bilong en, olsem ol wod bilong LORD long Israel.

original: This is the list of David’s mighty men: Jashobeam son of Hachmoni was chief of the officers; he wielded his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed at one time.
translation: Dispela em i lis bilong strongpela man bilong Dauid: Jashobeam son bilong Hachmoni em i bos bilong ofisa; em i usim spia bilong en i go long tri hundred man, olsem em i kilim ol wanpela taim.

original: Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men.
translation: Nambawan long komanda em i Eleazar, pikinini bilong Dodo Ahohite, wanpela i go long ol thri man bilong pawa.

original: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At the place with a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.
translation: Em i stap wantaim Dauid long Pas-dammim, taim Filistia i kam yumi i go aut long ples ia long harim bikpela. Long ples we i gat graun i fulap long bari, soljaman i ranawe long Filistia.

original: But Eleazar and David stationed themselves in the middle of the field and defended it. They struck down the Philistines, and the LORD brought about a great victory.
translation: Na Eleaza na Davide ol i stap yet long mit blo ples, ol i bin defendim em. Ol i bin kilim daun Filistia, na Bikpela i bin bringim bikpela win.

original: Three of the thirty chief men went down to David, to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a company of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Tri bilong ol bikpela man 30 i go daun long David, long rok bilong gua Adullam, wail grup bilong Filisti na katim kam long Vali bilong Rephaim.

original: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was at Bethlehem.
translation: Long dispela taim Dauid i stap long ples strongim, na grup bilong Philistine i stap long Betlehem.

original: David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”
translation: Daud i laikim strong wara na tok, "O, mipela i ken kisim wara long wel besain gat bilong Betlehem, bai mipela i givim mi drink!"

original: So the Three broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well at the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the LORD,
translation: Ol i go antap long ka pilistain, ol drawim wara long wel bung bilong Bethlehem gate, na bringim i bek long Davidson. Tasol em i refus long drinkim; insed, em pilim wara i go antap long LORD, olsem wok bilong lotu na sakrifis.

original: saying, “Far be it from me, my God, to do this! How can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?” Because they had brought it at the risk of their lives, David refused to drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.
translation: Nogat long mi, God bilong mi, long me dringim blod bilong ol man ya! Ol i bringim em long risk bilong laip, ol putim laip bilong ol long risk. David i refus long dringim, bikos ol i kamap long ol putim laip bilong ol long risk. Em ol nem bilong tripela strongpela man, na dispela i stap olsem stori bilong ol.

original: Now Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the Three, and he lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name along with the Three.
translation: Nau Abishai, brata bilong Joab, em i bikpela long Ol Tri, na em i kisim spia bilong en na ibin liftim i go long tri hanred man, na i kilim ol, na ol i save nem bilong en toktok wantaim long Ol Tri.

original: He was doubly honored above the Three, and he became their commander, even though he was not included among the Three.
translation: Em i gat dupela hanor long en long hap bilong ol Tri, na em i kamap komanda bilong ol, tasol em i no inkludim long ol Tri.

original: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a man of valor from Kabzeel, a man of many exploits. He struck down two champions of Moab, and on a snowy day he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
translation: Na Benaiah sussa bilong Jehoiada em i man strong na gutpela, em i man olsem bilong planti wok strong, na em i kilim tu paitman bilong Moab. Em i go daun insait hole long de bile igo daun na kilim lion.

original: He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man five cubits tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s beam in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club, snatched the spear from his hand, and killed the Egyptian with his own spear.
translation: Na em i kilim wanpela Egyptian, man bilong bikpela sampela, ai five kubiti long. Egyptian i gat spia olsem bem bilong wuver long han bilong em, tasol Benaiah i go bekim em wantaim klub, i pikim spia bilong em na kisim long han bilong em, na i kilim Egyptian wantaim spia bilong em yet.

original: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who won a name alongside the three mighty men.
translation: Dispela i bikpela wok bilong Benaiah, pikinini bilong Jehoiada, em i gat nem wantaim tripela man strong.

original: He was most honored among the Thirty, but he did not become one of the Three. And David appointed him over his guard.
translation: Em i man bilong het long ol Teti, tasol em i no kamap wanpela long ol Tripol. Na Daud i apoinim em long gavman bilong en.

original: Now these were the mighty men: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
translation: Nau ol i go na ol man bilong pawa: Asahel brata bilong Joab, Elhanan pikinini bilong Dodo bilong Betlehem.

original: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
translation: Shammoth man bilong Haror, Helez man bilong Pelon,

original: Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
translation: Ira sussa bilong Ikkesh, man bilong Tekoa, Abiezer man bilong Anathoth,

original: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
translation: Sibbekai man Hushati, Ilai man Ahoiti,

original: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,
translation: Maharai bilong Netofa, Heled Pikinini bilong Baanah bilong Netofa

original: Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the Benjamites, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
translation: Ithai man bilong Ribai long hap bilong Gibea bilong Benjamait, Benaiah man bilong Piraton

original: Hurai from the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
translation: Hurai long raon bilong Gaash, Abiel man bilong Arbathite,

original: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
translation: Azmaveth man bilong Baharum, Eliahba man bilong Shaalbon,

original: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Hashem man Gizonite, Jonathan pikinini bilong Shagee man Hararite,

original: Ahiam son of Sachar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,
translation: Ahiam pikinini bilong Sachar man Harari, Eliphal pikinini bilong Ur

original: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
translation: Hepfa man bilong Mecherat, Ahija man bilong Pelon,

original: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,
translation: Hezro bilong Kamelita, Naarai sussa bilong Ezbai,

original: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,
translation: Joel brata bilong Nathan, Mibhar pikinini bilong Hagri,

original: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
translation: Zelek bilong Ol Ammon, Naharai bilong Ol Beeroth, man i kisim skitu bilong Joab, Pikinini bilong Zeruiah,

original: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
translation: Aira man Ithrait, Gareb man Ithrait,

original: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,
translation: Uria bilong Hiti, Zabad su bilong Ahlai

original: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, chief of the Reubenites, and the thirty with him,
translation: Adina pikinini bilong Shiza Rubenaiti, bikpela leda bilong ol Rubenaiti, na ol thirty i kam wantaim em,

original: Hanan son of Maacah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,
translation: Hanan pikinini bilong Maacah, Joshaphat man Mithnite

original: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
translation: Uzia man bilong Ashterati, Sama na Jeiel ol pikinini bilong Hotam man bilong Aroeri,

original: Jediael son of Shimri and his brother Joha the Tizite,
translation: Jediael pikinini bilong Shimri na brata bilong em Joha man Tizite,

original: Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,
translation: Eliel bilong Ol Mahavite, Jeribai na Joshaviah, ol pikinini bilong Elnaam, Ithmah bilong Ol Moab

original: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
translation: Eliel, Obed na Jaasiel man bilong Mezoba.

original: Now these were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the mighty men who helped him in battle;
translation: Nau ol man i go kam long David long Ziklag, wail em i stap yet long ples banis long wei bilong presens bilong Saul pikinini bilong Kish, na ol i stap long ol man strong i helpim em long fight.

original: they were archers using both the right and left hands to sling stones and shoot arrows; and they were Saul’s kinsmen from Benjamin):
translation: Ol banarang man i save sutim banarang, na ol i usim han dirait na han kisim tu, ol i sutim ston na ol i puskat banarang; na ol i wantok bilong Saul, ol i kam long ol pipol bilong tribe Benjamin.

original: Ahiezer their chief and Joash, who were the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu the Anathothite;
translation: Ahiezer em i bikpela man, na Joash, ol i pikinini bilong Shemaah man Gibeat; Jeziel na Pelet, ol i pikinini bilong Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu man Anathot;

original: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the Thirty and a leader over the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite;
translation: Ishmaiah bilong Gibeon, em i man strong tumas, wanpela long Ol Thirty, na em i bic head bilong Ol Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, na Jozabad bilong Gederath;

original: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite;
translation: Eluzai, Jerimot, Bealia, Shemaria, na Shefatia Haruphiti;

original: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, who were Korahites;
translation: Elkanah, Ishaya, Azarel, Joezer, na Jashobeam, ol i bikpela man bilong Korahait;

original: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
translation: Na Joelah na Zebadia, ol pikinini bilong Jeroham long Gedor.

original: Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the desert. They were mighty men of valor, trained for battle, experts with the shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions and who were as swift as gazelles on the mountains:
translation: Ol Gadits i go bek long David long ples strong bilong en long bus. Ol man strong na gutpela, ol i trai long fait, na ol i save usim skild na spia. Olgeta pes bilong ol i olsem pes bilong lion, na ol i faast olsem gazel long maunten.

original: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
translation: Ezer bikpela, Obadiah i kam bihain long em, Eliab i kam namba tri.

original: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
translation: Mishmannah namba foa, Jeremia namba fai,

original: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
translation: Attai em i go sipis, Eliel em i go sevén

original: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
translation: Johanan namba et, Elzabad namba nain,

original: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbanai the eleventh.
translation: Jeremia i kam da namba ten, na Makabena i kam da namba eleven.

original: These Gadites were army commanders, the least of whom was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.
translation: Ol Gaditi em i bikpela komanda long ples bilong army, na liklik man tasol em i ken fight gen hundred, na bikpela man em i ken fight gen thousand.

original: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight all those in the valleys, both to the east and to the west.
translation: Ol i go pas long Jordan long mun tasol, wanem taim em i kamap strong tru na i spillim ovasa olgeta bank bilong wara, na ol i ranawe ol pipel long vali, long east na west.

original: Other Benjamites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.
translation: Ol narapela Benjamini na ol man pipel long Judah i kam kus ol David long ples strong bilong en.

original: And David went out to meet them, saying, “If you have come to me in peace to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free of violence, may the God of our fathers see it and judge you.”
translation: Na Davit i go bek gen long mipela, olsem: "Yu kam long me na mipela i stap long pisin, bai helpim mi, haret bilong mi bai i stap wantaim yu; be yu kam long betrayim mi long enemy bilong mi, wankain han bilong mipela i free long strong, God bilong tumbuna bilong yumi em i lukim na jijim yu."

original: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, the chief of the Thirty, and he said: “We are yours, O David! We are with you, O son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, and peace to your helpers, for your God helps you.” So David received them and made them leaders of his troops.
translation: Na Spirit i kam ana long Amasai, bikpela bilong ol Teti, na em i tok: “Yumi stap wantaim yu, O Davide! Yumi stap wantaim yu, O Pikinini bilong Jesse! Pece, pece long yu, na pece long ol i helpim yu, bikos Bikpela i helpim yu.” Na Davide i kisim ol na wokim ol i stap long hap bilong ol kapten bilong army.

original: Some from Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (They did not help the Philistines because the Philistine rulers consulted and sent David away, saying, “It will cost us our heads if he defects to his master Saul.”)
translation: Ol manmeri long Manasi i go bek long Daved wanpela taim em i go wantaim Filistia na fight gen Saul. (Ol i no helpim Filistia bikos pitoa bilong ol Filistia i tokpeek na rausim Daved, ol i tok, "em bai kosim hed bilong yumi if em i go bek long bos bilong em Saul.")

original: When David went to Ziklag, these men of Manasseh defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of thousands in Manasseh.
translation: Taim Dauid i go long Ziklag, ol man meri husat i bilong Manase, ol i bin lusim na joiim em: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, na Zillethai, bikpela chiefs bilong tausen long Manase.

original: They helped David against the raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor and commanders in the army.
translation: Ol i helpim David gen raider, bikos ol i stret ol man nau, strong na gutpela, na ol i kapten long ples bilong armi.

original: For at that time men came to David day after day to help him, until he had a great army, like the army of God.
translation: Long dispela taim, ol man i kam long David dei bihain dei i go halivim em, na em i gat planti solja olsem solja bilong God.

original: Now these are the numbers of men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him, in accordance with the word of the LORD:
translation: Nau ol dispela man i go wail long pait, ol i kam klostu long Dauid long Hebron, na ol i mekim kingdom bilong Saul i kam bek long em, olgeda samting i go wel long tok bilong LORD:

original: From Judah: 6,800 armed troops bearing shields and spears.
translation: Long hap bilong Yuda: 6,800 solja i gat wapen, bek na spia.

original: From Simeon: 7,100 mighty men of valor, ready for battle.
translation: Long Saimon: ol man strongpela i gat kuraj, 7,100, ol i redi long faet.

original: From Levi: 4,600,
translation: Long hap bilong Lebi: Fopora thousand sikis hundred

original: including Jehoiada, leader of the house of Aaron, with 3,700 men,
translation: Inklusiv Jehoiada, bikman bilong haus bilong Aron, wantaim 3,700 man,

original: and Zadok, a mighty young man of valor, with 22 commanders from his own family.
translation: Na Zadok, wanpela strongpela yongman bilong kamap strong, wantaim 22 bikpela leda nau bilong em famili.

original: From Benjamin, the kinsmen of Saul: 3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to the house of Saul up to that time.
translation: Long hap bilong Benjamin, ol brata na susa bilong Saul, 3000, ol i stap yet namel long haus bilong Saul inap long taim bilong em.

original: From Ephraim: 20,800 mighty men of valor, famous among their own clans.
translation: Long hap bilong Efrem: 20,800 man i gat strong na kuraj, ol i famus long ples bilong ol yet.

original: From the half-tribe of Manasseh: 18,000 designated by name to come and make David king.
translation: Long hap-tribe bilong Manase, 18,000 i kam anketa long nem tasol, ol i kam bekim Dauid king.

original: From Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do: 200 chiefs with all their kinsmen at their command.
translation: Long Isaka, ol man i save tok nimu long taim na ol i save tok long wei Israel mas mekim: 200 biceman wantaim ol brata bilong ol, i kamdaun olsem.

original: From Zebulun: 50,000 fit for service, trained for battle with all kinds of weapons of war, who with one purpose were devoted to David.
translation: Long Zebulun, fifty thousand i kamap strong long servis, ol i train long fait wantaim ol kain kain wep na armas bilong faight, na ol i birua wantaim wan porpose long David.

original: From Naphtali: 1,000 commanders, accompanied by 37,000 men with shield and spear.
translation: Long hap bilong Naftali, i kam wantaim thousand (1,000) ofisa komanda, skild na spia i go wantaim ol, 37,000 man.

original: From Dan: 28,600 prepared for battle.
translation: Long Dan: 28,600 i redi long pait.

original: From Asher: 40,000 fit for service, prepared for battle.
translation: Long hap bilong Asa: 40,000 i kamap strong long sarvis, ol i redi long fait.

original: And from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh there: 120,000 armed with every kind of weapon of war.
translation: Na long eastern sait bilong Jordan, ol Reuben, Gad, na hap-tribe bilong Manasseh, 120,000 i kamapim na ol i gat wel olgeta kain weapon bilong tait.

original: All these men of war, arrayed for battle, came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. And all the rest of the Israelites were of one mind to make David king.
translation: Ol man i go long war, ol i redi long fait, ol i kam long Hebron, na ol i desis strong long mekim David king bilong Israel. Na ol Israel olketa i wan mangana long mekim David king bilong ol.

original: They spent three days there eating and drinking with David, for their relatives had provided for them.
translation: Ol i spen tripela de na wel, na ol i kaikai na dring wantsail long David, bikos ol famili bilong ol i tokaut moni bilong ol.

original: And their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—abundant supplies of flour, fig cakes and raisin cakes, wine and oil, oxen and sheep. Indeed, there was joy in Israel.
translation: Na ol nabarna i kam longwe olsem Isaka, Sebulon, na Naphtali, ol i bringim ka long donki, kemel, mol, na okson – planti ka flauer, keik figa na keik reisin, wain na oil, okson na sheep. Ol i gat hamamas long Israel.

original: Then David conferred with all his leaders, the commanders of hundreds and of thousands.
translation: Na David i tokautim wantaim ol lida bilong en, ol kapten bilong hundred na bilong thousand.

original: And he said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if this is of the LORD our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our brothers in all the land of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites in their cities and pasturelands, so that they may join us.
translation: Na em i tokim assembli bilong Israel, "I luk gut long yu, na em i bilong LORD God bilong yumi, mipela salim wod long ol ples, long ol brata bilong mipela i stap long ol hap bilong kantri Israel, na pris na Levait long ol taun na graun bilong ol, ili ol i kam jionim mipela.

original: Then let us bring back the ark of our God, for we did not inquire of Him in the days of Saul.”
translation: Mipela bai bringim bek bokis bilong God bilong mipela, long bikos mipela i no askim em long taim bilong Saul.

original: And because this proposal seemed right to all the people, the whole assembly agreed to it.
translation: Na bikos dispela tok em i luk olsem em i rit long ol pipel, assembli bilong ol pipel i givim tokaut i wanbel long en.

original: So David assembled all Israel, from the River Shihor in Egypt to Lebo-hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
translation: Na Davidson em i kam kanu long olgeta Israel, stat long River Shihor long Egypt na go long Lebo-hamath, long bringim bikos bilong God from Kiriath-jearim.

original: David and all Israel went up to Baalah of Judah (that is, Kiriath-jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim—the ark that is called by the Name.
translation: Daavid na olgeta Israel i go ap long Baalah bilong Yuda, em i Kiriath-jearim, i kam bek long bringim ark bilong GOD we em i sibob long cherubim, em i ark bilong GOD we ol man i kolim long nem bilong Em.

original: So they carried the ark of God from the house of Abinadab on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding the cart.
translation: Ol i kisim bek bilong God na ol i karim i go long kar bilong nupela, statim long haus bilong Abinadab, na Uza na Ahio i laitim kar.

original: David and all the Israelites were celebrating before God with all their might, with songs and on harps and lyres, with tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
translation: Daavid na ol Pipol Israel ol i selebre bifor God wantaim olgeta strong bilong ol, ol i sing na usim hap, laip, tamberin, simbal, na trampet.

original: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark, because the oxen had stumbled.
translation: Tupela i kam long ples bilong kilim graas bilong Saidon, Uza em i stretim han na kisim bokis bilong Gad, bikos ol bulmakau i slip.

original: And the anger of the LORD burned against Uzzah, and He struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.
translation: Na anga bilong Jehovah i biruai long Uza, na i kilim em bikos em i putim han bilong en long bokis bilong bondari. Na em i dai pinis klostu long ai bilong God.

original: Then David became angry because the LORD had burst forth against Uzzah; so he named that place Perez-uzzah, as it is called to this day.
translation: Na Daudi i masal ai bikos LORD i kirap strong against Uza, na em i givim nem bilong hap ples ya we ol i kolim Perez-Uza, stap yet namba.

original: That day David feared God and asked, “How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?”
translation: Long dispela de David i bikim frik long God na em tanim askim, "Mipela inap kam bekim bilum bilong God long me olgeta?"

original: So he did not move the ark with him to the City of David; instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
translation: Em i no mosim ark wantaim em i go long Siti bilong David, tasol em i kisim i go klostu long haus bilong Obed-edom Gittite.

original: Thus the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house for three months, and the LORD blessed his household and everything he owned.
translation: Na Bokis Bilong God i stap wantaim famili bilong Obed-edom long haus bilong en tri mun, na LORD i givim blesing long husat i bilong en na evri samting i bin belonget long en.

original: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent envoys to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters, to build a palace for him.
