translation: Nau Hiram king bilong Tairo sendim mesijen i go long David, wantaim timber bilong seda, wokman bilong ston, na karpenta, ol i mekim haus bikpela long en.

original: And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and had highly exalted his kingdom for the sake of His people Israel.
translation: Na David i save olsem LORD i makim em king bilong Israel, na i lifim aup kingdom bilong em longpela, bilong mekim gudpela nem bilong em, long stap bilong piple Israel.

original: And David took more wives in Jerusalem and became the father of more sons and daughters.
translation: Na Davide i kisim meri plenti long Jerusalem, na i kamap papa bilong plenti pikinini man na pikinini meri.

original: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
translation: Dispela nem bilong pikinini i kamap long em i stap long Jerusalem: Shamuwa, Shobab, Natan, Solomon.

original: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
translation: Aibara, Erisua, Elpet,

original: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
translation: Nogah, Nefek, Jafia,

original: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
translation: Elishama, Beeliada, na Eliphelet.

original: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they all went in search of him; but David learned of this and went out to face them.
translation: Taim Philistia harim tok long Daud, ol i go lukim em; Daud i save long dispela, na em i go bekim ol.

original: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
translation: Nau Filistia i kam, na ol i save raun long Valeli bilong Rephaim.

original: So David inquired of God, “Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?” “Go,” replied the LORD, “for I will deliver them into your hand.”
translation: Na Dafid i askim God olsem, "Mi bai go apo long Filistia? Yu bai givim ol i go long mi?" "Go," LORD i tok olsem, "tasol mi bai givim ol i go long yu."

original: So David and his men went up to Baal-perazim, where he defeated the Philistines and said, “Like a bursting flood, God has burst out against my enemies by my hand.” So they called that place Baal-perazim.
translation: Na Daud na ol man bilong em i go antap long Baal-perazim, na em i winim Filipin olgets, na em i tok, "Olsem wara i kam antap strong, God i kamaut strong long enemy bilong me long han bilong mi." Na hivina ol i kallim ples ia Baal-perazim.

original: There the Philistines abandoned their gods, and David ordered that they be burned in the fire.
translation: Long hap em, Filistia i lusim olem god bilong ol, na Daud i tokim ol man i kisim na kaikai long paia.

original: Once again the Philistines raided the valley.
translation: Genaga yet Filistia i kam raunim laurabada.

original: So David again inquired of God, who answered him, “Do not march up after them, but circle around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.
translation: Na Daved i tok save gen long God, na God i bek gen long em, "Yu no ken go behaind ol, tasol yu wokabaut ol i go raun ol, na kilim ol long fron bilong diwai balsam.

original: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move out to battle, because this will mean that God has marched out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
translation: Olsem yu harim soun bilong i go wanwan long tup bilong diwai balsem, yu go long pati bikos God i go bifo yu ol na kamelim ka long ples bilong Filisitia.

original: So David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the army of the Philistines all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.
translation: Na Daved i mekim olsem God i bin tokim, na ol i kilim sampela solja bilong Filistia, stat long Gibeon kaensel long Geza.

original: And David’s fame went out into every land, and the LORD caused all nations to fear him.
translation: Na fem bilong David i go aut long olgeta graun, na LORD i mekim ol ples i bikimais long em.

original: David constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
translation: Dauid i bikim haus bilong en i go olsem na em i prepa ples bilong ark bilong God long Siti bilong Davit, na em i putim tent bilong ark bilong God.

original: Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD has chosen them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before Him forever.”
translation: Na David i tok olsem, "Nogat wanpela man i ken karim bokis bilong GOD, tasol Levaita inap karim, bikos GOD i chusim ol long karim bokis bilong em, na servis bihain long em foreva."

original: And David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.
translation: Na Daved i bikim olgeta Israel i kam bihain long Jerusalem, ili karim ark bilong Lod i go antap long ples we em i prepa.

original: Then he gathered together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
translation: Na em i kam na igatim ol desenden bilong Aron na ol Levai:

original: From the Kohathites, Uriel the chief and 120 of his relatives;
translation: Long ol ples bilong Kohathi, Uriel em i bikpela man, na 120 long ol brata na susa bilong em.

original: from the Merarites, Asaiah the chief and 220 of his relatives;
translation: Long ol Merarait, Asaiah bikpela man, na 220 blong brata na susa bilong em;

original: from the Gershomites, Joel the chief and 130 of his relatives;
translation: Long ol Gershomaites, Joel bikpela man na 130 blong brata na susa bilong em;

original: from the Elizaphanites, Shemaiah the chief and 200 of his relatives;
translation: Long ol Elizafanait, Semaia bikpela man na 200 long famili bilong em;

original: from the Hebronites, Eliel the chief and 80 of his relatives;
translation: Long ol Hebronit, Eliel bikpela na 80 bilong brata na susa i kam.

original: and from the Uzzielites, Amminadab the chief and 112 of his relatives.
translation: Na long ol Uzzielit pipol, Amminadab bikpela man, wantaim 112 blo brata na susa bilong em.

original: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
translation: Daavid i kam bekim pries Zadok na Abiatar na Levait Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, na Amminadab.

original: And he said to them, “You are the heads of the Levitical families. You and your relatives must consecrate yourselves so that you may bring the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.
translation: Na em i tokim ol long stret, "Yu olgeta i stap long hevi bilong famili Levai. Yu na brata bilong yu mas puripim yuself, nau yu ken kisim bek bilong Lod, God bilong Israel, i go long ples we mi prepareim i stap."

original: It was because you Levites were not with us the first time that the LORD our God burst forth in anger against us. For we did not consult Him about the proper order.”
translation: Em i bikos yu Levit i no stap wantaim mipela long taim past, nau Papa God i kirap strong long bel na i bekim mipela. Bikos mipela i no konsalt em long wok bilong kastom.

original: So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Na ol priist na Levait i stap strong long Spirit, ol i kamapim yet long karim i go antap Ark bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: And the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.
translation: Na Ol Levait i kisim bek arka bilong God long ol ska bilong ol, wantaim na rop bilong karim em, olsem Mosis i givim tok strongim tok bilong LORD.

original: David also told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their relatives as singers to lift up their voices with joy, accompanied by musical instruments—harps, lyres, and cymbals.
translation: Daud i tokim ol bikpela man Levai long appointim brata na kusin bilong ol olsem singinga, kirapim voys bilong ol long hap, laip, na simbal, wantaim instrument musik, long singautim voz bilong ol wantaim hamonika.

original: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his brothers, Asaph son of Berechiah; from their brothers the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
translation: Ol Levit i kamapim Heman man bilong Joel; long brata bilong em, Asaph man bilong Berechiah; long brata bilong ol Merari, Ethan man bilong Kushaiah;

original: and with them their brothers next in rank: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers Obed-edom and Jeiel.
translation: Na wantaim ol brata bilong ol i kam bihain long renk: Sekaria, Jaasiel, Semiramot, Jehiel, Uni, Eliab, Benaia, Maasia, Matitia, Elifelehu, Mikneia, na ol wokman bilong gat Obed-Edom na Jeiel.

original: The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals.
translation: Ol musishian Heman, Asaph, na Ethan igo, ol i mas skulim simbal long bronz.

original: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play the harps according to Alamoth.
translation: Zekaria, Aziel, Semiramot, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maasia, na Benaia ol i save playa hap long stap bilong Alamot.

original: And Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead the music with lyres according to Sheminith.
translation: Na Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, na Azaziah i save lidim song bilong musik wantaim pilip bilong singsing olsem Sheminith i tok.

original: Chenaniah the head Levite was the director of the music because he was highly skilled.
translation: Chenaniah hap boss bilong Levait, em i bikpela man i save diriectim singsing, wantaim em i gat saves bilong singsing i go het.

original: Berechiah and Elkanah were to be guardians of the ark.
translation: Berekiya na Elkana i go ken olsem kipman bilong arka.

original: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer—the priests—were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah were also to be guardians of the ark.
translation: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, na Eliezer—ol pris—i go blohim trampet bifor ark bilong God. Obed-edom na Jehiah tu i kam lukautim ark.

original: So David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders of thousands went with rejoicing to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom.
translation: Dauid, oda bilong Israel, na bikpela bos bilong tausend i go wailis long hapines long kisim bek bilong kaen agriement bilong LORD from haus bilong Obed-Edom.

original: And because God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
translation: Na bikos God i helpim Levit ol i karim bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD, ol i kilim sewn bulmakau na sewn ram.

original: Now David was dressed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, as well as the singers and Chenaniah, the director of music for the singers. David also wore a linen ephod.
translation: Nau Daud i kaikai klia long "linen namba wan", olsem na ol "Levai" husat i karim ark, na ol singaut, na Chenaniah, man i save dirisa musik bilong ol singaut. Daud i kaikai "epod linen" tu.

original: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, with the sounding of rams’ horns and trumpets, and with cymbals and the music of harps and lyres.
translation: Ol Israel i bringim bek i go ap ark bilong kaen kot bilong LORD wantaim sangsing, wantaim sauninim bilong ram na trambol, na wantaim simbal na muvik bilong hap na lair.

original: As the ark of the covenant of the LORD was entering the City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked down from a window and saw King David dancing and celebrating, and she despised him in her heart.
translation: Wanpela taim bokis bilong kaunsil bilong LORD i go insait long taun bilong David, Michal, gel bilong Saul, i lukim daun from windo, na i lukim King David i dansi na halivim, na em i biruaim em long hap bilong en.

original: So they brought the ark of God and placed it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. And they presented burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
translation: Ol i kisim bek bilong God na ol i karim i go insait long haus tambu we David i wokim. Na ol i givim ofing bung wantaim ofing peis bifo God.

original: When David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
translation: Olsem em i pinis long sakrifais ofa bilong bakim na peis ofing, em i givim bekim long ol pipol long nem bilong LORD.

original: Then he distributed to every man and woman of Israel a loaf of bread, a date cake, and a raisin cake.
translation: Em i givim long ol man na meri bilong Israel, ol i kamap long bau bilong bret, kek bilong det, na kek bilong reisin.

original: David appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to celebrate, to give thanks, and to praise the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Daudi i kam long apoinim Levai olsem minista bilong lotu i go sarve bifoa ark bilong LORD, long celabret, long givim sankyu, na long pris long LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: Asaph was the chief, Zechariah was second, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel. They were to play the harps and lyres, while Asaph sounded the cymbals
translation: Asaph em i bikpela, Zechariah em i namba tu, olsem na Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, na Jeiel. Ol i mas pilai harps na lyres long taim bilong lotu, tasol Asaph em i kilim simbal.

original: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel blew the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
translation: Na pris Benaiah na Jahaziel i blowim trambol olsem taim bilong ol bifo ark bilong kovenan bilong God.

original: On that day David first committed to Asaph and his brothers this song of thanksgiving to the LORD:
translation: Long dispela de Daud bungim long Asap na brata bilong en i givim dispela sang bilong hamamas long Papa God:

original: “Give thanks to the LORD; call upon His name; make known His deeds among the nations.
translation: Givim sanksem long LORD; kisim nem bilong Em i go; tusim ol samting em i mekim long ol narapela kantri.

original: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; tell of all His wonders.
translation: Singim sang bilong preis long em, singim sang long em; tok aut long olgeta wondas bilong em.

original: Glory in His holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
translation: Praise long long bilong Nem Holy bilong Em; hart bilong ol man i go hap long soim LORD.

original: Seek out the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
translation: Sukim ap long LORD na strong bilong em; olsem yu sukim pes bilong em oltaim.

original: Remember the wonders He has done, His marvels, and the judgments He has pronounced,
translation: Rimemba ol samting nogut na ol samting bikpela i bin mekim, ol samting em i tru, na ol jugment i bin givim.

original: O offspring of His servant Israel, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
translation: O pikinini bilong servant belong Him Israel, o soks bilong Jakob, ol pipol we Hem i pikinim.

original: He is the LORD our God; His judgments carry throughout the earth.
translation: Em i Lord God bilong yumi; jujement bilong em i go ol abaot long graun.

original: Remember His covenant forever, the word He ordained for a thousand generations—
translation: Rimemba covenant bilong em oltaim, wod bilong en i givim planti long tausend generesen.

original: the covenant He made with Abraham, and the oath He swore to Isaac.
translation: Ilipin em i mekim wantaim Abraham, na oth em i givim long Isaac.

original: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
translation: Em i konfirmim olsem wanpela laen long Jacob, long Israel olsem wanpela kovenan we i no pinis.

original: ‘I will give you the land of Canaan as the portion of your inheritance.’
translation: Mi bai givim yu làn bilòng Kanaan olsem porojon bilòng inhitanens bilòng yu.

original: When they were few in number, few indeed, and strangers in the land,
translation: Taim ol i stap liklik tasol, liklik tru ol i stap, na ol i stap olsem man bus long kantri.

original: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
translation: Ol i wail long ol narapela kantri, na ol i go long wan kingdm ikam long narapela kingdm.

original: He let no man oppress them; He rebuked kings on their behalf:
translation: Em i no lusim man i bagarapim ol; Em i strongim bic man long moninga bilong ol:

original: ‘Do not touch My anointed ones! Do no harm to My prophets!’
translation: Yu no ken tikim ol man meri we Yumi bin anointim! Yu no ken givim kros long profet bilong Mipela!

original: Sing to the LORD, all the earth. Proclaim His salvation day after day.
translation: Singim song long Jehovah, olgeta graun. Presem save blong em dei bihain dei.

original: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonderful deeds among all peoples.
translation: Kisim na tokim ol i go long hevi bilong Em, Ol samting nais em i mekim, long ol narapela kantri, long ol pipol olgeta.

original: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
translation: Bikpela i go longwe LORD, em i bikpela long praise; em i mas i save pipel wetim ol kina god igo.

original: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but it is the LORD who made the heavens.
translation: Ol god bilong ol nesen i ol samting we no save, tasol Bikpela LORD em i mekim heven.

original: Splendor and majesty are before Him; strength and joy fill His dwelling.
translation: Glamour na powa i stap bifor im; strong na hamamas i fillim ples bilong en.

original: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
translation: O yutupela papa graun bilong olgeta nesen, givim glor na strong long LORD.

original: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering and come before Him. Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness;
translation: Givim glory long namel bilong Lod; kisim ofing na kam bung long en. Wosipim Lod long bikpela holiness bilong en.

original: tremble before Him, all the earth. The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
translation: Olgeta graun, kukim i dai bifo Em. Wol i stap strong, em ino inap birua.

original: Let the heavens be glad, and the earth rejoice. Let them say among the nations, ‘The LORD reigns!’
translation: Heven i amamas, na graun i sangale. Ol pipol bai tok long kantri, ‘LORD em i bos!’

original: Let the sea resound, and all that fills it; let the fields exult, and all that is in them.
translation: Kisim solwara i singaut, na olgeta samting i stap inside, let gras bilong ples i amamas, na olgeta samting i stap long en.

original: Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD, for He is coming to judge the earth.
translation: Diwai bilong bus i singim song bilong hamamas long Bikpela, wantaim em i kam long jajim graun.

original: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
translation: Givim sanksem long LORD, em i gutpela; lovinkari ba em i stap oltaim.

original: Then cry out: ‘Save us, O God of our salvation; gather and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to Your holy name, that we may glory in Your praise.’
translation: Kirap strong, Bikpela God bilong savesen, kisim yumi na kam bek long yumi fromwe nen, dat yumi ken givim sankyu long nem bilong yu we i holy, dat yumi ken proud long tok ples bilong yu.

original: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.” Then all the people said, “Amen!” and “Praise the LORD!”
translation: Blesim i go long LORD, God bilong Israel, long taim bipo na long taim i kam. Na ol pipol i tok, “Amen!” na “Praisim LORD!”

original: So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to minister there regularly according to the daily requirements,
translation: Na Dauid lftim Asaph na brata bilong em stap we bifoa ark bilong kaovenan bilong LORD, olsem wokim minista i stap long hap olsem we bilong de bek.

original: along with Obed-edom and his sixty-eight relatives. Obed-edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were to be gatekeepers.
translation: Long ol Obed-edom na ol famili bilong em, ikamau 68 man. Obed-edom pikinini bilong Jeduthun, na Hosah, ol i mas skulim daon long lukautim gate.

original: And David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place in Gibeon
translation: Na Davide lusim Zadok priast na ol priast arere bilong em stap bifor tabenakel bilong Lod long ples hait bilong Gibeon

original: to regularly present burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offerings, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the Law of the LORD, which He had commanded Israel to keep.
translation: Oli mas presente sacrifice bai fafir long altan bilong sacrifice bai fafir, long moning na apinun, olsem olgeta samting i write long Lo bilong LORD, we em i bin givim instruction long Israel oli mas mekim.

original: With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the LORD, for “His loving devotion endures forever.”
translation: Wantaim ol i bin: Heman, Jeduthun, na ol arapela ol i bin chusim na tukim nem bilong ol yet long givim sankyu long LORD, bikos “lovingselo bilong em i stap foreva.”

original: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals for the music and instruments for the songs of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.
translation: Heman na Jeduthun i bin stap wantaim ol trumpet na simbal long musik, na intrumens bilong sang bilong God. Na sipsip bilong Jeduthun i bin stap klostu long gate.

original: Then all the people departed for their homes, and David returned home to bless his household.
translation: Ol pipel i go daun nau long ples bilong ol, na David i kam bek long haus bilong en i givim blesing long hus hold bilong en.

original: After David had settled into his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent.”
translation: Long taim David i go insait long haus bilong em, em i tokim Nathan man bilong spikim wod bilong God, “Mi stap hir, mi stap insait long haus bik bilong timbir cedar, tasol bokis bilong kaovenant bilong Masalai i stap aninit long kanu.”

original: And Nathan replied to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
translation: Na Natani i tokim bek long Davide, “Wokim ol samting we i stap inside haret bilong yu, bikos Bikpela i stap wantaim yu.”

original: But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
translation: Bai nait i go stap, tok bilong God i kam long Natan, olsem:

original: “Go and tell My servant David that this is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build Me a house in which to dwell.
translation: Go na tokim wokman David dispela em i tok olsem: Yu no nem bilong mekim haus bilong me stap, dispela em i tok olsem, LORD bilong yumiyami i tok olsem.

original: For I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt until this day, but I have moved from tent to tent and dwelling to dwelling.
translation: Mi no stap long haus from dei mi kisim Pipol Israel i kamap out long Egip until dispela de, but mi go long ol tent na long ol ples stap.

original: In all My journeys with all the Israelites, have I ever asked any of the leaders I appointed to shepherd My people, ‘Why haven’t you built Me a house of cedar?’
translation: Long olgeta ples we i go wantaim ol Pipol Israel, mi ever askim nakom bikman we mi apointrim long luka aut ol pipol bilong mi, ‘Why haven’t yu buildim mipela haus bilong seda?’

original: Now then, you are to tell My servant David that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be the ruler over My people Israel.
translation: Nau olsem, yu mas tokim servent bilong mi David dispela em i tok bilong LORD bilong ol ples i go: Mi bin karim yu long ples gras, long bihainim ol sheep, olsem yu inap bosim ol pipel bilong mi Israel.

original: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make for you a name like the greatest in the land.
translation: Mi bin go wantaim yu long olgeta hap yu go, na mi bin kilim ol eni bilong yu i go bifo yu. Nau mi bai mekim nem bilong yu olsem nem bilong ol bikpela man long kantri.

original: And I will provide a place for My people Israel and will plant them so that they may dwell in a place of their own and be disturbed no more. No longer will the sons of wickedness oppress them as they did at the beginning
translation: Mi bai givim ples long Pipol bilong mi Israel, na bai plantim ol, ol bai stap long ples bilong ol yet, na inap no gat trabel moa. Pikinini bilong nogutpas bai bagarapim ol olsem oli bin mekim long taim bilong bipo.

original: and have done since the day I appointed judges over My people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover, I declare to you that the LORD will build a house for you.
translation: Na ol i mekim sinse long de mi bin appointim jujes olsem ombud long piple Israel bilong Mi. Na mi bai kamdaunim ol enemy bilong yu yet. Na mi yet tokim yu, LORD bai mekim haus bilong yu.

original: And when your days are fulfilled and you go to be with your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
translation: Wën dei bilong yu kamap i go dae, na yu go klostu wantaim papamama bilong yu, mi bai kirapim wanpela pikinini bilong yu, husat i kam long gen bilong yu, na mi bai strongim kingdom bilong em.

original: He will build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.
translation: Em bai kirapimhaus bilong Mi, na Mi bai plantim trohn bilong en oltaim.

original: I will be his Father, and he will be My son. And I will never remove My loving devotion from him as I removed it from your predecessor.
translation: Bai mi bai stap papa bilong em, na em bai stap pikinini bilong mi. Na mi no go inap tekewe givim em lav bilong mi long em olsem mi bin tekewe lav bilong mi long man bifo.

original: But I will set him over My house and My kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.”
translation: Mipela bai putim em i go apo long Haus bilong mi na Kingdom bilong mi,-na tron bilong em bai strongim oltaim.

original: So Nathan relayed to David all the words of this entire vision.
translation: Na Natan i tokim Daud olgeta wod bilong dispela bikpela sien.

original: Then King David went in, sat before the LORD, and said, “Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that You have brought me this far?
translation: King Davi i go insait, i sindaun bifor LORD, na i tokim LORD, “Mi husat, oh LORD God, na husa bilong mi, dat yumu bringim mi kam long hap ini?

original: And as if this was a small thing in Your eyes, O God, You have spoken about the future of the house of Your servant and have regarded me as a man of great distinction, O LORD God.
translation: Na olsem nau i pikinini tu long ai bilong yu, o God, Yu tok long abus bilong taim i kam bilong haus bilong servant blo yu, na yu lukim mi olsem man bilong bikpela namel, o Bikpela God.

original: What more can David say to You for so honoring Your servant? For You know Your servant,
translation: Dauid i mas tok hap, olsem na, long servim sampela man, long givim em respek? Wantaim yu save yu yet servant, Dauid, wokman bilong yu.

original: O LORD. For the sake of Your servant and according to Your own heart, You have accomplished this great thing and revealed all Your greatness.
translation: Papa God, long servist bilong yu, olgeta long haret bilong yu yet, yu mekim dispela bikpela wok, na yu showim olgeta bikpela strong bilong yu.

original: O LORD, there is none like You, and there is no God but You, according to everything we have heard with our own ears.
translation: O Lo, nogat wan lain olsem yu, na nogat god bels long kantri aiggen bikos yu tasol i God, olgeta samting mipela harim wantaim yutupela ip bilong mipela.

original: And who is like Your people Israel—the one nation on earth whom God went out to redeem as a people for Himself? You made a name for Yourself through great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before Your people, whom You redeemed from Egypt.
translation: Na husat olsem piple Israel bilong yu - nesen wanpela long graun em God i go aut na redim olsem piple bilong en i kam? Yu mekim nem bilong yu i go pas long hevi na gret wondas, long dri Gim ol nesen aotside long piple bilong yu, ol i yu bin redim long Egip.

original: For You have made Your people Israel Your very own forever, and You, O LORD, have become their God.
translation: Yu, LORDE, bin mekim piple Israel bilong yu olsem propa bilong yu foreva, na yu, LORDE, kamap na yu bicom God bilong ol.

original: And now, O LORD, let the word You have spoken concerning Your servant and his house be established forever. Do as You have promised,
translation: Na nau, O GOD, wod yu tokim long servant bilong yu, hambak na haus bilong en, i kamap strong oltaim. Wokim olsem yu promis.

original: so that Your name will be established and magnified forever when it is said, ‘The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, is God over Israel.’ And may the house of Your servant David be established before You.
translation: Na nem bilong yu bai i kamap strong na i go inap long taim olgeta, wannem oli tok, 'LORD bilong ol ples we i gat armi, God bilong Israel, em i God bilong Israel.' Na maus bilong servant yu David bai i stap i go bek long yu.

original: For You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him. Therefore Your servant has found the courage to pray before You.
translation: Long yu, God bilong mipela, yu trai showim ol samting long servant bilong yu, olsem yu bai mekim haus bilong em, olsem haus bilong papa na ol descendants. Na em trai kisim hart long bihainim praer long yu.

original: And now, O LORD, You are God! And You have promised this goodness to Your servant.
translation: Na nau, o Lo, yu kam bek God! Yu promisim dispela gudpasin long servanu bilong yu.

original: So now You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You. For You, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.”
translation: Nau Yu bin kamapim belsi long haus bilong wokman Yu, na em i go inap stap oltaim long moning bilong Yu. Bikos Yu, Papa, yu bin givim belsi, na em bai belsi oltaim.

original: Some time later, David defeated the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its villages from the hand of the Philistines.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Daudi winim Philistia, em bungim ol, na em kisim Gath na vilij long han bilong ol Philistia.

original: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to David and brought him tribute.
translation: Dauid winim Moabiti, na ol i kam daun na i go antap long en, na brinigim gif long em.

original: As far as Hamath, David also defeated King Hadadezer of Zobah, who had marched out to establish his dominion along the Euphrates River.
translation: Olsem long olsem Hamati, Davidsoni tu i winim King Hadadeza bilong Zoba, hu i go bek long setim pawa bilong em long song Euphrates.

original: David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand charioteers, and twenty thousand foot soldiers, and he hamstrung all the horses except a hundred he kept for the chariots.
translation: Daud i kisim bek gen: em i kisim wan tusen kar, seven tusen draiva bilong kar, na twenty tusen soldia i go long graun, na em i bugum olgeta hors, so na em i skelim hap hundred tasol, na em i usim ol long kar.

original: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand men.
translation: Taim Aramen long Damaskas i kam halivim King Hadadezer long Zobah, Daud i kilim twenti-tu tusen man.

original: Then he placed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to David and brought him tribute. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
translation: Na em i putim solida grasim long Aram bilong Damaskas, na Arameans i bihainim David, na ol i bringim gif long em. Na LORD i givim win long David we ol i go.

original: And David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
translation: Na Daud i kisim skild bilong gol i go bilong ofisa bilong Hadadeza na i bringim i go long Yerusalem.

original: And from Tibhath and Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and various bronze articles.
translation: Na long Tibhath na Cun, tauns bilong Hadadeza, Daudi i kisim planti brom, na we bilong Solomona i wokim Solwara Brom, pila, na sampela narapela samting bilong brom.

original: When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
translation: Taim King Tou bilong Hamath harim olsem David winim pinis olgeta solja bilong Hadadezer king bilong Zobah,

original: he sent his son Hadoram to greet King David and bless him for fighting and defeating Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze,
translation: Em sendim pikinini bilong em, Hadoram, go bekim King Davide, na blessim em long pait na winim Hadadeza, ol i bin go long war wantaim Tou. Hadoram brings ol samting olsem kain bilong gold, silva, na bronze.

original: and King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had carried off from all these nations—from Edom and Moab, and from the Ammonites, Philistines, and Amalekites.
translation: Na King Davit i dediketim ol dispela silva na gołd long Jehovah, ol i kisim bek long olgeta nesen ol - Edom, Moab, Amonait, Filistia, na Amalekit.

original: Moreover, Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
translation: Na em i go yet, Abishai pikinini bilong Zeruiah i kilim eighteen thousand Pipol bilong Edom long Valley bilong Sol.

original: He placed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites were subject to David. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
translation: Em putim solida mana long Edom, na olgeta Edomites i bin stap aninit long David. Na Sabaot i wokim David winim we bilong en i go.

original: Thus David reigned over all Israel and administered justice and righteousness for all his people:
translation: Na thus David i bos bilong yutupela Israel, na i givim justis na streitim ol samting gut long ol pipel bilong en.

original: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder;
translation: Joab pikinini bilong Zeruiah em i bin kapten long hap bilong army; Jehoshaphat pikinini bilong Ahilud em i bin man bilong skrivim stori;

original: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was the scribe;
translation: Zadok Pikinini bilong Ahitub na Ahimelech pikinini bilong Abiathar i bin pris; Shavsha em i bin skrivimana;

original: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief officials at the king’s side.
translation: Benaiah sambai bilong Jehoiada i bin bos long ol Cherethites na Pelethites; na sosol bilong David i bin bikpela ofisal long sait bilong king.

original: Some time later, Nahash king of the Ammonites died and was succeeded by his son.
translation: Olgeta taim igo pinis, Nahash papa bilong kantri Ammonites i dai na i go bek, na pikinini bilong em i kam bihain long em.

original: And David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to console Hanun concerning his father. But when David’s servants arrived in the land of the Ammonites to console him,
translation: Na Daud i tok, "Mi bai mekim gutpela long Hanun sangelpela bilong Nahas, long ol i kam bek long papa bilong em, em trai mekim gutpela long mi." Na Daud i sendim misisini igo wokim toksaving long Papa bilong Hanun. Tasol wanpela taim wokman bilong Daud i go kasal long Amunait na wokim toksaving long en,

original: the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Just because David has sent you comforters, do you really believe he is showing respect for your father? Have not his servants come to you to explore the land, spy it out, and overthrow it?”
translation: Prinsis bilong Ammonait pipol i tokim Hanun, “Bikos Daudi i sendim man i kam givim yu ka, yu tinke em i mekim respek long papa bilong yu? Nogat, wokman bilong em i kam bekim yu long lukim gras bilong yumi, lukim i gut, na tata i go daun?”

original: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved their beards, cut off their garments at the hips, and sent them away.
translation: Na Hanun kisim servant bilong David, ol kisim razo katim barb bilong ol olsem sahin bilong shame, katim klot bilong ol long hip, na ol sendim ol i go.

original: When someone came and told David about his men, he sent messengers to meet them, since the men had been thoroughly humiliated. The king told them, “Stay in Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then return.”
translation: Wanpela i kam na toktok long David, em baim pesman igo mitim ol, ol i skulim pinis olgeta. King i tokim ol, “Bai yumi stap i go long Jeriko, na bifo yumi i kisim bek gras bilong yumi, na tainen yumi kam bek.”

original: When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.
translation: Taim Ammonait i save ol i kamapim stink long Davi, Hanun na Ammonait i sendim ain thousand talents silva bilong bipo long birua kareta na horsman long Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, na Zobah.

original: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, as well as the king of Maacah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba while the Ammonites came from their cities and marched out for battle.
translation: Ol birua long ol yet, na ol i kisim 32,000 kar, na king bilong Maacah wantaim ol soza bilong en i kam na kamped namba Medeba, wail Ammonites i kam aut long ol ples bilong ol, na ol i go aut long faet.

original: On hearing this, David sent Joab and the entire army of mighty men.
translation: Long hem harim tok dispela, Daud i sendim Joab na ol solja bilong man ol i strong.

original: The Ammonites marched out and arrayed themselves for battle at the entrance to the city, while the kings who had come stayed by themselves in the open country.
translation: Ammonites i go aut na ol i tanim yet long fait namba wan bung bilong siti, wail king na queen i kam stap wait long bus bilong gras bilong kantry.

original: When Joab saw the battle lines before him and behind him, he selected some of the best men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans.
translation: Taim Joab i lukim lain bilong fait bipo em na bihain em, em i piksim ol man nogut tru bilong Isrel na ol i sanap i go long Aramia.

original: And he placed the rest of the forces under the command of his brother Abishai, who arrayed them against the Ammonites.
translation: Na em putim narapela solja i go aninit long han bilong brata Abishai, we em i paitim ol i go kasal long Ammon.

original: “If the Arameans are too strong for me,” said Joab, “then you will come to my rescue. And if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come to your rescue.
translation: Sip Aramia ol i strong tumas long me, yu bai kam na halivim mi. Na sip Amonait ol i strong tumas long yu, mi bai kam na halivim yu.

original: Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and for the cities of our God. May the LORD do what is good in His sight.”
translation: I stap strong na mipela faitim stout long ol pipol bilong yumi na long ples bilong lotu bilong yumi. Mai Bikpela wokim ol guten zing long ai bilong em.

original: So Joab and his troops advanced to fight the Arameans, who fled before him.
translation: Na Joab wantaim soljas i go ap long fight Aramia, na Aramia i ranawe bekim em.

original: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before Joab’s brother Abishai, and they entered the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.
translation: Ol Ammoniti i lukim ol Aramia i ranawe, na ol tu i ranawe bifor Abisai, brata bilong Joab, na ol i go insait long siti. Na Joab i go bek gen long Jiusalema.

original: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers to bring more Arameans from beyond the Euphrates, with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them.
translation: Taim Arami pipo i lukim ol i bin kilim ol yet, ol i sendim man bung wantaim bilong bringim moa Arami pipo long bikos bilong Yufratis, wantaim na Shofak komanda bilong armi bilong Hadadeza i lidim ol.

original: When this was reported to David, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan, advanced toward the Arameans, and arrayed for battle against them. When David lined up to engage them in battle, they fought against him.
translation: Taim ol i ripotim stori ia long Daud, na em yet i kamas bilong Isrel olgeta, em i go pas Jordan, em i go inap long Aramia, na ol i sanap strong long fait wantaim ol. Taim Daud i sanap strong long fait wantaim ol, ol i faitim em.

original: But the Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach the commander of their army.
translation: Ol Aramen i ranawe long Israel, na Daudi i kilim seven thousand long ol draiva bilong chariot na forty thousand long ol soldia i go long graun. Na em i kilim Shophach tu, em i bigman bilong armi bilong ol.

original: When Hadadezer’s subjects saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were unwilling to help the Ammonites anymore.
translation: Taim ol i kam tokim olsem Hadadezer igat bikhet long ol, ol i wokim pis long Daavid na i bin go daun long en, ol Arameans nogat laik helpim Ammonits gen.

original: In the spring, at the time when kings march out to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the land of the Ammonites. He came to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab attacked Rabbah and demolished it.
translation: Long taim spring i kam, taim ol kingly bung wantaim go aut long wok bilong war, Yoab i karim aut ol solja na ol i bagarapim kantri bilong Ammonit. Ol i go kas Rabbah na i kukim em, tasol Daudi i stap yet long Jerusalem. Na Yoab i atakim Rabbah na i daunim em.

original: Then David took the crown from the head of their king. It was found to weigh a talent of gold and was set with precious stones, and it was placed on David’s head. And David took a great amount of plunder from the city.
translation: Na David i kisim krown na i putim long hed bilong en, em i kamap long wan talen bilong gol, na i kam long ston bilong valiu. Na David i kisim planti spoils bilong enimi long taun, na i bringim i go.

original: David brought out the people who were there and put them to work with saws, iron picks, and axes. And he did the same to all the Ammonite cities. Then David and all his troops returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Daud i kisim ol pipol i kam na givim wok long ol: ol i usim saksak, pik long airop, na akisi. Na Daud i wokim sampela olsem long ol taun bilong Ammon. Na bai Daud wantaim ol solja bilong en i go bek gen long Jerusalem.

original: Some time later, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim, and the Philistines were subdued.
translation: Olsem taim igo pinis, bikpela faet bilong war i kamap long Pilistia long Geza. Long hap tam, Sibbekai Husati i kilim Sipai, wanpela descendent bilong Refaim, na Pilistia oli bin dai, oli no ina save harim tok.

original: Once again there was a battle with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
translation: Gen tu, gen wanpela pait i kam long ol Filistia, na Elhanan, pikinini bilong Jair, i kilim Lahmi, brata bilong Goliath, man bilong Gat, na hambak bilong spear blong em olsem hambak bilong wumana weaver.

original: And there was still another battle at Gath, where there was a man of great stature with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot—twenty-four in all. He too was descended from Rapha,
translation: Na i gat narapela gen bikpela fait long Gat, na i gat man bilong hevi namel, em i gat sikis finga long ol han bilong en, na sikis toe long ol lek bilong en - olgeta twenty-four. Em tu i kam bek long Rapha, ol i bilong hevi namel.

original: and when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of David’s brother Shimei killed him.
translation: Na wán em i laikim ol i Angell long Isrel, Jonatan pikinini bilong brata bilong Davide Shimei i kilim em.

original: So these descendants of Rapha in Gath fell at the hands of David and his servants.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Rafa long Gat ol i pundaun pinis long han bilong Daved na wokmanmeri bilong em.

original: Then Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
translation: Na Satana i kamap bek gen long Israel na i provokim Davide long kisim namba bilong ol pipol long Israel.

original: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops, “Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan and bring me a report, so that I may know their number.”
translation: Na Davide i tok olsem long Joab na komanda bilong soljia, “Go na kauntim ol Israelites long Beersheba go long Dan, kisim ripot na bringim i kam long me, bilong me save namba blong ol.”

original: But Joab replied, “May the LORD multiply His troops a hundred times over. My lord the king, are they not all servants of my lord? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?”
translation: Mipela i harim Lord bai kamapim planti ol soldiers bilong en hundred taim moa. Papa bilong yu king, ol i no ol wokman bilong papa bilong yu tasol? Bilong wanem papa bilong yu laik mekim dispela? Bilong wanem em bai bringim bagarap long Israel?

original: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab. So Joab departed and traveled throughout Israel, and then he returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Nem mind, tok bilong king i winim Joab. So Joab i go na i wokabaut long ol lakan long graun bilong Isreael, na bai i kam bek gen long Jiusalem.

original: And Joab reported to David the total number of the troops. In all Israel there were 1,100,000 men who drew the sword, including 470,000 in Judah.
translation: Na Joab i kam tokim Davide long namba bilong ol soldier olgeta. Long ol Israel, ikam wantaim olgeta, ol i gat 1,100,000 man i bamim sua, na long Judah tu, ol i gat 470,000.

original: But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the count, because the king’s command was detestable to him.
translation: Bare Joab i no inkludim Levi na Benjamin long ol numbusen, bikos tok bilong king em i bagarap tru long em.

original: This command was also evil in the sight of God; so He struck Israel.
translation: Koman yet i kamap olsem bikhet long ai bilong God, na em i kilim Israel.

original: Then David said to God, “I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing. Now I beg You to take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”
translation: Na Davidson i tokim God olsem, "Mi go longwe na mi kamakai vakai long dispela wok. Nau mi bai yu yet long tekewe iniquiti bilong mi, for mi wokim ol samting long namba wan folly."

original: And the LORD instructed Gad, David’s seer,
translation: Na Lord i givim instrukshun long Gad, man bilong David we em i luk i go bikos.

original: “Go and tell David that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am offering you three options. Choose one of them, and I will carry it out against you.’”
translation: “Go na tokim Davit, dispela em i tok bilong LORD: ‘Mi givim yu tri pilihan. Baim wanpela bilong ol, na mi wokim i kam bek long yu.’”

original: So Gad went and said to David, “This is what the LORD says: ‘You must choose
translation: Gad i go na toktok long David, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'Yu mas pikimuna'"

original: between three years of famine, three months of being swept away before your enemies and overtaken by their swords, or three days of the sword of the LORD—days of plague upon the land, with the angel of the LORD ravaging every part of Israel.’ Now then, decide how I should reply to Him who sent me.”
translation: Bipo tripela yia bilong hangre, tripela mun em bai yu go daun long han bilong eni, ol i kam behainim na katim yupela wantaim sord, o tripela de bilong sord bilong LORD—de bilong sik long graun, na eit bilong LORD i go na bagarapim olgeta hap bilong Israel.’ Nau ole, tingim gutpela we bai mi tokim bek long Em hu mekirim mi.”

original: David answered Gad, “I am deeply distressed. Please, let me fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are very great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.”
translation: Daud i tokim Gad, "Mi birua nogut tru. Lemi go daun long han bilong LORD, bikos merci bilongen i gat planti; tasol no givim mi go daun long han bilong ol man."

original: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead.
translation: Na Bikpela i kirapim sik long ol, na seventy thousand man bilong Israel i dai pinis.

original: Then God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem, but as the angel was doing so, the LORD saw it and relented from the calamity, and He said to the angel who was destroying the people, “Enough! Withdraw your hand now!” At that time the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
translation: Na God i sendim enjel kam distroi Jerusalem, tasol olsem enjel i wok long mekim dispela, LORD i lukim na i sori long hevi bilong calamity, na em i tokim enjel husat i kirapim ol pipol, “I nap! Kamdaun han bilong yu nau!” Olsem taim em i go, enjel bilong LORD i stanap beside plaun bilong winim kuk bilong Ornan Jebusait.

original: When David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem, David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell facedown.
translation: Wanpela taim David i lukautim igo, na em i siangal long angel bilong Jehovah i stap long bikpela hap graun na hap heven, wantaim sord i stret long han bilong en, i pilakai yet long Jerusalema, David na ol birua yet i birua yet, ol i go daun yet, kaliko blak ol i wapim.

original: And David said to God, “Was it not I who gave the order to count the people? I am the one who has sinned and acted wickedly. But these sheep, what have they done? O LORD my God, please let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, but do not let this plague remain upon Your people.”
translation: Na Daud i tokim God, “Nau ai mi yet i givim oda long kauntim ol pipol? Mi yet, mi bin sin na wokim ol samting nogut. Tasol ol sip bilong mipela, ol i mekim wanem? O LORD God bilong mi, leg God yu yet, bihainim mi na haus bilong papa bilong mi, tasol no givim disela plak bai istap long pipol bilong yu.”

original: Then the angel of the LORD ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
translation: Enjel bilong LORD i tokim Gad long tokim Davit long go ap na bikim alta long pilai bilong winim buk bilong Ornan Jebusait, olsem LORD i laik.

original: So David went up at the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the LORD.
translation: Na Daud i go ap long toktok Gad i tok long nem bilong Jehovah.

original: Now Ornan was threshing wheat when he turned and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves.
translation: Na Ornan em i stap kukim waet, em i tornarong na lukim enjel; na fourpela pikinini bilong em i hidim yet.

original: David came to Ornan, and when Ornan looked out and saw David, he left the threshing floor and bowed facedown before David.
translation: Daud i kam bek long Ornan, na Ornan i lukim na i si Daud, na em i lusim ples bilong en pinisim ka na i katim gris long graun bifo Daud.

original: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the site of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar to the LORD. Sell it to me for the full price, so that the plague upon the people may be halted.”
translation: Na David i tokim Ornan olsem, "Givim mi dispela ples we yumai i kamdaun i stap, na mi bai mekim wankain altar long LORD. Sellok impas long mi long prais i kamap tru, na dispela bikpela sik long ol manmeri bai i stap, na i no go bek."

original: Ornan said to David, “My lord the king may take whatever seems good. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering—I will give it all.”
translation: Ornan i tokim David, “Papa bilong yu king bai karim bek ol samting i luk gut long en. Mipela bai givim oksen bilong ofa burntem, wesen bilong mipela i wokim daun graas bilong timber, na wheat bilong ofa grain – mipela bai givim everything.”

original: “No,” replied King David, “I insist on paying the full price, for I will not take for the LORD what belongs to you, nor will I offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.”
translation: “Nogat,” King Davide i bekim tok, “Mi laik pei prais olgeta, bikos mi no ken kisim bilong yu na givim long LORD, na mi no ken ofa saklis olsem samting we nogat kos bilong mi.”

original: So David paid Ornan six hundred shekels of gold for the site.
translation: Na Davide peim Ornan siksandan sikel bilong gol long ples.

original: And there he built an altar to the LORD and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called upon the LORD, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
translation: Na em i go bek gen, na em i bikim wanpela altar long Jehovah, na em i bringim ofring bilong bun na ofring bilong peis. Em i kolim namel long Jehovah, na Jehovah i ansa em wantaim faia kom dawn from heven long altar bilong ofring bilong bun.

original: Then the LORD spoke to the angel, who put his sword back into its sheath.
translation: Bikpela i tokim enjel, na enjel i putim sop bilong en bak long sip.

original: At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.
translation: Long taim ia, wennem David i lukim LORD i givim ansa long em long ples bilong wasim kunai bilong Ornan bilong Jebusait, na em i bringim sakrifis long hap ia.

original: For the tabernacle of the LORD that Moses had made in the wilderness and the altar of burnt offering were presently at the high place in Gibeon,
translation: Haus lotu bilong LORD, Mosis i mekim long bus, na sten bilong ofa i go daun, ol i stap yet long ples hait bilong Gibeon.

original: but David could not go before it to inquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
translation: Daubid inabe i no go pasim for asking longlong bilong God, bikos em i bin poret long sowrd bilong ein bilong LORD.

original: Then David said, “Here shall be the house of the LORD God, as well as the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
translation: Na Davidson i tok, "Haus bilong God LORD bai istap hia, olsem na altabila bilong ofing bung long Israel."

original: So David gave orders to gather the foreigners in the land of Israel, from whom he appointed stonecutters to prepare finished stones for building the house of God.
translation: Na Davidson i givim tok, ol i kam na katim ston long graun bilong Israel, na em i apointim man bung wantaim ston i katim, ol i preparim ston i redi long warkim haus bilong God.

original: David provided a large quantity of iron to make the nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, together with more bronze than could be weighed
translation: Dauid i givim planti ain long wokim nei bilong nales long door bilong gatpes, na wantaim pipia, tasol bronz i pauli, nogat wei bilong mekim pes.

original: and more cedar logs than could be counted; for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought a large quantity of cedar logs to David.
translation: Na i gat planti cedar log olsem ya no ken kauntim; ol Sidian na Tairen i bringim planti cedar log i kam long Daved.

original: And David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent—famous and glorious throughout all lands. Therefore I must make preparations for it.” So David made lavish preparations before his death.
translation: Na Daud i tok, "Pikinami Solomon i yangpela na nogat save, na haus bilong LORD ili bikim winim win longlong - gutpela tumas na swit moa long ol kantri. Olsem na mi mas sikirim ol samting bilong en." Na Daud i mekim bikpela i go longwe bilong en bifo em i dai.

original: Then David called for his son Solomon and instructed him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Na Davidson i singautim pikinini bilong em, Solomon, na i givim em tok instrukshun long bilum haus bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: “My son,” said David to Solomon, “it was in my heart to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God,
translation: Olsem Davide i tokim Solomon, "Pikinami, em i stap long het bilong mi bai mi bilirn haus long nem bilong LORD God bilong mi.

original: but this word of the LORD came to me: ‘You have shed much blood and waged great wars. You are not to build a house for My Name because you have shed so much blood on the ground before Me.
translation: Dispela tok bilong LORD i kam long me: ‘Yu kilim planti man na yu wokim bikpela faits. Yu no ken buildim haus lotu bilong Nem bilong Mi, wantaim yu kilim planti man, na blod i stap graun bifo Mi.’

original: But a son will be born to you who will be a man of rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side; for his name will be Solomon, and I will grant to Israel peace and quiet during his reign.
translation: Wanpela pikinini man bai i kam long yu, em bai man bilong ripos. Mi bai givim em ripos long ol enimi bilong en long ol sait, wantaim nem bilong en Solomon, na mi bai givim Israel pis na stil long tain bilong king em.

original: He is the one who will build a house for My Name. He will be My son, and I will be his Father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
translation: Em i man husat bai baim house long Nem Bilong Mi, na em bai bekim pikinini bilong Mi, na Mi bai bekim Papa bilong em, na mi bai stretem tron bilong ples bilong en long Israel foreva.

original: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you succeed in building the house of the LORD your God, as He said you would.
translation: Nau, pikinini bilong mi, mipela i hop LORD i stap wantaim yu, na yu kamap strong na wakem haus bilong LORD, olsem Bikpela i tok olsem.

original: Above all, may the LORD give you insight and understanding when He puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the Law of the LORD your God.
translation: Long olgeta hap, mipela i kirapim yu, na Bikpela i givim yu tingim i gut, na save nogut, wanpela taim em i stap i go het long yu, na yu i kisim bos bilong Isrel, bikos yu mas mekim gut Lo bilong Bikpela, God bilong yu.

original: Then you will succeed, if you carefully follow the statutes and ordinances that the LORD commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
translation: Yu bai win, mipela yumi bihainim ol loa na rul bilong Bikpela i givim long Mosese long Isrel. Katim gras na i stap strong, no ken kirap na no ken bikim bel.

original: Now behold, I have taken great pains to provide for the house of the LORD—100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron too great to be weighed. I have also provided timber and stone, and you may add to them.
translation: Nau mi lukim, mi bin i go longwe na kisim hap bilong planti wok long haus bilong LORD—100,000 talents bilong gol, 1,000,000 talents bilong silva, bronz na ain tu bikpela tru olsem no ina wei bilong mekim em i go daun. Mi bin i kisim timba na stoan, na yu ken kisim moa long ol.

original: You also have many workers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and men skilled in every kind of work—
translation: Yu tu gat planti wokman: ol man husat i katim ston, ol mason, ol karpenta, na ol man husat i gat save long olgeta kain wok –

original: in gold and silver, bronze and iron—craftsmen beyond number. Now begin the work, and may the LORD be with you.”
translation: Long ol gold na silva, bronzi na airen—ol wokman i gat planti tumas. Nau yu kam statim wok, mipela hop LORD i stap wantaim yu.

original: Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon:
translation: Na Davide i tokim ol bikpela leda long Israel, ol i mas helpim pikinini Solomon blong em.

original: “Is not the LORD your God with you, and has He not granted you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land has been subdued before the LORD and His people.
translation: Em i no LORD God bilong yu stap wantaim yu, na em i givim yu rip os bilong yu long olgeta sait? Tasol em i givim ol man meri bilong graun i go long mi, na graun i bin kukim pinis bifor LORD na ol pipol bilong em.

original: Now set your heart and soul to seek the LORD your God. Get started building the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy articles of God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the LORD.”
translation: Nau plantim het bilong yu na soul bilong yu long sori long Bikpela LORD, na bikim haus lotu bilong Bikpela LORD God, na kisim bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD, na samting bilong halivim bilong God, i go insait long haus lotu em bai i bikim long Nem bilong LORD.

original: When David was old and full of years, he installed his son Solomon as king over Israel.
translation: Taim Daoud i olsem old pinis, na em bungim Solomon pikinini bilong em i go bek king long hap bilong Israel.

original: Then he gathered all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.
translation: Em i kam bek long olgeta bikman bilong Israel, olsem na ol prist na Levaita.

original: The Levites thirty years of age or older were counted, and the total number of men was 38,000.
translation: Ol Levait i 30 yia na ova, ol i bin kauntim, na namba bilong ol man i kamap 38,000.

original: “Of these,” said David, “24,000 are to oversee the work of the house of the LORD, 6,000 are to be officers and judges,
translation: Long ol dispela, tok David, 24,000 i mas lukautim wok bilong haus bilong Lod, 6,000 i mas ofisa na juj.

original: 4,000 are to be gatekeepers, and 4,000 are to praise the LORD with the instruments I have made for giving praise.”
translation: 4,000 i mas bekim gatemana, na 4,000 i mas givim pepepe long LORD wantaim instrument mi bin mekim bilong givim pepepe.

original: Then David divided the Levites into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
translation: Na David i divelopim Levit ol i go long longolong divison, olsem hap bilong Levi: Gesom, Kohat, na Merari.

original: The Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
translation: Ol Gershonites: Ladan na Shimei.

original: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the first, Zetham, and Joel—three in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ladan: Jehiel em i namba wan, Zetham, na Joel—ol three tasol.

original: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran—three in all. These were the heads of the families of Ladan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, na Haran – ol i three tasol. Dispela i ol bikpela hap bilong lain bilong Ladan.

original: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei—four in all.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, na Beriah. Dispela i ol pikinini bilong Shimei – foa bilong olgeta.

original: Jahath was the first and Zizah was the second; but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted as one family and received a single assignment.
translation: Jahath em i namba wan, Zizah em i namba tu; Jeush na Beriah ol i no gat planti pikinini man, olsem ol i kamap wan famili tasol na ol i kisim wok singel.

original: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kohat: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, na Uzziel – foa olgeta.

original: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron and his descendants were set apart forever to consecrate the most holy things, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister before Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name forever.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Amram: Aron na Moses. Aron na ol desenden bilong en i stap apart oltaim long sakem samting namba wan holigren, long bunim smok go long ples bilong LORD, long minista long en, na long givim bekim tok bilong blesim long nem bilong en oltaim.

original: As for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
translation: Long Moses man bilong God, ol pikinini bilong em i kolim long klab bilong Levi.

original: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Moisi: Gesom na Eliesa.

original: The descendants of Gershom: Shebuel was the first.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Gershom: Shebuel em i kam first.

original: The descendants of Eliezer: Rehabiah was the first. Eliezer did not have any other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Eliezer: Rehabiah em i namba wan. Eliezer i no gat narapela pikinini man, tasol pikinini bilong Rehabiah i plenti tumas.

original: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the first.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Izhar: Shelomith em i kam first.

original: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Hebron: Jeriah em i kam first, Amariah em i sekend, Jahaziel em i thard, na Jekameam em i foa.

original: The sons of Uzziel: Micah was the first and Isshiah the second.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Uzziel: Mika em i kam first, na Ishaya em i kam sekond.

original: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Merari: Mahli na Mushi. Ol pikinini bilong Mahli: Eleazar na Kish.

original: Eleazar died without having any sons; he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them.
translation: Eleazar i dai pinis, em i katim meri tasol, i no gat man. Brata bilong papa bilong ol, ol bilong Kish, i maritim ol.

original: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth—three in all.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Mushi: Mahli, Eder, na Jeremoth – ol i go tripela tasol.

original: These were the descendants of Levi by their families—the heads of families, registered individually by name—those twenty years of age or older who worked in the service of the house of the LORD.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Levi, ikam long oleta famili, het bilong oleta famili, ol i skrivim nem bilong ol yet, wanwan, ol twenty yia na i go long, o posin, ol i wok long servos bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: For David had said, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has given rest to His people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever.
translation: Daud i tok olsem, "LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, i givim pes bilong ol pipol na i kam stap long Jerusalem foreva."

original: So now the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles for its service.”
translation: Nau Levitiko igat nau olsem, inogat karim tabenakil na sampela samting long servisse bilong en.

original: For according to the final instructions of David, the Levites twenty years of age or older were counted,
translation: Long taim bai i go pinis, olsem laik bilong Daavid, Levait pipol we olgeta i gat twenty yia na i go antap long dispela, ol i kan.

original: but their duty was to assist the descendants of Aaron with the service of the house of the LORD, being responsible for the courts and chambers, the purification of all the holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God,
translation: Bai wok bilong ol i kam ap long helpim ol desendan bilong Aron wantaim servis bilong haus bilong LORD, ol i mas lukautim ples na rum bilong kot, puripikेशन bilong ol samting bilong haliv, na wok bilong servis bilong haus bilong God.

original: as well as for the rows of the showbread, the fine flour for the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baking, the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.
translation: Na olsem tu long ol rols bilong bred bilong sho, flauer fini bilong ofing bilong grin, wafers bilong bred em i no gat yeast, bikim bread, mixim samting, na olgeta hap bilong em, olsem namba na sait.

original: They were also to stand every morning to give thanks and praise to the LORD, and likewise in the evening.
translation: Oli mas stap strong olsem kila maunin na apinun long givim sankyu na prais long PAPA GOD, na olsem tu oli mas sanap strong long naitai.

original: Whenever burnt offerings were presented to the LORD on the Sabbaths, New Moons, and appointed feasts, they were to serve regularly before the LORD in the numbers prescribed for them.
translation: Long taim husat ofa em i paul i kamap long ples bilong Bikpela, ol i wokim servis bilong ol olsem oltaim bifor Bikpela long Dei Bilong Rip, Mun Nupela, na Dei Bilong Kaikai Husat i Save, ol i gat namba husat i kamap long kanon bilong ol.

original: So the Levites were to carry out the responsibilities for the Tent of Meeting and the Holy Place, and, under their brothers the descendants of Aaron, the service of the house of the LORD.
translation: Levaitis i mas wokim ol responisbiliti long han long Haus bilong Miting na Haliv Ples, na aninit long brata bilong ol, desenden bilong Aron, ol i mas mekim sisa bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: These were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
translation: Em i stap long divison olsem bilong ol desenden bilong Aron. Sons bilong Aron i stap: Nadab, Abihu, Elezar, na Itamar.

original: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
translation: Nadab na Abihu i dai pinis bipo papa bilong ol i dai yet, na ol i no gat pikinini man; olezet Eleazar na Ithamar i warkim pastor.

original: With the help of Eleazar’s descendant Zadok and Ithamar’s descendant Ahimelech, David divided them according to the offices of their service.
translation: Long help bilong Eleaza pikinini bilong en Zadok na Ithama pikinini bilong en Ahimelek, Daud i divelopim ol long olsem ofis bilong wok bung.

original: Since more leaders were found among Eleazar’s descendants than those of Ithamar, they were divided accordingly. There were sixteen heads of families from the descendants of Eleazar and eight from the descendants of Ithamar.
translation: Bikos ol i finim planti moa lida long ol desenden bilong Eleazar, ol i dividim ol narapela. Na was sais hap bilong papa na mama i kam long desenden bilong Eleazar, na eit bilong ol i kam long desenden bilong Ithamar.

original: Thus they were divided by lot, for there were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God among both Eleazar’s and Ithamar’s descendants.
translation: Ol i divelop long rot, wantaim ol i gat ofisa bilong haiwe haus na ofisa bilong God long ol descent bilong Eleazar na Ithamar.

original: The scribe, Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officers: Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of families of the priests and the Levites—one family being taken from Eleazar, and then one from Ithamar.
translation: Skaibe Shemaiah, pikinini bilong Nethanel, wanpela Levite, i rakim nem bilong ol long han bilong king na ofisa: Zadok prist, Ahimelech, pikinini bilong Abiathar, na hed bilong papa graun bilong prist na Levites – em i tekin wanpela famili bilong Eleaza, na bihain em i tekin wanpela famili bilong Ithama.

original: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
translation: Em i go daun na pasim long namba wan, Jioarib i kisim tiket bilong namba wan, na namba tu i go long Jedaya.

original: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
translation: Namba tri i go long Harim, namba foa i go long Seorim,

original: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
translation: Namba faiv i go long Malchijah, namba sikis i go long Mijamin,

original: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
translation: Namba seven i go long Hakkoz, namba eight i go long Abijah,

original: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
translation: Namba nain i go long Jeshua, namba ten i go long Shekaniah,

original: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
translation: Nambatuwan i go long Eliashib, nambatuluv i go long Jakim,

original: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
translation: Nambatu thirteen i go long Huppah, nambafourteen i go long Jeshebeab,

original: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
translation: Kauntim fifteenth i go long Bilgah, kauntim sixteenth i go long Immer,

original: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
translation: Nambatu seventeen i go long Hezir, nambatu eighteen i go long Happizzez,

original: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
translation: Nambatu klak i go long Pethahiah, nambatu ein i go long Jehezkel,

original: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
translation: nambis twenty-one i go long Jachin, nambis twenty-two i go long Gamul

original: the twenty-third to Delaiah, and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
translation: Kaunti twenty-three i kam long Delaiah, na kaunti twenty-four i kam long Maaziah.

original: This was their appointed order for service when they entered the house of the LORD, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their forefather Aaron, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
translation: Dispela em i nau ordar bilong servis ol i go long, wen ol i go insait long haus bilong LORD, ol i bihainim ol ru na loa, olsem tumbuna Aaron i bin statim long loa, olsem LORD, God bilong Israel, i bin tokim em.

original: Now these were the remaining descendants of Levi: From the sons of Amram: Shubael; from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.
translation: Nau dispela i stap ol lain bilong Levi we i stap nabaut: Long ol pikinini bilong Amram: Shubael; long ol pikinini bilong Shubael: Jehdeiah.

original: As for Rehabiah, from his sons: The first was Isshiah.
translation: Long Rebahia, long ol pikinini bilong em, em i kam first, na em i Issiya.

original: From the Izharites: Shelomoth; from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
translation: Long ol descendent bilong Izhar: Shelomoth; long ol pikinini bilong Shelomoth: Jahath.

original: From the sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Hebron: Jeriah em i kam first, Amariah em i sekond, Jahaziel em i thurd, na Jekameam em i foa.

original: From the sons of Uzziel: Micah; from the sons of Micah: Shamir.
translation: Long ol pikanini bilong Uzziel: Mikah; long ol pikanini bilong Mikah: Shamir.

original: The brother of Micah: Isshiah; from the sons of Isshiah: Zechariah.
translation: Braza bilong Mikah: Isaya; long ol pikinini bilong Isaya: Zekaria.

original: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah: Beno.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Merari: Mahli na Mushi. Pikinini bilong Jaaziah: Beno.

original: The descendants of Merari from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Merari long Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, na Ibri.

original: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
translation: Long Mahli i kam: Eleazar, ol i no gat pikinini man.

original: From Kish: Jerahmeel the son of Kish.
translation: Long Kish: Jerahmeel, man bilong Kish.

original: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites, according to their families.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Mushi: Mahli, Eder, na Jerimoth. Dispela i ol pikinini bilong Levitai, olgeta long famili bilong ol.

original: As their brothers the descendants of Aaron did, they also cast lots in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the families of the priests and Levites—the family heads and their younger brothers alike.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Aron, ol brata bilong ol, ol kirapim ston tu long hap bilong King Davide na Zadok, Ahimelek, na lidaman bilong famili bilong pris na Levit - ol i mekim wankain long hap bilong ol papa bilong famili na ol brata bilong ol, bikos ol i gat lain bilong pris.

original: Additionally, David and the commanders of the army set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun to prophesy with the accompaniment of lyres, harps, and cymbals. The following is the list of the men who performed this service:
translation: David na ofisa bilong army i setim apikinini bilong Asaf, Heman, na Jedutan long tok bilong Spirit wantaim saund bilong gita, hap, na simbal. Dispela em i list bilong man husat i wokim dispela servisis:

original: From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah. These sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king.
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Asaf: Zakur, Joseph, Netania, na Asarela. Ol pikinini bilong Asaf i bin stap long han bilong direksion bilong Asaf, em i bin tokaut long han bilong direksion bilong king.

original: From the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah—six in all—under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the harp, giving thanks and praise to the LORD.
translation: Long ol pikanini bilong Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, na Mattithiah—six altogether—ol i go unda bos bilong tupa Jeduthun, ol i profesi wantaim harp, givim sankyu na prais long LORD.

original: From the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
translation: Long ol pikanini bilong Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, na Mahazioth.

original: All these sons of Heman the king’s seer were given him through the promises of God to exalt him, for God had given Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Heman, man prophets bilong king, ol i givim i kam bek long promis bilong God, long bringim em i go hap, bikos God i givim Heman fourteen ol pikinini man na three ol pikinini meri.

original: All these were under the direction of their fathers for the music of the house of the LORD with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.
translation: Olgeta i go bek long papa bilong ol long musik bilong haus bilong LORD, wantaim symbal, hap, na laip, long sabis bilong haus bilong God. Asaf, Jedutan, na Heman, ol i go bek long king.

original: Together with their relatives, who were all trained and skillful in the songs of the LORD, they numbered 288.
