translation: Wanpela wantaim ol famili bilong ol, ol i skulim na save long sang bilong LORD, ol i kauntim 288.

original: They cast lots for their duties, young and old alike, teacher as well as pupil.
translation: Ol i kirapim ston long wok bilong ol, liklik na bikpela olsem wan, tisa wantaim student.

original: The first lot, which was for Asaph, fell to Joseph, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all; the second to Gedaliah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Lot namba wan, em i go long Asaph, i kam bek long Joseph, pikinini bilong en, na brata bilong en—olgeta 12; namba tu i go long Gedaliah, pikinini bilong en, na brata bilong en—olgeta 12.

original: the third to Zaccur, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Na dispela tript i go long Zakkur, na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta;

original: the fourth to Izri, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba foa i go long Izri, na ol pikinini na ol brata bilong em – ol twelv hap.

original: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Kaia numba faiv i go long Nethaniah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em—12 olgeta;

original: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba sikis i go long Bukkiah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em—12 altogether;

original: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba sevhen i go long Jesarelah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em—12 olgeta;

original: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba eyt i go long Jesaia, na ol pikinini bilong en, na ol brata bilong en – 12 altogether;

original: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Nain bilong Mattaniah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta;

original: the tenth to Shimei, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba ten i go long Shimei, na ol pikinini na ol brata bilong em – ol i kamap twelev insait.

original: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba eleven i go long Azarel, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Numa 12 ibin go long Hashabiah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – olem 12 altogether.

original: the thirteenth to Shubael, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba thirteen i go long Shubael, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – olgeta 12.

original: the fourteenth to Mattithiah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba fotin bihain i go long Mattithiah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba fifteenth i go long Jeremoth, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba sixteen i go long Hanania, na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – ol i kamap 12 altogether.

original: the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba seventin i go long Joshbekashah, na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Numa etin de Hanani, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba nainteen i go long Mallothi, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 altogether;

original: the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba twenty ikam long Eliathah, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta;

original: the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Namba twenty-one i go long Hothir, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em—12 olgeta;

original: the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Numbu twenty-two i kam long Giddalti, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all;
translation: Nambatu twenty-thri i go long Mahazioth, ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – olgeta twelve.

original: and the twenty-fourth to Romamti-ezer, his sons, and his brothers—12 in all.
translation: Na twenti-fō i go long Romamti-ezer, na ol pikinini bilong em, na ol brata bilong em – 12 olgeta.

original: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers: From the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.
translation: Ol divisen bilong ol wokman long gate: Long ol desenden bilong Korah, Mesilemia, pikinini bilong Kore, em i wanpela long ol pikinini bilong Asap.

original: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
translation: Meshelemiah i gat pikinini ol: Zechariah em i namba wan, Jediael em i namba tu, Zebadiah em i namba tri, Jathniel em i namba foa.

original: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
translation: Elam namba faiv, Jehohanan namba sikis, na Eliehoenai namba seven.

original: And Obed-edom also had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
translation: Na Obed-edom i gat ol pikinini: Shemaiah em i nambatu, Jehozabad em i nambatri, Joah em i nambarfoa, Sachar em i nambafour, Nethanel em i nambarfaif.

original: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth. For God had blessed Obed-edom.
translation: Ammiel em sixpela, Isakara em sevempela, na Peullethai em eitpela. Bikos God i givim planti luk long Obed-edom.

original: Also to his son Shemaiah were born sons who ruled over their families because they were strong, capable men.
translation: Na long pikinini Shemaiah, ol i kamap pikinini man, na ol i bosim pamily bilong ol, bikos ol i strong, ol i gat save, na ol i ken lidim pamily bilong ol.

original: Shemaiah’s sons were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad; his brothers were Elihu and Semachiah, also capable men.
translation: Pikinini bilong Shemaiah i mekim Othni, Rephael, Obed, na Elzabad; na brata bilong em i Elihu na Semachiah, ol man strong tu.

original: All these were descendants of Obed-edom; they and their sons and brothers were capable men with strength to do the work—62 in all from Obed-edom.
translation: Ol desenden ol i kam bek long famili bilong Obed-Edom, ol man strong na save wok, na ol brata na ol pikinini bilong ol, ol i gat strength long wokim wok - 62 ol i kam bek long Obed-Edom.

original: Meshelemiah also had sons and brothers who were capable men—18 in all.
translation: Na Meshelemiah i gat ol pikinini tu na brata bilong en ol man strong, 18 olgeta.

original: Hosah the Merarite also had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father had appointed him as the first),
translation: Hosah bilong Merari i gat pikinini, na Shimri em i namba wan, maski em i no pikinini bilong papa, tasol papa bilong en i bin apointim em long namba wan.

original: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. The sons and brothers of Hosah numbered 13 in all.
translation: Hilkiah em i sekond, Tebaliah em i thard, na Zechariah em i foa. Ol pikinini na ol brata bilong Hosah i gat 13 olgeta.

original: These divisions of the gatekeepers, through their chief men, had duties for ministering in the house of the LORD, just as their brothers did.
translation: Ol divishen bilong ol gatemana, ol i go pas long ol bikpela man, ol i gat wok long sarvis long haus bilong LORD, olsem brata bilong ol i mekim.

original: They cast lots for each gate, according to their families, young and old alike.
translation: Ol i kirapim ston long liklik gate na bikpela gate, ol i kamapo long ol famili bilong ol, na ol i go long yutpi na olopas olgeta.

original: The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.
translation: Pilai bilong Get Isten i go long Shelemiah. Ol i kastim pilai, na pilai i kamap long pikinini Zechariah bilong em, em i kanselor i gat save, na pilai bilong Get Nort i go long em.

original: The lot for the South Gate fell to Obed-edom, and the lot for the storehouses to his sons.
translation: Lot bilong Saut Gate i go long Obed-edom, na lot bilong ples bilong kisim ka i go long pikinini bilong em.

original: The lots for the West Gate and the Shallecheth Gate on the ascending highway fell to Shuppim and Hosah. There were guards stationed at every watch.
translation: Ol ka bilong Get Weston na Get Shallecheth long rod i go ap inem asign long Shuppim na Hosah. Ol ka i stap yet long ol wach bilong taim.

original: Each day there were six Levites on the east, four on the north, four on the south, and two pairs at the storehouse.
translation: Long olgeta de, na i gat sikis Levit long sindaun bilong sun, fo a long not bilong kantry, fo a long saut bilong kantry, na tu pe i stap klostu long ples bilong storim samting.

original: As for the court on the west, there were four at the highway and two at the court.
translation: Long kaunti long wes, em i gat foa long rot na tu long kaunti.

original: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers who were descendants of Korah and Merari.
translation: Ol divison bilong ol gatman i go we ol desenden bilong Korah na Merari.

original: Now their fellow Levites were in charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries of the dedicated things.
translation: Nau ol felo Levait bilong ol i lukautim haus moni bilong haus bilong God na ol samting bilong winim God.

original: From the descendants of Ladan, who were Gershonites through Ladan and heads of the families of Ladan the Gershonite, were Jehieli,
translation: Long ol descent bilong Ladan, ol i bin Gershonites thru Ladan, na ol i bikpela hap bilong papa graun bilong Ladan dispela Gershonite, em i Jehieli.

original: the sons of Jehieli, Zetham, and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the treasuries of the house of the LORD.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Jehieli, Zetham, na brata bilong em Joel, ol i kam bek long lukautim ol tresori bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
translation: Long ol Amramit, long ol Izharit, long ol Hebronit, na long ol Uzzielit:

original: Shebuel, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the officer in charge of the treasuries.
translation: Shebuel, wan pikinini bilong Gershom, man bilong Moses, em i ofisa i stap long hap bilong haus moni.

original: His relatives through Eliezer included Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
translation: Ol famili bilong en long paipo Eliezer i inkludim Rehabiah pikinini bilong en, Jeshaiah pikinini bilong en, Joram pikinini bilong en, Zichri pikinini bilong en, na Shelomith pikinini bilong en.

original: This Shelomith and his brothers were in charge of all the treasuries for the things dedicated by King David, by the heads of families who were the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and by the army commanders.
translation: Dispela Shelomith na brata bilong en i kam long kontrolim ol haus bilong moni na gol we wail dedikeitom long King Dauid, long hed bilong papa na mama ol komanda bilong tausen na hundres, na long komanda bilong armi.

original: They had dedicated some of the plunder from their battles to the repair of the house of the LORD.
translation: Ol i makim dediket planti bilong ol faits long wokim gut aus hus bilong LORD.

original: Everything that had been dedicated by Samuel the seer, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah, along with everything else that was dedicated, was under the care of Shelomith and his brothers.
translation: Olgeta samting we i bin dediki long taim bilong Samuel man prophet, Saul pikinini bilong Kish, Abner pikinini bilong Ner, na Joab pikinini bilong Zeruiah, wantaim olgeta narakain samting we i bin dediki, i bin stap aninit long han bilong Shelomith na brata bilong em.

original: From the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons had the outside duties as officers and judges over Israel.
translation: Long ol ples Izhar, Chenaniah na ol pikinini bilong en i gat wok long hap bilong otside olsem ofisa na jaj ibilong Israel.

original: From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his relatives, 1,700 capable men, had charge of the affairs of Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the LORD and for the service of the king.
translation: Long Hebronites, Hashabiah na ol famili bilong em, 1,700 man meri strongpela, ol i lukautim wok bilong Israel wes sai bilong Joden, long olgeta wok bilong LORD na long sabis bilong king.

original: As for the Hebronites, Jerijah was the chief of the Hebronites, according to the genealogies of his ancestors. In the fortieth year of David’s reign the records were searched, and strong, capable men were found among the Hebronites at Jazer in Gilead.
translation: Long ol Hebronit na, Jerija em i bikpela long ol Hebronit, olsem genalogi bilong tumbuna i go daun. Long yia 40 bilong rein bilong King Davide, ol i saachim bek long buk, na ol man strong na Save long ol Hebronit i kamap long Jaza inside Gilead.

original: Among Jerijah’s relatives there were 2,700 capable men who were heads of families. King David appointed them over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh for every matter pertaining to God and to the affairs of the king.
translation: Long ol famili bilong Jerijah, i gat 2,700 ol man strong na i save lidim papa graun, King Davit i apoinim ol long Ol Reuben, Ol Gad, na hap tribe bilong Manase, ol i wok long ol samting we i kamap bilong God na bilong wok bilong king.

original: This is the list of the Israelites—the heads of families, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers who served the king in every matter concerning the divisions on rotating military duty each month throughout the year. There were 24,000 men in each division:
translation: Dispela em i lis bilong Israelait, ol bikpela hap bilong pamilia, kapten bilong tausen na hundres, na ofisa bilong ol i sarve king long ol samting bilong grup bilong solja i kam bek long wok bilong solja long mun bilong yia. Long kila dividion, em i gat 24,000 man:

original: Jashobeam son of Zabdiel was in charge of the first division, which was assigned the first month. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Jashobeam, pikinini bilong Zabdiel, em i bos bilong hap diwison, em i kamap long mun wanpela. Na ol man 24,000 i stap long diwison bilong em.

original: He was a descendant of Perez and chief of all the army commanders for the first month.
translation: Em i bikpela desenden bilong Perez, na em i big man bilong ol komanda bilong army long mun em i kam first.

original: Dodai the Ahohite was in charge of the division for the second month, and Mikloth was the leader. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Dodai Ahohite em i bos long divelop bilong mun two, na Mikloth em i bikpela man long en. Longpela grup bilong en, em i gat 24,000 ol man.

original: The third army commander, as chief for the third month, was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the priest. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Komanda bilong thiird ples bilong army, olsem chief bilong mun thiird, em i Benaiah sambai bilong Jehoiada priis. Na ol i gat 24,000 man long divison bilong em.

original: This Benaiah was mighty among the Thirty and was over the Thirty, and his son Ammizabad was in charge of his division.
translation: Dispela Benaiah i strong tumas long ol Thirty, na em i bos long ol Thirty, na yanem Ammizabad i lukautim kompi ani.

original: The fourth, for the fourth month, was Joab’s brother Asahel, and his son Zebadiah was commander after him. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba foa, long mun namba foa, em i brata bilong Joab, Asahel, na son bilong em, Zebadia, i bos bihain long em. Na ol man i kamap 24,000 long hap bilong em.

original: The fifth, for the fifth month, was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Kaun fim, long mun fim, em i komanda Shamhuth man Izrah. Na ol i gat 24,000 man long divison bilong en.

original: The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Nambatu, long mun nambatu, na Ira sussa bilong Ikkesh man Tekoait. Na i gat 24,000 man long hap bilong en.

original: The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba seven, long mun namba seven, em i Helez bilong Pelonite, man bilong Ephraim. Na ol i 24,000 man long kompi ani.

original: The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai the Hushathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba eyt, long mun eighth, em i Sibbecai man Hushathite, Zerahite desendan. Na i gat 24,000 man long divison bilong em.

original: The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite, a Benjamite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba nain, long namba nain mun, em i Abiezer Anathothite, man bilong Benjimin. Na ol i gat 24,000 man long hap divison.

original: The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba ten, long mun namba ten, em i Maharai man Netofati, wanpela man Zera. Na ol i gat 24,000 man long kompi na.

original: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba eleven, long namba eleven mun, em i Benaiah man bilong Pirathon, wanpela man bilong Ephraim. Na ol i gat 24,000 man long hap bilong em.

original: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, from the family of Othniel. There were 24,000 men in his division.
translation: Namba twelve, long mun twelve, em i Heldai man Netofati, long famili bilong Otniel. Na i gat 24,000 man long hap bilong em.

original: These officers were in charge of the tribes of Israel: Over the Reubenites was Eliezer son of Zichri; over the Simeonites was Shephatiah son of Maacah;
translation: Ofisa i kam bek long taim bilong Israel: Long ol Reubeni, Eliezer son bilong Zichri i bin bos; Long ol Simeoni, Shephatiah son bilong Maacah i bin bos.

original: over Levi was Hashabiah son of Kemuel; over Aaron was Zadok;
translation: Long Levi em i Hashabiah man bilong Kemuel; long Aaron em i Zadok;

original: over Judah was Elihu, one of David’s brothers; over Issachar was Omri son of Michael;
translation: Long Judah i got Elihu, wanpela bilong brata bilong David; long Issachar i got Omri, Pikinini bilong Mikaol.

original: over Zebulun was Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; over Naphtali was Jerimoth son of Azriel;
translation: Long Zebulun, bikman bilong en em Ishmaiah, sot bilong Obadiah; long Naphtali, bikman bilong en em Jerimoth, sot bilong Azriel.

original: over the Ephraimites was Hoshea son of Azaziah; over one of the half-tribes of Manasseh was Joel son of Pedaiah;
translation: Long long ol Ephraimites na Hoshea sambai bilong Azaziah em i bin kiap; long wanpela hap tribe bilong Manasseh na Joel sambai bilong Pedaiah em i bin kiap.

original: over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead was Iddo son of Zechariah; over Benjamin was Jaasiel son of Abner;
translation: Long hap-tribe bilong Manase long Gilead em i Iddo, pikinini bilong Zechariah; long Benjamin em i Jaasiel, pikinini bilong Abner;

original: and over Dan was Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
translation: Na Azarel man bilong Jeroham i stap win long Dan. Ol i bikpela leda long ol trib long Israel.

original: David did not count the men aged twenty or under, because the LORD had said that He would make Israel as numerous as the stars of the sky.
translation: Daud i no bin kauntim manmeri husat i gat twenti yia na unda, bikos Bikpela i tok olsem, em i mekim Israel i kamap olsem sta bilong heven.

original: Joab son of Zeruiah began to count the men but did not finish. For because of this census wrath came upon Israel, and the number was not entered in the Book of the Chronicles of King David.
translation: Joab san bilong Zeruiah i statim kauntim ol man, tasol em i no kamap yet. Bikos long dispela kauntim, ros i kam long Israel, na namba i no raitim long Buk bilong Stori bilong King Dauid.

original: Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the royal storehouses. Jonathan son of Uzziah was in charge of the storehouses in the country, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
translation: Azmaveth, pikinini bilong Adiel, em i bos long ples bilong ka bilong king. Jonathan, pikinini bilong Uzziah, em i bos long ples bilong ka long kantri, long taun, long vilij, na long ples bilong wara.

original: Ezri son of Chelub was in charge of the workers in the fields who tilled the soil.
translation: Ezri pikinini bilong Chelub i stap long ples bilong bos bilong ol wokman long graun ol i wokim gras na tilim graun.

original: Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards. Zabdi the Shiphmite was in charge of the produce of the vineyards for the wine vats.
translation: Shimei bilong Ramathite em i lukautim painim ka. Zabdi bilong Shiphmite em i stap long ples bilong kam apim produis bilong painim ka long tanks bilong wain.

original: Baal-hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive and sycamore trees in the foothills. Joash was in charge of the stores of olive oil.
translation: Baal-hanan Gederite em i bos bilong oлив treis na sukomore treis long bun legis. Joash em i bos bilong hap bilong stua bilong oil bilong oliv.

original: Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the herds grazing in Sharon. Shaphat son of Adlai was in charge of the herds in the valleys.
translation: Sitrai man bilong Soron em i bos bilong ol bulmakau i stap long hap bilong Soron, ol i kaikai gras. Safat, pikinini bilong Adlai, em i bos bilong ol bulmakau i stap long valis, ol i kaikai gras.

original: Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels. Jehdeiah the Meronothite was in charge of the donkeys.
translation: Obil bilong Ol Descendant bilong Ishmael em i bos bilong kamel. Jehdeiah bilong Ol Meronothite em i bos bilong donki.

original: Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks. All these officials were in charge of King David’s property.
translation: Jaziz bilong Hagrite i bin bos long ol hek. Ol ofsara ol i bin bos long papa graun bilong King David.

original: David’s uncle Jonathan was a counselor; he was a man of insight and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hachmoni attended to the sons of the king.
translation: Dadi bilong David, Jonathan em i wan counselor; em i man bilong save na scribe. Jehiel sussa bilong Hachmoni i lukautim pikinini bilong king.

original: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor. Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
translation: Ahithophel em i konsela bilong king. Hushai Arcite em i poroman bilong king.

original: Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah, then by Abiathar. Joab was the commander of the king’s army.
translation: Ahithofel em i kam bihain long Jehoiada pikinini bilong Benaia, na bihain ol i kam Abiatar. Joab em i kapten bilong army bilong king.

original: Now David summoned all the leaders of Israel to Jerusalem: the leaders of the tribes, the leaders of the divisions in the king’s service, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and the officials in charge of all the property and cattle of the king and his sons, along with the court officials and mighty men—every mighty man of valor.
translation: Nau Davide i kirapim olgeta bikman bilong Israel long Yerusalem: olgeta bikman bilong tribe, olgeta bikman bilong divison insait long servis bilong king, komanda bilong tausen na bilong hundret, na ofisa i lukautim olgeta propati na kuk bilong king na pikinini bilong en, wantaim na ofisa bilong kot na ol strongpela man—ol strongpela man we i gat strong.

original: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Listen to me, my brothers and my people. It was in my heart to build a house as a resting place for the ark of the covenant of the LORD and as a footstool for our God. I had made preparations to build it,
translation: King Daudo em i kam daun na i sanap, na em i tok, "Husait, harim tok bilong mi, brata na piple bilong mi. Em i stap long het bilong mi long mekim wanpela haus olsem ples bilong katim na isap long bokis bilong kaunsil bilong LORD, na olsem pati bilong foot bilong God bilong yumi. Mi bin mekim ol samting i rede long mekim em.

original: but God said to me, ‘You are not to build a house for My Name, because you are a man of war who has spilled blood.’
translation: Masintai i tokim olsem long me, ‘Yumi no ken buildim haus bilong Nem blo Mi, bikos yu man bilong pait, yu kilim man olsem na pilim blod.’

original: Yet the LORD, the God of Israel, chose me out of all my father’s house to be king over Israel forever. For He chose Judah as leader, and from the house of Judah He chose my father’s household, and from my father’s sons He was pleased to make me king over all Israel.
translation: Yet Lod, Papa God bilong Israel, em i piksim me long olgeta haus bilong papa bilong me king olsem long Israel. Olsem nau em i choosim Juda olsem lidia, na em i choosim haus bilong papa bilong me long haus bilong Juda, na em i bikpela long me long olgeta susa bilong papa bilong me, bekim me king olsem long ol Israel.

original: And of all my sons—for the LORD has given me many sons—He has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
translation: Na long ol pikinini bilong mi - bikos LORD im givim mi planti pikinini, em i choisim Solomon pikinini bilong mi olsem em i go sitten long thrown bilong ples bilong LORD iben long Israel.

original: And He said to me, ‘Solomon your son is the one who will build My house and My courts, for I have chosen him as My son, and I will be his Father.
translation: Em i tokim olsem long me, ‘Solomona pikinini bilong yu em i bai ibilum haus bilong Mi na kot bilong Mi, bikos Mi pilim em long me olsem pikinini bilong Mi, na Mi bai kamap Papa bilong em.

original: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he resolutely carries out My commandments and ordinances, as is being done this day.’
translation: Bai mi kamapim kingdam bilong en foreva, if i sori em i wankain strong long mekim komanda na lo bilong ples bilong mi, olsem ol i mekim tude.

original: So now in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God, keep and seek out all the commandments of the LORD your God, so that you may possess this good land and leave it as an inheritance to your descendants forever.
translation: Nau long ol geta bilong yumi yet Israel, mobilization bilong ol pipol long LORD, na long hering bilong God bilong yumi, yumi mas kisim strongim na salim ol tok bilong LORD, bambai yumi bai ken bamim dispela gudan graun, na livaim em i go daun long generations bilong yumi foreva.

original: As for you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve Him wholeheartedly and with a willing mind, for the LORD searches every heart and understands the intent of every thought. If you seek Him, He will be found by you; but if you forsake Him, He will reject you forever.
translation: Long yu, Solomon bilong mi, save long God bilong papa bilong yu na servim God olgeta haptim na wantaim mit bilong yu i stap redi, bikos LORD i lukim hap bilong ol manmeri na i save long tingting bilong olgeta man. Yusla salim bek bilong soim God, em bai yu kisim bek bilong soim God; bikos if yu livaim God tasol, em bai pilai i lusim yu foreva.

original: Consider now that the LORD has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary. Be strong and do it.”
translation: Noken tingim nau, Papa God i pikinim yu long wokim haus bilong hap tumuna. Strong na mekim.

original: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the portico of the temple, its buildings, storehouses, upper rooms, inner rooms, and the room for the mercy seat.
translation: Na David i givim pikanini Solomon plan bilong en long porch bilong haus lotu, na ol haus i go, stoas, rum bilong antap, rum bilong insait, na rum bilong sit bilong mercy.

original: The plans contained everything David had in mind for the courts of the house of the LORD, for all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of the house of God and of the dedicated things,
translation: Plani em i kamapim olgeta samting we David i gat long tingting bilong en, olsem long kothaus bilong haus bilong LORD, long ol rum i karim ol samting narakai long Haus bilong LORD, long ol treasuri bilong haus bilong God na ol samting em i dediket.

original: for the divisions of the priests and Levites, for all the work of service in the house of the LORD, and for all the articles of service in the house of the LORD:
translation: Long divisen bilong pries na Levait, long olgeta wok servis insait long haus bilong LORD, na long ol samting bilong servis insait long haus bilong LORD:

original: the weight of all the gold articles for every kind of service; the weight of all the silver articles for every kind of service;
translation: Wet bilong olgeta samting bilong gol long olkain kindim sabis; wet bilong olgeta samting bilong silva long olkain kindim sabis;

original: the weight of the gold lampstands and their lamps, including the weight of each lampstand and its lamps; the weight of each silver lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each lampstand;
translation: Wet bilong gol lampstan na lampa bilong ol, inkludivm wet bilong bekim lampstan na lampa bilong en; wet bilong silva lampstan na lampa bilong en, olsem usim bilong bekim lampstan.

original: the weight of gold for each table of showbread, and of silver for the silver tables;
translation: Wet bilong gol long wanpela tepol bilong bred bilong sho, na bilong silva long tepol silva;

original: the weight of the pure gold for the forks, sprinkling bowls, and pitchers; the weight of each gold dish; the weight of each silver bowl;
translation: Wet bilong golde i pinis long ol fork, bol na kapa em i go; wet bilong desk golde yet; wet bilong desk silva yet.

original: the weight of the refined gold for the altar of incense; and the plans for the chariot of the gold cherubim that spread their wings and overshadowed the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
translation: Wet bilong gol we i kamap pinis long altan bilong smel strong; na plenan bilong kar bilong kerubim gol ol i Go Ap long wing na i kambeng kot bilong kaon bilong Bikpela.

original: “All this,” said David, “all the details of this plan, the LORD has made clear to me in writing by His hand upon me.”
translation: Olgeta samting dispela, detels bilong dispela plan, Bikpela i bin mekim klia long mi long pepa wantaim han bilong En.

original: David also said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and do it. Do not be afraid or discouraged, for the LORD God, my God, is with you. He will neither fail you nor forsake you before all the work for the service of the house of the LORD is finished.
translation: David i tokim Solomon man bilong en, “Katrung na strongpela, no ken kirapim, na wokim. No ken bilong poret, no ken bikim yu bel kol, bikos LORD God, em i God bilong mi, i stap wantaim yu. Em i no inap failim yu, na em i no inap lusim yu, bifo olgeta wok bilong sarvis bilong haus bilong LORD i kam pinis.

original: The divisions of the priests and Levites are ready for all the service of the house of God, and every willing man of every skill will be at your disposal for the work. The officials and all the people are fully at your command.”
translation: Ol divishen bilong priests na Levites i redi long ol servos bilong haus bilong God, na every man we i laik wok, we i gat ol kain skil, bai i stap long han bilong yu. Ol ofisa na ol pipol i stap long han bilong yu, i go strong.

original: Then King David said to the whole assembly, “My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced. The task is great because this palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
translation: King Davi tokim assembli olgeta, "Pikinemi Solomon, em i man we God i pikinim, em i yupela na i no save gut. Wok em i bikpela, wantaim dispela haus palas i no bilong man, tasol bilong Bikpela God.

original: Now with all my ability I have made provision for the house of my God—gold for the gold articles, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron, and wood for the wood, as well as onyx for the settings, turquoise, stones of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and slabs of marble—all in abundance.
translation: Wantaim olgeta strong bilong me, mi bin mekim ka moni longaus long haus bilong God bilong me—gold long gold samting, silva long silva, bronze long bronze, iron long iron, timber long timber, onyx long setting, turquoise, ol kain ston bilong value, slab bilong marble—all i gat plenti.

original: Moreover, because of my delight in the house of my God, I now give for it my personal treasures of gold and silver, over and above all that I have provided for this holy temple:
translation: Olsem na, bikos mi hamamas long haus bilong God bilong mi, nau mi givim olgeta bilong mi yet long em, gold na silva, longway on top bilong olgeta samting mi bin givim long dispela temwel bilong halivim.

original: three thousand talents of gold (the gold of Ophir) and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the buildings,
translation: Tri tausen talents bilong gol bilong Ophir na seven tausen talents bilong silva i painim pinis, ol bikim kalsa long wal bilong haus.

original: for the gold work and the silver work, and for all the work to be done by the craftsmen. Now who will volunteer to consecrate himself to the LORD today?”
translation: Long ol wok bilong gol na silva, na long ol kain wok i mas mekim ol craftsmen i mekim, hu i laik givim himself frei long LORD God today?

original: Then the leaders of the households, the officers of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and the officials in charge of the king’s work gave willingly.
translation: Na ol bikpela i stap i lukautim ol hus na famili, ol ofisa bilong ol tribu bilong Israel, ol kapten bilong tausen na bilong hundret, na ol ofisala i wok long wok bilong king, ol givim freli.

original: Toward the service of God’s house they gave 5,000 talents and 10,000 darics of gold, 10,000 talents of silver, 18,000 talents of bronze, and 100,000 talents of iron.
translation: Long servise bilong haus bilong God, ol i givim 5,000 talents na 10,000 darics bilong paitim, 10,000 talents bilong silva, 18,000 talents bilong kapsul, na 100,000 talents bilong ain.

original: Whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the LORD, under the care of Jehiel the Gershonite.
translation: Ol husat i gat ston na valuali, ol i givim long treasuri bilong haus bilong Jehovah, na Jehiel Gershonait i lukautim.

original: And the people rejoiced at the willing response of their leaders, for they had given to the LORD freely and wholeheartedly. And King David also rejoiced greatly.
translation: Na ol pipel i amamas long givim bel kol bilong ol lidaman, ol i givim long LORD bai ol i laikim na ol i putim holim hart. King David tu i amamas tumas.

original: Then David blessed the LORD in the sight of all the assembly and said: “May You be blessed, O LORD, God of our father Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.
translation: Na Davidson blesim LORD long ai bilong olgeta assembli, na tokim: "Yu bai bles, Oh LORD, God bilong papa Israel, long taim bilong klostu go long taim bilong klostu."

original: Yours, O LORD, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the splendor and the majesty, for everything in heaven and on earth belongs to You. Yours, O LORD, is the kingdom, and You are exalted as head over all.
translation: Bilong yu, Papa GOD, em i bikpela, powa, winim man, manner bilong winim man, gutpela bilong strongim, olgeta samting long heven na graun i bilong yu. Bilong yu, Papa GOD, em i ples kingdom, Yu em i go hap long olgeta.

original: Both riches and honor come from You, and You are the ruler over all. In Your hands are power and might to exalt and give strength to all.
translation: Plauna na tetema i kam bek long yu, na yu em i bikpela long olgeta. Long hap bilong yu i gat powa na strong bilong liftim up na givim strong long olgeta.

original: Now therefore, our God, we give You thanks, and we praise Your glorious name.
translation: Nau olgeta, yumi givim sankyu long Bikpela, na yumi praisim nem bilong Yu we i glori.

original: But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? For everything comes from You, and from Your own hand we have given to You.
translation: Mi husat, na husat ol papa bilong mi, olsem mipela inap givim moninga longwey olsem? Olgeta samting i kam bek long yu, na mipela givim bek long yu from Bikpela han bilong yu.

original: For we are foreigners and strangers in Your presence, as were all our forefathers. Our days on earth are like a shadow, without hope.
translation: Mipela i kam long ples narapela, na mipela i stap olsem man bus long present bilong yu, olsem ol tumbuna bilong mipela. Dei bilong mipela long graun em i olsem shado, i no gat hope.

original: O LORD our God, from Your hand comes all this abundance that we have provided to build You a house for Your holy Name, and all of it belongs to You.
translation: O Bikpela, God bilong mipela, long han bilong yu, plenti samting i kam, na mipela warkim haus bilong yu long nem bilong yu we i halo, na olgeta em i bilong yu.

original: I know, my God, that You test the heart and delight in uprightness. All these things I have given willingly and with an upright heart, and now I have seen Your people who are present here giving joyfully and willingly to You.
translation: Mi save, Papa bilong mi, yu traiim bel bilong ol man na yu likim long streit. Olgeta samting dispela mi givim frei from hap bilong mi, wantaim bel bilong mi i stap streit, na nau mi lukim pipol bilong yu hu i stap hia givim strongim na kisim hamamas long givim long yu.

original: O LORD, God of our fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, keep this desire forever in the intentions of the hearts of Your people, and direct their hearts toward You.
translation: O Lod, God bilong papa na tumbuna Abraham, Aisak, na Iserel, strongim dispela laik longwe i stap insait long tingting bilong hert bilong ol pipol, na wokim brata bilong ol i kam long yu.

original: And give my son Solomon a whole heart to keep and carry out all Your commandments, decrees, and statutes, and to build Your palace for which I have made provision.”
translation: Givim pikinini Solomon haret i go olsem, nau em i ken kisim strong na mekim ol komando, lo bilong law, na statut ya, na bilum haus bilong yu olsem simbol bilong pawa na otari we mi bin makim preparison long en.

original: Then David said to the whole assembly, “Blessed be the LORD your God.” So the whole assembly blessed the LORD, the God of their fathers. They bowed down and paid homage to the LORD and to the king.
translation: Na Davit i tok olsem, "Papa God bilong yumi em i blesim, Bikpela i blesim." Ol pikinini bilong Israel olgeta i blesim Papa God bilong papa na mama tumbuna ol. Ol i paul ili go na givim respek long Papa God na Kwin.

original: The next day they offered sacrifices and presented burnt offerings to the LORD: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, along with their drink offerings, and other sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
translation: Nekis dei ol i bringim sakrifis, na ol i bin kisim oltabot ofing long LORD: a tausen bulmakau, a tausen ram, na a tausen lep, wantaem ol i bin bringim draun ofing, na sakrifis narakai i kamap long olgeta Israel.

original: That day they ate and drank with great joy in the presence of the LORD. Then, for a second time, they designated David’s son Solomon as king, anointing him before the LORD as ruler, and Zadok as the priest.
translation: Na dispela de ol i kaikai na drink wantaim bel hevi long hap bilong LORD. Fo sekend taim, ol i makim Solomon, pikinini bilong David, king, na ol i givim em anointing olsem em i bos, na Zadok olsem pries, tupela i kamap tru long hap bilong LORD.

original: So Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king in place of his father David. He prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
translation: Na Solomon i go sidaun long trohn bilong LORD olsem king istap long hap bilong papa David. Em i kamap strong, na yupela Israel i harim tok bilong em.

original: All the officials and mighty men, as well as all of King David’s sons, pledged their allegiance to King Solomon.
translation: Ol ofisa na ol man bilong strong, olgeta Pikinini bilong King Daivid, i tok tru long King Solomona, papa bilong kantri.

original: The LORD highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him royal majesty such as had not been bestowed on any king in Israel before him.
translation: Papa God i givim Solomon bikpela respek long ai bilong ol Israel, na i givim em royal majesti, wanpela kain authority, olsem nau bai no bin givim i go long eni king long Israel bifo em.

original: David son of Jesse was king over all Israel.
translation: Daavid sambai bilong Jesee em i bin king ibilong ol Israel.

original: The length of David’s reign over Israel was forty years—seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
translation: Taim bilong paitim bilong David long hap bilong Israel em i stap forty yia - seven yia long Hebron na thirty-three yia long Jerusalem.

original: He died at a ripe old age, full of years, riches, and honor, and his son Solomon reigned in his place.
translation: Em i dai long taim bilong em yet, plenti yia, plenti mani, na plenti givim respek, na son blong em Solomon i kam bek bihain long em na i bos.

original: Now the acts of King David, from first to last, are indeed written in the Chronicles of Samuel the Seer, the Chronicles of Nathan the Prophet, and the Chronicles of Gad the Seer,
translation: Nau ol samting King David i mekim, long taim bifo na long taim nau, ol i raisim olsem long Buk Baibel Chronicles bilong Samuel Profet, Nathan Profet, na Gad Profet.

original: together with all the details of his reign, his might, and the circumstances that came upon him and Israel and all the kingdoms of the lands.
translation: Wantaim ol detel bilong en reign, strongpela i go long en, na ol samting i kamap long en na Israel na ol kingdom bilong ol kantri.

original: Now Solomon son of David established himself securely over his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him and highly exalted him.
translation: Nau Solomon sot bilong David i kamap strong na stap long ples bilong king, na Bikpela God bilong em i bin stap wantaim em, na i lifim emap longpela.

original: Then Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, to the judges, and to every leader in all Israel—the heads of the families.
translation: Na Solomon i tokim olgeta Israel, long ol kapten bilong tausen na hanred, long ol jujes, na long ol lidaman bai bilong ples, long ol bikpela na smol pikinini bilong ol famili.

original: And Solomon and the whole assembly went to the high place at Gibeon because it was the location of God’s Tent of Meeting, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
translation: Na Solomon na mipela olgeta i go apla long ples hait long Gibeon, em i ples we Tenenibis bilong God i stap, Tenenibis we Moses wokman bilong LORD imekim long bus.

original: Now David had brought the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim to the place he had prepared for it, because he had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.
translation: Na Daudi bin kisim bek na ark bilong God long Kiriath-jearim, na em bin bringim i go long ples we em bin preparim olsem long en, na em bin putim tent bilong en long Jerusalem.

original: But the bronze altar made by Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, was in Gibeon before the tabernacle of the LORD. So Solomon and the assembly inquired of Him there.
translation: Bareket altagi bilong bronze we Bezalel, pikinini bilong Uri, pikinini bilong Hur, wokim i stap long Gibeon bifo tabenakol bilong LORD. Na Solomon na ol arapela i go bek askim em long hap bilong em.

original: Solomon offered sacrifices there before the LORD on the bronze altar in the Tent of Meeting, where he offered a thousand burnt offerings.
translation: Solomon i bikim sakris long wei bifor LORD long alta bilong bronz inside Haus Bilong Miting, na em i bikim tausend burnt ofring.

original: That night God appeared to Solomon and said, “Ask, and I will give it to you!”
translation: Nait i go daun, God i kamap long Solomon, na ol i tok, 'Yu askim, na mi bai givim long yu!'

original: Solomon replied to God: “You have shown much loving devotion to my father David, and You have made me king in his place.
translation: Solomon i tokim God olsem: Yu wai showim planti lavin klostu long papa bilong me, David, na yu makim me king long hap bilong em.

original: Now, O LORD God, let Your promise to my father David be fulfilled. For You have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.
translation: Nau, Papa God, Kisim promis bilong yu i kam tru long tupela papa David. Yu me king olsem king long ol pipel i pulap olsem gras we i pulap long graun.

original: Now grant me wisdom and knowledge, so that I may lead this people. For who is able to govern this great people of Yours?”
translation: Nau givim mi save na tok save, bilong lidim dispela ples. Husat ina em i kamap strong long governm dispela bikpela ples bilong Yu?

original: God said to Solomon, “Since this was in your heart instead of requesting riches or wealth or glory for yourself or death for your enemies—and since you have not even requested long life but have asked for wisdom and knowledge to govern My people over whom I have made you king—
translation: God i tokim Solomon, “Bikos dispela i stap inside het bilong yu, na yu no askim rupia, propati, o glori bilong yu, na yu no askim poisen long ol enemy bilong yu, na yu no askim laip longpela, tasol yu askim save na tok save long ridim piple bilong Mi, olsem nau Mi hamarim yu king ibilong ol,”

original: therefore wisdom and knowledge have been granted to you. And I will also give you riches and wealth and honor unlike anything given to the kings before you or after you.”
translation: Wisdome na save ili givim i go yu. Na mi tasol bai givim yu planti moni, plenti strong, na givim yu respek nogat samting i kamap olsem long taim bipo o narak.

original: So Solomon went to Jerusalem from the high place in Gibeon before the Tent of Meeting, and he reigned over Israel.
translation: Solomon i go long Jisasalem from ples hait i stap long Gibion, bifor Haus Bilong Miting, na em i bos bilong Israel.

original: Solomon accumulated 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses, which he stationed in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem.
translation: Solomon em i kamapim 1,400 kar na 12,000 hos, we em i stapim ol long ples bilong kar na wantaim em long Jerusalem.

original: The king made silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as abundant as sycamore in the foothills.
translation: King i mekim silva na gol olsem stoan i plenti long Jerusalem, na ceda i kamap olsem sikamor i plenti long bus kamap long ples.

original: Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and Kue; the royal merchants purchased them from Kue.
translation: Hos bilong Solomen ibin kam long wei import from Ijip na Kue; traida bilong king ibin baim ol hos long Kue.

original: A chariot could be imported from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty. Likewise, they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and to the kings of Aram.
translation: Kareta bilong pait inap kam insait long Egip ol i kisim aut go wanpela kareta bilong pait long sikul bilong silva six hundred, na hos long sikul bilong silva one hundred and fifty. Olsem tu, ol i kisim aut go ol kareta na hos long ol kwin pipla bilong Hittites na kings bilong Aram.

original: Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the Name of the LORD and a royal palace for himself.
translation: Nau Solomon em i mekim plan long bilden wanpela haus bilong Nem bilong Jehovah na wanpela halep bilong king bilong em yet.

original: So he conscripted 70,000 porters, 80,000 stonecutters in the mountains, and 3,600 supervisors.
translation: Em i kisim ol 70,000 wokman bilong karim samting, 80,000 man i katim ston long maunten, na 3,600 bos bilong wok.

original: Then Solomon sent word to Hiram king of Tyre: “Do for me as you did for my father David when you sent him cedars to build himself a house to live in.
translation: Solomon i salim wod long Hiram king bilong Tyre: “Wokim olsem yu wokim long tumbuna David bilong me, em yu salim em cedars long en bilong biuldim haus bilong en i stap.

original: Behold, I am about to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God to dedicate to Him for burning fragrant incense before Him, for displaying the showbread continuously, and for making burnt offerings every morning and evening as well as on the Sabbaths, New Moons, and appointed feasts of the LORD our God. This is ordained for Israel forever.
translation: Behold, mi go long bilong buildim haus bilong Nem bilong LORD God bilong mi, long dedikiem olgeta long Em, long bunim smel gude insens bifo Em, long putim bret bilong lukim kontinualli, na long mekim ofa bilong bunim bikosani long moning na apinun, olsem na long Sabbat Dei, Nupela Mun, na dei bilong ples bilong LORD God bilong yumi. Dispela em i kamap long ples Israel foreva.

original: The house that I am building will be great, for our God is greater than all gods.
translation: Haus bilong mi em mi wokim bai bagarap tru, wantaim God bilong yumi em i bikpela moa long ol kina god.

original: But who is able to build a house for Him, since the heavens, even the highest heavens, cannot contain Him? Who then am I, that I should build a house for Him, except as a place to burn sacrifices before Him?
translation: Bain tu hu ia inap wokim haus bilong Em, wantaim heven, olsem heven hevi, i no inap holim Em? Na hu mi, bai mi wokim haus bilong En, nogat, tasol olsem ples bilong mekim sakrifis bifor Em?

original: Send me, therefore, a craftsman skilled in engraving to work with gold and silver, with bronze and iron, and with purple, crimson, and blue yarn. He will work with my craftsmen in Judah and Jerusalem, whom my father David provided.
translation: Sendaim mi, olsem nau, wanpela krafisman i gat skil long engraving, ibin wokim wok wantaim gol na silva, bronz na aian, kalabus purpel, kalabus crimsem, na blu yarn. Em bai wok wantaim krafismen bilong mi long Juda na Jerusalem, ol i stap bilong papa bilong mi, David.

original: Send me also cedar, cypress, and algum logs from Lebanon, for I know that your servants have skill to cut timber there. And indeed, my servants will work with yours
translation: Sindaim mi tu sedo, sipres, na algum log long Lebanon, long ol i save katim timber i go wel. Na tru, wokman bilo mipela bai wok wantaim wokman bilong yu.

original: to prepare for me timber in abundance, because the temple I am building will be great and wonderful.
translation: Mi laikim ol i prepaim long me diwai long planti, wantaim ol i gat bikpela ka na switpela, bikos haus lotu we mi bilong me bai me warkim em i go long wei bikpela na switpela.

original: I will pay your servants, the woodcutters, 20,000 cors of ground wheat, 20,000 cors of barley, 20,000 baths of wine, and 20,000 baths of olive oil.”
translation: Mi baim pe bilong servants bilong yu, ol man i katim diwai, 20,000 cors bilong wauspepa graun, 20,000 cors bilong bale, 20,000 baths bilong wain, na 20,000 baths bilong olik ail.

original: Then Hiram king of Tyre wrote a letter in reply to Solomon: “Because the LORD loves His people, He has set you over them as king.”
translation: Hiram king bilong Taire wraitim leta bekim Solomon: “Bikos LORD i lavim piple bilong em, na em i putim yu olgeta long hem as king.”

original: And Hiram added: “Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who made the heavens and the earth! He has given King David a wise son with insight and understanding, who will build a temple for the LORD and a royal palace for himself.
translation: Na Hiram i tok: “Praiz i go long LORD, God bilong Israel, we i mekim heven na graun! Em i givim King David wanpela sun i gat save na save long tingting, i wol buildim haus lotu bilong LORD na wokim haus bilong king bilong em yet.

original: So now I am sending you Huram-abi, a skillful man endowed with creativity.
translation: Nau mi bilong sendim yu Huram-abi, em i man i gat save long wok bilong kamapim samting nupela.

original: He is the son of a woman from the daughters of Dan, and his father is a man of Tyre. He is skilled in work with gold and silver, bronze and iron, stone and wood, purple, blue, and crimson yarn, and fine linen. He is experienced in every kind of engraving and can execute any design that is given him. He will work with your craftsmen and with those of my lord, your father David.
translation: Em i pikinini bilong meri bilong ol meri bilong Dan, na papa bilong em i man bilong Taire. Em i saves long wokim samting wantaim gol na silva, bronz na aian, stoun na timba, kaul, blu, yarn bilong kaul rod, na linen bilong gutpela kalidad. Em i experien long olsem kain kain wokim painim long samting, na em i ken kukim eni kain design em i givim. Bai em i wok wantaim ol man bilong wokim samting bilong yu na ol man bilong wokim samting bilong papa bilong yu, Daved.

original: Now let my lord send to his servants the wheat, barley, olive oil, and wine he promised.
translation: Bikim Long bilong mi bai sindaun long ol i wokman bilong en waet, barli, oliva oil, na wain em i promis.

original: We will cut logs from Lebanon, as many as you need, and we will float them to you as rafts by sea down to Joppa. Then you can take them up to Jerusalem.”
translation: Mipela bai kam na katim log long Lebanon, olsem sampela yu laik, nau bai mipela putim ol i go long solwara olsem rak bilong kar i kale long Jopa. Bihain bai yu kisim ol i go ap long Jerusalem.

original: Solomon numbered all the foreign men in the land of Israel following the census his father David had conducted, and there were found to be 153,600 in all.
translation: Solomon i kamapim nem bilong ol man i kam long nesen narapela long lan bilong Israel bihaenim kaunsing tambu David bipo i mekim, na ol i kisim i kamap 153,600 olgeta.

original: Solomon made 70,000 of them porters, 80,000 stonecutters in the mountains, and 3,600 supervisors.
translation: Solomon i mekim 70,000 bilong ol portamaster, 80,000 ston katim man long maunten, na 3,600 lida.

original: Then Solomon began to build the house of the LORD in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David. This was the place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
translation: Na Solomon i statim bilong buildim haus bilong LORD long Jerusalem, long Maunt Moriah, waipla LORD em bin ap inu long papa bilong em, David. Em i preparim dispela ples long pla bilong kisim aus bilong graun bilong Ornan bilong Jebusite.

original: Solomon began construction on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.
translation: Solomon i statim wok long haus God long sekend de bilong sekend mun, long namba foa yia bilong en taim em i kam king.

original: The foundation that Solomon laid for the house of God was sixty cubits long and twenty cubits wide, according to the old standard.
translation: Bais Solomon i laim long haus bilong God em i go long sixty kibit, na wide em i go long twenty kibit, olsem wei bifo.

original: The portico at the front, extending across the width of the temple, was twenty cubits long and twenty cubits high. He overlaid the inside with pure gold.
translation: Porsiko long fron i go stret olgeta long waid pis na haos lotu, em i 20 kubiti long na 20 kubiti high. Em i kisim gol purpu long insait i kamap finis.

original: He paneled the main room with cypress, which he overlaid with fine gold and decorated with palm trees and chains.
translation: Em i hamarim rum big bilong haus long sipres, na em i savraim wantaim gol we i gat kain belkros, na em i dekoratem wantaim palm tre na chain.

original: He adorned the temple with precious stones for beauty, and its gold was from Parvaim.
translation: Em i kisim haus lotu i go luk good wantaim ston nogut tru long mekim em i luk sweet, na gol bilong en i kam from Parvaim.

original: He overlaid its beams, thresholds, walls, and doors with gold, and he carved cherubim on the walls.
translation: Em i kamapim bembel long beams, threshol, wal, na doa bilong en wantaim gold, na em i katim cherubim long wal.

original: Then he made the Most Holy Place; its length corresponded to the width of the temple—twenty cubits long and twenty cubits wide. And he overlaid the inside with six hundred talents of fine gold.
translation: Em wokim Ples bilong Holigas Holigas; em i go olsem laip bilong haos bilong Lotu – twenty hap met long na twenty hap met wide. Na em kavarim insait long six hundred tael bilong gol bilong kusai.

original: The weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. He also overlaid the upper area with gold.
translation: Wet bilong pail i kamap fifty sikel gol. Na em i kovaim hap i go antap long gol.

original: In the Most Holy Place he made two cherubim of sculptured work, and he overlaid them with gold.
translation: Long Holi Platz Bilong God em i mekim tu cherubim long wok bilong karamel, na em i kamapim olgeta gold long hap.

original: The total wingspan of the cherubim was twenty cubits. One wing of the first cherub was five cubits long and touched the wall of the temple, and its other wing was five cubits long and touched the wing of the other cherub.
translation: Wingspan bilong ol cherubim i go daunol i 20 hap cubic mita. Wanpela wing bilong em Cherub i kamap nau, em i lak i 5 hap cubic mita, na i tetek long wal bilong haus lotu, na narakai wing bilong en i lak i 5 hap cubic mita, na i tetek long wing bilong narakai cherub.

original: The wing of the second cherub also measured five cubits and touched the wall of the temple, while its other wing measured five cubits and touched the wing of the first cherub.
translation: Wing bilong sekend cherub em i mesor long faiv kukit na em i tang was bilong haos bilong Gad, na wing narakai bilong em i mesor long faiv kukit na em i tang wing bilong cherub bilong pes.

original: So the total wingspan of these cherubim was twenty cubits. They stood on their feet, facing the main room.
translation: Ol kerabim ya, wingspan olgeta bilong ol i 20 kibit. Ol i stap long lek bilong ol, na ol i luke long rum bilong bikpela.

original: He made the veil of blue, purple, and crimson yarn and fine linen, with cherubim woven into it.
translation: Em mekim bilum long blu, paenet, na redim wol, wantaim linen finis, na kerubim i stap insait long en.

original: In front of the temple he made two pillars, which together were thirty-five cubits high, each with a capital on top measuring five cubits.
translation: Long hap bilong haos lotu em mekim tupela pilia, na tupela i go antap olgeta 35 kap long en, na long tupela em i go antap, igat kapa long top, em i bikim 5 kap.

original: He made interwoven chains and put them on top of the pillars. He made a hundred pomegranates and fastened them into the chainwork.
translation: Em mekim chain we i bin karam long wan another, na em putim olsem long top bilong pilia. Em mekim hundap pomegranate, na em holim ol long chainwe i mekim.

original: Then he set up the pillars in front of the temple, one on the south and one on the north. The pillar on the south he named Jachin, and the pillar on the north he named Boaz.
translation: Em plantim pilia i go ap long hap bilong haus lotu, wan long saut na wan long not. Pilia long saut em i kolim Jachin, na pilia long not em i kolim Boaz.

original: He made a bronze altar twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and ten cubits high.
translation: Em wokim wanpela altar bilong bronze, twenti fut lon, twenti fut waid, na ten fut hai.

original: He also made the Sea of cast metal. It was circular in shape, measuring ten cubits from rim to rim, five cubits in height, and thirty cubits in circumference.
translation: Na em i mekim Solwara bilong meto tu. Em i raun olsem bola long shape, em i mesurim ten cubits from ripa go long ripa, em i kisim faiv cubits long hai, na em i gat triati cubits long circumference.

original: Below the rim, figures of oxen encircled it, ten per cubit all the way around the Sea, cast in two rows as a part of the Sea.
translation: Aninit long hap bilong em, figa bilong bulmakau i go raunim em, ten ya long wan fut olsem long raun bilong Solwara, ol i kamap strong long tu row olsem paht bilong Solwara.

original: The Sea stood on twelve oxen, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south, and three facing east. The Sea rested on them, with all their hindquarters toward the center.
translation: Solwara i stap antap long twelv bulmakau, tripla i luke bek long not, tripla i luke bek long wes, tripla i luke bek long saut, na tripla i luke bek long ist. Solwara i skulim bek long ol, na hinde leg bilong ol i go bek long senta.

original: It was a handbreadth thick, and its rim was fashioned like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It could hold three thousand baths.
translation: Em i bikpela wan finga kot, na rimi bilong en i kukim olsem lip blo kap, olsem flauer blo lili, na inap holim tri tausen bath.

original: He also made ten basins for washing and placed five on the south side and five on the north. The parts of the burnt offering were rinsed in them, but the priests used the Sea for washing.
translation: Em i mekim ten bilong wasim na i putim faiv long sait south na faiv long sait not. Ol samting bilong ofing bung i washim long ol dispela, tasol pris i usim Dispela Solwara long wasim.

original: He made ten gold lampstands according to their specifications and placed them in the temple, five on the south side and five on the north.
translation: Em i mekim tenpela laitpe long gol olsem ol i laikim, na em i putim ol long haus lotu, faiv long sait bilong saut na faiv long sait bilong not.

original: Additionally, he made ten tables and placed them in the temple, five on the south side and five on the north. He also made a hundred gold bowls.
translation: Em mekim tenpela tepul na em putim ol long haos lotu, five long sait bilong saut na five long sait bilong not. Em mekim hundred pipel bilong gol.

original: He made the courtyard of the priests and the large court with its doors, and he overlaid the doors with bronze.
translation: Em mekim ka bilong priests na longpela court wantaim door bilong em, na em kisim door na kisim bronzi i go antap long em.

original: He put the Sea on the south side, at the southeast corner.
translation: Em putim Solwara long sait bilong sas, long korner bilong sisibis.

original: Additionally, Huram made the pots, shovels, and sprinkling bowls. So Huram finished the work that he had undertaken for King Solomon in the house of God:
translation: Huram wokim pot, speda, na bol bilong sprinklem. Na Huram i kamap pinis wok ia we em bin statim long King Soloman long haus bilong God:

original: the two pillars; the two bowl-shaped capitals atop the pillars; the two sets of network covering both bowls of the capitals atop the pillars;
translation: Tupela pilia; tupela kapitel bilong bol we i go antap long pilia; tupela set blong nambis we i kova tupela bol bilong kapitel i go antap long pilia.

original: the four hundred pomegranates for the two sets of network (two rows of pomegranates for each network covering both the bowl-shaped capitals atop the pillars);
translation: Four hundred pomegranate bilong ol i go long twopela set bilong netwok, we tupela lain bilong pomegranate i stap long each netwok, na kambek i kalek long kapital bilong bowel shape we i stap antap long pilia.

original: the stands; the basins on the stands;
translation: Ol stend; ol basin long ol stend;

original: the Sea; the twelve oxen underneath the Sea;
translation: Solwara; twelve bulmakau unda long Solwara

original: and the pots, shovels, meat forks, and all the other articles. All these objects that Huram-abi made for King Solomon for the house of the LORD were of polished bronze.
translation: Na ol pot, ol shovel, ol fork bilong kukim mit na ol narapela samting. Ol dispela samting Huram-abi wokim long King Solomon bilong haus bilong LORD i mekim olsem nau, olgeta i bin mekim long bronze i pulis.

original: The king had them cast in clay molds in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zeredah.
translation: King i bin mekim ol castim ol long mold bilong klai long plen bilong Jordan, bihain long Sukkot na Zereda.

original: Solomon made all these articles in such great abundance that the weight of the bronze could not be determined.
translation: Solomon i mekim olgeta samting ol long wei bilong plenti tumas, na pe i no inap long ken wet bilong dispela bronzu.

original: Solomon also made all the furnishings for the house of God: the golden altar; the tables on which was placed the Bread of the Presence;
translation: Solomon i mekim pinis olgeta samting bilong haus bilong God: alta bilong gol; tebol bilong baret i stap, em i go long ples bilong baret.

original: the lampstands of pure gold and their lamps, to burn in front of the inner sanctuary as prescribed;
translation: Ol laitpepa bilong golpela pure, wantaim laip bilong ol, i mas burn long fron bilong rumu i go insait olsem lo dispel;

original: the flowers, lamps, and tongs of gold—of purest gold;
translation: Flauna bilong graun, lamip, na tong bilong gol - ol i kam long gol peaira;

original: the wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and censers of purest gold; and the gold doors of the temple: the inner doors to the Most Holy Place as well as the doors of the main hall.
translation: Ol man i trimim wick, bol bilong wasim blod, spoon bilong kisim, censer, na ol samting narakai bilong gol we em i kolim; na doa bilong gol bilong haos tembil: doa bilong go insait long ples we em i mas holigud tasol, na doa bilong rum bilong bikpela haos.

original: So all the work that Solomon had performed for the house of the LORD was completed. Then Solomon brought in the items his father David had dedicated—the silver, the gold, and all the furnishings—and he placed them in the treasuries of the house of God.
translation: Olgeta wok we Solomon wokim pinis long Haus bilong Lod, em i kamap pinis. Na Solomon kisim ol samting em papa David wod long en - silva, gold, na ol kaman na kala bilong haus - na em putim ol long hap bilong stua bilong God.

original: At that time Solomon assembled in Jerusalem the elders of Israel—all the tribal heads and family leaders of the Israelites—to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Zion, the City of David.
translation: Long taim igo, Solomon i kam long Jiusalem, na ol bikpela manmeri bilong Israel, het bilong ol clan na het bilong ol famili, i kam olgeta, kiol i bringim arka bilong kaen bilong LORD long Zion, Taun bilong Dauid.

original: So all the men of Israel came together to the king at the feast in the seventh month.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Isrel i kam together long king long kaikai bilong ol, long mun seventh.

original: When all the elders of Israel had arrived, the Levites took up the ark,
translation: Wanpela taim ol bikman bilong Isrel i kam pinis, Ol Levait i kisim bek arak.

original: and they brought up the ark and the Tent of Meeting with all its sacred furnishings. The Levitical priests carried them up.
translation: Na tuptela i kisim arak na Haus Bilong Miting wantaim ol samting bilong spirutual. Ol pris bilong Levi tribe i kisim ol i go antap.

original: There, before the ark, King Solomon and the whole congregation of Israel who had assembled with him sacrificed so many sheep and oxen that they could not be counted or numbered.
translation: Bifor ark, King Solomon na kongres bilong Israel ol i kilim na sakim plenti sheep na bulmakau, na ol i no inap long kauntim o nasim.

original: Then the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, the Most Holy Place, beneath the wings of the cherubim.
translation: Na prist i bringim ark bilong kaovenan bilong LORD i go long ples bilong en inside rumu daiwai, em i go daun, Ples Bilong Halivim Holiholi, aninit long wing bilong kerubim.

original: For the cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark and overshadowed the ark and its poles.
translation: Kerubim i go pasim wing bilong ol i kambak igo long bik na em poles.

original: The poles of the ark extended far enough that their ends were visible from in front of the inner sanctuary, but not from outside the Holy Place; and they are there to this day.
translation: Stik bilong bokis i go stret olsem, pipia bilong em i lukim from antap long ples masalai i go insait, tasol i no lukim from ausait long Ples Santi, na em i stap yet.

original: There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets that Moses had placed in it at Horeb, where the LORD had made a covenant with the Israelites after they had come out of Egypt.
translation: I gat nothin insait long ark, apart from tupela tablets Moses putim i go insait long em long Horeb, we bilong LORD bin mekim akornd long Israel bihaen ol i kamaut long Egip.

original: Now all the priests who were present had consecrated themselves regardless of their divisions. And when the priests came out of the Holy Place,
translation: Nau olgeta pries i stap, ol balansim olsen tisa, nogat yumi i kamap long ol divelopmen bilong ol. Na pries igo aut long Ples Bilong Holigren,

original: all the Levitical singers—Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, and their sons and relatives—stood on the east side of the altar, dressed in fine linen and playing cymbals, harps, and lyres, accompanied by 120 priests sounding trumpets.
translation: Olgeta singa bilong Levi - Asaf, Heman, Jedutan, na ol pikinini na brata bilong ol - i stap long sait east bilong alta, ol i dressim gut long kaliko finelin, na ol i pilai simbal, hap, na laip, ol i go wantaim 120 pries wokim traumpet.

original: The trumpeters and singers joined together to praise and thank the LORD with one voice. They lifted up their voices, accompanied by trumpets, cymbals, and musical instruments, in praise to the LORD: “For He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.” And the temple, the house of the LORD, was filled with a cloud
translation: Manmeri i save paitim trampet na singers, ol i joi wantaim long preisim na tankim LORD wantaim long wan voys. Ol i kirapim voys bilong ol, akompanim trampet, simbal, na instrument musik, long preisim long LORD: "Em i gutpela; em i gat lovingsik, na em i stap oltaim." Na haus bilong LORD, haus lotu, i kamap fulap long kloud.

original: so that the priests could not stand there to minister because of the cloud; for the glory of the LORD filled the house of God.
translation: Na prist i no inap stap, ol i no inap wark long servis bikos kol i kamap, bikos glori bilong Lod i kamap i fulim haus bilong God.

original: Then Solomon declared: “The LORD has said that He would dwell in the thick cloud;
translation: Na Solomon i tok olsem: “Papa God i tok olsem, em bai i stap long kloud i bikpela.”

original: and I have built You an exalted house, a place for You to dwell forever.”
translation: Mipela bin bilongim haus bilong yu we i go hevi, wanpela ples bilong yu bai yu stap oltaim.

original: And as the whole assembly of Israel stood there, the king turned around and blessed them all
translation: Na king i turnim bek gen, him i givim bikos long ol assembli bilong Israel i stanap olgeta.

original: and said: “Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who has fulfilled with His own hand what He spoke with His mouth to my father David, saying,
translation: Praiz i go long LORD, God bilong Israel, nau em i fulfillim gen pinis wanem em i tokim bai yutupela i go long mouth bilong em, olsem em i spikim long tumbuna David bilong papa,

original: ‘Since the day I brought My people out of the land of Egypt, I have not chosen a city from any tribe of Israel in which to build a house so that My Name would be there, nor have I chosen anyone to be ruler over My people Israel.
translation: Sinds dai mi bringim mipela out long Graun Egypt, mi no bin choosim siti long eni tribelong Israel olsem mi putim Haus bilong mi, na Nem bilong mi i stap da, na mi no bin choosim man i kam bosim ol pipol Israel bilong mi.

original: But now I have chosen Jerusalem for My Name to be there, and I have chosen David to be over My people Israel.’
translation: Bai nau mi bin chusim Jiusalem long namel bilong mi i stap, na mi bin chusim Devid olsem lipeli bilong piple Israel.

original: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a house for the Name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Em i stap insait long het bilong papa Davit na bouldim haus bilong Nem bilong LORD, God bilong Israel.

original: But the LORD said to my father David, ‘Since it was in your heart to build a house for My Name, you have done well to have this in your heart.
translation: Bikpela i tokim papa Davit bilong mi, olsem yu bin laik bilden haus bilong Nem Bilong Mi, yu mekim gut long yu gat dispela tinging inside bel bilong yu.

original: Nevertheless, you are not the one to build it; but your son, your own offspring, will build the house for My Name.’
translation: Nogat sem, yu no nau long mekim em; bek pikinini bilong yu, gen bilong yu yet, bai mekim haus long nem bilong Mi.

original: Now the LORD has fulfilled the word that He spoke. I have succeeded my father David, and I sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised. I have built the house for the Name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Nau Papa God i fulfilim tok bilong en. Mi go bek long ples bilong papa David, na mi siddaun long sit bilong Israel, olsem Papa God i promis. Mi buildim haus bilong Nem bilong Papa God, God bilong Israel.

original: And there I have provided a place for the ark, which contains the covenant of the LORD that He made with the children of Israel.”
translation: Na mi bin givim ples long bokis bilong kaivenan, em i gat kaivenan bilong LORD olsem em bino mekim long ol pikinini bilong Isrel.

original: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in front of the whole assembly of Israel and spread out his hands.
translation: Na Solomon i stap klostu long taula bilong Papa bilong olgeta bifor ol Israel i kam togeta na i waisim han bilong en.

original: Now Solomon had made a bronze platform five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high, and had placed it in the middle of the courtyard. He stood on it, knelt down before the whole assembly of Israel, spread out his hands toward heaven,
translation: Nau Solomona em mekim wanpela plet bilong bronzi, em trai kibit long en, faiv kibit waid, na tri kibit hai, na em putim i go insait long mit bilong ka. Em i stanap long en, em i kilaun i go daun bifo olgeta assembli bilong Israel, em i stretchim han bilong en i go hap long heven.

original: and said: “O LORD, God of Israel, there is no God like You in heaven or on earth, keeping Your covenant of loving devotion with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts.
translation: Tokim long LORD, God bilong Israel, i no gat narapela God olsem yu long heven o long graun, yu save strongim pakt long yu wantaim wokman bilong yu ol i go bifor yu wantaim ol hart bilong ol, diligim na save kam.

original: You have kept Your promise to Your servant, my father David. What You spoke with Your mouth You have fulfilled with Your hand this day.
translation: Yu kipim tok bilong yu long wokman bilong yu, tupela papa David. Olsem yu tokim long mao bilong yu, yu hamamasim long han bilong yu dispela de.

original: Therefore now, O LORD, God of Israel, keep for Your servant, my father David, what You promised when You said: ‘You will never fail to have a man to sit before Me on the throne of Israel, if only your descendants guard their way to walk in My law as you have walked before Me.’
translation: Orait nau, LORD, God bilong Israel, bihainim promis bilong yu long sarvim man bilong yu, mama bilong mi, David, we yu tok olsem: 'Yu no bin fail long kisim wan man i go siddaun bifo yu long trohn bilong Israel, long taem ol desenden bilong en i stap strong long wokim pasin bilong yu olsem mama bilong mi bin wokim bifo yu.'

original: And now, O LORD, God of Israel, please confirm what You promised to Your servant David.
translation: Na nau, O LORDE, Bikpela God bilong Israel, plis bikim strong ol tok You promis long servant Davide.

original: But will God indeed dwell with man upon the earth? Even heaven, the highest heaven, cannot contain You, much less this temple I have built.
translation: Olsem, God bai I stap wantaim man long graun? Hapin heven, heven i hai pas, em i no inap holim yu, maski olsem dispela haus lotu mi bin mekim i nogat ken.

original: Yet regard the prayer and plea of Your servant, O LORD my God, so that You may hear the cry and the prayer that Your servant is praying before You.
translation: Papa bilong mipela, harim prea na askim bilong wokman yu, mipela i bikpela God, nas tuharim krai na prea long yu.

original: May Your eyes be open toward this temple day and night, toward the place where You said You would put Your Name, so that You may hear the prayer that Your servant prays toward this place.
translation: Mai ai bilong yu i op long hap bilong haus lotu dispela de na nait, long ples we yu tokim olsem yu putim Nem bilong Yu, sapos yu harim praer bilong wokman bilong yu we em praer long dispela ples.

original: Hear the plea of Your servant and of Your people Israel when they pray toward this place. May You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place. May You hear and forgive.
translation: Harim tok bilong servant bilong Yu na bilong pipol Israel, wann ol i praet long dispela ples. Yu harim long heven, ples bilong Yu stap, na Yu harim na givim forgiveness.

original: When a man sins against his neighbor and is required to take an oath, and he comes to take an oath before Your altar in this temple,
translation: Wanpela man i bin i go agensim nek man bilong en, na em i mas kam long tekin ots, na em i kam long tekin ots bifo altia bilong yu inside haos bilong yu.

original: then may You hear from heaven and act. May You judge Your servants, condemning the wicked man by bringing down on his own head what he has done, and justifying the righteous man by rewarding him according to his righteousness.
translation: Bai yu harim tok long heven na wokim. Yu bai jijim servan bilong yu, kondemnIM man i no gut yet na bringim bek long hed bilong em yet olgeta samting em hamarim, na givim bos long man i gutpela yet na save long em olsem em i gutpela sindaun.

original: When Your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against You, and they return to You and confess Your name, praying and pleading before You in this temple,
translation: Wanpela taim pipo Israel i go daun bifor enemy kasem ol i mekim sin long yu, na ol i kam bek long yu na toktok nem bilong yu, ol i pray na beten long yu insait haus lotu,
