original: then may You hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your people Israel. May You restore them to the land You gave to them and their fathers.
translation: Na bai yumi harim i kam long heven, pardonim sindaun bilong pipol bilong yu Isrel. Bringim baksantim ol long laine yu givim long ol na tumbuna bilong ol.

original: When the skies are shut and there is no rain because Your people have sinned against You, and they pray toward this place and confess Your name, and they turn from their sins because You have afflicted them,
translation: Wanpela taim heven i kap, rain i no kam bekos pipol bilong yu i mekim sin long yu, na ol i go praya long dispela ples, ol i teteim nem bilong yu, na ol i lusim sin bilong ol bikos yu i skulim ol, yu i daunim ol,

original: then may You hear from heaven and forgive the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, so that You may teach them the good way in which they should walk. May You send rain on the land that You gave Your people as an inheritance.
translation: Long taem ol harim tok long heven, na bai yu forgivim sindaun bilong servants bilong yu, pipol Israel, na tisim ol long gutpela rot ol mas wokim. Bai yu salim ren i kam daun long graun we yu givim ol long inhitens.

original: When famine or plague comes upon the land, or blight or mildew or locusts or grasshoppers, or when their enemies besiege them in their cities, whatever plague or sickness may come,
translation: Wanem taim hangre oa poret ikam long kantri, oa yelo oa blackfrosta oa lokis oa gras hopa, oa wankain eni bilong ol i kam bekim ol long tok ples bilong ol, wanem kain poret oa sik malaria bai i kam,

original: then may whatever prayer or petition Your people Israel make—each knowing his own afflictions and spreading out his hands toward this temple—
translation: Olsem wanem praer o bosim i gat long ol pipol Israel bilong yu, na ol i save long susa bilong en himself, na i katim han bilong en i go long dispela tembal —

original: be heard by You from heaven, Your dwelling place. And may You forgive and repay each man according to all his ways, since You know his heart—for You alone know the hearts of men—
translation: Harim tok bilong yu long heven, ples bilong yu stap. Na givim sin i go na bekim pe long ol man, olsem ol samting em i mekim, long bikos yu save long hart bilong em - yu alone save long ol hart bilong ol man.

original: so that they may fear You and walk in Your ways all the days they live in the land that You gave to our fathers.
translation: Na ol i ken bikimim long Yu, na mipela i go long we bilong Yu, ol dei ol i stap long kantri we Yu givim long tumbuna bilong mipela.

original: And as for the foreigner who is not of Your people Israel but has come from a distant land because of Your great name and Your mighty hand and outstretched arm—when he comes and prays toward this temple,
translation: Na long olsem taim, long ol foreign man i no bilong pipol bilong yu Israel, em i kam bek long ples i stap farawe bikos bilong bikpela nem bilong yu, na han bilong yu i strong, na arm bilong yu i stret - wenn em i kam na em i pray long direction bilong haus lotu,

original: then may You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place, and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to You. Then all the peoples of the earth will know Your name and fear You, as do Your people Israel, and they will know that this house I have built is called by Your Name.
translation: Harim tok long heven, ples balus bilong yu, na wokim ol samting ol man bilong naiton i askim yu long. Olsem na ol ples long graun bai save nem bilong yu, wetem yu, na ol i tekede, olsem ol pipel bilong yu Israel, na bai ol i save husat dispela haus mi bin mekim em i kolim nem bilong yu.

original: When Your people go to war against their enemies, wherever You send them, and when they pray to You in the direction of the city You have chosen and the house I have built for Your Name,
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipol bilong Yu i go long war gen enebilong ol, we bilong yu salim ol go, na taim ol i basa prea long Yu, ol i lukim i go long taun Yu pikinini, na long haus mi bin buildim bilong Nem bilong Yu,

original: then may You hear from heaven their prayer and their plea, and may You uphold their cause.
translation: Na bai yumi harim tok bilong ol long heven, na yumi harim askim hel bilong ol, na yumi strongim kus bilong ol.

original: When they sin against You—for there is no one who does not sin—and You become angry with them and deliver them to an enemy who takes them as captives to a land far or near,
translation: Wanpela taim ol i bagarap agensim Yu — em i nogat wanpela man we i no bagarap — na Yu bai kros long ol, na yu inap givim ol i go long hanis man, ol i prisner long nepel o ples i stap farawe o klose.

original: and when they come to their senses in the land to which they were taken, and they repent and plead with You in the land of their captors, saying, ‘We have sinned and done wrong; we have acted wickedly,’
translation: Na wanpela taim ol i kam bek gen long tok bilong ol long kantri we ol i go daun, na ol i harmakim na bihain krikim Yu long graun bilong ol enemies, ol tok, 'Mipela i sindaun, mipela i mekim rong; mipela i warkim nogut.'

original: and when they return to You with all their heart and soul in the land of the enemies who took them captive, and when they pray in the direction of the land that You gave to their fathers, the city You have chosen, and the house I have built for Your Name,
translation: Na wailens ol i kam bek long Yu wantaim ol hart na sol long kantri bilong ol enemy we i bin kisim ol i go, na wailens ol i pray long ples we yu givim long tumbuna ol, taun we yu chusim, na haus mi bin mekim long nem bilong Yu,

original: then may You hear from heaven, Your dwelling place, their prayer and petition, and may You uphold their cause. May You forgive Your people who sinned against You.
translation: Bai yu harim bikos long heven, husat em ples bilong yu, praya na toksave bilong ol, na bai yu strongim kaos bilong ol. Bai yu forgivim sin bilong yu pipol we oli mekim long yu.

original: Now, my God, may Your eyes be open and Your ears attentive to the prayer offered in this place.
translation: Nau, Bikpela bilong mi, mai ai yu i op na yut yu i kamap strong long beten i givim long ples ia.

original: Now therefore, arise, O LORD God, and enter Your resting place, You and the ark of Your might. May Your priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and may Your godly ones rejoice in goodness.
translation: Nau therefore, kam bek, O Bikpela God, na go insait long ples bilong yu i stap, yu na bokis bilong powa bilong yu. Ol prist bilong yu, O Bikpela God, i mas kam ap long salvesen, na ol man bilong God i amamas long gutpela.

original: O LORD God, do not reject Your anointed one. Remember Your loving devotion to Your servant David.”
translation: O Bikpela, no rausim man i gat oili bilong yu. Yumi remember imasinen bilong yu long wokman bilong yu, Dauid.

original: When Solomon had finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of the LORD filled the temple.
translation: Taim Solomon finisim praip, faia i kam daun from heven na kaikaim ofa bilong bun na saksis, na glori bilong LORD i fulap haus lotu.

original: The priests were unable to enter the house of the LORD, because the glory of the LORD had filled it.
translation: Prist i no inap go insait long haus bilong LORD, bikos glory bilong LORD i fulim em.

original: When all the Israelites saw the fire coming down and the glory of the LORD above the temple, they bowed down on the pavement with their faces to the ground, and they worshiped and gave thanks to the LORD: “For He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.”
translation: Wanpela taim ol Israelites i lukim ka bilong glori bilong LORD i kam daun na ol i lukim glori bilong LORD ibin stap ibev long haus lotu, ol i paul ai bung long graun, ol i wosipim na tok gude long LORD: "Bikos Em i gut; em meri bilong em i stap oltaim."

original: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the LORD.
translation: King na olgeta pipol i bringim sakrifis bifoa LORD.

original: And King Solomon offered a sacrifice of 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
translation: King Solomona i bringim sakrifis long 22,000 bulmakau na 120,000 sip. Na king na ol pipol i dedikeim haus bilong God.

original: The priests stood at their posts, as did the Levites with the musical instruments of the LORD, which King David had made for giving thanks to the LORD and with which David had offered praise, saying, “For His loving devotion endures forever.” Across from the Levites, the priests sounded trumpets, and all the Israelites were standing.
translation: Pries i stap long ples bilong ol, olsem na Levaitis wantaim instrumens musical bilong LORD, we King Davide i mekim long givim tankyu long LORD, na ol i usim long mekim prais, ol i tok, "From lovik devosin bilong Em i stap oltaim." Long sait bilong Levaitis, pries i kilim trumpets, na all Israelaitis i stap.

original: Then Solomon consecrated the middle of the courtyard in front of the house of the LORD, and there he offered the burnt offerings and the fat of the peace offerings, since the bronze altar he had made could not contain all these offerings.
translation: Na Solomon em i bikim hol long mit bilong yaad i kamap tru long sait bilong haus bilong God, na em i bringim ofa bilong bun ruim na ol i kilim animal bilong pis, wantaim taul bilong bronx em i no inap holim ofa olgeta.

original: So at that time Solomon and all Israel with him—a very great assembly of people from Lebo-hamath to the Brook of Egypt—kept the feast for seven days.
translation: Long taem ya, Solomon na ol Isrel ol i stap long kaek wantaim - mipela ol i kam long wankain solwara bikpela tru - husat i kam long Lebo-hamath go long Warai bilong Ijip, ol i bungim pikinini long wik seven.

original: On the eighth day they held a solemn assembly, for the dedication of the altar had lasted seven days, and the feast seven days more.
translation: Long long eighth de, ol i mekim assembli bikpela, from dedikesin bilong alta i stap seven de, na festem moa seven de.

original: On the twenty-third day of the seventh month, Solomon sent the people away to their homes, joyful and glad of heart for the good things that the LORD had done for David, for Solomon, and for His people Israel.
translation: Long mun seventh, de twenty-third, Solomon i rausim ol pipol go long hus na ol i hapim na glat long het bilong ol samting gut we Bikpela i mekim long Daved, long Solomon, na long piple Isrel.

original: When Solomon had finished the house of the LORD and the royal palace, successfully carrying out all that was in his heart to do for the house of the LORD and for his own palace,
translation: Taim Solomon i winim wok bilong en, em i wokim gut na winimhaus bilong Lod na haus bilong king, na long het bilong en em i mekim olgeta samting we i stap long het bilong en tasol, wokim gut na winim husat i go long haus bilong Lod na husat i go long haus bilong em yet.

original: the LORD appeared to him at night and said to him: “I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for Myself as a house of sacrifice.
translation: LORD i kamap long em long nait na i tokim em: “Mi harim prea bilong yu, na mi pilim dispela ples gen olsem haos bilong sakrifis.

original: If I close the sky so there is no rain, or if I command the locust to devour the land, or if I send a plague among My people,
translation: Mi seklim sky nau i no gat ren, ovasem mi givim tokim long lokas i kaikaim graun, ovasem mi sendim sik ibong Pipol bilong mi,

original: and if My people who are called by My name humble themselves and pray and seek My face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and heal their land.
translation: Na sapos pisin bilong mi we i kolim nem bilong Mi stilim yet na prai, ol i luk saves long me, na ol i lusim wok bilong ol i we i no gud, maka Mi bai harim long heven, Mi bai forgivim sin blong ol, na Mi bai strongim graun blong ol.

original: Now My eyes will be open and My ears attentive to the prayers offered in this place.
translation: Nau ai bilong mi bai op na eipa bilong mi bai harim praida long bikpela tok we bilong mekim long hap dispela.

original: For I have now chosen and consecrated this temple so that My Name may be there forever. My eyes and My heart will be there for all time.
translation: Nau mi go chusim na setim ap haus lotu bilong mipela, ole Nem bilong mi i mas stap bek long hap forever. Ai bilong mi na het bilong mi bai stap long hap oltaim.

original: And as for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked, doing all I have commanded you, and if you keep My statutes and ordinances,
translation: Na long yupela, sapos yupela i wokabaut bifor mi olsem tumbuna David bilong yu i wokabaut, wokim ol samting we yu harim mi tok, na holim statut long mi na lo bilong mi,

original: then I will establish your royal throne, as I covenanted with your father David when I said, ‘You will never fail to have a man to rule over Israel.’
translation: Na mi bai plantim trohn bilong king bilong yu yet, olsem mi promis long tumbuna yu David, taim mi tok olsem, 'Yu no bin fail long gat man i go bosim kingdom bilong Israel.'

original: But if you turn away and forsake the statutes and commandments I have set before you, and if you go off to serve and worship other gods,
translation: Bai yu turnim bek na lusim na liva statut long lo bilong law na tok save we mi givim i go long yu, na bai yu go servis na worship ol spirits bikpela narapela,

original: then I will uproot Israel from the soil I have given them, and I will banish from My presence this temple I have sanctified for My Name. I will make it an object of scorn and ridicule among all the peoples.
translation: Na mipela bai katim gras bilong Israel long graun mipela givim ol, na mipela bai takede temple husat mipela sanctifyim long nem bilong mipela i go long presens bilong mipela. Na mipela bai mekim em i kamap samting bilong laif na kokomo long olgeta ples.

original: And when this temple has become a heap of rubble, all who pass by it will be appalled and say, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this land and to this temple?’
translation: Wanpela taim haus lotu ibin brok na kamap trausim, ol pipel husait i pas long em bai ol i sori nogut, ol tok, 'Bikpela LORD ibin mekim dispela samting long kantri na longhaus lotu?'

original: And others will answer, ‘Because they have forsaken the LORD, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and have embraced other gods, worshiping and serving them—because of this, He has brought all this disaster upon them.’”
translation: Na narapela ol bai tokim bek, ‘Bikos ol i lusim LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, we i bambekim ol long graun bilong Ijip, na ol i kamap haptim gog na kastom narapela, ol i wosipim na sarvim ol – bikos ol i mekim dispela, Em i bringim olgeta dispela bagarap long ol.’”

original: Now at the end of the twenty years during which Solomon had built the house of the LORD and his own palace,
translation: Nau long ol twenty yia i go pinis, Solomon im bin mekim haus bilong LORD na em palas bilong em yet.

original: Solomon rebuilt the cities Hiram had given him and settled Israelites there.
translation: Solomon i bikim gen town olgeta we Hiram i givim em, na oli Pipol Israel i stap long hap.

original: Then Solomon went to Hamath-zobah and captured it.
translation: Na Solomon i go long Hamati-Zoba na i winim em.

original: He built Tadmor in the wilderness, in addition to all the store cities that he had built in Hamath.
translation: Em i bilipim Tadmor long bus, olsem na em i bilipim olgeta taun bilong ka long Hamat.

original: He rebuilt Upper and Lower Beth-horon as fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars,
translation: Em i bin mekim gen Bete-Horon hap na Bete-Horon i go daun olsem taun bung bilong pait, wantaim banis, get, na bar.

original: as well as Baalath, all the store cities that belonged to Solomon, and all the cities for his chariots and horses—whatever he desired to build in Jerusalem, Lebanon, and throughout the land of his dominion.
translation: Olsem na Baalath, all ol ples bilong sto bilong Solomon, na all ol ples bilong kar bilong en na hos—olgeta samting em i laik bilong en long Jerusalem, Lebanon, na long olgeta graun bilong en i bos.

original: As for all the people who remained of the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites (the people who were not Israelites)—
translation: Long olgeta manmeri i stap yet, Hiti, Amori, Perizi, Hivi, na Jebusi, ol pipol we i no bin Israel,

original: their descendants who remained in the land, those whom the Israelites were unable to destroy—Solomon conscripted these people to be forced laborers, as they are to this day.
translation: Ol desenden ol i stap yet long kantri, ol man we Pipol Israel i no inap kilim—King Solomon i kisim ol man ya na wokim ol i go wokman strong long en, olsem tasol i kam tanim nau.

original: But Solomon did not consign any of the Israelites to slave labor, because they were his men of war, his officers and captains, and the commanders of his chariots and cavalry.
translation: Solomon i no bin kisim ol Israelites ol i go wok bicos gavman i tok, bikos ol i stap long en, ol solja bilong em, ofisa na kapten bilong en, na bos bilong kar bilong em na bos bilong soja hors bilong em.

original: They were also the chief officers for King Solomon: 250 supervisors.
translation: Ol i stap tu, ol bikpela ofisa bilong King Solomona, na 250 ol bos bilong wok.

original: Solomon brought the daughter of Pharaoh up from the City of David to the palace he had built for her. For he said, “My wife must not live in the house of David king of Israel, because the places the ark of the LORD has entered are holy.”
translation: Solomon bringim daughta bilong Pharaoh i go antap long Siti bilong David, go long haus kiak we em mekim olsem bilong em yet. Em tok olsem, "Meri bilong mi no inap long stap insait long haus bilong King David bilong Israel, bikos ol ples we ark bilong LORD ibin go insait, em i stap holy."

original: At that time Solomon offered burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of the LORD he had built in front of the portico.
translation: Long taim ia, Solomon i bringim olkaen ofing na ofa long alti bilong LORD, alti em i bin mekim bifoa veranda bilong temple.

original: He observed the daily requirement for offerings according to the commandment of Moses for Sabbaths, New Moons, and the three annual appointed feasts—the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles.
translation: Em i lukim necessiti long givim ofa olgeta dei olsem tok save bilong Moses, long deibodi sabat, mun nupela, na tripela bikpela de bung - Kaikai bread nogat yeast, Wiks fest, na Tabernakul fest.

original: In keeping with the ordinances of his father David, Solomon appointed the divisions of the priests over their service, and the Levites for their duties to offer praise and to minister before the priests according to the daily requirement. He also appointed gatekeepers by their divisions at each gate, for this had been the command of David, the man of God.
translation: Olsem mama lo ordinance bilong papa David, Solomon i apoinim divison bilong pris ol i go long serves bilong ol, na Levites long wok bilong ol i givim prais na i sarvim bifor pris olsem requayment bilong deiblack. Na em i apoinim gatekeepers long divison bilong ol long eni gait, bikos dispela em i kam long komando bilong David, man bilong God.

original: They did not turn aside from the king’s command regarding the priests or the Levites or any matter concerning the treasuries.
translation: Ol i no bin bikim bek long tok bilong king long ol praist, ol Levai, o long eni samting we i kamap long haus moni.

original: Thus all the work of Solomon was carried out, from the day the foundation was laid for the house of the LORD until it was finished. So the house of the LORD was completed.
translation: Olgeta wok bilong Solomon im bin mekim, long dei fondesen i bin planim long haus bilong LORD, na rait olsem i bin pinis, na husat Haus bilong LORD em i bin kamap pinis.

original: Then Solomon went to Ezion-geber and to Eloth on the coast of Edom.
translation: Na Solomon i go long Ezion-geber na long Eloth long kos bilong Edom.

original: So Hiram sent him ships captained by his servants, along with crews of experienced sailors. They went with Solomon’s servants to Ophir and acquired from there 450 talents of gold, which they delivered to King Solomon.
translation: Na Hiram i salim ship longen i go, wampela wantaim ol man husat save sail long taim. Ol i go wampela wantaim servant bilong King Solomo long Ophir, na ol kisim 450 talen bilong gol long hap, na brim long givim King Solomo.

original: Now when the queen of Sheba heard about the fame of Solomon, she came to test him with difficult questions. She arrived in Jerusalem with a very large caravan—with camels bearing spices, gold in abundance, and precious stones. So she came to Solomon and spoke with him about all that was on her mind.
translation: Na kwin bilong Siba harim tok bilong Solomon i go ol abaot, na i kam bekim em wantaim askim plenti harde kantri. I kam long Jerusalem wantaim bikpela karavan, kemel i karim spis, gold i plenti, na stoun bilong valiu. Na i kam bekim Solomon, na i toktok wantaim em long ol samting i stap inside mind bilong en.

original: And Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was too difficult for him to explain.
translation: Na Solomana i bekim tok long ol kesions bilong em, ningting i no hard tumas long en bilong tok klia.

original: When the queen of Sheba saw the wisdom of Solomon, the palace he had built,
translation: Taim queen bilong Siba i kam lukim save bilong Solomona, haus bilong kiak pundaun im bin mekim,

original: the food at his table, the seating of his servants, the service and attire of his attendants and cupbearers, and the burnt offerings he presented at the house of the LORD, it took her breath away.
translation: Ka moni long tebol bilong en, ol servent bilong en i go sindaun, wok bung long ol yangpela manmeri na ol i kam long en, na ol i holim kapa, na ol bikpela sakris bilong en i bin givim long haus bilong Lord, em i kirapim spirit bilong en finis.

original: She said to the king, “The report I heard in my own country about your words and wisdom is true.
translation: Em i tokim king, “Ripot weh mi harim long kantri bilong mi long tok bilong yu na wisdom bilong yu em i treu.”

original: But I did not believe the reports until I came and saw with my own eyes. Indeed, not half of the greatness of your wisdom was told to me. You have far exceeded the report I heard.
translation: Mi no bilip ol taktok yet, na mi kam na lukim wantaim ai bilong mi. Nogat, no hap bilong greatness bilong yu gutpela save em i tok long mi. Yu go pasis longwe na winim ol dispela taktok em i bin harim.

original: How blessed are your men! How blessed are these servants of yours who stand continually before you and hear your wisdom!
translation: Win bilong ol man bilong yu em i blessim! Win bilong ol servan bilong yu dispela em i blessim, ol i stap olsem long taim bilong hariap long yu na ol i harim save bilong yu!

original: Blessed be the LORD your God, who has delighted in you to set you on His throne to be king for the LORD your God. Because your God loved Israel enough to establish them forever, He has made you king over them to carry out justice and righteousness.”
translation: Praizim LORD God bilong yu, we i laikim yu tumas long putim yu long throne bilong en olsem king bilong LORD God bilong yu. Bikos God bilong yu em i laik Israel tumas, na em wan belisim ol long taim bilong ol, na em i mekim yu king bilong ol olgeta long mekim jusis na ret na wail long ol pipol.

original: Then she gave the king 120 talents of gold, a great quantity of spices, and precious stones. There had never been such spices as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
translation: Na em givim king 120 talents bilong gol, planti spices i kamap, na stoun bilong hap. Nogat spices olsem ol i bin katol bifo long taim bipo, olsem kwin bilong Siba i givim long King Solomona.

original: (The servants of Hiram and of Solomon who brought gold from Ophir also brought algum wood and precious stones.
translation: Wokman bilong Hiram na Solomon i go bekim gol long hap Ophir, na ol i kisim timba algum na ston bilong valiu.

original: The king made the algum wood into steps for the house of the LORD and for the king’s palace, and into lyres and harps for the singers. Never before had anything like them been seen in the land of Judah.)
translation: King i kamapim diwai algum long wail ol i kamapim steps longaus haus bilong LORD na longaus palas bilong king, na i kamapim long laplap bilong singautim na drum long ol man meri i singaut. Nogat ol samting ol i lukim bifo long grin bilong Judah.

original: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all she desired—whatever she asked—far more than she had brought the king. Then she left and returned to her own country, along with her servants.
translation: King Soloman i givim kwin pi Sheba olsem em i laik, planti moa long ol samting em i bring ikam. Na em i go bek gen na i stap gen long kantri bilong em, wantaim ol wokman bilong en.

original: The weight of gold that came to Solomon each year was 666 talents,
translation: Wet bilong gol i kam bek long Solomon long yia ya em i 666 talenta.

original: not including the revenue from the merchants and traders. And all the Arabian kings and governors of the land also brought gold and silver to Solomon.
translation: Ino klud na moni bilong ol bisnis man na treda. Na ol King bilong Arabia na gavana bilong kantri i bringim gol na silva long Solomon.

original: King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred shekels of hammered gold went into each shield.
translation: King Solomona i mekim tu hundred pipel bikpela silid long gol we i paitim; sikis shekel gol we i paitim i go insait long bekim wanpela silid.

original: He also made three hundred small shields of hammered gold; three hundred shekels of gold went into each shield. And the king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
translation: Em makim tripela handred skild liklik na ol i kam ap bilong gol we ol i paitim; tripela handred sikkel bilong gol i go insait long wanpela skild. Na king i putim ol i go insait long Haus bilong Bus bilong Lebanan.

original: Additionally, the king made a great throne of ivory and overlaid it with pure gold.
translation: King i mekim wanpela bikpela thrown blong ivori, na em koverim em ap long ivory longpela gold pepea.

original: The throne had six steps, and a footstool of gold was attached to it. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, with a lion standing beside each armrest.
translation: Thron bilong em i gat sikis steppela, na wan futstul bilong gol i luklum long en. Long sap bilong sit bilong em, i gat armres long both sait, na wan lion i sanap besaida long wanpela armres.

original: Twelve lions stood on the six steps, one at either end of each step. Nothing like this had ever been made for any kingdom.
translation: Twelve lipain i stap long sikis steppel, wan long wanen hap bilong eni steppel. Nogat samting olsem dispela i bin mekim long eni ples bilong king.

original: All King Solomon’s drinking cups were gold, and all the utensils of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. There was no silver, because it was accounted as nothing in the days of Solomon.
translation: Ol kap bilong King Solomon i mekim cup long dring bia, olgeta i gold, na ol samting bilong Haus bilong Bus bilong Lebanon, olgeta i gold tru. Nogat silva, long taim bilong King Solomon, em i nogat valui, em i nokisim olgeta samting, olsem silva i nogat wari.

original: For the king had the ships of Tarshish that went with Hiram’s servants, and once every three years the ships of Tarshish would arrive bearing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
translation: King i gat ship bilong Tarshish, na ol i go wantaim servant bilong Hiram, na wan taim olsem long tripela yia, ship bilong Tarshish bai kam, na ol bai kisim gold, silva, tuski, mogul, na paua.

original: So King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
translation: King Solomona i winim olgeta king bilong graun long sampela moni na wisdom.

original: All the kings of the earth sought an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had put in his heart.
translation: Ol king bilong graun i go bekim tok long Solomon, ol i laik harim wisdom we Bikpela i save plantim long het bilong en.

original: Year after year, each visitor would bring his tribute: articles of silver and gold, clothing, weapons, spices, horses, and mules.
translation: Yia bihain yia, nambis husat i go bek long ples bilong en i bringim gif bilong en: samting bilong silva na gold, klos, wip, spais, hos na mol.

original: Solomon had 4,000 stalls for horses and chariots, and 12,000 horses, which he stationed in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem.
translation: Solomon i gat 4000 ples bilong kaiim hors na kar, na 12,000 hors, we em i laik stapim ol long ol ples bilong kar, na wanpela tasol i stap wantaim em long Jerusalem.

original: He reigned over all the kings from the Euphrates to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt.
translation: Em i bos long olgeta king from Euphrates long go long kantri bilong Philistines, long stret bilong border bilong Egypt.

original: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as abundant as sycamore in the foothills.
translation: King i mekim silva i kamap olsem ston long graun long Jerusalem, na cedar i kamap planti olsem sycamore long bus kamap long ples.

original: Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and from all the lands.
translation: Hosis bilong Solomon i kam bek long import from Misraim na olgeta hap graun.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Solomon, from beginning to end, are they not written in the Records of Nathan the Prophet, in the Prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the Visions of Iddo the Seer concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat?
translation: Long ol stori bilong Solomon olsem, from bikpela i go inap long las, ol i raitim long Buk Bilong Stori bilong Natan Profet, long Tok Bilong God bilong Ahija Shilonit, na long Wisions bilong Ido Siar tok bilong Jeroboam man bilong Nebat.

original: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
translation: Solomon i bos long Jiusalem, na ibin bos long ol Israel foati yia.

original: And Solomon rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of his father David. And his son Rehoboam reigned in his place.
translation: Na Solomon i istap long ples bilong tumbuna olsem na em i go daun klostu long siti bilong David tumbuna. Na Rehoboam pikinini bilong em i kam bihain long em, na i kisim rod bilong king.

original: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had gone there to make him king.
translation: Na Rehoboam i go long Shekem, wantaim olgeta Israel i go dai na kat long en, ol i kam na mekim em king.

original: When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard about this, he returned from Egypt, where he had fled from King Solomon.
translation: Taim Jeroboam sone bilong Nebat harim tok long dispela, na em i kam bek gen long kantri from Egip, wahan em i ranawe go long King Solomon.

original: So they sent for Jeroboam, and he and all Israel came to Rehoboam and said,
translation: Ol i kirapim Jeroboam, na em na ol Israel i kam bek long Rehoboam na ol i tok.

original: “Your father put a heavy yoke on us. But now you should lighten the burden of your father’s service and the heavy yoke he put on us, and we will serve you.”
translation: Pita bilong yu, em i putim bikpela hap bilong wari long hed bilong mipela. Nau yu mas lilim daun hap bilong bikpela wari na lok olsem banis long hed bilong mipela, na mipela bai sarvim yupela.

original: Rehoboam answered, “Come back to me in three days.” So the people departed.
translation: Rehoboam i bekim tok, “Kam bek long me long three de.” Na ol pipol i go dasol.

original: Then King Rehoboam consulted with the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. “How do you advise me to respond to these people?” he asked.
translation: King Rehoboam i go ask long kaunsil bilong ol bikpela man we i wokim servos long papa bilong em Solomon long taim bilong life. “Yupela mas givim tok back long mi, mipela ken mekim wanem long dispela man?” em i askim.

original: They replied, “If you will be kind to these people and please them by speaking kind words to them, they will be your servants forever.”
translation: Ol i tok, "Sapos yu givim gutpela hap long ol pipel ya, na yu mas tok sweet moa long ol, bai ol i kamap nais, na bai ol i wok servant long yu foreva."

original: But Rehoboam rejected the advice of the elders; instead, he consulted the young men who had grown up with him and served him.
translation: Bare Rehoboam i rausim toktok bilong ol bikman i stap bifor, na isted long dispela, im go bek long ol yangpela man i grow up wantaim em, na ol i servim em.

original: He asked them, “What message do you advise that we send back to these people who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Lighten the yoke your father put on us’?”
translation: Em i askim ol, “Wanem tok ilesan bai yu givim bek long ol pipol ya we i tokim mi, ol i sindaun long papa bilong mipela, tisa ol i tok, ‘Laitim wei bilong yuk we papa bilong yu i putim long mipela’?”

original: The young men who had grown up with him replied, “This is how you should answer these people who said to you, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but you should make it lighter.’ This is what you should tell them: ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s waist!
translation: Em i tokim ol yangpela man, "Yu mas givim toktok long ol pipol olsem: 'Papa bilong yu makim yok bilong mipela i bikim, tasol yu mas mekim em i lait.' Tokim ol: 'Finger bilong han ikik i bikpela olgeta long het bilong bel bilong papa bilong mi!'"

original: Whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke. Whereas my father scourged you with whips, I will scourge you with scorpions.’”
translation: Wanpela taim papa bilong mi hamarim yu long yuk, na mi bai katim i go longa yuk bilong yu. Papa bilong mi bin givim yu swit bilong painim, na mi bai givim yu painim olsem skorpion.

original: After three days, Jeroboam and all the people returned to Rehoboam, since the king had said, “Come back to me on the third day.”
translation: Bihaen long tripe de, Jeroboam na ol pipol i kam bek gen long Rehoboam, bikos king i tok olsem, "Kam bek gen long me bihaen long deya three."

original: And the king answered them harshly. King Rehoboam rejected the advice of the elders
translation: King i bekim tok strong olsem na, King Rehoboam i no lissen long toktok bilong olegta.

original: and spoke to them as the young men had advised, saying, “Whereas my father made your yoke heavy, I will add to your yoke. Whereas my father scourged you with whips, I will scourge you with scorpions.”
translation: Na em i tokim ol long stret long ol yangpela man i givim tok, olsem: "Papa bilong mi i mekim yuk bilong yu i bikim hebavi, bai mi yet kam bekim yuk bilong yu i moa strong. Papa bilong mi i bin paitim yu long lip whips, bai mi paitim yu long Skorpion."

original: So the king did not listen to the people, and indeed this turn of events was from God, in order that the LORD might fulfill the word that He had spoken through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.
translation: King i no harim tok bilong ol pipol, na ol samting ol i kam bek long han bilong God, olsem LORD ina bai mekim wod i kam tru we i tokim thru Ahijah man bilong Shiloh long Jeroboam son bilong Nebat.

original: When all Israel saw that the king had refused to listen to them, they answered the king: “What portion do we have in David, and what inheritance in the son of Jesse? To your tents, O Israel! Look now to your own house, O David!” So all the Israelites went home,
translation: Wanpela taim ol Isrel i lukim king i no lissen long tok bilong ol, ol i ansa long king: “Pesen bilong yumi i stap long David, na inheretes bilong yumi i stap long pikinini bilong Jese? Go bak long hanus bilong yupela, O Isrel! Nau yumi harim long hus na famili bilong yu, O David!” Na ol Isrelait i go bak long ples bilong ol.

original: but Rehoboam still reigned over the Israelites living in the cities of Judah.
translation: Be Rehoboam i stap yet long trotem bilong Pipol Israel ol i stap long towns bilong Yuda.

original: Then King Rehoboam sent out Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but the Israelites stoned him to death. And King Rehoboam mounted his chariot in haste and escaped to Jerusalem.
translation: King Rehoboam salim go Hadoram, i bos bilong wok forced, tasol ol Israelites ol i kilim em wantaim ston. Na King Rehoboam em raitim chariot bilong en, em ranawe go long Jerusalem.

original: So to this day Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David.
translation: Na todei yet, Isrel i stap long streik i go bek long haus bilong Daud.

original: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he mobilized the house of Judah and Benjamin—180,000 chosen warriors—to fight against Israel and restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
translation: Rehoboam i kam bek long Jerusalem, na em i mobilaisim haus bilong Yuda na Benjamin – 180,000 solida bilong paitim we i pikinini long em – ol i go fight gensin Israel, na bringim bek kingdom long Rehoboam.

original: But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God:
translation: Bareket, tok bilong LORD i kam long Shemaiah, man bilong GOD.

original: “Tell Rehoboam son of Solomon king of Judah and all the Israelites in Judah and Benjamin
translation: Tokim Rehoboam, pikinini bilong Solomon, king bilong Yuda, na ol Israelaiti long Yuda na Benjamin.

original: that this is what the LORD says: ‘You are not to go up and fight against your brothers. Each of you must return home, for this word is from Me.’” So they listened to the words of the LORD and turned back from going against Jeroboam.
translation: Olsem LORD i tok: 'Yu no ken go antap na fait wantaim brata bilong yu. Yupela yet olgeta i mas go bak long hus, bikos dispela toksave i kam from Mipela.' Ol i harim tok bilong LORD, na ol i turnim bek long go antap na fait wantaim Jeroboam.

original: Rehoboam continued to live in Jerusalem, and he built up cities for defense in Judah.
translation: Rehoboam i stap yet olsem long Jerusalem, na em i bikim siti bilong difens long Judah.

original: He built up Bethlehem, Etam, Tekoa,
translation: Em i bikim i kamap Betlehem, Etam, Tekoa,

original: Beth-zur, Soco, Adullam,
translation: Bet-zur, Soko, Adulam

original: Gath, Mareshah, Ziph,
translation: Gat, Maresa, Zip,

original: Adoraim, Lachish, Azekah,
translation: Adoraim, Lachis, Aseka,

original: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, the fortified cities in Judah and Benjamin.
translation: Zorah, Aijalon, na Hebron, siti strongpela i gat barak long Judah na Benjamin.

original: He strengthened their fortresses and put officers in them, with supplies of food, oil, and wine.
translation: Em i strongim gutpela bung bilong toktok bilong ol, na em i putim ofisa long ol, wantaim ka long kai, oil, na wain.

original: He also put shields and spears in all the cities and strengthened them greatly. So Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
translation: Em putim skild na spia long ol taun, na strengthenim ol gutpela winim. Na Judah na Benjamin i bilong em tasol.

original: Moreover, the priests and Levites from all their districts throughout Israel stood with Rehoboam.
translation: Na pris na Levaita husat i kam long olgeta distrikt bilong ol long eni het bilong Israel, ol i stap wantaim Rehoboam.

original: For the Levites left their pasturelands and their possessions and went to Judah and Jerusalem, because Jeroboam and his sons had rejected them as priests of the LORD.
translation: Levaitis i lusim gras bilong ol na ol samting ol i gat, na ol i go long Juta na Jerusalema, bikos Jeroboam na ol pikinini bilong em i no wanpela bekim ol priest bilong LORD.

original: And Jeroboam appointed his own priests for the high places and for the goat demons and calf idols he had made.
translation: Na Jeroboam em i apointim prist na belong long em yet long ples hait, na long satan goat na idol kukul em i mekim.

original: Those from every tribe of Israel who had set their hearts to seek the LORD their God followed the Levites to Jerusalem to sacrifice to the LORD, the God of their fathers.
translation: Ol pipel bilong everi tribe bilong Israel husat i mekim harim bilong ol i go finisim long LORD, ol i foloim Levit na go long Jerusalem ol i givim sakrifis long LORD, Bikpela God bilong tumbuna ol.

original: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon for three years, because they walked for three years in the way of David and Solomon.
translation: Ol i strongim kauntri bilong Yuda, na ol i sapotim Rehoboam pikinini bilong Solomon long tripela yia, bikos ol i wok long rot bilong David na Solomon long dispela taim.

original: And Rehoboam married Mahalath, who was the daughter of David’s son Jerimoth and of Abihail, the daughter of Jesse’s son Eliab.
translation: Na Rehoboam i maritim Mahalath, daun sel bilong Jerimoth, pikinini bilong David, na bilong Abihail, daun sel bilong Eliab, pikinini bilong Jesse.

original: She bore sons to him: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
translation: Meri i karim pikinini man long em: Jeush, Shemariah, na Zaham.

original: After her, he married Maacah daughter of Absalom, and she bore to him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
translation: Bihaen long em, em i marit Maaka, dokim bilong Absalom, na em i karim bek long em Abija, Atai, Ziza, na Selomisi.

original: Rehoboam loved Maacah daughter of Absalom more than all his wives and concubines. In all, he had eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and he was the father of twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
translation: Rehoboam em i lakim Maacah, pikinini bilong Absalom, moa yet long olgeta meri na hamas meri. Em i gat eighteen meri na sixty hamas meri, na em i papa bilong twenty-eight pikinini man na sixty pikinini meri.

original: Rehoboam appointed Abijah son of Maacah as chief prince among his brothers, intending to make him king.
translation: Rehoboam i apoinim Abijah, pikinini bilong Maacah, olsem prins chief long ol bratas bilong en, na em i laik mekim em king.

original: Rehoboam also acted wisely by dispersing some of his sons throughout the districts of Judah and Benjamin, and to all the fortified cities. He gave them abundant provisions and sought many wives for them.
translation: Rehoboam i wok bung wantaim save, em i skulim ol pikinini bilong em yet long ol distrik bilong Juda na Benjamin, na long sitibilibong na sindaun bilong ples. Em i givim ol ka long ol, planti ka, na em i painim meri plenti long ol.

original: After Rehoboam had established his sovereignty and royal power, he and all Israel with him forsook the Law of the LORD.
translation: Rehoboam em i stap na em i bos, na em autoret bilong em, na ol Isrel istap wantaim em, ol i lusim Lo bilong GOD.

original: In the fifth year of Rehoboam’s reign, because they had been unfaithful to the LORD, Shishak king of Egypt came up and attacked Jerusalem
translation: Long namba faiv yia bilong paitim Rehoboam i bos, olsem na bikos ol i no bin bilip tru long Bikpela, Shishak king bilong Ijip i kam antap, na i go pasim Jerusalem.

original: with 1,200 chariots, 60,000 horsemen, and countless troops who came with him out of Egypt—Libyans, Sukkites, and Cushites.
translation: Em i bringim 1,200 kareta, 60,000 jockey, na ol solja i go antap long namba, i kam wantaim em long Egypt—ol pipel Libya, ol Sukkites, na ol Kush.

original: He captured the fortified cities of Judah and came as far as Jerusalem.
translation: Em i kapim ol ples strong bilong Juda na em i kamap het long Jerusalem.

original: Then Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam and the leaders of Judah who had gathered at Jerusalem because of Shishak, and he said to them, “This is what the LORD says: ‘You have forsaken Me; therefore, I have forsaken you into the hand of Shishak.’”
translation: Porofet Shemaiah i kam long Rehoboam na lidaman bilong Yuda ol i kam long wanpela hap long Jerusalem long taim bilong Shishak, na em i tokim ol: "Papa God i tok olsem: 'Yu lusim Mi; therefore, Na mi nau lusim yu long han bilong Shishak.'"

original: So the leaders of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said, “The LORD is righteous.”
translation: Ol lida bilong Israel na king ol i go daun long graun, na ol i tok, "LORD em i dikai".

original: When the LORD saw that they had humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, “They have humbled themselves; I will not destroy them, but will soon grant them deliverance. My wrath will not be poured out on Jerusalem through Shishak.
translation: LORD i si pem na ol i bin kamdaun yet, tok bilong LORD i kam long Shemaiah, i mekim tok: "Ol i kamdaun yet; mi no bai bagarapim ol, bat mi bai givim ol fri long taim. Werah bilong mi no bai ran i go long Jerusalem thru Shishak.

original: Nevertheless, they will become his servants, so that they may learn the difference between serving Me and serving the kings of other lands.”
translation: Nogat sem, ol bai kamap servan bilong em, bilong ol i larim difrens long servisim Mipela na ol i servisim king bilong narapela kantri.

original: So King Shishak of Egypt attacked Jerusalem and seized the treasures of the house of the LORD and of the royal palace. He took everything, including the gold shields that Solomon had made.
translation: King Shishak bilong Egypt i kam na winim Jerusalem, na em i taitim ol samting bilong haus bilong LORD na hus bilong king. Em i kisim everything, olgeta skild bilong gol Solomon i mekim.

original: Then King Rehoboam made bronze shields in their place and committed them to the care of the captains of the guard on duty at the entrance to the royal palace.
translation: King Rehoboam i mekim skild bron zo long ples bilong ol, na i givim ol i go long han bilong kaptin bilong gadi i stap wokabaut long entris bilong haus bilong king.

original: And whenever the king entered the house of the LORD, the guards would go with him, bearing the shields, and later they would return them to the guardroom.
translation: Na taim olsem king i go insait long haus bilong Lod, gaad i go wantaim em, ol i kisim skild, na bai ol brinngim bek long rum bilong gaad.

original: Because Rehoboam humbled himself, the anger of the LORD turned away from him, and He did not destroy him completely. Indeed, conditions were good in Judah.
translation: Bikos Rehoboam i kam daun long hes, anga bilong Jehovah i kam bek gen long rausim, na em i no killim em tete. Ol kondishon i gut long Judah.

original: Thus King Rehoboam established himself in Jerusalem. He was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the LORD had chosen from all the tribes of Israel in which to put His Name. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonite.
translation: King Rehoboam i kamap strong long Jisasalem. Emi forty-one yia na em i kamap king, na em i rain 17 yia long Jisasalem, taun we LORD i bin chusim long ol tribe bilong Israel long putim Nem bilong En. Mama bilong em i kolim Naamah bikmeri bilong Ammon.

original: And Rehoboam did evil because he did not set his heart to seek the LORD.
translation: Na Rehoboam i mekim olgeta samting nogut bikos em i no putim hari bilong en long sokim LORD.

original: Now the acts of Rehoboam, from first to last, are they not written in the records of Shemaiah the Prophet and of Iddo the Seer concerning the genealogies? There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout their days.
translation: Ol samting Rehoboam i mekim, long taim bifo na long las, ol i raun long buk bilong stori bilong Shemaiah man bilong God i tok na bilong Iddo man bilong si, long tok bilong famili. Rehoboam na Jeroboam i fait olgeta taim bilong ol.

original: And Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. And his son Abijah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Rehoboam i istap long ples bilong tumbuna olsem, na em i go daun long graon long Siti bilong Dauid. Na Abija, pikinini bilong em, i kam bihain long em, na i wokim sosen bilong king.

original: In the eighteenth year of Jeroboam’s reign, Abijah became king of Judah,
translation: Long namba eighteen yia bilong taim bilong paitim bilong Jeroboam, Abiya em i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: and he reigned in Jerusalem three years. His mother’s name was Micaiah daughter of Uriel; she was from Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
translation: Na em i bin king long Yerusalema long tripela yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Mikaiah, gel bilong Uriael, em i kam long Gibea. Na Abia na Yeroboam i bin gat bikpela fait.

original: Abijah went into battle with an army of 400,000 chosen men, while Jeroboam drew up in formation against him with 800,000 chosen and mighty men of valor.
translation: Abija i go long ples bilong fait wantaim arm na 400,000 manmeri we pipel i pikinim, wail Jeroboam i kam na sindaun i stap olsem wanpela lain i waitim em, wantaim 800,000 manmeri strong na manmeri we i gat kuraj.

original: Then Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim in the hill country of Ephraim and said, “Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel!
translation: Na Abija em i stap long Maunten Zemaraim long kantri bilong Ephraim, na em i tok, "Harim mi, O Jeroboam na yumi ol Israel!"

original: Do you not know that the LORD, the God of Israel, has given the kingship of Israel to David and his descendants forever by a covenant of salt?
translation: Yu no save long dispela? Bikpela, GOD bilong Israel, em i givim ples bilong king long Israel long David na ol desenden bilong en foreva long we bilong sol?

original: Yet Jeroboam son of Nebat, a servant of Solomon son of David, rose up and rebelled against his master.
translation: Na yet Jeroboam, pikinini bilong Nebat, wokman bilong Solomon, pikinini bilong David, i kamap strong na bagarap long han bilong bikman bilong en, na i go bek gen long en.

original: Then worthless and wicked men gathered around him to resist Rehoboam son of Solomon when he was young, inexperienced, and unable to resist them.
translation: Ol man ruina na ol man nogut i kam klostu long em, Rehoboam pikinini bilong Solomon, taim em i pikinini yet, na em i no save bagarapim ol, ol i laik bagarapim em.

original: And now you think you can resist the kingdom of the LORD, which is in the hands of David’s descendants. You are indeed a vast army, and you have with you the golden calves that Jeroboam made for you as gods.
translation: Na nau yu tink yu ken kaivim ples bilong Kingdom bilong LORD, olsem ples bilong God, we i stap long han bilong desenden bilong David, olsem famili bilong king. Yu yet em i gat planti man, na yu gat wantsail bulmakau bilong gol, olsem god bilong hevi, we Jeroboam wokim birua bilong Israel bilong yu.

original: But did you not drive out the priests of the LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites? And did you not make priests for yourselves as do the peoples of other lands? Now whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams can become a priest of things that are not gods.
translation: Bai yumi no drivim aut priest bilong LORD, ol susbilong Aharona, na Levaita? Na bai yumi mekim priest long yuself olsem ol ples i wok long narapela kantri? Nau husat i kam long konsekretim em yet long bulmak ya na ram sebn, em i kamap priest bilong samting we i no gott.

original: But as for us, the LORD is our God. We have not forsaken Him; the priests who minister to the LORD are sons of Aaron, and the Levites attend to their duties.
translation: Bai mipela i tok olsem, LORD em i God bilong mipela. Mipela i no lusim Em; pris ol i wokim sarvis long LORD, ol i pikinini bilong Aaron, na Levait i wokim wok bilong ol.

original: Every morning and every evening they present burnt offerings and fragrant incense to the LORD. They set out the rows of showbread on the ceremonially clean table, and every evening they light the lamps of the gold lampstand. We are carrying out the requirements of the LORD our God, while you have forsaken Him.
translation: Long moning na long apinun, ol i bringim ofa bilong em na smel gude long LORD, ol i putim rot bilong bret bilong show long tebol bilong klia, na long apinun ol i laitim lamp bilong gol. Mipela i wokim ol samting we LORD God bilong mipela i laikim, na yu lusim em.

original: Now behold, God Himself is with us as our head, and His priests with their trumpets sound the battle call against you. O children of Israel, do not fight against the LORD, the God of your fathers, for you will not succeed.”
translation: Nau lukim, Bikpela em i stap wantaim yumi olgeta as tingting bilong yumi, na prist bilong en i kirapim trampet bilong wail, i go bekim kisim olgeta man gen yumi. O ol pikinini bilong Israel, yu no ken fight gen Papa bilong yumi, Bikpela bilong tumbuna bilong yumi, bikos yu no inap win tumas.

original: Now Jeroboam had sent troops around to ambush from the rear, so that while he was in front of Judah, the ambush was behind them.
translation: Na Jeroboam im sendim solja i go long ambusim ol i kam bihain, na wail em i stap fron long Judah, ambus i stap bihain long ol.

original: When Judah turned and discovered that the battle was both before and behind them, they cried out to the LORD. Then the priests blew the trumpets,
translation: Juda i turnim na lukim biya i kam bilong ol, bihaen na bifor ol, ol i kirap long Jehova. Na pries ol i bulim trambel,

original: and the men of Judah raised the battle cry. And when they raised the cry, God routed Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
translation: Na man meri bilong Yuda i kirapim singsing bilong fait. Na taim ol i kirapim singsing, God i kilim Jeroboam na ol Israel bifor Abija na Yuda.

original: So the Israelites fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hands.
translation: Na Olia Isrel i ranawe long Olia Juda, na God i givim ol long hand bilong ol Juda.

original: Then Abijah and his people struck them with a mighty blow, and 500,000 chosen men of Israel fell slain.
translation: Na Abija na ol pikinini bilong em i givim Israel em i bikpela wiket, na 500,000 man strong bilong Israel i pundaun na i dai.

original: Thus the Israelites were subdued at that time, and the men of Judah prevailed because they relied on the LORD, the God of their fathers.
translation: Ol Israelait i go daun wailen bai ol man bilong Yuda i win, wantaim ol i putim trust long LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol.

original: Abijah pursued Jeroboam and captured some cities from him: Bethel, Jeshanah, and Ephron, along with their villages.
translation: Abija i go bihain Jerobeam, na i kisim sampela siti long em: Betel, Jesanah, na Efron, longolng ol vilij long ol.

original: Jeroboam did not again recover his power during the days of Abijah, and the LORD struck him down and he died.
translation: Jeroboam em i no kamap strong gen long taim bilong Abia, na LORD i kilim em na em i dai.

original: But Abijah grew strong, married fourteen wives, and became the father of twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
translation: Bare Abijah i kamap strong, i maritim fourteen meri, na i kamap papa bilong twenty-two man pikinini na sixteen woman pikinini.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Abijah, along with his ways and his words, are written in the Treatise of the Prophet Iddo.
translation: Nau ol narapela wok bilong Abiaja, longlong namel bilong en na toksave bilong en, ol i raitim long Buk bilong Prophet Ido.

original: Then Abijah rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. And his son Asa reigned in his place, and in his days the land was at peace for ten years.
translation: Na Abija i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, ol i kisim em i go wapim long Siti bilong Dauid. Susa bilong en Asa i kam bihain long em i bos, na long taim bilong em, kantri i stap gut, i no gat wari long ten yia.

original: And Asa did what was good and right in the eyes of the LORD his God.
translation: Na Asa i wokim ol gutpela na rait long ai bilong LORD, Bikpela bilong en.

original: He removed the foreign altars and high places, shattered the sacred pillars, and chopped down the Asherah poles.
translation: Em i tambuim ol altars bilong narapela kantry na ples bilong antap long hap, em i brisim ol pillar bilong holidei, na kisim daun ol polo bilong Asherah.

original: He commanded the people of Judah to seek the LORD, the God of their fathers, and to observe the law and the commandments.
translation: Em i givim tok save long ol pipol bilong Yuda, ol i go bek long LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, na ol i holim lotu na ol komando.

original: He also removed the high places and incense altars from all the cities of Judah, and under him the kingdom was at peace.
translation: Em tumasim ol ples bilong pagan, na em tu i rausim ol alta bilong smel i go dasol long ol taun bilong Yuda, astorolim em, ples bilong king i stap gut na i no gat kros.

original: Because the land was at peace, Asa built fortified cities in Judah. In those days no one made war with him, because the LORD had given him rest.
translation: Bikos kantri i stap gutpela, Asa i bikim siti strongpela long Juda. Long dispela taim, nobody i go fait wantaim em, bikos LORD i givim em pes.

original: So he said to the people of Judah, “Let us build these cities and surround them with walls and towers, with doors and bars. The land is still ours because we have sought the LORD our God. We have sought Him and He has given us rest on every side.” So they built and prospered.
translation: Na em i tokim ol pipol long Juda, "Mipela bai bilongim siti ya, bai kaunim olgeta na kisim klostu long wei, wantaim dor na bar. Graun yet em i stap long mipela, bekos mipela go pinis bek long LORD God bilong mipela, Bikpela, na mipela soekim Em, na Em i givim mipela ples long ripos strong long olgeta sait. Ol i wokabaut na kamap strong.

original: Asa had an army of 300,000 men from Judah bearing large shields and spears, and 280,000 men from Benjamin bearing small shields and drawing the bow. All these were mighty men of valor.
translation: Asa i gat armi long 300,000 man husat i kam long Judah, ol i karryng bigpela siel na spia, na 280,000 man husat i kam long Benjimin, ol i ilusim banara na kisim liklik siel. Ol i man bilong powa na streng.

original: Then Zerah the Cushite came against them with an army of 1,000,000 men and 300 chariots, and they advanced as far as Mareshah.
translation: Na Zera man bilong Kush i kam bek gen long ol, wantaim armi bilong em, milien moa na thousand man, na kareta three hundred, na ol i go yet long Maresha.

original: So Asa marched out against him and lined up in battle formation in the Valley of Zephathah near Mareshah.
translation: Na Asa i go bekim ol i kam long ples bilong war, na ol i sanap strong long Vali bilong Zefata, long hap bilong Maresa.

original: Then Asa cried out to the LORD his God: “O LORD, there is no one besides You to help the powerless against the mighty. Help us, O LORD our God, for we rely on You, and in Your name we have come against this multitude. O LORD, You are our God. Do not let a mere mortal prevail against You.”
translation: Na Asa harim tok long LORD God bilong en: "O LORD, i no gat narapela hap bilong halivim besides Yu to helpim ol i no inap against ol strongpela. Halivim, O LORD God bilong yumi, yumi putim trast long Yu, na long nem bilong Yu yumi kam bekgen ol i go. O LORD, yu be GOD bilong yumi, bai yu no ken lusim man bilong matemat na i winim Yu."

original: So the LORD struck down the Cushites before Asa and Judah, and the Cushites fled.
translation: Na Papa God i kilim Cusaiti long bikmus bilong Asa na Yuda, na Cusaiti i ranawe.

original: Then Asa and his army pursued them as far as Gerar. The Cushites fell and could not recover, for they were crushed before the LORD and His army. So the people of Judah carried off a great amount of plunder
translation: Na Asa wantaim ol solja bilong en i go bekim ol Cushites longwe na rausim tok bilong en asta long Gerar. Ol Cushites i krung na ol i no inap kam bek gen, bikos ol i bin krung long montering bilong LORD na armi bilong en. Na ol pipol bilong Judah i kisim planti strong bilong ol.

original: and attacked all the cities around Gerar, because the terror of the LORD had fallen upon them. They plundered all the cities, since there was much plunder there.
translation: Na ol i tambuim ol ples long raun we bilong Gerar, bikos wiket bilong Lod i kam daunupon ol. Ol i stilim ol samting long ol ples, long ol samting i planti.

original: They also attacked the tents of the herdsmen and carried off many sheep and camels. Then they returned to Jerusalem.
translation: Ol i kam bek long tent bilong ol wokman hus na kisim mosong ol sheep na camel, karim i go. Ol i go bek gen long Jerusalem.

original: Now the Spirit of God came upon Azariah son of Oded.
translation: Nau Spirit bilong God i kam long Azariah, pikinini bilong Oded.

original: So he went out to meet Asa and said to him, “Listen to me, Asa and all Judah and Benjamin. The LORD is with you when you are with Him. If you seek Him, He will be found by you, but if you forsake Him, He will forsake you.
translation: Em i go aut go mitim Asa na em i tokim em, "Harim tok bilong mi, Asa, na ol Juda na Benjimin. LORD i stap wantaim yu long taim yu stap wantaim Em. Yu sukim Em, bai yu finim Em, tasol yu lekim Em, bai Em i lek yu.

original: For many years Israel has been without the true God, without a priest to instruct them, and without the law.
translation: Long taim i go, Israel i no gat God bilong truth, ol i no gat pries long instruksem ol, na ol i no gat loa.

original: But in their distress they turned to the LORD, the God of Israel, and sought Him, and He was found by them.
translation: Tasol long ol taim bilong trobol na ogota, ol i turnim bek gen long LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, na ol i lukim i kam, na em i kisim ol.

original: In those days there was no safety for travelers, because the residents of the lands had many conflicts.
translation: Long dispela taim, i no stap sikuriti long ol trak, bikos ol pipol bilong ples i gat planti faet.

original: Nation was crushed by nation, and city by city, for God afflicted them with all kinds of adversity.
translation: Nesen i brukim nesen, na taun i brukim taun, wantaim God i givim ol kain sik kurukuru long ol.

original: But as for you, be strong; do not be discouraged, for your work will be rewarded.”
translation: Bai yu yet, iu stongpela; no ken skulim iu, wantaim wok bilong yu bai bekim gut.

original: When Asa heard these words and the prophecy of Azariah son of Oded the prophet, he took courage and removed the detestable idols from the whole land of Judah and Benjamin and from the cities he had captured in the hill country of Ephraim. He then restored the altar of the LORD that was in front of the portico of the LORD’s temple.
translation: Taim Asa harim dispela tok na propesi bilong Azariah sambai bilong Oded propet, em i kisim kuraj na rausim ol idols i no gut long holim kantri bilong Juda na Benjamin na long ol taun em i winim long maunten kantri bilong Efrayim. Em wokim gen altare bilong LORD i stap fron long porch bilong haus lotu bilong LORD.

original: And he assembled all Judah and Benjamin, along with those from the tribes of Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon who had settled among them, for great numbers had come over to him from Israel when they saw that the LORD his God was with him.
translation: Na em i kam na winim ol Judah na Benjamin, wantsail ol i stap long ol clan Ephraim, Manasseh, na Simeon i go daun klostu long ol, planti manmeri i kam daun long em from Israel, long taim ol i lukim Bikpela God bilong em i stap wantaim em.

original: So they gathered together in Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of Asa’s reign.
translation: Ol i kam together long Jerusalem long mun tri bilong yia fifteenth long tanim bilong Asa.

original: At that time they sacrificed to the LORD seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep from all the plunder they had brought back.
translation: Long dispela taim ol i bin sakim bek long LORD seven hundred bulmakau na seven thousand sip long olgeta ka i bin bringim bek.

original: Then they entered into a covenant to seek the LORD, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and soul.
translation: Ol i go insait long kaivenant, ol i serch long Lod, God bilong tumbuna bilong ol, wantaim ol hart na sol bilong ol.

original: And whoever would not seek the LORD, the God of Israel, would be put to death, whether young or old, man or woman.
translation: Na husat i no laik sakim LORD, God bilong Israel, bai ol i ken kisim desis long dai, narapela ol i pikinini o ol i bikpela, man o meri.

original: They took an oath to the LORD with a loud voice, with shouting, trumpets, and rams’ horns.
translation: Ol i makim oas long LORD wantaim voys bilong hap, wantaim rausim voys, trampet, na horn bilong ram.

original: And all Judah rejoiced over the oath, for they had sworn it with all their heart. They had sought Him earnestly, and He was found by them. So the LORD gave them rest on every side.
translation: Na ol Judah i amamas long promis, wantaim ol i promis long hap bilong ol, ol i serchim Em gut, na Em i kamap long ol. Na LORD i givim ol pis long ol sait.

original: King Asa also removed his grandmother Maacah from her position as queen mother because she had made a detestable Asherah pole. Asa chopped down the pole, crushed it, and burned it in the Kidron Valley.
translation: King Asa i rausim kwin mama bilong en, Maacah, long ples bilong en bikos em i mekim totem bilong Asherah we i no inu long God. King Asa i katim daun totem bilong Asherah, krungutim, na burnim long Kidron Valley.

original: The high places were not removed from Israel, but Asa’s heart was fully devoted all his days.
translation: Ol ples bilong hai i no go daun long Isrel, tasol hati bilong Asa i stap strong tru long en ol dei.

original: And he brought into the house of God the silver and gold articles that he and his father had dedicated.
translation: Na em kisim i go insait long haus bilong God ol samting bilong silva na gol we em na papa bilong em ol i dediki.

original: And there was no war until the thirty-fifth year of Asa’s reign.
translation: Na ino gat wok i kam long taim bilong thirty-fifth yia bilong paitim na rulim bilong Asa.

original: In the thirty-sixth year of Asa’s reign, Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah and fortified Ramah to prevent anyone from leaving or entering the territory of Asa king of Judah.
translation: Long yia triati-sikis bilong paitim bilong Asa, Baasha king bilong Israel i go ap gen long Judah na i stroingim Ramah, bilem ol man no inap go ausait o kam insait long grun bilong Asa king bilong Judah.

original: So Asa withdrew the silver and gold from the treasuries of the house of the LORD and the royal palace, and he sent it with this message to Ben-hadad king of Aram, who was ruling in Damascus:
translation: Na Asa i withdrawim tumasim sila na gol long hap bilong mani bilong haus bilong LORD na haus bilong king, na salim i go wantaim mesij em long Ben-hadad king bilong Aram, em i wok strong long Damaskas:

original: “Let there be a treaty between me and you, between my father and your father. See, I have sent you silver and gold. Now go and break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, so that he will withdraw from me.”
translation: Mipela i mas makim peis bilong yu na mipela, bilong papa bilong mipela na papa bilong yu. Lukim, mi sendim sipa na gol long yu. Nau yu go na braim peis bilong yu wantaim Baasha king bilong Israel, na em bai kam bek gen long mipela.

original: And Ben-hadad listened to King Asa and sent the commanders of his armies against the cities of Israel, conquering Ijon, Dan, Abel-maim, and all the store cities of Naphtali.
translation: Na Ben-hadad i harim i go pas long King Asa, na bai sendim komandan bilong ol armi bilong en against ol siti bilong Israel, winim Ijon, Dan, Abel-maim, na ol siti bilong stua bilong Naphtali.

original: When Baasha learned of this, he stopped fortifying Ramah and abandoned his work.
translation: Taim Baasha harim dispela, em i stap stopim wok long ram Ramah na em i lusim wok bilong en.

original: Then King Asa brought all the men of Judah, and they carried away the stones of Ramah and the timbers Baasha had used for building. And with these materials he built up Geba and Mizpah.
translation: King Asa kam bringim ol man meri bilong Yuda, na ol i kisim wei ston bilong Rama na timba Baasha bin usim long mekimhaus. Na King Asa i usim dispela samting long mekim Geba na Mizpa strong.

original: At that time Hanani the seer came to King Asa of Judah and told him, “Because you have relied on the king of Aram and not on the LORD your God, the army of the king of Aram has escaped from your hand.
translation: Long taim ia, Hanani man prophet i kam bek long King Asa bilong Yuda, na i tokim em, "Bikos yu putim traust long king bilong Aram, nogat long LORD God bilong yu, army bilong king bilong Aram i stap fri long han bilong yu."

original: Were not the Cushites and Libyans a vast army with many chariots and horsemen? Yet because you relied on the LORD, He delivered them into your hand.
translation: Oli Kusait na Libian, ol i gat planti kareta na jockey, tasol bikos yu putim trast long Lod, em i bingim ol i kam long han bilong yu.

original: For the eyes of the LORD roam to and fro over all the earth, to show Himself strong on behalf of those whose hearts are fully devoted to Him. You have acted foolishly in this matter. From now on, therefore, you will be at war.”
translation: Ai bilong Lod i wakabaut wantaim na bikos long olgeta graun, olsem i sanap strong long en bekim ol mana i givim hart long en. Yu kisim desison nogut long dispela matar. Nau, bai ol i go long war.

original: Asa was angry with the seer and became so enraged over this matter that he put the man in prison. And at the same time Asa oppressed some of the people.
translation: Asa em i birua tru na long man proses spirit na ol i kisim man i go long haus kuk. Na em i bagarap olgeta man meri.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Asa, from beginning to end, are indeed written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
translation: Nau ol narapela wok bilong Asa, long taim bifo na long las, ol i write pinis long Buk bilong King bilong Yuda na Isrel.

original: In the thirty-ninth year of his reign, Asa became diseased in his feet, and his malady became increasingly severe. Yet even in his illness he did not seek the LORD, but only the physicians.
translation: Long ninpela yia namba 39 bilong taim bilong rulim bilong en, Asa i katim sickness long lek bilong en, na sickness bilong en i kamap strongpla. Nogat, wail tasol, even long sickness bilong en, em i no go bek long LORD, tasol em i go bek long dokta tasol.

original: So in the forty-first year of his reign, Asa died and rested with his fathers.
translation: Long forty wan yia bilong en reign, Asa i dai na kat ikam long ples bilong tumbuna.

original: And he was buried in the tomb that he had cut out for himself in the City of David. They laid him on a bier that was full of spices and various blended perfumes; then they made a great fire in his honor.
translation: Na em i go daun long holep bilong ded em i kisim palet bilong en long Siti bilong Davit. Ol i lakim em long bikpela bokis i fulap long smel gutpela na san bilong switpela smell; ol i mekim gret paia long respek bilong en.

original: Asa’s son Jehoshaphat reigned in his place, and he strengthened himself against Israel.
translation: Jehoshaphat, pikinini bilong Asa, i kam bek long hap bilong en na i bos, na em i strongim yet long Israel.

original: He stationed troops in every fortified city of Judah and put garrisons in the land of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim that his father Asa had captured.
translation: Em i putim soljata long taun bung bilong Yuda, na em i laik putim gras bilong soljata long graun bilong Yuda, na long taun ol bilong Efrayim, we papa bilong en Asa i winim.

original: Now the LORD was with Jehoshaphat because he walked in the earlier ways of his father David. He did not seek out the Baals,
translation: Nau LORD i stap wantaim Jehosafat bikos em i wok long ol bikpela pas bilong papa Davit blo em, na em i no go lusim Baals.

original: but he sought the God of his father and walked by His commandments rather than the practices of Israel.
translation: Bare em sautim God bilong papa bilong en, na em i go wakabaut long komando bilong Em, nogat ol praktis bilong Israel.

original: So the LORD established the kingdom in his hand, and all Judah brought him tribute, so that he had an abundance of riches and honor.
translation: Na Papa God i stapim kingdom bilong God long hap bilong em, na ol Juda i bringim em gift bilong winim hart, na em i gat planti samting bilong valeu na gutpela nem.

original: And his heart took delight in the ways of the LORD; furthermore, he removed the high places and Asherah poles from Judah.
translation: Na het bilong en i amesen long rot bilong LORD, na em i kisim high places na sticks bilong spirit meri Asherah na rausim ol i go long Judah.

original: In the third year of his reign, Jehoshaphat sent his officials Ben-hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah to teach in the cities of Judah,
translation: Long yia three bilong paitim bilong Jehoshaphat i kam bek, na em i sendim ofisal bilong em, olsem Ben-hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, na Micaiah, go telem ol pipol long ol taun bilong Judah.

original: accompanied by certain Levites—Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tob-adonijah—along with the priests Elishama and Jehoram.
translation: I kam wantaim sampela Levit - Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, na Tob-adonijah - wantaim pries Elishama na Jehoram.

original: They taught throughout Judah, taking with them the Book of the Law of the LORD. They went throughout the towns of Judah and taught the people.
translation: Ol i skulim i go ol ples long Yuda, ol i kisim i go wantaim Buk bilong Lotu. Ol i go ol ples long taun bilong Yuda na ol i skulim ol pipol.

original: And the dread of the LORD fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that surrounded Judah, so that they did not make war against Jehoshaphat.
translation: Na fea bilong Lod i kalap long olgeta ples bilong king i karim kondom long Judah, olesem nasel em i no faigt gen long Jehosafati.

original: Some Philistines also brought gifts and silver as tribute to Jehoshaphat, and the Arabs brought him 7,700 rams and 7,700 goats from their flocks.
translation: Ol Filistia i bringim gif na silva olsem tok kes long Jehosafat, na ol Arab i bringim 7,700 rams na 7,700 goats long em bilong mobil bilong aninal.

original: Jehoshaphat grew stronger and stronger, and he built fortresses and store cities in Judah
translation: Jehosafat i kamap strongpela na strongpela, na em i bikim fos na taun bilong ka long Juda.

original: and kept vast supplies in the cities of Judah. He also had warriors in Jerusalem who were mighty men of valor.
translation: Na ol i save kaikai na samting nating long taim long siti bilong Judah. Ol i gat solja long Jerusalem, ol man bilong pait, strong na gutpela.

original: These are their numbers according to the houses of their fathers: From Judah, the commanders of thousands: Adnah the commander, and with him 300,000 mighty men of valor;
translation: Ol i kamap long hap bilong papa bilong ol: Long hap bilong Yuda, ol kapten bilong tausen: Adnah em i kapten, na wail 300,000 ol man strongpela na gutpela i stap wantaim em;

original: next to him, Jehohanan the commander, and with him 280,000;
translation: Beside em, Jehohanan kapten, na wantaim em, two hundred eighty thousand.

original: and next to him, Amasiah son of Zichri, the volunteer for the LORD, and with him 200,000 mighty men of valor.
translation: Na nambis na hap bilong en, Amasiah son of Zikri, man i wok volontari long Papa God, wantaim em 200,000 ol man strong na gutpela i go het long tok bilong wok.

original: From Benjamin: Eliada, a mighty man of valor, and with him 200,000 armed with bows and shields;
translation: Long Benjimin: Eliada, man strongpela i go long pait, wantaim em 200,000 man i kamap, olgeta i gat bow na shield;

original: and next to him, Jehozabad, and with him 180,000 armed for battle.
translation: Na nambis na em, ol i gat Jehozabad, wantaim em 180,000 saveman long pikinini i gat weapen bilong fait.

original: These were the men who served the king, besides those he stationed in the fortified cities throughout Judah.
translation: Ol man husat i wark long king, apart from ol husat i laikim long ples nogut tru istap long ol provins bilong Yuda.

original: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance, and he allied himself with Ahab by marriage.
translation: Nau Jehoshaphat em i gat plenti samting na het bilong en long plenti, na em i joim na kamap wantaim Ahab olsem pren na meri bilong peles.

original: And some years later he went down to visit Ahab in Samaria, where Ahab sacrificed many sheep and cattle for him and the people with him, and urged him to march up to Ramoth-gilead.
translation: Na bikos long taim igo, em i go daun kam bekim Ahab long Samaria, na Ahab i kilim planti sip na bulmakau long en na ol man meri i kam wantaim em, na em i askim em long go ap long Ramoth-gilead.

original: Ahab king of Israel asked Jehoshaphat king of Judah, “Will you go with me against Ramoth-gilead?” And Jehoshaphat replied, “I am like you, and my people are your people; we will join you in the war.”
translation: Ahab king bilong Isrel i askim Jehoshaphat king bilong Juda, “Yu bai go wantaim mi long harim Ramoth-gilead?” Na Jehoshaphat i tok, “Mi olsem yu, na mipela pipel i olsem yelopela pipel; mipela bai joiim yu long digmao.”

original: But Jehoshaphat also said to the king of Israel, “Please inquire first for the word of the LORD.”
translation: Na Jehosafat i tokim king bilong Israel, “Bamukim pas, inap yu askim long toktok bilong LORD.”

original: So the king of Israel assembled the prophets, four hundred men, and asked them, “Should we go to war against Ramoth-gilead, or should we refrain?” “Go up,” they replied, “and God will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
translation: King bilong Israel i kam na tokim ol profet, four hundred man, na askim ol, “Yu go long war gen Ramoth-gilead, o yu no ken tok?” “Go ap,” ol i tok, “na God bai givim i go long han bilong king.”

original: But Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there not still a prophet of the LORD here of whom we can inquire?”
translation: Jehosafati askim, “Inas olsem propheta bilong Bikpela i stap yet, we ken go askim dispela man?”

original: The king of Israel answered, “There is still one man who can ask the LORD, but I hate him because he never prophesies anything good for me, but only bad. He is Micaiah son of Imlah.” “The king should not say that!” Jehoshaphat replied.
translation: King bilong Isrel i tokim, "I gat wanpela man i stap yet olsem bai em i go askim LORD, tasol mi hatredim em tasol bikos em i go tok nathing gut long me, tasol ol samting nogut. Em i Mikaia, pikinini bilong Imla." "King no ken tok olsem!" Jehosafat i tok bek.
