original: So the king of Israel called one of his officials and said, “Bring Micaiah son of Imlah at once.”
translation: King bilong Isrel i kolim wanpela ofisa bilong en na tokim, "Kisim Mikaia sun bilong Imala na kam harim nau."

original: Dressed in royal attire, the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah were sitting on their thrones at the threshing floor by the entrance of the gate of Samaria, with all the prophets prophesying before them.
translation: King bilong Israel na Jehosafat king bilong Yuda i gat klos longwe bilong king, na ol i save sindaun long throne bilong ol long ples bilong kilim graas, klostu long entris bilong gait bilong Samaria, wantaim ol profet i stap tokaut bifor ol.

original: Now Zedekiah son of Chenaanah had made for himself iron horns and declared, “This is what the LORD says: ‘With these you shall gore the Arameans until they are finished off.’”
translation: Nau Zedekiah sambai pikinini bilong Chenaanah em i mekim aipas bilong airen long en self, na em i tokaut, "Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'Long dispela yupela ken pakim Arameans yet, ol i pinis'."

original: And all the prophets were prophesying the same, saying, “Go up to Ramoth-gilead and prosper, for the LORD will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
translation: Na olgeta propet i go prophesy olsem, ol i tok, "Yu go apo long Ramot-Gilead na yu kamap strong, Bikpela LORD bai givim em i go long han bilong king."

original: Then the messenger who had gone to call Micaiah instructed him, “Behold, with one accord the words of the prophets are favorable to the king. So please let your words be like theirs, and speak favorably.”
translation: Mesinja i go bek kam tokim Mikaia, "Yupela harim, olgeta i wan bel, toksave bilong propet i stap gut long king. Olsem na, yu mas tok bilong yu olsem tok bilong ol, na tok strongim."

original: But Micaiah said, “As surely as the LORD lives, I will speak whatever my God tells me.”
translation: Buat Mikaia i tok, "Olsem Papa bilong olgeta i stap, em i tu, na mi bai tok olsem God bilong yumi i laik tok."

original: When Micaiah arrived, the king asked him, “Micaiah, should we go to war against Ramoth-gilead, or should we refrain?” “Go up and triumph,” Micaiah replied, “for they will be given into your hand.”
translation: Taim Mikaia kam, king i askim em, "Mikaia, yupela bai go long war long Ramot-Gilead, o nogat?" "Go apo, yu bambai winim," Mikaia i tok bek, "ol i bambai givim long yu han."

original: But the king said to him, “How many times must I make you swear not to tell me anything but the truth in the name of the LORD?”
translation: King i tokim em, “Oli mas kali yu promis, olsem yu no ken tok olsem, tasol yu tok tru long namel bilong Bikpela?”

original: So Micaiah declared: “I saw all Israel scattered on the hills like sheep without a shepherd. And the LORD said, ‘These people have no master; let each one return home in peace.’”
translation: Mikaiah igo tok: "Mi lukim ol Isrel i daunol long maunten na wara olsem sip long graun we i no gat sikman. Na LORDE i tok, 'Ol pipel igat no masalai; nap tu ya, yumi go bek long hus na i stap gut.'"

original: Then the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you that he never prophesies good for me, but only bad?”
translation: King bilong Israel i tokim Jehoshaphat, "Mi no bin tokim yu? Em i no profesi gud long mi, tasol olgeta samting nogut."

original: Micaiah continued, “Therefore hear the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on His throne, and all the host of heaven standing on His right and on His left.
translation: Mikaia em i go on, “Orait, harim tok bilong Jehovah: mi lukim Jehovah i sindaun long thrown bilong En, na hos bilong heven i stap long sait rait na kais long En.

original: And the LORD said, ‘Who will entice Ahab king of Israel to march up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?’ And one suggested this, and another that.
translation: Na Bikpela i tok, ‘Husat bai kisim bek long Ahab king bilong Israel, na em bai go antap na kilim ol long Ramot-Gilead?’ Na wan tok olsem, na narapela tok olsem.

original: Then a spirit came forward, stood before the LORD, and said, ‘I will entice him.’ ‘By what means?’ asked the LORD.
translation: Wanpela spirit i kam ananait, i stap bifor LORD, na i tok, 'Mi bai larim em i go long wanpela rot.' 'Olsem wanem?' LORD i askim.

original: And he replied, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets.’ ‘You will surely entice him and prevail,’ said the LORD. ‘Go and do it.’
translation: Na em i tokim bek, ‘Mi go aut na bai mi kamap olsem spirit i givim lies long maus bilong ol prophet bilong en.’ ‘Yupela ken entisim em na winim hat bilong en na kisim win,’ LORD i tokim. ‘Go na mekim.’

original: So you see, the LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouths of these prophets of yours, and the LORD has pronounced disaster against you.”
translation: Bikpela i putim spirits i no gat tru long maus bilong ol man profet bilong yu, na Bikpela i autim bagarap long yu.”

original: Then Zedekiah son of Chenaanah went up, struck Micaiah in the face, and demanded, “Which way did the Spirit of the LORD go when He departed from me to speak with you?”
translation: Na Zedekiah, pikinini bilong Chenaanah, i go ap, i paitim Micaiah long hes, na i askim olsem, “Spirits bilong LORD i go we long yu, bilong tokim yu, na lusim me nau?”

original: Micaiah replied, “You will soon see, on that day when you go and hide in an inner room.”
translation: Mikaia i tok bek, “Bai yu yet go si, long dei yu go na kaivim yu yet inside long rum bilong-backed.”

original: And the king of Israel declared, “Take Micaiah and return him to Amon the governor of the city and to Joash the king’s son,
translation: Na king bilong Israel i tokim ol, "Kisim Mikaia na bringim bek i go long Amon gavman bilong taun na long Joash sot bilong king,"

original: and tell them that this is what the king says: ‘Put this man in prison and feed him only bread and water until I return safely.’”
translation: Tokim ol, king i tok olsem: 'Putim man i go insait kalabus, na givim man i kaikai bret na wara tasol, na stap til sei mi kam bek gen.'

original: But Micaiah replied, “If you ever return safely, the LORD has not spoken through me.” Then he added, “Take heed, all you people!”
translation: Mikaia i tokim bek, “Igo yu kam bek gen strong, Bikpela i no tok olsem long me.” Na em i tok plunta, “Yu mas save gut, ol pipol, olgeta!”

original: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
translation: King bilong Isrel na Jehosapat king bilong Joda i go apa long Ramot-Giladi.

original: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you wear your royal robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself and went into battle.
translation: King bilong Isrel i tokim Jehosafat, “Mi bai kisim skaipela skin na go long bikpela fait, na yu putim royal rop bilong yu.” Na king bilong Isrel i kisim skaipela skin na i go long bikpela fait.

original: Now the king of Aram had ordered his chariot commanders, “Do not fight with anyone, small or great, except the king of Israel.”
translation: King bilong Aram i givim oda long bos bilong kar bilong pait, olsem: "Yu no fight wantaim eni man, liklik na bikpela, nogat, bikos long king bilong Israel tasol."

original: When the chariot commanders saw Jehoshaphat, they said, “This is the king of Israel!” So they turned to fight against him, but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the LORD helped him. God drew them away from him.
translation: Taim komanda bilong kar i si Jehosafat, ol i tok, 'Dispela em i king bilong Israel!' Ol i turnim bek long fight lostu long en, tasol Jehosafat i kirap strong na tok, na LORD i hepim en. God i birua ol long en.

original: And when the chariot commanders saw that he was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.
translation: Taim komanda bilong kareta i lukim em i no king bilong Israel, ol i go bek gen long bihainim em.

original: However, a certain man drew his bow without taking special aim, and he struck the king of Israel between the joints of his armor. So the king said to his charioteer, “Turn around and take me out of the battle, for I am badly wounded!”
translation: Bai wanpela man em i kilim banis bilong en bai em no ken tokim speshal, na em i paitim king bilong Israel long hap bilong armas bilong en. King i tokim draiva bilong kareta bilong en, "Tarn arond na kam bek long karim mi aut long bikpela fait, dispela wounded i kilim mi planti!"

original: The battle raged throughout that day, and the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot facing the Arameans until evening. And at sunset he died.
translation: Pait i go strong olsem long de, na King bilong Isrel i usim han bilong en kisim ap em yet long kar bilong en, i lukim Aramen long sandaun, tasol em i stap yet, na em i dai wen san i go daon.

original: When Jehoshaphat king of Judah had returned safely to his home in Jerusalem,
translation: Wanpela taim Jehosafati king bilong Yuda i kam bek long we saf, i go bek long hus bilong en Jerusalem,

original: Jehu son of Hanani the seer went out to confront him and said to King Jehoshaphat, “Should you help the wicked and love those who hate the LORD? Because of this, the wrath of the LORD is upon you.
translation: Jehu susa bilong Hanani man we i save lukim tinging bai i kam, em i go bekim King Jehoshaphat, “Yu mas hilapim ol popoia na yu lakim ol i stap long wei bilong satan? Yu lukim ol i no laik LORD, tasol yu yet kam long ol, bihainim weri bilong LORD i kam long yu.

original: However, some good is found in you, for you have removed the Asherah poles from the land and have set your heart on seeking God.”
translation: Nogat, gutpela samting i stap insait long yu, wantaim yu kisim Asherah pols na rausim ol i go long graun, na yu putim harim bilong yu long sokim God.

original: Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem, and once again he went out among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim and turned them back to the LORD, the God of their fathers.
translation: Jehosafat i stap long Jerusalem, na em i go aut gen long ol pipol from Beersheba long kantri bilong Efraim na i bringim baksaida ol long LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol.

original: He appointed judges in the land, in each of the fortified cities of Judah.
translation: Em i apoinim jujes long graun, long bikpela towns ikon bilong Yuda.

original: Then he said to the judges, “Consider carefully what you do, for you are not judging for man, but for the LORD, who is with you when you render judgment.
translation: Em i tokim jaj olsem, "Tingim gut long ting bai yu mekim, bikos yu no makin desisan long ol man, tasol yu makin desisan long LORD, em i stap wantaim yu long taim yu givim desisan."

original: And now, may the fear of the LORD be upon you. Be careful what you do, for with the LORD our God there is no injustice or partiality or bribery.”
translation: Nau, mipela i mas save long tok bilong Jehovah. Yu mas bekim ol samting yu mekim, wantaim tok bilong Jehovah, em i gat jusis, nogat i gat hevi, nogat i gat sindaun i go long wanwan, nogat i gat moni bilong bikim ol desisen.

original: Moreover, Jehoshaphat appointed in Jerusalem some of the Levites, priests, and heads of the Israelite families to judge on behalf of the LORD and to settle disputes. And they lived in Jerusalem.
translation: Na Jehosafat i apointrm long Jerusalem samting Levaitis, pries, na bikpela hed bilong famili Israel ol i kam jus bilong GOD, ol i stap stretim hevi long namel bilong GOD. Na ol i stap long Jerusalem.

original: He commanded them, saying, “You must serve faithfully and wholeheartedly in the fear of the LORD.
translation: Em i givim ol tok, olsem: "Yu mas wok moa yet long heart na long trutru long respek na fea bilong Jehovah."

original: For every dispute that comes before you from your brothers who dwell in their cities—whether it regards bloodshed or some other violation of law, commandments, statutes, or ordinances—you are to warn them, so that they will not incur guilt before the LORD and wrath will not come upon you and your brothers. Do this, and you will not incur guilt.
translation: Long olgeta kaos em i kam bifo yu from ol braza yufela i stap long ples bilong ol - sapos em i go long shedim blood o samting narakain i go agensim komanda, lo bilong taim bifo, lo bilong gavman - yu mas toktok strongim ol, so ol no ken kisim gilt bifo LORD, na werah no ken kam bekim yu na ol braza yufela. Yu mekim dispela, na yu no ken kisim gilt.

original: Note that Amariah, the chief priest, will be over you in all that pertains to the LORD, and Zebadiah son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, in all that pertains to the king. And the Levites will serve as officers before you. Act resolutely; may the LORD be with the upright!”
translation: Amariah, bikpela pries, em i go long yu yet long ol samting we bilong LORD, na Zebadia, pikinini bilong Ishmael, bikpela bos bilong haus Judah, em i stap long yu long ol samting we bilong king. Na Levitim ol i wok olsem ofisa bifor yu. Wok strong long hap; LORD i stap wantaim ol man i stret!

original: After this, the Moabites and Ammonites, together with some of the Meunites, came to make war against Jehoshaphat.
translation: Narapela taim, Ol Moab na Ol Amon, wantsail long ol Ol Meuni, i kam na wari long Jehosafati.

original: Then some men came and told Jehoshaphat, “A vast army is coming against you from Edom, from beyond the Sea; they are already in Hazazon-tamar” (that is, En-gedi).
translation: Ol man i kam na toktok long Jehoshaphat, “Wanpela armi bikpela i kam bekain long yu, i kam long Edom, long bihainim Solwara; ol i stap gen long Hazazon-tamar” (em i tok olsem En-gedi).

original: Jehoshaphat was alarmed and set his face to seek the LORD. And he proclaimed a fast throughout Judah.
translation: Jehosafat em i stap in afraim na em putim faes bilong en long sokim LORD. Na em kamapim taim bilong hapkas long Judah.

original: So the people of Judah gathered to seek the LORD, and indeed, they came from all the cities of Judah to seek Him.
translation: Na ol pipol bilong Yuda i kam tugeta long sikiim LORD, na trotru, ol i kam long ol ples bilong Yuda i go bek long sikiim Em.

original: Then Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem in the house of the LORD in front of the new courtyard
translation: Na Jehosafati i stap long assembli bilong Juda na Jerusalem long haus bilong LORD, bifor nupela kot.

original: and said, “O LORD, God of our fathers, are You not the God who is in heaven, and do You not rule over all the kingdoms of the nations? Power and might are in Your hand, and no one can stand against You.
translation: Na em i tok, “O PAPA bilong yumi, LORD God, yu no stap iGod long heven? Yu no gat autoriti long ol kingdom bilong narapela kantri? Powea na strong i stap long han bilong yu, na nogat man i ken stap agensim yu.

original: Our God, did You not drive out the inhabitants of this land before Your people Israel and give it forever to the descendants of Abraham Your friend?
translation: Bikpela God bilong mipela, bai yu no rahim ol man i stap long ples dispela, na givim i go long taim olgeta long ol desenden bilong Abraham, nanamel bilong yu?

original: They have lived in the land and have built in it a sanctuary for Your Name, saying,
translation: Ol i stap long kantri na ol i bin mekim hap sanctuary long em, long nem bilong Yu, ol i tok

original: ‘If disaster comes upon us—whether sword or judgment, plague or famine—we will stand before this temple and before You, for Your Name is in this temple. We will cry out to You in our distress, and You will hear us and save us.’
translation: Sapos swod, jos, sik, o hangre i kam long mipela, mipela bai stap bifor hap haus lotu ya na bifor yu, wantaim Nem bilong yu i stap insait long em. Mipela bai singaut long yu long taim mipela i bagarap, na yu bai harim mipela na yu bai savem mipela.

original: And now, here are the men of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, whom You did not let Israel invade when they came out of the land of Egypt; but Israel turned away from them and did not destroy them.
translation: Na nau, ol man bilong Amon, Moab, na Maunten Seir, yumas no i givim pes bilong Isrel long ol taim ol i kamap long kantri bilong Ijip; be ol Isrel i go bek gen long ol, na nem i no kilim ol.

original: See how they are repaying us by coming to drive us out of the possession that You gave us as an inheritance.
translation: Lukim ol i kam bekim mipela, ol i kam draivim mipela aut long pasin bilong yu husat yu givim mipela long en heritage.

original: Our God, will You not judge them? For we are powerless before this vast army that comes against us. We do not know what to do, but our eyes are upon You.”
translation: Bikpela God bilong yumi, bai yu no kam jusim ol? Yumi no inap long harim dispela bikpela armi i kam againstim yumi. Yumi no save long wanem nau, tasol yumi lukim i go long yu.

original: Meanwhile all the men of Judah, with their wives and children and little ones, were standing before the LORD.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Yuda, wantaim meri na pikinini na ol liklik, ol i stap bifor LORD.

original: Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jahaziel son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite from Asaph’s descendants, as he stood in the midst of the assembly.
translation: Na Spirit bilong LORD i kam pon Jahaziel sambai bilong Zechariah, sambai bilong Benaiah, sambai bilong Jeiel, sambai bilong Mattaniah, wanpela Levite husat i kam long lain bilong Asaph, olsem em i stap long mitim blo assembli.

original: And he said, “Listen, all you people of Judah and Jerusalem! Listen, King Jehoshaphat! This is what the LORD says: ‘Do not be afraid or discouraged because of this vast army, for the battle does not belong to you, but to God.
translation: Em i tok, "Harim, olgeta pipol bilong Juda na Jerusalem! Harim, King Jehosafat! Dispela em i tok bilong LORD: 'No ken bekim na no ken bikhet long haret olsem dispela larim meri, long bikos em i no bilong yumi, Dispela em i bilong God.'"

original: Tomorrow you are to march down against them. You will see them coming up the Ascent of Ziz, and you will find them at the end of the valley facing the Wilderness of Jeruel.
translation: Tumora yumi mas marchim i go doun gen long ol. Yumi bai siim ol i kamap long Rod bilong Ziz, na yumi bai finim ol long lasis bilong vale, we i punda gen long Bus bilong Jeruel.

original: You need not fight this battle. Take up your positions, stand firm, and see the salvation of the LORD on your behalf, O Judah and Jerusalem. Do not be afraid or discouraged. Go out and face them tomorrow, for the LORD is with you.’”
translation: Yu no nidim faitim bikpela faet long dispela dei. Kam bek long ples bilong yu, stap strong, na lukim saveman bilong GOD long sait bilong yumi, Juda na Jerusalem. No ken afraid o isip long haptim. Go aut na katim ofa long tudei, bikos GOD i stap wantaim yumi.

original: Then Jehoshaphat bowed facedown, and all the people of Judah and Jerusalem fell down before the LORD to worship Him.
translation: Na Jehoshaphat i go daun klostu long graun, na ol pipel bilong Yuda na Jerusalem ol i kilim dai bifor LORD, na ol i kam worshipim Em.

original: And the Levites from the Kohathites and Korahites stood up to praise the LORD, the God of Israel, shouting in a very loud voice.
translation: Na Levaitis husat i kam long Kohatis na Koraitis ol i stanap long givim prais long LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, ol i singaut i go longpela voice.

original: Early in the morning they got up and left for the Wilderness of Tekoa. As they set out, Jehoshaphat stood up and said, “Hear me, O people of Judah and Jerusalem. Believe in the LORD your God, and you will be upheld; believe in His prophets, and you will succeed.”
translation: Long moning bai ol i go na lusim, na tupla i go long Bus bilong Tekoa. Olsem taim ol i wokabaut, Jehosapat i sanap na tokim ol: "Harim mi, o piple bilong Juda na Jerusalem. Bilivim long LORD God bilong yu, na yu ken stap strong; bilivim long propheta bilong em, na yu ken win."

original: Then Jehoshaphat consulted with the people and appointed those who would sing to the LORD and praise the splendor of His holiness. As they went out before the army, they were singing: “Give thanks to the LORD, for His loving devotion endures forever.”
translation: Jehoshaphat i tok tok wantaim ol pipol na em i apointim man ol i sing long LORD, ol i givim prais long bikpela holiness bilong em. Ol i go bifo long army, ol i sing: “Givim sankyu long LORD, from bikpela lovingsik bilong en i stap oltaim.”

original: The moment they began their shouts and praises, the LORD set ambushes against the men of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir who had come against Judah, and they were defeated.
translation: Taim ol i stat long wail na prais, LORD i planim ambus long ol man meri Amon, Moab, na Maunt Seir ol i kam bek gen Judah, na ol i kisim difet.

original: The Ammonites and Moabites rose up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir, devoting them to destruction. And when they had made an end to the inhabitants of Seir, they helped to destroy one another.
translation: Ol Ammonait na Ol Moabait i kamap strong na go bek gen long Ol man meri long Maunten Seir, na ol i stap long wei bilong bagarapim ol. Na bihaenim ol i tanim pinis long ol man meri long Seir, ol i helpim ol yet long bagarapim ol yet.

original: When the men of Judah came to a place overlooking the wilderness, they looked for the vast army, but there were only corpses lying on the ground; no one had escaped.
translation: Taim ol man bilong Yuda i kam long wanpela ples we i kamap long topples bilong bus, ol i wailokim long bikpela armi, tasol ol i lukim ol bodi i dai i lapun long graun; no wan i stap, ol i ranawe.

original: Then Jehoshaphat and his people went to carry off the plunder, and they found on the bodies an abundance of goods and valuables—more than they could carry away. They were gathering the plunder for three days because there was so much.
translation: Na Jehosafat na ol pikinini bilong en i go pinis long kisim ka, bai bringim bek i go, na ol i lukim ol samting em i stap long bodi bilong ol, planti gupla samting na samting bilong vailu - ol i wok long kisim, long paim ol ka, tasol i no inap long karim na kisim i go, bikos plati olsem inap long karim na kisim i go. Ol i wokim dispela wok long kisim samting bilong winim war long tri dei, bikos ol i save planti.

original: On the fourth day they assembled in the Valley of Beracah, where they blessed the LORD. Therefore that place is called the Valley of Beracah to this day.
translation: Long dei fo, ol i kam tanim long Vali bilong Berakha, na ol i givim bikpela tankyu long LORD. Na bekim olsem, wail place ya i kolim Vali bilong Berakha na tode.

original: Then all the men of Judah and Jerusalem, with Jehoshaphat at their head, returned joyfully to Jerusalem, for the LORD had made them rejoice over their enemies.
translation: Ol man meri bilong Yuda na Berehem, wantaim Jehosafati long hed bilong ol, i kam bek long Berehem wantaim bel isi, bikos LORD i mekim ol i amamas long ol enemy bilong ol.

original: So they entered Jerusalem and went into the house of the LORD with harps, lyres, and trumpets.
translation: Ol i go insait long Jerusalem na i go insait long haus bilong Jehovah wantaim hap, lyre, na trambet.

original: And the fear of God came upon all the kingdoms of the lands when they heard that the LORD had fought against the enemies of Israel.
translation: Na ogatta bilong God i kamapim ol ples bilong king na kantri olgeta, wanpela taim ol i harim olsem Bikpela, Em i gat autoriti, i go bekim ol birua bilong Israel.

original: Then Jehoshaphat’s kingdom was at peace, for his God had given him rest on every side.
translation: Pilisi bilong Yehosafati i stap gut na is, bikos Bikpela God bilong em i givim em res long ol sait.

original: So Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-five years. His mother’s name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.
translation: Jehoshaphat i bin king bilong Yuda. Em i 35 yia wen em i kamap king, na em i bin regim long Jerusalem 25 yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em i Azubah, daughter bilong Shilhi.

original: And Jehoshaphat walked in the way of his father Asa and did not turn away from it; he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD.
translation: Na Jehosafati i go long wei bilong papa em Asa, na em i no bihainim bek; em i mekim olgeta samting gut long ai bilong LORD.

original: The high places, however, were not removed; the people had not yet set their hearts on the God of their fathers.
translation: Ol ples high, ol ples we ol pipol i go wosipim divel, i no go daun yet; ol pipol i no bin putim hart bilong ol long God bilong ol tumbuna, bilong faeda bilong ol yet.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, from beginning to end, they are indeed written in the Chronicles of Jehu son of Hanani, which are recorded in the Book of the Kings of Israel.
translation: Long ol stap bilong akt bilong Jehosafati, from bikpela taim bipo na rait na kaikai i go long las, ol dispela i raisim, ol dispela i bin raitim long Stori bilong Jehu, Pikinini bilong Hanani, we ili bin skruim long Buk bilong King bilong Israel.

original: Later, Jehoshaphat king of Judah made an alliance with Ahaziah king of Israel, who acted wickedly.
translation: Bihain, Jehoshaphat king bilong Juda i mekim wok birua wantaim Ahaziah king bilong Isrel, emi wok olsem nogut.

original: They agreed to make ships to go to Tarshish, and these were built in Ezion-geber.
translation: Ol i orait long mekim ship long go long ples Tarshish, na ol i bin mekim dispela ship long ples Ezion-geber.

original: Then Eliezer son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, “Because you have allied yourself with Ahaziah, the LORD has destroyed your works.” So the ships were wrecked and were unable to sail to Tarshish.
translation: Na Eliezer sone bilong Dodavahu long Mareshah i tokaut long Jehoshaphat, olsem, “Yu go wankain wantaim Ahaziah, LORD i bagarapim wok bilong yu.” Na sip bilong ol i bagarap, ol i no inap sail i go long Tarshish.

original: And Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David. And his son Jehoram reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jehosafati i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i bin plantim em long Taun bilong Davit. Na Jehorami, pikinini bilong en, i bin bos long ples bilong en.

original: Jehoram’s brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat, were Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, and Shephatiah; these were all sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
translation: Bratas bilong Jehoram, ol pikinini bilong Jehoshaphat, em i Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, na Shephatiah; ol dispela i ol pikinini bilong Jehoshaphat king bilong Israel.

original: Their father had given them many gifts of silver and gold and precious things, as well as the fortified cities in Judah; but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn.
translation: Papa bilong ol i givim olgif long ol long taim, silva na gol na samting bilong value, na taun bung bilong strongim long Yuda. Tasol em i givim kingdom long Jehoram, bikos em i bikpela born, na pasin bilong bikpela born i min pasin bilong ineritim ples king.

original: When Jehoram had established himself over his father’s kingdom, he strengthened himself by putting to the sword all his brothers along with some of the princes of Israel.
translation: Wanpela taim Jehoram em i kamap bikpela long ples bilong papa, em i strongim yet olsem na kilim olgeta bratas wantaim sward, na kilim tu sampela ol bikpela man bilong Israel.

original: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years.
translation: Jehoram em thirty-two yia na i kamap king, na em i rulim Jerusalem long eight yia.

original: And Jehoram walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had done. For he married a daughter of Ahab and did evil in the sight of the LORD.
translation: Na Jehoram i go long wei bilong kings bilong Israel, olsem haus bilong Ahab i mekim. Bekas em i marry meri bilong Ahab na ol i mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong LORD.

original: Yet the LORD was unwilling to destroy the house of David, because of the covenant He had made with David, and since He had promised to maintain a lamp for David and his descendants forever.
translation: Bikpela i no laik bagarapim haus bilong David, bikos em i bin mekim kaunsal wantaim David, na em i promis long givim lait i stap long David na ol desenden bilong en forever.

original: In the days of Jehoram, Edom rebelled against the hand of Judah and appointed their own king.
translation: Long taim bilong Jehoram, Edom i go bek long han bilong Yuda na ol i chusim chief bilong ol yet.

original: So Jehoram crossed into Edom with his officers and all his chariots. When the Edomites surrounded him and his chariot commanders, he rose up and attacked by night.
translation: Jehoram i go kas long Edom wantaim ofisa bilong en na ol kareta bilong en. Pipol bilong Edom kam raitim em na bos bilong kareta, em kirap na em go fabait long nait.

original: So to this day Edom has been in rebellion against the hand of Judah. Likewise, Libnah rebelled against his rule at the same time, because Jehoram had forsaken the LORD, the God of his fathers.
translation: Na todei Edom i go bek long pait agensim han bilong Juda. Olsem tu, Libnah i rebel long en, long taim klostu, bikos Jehoram i lusim LORD, Bikpela God bilong papa bilong em.

original: Jehoram had also built high places on the hills of Judah; he had caused the people of Jerusalem to prostitute themselves and had led Judah astray.
translation: Jehoram i bikim ples bilong spirit i go het long maunten bilong Judah; em i mekim pikinini bilong Adam long Jerusalem i bagarap na i sindaun, na em i lusim Judah long rot bilong bagarap.

original: Then a letter came to Jehoram from Elijah the prophet, which stated: “This is what the LORD, the God of your father David, says: ‘You have not walked in the ways of your father Jehoshaphat or of Asa king of Judah,
translation: Na leta i kam long Jehoram from Elija man prophet, em i tok olsem: “Papa bilong olgeta, Bikpela bilong papa yu David i tok olsem: ‘Yu no wok long rot bilong papa yu Jehoshaphat o Asa king bilong Judah,’

original: but you have walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and have caused Judah and the people of Jerusalem to prostitute themselves, just as the house of Ahab prostituted itself. You have also killed your brothers, your father’s family, who were better than you.
translation: Bikos yu i go long wei bilong kings bilong Israel na yu i mekim Judah na ol pipol bilong Jerusalem i sindak, olsem haus bilong Ahab i mekim. Yu i kilim brata bilong yu, ol i gutpela moa long yu, ol bilong famili bilong papa bilong yu.

original: So behold, the LORD is about to strike your people, your sons, your wives, and all your possessions with a serious blow.
translation: Lukim, Papa God i go hamar gen wantaim bikpela pek, na bai i kilim pisin bilong yu, ol man bilong yu, meri bilong yu, na olgeta propati bilong yu.

original: And day after day you yourself will suffer from a severe illness, a disease of your bowels, until it causes your bowels to come out.’”
translation: Na yu yet, dei bihain dei, yu mas sik bilong bel i bagarap strong, sik bilong bel na em i go inap long kam ap.

original: Then the LORD stirred against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines and Arabs who lived near the Cushites.
translation: Papa God i kirapim spirit bilong Filistia na Arab ol i stap klostu long Kushit, na ol i go bek gen long Jehoram.

original: So they went to war against Judah, invaded it, and carried off all the possessions found in the king’s palace, along with his sons and wives; not a son was left to him except Jehoahaz, his youngest.
translation: Ol i go long war gen long Judah, ol i kam na bagarapim em, na ol i kisim na karim olgeta samting bilong em long haus bilong king, longol ol pikinini bilong en na meri bilong en; ol i leevim bek long em Jehohaz, em i pikinini namba wan bilong en.

original: After all this, the LORD afflicted Jehoram with an incurable disease of the bowels.
translation: Olgeta samting i go pinis, LORD i bin givim Jehoram sik long sindaun bilong hem, ol i no inap kurim.

original: This continued day after day until two full years had passed. Finally, his intestines came out because of his disease, and he died in severe pain. And his people did not make a fire in his honor as they had done for his fathers.
translation: Olsem, dispela i go pinis de dai bihain dai, tu pela yia i pinis pinis. Na gut bilong en i kam aut long sik, na em i dai long poret strong. Na ol pipol bilong en i no mekim wok bilong tumbuna long en, olsem ol i mekim long ol gupela tumbuna bilong en, ol i no kisim faia long en.

original: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years. He died, to no one’s regret, and was buried in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
translation: Jehoram i kamap king na em i gat 32 yia, na em i rulim long Jerusalem eight yia. Em i dai pinis, long moning bilong nobody, na ol i bin planti em long Siti bilong David, tasol em i no go insait long hol bilong ol king.

original: Then the people of Jerusalem made Ahaziah, the youngest son of Jehoram, king in his place, since the raiders who had come into the camp with the Arabs had killed all the older sons. So Ahaziah son of Jehoram became king of Judah.
translation: Na ol pipol bilong Yerusalem i makim Ahazaya, pikinini bilong Yehoram, i kamap king long hap bilong en, wantaim ol rop bilong Arab i kam insait long ken bilong solja na kilim ol brata bilong en ol i gat bikpela. Na Ahazaya pikinini bilong Yehoram i kamap king bilong Yuda.

original: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem one year. His mother’s name was Athaliah, the granddaughter of Omri.
translation: Ahaziah em i 22 yia na em i kamap king, na em i rulim Jerusalemu long wanpela yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em em i Athaliah, grandaughter bilong Omri.

original: Ahaziah also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother was his counselor in wickedness.
translation: Ahaziah i go long wei bilong haus bilong Ahab, wantaim mama bilong em em i bikpela adviser bilong em long ol samting nogut.

original: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, as the house of Ahab had done, for to his destruction they were his counselors after the death of his father.
translation: Na em i mekim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong LORD, olsem hus bilong Ahab i mekim bifo, bikos ol man bilong toktok i stap na i givim em toktok yet long narapela rot, bihaenim dead bilong papa bilong em.

original: Ahaziah also followed their counsel and went with Joram son of Ahab king of Israel to fight against Hazael king of Aram at Ramoth-gilead. But the Arameans wounded Joram;
translation: Ahaziah i bihainim tok bilong ol, na em i go wantaim Joram, Pikinini bilong Ahab, king bilong Israel, long harim Hazael, king bilong Aram, long pait bilong Ramoth-gilead. Tasol Aramean i wundim Joram;

original: so he returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds they had inflicted on him at Ramah when he fought against Hazael king of Aram. Then Ahaziah son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to Jezreel to visit Joram son of Ahab, because Joram had been wounded.
translation: Na em i go bek long Jezreel i kamap gen from ol wund ol i bin givim em long Ramah wail em i fait wantaim Hazael king bilong Aram. Na Ahaziah pikinini bilong Jehoram king bilong Judah i go daun long Jezreel i visit Joram pikinini bilong Ahab, bilong dispela Joram em i bin wund.

original: Ahaziah’s downfall came from God when he went to visit Joram. When Ahaziah arrived, he went out with Joram to meet Jehu son of Nimshi, whom the LORD had anointed to destroy the house of Ahab.
translation: Bilak bilong Ahaziah i kam bek long han bilong God long em i go harim Joram. Na em i go aut wantaim Joram long harim Jehu, pikinini bilong Nimshi, we LORD i bin givim oli long em olsem man bilong distroyim hus bilong Ahab.

original: So while Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, he found the rulers of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah’s brothers who were serving Ahaziah, and he killed them.
translation: Wail Jehu i wokim pinis bos' long haus bilong Ahab, na em i findim ol biceman bilong Juda na ol pikinini bilong brata bilong Ahazia ol i wokim servis long Ahazia, na em i kilim ol.

original: Then Jehu looked for Ahaziah, and Jehu’s soldiers captured him while he was hiding in Samaria. So Ahaziah was brought to Jehu and put to death. They buried him, for they said, “He is the grandson of Jehoshaphat, who sought the LORD with all his heart.” So no one was left from the house of Ahaziah with the strength to rule the kingdom.
translation: Na Jehu wail lukim Ahaziah, na solja bilong Jehu kisim i hap em long Samaria. Na Ahaziah i kam bek long Jehu na ol i kilim em. Ol i birim em, ol tok: "Em i granston bilong Jehoshaphat, we ili go bek long Bikpela wantaim olgeta harte." Na nogat wanpela i stap long haus bilong Ahaziah wantaim strong bilong bosim ples.

original: When Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she proceeded to annihilate all the royal heirs of the house of Judah.
translation: Taim Athaliah mama bilong Ahaziah harim ol i dai pinis, em go bek long kilim ol pikinini bilong klan royal bilong haus bilong Judah.

original: But Jehoshabeath daughter of King Jehoram took Joash son of Ahaziah and stole him away from among the sons of the king who were being murdered, and she put him and his nurse in a bedroom. Because Jehoshabeath, the daughter of King Jehoram and the wife of Jehoiada the priest, was Ahaziah’s sister, she hid Joash from Athaliah so that she could not kill him.
translation: Jehoshabeath, pikinini meri bilong King Jehoram, i kisim Joash, pikinini bilong Ahaziah, na ibin harim long wei from ol pikinini bilong king ol i paitim dai. Na em i putim em na nusis bilong en insait long rum bilong slip. Bikos Jehoshabeath, meri bilong King Jehoram na wife bilong Pries Jehoiada, em i susa bilong Ahaziah, ol i kaivim Joash long Athaliah bai em i no kilim em.

original: And Joash remained hidden with them in the house of God for six years while Athaliah ruled the land.
translation: Na Joash i stap klostu wantaim ol long haus bilong God for sikis yia, wail Athaliah i bosim kantri.

original: Then in the seventh year, Jehoiada strengthened himself and made a covenant with the commanders of hundreds—with Azariah son of Jeroham, Ishmael son of Jehohanan, Azariah son of Obed, Maaseiah son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat son of Zichri.
translation: Long long seventh yia, Jehoiada em i strongim yet na em mekim pinis kovenant wantaim kapten bilong hundret - Azariah son bilong Jeroham, Ishmael son bilong Jehohanan, Azariah son bilong Obed, Maaseiah son bilong Adaiah, na Elishaphat son bilong Zichri.

original: So they went throughout Judah and gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah and the heads of the families of Israel. And when they came to Jerusalem,
translation: Ol i go olsem long Judah, ol i kam bikim Levait na hed bilong papa na mama bilong Israel long ol geta taun bilong Judah. Na taim ol i kam long Jerusalem,

original: the whole assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. “Behold, the king’s son!” said Jehoiada. “He must reign, just as the LORD promised concerning the descendants of David.
translation: Ol i wokim pinis kot long haus bilong God. Sios, pikinini bilong king! i tok Jehoiada. Em i mas wokim gavman, olsem LORD i promis long ol desenden bilong Dauid.

original: This is what you are to do: A third of you priests and Levites who come on duty on the Sabbath shall keep watch at the doors,
translation: Wusai yupela mas mekim: Tripela wan tanobada long yupela pries na Levait husat i kam na go i go pas long wok long Sabbat De, stap strong long gatem na lukautim.

original: a third shall be at the royal palace, and a third at the Foundation Gate, while all the others are in the courtyards of the house of the LORD.
translation: Wanpela tausen i go long haus bilong king, wanpela tausen i go long gate bilong fondesen, na ol narapela i stap long ka long haus bilong LORD.

original: No one is to enter the house of the LORD except the priests and those Levites who serve; they may enter because they are consecrated, but all the people are to obey the requirement of the LORD.
translation: Nogat man i go insait long haus bilong Jehovah, tasol priest na ol Levaita i servim, olsem na bai ol i go insait bikos ol i stap klosim; ol pipol yumi mas lusim tok bilong Jehovah.

original: The Levites must surround the king with weapons in hand, and anyone who enters the temple must be put to death. You must stay close to the king wherever he goes.”
translation: Ol Levitikai mas kamap raun i go long king wantaim wip long han, na husat i go insait long haus lotu i ken kilim ol. Yupela mas stap klose long king wehren i go.

original: So the Levites and all Judah did everything that Jehoiada the priest had ordered. Each of them took his men—those coming on duty on the Sabbath and those going off duty—for Jehoiada the priest had not released any of the divisions.
translation: Na Levaitis na ol Juda i mekim olgeta samting we priast Jehoiada i tokim. Ol i kisim ol soldier bilong ol, ol i kam wok long Sabat De na ol i go pinis long duati, wantaim ol i kam wok gen, bikos priast Jehoiada i no lusim grup bilong ol yet.

original: Then Jehoiada the priest gave to the commanders of hundreds the spears and the large and small shields of King David that were in the house of God.
translation: Na Jehoiada priest i givim long ol kapten bilong hundred spia na sikis bilong bik na liklik bilong King Daivid, ol i stap long haus bilong God.

original: He stationed all the troops, with their weapons in hand, surrounding the king by the altar and the temple, from the south side to the north side of the temple.
translation: Em i stapim ol solder long ples, wantaim ol gun bilong ol i kamap, na ol i karamapim king long altar na tempele, stat long sait bilong sausage go long sait bilong nort bilong tempele.

original: Then Jehoiada and his sons brought out the king’s son, put the crown on him, presented him with the Testimony, and proclaimed him king. They anointed him and shouted, “Long live the king!”
translation: Na Jehoiada na ol pikinini bilong em i kamautim pikinini bilong king, ol i putim krown long hed bilong em, ol i givim em Testimeni, na ol i autim em olsem king. Ol i givim em ole bilong anoint, na ol i singaut, "King i stap long taim!"

original: When Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and cheering the king, she went out to them in the house of the LORD.
translation: Wanpela taim Atalia harim noise bilong ol pipol i ran i go na ol i singsing long king, em i go aut long ol long haus bilong LORD.

original: And she looked out and saw the king standing by his pillar at the entrance. The officers and trumpeters were beside the king, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets, while the singers with musical instruments were leading the praises. Then Athaliah tore her clothes and screamed, “Treason, treason!”
translation: Na em i lukim ol i stap na si king i staning beside pilia bilong en long entris. Ofisa na trumpeta i stap klostu long king, na ol pipol bilong kantri i amamas na bulimapim trumpets, wail ol singsing manmeri wantaim musical instrumens i lidim singsing. Den Atalia i rupim klos blong en na skirimiap, “Betrayal, betrayal!”

original: And Jehoiada the priest sent out the commanders of hundreds in charge of the army, saying, “Bring her out between the ranks, and put to the sword anyone who follows her.” For the priest had said, “She must not be put to death in the house of the LORD.”
translation: Na Jehoiada priest i kirapim komandan bilong hundred i stap bos long ples bilong armi, i tok, "Kisim na kamlautim em long namel bilong solja, na iu kilim ol man meri husat i go behain long em." Namba wan, priist i tok olsem, "Em no ken dai insait long haus bilong LORD."

original: So they seized Athaliah as she reached the entrance of the Horse Gate to the palace grounds, and there they put her to death.
translation: Ol i kisim Athaliah olsem em i kam apost long Gat long Hos insait long graun bilong haus king, na ol i kilim em.

original: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself and the king and the people that they would be the LORD’s people.
translation: Na Jehoiada i mekim pakt long en na king na pipol, ol bai stap ol pipol bilong LORD.

original: So all the people went to the temple of Baal and tore it down. They smashed the altars and idols to pieces and killed Mattan the priest of Baal in front of the altars.
translation: Ol pipol i go long hap bilong Baal, na ol i bagarapim em. Ol i krakim altars na idols bilong Baal i go olgeta, na ol i kilim Mattan pris bilong Baal long sait bilong altars.

original: Moreover, Jehoiada put the oversight of the house of the LORD into the hands of the Levitical priests, whom David had appointed over the house of the LORD, to offer burnt offerings to the LORD as is written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and song, as ordained by David.
translation: Na Jehoiada i putim kos bilong haus bilong LORD long han bilong prist bilong Levi, olsem David i bin appointim long taim bifo, ol i mas ofarim ofa bilong bun i go long LORD, olsem i writen long Lo bilong Musa, wantaim rejoicing na sang, olsem David i laikim.

original: He stationed gatekeepers at the gates of the house of the LORD, so that nothing unclean could enter for any reason.
translation: Em i putim gardman long gate bilong haus bilong LORD, so nogut samting i no inap go insait long ol geta reson.

original: He also took with him the commanders of hundreds, the nobles, the rulers of the people, and all the people of the land, and they brought the king down from the house of the LORD and entered the royal palace through the Upper Gate. They seated King Joash on the royal throne,
translation: Na em i kisim ol komanda bilong hundred, nobil, bos bilong ol pipol, na ol pipol bilong kantri, na ibin bringim king i kam doun from haus bilong Lod, na em i go insait long haus bilong king olsem na inap em i go pasim Gate bilong hap, na ol i pilim King Joash long sit bilong king.

original: and all the people of the land rejoiced. And the city was quiet, because Athaliah had been put to the sword.
translation: Na ol pipol bilong kantri i amamas. Siti i quiet na stil, bikos Athaliah i bin go daun long sop.

original: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother’s name was Zibiah; she was from Beersheba.
translation: Joash em i seven yia olsem, na em i kamap king, na em i rulim long Jerusalem fourti yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Zibiah; mama bilong em em i stap long Beersheba.

original: And Joash did what was right in the eyes of the LORD all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
translation: Na Joash wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD ol dei bilong Jehoiada pries.

original: Jehoiada took for him two wives, and he had sons and daughters.
translation: Jehoiada i kisim tu meri bilong en, na i gat ol pikinini man na meri.

original: Some time later, Joash set his heart on repairing the house of the LORD.
translation: Olsem taim igo pinis, Joash i putim haret bilong en long wokim hous bilong LORD i gutpela gen.

original: So he gathered the priests and Levites and said, “Go out to the cities of Judah and collect the money due annually from all Israel, to repair the house of your God. Do it quickly.” The Levites, however, did not make haste.
translation: Em i kam bek long ples na i kisim prist na levait, na em i tokim ol, “Go aut go long taun bilong Juta na kisim moni husat i save pe em i kam daun long yia olsem long ol Israel, long reparim haus bilong God bilong yu. Wokim ikik.” Tasol levait i no wokim hari.

original: So the king called Jehoiada the high priest and said, “Why have you not required the Levites to bring from Judah and Jerusalem the tax imposed by Moses the servant of the LORD and by the assembly of Israel for the Tent of the Testimony?”
translation: King i kolim Jehoiada hap priest bilong em na tokim, “Wai yu no askim Levites long kisim moni bilong tax we Moses wokman bilong LORD na mob bilong Israel laikim ol long bring long Haus Bilong Tok Autentik?”

original: For the sons of that wicked woman Athaliah had broken into the house of God and had even used the sacred objects of the house of the LORD for the Baals.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong mama i go het Atalia, ol i go braikim haus bilong Bikpela na usim samting bilong spirik bilong haus bilong God long Baals.

original: At the king’s command a chest was made and placed outside, at the gate of the house of the LORD.
translation: Long tok bilong king, ol i mekim wanpela boks, na ol i putim i go outside long gate bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: And a proclamation was issued in Judah and Jerusalem that they were to bring to the LORD the tax imposed by Moses the servant of God on Israel in the wilderness.
translation: Na tok save bilong gavman i kamap nau long Judah na Jerusalem ol i harim, ol mas bring i go long LORD moni bilong taks olsem Moses, wokman bilong God, i givim deslain long Israel long bus kantri.

original: All the officers and all the people rejoiced and brought their contributions, and they dropped them in the chest until it was full.
translation: Ol ofisa na ol pipol i hap, oli amamas, na oli kisim pinis kontribusen bilong ol, bringim i go, oli pilim pinis long bokis, na em i ful pinis.

original: Whenever the chest was brought by the Levites to the king’s overseers and they saw that there was a large amount of money, the royal scribe and the officer of the high priest would come and empty the chest and carry it back to its place. They did this daily and gathered the money in abundance.
translation: Wanpela taim bokis i kam long Levaitis, na ol i karim i go long ofisa bilong king, skarari bilong king, na ol i lukim moni i planti i stap, olsem longpela moni i stap, skarari bilong king na ofisa bilong padi i kam, ol i kisim moni, rausim bokis na karim i go bek long ples bilong en. Ol i mekim dispela kina wok daili na kisim moni i go longwe.

original: Then the king and Jehoiada would give the money to those who supervised the labor on the house of the LORD to hire stonecutters and carpenters to restore the house of the LORD, as well as workers in iron and bronze to repair the house of the LORD.
translation: King na Jehoiada bai givim moni long ol i kamapim wok long Haus bilong Jehovah, olsem stonkata na karpenta, na wokman long aian na bronz, for bringim bak agen Haus bilong Jehovah, na fixim Haus bilong Jehovah.

original: So the workmen labored, and in their hands the repair work progressed. They restored the house of God according to its specifications, and they reinforced it.
translation: Na wokman i wok hat, na long han bilong ol, wok bilong ripotim i go ap. Ol i bringim baksait haus bilong God i go bek gen long ruk long wokim, na ol i strongim gen.

original: When they were finished, they brought the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada to make with it the articles for the house of the LORD—utensils for the service and for the burnt offerings, dishes, and other objects of gold and silver. Throughout the days of Jehoiada, burnt offerings were presented regularly in the house of the LORD.
translation: Taim ol i pinis, ol i kisim moni i stap na kisim long king na Yehoiyada, ol i wokim long em samting bilong Haus bilong LORD, olsem pleni na kap bilong sabis, ofa bilong bun, kap, na samting naring bilong gol na silva. Long taim Yehoiyada i stap, ol i bringim ofa bilong bun em regulal long Haus bilong LORD.

original: When Jehoiada was old and full of years, he died at the age of 130.
translation: Jehoiada em i go dae na i kamap olsem man bilong taim bipo, na em i dai we em i gat 130 yia.

original: And Jehoiada was buried with the kings in the City of David, because he had done what was good in Israel for God and His temple.
translation: Na Jehoiada i go daun i stap wantaim ol king long Siti bilong David, bikos em mekim ol gutpela wok long Israel long God na temple bilong em.

original: After the death of Jehoiada, however, the officials of Judah came and paid homage to the king, and he listened to them.
translation: Olsem Jehoiada i dai pinis, ofisa bilong Yuda oli kam na tok aut long king, na em i harim toktok bilong ol.

original: They abandoned the house of the LORD, the God of their fathers, and served the Asherah poles and idols. So wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this guilt of theirs.
translation: Ol i lusim haus bilong LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, na ol i wok servisim pols Asherah na idol. Na popoia i kam long Judea na Jerusalem long gilt bilong ol.

original: Nevertheless, the LORD sent prophets to bring the people back to Him and to testify against them; but they would not listen.
translation: Bikpela i sendim prophets kisim ol pipol i kam bek gen long em, na tok strong long ol; tasol ol i no lisin.

original: Then the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah son of Jehoiada the priest, who stood up before the people and said to them, “This is what God says: ‘Why do you transgress the commandments of the LORD so that you cannot prosper? Because you have forsaken the LORD, He has forsaken you.’”
translation: Na Spirut bilong God i kam antap long Zekaria sun bilong Yehoiada prist, na em i stap na em i go bek gen long ples bilong ol pipol, na em i tokim ol: “Namba wan kos bilong God i tok olsem: ‘Wai yusupela i bagarapim kos bilong Lord, naso yusupela no inap strong? Yusupela i lusim Lord, na Lord i lusim yusupela.’”

original: But they conspired against Zechariah, and by order of the king, they stoned him in the courtyard of the house of the LORD.
translation: Tupela i mekim plan long kilim Zechariah, na long hap bilong king, tupela i roklim ston long en insait long ka long haus bilong LORD.

original: Thus King Joash failed to remember the kindness that Zechariah’s father Jehoiada had extended to him. Instead, Joash killed Jehoiada’s son. As he lay dying, Zechariah said, “May the LORD see this and call you to account.”
translation: King Joash i lusim gutpela kain pasin bilong Jehoiada, na em i kilim Pikinini Zechariah bilong em. Ol i kilim Zechariah, na em i stap dai pinis nau, na em tok, "Bikpela bai lukim dispela na bai kam bek long yu na tok stret."

original: In the spring, the army of Aram went to war against Joash. They entered Judah and Jerusalem and destroyed all the leaders of the people, and they sent all the plunder to their king in Damascus.
translation: Long taim bilong spring, armi bilong Aram i go fas long war gen Joash, na ol i go insait long Judah na Jerusalem, na ol i bagarapim ol bikpela manmeri bilong ples, na ol i sendim ol samting bilong war, ol luit, long king bilong ol long Damascus.

original: Although the Aramean army had come with only a few men, the LORD delivered into their hand a very great army. Because Judah had forsaken the LORD, the God of their fathers, judgment was executed on Joash.
translation: Powa bilong Arami i kam wantaim ol liklik man, tasol LORD i givim ol i go long ol, na i bringim bikpela pawa. Na bikos Yuda i lusim LORD, God bilong tumbuna ol, josim bilong Joash i kam.

original: And when the Arameans had withdrawn, they left Joash severely wounded. His own servants conspired against him for shedding the blood of the son of Jehoiada the priest, and they killed him on his bed. So he died and was buried in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
translation: Na Arameans i go bek, ol i leevim Joash i kaikai strong. Wokman bilong em yet ol i mekim birua long en long ol i kilim shedim blod bilong pikinini bilong Jehoiada prist, na ol i kilim em long bed bilong en. Na em i dai na ol i bin planti em insait long Taun bilong David, tasol em i no go long holep bilong king.

original: Those who conspired against Joash were Zabad son of Shimeath the Ammonitess and Jehozabad son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
translation: Ol man i bin pikanu gen long Joash em Zabad sambai bilong Shimeath, meri bilong Ammon, na Jehozabad sambai bilong Shimrith, meri bilong Moab.

original: The accounts of the sons of Joash, as well as the many pronouncements about him and about the restoration of the house of God, are indeed written in the Treatise of the Book of the Kings. And his son Amaziah reigned in his place.
translation: Stori bilong pikinini Joash, ol tokpela stori nau longen, na olgeta toktok long em na long i kam bek gen long haus bilong God, ol i raitim finis long Buk Bilong Stori Bilong King. Na sussa Amaziah i kam bos bihain long en.

original: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother’s name was Jehoaddan; she was from Jerusalem.
translation: Amaziah i kamap king wanpela taim em i gat twenty-five yia, na em i bos long Jerusalem long twenty-nine yia. Nem bilong mama i Jehoaddan; em i kam long Jerusalem.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, but not wholeheartedly.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta we tru long ai bilong LORD, tasol em i no wokim wantaim harim gut.

original: As soon as the kingdom was firmly in his grasp, Amaziah executed the servants who had murdered his father the king.
translation: Olsem wanpela kingdom i kamap strong long han bilong Amaziah, em i kilim ol wokman i bin mekim papa bilong en, king, i dai.

original: Yet he did not put their sons to death, but acted according to what is written in the Law, in the Book of Moses, where the LORD commanded: “Fathers must not be put to death for their children, and children must not be put to death for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin.”
translation: Na em i no kilim ol pikinini bilong ol, tasol em i wok long lotu na pasin bilong bibel, olsem tok bilong Buk Bilong Musa. GOD Bilong Yumi i tok olsem: "Papa i no inap dim ol long ol bikmoh long pikinini, na pikinini i no inap dim ol long ol bikmoh long papa; each man i dai long bikmoh bilong em yet, nogat wok bilong papa, nogat wok bilong pikinini, bikmoh i bilong en self."

original: Then Amaziah gathered the people of Judah and assigned them according to their families to commanders of thousands and of hundreds. And he numbered those twenty years of age or older throughout Judah and Benjamin and found 300,000 chosen men able to serve in the army, bearing the spear and shield.
translation: Na Amasia kamakim ol piple bilong Yuda na givim ol wok long bos bilong tausen na bos bilong hundret, ol i givim wok long ol ano long famili bilong ol. Ol i kauntim ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap long Yuda na Benjimin, na ol i finisim 300,000 man husat i chusim, ol i gat strong long karim spia na shild, ol i ken warkim wara.

original: He also hired 100,000 mighty warriors from Israel for a hundred talents of silver.
translation: Em i kisim 100,000 strongpela wokman long hap bilong Israel, na em i peilim ol long han blong hundapela talen bilong silva.

original: But a man of God came to him and said, “O king, do not let the army of Israel go with you, for the LORD is not with Israel—not with any of the Ephraimites.
translation: Man bilong God i kam long em, i tok, "King, no ken let armi bilong Israel i go wantaim yu, bikos LORD i no stap wantaim Israel – i no stap wantaim ol Ephraimta."

original: Even if you go and fight bravely in battle, God will make you stumble before the enemy, for God has power to help and power to overthrow.”
translation: Sapos yu go na fight olsem strong long pait, Bikpela God bai mekim yu tumbuna bifo enemy, bikos Bikpela ol i gat pawa long helpim na pawa long rilainim.

original: Amaziah asked the man of God, “What should I do about the hundred talents I have given to the army of Israel?” And the man of God replied, “The LORD is able to give you much more than this.”
translation: Amaziah tanim askim man bilong God, “Bai mi wokim wanem long moni bilong wokim bisnis hundred em mi gibim i go long solja bilong Israel?” Na man bilong God em tok bek, “Bikpela i save givim yu planti samting long hap tumas na dispela.”

original: So Amaziah dismissed the troops who had come to him from Ephraim and sent them home. And they were furious with Judah and returned home in great anger.
translation: Na Amaziah i rausim ol solja i kam long Efraim, na em i sendim ol i go back long hus. Na ol i bel kol kol long Juta, na ol i go back long hus, ol i sori tru long bel hevi.

original: Amaziah, however, summoned his strength and led his troops to the Valley of Salt, where he struck down 10,000 men of Seir,
translation: Amaziah, em i kirapim strong bilong en, na em i lidim solja bilong en i go daun long Vali bilong Soltt, na em i kilim 10,000 man bilong Seir.

original: and the army of Judah also captured 10,000 men alive. They took them to the top of a cliff and threw them down so that all were dashed to pieces.
translation: Na armbi bilong Yuda tu kisim 10,000 man bai i stap alive. Ol i karim ol go long top bilong klip bilong maunten na troim ol i daun, na pukim ol i brom, oleeta i dai pinis.

original: Meanwhile the troops that Amaziah had dismissed from battle raided the cities of Judah, from Samaria to Beth-horon. They struck down 3,000 people and carried off a great deal of plunder.
translation: Wanpela taim ol solja Amasia i mekim pinis long war, ol i go bagarapim ol taun bilong Yuda, ol i go raun long Samaria na Bet-horon. Ol i kilim 3,000 manmeri, na ol i kisim i go hevi plunta.

original: When Amaziah returned from the slaughter of the Edomites, he brought back the gods of the Seirites, set them up as his own gods, bowed before them, and burned sacrifices to them.
translation: Taim Amaziah i kam bek long ples bilong poroim Edomites, na i bringim bek god bilong Seirites, i planim ol god bilong em yet, i kros long ai bilong ol, na i mekim sakris long ol.

original: Therefore the anger of the LORD burned against Amaziah, and He sent him a prophet, who said, “Why have you sought this people’s gods, which could not deliver them from your hand?”
translation: Na weri bilong LORD i birua gen long Amaziah, na em sendim wanpela prophet long en, i tok, "Wai yu go bek long god bilong ples ia, we i no inap save ol long han bilong yu?"

original: While he was still speaking, the king asked, “Have we made you the counselor to the king? Stop! Why be struck down?” So the prophet stopped, but he said, “I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this and have not heeded my advice.”
translation: Wail em i stil tok, king i askim, “Mipela ibin mekim yu man bilong toksave long king? Hait! Wanem yu kat olsem? Na bai yu i stap daun!” Propheta i stop, tasol em i tok, “Mi save olsem God i laik bagarapim yu, bikos yu mekim dispela na yu no harim toksave bilong mi.”

original: Then Amaziah king of Judah took counsel and sent word to the king of Israel Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu. “Come, let us meet face to face,” he said.
translation: Na Amaziah king bilong Yuda i kisim ka long olgeta na i salim wod long king bilong Israel Jehoash, pikinini bilong Jehoahaz, pikinini bilong Jehu. “Yu kam, mipela i ken meet face to face,” ol i tok.

original: But Jehoash king of Israel replied to Amaziah king of Judah: “A thistle in Lebanon sent a message to a cedar in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son in marriage.’ Then a wild beast in Lebanon came along and trampled the thistle.
translation: Tete Joias king bilong Israel i tokim bek long Amasia king bilong Judah: “Gras bilong strongpela long Lebanon i salim pes long diwai bilong cedar long Lebanon, i tok olsem, ‘Givim doti bilong yu long pikinini bilong mi ol i marit.’ Na bihaenim, wanpela animal bilong bus long Lebanon i kam na i daunim gras bilong strongpela.”

original: You have said, ‘Look, I have defeated Edom,’ and your heart has become proud and boastful. Now stay at home. Why should you stir up trouble so that you fall—you and Judah with you?”
translation: Yu tokim ol, 'Mipela winim Edom,' na harte bilong yu i kamap strong na katol. Nau yu stap hap home. Olsem wanem yu wokim hevi, na yu pilai i go daun - yu na Juta tu?

original: But Amaziah would not listen, for this had come from God in order to deliver them into the hand of Jehoash, because they had sought the gods of Edom.
translation: Bare Amaziah i no lisin, wantaim em i kam bek long han bilong God olsem nau, ili givim ol long han bilong Jehoash, bikos ol i go bek long tok bilong god bilong Edom.

original: So Jehoash king of Israel advanced, and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced each other at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
translation: Na Jehoash king bilong Israel i go forward, na him na Amaziah king bilong Judah i kam fas nakam long Beth-shemesh insait long Judah.

original: And Judah was routed before Israel, and every man fled to his own home.
translation: Na Juda i go bak long Israel, na ol man i ranawe i go bek long hus bilong en.

original: There at Beth-shemesh, Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz. Then Jehoash brought him to Jerusalem and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate—a section of four hundred cubits.
translation: Long Beth-shemesh, Jehoash king bilong Israel i kisim Amaziah king bilong Judah, pikinini bilong Joash, pikinini bilong Jehoahaz. Jehoash i bringim em i go long Jerusalem na i brukim daun wal bilong Jerusalem husat i stret olsem long Gat bilong Ephraim go long Kona Gat - em i 400 cubits.

original: He took all the gold and silver and all the articles found in the house of God with Obed-edom and in the treasuries of the royal palace, as well as some hostages. Then he returned to Samaria.
translation: Em i kisim olgeta gol na silva, na ol samting em i lukim long hap bilong Obed-edom i stap long haus bilong God, na long treasuries bilong royalty palace, na em i kisim ol prisna. Na em i go bek gen long Samaria.

original: Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
translation: Amaziah Pikinini bilong Joash king bilong Juda i stap olsem fiften yia olsem dei bihain long deat bilong Jehoash pikinini bilong Jehoahaz king bilong Isrel.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Amaziah, from beginning to end, are they not written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel?
translation: Long ol bikpela stori bilong Amajiya, frm bikpela namel long las, i no writim long Buk bilong King bilong Judah na Israel?

original: From the time that Amaziah turned from following the LORD, a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish. But men were sent after him to Lachish, and they killed him there.
translation: Long taim Amaziah i tanim i go bek long folim LORD, ol i mekim pilai gen long en long Jerusalem, na em i ranawe go long Lachish. Tasol ol man i salim i go bihainim em long Lachish, na ol i kilim em long hap bilong em.

original: They carried him back on horses and buried him with his fathers in the City of Judah.
translation: Bamim i kisim i go bek gen long hors, na ol i makim em wantaim ol tumbuna bilong en long Siti bilong Yuda.

original: All the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.
translation: Ol pipol bilong Yuda olgeta i kisim Uzia, em i gat sikis yia, na oli mekim em i stap king long hap bilong papa bilong em, Amasia.

original: Uzziah was the one who rebuilt Eloth and restored it to Judah after King Amaziah rested with his fathers.
translation: Uzia em i man, na em i winim Eloth gen, na em i bringim bek i go long Judah bihaen King Amaziah i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en.

original: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-two years. His mother’s name was Jecoliah; she was from Jerusalem.
translation: Uzia em i kamap king na em i gat sikis yia, na em i rain long Jerusalem fourti tu yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em em i Jekolia; em i manmeri bilong Jerusalem.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father Amaziah had done.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem papa bilong em Amaziah i mekim.

original: He sought God throughout the days of Zechariah, who instructed him in the fear of God. And as long as he sought the LORD, God gave him success.
translation: Em i go bek long God olsem long ol dei bilong Zakaria, we em i laikim em long respek bilong God. Na olsem long ol taim we em i go bek long LORD, God i givim em wins.

original: Uzziah went out to wage war against the Philistines, and he tore down the walls of Gath, Jabneh, and Ashdod. Then he built cities near Ashdod and among the Philistines.
translation: Uzia i go aut na kisim faet olsem long Philistia, na em i pulim daun bilong ples bilong Gat, Jabne, na Asdod. Em i bikim taun long hap long Asdod na long ol pipel Philistia.

original: God helped him against the Philistines, against the Arabs living in Gur-baal, and against the Meunites.
translation: God i holim em longsaitim Ol Philistine, longsaitim Ol Arabu ol i stap long Gur-baal, na longsaitim Ol Meunite.

original: The Ammonites brought tribute to Uzziah, and his fame spread as far as the border of Egypt, for he had become exceedingly powerful.
translation: Ol Ammonites i bringim kot tribut long Uziya, na stori bilong em i go ol abaot long boda bilong Egip, bikos em i kamap strong win long olgeta.

original: Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, the Valley Gate, and the angle in the wall, and he fortified them.
translation: Uziah i bikim tower long Jerusalem, besait long Kona Gate, Vali Gate, na kona bilong barak i go daun i kam, na em i storim strongim ol.

original: Since he had much livestock in the foothills and in the plain, he built towers in the desert and dug many cisterns. And since he was a lover of the soil, he had farmers and vinedressers in the hill country and in the fertile fields.
translation: Biporong em i gat planti animals husat i kam long graun long ples we i go daun i go inap long mauntin na long grass bilong ples i stap flat, em i bilongim taiya hap na em i dikim ol waterhole plenti. Na em i man bilong liklik kantri, em i gat wokman na ol man husat i save kamdaim vine long mauntin na long gras bilong ples i stap gut na i gat planti ka.

original: Uzziah had an army ready for battle that went out to war by assigned divisions, as recorded by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer under the direction of Hananiah, one of the royal officers.
translation: Uzia i gat armi rede long faet, na ol i go aut long wok war, olsem ol i raunim long buk, olsem Jeiel skrivim buk na Maaseiah ofisa aninit long Hananiah, wanpela ofisa bilong king.

original: The total number of family leaders of the mighty men of valor was 2,600.
translation: Namba olgeta bilong bikpela leda bilong familia ol man strongpela na gat kuraj emi 2,600.

original: Under their authority was an army of 307,500 trained for war, a powerful force to support the king against his enemies.
translation: Bilong ol i stap aninit long han bilong ol i gat wanpela army long 307,500 man, ol i trainim strong long fare war, na ol i kamap wanpela powa strongpela fos bilong sapotim king genGEN poison bilong en.

original: Uzziah supplied the entire army with shields, spears, helmets, armor, bows, and slingstones.
translation: Uzia i kamapim ol solja holem wantaim skil, spia, het, armua, banara, na ston bilong slingim.

original: And in Jerusalem he made skillfully designed devices to shoot arrows and catapult large stones from the towers and corners. So his fame spread far and wide, for he was helped tremendously so that he became powerful.
translation: Na long Jerusalem, em mekim ol geta samting we i gat bikpela save olsem katapolt na ol arrows long ol towers na kona. Ol i singautim arrows na katapoltim ston bilong bikpela siz, na nem bilong em i go longwe na waid, bikos em i gat hap bilong bikpela strong, na em i kamap strong tru.

original: But when Uzziah grew powerful, his arrogance led to his own destruction. He was unfaithful to the LORD his God, for he entered the temple of the LORD to burn incense on the altar of incense.
translation: Taim Uzia em i bikpela, praid bilong em iledim i go daun na kisim nok. Em no trusim olgot long Lod em yet, na em go insait long haus lotu bilong Lod, na em mekim smok long staun we ol pipol i ofa, em i wok bilong Lotu tasol.

original: Then Azariah the priest, along with eighty brave priests of the LORD, went in after him.
translation: Na Azaria pries, wantaim eighty pries bilong Jehovah ol i gat hart strepela, i go insait bihain long em.

original: They took their stand against King Uzziah and said, “Uzziah, you have no right to offer incense to the LORD. Only the priests, the descendants of Aaron, are consecrated to burn incense. Leave the sanctuary, for you have acted unfaithfully; you will not receive honor from the LORD God.”
translation: Ol i tok strong i go agensim King Uzia na ol i tok, "King Uzia, yu no inogat rait long bringim smoke bilong pray long Bikpela. Pris, ol descendants bilong Aron, ol i kamap olsem santing we i belong long mekim smoke bilong pray. Lusim hap graun, yu wokim olsem nogut; yu no ken kisim gat respek long Bikpela."

original: Uzziah, with a censer in his hand to offer incense, was enraged. But while he raged against the priests in their presence in the house of the LORD before the altar of incense, leprosy broke out on his forehead.
translation: Uzia, na kros bilong smel i holim, em i bel kol. Em i katim bek long ol priester long haus bilong LORD, bifo alta bilong smel, na sik leprosi i kamap long hed bilong em.

original: When Azariah the chief priest and all the priests turned to him and saw his leprous forehead, they rushed him out. Indeed, he himself hurried to get out, because the LORD had afflicted him.
translation: Taim Azaria papa bilong ol prist na ol prist i turnim bek long em na ol lukim het bilong en i gat sik leprosi, ol i birua hariap long rausim em. Em yet, em i ran i go aut bere, wantaim GOD i wari long en.

original: So King Uzziah was a leper until the day of his death. He lived in isolation, leprous and cut off from the house of the LORD, while his son Jotham had charge of the royal palace to govern the people of the land.
translation: King Uzziah em i sik long leprosi tasol, na em i stap isolat, kat olwei long haus bilong Lod, traem em i no inap go insait long en. Na Jotham, pikinini bilong em, em i lukautim palas bilong king, na em i gavmanim ples bilong ol pipol.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Uzziah, from beginning to end, they are recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
translation: Long ol stap bilong akt bilong Uzziah, from bikpela tanim go long las, ol i raisim i go daun olsem propet Esaiya son bilong Amoz i skrivo.

original: And Uzziah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in a field of burial that belonged to the kings; for the people said, “He was a leper.” And his son Jotham reigned in his place.
translation: Na Uzia i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, na ol i kisim em i go wap long ples bilong kisim king na kisim ol granking; ol i tok, "Em i gat lekpa." Na Jotam i kam bihain long em, i bos.

original: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. His mother’s name was Jerushah daughter of Zadok.
translation: Jotham em twenty-five yia na i kamap king, na em i rulim Jerusalem sixteen yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em em Jerushah, gel bilong Zadok.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father Uzziah had done. In addition, he did not enter the temple of the LORD. But the people still behaved corruptly.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem tisa bilong em Uzziah i mekim. Em i no go insait long haos lotu bilong LORD. Tasol ol pipel i stap wokim ol samting i nogut.

original: Jotham rebuilt the Upper Gate of the house of the LORD, and he worked extensively on the wall at the hill of Ophel.
translation: Jotam im rebuildim Upper Gate bilong haus bilong Lod, na em i wok strong long banis long maunten bilong Ofel.

original: He also built cities in the hill country of Judah and fortresses and towers in the forests.
translation: Em i bikim ol siti long hap graun bilong Juda, na em i wokim strongpela haus na tok bilong war long bus.

original: Jotham waged war against the king of the Ammonites and defeated them, and that year they gave him a hundred talents of silver, ten thousand cors of wheat, and ten thousand cors of barley. They paid him the same in the second and third years.
translation: Jotam i go long war gen king bilong pipol Ammon, na em i winim ol, na yia ia ol i givim em hundred talents bilong silva, ten thousand kors bilong waet, na ten thousand kors bilong balei. Ol i peim em moning sampela long yia nambatu na yia namtri tu.

original: So Jotham grew powerful because he ordered his ways before the LORD his God.
translation: Na Jotham i kamap strongpela bikos em i organize wel ol pasin bilong em bifor LORD God bilong em.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Jotham, along with all his wars and his ways, they are indeed written in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.
translation: Long ol stap bilong aktibodi bilong Jotam, longsing ol faet po na rot bilong en, ol i raisim olsem, ol i kukim long Buk Bilong King bilong Israel na Judah.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years.
translation: Em i twentifait yia olsem tasol em i kamap king, na em i rain king long Jiusalem long sikis yia.

original: And Jotham rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. And his son Ahaz reigned in his place.
translation: Na Jotam i go stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, ol i kisim em na buri long Siti bilong Dauid. Na susa bilong en Ahaz i kam bihain long en i bos.

original: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. And unlike David his father, he did not do what was right in the eyes of the LORD.
translation: Ahaz emi twenti yia na i go nau, na em bungim king, na em rulim long Jerusalem sixteen yia. Na olsem Papa David i no kamap, em i no mekim olgeta samting orait long ai bilong Bikpela.

original: Instead, he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and even made cast images of the Baals.
translation: Em i go long rot bilong kings bilong Israel na em i mekim piksa we i kamap long han bilong Baal.

original: Moreover, Ahaz burned incense in the Valley of Hinnom and sacrificed his sons in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations that the LORD had driven out before the Israelites.
translation: Na Ahaz wailisim insens long Vali bilong Hinnom na sakrifaisim pikinini bilong em long faia, olsem abominations ol i pasim long narapela kantri we LORD i pusim i go bifo pipol Israel.

original: And he sacrificed and burned incense on the high places, on the hills, and under every green tree.
translation: Na em i pilai, em i bunim smok long ol smel long hap bilong mountain, long ol maunten, aninit long ol diwai i gat gris.

original: So the LORD his God delivered Ahaz into the hand of the king of Aram, who attacked him and took many captives to Damascus. Ahaz was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who struck him with great force.
