translation: Na Sabaai Papa God bilong em, LORD, i salim Ahaz kisim long han bilong king bilong Aram, ol i kam bekim em na kisim planti manmeri i go olsem prisna i go long Damascus. Ahaz i kamap long han bilong king bilong Israel, na king i bikim em wantaim pas bilong pait, i kilim em.

original: For in one day Pekah son of Remaliah killed 120,000 valiant men in Judah. This happened because they had forsaken the LORD, the God of their fathers.
translation: Long wanpela de Pekah son bilong Remaliah i kilim 120,000 ol man strong bilong Juda. Dispela i kam bekim ol i lusim Bikpela, Bikpela God bilong tumbuna ol.

original: Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the son of the king, Azrikam the governor of the palace, and Elkanah the second to the king.
translation: Zichri, man strongpela bilong Ephraim, i kilim Maaseiah pikinini bilong king, Azrikam gavana bilong haus king, na Elkanah namba tu, bihain long king.

original: Then the Israelites took 200,000 captives from their kinsmen—women, sons, and daughters. They also carried off a great deal of plunder and brought it to Samaria.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i kisim 200,000 prisoner long brata na susa ol - meri, pikinini man na pikinini meri. Ol i kirapim planti tru sampela samting bilong eni na i bringim i go long Samaria.

original: But a prophet of the LORD named Oded was there, and he went out to meet the army that returned to Samaria. “Look,” he said to them, “because of His wrath against Judah, the LORD, the God of your fathers, has delivered them into your hand. But you have slaughtered them in a rage that reaches up to heaven.
translation: I gat wanpela propet bilong LORD we i kolim Oded em i stap, na em i go aut long mitimupela army we i kam bek long Samaria. “Lukim,” em i tokim ol, “bilong werah bilong GOD long Juda, GOD, God bilong papa bilong yu, i salim ol i go long han bilong yu. Tasol yu i kilim ol long taim yu bel kol, na ragim bilong yu i rin i go apl long heven.

original: And now you intend to reduce to slavery the men and women of Judah and Jerusalem. But are you not also guilty before the LORD your God?
translation: Nau yu laik mekim slave ol man na meri bilong Judah na Jerusalem. Bamu gat skul long loa bilong Jehovah God bilong yumi?

original: Now therefore, listen to me and return the captives you took from your kinsmen, for the fierce anger of the LORD is upon you.”
translation: Nau therefore, harim tok long mi na bekim ol prisen i go bak long ples bilong ol wantok, bikos aire bilong Jehovah i stap strong long yu.

original: Then some of the leaders of the Ephraimites—Azariah son of Jehohanan, Berechiah son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah son of Shallum, and Amasa son of Hadlai—stood in opposition to those arriving from the war.
translation: Olgeta bikpela man meri long Ephraim, Azariah sambai long Jehohanan, Berechiah sambai long Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah sambai long Shallum, na Amasa sambai long Hadlai, i stap klostu long ol i kam bek long pait.

original: “You must not bring the captives here,” they said, “for you are proposing to bring guilt upon us from the LORD and to add to our sins and our guilt. For our guilt is great, and fierce anger is upon Israel.”
translation: “Yu no ken bringim priseni i go long hap,” ol i tok, “kuz yu laik bringim bipaim bilong gilti long mipela from ol LORD na kisim i go long sin bilong mipela na gilti bilong mipela. Kuz gilta bilong mipela i bikpela, na popoia i kamap strong long Israel.”

original: So the armed men left the captives and the plunder before the leaders and all the assembly.
translation: Ol man i gat gun lusim ol prisen na ol samting bilong war bifor ol bikpela manmeri na ol pipol olgeta.

original: Then the men who were designated by name arose, took charge of the captives, and provided from the plunder clothing for the naked. They clothed them, gave them sandals and food and drink, anointed their wounds, and put all the feeble on donkeys. So they brought them to Jericho, the City of Palms, to their brothers. Then they returned to Samaria.
translation: Ol man we em i kolim nem istap arais, tok, ol i kisim hevi long ol prisen. Ol givim klos long ol narapela husat i no gat klos, husat ol winim long toktok bilong eni, ol givim sandal, ka, na dring long ol, na ol putim oil long wonj long ol. Ol putim ol man husat i no inap go yet long donki. Na so ol bringim ol go long Jeriko, taun bilong palma, go long brata bilong ol. Olgo bek gen long Samaria.

original: At that time King Ahaz sent for help from the king of Assyria.
translation: Long dispela taim King Ahaz i sendim man bung long king bilong Asiria bilong i helpim em.

original: The Edomites had again come and attacked Judah and carried away captives.
translation: Ol Edomait i kam bek gen na paitim Ol Judah, na ol i kisim na karamapim ol prisen.

original: The Philistines had also raided the cities of the foothills and the Negev of Judah, capturing and occupying Beth-shemesh, Aijalon, and Gederoth, as well as Soco, Timnah, and Gimzo with their villages.
translation: Filistia i go na rausim taun long ples ili stap long fut bilong maunten na Negib bilong Juda, ol i kisim na holim Bet-Semes, Aiylon, Gadero, Soko, Timna, na Gimzo wantaim vilij ol i stap.

original: For the LORD humbled Judah because Ahaz king of Israel had thrown off restraint in Judah and had been most unfaithful to the LORD.
translation: Bikpela i bringim Judah i go daun long graun bikos Ahaz king bilong Israel i kirap na lusim ol sel bilong en, na ol i mekim bagarap tru long taim bifo, na bikos ol i no givim respek tru long Bikpela.

original: Then Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria came to Ahaz but afflicted him rather than strengthening him.
translation: Na Tiglat-Pilisa king bilong Asiria i kam long Ahaz, tasol em i bagarapim Ahaz yet, olsem i no strongim em.

original: Although Ahaz had taken a portion from the house of the LORD, from the royal palace, and from the princes and had presented it to the king of Assyria, it did not help him.
translation: Ahaz em i kisim hap bilong en long haus bilong LORD, long haus bilong king, na long prins, na em i givim i go long king bilong Asiria, tasol i no helpim em.

original: In the time of his distress, King Ahaz became even more unfaithful to the LORD.
translation: Long taim King Ahaz i katik, em i kamap moa yet long bikim sin long LORD.

original: Since Damascus had defeated him, he sacrificed to their gods and said, “Because the gods of the kings of Aram have helped them, I will sacrifice to them that they may help me.” But these gods were the downfall of Ahaz and of all Israel.
translation: Long taim Damaskas winim em, em i sakifikis long god bilong ol kingly kings bilong Aram na em i tok, "Bikos god bilong ol kingly kings bilong Aram i helpim ol, naka mi bai sakifikis long ol, ol bai helpim mi." Be dispela god i bin bringim daun long Ahaz na long ol Israel.

original: Then Ahaz gathered up the articles of the house of God, cut them into pieces, shut the doors of the house of the LORD, and set up altars of his own on every street corner in Jerusalem.
translation: Na Ahaz i kam bek na kisim ol samting bilong haus bilong God, ol i katim ol i go pinis, ol i pasim door long haus bilong LORD, na ol i wokim altar bilong en long ol korner bilong stret long Jerusalem.

original: In every city of Judah he built high places to offer incense to other gods, and so he provoked the LORD, the God of his fathers.
translation: Long olgeta taun bilong Yuda em i bikim ples hait, na bai em ofrim smok long narapela god, na dispela tripela wok em i kirapim LORD, God bilong tumbuna bilong en.

original: As for the rest of the acts of Ahaz and all his ways, from beginning to end, they are indeed written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
translation: Long olgeta samting bilong wok bilong Ahaz na rot bilong em, from bikpela hap taim na go inap long las tim, ol i writen pinis tru long Buk Bilong Kings bilong Yuda na Isrel.

original: And Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of Jerusalem, but he was not placed in the tombs of the kings of Israel. And his son Hezekiah reigned in his place.
translation: Na Ahazi i stap wantaim tumbuna bilong en, em i go daun long graon long siti bilong Yerusalem, tasol em i no bos long hap bilong kings bilong Israel. Na Hezekiya, pikinini bilong em, i kamap king bihain long em.

original: Hezekiah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother’s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
translation: Hezekiah i kamap king na em i gat twenty-five yia. Em i rain long Jerusalem olgeta twenty-nine yia. Nem bilong mama bilong em Abijah, meri bilong Zechariah.

original: And he did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his father David had done.
translation: Na em wokim olgeta samting i orait long ai bilong LORD, olsem tupela papa David i mekim.

original: In the first month of the first year of his reign, Hezekiah opened and repaired the doors of the house of the LORD.
translation: Long mun bilong yia bilong en, taim Hezekiya i kamap king, em i opim na i fiksim doa bilong haus bilong LORD.

original: Then he brought in the priests and Levites and gathered them in the square on the east side.
translation: Emi bringim pries na Levait i go, na emi bungim ol long skwar bilong sait bilong east.

original: “Listen to me, O Levites,” he said. “Consecrate yourselves now and consecrate the house of the LORD, the God of your fathers. Remove from the Holy Place every impurity.
translation: Harim tok long me, o Levitiko, he said. Purify yuself na purify Haus bilong LORD, Bikpela God bilong tumbuna. Kisim awai ol nogut pasin long Ples Holy.

original: For our fathers were unfaithful and did evil in the sight of the LORD our God. They abandoned Him, turned their faces away from the dwelling place of the LORD, and turned their backs on Him.
translation: Pipia bilong yumi i no bilip na mekim samting nogut long ai bilong LORD God bilong yumi. Ol i lusim Em, turnim face bilong ol i bek long haus kilim LORD, na turnim bek bilong ol long Em.

original: They also shut the doors of the portico and extinguished the lamps. They did not burn incense or present burnt offerings in the Holy Place of the God of Israel.
translation: Ol i pasim doa bilong veranda, ol i pilim lamp i stap dae. Ol i no burn smok bilong pray, na ol i no bringim ofa i bungim long Holi Ples bilong God bilong Israel.

original: Therefore, the wrath of the LORD has fallen upon Judah and Jerusalem, and He has made them an object of terror, horror, and mockery, as you can see with your own eyes.
translation: Bikos olsem, bel hat bilong Lotu i kirapim Juda na Jerusalem, na ol i wokim olsem samting bilong poret, horror, na mosim - olsem yu inap lukim wantaim ai bilong yu.

original: For behold, this is why our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and daughters and wives are in captivity.
translation: Susa, mipela lukim, dispela em i reason mama bilong mipela i punda long suis, na susa bilong mipela, pikinini bilong mipela, na meri bilong mipela i stap insait long kampa.

original: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with the LORD, the God of Israel, so that His fierce anger will turn away from us.
translation: Nau em i stap insait long het bilong mi, bai mi mekim pinis kovenan wantaim LORD, God bilong Israel, oleesa em bai popoia kros bilong em i wokim bek gen long mipela.

original: Now, my sons, do not be negligent, for the LORD has chosen you to stand before Him, to serve Him, to minister before Him, and to burn incense.”
translation: Nau, mipela pikinini, no ken kisim lais, bikpela i chusim yupela long stap bung long em, wokim servis long em, sarvis long em olsem minista, na burnim smel.

original: Then the Levites set to work: Mahath son of Amasai and Joel son of Azariah from the Kohathites; Kish son of Abdi and Azariah son of Jehallelel from the Merarites; Joah son of Zimmah and Eden son of Joah from the Gershonites;
translation: Na Ol Levaita i go wok: Mahath son bilong Amasai na Joel son bilong Azariah long ol Kohati; Kish son bilong Abdi na Azariah son bilong Jehallelel long ol Merari; Joah son bilong Zimmah na Eden son bilong Joah long ol Gershonites;

original: Shimri and Jeuel from the Elizaphanites; Zechariah and Mattaniah from the Asaphites;
translation: Shimri na Jeuel long ol Elizafanait; Zekaria na Matania long ol Asafait;

original: Jehiel and Shimei from the Hemanites; and Shemaiah and Uzziel from the Jeduthunites.
translation: Jehiel na Shimei long ol Hemanites, na Shemaiah na Uzziel long ol Jeduthunites.

original: When they had assembled their brothers and consecrated themselves, they went in to cleanse the house of the LORD, according to the command of the king by the words of the LORD.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i kamasimpin long ol brata bilong ol, na ol i makim ol yet long spirik, ol i go insait long kliaim haus bilong Lod, strong long tok bilong king, em i kam long tok bilong Lod.

original: So the priests went inside the house of the LORD to cleanse it, and they brought out to the courtyard all the unclean things that they found in the temple of the LORD. Then the Levites took these things and carried them out to the Kidron Valley.
translation: Na prist i go insait long haus bilong Jehovah olsem ili bai i kliaim em, na tupela i kisim aut go long ka long haus ol samting nogut tupela i finais long temwel bilong Jehovah. Na Levit i kisim dispela samting na karim i go daun long Kidron Valley.

original: They began the consecration on the first day of the first month, and on the eighth day of the month they reached the portico of the LORD. For eight more days they consecrated the house of the LORD itself, finishing on the sixteenth day of the first month.
translation: Ol i statim makim dedikeshon long dia fest bilong mun fest, na ol i kamap long porcho bilong Bikpela long ate dei bilong mun. Na ol i makim haus bilong LORD i dedike, befors em i go bek gen long atepela de, na taitim em i pinis long sikiste dei bilong mun fest.

original: Then they went in to King Hezekiah and reported, “We have cleansed the entire house of the LORD, the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the table of the showbread with all its utensils.
translation: Na ol i go insait long King Hezekiah na ol i ripot, “Mipela i kliaim hap masalai bilong LORD, kaun bilong bun anim wantaim ol gets bilong en, na tepul bilong breads bilong shoo wantaim ol gets bilong en.”

original: Moreover, we have prepared and consecrated all the articles that King Ahaz in his unfaithfulness cast aside during his reign. They are now in front of the altar of the LORD.”
translation: Mipela i prepa na waiusim ol samting we King Ahaz long taim bilong em, em i no trustum, nau ol i stap long hap bilong altar bilong LORD.

original: Early the next morning King Hezekiah gathered the city officials and went up to the house of the LORD.
translation: Bikos long moning i kam, King Hezekia i kirapim ofisal bilong siti, na ol i go ap long haus bilong LORD.

original: They brought seven bulls, seven rams, seven lambs, and seven male goats as a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary, and for Judah. And the king commanded the priests, the descendants of Aaron, to offer them on the altar of the LORD.
translation: Ol i bringim sewen bullok, sewen ram, sewen lamb, na sewen male goat olsem sin ofing long ridim sin long kingdom, long ples bilong God, na long Judah. Na king i givim komando long prist, ol desenden bilong Aron, ol i mas putim ol samting long alta bilong LORD.

original: So they slaughtered the bulls, and the priests took the blood and sprinkled it on the altar. They slaughtered the rams and sprinkled the blood on the altar. And they slaughtered the lambs and sprinkled the blood on the altar.
translation: Ol i kilim oks bilong bulmakau, na pris ol i kisim blod na sprendim antap long alta. Ol i kilim rams na sprendim blod antap long alta. Na ol i kilim lambs na sprendim blod antap long alta.

original: Then they brought the goats for the sin offering before the king and the assembly, who laid their hands on them.
translation: Ol i bringim goats long offering bilong sin bifor king na ol pipol i garem, na ol i putim han bilong ol long ol.

original: And the priests slaughtered the goats and put their blood on the altar for a sin offering, to make atonement for all Israel, because the king had ordered the burnt offering and the sin offering for all Israel.
translation: Na prist i kilim goat na putim blod long alta olsem ofing em i kilim, makim peis long mekim raitim ol samting long ol Israel, bikos king i tokim ol prist long givim ofing em i birua na ofing em i kilim long ol Israel.

original: Hezekiah stationed the Levites in the house of the LORD with cymbals, harps, and lyres according to the command of David, of Gad the king’s seer, and of Nathan the prophet. For the command had come from the LORD through His prophets.
translation: Hezekia i stapim Levait long haus bilong Jehovah wantaim simbal, hap, na lirai olsem komando bilong Daud, Gad king seer, na Natan prophet. Bikos komando em i kam from Jehovah thruim prophet.

original: The Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.
translation: Ol Levitiko i stap wantaim instrument bilong David, na ol pries wantaim trumpets.

original: And Hezekiah ordered that the burnt offering be sacrificed on the altar. When the burnt offering began, the song of the LORD and the trumpets began as well, accompanied by the instruments of David king of Israel.
translation: Na Hezekia i tok olsem bai plantaen bikos em i mas go antap long altar. Wanem taim plantaen bikos i stat, sang bilong LORD na trambol i stat tu, na ol i go wail wantaim instrument bilong King David bilong Israel.

original: The whole assembly was worshiping, the singers were singing, and the trumpeters were playing. All this continued until the burnt offering was completed.
translation: Olgeta assembli i stap worship, ol singa i stap sing, na ol trumpeta i stap pley. Ol dispela i go stret olsem na taim em ol ip pinisim ofing bung.

original: When the offerings were completed, the king and all those present with him bowed down and worshiped.
translation: Taim ofingi ibin paitim pinis, king na ol man meri i stap wantaim em, ol i kosi i go daun na ol i wosip.

original: Then King Hezekiah and his officials ordered the Levites to sing praises to the LORD in the words of David and of Asaph the seer. So they sang praises with gladness and bowed their heads and worshiped.
translation: King Hezekiah na ofisal bilong em i givim tok long Levit ol, olsem ia: "Singim sang bilong prais long LORD, long tok bilong David na Asaph profet." Na so ol i singim sang bilong prais wantaim hapines, ol i paulim hed bilong ol na ol i wosip.

original: Then Hezekiah said, “Now that you have consecrated yourselves to the LORD, come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings to the house of the LORD.” So the assembly brought sacrifices and thank offerings, and all whose hearts were willing brought burnt offerings.
translation: Na Hezekia i tok, "Nau yu mas makim ap long yuself i go long olgets bilong LORD, kam klost na bringim sakrifis na ofing bilong tankyu long haus bilong LORD." Na ol i bringim sakrifis na ofing bilong tankyu, na ol man meri husat harim i stap strong, ol i bringim ol burnt ofing.

original: The number of burnt offerings the assembly brought was seventy bulls, a hundred rams, and two hundred lambs; all these were for a burnt offering to the LORD.
translation: Namba bilong ofing bung na ka assembli ibin kisim i kam inap long bringim ofing bung i go long LORD em i go olsem: seventi bulmakau, wan hundred ram, na tu hundred lamb; ol dispela ya ol i go long ofing bung bilong LORD.

original: And the consecrated offerings were six hundred bulls and three thousand sheep.
translation: Na ofa i stap long bikpela ai bilong God em i go long sikis hundred bulmakau na tri tausen sheep.

original: However, since there were not enough priests to skin all the burnt offerings, their Levite brothers helped them until the work was finished and until the priests had been consecrated. For the Levites had been more diligent in consecrating themselves than the priests had been.
translation: Bikos prist i no planti, bratha Levai bilong ol i helpim ol bekim ofa bilong bun, na wok i go finis, na prist i kamapim na kisim wer. Bratha Levai i bin hatwok long puripim yumi, i go moa dan prist.

original: Furthermore, the burnt offerings were abundant, along with the fat of the peace offerings and the drink offerings for the burnt offerings. So the service of the house of the LORD was established.
translation: Ol bikpela ofing bung bilong God i plenti, longsait wantaim ol fat bilong peis ofing na dring ofing bilong ol bikpela ofing bung. Na em i go, wok bilong haus bilong LORD em i kamap strong.

original: Then Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced at what God had prepared for the people, because everything had been accomplished so quickly.
translation: Hezekia na olgeta pipol i amamas long olgeta samting God i prepa long ol pipol, wantaim olgeta samting i kamap finisqiik.

original: Then Hezekiah sent word throughout all Israel and Judah, and he also wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh inviting them to come to the house of the LORD in Jerusalem to keep the Passover of the LORD, the God of Israel.
translation: Na Hezekia tok aut olsem long olgeta hap Isrel na Judah, na i raitim leta go long Efraim na Manase, askim ol i kam long haus bilong LORD long Jerusalem, ol i stap gut long kaen Pasowa bilong LORD, Bikpela God bilong Isrel.

original: For the king and his officials and the whole assembly in Jerusalem had decided to keep the Passover in the second month,
translation: Long king na ofisal bilong en, olgeta assembli long Jerusalem, ol bin desisim long kaipim Pasaka long mun two.

original: since they had been unable to observe it at the regular time, because not enough priests had consecrated themselves and the people had not been gathered in Jerusalem.
translation: Bikos ol i no inap lukim i gut long taim bilong kastom, olsem na bikos ol pris i no enough yet i kamap santing, na ol pipol i no bin kam yet long Jerusalem.

original: This proposal pleased the king and the whole assembly.
translation: Rikuesi ya i kamapim bel hevi bilong king na olgeta assembli.

original: So they established a decree to circulate a proclamation throughout Israel, from Beersheba to Dan, that the people should come to keep the Passover of the LORD, the God of Israel, in Jerusalem. For they had not observed it as a nation as prescribed.
translation: Ol i wokim pes bilong gavman, na givim notis long ol pipol long Israel, from saut go long not, olegta kantri, olsem ol pipol i mas kam keepim Pasowa bilong Bikpela, God bilong Israel, long Jerusalem. Tasol bipo ol i no keepim olsem i laikim, na ol i no bin observe pasowa long taim bifo olsem wanpela nesen.

original: So the couriers went throughout Israel and Judah with letters from the king and his officials, which read: “Children of Israel, return to the LORD, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, so that He may return to those of you who remain, who have escaped the grasp of the kings of Assyria.
translation: Na kourier ol i go wail long Israel na Judah wanpela leta from king na ofisala bilong en, i tok olsem: "Oli pikinini bilong Israel, kam bek long LORD, God bilong Abraham, Isaac, na Israel, bilong mekim em i kam bek long yu ol yet, husat i stap, ol i skulim pinis long han bilong king bilong Asiria.

original: Do not be like your fathers and brothers who were unfaithful to the LORD, the God of their fathers, so that He made them an object of horror, as you can see.
translation: No ken olsem papa na brata bilong yu ol i bin nogat trast long LORD, Bikpela God bilong tumbuna ol, na em i mekim ol samting bilong bagarap long ol, olsem yu laik harim nau.

original: Now do not stiffen your necks as your fathers did. Submit to the LORD and come to His sanctuary, which He has consecrated forever. Serve the LORD your God, so that His fierce anger will turn away from you.
translation: Nau no ken stretim nek bilong yu olsem tumbuna bilong yu. Kisim bek long LORD, kam long haus lotu bilong em, em i makim em i stap oltaim. Servim LORD God bilong yu, na bel hevi bilong en i pas long yu.

original: For if you return to the LORD, your brothers and sons will receive mercy in the presence of their captors and will return to this land. For the LORD your God is gracious and merciful; He will not turn His face away from you if you return to Him.”
translation: Sapos yu kam bek long Lod, ol brata na pikinini bilong yu bai i ken kisim merisi long ai bilong ol i bin kisim yu na bai ol i kam bek long kantri. Bikos Lod God bilong yu em i graun na givim merisi; em i no inap turnim face bilong en awe long yu sapos yu kam bek long en.

original: And the couriers traveled from city to city through the land of Ephraim and Manasseh as far as Zebulun; but the people scorned and mocked them.
translation: Na kauria i go bek olsem siti na siti long hap graon bilong Efraim na Manase, na i kam apostol long Sebulun, tasol ol pipol i kat ol na bilak.

original: Nevertheless, some from Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem.
translation: Nem minduas, sampela husat i kam long Asa, Manase, na Sebulon, ol i go daun long hed bilong ol, na ol i kam long Jerusalema.

original: Moreover, the power of God was on the people in Judah to give them one heart to obey the command of the king and his officials according to the word of the LORD.
translation: Na pawa bilong God i stap strong long ol pipol long Judah, givim ol wanpela het ol i harim komando bilong king na ofisal bilong en, olsem tok bilong LORD.

original: In the second month, a very great assembly gathered in Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread.
translation: Long mun tu, wanpela bikpela assembli igo long Jerusalem bilong selibretim Kaen Dei Bred, em i dai blo pait.
